AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1251 AM EST TUE JAN 1 2013

.AVIATION...MAIN SHIELD OF PRECIPITATION STILL WELL OUT WEST ACROSS
WESTERN AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE ALTHOUGH SOME LIGHT RAIN TRYING TO
MOISTEN UP THE LOWER LAYERS AROUND TYS WHERE MVFR CONDITIONS HAVE
SET IN FOR THE LONG HAUL. LOWER LAYER WILL STEADILY MOISTEN WITH
ALL THE TAF SITES DETERIORATING TO MVFR CEILINGS/VSBY IN LIGHT RAIN
AND FOG AROUND 08Z TO 11Z AS THE STRONGER LIFT BUILDS ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. POOR FLIGHT WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WITH IFR CEILINGS DEVELOPING
AROUND 13Z TO 15Z AROUND CHA AND TYS. THE LAST SEVERAL HOURS OF THE
PERIOD MAY EVEN DROP TO LIFR AS A CEILING FORMS BELOW 600 FT.

902 
FXUS64 KMRX 010103
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
803 PM EST MON DEC 31 2012

.DISCUSSION...
MODEL SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO SHOW VERY DRY AIR ABOUT 2KFT-2.5KFT
ABOVE THE SURFACE. THIS CORRESPONDS WELL WITH THE LATEST UPPER AIR RELEASE
FROM NASHVILLE. SOME OF THE LIGHT ECHOS WERE REACHING THE GROUND IN
SW VA AND SOME OF THAT PRECIPITATION IS SLEET. THIS TREND IS
LIKELY TO PERSIST FOR ANOTHER COUPLE OF HOURS. HOWEVER...ONCE THE
DRY AIR BECOMES MORE SATURATED WE SHOULD SEE THE FROZEN
PRECIPITATION TRANSITION TO ALL LIQUID. THERE IS STILL QUITE A BIT
OF MOISTENING THAT IS REQUIRED BEFORE THAT TAKES PLACE. THE
PRECIPITATION BAND ORIENTED FROM NORTHEAST TO SOUTHWEST WILL
GRADUALLY FILL IN ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT AND BRING RAINFALL TO
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO
STEADY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS WHILE ONLY SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS
WILL OCCUR OVER SOUTHERN AREAS. 

A GRID UPDATE WAS JUST SENT TO FRESHEN UP THE FORECAST PRODUCTS.

459 
FXUS64 KMRX 311950
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST MON DEC 31 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT...BRINGING WITH IT A 
WIDE BAND OF RAIN TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  SHOULD SEE CONTINUED WARMING 
AND INCREASED MOISTURE INTO THE EVENING AHEAD OF THE FRONT WHICH 
WILL AID IN KEEPING PRECIP AS MOSTLY RAIN THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON. 
HOWEVER... HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND A FEW NORTHERN LOCATIONS MAY 
OCCASIONALLY SEE A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW TOWARDS MORNING.  ANY 
ACCUMULATION SHOULD BE LESS THAN AN INCH.  THE FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH 
OF THE AREA LATE TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  WITH LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IN PLACE AND WEAK WEST TO EVENTUALLY NORTHWEST FLOW... 
SHOULD CONTINUE TO HAVE SCATTERED PRECIPITATION THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  PRECIP WILL BEGIN TO EXIT THE AREA FROM NORTHEAST TO 
SOUTHEAST AND RAIN WILL CHANGE OVER TO SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT.  ANY 
ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD REMAIN LESS THAN AN INCH AND BE 
CONFINED TO THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THESE PERIODS STILL LOOK 
GENERALLY DRY WITH SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. PERHAPS STILL A VERY 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY OVER 
EXTREME EASTERN AND SOUTHERN AREAS. HOWEVER...MODELS APPEAR TO BE 
KEEPING THE BULK OF PRECIPITATION OVER THE GULF COAST STATES...AND 
TRENDING DRY FOR THE SRN APPALACHIANS. KEPT SOME CONTINUITY WITH 
PREVIOUS GRIDS AND NWS NEIGHBORS FOR NOW.

PATTERN LOOKS A BIT NOISY FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY...BUT FEATURES 
SOME WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING OVER THE NE STATES AND NEAR ZONAL 
FLOW ACROSS THE SE STATES. THIS SHOULD EQUATE TO A DRY FORECAST. DID 
NOT SEE ANY REAL OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE OVER GFSX MOS...SO JUST 
MADE A FEW TWEAKS ON MAXES AND MINS IN LINE WITH SIMILAR 00Z/12Z 
GFSX NUMBERS.

759 
FXUS64 KMRX 310752
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 AM EST MON DEC 31 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A TROUGH OVER THE DESERT SW AND A STRONG SUBTROPICAL JET ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL BRING BROKEN TO OVERCAST MID TO HIGH CLOUDS 
TODAY. VERY DRY AIR BELOW 700 MB WILL PREVENT ANY PRECIP FROM 
REACHING THE GROUND BEFORE 00Z. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE INCREASING 
TONIGHT AS THE SOUTHWESTERLY 850 MB FLOW STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF THE 
PROGRESSIVE TROUGH. GRADUAL TOP-DOWN MOISTENING OF THE COLUMN SHOULD 
BEGIN TO BRING MEASURABLE PRECIP TO THE AREA AROUND MIDNIGHT. 

TEMPERATURE PROFILES IN THE NAM ARE QUITE A BIT COLDER THAN THE GFS 
AT THE ONSET OF PRECIP. SIMILAR TO THE LAST PRECIP EVENT...THE NAM 
SEEMS TO BE PUTTING GREATER WEIGHT ON EVAPORATIVE COOLING EFFECTS 
OVER WARM ADVECTION. THE GFS PROVED MORE ACCURATE IN THAT EVENT...SO 
WILL FOLLOW THE WARMER GFS FOR TONIGHT. THIS WILL MEAN NO MENTION OF 
SNOW IN THE FORECAST FOR THE MOUNTAINS. POPS WILL RISE TO 
CATEGORICAL IN THE WESTERN HALF IN THE 09-12Z TIME FRAME. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
FAIRLY STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING FOR TUESDAY WILL PRODUCE A
LARGE AREA OF RAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH CATEGORICAL POPS.
BOUNDARY WILL DRIFT SOUTHEAST FOR TUESDAY NIGHT DIMINISHING THE
CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION. THE RAIN MAY CHANGE OVER THE LIGHT SNOW
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BEFORE ENDING. THERE ARE SOME
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM RUNS THIS MORNING FOR TUESDAY
NIGHT. THE NAM SUGGESTS A WAVE WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE BOUNDARY
KEEPING HIGHER CHANCES OF RAIN OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA. WILL FOLLOW THE GFS/ECMWF SOLUTION FOR NOW...BUT
WILL WATCH TO SEE IF THIS WAVE BECOME MORE LIKELY DURING LATER
MODEL RUNS.

FOR WEDENSDAY...BOUNDARY PULLS WELL SOUTH TO THE GULF COASTS. FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...A NORTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVES TOWARD 
THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS MORNING MODEL RUNS AGREE WITH A 
MORE POSITIVE TILTED UPPER TROUGH WITH MUCH WEAKER FORCING AND 
PRESSURE FALLS. THE WEAKER SYSTEM DOES NOT PULL DEEPER BOUNDARY 
LAYER MOISTURE BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS..SO CHANCES OF 
PRECIPITATION LIMITED TO FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

FOR FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS SHOW MAJOR 
DIS-AGREEMENTS WITH UPPER PATTERN. WILL FOLLOW THE GFS FOR NOW WITH 
MORE OF A DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN.


&&

474 
FXUS64 KMRX 310222 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 PM EST SUN DEC 30 2012

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE FORECAST THIS EVENING AS CALM 
AND DRY WEATHER IS PREVAILING IN WAKE OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
THAT IMPACTED THE REGION AT THE END OF LAST WEEK. MOSTLY CLEAR
CONDITIONS HAVE ALLOWED FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING TO OCCUR AS
TEMPS HAVE DIPPED QUITE A BIT AFTER SUNSET. HOWEVER...SOME SCT MID
TO HIGH CLOUDS ARE BEGINNING TO WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE FORECAST
AREA FROM THE WEST IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING STORM SYSTEM OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THESE CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO BECOME DENSER
AFTER MIDNIGHT...PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHICH
WILL HELP TO LIMIT COOLING A LITTLE BIT. STILL...GENERALLY SPEAKING
A VERY COLD NIGHT IS ON TAP FOR THE AREA REGARDLESS OF CLOUD
COVER AS THE MERCURY WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER TEENS TO LOW 20S
IN THE MTNS AND FOOTHILLS...AND IN THE NORTHEAST ZONES /WHERE
CLEARER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED/...TO THE MID TO UPPER 20S ACROSS
THE WESTERN ZONES GIVEN THE SOME INCREASED CLOUD COVER LATE
TONIGHT.

729 
FXUS64 KMRX 302000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST SUN DEC 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...ALL LOW CLOUDS HAVE CLEARED THE 
AREA AND THE SURFACE HIGH IS SETTLING INTO THE AREA...SO AT SUNSET 
THERE SHOULD BE VERY EFFICIENT RADIATIONAL COOLING.  HOWEVER...HIGH 
CLOUDS...THEN MIDDLE CLOUDS WILL BE RACING TOWARD THE AREA...SO THE 
COOLING WILL BE CUT SHORT LATER TONIGHT AS THE BLANKETING EFFECT OF 
THE CLOUDS TAKES EFFECT.  HAVE GONE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE MIN 
TEMPS...BUT HAVE ADJUSTED THE HOURLY TEMPS TO COOL QUICKLY THIS 
EVENING...THEN LEVEL OFF LATER ON.  FOR MONDAY...HAVE KEPT THE 
FORECAST DRY INTO THE AFTERNOON...WILL HAND OFF TO MONDAY NIGHT FOR 
PRECIP TIMING ETC.  LOOKS LIKE THE PRECIP WILL EITHER BE WEST OR 
NORTH OF US...OR EVEN ABOVE US AS VIRGA FALLING INTO DRIER AIR...AT 
THE END OF THE DAY...BUT READY TO MOVE IN MONDAY NIGHT.  RETURN FLOW 
SWLY WINDS WILL PICK UP MONDAY...BUT SHOULD NOT BE STRONG.

.LONG TERM  (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH 
A SHORT WAVE RIDING ALONG IT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA EARLY IN THE 
EXTENDED.  AS IT MOVES THROUGH...A WIDE BAND OF SHOWERS WILL PUSH IN 
MONDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY FOR CATEGORICAL POPS.  WARM 
AIR AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM SHOULD ALLOW MUCH OF THE PREFRONTAL PRECIP 
TO BE RAIN.  ONLY EXCEPTION MAY BE A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW AT HIGHER 
ELEVATION.  A WINTERY MIX IS POSSIBLE BEHIND THE FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY...BUT MOISTURE BECOMES MORE LIMITED AND PRECIP SHOULD 
BECOME CONFINED TO GENERALLY FAR SOUTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS.  
THE BOUNDARY SETTLES TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST AS ADDITIONAL WAVES TRACK 
ALONG IT.  CURRENT MODEL RUNS GENERALLY KEEP ASSOCIATED PRECIP SOUTH 
OF THE AREA THROUGH SCATTERED SHOWER ACTIVITY MAY REACH INTO MAINLY 
SOUTHERN AND EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE MRX CWA THROUGH THURSDAY.  A 
COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES MOVES THROUGH DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE 
EXTENDED BUT SHOULD ONLY BRING IN A FEW CLOUDS AND WILL KEEP THINGS 
DRY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.  

&&

305 
FXUS64 KMRX 300833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 AM EST SUN DEC 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL PATTERN WILL BE DIMINISHING THIS MORNING 
AS MIDLEVEL TEMPS WARM BEHIND THE 500 MB TROUGH AXIS. EARLY THIS 
MORNING...LIGHT SNOW CONTINUES OVER PORTIONS OF SW VA...BUT 
ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL WILL END AROUND SUNRISE AS MOISTURE DEPTH 
CONTINUES TO DECREASE AND STABILIZATION ALOFT INCREASES. THUS THE 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE CANCELED. SCATTERED FLURRIES WILL BE 
MENTIONED THROUGH THE REST OF THE MORNING IN SW VA AND NE TN 
MOUNTAINS. CURRENT OBS INDICATE THAT WINDS ON OUR SIDE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS HAVE DIMINISHED BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA...SO THE NPW 
WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE. WITH CONTINUED STABILIZATION AND 
DRY ADVECTION ALOFT...CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM WEST TO 
EAST THIS AFTERNOON. HIGH TEMPS WILL RANGE FROM THE MID 30S NORTH TO 
LOWER 40S SOUTH.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN STREAM WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH
ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY NIGHT
INTO TUESDAY INCREASING THE SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA.

INCREASING MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT ALONG WITH A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WILL PRODUCE LIKELY TO 
CATEGORICAL POPS. SOME OF THE PRECIPITATION MAY BE A MIXTURE OF 
SNOW/SLEET AND POSSIBLY FREEZING RAIN ACROSS THE NORTHEAST AND FAR 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS.

PRECIPITATION ENDS TUESDAY NIGHT AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY PULLS SOUTH OF 
THE AREA. GFS/ECMWF ARE IN DIS-AGREEMENT IN REPECT TO NEXT NORTHERN 
STREAM WAVE WITH ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE. THE GFS HAS A STRONGER 
NORTHERN STREAM WAVE WHILE THE ECMWF IS WEAKER. BOTH MODELS SHOW 
ONLY MINOR PHASING OF THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES..SO
BRUNT OF THE MOISTURE/PRECIPITATION REMAINS EAST OF THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. LATER SHIFTS WILL NEED 
TO WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL OF GREATER PHASING OF THESE TWO SYSTEMS. 
IF THEY DO PHASE..THEN THE FORECAST AREA COULD SEE A DECENT SNOWFALL.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             43  28  51  38  46 /   0   0  10  80 100

719 
FXUS64 KMRX 300005 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
705 PM EST SAT DEC 29 2012

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATED THE POPS/WX GRIDS TO ACCOUNT FOR AN EXPANDING FIELD OF
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OVERSPREADING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND MUCH OF
THE GREAT TENNESSEE VALLEY. INCLUDED AT LEAST A CHANCE OF SNOW
SHOWERS AREAWIDE THIS EVENING...WITH LIKELY SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS IN THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY. ADDITIONALLY
OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED HEAVIER NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS/BANDS
ARE CONTINUING TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EASTERN
KY/SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MTNS OF EAST TENNESSEE. AM EXPECTING THESE
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS TO CONTINUE ACROSS THE PLATEAU/TN VALLEY FOR
MOST OF THE EVENING AS SOME ENHANCED LIFT FROM AN UPPER-LEVEL
DISTURBANCE DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THESE SNOW
SHOWERS SHOULD NOT BE VERY HEAVY AND ARE NOT EXPECTED TO PRODUCE
ANYTHING MORE THAN EXTREMELY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS...WITH MOST AREAS
RECEIVING NOTHING MORE THAN A DUSTING. HOWEVER...A LOCALIZED
COVERING OF GRASSY SURFACES WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH THE EVENING IN
A FEW SPOTS. ALSO...AS TEMPERATURES DROP OVERNIGHT...SOME PATCHY
BLACK ICE WILL BE POSSIBLE ON SOME AREA ROADWAYS THAT ARE WET FROM
THE LIGHT RAIN/SNOW THAT HAS FALLEN EARLIER.

ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE HEAVIER
SNOW SHOWERS/BANDS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THIS EVENING AND LINGER
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW HAS
ALREADY OCCURRED IN THE HIGHER PEAKS OF THE SMOKIES AND AN
ADDITIONAL 2-3 INCHES IS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT. AS A RESULT...A WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT THROUGH 12Z TMRW MORNING TO ACCOUNT
FOR THIS POTENTIAL. ADDITIONALLY...A WIND ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR
PORTIONS OF FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...WHERE STRONG POST FRONTAL
WIND GUSTS OF UP TO 30-40 MPH COULD CREATE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL
CONDITIONS AND COMBINE WITH THE WINTRY PRECIP TO CREATE SOME
BLOWING SNOW IN A FEW SPOTS AS WELL. BY SUNRISE TMRW...ANY SNOW
SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO TAPER OFF...BUT GIVEN THE COLD CONDITIONS
/WITH LOWS IN THE 20S AREAWIDE/...ROADS COULD STILL BE SLICK ALONG
THE HIGHER TERRAIN IN THE AFOREMENTIONED AREAS...SO CAUTION IS
URGED FOR THOSE WITH TRAVEL PLANS IN THE ADVISORY AREAS THIS
WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST SAT DEC 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLDER AIR NOW POURING INTO THE 
AREA...WEAK DISTURBANCE IN NW FLOW MOVING INTO/ACROSS MID TN...LOOKS 
LIKE IT WILL HOLD TOGETHER WELL ENOUGH TO GET AT LEAST FLURRIES 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA THIS EVENING.  GOING ABOVE GUIDANCE ON POPS 
OVER WESTERN AND NWRN AREAS...THINKING THEY HAVE A DECENT CHANCE OF 
MEASURABLE PRECIP IN FIRST PERIOD...WHEREAS GUIDANCE WAS MOSTLY 
DRY.  THIS ENHANCED AREA OF PRECIP SHOULD MOVE ON PAST THE AREA 
SHORTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  

WENT ABOUT A CATEGORY ABOVE GUIDANCE ON MIN TEMPS...AS STRATOCUMULUS 
CLOUDS SHOULD COVER MOST AREAS ALL NIGHT...AND UPSTREAM LOW TEMPS 
WERE NOT OVERLY COLD THIS MORNING IN ILL/IOWA.  ALSO...WENT ABOVE 
GUIDANCE ON DEW POINTS...AS MODELS WERE DRYING AREA OUT TOO QUICKLY.

MENTIONING BLOWING SNOW IN NE TN ZONES THAT HAVE WIND ADVISORY 
TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM  (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE 
REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WILL DAMPEN AND DROP SOUTHEAST LATE 
MONDAY AS THE NEXT SYSTEM AND COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA.  A FEW 
SHOWERS MAY MOVE IN IN ADVANCE OF THE SYSTEM LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON.  
HOWEVER...THE MAIN LINE OF SHOWERS WILL PUSH ACROSS THE MRX CWA 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  EXPECT WIDESPREAD RAIN SHOWERS TO MOVE 
THROUGH FOR LIKELY POPS AND COULD SEE A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW EARLY 
TUESDAY MORNING AND MAINLY OVER NORTHERN AREAS AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. ANY LINGER PRECIP BEHIND THE FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT SHOULD 
TRANSITION TO LIGHT SNOW.  FRONT SETTLES TO OUR SOUTH ON WEDNESDAY 
WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE RIDING ALONG IT WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY.  MAIN AREA OF ASSOCIATED SHOWERS WILL STAY TO OUR 
SOUTH...BUT MAY SEE SOME SHOWER ACTIVITY LIFT NORTH INTO OUR AREA.  
WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS OVER MUCH OF THE AREA FOR THIS TIME 
FRAME.

LATEST MODELS IN DISAGREEMENT FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED. PREVIOUS 
GFS MODEL RUNS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT IN SHOWING A NORTHERN 
STREAM WAVE DIPPING DOWN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND PULLING A 
FAIRLY COLD SURFACE HIGH INTO THE PLAIN STATES KEEPING TEMPERATURES 
COOLER ON FRIDAY...WHILE LATEST 12Z RUN DEVELOPS RIDGING AND MUCH 
WARMER TEMPERATURES ACROSS OUR AREA. ECMWF MORE IN LINE WITH 
PREVIOUS GFS RUNS SO GOING WITH COOLER TEMPS FOR NOW. MODELS IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT ON A POTENTIAL LOW SWINGING THROUGH ON SATURDAY...BUT VARY 
ON INTENSITY AND PATH. WILL KEEP THE END OF THE EXTENDED DRY FOR NOW.

SMOKIES...LOOKS LIKE WINDS WILL BE GUSTY...BUT MAINLY BELOW
CRITERIA. WILL KEEP CURRENT WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AS-IS.

206 
FXUS64 KMRX 290805
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST SAT DEC 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SYNOPTIC SCALE Q-G FORCING HAS PUSHED EAST OF THE AREA...WITH 
SHOWERY CONVECTIVE PRECIP REMAINING TO MOVE THROUGH THIS MORNING 
BENEATH COLD MIDLEVEL TEMPS WITH THE 500 MB TROUGH. OBSERVED 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MOUNTAINS AND DUAL-POL RADAR SUGGEST THAT ONLY 
THE VERY HIGHEST MOUNTAIN PEAKS MAY BE SEEING SNOW OR SLEET EARLY
THIS MORNING. HOWEVER THE FREEZING LEVEL WILL BE DROPPING OVER THE
NEXT FEW HOURS AS COLD ADVECTION INCREASES WITH THE 850-500 MB
TROUGH PASSAGE. ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS THIS MORNING WILL BE MAINLY
ABOVE 4000 FT. SOME TOP-DOWN DRYING WILL OCCUR LATE THIS MORNING
AND EARLY AFTERNOON...WHICH WILL LOWER POPS TO A CHANCE. MOISTURE
DEPTH INCREASES SLIGHTLY IN THE LATE AFTERNOON WITH THE APPROACH OF
A SECONDARY MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS. RESULTING STEEP LAPSE RATES AND
30-35 KT 850 UPSLOPE WINDS WILL PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS WITH LIGHT
ACCUMULATIONS...MAINLY IN HIGHER TERRAIN. FOR TODAY AND
TONIGHT...UP TO 3 INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS
AND SW VA MOUNTAINS. THE CURRENT ADVISORY WILL BE CONTINUED AS IS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
FOR SUNDAY...RIDGING BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL BEGIN THE
EXTENDED FORECAST WITH DRY CONDITIONS. FOR LATE MONDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY...A NORTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAEKS WITH
A COLD FRONT DROPPING TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. AT THE SAME
TIME...A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
PLAINS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PULLING
MOISTURE BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA. GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN PRETTY
DECENT AGREEMENT SHOWING A VERY STRONG UPPER JET PULLING ACROSS THE
OHIO VALLEY WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE OVER THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY
EVENING. THE UPPER JET HELPS TO PRODUCE FAIRLY STRONG FRONTO-
GENETIC FORCING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH
TUESDAY EVENING. LIKELY-CATEGORICAL POPS WILL BE INCLUDED.

MAIN CONCERN IS HOW OF A WINTRY MIX CAN BE EXPECTED ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SMOKY MOUNTAINS. 
WILL INCLUDE A WINTRY MIX FOR THESE AREAS. THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA SHOULD MAINLY BE RAIN.

ANOTHER NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVES WELL NORTH AND SOUTH 
OF THE FOREACST AREA FOR LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. AGAIN...GFS 
AND ECMWF ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING BRUNT OF THE 
PRECIPITATION SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. NORTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL 
PULL A FAIRLY COLD SURFACE HIGH INTO THE PLAIN STATES WITH A PIECE 
OF THE COLD AIR MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 290313 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1013 PM EST FRI DEC 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE FORECAST THIS EVENING AS SHOWERS
CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE SOUTHWEST AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH TRACKS EASTWARD FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. PRECIP CHANCES MAY BEGIN TO
DIMINISH LATE TONIGHT AS THERE IS SOME DRYING BACK TO THE WEST AND
SOME BREAKS WITHIN THE RAIN SHIELD ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND
CUMBERLAND MTNS ATTM. HOWEVER...AM EXPECTING AT LEAST SCATTERED
LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS TO TRACK ACROSS THE REGION FOR MOIST OF
THE NIGHT GIVEN THE A HIGH BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE/LIFT ASSOCIATED
WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT /CURRENTLY IN WESTERN
TENNESSEE/. IN FACT...A LARGE PLUME OF MOISTURE /AND ASSOCIATED
RAIN SHIELD/ LOOKS AS THOUGH IT WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE
NORTHEASTWARD FROM CENTRAL/EAST ALABAMA ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE AND
THE SPINE OF THE MTNS FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS...YIELDING NEAR
100 POPS FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
NIGHT.

TEMPS HAVE HELD STEADY FOR THE MOST PART IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER
40S...AND ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BUDGE MUCH OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...IN
THE MTNS THEY WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW TO OCCUR...POSSIBLY UP
TO A COUPLE INCHES ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VIRGINIA AND THE
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MTNS OF EAST TENNESSEE /MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT/.
THEREFORE A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BEGIN AT 4 AM EST IN THE
AFOREMENTIONED AREA AND ACTUALLY WILL PERSIST THROUGH 12Z SUNDAY AS
POST FRONTAL UPSLOPE FLOW WILL ALLOW SOME FOR SOME LINGERING SNOW
SHOWERS IN THESE AREAS TMRW AND TMRW NIGHT. ADDITIONALLY SOME LIGHT
ISOLATED POCKETS OF SLEET MIXING IN WITH THE RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE
MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE PLATEAU AND MTNS AS WELL...
THOUGH THE PREDOMINANT PRECIP TYPE IN MOST AREAS OVERNIGHT WILL BE
RAIN.

MOISTURE INCREASES...CIGS WILL DROP TO MVFR TO PERHAPS IFR LEVELS
AT TIMES LATER THIS EVENING AND TONIGHT. CIGS WILL GRADUALLY RISE
TO VFR LEVELS AS THE -RA TAPERS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST LATE
TONIGHT/DAYBREAK. EARLY THIS MORNING A FRONT WILL SWEEP THROUGH THE
REGION...PROMPTING A SHIFT IN THE WINDS TO THE WNW...AS THEY BECOME
STRONGER /POSSIBLY GUSTY AT TIMES/ BY THE AFTERNOON.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...

FXUS64 KMRX 282011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EST FRI DEC 28 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...LOW LEVELS HAVE REMAINED DRY 
FOR MUCH OF THE DAY ACROSS E TN LIMITING RAINFALL REACHING THE 
GROUND. WE DID RECEIVE A FEW BRIEF SLEET REPORTS FROM AROUND 
CLEVELAND TN EARLIER THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT RAINFALL SHIELD TO 
SPREAD ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT. AFTER MIDNIGHT...THE TEMPERATURES WILL BECOME COLD ENOUGH FOR 
SOME SNOW TO DEVELOP PARTICULARLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATION SAY 
ABOVE 3 KFT. MODEL SOUNDS HINT AT GOOD DRYING OVER CHATTANOOGA AND 
KNOXVILLE AFTER 12Z SATURDAY...SO RAIN CHANCES MAY DIMINISH GREATLY 
AFTER SUNRISE FOR THE THE SOUTHERN VALLEY EVEN WITH THE WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM.

DUE TO THE ONSET OF SNOWFALL AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS EXPECT 
ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WITH THE 
LOW LEVEL NORTHWEST UPSLOPE FLOW REGIME. WILL BE ISSUING A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND PART OF THE 
SMOKIES FROM 9Z SATURDAY TO 12Z SUNDAY. THE MAIN SNOWFALL WILL OCCUR 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON INTO SUNDAY EVENING. LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO 
CANCEL BEFORE 12Z SUNDAY AS CONDITIONS WARRANT.

.LONG TERM....(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPSLOPE SNOWFALL 
WILL CONTINUE SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A FEW PATCHES OF LIGHT SNOW OR 
FLURRIES LINGERING OVER FAR NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS ON SUNDAY.  A 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A 
TOTAL OF 1 TO 3 INCHES OF SNOWFALL POSSIBLE OVER FAVORED AREAS...THE 
HIGHEST PEAKS COULD SEE SLIGHTLY MORE ACCUMULATIONS.  HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.  MODELS DIVERGE DURING THE 
LATER HALF OF THE EXTENDED...HOWEVER...THE NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD MOVE 
IN QUICKLY AND COULD SEE CLOUDS AND POSSIBLE A FEW ADVANCE SHOWERS 
MOVE IN LATE IN THE DAY MONDAY.  THE BEST CHANCE FOR THE MAIN BAND 
OF SHOWERS WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  THE EVENT SHOULD BE 
MAINLY RAIN WITH SOME SNOW POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  MODELS 
DIFFER AS TO PLACEMENT BUT SHOULD SEE A BOUNDARY TO OUR SOUTHEAST 
WITH ASSOCIATED SHOWER ACTIVITY CONTINUING ALONG THE BOUNDARY.  WILL 
KEEP SOME LOW POPS GENERALLY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE AREA FOR 
WEDNESDAY.

FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED..A SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE ACROSS THE GULF 
COAST STATES WILL MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE CAROLINAS FOR THURSDAY. 
THURSDAY NIGHT...A NORTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY FOR FRIDAY WITH COLDER AIR SPILLING INTO THE AREA AT THE END 
OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

AND NE TN. THE CLOUD COVER AND COOLER AIR IN PLACE WILL INHIBIT
WARMING UP TOO FAR INTO THE 40S BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON.

118 
FXUS64 KMRX 280814
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EST FRI DEC 28 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE BROAD UPPER TROUGH NOW OVER THE ROCKIES WILL BE PROGRESSING EAST 
TODAY...WITH THE JET STREAM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS PROVIDING 
PLENTY OF HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE TN VALLEY. TEMPS WILL 
STAY IN THE 40S ACROSS THE AREA WITH LIMITED SUNSHINE. BY LATE 
AFTERNOON...850-700 MB POSITIVE THETA-E ADVECTION BEGINS...SPREADING 
RAIN INTO SOUTHERN AREAS. GOOD Q-G FORCING AHEAD OF THE ADVANCING 
UPPER TROUGH WILL BRING OCCASIONAL MODERATE RAINFALL TONIGHT. THE 
NAM AND GFS HAVE SOME DIFFERING TEMPERATURE PROFILES AT THE ONSET OF 
PRECIP...WHICH WILL IMPACT THE AMOUNT OF SNOW IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WARMER PROFILE OF THE GFS...WHICH HOLDS OFF 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS UNTIL THE 09-12Z TIME FRAME WHEN COLD ADVECTION 
ALOFT BEGINS. THE NAM MAY BE OVERDOING THE EFFECTS OF EVAPORATIVE 
COOLING AT ONSET...AS WARM ADVECTION APPEARS TO BE QUITE STRONG.
THE HIGHEST PEAKS OF THE SMOKIES AND NE TN MOUNTAINS...ABOVE 4000
FT...COULD SEE 1 TO 2 INCHES LATE TONIGHT...WITH AREAS ABOVE 3000
FEET SEEING UNDER 1 INCH.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE 
WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. MODELS SHOW A 
GOOD DEAL OF WRAP-AROUND LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINING WITH DECENT 
COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND EXITING CYCLOGENESIS OFF THE MID-ATLANTIC 
COAST. ALSO...ANOTHER WEAK NORTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. END RESULT WITH PERIOD OF 
PRECIPITATION FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE SUGGEST SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH A 
MIXUTRE OF SNOW/RAIN FOR THE LOWER TERRAIN. CONTINUED SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE LIKELY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN WITH AMOUNTS 
APPROACHING WARNING CRITERIA FOR THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 
HOWEVER...MOST LOCATIONS WILL BE ADVISORY 1 TO 3 INCH RANGE. A 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN IS LIKELY FOR 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT.

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...RIDGING BUILDS IN WITH SKY CLEARING. 
RETURN OF SUNSHINE SUNDAY WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM...BUT WILL 
STILL GO A CAT COOLER THAN GUIDANCE.

ANOTHER FAST MOVING SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR LATE MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THE PRECIPITATION MAY BEGIN A MIXTURE OF SNOW..SLEET AND 
FREEZING RAIN FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS MONDAY NIGHT..CHANGE TO MAINLY 
RAIN TUESDAY..THEN BACK TO SNOW FOR LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY 
NIGHT.

FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED..A SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE ACROSS THE GULF 
COAST STATES WILL MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE CAROLINAS FOR THURSDAY. AT 
THE SAME TIME...A NORTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY FOR THURSDAY WITH COLDER AIR SPILLING INTO THE AREA AT THE 
END OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 271938
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 PM EST THU DEC 27 2012

.SHORT TERM TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CLOUDS THAT HAVE BLANKETED EAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR MUCH OF THE DAY WILL BEGIN 
DISSPIATING FROM SOUTH TO NORTH BEGINING LATE THIS AFTERNOON. SOME 
CLOUD CLEARING CAN BE SEEN ACROSS SOUTHERN ALABAMA OVER THE PAST 
HOUR OR SO. THIS TREND SHOULD CONTINUE INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS.

THIN HIGH CLOUDS WILL STREAM OVER THE AREA THE REMAINDER OF THE 
NIGHT AHEAD OF THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL 
FALL INTO THE 20S. THE SHORT-TERM FORECAST MODELS ARE ABOUT SIX 
HOURS FASTER MOVING THE RAINFALL INTO THE WESTERN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WHEN COMPARED TO THE RUNS 24 HOURS AGO. EXPECT RAIN TO 
BEGIN AFFECTING PORTIONS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND PERHAPS AS 
FAR EAST AS KNOXVILLE AND CHATTANOOGA AROUND NOON TIME. THE AREA OF 
RAIN SHOULD SPREAD NORTH AND EAST THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON. DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES WILL WILL GENERALLY BE IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN CONCERN THIS 
EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE REGION EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD.  THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY AND WILL 
BRING WIDESPREAD RAINFALL ACROSS THE AREA.  HAVE UPPED POPS TO NEAR 
100 FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.  PRECIP SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN...AND SWITCH OVER 
TO SNOW MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN AND SOME NORTHERN LOCATIONS 
OVERNIGHT.  ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO BRING IN LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE...COOLER AIR AND UPSLOPE FLOW.  SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA...FAVORING NORMAL UPSLOPE 
LOCATIONS.  THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE 1 TO 3 INCHES OF 
ACCUMULATIONS BY THE TIME THE SYSTEM EXITS SATURDAY NIGHT.  AN UPPER 
RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  MODELS DIVERGE AS THE NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  CONFIDENCE 
BECOMING QUITE LOW AT THIS POINT AND WILL KEEP POPS AT CHANCE 
CATEGORY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...AND LOWER TO 20 POPS FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT.

GFS AND ECMWF NOT IN AGREEMENT ON PATTERN EVOLUTION FOR WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. ECMWF WANTS TO START BRINGING IN PRECIP ON 
WEDNESDAY FROM A CUT OFF LOW OVER TEXAS. LOW IS SLOW TO PROPAGATE 
EASTWARD BUT EVENTUALLY GETS PICKED UP BY A TROUGH SWINGING DOWN 
FROM THE NORTH ON FRIDAY EVENING INTO SATURDAY MORNING. GFS IS MUCH 
FASTER AS IT DOES NOT WANT TO CUT OFF THE LOW. GFS WASHES OUT THE 
LOW BEFORE IT EVER REACHES THE SOUTHERN U.S. BECAUSE OF THIS...GFS 
IS MUCH DRIER THROUGH THIS PERIOD. FOR NOW...GOING WITH A BLEND OF 
THE TWO BUT FAVORING GFS. CARRIED SLIGHT CHANCE OF POPS THROUGH THIS 
PERIOD.

016 
FXUS64 KMRX 270848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EST THU DEC 27 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS STILL REMAIN
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...FAR NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE...AND THE
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAIN ZONES OF EAST TENNESSEE. RADAR
TRENDS ARE INDICATING THAT THE OVERALL INTENSITY OF THESE SHOWERS
IS WEAKENING...THOUGH THEY ARE STILL EXPECTED TO PERSIST ALONG THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH SUNRISE...AND PERHAPS MID TO LATE
MORNING. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN SW
VIRGINIA AND THE NORTHERN/CENTRAL TENNESSEE MOUNTAIN ZONES TO
ACCOUNT FOR SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS THROUGH 12Z...BEFORE IT
TAPERS TO MORE WIDELY SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES BY
DAYBREAK. SOME BREEZY/GUSTY WINDS WILL ALSO PERSIST ALONG THE
HIGHER TERRAIN AND IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT.
HOWEVER...THE OBS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS HAVE CONTINUED TO SHOW A
DIMINISHING TREND...SO WILL ALLOW THE WIND ADVISORY TO EXPIRE AT 08Z.

FOR TOMORROW...LOW CLOUD COVER WILL GRADUALLY BEGIN TO BREAK UP
FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST OVER THE COURSE OF THE DAY. SKIES
SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY BY THE AFTERNOON OVER A GOOD
CHUNK OF THE FORECAST AREA...THOUGH CLOUDS WILL LIKELY LINGER IN
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR MOST OF THE DAY. AS
A RESULT...TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OUT OF THE MID-UPPER
30S IN THE NORTHEAST ZONES...AND DESPITE SOME HEATING ONLY THE LOW
TO MID 40S ELSEWHERE /THANKS A PERSISTENT NORTHERLY FLOW/. MAINLY
CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED LATER TONIGHT...RESULTING IN
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING AND COLDER LOW TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S IN
MOST LOCATIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
A BROAD MID-UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE TRACKING FROM THE PLAINS TO
THE ATLANTIC COAST FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. THE SURFACE LOW WILL
TRACK WELL TO OUR SOUTH...WITH 850-700 MB MOISTURE ADVECTION AND
ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING NORTHWARD INTO THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY
AFTERNOON. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS IN FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER
JET AND 500 MB VORTICITY AXIS CROSS THE AREA. TEMPS APPEAR COLD
ENOUGH FOR PRECIP TO CHANGE TO SNOW ON THE MOUNTAIN PEAKS ABOVE
4000 FT FRIDAY NIGHT. DRYING ALOFT BEGINS SATURDAY...ALONG WITH
850-500 MB COLD ADVECTION. THE PATTERN WILL TRANSITION TO A NW
FLOW...WITH MOUNTAIN AREAS BEING FAVORED FOR POP AND QPF THROUGH
SATURDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE BARELY REACHES THE DENDRITE GROWTH
ZONE...SO ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT...AROUND 1 TO 2
INCHES AT BEST...AND MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FT. TOP-DOWN DRYING SHOULD
END ALL PRECIP BY 12Z SUNDAY.

SUNDAY WILL BE DRY WITH A RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE REGION. CONFIDENCE 
DROPS DRAMATICALLY FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS THE GFS AND ECMWF 
SHOW VERY DIFFERENT SCENARIOS. THE GFS MERGES SOUTHERN AND NORTHERN 
STREAM TROUGHS OVER THE OH AND MS VALLEYS...RESULTING IN PRECIP 
SPREADING OVER OUR AREA MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. IT ALSO 
PLACES OUR AREA IN THE RAIN/SNOW TRANSITION ZONE. THE ECMWF HAS A 
STRONGER NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH CROSSING NEW ENGLAND...KEEPING MORE 
RIDGING OVER OUR AREA WITH A STATIONARY CLOSED LOW OVER THE DESERT 
SW. WITH SUCH LOW CONFIDENCE...WILL MAKE FEW CHANGES TO THIS 
PERIOD...KEEPING THE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING AND A MENTION 
OF RAIN OR SNOW NORTH.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 262059
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
359 PM EST WED DEC 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...POWERFUL SYSTEM STILL
TRUDGING THROUGH AREA...NOW TRANSITIONING TO COLD PHASE...SW TO NE.
EXPECTED TO GET AT LEAST FLURRIES OVER MUCH OF THE AREA...WITH
MEASURABLE SNOW ACROSS MOST HIGHER TERRAIN. COULD BE MEASURABLE
OVER NORTHERN HALF OF THE VALLEY...BUT MAINLY BELOW 1 INCH OVER
VALLEY. MOISTURE ERODES VERY QUICKLY ON THURSDAY...JUST GOING WITH
FLURRIES IN HIGHER ELEVATION AND DRY ELSEWHERE. WILL KEEP CURRENT
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING...WILL LEAVE OUT THE NORTHERN PLATEAU
AS AMOUNTS LOOK TOO LOW FOR THIS EVENT. MODELS LOOKED PRETTY GOOD
FOR TEMPS. WINDS WILL STAY UP FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT...WITH ADVISORY
WINDS OVERNIGHT ALONG APPALACHIAN CHAIN. WILL KEEP OTHER AREAS FOR
ADVISORY EXPIRING AT 6PM THIS EVENING.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE
FORECAST MODELS LOOK IN DECENT AGREEMENT THROUGH ABOUT SUNDAY
NIGHT. SO FOR THURSDAY NIGHT WITH SHORT WAVE RIDGING OCCURRING OVER
THE FORECAST AREA...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE NEARLY NON-
EXISTENT. THE NEXT SYSTEM...PRESENTLY OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S.
WILL BECOME A POSITIVELY TILTED TROUGH. THE AXIS OF THE TROUGH BY
FRIDAY EVENING WILL STRETCH ROUGHLY FROM MIDLAND TX TO LACROSSE WI.
AHEAD OF THE TROUGH... ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRANSPORT WILL
OCCUR FROM LA...ACROSS MS TN AND AL. FRIDAY NIGHT SURFACE
CYCLOGENESIS IS EXPECTED TO OCCUR SOMEWHERE BETWEEN NEW ORLEANS AND
JACKSON MS WHICH SHOULD ONLY HELP PRECIPITATION EFFICIENCY
PARTICULARLY ALONG THE GULF COAST. HOWEVER...SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA SUCH AS CHATTANOOGA COULD RECEIVE DECENT RAINFALL
AMOUNTS THROUGH MID DAY SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT. AS
THE TROUGH TRANSLATES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...STRONG NORTHWEST
FLOW SHOULD PROVIDE CHANCES FOR SNOW SATURDAY ESPECIALLY FOR
NORTHEASTERN AREAS SUCH AS TRI CITIES...SOUTHWEST VA AND HIGHER
MOUNTAIN ELEVATIONS. THIS WILL BE SOMETHING TO WATCH IN THE COMING
DAYS.

AS MENTIONED EARLIER...AFTER SUNDAY NIGHT THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS 
DIVERGE AND BECOME VERY OUT OF SYNC. THEREFORE CONFIDENCE IN PERIODS 
AFTER SUNDAY NIGHT ARE VERY LOW. THE ECMWF FROM 00Z AND SOMEWHAT 
FROM THE 12Z RUN AND THE 00Z/12Z CANADIAN ARE SIMILAR IN CUTTING OFF 
THE LOW IN THE DESERT SOUTHWEST WHILE THE GFS IS MUCH MORE 
PROGRESSIVE. THUS THE GFS IS MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH PAINTING 
PRECIP OVER THE FORECAST AREA THAN THE OTHER MEDIUM RANGE MODELS. 
EVEN THE ENSEMBLE GFS RUNS HAVE A TOUGH TIME COMING TO A CONSENSUS 
IN THESE LATER PERIODS. AS SUCH...MINIMAL CHANGES TO THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST HAVE BEEN MADE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1130 AM EST WED DEC 26 2012

.DISCUSSION...
FORECAST PRETTY WELL PLAYING OUT AS EXPECTED. SURFACE LOW NOW HAS
CONTINUED TO MOVE TO THE NORTHEAST AND IS NOW IN CENTRAL KY.
DOWNSLOPING WINDS WILL BE ENDING SW-NE AS THE WINDS SHIFT. SEVERAL
COUNTIES IN THE HIGH WINDS WARNING AREA ARE REPORTING TREES AND
LIMBS DOWN. WILL LOOK A LITTLE MORE CLOSELY FOR POSSIBILITY OF POST-
FRONTAL WIND ADVISORY IN SAME HIGH WINDS WARNING AREA. FOR
NOW...WILL LEAVE CURRENT ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS GOING.

INSTABILITY FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR AREAS THAT HAVE NOT GOTTEN THE
COLD FRONT LOOKS VERY LIMITED. MODELS INDICATE MINIMAL ELEVATED
INSTABILITY...SO SHOWERS WILL BE COMMON...AND THERE COULD BE A
RUMBLE OF THUNDER...BUT THE INSTABILITY NEEDED FOR SEVERE STORMS IS
WELL EAST OF THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE DOWNWARD TREND
FOR MOST LOCATIONS THIS AFTERNOON AS THE COLDER AIR POURS INTO THE
REGION.

.AVIATION...

THEY GRADUALLY WEAKEN AND VEER TO THE WNW/NW LATER TONIGHT.

078 
FXUS64 KMRX 260937
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
437 AM EST WED DEC 26 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...A BROAD AREA OF SHOWERS CONTINUES TO PUSH ITS
WAY NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE SOUTH...AS A SURFACE
LOW OVER SOUTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE LIFTS NORTHEAST. AS IT DOES
SO...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE REGION LATER
TODAY...BRINGING IT WITH SOME COOLER AIR TO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. THIS COOLER AIR WILL COMBINE WITH SOME LINGERING
MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THIS STORM SYSTEM TO CREATE SOME SNOW
SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING THROUGH THE
OVERNIGHT HOURS. ATTM...THE LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE...LIMITED COLD
AIR ALOFT AND A MORE PREVAILING WESTERLY FLOW WILL LIMIT THE
POTENTIAL FOR THIS TO BE A TRUE NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL EVENT.
HOWEVER...HIGHER ELEVATION LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
EAST TENNESSEE...PARTICULARLY THE HIGH MOUNTAIN PEAKS WILL LIKELY
EXPERIENCE SOME ACCUMULATIONS 1-4 INCHES...WITH SOME LOCALLY HIGHER
AMOUNTS POSSIBLE IN THE SMOKIES GIVEN THE LONGER DURATION OF COLD
AIR AND ENHANCED ORTHOGRAPHIC LIFT. GIVEN THIS...HAVE OPTED TO
ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE AFOREMENTIONED AREAS FROM
23Z THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH 12Z THURSDAY MORNING WHEN THE SNOWFALL
POTENTIAL APPEARS GREATEST.

THE OTHER THREAT OF NOTE WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM WILL BE THE
POTENTIAL FOR SOME STRONG GRADIENT WINDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
TODAY AS A STRONG 60-70 KT LOW-LEVEL JET PASSES OVER EAST
TENNESSEE. THE POTENTIAL FOR VERY GUSTY/STRONG WINDS WILL EXIST
ALONG THE FOOTHILLS AND HIGHER MOUNTAIN TERRAIN AND THUS A HIGH
WIND WARNING IS IN EFFECT FOR THE FAVORED AREAS THROUGH THIS
AFTERNOON. ADDITIONALLY...WIND ADVISORIES FOR THE PLATEAU AND
MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ARE IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS
AFTERNOON AS WELL. SOME GUSTY NEAR ADVISORY-LEVEL WINDS WILL LIKELY
PERSIST ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS LATER TONIGHT...BUT
GIVEN THEIR WESTERLY COMPONENT THE HIGHER WIND SPEEDS WILL BE ON
THE LEE SIDE IN WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA...WITH VALUES IN THE VALLEYS
BEING MUCH LIGHTER AS WELL. THUS...HELD OFF ON EXTENDING ANY WIND
ADVISORY PRODUCTS FOR TONIGHT FOR NOW.


.LONG TERM /THU NIGHT THROUGH TUE/...
WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL PROVIDE A
DRY THU NIGHT INTO AT LEAST THE FIRST PART OF FRIDAY. MODELS
CONTINUE TO BE IN DECENT AGREEMENT THAT THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL
APPROACH BY FRIDAY NIGHT. MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN
CONSISTENCY STILL LACKING FOR THE DETAILS HOWEVER. TREND OF THE
MODELS HAS BEEN TO SPEED THINGS UP...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS SOUTHWEST ZONES LATE FRIDAY...THEN CAT TO LIKELY POPS FOR
FRIDAY NIGHT. CHANCE SOUTHWEST TO LIKELY NORTHEAST SATURDAY. PRECIP
TYPE STILL LOOKS TO BE PRIMARILY RAIN IN THE SOUTHERN/CENTRAL AREAS
UNTIL A SWITCH TO SNOW SHOWERS ON THE BACKSIDE. PRECIP TYPE STILL
MORE UNCERTAIN NORTH. MAY BE A LINGERING SNOW SHOWER EARLY NORTHERN
AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS SUNDAY BUT OTHERWISE DRY...WITH DRY WEATHER
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE INTO MONDAY. ANOTHER SYSTEM FORECAST TO
APPROACH BY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...SO WILL CARRY CHANCE

945 PM EST TUE DEC 25 2012

.DISCUSSION...
MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL IS BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO OUR
AREA...ASSOCIATED WTIH STRONG SYNOPTIC LIFT AND QG FORCING. TIMING
OF PRECIP APPEARS TO BE A BIT FASTER THAN THE NAM...BUT IN LINE
WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST. NO UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED. THE LLJ WILL
CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN OVERNIGHT AS THE 850 MB LOW MOVES INTO
MIDDLE TN. SO FAR WINDS HAVE NOT BEEN VERY STRONG...GUSTING IN THE
20S...BUT SHOULD PICK UP QUICKLY TOWARD MIDNIGHT. THE CURRENT WIND
ADVISORY AND HIGH WIND WARNING WILL NOT BE CHANGED. THE THREAT OF
SEVERE WEATHER APPEARS TO BE DIMINISHING AS THE SURFACE WARM FRONT
REMAINS WELL TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS CENTRAL AL AND SRN GA. WITH THE
SYSTEM BECOMING OCCULDED...WE WILL LIKELY AVOID THE WARM SECTOR
INSTABILITY. SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY COULD PRODUCE SOME
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS MAINLY SOUTHERN AREAS TONIGHT.

PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND INTO KY.

FXUS64 KMRX 251935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST TUE DEC 25 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...VERY DYNAMIC 
SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS/GULF COAST STATES THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH STRONG CONVECTION ACROSS LA. NORTHERN STREAM JET OVER 
THE OHIO VALLEY AND STRONG SOUTHERN STREAM JET ACROSS TX WILL 
PRODUCE DEEP AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL LIFT OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
LATER TONIGHT AND RAPID CYCLOGENESIS. SURFACE LOW OVER LA WILL LIFT 
NORTHEAST TOWARD THE PLATEAU THIS EVENING WITH A WARM FRONT LIFT 
NORTH ACROSS THE NORTHERN GULF COAST STATES. 

STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE WARM FRONT WILL PULL AN AREA OF RAIN 
INTO THE FORECAST LATER THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING. THE WARM FRONT WILL 
PULL NORTH TO JUST ABOUT CHA BEFORE OCCLUDING AS SURFACE LOW RIDES 
NORTH. INSTABILITY WILL INCREASE WITH CAPES AROUND 500 J/KG INTO THE 
PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. THE CONVECTION WILL TAP INTO THE 
VERY STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET TO PRODUCE A CHANCE OF DAMAGING CONVECTIVE 
WINDS GENERALLY SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40 BETWEEN 05-13Z. 

THE STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET WITH 850MB WINDS OF 65-70KTS ALONG WITH 
FAVORABLE VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL SET THE STAGE FOR 
DAMAGING MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WINDS. HIGH WIND WARNING IS IN EFFECT 
FOR THE FAVORED AREAS TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. HAVE ALSO INCLUDED WIND 
ADVISORIES FOR THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS 
WELL.

AS SURFACE LOW MOVES NORTH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND SECONDARY LOW 
FORMS ACROSS THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES..COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL CHANGE 
THE RAIN TO SNOW..ESPECIALLY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. SNOWFALL OF 1 
TO 3 INCHES ANTICIPATED FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA..EASTERN
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS..AND AROUND 1 INCH FOR THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. 
MOST OF THE ACCMULATING SNOWS WILL OCCUR LATE WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...MAY BE A FEW LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS 
INTO THU MORNING OVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS...BUT THE 
WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND UPPER RIDGING SHOULD PROVIDE A DRY 
AFTERNOON THU WITH DRY WEATHER CONTINUING THROUGH FRIDAY.  MODELS IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT THAT ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL BE AFFECTING THE AREA THIS 
WEEKEND...BUT DIFFER IN THE DETAILS AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS 
LACKING AS WELL.  00Z ECMWF SHOWS A STRONGER SOUTHERN SYSTEM...WHILE 
THE 12Z GFS SHOWS MORE LOW PRESSURE FARTHER NORTH.  A SOLUTION MORE 
LIKE THE ECMWF WOULD LEAD TO MORE OF A WINTRY MIX THAN THE WARMER 
GFS.  GIVEN MODEL AND ENSEMBLE SPREAD WILL MENTION A WINTRY MIX 
MAINLY NORTH BUT WILL LEAN TOWARD MORE RAIN OVERALL.  SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS CAN BE EXPECTED ON THE BACK SIDE SAT NIGHT AND POSSIBLY INTO 
SUNDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE EXPECTED TO BRING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO MONDAY.  

ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES THE REGION LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. 
MODELS SHOW A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THE TIMING...SO KEPT POPS LOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1022 AM EST TUE DEC 25 2012

.DISCUSSION...AREAS OF DENSE FOG DISSIPATING...SO HAVE ALLOWED
DENSE FOG ADVISORY EXPIRE.

LATEST NAM MODEL CONTINUES TO SHOW A GOOD MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WIND
EVENT FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNEDAY..SO HAVE UPGRADED WATCH TO A WARNING.

SATELLITE AND LIGHTNING DATA SHOWS AN OUTBREAK OF STORMS ACORSS
TEXAS THIS MORNING DUE TO STRONG DYNAMICS WITH THE SOUTHERN PLAINS
SHORT-WAVE. THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
TONIGHT. I AM BECOMING MORE CONCERNED WITH THE POTENTIAL OF SEVERE
WEATHER OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY MORNING.

FOR THE AFTERNOON UPDATE...WILL LIKELY ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR
THE REST OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE FOR LATE TONIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY.

ALSO...THE STRONG SURFACE CYCLOGENESIS IS MOVING FARTHER SOUTH THAN
SHOWN YESTERDAY WHICH GIVES OUR NORTHERN FORECAST AREA AND
MOUNTAINS A BETTER CHANCE OF SNOW.

HAVE A GREAT CHRISTMAS DAY...

078 
FXUS64 KMRX 250913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
413 AM EST TUE DEC 25 2012

.SHORT TERM...(CHRISTMAS DAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LOTS OF WEATHER
OCCURRING BOTH THIS MORNING AND FROM LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. 
DENSE FOG AND DRIZZLE THE PROBLEM THROUGH MID MORNING...WITH MOST
OF THE AREA EXPERIENCING LESS THAN 1/2 MILE VISBYS. THUS...EXTENDED
THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 10 AM EST TODAY. FOG SHOULD LIFT
WITH SOME BRIEF IMPROVEMENT BEFORE MID AND HIGH CLOUDS OVERSPREAD
THE REGION AS THE INTENSE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE STRENGTHENS OVER THE
LOWER MS VALLEY REGION THIS AFTERNOON. WITH ONLY THE SREF SPREADING
ANY RAIN TO SW VA AND NE TN THIS AFTERNOON...I KEPT THOSE AREAS AT
LESS THAN 20 PERCENT POPS FOR NOW.

FOR TONIGHT...MAIN STORY REMAINS THE HIGH WINDS FOR THE EASTERN
MTNS AND FOOTHILLS...WITH HIGH WIND WATCH CONTINUED FOR NOW. THERE
IS ALSO A THREAT OF A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS LATE TONIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY MORNING...AT LEAST FOR SE TN AND SW NC AS THE WARM FRONT
LIFTS NORTH INTO THOSE AREAS. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED RIGHT
ON TRACK WITH VERY LITTLE CHANGES MADE...WITH A LITTLE DOWNSLOPING
QUITE POSSIBLE DUE TO THE STRONG SE WINDS THAT DEVELOP.

FOR WEDNESDAY...TEMPS SHOULD PEAK EARLY THEN DROP IN THE AFTERNOON
BUT I DID BUMP UP THE AFTERNOON TEMPS JUST A BIT...EXCEPT FOR OUR
NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES WHERE COLD AIR ADVECTION ARRIVES SOONEST. HIGH
WIND THREAT IS GREATLY DIMINISHED AFTER 18Z...BUT SPEEDS MAY STILL
WARRANT A WIND ADVISORY IN SEVERAL AREAS. WILL LET DAY SHIFT TODAY
ADDRESS THIS ISSUE. NOT LIKELY TO SEE MUCH SNOW ACCUMULATIONS
THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...EVEN ACROSS NRN PLATEAU AND HIGHER
TERRAIN OR MTN AREAS. 


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
IN WAKE OF A COLD FRONT DROPPING THOUGH THE FORECAST AREA...SOME 
COLD AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER INTO THE REGION AND COMBINE WITH 
THE SOME LINGERING WRAP AROUND MOISTURE TO CREATE SNOW SHOWERS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING. GIVEN THE LACK OF DEEP 
MOISTURE/COLD AIR AND A PREVAILING WEST TO WNW COMPONENT TO THE 
WIND...THIS DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A CLASSIC NORTHWEST SNOWFALL 
CASE. MOST VALLEY AND LOWER ELEVATION AREAS WILL EXPERIENCE LIGHT 
SNOW SHOWERS...WITH VERY NO MINOR TO NO ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED. 
HOWEVER...HIGHER ELEVATION LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
EAST TENNESSEE...PARTICULARLY THE HIGH MOUNTAIN PEAKS WILL LIKELY 
EXPERIENCE SOME ACCUMULATIONS OF AN INCH OR TWO GIVEN THE LONGER 
DURATION OF COLD AIR AND ENHANCED OROGRAPHIC LIFT. WITH THE JET 
PULLING NORTHEAST OF THE AREA BY 00Z THURSDAY...THE THREAT OF HIGH 
WINDS WILL LIKELY CEASE HEADING INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER... 
GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF THIS STORM SYSTEM AND THE TIGHT PRESSURE 
GRADIENT...SOME PERSISTENT ROBUST GRADIENT WINDS IN WAKE WILL CREATE 
SOME DIFFICULT TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THE FOOTHILLS AND HIGHER TERRAIN 
AND LIKELY REQUIRE A WIND ADVISORY THROUGH 12Z THURSDAY. 

BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING...ANY LINGERING PRECIPITATION IN THE 
MOUNTAINS WILL DISSIPATE...RESULTING IN DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH 
FRIDAY. HOWEVER...ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING THROUGH 
THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS WEEKEND...GIVING THE REGION 
ANOTHER SHOT OF PRECIPITATION /POTENTIALLY SOME WINTERY PRECIP... 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN/MOUNTAIN ZONES SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY MORNING/. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE MODEL UNCERTAINTY THIS FAR OUT 
WILL NOT GET TOO SPECIFIC WITH THE EXACT DETAILS YET. STILL...FELT 
CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO GO LIKELY TO HIGH-END CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE ON 
SATURDAY...WITH CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY BEFORE THINGS DRY OUT TO 
CLOSE OUT THE YEAR 2012 ON MONDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 PM EST MON DEC 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FOR TONIGHT...PLENTY OF
LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE..WET GROUND..LIGHT WINDS AND DIMINISHING MID AND
UPPER LEVEL CLOUDS WILL ALLOW AREAS OF DENSE FOG TO DEVELOP
OVERNIGHT. HAVE ISSUED A DENSE FOG ADVISORY AREA-WIDE THROUGH 13Z.

AN ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN WITH A DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE
PLAINS STATES WILL LIFT NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WEDNESDAY. STRONG
DYNAMICS AS A DOUBLE JET STRUCTURE PRODUCES IMPRESSIVE LIFT OVER
THE AREA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING. AGEOSTROPHIC
CIRCULATIONS AROUND NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAMS JETS WILL ENHANCE
FRONTO- GENETIC FORCING FOR LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY
MORNING. ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO INCLUDE THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. DUE TO THE STRONG BOUNDARY
LAYER JET (850MB WINDS 60-70KTS)..LOCALIZED CONVECTIVE DAMAGING
WINDS ARE POSSIBLE.

DUE THE STRONG 850MB JET AND FAIRLY FAVORABLE VERTICAL TEMPERATURE 
PROFIE...MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WINDS ARE A REAL CONCERN FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS FROM EAST TENNESSEE TO SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. HAVE ISSUED A HIGH WIND
WATCH FOR THESE AREAS.

FOR WEDNESDAY...STRONG COLD FRONT PASSES QUICKLY ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH ENOUGH WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE TO ALLOW THE RAIN TO CHANGE TO 
SNOW AREA-WIDE. 

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH MON)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
EARLY ON WITH FAIRLY TYPICAL INCREASING SPREAD LATER ON.  FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  WITH COLD AIR 
PUSHING IN AND SOME MOISTURE WRAPPING AROUND DEPARTING SYSTEM WED 
NIGHT SHOULD SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS.  RIGHT NOW DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A 
FAVORABLE NORTHWEST UPSLOPE SNOW EVENT...AS FLOW WILL BE MORE 
WESTERLY...COLD AIR NOT OVERLY DEEP AND MOISTURE BECOMES SHALLOW 
FAIRLY QUICKLY. STILL MAY BE SOME AT LEAST MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
ESPECIALLY HIGHER TERRAIN WED NIGHT INTO EARLY THU SO WILL CONTINUE 
MENTION IN HWO.  SHOULD BE DRY THU NIGHT AND FRIDAY AS WEAK SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE TAKES CONTROL.  NEXT SYSTEM FORECAST TO BRING PRECIP 
TO THE AREA THIS WEEKEND.  AT THIS POINT THIS LOOKS LIKE MUCH OF 
THIS WILL BE A RAIN EVENT...BUT CANNOT RULE OUT SOME FREEZING/FROZEN 
PRECIP AT THE ONSET MAINLY NORTH. ALSO LOOKS QUITE LIKELY THAT WE 
WILL SEE SNOW SHOWERS ON THE BACK SIDE SAT NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  DRY 
WEATHER FORECAST FOR MONDAY.

981 
FXUS64 KMRX 240942 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
437 AM EST MON DEC 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FIRST SHORTWAVE AND LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO SPREAD RAIN ENE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING. RAIN ARRIVED MUCH FASTER AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM ON 
SUNDAY...BUT PREVIOUS TIMING ON THE RAIN ENDING FROM THE WEST THIS 
AFTERNOON STILL LOOKS ON TRACK. CATEGORICAL POPS EARLY TODAY...THEN
TAPERING OFF IN THE AFTERNOON...WHICH FAVORS COOLER MOS MAX TEMPS.

FOR TONIGHT...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE EVENING THEN AREAS OF 
DRIZZLE AND FOG...DUE TO MOIST LOW LEVELS AND ONLY PARTIAL CLEARING 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. ACTUALLY...ANY CLEARING AT ALL WILL CAUSE 
FOG AND LOW CLOUDS TO FILL IN RATHER QUICKLY.

FOR CHRISTMAS DAY...SREF SPREADS MORE RAIN OUR WAY BY LATE MORNING 
INTO THE AFTERNOON...AS THE STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WINDS UP OVER 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION. SREF WAS FASTER THAN EITHER 00Z 
NAM OR GFS MODELS...BUT SEEMS QUITE REASONABLE AND IN LINE WITH 
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. ANY CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION SHOULD HOLD 
OFF FOR OUR REGION UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...SO JUST RAIN 
FOR CHRISTMAS DAY.  

OTHERWISE...MILDER MOS MINS PREFERRED FOR TONIGHT AND A BLEND OF MOS 
FOR HIGHS ON CHRISTMAS DAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A DEEP UPPER TROUGH
ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES LIFTS NORTHEAST TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES. STRONG DYNAMICS
WILL PRODUCE STRONG LIFT TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING.
WINDS WILL INCREASE FROM THE SE WITH MOUNTAIN WAVE ACTIVITY
POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING THEN SHIFTING TO THE
SW AND NW BEHIND THE SYSTEM. A HIGH WIND WATCH MAY HAVE TO BE
ISSUED LATER TODAY FOR THE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING 
PERIOD. DUE TO THE STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS OF 850MB WINDS OF 
55-60 KNOTS AND INSTABILITY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST
AREA CONVECTIVE DAMAGING WINDS ARE POSSIBLE LATE TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING.

WEDNESDAY A STRONG COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA
WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION AND DEEP MOISTURE BEHIND IT. THE RAIN
WILL CHANGE TO SNOW LATE WEDNESDAY OR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LIGHT SNOWS
ARE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING. THE WIND WILL
STAY STRONG UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO
THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AS DEEP SYSTEM MOVES NE
INTO THE NE STATES. A NEW SOUTHERN SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS TEXAS
FRIDAY AND WILL SPREAD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT AND
SATURDAY. THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR RAIN BUT
NORTHERN AREAS WILL HAVE RAIN AND SNOW AS COLD AIR WILL STILL BE
OVER THE NORTH AND COLDER AIR WILL SPREAD QUICKLY BEHIND THE FRONT
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

349 
FXUS64 KMRX 240937
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
437 AM EST MON DEC 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FIRST SHORTWAVE AND LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO SPREAD RAIN ENE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING. RAIN ARRIVED MUCH FASTER AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM ON 
SUNDAY...BUT PREVIOUS TIMING ON THE RAIN ENDING FROM THE WEST THIS 
AFTERNOON STILL LOOKS ON TRACK. CATEGORICAL POPS EARLY TODAY...THEN
TAPERING OFF IN THE AFTERNOON...WHICH FAVORS COOLER MOS MAX TEMPS.

FOR TONIGHT...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE EVENING THEN AREAS OF 
DRIZZLE AND FOG...DUE TO MOIST LOW LEVELS AND ONLY PARTIAL CLEARING 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. ACTUALLY...ANY CLEARING AT ALL WILL CAUSE 
FOG AND LOW CLOUDS TO FILL IN RATHER QUICKLY.

FOR CHRISTMAS DAY...SREF SPREADS MORE RAIN OUR WAY BY LATE MORNING 
INTO THE AFTERNOON...AS THE STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WINDS UP OVER 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION. SREF WAS FASTER THAN EITHER 00Z 
NAM OR GFS MODELS...BUT SEEMS QUITE REASONABLE AND IN LINE WITH 
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. ANY CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION SHOULD HOLD 
OFF FOR OUR REGION UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...SO JUST RAIN 
FOR CHRISTMAS DAY.  

OTHERWISE...MILDER MOS MINS PREFERRED FOR TONIGHT AND A BLEND OF MOS 
FOR HIGHS ON CHRISTMAS DAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A DEEP UPPER TROUGH
ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES LIFTS NORTHEAST TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES. STRONG DYNAMICS
WILL PRODUCE STRONG LIFT TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING.
WINDS WILL INCREASE FROM THE SE WITH MOUNTAIN WAVE ACTIVITY
POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING THEN SHIFTING TO THE
SW AND NW BEHIND THE SYSTEM. A HIGH WIND WATCH MAY HAVE TO BE
ISSUED LATER TODAY FOR THE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING
PERIOD. FOR INSTABILITY MAY PRODUCE SOME THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. DUE TO THE STRONG BOUNDARY
LAYER WINDS OF 850MB WINDS OF 55-60KTS CONVECTIVE DAMAGING WINDS
ARE POSSIBLE LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING.

WEDNESDAY A STRONG COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA
WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION AND DEEP MOISTURE BEHIND IT. THE RAIN
WILL CHANGE TO SNOW LATE WEDNESDAY OR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LIGHT SNOWS
ARE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING. THE WIND WILL
STAY STRONG UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO
THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AS DEEP SYSTEM MOVES NE
INTO THE NE STATES. A NEW SOUTHERN SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS TEXAS
FRIDAY AND WILL SPREAD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT AND
SATURDAY. THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR RAIN BUT
NORTHERN AREAS WILL HAVE RAIN AND SNOW AS COLD AIR WILL STILL BE
OVER THE NORTH AND COLDER AIR WILL SPREAD QUICKLY BEHIND THE FRONT
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  41  55  43  52 / 100  20  60 100  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  41  54  43  52 / 100  20  60 100  60

FXUS64 KMRX 231944
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 PM EST SUN DEC 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A FAST MOVING AND RATHER WEAK 
SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON CLOUDS THICKENING...THEN RAIN 
CHANCES CLIMB TO CATEGORICAL AFTER 23/06Z MONDAY. PERSISTENT 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WITH DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW OVER THE AREA 
MOST OF THE DAY AS SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVES NE ACROSS W TN INTO 
THE OH VALLEY. THIS SHAPES UP TO BE AN ALL RAIN EVENT GIVEN THE WARM 
AIR ADVECTION IN ADVANCE OF THE SHORTWAVE. LEANED TOWARD WARMER NAM 
TEMP MOS TONIGHT AND USED BLEND FOR MONDAY. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...VERY ACTIVE EXTENDED 
FORECAST. FOR MONDAY NIGHT...WEAK FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE AREA WITH 
A GOOD DEAL OF LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINING ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. WILL INCLUDE AREAS OF FOG AND DRIZZLE. SOME OF THE FOG COULD 
BE DENSE.

FOR TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...A DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE 
PLAINS STATES WILL LIFT NORTHEAST. STRONG DYNAMICS AS A DOUBLE JET 
STRUCTURE PRODUCES IMPRESSIVE LIFT OVER THE AREA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY MORNING. AGEOSTROPHIC CIRCULATIONS AROUND NORTHERN AND 
SOUTHERN STREAMS JETS WILL ENHANCE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING FOR LATE 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING. ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO INCLUDE 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. DUE TO 
THE STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET (850MB WINDS 60-65KTS)..LOCALIZED 
CONVECTIVE DAMAGING WINDS ARE POSSIBLE.

DUE THE STRONG 850MB JET AND FAIRLY FAVORABLE VERTICAL TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE...MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WINDS ARE A REAL CONCERN FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS FROM EAST TENNESSEE TO SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. NON-CONVECTIVE DAMAGING WINDS ARE POSSIBLE AND A HIGH WIND 
WARNING MAY BE NEEDED.

FOR WEDNESDAY...STRONG COLD FRONT PASSES QUICKLY ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH ENOUGH WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE TO ALLOW THE RAIN TO CHANGE TO 
SNOW AREA-WIDE. A LIGHT SNOWFALL POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FLOW IS MORE 
WESTERLY...SO DO NOT EXPECT A MAJOR NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL EVENT.

THE ADVECTION OF COLD AIR AND STRONG PRESSURE RISES BEHIND FROPA 
WILL PRODUCE WINDY CONDITIONS AREA-WIDE FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
EVENING. 

FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...STRONG CYCLOGENESIS MOVES NORTH OF THE 
AREA WITH SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS ENDING THURSDAY 
MORNING. A BRIEF PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER ANTICIPATED UNTIL THE NEXT 
SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR 
SATURDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1040 AM EST SUN DEC 23 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. RELATIVELY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE
RAPIDLY MODIFIES LATER TODAY AND ESPECIALLY TONIGHT. PWAT VALUES 
RISE TO .75 TO .90 TONIGHT. GOOD LIFT IN THE H85-H70 LAYER. THIS 
MOISTENING WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST WARM UP. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...FAST MOVING AND 
RATHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION LATE TONIGHT AND 
EARLY MONDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON CLOUDS INCREASING 
TODAY...THEN RAIN CHANCES CLIMB TO CATEGORICAL AFTER 06Z MONDAY. 
THIS SHAPES UP TO BE AN ALL RAIN EVENT GIVEN THE WARM AIR ADVECTION 
IN ADVANCE OF THE SHORTWAVE. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED 
RIGHT ON TRACK WITH JUST A FEW ADJUSTMENTS. SHORT RANGE MODELS 
INCLUDING THE SREF WANT TO ZIP THE RAIN EAST OF THE REGION LATE 
MONDAY AFTERNOON...SO POPS WERE LOWERED FROM THE WEST A BIT FASTER.

OTHERWISE...STUCK CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMPS FOR TODAY...AND FAVORED 
MORE OF A MOS BLEND FOR TONIGHT AND MONDAY. NAM WINDS BETTER CHOICE 
BUT WERE DECREASED SOME IN LIGHT OF THE WEAKER TEMP/PRESSURE DIFFS 
WITH THIS SYSTEM. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WITH PASSAGE OF FIRST 
SYSTEM MONDAY EVENING RAIN WILL COME TO AN END. THERE WILL BE A 
BRIEF BREAK MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. AIR MASS DRIES OUT WITH 
ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS NORTH AND EASTERN AREAS. MOISTURE 
SURGES BACK NORTH TUESDAY AS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPS OVER 
TEXAS ALONG COLD FRONT. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW LOW PRESSURE 
DEEPENING RAPIDLY TUESDAY OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY BRINGING RAIN 
BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 850 MB WINDS INCREASE TO ABOUT 55 TO 60 
KNOTS TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A MOUNTAIN WAVE LIKE PATTERN. A WIND 
ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE NEEDED. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS MAY DEVELOP BUT 
MORE LIKELY TO THE SOUTH IN AL OR GA SO NOT INCLUDING THEM IN THE 
FORECAST YET. DEEPENING SURFACE LOW IS EXPECTED TO TRACK NE THROUGH 
TN AND THEN NE INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY THURSDAY MORNING. 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE ON THE WARM SIDE OF THE SYSTEM 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH A COLD RAIN THE EXPECTED PRECIPITATION. LATER 
WEDNESDAY COLD AIR WRAPPING AROUND THE LOW WILL CAUSE A CHANGE OVER 
TO SNOW. MEASURABLE SNOW LOOKS POSSIBLE ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BUT AMOUNTS LOOK TO BE ONLY ABOUT ONE INCH OR TWO POSSIBLY 
HIGHER IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MUCH COLDER WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. ANOTHER 
SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE REGION WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN AND SNOW FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY.

&&

868 
FXUS64 KMRX 222017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST SAT DEC 22 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CLEAR AND COOL TONIGHT AS SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE AREA SLIDES SE ON SUNDAY. WEAK SW LOW 
LEVEL FLOW COMMENCES SUNDAY. AN WEAK UPPER SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE 
INTO THE AREA SUNDAY AFTERNOON. INCREASING AND LOWER CLOUDS THROUGH 
THE DAY. GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MOISTURE RETURN WILL BRING IN SOME 
LIGHT RAIN FROM THE SW LATE. COOL TEMPS TONIGHT WARMING UP TO ABOVE 
NORMAL SUNDAY.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...FIRST SHORT-WAVE 
TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO SOUTHERN PLAINS SUNDAY NIGHT WITH CYCLOGENESIS 
DEVELOPING OVER THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. ISENTROPIC LIFT 
WILL HELP SPREAD AN AREA OF RAIN INTO THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY EVENING. FRONTAL PASSAGE MONDAY EVENING WILL PULL 
RAIN EAST OF THE AREA...BUT PLENTY OF BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE WILL 
REMAIN PRODUCING FOGGY CONDITIONS AND AREAS OF DRIZZLE. 

A MUCH STRONGER UPPER TROUGH WILL DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY THEN PULL TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR 
TUESDAY. NORTHERN STREAM JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY COMBINED WITH A 
STRONG SOUTHERN STREAM JET ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES WILL COMBINE 
TOO PRODUCE A DOUBLE JET STRUCTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT. THE AGEOSTROPHIC CIRCULATION AROUND THE RIGHT 
ENTRANCE AND LEFT EXIT REGION WILL STRENGTHEN THE FRONTO-GENETIC 
FORCING WITH FROPA ANTICIPATED BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. STRONG COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WEDNESDAY WILL QUICKLY CHANGE THE RAIN TO SNOW OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA.

FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...WRAP-AROUND 
MOISTURE AND NORTHWEST BOUNDARY FLOW WILL PRODUCE GOOD OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT. NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALLS ARE ANTICIPATED WITH SIGNIFICANT 
MOUNTAIN SNOWS POSSIBLE FOR THE NORTHERN-CENTRAL EASTERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. ELSEWHERE...A LIGHT SNOWFALL IS 
POSSIBLE WHICH MAY CAUSE SOME TRAVEL CONCERNS...GENERALLY NORTH AND 
CENTRAL FORECAST AREA. 

BESIDES THE RAIN/SNOW CONCERNS...FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...A 60-65KT 
BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL PRODUCE HIGH WINDS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. 
AREA FORECAST SOUNDINGS DO NOT SHOW A GOOD VERTICAL PROFILE FOR 
MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WINDS FOR THE FOOTHILLS...BUT A MARGINAL HIGH 
WIND WARNING EVENT IS POSSIBLE.

FOR FRIDAY...FORECAST AREA WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS. 

FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE EAST 
OUT OF THE CENTRAL-SOUTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE AREA. THIS NORTHERN 
STREAM WAVE WILL PULL A CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW FOR SATURDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  53  40  57  41 /   0  40  90  60  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EST SAT DEC 22 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LAST BIT OF CLOUDS CONTINUES TO 
HANG IN ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN THIS MORNING. THESE CLOUDS AND W-NW 
WINDS WERE KEEPING TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY ABOVE MOS 3 HOURLY TEMPS. 

CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT IS EXITING THE REGION WITH A SURFACE AND UPPER 
RIDGE SPREADING E-SE THROUGH TONIGHT. EXPECTING PLENTY OF SUNSHINE 
ON TAP FOR TODAY AND THEN MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT. FAVORED A MOS BLEND 
OVER PURE GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY...DUE TO A FEW AREAS OF SNOW 
OVER NORTHERN AREAS AND WARM AIR ADVECTION ONLY DEVELOPING BY LATE 
AFTERNOON. MOS MINS VERY CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED...WITH WEAK 
WARM AIR ADVECTION OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY 06Z SUNDAY.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...EXTENDED FORECAST WILL BE 
HIGHLY CHANGEABLE. ON SUNDAY GULF MOISTURE MOVES NORTHEAST INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN STATES 
WILL INDUCE WEAK CYCLO-GENESIS ACROSS THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND BRING RAIN INTO EAST TN INCREASING MONDAY AND 
CONTINUING MONDAY NIGHT WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE. THIS EVENT WILL BE 
MAINLY LIGHT RAIN BUT SOME SHOWERS AND A POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM COULD 
AFFECT THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND PLATEAU LATE MONDAY BEFORE PASSAGE OF 
THE COLD FRONT. THERE MAY BE A BRIEF BREAK LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY BEFORE A MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM BEGINS TO FORM OVER THE 
PLAINS AND LOWER MS VALLEY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS THE 
SYSTEM MOVES EAST NORTHEAST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WINDS WILL INCREASE WITH 
HIGH WINDS LIKELY OVERNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT. STRONG LIFT WILL GENERATE 
MORE SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL AS WELL. MUCH COLDER AIR ON BACK SIDE OF 
SYSTEM WILL CHANGE THE RAIN TO SNOW LATE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. 
THE SNOW AND COLD WILL LINGER IN THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY EVENING. AS 
STRONG LOW WITH SYSTEM MOVES NE THURSDAY NIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL 
END. HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS IN FRIDAY WITH A WARMING TREND.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 212001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EST FRI DEC 21 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE
ACROSS NE TN AND SW VIRGINIA THIS EVENING. BRISK WEST TO NORTHWEST 
WINDS WILL WEAKEN THIS EVENING. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE 
TO MOVE NORTHEAST THROUGH THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES INTO SE CANADA 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. HIGH PRESSURE AND A DRIER AIRMASS WILL BUILD 
INTO THE REGION FROM THE WEST. TEMPERATURE ADVECTION BECOME NEUTRAL 
TONIGHT AND IS WEAKLY WARM ON SATURDAY. TONIGHT MINS WILL BE RANGE 
FROM THE TEENS TO THE LOW 20S ACROSS MOST AREAS WITH COLDER READINGS 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SATURDAY WITH SUNNY SKIES TEMPERATURES 
WILL APPROACH NORMAL LATE. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...ACTIVE EXTENDED 
FORECAST. SURFACE RIDGING SATURDAY NIGHT WILL MOVE EAST ALLOWING A 
PLUME OF GULF MOISTURE TO PULL NORTHEAST TOWARD THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. A FAST MOVING SOUTHERN 
STREAM WAVE WILL PRODUCE WEAK CYCLONGENESIS OVER THE MID-MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE MONDAY. ISENTROPIC 
LIFT AND FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WILL FOCUS THE GULF MOISTURE TO 
PRODUCE AN AREA OF GENERALLY LIGHT RAIN. 

THIS BOUNDARY WILL MOVE SOUTH OF THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT...BUT A 
NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES WILL PHASE OVER THE PLAIN STATES 
TUESDAY THEN MOVE EAST/NORTHEAST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THE GFS/ECMWF 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT IN TRACKING THE SURFACE LOW ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. A DOUBLE JET STRUCTURE OF THE NORTHERN AND 
SOUTHERN STREAM JETS WILL PRODUCE STRONG LIFT OVER THE AREA 
ENHANCING FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING. LATEST RUN SHOWS A MORE 
PROGRESSIVE SYSTEM WHICH WILL LIMIT FLOODING POTENTIAL. 

HOWEVER...AS THE SURFACE LOW MOVES NORTHEAST...COLD AIR WILL SPILL 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY CHANGING PRECIPITATION TO SNOW. 
SNOWFALL IS POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS.

FXUS64 KMRX 211531
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST FRI DEC 21 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE TODAY. ANOTHER IMPULSE OF SLIGHTLY DEEPER MOISTURE WILL 
BRING ADDITIONAL SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS...MAINLY ACROSS 
NORTHERN AREAS. TEMPERATURES WILL MOVE LITTLE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD AIR FLOWING INTO THE REGION 
THIS MORNING...BRINGING WINDY CONDITIONS AND SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS SW 
VA AND THE NE HALF OF E TN. LAPSE RATES ARE QUITE STEEP THIS MORNING 
ALREADY AND PROGGED TO STEEPEN EVEN MORE THIS AFTERNOON. W-NW LOW 
LEVEL WINDS SHOULD PROVIDE UPSLOPE COMPONENT TO COMBINE WITH STRONG 
COLD AIR ADVECTION. BOTH GFS AND NAM MODELS SHOW SUFFICIENT MOISTURE 
INTO THE AFTERNOON FOR A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF SW VA AND NE TN. THUS...A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WAS 
INTRODUCED FROM FORECAST ISSUANCE THROUGH 7 PM EST (SAME ENDING TIME 
AS OUR WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA).

STAYED TRUER TO PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID AND UNDERCUT THE GFS MOS 
HIGHS WHICH WERE SIMILAR TO NAM MOS. WINDS SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH 
THIS EVENING...SO I DID NOT EXTEND THE WIND ADVISORY FOR NOW...NOR 
DID I KEEP ANY MENTION OF SNOW OR FLURRIES AFTER THIS EVENING. 
TRENDED QUITE CLOSE TO THE COLDER GFS MOS ON MINS TONIGHT.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AFTER COLD NIGHT GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND BEGINS SATURDAY AS COLD UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST AND 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING MOVES EAST FROM THE CENTRAL STATES. HIGHS ABOUT 
5 DEGREES WARMER. WINDS STILL STRONG ESPECIALLY SW VA AND NE TN 
MOUNTAINS AS LARGE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN STACKED UPPER LOW OVER 
NE AND GULF COAST HIGH CONTINUES. SURFACE HIGH BEGINS TO SHIFT TO 
THE SE US COAST SATURDAY NIGHT. LOWS WILL BE SLIGHTLY WARMER SUNDAY 
MORNING. SUNDAY MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE AS NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA 
DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. WARM FRONT DEVELOPS AHEAD OF 
SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT EARLY MONDAY WITH RAIN SOUTH AND RAIN OR SNOW 
POSSIBLY EARLY MONDAY BEFORE WARM AIR OVERTAKES THE REGION. COLD 
FRONT TO APPROACH MONDAY NIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY WITH WARMER 
TEMPERATURES AND MORE RAIN. TUESDAY EVENING NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM 
TO DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY ALONG TUESDAYS FRONT. MODELS 
RAPIDLY INTENSIFY THIS SYSTEM AS IT MOVES FROM THE TN VALLEY TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THE MID ATLANTIC EARLY THURSDAY. STRONG WINDS DEVELOP 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND COLD AIR ON THE BACK SIDE WILL CAUSE RAIN 
TO CHANGE TO SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY. A COUPLE 
INCHES OF SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN LOOKS 
POSSIBLE. ALSO MUCH COLDER THURSDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 30S AND COLDER 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE NE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
441 AM EST FRI DEC 21 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD AIR FLOWING INTO THE REGION 
THIS MORNING...BRINGING WINDY CONDITIONS AND SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS SW 
VA AND THE NE HALF OF E TN. LAPSE RATES ARE QUITE STEEP THIS MORNING 
ALREADY AND PROGGED TO STEEPEN EVEN MORE THIS AFTERNOON. W-NW LOW 
LEVEL WINDS SHOULD PROVIDE UPSLOPE COMPONENT TO COMBINE WITH STRONG 
COLD AIR ADVECTION. BOTH GFS AND NAM MODELS SHOW SUFFICIENT MOISTURE 
INTO THE AFTERNOON FOR A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF SW VA AND NE TN. THUS...A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WAS 
INTRODUCED FROM FORECAST ISSUANCE THROUGH 7 PM EST (SAME ENDING TIME 
AS OUR WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA).

STAYED TRUER TO PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID AND UNDERCUT THE GFS MOS 
HIGHS WHICH WERE SIMILAR TO NAM MOS. WINDS SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH 
THIS EVENING...SO I DID NOT EXTEND THE WIND ADVISORY FOR NOW...NOR 
DID I KEEP ANY MENTION OF SNOW OR FLURRIES AFTER THIS EVENING. 
TRENDED QUITE CLOSE TO THE COLDER GFS MOS ON MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AFTER COLD NIGHT GRADUAL
WARMING TREND BEGINS SATURDAY AS COLD UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST AND
UPPER LEVEL RIDGING MOVES EAST FROM THE CENTRAL STATES. HIGHS ABOUT
5 DEGREES WARMER. WINDS STILL STRONG ESPECIALLY SW VA AND NE TN
MOUNTAINS AS LARGE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN STACKED UPPER LOW
OVER NE AND GULF COAST HIGH CONTINUES. SURFACE HIGH BEGINS TO SHIFT
TO THE SE US COAST SATURDAY NIGHT. LOWS WILL BE SLIGHTLY WARMER
SUNDAY MORNING. SUNDAY MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE AS NEW LOW
PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. WARM FRONT
DEVELOPS AHEAD OF SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT EARLY MONDAY WITH RAIN SOUTH
AND RAIN OR SNOW POSSIBLY EARLY MONDAY BEFORE WARM AIR OVERTAKES
THE REGION. COLD FRONT TO APPROACH MONDAY NIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY
WITH WARMER TEMPERATURES AND MORE RAIN. TUESDAY EVENING NEXT
SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM TO DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY ALONG
TUESDAYS FRONT. MODELS RAPIDLY INTENSIFY THIS SYSTEM AS IT MOVES
FROM THE TN VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO THE MID ATLANTIC EARLY
THURSDAY. STRONG WINDS DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND COLD AIR
ON THE BACK SIDE WILL CAUSE RAIN TO CHANGE TO SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AND EARLY THURSDAY. A COUPLE INCHES OF SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN LOOKS POSSIBLE. ALSO MUCH COLDER THURSDAY
WITH HIGHS IN THE 30S AND COLDER HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE NE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
850 PM EST THU DEC 20 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A COLDER AIR 
MASS MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. A STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD GENERATE STRONG WINDS 
THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY WITH NO 
CHANGES. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILE CONDUCIVE 
FOR SNOW DEVELOPMENT TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...BUT THE 850 MB WINDS ARE 
PROGGED TO REMAIN MORE WESTERLY THAN NORTHWESTERLY TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY MORNING. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD BE 
MINIMAL AND MAY NOT BE ENOUGH TO GENERATE ADVISORY-LEVEL SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS. THUS...WILL HOLD OFF ON ISSUING ANY WINTER WX 
ADVISORIES FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS THIS EVENING...AND 
WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT RE-EVALUATE. WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF UP TO TWO INCHES OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS BY FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST LATER THIS EVENING MAINLY 
TO REMOVE ANY EVENING PRECIP WORDING.

.AVIATION...POWERFUL SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES

LOWER LEVEL ATMOSPHERE AND WILL HELP TO KEEP STRONG WIND GUSTS

FRIDAY. KEPT SOME DRIZZLE GOING AT TRI FOR SEVERAL HOURS UNTIL

HERE. VFR CEILINGS WILL DROP TO MVFR LEVELS AT TYS AND TRI AROUND
05-06Z AND STAY THAT WAY THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY AT TRI WHILE TYS
BREAKS OUT AROUND 14Z.

FXUS64 KMRX 201955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EST THU DEC 20 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...STRONG SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE NE INTO MI TONIGHT AND ENE THROUGH THE E 
GREAT LAKES ON FRIDAY. COLD FRONT BOWING THROUGH THE E TN VALLEY 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. PREFRONTAL 
DOWNSLOPING WINDS WILL END AS WINDS SHIFT SW BEHIND THE FRONT. AREAS 
OF PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF BEHIND THE FRONT. WINDS WILL SHIFT 
TO THE NW THIS EVENING AND REMAIN BREEZY AND BECOME STRONG OF 
FRIDAY. NEAR POST FRONTAL RELATIVE HUMIDITY REMAINS SHALLOW WHILE 
COLD AIR ADVECTION IS STRONG. LIGHT SHOWERS AND DRIZZLE WILL CONTINUE 
IN CYCLONIC FLOW ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART OF MRX CWA. 
FREEZING LEVEL FALLS HARD AFTER 21/00Z. THE LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL 
LIKELY SHIFT BRIEFLY TO FREEZING DRIZZLE AS DEPTH OF RH DOES NOT 
EXTEND INTO THE SNOW GROWTH REGION. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE MOVES INTO 
THE AREA AFTER 21/06Z WITH HIGHER RH EXTENDING UP INTO THE SNOW 
GROWTH REGION CONTINUING INTO MID DAY FRI. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOME 
LIGHT SNOWFALL ACROSS NE TN/SW VA. TEMPERATURES WILL FALL INTO THE 
20S TONIGHT. STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS WILL KEEP WIND CHILL VALUES 
BELOW FREEZING FRIDAY. A WIND ADVISORY WILL BE REQUIRED AREAWIDE 
WITH AN ADDITION WARNING POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
LIGHT SNOW AND CLOUDS CONTINUE TO SCOUR OUT FRIDAY NIGHT WHILE 
TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TO FALL TO BELOW NORMAL WITH WIND CHILLS 
RANGING FROM THE SINGLE DIGITS TO THE TEENS. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN ACTIVE EXTENDED 
FORECAST. A BREAK PERIOD OF SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING WILL PRODUCE 
DRY CONDITIONS FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...BUT A DEVELOPING SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL INDUCE CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
BY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. THIS WAVE WILL HELP PULL A FRONT NORTH 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR MONDAY. INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT 
AHEAD OF A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WEST OF THE AREA WILL SPREAD RAIN OVER 
THE AREA. THERE IS A CHANCE THAT PRECIPITATION MAY BEGIN AS 
SNOW/SLEET OR FREEZING RAIN ACROSS THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.

THIS BOUNDARY WILL PULL SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY...BUT 
ANOTHER NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAMS WAVES WILL PHASE OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS TUESDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL PULL NORTHEAST TOWARD THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. GFS AND ECMWF 
HAVE DIFFERENT TRACKS OF THE SURFACE LOW. GFS BRINGS THE LOW OVER 
EAST TENNESSEE...WHILE THE ECMWF IS SLIGHTLY FARTHER EAST. EITHER 
WAY..MODELS SHOW STRONG DYNAMICS OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH NORTHWEST FLOW OROGRAPHIC LIFT FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.

DEPENDING ON LOCATION OF BEST FRONTO-GENESIS...THERE IS A POTENTIAL 
OF HEAVY RAINS WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ALSO...DEPENDING ON 
EVOLUTION/TRACK OF SURFACE LOW...PRECIPITATION MAY CHANGE OVER TO 
SNOW LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY. HEAVY SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE MOUNTAINS DUE TO A NORTHWEST 
FLOW EVENT. CONFIDENCE IS STILL LOW...BUT WILL NEED TO MONITOR FOR 
THE POTENTIAL OF HEAVY RAINS AND MOUNTAINS SNOW. THE PRECIPITATION 
MAY CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS THE VALLEYS AS WELL LATER IN THE EVENT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT OVER MIDDLE TN MOVING EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS THIS EVENING. AREAS OF RAIN WITH EMBEDDED SHOWERS WILL
CONTINUE ALONG AND IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS
WILL CONTINUE TO GUST TO NEAR 60 MPH ALONG THE FOOTHILLS OF THE
APPALACHIANS. VALLEY WINDS WILL GENERALLY BE SW 10 TO 20 MPH IN
ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. FREEZING LEVEL WILL REMAIN AROUND 9500 FEET
UNTIL AROUND 21/00Z. THE WIND WILL SHIFT TO THE WEST BEHIND THE
FRONT AND THE FREEZING LEVEL WILL BEGIN TO DROP TO NEAR THE SURFACE
AROUND 21/09Z. DECREASING PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE FROM RAIN TO
FREEZING DRIZZLE AND LIGHT SNOW ACROSS AREAS FROM TYS TO TRI. MVFR
VSBY AND IFR CIGS WILL PERSIST EARLY IN THE TAF PERIOD AND
GRADUALLY CLEAR AND LIFT FROM THE SW THROUGH THE PERIOD. NW WINDS
WILL BECOME VERY STRONG POST FRONTAL AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE TAF
PERIOD.
