AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST THU DEC 20 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. DOWN SLOPING WINDS INDICATED BY 
RADAR. FIRST WAVE OF SHOWERS MOVING ACROSS NE TN. NEXT WAVE WILL BE 
MOVING INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. THUNDERSTORM AND ESPECIALLY 
SEVERE THREAT WILL BE LOW. COLD FRONT AND DRY SLOT MOVING INTO 
MIDDLE TN. MAX TEMPERATURES IFFY BUT BRIEF WARM UP INDICATED EARLY 
THIS AFTERNOON. SON 

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A POWERFUL COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERLY APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY.  MAIN CONCERN WILL 
BE STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE AREA.  SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL 
INCREASE TO ADVISORY LEVEL ACROSS THE VALLEY AND HIGH WIND WARNING 
CRITERIA WILL BE MET ALONG THE FOOTHILLS AND MOUNTAIN LOCATIONS.  
WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...WINDS WILL SHIFT WEST TO NORTHWESTERLY AND 
CONTINUE TO BE STRONG AND GUSTY ACROSS THE AREA.  A WIND ADVISORY 
WILL BE IN PLACE ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA TONIGHT AND FRIDAY.  
ADDITIONALLY...A LINE OF SHOWERS AS WELL A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
MOVE THROUGH AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  WITH WIDESPREAD RAINFALL...HAVE 
UPPED THE POPS TO 100.  THE MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION WILL EXIT LATE 
THIS AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE FLOW 
WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE SCATTERED SHOWERS THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
SHORT TERM.  COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT...ALLOWING 
RAIN TO CHANGE TO SNOW TONIGHT MAINLY AT NORMAL UPSLOPE LOCATIONS.  
SNOW WILL BE RATHER LIGHT AND SHOULD END AT MOST LOCATIONS ON 
FRIDAY.  ONE TO TWO INCHES OF ACCUMULATIONS IS POSSIBLE AT FAVORED 
AREAS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT EARLY ON...BUT MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY POOR LATE.  MAY BE A LINGERING SNOW SHOWER EARLY FRIDAY 
NIGHT NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS...THEN DRY THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS AN AREA 
OF SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE DRIFTS EAST ACROSS THE REGION.  WEATHER 
EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED FOR THE MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
PERIOD...BUT MODELS HAVING A HARD TIME RESOLVING THE DETAILS SO 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE SUFFERS.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR PRECIP TO BE 
LIQUID...AND EXPECT SOME PERIODS OF RAIN POSSIBLY AS EARLY AS SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  RIGHT NOW BEST CHANCES LOOK 
LIKE THEY WILL BE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS THE MAIN LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM/COLD FRONT ARE FORECAST TO BE IN THE AREA.  WILL 
GENERALLY STAY CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMPS EARLY ON...ALTHOUGH LATER IN 
THE PERIOD WILL MAKE SOME MORE SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENTS UP FOR MIN 
TEMPS AND DOWN FOR MAX TEMPS GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUDS/PRECIP.

MOVES THROUGH.

.AVIATION...AN APPROACHING STRONG COLD FRONT WILL BRING AN END TO

THUNDERSTORM WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TAF SITES THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

WITH BREEZY/GUSTY CONDITIONS EXPECTED IN THE AFTERNOON.  PRECIP WILL 
EXIT FROM WEST TO EAST AFTER 20Z FOR IMPROVING CIGS AND VSBYS 
CONDITIONS.  HOWEVER...WINDS WILL REMAIN STRONG THROUGH THE REST OF 
THE TAF PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
745 PM EST WED DEC 19 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS...WITH A WARMER AND MORE MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY). MODELS ARE INDICTING THAT 
THIS STRONG SYSTEM WILL MOVE SLOWLY NORTHEASTWARD TONIGHT...WITH ITS 
TRAILING COLD FRONT BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
AROUND SUNRISE. A STRONG SOUTHERLY 850 MB WIND FLOW (IN EXCESS OF 60 
KT) IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THIS 
COLD FRONT LATER TONIGHT...BUT MAINLY AFTER SUNRISE ON THURSDAY. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS STILL INDICATE A DEEP STABLE LAYER EXTENDING ABOVE 
THE MOUNTAINS...ALONG WITH A STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILE THROUGHOUT 
THE BOUNDARY LAYER. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT DAMAGING WIND GUSTS (IN 
EXCESS OF 60 MPH) DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE 
FOOTHILLS ON THURSDAY.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO INCREASE WIND 
SPEEDS IN THE HIGH WIND WARNING ZONES...AND HAVE MENTIONED 
'INCREASING CLOUDINESS' EVERYWHERE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CURRENT 
SATELLITE TRENDS.
&&

.AVIATION...FLIGHT WEATHER SHOULD BE QUITE GOOD FOR THE FIRST HALF

924 
FXUS64 KMRX 192047
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 PM EST WED DEC 19 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE 
NE FROM OK TO W IL TONIGHT. STRONG UPPER JET SEGMENT WILL DEVELOP 
EAST OF THE UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. HIGH AND 
MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. LOW 
LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES RISE AND WITH LATE CLOUD COVER DECIDED TO GO 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE MOS TEMP GUIDANCE TONIGHT. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET 
INCREASES ACROSS THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT AND PEAKS NEAR 70 KTS ACROSS 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY THU AFTERNOON. SYNOPTIC SET UP 
FAVORABLE FOR DOWN SLOPING WINDS WEST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THU. WIND DIRECTION EAST OF THE SMOKIES IS NOT IDEALLY SE BUT LOCAL 
AFFECTS SHOULD BE REALIZED. ANTICIPATED DOWN SLOPING WILL HINDER 
CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION EARLY IN NEAR FOOTHILLS AREAS AND ALSO 
ALLOW FOR BRIEF SPIKES IN WARMER TEMPERATURES. A STRONG COLD FRONT 
WILL MARCH EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY THU. ONGOING PREFRONTAL 
CONVECTION WILL MOVE OFF THE PLATEAU IN THE MORNING HOURS. BEST 
FORCING WILL BE NORTH OF THE AREA. INSTABILITY IS LIMITED BUT BULK 
SHEAR IS FAVORABLE FOR STRONG CONVECTION. ISOLATED SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE MAINLY S AND WEST OF KNOXVILLE. LOW LEVEL 
WIND CONDITIONS ALONG WARM FRONT ACROSS SOUTHERN PLATEAU MAY ALSO 
CONTRIBUTE TO THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS. THE DEEPER 
CONVECTION WILL TAPER OFF AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE MOUNTAINS BY 
THU EVENING. 

.LONG TERM (THURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD...THE COLD FRONT IS PUSHING INTO THE AREA.  STRONG 
GRADIENT WINDS WILL BE FILLING INTO THE AREA.  THE HIGH WINDS 
WARNING IS FOR PRE-FRONTAL DOWNSLOPING WINDS.  THERE MAY BE THE NEED 
FOR A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE POST-FRONTAL WINDS AS WELL...HOWEVER...
WILL NOT ISSUE AT THIS TIME TO AVOID CONFUSION WITH THE EARLIER 
WARNING.

UPSLOPE SNOWS ARE EXPECTED IN THE HIGH TERRAIN AS WELL. 
HOWEVER...MOISTURE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO BE DROPPING...SO 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT.  MAIN THREAT WILL BE VISIBILITY FROM 
WIND-BLOWN SNOW IN THESE AREAS.

BY SATURDAY...THE AREA SHOULD BE COMPLETELY BETWEEN SYSTEMS.  A WEAK 
FRONT WILL BE PUSHING INTO THE AREA AROUND MONDAY...IS EXPECTED TO 
STALL AS LOW PRESSURE BUILDS IN THE WESTERN GULF.  A BIG PUSH OF 
MOISTURE SHOULD BE COMING UP INTO THE AREA AS THE SURFACE LOW TRACKS 
TO THE NORTHEAST EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH HEAVY RAINS POSSIBLE WHEN 
THE MAIN AXIS OF PRECIPITATION MOVES THROUGH.  PRECIPITABLE WATER 
CLIMATOLOGY SUGGESTS THAT WE WILL BE NEAR THE 95TH PERCENTILE ON THE 
PWAT...MEANING LOTS OF MOISTURE TO INTENSIFY RAINFALL RATES.  THE 
MAIN AXIS WILL BE MOVING THROUGH DURING ABOUT A 24 HOUR TIME 
PERIOD...SOMEWHERE BETWEEN MONDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  MODELS ARE HAVING 
A TERRIBLE TIME DETERMINING THE SPECIFICS OF TIMING WITH THIS 
SYSTEM. WILL NEED TO WATCH THIS SYSTEM FOR HEAVY RAIN/POSSIBLE FLOOD 
THREAT EARLY NEXT WEEK...INCLUDING CHRISTMAS DAY. WHEN THIS SYSTEM 
EXITS...WE WILL LIKELY HAVE SOME THREAT OF UPSLOPE NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW SNOWS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. THIS IS JUST BEYOND THE CURRENT 
TIMING OF THIS FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             47  59  29  45  28 /  10 100  10  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  60  30  39  22 /  10  90  20  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       46  57  30  43  28 /  10  90  10  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              38  58  32  36  21 /  10  90  60  20  10

LATE IN THE PERIOD. STRONG DOWNSLOPING WINDS WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATER TONIGHT WITH STRONG WINDS EXPECTED ALONG
THE FOOTHILLS. VALLEY WINDS WILL BE LIGHT TONIGHT AND NE TO SE AT
THE TAF SITES EARLY THU. ONGOING CONVECTIVE WILL CONTINUE IN
ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT. THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE ALONG WITH
STRONG SHOWERS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY AFFECT CHA LATE IN THE
PERIOD. THE ACTIVITY WILL EXTEND TO TYS AND TRI BEYOND THE TAF
PERIOD. 


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HIGH WIND WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...MCMINN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...
     NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI...
     WASHINGTON TN.

VA...HIGH WIND WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: RUSSELL...WASHINGTON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST WED DEC 19 2012

.DISCUSSION...TODAYS WARM AND SUNNY FORECAST ON TRACK. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION: 
SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL 
TODAY FOR ANOTHER WARM AND DRY DAY.  WILL TRANSITION INTO A MORE 
ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN TONIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH THE APPROACH AND A 
STRONG COLD FRONT.  WILL SEE CLOUDS INCREASE OVERNIGHT WITH A CHANCE 
OF A STRAY SHOWER MOVING IN IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT.  
ADDITIONALLY ...A STRONG 850MB JET ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL BEGIN 
TO INCREASE WINDS ACROSS THE AREA LATE IN THE NIGHT.  MODELS 
TRENDING A BIT SLOWER WITH ONSET OF THE STRONG WIND FIELD BUT WILL 
KEEP HIGH WIND WATCH IN PLACE BEGINNING AT 09Z.  AS THE FRONT 
REACHES INTO THE REGION...WINDS WILL INCREASE 
SIGNIFICANTLY...ESPECIALLY OVER FAVORED AREAS ALONG THE FOOTHILLS 
AND HIGHEST PEAKS.  ADDITIONALLY...A LARGE BAND OF SHOWERS AND EVEN 
A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE THROUGH ON THURSDAY IN ADVANCE OF THE 
FRONT AND HAVE KEPT POPS AT CATEGORICAL.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT DURING THIS FAIRLY ACTIVE PATTERN...AND FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR FOR THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD.  DEEP LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL LINGER TO OUR NORTH AND 
NORTHEAST EARLY IN THE PERIOD.  MUCH COLDER AIR WILL PUSH INTO THE 
AREA ON STRONG WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS. MAY END UP NEEDING A WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THU NIGHT INTO FRIDAY FOR PARTS OF THE AREA ESPECIALLY 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...SO WILL MENTION IN HWO.  ALSO POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
SNOW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY UPSLOPE AREAS THU NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  MODELS 
DISAGREE SOMEWHAT ON THIS POTENTIAL...WITH THE 00Z NAM NOT SHOWING 
MUCH.  HOWEVER...OTHER MODELS MORE BULLISH AS IS THE SREF. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS DO NOT LOOK IDEAL AND MOISTURE EXPECTED TO BE ON THE 
SHALLOW SIDE...SO WHILE PLAN TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE POPS FOR NOW 
WILL KEEP ACCUMULATIONS ON THE LIGHT SIDE AND PRIMARILY IN THE 
MOUNTAINS.  WILL MENTION SNOW POTENTIAL IN HWO.  SHOULD BE DRY 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE TAKES CONTROL...THEN NEXT 
SYSTEM EXPECTED TO AFFECT THE AREA MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  FOR NOW 
LOOKS LIKE PRECIP TYPE WILL BE MAINLY RAIN FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

906 
FXUS64 KMRX 181942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST TUE DEC 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SKIES HAVE BECOME MOSTLY SUNNY 
OVER ALL BUT THE EXTREME NE TN CORNER AND SW VA THIS AFTERNOON AS 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND EXITING TROUGH WHICH BROUGHT 
A FEW SPRINKLES TO THE NE PART OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. 
TEMPERATURES AT MID AFTERNOON RANGE FROM THE 40S EXTREME NE WHERE 
CLOUDS HAVE LINGERED TO THE LOWER TO MID 50S ELSEWHERE. WINDS ARE 
GENERALLY LIGHT BUT ARE STILL AROUND 10 TO 15 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 25 
MPH EXTREME NE BECAUSE OF THE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN SURFACE LOW 
OVER THE NE AND HIGHER PRESSURE OVER AL. THESE WINDS WILL GRADUALLY 
DECREASE LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING AS SURFACE LOW MOVES 
AWAY. FORECAST AREA WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
BEFORE A DEVELOPING SYSTEM NOW FORMING OVER THE INTERMOUNTAIN WEST 
APPROACHES.

SKIES WILL STAY MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS SURFACE HIGH 
MOVES ALONG THE GULF COAST AND 500 MB RIDGE MOVES THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. LOWS TONIGHT WILL BE COOLER THAN THIS MORNING BUT STILL 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. FULL SUNSHINE WITH A SOUTHWEST WIND ALOFT 
WILL ALLOW HIGH TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY TO REACH THE MID 50S TO MID 
60S SOME 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL ONE 
MAIN SYSTEM AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVING INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A STRONG SOUTHERLY 850 MB WIND FLOW (IN EXCESS 
OF 60 KT) IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF 
THIS COLD FRONT...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING A DEEP STABLE 
LAYER EXTENDING ABOVE THE MOUNTAINS AND A STRONG VEERING WIND 
PROFILE THROUGHOUT THE BOUNDARY LAYER. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT 
DAMAGING WINDS DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL BE A GOOD POSSIBILITY LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING ALONG THE FOOTHILLS OF THE 
MOUNTAINS. THE NAM MODEL INDICATES THAT THE LOW-LEVEL WIND FLOW MAY 
BE MORE SOUTHWESTERLY (WHICH IS NOT NECESSARILY THE MOST IDEAL WIND 
DIRECTION FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE DEVELOPMENT)...THE GFS MODEL INDICATES A 
MORE SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WHICH WOULD BE PERPENDICULAR ENOUGH TO THE 
MOUNTAIN RIDGES FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A STRONG MOUNTAIN WAVE WIND 
EVENT. SINCE IT APPEARS THAT THE OTHER CONDITIONS NECESSARY FOR A 
STRONG MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT SHOULD BE IN PLACE...WILL ISSUE A HIGH 
WIND WATCH FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING ALONG THE 
FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS.

MODELS AGREE THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL BE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
AROUND 18Z ON THURSDAY...WITH AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF SHOWERS OCCURRING 
ALONG AND AHEAD OF IT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS COLD 
FRONT...SO WILL ALSO MENTION A CHANCE OF TSTORMS ON THURSDAY. WITH 
THE STRONG 850 MB JET EXPECTED AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...THINK THAT 
SOME DAMAGING WINDS COULD ALSO BE POSSIBLE IN THE VALLEY AREAS WITH 
ANY OF THE STRONGER CONVECTION. MODELS INDICATE THAT PRECIP WILL 
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW IN MOST AREAS ON THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH A 
NORTHWESTERLY UPSLOPE WIND FLOW PRODUCING SOME SCATTERED SNOW 
SHOWERS THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE 
LIMITED ENOUGH FOR JUST SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. QUIET CONDITIONS THEN DEVELOP FOR THE WEEKEND AND 
INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH SHOWERS INCREASING ON TUESDAY AHEAD OF 
THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARD THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.DISCUSSION...LOW PRESSURE OVER NEW YORK WAS DEEPENING AS IT MOVES

SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND WERE SCATTERING OUT OVER THE

CLOUDS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES LOWER OVER SW VA TODAY. FORECAST
UPDATED TO REMOVE SHOWERS AND CHANGE SKY COVER WORDING. INCREASED

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 AM EST TUE DEC 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BRIEF SHOT OF COOLER AIR WILL MOVE 
IN TODAY BEHIND THE WEAK COLD FRONT...AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  
MAY BE A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER THE FAR NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS

STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...DRY AND WARM ON WEDNESDAY 
WITH A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL.  MAIN CONCERN FOR THE 
EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY.  AIR 
MASS BECOMES WEAKLY UNSTABLE AND MAY SEE A RUBBLE OF THUNDER AS A 
LINE OF CONVECTION MOVES ACROSS THE MRX CWA.  ADDITIONALLY...A 
STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT AND WILL BRING STRONG 
...GUSTY WINDS INTO THE AREA.  STRONGEST WINDS WILL BE OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WHERE WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO REACH ADVISORY AND 
POSSIBLE WARNING CRITERIA. THE WIND FIELD AND PRECIP WILL LESSEN 
BEHIND THE FRONT AS COOLER...DRIER AIR MOVES IS.  LINGERING RAIN 
SHOWERS WILL SWITCH TO LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY FRIDAY WITH A TRANSITION INTO A WEAK UPSLOPE FLOW EVENT.  
MOISTURE EXITS THE AREA RATHER QUICKLY...MINIMIZING SNOW AMOUNTS.  
SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN BY THE WEEKEND FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND 
SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.  MODELS TRENDING TOWARDS ANOTHER SYSTEM 
APPROACHING THE AREA LATE IN THE EXTENDED BUT IS EXPECTED TO HOLD 
OFF UNTIL AFTER MONDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

174 
FXUS64 KMRX 171952
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST MON DEC 17 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SKIES REMAIN CLOUDY TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON WITH GENERALLY LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS MOVING NE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE ABOUT TO 
EXIT THE REGION INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. STRONG TO SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS PRODUCING LARGE HAIL AND HIGH WINDS HAVE DEVELOPED 
WITH SCATTERED ACTIVITY MOVING INTO WESTERN KY AND TN JUST WEST OF 
BNA. AIR MASS TO THE WEST OF THE PLATEAU BECOMING UNSTABLE AS SKIES 
HAVE CLEARED AHEAD OF STRONGER SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO THE MS AND 
LOWER OH VALLEYS.

THESE STORMS LIKELY TO CONTINUE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS BEFORE WEAKENING 
AS THEY MOVE INTO MORE STABLE AIRMASS IN EAST TN. NAM AND RUC MODELS 
FORECAST THIS AREA TO MOVE MOSTLY NE INTO SE KY LATER THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. TEMPERATURES OVER FORECAST AREA ARE NOW IN THE LOWER 
50S NE AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO MID 50S TO NEAR 60 EXCEPT LOWER 60S 
AT CHA. A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE EITHER LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON OR EARLY EVENING MAINLY PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY WITH 
HAIL TO ONE INCH AND DAMAGING WIND GUSTS. COLD FRONT ALONG MS RIVER 
WILL SWING THROUGH THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AND MOUNTAINS BY 
LATE TONIGHT ENDING PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTH THIS EVENING. A 
SECONDARY FRONT AND SHORTWAVE EARLY TUESDAY WILL ALLOW SHOWERS TO 
LINGER ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN INTO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING. 
SKIES WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR LATE TONIGHT FROM THE SW AND BY TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON CLOUDS SHOULD START TO BREAK UP OVER NE SECTIONS. NAM/GFS 
GUIDANCE SIMILAR TONIGHT SO FOLLOWED CLOSE AND FOR TUESDAY AS WELL. 
HIGHS TUESDAY WILL STILL BE ABOUT 5 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL ALL AREAS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL ONE 
MAIN SYSTEM AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL BRING DRY AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS ON WEDNESDAY...WHICH WILL THEN MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE 
LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A STRONG 850 MB LOW-LEVEL 
JET (IN EXCESS OF 50 KT) IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY AHEAD OF ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT. MODEL SOUNDINGS AROUND THE 
MOUNTAINS INDICATE A VEERING WIND PROFILE...SOUTH TO SOUTHEASTERLY 
LOW-LEVEL WINDS PERPENDICULAR TO THE MOUNTAINS...AND A DEEP STABLE 
LAYER EXTENDING ABOVE THE MOUNTAIN RIDGES. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT 
DAMAGING WINDS DUE TO MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL BE A GOOD POSSIBILITY LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING ALONG THE FOOTHILLS OF THE 
MOUNTAINS. FOR NOW...WILL PLAN TO MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY IN THE 
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK...BUT HIGH WIND WATCHES AND/OR WARNINGS 
MAY BE NEEDED FOR THE FOOTHILLS IN LATER FORECASTS. MODELS AGREE 
THAT MOISTURE WILL DECREASE RAPIDLY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT THURSDAY 
NIGHT...SO THAT THE CHANGE OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS BEHIND THE FRONT 
SHOULD BE QUICK AND MOSTLY LIMITED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ANOTHER 
WEAK COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY...BUT THE MODELS INDICATE THAT LIMITED 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH IT SHOULD RESULT MAINLY IN JUST AN INCREASE 
IN CLOUDS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARD THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO OUR WEST

THAT A FEW STORMS COULD BE SEVERE MAINLY SOUTHWEST ZONES.  WILL 
MENTION IN HWO.  SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO TONIGHT

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS STAY THE COURSE DURING 
THIS PERIOD WITH AN UPPER TROUGH GRADUALLY MOVING OUT OF THE EASTERN 
U.S. STILL A BIT OF MOISTURE AND LIFT IN PLACE ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TUESDAY MORNING SO KEPT A 
SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR A SHOWER IN THIS AREA. BUILDING 
HEIGHTS AND DRY ADVECTION ALLOW FOR A SHORT DURATION OF QUIET 
WEATHER MID WEEK. STRONG FRONTAL SYSTEM STILL EXPECTED TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY WITH LIKELY POSSIBILITY OF 
SHOWERS AND EVEN A CHANCE FOR CONVECTION AHEAD OF SYSTEM COLD FRONT. 
ENOUGH AMPLIFICATION MODELED WITH UPPER TROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS. A NICE AREA OF 
MOISTURE AND LIFT IS INDICATED WITH TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
BUILDING THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE LONG WAVE TROUGH DURING THIS 
PERIOD. THEREFORE...MAINTAINED OROGRAPHIC SNOW SHOWER CONCEPT WITH A 
TAPERING TREND THROUGH THE DAY FRIDAY FOR THE MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL AS THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER REGION. SHOULD BE A COLD...ALBEIT DRY...WEEKEND WITH 
TEMPERATURES STRUGGLING TO RETURN TO SEASONAL NORMALS AS AN UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH FINDS A HOME OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S.

FXUS64 KMRX 161946
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EST SUN DEC 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
RAINFALL HAS GRADUALLY BECOME LIGHTER THIS AFTERNOON AS STRONGER 
FORCING HAS SHIFTED SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR AREA. CATEGORICAL POPS 
WILL CONTINUE IN SOUTHERN AREAS THROUGH THE EVENING...WITH CHANCE 
POPS NORTH. A LULL IN THE PRECIP COMES AFTER MIDNIGHT AS BOTH THE 
NAM AND THE GFS SHOW SOME MIDLEVEL DRYING. HOWEVER THE MODELS 
DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY LATE TONIGHT. THE GFS PLACES OUR AREA IN THE 
DRY SLOT BENEATH THE UPPER JET...PRODUCING VERY LITTLE PRECIP. THE 
NAM SHOWS PRECIP BLOSSOMING AROUND 09Z ACROSS NRN AL/GA...SPREADING 
NORTHWARD THROUGH THE MORNING. A FRONTOGENETIC ZONE AND GOOD QG 
FORCING RESULT IN A HALF TO ONE INCH OF QPF AMOUNTS IN THE NAM 
BETWEEN 12-18Z. THE NAM WILL BE PREFERRED AS IT HAS BEEN PERFORMING 
WELL SO FAR WITH THIS SYSTEM...ALTHOUGH WILL BUMP ITS QPF AMOUNTS 
DOWN. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MENTIONED AS THERE 
WILL BE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY. PRECIP CHANCES BEGIN TO FALL IN 
THE AFTERNOON AS A 850-700 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH. THE 
MID/UPPER LEVEL TROUGH PASSAGE IS DELAYED UNTIL AFTER 00Z...SO WILL 
CARRY CHANCE POPS INTO MONDAY NIGHT. DRY ADVECTION AND PASSAGE OF 
THE SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BRING AN END TO POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
WITH PASSAGE OF MID AND UPPER LEVEL TROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT...SKIES
WILL CLEAR FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST BECOMING MOSTLY SUNNY
TUESDAY. A FEW CLOUDS LINGER NE OTHERWISE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.
HIGHS NEAR TO ABOVE NORMAL SOUTH AND CLOSE TO NORMAL NORTH. COOLER
TEMPERATURES NORTHERN AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS WHERE CLOUDS WILL
LINGER IN THE MORNING. SURFACE HIGH MOVES EAST ALONG GULF COAST TO
REACH SOUTHEAST COAST BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. RIDGING ALOFT KEEPS SKIES
MOSTLY CLEAR. WEDNESDAY WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER AS CENTER OF
HIGH SHIFTS FARTHER SOUTH AND EAST...AND SOUTH WINDS DEVELOP. NEXT
WEATHER SYSTEM TO AFFECT REGION THURSDAY. SURFACE LOW DEEPENS OVER
MID MS VALLEY THURSDAY AND RAPIDLY MOVES NE INTO THE EASTERN GREAT
LAKES FRIDAY. SHOWERS BECOME LIKELY THURSDAY. MUCH COLDER AIRMASS
BEHIND COLD FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT TO CHANGE PRECIPITATION TO SNOW
SHOWERS BEFORE ENDING OVERNIGHT VALLEYS AND FRIDAY NORTHEAST AND
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. AMOUNTS IN THE MOUNTAINS COULD BE A COUPLE OF
INCHES BUT IN THE VALLEY AREAS TOO EARLY TO TELL IF ANY COULD
ACCUMULATE BEFORE MOISTURE MOVES OUT AND IF TEMPERATURES GET COLD
ENOUGH FOR SNOW TO STICK BEFORE ENDING. HIGHS FRIDAY ONLY EXPECTED
TO REACH THE LOWER 30S HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND PARTS OF THE NE WITH
LOWER TO MID 40S ELSEWHERE. FRIDAY NIGHT LOWS IN THE 20S. THEN SLOW
WARMING TREND OVER THE WEEKEND AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE
REGION.

ESPECIALLY AT CHA AND TYS...BUT AGAIN GIVEN TIMING UNCERTAINTIES
WILL JUST INLCUDE VCTS EARLY.

883 
FXUS64 KMRX 160920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST SUN DEC 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT WILL 
REMAIN TO OUR WEST...AND WILL BEGIN ADVANCING EAST TOWARD THE AREA 
LATE IN THE PERIOD. SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL PROVIDE PLENTY OF 
MOISTURE OVER THE AREA...AND WHILE EXACT TIMING STILL 
DIFFICULT...APPEARS THERE WILL BE A COUPLE OF PERIODS OF ENHANCED 
SHOWER ACTIVITY DURING THE PERIOD. A WEAK SHORT WAVE THIS MORNING 
WILL BRING A ROUND OF SHOWERS...WITH ANOTHER SURGE OF SHOWERS 
EXPECTED LATER TONIGHT AS THE MORE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS 
TO OUR WEST AND APPROACHES.  APPEARS THERE WILL BE ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY FOR SOME THUNDER AS WELL...ESPECIALLY SOUTH.  WILL CARRY 
CAT POPS ALL ZONES TODAY AND CAT SOUTH WITH LIKELY NORTH TONIGHT. 
WILL GO CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...ALTHOUGH WILL TWEAK MOST MAV TEMPS UP 
SLIGHTLY FOR TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A HEALTHY SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
PROGRESSES EASTWARD ACROSS THE MID AND DEEP SOUTH ON MONDAY. THE 
SYSTEM SHOULD HAVE MORE THAN SUFFICIENT MOISTURE FOR LIFTING AHEAD 
OF THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AND THERE WILL BE 
YET ANOTHER CHANCE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTION AS MODELS PROG 
ADEQUATE INSTABILITY DURING THE DAY. MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE ON 
THE DECREASE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY BEHIND THE DEPARTING STORM 
SYSTEM. THE DRY REGIME MAY CONTINUE ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE EVENING 
HOURS WEDNESDAY AS THE FORECAST AREA ENJOYS A BRIEF PERIOD OF 
RIDGING. THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL 
BE KNOCKING ON THE DOOR LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MODELS CONTINUE TO 
SHOW A RATHER AMPLIFIED HEIGHT PATTERN WITH THIS SYSTEM AND EVEN 
THOUGH THE EVENT IS ON DAY 5...THE STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE AND 
MODEL AGREEMENT PUSH PROBABILITY OF PRECIP TO THE LIKELY CATEGORY. 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION (85H TEMPS AROUND -5 TO -10 C) AND 
SUFFICIENTLY DEEP MOISTURE ALONG WITH A NICE UPSLOPE COMPONENT 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN THURSDAY NIGHT. A FEW SNOW SHOWERS MAY CONTINUE IN 
THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE TENNESSEE-NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY FRIDAY. THE DEEP COLD 
TROUGH MOVES AWAY FOR THE WEEKEND WHICH SHOULD BRING SUNSHINE BACK 
TO THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA WITH SLIGHTLY WARMER HIGH TEMPERATURES.

041 
FXUS64 KMRX 152021
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST SAT DEC 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
A BAND OF PRECIP ACROSS MIDDLE TN APPEARS TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH 
THETA-E ADVECTION AND CONVERGENCE IN THE 925-700 MB LAYER. THE NAM 
SHOWS THE THETA-E RIDGE EXTENDING INTO OUR AREA AFTER 00Z...ALONG 
WITH STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE ACROSS THE PLATEAU 
OVERNIGHT. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS WEST TO CHANCE POPS EAST...AND A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS WEST WHERE 850 MB THETA-E VALUES WILL 
EXCEED 320K. WILL LEAN TOWARD WARMER GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS TONIGHT 
GIVEN EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER AND WARM ADVECTION.

DEEPER FORCING FOR LIFT DEVELOPS ON SUNDAY AS THE UPPER JET MOVES 
INTO THE TN VALLEY REIONG...WITH Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE AND A BAND OF 
MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS ACROSS OUR AREA. ALONG WITH CATEGORICAL 
POPS...THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS AREA-WIDE WITH 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY PRESENT AT OR ABOVE 850 MB. SYNOPTIC LIFT AND 
INSTABILITY DECREASE SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER JET WEAKENS AND THE 
FRONTOGENESIS ZONE SHIFTS TO OUR EAST. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW A PERIOD 
OF MID-UPPER LEVEL DRY AIR ABOVE 700 MB. POPS WILL DROP BACK TO 
LIKELY SOUTH TO CHANCE NORTH IN THE EVENING AND CONTINUE THROUGH
THE NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
BROAD TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE SE STATES MONDAY. A SURFACE
LOW THAT DEVELOPS OVER THE MS VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT DEEPENS AS IT
MOVES NE THROUGH THE OH VALLEY. SHORT WAVE ENERGY OUT AHEAD OF THE
LOW AND COLD FRONT SHOULD TRIGGER MORE CONVECTION ACROSS EAST TN
AND THE SE MONDAY. WARM AND MOIST SW FLOW WILL ADD FUEL TO THE
STORMS WHICH MAY BECOME STRONG ACROSS THE SE STATES AND PART OF THE
OHIO VALLEY. BEST THREAT FOR CONVECTION WILL BE PLATEAU AND SOUTH
VALLEY INTO SE TN AND SW NORTH CAROLINA MONDAY. HIGHS MONDAY WILL
WARM IN THE UPPER 50S TO UPPER 60S WITH DEW POINTS IN THE 50S. AN
AVERAGE OF ONE HALF TO ONE INCH OF RAIN MAY FALL ACROSS SOUTHERN
SECTIONS WITH ANTICIPATED CONVECTION MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.
MONDAY NIGHT MUCH COLDER AIR MASS WILL DROP FREEZING LEVELS TO
BETWEEN 4 AND 5 THOUSAND FEET. LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY
MORNING COULD SEE AN INCH OR SO OF SNOW AT THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS
FOR NOW NO SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION AND WILL JUST MENTION CHANCE AT
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING
RIDGING ALOFT AND WEAK SURFACE HIGH BRINGS SHORT BREAK IN WET
PATTERN.

EARLY THURSDAY A MORE DEVELOPED SYSTEM WILL MOVE RAPIDLY FROM THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES BY FRIDAY. CLOUDS AND RAIN 
SHOULD SPREAD INTO THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. BEHIND 
THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MUCH COLDER AIRMASS WILL CHANGE RAIN TO 
SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY EVENING. WITH NW FLOW TRAJECTORY IN 
PLACE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SHOULD RECEIVE SOME SNOWFALL WITH THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS ALSO HAVING SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES BEFORE 
THE PRECIPITATION ENDS EARLY FRIDAY. LOWS WILL BE MOSTLY ABOVE 
FREEZING MONDAY NIGHT EXCEPT NEAR FREEZING HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. HIGHS 
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY COOLER THAN MONDAY BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL. 
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MUCH COOLER BEHIND FRONT. MAY BE THE 
COLDEST NIGHT OF THE YEAR SINCE THE OCTOBER SNOWS FRIDAY NIGHT WITH 
LOWS IN TEENS IN THE MOUNTAINS TO LOWER AND MID 20S ELSEWHERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST SAT DEC 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE IN THE PLAINS WILL 
LIFT NORTHEAST INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION...AND A COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH SLOWLY BUT WILL STILL BE WELL TO OUR WEST BY END OF THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM...AND MAY SEE A FEW SHOWERS MAINLY WEST TODAY.  CHANCES FOR 
RAIN WILL INCREASE TONIGHT. WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TODAY WEST 
ZONES...THEN LIKELY SOUTHWEST AND CHANCE ELSEWHERE BY LATE TONIGHT. 
MAY BE ENOUGH ELEVATED INSTABILITY FOR A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER 
SOUTHWEST AREAS LATE TONIGHT...BUT AT THIS POINT DOES NOT LOOK VERY 
FAVORABLE SO NO MENTION OF THUNDER.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...INITIAL SHORT WAVE MOVES 
NORTHEAST THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES EARLY ON SUNDAY LEAVING A WEAK 
SURFACE BOUNDARY BEHIND ACROSS THE OHIO THROUGH MID MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY. A CONVERGENT...MOIST AND UNSTABLE SOUTHWEST FLOW SHOULD BE 
ABLE TO SPARK SOME SHOWERS AND EVEN A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE 
REGION DURING THE DAY SUNDAY. SO KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING FROM THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST AND ADJUSTED PARTS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA TO CATEGORICAL 
RANGE WHERE DEEPEST MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL OCCUR. TRAILING SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL PRESS NORTHEAST 
TOWARD THE MID SOUTH SUNDAY NIGHT EVENTUALLY DRAGGING THE STALLED 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
BY 12Z TUESDAY. LOOKS LIKE ATMOSPHERE MAY BE UNSTABLE ENOUGH TO 
SUPPORT MORE CONVECTION WITH THE SECOND UPPER TROUGH SO INCLUDED 
THROUGH MID DAY MONDAY. THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF MONDAY 
NIGHT MOST OF THE AREA BUT LEFT A SMALL/SLIGHT CHANCE GOING ACROSS 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS EVEN INTO TUESDAY MORNING AS WEST TO 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW FILLS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTED SURFACE SYSTEM. 
PERIOD OF RIDGING KEEPS A DRY FORECAST IN PLACE TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT ANOTHER MID LATITUDE CYCLONE MOVES 
QUICKLY EAST ON THURSDAY AS A DEEP UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BUILDS INTO 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. STAYED WITH MEDIUM AND HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS FOR THE LATE WEEK EVENT. THIS AMPLIFIED SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT 
WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH TO PULL POLAR AIR WELL SOUTH INTO THE BACK 
SIDE OF THE PRESSURE SYSTEM. THE MODELS SHOW A NICE SWATH OF 
TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY ALONG WITH RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE 
ADVECTING INTO THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. THE CHILLY 
NORTHWEST FLOW WOULD LIKELY RESULT IN OROGRAPHIC SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN ON THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER SO APPLIED THIS SCENARIO TO THE FORECAST.

309 
FXUS64 KMRX 142024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST FRI DEC 14 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A TROUGH AND UPPER JET OVER THE DESERT SW WILL BE LIFTING NE TOWARD 
THE GREAT LAKES THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE 
INCREASING TONIGHT AS THE SOUTHERN STREAM JET INTENSIFIES AND 
EXTENDS EASTWARD. THIS CLOUD COVER SHOULD RESULT IN LOW TEMPS WARMER 
THAN THE PAST FEW NIGHTS...AND LESS POTENTIAL FOR FOG DEVELOPMENT. 
CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY LOWER THROUGH SATURDAY AS 500 MB HEIGHTS FALL 
AND 850-700 MB WARM ADVECTION ENSUES. AN INITIAL MID-UPPER LEVEL 
VORT MAX IS SHOWN BY THE NAM AND GFS TO CROSS OUR AREA IN THE 
MORNING...WHICH MAY BRING LIGHT PRECIP TO THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. 
HOWEVER WITH LIMITED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT...WILL HAVE 
JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP. WITH THE OFFSHORE RIDGE AND LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKING THROUGH THE PLAINS...A SOUTH WIND WILL PICK UP TO 10-15 MPH 
BY AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT WITH
COLD FRONT STILL FAR TO THE WEST ALONG THE MS RIVER BY 12Z SUNDAY.
THERE WILL BE AN INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS BUT THE BULK OF THE
LIFT WILL SHIFT NORTH INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. EXPECT ONLY A
FEW LIGHT SHOWERS BUT MUCH WARMER OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES. LOW LEVEL
SOUTHWEST WINDS SHOULD PICK UP OVERNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
AHEAD OF COLD FRONT THAT WILL ADVANCE EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY
SUNDAY AND INTO THE APPALACHIANS SUNDAY NIGHT. SFC DEW POINTS WILL
REACH THE 50S SUNDAY AND SLIGHT INSTABILITY WILL ALLOW FOR A FEW
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP LATER SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH 60 KNOT
WINDS AT 500 MB AND STRONG 0-6KM SHEAR PER DAY 3 OUTLOOK SOME
STRONG STORMS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS MAINLY SOUTHERN AND WESTERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS STILL SHOW FRONT SLOWING AS
NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPS ALONG FRONT MONDAY AND THEN MOVES NE
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS WILL CONTINUE GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS
MONDAY AND MORE THUNDER CHANCES BEFORE FRONT FINALLY MOVES SOUTH
AND EAST OF THE REGION TUESDAY.

COLDER MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH SHOWERS MAINLY EAST MONDAY 
NIGHT AND NORTH TUESDAY WITH COLDER AIR TUESDAY TEMPERATURES LOWER 
BUT HIGHS STILL MID 40S TO MID 50S. BRIEF DRYING AS RIDGING BUILDS 
IN TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY NEW DEVELOPING SYSTEM 
BRINGS RENEWED RAIN CHANCES BUT MUCH COLDER AIRMASS BEHIND FRONT 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. FREEZING LEVELS DROP SO SNOW POSSIBLE 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHERN SECTIONS THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY. 
HIGHS FRIDAY 30S MOUNTAINS AND 40S VALLEYS.

931 
FXUS64 KMRX 140928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EST FRI DEC 14 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
AREA WILL SHIFT EAST DURING THE PERIOD.  MOISTURE WILL START TO 
INCREASE...WITH INCREASING HIGH CLOUDS ESPECIALLY TONIGHT WHEN SOME 
MID CLOUDS MAY START MOVING IN AS WELL.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
GOOD...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ACTIVE PATTERN WITH SEVERAL 
FEATURES TO AFFECT THE REGION DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST. 
MODELS GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT DIVERGE LATE 
WITH STRENGTH AND TIMING ISSUES. STAYED WITH A GFS/ECMWF BLEND FOR 
THIS PACKAGE. THE FIRST WAVE BUILDS NORTHEAST FROM THE PLAINS ON 
SATURDAY INTO SOUTHEASTERN CANADA BY 12Z SUNDAY WEAKENING DURING ITS 
JOURNEY. HOWEVER...NICE LOW LEVEL JET ADDS MOISTURE TO THE COLUMN 
LATER SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...MOISTURE THAT SHOULD BE LIFTED 
EFFECTIVELY AHEAD OF THE STORM SYSTEM COLD FRONT. THERE MAY EVEN BE 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF 
CONVECTION OVER WESTERN AND SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA SO 
MAINTAINED THIS IDEA WHILE TWEAKING POPS TO LIKELY ON SUNDAY FOR 
MOST OF THE REGION. WITH THE WEAKENING WAVE RIPPING QUICKLY 
NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL SLOW DOWN. ON MONDAY...A TRAILING SHORT WAVE WILL RIDE 
NORTHEAST ALONG A SIMILAR PATH AS THE FIRST WAVE AND WILL DEEPEN 
OVER THE EASTERN LAKES WHICH SHOULD HELP TO PULL THE COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SO HELD ONTO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS 
MONDAY WHILE DECREASING TO SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY AS ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST IN THE CYCLONIC FLOW AROUND 
THE EASTERN LAKES UPPER LOW. A NICE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE 
EASTERN U.S. AT MID WEEK KEEPING DRY CONDITIONS IN PLACE. YET 
ANOTHER AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY AND ADJUSTED POPS A LITTLE 
HIGHER FROM SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE FOR THIS EVENT WHICH MAY HAVE SOME 
SNOW MIXED IN WITH THE COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN BEHIND THE 
DEPARTING FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 140251
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EST THU DEC 13 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MIN TEMPS LOOK GOOD. DEW POINTS ARE 
RUNNING A TAD HIGH AND SHOULD ONLY FALL 2 TO 3 DEGREES OVERNIGHT.
ADDED FREEZING FOG TO SW NORTH CAROLINA AND EXTREME SE TENNESSEE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH 
TONIGHT AND FRIDAY AS A LOW TO MID LEVEL RIDGE WILL BE OVER THE 
AREA. LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD BE CLOSE TO LAST NIGHT...WITH HIGHS 
TOMORROW A BIT WARMER THAN TODAY...MAINLY IN THE 55 TO 60 RANGE. THE 
RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS TO OUR EAST BY FRIDAY EVENING...AND 500 MB HEIGHTS 
BEGIN TO FALL AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND UPPER JET. THIS SHOULD 
BRING INCREASING HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE WEST FRIDAY NIGHT. 

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT SHIFTS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT ALTHOUGH TIMING OF PRECIPITATION START
IS SLOWER SO BACKED OFF ON RAIN START ANOTHER 6 HOURS UNTIL
AFTERNOON WEST AND EVENING EAST. MAY ACTUALLY STAY DRY UNTIL
SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY MORNING IF SLOWING TREND CONTINUES. NEXT
SYSTEM DEEPENS OVER THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES SATURDAY NIGHT AND
SUNDAY. GULF MOISTURE STREAMS NORTH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. MORE
SIGNIFICANT SHOWERS MOVE IN SUNDAY WITH THUNDER A POSSIBILITY SOUTH
AND WEST. MODELS BRING FRONT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SECONDARY
FRONT BEHIND THE FIRST ONE MONDAY. BEST RAIN CHANCES SUNDAY AND
SUNDAY NIGHT DECREASING MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. COLDER TEMPERATURES
BEHIND THE SECOND SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY MAY
BRING SOME SNOW BUT IF SYSTEM MOVES OUT TOO FAST FOR ANY
SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION AND IF SYSTEM SPEEDS UP PRECIPITATION MAY
ONLY BE RAIN TUESDAY WITH NO MOISTURE LEFT WHEN TEMPERATURES DROP
THAT NIGHT. A BRIEF BREAK IN THE PATTERN WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY
NIGHT THEN ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE REGION WITH MORE RAIN
THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY BUT
COOLER MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.

245 
FXUS64 KMRX 130857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
357 AM EST THU DEC 13 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SATELLITE IMAGERY DEPICTING A
FEW CLOUDS ALONG THE EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. THEY SHOULD
EXIT THE REGION EARLY TODAY AS A DRIER AIRMASS PUSHES IN. LATEST
OBSERVATIONS INDICATING FREEZING FOG AT TRI-CITIES. ONLY ISOLATED
FOG IS EXPECTED THIS MORNING...MAINLY NEAR THE LAKES... STREAMS AND
OTHER BODIES OF WATER SO WILL NOT ADD IN THE ZONE PACKAGE.
OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION WILL BRING DRY WEATHER
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT ALONG WITH A LITTLE WARMER TEMPERATURES.
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LATEST MODEL RUNS ARE 
BECOMING MORE OUT-OF-PHASE WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN FOR EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...BUT THEY GENERALLY AGREE THAT AN UNSETTLED PATTERN WILL 
DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHEAST. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN IS DRIER AND LESS 
ACTIVE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THAN THE ECMWF MODEL FOR EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...WITH THE CANADIAN MODEL APPEARING TO AGREE MORE WITH THE GFS 
MODEL THAN THE ECMWF MODEL (ALTHOUGH THE CANADIAN MODEL HAS BEEN 
VERY INCONSISTENT FROM RUN TO RUN LATELY). WILL PLAN TO TREND THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST TOWARDS THE ECMWF MODEL SOLUTION...SINCE IT HAS 
BEEN MORE CONSISTENT OVER THE LAST FEW MODEL RUNS AND IS GENERALLY A 
BETTER MODEL IN THE EXTENDED PERIODS THAN THE OTHER MODELS. 

WITH THIS IN MIND...IT APPEARS THAT A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. THIS FRONT WILL LIKELY STALL OUT BEFORE 
REACHING THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY. THE ECMWF MODEL THEN 
QUICKLY DEVELOPS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ON TUESDAY FURTHER 
SOUTH ALONG THE SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC COAST...WITH SHOWERS EXPECTED 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. THE EXACT TRACK OF THIS 
LOW WILL DETERMINE HOW MUCH COLD AIR CAN BE PULLED INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SNOW...BUT RIGHT NOW...THE ECMWF MODEL 
INDICATES THAT IT WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. BASED ON THE CURRENT ECMWF SOLUTION...THIS SNOW WILL BE 
THE RESULT OF NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...AND SO WOULD THINK THAT ANY 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS 
FOR TEMPS IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT THEREAFTER...WILL 
TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE WHICH IS MORE IN LINE WITH THE 
ECMWF SOLUTION.


.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  29  59  39  60 /   0   0   0   0  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  27  58  38  59 /   0   0   0   0  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  29  58  38  59 /   0   0   0   0  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  22  56  34  57 /   0   0   0   0  20

829 
FXUS64 KMRX 130246
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EST WED DEC 12 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. UPPER TROUGH 
OVER THE AREA WILL EXIT TO THE EAST IN A FEW HOURS. CLEAR COOL 
NIGHT ON TRACK. SON

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY TODAY WILL MOVE EAST 
ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH THROUGH THE EVENING...MOVING TO THE COAST 
TOWARD MIDNIGHT. THE BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS ON THE WESTERN FRINGES OF 
THE UPPER JET HAS BEEN OVER OUR AREA TODAY...AND WILL GRADUALLY 
PROGRESS EAST THROUGH THE EVENING. WE SHOULD SEE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
BY MIDNIGHT. AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN NEARLY 
STATIONARY OVER PA AND THE OH VALLEY REGION THROUGH THURSDAY. WITH 
NEUTRAL ADVECTION AND FULL SUN...WE SHOULD SEE HIGH TEMPS A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY...REACHING THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS. 

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
BENIGN...TRANQUIL AND DRY WEATHER WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE SATURDAY
BRINGING WARM...MOIST AIR INTO THE REGION AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. AT
THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT MUCH OF THE DAYLIGHT HOURS WILL BE DRY.
HOWEVER...THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT
BRINGING GOOD CHANCES OF RAINFALL.

UNFORTUNATELY CONFIDENCE PAST SATURDAY IS VERY LOW GIVEN THE MEDIUM 
RANGE MODEL AND ENSEMBLE SOLUTIONS. THESE MODELS HAVE BEEN ALL OVER 
THE PLACE AND THERE IS JUST NOT A GOOD CONSENSUS TO GIVE HIGH 
CONFIDENCE IN THE FORECAST AFTER SATURDAY. SHOULD THE OPERATIONAL 
RUN OF THE GFS VERIFY ON MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE SURFACE LOW CENTERED 
OVER NW NC...SOME HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD EXPERIENCE SNOW 
PARTICULARLY IN SW VA. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  56  30  59  36 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  28  53  28  57  33 /   0   0   0   0   0

THE PLACE AND THERE IS JUST NOT A GOOD CONSENSUS TO GIVE HIGH 
CONFIDENCE IN THE FORECAST AFTER SATURDAY. SHOULD THE OPERATIONAL 
RUN OF THE GFS VERIFY ON MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE SURFACE LOW CENTERED 
OVER NW NC...SOME HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD EXPERIENCE SNOW 
PARTICULARLY IN SW VA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
356 AM EST WED DEC 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY WEATHER PUSHING INTO THE
AREA BEHIND THE FRONT. A WEAK TROUGH WILL BRING A FEW HIGH CLOUDS
TODAY WITH A PARTLY SUNNY SKY EXPECTED. BUT NO PRECIPITATION IS
ANTICIPATED. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY
WHICH SHOULD BE NEAR SEASONAL LEVELS. THE CLOUDS SHOULD EXIT
TONIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY.
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE AGAIN FOR TONIGHT WITH
ANOTHER NIGHT WITH NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL SYNOPTIC PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT
WEEK...BUT DIFFER ON THE DETAILS OF HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE
AVAILABLE WITH THE TWO SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA THIS
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE DOMINATING THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WHICH WILL
BRING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT (ALONG WITH
A WARMING TREND). MODELS AGREE THAT A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE
FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION
THIS WEEKEND. ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER
VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WITH A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN AHEAD
OF IT PRODUCING SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY NIGHT. THE ECMWF
MODEL THEN DEVELOPS A FAIRLY STRONG SECONDARY LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS BY SUNDAY NIGHT...WHICH WOULD KEEP SHOWERS OVER THE
FORECAST AREA THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. SINCE THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS
DIFFER ON THIS SOLUTION (AND THIS LATEST WET ECMWF SOLUTION HAS
ONLY JUST APPEARED WITH THIS MODEL RUN)...WILL TREND TOWARDS A
COMPROMISE SOLUTION BETWEEN THE TWO MODELS FOR NOW. ANOTHER LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM IS THEN PROGGED BY BOTH MODELS TO DEVELOP OVER THE
SOUTHEAST ON TUESDAY...BUT THE EXACT TRACK REMAINS IN QUESTION AS
BOTH MODELS HAVE BEEN FLIP-FLOPPING WITH ITS TRACK OVER THE LAST
FEW MODEL RUNS. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS THAT THE TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT
TIMEFRAME WILL BE UNSETTLED...WITH THE EXACT TRACK DETERMINING HOW
MUCH COLD AIR CAN BE PULLED INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE
POSSIBILITY OF SNOW. FOR NOW...WILL NOT MENTION ANY SNOW
POSSIBILITIES OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND
TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT
THEREAFTER...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER ENSEMBLE MEANS DUE TO
THE UNSETTLED CONDITIONS AND LIKELY CLOUD COVER.

TRANSLATE ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. A DRY AND 
STABLE AIRMASS WILL REMAIN IN PLACE AND PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL OCCUR WELL SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR FORECAST AREA 
ON WEDNESDAY. LOOK FOR AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES TO BE CLOSER TO 
SEASONAL AVERAGES. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS SLIDES SE TO THE OUTER BANKS 
BY LATE FRIDAY. UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST THROUGH THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT FOLLOWED BY RIDGING INTO THE EARLY WEEKEND. DRY CONDITIONS 
INTO THE THE EARLY WEEKEND WITH TEMPERATURES RANGING JUST OUTSIDE 
CLIMO. SHORT WAVE ENERGY EJECTING NE OUT OF THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES 
DEVELOPS SURFACE LOW OVER KANSAS BY EARLY SATURDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL 
CONTINUE TO THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES BY LATE SUNDAY. WESTERLY 
STEERING FLOW WILL DRIVE COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED SHOWER ACTIVITY 
THROUGH THE TN VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE 
SATURDAY AND EARLY SUNDAY. LIGHT NW FLOW ACTIVITY POSSIBLE INTO 
MONDAY. SIGNIFICANT LOW PRESSURE TAKING SHAPE ON TUESDAY. TRACK AND 
TIMING REMAIN IN QUESTION BUT SNOW EVENT LIKELY WITH THIS SYSTEM.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...LARGE SHIELD OF RAIN HAS KEPT

IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LOOKS VERY LIMITED AS WELL SINCE MOISTURE 
WILL BE PUSHING OUT OF THE AREA VERY QUICKLY THIS EVENING.  

FOR WIND ADVISORY...WILL GO AHEAD AND CANCEL THE SOUTHERN 
PLATEAU...BUT WILL KEEP THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS GOING...DUE TO EXPIRE 
AT 6PM EST.  

FOR TEMPS...GOING A LITTLE BELOW GUIDANCE IN NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS 
TONIGHT...AND A LITTLE COOLER FOR THE MAX TEMPS ACROSS THE BOARD FOR 
MAX TEMPS TOMORROW.  THIS IS BASED ON LOOKING AT TRAJECTORY 
FORECASTS SHOWING SOURCE REGION FOR AIR TOMORROW IS EASTERN IOWA 
WHERE CURRENT TEMPS ARE BELOW FREEZING.  THE AIR MASS SHOULD MODIFY 
SOMEWHAT...BUT MOS SEEMED TOO WARM.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. DRY AIRMASS WILL LEAD TO COOL NIGHTS 
AND WARM DAYS WITH LIGHT WINDS. AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST 
THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY WITH LITTLE INFLUENCE WEST 
OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES 
RAPIDLY NE THROUGH KANSAS ON SATURDAY. WARM AIR ADVECTION AND 
MOISTURE TRANSPORTS UP THE TN VALLEY WITH SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW. 
ONGOING CONVECTION WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WITH TIMING PROGGED FOR SAT NIGHT. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND 
SCATTERED SHOWERS CONTINUES INTO SUNDAY. MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND RELATIVELY DRY AIRMASS 
WILL LIKELY BECOME ESTABLISHED AGAIN LEADING TO COOL MORNINGS AND 
WARM DAYS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1121 AM EST MON DEC 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT STILL APPROACHING AREA...EXPECTING IT TO MOVE INTO NWRN
CWA AROUND 18Z...THEN FINALLY CLEARING ERN CWA THIS
EVENING...PROBABLY PRIOR TO MIDNIGHT. WITH ALL THE RAIN OVER THE
AREA NOW...THE AIR MASS IS PRETTY STABLE. LIGHTNING THAT HAD MOVED
THROUGH THE AREA BEFORE SUNRISE HAS NOW MOVED AWAY TO THE EAST AND
HAS FADED. UPSTREAM CLOSEST LIGHTNING NOW IS BACK NEAR KBHM.
ANOTHER SURGE OF WIND/RICHER MOISTURE IS EXPECTED TO PUSH UP INTO
THE REGION IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON...SO THE AIR MASS COULD
DESTABILIZE SOMEWHAT. WILL GO WITH CHANCE OF THUNDER SOUTH AND
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER CENTRAL AND NORTHERN AREAS. CHANCES OF
SEVERE STORMS LOOKING IFFY AT BEST...SINCE STABILITY RECOVERY WILL
BE LIMITED. LOOKS LIKE MOST STRONGER STORMS WILL STAY SOUTH OF
AREA.

WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT ON PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN HALF OF EASTERN
MOUNTAINS. WINDS OVERALL VERY LIGHT RIGHT NOW...AFOREMENTIONED
SURGE LOOKS LIKE IT COULD BUMP WINDS UP AGAIN ON SOUTHERN PLATEAU
AND SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON...BUT IT LOOKS LIKE FRONT
WILL CUT OFF THE CHANCES FOR THESE WINDS ON THE NORTHERN PLATEAU.
WILL CANCEL WIND ADVISORY FOR NORTHERN PLATEAU. WILL KEEP IT
RUNNING FOR SOUTHERN PLATEAU...BUT TRIMMING ITS EXPIRATION TIME
BACK A COUPLE OF HOURS DUE TO FRONTAL PASSAGE. WILL LEAVE SOUTHERN
MOUNTAINS WIND ADVISORY AS- IS.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK FOR THE AFTERNOON...SO WILL NOT
ADJUST MAX TEMPS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

640 AM EST MON DEC 10 2012

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM NEAR 
CINCINNATI SOUTHWEST TO NEAR COOKEVILLE AND MUSCLE SHOALS. THIS COLD 
FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY ADVANCE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY THIS MORNING...WITH A BAND OF CONVECTION AHEAD OF IT 
AFFECTING THE TAF SITES FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS. MODELS INDICATE 
ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON...AS AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. HAVE TRIED TO TIME 
THE NEXT ROUND OF CONVECTION IN EACH TAF FOR A COUPLE OF HOURS 
BETWEEN 18 AND 22Z. OVERALL...EXPECT MVFR CONDITIONS FOR MOST OF THE 
DAY...WITH SOME TEMPORARY IFR CONDITIONS AND GUSTY WINDS WITH ANY 
CONVECTION. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE WEST OR NORTHWEST BY LATE 
AFTERNOON AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE...WITH CEILINGS REMAINING IN THE 
MVFR RANGES TONIGHT.

905 
FXUS64 KMRX 100840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST MON DEC 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
STRONG COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM NEAR CINCINNATI SOUTHWEST TO NEAR 
NASHVILLE AND TUPELO. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY ADVANCE 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING...AND SHOULD BE 
LOCATED DIRECTLY OVER THE FORECAST AREA AROUND NOON. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL A SOLID LINE OF CONVECTION AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT...WHICH 
WAS BEGINNING TO AFFECT THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES. THE LATEST 
NAM MODEL RUN NOW REVEALS A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY...ALTHOUGH THE GFS MODEL CONTINUES 
TO SHOW A MORE STABLE AIR MASS. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS BY MENTIONING SHOWERS WITH 
SCATTERED TSTORMS EVERYWHERE FOR TODAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL WIND FIELD WILL DEVELOP ALONG THIS COLD 
FRONT...WITH A 850 MB JET AROUND 50 KT EXPECTED. THUS... WILL 
CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 
FEET...AND WILL EXPAND IT IN AREA TO COVER THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS 
AND IN TIME UNTIL 6 PM THIS EVENING. IF THE NAM MODEL'S FORECAST OF 
SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY MATERIALIZES...THEN IT APPEARS POSSIBLE 
FOR AN ISOLATED TORNADO OR TWO TO FORM (MAINLY OVER THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA) DUE TO THE LARGE HELICITY VALUES OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL 
DECREASE RAPIDLY TONIGHT BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT...SO THINK THAT ANY 
SNOW DEVELOPMENT ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE PRECIP SHOULD BE LIMITED TO 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET WITH NOT MUCH ACCUMULATIONS. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT (MAINLY DUE TO SLIGHT TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE COLD FRONT)...AND WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY...AND IN ITS WAKE COOLER AIR WILL 
FILTER INTO THE REGION...DROPPING HIGH TEMPERATURES INTO THE 40S 
AREAWIDE. THOUGH ANY RAIN SHOWERS SHOULD BE EAST OF THE 
AREA...ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING ALONG THE GULF COAST WILL PULL 
SOME MOISTURE AND PRECIP BACK ALONG THE LEE SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. MODELS HAVE TRENDED THIS FURTHER 
EAST...WITH ALL OF THE QPF SIGNALS AND BEST DYNAMICS OCCURRING 
ACROSS THE CAROLINAS AND GEORGIA. THUS...HAVE KEPT MENTIONABLE POPS 
OUT OF THE FORECAST DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. SUBTROPICAL RIDGING 
OVER THE REGION WILL PROMOTE FAIR WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY...ALONG WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND AS HIGHS WILL RETURN TO 
THE 50S TO LOW 60S BY THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. HOWEVER...ANOTHER 
UPPER-TROUGH WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION THIS WEEKEND AND BRING AN 
ADDITIONAL SHOT OF PRECIPITATION. AS A RESULT HAVE GONE CHANCE POPS 
AREAWIDE FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF SUNDAY 
NIGHT FROM WEST TO EAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

LOW-LEVEL JET PROGGED TO DEVELOP LATER THIS MORNING ALONG THE COLD

FXUS64 KMRX 092023
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 PM EST SUN DEC 9 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...BRUNT OF SIGNIFICANT WEATHER 
OCCURS IN THE SHORT TERM...SIMILAR TO TIMING IN PREVIOUS FORECAST 
GRIDS. SHOWERS PASS ACROSS NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA EARLY TONIGHT...
THEN A BREAK BEFORE MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION MOVES IN TOWARD AND 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. THERE IS SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY NOTED WITH 
CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT TONIGHT...MAINLY ACROSS WRN 
AREAS. 

FAVORED THE STRONGER NAM LOW LEVEL JET WHICH SUPPORTS A WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THE PLATEAU AND SMOKY MOUNTAINS LATE TONIGHT INTO EARLY 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. GUSTY OR DAMAGING WINDS APPEAR TO BE THE MAIN 
THREAT...WITH STRONG LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND DEEP LIFT WITH THE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE. DOWNWARD TRANSFER OF MOMENTUM WITH MORNING 
CONVECTION WILL LIKELY ENHANCE THE WIND GUSTS. OPTED TO LEAVE SW VA 
AND THE CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES OUT OF THE WIND ADVISORY FOR 
NOW...LETTING MIDNIGHT SHIFT DECIDE IF ADVISORY IS JUSTIFIED 
ELSEWHERE.

OTHERWISE...MIN TEMPS SHOULD BE AT LEAST A COUPLE TO FEW DEGREES 
ABOVE GFS MOS...THEN MAXES OCCUR IN THE MORNING PRIOR TO FRONTAL 
PASSAGE. STEADY OR FALLING TEMPS IN THE AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE RIDGING WILL 
BUILD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK. 
HOWEVER...AN UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL 
PULL MOISTURE/PRECIPITATION BACK INTO THE CAROLINAS/GEORGIA FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING...BUT BOTH GFS/ECMWF SHOWS MOST 
OF THE MOISTURE/DYNAMICS STAYING EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT POPS FOR THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA...OTHERWISE DRY.

SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER OVER THE AREA 
FOR LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT KEEPING FOR THE FORECAST 
AREA DRY WITH MODERATING TEMPERATURES.  FOR NEXT WEEKEND...ANOTHER 
SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
INCREASING THE CHANCES OF RAIN.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EST SUN DEC 9 2012

.DISCUSSION...MORNING CONVECTION CONTINUES OVER WRN HALF OF TN NNE 
INTO CENTRAL/WRN KY...ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT. THIS IS 
MOSTLY ELEVATED INSTABILITY...WHICH LATEST NAM MODEL KEEPS TO OUR 
WEST AND NORTH TODAY. THUS...RAIN CHANCES AS IN CURRENT GRIDS LOOK 
GOOD WITH 40 PERCENT CHANCE ACROSS NRN AREAS DOWN TO 20 PERCENT 
CHANCE ACROSS EXTREME SRN AREAS. MAIN ACTION AS FAR AS STRONG 
CONVECTION AND MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS HOLDS OFF UNTIL LATE 
TONIGHT AND MONDAY. 

LOW CLOUDS AND FOG PERSIST AT CHA...BUT EVEN THERE THE TEMPERATURE 
WAS ALREADY IN THE LOWER 60S. THUS...HIGHS IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S 
IS ON TRACK. AN UPDATE OF FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS MAY NOT BE 
REQUIRED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
635 AM EST SUN DEC 9 2012

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT NORTHWEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...GENERALLY STRETCHING ALONG A LINE FROM LEXINGTON TO 
NASHVILLE TO MEMPHIS. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT 
NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT TODAY...AS SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS INCREASE 
AHEAD OF A DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS. SCATTERED 
SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED AT ALL THREE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT THE TAF 
PERIOD...BUT TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE OF THESE SHOWERS AT THE TAF 
SITES WILL BE TOO PROBLEMATIC TO MENTION IN THE TAFS. SOME MVFR 
CEILINGS/VISIBILITIES ARE EXPECTED AT KCHA THIS MORNING AND THEN 
AGAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...BUT OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS AND 
LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED AT ALL THREE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT MOST OF 
THE TAF PERIOD.

513 
FXUS64 KMRX 090901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SUN DEC 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT NORTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA...GENERALLY STRETCHING 
ALONG A LINE FROM LEXINGTON TO NASHVILLE TO MEMPHIS. THIS COLD FRONT 
IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT TODAY...AS 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS INCREASE AHEAD OF A DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
OVER THE PLAINS. MODELS INDICATE THAT MOST OF THE UPPER DYNAMICS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS TROUGH WILL BE OCCURRING WEST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY...WITH ONLY SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT POSSIBLY CREATING 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ALSO REVEAL SOME 
WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPING AROUND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS 
AFTERNOON...SO WILL MENTION THUNDER IN THESE AREAS. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...BRINGING WITH IT SOME VERY 
GOOD CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND SOME SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. THIS 
ACTIVITY WILL MOVE INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/WESTERN ZONES LATE 
TONIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING AND OVERSPREAD THE AREA THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY...BEFORE GRADUALLY TAPERING OFF BY LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. 
WITH HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES IN PLACE AND A STRONG MEAN 
SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT MOVING PARALLEL TO THE BOUNDARY...THE POTENTIAL 
FOR TRAINING AND THUS LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE...AND 
WILL BE THE BIGGEST THREAT WITH THE ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP. 
INSTABILITY PARAMETERS STILL DO NOT APPEAR TO BE TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE 
DURING THIS TIME. HOWEVER...THERE WILL BE SOME MODEST ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY VALUES /PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/. 
THIS...COMBINED WITH STRONG JET DYNAMICS AND SUBSEQUENTLY HIGH 0-6 
KM SHEAR VALUES WILL ALLOW FOR DECENT STORM ORGANIZATION AND THUS A 
DAMAGING WIND THREAT WITH ANY STRONG/SEVERE STORMS THAT DO DEVELOP. 

AS MENTIONED...BY MONDAY NIGHT SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO TAPER OFF FROM 
WEST TO EAST...THOUGH STILL FEEL HIGH-END CHANCE POPS ARE WARRANTED 
OVER MUCH OF THE AREA /FAVORING THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS ZONES/. 
AS COLDER AIR WORKS ITS WAY INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...A CHANGE OVER TO LIGHT SNOW IS EXPECTED IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AFTER 06Z TUESDAY THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. WHILE  
SOME ACCUMULATIONS CANNOT BE RULED OUT ALONG THE PEAKS OF THE 
MOUNTAINS...VERY MINOR TO NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED TO BE THE RULE 
IN MOST OTHER LOWER ELEVATION AREAS. THEREAFTER...SUBTROPICAL 
RIDGING WILL PROMOTE DRY/CLEARER WEATHER THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF 
THE WORK WEEK...BEFORE ANOTHER UPPER STORM SYSTEM APPROACHES THE 
AREA FROM THE WEST BRINGING SOME ADDITIONAL PRECIP CHA...HAVE OPTED 
TO INCREASE POPS TO CHANCE AREAWIDE BY SATURDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   71  55  60  36  48 /  20  80 100  50  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     71  54  58  36  46 /  30  70 100  60  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             71  54  57  35  45 /  30  70 100  50  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    68  45  55  34  44 /  40  50 100  70  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1235 AM EST SUN DEC 9 2012

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT NEAR THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU/MTN RANGE...GENERALLY STRETCHING FROM NEAR LEXINGTON TO 
NASHVILLE TO MEMPHIS. THIS COLD FRONT IS NOT EXPECTED TO MAKE MUCH 
EASTWARD PROGRESS THIS MORNING...BEFORE IT LIFTS NORTHWARD AS A WARM 
FRONT AFTER SUNRISE. A DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE TAF SITES THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD...WITH SCATTERED 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY AGAIN DEVELOPING. HOWEVER...WILL NOT MENTION ANY 
THUNDER OR PRECIP IN THE TAFS AT THIS TIME...DUE TO THE SCATTERED 
NATURE OF THIS CONVECTION AND THE DIFFICULTIES OF TIMING ITS EXACT 
OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES. OUTSIDE OF SOME MVFR CEILINGS AND/OR 
VISIBILITIES THIS MORNING...EXPECT VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS AT 
ALL THREE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD.

393 
FXUS64 KMRX 082016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST SAT DEC 8 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CONVECTION TO OUR WEST
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...HAS CONTINUED TO WEAKEN AS IT FINALLY HAS
REACHED OUR NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES. TRIMMED POPS BACK A BIT ACROSS
SRN AREAS BUT KEPT A NARROW SWATH OF LIKELY POPS TONIGHT FOR NRN
PLATEAU INTO SW VA COUNTIES. BETTER IDEA TO GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE GFS
MOS MINS BASED ON TREND OF LATE.

FOR SUNDAY...HAD TO CUT POPS BACK QUITE A BIT AND ALSO DOWNPLAYED
THE CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS. LIFT SEEMS TO BE LACKING ON SUNDAY AS
THE APPROACHING FRONT TONIGHT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY LIFT NE AS A
WARM FRONT TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY MORNING. THE LOW LEVEL JET
AFTER 12Z SUNDAY IS OVER CENTRAL KENTUCKY...WITH ANY ELEVATED
INSTABILITY WELL OFF TO OUR NW SUNDAY MORNING. RAN SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS OVER SRN AREAS TO GOOD CHANCE OVER SWRN VA...WITH JUST SHOWERS
IN THE MORNING. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW SOME STEEPER LAPSE RATES BY
SUNDAY AFTERNOON...SO I CARRIED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN
THE AFTERNOON. TEMPS SHOULD EASILY REACH THE 60S TO LOWER 70S GIVEN
ANY BREAKS OF SUNSHINE...SO TRENDED TOWARD THE MILDER MAXES WHERE
ANY SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...MODELS WERE CONSISTENT AND PREVIOUS
GRIDS LOOKED GENERALLY ON TRACK...ALTHO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS COULD BE
SLOWED DOWN BY 1 TO 3 HOURS. STILL...I LIKED THE POP GRADIENT FOR
SUNDAY NIGHT FROM NW TO SE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...LEADING TO
CATEGORICAL POPS ON MONDAY. LIFT IS IMPRESSIVE WITH HEAVIEST RAINS
WE HAVE HAD IN QUITE SOMETIME WITH THIS FRONT. OTHERWISE...TEMPS
LOOK TO FALL MONDAY AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE...BUT MAX TEMPS EARLY
MONDAY WERE BUMPED UP CLOSER TO 8/12Z GUIDANCE AND NWS NEIGHBORS
GRIDS. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE 
MOVING EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT BUT STILL 
A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE REMAINS BEHIND THE FRONT ALONG WITH SOME 
UPPER LEVEL ENERGY SO KEPT POPS IN A LIKELY CATEGORY.  MOISTURE 
GRADUALLY EXITS ON TUESDAY BUT UPSLOPE COMPONENT STRONG AND KEPT 
SOME LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS WITH A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHEST 
TERRAIN GOING. THE FORECAST AREA DRIES OUT THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
REMAINDER OF THE WEEK AS UPPER RIDGING TAKES HOLD BY THURSDAY 
HELPING TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND BACK TO A NORMAL RANGE FOR EARLY 
DECEMBER. AN AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES TOWARD THE WEEKEND 
AND THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT BUILDS THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
ON SATURDAY. MODELS SHOW QUITE A MOIST CONVEYOR DEVELOPING AND WOULD 
EXPECT SOME SHOWER TO DEVELOP WELL AHEAD OF THE FRONT SO INCLUDED A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.

217 
FXUS64 KMRX 080913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EST SAT DEC 8 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE GEORGIA/SOUTH CAROLINA 
STATE LINE...WITH A COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHING THE LOWER OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT 
EASTWARD TODAY...BECOMING LOCATED AROUND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY 
THIS EVENING. A DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA INTO TONIGHT...WITH WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT RESULTING 
IN MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES. GFS AND NAM MODELS AGREE THAT SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...SO 
WILL MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION WITH THE BEST COVERAGE EXPECTED 
OVER THE NORTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA CLOSER TO THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ACTIVE WEATHER IN THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD AS A WARM/STATIONARY FRONT WILL REMAINED DRAPED IN THE 
VICINITY OF THE FORECAST AREA ALONG THE TENNESSEE/KENTUCKY BORDER ON 
SUNDAY. THIS BOUNDARY WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGHOUT THE DAY...WITH THE MOST FAVORED 
AREAS BEING IN THE NORTHERN ZONES /CLOSEST TO THE FRONT/. SOME 
STORMS WILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO BECOME STRONG GIVEN SOME ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY ALOFT AND WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE A MENTION OF THIS IN THE 
HWO. 

WITH UPPER-RIDGING ONGOING TO THE NORTHEAST AND A DEEPENING UPPER- 
TROUGH AND STRONG COLD FRONT TO THE WEST...A MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW 
FROM THE GULF WILL PERSIST THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON SUNDAY. THIS MOIST 
ENVIRONMENT WILL SET THE STAGE FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AS THE 
AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS 
ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING OF THE HEAVY 
PRECIPITATION...SHOWING IT APPROACHING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BTWN 
06-12Z ON MONDAY AND THEN GRADUALLY MOVING EAST THROUGH THE AREA 
MONDAY AND MONDAY EVENING...BEFORE TAPERING OFF FROM WEST TO EAST 
LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. GIVEN THIS...HAVE GONE LIKELY POPS 
IN MOST AREAS BTWN 06-12Z MONDAY AND THEN CATEGORICAL AREAWIDE 
DURING THE DAY TO REFLECT THIS POTENTIAL. WITH UNSEASONABLY HIGH 
PWAT VALUES AND A STOUT MEAN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT MOVING PARALLEL TO 
THE BOUNDARY...THE POTENTIAL FOR TRAINING/LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IS 
EXPECTED WITH THE PASSAGE OF THIS FRONTAL SYSTEM. ALSO...WHILE SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY WILL EXIST IT IS PROGGED TO BE SOMEWHAT 
LIMITED. STILL...THE STRONG JET DYNAMICS COMBINED WITH THIS MODEST 
INSTABILITY WILL ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW ISOLATED STRONG 
STORMS ONCE AGAIN. 

AS MENTIONED...POPS WILL BEGIN TO GRADUALLY TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO 
EAST LATE MONDAY...THOUGH HIGH-END CHANCE POPS ARE STILL WARRANTED 
AREAWIDE THROUGH 12Z WEDNESDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST VALUES FAVORING 
THE MOUNTAINS/NORTHEAST ZONES. AS COLDER AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION 
IN WAKE OF THE FRONT THE POTENTIAL FOR A CHANGE OVER TO LIGHT SNOW 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IS EXPECTED TO OCCUR. WHILE SOME 
ACCUMULATIONS CANNOT BE RULED OUT ALONG THE PEAKS OF THE 
MOUNTAINS...VERY MINOR TO NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED TO BE THE RULE 
IN MOST OTHER LOWER ELEVATION AREAS. BEHIND THIS STORM SYSTEM 
ANOTHER SERIES OF TROUGHS ARE PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE END OF WEEK. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LACK OF 
MOISTURE HAVE KEPT MENTIONABLE POPS OUT INITIALLY FOR THURSDAY... 
WITH LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY AS MOISTURE SLOWLY 
RETURNS.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 072032
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EST FRI DEC 7 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...LOW CLOUDS FINALLY LIFTING AND 
BREAKING UP ACROSS THE SRN VALLEY AREAS...WITH MOST OTHER AREAS 
EXPERIENCING BRIEF PERIODS OF SUNSHINE. REALLY NO FORCING FOR LIFT 
THIS AFTERNOON...THUS RADARS HAVE REMAINED ECHO FREE. STILL A NICE 
DAY FOR EARLY DECEMBER WITH HIGHS EASILY REACHING THE MID 50S TO MID 
60S...ABOUT 5 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS.

MODELS DEVELOP BROAD WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT OVERNIGHT...WITH CLOUDS 
EXPECTED TO FILL IN AND LOWER. WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
MAINLY PATCHY LIGHT RAIN OR SPRINKLES. CLOUDINESS FAVORS AT OR JUST 
ABOVE THE GFS MOS MINS.

FOR SATURDAY...NO MAJOR CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS...EXCEPT TO 
LOWER POPS IN THE MORNING AND TO RAISE POPS IN THE FAR NWRN AREAS TO 
LOW END OF LIKELY IN THE AFTERNOON. THREAT OF THUNDERSTORMS LOOKS TO 
BE MAINLY CONFINED TO THE PLATEAU COUNTIES...WHERE ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY IS NOTED IN THE AFTERNOON. MOS MAX TEMPS ARE REACHABLE
BUT CHA MAY STRUGGLE TO REACH THE GFS 68 MAX...SIMILAR TO THIS 
AFTERNOON. 


.LONG TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD...WE ARE IN A DEEP SWLY FLOW BETWEEN THE UPPER 
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OVER CUBA AND THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL 
U.S. AND CANADA.  A RELATIVELY WARM/MOIST AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE 
OVER THE AREA AS WELL...AS A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY STAYS TO OUR 
NORTH EARLY-ON.  AS WE HEAD DEEPER INTO THE FORECAST...THE UPPER 
TROUGH HEADS OUR WAY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED FRONT TO PASS THRU ABOUT 
MONDAY.  HOWEVER...THE UPPER TROUGH KEEPS HOLD OF THE AREA THROUGH 
MID WEEK AND DOESN'T LOOK TO PASS UNTIL AROUND WEDNESDAY.  MOS KEEPS 
POPS OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF THESE DAYS...BUT IT LOOKS 
LIKE MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA.  A SIGNIFICANT 
PATCH OF ELEVATED Q-CONVERGENCE AND LIFT COME OVER THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY...BUT THE AIR MASS LOOKS TOO DRY TO PRODUCE ANY PRECIP.  
GOING DRY IN THE FORECAST AFTER TUESDAY NIGHT...EXCEPT FOR SOME POPS 
AT THE END OF THE FORECAST AS THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES IN FROM THE WEST.

FOR WINTER PRECIP...MIGHT BE A LITTLE SNOWFALL IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH 
THE POST-FRONTAL UPSLOPE FLOW MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...BUT 
MOISTURE IS PRETTY SHALLOW AND IT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE THERE WILL BE 
ANY POST-FRONTAL NORTHWEST FLOW INSTABILITY WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO 
NOT PUTTING ANY MEASURABLE SNOW IN THE GRIDS IN THOSE MOUNTAIN AREAS.

WEDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ALL ALONG THE EASTERN SEABOARD AND CENTERED 
ALONG THE NORTHEAST COAST...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY. A DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...WHICH WILL PRODUCE SOME 
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT RESULTING IN MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER GFS NUMBERS DUE TO THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ACTIVE WEATHER IN THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD AS A SERIES OF UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL PASS 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA...BRINGING WITH THEM THE POTENTIAL FOR 
PRECIPITATION THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. INITIALLY ON 
SATURDAY...A MOIST/SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO REMAIN IN PLACE 
WITH RIDGING TO THE NORTHEAST AND AN UPPER-TROUGH AND COLD FRONT TO 
THE WEST. SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT IS PROGGED TO INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM...AND THIS COMBINED WITH A WARM FRONT PUSHING NORTH THROUGH 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND INTO KENTUCKY WILL PROVIDE THE POTENTIAL 
FOR SHOWERS /AND THUNDERSTORMS GIVEN THE PROGGED ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY/ ON SATURDAY. FELT CONFIDENT TO GO CHANCE POPS IN MOST 
LOCATIONS THROUGH SUNDAY...WITH THE MOST FAVORED AREAS BEING ACROSS 
THE NORTHWEST/FAR NORTHERN ZONES WHICH WILL BE CLOSEST TO THE 
BOUNDARY. 

SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...A STRONG UPPER-TROUGH STRETCHING FROM 
THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES INTO THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL 
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA AND BRING WITH IT A STRONG COLD FRONT 
WHICH WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR ADDITIONAL SHOWERS THROUGH THE 
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. BOTH THE GFS/NAM SHOW THE FRONT AND 
ASSOCIATED PRECIP WORKING ITS WAY INTO CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE 
SUNDAY NIGHT...SO HAVE GONE CHANCE TO LIKELY AREAWIDE DURING THIS 
TIME PERIOD. THEN AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA...SOME 
WIDESPREAD HEAVIER CONVECTION IS EXPECTED /PRIMARILY IN THE MODE OF 
SHOWERS GIVEN THE OVERALL LACK OF INSTABILITY/ DURING THE DAY ON 
MONDAY. THUS HAVE GONE WITH CATEGORICAL POPS AREAWIDE ON MONDAY. 
THEN HAVE TAPERED THINGS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST MONDAY NIGHT...THOUGH 
SOME LINGERING LIGHT PRECIP IS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND 
NORTHEAST ZONES THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY. GIVEN THE PUSH OF COLD AIR 
BEHIND THE FRONT...SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OVERNIGHT MONDAY AND INTO TUESDAY AS WELL. 
THEREAFTER...ANOTHER TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY THE END OF THE WORK WEEK...BUT GIVEN THE LACK OF 
MOISTURE HAVE KEPT MENTIONABLE POPS OUT FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
FORECAST. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP TO MUCH MORE SEASONABLE LEVELS IN 
WAKE OF THE FRONT IN THE UPPER 40S TO 50S...WITH LOWS GENERALLY IN 
THE 30S. THIS WILL BE A NOTICEABLE CHANGE FROM EARLIER IN THE 
WEEKEND WHEN HIGHS BE VERY MILD IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   63  48  67  54  69 /  20  20  30  30  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     63  45  65  52  67 /  20  20  30  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN             63  45  65  52  67 /  20  20  40  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    61  42  64  48  66 /  20  20  20  20  30

605 
FXUS64 KMRX 062001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EST THU DEC 6 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SOUTHERLY FLOW PERSISTS
FOR THESE PERIODS BETWEEN A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR NE...AND
A COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST. THERE ARE PERIODS OF ISENTROPIC LIFT
POSSIBLY MIXED WITH SOME WEAK UPSLOPE FLOW AT TIMES...BUT NO MAJOR
FORCING TO WARRANT MORE THAN MINIMAL POPS AT THIS TIME. THE
ISENTROPIC LIFT WAS PROGGED TO DIMINISH BY THIS EVENING...THEN
INCREASE OR BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD FRIDAY AND AGAIN ON SATURDAY.
SHOWERS MAY ALSO INCREASE OVER NWRN AREAS ON SATURDAY DUE TO THE
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED GOOD WITH EITHER
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OR SIMPLY A MENTION OF SPRINKLES. POPS WERE
INCREASED TO LOW END OF CHANCE FOR WRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BY
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 

LOTS OF CLOUD COVER LINGERS...WHICH FAVORS AT OR ABOVE THE MILDER
MOS MINS...WHILE MAX TEMPS SHOULD STRUGGLE TO REACH THE HIGHER MOS
MAXES. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL PATTERN 
WILL BE IN THE PROCESS OF AMPLIFYING SATURDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS A 
DEEP UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BUILDS SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS 
TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS SHOULD HELP TO PUSH A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY NORTH OF THE OHIO VALLEY. MUCH OF 
THE LIFT SHOULD MOVE NORTH WITH THIS WARMER FRONTAL PUSH KEEPING THE 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS RATHER LOW OR NON-EXISTENT SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY. LEFT SOME SLIGHT CHANCE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU POPS GOING HERE 
BUT THE AREA SHOULD BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A WARM SECTOR AIRMASS 
WHILE A STRONG MID LATITUDE CYCLONE AND COLD FRONT MAKE THEIR WAY 
INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 12Z MONDAY. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AND ADJUSTED POPS TO CATEGORICAL 
FOR THE WHOLE REGION. STRONG SHEAR WITH JUST ADEQUATE INSTABILITY 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY SO KEPT THIS IDEA IN PLACE. NICE...STRONG UPPER TROUGH 
LOOKS LIKE IT MAY HAVE A TRAILING SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURE AND 
ASSOCIATED MOISTURE TO FILL IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING FRONT. THIS 
SCENARIO REQUIRES A SLOW DROP IN POP FOR MONDAY NIGHT WITH LINGERING 
SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITIES IN THE TERRAIN AREAS OF SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE INTO TUESDAY. WINTER TIME COLD AIR 
ADVECTION SHOULD ALLOW FOR A MIXTURE WITH OR CHANGEOVER TO SNOW IN 
THESE HIGH TERRAIN AREAS AND POSSIBLY VALLEY LOCALES BEFORE THE 
PRECIP ENDS. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE BUILDS ACROSS AT MID WEEK BUT HAS 
LITTLE AVAILABLE MOISTURE. PERHAPS THE NEXT LOOK AT RAIN MAY WAIT 
UNTIL FRIDAY OR SATURDAY AS ISENTROPIC LIFT STRENGTHENS IN 
INCREASING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. TRENDED TEMPERATURE FORECAST TO 
WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF MEX MOS.   


&&
