NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
426 AM EST THU DEC 6 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
NE AND EASTERN GREAT LAKES HAD CLEARED OUT SKIES OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA LATE WEDNESDAY AND OVERNIGHT WITH A DRIER AIRMASS AND A NE WIND 
TO DROP TEMPERATURES INTO THE UPPER 20S AND 30S NE. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WAS INCREASING FROM THE SOUTH EARLY THIS MORNING WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER 40S TO LOWER 50S IN THE SOUTH AS A WEAK 
LOW LEVEL TROUGH WAS SETTING UP ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY. A FEW 
SHOWERS WERE MOVING NE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU...SOUTHERN VALLEY 
AND SOUTHEAST MOUNTAINS INCLUDING SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THE WEAK 
SURFACE TROUGH WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA TODAY ENHANCING LIFT FOR A 
FEW SHOWERS TODAY AND TONIGHT. HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU... 
AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS WILL SEE THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN ALTHOUGH ON 
VERY LIGHT AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES STILL ABOVE NORMAL 
FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MET/MAV BLEND FOR HIGHS. WITH CONSIDERABLE CLOUD 
COVER TONIGHT LOWS WILL STAY MOSTLY IN THE LOWER TO MID 40S.    

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGING FROM THE ATLANTIC THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
WEAKENING LOW PRESSURE MOVES NE FROM NE GLFMEX TO COASTAL CAROLINAS 
BY SATURDAY MORNING. VERY BROAD UPPER TROUGH SETTING UP ACROSS NORTH 
AMERICA. ENERGY SWINGING THROUGH UPPER TROUGH WITH STRONG JET 
SEGMENT MOVING THROUGH TN VALLEY ON MONDAY. SIGNIFICANT AIRMASS 
CHANGE EXPECTED BY LATE MONDAY AS COLD FRONT SWEEPS ACROSS EASTERN 
UNITED STATES. WARM TEMPERATURES AND VARIABLE CLOUDY CONDITIONS 
DEPICTED THROUGH SUNDAY. WENT BELOW MOS POPS THROUGH SUNDAY DUE TO 
LACK OF FOCUSING MECHANISM ACROSS MRX CWA. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
A GOOD BET. ONGOING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL LIKELY ACCOMPANY 
COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES THROUGH ON MONDAY. STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS 
POSSIBLE WITH WEAK INSTABILITY AND GOOD LAYER SHEAR. EXACT EXTENT OF 
COLD AIR ADVECTION REMAINS IN QUESTION AT THIS TIME BUT APPEARS TO 
BE BRIEF SHOT BEHIND FRONT. DOES NOT SET UP FOR A NORTHWEST FLOW 
EVENT.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
413 AM EST WED DEC 5 2012

.SHORT TERM...SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT 
WAS PASSING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH A BROKEN 
AREA OF SHOWERS ALONG AND BEHIND THE FRONT. MEASURABLE RAIN HAS 
FALLEN ACROSS ALL BUT THE EXTREME EASTERN MOUNTAINS SINCE THE RAIN 
BEGAN TUESDAY AFTERNOON. ADDITIONAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE 
LESS THAN ONE QUARTER INCH. TEMPERATURES ARE STILL VERY MILD AT THIS 
HOUR...IN THE 50S TO THE LOWER 60S. THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH 
OF THE REGION WITH THE RAIN ENDING OVER ALL BUT SW NC BY TONIGHT. AS 
DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT SKIES WILL 
CLEAR FROM NORTH TO SOUTH DURING THE AFTERNOON. SOME COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL KEEP HIGHS MUCH COOLER TODAY MID 50S NORTH TO MID 60S 
SOUTH. TONIGHT SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY SOUTH CLOSER TO THE FRONT 
AND PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLEAR NORTH. LOWS DROP TO THE LOWER 30S TO 
LOWER 40S WHICH IS STILL SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.    

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE RIDGING RESISTS EAST 
OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH SUNDAY. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MAINTAINED WITH LOW LEVEL SW FLOW UP THE TN 
VALLEY. RETURN FLOW TRANSPORT RELATIVELY HIGH MOISTURE RESULTING IN 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS INTO THE WEEKEND. OVERALL LAYER MOISTURE ACROSS 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IS RELATIVELY DRY. BEST LIFT WILL BE 
WEST ALONG COLD FRONT AND NORTH ACROSS WARM FRONT OVER OH VALLEY. 
TRENDED AWAY FROM PRECIPITATION INTO SATURDAY. BIG CHANGE IN STORE 
FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. TIMING CONFIDENCE IS LOW. BLENDED FASTER GFS 
TOWARD ECMWF. SHARP TROUGH WILL SWING THROUGH CNTRL U.S. ON MON WITH 
STRONG LAYER SHEAR ACROSS TN VALLEY. THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE WITH 
SYSTEM BUT TIMING STILL IN QUESTION BUT LEANING TOWARD MONDAY FOR 
STRONGEST STORMS. VERY COLD POST FRONTAL AIRMASS WILL BE MODIFYING 
BUT MUCH COLDER TEMPS ON TRACK FOR TUESDAY. 

&&

935 
FXUS64 KMRX 041957
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EST TUE DEC 4 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
A CHANGE IN THE PATTERN WILL OCCUR OVER THE NEXT 12-24 HOURS AS AN
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM DRAGS A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE LOWER-
MISSISSIPPI/TENNESSEE VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...SOME BREEZY SW WINDS
AND HEATING HAS ALLOWED HIGHS TO ONCE AGAIN CLIMB INTO THE UPPER
60S TO AROUND 70 DEGREES IN MANY LOCATIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA...ABOUT 15-20 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.
HOWEVER...SOME DENSE CLOUD COVER AHEAD OF THIS STORM SYSTEM HAVE
BEGUN TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION AND RADAR IS SHOWING SOME SCATTERED
LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS MOVING INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. SOME
HEAVIER ACTIVITY TO THE WEST ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE IS PROGGED TO
GRADUALLY MOVE EASTWARD IN THE AREA OVERNIGHT. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY
GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING OF THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED
PRECIPITATION...PUSHING THE HEAVIEST QPF SIGNALS ACROSS THE AREA
OVERNIGHT /ROUGHLY BTWN 03-12Z/ AND THE GRADUALLY TAPERING THINGS
OFF ON WEDNESDAY FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST. AS A RESULT...HAVE
LIKELY POPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA /WITH DEFINITIVE POPS IN THE
NORTHWEST ZONES/ THIS EVENING...BEFORE INCREASING THEM TO DEFINITE
AREAWIDE AFTER 04Z OR SO. GIVEN THAT THE FORECAST MAY SLOW/STALL
NEAR THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES TOMORROW...HAVE MAINTAINED CHANCE TO
LIKELY POPS ACROSS THIS AREA THROUGH 00Z THURSDAY. SOME COOLER
TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED FOR TOMORROW AS WELL...BUT THERE IS
NOT A SIGNIFICANT PUSH OF COOLER AIR IN WAKE OF THE FRONT. IN
FACT...HIGHS SHOULD STILL BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL IN THE UPPER
50S/LOWER 60S.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
THE FRONT WILL STALL JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE
MOVEMENT OF THE 850 MB RIDGE TO THE MID-ATLANTIC COAST WILL BRING A
SE FETCH AND WEAK LIFT OVER THE FRONT. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE
POP IN SW NC/SE TN WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SHALLOW MOISTURE AND A
NORTHWARD-DRIFTING WARM FRONT WILL PROVIDE CLOUDS ON THURSDAY...BUT
CHANCES OF MEASURABLE PRECIP LOOK SLIM AS MIDLEVELS STAY DRY.

A SPLIT FLOW PATTERN DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS...WITH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FIRMLY UNDER THE SOUTHERN STREAM. THIS 
WILL RESULT IN A MILD PERIOD THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH LOW PRECIP 
CHANCES EACH PERIOD. MODELS TYPICALLY HAVE A HARD TIME WITH SUCH A 
PATTERN...SO FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS LOW. WEAK UPPER VORT MAXES AND 
JET STREAKS MOVING OVER A MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW COULD PRODUCE LIGHT 
RAIN SHOWERS ANY TIME FROM FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. WITH NO STRONG 
FORCING MECHANISM TO LATCH ONTO...WILL CARRY SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE 
POPS. NORTHWESTERN SECTION MAY HAVE THE BEST CHANCES CLOSER TO A 
STATIONARY FRONT NEAR THE OHIO VALLEY. A MERGER OF NORTHERN AND 
SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGHS OCCURS MONDAY OVER THE PLAINS...PUSHING THE 
OH VALLEY FRONT TOWARD OUR AREA. PRECIP CHANCES LOOK TO INCREASE 
MONDAY...BUT STILL IN THE CHANCE RANGE. DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS 
AND ECMWF AND LARGE ENSEMBLE SPREADS LEAD TO A LOW CONFIDENCE 
FORECAST. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  61  41  61  43 /  90  50  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 041523 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1023 AM EST TUE DEC 4 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A CHANGE IN THE PATTERN IS COMING TO THE REGION AS AN UPPER-STORM
SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO DRAG A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE LOWER-
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON.
AS A RESULT...CLOUD COVER AND MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE...
ALONG WITH THE CHANCE FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON
RADAR IMAGERY AS OF 10 AM EST ALREADY SHOWS SEVERAL BANDS OF LIGHT
TO MODERATE SHOWERS MOVING THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE TOWARD THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. AS A RESULT...FELT THAT IT WAS WARRANTED TO ADD
A MENTION FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN THE WESTERN ZONES PRIOR
TO 18Z. SOME BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS WILL EXIST THIS AFTERNOON
AS LIFT/MOISTURE INCREASES AND THESE SHOWERS WORK THEIR WAY INTO
THE AREA. AS SUCH...HAVE INCREASED POPS IN AREAS ALONG AND
KNOXVILLE TO CHANCE AFTER 18Z AND THE FAR WESTERN ZONES TO LIKELY
AFTER 21Z. GIVEN SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY...CANNOT RULE OUT A FEW
ISOLATED STORMS DEVELOPING WITH THESE SHOWERS LATE THIS AFTERNOON
/GENERALLY WEST OF THE I-75 CORRIDOR/ AND HAVE ADDED THIS TO THE
FORECAST. ALSO...THOUGH SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL HELP TO PROMOTE VERY
MILD TEMPERATURES ONCE AGAIN...THE DENSE CLOUD COVER WILL HELP
LIMIT HEATING SOMEWHAT...SO HAVE LOWERED HIGHS /PARTICULARLY ACROSS
THE SOUTHERN ZONES/ TO GENERALLY THE MID TO UPPER 60S.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
434 AM EST TUE DEC 4 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
OVER THE AREA WEAKENING TODAY. WARM AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES. SW TO
NE UPPER IMPULSE MOVES THROUGH MID TN BRINGING SOME MID LEVEL CLOUD
COVER. THIS MAY HINDER HEATING BUT CONTINUED WITH ABOVE MOS
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES. MAJOR EVOLUTION OF UPPER PATTERN TODAY AND
TONIGHT ACROSS EAST U.S. MAIN UPPER LOW OVER SE CANADA MOVES NE
WHILE JET STREAM SWINGS QUICKLY THROUGH LOWER GREAT LAKES.
ADDITIONAL JET SEGMENT DIGS SE THROUGH TX INTO W GLFMEX LATER
TONIGHT. THIS DEVELOPS SHORT WAVE TROUGH OVER LWR MS RVR VALLEY.
SLOWER MOVING TROUGH SEGMENT MOVES ESE INTO TN VALLEY TONIGHT.
SURFACE COLD FRONT ZIPS EAST THROUGH CNTRL APPALACHIANS TONIGHT BUT
DRAGS INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY EARLY WED. INSTABILITY AND LIFT
LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM BUT AVAILABLE MOISTURE IS GOOD. EASTERN
EDGE OF ONGOING PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY REACH CUMBERLAND PLATEAU
THIS AFTERNOON. WEAKENING LIFT ALONG FRONT TONIGHT WITH BEST CHANCE
FOR PRECIPITATION AROUND 4 AM WEDNESDAY FOR EAST TN VALLEY.
SOUTHERN PUSH OF COLD FRONT SLOWS AND WITH SW FLOW ALOFT KEPT
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION GOING WEDNESDAY MORNING ACROSS CENTRAL
AREAS AND ALL DAY SE AREAS. CAA APPEARS LIMITED SO STAYED AT OR
ABOVE MOS TEMP GUIDANCE. SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL AMOUNTS NOT EXPECTED
WITH SREF ENSEMBLE QPF AROUND .30 INCHES.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL
HAVE PUSHED SOUTH OF FORECAST AREA LATE WEDNESDAY WITH A FEW
LINGERING SHOWERS SW NC WEDNESDAY EVENING. HOWEVER SURFACE LOW OVER
THE SOUTHEAST WILL KEEP RAIN NOT TOO FAR AWAY TO THE SOUTH AND
EAST. HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND EASTERN
GREAT LAKES WILL CLEAR SKIES OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH
CLEARING SKIES OVER ALL BUT THE EXTREME SOUTH. LOWS SHOULD DROP TO
NEAR FREEZING ACROSS THE NE SECTIONS AND UPPER 30S TO MID 40S
SOUTH. SURFACE HIGH TO THE NORTH SHIFTS EAST RAPIDLY THURSDAY WITH
MOISTURE SURGING NORTH. NEW MODEL TRENDS ARE MUCH WETTER FOR LATE
THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AS SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE CHANCE OF
SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. A NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL
APPROACH THE OHIO AND TN VALLEY FRIDAY WITH BROAD TROUGH OVER THE
CENTRAL STATES MOVING EAST AND PUSHING EAST COAST RIDGE FARTHER
EAST. CHANCE OF SHOWERS THROUGH THE REST OF THE FORECAST WITH
TEMPERATURES STAYING ABOVE AVERAGE. INSTABILITY ENOUGH FOR A FEW
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

596 
FXUS64 KMRX 031948
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EST MON DEC 3 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
A VERY UNSEASONABLY WARM EARLY DECEMBER DAY IS OCCURRING ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON AS TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN INTO
THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. SOME
LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WILL LIKELY REACH THE MID 70S
BEFORE HEATING CEASES LATER THIS EVENING. THE WARM/DRY CONDITIONS
ARE THE RESULT OF A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE CENTERED TO THE SOUTHEAST OF
THE REGION...WHICH HAS ALLOWED FOR MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND A
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. HOWEVER...A CHANGE IN THE PATTERN WILL OCCUR BY
TOMORROW AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM PASSING THROUGH THE
NORTHERN GREAT LAKES WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT FROM THE LOWER-
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE REGION DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING.
THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME INCREASED CLOUD COVER TONIGHT INTO
TUESDAY AS THE FRONT APPROACHES ALONG WITH SOME DECENT RAIN CHANCES
BEGINNING TOMORROW AFTERNOON.

MODELS ARE STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THE FRONT AND
PRECIP...SHOWING THE BULK OF IT MOVING IN AFTER 00Z WEDNESDAY.
HOWEVER...SOME SHOWERS MAY BEGIN TO WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AFTER 18Z TOMORROW BASED ON THE LATEST MODEL
TRENDS. THUS...CERTAINLY FELT LIKE SOLID CHANCE POPS WERE
WARRANTED ALONG AND WEST OF THE I-75 CORRIDOR. ADDITIONALLY...SOME
ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY RESULT IN SOME ISOLATED/SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS OCCURRING WITH THE SHOWERS...SO HAVE INCLUDED A
MENTION OF THEM IN THE WESTERN ZONES AS WELL. WITH BREEZY SOUTHWEST
WINDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT...HIGHS TOMORROW WILL STILL BE WELL ABOVE
NORMAL...BUT LIKELY A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY GIVEN THE
DENSER CLOUD COVER. LOWS TONIGHT WILL ALSO BE MILD...BOTTOMING OUT
IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S ONCE AGAIN.


.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
NAM AND GFS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF AN APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH...WITH THE BULK OF THE PRECIP CROSSING 
OUR AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. CATEGORICAL POPS WILL ENTER THE PLATEAU 
COUNTIES BETWEEN 00-04Z...PEAKING 04-08Z...THEN DECREASING FROM WEST 
TO EAST 08-12Z. THE FRONT LAGS THE UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE A BIT...AND 
SO WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING SOUTHEAST. COLD 
ADVECTION IS NOT VERY STRONG BEHIND THE FRONT...AND HIGH TEMPS WILL 
REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL FOR WEDNESDAY WITH CLEARING SKIES THROUGH THE 
DAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL DRIFT EASTWARD ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY/GREAT LAKES 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY...BECOMING POSITIONED OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC 
REGION THURSDAY. WE WILL SEE A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WITH A 
NEARLY ZONAL MID-UPPER LEVEL FLOW THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. MODELS 
TYPICALLY HAVE A DIFFICULT TIME PICKING OUT THE SMALL SHORTAVES AND 
JET STREAKS IN THIS TYPE OF PATTERN...AND THERE IS CONSIDERABLE 
ENSEMBLE SPREAD THIS PERIOD. FORCING IN THE MODELS IS WEAK...TIED 
MAINLY TO A SERIES OF UPPER JET STREAKS. CONFIDENCE IS LOW...SO ONLY 
MINOR CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE PREVIOUS FORECAST OF LOW TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. A MORE AMPLIFIED PATTERN DEVELOPS 
ON MONDAY...HOWEVER THE ECMWF AND GFS HAVE BIG TIMING DIFFERENCES 
WITH THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS. WILL BRING MONDAY IN DRY AND 
MILD. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  69  49  63  41 /  10  40  70  20   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  66  47  61  39 /   0  30  80  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  66  47  60  38 /   0  40  80  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              48  65  46  57  30 /   0  10  80  20   0

...ZONAL FLOW WILL DEVELOP OVER THE REGION FOR LATE WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY.  WILL TRANSITION INTO AN UNSETTLE PATTERN FOR THE REST OF

MONDAY.

884 
FXUS64 KMRX 022002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST SUN DEC 2 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT WILL STAY WELL 
TO OUR NORTH...AND SOUTHERN EDGE OF WEAKENING SHOWERS MAY COME CLOSE 
TO OUR SW VA ZONES BUT LOOKS LIKE THEY SHOULD STAY NORTH.  WILL GO 
DRY FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
TONIGHT...THEN EXPECT CLOUDS TO DECREASE FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST 
LATER TONIGHT AND MONDAY.  TEMPS WILL CONTINUE WELL ABOVE NORMAL 
MONDAY. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... A CHANGE IN THE
PATTERN WILL OCCUR ON TUESDAY AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVES
ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES...DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE
LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THE
FRONT WILL BRING WITH IT SOME GOOD CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION AS
MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS
SYSTEM. MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF
THE FRONT/PRECIP...WITH THE NAM AND GFS BOTH SHOWING THE FRONT
WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE WESTERN ZONES LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND
THE HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION OCCURRING OVERNIGHT. THUS...HAVE
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY AREAWIDE BTWN 00-12Z ON WEDNESDAY. BEHIND
THE FRONT...RAINFALL WILL TAPER OFF FAIRLY QUICKLY AND HAVE
REFLECTED THIS IN THE GRIDS DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY.
STILL...THINK THAT THERE WILL BE A FAIRLY GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS
ALONG THE EASTERN/MOUNTAIN ZONES THROUGH MIDDAY WEDNESDAY AND HAVE
REFLECTED THIS IN THE FORECAST...BEFORE REALLY DIMINISHING POPS
AFTER 18Z. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO COOL TO MORE SEASONABLE LEVELS IN
WAKE OF THE FRONT...WITH HIGHS DROPPING BACK INTO THE 50S TO AROUND
60 IN A FEW SPOTS.

THEREAFTER...ZONAL FLOW ALOFT RETURNS FOR THURSDAY BEFORE ANOTHER 
SERIES OF UPPER-WAVES APPROACH THE REGION FROM THE WEST...BRINGING 
WITH THEM SOME ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS LATE FRIDAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND. GIVEN SOME MODEL UNCERTAINTIES THAT FAR OUT HAVE BEEN 
CAUTIOUS ABOUT INCREASING POPS TOO MUCH ON SATURDAY...BUT CERTAINLY 
FEEL CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE SEEMS REASONABLE ATTM...WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCES POPS ON SUNDAY AS WELL.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

824 
FXUS64 KMRX 011952
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EST SAT DEC 1 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...WEAK UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA 
SHIFTS EAST...AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS CENTERED TO OUR EAST 
DURING THE SHORT TERM.  STRATO CU REDEVELOPMENT LOOKS MOST LIKELY IN 
OUR NC ZONES TONIGHT...SO WILL GO WITH MORE CLOUDS THERE THAN 
ELSEWHERE.  SHOULD BE WARM WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AGAIN ON SUNDAY.  
WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SUBTROPICAL RIDGING
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO
PROMOTE WARM/DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE REGION ON MONDAY AS HIGH
TEMPERATURES SHOULD REACH THE MID/UPPER 60S TO EVEN THE LOWER 70S
IN SOME LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL PASS THROUGH THE
OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MODELS HAVE SHOWN A FEW LIGHT QPF
SIGNALS JUST TO THE NORTH OF OUR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA COUNTIES.
HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LACK OF MOISTURE...DID NOT FEEL CONFIDENT
ENOUGH TO INTRODUCE MENTIONABLE POPS AND FEEL THAT LOW/MID CLOUDS
OVER THAT AREA WILL BE THE PRIMARY RESULT.

HEADING INTO TUESDAY...A CHANGE IN THE PATTERN WILL OCCUR AS A STORM 
SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE REGION LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY. MODELS 
HAVE TRENDED A LITTLE LATER IN THE TIMING OF THE FRONT...THOUGH THE 
NAM/GFS SOLUTIONS ARE STILL A BIT FASTER THAN THE ECMWF. SO... 
TUESDAY MAY BE A BIT WARMER/DRIER THAN INITIALLY EXPECTED WITH HIGHS 
IN THE 60S ONCE AGAIN BEFORE THE FRONT MOVES IN BY THE LATE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HAVE HIGHLIGHTED THIS IN THE FORECAST AND 
HAVE KEPT MENTIONABLE POPS OUT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON /GOING CHANCE 
IN THE WEST...BUT LEAVING THE FAR EASTERN ZONES DRY/. THEN HAVE GONE 
HIGH END CHANCE TO LIKELY TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF SIGNIFICANTLY FROM WEST TO EAST 
ON WEDNESDAY. THEREAFTER...ZONAL FLOW AND SLIGHTLY MILDER AND DRY 
WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR THURSDAY BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM IS 
PROGGED TO APPROACH THE AREA LATE FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. GIVEN 
THAT BOTH MODELS HAVE HINTED AT THIS FOR THE PAST COUPLE OF 
DAYS...HAVE GONE AHEAD AND INTRODUCED CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY.   



&&

CONTINUE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK UPPER RIDGE IN PLACE ON 
SUNDAY WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH.  THIS 
MAY BRING IN A STRAY SHOWER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  FOR NOW... 
WILL ONLY MENTION A CHANCE OF SPRINKLES OVER OUR VA COUNTIES ON 
SUNDAY LEAVING THE REST OF THE AREA DRY.  THE BOUNDARY MOVES OUT 
WITH THE RIDGE STRENGTHENING OVER THE EASTERN U.S. ON MONDAY.  THE 
MAIN CONCERN FOR THE FORECAST PERIOD CONTINUES TO BE A STRONGER 
...WETTER COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH MID WEEK.  THERE REMAINS SOME 
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BUT GENERALLY SHOULD MOVE THROUGH LATE TUESDAY 
INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP LIKELY TO HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR THIS 
PERIOD.  SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY.  ZONAL FLOW TO WEAK 
RIDGING EXPECTED OVER THE AREA THURSDAY.  MODELS WANTING TO BRING 
ANOTHER FRONT IN AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME AND HAVE INTRODUCED 
LOW POPS FOR FRIDAY.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.


&&

167 
FXUS64 KMRX 302002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST FRI NOV 30 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...WEAK MOISTURE RETURN IN THE 
LOWER LEVELS AROUND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR EAST BROUGHT SOME 
CLOUDS LATE LAST NIGHT INTO TODAY OVER SOUTHERN HALF...BUT THESE ARE 
MIXING OUT THIS AFTERNOON.  MAY SEE A REPEAT TONIGHT WITH EXTENT 
FARTHER NORTH...SO WILL SHOW SIMILAR PATTERN FOR THE SHORT TERM SKY 
COVER FORECAST.  OTHERWISE...SHOULD BE PRECIP FREE WITH THE WARMING 
TREND CONTINUING.  MAV TEMPS HAVE GENERALLY BEEN GOOD OF LATE AND 
LOOK GOOD ONCE AGAIN...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... CONTINUED QUIET
WEATHER IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MONDAY AS THE
REGION WILL REMAIN ON THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE
SITUATED OVER THE CENTRAL GULF OF MEXICO. A WEAK WAVE WILL PASS
ALONG THE TOP OF THIS RIDGE SUNDAY NIGHT...AND THE NAM SHOWS IT
TRIGGERING OFF A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS EASTERN KENTUCKY/NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF SW VIRGINIA. GIVEN THAT THIS IS THE FIRST TIME THIS HAS
SHOWN UP AND THE GFS IS STILL MUCH DRIER...HAVE OPTED TO KEEP
MENTIONABLE POPS OUT OF THE FORECAST THERE FOR NOW...THOUGH HAVE
INCREASED CLOUD COVER A BIT OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER... THE MAIN STORY
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK WILL BE CONTINUED WARM CONDITIONS AS THE
PARTLY SUNNY SKIES AND SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL HELP TO PUSH HIGHS INTO
THE MID TO UPPER 60S /WITH A FEW SPOTS ACROSS SE TENNESSEE REACHING
70 DEGREES/.

THE BOUT OF WARMER AND DRIER WEATHER WILL COME TO AN END BY THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK AS MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF AN 
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM PASSING THROUGH THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES. 
THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SOMETIME TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING THE REGION ITS BEST SHOT FOR RAINFALL IN OVER A 
WEEK. THERE CONTINUES TO BE DISAGREEMENT AMONG THE MODELS REGARDING 
THE EXACT TIMING OF THE FRONT/PRECIP...THOUGH CONFIDENCE IS FAIRLY 
HIGH THAT SHOWERS WILL OCCUR DURING THIS TIMEFRAME. THE GFS IS STILL 
FASTER...MOVING THE PRECIP IN TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND HAVING IT EXIT THE 
AREA BY WEDNESDAY MORNING...WHILE THE ECMWF INDICATES IT WILL MOVE 
IN TUESDAY NIGHT AND EXIT THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY EVENING. GIVEN 
THESE DIFFERENCES...HAVE TRIED NOT TO GET TOO SPECIFIC WITH THE  
TIMING JUST YET. STILL...FELT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO GO HIGH-END CHANCE 
ACROSS THE WESTERN ZONES TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND THEN HIGH-END CHANCE 
TO LIKELY TUESDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA...BEFORE GRADUALLY 
TAPERING THINGS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON WEDNESDAY. THEREAFTER... 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT PREVAILS TO CLOSE OUT THE WORK WEEK BEFORE ANOTHER 
STORM SYSTEM/FRONT TRACKS EAST AND POTENTIALLY BRINGS MORE SHOWERS 
TO THE AREA FOR NEXT WEEKEND. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST THU NOV 29 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...AN AREA OF SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE TO OUR EAST WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND INTO THE AREA.  LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE WILL START TO RETURN LATER TONIGHT AROUND THIS 
HIGH...WHICH MAY BRING SOME LOWER CLOUDS MAINLY SOUTH LATE TONIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY.  OTHERWISE JUST SOME HIGH CLOUDS DRIFTING ACROSS THE 
AREA. CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH FOR LOW CLOUDS SOUTH TO IMPACT 
FORECAST TOO MUCH AT THIS POINT...SO WILL KEEP THINGS PRIMARILY 
MOSTLY CLEAR/SUNNY FOR NOW.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... THINGS LOOK TO BE
FAIRLY QUIET HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND AS A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE AXIS
PUSHES INTO THE AREA...PROMOTING DRY CONDITIONS FOR THE NEXT
SEVERAL DAYS. WITH CLEAR SKIES...A PREVAILING SOUTHWEST FLOW AND
INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPS ALOFT...HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL
WARM BACK INTO THE MID TO UPPER 60S IN MANY SPOTS...AND POTENTIALLY
REACH/EXCEED 70 DEGREES ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE SUNDAY AND
MONDAY. THE MILD AND DRY WEATHER WILL EVENTUALLY COME TO AN END
HEADING INTO THE MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM
PASSING ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES WILL DRIVE A COLD FRONT
THOUGH THE AREA. THIS WILL GIVE THE REGION IT'S FIRST REAL SHOT OF
PRECIPITATION IN OVER A WEEK'S TIME. ATTM...THERE IS STILL SOME
DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MODELS AS THE GFS SHOWS THE FRONT AND
ASSOCIATED PRECIP MOVING IN AFTER 12Z TUESDAY AND EXITING THE
REGION BY EARLY WEDNESDAY. THE ECMWF IS SOMEWHAT SLOWER...MOVING
THE PRECIP IN TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EXITING IT LATER IN THE DAY ON
WEDNESDAY. HAVE INCREASED POPS DURING THE TUESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING
TIMEFRAME TO HIGH-END CHANCE...BUT HAVE STILL ALLOWED FOR SOME
MODEL FLUCTUATIONS ON WEDNESDAY AND HAVE NOT GONE AS HIGH WITH POPS
THEN. AFTERWORDS...COOLER CONDITIONS AND FAIR/DRY WEATHER ARE
EXPECTED HEADING INTO THE LATTER PART OF NEXT WEEK.

TUESDAY. A TROUGH CROSSES THE GREAT LAKES REGION ON TUESDAY...WITH A 
TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH OUR AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. THE 
OPERATIONAL GFS HAS TRENDED A BIT FASTER WITH THE FRONT AND 
ASSOCIATED PRECIP...BUT THIS APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER COMPARED TO 
THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AND THE ECMWF. WILL SPEED UP THE START/END 
TIMIING OF POPS SLIGHTLY...BUT STILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS TUESDAY 
NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RIDGING AT THE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL WARM TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL FROM FRIDAY 
THROUGH THE FIRST WEEKEND IN DECEMBER INTO THE FIRST TWO DAYS OF
NEXT WEEK. THE RIDGE MAY FLATTEN SOME BY SUNDAY WITH AN INCREASE OF 
CLOUDS AS A WEAK SYSTEM MOVES BY MAINLY ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES 
ABOVE NORMAL FROM SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WITH MOST LOWS WARMING TO 
THE ABOVE FREEZING RANGE OF MID 30S TO MID 40S FOR THE SAME TIME 
FRAME.THE ECMWF IS THE MOST AGGRESSIVE WITH MOISTURE SHOWING SHOWERS 
OVER SW VA SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. OTHER MODELS ARE DRIER SO 
DECIDED TO REMOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTH FOR THOSE 
PERIODS. A MORE SIGNIFICANT FRONTAL SYSTEM DEVELOPS ALONG THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS INTO CANADA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY BRINGING A COLD 
FRONT ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND APPALCHIANS TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY. BEHIND THE FRONT MUCH COLDER 
TEMPERATURES WILL FOLLOW ON WEDNESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 280815
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST WED NOV 28 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TYPICAL SCENARIO FOR THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH A FRONTAL SYSTEM WELL SOUTHEAST OF THE REGION WITH 
NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT AND LOW CLOUDS TRAPPED UNDER AN INVERSION 
AROUND 925 MB. APPEARS THE FORECAST HINGES ON THE THINNING CLOUD 
LAYER (ALREADY SEEING THE HIGH TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER PEAKING THROUGH THE STRATUS). SEEMS LIKE THE RUC13 HAS THE 
BEST HANDLE ON THE SITUATION WITH LAYER HANGING IN THERE A WHILE 
LONGER THAN OTHER MODELS INDICATE...ALTHOUGH THE GFS ISN'T AS BAD AS 
THE WRF PROGNOSTICATION ABILITIES. IT'S ALWAYS INTERESTING BECAUSE 
WHEN THIS ASPECT IS INCORRECT...TEMPERATURES ARE WAY OFF. THE MODELS 
HAD WHAT LITTLE HEAT THE AREA PICKED UP ON TUESDAY HAPPILY RADIATING 
AWAY UNDER CLEARING OVERNIGHT SKIES. MODEL SUGGESTIONS INDICATE 
TEMPS SHOULD BE SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER TOWARD DAYBREAK ALONG WITH 
SOME SATURATED SURFACE CONDITIONS IN SPOTS. WENT AHEAD AND STAYED 
WITH A PESSIMISTIC CLEARING TREND CLOSE TO THE RUC13 IDEA WITH 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA CLEARING EARLY IN 
THE DAY WITH CLOUDS HANGING AROUND LONGER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. BECAUSE TEMPERATURES LOOK LIKE THEY WILL 
START OUT WARMER THAN THEY WERE SUPPOSED TO...STAYED CLOSE TO THE 
MOS MAX TEMP BLEND. WOULD EXPECT HIGH PRESSURE AND DRIER AIR TO TAKE 
OVER FOR TONIGHT ALLOWING RADIATION AND LOW TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN 
THE 20S. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY 
WILL FEATURE A LOW LEVEL RIDGE OFF THE GA/SC COAST...WITH A NEARLY 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. THIS WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY AND MILD EACH DAY. A 
WEAK MIDLEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES TO OUR NORTH ON SUNDAY/SUNDAY 
NIGHT. SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN NORTHERN SECTIONS LOOKS QUITE GENEROUS 
AS MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED...BUT WILL BE KEPT IN THE FORECAST. THE 
MID-UPPER LEVEL FLOW AMPLIFIES ON MONDAY AS A DEEP TROUGH MOVES INTO 
THE PLAINS. WITH A DEEP SW FLOW...TEMPS WILL RISE WELL ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR MONDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH TIMING OF PRECIP WITH 
THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT...AND WILL ADD CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY.

DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVE EAST OUT 
OF THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.

WILL TREND WARMER EACH DAY UNTIL MONDAY...WHEN BOTH MAX AND MIN 
TEMPS WILL BE ABOUT 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR EARLY DECEMBER.

WILL BE CROSSING INTO OUR AREA BY LATE MORNING. PRECIP WILL QUICKLY 
END FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH THE LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON 
BEHIND THE 850-700 MB TROUGH PASSAGE. WILL END ALL PRECIP CHANCES 
ACROSS THE AREA BY 20Z. COLD ADVECTION AND DECREASING CLOUDS THROUGH

WILL LEAN ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE BASED ON VERY COLD 
UPSTREAM TEMPS.

MODERATING TEMPERATURES AS A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BE OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST. COLD ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY...BECOMING NEUTRAL BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
LOOKS LIKE THE COLDEST NIGHT WITH THE SURFACE HIGH DIRECTLY OVER THE 
AREA. A SW FLOW DEVELOPS THURSDAY AS THE HIGH SIFTS TO THE GA/SC 
COAST...BRINGING TEMPS BACK TO NEAR NORMAL VALUES.

WHICH STARTS OUT DRY ON FRIDAY. A SHORT WAVE TROUGH BUILDS ACROSS
THE REGION ON SATURDAY AND ANOTHER ON SUNDAY BUT MOISTURE REMAINS
LIMITED BECAUSE THE GULF OF MEXICO IS NEVER TAPPED TO ANY LARGE
DEGREE SO KEPT THE WEEKEND SHOWER CHANCE SLIGHT. BY MONDAY AN UPPER

ANY CHANCE FOR RAIN. THE LONG TERM SHOULD BE VERY PLEASANT
CONCERNING TEMPERATURES WHICH WILL TREND WARMER EACH DAY UNTIL

ABOVE NORMAL FOR EARLY DECEMBER.

068 
FXUS64 KMRX 270228 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
928 PM EST MON NOV 26 2012

.DISCUSSION...
INCREASED POPS SIGNIFICANTLY THIS EVENING ACROSS MUCH OF THE
FORECAST AREA...PARTICULARLY IN THE FAR NORTHEASTERN ZONES. THIS
WAS DONE TO ACCOUNT FOR LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS MOVING IN A
LITTLE EARLIER THAN EXPECTED AS A SURFACE LOW AND ITS ASSOCIATED
COLD FRONT CONTINUE TO TRACK EASTWARD TOWARD THE REGION FROM MIDDLE
TENNESSEE. THESE SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE
REGION OVERNIGHT INTO TOMORROW MORNING...GIVING THE ENTIRE AREA A
SHOT OF MEASURABLE RAINFALL...UP TO 1/10 TO 1/4 OF AN INCH IN MANY
LOCATIONS. AS A RESULT...HAVE BUMPED POPS UP TO CHANCE AREAWIDE
THIS EVENING AND DEFINITE AFTER 06Z WHEN THE BETTER MOISTURE/LIFT
WILL BE PRESENT ACROSS THE REGION. HAVE ALSO BEEN MONITORING THE
MELTING LEVEL ON MODEL SOUNDINGS AND FROM ESTIMATES FROM KJKL AND
KMRX DUAL-POL RADAR IMAGERY...WHICH PLACE IT ROUGHLY BETWEEN 4-6
KFT AGL ATTM. AS A RESULT...SOME LIGHT SNOW COULD MIX IN WITH THIS
RAIN LATER TONIGHT ACROSS THE HIGHER MOUNTAIN ELEVATIONS...THOUGH
VERY MINOR/NO ACCUMULATIONS ARE ANTICIPATED. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT
MOST AREAS WILL BE TOO WARM TO EXPERIENCE ANY SNOW AS CLOUDS AND
MOISTURE HAVE HELPED TO KEEP TEMPS UP HIGHER THAN EXPECTED SO FAR
THIS EVENING. THUS...HAVE ADJUSTED THE FORECAST TO REFLECT THIS.
LOWS ARE EXPECTED TO DROP INTO THE UPPER 30S ACROSS SW VIRGINIA AND
NE TENNESSEE AND THE LOW TO MID 40S ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE GREAT
TENNESSEE VALLEY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  55  33  56  31 /  80  50  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  41  52  32  53  31 /  80  60  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  51  31  53  30 /  80  60  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              36  48  29  51  25 /  70  80  10   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

243 PM EST MON NOV 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE

HIGH LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL.  THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD 
EXIT QUICKLY ON TUESDAY.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER FAR EASTERN 
LOCATIONS THROUGH THE DAY...THE REST OF THE AREA SHOULD SEE 
IMPROVING CONDITIONS WITH CLEARING SKIES AND MILD TEMPERATURES 
EXPECTED BY THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MOISTURE AND LIFT EXIT 
THE REGION LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON OR EVENING...SO KEPT FORECAST DRY 
FOR TUESDAY NIGHT WITH SOME LINGERING CLOUDS EARLY IN THE NE AREAS. 
SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE BUILD BRIEFLY ACROSS THE REGION WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY...FOR MORE DRY WEATHER WITH MAX TEMPS NEAR NORMAL AND 
MINS AT OR JUST BELOW NORMAL FOR LATE NOVEMBER. GFS/GFSX MOS TEMPS 
WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED...WITH MAX TEMPS NUDGED UP SLIGHTLY LATER IN 
THE PERIOD CLOSER TO THE 12Z GFSX MOS HIGHS. 

FLOW ALOFT BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH LIGHT 
SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPING INTO THE WEEKEND. 
MODELS WERE IN BETTER AGREEMENT AND GENERALLY DRIER RIGHT INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...WITH 500 MB HEIGHTS ON THE INCREASE SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS 
THE UPPER RIDGE SPREADS EASTWARD OVER THE REGION. SOME SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN LONG RANGE MODELS...SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
IN FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. HOWEVER...LATEST ECMWF MODEL RUN IS 
DRIER THAN 12Z GFS RUN. GFS MODEL SEEMS TO GENERATE SOME LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION IN THE WARM AIR ADVECTION THAT DEVELOPS FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...WHICH MAY JUST EQUATE TO AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. THE 
ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT WILL LIFT WELL NE OF THE TN VALLEY AND SRN 
APPALACHIANS BY SUNDAY...SO AGAIN NOT MUCH SUPPORT FOR ANY RAIN AT 
THIS POINT.

SHORT-WAVE WILL TRY TO PHASE WITH A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE OVER
NORTHERN MEXICO. UPPER JET ASSOCIATED WITH NORTHERN WAVE WILL PLACE
THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE
REGION OF THE JET. THIS JET WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTO-GENETIC LIFT
WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVING THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT AND TUESDAY
MORNING. ENOUGH MOISTURE STREAMING NORTH FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO
COMBINED WITH THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WILL PRODUCE LIKELY CHANCE
OF RAIN (GENERALLY LIGHT) LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. 

SYSTEM WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA TUESDAY AFTERNOON ENDING RAIN
CHANCES.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. THERE ARE 
STILL SOME DIFFERENCE ON TIMING REGARDING A FRONT THAT TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. THE GFS IS THE FASTEST. 
WITH STILL THE DIFFERENCES ON TIMING BETWEEN THE MODELS....WILL ADD 
LOW CHANCES FOR SHOWERS FOR THE WEEKEND. STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC

TEMPERATURES WARMER TONIGHT. MOST LOCATIONS ACROSS THE REGION WILL
BE AROUND 5 DEGREES OR SO WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT...AS THE MERCURY
WILL DROP INTO THE MID 20S TO LOWER 30S IN MOST AREAS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1051 AM EST SUN NOV 25 2012

.DISCUSSION...
COOL AND CRISP MORNING GIVING WAY TO A PLEASANT AFTERNOON TODAY.
HOWEVER...THESE DRY AND WARMER CONDITIONS ALONG WITH AN INCREASING
SOUTHWESTERLY BREEZE WILL ALSO INCREASE THE WILD FIRE POTENTIAL
SOMEWHAT THIS AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL NOT BE STRONG...BUT HUMIDITY
VALUES WILL DEFINITELY BE LOW. SO THERE IS AN INCREASED THREAT OF
FIRE POTENTIAL THIS AFTERNOON.

ONE FACTOR IS THAT AREA OBS/MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOWED DRY AIR JUST OFF
THE SURFACE...AS THIS AIR MIXES DOWN INTO THE AFTERNOON...DEW
POINTS AND RH VALUES WILL DROP A LITTLE. THIS EVENING...THE
INCREASING SWLY WINDS START BRINGING MOISTURE BACK INTO THE
AREA...BUT NOT FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

FOR THIS UPDATE...MAIN TWEAKS...SLIGHT TWEAKS AT THAT...ARE THE
DEW POINTS AND WIND...ALSO BUMPED UP THE MAX TEMP IN ABINGDON
VICINITY BY A DEG OR TWO.

PATCH OF DENSE LOW CLOUD COVER AND ASSOCIATED LOW/MID-LEVEL
ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF AN UPPER-LOW ACROSS THE
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. HOWEVER...THESE CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN
JUST TO THE NORTH OF THE REGION...KEEPING CONDITIONS CLEAR TO
MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT. AS A RESULT...GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING HAS
TAKEN PLACE THIS EVENING AS TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED STEADILY AFTER
SUNSET. THIS...COMBINED WITH THE COOL/DRY POST FRONTAL AIR MASS IN
PLACE ACROSS THE REGION WILL PROMOTE A HARD FREEZE AREAWIDE TONIGHT.
LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE LOW TO MID 20S IN MANY AREAS...WITH
SOME LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS
DROPPING INTO THE UPPER TEENS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

447 
FXUS64 KMRX 242013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EST SAT NOV 24 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS FILLING 
INTO THE REGION NOW...WITH THE RIDGE MOVING OVER THE AREA BY 
DAYBREAK.  THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING...BUT SOME 
MID LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE COMING ACROSS FOR A FEW HOURS ABOUT THAT 
TIME AS WELL.  NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF A BLANKETING EFFECT 
FROM THE MINIMAL CLOUD LAYER THAT IS PRODUCED...BUT COULD HINDER A 
LITTLE COOLING.  SO NOT FORECASTING ALL THE WAY DOWN TO THE DRY DEW 
POINTS THAT WILL BE IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA...BUT IT WILL BE WELL 
BELOW FREEZING AREA WIDE.

FOR SUNDAY...THE RIDGE MOVES TO THE EAST OF THE AREA AND THE RETURN 
FLOW STARTS UP WITH AN INCREASING SOUTHWEST WINDS. WINDS WILL NOT 
THREATEN RED FLAG CRITERIA...BUT VERY LOW RH LEVELS...MOSTLY IN THE 
20S...WILL SPELL POTENTIAL TROUBLE FOR WILD FIRES.  SOME LOCATIONS 
MAY EVEN GET RH VALUES BELOW 20%.  MAY HAVE SOME MID/HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS IN THE MORNING...BUT EXPECTING PLENTY OF SUNSHINE FOR THE 
AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM 
WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA ON MONDAY WITH CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY A 
STRAY SHOWER MOVING IN LATE IN THE DAY. MAIN BAND OF ASSOCIATED 
SHOWERS SHOULD REACH INTO THE AREA LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
MORNING.  WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS MONDAY NIGHT AND LIKELY POPS 
EARLY TUESDAY.  PRECIP SHOULD REMAIN AS RAIN ACROSS THE VALLEY WITH 
A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN...ESPECIALLY 
DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  UPSLOPE LIGHT RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS MAY 
CONTINUE INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT BY THE END OF THE 
PERIOD...WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY FOR NOW...BUT THIS MAY CHANGE AS 
MODELS GET A BETTER HANDLE ON AN APPROACHING SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1023 AM EST SAT NOV 24 2012

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE AND DRIER AIR FILTERING INTO AREA SLOWLY.
STRATOCUMULUS CLOUD COVER OVER THE NORTHEASTERN AREAS LOOKS TO BE
PRETTY STUBBORN TO ERODE. MODEL SOUNDINGS WERE A LITTLE THICK ON
THE SATURATED DEPTH...BUT APPARENTLY ARE TOO OPTIMISTIC ON THE
SUBSIDENCE...BASED ON CLOUD TOP TEMPS HOLDING STEADY OR EVEN
COOLING/THICKENING. THINK THAT THE DECK WILL ERODE...BUT MORE
SLOWLY THAN THE MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST. CLOUD COVER IN THE
PRESENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD OVERALL...SO NOT MUCH CHANGE IN THE
FORECAST SKYGRIDS. LOOKS LIKE FLURRIES WILL STAY NORTH OF AREA.

BUMPED UP HIGH TEMP BY ABOUT 1 DEG IN THE NORTHERN AREAS...EVEN
WITH ANTICIPATED CLOUD COVER PRESENT TEMPS ARE RUNNING 3-4 DEGREES
AHEAD OF FORECAST.

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO THE FORECAST TONIGHT. A COLD FRONT
IS TRACKING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WHICH HAS
USHERED IN MOSTLY CLEAR/CLEAR CONDITIONS ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA
AND IS USHERING IN A COOLER AIR MASS INTO THE REGION. OVERNIGHT
LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD PLUNGE BELOW THE FREEZING MARK...WITH LOWS IN
THE 20-30 DEGREE RANGE EXPECTED FOR MOST LOCATIONS. A FEW HIGHER
ELEVATION AREAS MAY ACTUALLY SLIP INTO THE UPPER TEENS. LATER
TONIGHT...SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF AN UPPER-
LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES IS PROGGED TO OOZE
INTO THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES. THIS MAY RESULT IN SOME LOW CLOUD
DEVELOPMENT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
THE MOUNTAIN ZONES OVERNIGHT. ADDITIONALLY...A COUPLE OF FLURRIES
MAY BE POSSIBLE WITH THESE CLOUDS ALONG THE HIGHEST MOUNTAIN PEAKS
LATE TONIGHT...WITH NO ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST FRI NOV 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT IS PRESSING THROUGH 
THE VIEWING AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND SHOULD EASILY BE EAST OF THE 
TN-NC BORDER BY 00Z SATURDAY. LOOKS LIKE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR MUCH 
OF THE REGION. HOWEVER...ENERGY DROPPING THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE EASTERN STATES UPPER TROUGH SHOULD BRING SOME MORE SC BACK INTO 
THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH EMPHASIS IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE 
MOUNTAINS ON THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. WITH MUCH COLDER AIR 
BUILDING IN ALOFT AND WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW IN PLACE THERE COULD 
BE A FEW SNOW FLURRIES IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. SOME LOW 
CLOUDS MAY HANG AROUND FOR A BRIEF PERIOD FOLLOWING SUNRISE ACROSS 
THE GREAT VALLEY OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA INTO NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
OTHERWISE...THERE SHOULD BE QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE ON SATURDAY BUT 
IT WILL NOT DO MUCH TO WARM THE SURFACE AS HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
RUNNING ABOUT 8 TO 12 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR LATE NOVEMBER.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH IN CONTROL 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEKEND PROVIDING COOL AND DRY CONDITIONS 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING THE AREA ON 
MONDAY WILL BRING IN MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS AND MAY GENERATE A 
STRAY ISOLATED SHOWER.  TIMING OF THE SYSTEM REMAINS IN QUESTION BUT 
GENERALLY LOOKS LIKE LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING.  HAVE 
CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY 
FOR THE FIRST HALF OF TUESDAY.  EXPECTED MAINLY RAIN ACROSS THE 
VALLEY WITH A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS... 
ESPECIALLY DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  UPSLOPE RAIN AND SNOW SHOWER 
MAY LINGER INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY.  OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
BACK IN FOR THE END OF THE WEEK.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL REMAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA
THROUGH MOST OF THE NIGHT. THIS CONTINUED RIDGING EXTENDING INTO TO
THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL ONLY ALLOW LIMITED MOISTURE RETURN
NORTH INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MODELS ONLY

AFTER FROPA FRIDAY AFTERNOON...CONDITIONS QUICKLY DRY OUT OVER MOST
OF THE AREA..EXCEPT FOR THE NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS WHERE SOME
OROGRAPHIC NORTHWEST FLOW PRECIPITATION IS POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN ON SATURDAY FOR GENERALLY A COOL 
AND DRY WEEKEND.  A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA ON MONDAY WILL 
INCREASE CLOUDS AND MAY BRING IN A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS IN ADVANCE 
OF THE FRONT LATE IN THE DAY.  THERE REMAINS SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES 
FOR THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND WILL KEEP HIGH CHANCE POPS IN PLACE 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  SHOULD BE MAINLY A RAIN EVENT THOUGH A 
MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW IS EXPECTED OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS DURING THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS.  PRECIP SHOULD EXIT FROM WEST TO EAST ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT WITH LINGERING UPSLOPE RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUING OVER 
NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS ON WEDNESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO BUILD 
IN FOR THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST THU NOV 22 2012

.SHORT TERM /THANKSGIVING DAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL THANKSGIVING DAY IS ON TAP AS A UPPER
RIDGE AXIS BUILDS INTO THE AREA TODAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN
CLEAR/MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPS
ALOFT...AND SUBSEQUENTLY EVEN WARMER HIGHS FOR TODAY. THE MERCURY
IS PROGGED TO CLIMB INTO THE LOWER 70S ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE
AND INTO THE MID TO UPPER 60S ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.
CLEAR CONDITIONS DURING THE EVENING WILL GIVE WAY TO INCREASING
CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT AHEAD OF AN ADVANCING COLD FRONT FROM THE
LOWER- MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THAT WILL TRACK EASTWARD TOWARD THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. HOWEVER...ANY PRECIPITATION
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE WILL LIKELY OCCUR AFTER DAYBREAK ON
BLACK FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
MOISTURE DOES SEEM LACKING WITH THE COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY...BUT
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS STILL SEEM JUSTIFIED. LIGHT MEASURABLE
PRECIPITATION DOES SEEM POSSIBLE...SO CARRIED LOW POPS ALSO FOR THE
SRN AREAS INSTEAD OF SPRINKLES. DRY FORECAST LOOKS GOOD FOR THE
WEEKEND WITH NW FLOW ALOFT TRANSITIONING TO A ZONAL FLOW. THIS
KEEPS TEMPS MUCH CLOSER TO SEASONAL NORMALS...AFTER A COOL DOWN ON
SATURDAY.

A STRONGER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND COLD FRONT WILL REACH THE 
FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. MODELS GENERALLY SEEM TO 
BE A BIT SLOWER...SO ANY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS MADE WERE TO HOLD 
SHOWERS OFF UNTIL LATE MONDAY NIGHT. TIMING OF THE FRONT WOULD 
SUPPORT LIKELY POPS ON TUESDAY...SO POPS WERE INCREASED SLIGHTLY...
BUT SEEMS EARLY TO GO 60 PERCENT OR HIGHER JUST YET EXCEPT FOR NW 
AREAS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS DON'T REVEAL MUCH OF A LAPSE RATE WITH 
JUST VERY MINIMAL INSTABILITY...AND NO HINT OF ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
EITHER. THUS...I CAN SEE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO OUR WEST OVER 
MIDDLE TN TUESDAY AFTERNOON...BUT JUST SHOWERS FOR OUR REGION. 

22/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE IN AGREEMENT WITH PREVIOUS 2 MODEL RUNS
SO JUST SOME SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS NEEDED AT THIS POINT.

FXUS64 KMRX 212011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST WED NOV 21 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL KEEP CONDITIONS DRY THROUGH
THURSDAY NIGHT. DEWPOINTS WILL REMAIN LOW WITH AFTERNOON RELATIVE
HUMIDITIES FALLING INTO THE 20S MOST LOCATIONS THURSDAY. A COLD
FRONT WILL SWEEP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY WITH MAIN UPPER
DYNAMICS STAYING NORTH ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. ALSO...RIDGING OVER
THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL KEEP THE MOISTURE FROM STREAMING NORTH INTO
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AHEAD OF THE FRONT. LIMITED MOISTURE AND
WEAK UPPER DYNAMICS WILL KEEP CHANCES LOW WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH
PRECIPITATION LIMITED TO SPRINKLES MOST LOCATIONS.

FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...NORTHWEST FLOW INTO THE NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS WILL
PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS...POSSIBLY MIXING WITH SNOW. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FRIDAY SYSTEM WILL BE ON 
ITS WAY OUT ALLOWING A RETURN TO INCREASING AMOUNTS OF SUNSHINE 
SATURDAY INTO MONDAY AS A COLDER NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT 
TRANSITIONS TO ZONAL ON SUNDAY. THE NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WILL BE AMPLIFYING ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS ON MONDAY WHICH ALLOWS A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW TO STRENGTHEN 
ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. HELPING TO BOOST TEMPERATURES BACK A FEW 
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL MONDAY AND TUESDAY. ALONG WITH THE 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL COME A MOISTENING ATMOSPHERE WHICH 
WILL BE LIFTED AHEAD OF A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THE LOW WILL 
DRIVE NORTHEAST OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT DRAGGING A COLDER AIRMASS 
TOWARD THE EAST COAST. ECMWF A LITTLE FASTER WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE BUT IT LOOKS LIKE THE MAIN EVENT WILL OCCUR ON TUESDAY AND 
ADJUSTED POPS JUST A LITTLE HIGHER INTO THE GOOD CHANCE REALM FOR 
THIS PERIOD TWEAKING BACK TO MEDIUM CHANCE TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE MAIN 
LIFT WITH THE FRONT HEADS EAST OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS 
INDICATE SOME TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND MOISTURE DIVING THROUGH 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE UPPER TROUGH LATER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY 
SO KEPT SOME SMALL AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR THIS PERIOD. THE CHILLY AIR ADVECTING 
INTO THE REGION WILL ALLOW FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS TO DEVELOP WITH 
MAIN IMPACT AT THIS TIME APPEARING TO BE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 AM EST WED NOV 21 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PASSING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY
THIS MORNING...BRINGING SOME LOW/MID LEVEL DECKS OF CLOUD COVER AND
SOME ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS THAT HAVE GRADUALLY DIMINISHED OVER THE
COURSE OF THE NIGHT. IN WAKE OF THIS TROUGH...SOME CLEARING SKIES
WILL RESULT IN MOSTLY/PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS FOR TODAY ALONG WITH
SOME CONTINUED MILD TEMPERATURES AS AN UPPER RIDGE AXIS BEGINS TO
BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS WILL
RESULT IN HIGHS PEAKING IN THE 60S AREAWIDE ONCE AGAIN. TONIGHT...
SKIES WILL BE CLEAR RESULTING IN GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING AND LOWS
BOTTOMING OUT IN THE 30S TO THE LOWER 40S IN FAR SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE.

.LONG TERM /THANKSGIVING THROUGH TUESDAY/...
LOOKS LIKE GREAT WEATHER FOR THANKSGIVING AS THE SURFACE AND UPPER
RIDGE EXTEND RIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPS SHOULD HAVE NO
PROBLEM REACHING AROUND 5 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS...SO
MOSTLY 50S TO NEAR 70 DEGREES.

FOR FRIDAY...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DROPS SE FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST 
AND GREAT LAKES REGIONS. THIS FLATTENS OUR UPPER RIDGE WITH AN 
ASSOCIATED RATHER WEAK LOOKING COLD FRONT DEVELOPING. THIS FRONT 
ONLY WARRANTS LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SW VA/NE TN WITH JUST SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE. MOISTURE BECOMES QUITE SHALLOW BY FRIDAY 
EVENING AFTER PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT...SO I KEPT JUST SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE NE AREAS AND SMOKIES FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.  

PRESSURE GRADIENT IS FAIRLY TIGHT INTO EARLY SATURDAY...SO BREEZY NW 
WINDS AS SKIES BECOME SOME DEGREE OF SUNNY. 850 MB TEMPS TAKE A 
SIGNIFICANT PLUNGE ON SATURDAY...SO LOOKING AT A MUCH COOLER DAY 
WITH HIGHS ONLY 30S SW VA TO NEAR 50 ACROSS SE TN/SW NC. 

CONTINUED DRY FORECAST THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH CHILLY MIN TEMPS 
FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN TEMPS BEGIN A GRADUAL WARMING TREND INTO 
TUESDAY. MODELS SEEM IN UNUSUALLY GOOD AGREEMENT ON A STRONGER LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TO AFFECT US BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. KEPT OUR 
CHANCE POPS GOING FOR THOSE PERIODS FOR NOW...BUT MAY BE ABLE TO 
NUDGE UP TO LOW END OF LIKELY POPS IF MODELS REMAIN CONSISTENT. WE 
COULD ALSO SEE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS ON TUESDAY GIVEN THE TRACK 
AND TIMING AS ADVERTISED BY MOST MODELS. HOWEVER...I DID NOT ADD 
THUNDER JUST YET. 

SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO MAX/MIN TEMPS IN LINE WITH 21/00Z GFSX 
MOS AND NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 200828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 AM EST TUE NOV 20 2012

.SHORT TERM.../TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING HAS
PRODUCED A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS OR SPRINKLES OVER MIDDLE TN /-RA AT
KBNA/. WAITING TO SEE HOW MUCH PCPN CAN REACH THE SURFACE AT
CSV...BUT OPTED TO ADD A MENTION OF SPRINKLES OUT TO 15Z
TODAY...MAINLY THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND WRN AREAS EARLY. ASSOCIATED
CLOUDS WILL THICKEN TO OVERCAST THIS MORNING THEN MAY BREAK UP A
BIT. THIS SHOULD KEEP HIGHS A FEW DEGREES BELOW MONDAY MAXES...SO I
OPTED TO GO JUST BELOW THE GFS MOS MAXES.

UPPER TROUGH BRIEFLY OVER THE REGION TONIGHT WILL DEEPEN...SO I DO 
EXPECT ANOTHER INCREASE IN CLOUDS BY 21/03Z OR LATER. WON'T ADD ANY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OR SPRINKLES...BUT WORTH KEEPING MOSTLY CLOUDY
SKIES. THE HEIGHT OF CLOUDS TONIGHT WILL BE MUCH LOWER AND SHOULD
AFFECT MIN TEMPS...MAKING THE MILDER NAM MINS OR A BLEND BETTER
THAN THE COOLER GFS MINS.


.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
FAIRLY BENIGN WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD. IN WAKE OF AN UPPER-TROUGH PASSAGE...AN UPPER-SUBTROPICAL 
RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION WEDNESDAY INTO THANKSGIVING 
DAY...PROMOTING CONTINUED WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS...WITH HIGHS
PEAKING IN THE 60S TO AROUND 70 DEGREES IN A FEW SPOTS IN SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE ON THANKSGIVING. HOWEVER...ON BLACK FRIDAY ANOTHER UPPER-
LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WILL DRIVE A COLD
FRONT THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. GIVEN
THE LIMITED AMOUNT OF MOISTURE...HAVE KEPT POPS FAIRLY LOW /IN
ACCORDANCE WITH MODEL GUIDANCE/ AND IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY.
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW FAIRLY LIGHT QPF SIGNALS AS THE FRONT
MOVES INTO THE AREA AND THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LIGHT SHOWERS
FRIDAY...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF DURING THE EVENING AS THE FRONT
PUSHES EAST. COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THE
FRONT...DROPPING HIGHS BACK INTO THE 40S TO LOW 50S ON SATURDAY.
THEREAFTER HOWEVER...A WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR AS ZONAL FLOW
RETURNS BY SUNDAY...BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM POTENTIALLY
APPROACHES THE AREA BY MONDAY...RESULTING IN INCREASED CLOUD COVER
AND RAIN CHANCES LATE IN THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...BASED ON SOME MODEL
DIFFERENCES IN THE EXTENDED...HAVE INCREASED POPS ON DAY 7 ONLY
SLIGHTLY AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER CONTINUITY BEFORE MAKING ANY
FURTHER ADJUSTMENTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
428 AM EST MON NOV 19 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ANOTHER MOSTLY CLEAR MORNING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...ALTHOUGH LOW CLOUDS HAVE SPREAD GRADUALLY 
WEST ACROSS WESTERN PARTS OF NC AND NW PARTS OF SC. THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OFF THE NC/SC COAST HAS MOVED FURTHER SE OF THE SRN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH THE CIRCULATION FROM THIS LOW AND THE SURFACE 
RIDGE IN PLACE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE LOW CLOUDS. UPPER RIDGE TO OUR 
WEST WILL SPREAD HIGH CLOUDS OUR WAY TODAY...BUT DON'T EXPECT ANY 
LOW CLOUDS OR EVEN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR TODAY OR TONIGHT. 
THUS...I DROPPED ANY MENTION OF RAIN CHANCES FROM TONIGHT'S WEATHER 
GRIDS. 

IF HIGH CLOUDS STAY THIN IN THE AFTERNOON...I EXPECT MAX TEMPS AT 
LEAST AS WARM AS YESTERDAY. PARTIAL THICKNESSES AND 850 MB TEMPS 
SUPPORT ABOUT 1 TO 3 DEGREES WARMER THAN SUNDAY'S HIGHS. SO...I WENT 
AT LEAST AS WARM AS GFS MOS. MINS TONIGHT SHOULD BE MILDER GIVEN 
PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES. MOS GUIDANCE WAS IN DISAGREEMENT WITH 
NAM MINS MILDER THAN COOLER GFS MINS...SO A BLEND WAS BEST CHOICE 
FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE TO KEEP
FORECAST AREA DRY TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WITH SE COASTAL SYSTEM
CONTINUING TO SPIN OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST. WEAK UPPER TROUGH 
MOVING INTO TN VALLEY WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER EARLY TUESDAY AND
MOVE ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY. UPPER RIDGE THEN
STRENGTHENS LATER WEDNESDAY THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY. HIGHS WILL
CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. RAISED HIGHS A
FEW DEGREES FOR THIS TIME PERIOD. RIDGE BUILDS IN STRONGEST ON
THANKSGIVING. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GUIDANCE BUT HIGHS MAY NEED TO BE
RAISED A FEW MORE DEGREES. ANOTHER WEAK FRONT BREAKS DOWN STRONG
RIDGE FRIDAY AND QUICKLY TRACKS ACROSS THE REGION. BEST CHANCE FOR
RAIN FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. BIG COOL DOWN BEHIND FRONT AS
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT DROPS TEMPERATURES ABOUT 10
TO 15 DEGREES SATURDAY...THEN SLIGHT WARMING SUNDAY.

WEAK SYSTEM DEVELOPING OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST MONDAY JUST EAST OF
THE APPALACHIAN CREST. SOME CLOUDS WILL SPREAD INTO EASTERN SECTIONS
BY MONDAY NIGHT. RIDGING ALOFT BREAKS DOWN OVER THE FORECAST AREA
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY AND ALLOWS A WEAK MAINLY UPPER
LEVEL SYSTEM TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. DECREASED CLOUD COVER
AND LOWERED POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THE TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
MORNING PERIOD. PRECIPITATION AMOUNT PROBABLY ONLY SPRINKLES TO A
FEW HUNDREDTHS WITH THIS SYSTEM. TEMPERATURES TO STAY MILD WITH
HIGHS ABOUT THE SAME MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY UPPER 50S TO MID 60S
WHICH IS SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL AND LOWS WARMER WITH MORE CLOUDS IN
THE LOWER 40S. RIDGING REBUILDS WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY
FRIDAY. THEN ANOTHER TROUGH AND MORE SIGNIFICANT FRONT TO BRING
ANOTHER RAIN CHANCE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. COOLER SATURDAY AS
UPPER TROUGH SETTLES SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  36  65  44  65 /   0   0  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  34  63  43  63 /   0   0  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       62  34  64  42  64 /   0   0  10  10  20

TRACKING IN THE AREA ON FRIDAY BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. WITH

1050 AM EST SAT NOV 17 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VERY DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE THIS 
MORNING WITH WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS SHOWING MORE DRY AIR ON THE 
WAY. HEIGHTS RISING TODAY AS UPPER RIDGE REPLACES THE WEAK TROUGH. 
SURFACE RIDGE HOLDS ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION FOR THE 
WEEKEND...SO DRY WEATHER...HARDLY ANY CLOUDS AND SLIGHTLY WARMER 
TEMPS ARE ON TAP FOR BOTH TODAY AND TONIGHT.

GFS MAXES PLUS A DEGREE OR SO LOOKED BEST FOR TODAY...THEN A BLEND 
OF MOS FOR TONIGHT. ALTHOUGH I FAVORED THE LOWEST MINS FOR NE AREAS. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE TO CONTINUE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH DRY AIR MASS AND SEASONABLY WARM 
TEMPERATURES. HOWEVER SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLE MODELS INDICATE A SYSTEM 
DEVELOPING ALONG THE SC COAST. THIS SYSTEM MOVES EAST TAKING CLOUDS 
AND PRECIPITATION WITH IT. CANADIAN MODEL SPREADS CLOUDS AND 
RAINFALL INTO THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS AS EARLY AS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT WHILE THE GFS AND IS SLOWER AND BRINGS CLOUDS INTO THE 
MOUNTAINS SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY BUT HOLDS RAINFALL OFF UNTIL 
MONDAY NIGHT. NAM MODEL TOO TRYING TO BRING CLOUDS ACROSS MOUNTAINS 
MOUNTAINS SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WILL 
CONTINUE DRY AND MOSTLY CLEAR BUT SPREAD MORE CLOUD COVER INTO 
EASTERN AREAS MONDAY NIGHT WITH SLIGHT CHANCE RAIN. RIDGE BEGINS TO 
BREAK DOWN BY MONDAY NIGHT AND WEAK TROUGH MOVES OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA BY TUESDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUES WEDNESDAY. STILL LOOKS LIKE BEST 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS WITH THIS FEATURE IS TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. 
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST LATE WEDNESDAY WITH HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDING BACK 
INTO THE SOUTHEAST THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. &&

FXUS64 KMRX 162020
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST FRI NOV 16 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...AND WILL 
BE OVERTAKEN BY RIDGING FROM THE WEST BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. 
WESTWARD MOVING RIDGE WILL CUT OFF THE BASE OF THE WEAK LONGWAVE 
TROUGH. MODELS INDICATE A WEAK CLOSED OFF LOW DUE TO THE RIDGE 
PINCHING OFF THE BASE OF THE TROUGH. THIS AREA OF WEAK LOW PRESSURE 
WILL NOT HAVE AN AFFECT ON OUR CWA AS IT IS WILL BE PUSHED TO OUR 
SOUTH AND EAST ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY BY ADVANCING RIDGE. 
THIS LOW WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN SHOWERS AND CLOUDS TO THE COASTAL 
CAROLINAS ON SUNDAY...WITH MOISTURE ADVECTING WEST. HOWEVER...THE 
APPALACHIANS...COMBINED WITH THE MORE DOMINANT RIDGING...WILL 
INHIBIT MOISTURE FROM ADVECTING INTO OUR AREA. THIS WILL KEEP 
CONDITIONS CALM AND MOSTLY CLEAR THROUGH SUNDAY.  

WENT WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR MIN TEMPS TONIGHT AS WE ARE 
UNDER NEUTRAL ADVECTION CONDITIONS. A SLIGHT WARM UP IS EXPECTED ON 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS MODELS SHOW A SLIGHT INCREASE IN THICKNESS 
VALUES DUE TO ADVANCEMENT OF RIDGE. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED 
VERY GOOD WITH LITTLE CHANGES MADE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY.  A 
TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA IN THE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY TIME 
FRAME BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. WILL CONTINUE THE LOW CHANCE FOR 
FOR BOTH DAYS WITH HIGHEST CHANCE ON TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS WITH DRY WEATHER EXPECTED ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. STAYED 
NEAR MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

101 
FXUS64 KMRX 160144
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST THU NOV 15 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WEAK TROUGH 
LINGERING GENERALLY ALONG THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS SOME SCATTERED HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE MID MS 
AND TN RIVER VALLEYS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. 
THESE HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. THE TEMP/DEWPOINT SPREAD TONIGHT IS EXPECTED 
TO BECOME MINIMAL TOWARDS SUNRISE...WHICH SHOULD ENCOURAGE FOG 
FORMATION...ESPECIALLY AROUND BODIES OF WATER WHICH ARE STILL 
RELATIVELY WARM THIS TIME OF YEAR. THE HIGH CLOUDS WITH THE UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL PROBABLY INHIBIT WIDESPREAD FOG FORMATION 
OVERNIGHT...BUT THINK IT IS PRUDENT TO MENTION AT LEAST SOME PATCHY 
FOG TOWARDS SUNRISE...CONSIDERING THE FAVORABLE TIME OF YEAR FOR FOG 
DEVELOPMENT.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND PATCHY FOG TOWARDS SUNRISE.
&&

SUNDAY.  WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  MOISTURE 
SHOULD START TO INCREASE BY TUESDAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER 
TROUGH. STILL SOME QUESTION ABOUT TIMING...BUT WILL INCLUDE LOW POPS 
FOR SOME SHOWERS TUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE LONG TERM...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

FXUS64 KMRX 150215
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST WED NOV 14 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A SOUTHWEST-TO-NORTHEAST ORIENTED 
TROUGH GENERALLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS...WITH TEMPS IN THE 30S AND 40S 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT AN UPPER- 
LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION TONIGHT...WITH SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE TROUGH AXIS 
GENERATING SOME RAIN OVER GEORGIA AND THE CAROLINAS. SOME OF THIS 
RAIN MAY AFFECT THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN LATER TONIGHT...WHERE TEMPS 
COULD BE NEAR THE FREEZING MARK IN SOME SHELTERED VALLEYS TOWARDS 
SUNRISE. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING 
RAIN OVERNIGHT...BUT THE MODELS INDICATE THAT THE BULK OF THE 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SHORT WAVE WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
CAROLINAS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE SOME EVENING PRECIP WORDING.

596 
FXUS64 KMRX 142013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST WED NOV 14 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A WEAKENING SHORT WAVE WILL 
MOVE EAST THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TONIGHT AND THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY THURSDAY. AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
WILL DEVELOP NE IN ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING SHORT WAVE. THE SURFACE
TROUGH WILL WEAKLY DEEPEN INTO SW VA TONIGHT BEFORE SLIDING EAST 
THROUGH THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY. AIRMASS IS INITIALLY DRY WITH 
SURFACE DEWPOINTS IN THE 20S. GOOD LIFT IN ADVANCE OF SHORTWAVE BUT 
LAYER MOISTURE LIMITED SO ONLY VIRGA EXPECTED AT BEST FOR MOST 
AREAS. STRONG LOW LEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPS TONIGHT S OF THE 
AREA AND REACHES INTO SW NC TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RAPIDLY 
INCREASES UP TO 700 MB OVER THE CAROLINAS AND TO ALONG THE EXTREME 
EAST TN BORDER. MODELS DEPICT A GOOD WARM UP OVERNIGHT BUT STAYED
TOWARD A COOLER SOLUTION. KEPT SUB FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN NORTHERN 
AND EASTERN ZONES. THIS CALLS FOR SOME FREEZING RAIN IN THE 
MOUNTAINS WITH LIGHT AMOUNTS ANTICIPATED.  

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
FAIRLY BENIGN WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH NEAR SEASONABLE TEMPS AND DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND INTO THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. AN UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH WILL DIG IN AND SWING ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...BUT OTHER THAN A WIND SHIFT TO THE 
NORTHEAST /WHICH WILL HELP TO REINFORCE SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER 
TEMPS/...THE LACK OF LIFT AND MOISTURE WILL KEEP SHOWERS OUT OF THE 
FORECAST. A VERY GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL THEN OCCUR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY AS ZONAL FLOW RETURNS ALOFT AND HIGHS CLIMB BACK INTO THE 
LOW TO PERHAPS MID 60S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS AREAWIDE WITH AMPLE 
SUNSHINE. HOWEVER...ANOTHER LONGWAVE IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE 
REGION TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY...AND DEPENDING ON THE TRACK AND 
AMOUNT OF MOISTURE PRESENT...IT COULD GIVE THE AREA IT'S FIRST SHOT 
OF SCATTERED PRECIP IN ABOUT A WEEK. HOWEVER...THE LONG TERM MODEL 
SOLUTIONS DIFFER WITH THE TIMING AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP CHANCES. THE 
ECMWF IS TRENDING A BIT FASTER AND IS MORE BULLISH WITH QPF SIGNALS 
TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. THE GFS IS STILL TRENDING SLOWER AND 
DRIER...SHOWING A FEW MODEST LIGHT QPF SIGNALS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY. GIVEN THESE DIFFERENCES...HAVE KEPT LOW-END 
MENTIONABLE POPS ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND ON WEDNESDAY...THOUGH CONFIDENCE IN THIS ATTM IS STILL LOW.    


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             38  58  38  61  39 /  10  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  35  58  36  59  35 /  10  10  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       35  58  35  59  36 /  10  10  10   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST WED NOV 14 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SATELLITE SHOWS A BAND OF HIGH 
LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING  INTO THE REGION FOR TODAY.  OTHERWISE...SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER FOR DRY AND MILD 
CONDITIONS.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE A BIT WARMER WITH HIGHS GENERALLY 
IN THE MID 50S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.  A WEAK WEATHER DISTURBANCE 
WILL MOVE UP FROM THE SOUTH TONIGHT...GENERALLY TRACKING THROUGH THE 
CAROLINAS.  ASSOCIATED SHOWERS MAY REACH INTO EXTREME SOUTHERN NC 
AND THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN.  WILL KEEP POPS AT 20 TO 30 OVER THIS 
AREA.  THE REST SHOULD STAY DRY WITH OVERNIGHT LOW EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN ABOVE THE FREEZING MARK ACROSS MUCH OF THE VALLEY.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD...BUT INTERMODEL AGREEMENT AND 
CONSISTENCY STARTS TO DETERIORATE A BIT BY LATE IN THE PERIOD.  
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  MAY BE 
A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS INTO EARLY THU OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS...SO 
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.  AN UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO THE AREA 
FRIDAY...BUT LACKING FORCING AND MOISTURE SO SHOULD REMAIN DRY.  
MOISTURE SHOULD START TO INCREASE BY TUESDAY AHEAD OF ANOTHER WAVE. 
NEITHER GFS NOR ECMWF BULLISH FOR PRECIP...SO FOR NOW WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE DRIER ECMWF AND CONTINUITY AND KEEP THINGS PRECIP FREE 
WITH JUST AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

681 
FXUS64 KMRX 131931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST TUE NOV 13 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...THE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGE OVER THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL GRADUALLY BUILD NORTHEAST 
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT AND THEN THE NEW ENGLAND STATES BY 
SUNRISE. WITH SHORTWAVE RIDGING ALOFT...EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
OVERNIGHT WITH PATCHY FOG POSSIBLE PARTICULARLY AROUND TRI-CITIES. 
INCREASING HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS WILL GRADUALLY MOVE SOUTH TO NORTH 
ON WEDNESDAY IN ASSOCIATION WITH A SHORTWAVE TROUGH. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE VERY DRY AIR FROM 850-600MB THROUGH TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE CONSIDERABLY COLDER THAN 
THIS MORNING DUE TO EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING. HOWEVER... 
WEDNESDAY DAYTIME TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN TODAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A TRANQUIL PERIOD WITH TWO UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVES AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/ 
THURSDAY AND SATURDAY/SUNDAY TIME FRAMES. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS 
MODELS INDICATE THAT THE LATTER SHORT WAVE WILL CLOSE OFF INTO AN 
UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA OVER THE WEEKEND. BOTH MODELS 
HAVE ALSO COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT THIS RUN WITH THE AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH EACH OF THESE SHORT WAVES...AND GENERALLY 
INDICATE A DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF SOME LIGHT RAIN OVER THE MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
OVERALL...EXPECT THESE SHORT WAVES TO PRODUCE AT LEAST AN INCREASE 
IN CLOUDS...SO WILL MENTION AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   31  55  41  60  41 /   0  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     30  55  38  59  39 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             29  53  38  59  39 /   0   0   0   0   0

ONLY OTHER CONCERN THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE ANOTHER WAVE MOVING 
THROUGH AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME.  WITH THE LACK OF MOISTURE AND 
ENERGY...ONLY EXPECT TO SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER AS THIS MOVES 
THROUGH.  OTHERWISE...SHOULD EXPERIENCE TRANQUIL WEATHER WITH NEAR 
TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.

186 
FXUS64 KMRX 122311
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST MON NOV 12 2012

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED FORECAST TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING. NO OTHER 
CHANGES MADE. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT HAS BEEN MAKING SLOW 
PROGRESS ACROSS TN AND IS NOW LOCATED ALONG OR JUST EAST OF THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. LARGE AREA OF LIGHT RAIN HAS SPREAD EAST THROUGH 
EAST TN AND SW NC AND COVERED ALL BUT THE NE CORNER OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. TEMPERATURES RANGED FROM NEAR 50 ON THE PLATEAU TO THE 50S 
WEST AND 60S EAST. SOME LOCATIONS REACHED AROUND 70 BEFORE THE RAIN 
MOVED IN. GUSTY SW TO NW WINDS WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT THIS 
AFTERNOON BEFORE DROPPING OFF TONIGHT. HAVE ADJUSTED GRIDS SLIGHTLY 
WITH TIMING FOR THE RAIN ENDING. PRECIPITATION SHOULD END DURING THE 
EVENING PLATEAU...AROUND MIDNIGHT CENTRAL AREAS AND AFTER MIDNIGHT 
EAST. MODELS SHOW A SMALL AMOUNT OF SNOW MAY FALL AT THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS OF VA AND THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS ABOVE ABOUT 4000 FEET 
LATE TONIGHT BEFORE PRECIPITATION ENDS BUT DID NOT INCLUDE IN 
FORECAST SINCE AMOUNTS WERE LESS THAN ONE INCH. AT ANY RATE... 
TEMPERATURES DROP RATHER QUICKLY WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND 
FRONT TONIGHT WITH LOWS REACHING THE LOWER TO MID 30S. TEMPERATURES 
MUCH COOLER WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUING TOMORROW. FOLLOWED 
MAV GUIDANCE WITH HIGHS MID 40S TO MID 50S. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A TRANQUIL PERIOD WITH TWO UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVES AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE WEDNESDAY/ 
THURSDAY AND SATURDAY/SUNDAY TIME FRAMES. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS 
MODELS INDICATE THAT THE LATTER SHORT WAVE WILL CLOSE OFF INTO AN 
UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. SOME 
DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN THE MODELS ARISE WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
EXPECTED WITH EACH OF THESE SHORT WAVES...WITH THE ECMWF MODEL 
WETTER OVER THE FORECAST AREA THAN BOTH THE GFS AND CANADIAN MODELS. 
FOR NOW...WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD TO 
MAINTAIN CONTINUITY WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECASTS...AND TO BE IN 
AGREEMENT WITH THE GFS AND CANADIAN MODEL SOLUTIONS. OVERALL... 
EXPECT AT LEAST AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER WITH THESE TWO SHORT 
WAVES...SO WILL BE A LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH SKY COVER THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   33  55  34  55  41 /  30   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     34  52  32  54  39 /  50   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             33  51  32  54  39 /  30   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    34  50  28  52  34 /  90   0   0   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST MON NOV 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE 
AREA TODAY.  A BAND OF SHOWERS WILL SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA...EXITING EASTERN ZONES TONIGHT.  INSTABILITY LOOKS QUITE 
LIMITED...SO NO MENTION OF THUNDER FOR NOW.  WILL CARRY CAT POPS ALL 
ZONES TODAY. CAT POPS NORTHEAST TO SLIGHT CHANCE FAR WESTERN ZONES 
EARLY TONIGHT...AND THEN PRECIP FREE BY LATE TONIGHT.  COLDER AND 
DRIER AIR WILL PUSH IN BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH A CLEARING SKY 
OVERNIGHT ONCE THE PRECIP ENDS. WIND ADVISORY THROUGH NOON STILL 
LOOKS GOOD...SO NO CHANGES THERE. WILL GO ABOVE MAV TEMPS TODAY AS 
EXPECT SOME WARMING AHEAD OF THE PRECIP...THEN WILL GENERALLY GO A 
BIT BELOW MAV NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAINTAINED CONTINUITY WITH THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST WHICH KEEPS THE REGION DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
HOWEVER...MODELS ARE NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT. A COUPLE OF WEAK 
SHORT WAVE TROUGHS MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH THE 
FIRST BUILDING THROUGH WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. 
BOTH THE ECMWF AND THE GFS REALLY SLOW DOWN THE LATTER WAVE AND EVEN 
CLOSE OFF AN UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE AREA SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. THE 
SHORT WAVELENGTH SYSTEMS WILL ENCOURAGE AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
INTO FORMATION ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WITH EXTENSION NORTH 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. ADDED A FEW CLOUDS TO THE MIX ACROSS THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. IN THIS SCENARIO 
MODELS FAVOR PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING OVER THE CAROLINAS BUT I 
CERTAINLY WOULDN'T BE SURPRISED IF SOME LIGHT QPF DEVELOPED OVER 
EASTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. ADJUSTED THE TEMPERATURE 
FORECAST WITH THE AID OF MEX MOS GUIDANCE. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRACKING ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE AND WEST KENTUCKY. MOST OF THE
PRECIPITATION SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL DURING THE DAY SO WILL LEAVE
THE CURRENT RAIN CHANCES FOR THE PLATEAU AS IS AND DRY ELSEWHERE
FOR TONIGHT. THE WINDS SHOULD BE WINDY ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. WILL LEAVE THE WIND ADVISORY GOING AS IS. TEMPERATURES
AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED FOR
TONIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 111947
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EST SUN NOV 11 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING ACROSS THE AREA IN THE SHORT TERM 
PERIOD. TONIGHT...A SOUTHERLY LLJ STRENGTHENS TO 45-50 KTS AT 850 
MB. THIS WILL CREATE FAVORABLE CONDITIONS FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE WINDS 
ACROSS THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS. THE WIND ADVISORY FROM 
00Z TONIGHT TO NOON TOMORROW APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. OBS THIS 
AFTERNOON HAVE SHOWN GUSTS OF 25-30 MPH IN SOME SPOTS...AND GUSTS UP 
TO 50 MPH WILL BE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT. 

MODELS SHOW THAT PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD FRONT WILL BE ALONG 
OR BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH VERY LITTLE AHEAD OF IT. THIS SEEMS TO 
MATCH WITH CURRENT WV IMAGERY OVER THE PLAINS...WHICH SHOWS THE 
UPPER TROUGH LAGGING WELL BEHIND THE SURFACE FRONT. SO WILL DELAY 
THE ONSET OF POPS UNTIL AFTER 12Z MON. THE SURFACE FRONT PUSHES 
THROUGH THE AREA IN THE 18-00Z TIME FRAME...WITH PRECIP TRAILING 
BEHIND AND CONTINUING PAST MIDNIGHT. WITH THE STRONG LLJ AND LOW 
LEVEL THETA-E VALUES NEAR 320K...WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY AFTERNOON. DRY ADVECTION AND CLEARING WILL 
QUICKLY FOLLOW THE BACK EDGE OF PRECIP BETWEEN 06-12Z TUESDAY. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
ANOTHER QUIET PERIOD BEGINS TUESDAY AS FRONT AND PRECIPITATION MOVES 
EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY TUESDAY MORNING. SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES 
BRING HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND MS VALLEY TO OVER 
THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT WILL CAUSE A BIG DROP IN HIGHS FROM THE 60S 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT TO 40S HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SW VA...TO THE 50S 
LOWER TN VALLEY ELEVATIONS. AIR MASS BECOMES DRIER AS WELL WITH DEW 
POINTS DROPPING INTO THE 20S. SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS MID 20S TO LOWER 30S...AND COLDER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO THURSDAY MORNING MODELS 
DISAGREE WITH POSSIBLE WEAK BOUNDARY JUST TO THE SOUTH AND SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THE BASE OF UPPER TROUGH BEHIND TOMORROWS 
FRONT POSSIBLY CAUSING A FEW SHOWERS TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. CANADIAN AND ECMWF SHOWING THIS FEATURE BUT GFS DRY. WILL 
LEAVE DRY FOR NOW BUT MAY NEED TO INCREASE CLOUDS AND HAVE SLIGHT 
CHANCE SHOWERS ADDED FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT PERIOD. THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
THROUGH SUNDAY HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER EASTERN THIRD OF THE 
COUNTRY WITH MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS EXPECTED AND SEASONABLE 
TEMPERATURES.

SIGNIFICANTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT AS DRIER AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT. KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE IN 
THIS FAIR WEATHER SCENARIO IS A LITTLE LOWER AS MODEL SOLUTIONS 
DIVERGE QUITE A BIT. THE GFS GENERALLY STAYS THE COURSE FROM THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST HOWEVER...THE ECMWF AND CMC INDICATE WETTER 
SOLUTIONS WITH A MID WEEK SHORT WAVE FEATURE. WILL WAIT FOR LATER 
MODEL RUNS TO SEE HOW THIS IS RESOLVED. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

ABOVE NORMAL FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON ONWARD.

THE PROPER ADJUSTMENTS TO THE GRIDDED DATABASE. TWEAKED POPS UP TO 
CATEGORICAL MUCH OF THE WESTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
LIKELY PROBABILITY STILL GOING ELSEWHERE ON MONDAY. THE FRONT MAY BE 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY 00Z TUESDAY BUT RAIN MAY LINGER BEHIND 
THE FROPA MONDAY NIGHT. NICE STRONG SYSTEM WITH A TIGHT PRESSURE 
GRADIENT BUT THE ATMOSPHERE LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE TOO STABLE FOR 
CONVECTION SO KEPT THUNDER OUT OF THE FORECAST. MOST OF THE RAIN 
SHOULD BE EAST OF THE REGION BY 12Z TUESDAY BUT THERE IS A SMALL 
CHANCE FOR A SHOWER EARLY IN THE DAY EASTERN SECTIONS BEFORE RAPID 
DRYING BEGINS. MAINTAINED A DRY AND SUNNY FORECAST FOR MID TO LATE 
WEEK BUT CONFIDENCE LEVEL A LITTLE LOWER AS THE MODELS ARE HINTING 
AT THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW MORE "RIPPLES" IN THE ZONAL FLOW 
PATTERN. STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE BLEND SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY CONCERNING MAXES BUT TRIMMED A DEGREE OR TWO OFF HIGHS DURING 
THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST. DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM SUGGESTED 
MINS THROUGH THE PERIOD.
