041 
FXUS64 KMRX 092031
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EST FRI NOV 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY 
WILL SHIFT EAST TO THE NC/SC COAST TOMORROW. ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE 
RIDGE...WE WILL SEE SLIGHTLY RISING DEWPOINTS AND A LIGHT SW FLOW. 
THIS SHOULD RESULT IN LOW TEMPS TONIGHT A BIT WARMER THAN PREVIOUS 
NIGHTS. WE WILL ALSO SEE HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW RISING WELL ABOVE 
CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMALS...INTO THE LOWER 70S ACROSS MUCH OF THE TN 
VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
FAIRLY SIMPLE SETTING FOR THIS SET OF DAYS...WITH ONLY ONE MAIN
SYSTEM IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PERIOD. STARTING WITH SATURDAY
EVENING...WITH UPPER RIDGE OVERHEAD BUT ABOUT TO EXIT TO THE EAST
AND A SURFACE SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW HAS BEGUN. AROUND MONDAY/MONDAY
EVENING THERE SHOULD BE A STRONG COLD FRONT THAT PASSES THROUGH.
MODELS STILL SHOW MOIST LOW LEVEL DEW POINTS IN THE 50S ACROSS THE
AREA...BUT AIR MASS IS NOT EXPECTED TO GET VERY UNSTABLE. WILL NOT
HAVE THUNDER IN FORECAST FOR FRONTAL PASSAGE...MERELY SHOWERS.
HOWEVER...THERE IS A STRONG WIND FIELD ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
FRONT...SO EVEN SHOWERS COULD PROVIDE DOWNWARD TRANSPORT OF GUSTY
IF NOT ISOLATED DAMAGING WINDS. THIS OPPORTUNITY FOR STRONGER WINDS
WILL BE BRIEF HOWEVER SINCE MUCH COOLER SURFACE AIR SURGES INTO THE
REGION...AND WILL BREAK THE CONNECTION TO THE DYNAMIC WINDS ALOFT.
FRONT AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD EXIT PRETTY QUICKLY ON TUESDAY.
A SHORTWAVE PASSES THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY...BUT WILL KEEP THIS PART
OF THE FORECAST DRY. ADDITIONALLY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
INTO THE REGION FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK AND SHOULD KEEP THE
AREA DRY AS WELL. WENT VERY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE VALUES.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  70  41  66  49 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  70  33  70  40 /   0   0   0   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 090856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST FRI NOV 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE OUR 
WEATHER FOR THE SHORT TERM.  SHOULD SEE A FEW HIGH CLOUDS 
AROUND...BUT OVERALL SHOULD BE MAINLY CLEAR WITH LIGHT WINDS.  WILL 
ALLOW FREEZE WARNING TO CONTINUE UNTIL THE 13Z EXPIRATION TIME.  
WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM.      

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A NICE AMPLIFIED PATTERN 
WILL BE IN PLACE FROM THE WEEKEND THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE NEW 
WEEK. THE FORECAST AREA ENJOYS THE RIDGE ASPECT OF THIS PATTERN 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY ALLOWING FOR MAXIMUM SUNSHINE AND PLEASANTLY 
WARM TEMPERATURES WHICH SHOULD RUN A GOOD TEN DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR EARLY NOVEMBER AS STEADILY STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW DEVELOPS. BY MONDAY THE WESTERN STATES UPPER TROUGH WILL HAVE 
PROGRESSED INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH SURFACE COLD FRONT 
PRESSING INTO WESTERN TENNESSEE BY 12Z (A LITTLE FASTER THAN THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST). EVEN STILL...MAINTAINED A POP GRADIENT WITH 
SHOWERS AND A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH 00Z 
TUESDAY WITH LIKELY CATEGORY WEST AND CHANCE CATEGORY EAST IN CASE 
SYSTEM MOVES SLOWER. STAYED WITH LIKELY POPS MONDAY NIGHT WHILE 
TAPERING BACK AFTER MIDNIGHT AS MODELS GENERALLY AGREE FRONT MOVES 
FAIRLY QUICKLY TOWARD THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. KEPT A SLIGHT AND 
LOW CHANCE POP FOR EASTERN SECTIONS MAINLY FIRST HALF OF THE DAY 
TUESDAY. BEYOND THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE MODELS INDICATE UPPER FLOW 
BECOMING ZONAL BY WEDNESDAY WITH AMPLIFICATION OCCURRING THURSDAY 
INTO FRIDAY. SO IT LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER RETURN TO IMPROVED WEATHER 
WITH TEMPERATURES MODERATING MID TO LATE WEEK. STAYED RELATIVELY 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

945 
FXUS64 KMRX 090345
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 PM EST THU NOV 8 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. FOG WILL LIKELY 
BE ALONG WATERWAYS WITH FROST ELSEWHERE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING OVER THE AREA FROM THE WEST. THIS 
RIDGE WILL EXTEND FROM THE SURFACE THROUGH THE TROPOSPHERE...AND 
GIVE CLEAR SKIES THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. WHILE FOG POTENTIAL 
DOES NOT LOOK QUITE AS FAVORABLE TONIGHT AS LAST NIGHT...PATCHY FOG 
WILL BE POSSIBLE MAINLY NEAR BODIES OF WATER. 

LOW TEMPS TONIGHT SHOULD REACH THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S ACROSS THE 
MAJORITY OF THE AREA. OUR FREEZE PROGRAM IS STILL ACTIVE FOR THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY COUNTIES. WHILE THERE HAVE BEEN 
POCKETS OF SUB-FREEZING TEMPS IN THIS AREA ALREADY...IT APPEARS 
LIKELY THAT FREEZING TEMPS TONIGHT WILL COVER A MUCH GREATER AREA 
THAN WE HAVE PREVIOUSLY SEEN THIS FALL. AS A RESULT...A FREEZE 
WARNING WILL BE ISSUED BETWEEN 4-8 AM. THE BUILDING RIDGE WILL GIVE 
HIGH TEMPS IN THE 60S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS TOMORROW. 

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES FRIDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH SUNDAY WITH NEXT SYSTEM BEING SHUNTED NE NORTH OF THE OHIO 
VALLEY ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND SOUTHERN CANADA. TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE 3 TO 5 DEGREES WARMER FRIDAY NIGHT WITH FROST POSSIBLE MOSTLY NE 
TN AND SW VA SHELTERED VALLEYS AND THE VALLEYS OF SW NC. OTHER 
LOCATIONS MOSTLY UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S AND SOUTHWEST WINDS KEEPING 
AIR MIXED AND WARMER AT MID SLOPE LOCATIONS WHICH INCLUDES THE  
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU. SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY MORE 
WARMING WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 60S TO THE LOWER 70S AS SURFACE HIGH 
SHIFTS TO EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. LATE SUNDAY AND THROUGH MONDAY 
THE PATTERN BEGINS TO CHANGE AGAIN AS COLD FRONT MOVES INTO MS 
VALLEY. CLOUDS INCREASE FROM SW TO NE SUNDAY NIGHT AND THEN SHOWERS 
BECOMING LIKELY LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. AIR MASS BECOME 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WITH THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE THROUGH MID EVENING BEFORE AIRMASS STABILIZES. RAIN 
EXPECTED TO LAST INTO TUESDAY BEHIND THE FRONT THEN HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN AGAIN TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. MUCH 
COOLER TEMPERATURES TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES AT NIGHT NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       31  64  37  69  40 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              28  62  30  69  35 /   0   0   0   0   0

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. UPPER LOW AXIS

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
THE UPPER LOW OVER VA/NC WILL TRACK EAST TONIGHT. A TROUGH EXTENDING 
NW ACROSS THE TN AND OH VALLEY REGION TODAY WILL MOVE SOUTH OF THE 
AREA THIS EVENING. CLEARING IS EXPECTED BEHIND THIS TROUGH...AS SEEN 
IN VIS SAT ACROSS OH AND NRN KY. WITH SURFACE MOISTURE FROM EARLIER 
RAINFALL AND CLEARING SKIES...FOG POTENTIAL LOOKS GOOD. A BUILDING 
SURFACE RIDGE SHOULD ALSO LEAD TO CALM WINDS BY MIDNIGHT. AREAS OF 
FOG WILL BE MENTIONS AREAWIDE...WITH FREEZING FOG ACROSS THE NORTH 
AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. PATCHY BLACK ICE MAY ALSO DEVELOP...AND WILL 
ISSUE A SPS TO ADDRESS THIS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 20S 
TO LOWER 30S NORTH...WITH MID 30S CENTRAL AND SOUTH. THURSDAY LOOKS 
DRY AND SUNNY AS A HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE REGION. 
HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS. 

LONG TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE BUILD OVER THE REGION FROM THURSDAY NIGHT
INTO SUNDAY...SO DRY WEATHER WITH SLOWLY RISING TEMPERATURES LOOKS
PROMISING. JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR THOSE
PERIODS...PLUS 7/12Z GFSX MOS WAS VERY CLOSE TO 7/00Z MOS.

A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING EAST INTO THE 
REGION MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...WITH VERY GOOD AGREEMENT AMONGST 
THE AVAILABLE MODELS. I NUDGED POPS UP TO LIKELY OVER WRN AREAS 
MONDAY NIGHT AND RAISED ERN POPS TO A HIGHER CHANCE. THE LATEST 
CANADIAN MODEL RUN HAS BACKED OFF ON THE POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS...AND LOOKS VERY MUCH LIKE THE GFS AND ECMWF NOW.
TRACK OF THE SURFACE LOW AND DYNAMICS LOOK TO BE WELL TO OUR 
NORTHWEST. GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR TUESDAY AND I INTRODUCED WEDNESDAY 
AS DRY FOR NOW. REMAINDER OF GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE TO PREVIOUS 
GRIDS AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             36  59  34  67  39 /  10   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  35  57  32  64  37 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  57  31  63  38 /  10   0   0   0   0

130 
FXUS64 KMRX 070933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
428 AM EST WED NOV 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA BRINGING MAINLY RAIN TODAY. BUT THERE IS A CHANCE OF A SNOW 
FALLING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE MORNING HOURS...MAINLY 
ABOVE 4000 FEET. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LESS THAN 1-2 INCHES. 
MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE FOR TODAY. THE 
DISTURBANCE EXITS THE AREA TONIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE APPROACHING 
THE REGION LATE TONIGHT. WILL CONTINUE THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE 
EVENING HOURS. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REALISTIC AGAIN.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS
SET OF DAYS THE UPPER TROUGH IS EXITING THE AREA...AND THE UPPER
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE STARTS TO BUILD INTO THE AREA...AND CONTINUES TO
BUILD AND AMPLIFY INTO THE WEEKEND.

NEXT SYSTEM DUE INTO THE AREA AROUND MONDAY.  SOME CONCERNS ABOUT 
SEVERE STORMS OR A MOUNTAIN WAVE/WIND EVENT...BUT BOTH LOOK FAIRLY 
LIMITED RIGHT NOW. CAN MODEL LOOKS THE MOST THREATENING AS IT 
DEVELOPS A CUTOFF LOW IN THE SOUTHERN STATES THAT WOULD BE A FOCUS 
FOR ORGANIZED STORM DEVELOPMENT...BUT THIS MODEL LOOKS LIKE THE 
OUTLIER...AS NONE OF THE OTHER MODELS OR ANY OF THE 12Z GFS 
ENSEMBLES RESOLVED THE SOUTHERN LOW.  SO IT IS LOOKING MORE LIKE A 
LINE OF SHOWERS/STORMS JUST AHEAD OR ALONG THE COLD FRONT.  CAN 
SOLUTION WOULD ALSO OFFER MORE OF A MOUNTAIN WIND EVENT AS WELL 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...BUT OTHER MODELS HAVE SURFACE LOW NORTH OF THE 
GREAT LAKES WHICH IS WELL NORTH OF THE CLIMATOLOGICAL MEAN FOR THE 
LOW CENTER FOR MOUNTAINS WAVE/WIND EVENTS THAT PLACES THE LOW MORE 
ABOUT THE KSTL LATITUDE.  IN HWO WILL SIMPLY MENTION GUSTY OUTFLOW 
WINDS FROM WEAK/MODERATE STORMS ALONG OR NEAR THE COLD FRONT MIGHT 
APPROACH SEVERE LIMITS.

BY TUESDAY...GFS/EURO AGREE THAT FRONT WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA AND 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE REGION.  GOING DRY ON POPS 
BY THEN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  37  58  33  67 /  50  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  35  54  31  63 /  50  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       51  35  55  30  64 /  50  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              50  31  50  25  62 /  50  10   0   0   0

OF SNOW. HOWEVER...MODELS SHOW 85H TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO FREEZING 
OR JUST BELOW LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. SO WE SHOULD SEE 
SOME RAIN MIX WITH AND LIKELY CHANGE OVER TO SNOW AT VERY HIGH 
ELEVATIONS ALONG THE TENNESSEE-NORTH CAROLINA BORDER (4000 FT AND 
ABOVE). WOULDN'T EXPECT MORE THAN ONE INCH ACCUMULATION AT THIS 
POINT. THE LIGHT RAIN MAY HANG AROUND THROUGH MUCH OF THE MORNING 
AND EXTEND INTO THE AFTERNOON AS THE BACK EDGE WRAPS UP ACROSS THE 
WESTERN AND SOUTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. MET MOS LOOKS 
UNREALISTICALLY WARM FOR MAX TEMPS ON WEDNESDAY WITH CLOUDS AND 
PRECIP IN THE AREA SO WENT MUCH CLOSER TO THE COLDER MAV 
NUMBERS.

PRESSURE...SURFACE AND ALOFT MOVES SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE AREA 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. H85 TEMPS RISE NORTH OF 10C. PWATS FALL SOUTH 
OF .50. LARGE DIURNAL TEMPERATURE RANGE WITH COOL MORNINGS AND WARM

796 
FXUS64 KMRX 060930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST TUE NOV 6 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE UPPER TROUGH AND CENTRAL
CIRCULATION WAS LOCATED OVER NE AL AND NW GA THIS MORNING. A FEW
SHORT-LIVED BANDS OF MODERATE RAINFALL DID OCCUR OVER PARTS OF
HAMILTON...SEQUATCHIE AND MARION COUNTIES THIS MORNING. THE BULK OF
THE MODERATE RAINFALL WAS OCCURRING OVER NORTHERN GA. 

BY AFTERNOON THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE AFFECTING PARTS OF THE
CAROLINAS TAKING THE RAIN EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. CLOUD COVER
WILL FROM THIS SYSTEM WILL GRADUALLY MOVE EAST TOO...HOWEVER THE
NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT OUR REGION WILL BE DIVING OUT OF THE MIDWEST.
THUS MORE CLOUDS WILL BE STREAMING IN ON THE HEELS OF THE EXITING
SYSTEM. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS REALLY BEGIN TO SATURATE AROUND 00Z WITH THE BEST
DYNAMICS COMING IN AROUND 06Z. TRIED TO PAINT THIS IN THE LATEST
GRID PACKAGE EXPANDING POPS FROM THE PLATEAU EARLY EVE AND THEN
SPREADING EASTWARD. LOWEST POPS WILL LIKELY BE PORTIONS OF SW VA
AND EXTREME NE TN. WHILE THE NAM IS THE DRIEST OF ALL THE MODEL
SOLUTIONS...IT STILL INDICATES AT LEAST A HUNDREDTH OF PRECIP WILL
OCCUR AT MANY LOCATIONS ACROSS E TN AND SW NC. THE SREF...GFS AND
ECMWF STILL KEEP WIDESPREAD RAIN ACROSS NEARLY THE ENTIRE AREA.
ANTICIPATED RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL REMAIN BELOW ONE QUARTER INCH.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER TROUGH TRACKING
THROUGH THE AREA BRINGING A CHANCE OF MAINLY RAIN ON WEDNESDAY.
COULD SEE LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
ON WEDNESDAY MORNING. THE DISTURBANCE EXITS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY
NIGHT SO WILL CONTINUE WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCE FOR THE EVENING
HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS WITH DRY WEATHER EXPECTED FOR THURSDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. A FRONT ENTERING THE AREA ON MONDAY PROVIDING THE

NEAR THE EXTREME SOUTHERN EXTENT OF THE APPALACHIANS ALONG THE 
ALABAMA/GEORGIA BORDER BY 12Z TUESDAY. THE PROBLEM WITH THIS SYSTEM 
IS IT WILL NOT HAVE ENOUGH MOISTURE AVAILABLE...ESPECIALLY AROUND 
85H AND BELOW...FOR PRECIPITATION PRODUCTION. IT LOOKS LIKE A LIGHT 
RAIN EVENT IMPACTING MAINLY SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA CLOSER TO THE BETTER LIFT AND HIGHER MEAN RELATIVE 
HUMIDITY. TIGHT POP GRADIENT PROGGED BY THE MODELS FROM SOUTH TO 
NORTH ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY LOOKS GOOD SO STAYED THE COURSE HERE 
WITH VERY LITTLE CHANCE OF MEASURABLE PRECIP ACROSS NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THE FEATURE MOVES AWAY FROM THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY TUESDAY WITH MUCH OF THE AREA DRY BY 
THE AFTERNOON. STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES 
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK SURFACE TROUGH 
REMAINS OVER THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY INTO WEDNESDAY. UPPER LOW 
SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD. PWATS AROUND .60 IN 
PLACE AS MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES INCREASE WITH FALLING MID LEVEL 
TEMPS. H50 TEMPS DROP TO NEAR -27C AS UPPER LOW SWINGS THROUGH EARLY 
WEDNESDAY. RAISED POPS EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHILE EXPECTING LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS. AVAILABLE RH IN THE SNOW GROWTH REGION BUT 
FREEZING LEVEL ONLY DROPS TO AROUND 3500 FEET ON WEDNESDAY BEFORE 
LOWERING BEHIND UPPER LOW WITH TAPERING OFF RH. SOME SNOW POSSIBLE 
ON THE RIDGE TOPS. LIGHT UPSLOPE SHOWERS CONTINUE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY MOVES EAST THROUGH THE AREA INTO THE 
WEEKEND. DRY CONDITIONS WITH LARGE DIURNAL TEMPERATURE RANGE CAN BE 
EXPECTED THROUGH SUNDAY. NEXT FRONT WITH A CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS 
PROGGED TO ARRIVE LATE MONDAY.

569 
FXUS64 KMRX 050850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST MON NOV 5 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING HAS
HELPED TEMPERATURES FALL INTO THE 30S ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION.
WILL CONTINUE THE FROST ADVISORY FOR THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
VALLEY AND THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU.

THERE WAS A POTENT SHORTWAVE SPINNING ACROSS NORTHWESTERN MISSOURI 
THIS MORNING. IN RESPONSE...HIGH CLOUDS WERE SPREADING ACROSS 
WESTERN KENTUCKY...NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND WESTERN TENNESSEE. DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN 
YESTERDAY. EXPECT CLOUDS TO INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH DIGS FARTHER SOUTH AND TRANSLATES OVER WEST TENNESSEE BY LATE 
THIS AFTERNOON. MODEL FORECASTS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT TAKING 
IT AS FAR SOUTH AS BIRMINGHAM. THE LIGHT RAIN THAT IS EXPECTED TO 
OCCUR OVER THE REGION SHOULD BE CONFINED TO AREAS GENERALLY SOUTH OF 
I-40. 

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY/...
A DEEPENING UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH NORTHERN ALABAMA/GEORGIA
WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE REGION
ON TUESDAY...PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
NORTH CAROLINA...WITH SOME ISOLATED ACTIVITY MORE LIKELY NORTH OF
THE I-40 CORRIDOR...PARTICULARLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AS PRECIP
CHANCES BEGIN TO WANE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. HOWEVER...A SECONDARY
UPPER-WAVE WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL GIVE THE AREA ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SOME
SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES OVERNIGHT...
BEFORE DIMINISHING AND BECOMING MORE CONFINED TO THE MOUNTAINS OF
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.

COOL CONDITIONS WILL ALSO PREVAIL THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AS 
HIGHS WILL PEAK INTO THE 40S AND 50S ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. 
HOWEVER...WARMER AND DRIER CONDITIONS WILL BEGIN BY THURSDAY AS 
THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT INCREASE IN RESPONSE TO AN
UPPER-RIDGE AXIS BUILDING INTO THE FORECAST AREA HEADING INTO
VETERANS DAY WEEKEND. HIGHS WILL RETURN TO THE 60S AREAWIDE BY
FRIDAY AND PERHAPS THE LOWER 70S ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ZONES BY THE
WEEKEND.

502 
FXUS64 KMRX 042032
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EST SUN NOV 4 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A NICE MIX OF SUNSHINE
HAS RETURNED ACROSS THE VALLEY COUNTIES AND SW NC THIS AFTERNOON.
MEANWHILE...LOW CLOUDS HAVE BEEN MUCH SLOWER TO ERODE OVER THE
FOOTHILLS...NRN PLATEAU AND NRN PARTS OF SW VA. THE CLOUDS AND SNOW
COVER OVER WISE COUNTY HAVE REALLY KEPT A LID ON MAX TEMP THERE.
LOW CLOUDS MAY FORM AGAIN TONIGHT ALONG WITH A SLIGHT INCREASE IN
HIGH CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. THUS...WILL RUN PARTLY TO
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVERNIGHT. CLOUDS AND LIGHT WINDS DON'T REALLY
FAVOR FOG OR FROST...BUT I ADDED PATCHY MENTION WHERE MIN TEMPS
FALL ENOUGH.

DRY FOR MONDAY WITH CLOUDS INCREASING BY LATE AFTERNOON. ANY
PRECIPITATION HOLDS OFF UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT...WITH NRN AREAS LOOKING
TO POSSIBLY MISS OUT FROM THE DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO OUR
WEST. I LOWERED POPS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN...AND MIDNIGHT SHIFT
MAY BE ABLE TO DROP POPS COMPLETELY OVER THESE AREAS FOR BOTH LATE
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. 

THE LIFT APPEARS TO BE ISENTROPIC WHICH WOULD BE MORE RAIN THAN
SHOWERS...BUT NOT A REAL SIGNIFICANT POINT...SO KEPT AS RAIN
SHOWERS IN MOST AREAS. OTHERWISE...MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE FOR THESE
PERIODS AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED...EXCEPT TO UNDERCUT HIGHS OVER WISE
COUNTY. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...FIRST PART OF THE
PERIOD DEEP EASTERN STATES LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL NEED TO EJECT A
HEALTHY AMOUNT OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE
EASTERN FEATURE. THEREFORE...POPS WILL REMAIN IN PLACE FROM TUESDAY
NIGHT THROUGH THE DAY WEDNESDAY AND POSSIBLY INTO THE EVENING HOURS
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NICE SHOT OF MOISTURE WITH THE SHORT WAVE SYSTEMS
AND NORTHWESTERLY UPSLOPE COMPONENT TO ENHANCE PRECIP IN THE
TERRAIN. LOOKS LIKE LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS WITH A SNOW SHOWER OR TWO
MIXED INTO THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS WELL
AS THE TENNESSEE-NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AS COLDER AIR SPILLS SOUTH
TOWARD WEDNESDAY MORNING AND CONTINUES THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING
BEHIND THE SLOWLY DEPARTING NORTHEASTERN U.S. STORM SYSTEM. IT
COULD BE A SLOW GO BUT EVENTUALLY A NICE BIG UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL
MAKE ITS WAY EAST THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK WITH THE RIDGE AXIS
OVER THE APPALACHIANS AROUND SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. SUBSIDENCE AND
DRYING IN THE RIDGE PATTERN COULD KEEP THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
PRECIP FREE AWAITING A FRONTAL SYSTEM DUE INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY.
ADJUSTED MEX MOS TEMPERATURES BACK SEVERAL DEGREES EARLY IN THE
FORECAST PERIOD WITH THE STRONG MID LATITUDE SYSTEM MAKING ONLY
SLOW PROGRESS AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 040854
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EST SUN NOV 4 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH HAS BROUGHT A WARM AND HUMID AIR
MASS INTO THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS LOW PRESSURE
AREA IS PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD INTO THE CAROLINAS TODAY...WITH
CLOUDS LIKELY LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE DAY
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM DUE TO AN UPPER- LEVEL SHORT WAVE DIGGING OVER
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS SHORT WAVE SHOULD GRADUALLY MOVE
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE EVENING HOURS...BUT ADDITIONAL
HIGH CLOUDS IN ADVANCE OF ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE
CENTRAL PLAINS WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA AFTER
MIDNIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER NUMBERS
WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY/...
THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WAS TO DIAGNOSE 
PRECIP CHANCES THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. AN 
INTENSIFYING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE PUSHING SOUTH FROM THE
MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO NORTHERN ALABAMA/GEORGIA BY 12Z
TUESDAY. INCREASED MOISTURE AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM AND THE ASSOCIATED
SYNOPTIC LIFT WILL PROVIDE THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME SCATTERED
SHOWERS FAVORING THE SOUTHERN ZONES MONDAY NIGHT AND THE MOUNTAIN
ZONES ON TUESDAY ALONG THE NORTHERN/WESTERN SIDE OF THE LOW AS IT
TRACKS SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. A SECONDARY UPPER-WAVE WILL THEN
DROP SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY...PROVIDING SOME ADDITIONAL LIFT FOR SOME LIGHT SHOWERS
AREAWIDE OVERNIGHT AND POTENTIALLY THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES...BEFORE CLEARING BEGINS TO OCCUR
FROM WEST TO EAST BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. IT SHOULD ALSO BE
NOTED THAT IT MAY BE COLD ENOUGH IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR SOME
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS TO MIX WITH THE RAIN OR CHANGE OVER TO ALL SNOW
LATE MONDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHTS...THOUGH MINOR TO NO ACCUMULATIONS
ARE EXPECTED. THEREAFTER...A WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR...ALONG WITH
CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS AS AN UPPER SUBTROPICAL RIDGE BUILDS BACK
INTO THE REGION THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND.

DROPPING INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE DEEP EASTERN U.S. LONG WAVE 
SYSTEM. PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT GRADUALLY TRANSITIONS TO 
WESTERLY AS A NICE AMPLIFIED RIDGE EXPANDS EAST TOWARD THE REGION. 
HAD TO ADJUST MEX MOS TEMPS BACK JUST A BIT THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
PERIOD WHICH APPEARS TO BE TOO OPTIMISTIC ON MODERATION WITH THE 
STRONG AND SLOW MOVING EASTERN U.S. STORM SYSTEM.

FXUS64 KMRX 030752

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT SAT NOV 3 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE OZARKS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED 
WARM FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHEAST ACROSS NORTHERN MS AND CENTRAL AL. 
THIS LOW PRESSURE AREA IS PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...WITH CLOUDS INCREASING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF IT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT THERE WILL BE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT FOR SOME SCATTERED 
SHOWERS TONIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION LIKELY POPS FOR MOST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY FOR TONIGHT...BUT FOR NOW...WILL NOT 
MENTION ANY THUNDER IN THE FORECAST SINCE THIS INSTABILITY IS WEAK 
AND THE GFS MODEL SOUNDINGS APPEAR FAIRLY STABLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
BUT WILL TREND A LITTLE WARMER THAN BOTH WHICH AS BEEN THE VERIFYING 
TREND LATELY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL 
MOVE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...DECREASING PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES ACROSS THE REGION FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. HAVE MAINTAINED 
CHANCE POPS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND I-40 SOUTH DURING THE MORNING... 
BEFORE DECREASING THEM FURTHER AND REMOVING THEM ENTIRELY FROM THE 
NORTHERN ZONES AFTER 18Z AS BOTH THE NAM AND THE GFS SHOW PRECIP 
BEGINNING TO WANE IN ALL EXCEPT THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES. COOLER AIR 
WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM...KEEPING HIGHS 
IN THE 50S TO LOW 60S FOR MOST OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. 

THEREAFTER...A DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE TROUGH WILL SWING FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER OPPORTUNITY FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS /AND 
SOME ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS IN THE SMOKIES LATE MONDAY NIGHT/ TO THE 
AREA DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE WEEK. THE EXACT TRACK IS A LITTLE 
DIFFERENT BETWEEN THE MODELS...WITH THE GFS SHOWING A SLIGHTLY MORE 
NORTHERN AND WETTER TRACK. HOWEVER...THE HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION WILL 
LIKELY MISS THE REGION TO THE SOUTHEAST AS THE STORM SYSTEM CRANKS 
UP EAST OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY. STILL...FELT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO 
INCREASE POPS TO LOW-END CHANCE AREAWIDE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS 
NORTHERN/WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE PRECIPITATION SHIELD WILL PASS OVER 
THE AREA. A SUBTROPICAL UPPER-RIDGE WILL THEN BUILD BACK INTO THE 
AREA FOR VETERANS DAY WEEKEND AND RESULT IN A GRADUAL WARMING TREND 
BACK INTO THE 60S TO PERHAPS 70 DEGREES IN SOME SPOTS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UNEVENTFUL WEATHER FOR

HOLDS OFF UNTIL SATURDAY NIGHT...THUS I WENT WITH OR A BIT ABOVE
GFS MOS FOR MAXES SATURDAY.

WEAK LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SATURDAY
THEN TRACKS E-SE ACROSS SRN PARTS OF TN AND NRN PARTS OF THE GULF
COAST STATES. A SWATH OF SHOWERS LOOKS GOOD AS PREVIOUSLY
ADVERTISED IN FORECAST GRIDS ON SATURDAY NIGHT. EVEN THE GFS MODEL
NOWS PUSHES THIS SYSTEM TO OUR SOUTH BY SUNDAY MORNING OR EARLY
AFTERNOON. THIS LED ME TO DROP POPS ACROSS NRN THIRD OF THE AREA BY
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. FAVORED THE MILDER GFS MOS MINS OR A BLEND FOR
SATURDAY NIGHT. SUNDAY MAXES LOOK GOOD WITH 40S TO LOWER 50S OVER
SW VA AND SEASONAL 60S ACROSS THE SRN AREAS.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A SHORT WAVE WILL BUILD 
SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES ACROSS THE NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THE PRECIPITATION SHIELD WILL BE MOVING 
AWAY SUNDAY EVENING WITH DRY ADVECTION AFTER MIDNIGHT AND SHORT WAVE 
RIDGING INTO MONDAY. BY MONDAY NIGHT MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE 
INCREASE AHEAD OF AN AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH. THE SYSTEM WILL DROP 
FAR ENOUGH SOUTH THAT CYCLOGENESIS WILL DEVELOP WELL SOUTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ACROSS THE GULF COASTAL REGION. THEREFORE...THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL BE ON THE NORTHERN AND WESTERN EDGE OF 
THE PRECIPITATION SHIELD. KEPT SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THIS 
SYSTEM AS MORE EXACT PLACEMENT OF SYNOPTIC LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE 
NOT YET IN FOCUS. ENOUGH COLD AIR WILL LIKELY FLOW INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA BEHIND THE SYSTEM FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SNOW SHOWERS IN 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. 
MAINTAINED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS THROUGH TUESDAY FOR RAIN 
SHOWERS WITH THE SYSTEM DEPARTING TUESDAY EVENING. THE PERIOD 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY APPEARS TO BE DRY AS A SLOW WARMING TREND 
DEVELOPS THE EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH GRADUALLY GIVES WAY TO AN 
EXPANDING RIDGE WITH ASSOCIATED WARM AIR ADVECTION. STAYED 
RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED.

OVER FAR EASTERN KENTUCKY...WITH A DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS LOW PRESSURE AREA IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE 
SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS MORNING... 
BRINGING A MID LEVEL CLOUD DECK OVER THE TAF SITES. OTHERWISE...HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND 
TONIGHT...BRINGING VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS.

474 
FXUS64 KMRX 020755
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT FRI NOV 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN INDIANA...WITH A 
DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS LOW PRESSURE AREA IS 
PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION THIS MORNING...BRINGING MAINLY JUST SOME CLOUDS 
FOR THE MORNING HOURS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD INTO THE REGION 
THIS AFTERNOON...BRINGING LIGHT WINDS AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
THROUGH TONIGHT. TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE 30S TONIGHT... 
WHICH MAY ALLOW SOME FROST TO DEVELOP IN THE VALLEYS TOWARDS 
SUNRISE. IT APPEARS THAT HIGH CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MAY MOVE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT IN THE NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT...SO WILL ONLY MENTION PATCHY FROST FOR NOW...AND WILL 
HOLD OFF ON ANY FROST ADVISORIES. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSING 
ALONG THE GULF COAST STATES WILL HELP TO PUSH A FRONT INTO THE AREA 
ON SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY...INCREASING CHANCES FOR SHOWERS BEGINNING 
LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING IN THE NORTHERN ZONES AND DROPPING 
SOUTHWARD OVERNIGHT THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE REGION...BEFORE 
FINALLY TAPERING OFF SOMETIME ON SUNDAY. THERE ARE STILL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE TIMING OF THE PRECIPITATION EXITING THE 
AREA...WITH THE NAM DRYING OFF SUNDAY MORNING AND THE GFS KEEPING 
SOME REASONABLE QPF SIGNALS THOUGH THE ENTIRE DAY. AS A RESULT... 
HAVE OPTED TO GO WITH HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS SATURDAY NIGHT IN MOST 
AREAS AND THEN CHANCE POPS IN MOST AREAS /EXCEPT THE FAR NORTHERN 
ZONES/ ON SUNDAY FOR NOW AND WILL WAIT FOR SLIGHTLY BETTER MODEL 
CONTINUITY BEFORE MAKING ANY OTHER CHANGES TO THIS PERIOD. 

THEREAFTER...AN UPPER TROUGH DRIVES SOUTHWARD FROM THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS INTO THE SOUTHEAST U.S. AND INTENSIFIES...BRINGING THE 
OPPORTUNITY FOR ADDITIONAL SHOWERS /AND SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS DURING EARLY TUESDAY MORNING/ MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY. GIVEN THE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS ON TIMING AND HOW 
FAR THE LOW WILL TRACK...HAVE OPTED TO KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
NOW. HOWEVER IF TRENDS CONTINUE...AN INCREASE IN POPS WILL BE 
WARRANTED DURING THE EARLY/MIDDLE PART OF THE WORK WEEK. 

COOL CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD...WITH HIGHS 
TOPPING OFF IN THE 50S TO LOW 60S FROM THE LATE WEEKEND THOUGH MOST 
OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. HOWEVER...A GRADUAL WARMING TREND IS 
EXPECTED BY NEXT WEEKEND AS AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS BUILDS OVERHEAD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 011841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EDT THU NOV 1 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...LOW CLOUDS JUST ABOUT ERODED 
OVER EXTREME NE PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. THIS 
REVEALS AN INTERESTING SNOW PATTERN ON VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS...WITH 
SNOW COVERING THE SMOKIES...HIGHEST TERRAIN OVER UNICOI/CARTER AND 
JOHNSON COUNTIES OF NE TN...AND ALSO OVER NWRN PARTS OF WISE COUNTY 
VA. 

STILL UNDER NW FLOW ALOFT ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE REMNANTS OF SANDY
WITH MODELS SHOWING A FAST MOVING DISTURBANCE TO DROP SE FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY...MOVING ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT. THIS 
WILL BRING INCREASING MID TO LOW CLOUDS TONIGHT...BUT NOT WORTH MORE 
THAN A MENTION OF SPRINKLES ACROSS SW VA COUNTIES. THESE CLOUDS AND 
SOME LIGHT WESTERLY WINDS SEEM MORE SUPPORTIVE OF THE MILDER GFS MOS 
MINS. 

SUNSHINE RETURNS ON FRIDAY WITH CLOUDS DECREASING FROM SW TO NE. A 
BIT BREEZY WITH SIMILAR MOS MAX TEMPS WHICH WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 
SRN AREAS AND OTHER AREAS WITH NO SNOW COVER SHOULD ACTUALLY WARM TO 
A COUPLE OF DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN SYSTEM DURING
THE EXTENDED FORECAST WILL BE A SOUTHERN AND NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-
WAVES MOVING ACROSS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY.
SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FOR LATE SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY PRODUCING HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY RAIN SHOWERS. MAIN FORCING WILL
BE ISENTROPIC LIFT AND FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG A WEAK FRONTAL
BOUNDARY. 

TIMING OF NORTHERN STREAM WAVE IS UNCERTAIN WITH DIFFERENCES
BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS. WILL GO WITH THE GFS...BUT
CONFIDENCE IS LOW. ALBERTA-LIKE SYSTEM WILL MOVE QUICKLY ACROSS THE
AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY PRODUCING A SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE OF
SHOWERS. LATEST MODEL RUNS ARE WARMER THAN YESTERDAY'S SO CHANCES
OF SNOW IS VERY LIMITED. MAIN FORCING IS Q-G FORCING AND ISENTROPIC
LIFT. 

FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...FORECAST AREA WILL BE UNDER DRY
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH SURFACR RIDING BUILDING INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY.

.DISCUSSION...GRIDS AND FORECAST PRODUCTS WERE GIVEN AN UPDATE WITH

BELOW. THIS RESULTED IN THE COLDEST TEMPS MAINLY OVER THE SRN HALF

NRN PLATEAU. COLDEST MINS NOTED SO FAR WERE 26 DEGREES AT DECATUR
27 AT TOWNSEND AND 28 AT ATHENS. SOME OTHER RURAL/OUTLYING AREAS
PROBABLY ALSO FELL BELOW 32 DEGREES...ALTHO 33 WAS OBSERVED AT BOTH
CHA AND TYS.

MUCH MILDER MINS OCCURRED OVER SW VA AND NE TN WHERE LOWS (OUTSIDE
OF SNOW COVERED AREAS) RANGED FROM THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S.

OTHERWISE...EXPECTING THE CLOUDS OVER THE NE TO GRADUALLY BREAK UP
AND GIVE WAY TO SOME DEGREE OF SUNSHINE. FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK.

THROUGH CENTRAL APPALACHIANS SATURDAY THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY. WEAK 
SURFACE LOW MOVES SE THROUGH SOUTHERN APPS SAT NIGHT. INCREASING 
CLOUDS SAT WITH CHANCE OF LIGHT SHOWERS SAT NGT THROUGH MONDAY 
MORNING. WEAKLY DEVELOPING UPPER LOW SWINGS THROUGH E TN VALLEY ON 
TUESDAY. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LIMITED WITH THIS FEATURE. MAY SEE 
VIRGA...LIGHT RAIN OR IN THE MOUNTAINS...SNOW SHOWERS. THEN 
COOL AND DRY THROUGH THE MID WEEK.

POSSIBLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SO THE FORECAST UPDATE WILL

705 
FXUS64 KMRX 311924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT WED OCT 31 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SHORT RANGE MODELS SUGGEST
ANOTHER SURGE OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO MOVE ACROSS SW VA AND
EXTREME NE TN OVERNIGHT...ALONG WITH ANOTHER SHOT OF VORTICITY AND
LINGERING LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW. SATELLITE PICS SUPPORT THIS
UPSTREAM...SO I INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND POPS ACROSS THESE AREAS
BUT KEPT POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY OR LOWER...AS ANY ADDITIONAL
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS LOOK TO BE MAINLY TRACE TO LESS THAN 1/2 INCH AT
BEST OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF RUSSELL AND WISE COUNTIES OF SW VA. 

THE FREEZE WATCH WAS UPGRADED TO A WARNING FOR ALL BUT NE TN...
WHERE LINGERING CLOUDS AND SOME WESTERLY WINDS SHOULD KEEP MINS IN
THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 30S. EXPECTING A BROAD AREA OF UPPER 20S TO
LOWER 30S ACROSS THE FREEZE WARNING AREA...WHERE FREEZING TEMPS HAD
YET TO OCCUR THIS FALL.

SOME FLURRIES ARE POSSIBLE BRIEFLY THURSDAY MORNING OVER SW VA AND
NE TIP OF TN. OTHERWISE...SUNSHINE RETURNING BUT MAX TEMPS WILL
LIKELY BE AFFECTED BY SNOW COVER OVER THE HIGHEST TERRAIN. MY MAX
TEMPS WERE CREATED TO REFLECT THIS DIFFERENCE...BUT MID SHIFT MAY
NEED TO ADJUST A BIT MORE. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT...ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS 
BRING AN AREA OF LOW CLOUDS BACK ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE...AND
THEN MOVE OUT OF THE AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON. SPRINKLES OR 
FLURRIES (HIGHER ELEVATIONS) POSSIBLE...OTHERWISE DRY.

UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS IN FOR SATURDAY WITH WARMER 
TEMPERATURES AND DRY CONDITIONS.

FOR SUNDAY...A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS 
THE AREA WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AREA-WIDE. LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED 
TO INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY...BUT TIMING AND STRENGTH OF WAVE ARE 
UNCERTAIN. FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...A NORTHERN STREAM SHORT TROUGH WILL 
DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS SYSTEM IS 
SIMILAR TO AN ALBERTA CLIPPER WITH DECENT Q-G FORCING AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM. AFTER TROUGH AXIS MOVES EAST...THEN NORTHWEST ORGOGRAPHIC 
FLOW WILL KICK-IN. TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR 
MOUNTAIN SNOWFALL. WENT A CAT OR SO COLDER THAN GUIDANCE MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY DUE TO THE COLD AIR ADVECTION AND PRECIPITATION.

CONDITIONS FOR A FEW MORE HOURS. ALSO...ANOTHER SURGE OF MOISTURE 
AND LIFT WILL PASS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN LATER TONIGHT...WITH MVFR 
RETURNING AT TRI AFTER MIDNIGHT. VFR FOR ALL 3 TAF SITES THURSDAY 
WITH SOME SLIGHTLY BREEZY SW-W WINDS.

MORNING ACROSS SW VA WITH SOME FLURRIES POSSIBLE AS WELL.

AND UPDATE GENERALLY ALL PRODUCTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
441 AM EDT WED OCT 31 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SATELLITE AND RADAR
FROM JKL AND MRX SHOWING NW FLOW SNOWFALL OVER SW VA AND TO A
LESSER EXTENT NE TN EARLY THIS WEDNESDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES THIS
MORNING NOT QUITE AS COLD ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA AND HAD
TO RAISE TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES FROM CURRENT GRIDDED
TEMPERATURES. LATEST SHORT RANGE MODELS KEEP SHORT WAVE ENERGY WITH
NW FLOW MOVING SOUTH INTO THE NE HALF OF THE AREA THIS MORNING AND
EARLY AFTERNOON AS THE REMNANT CIRCULATION OF SANDY CONTINUES OVER
THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES. THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM FINALLY SHIFTS
NORTH THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY DECREASE OVER
THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND
THEN START TO DECREASE TONIGHT. THE EXCEPTION BEING SW VA WHERE
SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE EVEN TONIGHT ESPECIALLY THE HIGH KNOB
AREA OF WISE COUNTY. HAVE DROPPED THE WINTER STORM WARNING AND KEPT
A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH THE AFTERNOON FOR LIGHT SNOW OF
1 TO POSSIBLY 3 MORE INCHES ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA
AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. WINDS WILL STAY UP DURING THE DAY TODAY
ACROSS THE NE HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH LARGE PRESSURE
DIFFERENCE FROM SURFACE LOW OVER EASTERN LAKES AND HIGH PRESSURE
LOWER MS VALLEY THROUGH THE CENTRAL STATES. HIGHS TODAY A FEW
DEGREES WARMER THAN TUESDAY BUT WENT BELOW GUIDANCE NE AND NEAR
NAM GUIDANCE SW. WIDE RANGE FROM 30S NE AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN
SNOW AND CLOUDS TO 50S SW IN THE SUN. AS PRESSURE GRADIENT RELAXES
TONIGHT AND SKIES CLEAR TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 30S LOWER
ELEVATIONS. THINK LOWS WILL BE NEAR TO BELOW FREEZING AND WITH
RECENT WARM WEATHER AND NO FREEZE YET AND EVEN A FROST IN MANY LOWER
ELEVATIONS OF EAST TN...ISSUED FREEZE WATCH TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FROM THE SW THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY. UPPER FLOW BACKS TO
ZONAL. DRY CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED WITH A SLOW WARMING TREND.
UPPER IMPULSE MOVES EAST THROUGH LOWER OH VALLEY SATURDAY BRINGING
SOME CLOUDS ACROSS THE NORTH. A SECOND STRONGER IMPULSE MOVES
THROUGH ON SUNDAY GETTING INTO THE UPPER TN VALLEY. INCREASING
CLOUDS WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS EARLY SUNDAY. WEAK SURFACE
REFLECTION MOVES THROUGH SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUNDAY NIGHT BUT
UPPER TROUGH AXIS REMAINS TO THE WEST. CHANCE POPS CONTINUE INTO
MONDAY. UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA THROUGH THE MID WEEK. TEMPS COOL
TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EDT TUE OCT 30 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE CENTER OF POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE 
SANDY ALONG THE OH/PA STATE LINE...WITH A COLD AIR MASS REMAINING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WIND SPEEDS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS HAVE 
BEEN DIMINISHING THIS EVENING...AND THEY SHOULD REMAIN BELOW WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA TONIGHT AS SANDY SLOWLY DRIFTS NORTHWARD. THUS... 
HAVE LET THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS EXPIRE THIS 
EVENING...AND HAVE REPLACED THE BLIZZARD WARNING FOR WISE COUNTY 
WITH A WINTER STORM WARNING. MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH SANDY WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...SO WILL LET THE 
WINTER STORM WARNINGS CONTINUE FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 
FEET WITH NO CHANGES TO THE FORECASTED SNOWFALL AMOUNTS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE AGAIN LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE SOME EVENING 
WORDING.

175 
FXUS64 KMRX 301933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EDT TUE OCT 30 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
THE LARGE/INTENSE UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM THAT IS THE REMNANTS OF
HURRICANE SANDY WILL CONTINUE TO IMPACT THE REGION OVERNIGHT...
PRODUCING MODERATE TO PERHAPS LOCALLY HEAVY SNOWFALL ACROSS THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE...AND
SOME GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS THROUGH THIS EVENING. IT HAS BEEN A
RECORD SETTING SNOWFALL FOR SOME LOCATIONS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AS
TOTALS BETWEEN 18-24+ INCHES HAVE BEEN REPORTED AT HIGH KNOB IN
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND AT MT LECONTE AND NEWFOUND GAP IN THE GREAT
SMOKY MOUNTAINS. OTHER LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR
NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE HAVE RECEIVED AROUND 3-6 INCHES...WITH SOME
SPOTS GETTING AS MUCH AS 6-12 INCHES ALONG THE SLIGHTLY HIGHER
ELEVATIONS BETWEEN 3000-4000 FEET.

THERE CONTINUES TO BE SOME BANDS OF GENERALLY LIGHT TO MODERATE
PRECIPITATION MOVING SOUTHWARD THROUGH EASTERN KENTUCKY AND INTO
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AND
THIS IS EXPECTED TO LINGER OVERNIGHT...THOUGH ITS COVERAGE AND
INTENSITY SHOULD WANE A BIT WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. STILL...AN ADDITIONAL 3-6 INCHES IS NOT OUT OF THE
QUESTION FOR THE AREA MOUNTAINS...ESPECIALLY THOSE LOCATIONS ABOVE
4000-5000 FEET...WITH ADDITIONAL LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE TO
AROUND 1500-2500 FT DEPENDING ON HOW LOW THE MELTING LEVEL DROPS
DOWN TO OVERNIGHT. GIVEN THAT THIS SNOWFALL HAS BEEN EXTREMELY
ELEVATION DEPENDENT...MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL EXPERIENCE LIGHT
TO LOCALIZED MODERATE BURSTS OF RAINFALL...AND RECEIVE NO SNOWFALL
ACCUMULATIONS. THUS...HAVE DECIDED TO CANCEL THE WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY FOR THE FOR NORTHERN ZONES GIVEN THE EXPECTED LACK OF
SNOWFALL POTENTIAL IN THIS AREA. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER
STORM WARNING THROUGH 12Z TOMORROW MORNING FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
AND THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND WILL KEEP THE WIND ADVISORY
THERE AS WELL THROUGH 00Z TONIGHT.

BY TOMORROW...SOME LINGERING LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER
TERRAIN ARE STILL EXPECTED...BUT ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE VER LIGHT AS
THIS STORM SYSTEM PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION. CLOUD COVER SHOULD
BEGIN TO BREAK UP SOMEWHAT AS WELL BY THE LATE AFTERNOON AS
TEMPERATURES WARM UP JUST A TAD AS WELL.

HOWEVER...IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THIS IS STILL A DANGEROUS
SITUATION IN THE WARNED AREA AS SOME SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL HAS
OCCURRED AND WILL CONTINUE ACCUMULATE OVERNIGHT...CREATING SOME
DANGEROUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS IN THOSE HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS...
PARTICULARLY AFTER SUNSET THIS EVENING. THOSE WITH TRAVEL PLANS
SHOULD CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE LATEST FORECAST INFORMATION AND BE
PREPARED FOR RAPIDLY CHANGING WEATHER CONDITIONS IN THE HIGHER
TERRAIN THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/... 
THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY
NIGHT...AND MOISTURE DEPTH WILL BE RAPIDLY DECREASING. WILL HAVE A
SLIGHT CHANCE POP NEAR OUR NORTHERN BORDER WEDNESDAY EVENING...WITH
ALL PRECIP OVER AROUND MIDNIGHT. LOW TEMPS THURSDAY MORNING MAY
DROP BELOW FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA...THE FIRST HARD FREEZE
FOR VALLEY LOCATIONS. BUILDING HEIGHTS ALOFT AND DRY ADVECTION WILL
PROVIDE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND GRADUALLY WARMING TEMPS FOR THURSDAY
THROUGH SATURDAY. HIGH TEMPS WILL REACH INTO THE 60S IN MOST SPOTS
BY SATURDAY.

MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON A CLOSED LOW TRACKING FROM THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS SATURDAY NIGHT TO NEW ENGLAND BY TUESDAY. THIS SYSTEM PUSHES 
A COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY NIGHT. THERE ARE SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE TIMING AMONG THE MODELS...AND THERE IS 
CONSIDERABLE SPREAD IN GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. WILL HAVE LOW TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY.

&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       34  52  31  56  36 /  20  10   0   0   0

276 
FXUS64 KMRX 301534 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1134 AM EDT TUE OCT 30 2012

.DISCUSSION...
THE LARGE/INTENSE UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM THAT IS THE REMNANTS OF
HURRICANE SANDY CONTINUES TO BARREL THROUGH THE CENTRAL
APPALACHIANS AND WILL PRODUCE IMPACTS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...BEFORE PULLING AWAY FROM
THE REGION BY TOMORROW. SOME VERY HEAVY SNOWFALL HAS ALREADY
OCCURRED ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE
EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS WHERE BETWEEN 12-18 INCHES HAS BEEN
REPORTED. SOME LOWER ELEVATION AREAS DOWN TO 2000-2500 FEET OR SO
HAVE RECEIVED SOME MEANINGFUL SNOWFALL AS WELL AROUND 3-6 INCHES
ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEASTERN
TENNESSEE...WITH WISE/NORTON RECEIVING 8 INCHES AS OF MID MORNING.

IT APPEARS AS THOUGH A TROWAL FEATURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THIS STORM
SYSTEM WILL GRADUALLY MOVE SOUTHWARD INTO THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES
TODAY...PROVIDING SOME ADDITIONAL LIFT FOR SOME LIGHT TO MODERATE
PRECIPITATION. THIS IS ALREADY BEING OBSERVED ON RADAR IN
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS SOME HEAVIER BANDS CONTINUE TO MOVE SOUTH
FROM WEST VIRGINIA AND EASTERN KENTUCKY. AS A RESULT...SOME LOCALLY
MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOWS ARE EXPECTED ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF
THE SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE WHERE AN ADDITIONAL 6-10
INCHES COULD ACCUMULATE ALONG THE HIGHEST PEAKS BY THIS EVENING.
THE SNOWFALL HAS BEEN VERY MUCH TIED TO THE MELTING LEVEL WHICH HAS
HELD STEADY AT 2200 FT OR SO OVERNIGHT AND INTO THIS MORNING.
THEREFORE...MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO EXPERIENCE LIGHT
RAIN SHOWERS AND LITTLE TO NO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. HOWEVER...SOME
WET BULB COOLING LATER TODAY/TONIGHT COULD RESULT IN THE MELTING
LEVEL DROPPING SOME...AND ALLOWING SOME ADDITIONAL AREAS TO PICK UP
A DUSTING TO MAYBE AN INCH OF SNOW IN THE ADVISORY AREAS ACROSS THE
FAR NORTHERN ZONES. MOST LOCATIONS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY...THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WILL RECEIVE
NO SNOWFALL HOWEVER.

A WINTER STORM WARNING WILL CONTINUE TO REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE THROUGH 12Z
WEDNESDAY. A WIND ADVISORY WILL ALSO REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR THESE
AREAS THROUGH 00Z THIS EVENING. THE WIND ADVISORY WAS CANCELLED FOR
THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA AS WINDS SHOULD BE WEAKER THAN
INITIALLY EXPECTED AND REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE DAY. 
 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
727 AM EDT TUE OCT 30 2012

.AVIATION...POWERFUL STORM SYSTEM PRESSURE CENTER WILL MOVE INTO PA 
TODAY AND TURN NORTH INTO W NY TONIGHT. STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT 
WILL KEEP BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS GOING THROUGH THE PERIOD. SW EXTENT 
OF DEEPER MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO THE TYS AREA AND GRADUALLY SHIFT 
NE LATE IN THE PERIOD. CHA WILL REMAIN VFR. TYS WILL REMAIN MVFR 
WITH LIGHT PRECIPITATION UNTIL AROUND 31/00Z. RAIN MAY MIX WITH SNOW 
AT TIMES. TRI WILL EXPERIENCE LOW MVFR CIGS WITH PERIODS OF IFR CIGS 
POSSIBLE. LIGHT RAIN WILL CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW IN THE MORNING HOURS. 
SNOW WILL CHANGE BACK TO RAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE THROUGH 
THE PERIOD. FREEZING LEVEL WILL SLANT DOWNWARD TOWARD THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM. CHA 3500 FEET TO TYS 3000 FEET TO AROUND 1000 FEET 
AT TRI. THE LEVELS WILL LIFT AT CHA THROUGH THE PERIOD BUT REMAIN 
NEARLY THE SAME AT TYS AND TRI.

824 
FXUS64 KMRX 300814
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EDT TUE OCT 30 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO ONGOING
FORECAST. LOW PRESSURE CENTER WILL MOVE TO NEAR PITTSBURGH TODAY AND
THEN TURN NORTH INTO W NY TONIGHT. EXTREME WEATHER WILL PEAK EARLY
TODAY ACROSS NORTHERN MRX CWA. STRONG NW LOW LEVEL WINDS BECOME
STRONGEST THIS AFTERNOON THEN BEGIN TO SLACKEN TONIGHT AS PRESSURE
GRADIENT RELAXES. SW EXTEND OF DEEP LAYER MOISTURE REACHES TO NEAR
CLEVELAND TN THIS AFTERNOON BEFORE RETREATING NE TONIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY. MID LEVEL SPEED MAX APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH PROVIDING
ADDITIONAL LIFT. THIS WILL ALSO DRAW TROWEL FEATURE DOWN INTO SW
VA THIS MORNING. HEAVY SNOWFALL REMAINS ON TRACK FOR SW VA AND THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NE TN AND THE SMOKIES. HOURLY RATES NEAR 2 INCHES
POSSIBLE. HEIGHT OF THE FREEZING LEVEL AND RELATED SURFACE FREEZING
TEMPS WAVER BUT LOWER TO NEAR 1000 FEET ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN
ELEVATION. THE SURFACE WET BULB ZERO SKIRTS ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS
OF TN TO NEAR TRI ...THEN DOWN THE FOOTHILLS TO NEAR CADES COVE.
AREAS NEAR THIS BOUNDARY STAND THE RISK OF SEEING ACCUMULATING
SNOWS. OTHER AREAS IN THE VALLEY DOWN TO KNOXVILLE WILL LIKELY SEE
SOME SNOW BUT ACCUMULATIONS APPEAR UNLIKELY AT THIS TIME. TONIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY SETS UP AS A DIMINISHING UPSLOPE EVENT. TEMPERATURE
PROFILE LOWERS BUT THE LAYER RH DROPS DRAMATICALLY EARLY WEDNESDAY.
NEAR FREEZING LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE COMMON IN THE VALLEYS LATE
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...DEEP CLOSED LOW
SLOWLY MOVES NORTH NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. FOR
THE FORECAST AREA SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD END WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT FLOW
FROM THE NORTHWEST BEHIND LOW AND UPPER TROUGH KEEPS THE REGION
COLD. CLEARING SKIES WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND LIGHTER WINDS WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO DROP ONCE AGAIN INTO THE 20S MOUNTAINS AND LOWER TO
MID 30S ELSEWHERE. THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY AREAS WILL
LIKELY SEE THERE FIRST FROST AND FREEZE IN COLDER SPOTS. WILL
HIGHLIGHT IN HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. A FEW CLOUDS SW VA AND NE
TN THURSDAY MORNING OTHERWISE SKIES SHOULD BE CLEAR. NW FLOW TO
KEEP TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE. NE AREAS AND
MOUNTAINS POSSIBLY SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER WITH SNOW COVER. IN THE
NE AND MOUNTAINS HIGHS ONLY IN THE 40S OTHERWISE MOSTLY 50S TO
LOWER 60S NEAR CHATTANOOGA. HIGHS FRIDAY SIMILAR THURSDAY TO
SLIGHTLY WARMER WITH COLD CANADIAN AIR STILL AFFECTING THE REGION.
MORE PRONOUNCED WARMING ON THE WEEKEND AS RIDGING ALOFT AND SURFACE
HIGH SHIFTING EAST. HIGHS MOSTLY FROM THE MID 50S TO THE MID 60S. 
RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN SUNDAY AS COLD FRONT APPROACHES. GFS
SLOWER THAN ECMWF WITH RAIN POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE CENTER OF POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE 
SANDY OVER SOUTHERN NEW JERSEY...WITH A COLD AIR MASS LINGERING OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. A STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BETWEEN SANDY AND A LARGE DOME OF HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...BUT WIND SPEEDS 
HAVE BEEN BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA THIS EVENING IN THE GREAT TN 
VALLEY. WITH THE CENTER OF SANDY EXPECTED TO MOVE WEST-SOUTHWEST TO 
THE PANHANDLE OF MARYLAND BY SUNRISE...WILL CONTINUE THE WIND 
ADVISORIES OVERNIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME HIGHER 
WIND GUSTS TOWARDS SUNRISE. EARLIER REPORTS FROM THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS HAVE ALREADY INDICATED THAT 4 TO 10 INCHES OF SNOW HAS 
ACCUMULATED ABOVE 2500 FEET. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER WX 
WARNINGS/ADVISORIES WITH THE SAME FORECASTED AMOUNTS...SINCE DEEPER 
MOISTURE IS EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AS 
SANDY GETS A LITTLE CLOSER.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE SOME EVENING WORDING.
&&

312 
FXUS64 KMRX 292350
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
750 PM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.AVIATION...POWERFUL STORM SYSTEM PRESSURE CENTER APPEARS TO BE
BUILDING OVER THE NEW JERSEY COAST AT THIS TIME AND LIFT HAS BEEN
GRADUALLY STRENGTHENING ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION WITH LIGHT RAIN TRYING TO MIX WITH LIGHT SNOW NEAR THE TN/VA
BORDER IN THE VICINITY OF TRI. THEREFORE...APPLIED A LIGHT MIXED
PRECIP HERE FOR SEVERAL HOURS. LIGHT SNOW WILL BE MORE LIKELY
LATER TONIGHT WITH VSBY IN THE HIGH END RANGE OF MVFR. EXPECT VERY
LIGHT RAIN TO MIX WITH A FEW FLAKES OF SNOW AT TYS TOWARD DAYBREAK
AS LIFT STRENGTHENS AND MOISTURE IN THE ATMOSPHERIC COLUMN DEEPENS.
IT WILL BE DURING THIS PERIOD (APPROXIMATELY 12Z-20Z) WHEN FLIGHT
CONDITIONS SHOULD BE AT THEIR LOWEST AT BOTH TRI AND TYS. EXPECT A
MIXTURE OF LIGHT SNOW AND RAIN AT TRI THROUGH ABOUT MID DAY BEFORE
TRANSITIONING BACK TO ONLY RAIN. THIS SHOULD HAPPEN MUCH EARLIER AT
TYS. THE OTHER FEATURE TO BE AWARE OF WILL BE THE HEALTHY WESTERLY
FLOW AT AROUND 15-18 KNOTS WITH GUSTS AROUND 20-30 KNOTS DURING THE
HEIGHT OF THE STORM AROUND 12-20Z.

&&

711 
FXUS64 KMRX 291912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.SHORT TERM...
AN INTENSIFYING UPPER-LEVEL LOW HAS PUSHED SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND IS BEGINNING TO INTERACT WITH LANDFALLING
HURRICANE SANDY ACROSS THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. BOTH OF THESE
SYSTEMS WILL MORPH INTO ONE LARGE...INTENSE UPPER-LEVER STORM
SYSTEM THAT WILL IMPACT THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR THE
NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. THROUGHOUT LAST NIGHT INTO TODAY...LIGHT
RAIN/SNOW HAS FALLEN ACROSS THE NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA...WITH SOME MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVIER BURSTS OF
SNOWFALL OCCURRING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS...PARTICULARLY
THOSE ABOVE 5000 FT WHERE REPORTS OF AROUND HALF A FOOT OF SNOW
LOCALLY AT HIGH KNOB...NEWFOUND GAP AND MT LECONTE HAVE ALREADY
BEEN REPORTED. THIS POINTS TO THE POTENTIAL FOR EVEN GREATER
SNOWFALL IN THESE AREAS THAN EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS
AFTER A PLUME OF DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE ARRIVES LATER THIS EVENING
INTO TUESDAY.

THERE ARE A COUPLE OF FEATURES OF NOTE THAT MAKE THIS EVENT 
DIFFERENT FROM A TYPICAL NORTHWEST FLOW CASE IN THAT THERE WILL BE A
PLUME OF DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION THAT WILL
INTERACT WITH THE COLD AIRMASS IN PLACE. THIS...COMBINED WITH SOME
UPPER-LEVEL SYNOPTIC LIFT FROM A TROWAL FEATURE ROTATING AROUND THE
BACKSIDE OF THE SYSTEM AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL RESULT IN THE
POTENTIAL FOR SOME VERY HEAVY SNOWFALL ACROSS THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS...PARTICULARLY TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS MOISTURE/LIFT
REALLY RAMPS UP. IT SHOULD ALSO BE NOTED THAT MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE
TRENDING COLDER IN THE VALLEY LOCATIONS...WHICH WOULD RESULT IN A
GREATER POTENTIAL FOR ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS
ACROSS FAR NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND ALONG NORTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE PLATEAU AS WELL /ESPECIALLY WITH WET-BULB COOLING TAKING PLACE
AS IT STARTS TO PRECIPITATE/. GIVEN ALL THIS...HAVE OPTED TO
MAINTAIN THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY ACROSS THE FAR NORTHERN AND
NORTHEAST ZONES THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY GIVEN THE POTENTIAL FOR 1-2
INCHES OF SNOW /WITH SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS/ ACROSS THESE
AREAS.

THE BIG CONCERN WILL BE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE HEAVY 
SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE...PARTICULARLY ABOVE 3000 FT WHERE BETWEEN
4-12 INCHES COULD ACCUMULATE...WITH EVEN HIGHER AMOUNTS FURTHER UP
INTO THE 4000-6000 FT RANGE WHERE BETWEEN 1-2+ FEET IS NOT OUT OF
THE QUESTION. SOME OF THE TALLEST PEAKS IN THE SMOKIES MAY APPROACH
30 INCHES BEFORE THINGS TAPER OFF ON WEDNESDAY AS THE STORM SYSTEM
MOVES TO THE NORTH. GIVEN ALL THIS...WILL STICK WITH THE WINTER
STORM WARNING FOR ALL OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE EAST TENNESSEE
MOUNTAINS THROUGH 12Z WEDNESDAY.

A TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT OVERNIGHT WILL PRODUCE NORTHWEST 
WINDS IN THE ADVISORY RANGE BEGINNING TONIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH 
TUESDAY. VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL BE TOWARD THE LOW END OF THE ADVISORY 
RANGE (20-30 MPH)...WITH ELEVATIONS AT OR ABOVE 3000 FT NEAR THE 
HIGH END (35-40 MPH). WITH THIS AMOUNT OF WIND AND SNOWFALL...
BLIZZARD CONDITIONS APPEAR LIKELY...ESPECIALLY ON HIGH KNOB IN WISE
COUNTY. WILL CHANGE WISE TO A BZ.W. FOR THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS...
WILL MENTION BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE AT TIMES IN THE WARNING
WORDING...BUT KEEP AS A WS.W FOR THE SAKE OF CONTINUITY WITH
EASTERN NEIGHBORS.

IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THIS IS A RARE AND DANGEROUS SITUATION FOR
THOSE ACROSS THE WARNED AREAS...WITH DANGEROUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS
AND POWER OUTAGES EXPECTED. PLEASE STAY AWARE OF THIS RAPIDLY
EVOLVING EVENT AND THE LATEST FORECAST INFORMATION FROM THE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE.

.LONG TERM...
MAY BE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS OR RAIN SHOWERS LINGERING OVER THE
NORTHEAST INTO WED NIGHT AS BIG SYSTEM PULLS AWAY. WILL ONLY CARRY
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FAR NORTHEAST ZONES. NAM IS BRINGING SOME PRECIP
THU WITH A FAST MOVING WAVE COMING DOWN IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW.
GIVEN LACK OF SUPPORT FROM OTHER MODELS/ENSEMBLES...WILL JUST BEEF
UP CLOUDS A BIT FOR THU AND KEEP THINGS DRY. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN
FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH DRY AND WARMING CONDITIONS FOR FRIDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. A COLD EXPECTED TO APPROACH BY MONDAY...SO WILL
CARRY A CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST.

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
135 PM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.AVIATION...
EAST TN WILL BE ON THE FRINGES OF THE MASSIVE EAST COAST STORM
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. WINDS OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS HAVE REMAINED
RELATIVELY GUST-FREE AT TYS AND TRI DUE TO OVERCAST CLOUD
COVER...WITH CHA SEEING SOME GUSTS FROM MIXING WITH SUNSHINE.
EXPECT THIS TREND TO CONTINUE THROUGH SUNSET. CLOUDS AT TRI SHOULD
BE PREDOMINANTLY MVFR...WTIH VFR CEILINGS AT TYS OVERNIGHT. PRECIP
WILL MOVE INTO TRI THIS EVENING...CHANGING TO SNOW AFTER MIDNIGHT.
THIS WILL LOWER VIS TO IFR AT TIMES. WINDS SHOULD BECOME GUSTY
AFTER SUNRISE TOMORROW AS THE STRONG LOW PRESSURE CENTER TRACKS
FARTHER INLAND.

067 
FXUS64 KMRX 291441 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1041 AM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A RARE EARLY SEASON WINTER WEATHER STORM IS BEGINNING TO COME
TOGETHER ACROSS THE EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MOUNTAINS
THIS MORNING. AN INTENSIFYING UPPER-LOW HAS MOVED SOUTHWARD OVER THE
REGION AND WILL BEGIN TO INTERACT WITH LANDFALLING HURRICANE SANDY
LATER TODAY ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. LIGHT
PRECIPITATION CONTINUES TO FALL ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...GENERALLY HUGGING THE HIGHER
TERRAIN...WHERE TEMPERATURES ABOVE 2500-3000 FT ARE AT OR BELOW
FREEZING AND HAVE BEEN RECEIVING LIGHT TO MODERATE BURSTS OF
SNOWFALL SINCE LATE YESTERDAY EVENING. INCREDIBLY...BEFORE THE DEEP
MOISTURE FROM SANDY HAS EVEN ARRIVED...WE HAVE RECEIVED REPORTS OF
4-5 INCHES OF SNOW AT NEWFOUND GAP IN GSMNP AND AT HIGH KNOB IN
WISE COUNTY VA AS OF 10 AM EDT. WHILE THESE AMOUNTS ARE VERY
LOCALIZED AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...IT POINTS TO THE POTENTIAL FOR
EVEN GREATER SNOWFALL IN THESE AREAS THAN EXPECTED FOR LATER THIS
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT WHEN THE DEEP MOISTURE FINALLY DOES ARRIVE.

FOR TODAY THOUGH...CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED LIGHT PRECIPITATION
WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE MUCH OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA...AND ALONG THE SPINE OF THE SMOKIES. LATE IN THE
AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING THIS PRECIPITATION COULD BECOME MORE
WIDESPREAD AS LIFT/MOISTURE INCREASES. ADDITIONALLY...IT SHOULD BE
NOTED THAT THE NAM-12 ALONG WITH THE GFS ARE NOW TRENDING SLIGHTLY
COLDER IN THE VALLEYS...WHICH MAY ALLOW /ESPECIALLY WITH WET-BULB
COOLING OCCURRING/...FOR SOME SNOW TO MIX WITH THE RAIN EARLIER
THAN ANTICIPATED IN SOME OF THE LOWER ELEVATIONS AROUND 1500-2000
FT. HOWEVER...MOST/ALL OF THE ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL TODAY SHOULD BE
CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE AN ADDITIONAL 2-3 INCHES
CANNOT BE RULED OUT IN SOME SPOTS BEFORE 00Z. MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS
WILL EXPERIENCE ALL RAIN...ESPECIALLY ALONG AND SOUTHWEST OF THE
I-26 CORRIDOR WHERE HIGHS WILL BE SLIGHTLY WARMER IN THE UPPER 30S
TO MID/UPPER 40S IN THE KNOXVILLE METRO AREA. ELSEWHERE... ACROSS
FAR SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU...DRIER AIR
WILL PROMOTE SUNNY CONDITIONS AND WARMER TEMPS IN THE 50S.

ADDITIONALLY...THE STRONG GRADIENT WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS STORM
SYSTEM WILL CREATE BREEZY CONDITIONS TODAY...AND SOME PRETTY GUSTY
WINDS ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THUS...GIVEN ALL THE FACTORS
MENTIONED ABOVE WILL OBVIOUSLY MAINTAIN A WINTER STORM WARNING FOR
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE...ALONG WITH THE
WIND ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA AS WELL.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
728 AM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.AVIATION...HURRICANE SANDY WILL COMPLETE A NORTHWEST TURN INTO
THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH
MOISTURE AND LIFT INCREASING ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN SEABOARD
EXTENDING INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. BECAUSE THE
TREMENDOUS GRADIENT IN MOISTURE ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...FLIGHT
CONDITIONS AT CHA SHOULD BE VFR THROUGHOUT. MVFR CEILINGS AT TYS
WITH SOME DETERIORATION TOWARD THE END OF THE FORECAST WITH DRIZZLE
AND RAIN. TRI WOULD EXPECT MVFR AND POSSIBLY IFR FLIGHT CONDITIONS
WITH VSBY DROPPING IN RAIN WITH A FEW FLAKES MIXED IN AT TIMES.
HEAVY SNOW IS POSSIBLE LATE IN THE PERIOD IN AND AROUND TRI.
STRONG NW WINDS THROUGH THE PERIOD. HIGHER GUSTS DURING THE DAY.
FREEZING LEVEL NEAR 2500 FEET TODAY DROPS TO NEAR 2000 FEET
TONIGHT. FZLVL WILL DROP TO NEAR 1000 FEET AT TRI LATE.

605 
FXUS64 KMRX 291026
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
626 AM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.DISCUSSION...CORRECTION TO CHANGE END TIME OF WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY FOR PORTIONS OF NE TN. 

SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE
REGION WILL CONTINUE TO TIGHTEN THROUGH THE PERIOD AS SANDY MOVES
TO SE PA BY TUE. STRONG NW WINDS WILL PERSIST. COLD AIR ADVECTION
WILL ALSO CONTINUE AND PEAK AROUND -4C AT H85 ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA. MOISTURE GRADIENT WILL BE TIGHT SO SW EXTENT OF PRECIPITATION
WILL BE SHARP. FREEZING LEVEL HOLDS STEADY AROUND 2500 FEET TODAY
BUT DROPS TO BELOW 2000 FEET TONIGHT. THIS IS WHEN DEEPEST MOISTURE
IS EXPECTED. THE LEAN THICKNESS OF THE WARM LAYER WILL NOT ALLOW
FOR MUCH MELTING OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS. ADVISORY ISSUED TONIGHT AND
TUESDAY FOR NE TN AND N PLATEAU. ACTUAL ACCUMULATIONS REMAIN IS
QUESTION BUT PERIOD OF HEAVY WET SNOW WILL BE LONG. WENT BELOW MOS
TEMP GUIDANCE. VALLEY WIND CHILLS WILL BE IN THE 20 TONIGHT AND IN
THE 30S FOR MUCH OF TUESDAY.

LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WINTER STORM WILL BE
WINDING DOWN ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WILL
CONTINUE TO SEE SOME ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A FEW
LINGERING LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND THE EAST
TN MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY. ANY ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS ON
WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE LESS THAN AN INCH. WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO
DIMINISH ACROSS THE AREA AS WELL AS THE UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY FROM
THE REGION. IMPROVING CONDITIONS THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED
WITH PRECIP AND BREEZY WINDS ENDING AND A DRYING AND WARMING TREND
EXPECTED THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 290754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE 
REGION WILL CONTINUE TO TIGHTEN THROUGH THE PERIOD AS SANDY MOVES TO 
SE PA BY TUE. STRONG NW WINDS WILL PERSIST. COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL 
ALSO CONTINUE AND PEAK AROUND -4C AT H85 ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. 
MOISTURE GRADIENT WILL BE TIGHT SO SW EXTENT OF PRECIPITATION WILL 
BE SHARP. FREEZING LEVEL HOLDS STEADY AROUND 2500 FEET TODAY BUT 
DROPS TO BELOW 2000 FEET TONIGHT. THIS IS WHEN DEEPEST MOISTURE IS 
EXPECTED. THE LEAN THICKNESS OF THE WARM LAYER WILL NOT ALLOW FOR 
MUCH MELTING OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS. ADVISORY ISSUED TONIGHT AND 
TUESDAY FOR NE TN AND N PLATEAU. ACTUAL ACCUMULATIONS REMAIN IS 
QUESTION BUT PERIOD OF HEAVY WET SNOW WILL BE LONG. WENT BELOW MOS 
TEMP GUIDANCE. VALLEY WIND CHILLS WILL BE IN THE 20 TONIGHT AND IN 
THE 30S FOR MUCH OF TUESDAY.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...WINTER STORM WILL BE 
WINDING DOWN ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  WILL 
CONTINUE TO SEE SOME ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL TUESDAY NIGHT WITH A FEW 
LINGERING LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND THE EAST 
TN MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY.  ANY ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS ON 
WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE LESS THAN AN INCH.  WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO 
DIMINISH ACROSS THE AREA AS WELL AS THE UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY FROM 
THE REGION.  IMPROVING CONDITIONS THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED 
WITH PRECIP AND BREEZY WINDS ENDING AND A DRYING AND WARMING TREND 
EXPECTED THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

139 AM EDT MON OCT 29 2012

.AVIATION...HURRICANE SANDY WILL COMPLETE A NORTHWEST TURN INTO
THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH
MOISTURE AND LIFT INCREASING ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN SEABOARD
EXTENDING INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. BECAUSE THE
TREMENDOUS GRADIENT IN MOISTURE ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...FLIGHT
CONDITIONS AT CHA SHOULD BE VFR THROUGHOUT. MVFR CEILINGS AT TYS
WITH SOME DETERIORATION TOWARD THE END OF THE FORECAST WITH DRIZZLE
AND RAIN. TRI WOULD EXPECT MVFR AND POSSIBLY IFR FLIGHT CONDITIONS
WITH VSBY DROPPING IN RAIN (WITH A FEW FLAKES MIXED IN AT TIMES)
ESPECIALLY LATE IN THE PERIOD. STRONG NW WINDS THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
HIGHER GUSTS DURING THE DAY. FREEZING LEVEL NEAR 2500 FEET TODAY
DROPS TO NEAR 2000 FEET TONIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT SUN OCT 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH HURRICANE 
SANDY LOCATED IN THE WESTERN ATLANTIC AROUND 280 MILES EAST OF THE 
NC OUTERBANKS. A STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA BETWEEN SANDY AND A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY 
FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. MODELS AGREE THAT A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL LINGER OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT...WHICH WILL LIKELY CONTINUE TO GENERATE 
PRECIP OVER THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...AND 
WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

.AVIATION...HURRICANE SANDY WILL COMPLETE A NORTHWEST TURN INTO THE

TENNESSEE...FLIGHT CONDITIONS AT CHA SHOULD BE VFR THROUGHOUT.
APPLIED NEAR MVFR CEILINGS AT TYS WITH SOME DETERIORATION TOWARD
THE END OF THE FORECAST AS THE MAIN AREA OF LIFT FROM THE STORM
SYSTEM BUILDS WEST INTO THE REGION. ASIDE FROM A BRIEF PERIOD OF
VFR CEILINGS AROUND TRI THIS EVENING WOULD EXPECT MVFR AND POSSIBLY
IFR FLIGHT CONDITIONS HERE WITH VSBY DROPPING IN RAIN (WITH A FEW
FLAKES MIXED IN AT TIMES) DURING THE DAY MONDAY.

DIFFICULT FORECAST AS LOOKING LIKE SIGNIFICANT SNOW AND WIND...BUT
VERY ELEVATION DEPENDENT AS LOWER ELEVATIONS WILL BE MAINLY RAIN
AND NOT AS WINDY. MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT IN HANDLING
SANDY...AND IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH OFFICIAL FORECAST SO WILL LEAN
TOWARD A GFS/NAM BLEND. SHOULD SEE SOME SNOW STARTING TONIGHT OVER
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND E TN. SHOULD NOT BE THAT
SIGNIFICANT EARLY ON...BUT TO KEEP THINGS SIMPLE WILL START WINTER
STORM WARNING TONIGHT AT MIDNIGHT. LOOKS LIKE SIGNIFICANT SNOW
POSSIBLE FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ESPECIALLY MONDAY AFTERNOON
THROUGH TUESDAY. WINDS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SHOULD BE STRONG
AND GUSTY SO WILL ISSUE WIND ADVISORY FOR SW VA AND E TN AS WELL AS
SW NC. WILL KEEP FREEZE WARNING FOR HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS...BUT
WILL CANCEL FROST ADVISORY AS SHOULD BE TOO WINDY/CLOUDY FOR FROST
AND EXPECT TEMPS TO STAY MAINLY IN THE UPPER 30S IN VALLEY
LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY/...
SOME LINGERING RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY
AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES FROM SOME WRAP
AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE DEPARTING LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC. MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
FAIRLY LIGHT...WITH ANY MINOR SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS STAYING
CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THEREAFTER...THE FORECAST
BECOMES FAIRLY BENIGN AS A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE
WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO ON THURSDAY GRADUALLY MOVES EAST AND BUILDS
INTO THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL PROVIDE DRY CONDITIONS
ACROSS THE AREA AS SKIES CLEAR...ALONG WITH SOME WARMER
TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO THE MONTH OF NOVEMBER. BY THE WEEKEND A
RETURN TO THE MID TO UPPER 60S LOOKS POSSIBLE IN MANY AREAS...WITH
LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FINALLY RETURNING TO THE UPPER
50S TO AROUND 60 DEGREES.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1106 AM EDT SUN OCT 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...
MADE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FORECAST...MAINLY TO POPS TO ACCOUNT
FOR THE BROAD AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN GRADUALLY MOVING TO
THE NORTH AND EAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND EASTERN ZONES TODAY. IN
GENERAL...THESE SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO WANE FROM WEST TO EAST
THROUGHOUT THE DAY...AND BY 18Z THE HEAVIEST ACTIVITY SHOULD MAINLY
BE CONFINED TO NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.
HOWEVER...A REASONABLE CHANCE FOR SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS WILL
CERTAINLY EXIST ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGHOUT THE
REMAINDER OF THE DAY. WINDS WILL ALSO BECOME BREEZY AT TIMES DURING
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS A STRENGTHENING UPPER-TROUGH CONTINUES
TO SLIDE SOUTHWARD INTO THE REGION FROM THE OHIO VALLEY.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN FAIRLY CONSTANT IN THE UPPER 40S TO
LOWER 50S THROUGHOUT THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY GIVEN THE DENSE CLOUD
COVER AND SCATTERED PRECIPITATION OCCURRING.

723 AM EDT SUN OCT 28 2012

.AVIATION...UPPER SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE NE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY.
THIS FEATURE WILL PROVIDE SUFFICIENT LIFT TO PRODUCE ONGOING LIGHT
PRECIPITATION FOR MUCH OF TODAY. LOW MVFR CIGS WILL DOMINATE.
BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS WILL PREVAIL. FREEZING LEVEL WILL FALL TO
3500-4000 FEET BY 29/00Z. THE NONE SURFACE FZLVL WILL CONTINUE TO
LOWER OVERNIGHT TO BETWEEN 1800 AND 2500 FEET.

658 
FXUS64 KMRX 280824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EDT SUN OCT 28 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HURRICANE SANDY WILL MOVE NORTH 
OFFSHORE THE MID ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH THE PERIOD. LOW LEVEL 
NORTHERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE UP TO 400 MB THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
SURFACE TO H85 FLOW WILL BECOME NWRLY AND INCREASE THROUGH THE 
PERIOD. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS SHIFT NE THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. 
THIS WILL PROVIDE SOME LIFT FOR REINFORCED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
TODAY. TEMPERATURES WILL HAVE SMALL DIURNAL RANGE AND BE ABOUT 10 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. AS TROUGH AXIS SWINGS NE H85-H70 LAYER 
MOISTURE DROPS OFF. LIGHT RA AND DRIZZLE CONTINUES OVERNIGHT MAINLY 
ACROSS NE AREAS. FREEZING LEVEL DROPS FROM THE WEST TO NEAR SURFACE 
TO AROUND 2500 FEET. SOME WINTRY MIX AND SNOW POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF SW VA/E TN TONIGHT. LATE NIGHT TEMP DROPS WILL 
BE IN THE LOWER TO MID 30S ACROSS THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. SOME FROST 
AND FREEZE AREAS ARE POSSIBLE. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO 
INCREASE WITH THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS MEETING HIGH WIND WARNING 
CRITERIA ON MONDAY AND ADVISORY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF 
MRX CWA. COLD AIR ADVECTION PERSISTS WITH FREEZING LEVEL ONLY 
BUMPING UP TO AROUND 2500 FEET. RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS FAVOR NE AND 
MAINLY UPSLOPE AREAS MONDAY. HIGHER RH VALUES ARE BELOW SNOW GROWTH 
REGION. WIND CHILL READINGS WILL BE IN THE 30S MUCH OF MONDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAJOR WEATHER SYSTEM 
STILL ON TRACK TO EFFECT THE AREA DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE 
EXTENDED.  FIRST CONCERN IS WINDS.  A VERY STRONG WIND FIELD WILL 
DEVELOP OVER THE AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY.  
WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA WILL LIKELY DEVELOP OVER MUCH OF THE VALLEY 
LOCATIONS WITH HIGH WIND WARNING CRITERIA MET AT HIGH ELEVATIONS... 
WIND GUSTS POSSIBLY REACHING 50 TO 60 MPH AT THE HIGHEST POINTS.  
THEN...MUCH COOLER AIR MOVING IN WILL ALLOW OVERNIGHT LOWS TO FALL 
TO THE FREEZING MARK OR LOWER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN AND 
THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND MID 30S ACROSS THE REST OF THE MRX CWA.  THE 
COLD COMBINED WITH THE WINDS WILL PRODUCE WINDS CHILLS IN THE TEENS 
ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN.  FINALLY...WITH THE INTRODUCTION OF 
SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF SANDY MOVING IN...EXPECT 
SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS TO CHANGE OVER TO SNOW BY MONDAY NIGHT.  
THERE DOES REMAIN SOME QUESTION ON EXACT TRACK OF THE REMNANTS OF 
SANDY BUT MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THE DEEP MOISTURE WILL REACH INTO 
THE AREA.  THIS COMBINED WITH THE STRONG UPSLOPE FLOW WILL ALLOW FOR 
THE POTENTIAL OF A SIGNIFICANT SNOW EVENT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND 
THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN.  A WINTER WEATHER WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FOR 
THE EFFECTED AREAS.  MOISTURE WILL BE MORE LIMITED ACROSS THE LOWER 
ELEVATION OF THE TN VALLEY AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THIS ALONG 
WITH THE WARM GROUND SHOULD ALLOW FOR LITTLE TO NO SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THOSE LOCATIONS.  THE SYSTEM SHOULD PULL AWAY FROM 
THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY ALLOWING FOR IMPROVING CONDITIONS WITH A 
DRYING AND WARMING TREND FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.



&&

.AVIATION...FLIGHT CONDITIONS WILL BE PREDOMINANTLY MVFR THROUGH

438 
FXUS64 KMRX 280051
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
850 PM EDT SAT OCT 27 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
GENERALLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH HURRICANE SANDY 
LOCATED OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC OFF THE GA/SC COAST. A STRONG 
PRESSURE GRADIENT EXISTS OVER THE FORECAST AREA BETWEEN SANDY AND A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. 
REPORTS FROM THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THIS EVENING INDICATE THAT BREEZY 
WINDS WERE OCCURRING...AND THINK THAT THIS PRESSURE GRADIENT SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO CREATE BREEZY WINDS OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO 
MENTION STRONGER WINDS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATION ZONES. MODELS AGREE 
THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY 
OVERNIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS SINCE 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY REMAINS IN CLOSE PROXIMITY. WITH THE UPDATE 
THIS EVENING...WILL PLAN TO ALSO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO 
THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN             46  53  34  48  33 /  20  20  20  10  10

.AVIATION...FLIGHT CONDITIONS WILL BE PREDOMINANTLY MVFR THROUGH
THE PERIOD AND MAY EVEN TOUCH INTO IFR FOR A BRIEF TIME AS MOISTURE
INCREASES AHEAD OF A SHORT WAVE TROUGH BUILDING TOWARD THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS DURING THE DAY SUNDAY. PRECIP MAY INITIATE AS DRIZZLE
LATE TONIGHT AND THEN AS LIFT INCREASES AROUND 15Z-20Z LIGHT RAIN
MAY DEVELOP AT TYS NORTHEAST THROUGH TRI. A NORTHERLY SURFACE FLOW
SHOULD PERSIST THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

771 
FXUS64 KMRX 271933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EDT SAT OCT 27 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...THE VERY SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT 
HAS JUST ABOUT WORKED THROUGH OUR AREA...HAVING JUST PASSED 
TRI...AND SHOULD BE JUST TO OUR EAST TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA TONIGHT...AND A SHORT WAVE WILL AFFECT THE 
REGION ON SUNDAY.  MAY BE SOME LIGHT SHOWERS AROUND TONIGHT 
ESPECIALLY NORTH...WITH A BETTER CHANCE SUNDAY AGAIN WITH HIGHEST 
PROBABILITIES NORTH.  WILL KEEP SOUTHERN AREAS DRY...WITH POPS AS 
HIGH AS LIKELY FAR NORTHEAST ON SUNDAY. COLDER AIR WILL BE PUSHING 
IN...BUT PRECIP TYPE SHOULD BE MAINLY RAIN FOR THE SHORT TERM.   


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A VERY COMPLICATED
FORECAST IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS A COOL POST- FRONTAL AIRMASS
WILL COMBINE WITH DEEP MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF LANDFALLING
HURRICANE SANDY TO CREATE THE POTENTIAL FOR AN EARLY SEASON WINTER
WEATHER EVENT ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.
THE MAIN QUESTION WILL BE THE EXACT TRACK OF SANDY AS IT MAKES
LANDFALL. WITHIN THE PAST COUPLE OF MODEL RUNS...BOTH THE NAM AND
GFS HAVE SHOWN AN AREA OF DEEP MOISTURE MOVING OVER THE
NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS...ALONG WITH SOME
OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND THE COLD AIR IN PLACE WILL PROVIDE THE
POTENTIAL FOR LIGHT SHOWERS AND EVENTUALLY SNOW SHOWERS...
PARTICULARLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES
SHOULD THIS SCENARIO PLAY OUT. A COUPLE OF LIMITING FACTORS FROM A
CLASSIC NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL EVENT WOULD BE A RELATIVE LACK OF
INSTABILITY AND SOME FAIRLY LOW LAPSE RATES...WHICH WOULD LIMIT THE
POTENTIAL FOR MESOSCALE BANDING/SNOW SQUALLS. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE
PROGGED MOISTURE AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT IN PLACE...SOME LOCALLY HEAVY
SNOWFALL IS CERTAINLY VERY POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
/PARTICULARLY IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEASTERN
TENNESSEE/. MODELS HAVE COME UP WITH SOME FAIRLY HIGH SNOW
AMOUNTS...AND FOR NOW GIVEN SOME OF THE LIMITING FACTORS AND
UNCERTAINTY THINK THAT IT IS SOMEWHAT OVERDONE. SO...GENERALLY SHOW
A STORM SNOWFALL TOTAL THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY OF 0-1 INCHES ACROSS
MOST OF THE VALLEYS...WITH TOTALS APPROACHING 4 INCHES OR HIGHER
ACROSS THE MOUNTAIN PEAKS. IT SHOULD ESPECIALLY BE NOTED THAT THERE
IS STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH THE TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM...AND GIVEN
THE VERY SHARP MOISTURE CUTOFF SHOULD SANDY TRACK FURTHER TO THE
NORTH AND EAST...IT IS CONCEIVABLE THAT MOST OF THE AREA WILL
REMAIN DRY. THUS...GIVEN THIS AM CONTINUING TO BE CAUTIOUS FOR NOW
AND WILL CONTINUE TO HANDLE THINGS WITH AN SPS. THE SYSTEM WILL
EVENTUALLY PULL AWAY FROM THE AREA DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THE
WEEK...RESULTING IN DRIER CONDITIONS AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND
HEADING INTO THE FIRST WEEKEND OF NOVEMBER.


&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT CRAWLING EAST INTO

APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH EXITING TO THE NORTHEAST EARLY. BACKSIDE 
JET TAKING SHAPE AND DIGGING INTO THE DEEP SOUTH BY TONIGHT. LIFT IS

AND FAVOR NW AREAS. WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT TODAY.

COLD AIR ADVECTION BEGINS ON SUNDAY WHEN UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWINGS 
INTO AREA. UPSLOPE AREAS OF SW VA AND THE E TN MOUNTAINS WILL BE 
FAVORED AREAS FOR SHOWERS ON SUNDAY.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...COMPLEX SYSTEM IN PLAY 
EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  SUNDAY NIGHT WILL SEE THE BEGINS OF A 
NORTHWEST FLOW EVENT DEVELOPING OVER THE AREA.  REMNANTS OF SANDY 
NOT EXPECTED TO BE A FACTOR YET OVER THE AREA.  SO WITH MINIMAL LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE AND WIND FIELD JUST BEGINNING TO RAMP UP COMBINED 
WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES BEGINNING TO FILTER IN...SHOULD SEE 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER MAINLY NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS.  SOME 
SNOW MAY MIX IN BUT WITH A WARM GROUND...LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION 
IS EXPECTED.  WINDS WILL INCREASE ON MONDAY WITH BREEZY TO LOCALLY 
WINDY CONDITIONS EXPECTED OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  DEGREE REMNANTS OF 
SANDY WILL EFFECT AREA WEATHER BIGGEST CONCERN FOR MONDAY NIGHT.  
THERE IS A POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT ADDITIONAL MOISTURE TO MOVE IN 
AS TROPICAL MOISTURE GETS WRAPPED UP IN UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH.  
THIS COMBINED WITH CONTINUED STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW AND COLD 
TEMPERATURES IN PLACE...EXPECT TO SEE SOME SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OVER 
PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS...AN ADVISORY OR 
WARNING MAY BE NECESSARY.  ADDITIONALLY...A FREEZE WARNING AND 
POSSIBLY A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED AS WELL.  CONDITIONS WILL 
SLOWLY IMPROVE BY LATE IN THE EXTENDED WITH LINGER PRECIP SLOWLY 
ENDING OVER NORTHERN AREAS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AND TEMPERATURES 
SLOWLY MODERATING.

NIGHT. WILL CALL FOR LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FOR HIGH KNOB (AROUND 
1 INCH TO LOCALLY 2 INCHES TOP OF HIGH KNOB). 

ANOTHER FACTOR FOR MONIGHT NIGHT IS THE POTENTIAL HARD FREEZE ACROSS 
MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY ALONG AND NORTH OF INTERSTATE 
40. FREEZE WARNINGS MAY BE ISSUED BY LATTER SHIFTS.

WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND WINDY CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED FOR SUNDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY). UPPER LOW SLOWLY LIFT NORTHEAST BY MID-WEEK 
WITH A SLOW WARMING TREND AND MORE SUNSHINE.
