FXUS64 KMRX 251915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT THU OCT 25 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN CONTROL
OF FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH SUNNY SKIES NE HALF AND SOME
INCREASED MOISTURE SOUTH WHERE SOME LOW CLOUDINESS HAS FORMED.
HIGHEST TEMPERATURES ARE NE WITH READINGS NEAR 80 AND DEW POINTS
THERE IN THE 40S. COOLER TO THE SW IN THE MID 70S WHERE DEW POINTS
HAVE RISEN TO THE MID 50S TO NEAR 60. EASTERLY FLOW AROUND
HURRICANE SANDY HAS BROUGHT THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE NORTH FROM THE
BAHAMAS INTO FL THE CAROLINAS AND GA. NOT MUCH CHANGE OVERNIGHT
EXCEPT CLOUDS DIMINISH AS HEATING ENDS AND THEN MAY INCREASE SOUTH
LATE WITH EASTERLY FLOW CONTINUEING AS SANDY MOVES NORTH. SE TO
SOUTH FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES WARMER TONIGHT ESPECIALLY SOUTH
AND AT MID SLOPES IN MOUNTAINS. COOLEST SPOTS WILL BE COLD AIR
DRAINAGE VALLEYS IN THE NE WHERE DEW POINTS ARE LOWEST. THERE LOWS
SHOULD DROP INTO THE MID 40S.

FRIDAY MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AS COLD FRONT NOW OVER THE GREAT
LAKES TO AR AND EAST TEXAS MOVES EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY
ABOUT 00Z. MUCH OF THE PRECIPITATION WITH THIS FRONT LIES JUST
ALONG AND BEHIND IT SO OVERALL FRIDAY WILL START OUT MOSTLY SUNNY
TO PARTLY CLOUDY THEN DETERIORATING DURING THE AFTERNOON FROM WEST
TO EAST. KEPT RAIN OUT THROUGH THE DAY. TEMPERATURES WILL ONCE
AGAIN BE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL IN THE 70S TO NEAR 80.
FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE SOUTH AND A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORTH TO MATCH
CLOSER TO TODAYS TRENDS.

.LONG TERM...BIG CHANGES AHEAD WITH THE WEATHER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION AS A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
MOVING ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA WILL DRIVE A COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THERE WILL BE A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS
ALONG AND IN WAKE OF THE FRONT ON SATURDAY ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA.
HOWEVER...THE OVERALL TREND WITH THE MODELS HAS BEEN A DRYING ONE
AS MOST OF THE BEST MOISTURE/LIFT WILL BE DISPLACED TO THE NORTH
AND EAST OF THE AREA AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH SHIFTS INTO THE OHIO
VALLEY BY SATURDAY MORNING. AS A RESULT...HAVE KEPT POPS AT SLIGHT
CHANCE TO LOW-END CHANCE ACROSS THE AREA...WITH THE MOST FAVORED
LOCATIONS BEING THE NORTHEAST ZONES.

BY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...SOME CLEARING MAY BEGIN TO TAKE 
PLACE ACROSS THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES...LEAVING JUST LOW-END 
MENTIONABLE POPS TO THE NORTHEAST. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THE 
POTENTIAL FOR CLOUD COVER AND LIGHT SHOWERS...PRIMARILY ALONG THE 
NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS A LONG WAVE TROUGH DEEPENS 
AND MOVES SOUTH TOWARD THE REGION. THIS TROUGH WILL ALSO CONTAIN 
SOME VERY COLD AIR UNDERNEATH IT...HELPING TO REINFORCE THE COOL 
POST FRONTAL AIRMASS THAT WILL MOVE IN SATURDAY NIGHT...AND HELP TO 
GENERATE THE CLOUDS AND DRIZZLE DURING THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. 

DESPITE THE PRECIP CHANCES...THIS COOLER AIR WILL BE THE MAIN 
WEATHER STORY THIS WEEKEND INTO THE NEXT WEEK AS THE COLDEST 
TEMPERATURES BY FAR OF THE SEASON WILL BE EXPERIENCED AREAWIDE. 
DAYTIME HIGHS WILL DROP INTO THE 50S ON SUNDAY AND STRUGGLE TO CLIMB 
MUCH ABOVE 45 TO 50 DEGREES ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. IN FACT...SOME 
LOCATIONS ACROSS NE TENNESSEE AND SW VIRGINIA MAY LINGER AROUND 40 
DURING THOSE TWO DAYS. IN ADDITION...OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK AS THOUGH 
THEY WILL PLUNGE TO BELOW OR JUST ABOVE THE FREEZING MARK OVER A 
GOOD PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA STARTING SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
PERSISTING THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. A VERY 
GRADUAL WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED TO LATE IN THE PERIOD INTO THE 
FIRST WEEKEND OF NOVEMBER AS THE AFOREMENTIONED SYSTEM PULLS AWAY 
FROM THE AREA. HOWEVER...HIGHS WILL REMAIN IN THE UPPER 40S TO 50S 
IN MOST SPOTS...AND APPROACH OR DROP BELOW FREEZING ACROSS THE FAR 
NORTHEASTERN ZONES THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             54  80  51  61  42 /   0  10  20  20  10

WILL COME TO AN ABRUPT END THIS WEEKEND. FRIDAY WILL BE MILD UNDER A 
DEEP SW FLOW...WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO 
AROUND 80. A BROAD TROUGH WILL DROP INTO THE MS VALLEY REGION...WITH 
AN EMBEDDED SHORTWAVE LIFTING NE ACROSS THE OH VALLEY ON SATURDAY. 
AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MAKE SLOW EASTWARD PROGRESS INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...AND THE 
BEST DYNAMICS WILL PASS TO OUR NORTH. THUS WILL KEEP POPS IN THE LOW 
CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE. 

A LONG NORTHERLY FETCH AND A DEEP LONGWAVE TROUGH SET UP OVER THE 
REGION FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...EVOLVING INTO A CLOSED LOW OVER THE 
OH VALLEY AND MID-ATLANTIC REGION BY TUESDAY. WHILE MOISTURE WILL BE 
LIMITED TO BELOW 800 MB...VERY COLD MIDLEVEL TEMPS BENEATH THE LOW 
COULD PRODUCE BROKEN CLOUDS AND SOME RAIN SHOWERS/SPRINKLES IN 
NORTHERN AREAS MONDAY AND TUESDAY...MAINLY DURING THE DAY WHEN 
INSTABILITY WILL BE ENHANCED BY SURFACE HEATING. TEMPERATURES WILL 
TURN MUCH COLDER...WITH HIGHS IN THE 40S NORTH TO MID 50S 
SOUTH...AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S.

FARTHER EAST. TEMPERATURES STILL SHOULD REACH 70S TO NEAR 80 AT CHA. 
RAIN STILL LOOKS TO HOLD OFF UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT AS RIDGE HOLDS ALONG 
THE EAST COAST. AT THE SAME TIME TROPICAL STORM OR HURRICANE SANDY 
WILL BE MOVING NORTH ALONG THE EAST COAST FROM THE BAHAMAS. MODELS 
STILL IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT BULK OF THE ENERGY WITH NEXT 
FRONT SATURDAY WILL SHIFT NE WITH GENERALLY LIGHT RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. MODELS KEEP RAIN BANDS FROM SANDY 
ACROSS THE EASTERN CAROLINAS SATURDAY BUT IF SANDY MOVES FARTHER 
WEST THIS COULD SLOW THE SATURDAY SYSTEM ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
NEXT UPPER TROUGH MOVES IN BEHIND FRONT SUNDAY AND MONDAY. MUCH 
COLDER TEMPERATURES SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
MOVING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING AND COLD TEMPERATURES 
COULD BRING SOME SNOW TO SW VA. LOWS MONDAY MORNING THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY SHOULD DROP TO NEAR TO BELOW FREEZING MOUNTAINS AND NE AND 
LOWER TO MID 30S SOUTH SO FROST LIKELY AND POSSIBLE FREEZE WARNINGS. 
HIGHS WILL BE MOSTLY IN THE 50S WITH 40S IN THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 AM EDT WED OCT 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EARLY THIS MORNING...A SHORT-
WAVE WAS MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AS
FAR SOUTH AS SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY. THIS ACTIVITY WILL STAY NORTH OF
THE FORECAST AREA...BUT AN AREA OF HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS IS MOVING
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST. THESE CLOUDS WILL MOVE EAST OF
THE AREA BEFORE SUNRISE. SURFACE RIDGING IS PRODUCING CALM WINDS
OVER THE AREA WITH MOST LOCATIONS CLOUD FREE. GOOD RADIATIONAL
COOLING CONDITIONS IS ALLOWING DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS TO FALL TO NEAR
ZERO. AREAS OF FOG...SOME LOCALLY DENSE...WILL DEVELOP THROUGH
SUNRISE...ESPECIALLY NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS.

FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...RIDGING BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL PRODUCE
GENERALLY CLEAR SKIES. PATCHY FOG IS ONCE AGAIN EXPECTED EARLY
THURSDAY MORNING.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED A BLEND OF GFS/MET MOS DUE TO BETTER PERFORMANCE
THE LAST COUPLE DAYS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
WITH A RIDGE ACROSS THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD AND LOW PRESSURE TRACKING 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS...WE WILL SEE AN INCREASING SW FLOW ON 
THURSDAY. THIS WILL BRING TEMPERATURES INTO THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 
80S ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE FRIDAY AHEAD 
OF THE APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH...WITH RAIN CHANCES ARRIVING IN THE 
PLATEAU FRIDAY NIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GENERALLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
TIMING...WITH THE BEST RAIN CHANCES SATURDAY. HOWEVER...THE SYSTEM 
WILL LIKELY BE WEAKENING AS IT APPROACHES SINCE THE UPPER TROUGH 
AXIS IS POSITIVELY TILTED AND THE UPPER JET REMAINS WELL TO OUR 
NORTH. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE SATURDAY...WITH FROPA 
EXPECTED SATURDAY NIGHT. 

SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WILL BE DRY AND COOLER WITH A BROAD LONGWAVE 
TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. AN AIR MASS WITH CANADIAN ORIGINS 
WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE AREA. HIGH TEMPS WILL BE IN THE 50S TO 
LOWER 60S SOUTH EACH DAY. MUCH OF THE AREA COULD SEE LOW 
TEMPERATURES NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING BY MONDAY NIGHT.

VERY LOW. AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL BE 
RATHER LIGHT FROM THE SOUTH WITH THE HEAVIEST PRECIP OCCURRING OVER 
EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA. SHOULD BE ABLE TO GET A BETTER HANDLE ON 
ACTUAL QPF NUMBERS OVER THE NEXT FEW MODEL RUNS. STILL SOME 
DIFFERENCES ON WHERE TS SANDY ENDS UP IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. 
REGARDLESS...LOOK FOR WELL BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS SATURDAY BUT

ANCHORED OVER THE REGION THROUGH THE SHORT TERM FOR A MILD NIGHT 
TONGIHT AND WARM WENDESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A WARM...DRY PERIOD 
WILL PREVAIL UNTIL FRIDAY. EXPECT ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL 
OCCUR THROUGH THURSDAY BEFORE A COLD FRONT MARCHES SLOWLY THROUGH 
EAST TENNESSEE...SW NORTH CAROLINA AND SW VIRGINIA. THE FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN MID DAY FRIDAY. SOME SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM COULD DEVELOP ON THE PLATEAU 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON. THE MAJORITY OF THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE POST 
FRONTAL ON FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY THUS THUNDER PROBABILITIES ARE 
VERY LOW. AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL BE 
RATHER LIGHT FROM THE SOUTH WITH THE HEAVIEST PRECIP OCCURRING OVER 
EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA. SHOULD BE ABLE TO GET A BETTER HANDLE ON 
ACTUAL QPF NUMBERS OVER THE NEXT FEW MODEL RUNS. STILL SOME 
DIFFERENCES ON WHERE TS SANDY ENDS UP IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. 
REGARDLESS...LOOK FOR WELL BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS SATURDAY BUT 
ESPECIALLY SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WITH DAYTIME HIGHS IN THE 50S.     

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  50  81  51  82  55 /   0   0   0   0   0

887 
FXUS64 KMRX 230751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
351 AM EDT TUE OCT 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING FROM THE SURFACE TO 700 MB WILL BE CENTERED 
OVER THE CAROLINAS TODAY AND TONIGHT. A WEAK TROUGH AT THE 300-500 
MB LEVEL WILL BE CROSSING JUST NORTH OF THE AREA TODAY...BUT THIS 
SHOULD HAVE LITTLE IMPACT ASIDE FROM SOME SCATTERED HIGH CLOUDS. 
WEAK WARM ADVECTION ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE RIDGE WILL BRING HIGH 
TEMPS IN THE MID 70S TO AROUND 80 ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. WE SHOULD 
SEE CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH...ALLOWING TEMPS TO 
DROP TO THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S IN MOST SPOTS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THIS PERIOD STARTS WITH 
QUIET WEATHER UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE SUBTROPICAL UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGE THAT IS BASED ALONG THE WESTERN GULF AND EXTENDING WWD ACROSS 
BAJA CA.  THE NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM COMES IN FOR THE WEEKEND...AS 
TROPICAL STORM SANDY IS ONLY EXPECTED TO PLAY A PERIPHERAL 
ROLE...WITH THE TIMING OF OUR FRONTAL PASSAGE...AS SANDY STAYS OUT 
OVER THE ATLANTIC.

FIRST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION MENTIONED IS ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
ON/NEAR THE PLATEAU.  FRONT LOOKS TO SLOW DOWN SOME AS SANDY MOVES 
NORTHWARD...BUT PRECIP AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT WITH OUR 
FRONTAL SYSTEM. ALSO HAVE A MENTION OF THUNDER SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON...THAT COULD BE CLOSE TO FROPA.  ON SUNDAY...MODELS AGREE 
ON POST-FRONTAL LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEASTERN 
SECTIONS...LOOKS LIKE IT COULD BE A DRIZZLE SCENARIO THROUGH THE 
MORNING...AND EVEN LATER INTO THE UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE 
APPALACHIANS.  WENT BELOW GUIDANCE ON MAX TEMPS FOR SUNDAY...1-2 
DEGREES FOR SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS...2-5 DEGREES COOLER ACROSS 
THE NE AND 5-10 DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE IN THE NERN UPSLOPE 
AREAS.  ALSO TWEAKED HOURLY TEMPERATURE TIMING ON SUNDAY FOR A SLOW 
WARM-UP...AS SATURATED LOW LEVEL CONDITIONS AND COLD ADVECTION 
OFFSET DIURNAL WARMING.

BY MONDAY ALL MODELS AGREE THAT LAST SHORTWAVE WILL BE PAST US...AS 
SANDY MOVES FARTHER AWAY TO THE NORTH OR NORTHEAST...SO MONDAY WENT 
DRY. DRYING OF DEWPOINTS ON MONDAY BY GFS MOS SEEMED WAY 
UNDERDONE...SO MONDAY DEW POINTS IN GRIDS ARE MUCH LOWER THAN 
GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  78  49  80  46  79 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       78  49  80  47  80 /   0   0   0   0   0

094 
FXUS64 KMRX 221900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT MON OCT 22 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER 
PATTERN THROUGH THE SHORT TERM WITH STRONG HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL.  AS A RESULT...WILL HAVE MILD LOWS OVERNIGHT AND SEASONALLY 
WARM TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...DRY CONDITIONS WILL 
PERSIST THROUGHOUT THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK-WEEK WITH SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE ANCHORED IN PLACE. THE UPPER AIR PATTERN WILL BEGIN TO 
AMPLIFY OVER THE WESTERN U.S. AS EARLY AS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A COLD 
FRONT WILL BEGIN TO TREK ACROSS MISSOURI AND ARKANSAS ON THURSDAY 
AND MOVE INTO WESTERN TENNESSEE BY FRIDAY MORNING. MEANWHILE...AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA...E TN AND SW VA WILL 
GRADUALLY WARM AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE THROUGH 
THE WEEK. MODELS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT IN REGARDS TO TIMING OF 
THE FRONTAL PASSAGE THROUGH OUR AREA SATURDAY AFTERNOON. AT THIS 
TIME THE AIRMASS LOOKS STABLE HOWEVER THERE COULD STILL BE AN 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM IN THE SHOWERS THAT WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE FRONT. THERE IS SOME DISAGREEMENT WHEN IT COMES TO LINGERING 
PRECIP CHANCES INTO SUNDAY. THE ECMWF IS MUCH COLDER POSSIBLY DUE TO 
THE WAY IT HANDLES - THE YET TO FORM - TROPICAL STORM/HURRICANE AND 
TRACKING IT INTO THE NEW ENGLAND STATES. WHILE THE GFS KEEPS THE 
STORM WELL OUT IN THE ATLANTIC. THE AIRMASS AND RAINFALL TIMING WILL 
BE SOMETHING TO WATCH IN THE COMING DAYS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

115 
FXUS64 KMRX 210146 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
946 PM EDT SAT OCT 20 2012

.DISCUSSION...
THE MAIN ADJUSTMENT TO THE FORECAST THIS EVENING WAS TO THE SKY
GRIDS TO ACCOUNT FOR THE LINGERING BROKEN TO OVERCAST DECKS OF LOW
CLOUDS ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES AND ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. OVER THE
COURSE OF THE EVENING AND NIGHT...THIS CLOUD COVER IS PROGGED TO
GRADUALLY BREAK UP SOMEWHAT...RESULTING IN AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY
CONDITIONS FOR A MAJORITY OF THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE TONIGHT.
THIS TREND IS GENERALLY SUPPORTED BY THE LATEST IR SATELLITE
IMAGERY...THOUGH SOME PATCHES OF DENSER CLOUD COVER COULD LINGER
AND PASS OVER PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN ZONES/MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT.
THIS LEADS TO A BIT OF A TRICKY FORECAST REGARDING PATCHY FOG
FORMATION AND FROST DEVELOPMENT. WITH CALM WINDS IN PLACE...GOOD
RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL OCCUR IN AREAS THAT REMAIN CLEAR/MOSTLY
CLEAR. LOW TEMPERATURES ARE GENERALLY EXPECTED TO DROP INTO THE
LOWER 40S TO POTENTIALLY THE MID/UPPER 30S IN SHELTERED VALLEYS
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. THIS WILL CREATE A FROST POTENTIAL IN THESE
COLD POCKETS ALONG THE MOUNTAIN ZONES...WHERE A FROST ADVISORY IS
IN EFFECT FROM 4-9 AM EDT. ADDITIONALLY THE POTENTIAL FOR PATCHY
FOG WILL EXIST ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING.
HOWEVER...THE PRESENCE OF CLOUD COVER IN CERTAIN LOCALIZED AREAS
COULD KEEP TEMPERATURES UP A FEW MORE DEGREES AND LIMIT FOG/FROST
DEVELOPMENT THERE. THE GIVEN THE LATEST TRENDS/PROGS WITH SOME
CLEARING TAKING PLACE...STILL FEEL A MENTION OF FOG/FROST IS
WARRANTED AND MADE NO CHANGES TO THE WX GRIDS.

.DISCUSSION...

PLUME FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS REGION WAS LOFTED BY THE PREVAILING
WINDS AROUND AN UPPER-STORM SYSTEM AND PUSHED OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. VISIBILITIES HAVE IMPROVED AS WINDS HAVE BEGUN TO
RELAX AFTER SUNSET...BUT A MINOR HAZE IS STILL BEING REPORTED AT
KTYS FROM SOME REMNANT DUST PARTICULATES STILL IN THE AIR. OVC/BKN
DECKS OF LOW TO MID CLOUD WILL PASS OVERHEAD ON THE BACK SIDE OF
THIS STORM SYSTEM THROUGH THE EVENING AND MOST OF THE OVERNIGHT
PERIOD IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES. HOWEVER...SATELLITE TRENDS AND
MODEL PROGS INDICATE THAT THIS CLOUD COVER SHOULD BEGIN TO BREAK UP
AFTER 06Z OR SO IN MANY AREAS. STILL...TEMPERATURES COULD BE A
DEGREE OR TWO WARMER IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES WHERE BKN/OVC DECKS
MAY HANG ON FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT...LIMITING RADIATIONAL COOLING
SOME. OTHERWISE...LOWS IN THE LOWER 40S ARE GENERALLY EXPECTED IN
THE VALLEYS AREAWIDE TONIGHT. THE ONLY OTHER CHANGE TO THE FORECAST
THAT WAS MADE WAS TO ADJUST CLOUD COVER TO MOSTLY CLOUDY TO
OVERCAST BEFORE 06Z TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CURRENT SKY CONDITIONS.

FORECAST AREA WITH AREAS OF DUST BLOWING UP THE GREAT TN VALLEY.

PLUME EXTENDS BACK TO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS (OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS)...AND 
THINK THAT THIS BLOWING DUST WILL CONTINUE UNTIL AFTER SUNSET WHEN 
THE WINDS DIMINISH. THE LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT...AND WILL LIKELY BRING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS OVER 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
SOME SPRINKLES OVER SOUTHWEST VA FOR TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...SINCE 
THE MODELS AGREE THAT SOME LIGHT QPF WILL BE GENERATED WITH THE 
PASSAGE OF A FEW UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES ROTATING AROUND THE LARGE 
UPPER-LEVEL CUT-OFF LOW. HIGH PRESSURE AND AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL 
THEN BUILD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT... 
BRINGING TRANQUIL CONDITIONS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. AS FOR TEMPS... 
NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE ON SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WHEN SOME 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED. AS A RESULT...WILL SEE DRY AND 
WARM CONDITIONS. HOWEVER...MODELS IS POOR AGREEMENT BY THE END OF 
THE PERIOD WITH THE GFS BRINGING IN A COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY AND ECMWF 
KEEP IT TO OUR NORTH. FOR NOW...WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR FRIDAY AND 
MONITOR THE APPROACHING SYSTEM.

EXPECTED AS MOISTURE IS LIMITED TO A THIN LAYER...AND LOW LEVELS 
WILL BE DRYING WITH FALLING DEWPOINTS THIS AFTERNOON. MAX MOISTURE 
DEPTH BETWEEN 850-700 MB OCCURS IN NORTHERN AREAS BETWEEN 06Z-09Z. 
THIS MAY PRODUCE SOME DRIZZLE AT BEST. NAM AND GFS MOS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT TODAY AND TONIGHT...SO WILL STAY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPS. HIGHS TODAY WILL BE MAINLY IN THE 60S...WITH LOWS TONIGHT IN 
THE 40S. SOME GUSTY WINDS CAN BE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON...IN THE 
25-30 MPH RANGE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKING
ACROSS THE AREA BRINGING A CHANCE FOR FEW SPRINKLES ON SATURDAY
MORNING...MAINLY ACROSS OUR NORTHERN ZONES. THE RIDGE BUILDS BACK
INTO THE REGION RESULTING IN DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY. MAINLY SEASONAL TEMPERATURES FOR THE PERIOD...STAYED NEAR
MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS AFTERNOON 
BEFORE THE FRONT COMPLETELY EXITS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL FURTHER AMPLIFY 
OVER THE TN AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD PUSH THIS 
COLD FRONT OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNSET. THIS DEEP UPPER TROUGH 
IS PROGGED TO BECOME A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH A DRY SLOT BETWEEN IT AND THE COLD 
FRONT BRINGING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
IS A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE THROUGHOUT. UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH TO START 
THE PERIOD WILL LIFT NORTHEAST AND WILL BE REPLACED BY AN UPPER 
RIDGE. SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW 
EXPECTED TO ENHANCE CLOUDS EARLY ESPECIALLY NORTH. COULD BE A FEW 
SPRINKLES OR LIGHT SHOWERS MAINLY NORTH MAINLY FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY SATURDAY...AND FOR NOW WILL JUST MENTION POSSIBILITY OF 
SPRINKLES. REMAINDER OF PERIOD SHOULD BE DRY WITH A WARMING TREND.

TOWER (SOUTHEAST GREENE COUNTY) OBSERVED WIND GUSTS UP TO 56 MPH...

335 
FXUS64 KMRX 180751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
351 AM EDT THU OCT 18 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A WEAKENING LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES TO TRACK INTO THE
FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE NEARLY COMPLETE
LACK OF INSTABILITY IN PLACE ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE ATTM...THE
OVERALL THUNDER THREAT WILL FURTHER DIMINISH OVER THE COURSE OF THE
EARLY MORNING HOURS. HOWEVER...GIVEN A LOW-LEVEL JET IN PLACE AND
SOME MODEST INSTABILITY ALOFT...SOME ISOLATED STORMS WILL STILL BE
POSSIBLE. THE AFOREMENTIONED JET AND ASSOCIATED BULK SHEAR VALUES
OF 50-60 KTS WILL CREATE SOME GUSTY WINDS WITH THESE STORMS ALONG
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND PARTICULARLY
ALONG THE SPINE OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS WHERE GUSTS UP TO 40 MPH
WILL BE POSSIBLE IN SOME LOCALIZED SPOTS. THUS...A WIND ADVISORY IS
IN PLACE ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS THROUGH LATE MORNING.

THE ADVANCING AREA OF SHOWER/STORMS WILL HAVE MOVED THROUGH THE
WESTERN ZONES BY THE EARLY MORNING...AND SHOULD CLEAR MOST OF THE
AREA BY LATE MORNING/MIDDAY. HOWEVER...SOME ENHANCED INSTABILITY
VALUES ALOFT JUST AHEAD OF THE ADVANCING COLD FRONT MAY CREATE THE
POTENTIAL FOR AN ADDITIONAL ROUND OF ISOLATED/SCATTERED STORMS
ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES DURING THE
AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE...CLEARING CONDITIONS AND A COOLER AND DRIER
AIR MASS WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONTAL
PASSAGE. THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME COOLER HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE
UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S...AND LOWS TONIGHT IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER
40S. 

.LONG TERM.../FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
CLOSED UPPER LOW KEEPS A TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA FRIDAY...PLUS A STRONG SHORTWAVE DROPS ACROSS KY AND
NRN PARTS OF TN/SW VA TO ENHANCE THE GUSTINESS OF THE SW WINDS.
18/00Z NAM 12KM WINDS LOOKED VERY GOOD AND COULD BE BORDERLINE ON
WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. KEEPING A FEW CLOUDS OVER NRN AREAS AND A
DRY FORECAST.

THE UPPER LOW LIFTS NE BY LATE SATURDAY AND A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION SUNDAY AND MONDAY. THE SURFACE RIDGE 
SETTLES ACROSS THE SRN APPALACHIANS AND DOES NOT MOVE MUCH THROUGH 
MID NEXT WEEK...WHILE THE UPPER RIDGE FLATTENS SLIGHTLY. THE 00Z 
MODEL RUNS ARE VERY CONSISTENT WITH 12Z RUNS IN A DRY FORECAST...
WITH ONLY VERY MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO FORECAST GRIDS ATTM.


&&

312 
FXUS64 KMRX 171844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT WED OCT 17 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD...WITH A COLD FRONT EXTENDING OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY AND 
OZARKS REGION. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY BEHIND THIS FRONT TONIGHT...WHICH WILL HELP TO 
GENERATE AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CONVECTION OVER THE LOWER AND MID MS 
RIVER VALLEYS THIS EVENING. THIS AREA OF CONVECTION WILL MOVE 
EASTWARD OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...AND SHOULD BEGIN TO 
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY ABOVE A STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER FROM THE 
SURFACE UP TO 850 MB. THUS...EXPECT THIS CONVECTION TO WEAKEN AFTER 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...BUT WILL MENTION SOME TSTORMS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA DUE TO THE ELEVATED INSTABILITY. MODELS INDICATE A VERY STRONG 
850 MB WIND FLOW IN EXCESS OF 60 KT DEVELOPING OVER CENTRAL KY LATE 
TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT. WITH A STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER AND A VEERING 
WIND PROFILE OVER THE MOUNTAINS...AND A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW NEARLY 
PERPENDICULAR TO THE MOUNTAINS...THINK THAT MOUNTAIN WAVES WILL BE 
POSSIBLE ALONG THE FOOTHILLS AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. THIS SCENARIO 
TONIGHT IS NOT NECESSARILY THE MOST OPTIMUM SET-UP FOR MOUNTAIN 
WAVES...BUT IT APPEARS THAT ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS (AROUND 25 TO 35 
MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS) WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE FAVORED AREAS OF THE 
FOOTHILLS. THESE LOW-LEVEL WINDS WILL THEN BECOME MORE SOUTHWESTERLY 
AFTER SUNRISE THURSDAY MORNING...WHICH SHOULD DIMINISH THE THREAT OF 
MOUNTAIN WAVES. HOWEVER...STRONG GUSTY WINDS WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE 
AFTER SUNRISE...SINCE THE MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING IN THE LOW LEVELS BELOW 850 MB. THIS SURFACE-BASED 
INSTABILITY MAY ALLOW SOME OF THE STRONGER 850 MB WINDS TO DESCEND 
TO THE SURFACE WITH ANY CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ALONG THE COLD FRONT. IT 
APPEARS THAT THE OVERALL INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE 
A LITTLE BETTER ALONG THE COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY MORNING...SO WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION TSTORMS THURSDAY MORNING...AND WILL UPDATE THE 
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME TSTORMS 
WITH DAMAGING WINDS OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA BEFORE THIS 
COLD FRONT EXITS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON. 
THEREAFTER...A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW WILL LINGER AROUND THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH MAY BRING SOME CLOUDS TO 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT DRY 
WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM 
AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE UPPER TROUGH 
RESPONSIBLE FOR THE FRONTAL PASSAGE THURSDAY MORNING WILL BE 
SHIFTING FARTHER EAST BY LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. THUS DAYTIME HIGHS ON 
SATURDAY AND MORNING SUNDAY LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER THAN 
SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL PERSIST THROUGH 
MID WEEK IN RESPONSE TO SHORTWAVE RIDGING AND ASSOCIATED LOW LEVEL 
SOUTHERLY FLOW.

RAIN CHANCES SATURDAY WILL BE LOW PARTICULARLY OVER NE TN AND SW VA 
TO NON-EXISTENT. DRY CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED THROUGH AT LEAST 
TUESDAY. THE LONGER RANGE MODELS THAT REFLECT TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY 
TIME-FRAME ARE NOT IN AGREEMENT WITH REGARDS TO SURFACE FRONTAL 
FEATURES. CONFIDENCE IS LOW REGARDING RAIN CHANCES FOR TUESDAY BUT 
HAVE CONTINUED WITH NO MENTION OF POPS.
&&

DURING SHOWERS.

425 
FXUS64 KMRX 170750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT WED OCT 17 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY/...
A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL PROMOTE DRY WEATHER AND MOSTLY
SUNNY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. THIS...COMBINED
WITH A PREVAILING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL HELP TO PROMOTE MILD
TEMPERATURES AS HIGHS TOP OFF IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S IN MOST
VALLEY LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...A CHANGE IN THE PATTERN WILL OCCUR
LATER TONIGHT AS THE RIDGE SCOOTS EAST AND A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED
WITH A DEEP UPPER-LOW ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES MOVES THROUGH THE
REGION. A LOW-LEVEL JET RAMPING UP AHEAD OF THIS FRONT WILL
INCREASE MOISTURE AND CREATE GOOD CHANCES FOR SHOWERS /OVERSPREADING
THE AREA FROM WEST TO EAST/ AFTER MIDNIGHT. THOUGH INSTABILITY
PARAMETERS APPEAR TO BE VERY LOW...SOME MODEST MLCAPE VALUES COULD
ALLOW FOR SOME ISOLATED WEAK STORMS TO PERSIST OVERNIGHT FROM
DECAYING CONVECTION ACROSS WESTERN/MIDDLE TENNESSEE EARLIER IN THE
EVENING. THE BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION WILL BE ACROSS THE
PLATEAU LATE TONIGHT...BEFORE TRANSITIONING TO THE EASTERN ZONES
AFTER SUNRISE WITH THE ADVANCING COLD FRONT. BY THE MID/LATE
AFTERNOON...RAINFALL WILL HAVE WANED AS THE FRONT MOVES
EAST...LEAVING A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
IN ITS WAKE.

.LONG TERM.../THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...SOME LINGERING
WEATHER CONCERNS TO START OUT AS THE WRN GREAT LAKES UPPER LOW DOES
NOT LIFT NE UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY. THIS MAY KEEP SOME CLOUDS ACROSS
NRN AREAS AND CERTAINLY SOME BREEZY TO WINDY CONDITIONS.
HOWEVER...ALL MODELS GENERALLY SUPPORT A DRY FORECAST FOR OUR
REGION RIGHT ON THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. GRIDS
WERE FRESHENED WITH THE STRONGER NAM 12KM WINDS INTO SATURDAY
MORNING...THEN THE GRADIENT RELAXES AS THE SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE
BUILD EASTWARD.

A WEAK DISTURBANCE MAY TRACK NE FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TO 
OHIO VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY...BUT THIS PROBABLY WILL HAVE 
LITTLE EFFECT ON OUR WEATHER. THUS...KEEPING POPS IN THE 8 TO 14 
PERCENT RANGE FOR ALL PERIODS...AS GFSX MOS POPS WERE VERY LOW AND 
CONSISTENT FROM THE 16/12Z TO 17/00Z RUNS. GFSX MOS MINS AND MAXES 
WERE ALSO CONSISTENT AND VERY CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS.

SUMMARIZING...VERY NICE WEATHER AHEAD AFTER WINDS DIMINISH FRIDAY 
NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EDT TUE OCT 16 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE LINGERS ACROSS 
REGION PROVIDING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. AN UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH BRINGING A FEW CLOUDS TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...BUT NO 
PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. EVEN WITH CLOUDS THERE WILL BE A THE RISK 
OF PATCHY FROST TONIGHT. WILL CONTINUE THE PATCHY FROST IN THE 
FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT SHOULD BE NEAR 
SEASONAL AND STAYED CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE. HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD BE 
AROUND FOR MOST OF THE DAY. TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE AFFECTED WITH 
STILL PLENTY OF SUN. STAYED NEAR MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...WITH JUST AN AVERAGE 
AMOUNT OF INCONSISTENCY DEVELOPING BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.  
FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE PERIOD IS ABOVE AVERAGE EARLY...DROPPING 
TO ABOUT AVERAGE LATE. A COLD FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY THURSDAY. FAIRLY STRONG LOW LEVEL JET AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONT WILL BRING BRIEF SHOT OF SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE...ALTHOUGH 
FORCING DOES NOT LOOK IMPRESSIVE FOR OUR AREA.  EXPECT SOME 
WEAKENING CONVECTION TO PUSH INTO THE AREA AND CONTINUE TO WEAKEN AS 
IS MOVES THROUGH.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS WEST AND CHANCE POPS EAST 
WED NIGHT...THEN CHANCE POPS EAST SLIGHT CHANCE WEST ON THU.  WILL 
ADD MENTION OF A CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER AS WELL.  WINDS 
WILL LIKELY BE QUITE GUSTY FOR SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
FOOTHILLS LATE WED NIGHT...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP BELOW WIND ADVISORY 
LEVELS. WITH UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY CANNOT RULE 
OUT SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND AND BRINGING A FEW 
SHOWERS MAINLY NORTH...BUT AT THIS POINT STILL LOOKS LIKE ANY PRECIP 
SHOULD STAY NORTH OF OUR AREA SO WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY BOTH DAYS.  
RIDGE WILL BUILD IN LATER IN THE PERIOD...SO WILL GO PRECIP FREE 
REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

769 
FXUS64 KMRX 160754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT TUE OCT 16 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
TEMPS RUNNING A BIT ABOVE HOURLY GRIDS THIS MORNING...ALTHO SKIES
ARE MOSTLY CLEAR WITH VERY LIGHT WINDS. PATCHY FROST MAY STILL
DEVELOP BUT CERTAINLY NOT ON A VERY BROAD SCALE. LOOKS LIKE
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE AND 850 MB TEMPS AT OR A LITTLE ABOVE
YESTERDAY...SO I WAS IN FAVOR OF GOING WITH OR JUST A DEGREE OR TWO
ABOVE THE MILDER GFS MOS MAXES.

THE SURFACE RIDGE SHIFTS SLIGHTLY EASTWARD TONIGHT AND 850 MB RH 
INCREASES BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...NOT MUCH IN THE 
WAY OF CLOUDS INDICATED...ALTHO MILDER 850 MB TEMPS DO SUPPORT A 
BLEND OF THE SIMILAR MOS MIN TEMPS. ANY FROST SHOULD BE LIMITED TO 
JUST THE NRN VALLEY OF NE TN...CENTERED AROUND TRI. 


.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/... 
A SURFACE RIDGE WILL PROMOTE FAIRLY MILD CONDITIONS ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY...BEFORE IT SCOOTS OFF TO THE EAST. THIS
WILL ALLOW FOR A WEAK COLD FRONT TO PUSH INTO THE REGION FROM THE
WEST WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...AS A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW
ROTATES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. THE DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM ARE
FAIRLY IMPRESSIVE...WITH BULK SHEAR VALUES AOA 60 KTS BY 12Z
THURSDAY. HOWEVER...THE TIMING OF THE ASSOCIATED PRECIPITATION
/WHICH WILL BE LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING/ WILL
RESULT IN LOW INSTABILITY VALUES...AND THUS A VERY LIMITED THUNDER
POTENTIAL. AS SUCH...HAVE JUST GONE WITH A MENTION OF SHOWERS
DURING THIS PERIOD...THOUGH SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY COULD RESULT
IN SOME LOCALIZED RUMBLES OF THUNDER. A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS
WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA IN WAKE OF THE FRONT...RESULTING COOLER
TEMPERATURES /WITH HIGHS GENERALLY REMAINING IN THE 60S AREAWIDE
THROUGH THE WEEKEND/. A GRADUAL WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED HEADING
INTO THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL
RIDGE TO THE SOUTH NUDGES INTO THE REGION.

&&

TROUGH TRACKING ACROSS THE AREA BRINGING A FEW HIGH CLOUDS ON 
TUESDAY...BUT NO PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE 
AFFECTED. TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONAL AGAIN...STAYED NEAR MOS 
GUIDANCE AGAIN.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT
AGREEMENT EARLY ON...BUT MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY
DEGRADES WITH TIME...LEADING TO LOWER THAN AVERAGE FORECAST
CONFIDENCE BY THE LATTER PERIODS. WILL START OUT DRY FOR TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION SHIFTS TO THE
EAST. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH WED NIGHT THEN MOVE EAST OF
THE AREA DURING THURSDAY. APPEARS FORCING WILL BE WEAK WITH THIS
SYSTEM SO PLAN TO GO NO HIGHER THAN CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. DRYING
INDICATED BEHIND THIS SYSTEM SO WILL GO PRECIP FREE FOR FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. IN THE FAST FLOW CANNOT RULE OUT ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM
BRINGING SOME PRECIP TO THE AREA AS THE GFS SUGGESTS FOR
SUNDAY...BUT FOR NOW WILL GO WITH THE DRYER ECMWF SOLUTION WHICH
AGREES WITH HPC AND WILL KEEP FORECAST PRECIP FREE THROUGH MONDAY.

SLIGHTLY COOLER BEHIND TODAYS COLD FRONT. THE SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS
QUICKLY EAST TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. COULD BE SOME PATCHY

LIKELY KEEP TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN TUESDAY MORNINGS
READINGS. SOUTHERLY FLOW THEN WARMS TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES
WEDNESDAY. NEXT COLD FRONT MOVES INTO TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS
TROUGH MOVES INTO THE PLAINS AND CLOSES OFF. MOISTURE INCREASES
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH SHOWERS POSSIBLE BY THURSDAY MORNING.
INSTABILITY DOES NOT LOOK THAT IMPRESSIVE AHEAD OF THIS FRONT SO
FORECASTING ONLY SHOWERS NOW. FAIRLY DEEP SURFACE AND UPPER LOW

NW WHICH WILL KEEP SHOWERS AROUND THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY. UPPER LOW SHIFTS NE SATURDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING
BACK OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOUTHWEST WINDS AND CLOUDS 
INCREASE TODAY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...BUT I DON'T SEE SHOWERS 
DEVELOPING UNTIL THIS EVENING. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED 
GOOD WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A FEW WESTERN MOST COUNTIES 
THIS AFTERNOON. KEPT POPS CATEGORICAL WEST TO LIKELY NE FOR TONIGHT. 
INTENSITY OF STORMS SHOULD DROP SHARPLY AFTER SUNSET...AND ANY 
STORMS SHOULD BE ISOLATED NON-SEVERE AFTER 06Z MONDAY. WIND SPEEDS 
ARE A SLIGHT CONCERN AS LOW LEVEL JET REACHES 50 KNOTS OR SO THIS 
AFTERNOON OVER MIDDLE TN...BUT FOR NOW IT APPEARS THAT THE LOW LEVEL 
JET WILL MOVE QUICKLY NE BY 03Z MONDAY. KEEPING WIND SPEEDS IN THE 
15 TO 25 MPH RANGE FOR MTNS AND LET LATER SHIFTS MONITOR. 

OTHERWISE...MOS MAX AND MIN TEMPS WERE CONSISTENT WITH 12Z NUMBERS 
AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...STRONG COLD FRONT TO MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY MORNING. MODELS NOW FASTER WITH 
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS EXITING AREA. GFS SLOWER THAN 
NAM. HAVE CUT POPS BACK MONDAY BUT STILL HAVE CHANCE IN EASTERN 
SECTIONS THROUGH THE MORNING. UPPER TROUGH WILL BRING SECONDARY 
SHORT WAVE INTO OHIO VALLEY AND NORTHERN SECTIONS OF FORECAST AREA 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. EXPECT MAINLY CLOUDS BUT SOME RAINFALL NE. STRONG 
COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT WILL DROP TEMPERATURES INTO THE 
UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S MONDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN TUESDAY 
AND CONTINUES THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH FAST WESTERLY FLOW. THURSDAY 
NEW SYSTEM TO AFFECT AREA. GFS SHOWS A FAST MOVING SYSTEM TO ONLY 
AFFECT THE REGION THURSDAY BUT ECMWF AND CANADIAN DEVELOP A CLOSED 
LOW BEHIND THE SYSTEM WHICH SLOWS IT DOWN AND BRINGS A MORE 
PROLONGED PERIOD OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WITH IT. THE 
CHANCE OF RAIN WILL LINGER THROUGH FRIDAY AS UPPER LOW MOVES EAST 
THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES. SOME FROST POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT IN 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST. TEMPERATURES COOLER MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
BEHIND FRONT AND THEN AGAIN FRIDAY AND SATURDAY BEHIND SECOND FRONT.

WITH STORMS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN TONIGHT...OPTED TO CARRY VCTS FOR CHA 
AND TYS WITH TEMPO SHOWERS FOR NOW. CEILINGS AND VISBYS COULD FALL 
TO OR BELOW MVFR...IF A TSRA PASSES OVER ANY OF THE TAF SITES.

FXUS64 KMRX 131510
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SAT OCT 13 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. CHATTANOOGA AREA 
TEMPS OFF TO A SLOW START DUE TO MORNING FOG. HOWEVER 10 MORE 
DEGREES IS ATTAINABLE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY AIR IS MORE NOTABLE THIS 
MORNING OVER THE NRN 1/2 TO 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME 
PATCHY AREAS OF LOW CLOUDS AND FOG ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC. 
ALSO...LIKELY SOME PATCHY VALLEY FOG NEAR LAKES/STREAMS OVER NRN 
AREAS WHERE CLEARING OCCURRED. EXPECT ANY LINGERING CLOUDS/FOG TO 
GIVE WAY TO AT LEAST PARTLY SUNNY SKIES AND WARMER TEMPS TODAY. MOS 
MAXES WERE QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. 

WON'T HAVE ANY PESKY LOW CLOUDS OR FOG TONIGHT AS CLOUDS AND WINDS 
INCREASE AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING COLD FRONT. LOW LEVEL JET IS TO OUR 
WEST THROUGH 18Z SUNDAY...SO NAM 12KM WINDS WERE TAPERED DOWN A BIT 
IN THE GRIDS. STILL WITH CLOUDS AND WINDS TONIGHT...I THINK MINS MAY 
BE QUITE MILD...SO I WENT WITH THE WARMER NAM MOS MINS EXCEPT IN THE 
FAR NE AREAS SUCH AS TRI. 

FOR GENERAL INFORMATION...USGS REPORTED A 2.5 MAG EARTHQUAKE 
CENTERED 1 MILE SOUTH OF MCCAYSVILLE GA (JUST SOUTH OF DUCKTOWN TN) 
AT 1203 AM EDT. FELT BY A FEW FOLKS ACROSS POLK TN AND CHEROKEE/CLAY 
COUNTIES OF NC WITH NO DAMAGE AT ALL.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...NEXT SYSTEM BRINGS A STRONG 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY MONDAY. BEFORE THAT 
DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SUNDAY MORNING AND AFTERNOON MOVING NE INTO 
THE GREAT LAKES WITH STRENGTHENING SOUTHWEST FLOW BRINGING MOISTURE 
AND WARMING IN THE LOW LEVELS. MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION AREA MOVES 
NE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES BUT LINE OF SHOWERS AND 
STORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS WEST TN AHEAD OF THE FRONT SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
AND MOVE EAST INTO MIDDLE TN BY LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. BEST 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. 
THIS LINE SHOULD WEAKEN BEFORE IT GETS TO THE PLATEAU BUT SOME 
STRONG STORMS ARE POSSIBLE THERE. LATER SUNDAY EVENING FARTHER EAST 
EXPECT MOSTLY SHOWERS. SECONDARY AREA OR LINE OF SHOWERS ASSOCIATED 
WITH ACTUAL FRONT MOVES IN MONDAY MORNING ADDITIONAL THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE ALONG FRONT. IMPROVING CONDITIONS MONDAY AFTERNOON BEHIND 
FRONT FROM WEST TO EAST. SOME MORE SHOWERS POSSIBLE IN THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS WITH UPPER TROUGH BEFORE 00Z TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
SETTLES IN MONDAY NIGHT AND WILL BRING A QUIET PATTERN THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. CLOUDS INCREASE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES. THIS SYSTEM IS SIMILAR TO THE FIRST ONE WITH SHOWERS 
DEVELOPING WITH PRE FRONTAL BAND THURSDAY. PREFER SLOWER ECMWF 
SOLUTION WITH MORE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE STORMS THURSDAY NIGHT WITH 
FRONT. DEEP TROUGH MOVING IN BEHIND FRONT WITH WRAP AROUND SHOWERS 
FRIDAY. FOLLOWED WARMER NAM GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES SUNDAY AND A 
BLEND SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR REST OF 
THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

HIGH SHIFTS QUICKLY EAST SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A DEEPENING AREA OF
LOW PRESSURE OVER THE PLAINS WITH A STRONG LOW LEVEL JET CAUSING
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM AND
MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY BY SUNDAY MORNING. THE AIR MASS BECOMES
MODERATELY UNSTABLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH A POSSIBLE

DAMAGING WINDS A THREAT. SHOWERS CONTINUE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. BEHIND THIS FRONT MONDAY NIGHT
THROUGH WEDNESDAY HIGH PRESSURE WITH MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY
SKIES WILL PREVAIL. ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH A GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THIS SYSTEM DOES
NOT LOOK AS STRONG AS THE SUNDAY SYSTEM AND INSTABILITY NOT AS HIGH
SO ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THUNDER.

SHOULD INHIBIT ANY FOG FORMATION AT THE TAF SITES EARLY THIS 
MORNING...BUT MAY TRIGGER A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS AROUND CHA 
TOWARDS SUNRISE. OTHERWISE...VFR CEILINGS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE 
EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

MOVES INTO A MORE STABLE ENVIRONMENT OVER EAST TN.

AND WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING.

THROUGH THE AREA. HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS QUICKLY INTO THE AREA FROM 
THE NORTH. OTHER THAN THE BRIEF SHOT OF CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION 
EARLY FRIDAY...PATTERN IS A MILD WARMING TREND. SATURDAY SHOULD 
REBOUND TO ABOUT 5 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL 
TRACKS THOUGH REGION ON THE SUNDAY AND INTO MONDAY. BRINGING A 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER ON TUESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON THE 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY TIME FRAME. WILL THE CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS 
GOING FOR SHOWERS AND FEW THUNDERSTORMS. THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL BE 
ON THURSDAY. STAYED NEAR GFS MOS AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

CHANCE POPS.  WILL GO DRY SATURDAY...THEN THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE THROUGH IN THE SUNDAY TO MONDAY TIME FRAME.  SOME UNCERTAINTY 
WITH TIMING...BUT STILL LOOKS LIKE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP WILL 
BE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH LESSER PROBABILITIES SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  NOT 
MUCH COOLING BEHIND THIS FRONT...BUT SOME DRYING INDICATED SO WILL 
GO PRECIP FREE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
TO BE IN THE BALLPARK...SO ONLY SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT WED OCT 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH AN AREA OF 
HIGH PRESSURE BEHIND IT CENTERED OVER THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD TONIGHT...AND 
BECOME CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY SUNRISE. AS A 
RESULT...MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED WITH AREAS 
OF FOG LIKELY DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT...ESPECIALLY NEAR BODIES OF 
WATER. TEMPS SHOULD FALL INTO THE 30S OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT...WITH AREAS OF FROST LIKELY DEVELOPING OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH FROST LIKELY MORE CONFINED TO THE 
RURAL AREAS OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.

AFTER FURTHER REVIEW...IT APPEARS THAT THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA 
REMAINS IN THE FROST/FREEZE PROGRAM THIS FALL (SINCE NO ONE HAS 
EXPERIENCED A HARD FREEZE YET)...SO WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS 
EVENING TO EXPAND THE FROST ADVISORY TO COVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA.

FXUS64 KMRX 101915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT WED OCT 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTHEAST 
THROUGH THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD. CLOUDS WILL THIN THROUGH 
MIDNIGHT AS LOWERING CAP ERODES. COLD AIR ADVECTION TAKES OVER IN 
EARNEST WITH CLEARING SKIES AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM 
THE WEST. SURFACE DEW POINTS AND WET BULB TEMPERATURES FALL TO AT OR 
BELOW FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA BY THURSDAY MORNING. 
CONFIDENCE IS HIGH FOR FROST ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS TONIGHT. FROST 
MAY BE RESTRICTED TO RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND BE 
ISOLATED ACROSS SOUTHERN VALLEYS. WINDS WILL CLOCK FROM THE NW THIS 
EVENING AND WEAKEN BECOMING NE OVERNIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY. LIGHT 
WINDS WILL BECOME UP VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
ALLOWING FOR A MILD LATE DAY WARM UP.        

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS 
WITH THE AREA UNDER THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF AN UPPER LEVEL NW 
FLOW...WITH AN UPPER HIGH NOT TOO FAR AWAY OVER THE WESTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO. A COLD FRONT HAS JUST PASSED AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS 
STARTING TO BUILD INTO THE AREA.   

RIGHT OUT THE CHUTE...THERE IS AN ISSUE AT 12Z FRIDAY...06Z NAM 
SHOWS MORE OF A DISTURBANCE COMING THROUGH THE NW FLOW THAN THE 
OTHER MODELS AND HAS MUCH HIGHER POPS IN ITS 00Z RUN FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  THERE IS NO UPPER LEVEL QG FORCING WITH THIS 
SYSTEM EVEN IN THE NAM...IT'S SIMPLY WARM/MOIST ADVECTION OVER THE 
TOP OF THE SHALLOW FRONT.  OTHER MODELS SHOW PRECIP...BUT ARE 
FARTHER WEST THAN THE NAM. WILL TAKE A MENTION OF PRECIP THROUGH 
MOST OF THE CWA BUT NOT COMPLETELY TO THE EAST...THUS 30 PCT WEST 
AND 20 PCT VALLEY.

RIDGING FOR LATE WEEK INTO SUNDAY THUS EXPECTING WARMER TEMPS. 
FRONTAL PASSAGE SUNDAY WITH CHC OF RAIN...RIDGE MOVES EAST REPLACED 
BY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. A BRIEF COOL DOWN MONDAY...BUT NOT TOO 
SUBSTANTIAL. SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS THAT WILL HELP KEEP 
THINGS WARMER AND MORE HUMID FOR MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. MAY SEE 
ANOTHER WEATHER SYSTEM COME THROUGH AROUND NEXT THURS.

THE WEST. SURFACE DEW POINTS AND WET BULB TEMPERATURES FALL TO AT OR 
BELOW FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA BY THURSDAY MORNING. 
CONFIDENCE IS HIGH FOR FROST ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS TONIGHT. FROST 
MAY BE RESTRICTED TO RURAL AREAS ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND BE 
ISOLATED ACROSS SOUTHERN VALLEYS. WINDS WILL CLOCK FROM THE NW THIS 
EVENING AND WEAKEN BECOMING NE OVERNIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY. LIGHT 
WINDS WILL BECOME UP VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
ALLOWING FOR A MILD LATE DAY WARM UP.        

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS 
WITH THE AREA UNDER THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF AN UPPER LEVEL NW 
FLOW...WITH AN UPPER HIGH NOT TOO FAR AWAY OVER THE WESTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO. A COLD FRONT HAS JUST PASSED AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS 
STARTING TO BUILD INTO THE AREA.   

RIGHT OUT THE CHUTE...THERE IS AN ISSUE AT 12Z FRIDAY...06Z NAM 
SHOWS MORE OF A DISTURBANCE COMING THROUGH THE NW FLOW THAN THE 
OTHER MODELS AND HAS MUCH HIGHER POPS IN ITS 00Z RUN FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  THERE IS NO UPPER LEVEL QG FORCING WITH THIS 
SYSTEM EVEN IN THE NAM...IT'S SIMPLY WARM/MOIST ADVECTION OVER THE 
TOP OF THE SHALLOW FRONT.  OTHER MODELS SHOW PRECIP...BUT ARE 
FARTHER WEST THAN THE NAM. WILL TAKE A MENTION OF PRECIP THROUGH 
MOST OF THE CWA BUT NOT COMPLETELY TO THE EAST...THUS 30 PCT WEST 
AND 20 PCT VALLEY.

RIDGING FOR LATE WEEK INTO SUNDAY THUS EXPECTING WARMER TEMPS. 
FRONTAL PASSAGE SUNDAY WITH CHC OF RAIN...RIDGE MOVES EAST REPLACED 
BY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. A BRIEF COOL DOWN MONDAY...BUT NOT TOO 
SUBSTANTIAL. SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS THAT WILL HELP KEEP 
THINGS WARMER AND MORE HUMID FOR MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. MAY SEE 
ANOTHER WEATHER SYSTEM COME THROUGH AROUND NEXT THURS.




&&

LOCATION.  WILL ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR THOSE NORTHERN AREAS THAT 
HAVE NOT SEE FREEZING TEMPERATURES YET THIS SEASON.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN...ALTHOUGH SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE 
DETAILS.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE.  SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BE OVER THE AREA THURSDAY...BUT WILL GIVE WAY TO AN 
ADVANCING WEAK COLD FRONT THAT WILL SAG SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA 
FRIDAY.  NAM MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN OTHER MODELS WITH BRINGING 
CONVECTION INTO THE AREA WITH THIS SYSTEM. WILL LEAN TOWARD MORE OF 
A COMPROMISE SOLUTION...AND WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LATE THU 
NIGHT THEN LOW CHANCE POPS FRIDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL REGAIN 
CONTROL FOR SATURDAY...BUT ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT FORECAST TO 
AFFECT THE AREA SOMETIME IN THE SUNDAY TO MONDAY TIME FRAME. GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTIES IN TIMING WILL CARRY LOW POPS ALL THREE PERIODS...WITH 
HIGHEST POPS...BUT STILL LOW CHANCE...SUN NIGHT.  DRY TUESDAY FOR 
NOW.  WILL GO ABOVE MAV TEMPS THU NIGHT AND A BIT BELOW FOR HIGHS 
FRIDAY...AND WILL MAKE A FEW OTHER MAINLY MINOR TWEAKS TO GFS MOS 
TEMPS OTHER PERIODS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT TUE OCT 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...FIRST CONCERN IS WHEN THE
CLOUDS WILL BREAK. TN VALLEY STILL MOSTLY OVERCAST. SPLIT THE DIFF
BETWEEN THE COOLER MAV AND WARMER MET MOS ON MINS TONIGHT AND MAX
TEMPS WEDNESDAY. BUT WITH W TO NW WINDS EXPECTED TO PICK UP LATE
MORNING...AHEAD OF APPROACHING FRONT...WILL EXPECT THE LOW STUFF TO
BE GONE BY THEN. CUT BACK ON POPS AND PRECIP AREA WITH FROPA
WEDNESDAY AS MODELS ARE BASICALLY DRY...EXCEPT FOR ECMWF WITH A
HUNDREDTH. KEPT SLGT CHANCES FOR THE PLATEAU EARLY...THEN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS N AND NE IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE 
WEEK...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL FLOW LINGERING OVER 
THE NATION WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
ON FRIDAY. MODELS INDICATE ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE WITH THIS WEAK COLD 
FRONT...SO WILL MENTION ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY. A MORE 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP FOR THE 
WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED 
TO BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...AND SHOULD BECOME THE FOCUS FOR SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION EACH 
DAY EARLY NEXT WEEK. GFS AND ECMWF MODELS THEN BEGIN TO DIVERGE WITH 
THEIR SOLUTIONS BY THE END OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT GENERALLY 
INDICATE AN UNSETTLED PERIOD WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN BRINGING A STRONGER COLD FRONT INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...CLEARNIG AND COLDER TONIGHT
WITH PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING A FEW HOURS AFTER SKIES CLEAR...THEN
SOME PATCHY FROST AS WELL BEFORE DAWN NORTH AND HIGHER TERRAIN.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND 
GENERALLY REVEAL SEVERAL WEAK COLD FRONTS THROUGHOUT THE WEEK WITH A 
MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. BOTH THE GFS 
AND ECMWF MODELS INDICATE ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE WITH THE WEAK COLD 
FRONTS THIS WEEK...WITH ONE EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY...FRIDAY...AND 
SUNDAY. AS A RESULT...WILL MENTION ONLY LOW POPS DURING THESE 
PERIODS OF FRONTAL PASSAGES. WITH NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT LINGERING 
THROUGHOUT THE WEEK...TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN NEAR NORMAL WITH ONLY A 
SLIGHT COOL DOWN EXPECTED BEHIND THE WEAK COLD FRONTS. IN FACT...AN 
UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR 
THE WEEKEND...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO WARM TEMPS ABOVE NORMAL. THE GFS 
AND ECMWF MODELS THEN BEGIN TO DIVERGE WITH THEIR SURFACE PATTERNS 
BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT GENERALLY AGREE THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL 
PATTERN WILL BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE GFS NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ENSEMBLE MEANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 080802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON OCT 8 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SHORT WAVE WILL SWING ACROSS THE 
AREA TODAY...BRINGING CLOUDS AND A BAND OF RAIN. WILL CARRY CAT POPS 
FOR SEVERAL HOURS TODAY WITH THIS FEATURE.  SOME CLEARING EXPECTED 
TONIGHT...AND EXPECT SOME PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP.  MAY ALSO BE COLD 
ENOUGH MAINLY NORTH FOR SOME PATCHY FROST TO DEVELOP...SO WILL CARRY 
MENTION OF THIS IN FORECAST AS WELL.  AT THIS POINT CONFIDENCE NOT 
HIGH THAT IT WILL BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH FOR A FROST ADVISORY...SO 
WILL LET DAY SHIFT TAKE ANOTHER LOOK.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO JUST A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.    

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A COUPLE OF SYSTEMS AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. MODELS STILL SHOW THE 
FIRST SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL HAVE ONLY LIMITED 
IMPACT ON THE REGION WITH DEEP MOISTURE LACKING AND BETTER LIFT WELL 
NORTH OF THE AREA. THEREFORE MAINTAINED A DRY FROPA FOR POINTS 
BASICALLY SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40 WHILE KEEPING SOME SLIGHT AND LOW 
CHANCE POPS FURTHER NORTH. DRY ADVECTION BEGINS BEHIND THIS SYSTEM 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY WITH A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN U.S. MODELS APPEAR TO BE 
MAINTAINING CONSISTENCY WITH THE NEXT SHORT WAVE AND SURFACE COLD 
FRONT IMPACTING THE REGION LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE AND UNIMPRESSIVE LIFT. STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR A SHOWER NORTH HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR THIS SYSTEM. ECMWF 
AND GFS SIMILAR IN DEPICTION A NICE AMPLIFICATION TO THE UPPER 
PATTERN WHICH FEATURES RIDGING ON SATURDAY WITH WARM AND MOIST 
SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPING LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AHEAD OF 
THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM. WENT WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION 
DURING THE DAY SUNDAY BECAUSE OF SLOWER ARRIVAL OF SYSTEM COLD FRONT 
WHILE RAISING TO LOW CHANCE CATEGORY SUNDAY NIGHT CLOSER TO EXPECTED 
FROPA. ADJUSTED TEMPS TOWARD THE NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE DURING THE 
PERIOD.

479 
FXUS64 KMRX 071837
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EDT SUN OCT 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
A SHORT PERIOD OF CLEARING WILL OCCUR THIS EVENING AS THE TROUGH 
NEAR THE APPALACHIANS PUSHES EAST AND DRIER AIR BUILDS IN FROM THE 
WEST. THE TROUGH NOW DROPPING SOUTHWARD OVER THE ROCKIES WILL BE 
RIGHT BEHIND...BRINGING INCREASING CLOUDS AGAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT. QG 
FORCING AND FRONTOGENESIS WILL BE THE MAIN FACTORS FOR LIFT WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...AND THE GFS AND NAM ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THESE 
FEATURES. BOTH POINT TOWARD THE 12-15Z TIME FRAME FOR GREATEST LIFT 
OVER OUR AREA. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS EVERYWHERE AT THIS TIME...WITH 
CHANCE POPS COMING IN LATE TONIGHT...AND AGAIN AS THE SYSTEM EXITS 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. THE FIRST SNOW OF THE SEASON WILL BE POSSIBLE ON 
MOUNTAIN PEAKS ABOVE 5000 FT WITH THE ONSET OF PRECIP LATE 
TONIGHT...BUT NO SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
GENERAL TROUGHING OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL KEEP OUR TEMPERATURES 
AT OR BELOW NORMAL FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...WHILE SHORTWAVES 
CONTINUOUSLY REINFORCING THE LONGWAVE TROUGH WILL KEEP FREQUENT BUT 
NOT OVERLY SIGNIFICANT CHANCES OF PRECIP IN THE FORECAST. THE 
PATTERN IS EXPECTED TO TRANSITION OUT OF TROUGHINESS TO A RIDGING 
SCENARIO ALOFT BY END OF THE WEEK. GFS AND ECMWF AREN'T TOO FAR 
APART ON PROGRESSION OF WESTERN CLOSED LOW...THAT STARTS OFF NEAR 
THE NORTHERN CA COAST PRESENTLY AND VERY SLOWLY MOVES INTO THE 
SOUTHERN ROCKIES ON FRIDAY. CANADIAN HAS A SIMILAR TRACK TIMING. 
GFS/ECMWF OPEN AND MOVE THE LOW TO THE GREAT LAKES BY NEXT SUNDAY 
MORNING. DGEX IS A BIT OF AN OUTLIER WITH A SLOWER SOLUTION... 
KEEPING THE CUTOFF FURTHER WEST LONGER...AND FURTHER BUILDING THE 
EASTERN WARM RIDGE. MAKES ME WONDER. I GENERALLY DID NOT STRAY FROM 
THE CONSENSUS BUT THIS IS THE TIME OF YEAR CUTOFF LOWS LIKE TO BE 
DIFFICULT. BEARS KEEPING AN EYE OPEN. STILL EXPECT THINGS TO BE 
FAIRLY WARM FRI/SAT/PSBLY SUN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  60  44  71  48 /  40  60  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  59  41  69  48 /  20  70  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  59  40  70  47 /  20  60   0   0  10

579 
FXUS64 KMRX 070824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EDT SUN OCT 7 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SERIES OF FAST MOVING 
SHORT-WAVES WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND EARLY MONDAY 
MORNING. SATELLITE SHOWS FIRST SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS IOWA 
AND MISSOURI EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS WAVE WILL PULL QUICKLY ACROSS 
THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS WITH ASSOCIATED UPPER JET PLACING THE 
FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVOR RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION. MODERATELY 
STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING THIS MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE 
AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN WITH THE BEST LIFT OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. WILL CONTINUE WITH CAT/LIKELY POPS NORTH TO CHANCE 
SOUTH FOR MAINLY THIS MORNING. AFTER WAVE PASSES BY AFTERNOON... 
CLOUD COVER WILL BECOME SCATTERED-BROKEN FOR THIS EVENING/EARLY 
TONIGHT.

DUE TO THE RECENT RAINS...SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS EARLY AND CALM 
WINDS...PATCHY FOG IS ANTICIPATED. ANOTHER FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE...
CURRENTLY OVER THE GREAT BASIN WILL SWING TOWARD THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY MONDAY MORNING. WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE POPS OVER THE WEST AND 
SOUTHERN AREAS TOWARD DAYBREAK. BEST CHANCES WILL BE DURING THE DAY 
MONDAY.

GENERALLY WENT FOR COMPROMISE BETWEEN GFS/MET MOS TEMPERATURE 
GUIDANCE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RELATIVELY ACTIVE PERIOD AS 
SEVERAL SHORT WAVES ROTATE ACROSS THE REGION GENERATING A FEW 
PERIODS OF SHOWERS. THE FIRST BUILDS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH ON MONDAY 
WITH A DRY PERIOD FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WHILE THE 
FORECAST AREA AWAITS THE ARRIVAL OF A LOW AMPLITUDE UPPER TROUGH 
WHICH DROPS THROUGH THE MIDWEST ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS CONTINUE TO 
ADVERTISE ONLY A SMALL CHANCE FOR A SHOWER FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH THIS SYSTEM WHICH FEATURES AN ASSOCIATED 
RATHER WEAK COLD FRONT. ANOTHER PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER CAN BE ENJOYED 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AS A LARGE SURFACE RIDGE 
BUILDS ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN U.S. THE NEXT TROUGH AND SURFACE 
FRONTAL SYSTEM SLIDES ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION 
ON FRIDAY BRINGING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. BY SATURDAY THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL HAVE 
TRANSITIONED TO A GRADUALLY AMPLIFYING RIDGE WHICH LOOKS LIKE IT 
COULD BOOST TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE FIRST 
HALF OF THE WEEKEND. IN THIS CONFIGURATION THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN 
WILL NOT OCCUR UNTIL SUNDAY. ADJUSTED MAX/MIN TEMPS WITH THE AID OF 
MOS GUIDANCE.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  49  62  45  71 /  20  30  50  10   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT SAT OCT 6 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
A SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL PUSH ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF 
THE AFTERNOON. A SHORT PERIOD OF CLEARING MAY COME THIS EVENING
BEFORE CLOUDS INCREASE AGAIN TOWARD MIDNIGHT...FOLLOWED BY RISING
RAIN CHANCES AFTER MIDNIGHT. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL INCREASE AFTER
MIDNIGHT AS A MIDLEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES. THE BEST
CHANCES LOOK TO BE IN THE NORTH WHERE THE LIFT WILL BE AIDED BY THE
UPPER JET ACROSS KY/OH AND 500 MB VORTICITY ADVECTION. RAIN CHANCES
WILL BEGIN TO DECREASE SUNDAY AFTERNOON ONCE THE 850-700 MB TROUGH
AXIS MOVES THROUGH...AND ADVECTION OF LOWER THETA-E AIR COMMENCES
AT 850 MB AS A NW FLOW DEVELOPS. TEMPERATURES TOMORROW WILL STAY IN
THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS...WITH SOME LOWER 60S POSSIBLE SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
TROUGHING OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL KEEP OUR TEMPERATURES AT OR 
BELOW NORMAL FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...WHILE SHORTWAVES COMING 
AROUND THE BASE OF THE TROUGH WILL KEEP A FEW QUICK SHOTS OF RAIN IN 
THE FORECAST...AROUND MON...WED...AND FRI. NONE OF THE RAIN EVENTS 
SHOULD BE HEAVY THOUGH. IT WON/T BE UNTIL LATE WEEK WHEN RIDGING 
RETURNS AND TEMPERATURES REBOUND. EXPECT THINGS TO BE FAIRLY WARM 
NEXT WEEKEND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  62  47  65  45 /  40  30  20  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  57  44  64  42 /  60  50  20  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  59  43  65  40 /  60  40  10  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              49  54  38  63  36 /  80  80  10  40  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
134 PM EDT SAT OCT 6 2012

.AVIATION...A COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH EAST TN THIS 
AFTERNOON KEEPING CLOUDS AROUND FOR MOST OF THE DAY. THE CLOUD 
CEILINGS WILL KEEP TAFS SITES DOWN TO MVFR CONDITIONS (2-3KFT) 
THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON. CLOUD CEILINGS SHOULD BEGIN TO RISE BY 
LATE AFTERNOON WITH CLOUDS DECREASING TOWARD SUNSET.

ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT. 
CLOUD BASES WILL LOWER ONCE AGAIN TO ALMOST MVFR CONDITIONS. 
ALSO...OCCASIONAL RAIN WILL DEVELOP AT TRI/TYS BETWEEN 08-12Z. THESE 
SHOWERS WILL BE MORE SCATTERED IN NATURE AT CHA. SHOWERS WILL REDUCE 
VISIBILITIES TO AT LEAST 4-6 MILES AND POSSIBLY LOWER AT TIMES.

FOG SHOULD NOT BE A PROBLEM TONIGHT AS WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO STAY UP 
OVERNIGHT AT ALL THREE SITES. THE WINDS...COMBINED WITH INCREASING 
CLOUDS BY 0600Z AND SHOWERS BY 0800Z...SHOULD INHIBIT ANY FOG 
DEVELOPMENT.

&&

523 
FXUS64 KMRX 061427 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1027 AM EDT SAT OCT 6 2012

.DISCUSSION...
ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FORECAST WILL BE NEEDED THIS MORNING TO ACCOUNT
FOR THE FASTER MOVEMENT OF SHOWERS AND COLD FRONT. THE FRONTAL ZONE
IS CURRENTLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH SHOWER ACTIVITY
AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN A WEAK 925-700 MB CONVERGENCE ZONE. SATELLITE
SHOWS ONLY LOW CLOUD COVER BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH THE 12Z OHX
SOUNDING SHOWING MOISTURE CONFINED BELOW 800 MB. POPS WILL BE
LOWERED TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. 

EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER THROUGH THE DAY AND BUILDING COLD ADVECTION
WILL KEEP TEMPS NEARLY STEADY OR SLOWLY RISING THROUGH THE DAY AS
CLOUDS DECREASE. THE BACK EDGE OF THE CLOUDS IS PROJECTED TO REACH
THE MOUNTAINS BY AROUND 22Z. SO SOME SUNSHINE WILL COME IN LATE IN
WESTERN SECTIONS. HOURLY TEMPS WILL BE UPDATED TO CAPTURE THIS
TREND BETTER.

CEILINGS WILL RISE TO VFR CONDITIONS BY MID/LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON.

198 
FXUS64 KMRX 060816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
416 AM EDT SAT OCT 6 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IS MOVING EAST ACROSS MIDDLE AND WEST TENNESSEE. THIS 
AREA OF CONVECTION IS ASSOCIATED WITH 925-850MB FRONTOGENETIC 
FORCING AS A COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. MODELS 
SHOW THE FORCING ALONG AND WEST OF THE FRONT WEAKENING CONSIDERABLY 
AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. WILL HAVE LIKELY 
CHANCES FOR THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...THEN DECREASING POPS INTO THE 
VALLEY EASTWARD. COOLER AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE FORECAST TODAY..PER
MOS GUIDANCE.

FOR TONIGHT...A FAST MOVING UPPER TROUGH WILL SWEEP ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY/GREAT LAKES REGION WITH ASSOCIATED UPPER JET PRODUCING 
PRODUCING MODERATELY STRONG LIFT DUE TO THE INFLUENCE OF RIGHT 
ENTRANCE REGION. BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL CALL FOR LIKELY/CAT POPS NORTH 
TO HIGH CHANCE POPS SOUTH FOR LATE TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ACTIVE FALL WEATHER PATTERN HAS 
ARRIVED ACROSS THE U.S. THROUGH THE LONG TERM. IT LOOKS LIKE THERE 
WILL BE ABOUT FOUR SYSTEMS TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
PERIOD WITH THE FIRST CURRENTLY DROPPING SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS. PREFERRED THE SLOWER NAM SOLUTION WITH THIS SHORT 
WAVE WHICH INDICATES DEEPER MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MAINLY DURING THE MORNING WITH 
SHOWERS FADING FROM WEST TO EAST DURING THE AFTERNOON. THE NEXT WAVE 
FOLLOWS CLOSE ON THE HEELS OF SUNDAY'S SYSTEM BUT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL 
HAVE A LIMITED IMPACT WITH PRODUCING MAINLY MID AND UPPER LEVEL 
CLOUDS SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH 
THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO AFFECT EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AS WELL AS THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS WHERE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN WAS FORECAST LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
APPROXIMATELY MID DAY MONDAY. THE INTERESTING ASPECT OF THIS FAST 
MOVING WAVE IS THE POSSIBILITY THAT THE SYSTEM'S MID LEVEL CLOUD 
DECK MAY REDUCE THE CHANCE OF FROST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTION OF 
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY MORNING. THE UPPER 
LEVEL FLOW TRANSITIONS BACK TO A ZONAL CONFIGURATION LATER MONDAY 
INTO TUESDAY AS A SURFACE HIGH BUILDS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. CLEARING SKIES UNDER DRY COLD ADVECTION MAY LEAD TO 
SOME PATCHY FROST FORMATION ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AND MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. ANOTHER RELATIVELY WEAK SHORT WAVE AND 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT BUILD ACROSS THE REGION DURING THE DAY 
WEDNESDAY BUT MODELS INDICATE THE SYSTEM LACKS SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE RETURN WITH BETTER UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS FARTHER NORTH SO 
JUST KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS MAINLY NORTH OF I-40 AT 
THIS TIME. MORE SURFACE RIDGING AND DRY ADVECTION IN STORE BEHIND 
THIS SYSTEM ON THURSDAY ALLOWING A RETURN TO SUNSHINE 
HOWEVER...CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AGAIN THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION STRENGTHENING AHEAD OF ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT. MODELS ARE NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT THIS LATE IN THE 
FORECAST SO JUST STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS ON 
FRIDAY. ADJUSTED MAX/MIN TEMPS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD OF 00Z MEX MOS 
GUIDANCE.     

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  49  60  44  65 /  30  40  40  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  48  57  40  63 /  30  60  70  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  46  57  41  63 /  40  60  70  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              67  48  55  36  62 /  30  80  80  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

.AVIATION...
MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN OVERNIGHT AS A COLD FRONT
PROGRESSES TOWARDS THE AREA AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES OFF TO
THE EAST. THIS CLOUD COVER SHOULD PREVENT FOG FORMATION AT CHA AND
TYS TOMORROW MORNING. HOWEVER...AS THE CLOUDS WILL AFFECT TRI A BIT
LATER...SOME PATCHY FOG IS STILL POSSIBLE. MVFR VIS RESTRICTIONS
HAVE BEEN INCLUDED FOR A BRIEF PERIOD AROUND SUNRISE AT TRI.
SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL BE IN THE AREA TOMORROW BUT CONFIDENCE IS
LOW AT THIS TIME THAT THEY WILL EFFECT ANY OF THE SITES...SO HAVE
CHOSEN NOT TO MENTION. CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO LOWER THROUGH
TOMORROW AFTERNOON AS FRONT GETS CLOSER BUT HAVE KEPT CIGS VFR FOR
NOW.

730 
FXUS64 KMRX 051917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EDT FRI OCT 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A CHANGE IN AIR MASS WILL BEGIN ON SATURDAY AS A COLD FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE AREA. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT...WITH BROKEN TO OVERCAST COVERAGE EXPECTED BY SUNRISE. THE 
CLOUD COVER AND SLIGHT SW WINDS SHOULD PREVENT MUCH FOG DEVELOPMENT. 
RAIN IS EXPECTED TO ENTER THE PLATEAU COUNTIES BEFORE SUNRISE...AND 
SPREAD ACROSS THE TN VALLEY THROUGH THE MORNING. PRECIP AMOUNTS LOOK 
LIGHT AS MID/UPPER LEVEL FORCING IS NOT VERY STRONG AND THE FLOW 
ALOFT REMAINS NEARLY ZONAL. POPS WILL REMAIN IN THE CHANCE RANGE. 
SOUNDINGS SHOW WEAK ELEVATED INSTABILITY...AND WILL JUST MENTION A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH. THE COLD FRONT CROSSES THE 
AREA IN THE LATE MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON...AND WILL BE NEAR THE 
MOUNTAINS BY THE EVENING. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
COOLER PATTERN CONTINUES SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY AS UPPER TROUGH 
DIGS SOUTH ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES FROM THE PLAINS TO THE EAST 
COAST. SHORT WAVE MOVES INTO THE MS VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT AND THEN 
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY. THIS WILL TRIGGER AN INCREASE OF 
SHOWERS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. BEST CHANCE NORTH. COLD 
AIR ADVECTION WILL HOLD HIGH TEMPERATURES INTO THE 50S NORTH TO 60S 
SOUTH WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES DURING THE DAY. THEN SUNDAY NIGHT 
CLOUDS DECREASE WITH RAIN ENDING. HOWEVER ANOTHER WEAKER SHORT WAVE 
TO MOVE THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT. BEST MOISTURE SOUTHEAST SO COULD 
SEE A FEW SHOWERS SW NC. BIGGER STORY WILL BE THE LOWS WITH COLD AIR 
ADVECTION AND VARIABLE CLOUD COVER TEMPERATURES STILL EXPECTED TO 
DROP INTO THE MID TO UPPER 30S NORTHERN PLATEAU THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. RIGHT NOW FROST NOT TOO FAVORABLE. MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY TEMPERATURES BEGIN TO WARM AS TROUGH AND SURFACE HIGH 
SHIFT EAST. MONDAY NIGHT LOOKS TO BE THE COLDEST NIGHT AS SKIES 
CLEAR. FROST POSSIBLE IN THE SAME AREAS MENTIONED SUNDAY NIGHT. WEAK 
SYSTEM MOVING SE IN NW FLOW ALOFT WEDNESDAY BRINGS A A THREAT FOR 
SHOWERS. AND ANOTHER QUICK SYSTEM THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 051717
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
217 PM EDT FRI OCT 5 2012

.AVIATION...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO RETREAT TO THE EAST 
AS A WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHES. WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
OVERNIGHT AND THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS. RAIN CHANCES INCREASE 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON...BUT NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO MENTION IN TAFS 
DURING THIS PERIOD. SOME FOG MAY DEVELOP AGAIN TONIGHT AT TRI. 

CURRENT THINKING IS...INCREASING CLOUD COVER SHOULD PREVENT CHA AND 
TYS FROM DEVELOPING FOG...ALONG WITH THE EXPECTED LIGHT WINDS 
OVERNIGHT OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT. KEPT BOTH CHA AND TYS SITES VFR. 
HOWEVER...CHA COULD GO MVFR FOR A BRIEF PERIOD IF CLOUDS ARE A 
LITTLE LATE TO ARRIVE. CONFIDENCE IS TO LOW AT THIS POINT TO 
MENTION MVFR AT CHA THOUGH.

CLOUD COVER SHOULD ARRIVE A LITTLE LATER AT TRI. CLEARER SKIES AND 
CALM WINDS SHOULD ALLOW ENOUGH TIME FOR SOME FOG TO DEVELOP BEFORE 
CLOUDS ARRIVE. MVFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TONIGHT AT TRI.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
721 AM EDT FRI OCT 5 2012

.AVIATION...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETREAT AS A WEAK COLD FRONT
APPROACHES. WILL SEE SOME INCREASE IN CLOUDS TONIGHT AND A
SHOWER MAY MAKE IT INTO CHA VICINITY LATE...BUT PROBABILITY LOOKS
TOO LOW TO INCLUDE IN TAF AT THIS POINT. AFTER ANY MORNING FOG
DISSIPATES SHOULD BE MAINLY VFR...ALTHOUGH SOME FOG MAY DEVELOP
AGAIN TONIGHT AT TRI. WILL MENTION MVFR VIS AT TRI LATE.

956 
FXUS64 KMRX 050816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT FRI OCT 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OVER 
THE AREA TODAY...THEN A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH LATE TONIGHT.  
AFTER SOME FOG TO START EXPECT A MAINLY SUNNY DAY TODAY WITH ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES. WITH APPROACHING COLD FRONT CLOUDS WILL START 
TO INCREASE TONIGHT...AND A FEW SHOWERS MAY MAKE IT INTO WESTERN 
AREAS BEFORE SUNRISE.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LATE TONIGHT 
MOST WESTERN ZONES...EXCEPT LOW CHANCE FAR NORTHWEST PORTION OF 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MAV TEMPS LOOK SLIGHTLY HIGH MOST AREAS FOR 
TODAY...SO WILL TWEAK DOWN SLIGHTLY.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODEL FORECASTS FOR THE 
PERIOD NOT VERY FAR APART WITH PREDICTION OF ABOUT THREE SHORT WAVE 
SYSTEMS TRANSITING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THE FIRST BUILDS 
EAST ACROSS GREAT LAKES AND NEW ENGLAND WHICH BRINGS A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. UPPER DYNAMICS RATHER WEAK 
WITH POST FRONTAL LIFT GENERATING A FEW SHOWERS DURING THE DAY WITH 
BETTER CHANCE NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS. THERE COULD BE ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY FOR A THUNDERSTORM ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA DURING THE AFTERNOON. A MORE SIGNIFICANT SHORT 
WAVE ROTATES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY SO 
GRADIENT OF LIKELY POPS NORTH THROUGH CHANCE POPS SOUTH FOR SHOWERS. 
COLD AND DRY AIR BUILDS INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY BUT 
SUNSHINE WILL BE BACK ON MONDAY. THE FAIR WEATHER PERIOD SHOULD 
EXTEND THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS TEMPERATURES REBOUND BACK CLOSER TO 
NORMAL WITH A WARM AIR ADVECTION INCREASING AHEAD OF ANOTHER FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY. AT THIS TIME MODELS INDICATE THIS FEATURE WILL BE DRIVEN 
BY A RATHER LOW AMPLITUDE TROUGH WITH DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT NORTH 
OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION SO HELD POPS FOR SHOWERS IN THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE. MORE DRY ADVECTION BEHIND DEPARTING MID WEEK 
FRONTAL SYSTEM ALLOWS FOR ANOTHER MOSTLY SUNNY DAY THURSDAY. TRENDED 
MAX/MIN TEMPS TOWARD NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE FOR THE LONG TERM.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  58  72  49  63 /   0  10  40  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  81  56  69  47  60 /   0  10  40  50  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       81  56  65  46  60 /   0  20  40  50  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              78  52  67  47  57 /   0  10  40  70  70

.AVIATION...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETREAT AS A WEAK COLD FRONT

620 
FXUS64 KMRX 050201
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT THU OCT 4 2012

.DISCUSSION...MINOR ADJUSTMENT TO TEMPS AND DEW POINTS WHICH ARE 
RUNNING A LITTLE WARM ACROSS URBAN AREAS THIS EVENING. OTHERWISE
GOOD RAD COOLING OVERNIGHT SHOULD APPROACH FORECAST MINS AND 
ALLOW FOR FOG DEVELOPMENT. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... WITH HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING 
OVER THE AREA AND A DRY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...CONDITIONS APPEAR 
FAVORABLE FOR FOG DEVELOPMENT TONIGHT. DEWPOINTS THIS AFTERNOON ARE 
IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S...AND LOWS ARE EXPECTED TO BE IN THE UPPER 
40S TO LOWER 50S. CONFIDENCE IN FOG FORMATION IS HIGHEST NORTHEAST. 
WILL MENTION AREAS OF FOG NE WITH PATCHY FOG ELSEWHERE. WILL HOLD 
OFF ON A DENSE FOG ADVISORY...AND LET THE EVENING SHIFT EVALUATE. 
FRIDAY LOOKS SUNNY AND MILD AFTER THE FOG BURNS OFF BY 
MID-MORNING...WITH HIGHS A BIT WARMER THAN TODAY...IN THE UPPER 70S 
TO LOWER 80S.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN STORY FOR THIS TIME 
PERIOD WILL BE THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA...THE ASSOCIATED RAINFALL AND SUBSEQUENT COOLER 
TEMPERATURES OVER THE UPCOMING WEEKEND.

IT WILL CERTAINLY FEEL LIKE FALL AFTER THE COLD FRONT MARCHES INTO 
GEORGIA AND THE CAROLINAS. THE NAM IS ABOUT SIX HOURS SLOWER WITH 
THE FRONTAL PASSAGE THAN THE GFS ON SATURDAY. HOWEVER BOTH MODELS 
SUGGEST THAT THE BEST CHANCES FOR MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION WILL 
OCCUR ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA. IT ALSO APPEARS THAT SHOWERS THAT DEVELOP 
WILL BECOME MORE SCATTERED AS THE DAY PROGRESSES ON SATURDAY. THE 
HEAVIER AND BETTER CHANCES OF RAIN WILL AWAIT THE UPPER TROUGH 
POISED TO BARREL ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY ON SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY. ONCE AGAIN...THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAINFALL WILL BE ACROSS NE 
TN AND SW VA. MOST PRECIPITATION WILL BE N AND E OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT.

WHILE SUNDAY MORNING WILL BE COOL WITH LOWS EXPECTED TO BE NEAR 40 
DEGREES IN SOME PLACES...THE COLDEST MORNING WILL BE MONDAY 
PARTICULARLY OVER PARTS OF THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...NE TN AS WELL AS 
HIGHER TERRAIN IN E TN AND SW VA. THUS THERE WILL BE A POSSIBILITY OF 
FROST FOR THESE AREAS. 

DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL UNTIL LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. 
ANOTHER STRONG TROUGH/SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE OVER THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION SENDING ANOTHER COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA. AT THIS TIME WE 
HAVE MENTIONED ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR NE TN AND SW VA 
BECAUSE THAT WILL BE THE LOCATION OF THE BEST LIFT FOR OUR AREA.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

DGS/AC


734 PM EDT THU OCT 4 2012

.AVIATION...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA THIS EVENING WILL KEEP WINDS
CALM AND SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR. THIS ENVIRONMENT WILL BE CONDUCIVE FOR
FOG FORMATION TONIGHT AND TOMORROW MORNING AT ALL TERMINALS. AT
PRESENT...MVFR VSBYS HAVE BEEN INCLUDED AT CHA AND IFR VSBYS AT TYS
FOR THE HOURS AROUND SUNRISE. HIGHEST CONFIDENCE FOR DENSE FOG WILL
BE AT TRI WITH CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO DROP DOWN TO LIFR CRITERIA.
FOG WILL TAKE A BIT LONGER THAN USUAL TO DISSIPATE SO HAVE KEPT VIS
RESTRICTIONS IN THROUGH MID-MORNING. ONCE THIS FOG
LIFTS...CONDITIONS WILL AGAIN BE VFR FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
PERIOD.

052 
FXUS64 KMRX 041744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
144 PM EDT THU OCT 4 2012

.AVIATION...FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE REST OF THE DAY. 
AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP WINDS LIGHT WITH A FEW CLOUDS 
AROUND. VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON.

LAST NIGHT...TYS AND TRI DID NOT RECEIVE MUCH FOG DUE TO THE 
LINGERING CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT AND THROUGH EARLY MORNING. AS 
OPPOSED TO CHA...WHICH RECEIVED CLEAR SKIES AND THUS HAD FOG. 

TONIGHT...CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS WILL FAVOR FOG DEVELOPMENT AT 
ALL THREE TAF SITES. CURRENT DEWPOINTS ARE 61 AT CHA...56 AT 
TYS...AND 56 AT TRI. IF THE DEWPOINTS CONTINUE TO STAY UP...NO 
REASON WHY THEY SHOULD DROP...LOW TEMPERATURE FORECASTS FOR ALL THREE 
SITES ARE EXPECTED TO REACH THE DEWPOINT TEMPS. 

CURRENT THINKING IS...WIDESPREAD FOG IS FAVORABLE DUE TO THE 
AFOREMENTIONED CONDITIONS. CONFIDENCE IS HIGH FOR SEEING AT LEAST 
IFR CONDITIONS AT ALL THREE TAF SITES. FOG WILL BE SLOW TO BURN OFF 
TOMORROW MORNING...SO KEPT FOG IN UNTIL 1400Z FOR ALL THREE SITES.

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

978 
FXUS64 KMRX 040803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
403 AM EDT THU OCT 4 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE EXPECTED TO TRACK
OUT TO THE REGION WHICH SHOULD PROVIDING DECREASING CLOUDS OVER THE
NORTHERN PORTIONS THIS MORNING. IT SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY EVERYWHERE
THIS AFTERNOON AS HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS TODAY. MAY SEE PATCHY FOG
EARLY TODAY BUT NOT WIDESPREAD ENOUGH FOR AN ADVISORY. WITH THE LESS
CLOUDINESS EXPECTED IT SHOULD BE WARMER TODAY. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES
LOOKED REASONABLE FOR TODAY SO STAYED CLOSE. HIGH PRESSURE LINGERS
INTO TONIGHT BRINGING ANOTHER DRY NIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES
LOOKED REASONABLE AGAIN.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THE WEEKEND. MODELS AGREE
THAT A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY
SATURDAY MORNING... WITH MOST OF THE PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH IT
DEVELOPING BEHIND IT AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW AMPLIFIES. THUS...WILL
MENTION JUST SHOWERS FOR THE WEEKEND...SINCE THE AIR MASS SHOULD BE
FAIRLY STABLE BEHIND THIS FRONT. A STRONG SHORT WAVE IS THEN
PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...GENERATING
ADDITIONAL SHOWERS THROUGHOUT THE DAY. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS
OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...BRINGING UNSEASONABLY
COLD TEMPS AND AREAS OF FROST OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...TRENDED CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
