955 
FXUS64 KMRX 040205
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT WED OCT 3 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. CLOUDS WILL 
SLOWLY THIN AND MOVE OFF AS UPPER TROUGH AXIS WEAKENS AND SHIFTS 
NORTHEAST. PATCHY LATE NIGHT FOG WILL LIKELY DEVELOP. TEMPS LOOK 
GOOD. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
THE DEEP TROUGH OVER THE MS VALLEY TODAY WILL BE LIFTING NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE TN/OHIO VALLEY REGION TONIGHT AND TOWARD NEW ENGLAND BY 
LATE TOMORROW. DRIER AIR TO OUR WEST WILL BE WORKING ITS WAY EAST AS 
THE TROUGH DEPARTS. WITH LESS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND WITHOUT A 
STRONG INVERSION TO TRAP MOISTURE...WE SHOULD NOT SEE AS MUCH  
CLOUDINESS TONIGHT AS WE DID LAST NIGHT...ESPECIALLY WEST. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME CLOUDS HANGING ON IN EASTERN SECTIONS 
OVERNIGHT JUST AHEAD OF THE TROUGH PASSAGE. PATCHY VALLEY FOG WILL 
BE POSSIBLE IN AREAS THAT BECOME CLEAR. LOWS SHOULD ALSO BE SEVERAL 
DEGREES COOLER.  HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND A NEARLY ZONAL 
MID/UPPER FLOW WILL PROVIDE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR THURSDAY...WITH 
HIGHS IN THE MID 70S NORTH TO LOWER 80S SOUTH.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AT THE START OF THIS PERIOD OUR AREA IS UNDER AN UPPER LEVEL ZONAL
FLOW...BETWEEN AN UPPER LOW/TROUGH TO OUR NORTH AND THE SUBTROPICAL
RIDGE TO THE SOUTH. FROM THIS POINT FORWARD INTO THE WEEKEND...500
MB HEIGHTS ARE FALLING AS THE UPPER TROUGH BUILDS SOUTHWARD LATER
IN THE WEEK...AND PUSHES A SURFACE COLD FRONT INTO/THRU THE AREA
ABOUT SATURDAY. MODELS GENERALLY IN GOOD AGREEMENT RIGHT NOW FOR
FROPA ON SATURDAY.

AIRMASS LOOKS ONLY MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...WITH SOME POST-FRONTAL ELEVATED LI VALUES OF -1 TO MAYBE 
-2.  WILL JUST GO WITH SHOWERS FOR NOW SATURDAY AND RAIN SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST PRETTY GOOD CHANCE OF 
DRIZZLE FOLLOWING MAIN PRECIP. WILL NOT MENTION THE DRIZZLE 
YET...JUST THE POP FOR THE RAIN.

MUCH COOLER AIR EXPECTED TO SPILL INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND 
INTO NEXT WEEK. MODELS ALSO AGREE ON A COUPLE OF TRAILING 
SHORTWAVES ON SUNDAY AND INTO MONDAY.  FINALLY BY SUNSET ON MONDAY 
ALL THE SHORTWAVES SHOULD BE PAST. WILL CUT OFF POPS BY SUNDAY 
EVENING AS THE MOISTURE GETS TOO SHALLOW FOR THE LIFT WITH THIS 
FINAL SHORTWAVE. AM GOING A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE FOR THE 
MAX TEMP ON SUNDAY IN THE NERN SECTIONS...THINKING THAT IT WILL BE 
COLD AND WET AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY...WOULD HAVE GONE 
COLDER IF IT LOOKED FOR SURE TO HANG IN ALL DAY...BUT MIGHT BREAK UP 
LATTER HALF OF THE AFTERNOON.

BOTH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT LOOK PRETTY CHILLY...SUNDAY NIGHT 
AS THE COLDEST AIR SETTLES IN...AND MONDAY NIGHT DUE TO BETTER 
RADIATIONAL COOLING. WENT A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE 
ON MONDAY NIGHT.  STARTING TUESDAY...THE AIR MASS SHOULD MODIFY 
ENOUGH TO GET NOTABLY WARMER.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  81  51  85  54 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  55  79  50  82  52 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  79  49  83  53 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  78  45  80  50 /   0   0   0  10  10

923 
FXUS64 KMRX 032326
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
726 PM EDT WED OCT 3 2012

.AVIATION...
LOW LEVEL CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO DISSIPATE OVERNIGHT AS AN UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH PULLS AWAY TO THE NORTHEAST...LEAVING MAINLY MID AND
UPPER LEVEL CLOUD DECKS ACROSS THE AREA. MAIN ISSUE THIS PERIOD WILL BE
WHETHER OR NOT THESE LOW CLOUDS LINGER OVER TRI OVERNIGHT...WHICH
WOULD HELP INHIBIT FOG FORMATION DURING THE MORNING HOURS TOMORROW.
WHERE CLEARING DOES OCCUR FOG FORMATION WILL BE LIKELY.
CURRENTLY...EXPECTING LOW LEVEL CLOUDS TO LINGER OVER TRI AND BEGIN
TO SCATTER OUT LATE TONIGHT ALLOWING A BRIEF PERIOD FOR PATCHY FOG
TO DEVELOP...SO HAVE INCLUDED MVFR VSBYS FOR A FEW HOURS IN THE
MORNING. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE SITUATION AND UPDATE AS
NEEDED. OTHERWISE...MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS CAN BE
EXPECTED TOMORROW AS HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE REGION.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

KG/SON


754 
FXUS64 KMRX 032042
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 PM EDT WED OCT 3 2012

...RETRANS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
THE DEEP TROUGH OVER THE MS VALLEY TODAY WILL BE LIFTING NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE TN/OHIO VALLEY REGION TONIGHT AND TOWARD NEW ENGLAND BY 
LATE TOMORROW. DRIER AIR TO OUR WEST WILL BE WORKING ITS WAY EAST AS 
THE TROUGH DEPARTS. WITH LESS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND WITHOUT A 
STRONG INVERSION TO TRAP MOISTURE...WE SHOULD NOT SEE AS MUCH  
CLOUDINESS TONIGHT AS WE DID LAST NIGHT...ESPECIALLY WEST. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME CLOUDS HANGING ON IN EASTERN SECTIONS 
OVERNIGHT JUST AHEAD OF THE TROUGH PASSAGE. PATCHY VALLEY FOG WILL 
BE POSSIBLE IN AREAS THAT BECOME CLEAR. LOWS SHOULD ALSO BE SEVERAL 
DEGREES COOLER.  HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND A NEARLY ZONAL 
MID/UPPER FLOW WILL PROVIDE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR THURSDAY...WITH 
HIGHS IN THE MID 70S NORTH TO LOWER 80S SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AT THE START OF THIS PERIOD OUR AREA IS UNDER AN UPPER LEVEL ZONAL
FLOW...BETWEEN AN UPPER LOW/TROUGH TO OUR NORTH AND THE SUBTROPICAL
RIDGE TO THE SOUTH. FROM THIS POINT FORWARD INTO THE WEEKEND...500
MB HEIGHTS ARE FALLING AS THE UPPER TROUGH BUILDS SOUTHWARD LATER
IN THE WEEK...AND PUSHES A SURFACE COLD FRONT INTO/THRU THE AREA
ABOUT SATURDAY. MODELS GENERALLY IN GOOD AGREEMENT RIGHT NOW FOR
FROPA ON SATURDAY.

AIRMASS LOOKS ONLY MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...WITH SOME POST-FRONTAL ELEVATED LI VALUES OF -1 TO MAYBE 
-2.  WILL JUST GO WITH SHOWERS FOR NOW SATURDAY AND RAIN SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST PRETTY GOOD CHANCE OF 
DRIZZLE FOLLOWING MAIN PRECIP. WILL NOT MENTION THE DRIZZLE 
YET...JUST THE POP FOR THE RAIN.

MUCH COOLER AIR EXPECTED TO SPILL INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND 
INTO NEXT WEEK. MODELS ALSO AGREE ON A COUPLE OF TRAILING 
SHORTWAVES ON SUNDAY AND INTO MONDAY.  FINALLY BY SUNSET ON MONDAY 
ALL THE SHORTWAVES SHOULD BE PAST. WILL CUT OFF POPS BY SUNDAY 
EVENING AS THE MOISTURE GETS TOO SHALLOW FOR THE LIFT WITH THIS 
FINAL SHORTWAVE. AM GOING A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE FOR THE 
MAX TEMP ON SUNDAY IN THE NERN SECTIONS...THINKING THAT IT WILL BE 
COLD AND WET AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY...WOULD HAVE GONE 
COLDER IF IT LOOKED FOR SURE TO HANG IN ALL DAY...BUT MIGHT BREAK UP 
LATTER HALF OF THE AFTERNOON.

BOTH SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT LOOK PRETTY CHILLY...SUNDAY NIGHT 
AS THE COLDEST AIR SETTLES IN...AND MONDAY NIGHT DUE TO BETTER 
RADIATIONAL COOLING. WENT A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE 
ON MONDAY NIGHT.  STARTING TUESDAY...THE AIR MASS SHOULD MODIFY 
ENOUGH TO GET NOTABLY WARMER.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  81  51  85  54 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  55  79  50  82  52 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  79  49  83  53 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  78  45  80  50 /   0   0   0  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 030801
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 AM EDT WED OCT 3 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR WAS INDICATING LIGHT
DRIZZLE TO THE NORTH EARLIER ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW TO THE NORTH.
IT SHOULD CONTINUE TO HEAD OUT OF OUR AREA SO WILL KEEP THE DRY
FORECAST FOR TODAY. CLOUDS OVER THE AREA HAS SLOWED DOWNED FOG
FORMATION THIS MORNING. COULD SEE FOG FORMING EARLY THIS MORNING SO
WILL HANDLE WITH AN SPS. EXPECTING DECREASING CLOUDS...SO GUIDANCE
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE. HIGH PRESSURE
LINGERS OVER THE REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT. DIDN'T
STRAYED TOO FAR FROM GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A SLOW-MOVING COLD FRONT ON SATURDAY
BRINGING BELOW NORMAL TEMPS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. BEFORE THEN...A
ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL FLOW PATTERN WILL BRING DRY CONDITIONS AND ABOVE
NORMAL TEMPS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WITH THIS UPPER-LEVEL FLOW
AMPLIFYING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THE WEEKEND.
MODELS AGREE THAT MOST OF THE PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COLD
FRONT WILL BE BEHIND IT...SO WILL MENTION JUST SHOWERS BEGINNING
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND LINGERING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. ANOTHER
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL ROTATE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON
SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS DISAGREE ABOUT WHETHER
THIS FEATURE WILL HAVE ENOUGH MOISTURE TO PRODUCE PRECIP. FOR
NOW...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL
INCREASE THE CLOUD COVER WHICH SHOULD KEEP MINS A LITTLE WARMER AS
WELL. HIGH PRESSURE THEN SETTLES OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR EARLY
NEXT WEEK...WITH AREAS OF FROST POSSIBLY DEVELOPING IN THE MORNING
OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. AS FOR TEMPS...TRENDED CLOSE TO
THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT TUE OCT 2 2012

.DISCUSSION...AMPLIFIED PATTERN CONTINUES ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. 
WITH UPPER TROUGH HOLDING OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. MASS OF LOW 
CLOUDS COVER AT LEAST THE WESTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA 
WHILE LOWER DECK IS ERODING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. DEEP MOIST AXIS IS SHIFTING EAST AWAY FROM THIS AREA 
WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR SOME INSOLATION. HOWEVER...THE STRATO CU DECK 
TO THE WEST IS PROGRESSING STEADILY EAST WHICH WILL IMPACT SHOWER 
PRODUCING INSTABILITY AND MAX TEMPS IN THIS AREA. FOR THIS AFTERNOON 
WILL TWEAK POPS DOWN EVERYWHERE LEAVING LOW CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM EASTERN SECTIONS WHILE MAINTAINING A SLIGHT CHANCE 
ELSEWHERE AS WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY RIDES NORTHEAST WITHIN THE 
EASTERN U.S. LONG WAVE TROUGH. TEMPERATURE FORECAST INTERESTING AS 
THE MODELS CONTINUE TO HOLD ONTO LOWER 80 DEGREE MAXES ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. NOT SURE THIS WILL 
HAPPEN SO WILL ADJUST TEMPS BACK A DEGREE OR SO HERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT TUE OCT 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER CENTRAL KY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH ALONG THE SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
AL/GA BORDER. AREA RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS LOW AND ITS 
COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHEASTWARD TODAY...WITH A MARGINALLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA 
WHERE DECENT HELICITY VALUES WILL STILL RESIDE AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT. AS A RESULT...IT APPEARS THAT A FEW SEVERE TSTORMS WILL STILL 
BE POSSIBLE TODAY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN BEFORE THE COLD 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY WILL THEN DRIFT EASTWARD 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...GENERATING SOME ADDITIONAL 
CLOUDINESS AND AREAS OF DRIZZLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND THE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO 
THE REGION WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER FOR THE EARLY PORTIONS OF THE 
PERIOD. A COLD FRONT TRACKING INTO THE AREA WILL BRING A CHANCE OF 
SCATTERED SHOWERS FOR THE WEEKEND. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES FOR SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE NEAR SEASONAL NORMS 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD...WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE 
WEEKEND. STAYED NEAR THE MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 011928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT MON OCT 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH REMAINS IN 
PLACE OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THROUGH THE PERIOD KEEPING A MOIST 
SOUTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AT THE 
SURFACE...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MAKE SLOW PROGRESS NORTH FROM 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY OF ALABAMA INTO THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY BY LATE 
AFTERNOON TUESDAY. VERY FAST...MOIST AND DESTABILIZING LOW LEVEL 
FLOW IS IN PLACE ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH EXTENDING INTO MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE. JUST ENOUGH INSTABILITY IS PRESENT WEST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA ALONG WITH VERY STRONG WIND SHEAR FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SUPER 
CELLULAR STRUCTURES. VERY HIGH HELICITY VALUES MAY LEAD TO THE 
FORMATION OF A FEW TORNADOES IN THIS AXIS JUST WEST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. A FEW STRONG THUNDERSTORMS MAY BRUSH ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS BEFORE 
THE ATMOSPHERE STABILIZES. PROBABILITY OF PRECIP WILL BE RATHER HIGH 
FORECAST AREA WIDE TONIGHT BUT WILL ONLY BE IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY 
ON TUESDAY AS THE DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT SHIFTS OFF TO THE EAST. 
WE COULD SEE A FEW SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM OR TWO OVER 
PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY CONTINUES 
TO ROTATE AROUND THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH. TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN MILD TONIGHT WITH A CONTINUATION OF WARM AIR ADVECTION AND 
WILL BE NEAR TO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER TROUGH REMAINS 
WEST OF THE AREA WITH SOUTHERLY JET SEGMENT EXTENDING UP THE 
APPALACHIANS. THE BULK OF THE LAYER MOISTURE WILL MOVE OFF TO THE 
EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. THE COOLER AREA WILL REMAIN TO THE NW ON 
WEDNESDAY. THE TROUGH AXIS SHIFTS EAST AND WEAKENS WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES JUST SW OF ZONAL FOR THE REST OF THE 
WEEK. COOLER AIR MOVES IN AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WEAKLY BUILDS 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. DIURNAL TEMPERATURE RANGE WILL BE 
RELATIVELY LARGE WITH DRIER AIRMASS IN PLACE. COOL NIGHTS NEAR 
NORMAL WITH WARM DAYS. RIDGE SHIFTS EAST OVER THE WEEKEND WITH COLD 
FRONT MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE AREA AROUND SATURDAY EVENING.  
SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED WITH THIS FRONT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
THEN BUILDS IN FROM THE NW AT END OF PERIOD. LEANED TOWARD THE ECMWF 
TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD. MILD COOL DOWN BEHIND FRONT. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
153 PM EDT MON OCT 1 2012

.AVIATION...VARIED FLIGHT CONDITIONS EXIST FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST
ACROSS THE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AS THE ATMOSPHERE QUITE MOIST IN
THE LOW LEVELS AROUND CHA. IN THIS AREA FLIGHT CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN
AND WILL PROBABLY CONTINUE TO BE (FOR AT LEAST ANOTHER COUPLE
HOURS) IFR IN REDUCED VSBY DUE TO RAIN AND FOG WITH CEILINGS AROUND
A THOUSAND FEET OR LOWER. FARTHER NORTHEAST AT TYS AND TRI THE
WARMING AND DRYING EFFECT FROM THE FAST SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS THE
SMOKY MOUNTAINS IS ALLOWING FOR BETTER FLIGHT CONDITIONS. ALLOWED
FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION AT CHA AND TYS THROUGH EARLY
EVENING AS WARM SECTOR TRIES TO EXPAND NORTH THROUGH THE SOUTHERN
REACHES OF THE GREAT VALLEY. THE ATMOSPHERE IS HAVING A DIFFICULT
TIME DESTABILIZING IN THIS AREA DUE TO AN APPARENT LOW LEVEL...DOWN
VALLEY FLOW FORCED BY THE MODEST SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT. PLACED
SOME MVFR/IFR FLIGHT CONDITIONS IN LOW CEILINGS AND FOG AT THE
TERMINALS LATE TONIGHT WHEN THE PRECIP FADES. NOT SURE HOW QUICKLY
VFR FLIGHT GETS GOING ON TUESDAY BUT WOULD EXPECT MUCH OF THE AREA
TO IMPROVE BY MID MORNING.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT MON OCT 1 2012

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST BASICALLY ON TRACK AS SHORT WAVE 
IMPULSES ROTATE AROUND AMPLIFIED MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LONG WAVE 
TROUGH. ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL SHIFT VERY SLOWLY NORTHEAST INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY OF ALABAMA BY EARLY EVENING. PLUME OF DEEP 
MOISTURE CONTINUES TO STREAM NORTH OUT OF THE GULF. THIS AXIS OF 
DEEP MOISTURE WILL EDGE SLOWLY FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY. GREATER RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE REALIZED ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA. WOULD EXPECT A BIT OF A RAIN SHADOW FARTHER 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY WHERE FAST FLOW ACROSS THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN SHOULD LEAD TO LIGHTER RAINFALL AMOUNTS FROM NEAR KNOXVILLE 
TO THE TRI-CITIES. SOME CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE DURING THE AFTERNOON 
AS TEMPERATURES WARM WITH SOME BREAKS IN THE LOW OVERCAST. THE BEST 
CHANCE FOR THUNDER WOULD BE ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THE ADIABATIC WARMING MAY HELP TO BOOST 
MAX TEMPS CLOSER TO FORECAST HIGHS ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA DESPITE DEEP MOIST AXIS BUILDING INTO THIS 
AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON.

730 AM EDT MON OCT 1 2012

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER 
CENTRAL MS...WITH A LARGE AREA OF LIGHT RAIN AHEAD OF IT MOVING 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS LOW IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY DRIFT 
NORTHEASTWARD INTO MIDDLE TN BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO 
TONIGHT. MODELS AND RADAR VAD WIND PROFILES INDICATE A FAIRLY STRONG 
SOUTHERLY 850 MB WIND FLOW (AROUND 40 TO 45 KT) OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING...SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR AT 
THE TAF SITES THIS MORNING. OVERALL...SHOWERS WILL AFFECT THE TAF 
SITES THIS MORNING...WITH SCATTERED TSTORMS POSSIBLE DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. SINCE TIMING THE OCCURRENCE OF STORMS 
AT THE TAF SITES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC...WILL JUST MENTION VCTS IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR NOW. CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES ARE 
EXPECTED TO MAINLY BE IN THE MVFR RANGES THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD... 
ALTHOUGH SOME IFR CONDITIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE AT TIMES WITH THE 
STRONGER SHOWERS.

382 
FXUS64 KMRX 010712
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT MON OCT 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER CENTRAL MS...WITH A WEST-TO-EAST 
ORIENTED WARM FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY AHEAD OF THIS WARM FRONT...WITH SOME STRONG CONVECTION 
OCCURRING FURTHER SOUTH ALONG THE GULF COAST. MODELS AGREE THAT A 
STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILE WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AS THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SLOWLY DRIFTS 
NORTHEASTWARD INTO MIDDLE TN TONIGHT. A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS 
AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT. NAM MODEL INDICATES 
MORE INSTABILITY THAN THE GFS MODEL...MAINLY DUE THE NAM MODEL'S 
WARMER SURFACE TEMPS. WITH BOTH MODELS AGREEING THAT VERY HIGH LOW- 
LEVEL HELICITY VALUES (0-1 KM VALUES IN EXCESS OF 350 M2/S2) WILL 
SPREAD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...IT APPEARS THAT 
THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS 
AND ISOLATED TORNADOES POSSIBLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE REVEALING SOME LARGE DISCREPANCIES WITH MAXES FOR 
TODAY...BUT ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT. SINCE IT 
APPEARS THAT THERE WON'T BE TOO MANY BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER... 
WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE WITH HIGHS FOR TODAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE UPPER-LOW WILL CONTINUE TO 
PUSH NORTHWARD ALONG THE LOWER AND MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY ON 
TUESDAY AND EVENTUALLY WELL INTO THE GREAT LAKES BY WEDNESDAY 
EVENING. GIVEN THE MOISTURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION AND AN 
INTENSIFYING JET ROTATING OVER EASTERN TENNESSEE PROVIDING LIFT... 
SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY ON TUESDAY...PARTICULARLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS. SOME 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING WILL BE POSSIBLE IN LOCATIONS 
THAT RECEIVE TRAINING AND THE HEAVIEST BURSTS OF RAINFALL. BY THE 
AFTERNOON/EVENING...DRY SLOTTING WILL BEGIN TO TAKE PLACE RESULTING 
IN PRECIPITATION WANING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST AFTER 00Z 
WEDNESDAY. SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF THIS STORM 
SYSTEM WILL KEEP SOME LINGERING CLOUD COVER AND A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
PERHAPS A STRAY SHOWER OR TWO ON WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...BY THURSDAY 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL RETURN BRIEFLY...RESULTING IN DRIER AND WARMER 
CONDITIONS FOR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. 

THEREAFTER...ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHERN CONUS IS PROGGED 
TO DRIVE ANOTHER FRONT INTO THE REGION THIS WEEKEND...THOUGH THE 
EXACT TIMING AND TRACK OF THIS IS STILL SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN. THIS 
FRONT WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME SHOWERS AS CLOUD COVER 
INCREASES AND COOLER HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 60 TO LOWER 70S 
ARE EXPECTED. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTIES IN THE TIMING AND TRACK...HAVE 
KEPT LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS IN DAYS 6 AND 7 AND WILL WAIT FOR 
BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY BEFORE MAKING ANY FURTHER ADJUSTMENTS TO THE 
FORECAST ATTM.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   73  66  74  56  77 / 100  80  50  20  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     72  63  73  55  75 / 100 100  60  20  20

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    70  59  72  53  72 / 100 100  60  20  20

INTO THE MVFR RANGES...ALTHOUGH SOME IFR CONDITIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE 
AT TIMES WITH THE STRONGER SHOWERS. SOME SCATTERED TSTORMS ARE ALSO

960 
FXUS64 KMRX 301934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 PM EDT SUN SEP 30 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SHOWERS STILL SOUTH OF
THE SRN TN LINE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THE RAINS WILL WORK NE RATHER
QUICKLY OVERNIGHT. THUS...POPS WERE NUDGED UPWARDS ACROSS THE BOARD
AND I INCLUDED A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS LATE FOR SE TN/SW NC
WHERE AT LEAST SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY DEVELOP PRIOR TO 12Z
MON. THE STRENGTH OF THE LOW LEVEL JET IS MARGINAL OVERNIGHT...WITH
SE-S WINDS OF PROBABLY JUST 15 TO 30 MPH DEVELOPING. MTN WAVE
CONDITIONS DO NOT APPEAR TO BE MET ON MONDAY...WITH BOTH A STABLE
LAYER ALOFT AND UPPER JET INTERACTION LACKING. THUS...FOR NOW I
KEPT SPEEDS IN THE MTNS AT 15-25 MPH AND GUSTS TO 35 MPH.

IF WARM FRONT WERE TO MOVE NE INTO OUR FORECAST AREA THEN A WIDER
THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS FOR MONDAY. HOWEVER...I DO EXPECT THE WARM
FRONT TO BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO CREATE SOME DECENT ELEVATED INSTABILITY
COUPLED WITH IMPRESSIVE SHEAR/HELICITY. SO...A MENTION OF STRONG TO
SEVERE STORMS WAS ADDED FOR SE TN/SW NC. 

TRACK OF THE UPPER AND SURFACE LOW MAY VARY A BIT...AND THERE MAY
BE A BRIEF DRY SLOT OCCURRING MONDAY NIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY. I KEPT
POPS JUST ABOUT UNCHANGED FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...BUT I DID
ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY AFTERNOON (IF CLOUDS
DO BREAK AND SOME SUNSHINE MIXES IN). THE SLIGHT DRYING ON TUESDAY
IS WHY THE MOS TEMPS ARE MUCH WARMER FOR HIGHS TUESDAY...AND I
TRENDED CLOSER TO THESE LATEST MOS MAXES.

OTHERWISE...DID NOT SEE ANY REASON TO HIGHLIGHT HEAVY RAINS OR
FLOODING ANY MORE THAN IN CURRENT HWO PRODUCT.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS NOT TOO FAR APART 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH DEPICTION OF SLOW DEPARTURE OF LOWER LEVEL 
FEATURES AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE OF MAJOR LEAGUE EASTERN STATES 
STORM SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. STILL HUNG ONTO A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR A SHOWER ON WEDNESDAY AS FAIRLY NICE SWATH OF 
MOISTURE AND GENERALLY WEAK LIFT MAKE NORTHEASTWARD PROGRESS ACROSS 
THE MID SOUTH ON SYSTEM'S WAY INTO THE EASTERN LAKES. WEAKENING 
SYSTEM DEPARTS BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND KEPT THE DRY PERIOD IN PLACE 
FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MID DAY FRIDAY. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS NOT 
ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT LATE IN THE FORECAST PERIOD AS A MOISTURE 
STARVED COLD FRONT BUILDS INTO THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. 
LONG WAVE TROUGH AMPLIFIES ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. SATURDAY NIGHT 
INTO SUNDAY WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPPING THROUGH THE BASE OF THE 
TROUGH. RESOLUTION RATHER MURKY AT THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST SO KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS GOING THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND.  


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1005 AM EDT SUN SEP 30 2012

.DISCUSSION...VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS SHOW AN APPRECIABLE AMOUNT OF 
VALLEY FOG OVER ESPECIALLY SW VA AND NE TN AT MID MORNING. THIS FOG 
IS LIFTING/DISSIPATING AT THIS TIME. 12Z OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW A 
GOOD AMOUNT OF DRYING AND SLIGHT COOLING FROM YESTERDAY...WITH HIGHS 
MAINLY IN THE 60S TO MID/UPR 70S AS FORECASTED. 

LOWER MS VALLEY LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD SPREAD SOME SHOWERS OUR 
WAY RATHER QUICKLY TONIGHT...ALTHO THE LOW LEVEL WINDS WILL 
INITIALLY BE SOUTHEAST (DOWNSLOPE INTO CENTRAL AND NRN VALLEY). THE 
LOW LEVEL JET TURNS SOUTHERLY BY 12Z TO 18Z MONDAY...AND SPEEDS 
INCREASE FROM 10 TO 20 MPH OVERNIGHT TO LIKELY 25 TO 35 DURING THE 
DAY. NOT SURE ABOUT STABLE LAYER AT 700 MBS TONIGHT AND APPEARS THAT 
UPPER JET MAY NOT BE LOCATED TO ENHANCE MTN WAVE DEVELOPMENT EITHER.

SEVERE THREAT SHOULD EXTEND AS FAR NORTH AS WARM FRONT REACHES INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WHICH REMAINS TO BE 
SEEN. MORE ON THIS AND ANY HEAVY RAIN CONCERNS LATER.

OTHERWISE...FORECAST GRIDS LOOK GENERALLY ON TRACK. WILL FRESHEN 
HOURLY GRIDS AND UPDATE PRODUCTS IF NEEDED.

&&

715 AM EDT SUN SEP 30 2012

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER

COMPARED TO THIS TIME YESTERDAY. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE DEEP SOUTH AHEAD OF THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM...WHICH WERE MOVING NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A VERY DRY BOUNDARY LAYER LINGERING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR MOST OF THE DAY TODAY...WITH HIGH CLOUDS 
AFFECTING THE TAF SITES UNTIL AFTER SUNSET WHEN CEILINGS SHOULD 
BEGIN TO LOWER. OUTSIDE OF SOME MORNING FOG AT KTRI...VFR CONDITIONS 
AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD...UNTIL 
LATER TONIGHT WHEN MVFR VISIBILITIES DUE TO LIGHT RAIN WILL LIKELY 
SPREAD NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TAF SITES.

212 
FXUS64 KMRX 300758
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN SEP 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER SOUTHEAST TX...WITH A SLIGHTLY 
DRIER AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO THIS TIME 
YESTERDAY. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF HIGH 
CLOUDS OVER THE DEEP SOUTH AHEAD OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...WHICH 
WERE MOVING NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. OVERALL... 
INCREASING CLOUDINESS WILL BE THE TREND TODAY...AS THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE DEEP SOUTH BY TONIGHT. A STRONG 
WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN AHEAD OF THIS LOW WILL HELP TO GENERATE A 
LARGE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA LATE 
TONIGHT. THUS...WILL MENTION FAIRLY HIGH POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA...MAINLY FOR AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE MOUNTAINS LATE 
TONIGHT TOWARDS SUNRISE...ALONG WITH A DECENT VEERING WIND PROFILE 
AND LOW-LEVEL WINDS PERPENDICULAR TO THE MOUNTAINS. THUS...THINK 
THAT SOME MOUNTAIN WAVE ACTIVITY COULD POSSIBLY DEVELOP IN THE 
FOOTHILLS AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT AND INTO EARLY MONDAY MORNING. WITH 
THE MODELS AGREEING THAT THE 850 MB WINDS WILL ONLY BE AROUND 20 TO 
25 KT JUST WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS...THINK THAT ANY MOUNTAIN WAVE 
INDUCED WINDS IN THE FOOTHILLS SHOULD BE ADVISORY LEVEL AT MOST. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER VALLEY...INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. THIS STORM SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE THE REGION WITH 
THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THAT 
TIME PERIOD. AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM...VERY MOIST GULF AIR WILL ADVECT 
INTO THE REGION. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT PWATS WILL BE 
UNSEASONABLY HIGH AOA 1.75 TO 2.0 INCHES AREAWIDE. THIS...COMBINED 
WITH THE STRONG UPPER-LEVEL LIFT...A DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER...AND 
SOME APPRECIABLE ELEVATED INSTABILITY SUGGEST THE POTENTIAL FOR 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL ACROSS THE REGION. ENHANCING THIS 
THREAT...AND THE POTENTIAL FOR TRAINING CELLS WILL BE A STRONG 
LOW-LEVEL JET THAT IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP MONDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING /SETTING UP PARALLEL TO AN SLOWLY ADVANCING COLD FRONT FROM 
THE WEST/. GIVEN THIS...FEEL THAT THE POTENTIAL WILL EXIST FOR 
WIDESPREAD HEAVY RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED FLOODING AND HAVE KEPT A 
MENTION OF THIS IN THE HWO. 

ADDITIONALLY...THE STRONG JET DYNAMICS WILL CREATE A VERY STRONG 
BULK SHEAR PROFILE...ALLOWING FOR GOOD STORM ORGANIZATION SHOULD 
INSTABILITY PARAMETERS BE SUFFICIENT. OF PARTICULAR NOTE ARE THE 0-1 
KM SHEAR VALUES AOA 25 KTS...WHICH COMBINED WITH THE STRONGLY BACKED 
WINDS AT THE SURFACE RESULT IN A NICELY CURVED HODOGRAPH... 
INDICATING GOOD SPEED AND DIRECTIONAL SHEAR AT THE LOW-LEVELS. THIS 
COMBINED WITH SOME APPRECIABLE INSTABILITY PARAMETERS /INCLUDING 
HELICITY VALUES BTWN 200-450 M2/S2 WITHIN THE WARM SECTOR/...A 
THREAT FOR SOME SUPERCELLS WITH PERSISTENT ROTATING UPDRAFTS WILL 
EXIST THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS ON MONDAY. AS A RESULT...THE 
POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WEATHER...INCLUDING TORNADOES AND DAMAGING 
WINDS WILL EXIST...PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ZONES WHICH WILL 
LIKELY BE IN THE VICINITY OF A NORTHWARD ADVANCING WARM FRONT. 

BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING...MODELS BEGIN TO SHOW SOME DRY 
SLOTTING TAKING PLACE AS THE SYSTEM PULLS EAST OF THE REGION. SOME 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE MAY RESULT IN LINGERING SHOWERS AND CLOUD COVER 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...BEFORE SOME CLEARING TAKES PLACE AS 
THE SYSTEM PULLS EAST. A BRIEF PERIOD OF ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL 
RESULT IN DRY CONDITIONS FOR THURSDAY BEFORE ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN CONUS DRAGS A FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA 
FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTIES IN THE TIMING AND 
TRACK...HAVE KEPT LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS IN DAYS 6 AND 7 AND WILL 
WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY BEFORE MAKING ANY FURTHER 
ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FORECAST ATTM. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   78  61  74  64  73 /  10  90  90  90  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     76  58  72  62  72 /   0  70  90  90  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN             76  59  73  61  72 /   0  70  80  90  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    73  54  67  58  70 /   0  50  80 100  60 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
837 PM EDT SAT SEP 29 2012

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS HAVE ABOUT ENDED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
THIS EVENING WITH SKIES BEGINNING TO CLEAR AND DRIER AIR FILTERING
INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS EVENING.
WITH THE RAINFALL ACROSS THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS AND COOLING
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT EXPECT DENSE FOG IN PLACES ACROSS THIS AREA
AND POSSIBLY CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS. NOT AS CONFIDENT ACROSS
SOUTHERN AREAS AS HIGH CLOUDS SPREADING IN FROM GULF COAST SYSTEM.
IF CLOUDS THIN FOG MAY FORM LATER TONIGHT. MAY NEED TO ISSUE DENSE
FOG ADVISORY LATER TONIGHT FOR AT LEAST NORTHERN SECTIONS. REMOVED
RAIN CHANCES REST OF NIGHT FOR ALL BUT EASTERN MOUNTAINS WHICH MAY
HAVE A FEW SHOWERS NEXT COUPLE HOURS. ALSO LOWER LOW TEMPERATURES A
DEGREE SOUTH AND A FEW DEGREES NORTH AS TEMPERATURES EXTREME NORTH
ALREADY IN THE 50S. UPDATE ALREADY SENT.

511 
FXUS64 KMRX 291942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EDT SAT SEP 29 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SHOWERS LINGER ACROSS
MAINLY THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...
ALTHO SATELLITE PICS SHOW THE ENHANCED/COOLER TOPS OFF TO OUR EAST. 
WATER VAPOR PICS SHOW SOME DRIER AIR MOVING IN...WHICH COULD LEAD
TO AREAS OF FOG LATER TONIGHT...INCLUDING DENSE FOG WITH VISBYS 1/4
MILE OR LESS. DEW POINT TEMPS CONTINUE TO RUN A FEW DEGREES ABOVE
MOS...SO I WENT A BIT ABOVE THE GFS MOS MINS. 

GFS AND ENSEMBLES...AS WELL AS MOST OTHER MODELS...ARE MORE IN LINE
ON TIMING THE DEVELOPING UPPER LOW OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY REGION
SUNDAY NIGHT. ECMWF WAS QUICKEST BUT NOT PREFERRED...STILL HAD TO
INCREASE POPS FROM THE SW SUNDAY NIGHT AND WENT AHEAD WITH SOME
CATEGORICAL POPS ON MONDAY. LAPSE RATES MONDAY ARE QUITE MOIST...
SO LESS INSTABILITY WHICH FAVORS JUST ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS.
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS COULD OCCUR...ALTHO SOME AREAS COULD SEE A
BRIEF DOWNSLOPE PERIOD IF LOW LEVEL JET IS FROM THE SE.  

GFS MOS TEMPS WERE QUITE REASONABLE FOR THESE PERIODS AND CLOSELY
FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS RELATIVELY 
SIMILAR IN DEPICTION OF SLOW MOVING AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
PROGRESSION FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE EASTERN 
LAKES/CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WITH SURFACE LOW PRESSURE CENTER DRAGGING 
COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY. USED LIKELY POPS MONDAY NIGHT EDGING BACK TO GOOD CHANCE TO 
LOW LIKELY CATEGORY DURING THE DAY TUESDAY AS A DRY SLOT BUILDS IN 
BEHIND THE MAIN SYSTEM. UPPER LEVEL ENERGY TRAILS BEHIND THE SURFACE 
SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WITH ASSOCIATED AXIS OF HIGHER 
MEAN RELATIVE HUMIDITY SO KEPT SOME TOKEN SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS 
IN HERE. KEPT WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY DRY WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION BACK IN THE FORECAST FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
ALTHOUGH AT THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST THERE ARE TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE MODELS...THUS THE LOW PROBABILITY. ADJUSTED MAX 
TEMPS A FEW DEGREES LOWER DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD. MOS APPEARED 
TO BE A LITTLE TOO OPTIMISTIC ON WARMING.

749 
FXUS64 KMRX 290758
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT SEP 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
DEWPOINTS STILL IN THE 60S...ALTHOUGH THE ISOBARS WOULD SUGGEST THAT 
A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WAS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA OVER THE 
CAROLINAS AND NORTHERN GA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS 
MOIST AIR MASS WILL COMBINE WITH AN AMPLIFYING UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION TO PRODUCE A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
SOME SCATTERED LINGERING CONVECTION TODAY...BUT MID LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES APPEAR TO BE WEAK ENOUGH TO KEEP THIS CONVECTION FROM BECOMING 
TOO STRONG. A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE POSSIBLE 
THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS TONIGHT...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AXIS 
MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN WILL 
EXIST IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS A STRONGER UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE OUT OF TEXAS INTO THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI... 
AND EVENTUALLY THE TENNESSEE VALLEY EARLY NEXT WEEK. ATTM...MODELS 
ARE IN GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT WITH THE INITIAL TRACK...THOUGH THERE 
IS STILL SOME VARIABILITY WITH THE EXACT INTENSITY AND EVOLUTION OF 
THE SYSTEM. REGARDLESS...DEEP GULF MOISTURE IS PROGGED TO STREAM 
INTO THE REGION AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM ON SUNDAY. THEN AS LIFT 
INCREASES WITH THE APPROACHING TROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY...AREAS OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AND 
OVERSPREAD THE REGION FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. ALL INDICATIONS 
ARE THERE FOR ANOTHER POTENTIAL HEAVY RAIN EVENT ACROSS THE AREA 
BEGINNING SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY BEFORE BEGINNING TO WIND DOWN TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A DEEP WARM CLOUD 
LAYER...SEASONABLY HIGH PWAT VALUES AOA 1.75-2.0 INCHES AND SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY. THIS COMBINED WITH AN INCREASING LOW-LEVEL JET 
SETTING UP PARALLEL TO A COLD FRONT PUSHING TO INTO THE REGION WILL 
CERTAINLY ALLOW FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR TRAINING AND FOR SOME 
LOCALIZED FLOODING CONCERNS. AS A RESULT...WILL MAKE A MENTION OF 
THIS IN THE HWO. 

GIVEN ALL THIS...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY FOR MOST OF THE AREA 
MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST VALUES FAVORING THE FAR 
SOUTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS. MODELS SHOW THE PRECIPITATION 
SHIFTING OUT OF THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY MORNING AS THE SYSTEM PULLS 
EAST. THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME DRIER WEATHER FOR THE LATTER HALF OF 
THE WORK WEEK AS A BRIEF PERIOD OF ZONAL FLOW BEGINS TO SET UP 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN UNITED STATES. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW 
DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED GIVEN THE 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION CHANCES...SO HAVE GENERALLY GONE 
SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE WITH TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   80  59  75  61  73 /  40  20  20  40  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     77  56  73  59  71 /  40  20  10  30  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN             76  56  74  58  72 /  30  20  10  30  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    73  49  71  55  69 /  40  20  10  20  70

934 PM EDT FRI SEP 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS HAVE DECREASED RAPIDLY WITH SUNSET BUT

DEFINE STILL LIES NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND IMPULSES ALONG THE

SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE NIGHT. DID NOT CHANGE RAIN
CHANGES MUCH FROM EARLIER FORECAST AND ADDED PATCHY FOG TO THE
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS WHERE RAIN FELL TODAY. ADJUSTED
TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS TO CURRENT READINGS. UPDATE ALREADY SENT.

FXUS64 KMRX 281856

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EDT FRI SEP 28 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT SEEMS TO BE
STILL HANGING ACROSS NRN HALF OF KY THIS AFTERNOON...WHILE
SHORTWAVE HAS TRACKED ENE TOWARD THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. COVERAGE
OF CONVECTION HAS GENERALLY BEEN SCATTERED OR LESS AFTER AN INITIAL
BAND MOVED ACROSS SW VA EARLIER. DAYTIME HEATING AND THE
APPROACHING WEAK COLD FRONT WILL JUSTIFY CHANCE POPS (HIGHEST SW
VA/NRN TN) THRU THIS EVENING...ALTHO I DID LOWER POPS TO SLIGHT
CHANCE FOR SE TN/SW NC. REMOVED THUNDERSTORMS AFTER MIDNIGHT AND
KEPT LOW POPS FOR ANY LINGERING SHOWERS OVERNIGHT. FAVORED A DEGREE
OR SO ABOVE THE COOLER GFS MOS ON MIN TEMPS.

FOR LATER PERIODS...UPPER LOW DROPPING SOUTH INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION SHOULD FINALLY PUSH THE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN  
APPALACHIANS BY SATURDAY EVENING (PERHAPS NOT AS FAST FRONTAL PROGS 
SUGGEST). GFS MODEL WAS ONLY MEDIUM-LONG RANGE MODEL DEVELOPING RAIN 
AGAIN BY SUNDAY...SO I STAYED WITH A MOSTLY DRY FORECAST FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY (IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND NWS 
NEIGHBORS). MOS TEMPS FAIRLY CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS AND GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN 
AGREEMENT DURING THE LONG TERM PERIOD BUT GENERALLY INDICATE UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS GETS PICKED UP BY DEEP 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER LOW AND MAKES SLOW PROGRESS INTO THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON MONDAY. WHILE THIS HAPPENS A SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTS NORTH EAST FROM THE NORTHWESTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 12Z TUESDAY. PLENTY OF 
LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE TRANSPORT EXPECTED SO CRANKED UP POPS FROM 
CHANCE TO LIKELY CATEGORY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND WITH VERY 
SLOW PROGRESSION OF THE MID LATITUDE CYCLONE KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING 
INTO MONDAY NIGHT WHILE DROPPING PROBABILITY FROM WEST TO EAST LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS THE MAIN BULK OF THE STORM SYSTEM 
BUILDS NORTH AND EAST AWAY FROM THE REGION. HAD TO HOLD ONTO SLIGHT 
THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE POP FROM WEST TO EAST TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY WITH MODELS VERY SLOW TO SWING WEAKENING TROUGH EAST OF 
THE APPALACHIANS. THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE WITH 
RATHER LOW FORECAST CONFIDENCE WITH ECMWF AND GFS OUT OF PHASE WITH 
ECMWF SHOWING ZONAL FLOW WITH GFS INDICATING A DEEP EASTERN STATES 
TROUGH. WENT WITH THE NEIGHBORS TO THE WEST SOLUTION WHICH FOLLOWS 
THE LESS ACTIVE EUROPEAN MODEL. HAD TO ADJUST MOS MAXES BACK SEVERAL 
DEGREES THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD WHILE TRIMMING A COUPLE DEGREES 
OFF SUGGESTED MINS.

464 
FXUS64 KMRX 280745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT FRI SEP 28 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
SOUTHWEST-TO-NORTHEAST ORIENTED COLD FRONT OVER KENTUCKY...WITH A 
WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TODAY... 
AS A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER SOUTHERN CANADA SINKS SOUTHWARD 
TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES REGION. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A 
MARGINALLY TO POSSIBLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL MENTION SCATTERED 
CONVECTION AREAWIDE...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE STRONGER UPPER-LEVEL WINDS SHOULD SUPPORT 
A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW IS PROGGED TO 
FURTHER AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION TONIGHT AS THE 
CANADIAN UPPER LOW SINKS SOUTHWARD...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
SCATTERED CONVECTION THROUGH THE NIGHT WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS EXPECTED TO LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE 
TO NUDGE SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE REGION ON SATURDAY IN RESPONSE TO A 
DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ROTATING OVER LAKE HURON 
AND SOUTHERN ONTARIO. SOME APPRECIABLE FRONTAL-GENETIC FORCING AND 
SOME UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT FROM THE AFOREMENTIONED STORM SYSTEM WILL 
PROMOTE A SOLID CHANCE FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS DURING THE 
DAY. AFTER SUNSET...THE FRONT IS PROGGED TO DROP SOUTHWARD INTO 
NORTHERN ALABAMA...RESULTING IN PRECIP CHANCES BEGINNING TO WANE 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS THE COOLER/DRIER POST FRONTAL AIRMASS 
SEEPS INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. HOWEVER...GIVEN 
SOME UNCERTAINTY IN EXACTLY HOW FAR SOUTH THE FRONT WILL MOVE...HAVE 
KEPT SOME LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ZONES THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT.

THEREAFTER...ANOTHER DEEPENING UPPER-TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING OUT 
OF TEXAS AND INTO THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI AND EVENTUALLY TENNESSEE 
VALLEY BY THE EARLY TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL PROVIDE 
THE AREA WITH REASONABLE CHANCES FOR SCATTERED TO PERHAPS WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS AND STORMS AS ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE BEGINS TO STREAM BACK 
INTO THE REGION. THOUGH THE LONG RANGE MODELS HAVE GENERALLY COME 
INTO AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...THERE IS STILL A BIT 
OF UNCERTAINTY WITH ITS EXACT TRACK AND EVOLUTION. GIVEN THE 
INCREASED MOISTURE AND THE UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT HOWEVER...FELT 
CONFIDENT TO GO CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE STARTING MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THE DAY ON THURSDAY...BEFORE THIS SYSTEM GRADUALLY MOVES EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THE END OF NEXT WEEK. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW 
DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED GIVEN THE 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIP CHANCES...SO HAVE GENERALLY GONE 
SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AND WESTERN KY IS MOVING INTO A MORE STABLE AIR MASS SO SHOULD

DURING THE DAY ACROSS THE CWA BUT ONLY AFFECT HIGHS SLIGHTLY. STILL
EXPECT TEMPERATURES ABOUT THE SAME AS TUESDAY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER
SOUTH WHERE THERE SHOULD BE LESS CLOUD COVER. TONIGHT WITH THE
FRONT CLOSER EXPECT SCATTERED SHOWERS AND SOME THUNDERSTORMS TO
CONTINUE WITH BETTER COVERAGE THAN DURING THE DAY TODAY. GENERALLY
FOLLOWED A BLEND OF MET AND MAV GUIDANCE FOR LOWS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALONG 
NORTH END OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL BEGIN TO MOVE SOUTH INTO THE
MRX CWA FRIDAY. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL AID PROLONGED PRECIPITATION
PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AS IT SHIFTS INTO E TN. BROAD
NEGATIVELY TILTED UPPER TROUGH OVER SE CANADA DRIFTS SW WITH BASE
MAKING ITS WAY INTO W TN VALLEY. THIS CONTINUES THROUGH THE WEEKEND
AS FRONT SLOWLY PUSHES SE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY
SUNDAY. PRECIPITATION CHANCES MAY BE UNDERDONE OVER THE WEEKEND BUT
LAYER MOISTURE IS PROGGED TO DROP OFF ON NW SIDE OF JET AXIS AT
BASE OF UPPER TROUGH. EARLY NEXT WEEK STARTS OFF RELATIVELY DRY
WITH DEEP MOISTURE SOUTH OF THE AREA. WEAK UPPER LOW SLOWLY
DEVELOPS OVER THE LOWER MS RVR VALLEY THROUGH THE MID WEEK.
INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH WORKS NORTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
BY END OF PERIOD. THIS SETS UP FOR A WET PERIOD FOR THE LATER PART
OF NEXT WEEK. BRIEF COOLING BEHIND FRONT MID PERIOD BUT OVERALL
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE. &&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...ONGOING CONVECTION THIS

POPS FOR LATE TONIGHT ACROSS SW VA AND FAR NRN COUNTIES OF E TN. I 
ADDED PATCHY LATE NIGHT FOG FOR AROUND TRI AND A FEW SPOTS OVER SE 
TN AND SW NC...WHERE SKIES MAY STAY NEARLY CLEAR. BASED ON MIN TEMP 
TREND OVER THE PAST FEW NIGHTS...I FAVORED A BIT CLOSER TO A MOS 
BLEND FOR LOWS TONIGHT.

FRONT DOES NOT MAKE MUCH OF A SOUTHWARD PUSH ON THURSDAY...SO JUST 
KEPT 20 TO 30 PERCENT POPS ACROSS NRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS. MOS BLEND FOR MAX TEMPS SEEMED MORE REASONABLE 
DUE TO AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS ALONG WITH THE LOW POPS. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A STALLED FRONTAL
BOUNDARY JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL FINALLY MOVE SOUTH
INTO THE REGION FRIDAY. THE FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH DUE TO A SHORT-
WAVE MOVING INTO THE BASE OF THE SOUTHEAST CANADIAN UPPER TROUGH. 

GFS AND NAM ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MODERATE CAPE WITH VALUES UP
TO 1800 J/KG. DECENT FRONTAL-GENETIC FORCING ALONG THE BOUNDARY
WILL BE ABLE TO PRODUCE LIKELY POPS OVER MOST OF THE REGON FRIDAY
WITH CHANCES POPS (MAINLY SOUTH) SATURDAY. AT THIS TIME... WIND
FIELDS AND INSTABILITY DO NOT FAVOR ORGANIZED SEVERE STORMS...BUT
ISOLATED STRONG THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE.

FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY...UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE NORTHEAST
UNITED STATES WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIRMASS. FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...
UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST ALLOWING WEAK RIDGING ALOFT AND
SURFACE TO PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS. BY WEDNESDAY...MEDIUM RANGE
MODELS SHOW A SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH OVER TEXAS PULLING
MOISTURE BACK INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY

TO UPPER 50S TO MID 60S SOUTH. THESE TEMPERATURES ARE 10 TO 15 DEGREES

359 
FXUS64 KMRX 251903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT TUE SEP 25 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
A BIT OF A TRICKY FORECAST FOR THE VERY NEAR TERM AS THE REMNANTS OF 
AN MCS CONTINUE TO PUSH ACROSS EASTERN KENTUCKY THIS AFTERNOON. 
WHILE THIS ACTIVITY HAS GENERALLY REMAINED NORTH OF THE KY/TN STATE 
BORDER...SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS HAVE BEGUN TO WORK THEIR WAY INTO 
SOUTHWEST VA. THIS COMPLEX HAS MAINTAINED ITSELF FOR MUCH OF THE DAY 
THANKS TO SOME ENHANCED MUCAPE VALUES ACROSS MIDDLE TN/CENTRAL KY 
AND A 850 JET DRAPED ACROSS WESTERN/MIDDLE TN. GIVEN THE MUCH MORE 
STABLE AND DRIER ENVIRONMENT EAST OF THE INTERSTATE 75 CORRIDOR...AM 
EXPECTING A GENERAL WEAKENING TREND TO CONTINUE HEADING INTO THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HOWEVER...THE AFOREMENTIONED JET TO THE WEST 
COULD HELP TO MAINTAIN THIS ACTIVITY SOMEWHAT ALONG KY/TN 
BORDER...SW VIRGINIA AND BACK ALONG THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
THROUGH THE EVENING. 

OVERNIGHT...DECKS OF MID/HIGH CLOUDS WILL PERSIST ACROSS MOST OF THE 
REGION AND ALONG WITH SOME LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS SHOULD HELP TO KEEP 
LOWS A FEW DEGREES WARMER...IN THE 50S GENERALLY AREAWIDE. MODELS 
CONTINUE TO SHOW CONVECTION FIRING ALONG A FRONT ALONG THE OHIO 
RIVER TOMORROW...BUT ALL SOLUTIONS SHOW IT REMAINING DISPLACED WELL 
NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. STILL...IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT MODELS 
DID A FAIRLY POOR JOB RESOLVING TODAYS ACTIVITY...SO ANY TRENDS WILL 
NEED TO BE MONITORED OVERNIGHT/TOMORROW. OVERALL THOUGH...A SURFACE 
HIGH TO THE EAST OF THE REGION WILL ONCE AGAIN ATTEMPT TO PROMOTE 
WARMER AND DRY CONDITIONS...WITH MOST AREAS PROGGED TO REACH THE 
UPPER 70S TO THE MID 80S BY THE AFTERNOON. 


.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...A STALLED FRONT WILL REMAIN
ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY KEEPING THE BRUNT OF THE SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL KEEP A LOW CHANCE
POPS FOR THE FAR NORTHERN AREAS...OTHERWISE DRY. FOR SATURDAY...A
SHORT-WAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND UPPER OHIO
VALLEY WILL PROVIDE THE ENERGY TO PULL FRONT SOUTH ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. UPPER JET MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PLACE
THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION WITH
DIRECT CIRCULATION FROM THE JET ENHANCING THE FRONTAL-GENETIC
FORCING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WOULD GO LIKELY POPS FOR THE AREA
SATURDAY...BUT STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE STRENGTH OF THE UPPER
JET AND PLACEMENT. WILL UP POPS TO HIGH CHANCE.

THE SHORT-WAVE WILL DIVE SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR 
SUNDAY. WILL MAINTAIN A CHANCE OF POPS...ESPECIALLY FOR THE WEST-
NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST WITH BOTH RIDGING 
SURFACE AND ALOFT TAKING HOLD.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
207 PM EDT TUE SEP 25 2012

.DISCUSSION...
BASED ON CURRENT OBS/TRENDS...HAVE INCREASED POPS A BIT ACROSS THE
FAR NORTHERN AND NORTHEASTERN ZONES TO ACCOUNT FOR THE BROAD AREA
OF SHOWERS AND STORMS THAT WILL BEGIN TO WORK THEIR WAY INTO SW
VIRGINA AND FAR NE TENNESSEE WITHIN THE NEXT HOUR. THIS ACTIVITY
IS BEING MAINTAINED BY SOME ENHANCED LIFT FROM A 850 MB JET DRAPED
ACROSS MIDDLE/SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE. AM STILL THINKING THAT THE
GENERAL TREND IN THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE A WEAKENING ONE AS IT PUSHES
EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA GIVEN THE DRIER AND MORE STABLE
ATMOSPHERE HERE. HOWEVER...THE AFOREMENTIONED JET MAY HELP TO
MAINTAIN THIS ACTIVITY SOMEWHAT ALONG KY/TN BORDER AND SW
VIRGINIA THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING. ADDITIONALLY...SOME ISOLATED
SHOWERS ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE MAY WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE UPPER TENNESSEE VALLEY BEFORE
00Z AS WELL.

&&

.AVIATION...
VFR CONDITIONS WILL BE THE PREDOMINANT FLIGHT CATEGORY THROUGH THE
PERIOD. A DECAYING TSRA COMPLEX ACROSS KY WILL PROVIDE THE
POTENTIAL FOR A VCSH AT KTRI THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE
AFTERNOON...ALONG WITH SOME BKN/OVC LOWER CIGS. MID LEVEL CLOUDS
WILL LINGER ACROSS THE REGION ALL NIGHT AS THIS COMPLEX MOVES NORTH
OF THE REGION...WITH WINDS REMAINING FAIRLY LIGHT AND FROM THE
SOUTH.

320 
FXUS64 KMRX 251522 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1122 AM EDT TUE SEP 25 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A BEAUTIFUL AUTUMN MORNING HAS PREVAILED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION THIS MORNING AS A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
REMAINS SITUATED JUST TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. THIS WILL PROMOTE A
GENERALLY WARM/DRY SOUTHERLY FLOW AND PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS. AS A RESULT...HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL GENERALLY RUN
ABOUT 5 T0 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY...WITH MANY LOCATIONS
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REACHING THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S
LATER TODAY.

DESPITE THE MOSTLY FAIR WEATHER EXPECTED...THE MAIN CHALLENGE WITH
THE FORECAST TODAY WILL BE THE POSSIBLY OF A DECAYING MCS THAT IS
PRESENTLY SITUATED ACROSS CENTRAL KENTUCKY PUSHING TOWARD THE
ESE INTO THE FAR NORTHERN AND NORTHEASTERN ZONES LATER THIS
AFTERNOON. ATTM...THE BEST THETA-E ADVECTION AND INSTABILITY IS
DISPLACED WELL TO THE NORTH AND WEST OF THE REGION...AND GIVEN THAT
THIS CONVECTION WILL BE WORKING ITS WAY INTO A MUCH MORE STABLE AND
DRIER ENVIRONMENT...AM THINKING THAT THE THREAT FOR PRECIPITATION
WILL BE FAIRLY LOW EVEN IN THESE AREAS BY THE AFTERNOON. MODELS
HAVE NOT HANDLED THE POSITION OF THIS ACTIVITY WELL AS OF LATE
EITHER...AND HAVE SHOWED STRONG QPF SIGNALS ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE
THAT ARE CERTAINLY NOT OCCURRING. STILL...GIVEN THAT SOME ISENTROPIC
LIFT IS PROGGED TO INCREASE OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINA AND FAR
NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AFTER 18Z...FELT THAT A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
RAIN SHOWERS/ISOLATED THUNDER WAS WARRANTED FOR THE AFTERNOON. ALSO
INCREASED CLOUD COVER ACROSS THAT SAME AREA GIVEN THE DENSE LOW/MID
CLOUDS ADVECTING IN...WHICH WILL LIKELY LIMIT HEATING TODAY AND
KEEP HIGHS IN THE LOWER 70S AND PERHAPS THE UPPER 60S IN A FEW
SPOTS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  58  83  60  84 /  10  10  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
441 AM EDT TUE SEP 25 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CENTER OF LOW LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO MOVE NE OF THE AREA. RIDGING CONTINUES INTO THE DEEP 
SOUTH WITH INCREASING SWRLY LOW LEVEL FLOW INTO THE EAST TN VALLEY. 
WEAK MID LEVEL SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST THROUGH KY TODAY. MID LEVEL 
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TODAY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS OF MRX CWA. CIRRUS 
WILL STREAM EAST ACROSS THE REGION. LIFT IS WEAK AND LOW LEVELS 
REMAIN RELATIVELY DRY SO PRECIPITATION WILL BE LIMITED TO A FEW 
SPRINKLES ACROSS SW VA. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO WARM TO ABOVE 
NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BECOMES
CENTERED OVER THE EAST COAST WEDNESDAY WITH A NEARLY STATIONARY
FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS FEATURE WILL SPREAD CLOUDS INTO
NORTHERN SECTIONS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THEN THE FRONT WILL
LIE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. SUNDAY AND MONDAY
AN UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE EASTERN STATES WHICH WILL ENHANCE
SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY ALONG AND BEHIND THE FRONT OVER
THE TN VALLEY. HAVE INCREASED POPS FROM FRIDAY THROUGH THE END OF
THE FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MILD WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY AND THEN LOWER AS CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES INCREASE.

FXUS64 KMRX 250041
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
840 PM EDT MON SEP 24 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS 
REMAINING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...CURRENT DEWPOINTS ARE A 
LITTLE HIGHER THAN THIS TIME YESTERDAY EVENING...SO THINK THAT MINS 
SHOULD BE A LITTLE WARMER OVERNIGHT (COMPARED TO THIS MORNING). 
TEMPS ARE CURRENTLY FALLING A LITTLE FASTER THAN FORECAST OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...SO WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST 
THIS EVENING TO LOWER MINS IN THESE AREAS. ALSO...THINK THAT THE 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS THIS EVENING WILL COMBINE WITH WARM LAKE TEMPS 
(RELATIVE TO THE COOL AIR TEMPS) TO ALLOW SOME PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP 
ALONG THE WATERWAYS. THUS...WILL MENTION SOME PATCHY FOG TOWARDS 
SUNRISE IN THE UPDATE FOR ALL ZONES.

762 
FXUS64 KMRX 241908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT MON SEP 24 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY...PROMOTING SOME
TERRIFIC AUTUMN WEATHER FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. 

THIS AFTERNOON...LIGHT BUT PERSISTENT NORTH TO NORTHEASTERLY FLOW
HAS HELPED TO REINFORCE A COOL/DRY POST FRONTAL AIRMASS AND HAS
KEPT HEATING IN CHECK SOMEWHAT...AS TEMPERATURES HAVE STRUGGLED TO
CLIMB ABOVE THE MID 60S TO LOW 70S AS OF 3 PM EDT. HOWEVER...AS THE
CENTER OF THIS RIDGE MOVES SLIGHTLY TO THE SOUTHEAST...WINDS WILL
GRADUALLY SHIFT TO THE SOUTH/SOUTHWEST TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY. THOUGH
CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED OVERNIGHT ONCE AGAIN...
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER THAN
LAST NIGHT. WHILE A FEW SHELTERED LOCATIONS MAY DROP INTO THE UPPER
30S TO AROUND 40...MOST LOCATIONS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE MID TO
UPPER 40S /WITH A FEW LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE
REMAINING ABOVE 50 DEGREES/. AS A RESULT...DO NOT FEEL THAT A FROST
ADVISORY WILL BE NECESSARY...PARTICULARLY SINCE IT WAS FAIRLY
MARGINAL LAST NIGHT WHEN CONDITIONS WERE COOLER AND BOUNDARY LAYER
MOISTURE WAS SLIGHTLY HIGHER.

FOR TUESDAY...THE NAM CONTINUES TO SHOW SOME LIGHT QPF SIGNALS
/ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY
OVERNIGHT/ MOVING INTO THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES AFTER 12Z. GIVEN THAT
THIS IS THE ONLY SOLUTION THAT IS SHOWING THIS...DID NOT FEEL
CONFIDENT IN GOING MORE THAN LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS ACROSS OUR
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA COUNTIES ATTM. THE MAIN STORY FOR THE NEXT
COUPLE OF DAYS HOWEVER WILL SIMPLY BE THE WARM...SUNNY AND DRY
CONDITIONS BEING PROMOTED BY THE AFOREMENTIONED HIGH PRESSURE
RIDGE. WITH HIGHER THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT...HIGHS WILL
RETURN TO THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...
WITH A FEW SPOTS ACROSS THE SOUTH POSSIBLY REACHING 85 BY MIDWEEK.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
EXTENDED STARTS OFF OKAY BUT QUICKLY GETS MURKY AS MODELS ARE QUITE 
APART ON LATE PERIOD SOLUTION. LATEST GFS HAS FAIR WX EARLY NEXT 
WEEK WHILE 00Z ECMWF HAS WET WX FOR THE SAME TIME FRAME. IT SEEMS 
THE LATEST CANADIAN RUN LEANS TOWARD THE ECMWF SIDE. NOT TO LEAVE 
THE AMERICAN SOLUTIONS ISOLATED...THE 06Z DGEX LIKEWISE FAVORS A 
WETTER SOLUTION. WE WILL HAVE LOW POPS IN THE FORECAST UNTIL THERE 
IS CLARITY ON TAKING THEM OUT OR BUMPING THEM HIGHER. THE MAIN 
WEATHER CULPRIT TO THE MODEL DISPARITIES IS A PERSISTENT LONGWAVE 
TROUGH OVER THE EAST...WITH A SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO BE 
DRAPED SOMEWHERE AROUND THE OH/TN VALLEYS. THE THREE WET MODELS PICK 
UP ON A SHORTWAVE ROUNDING THE BASE OF THE LONGWAVE THIS COMING 
WEEKEND AND TAPPING INTO MOISTURE TO PRODUCE PRECIP...WHILE GFS IS A 
BIT FASTER AND MUCH DRIER WITH THE SHORTWAVE FEATURE. WE SHALL SEE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  74  47  80  58  82 /   0  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       75  48  81  57  82 /   0  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              70  44  76  53  78 /   0  10  10  10  10

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE FORECAST AS SURFACE RIDGING
CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE REGION...PROMOTING A BEAUTIFUL SUNNY
AUTUMN DAY...WITH VERY LOW RH VALUES. WITH AMPLE SUNSHINE AND
INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT...HAVE TWEAKED HIGHS
UP A DEGREE OR TWO. VALLEY LOCATIONS ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN ZONES WILL LIKELY CLIMB INTO THE MID TO UPPER 70S...WITH
SLIGHTLY COOLER READINGS EXPECTED ACROSS NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. GIVEN THE VERY DRY POST FRONTAL AIRMASS IN PLACE
AND THE STRONG SUBSIDENCE PREVAILING...POPS WILL REMAIN AT ZERO
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY.

VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...AND OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
EARLY THIS MORNING WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING INTO THE MID TO UPPER

TEMPERATURES RISING INTO THE LOW TO MID 70S.

TRAVELING ALONG A STATIONARY BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH MAY PULL IN A 
FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS ON TUESDAY.  ANY 
CONVECTION SHOULD STAY TO OUR NORTH ON WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER 
DISTURBANCE SLIDES THROUGH THURSDAY AND HAVE CONTINUE LOW POPS OVER 
NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN DURING THE 
WEEKEND.  IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...SHOULD SEE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND OCCASIONALLY A FEW THUNDERSTORMS MOVE THROUGH THE MRX 
CWA FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
LOOK REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

210 
FXUS64 KMRX 231904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT SUN SEP 23 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
TO OUR NORTHWEST WILL DRIFT EAST AND SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE PERIOD.  
WITH DRY AIR IN PLACE WILL SEE MAINLY CLEAR CONDITIONS TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY.  WITH WINDS DROPPING OFF TONIGHT AND CLEAR SKY EXPECT SOME 
AREAS OF FROST TO FORM MAINLY NORTH AND EAST ZONES..WITH SOME PATCHY 
LIGHT FROST EVEN INTO SOME OUTLYING AREAS OF CENTRAL VALLEY AND 
NORTHERN PLATEAU.  WILL ISSUE FROST ADVISORY FOR NORTHEAST AND 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS ZONES FOR LATE TONIGHT.  



.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... CONTINUED PLEASANT
WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE FIRST FULL WEEK OF AUTUMN AS A
SURFACE HIGH WILL PROMOTE GENERALLY MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS AND WARMER DAYTIME TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 70S TO MID
80S FOR MUCH OF THE WORK WEEK. MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS ARE
ANTICIPATED FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT SOME LOW-END
CHANCES FOR ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL EXIST ON TUESDAY AS THE NAM IS
HINTING AT THE REMNANTS OF SOME NOCTURNAL CONVECTION ACROSS
KENTUCKY MOVING INTO THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES DURING THE
MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON.

A COLD FRONT WILL GRADUALLY MOVE SOUTH FROM THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN THE WEEK AS ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH MOVES 
ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN UNITED STATES. DEPENDING ON HOW FAR SOUTH 
THE FRONT MAKES IT...SOME LOW-END CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS ARE 
POSSIBLE BEGINNING THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
ZONES. HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND...SOME SLIGHTLY HIGHER PRECIP 
CHANCES WILL EXIST AREAWIDE AS ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH IS PROGGED TO 
SWING FROM THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TOWARD THE REGION. STILL... 
GIVEN THE MODEL UNCERTAINTY ON THE EXACT TRACK/INTENSITY OF THIS 
LOW...DID NOT FEEL CONFIDENT GOING HIGHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
THAT FAR OUT IN THE FORECAST ATTM. THUS...WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL 
CONTINUITY BEFORE MAKING ANY OTHER CHANGES TO THE POP FORECAST. IN 
ADDITION TO SOME SLIGHTLY BETTER RAIN CHANCES...ADDITIONAL CLOUD 
COVER/LOWERING THICKNESS VALUES WILL ALLOW FOR COOLER TEMPERATURES 
IN THE 70S TO AROUND 80 DEGREES BY THE DAYS 6 AND 7.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

962 
FXUS64 KMRX 230704
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT SUN SEP 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST. WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. SUNNY SKIES WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO WARM INTO THE 70S 
MOST AREAS. TONIGHT TEMPS WILL FALL TO WELL BELOW NORMAL. SOME 30S 
CAN BE EXPECTED IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND OUTLYING VALLEYS. 
DURATION OF COLDEST TEMPERATURES AND DRY AIRMASS DO NOT SEEM TO 
SUPPORT FROST FOR MOST AREAS...ALTHOUGH ISOLATED HIGHER VALLEYS IN 
THE NE COULD SEE SOME LIGHT FROST.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COOL...DRY AIR MASS WILL 
REMAIN IN PLACE ACROSS THE MRX CWA FOR MONDAY.  WARMING TREND BEGINS 
OVER THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
EXTENDED.  THE MAIN WEATHER MAKER FOR THE EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD 
FRONT THAT IS EXPECTED TO STALL OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY.  A 
SERIES OF WEAK IMPULSES RIDING ALONG THIS BOUNDARY WILL OCCASIONALLY 
BRING IN BANDS OF CLOUDS AS WELL AS A STRAY SHOWER.  WILL CONTINUE 
WITH LOW POPS NORTH ON TUESDAY AS THE FIRST OF THE IMPULSES MOVES 
THROUGH.  ANOTHER...WEAKER WAVE TRACKS THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ON 
THURSDAY AND THEN AGAIN FRIDAY.  CONFIDENCE LOW BY THE END OF THE 
PERIOD BUT MAY SEE THE FRONT PUSH THROUGH ON SATURDAY FOR ISOLATED 
CONVECTION POSSIBLE ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWA.

376 
FXUS64 KMRX 221922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT SAT SEP 22 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
DEWPOINTS JUMPED UP BRIEFLY AHEAD OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT...
CLIMBING ALL THE WAY INTO THE LOWER 60S. BUT DRY AIR BEHIND THE
APPROACHING FRONT WILL WIPE THAT OUT QUICKLY...DEWPOINTS ALREADY
FALLING TO NEAR 50 AT CROSSVILLE. SW WINDS THIS MORNING GIVING WAY
TO WESTERLIES...SOON TO BE NORTHWESTERLIES OVERNIGHT. THE AREA WILL
BE UNDER THE COOL INFLUENCE OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING OVER THE
APPALACHIANS. A VERY NICE COUPLE OF DAYS IN STORE FOR SUNDAY/MONDAY
WITH TEMPS 5-10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AND LOTS OF SUNSHINE. WINDS
DIMINISHING TONIGHT AND SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT THE NEXT COUPLE OF
DAYS.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/... 
A SURFACE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION NEXT
WEEK...PROMOTING MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING
TREND AS HIGHS SHOULD CLIMB WELL INTO THE 70S TO LOWER 80S ACROSS
MUCH OF THE REGION THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. THOUGH MOSTLY
DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH MUCH OF THE WORK WEEK...A
SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH THE REGION COULD TRIGGER OFF A FEW
ISOLATED SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES TUESDAY AFTERNOON...
THOUGH UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT WILL BE FAIRLY LIMITED. A STRONGER
UPPER-WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN UNITED STATES WEDNESDAY
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY
AND POTENTIALLY INTO THE AREA LATE IN THE WEEK...RESULTING IN SOME
LOW-END CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...AND
POTENTIALLY INTO SATURDAY DEPENDING ON THE TRACK OF THE ANOTHER
UPPER-TROUGH PROGGED DROP OUT OF SOUTHERN ONTARIO IN ITS WAKE. FOR
NOW HAVE CONTINUED THE 15-20 POP FORECAST AREAWIDE THURSDAY EVENING
THROUGH SATURDAY /WITH THE HIGHEST VALUES FAVORING THE MOUNTAINS
AND NORTHEAST ZONES/...AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY
BEFORE MAKING ANY FURTHER ADJUSTMENTS. GIVEN THE INCREASED CLOUD
COVER... AND PERHAPS SOME COOLER AIR FILTERING INTO THE
REGION...TEMPERATURES MAY BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER HEADING INTO THE
WEEKEND AS WELL.

TONIGHT.

BEHIND SATURDAY COLD FRONT.  HIGHS WILL ONLY REACH INTO THE 60S AND 
LOWER 70S AND LOWS INTO THE 40S EARLY IN THE PERIOD.  A SLOW WARMING 
TREND IS EXPECTED THROUGH THE WEEK AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION.  BY THE END OF THE EXTENDED...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL STALL OVER THE OHIO VALLEY.  A COUPLE OF WEAK WEATHER 
DISTURBANCES WILL TRACK ALONG THE BOUNDARY WILL OCCASIONALLY BRING A 
FEW CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY A STRAY SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM INTO THE MRX 
CWA FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 211839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EDT FRI SEP 21 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND SATURDAY/...
A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY. MOISTURE WILL BE
QUITE LIMITED AS WILL FORCING. STILL LOOKS LIKE A SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS IS REASONABLE FOR SAT MORNING UNTIL MID AFTERNOON...AND WITH
THE LIMITED INSTABILITY WILL KEEP THUNDER MENTION OUT. WILL
GENERALLY GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE MAV NUMBERS FOR LOWS TONIGHT GIVEN SOME
CLOUDS MOVING IN AND WINDS STAYING UP AT LEAST SOME LOCATIONS. MAV
HIGHS LOOK REASONABLE FOR SAT.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...
A COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK EAST OF THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. 
THOUGH A FEW ROGUE SHOWERS MAY BE POSSIBLE DURING THE EVENING... 
GIVEN THE LATEST MODEL TRENDS HAVE OPTED TO REMOVE MENTIONABLE POPS 
FROM THE ZONES AFTER 00Z SUNDAY...AS CONFIDENCE IS INCREASING FOR A 
DRY FORECAST AFTER SUNSET. THE MAIN WEATHER STORY WITH THIS STORM 
SYSTEM...WILL BE THE COOLER AND DRIER AIR PROGGED TO FILTER INTO THE 
REGION BEHIND THE FRONT...RESULTING IN HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S TO 
LOWER 70S AND LOWS IN THE 40S DURING THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. A 
GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR AS A SURFACE RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD 
IN LATER NEXT WEEK...BUT A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVES ROTATING AROUND 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW SHOULD TEMPER HEATING SLIGHTLY...KEEPING 
HIGHS IN THE 70S TO LOW 80S THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. LATE 
IN THE PERIOD...ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO DROP OUT OF THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND APPROACH THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WHICH 
COULD CERTAINLY BRING SOME CHANCES FOR SHOWERS TOWARD THE END OF 
NEXT WEEK. AS SUCH...GIVEN THAT BOTH MODELS ARE INDICATING FAIRLY 
GOOD QPF SIGNALS WITH THE FRONT SAGGING SOUTH ON FRIDAY...HAVE 
INTRODUCED A 20 POP TO THE GRIDS FOR NOW ON DAY 7.

SLIDE THROUGH ON SATURDAY.  MINIMAL MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT SHOULD

PERIOD IS PROGGED TO STALL TO OUR NORTH.  THIS MAY PROVIDE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS ON THURSDAY...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  AT 
FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT THU SEP 20 2012

.SHORT TERM...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN CONTROL WITH JUST A FEW SCATTERED
CLOUDS DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON WHICH WILL GRADUALLY DISSIPATE
THIS EVENING. TONIGHT WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE
MID 50S. MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE RISE TOMORROW AS THE SURFACE RIDGE
BEGINS TO PUSH OFF TO THE EAST AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM BUT STILL
EXPECTING A DRY...MOSTLY SUNNY DAY WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES WARMING A
BIT INTO THE LOW TO MID 80S.

.LONG TERM...
.LONG TERM /FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/...
AFTER A FAIRLY WARM AND PLEASANT FRIDAY...AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM PASSING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES WILL PUSH A COLD 
FRONT INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY. ALONG WITH SOME INCREASED CLOUD 
COVER...THE FRONT WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED SHOWERS /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES AND 
ALONG THE SPINE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS/ DURING THE AFTERNOON BEFORE 
TAPERING OFF AFTER SUNSET. THE MAIN STORY WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE 
HOWEVER WILL BE THE COOL/DRY AIR MASS THAT WILL FILTER INTO THE 
REGION BEHIND IT. THIS WILL PUSH DAYTIME HIGHS INTO THE BACK INTO 
THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH LOWS BOTTOMING 
OUT IN THE 40S TO AROUND 50 DEGREES IN MOST SPOTS OVERNIGHT. 

BEAUTIFUL AUTUMN WEATHER WITH AMPLE SUNSHINE WILL PREVAIL DURING THE 
EARLY TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK AS A SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. TEMPERATURES LOOK TO GRADUALLY WARM WELL INTO THE 
70S TO LOWER 80S BY TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. ALTHOUGH DRY WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED...A SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY/CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS COULD TRIGGER A FEW ROGUE SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHEAST 
ZONES ON TUESDAY...BUT DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE TO FORECAST  
MENTIONABLE POPS ATTM. LATE IN THE PERIOD...A STRONGER FRONT LOOKS 
TO DROP INTO THE AREA...WHICH MAY RESULT IN SOME SLIGHTLY BETTER 
PROSPECTS FOR PRECIPITATION. GIVEN BOTH MODELS INDICATING FAIRLY 
GOOD QPF SIGNALS...HAVE INTRODUCED A 20 POP TO THE GRIDS ON THURSDAY 
FOR NOW.

AROUND 00Z SUNDAY. WILL HAVE SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POPS SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT.

THE AREA...BRINGING COOLER TEMPS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. HIGHS WILL 
BE IN THE 70S WITH LOWS IN THE 40S. THE AIR MASS MODERATES TOWARD 
MORE SEASONAL NORMS AS THE RIDGE SHIFTS TO OUR EAST ON TUESDAY. THE 
GFS SHOWS A MID/UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSING THE AREA 
TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT LACK OF MOISTURE AND LIFT SHOULD MEAN JUST A 
SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER WITH NO POPS.

A FEW DEGREES MORE. A CLOSED LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND
SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY WILL INCREASE CLOUDS
ESPECIALLY OVER THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. LOWS SHOULD BE
SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER. NAM MODEL MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH SHOWERS
SATURDAY AND MORE UNSTABLE AHEAD OF COLD FRONT WITH ENOUGH
INSTABILITY THAT A FEW THUNDERSTORMS COULD FORM IN THE EASTERN
SECTIONS. GFS MODEL NOT AS UNSTABLE AS NAM AND QUICKER WITH SYSTEM
THAN ECMWF WHICH IS SLOWER WITH FRONT AND KEEPS SHOWERS AROUND
UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING. WILL KEEP PRECIPITATION AS SHOWERS FOR NOW
BUT HAVE A FEW SHOWERS INTO SUNDAY MORNING IN THE NE. CLOUDS
DECREASE SUNDAY BEHIND FRONT AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES IN. TEMPERATURES
MUCH COOLER SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH HIGHS ONLY IN THE 60S NORTH AND
LOWS DROPPING DOWN INTO THE 40S. WARMING TREND TUESDAY INTO
WEDNESDAY WITH HIGHS BACK UP INTO THE 70S AND LOWS SLOWLY
MODERATING.

WEEK AS THE LOW LEVEL RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS TO OUR EAST. HIGH WILL REACH

WILL BE SPINNING OVER THE UPPER GREAT LAKES/ONTARIO...WITH AN 
EMBEDDED SHORTWAVE TROUGH DIPPING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY ON SATURDAY. 
THE NAM APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER AMONG THE MODELS...BRINGING THE

GFS/SREF/ECMWF WHICH SHOW FROPA SATURDAY NIGHT...AND CARRY POPS 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. ALL MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE WILL BE 
VERY LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO WILL HAVE POPS IN THE SLIGHT TO 
LOW CHANCE RANGE...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS NORTH. A COLD AND DRY AIR 
MASS FOLLOWS FOR SUNDAY...AND TEMPS SHOULD BE BELOW NORMAL FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

WINDS SHOULD STAY UP OVERNIGHT HINDERING FOG AND STRATUS OVERNIGHT.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE 
MRX CWA LATE THIS AFTERNOON.  MAIN BAND OF SHOWERS HAS EXITED THE 
AREA.  HOWEVER...A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THIS EVENING 
JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  THE FRONT WILL PULL AWAY OVERNIGHT... 
ENDING THE CHANCE OF CONVECTION.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO 
BUILD IN ON WEDNESDAY FOR DECREASING CLOUDS AND COOL TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...AT THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IS ESTABLISHED AND THE AREA CONTINUES 
TO DRY OUT.  THE NEXT SYSTEM IS MORE OF A CLIPPER-TYPE SYSTEM COMING 
OUT OF THE NORTHWEST.  MOST OF ITS ENERGY IS EXPECTED TO GO NORTH OF 
US...BUT SOME MODELS BRING A WAVE A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH AND A 
LITTLE SLOWER. MAKING POPS AND CLOUDS HIGHER NORTH...AND KEEPING 
POPS IN FOR SUNDAY IN THE NORTH ONLY.  EARLY NEXT WEEK...WE DRY OUT 
AGAIN.  IN GENERAL...WENT DRIER THAN GUIDANCE ON POST-FRONTAL DEW 
POINTS FOR BOTH EVENTS.  WENT A SLIGHTLY COOLER ON POST-FRONTAL MIN 
TEMPS AND AN EDGE COOLER ON MAX TEMPS IN THE NORTH SAT/SUN DUE TO 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER.

016 
FXUS64 KMRX 180810
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT TUE SEP 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...STRONG LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE 
IS CURRENTLY PRODUCING A BAND OF HEAVY RAINFALL OVER THE TN VALLEY. 
THE NAM SEEMS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE SITUATION...CORRECTLY 
PLACING THE AREA OF HIGHEST QPF. THE CONVERGENCE ZONE TRACKS EAST 
THROUGH THE MORNING...MOVING TO OUR EASTERN BORDER AROUND 16Z. 
EXPECT THAT MOST OF THE HEAVY RAIN WILL BE OUT OF OUR AREA AROUND OR 
SHORTLY AFTER THIS TIME. WITH MODERATE RAINFALL SEEN ON RADAR BEHIND 
THIS MAIN HEAVY BAND...WILL KEEP THE FLOOD WATCH INTACT. HOWEVER IT 
IS EXPECTED THAT WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE WATCH COULD BE REMOVED 
BEFORE ITS EXPIRATION TIME OF 00Z. 

ADVECTION OF DRIER AIR BEHIND THE 700 MB TROUGH AXIS BEGINS IN 
EARNEST LATE THIS AFTERNOON. RAIN CHANCES SHOULD BEGIN TO TAPER OFF 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...AND ENDING EVERYWHERE AROUND MIDNIGHT. COLD 
ADVECTION KICKS IN TONIGHT...AND WITH CLEARING SKIES...LOWS ARE 
EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S IN MOST SPOTS. 
WEDNESDAY LOOKS LIKE A VERY PLEASANT EARLY FALL DAY...WITH MOSTLY 
SUNNY SKIES AND HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S TO MID 70S.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THE PERIOD STARTS OUT 
DRY AS MODELS INDICATE A WEAK SHORT WAVE SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE DEEP 
SOUTH WITH NO IMPACT ON THE FORECAST AREA OTHER THAN A BIT OF CIRRUS 
AND POSSIBLY SOME ALTO CU ON THURSDAY. ANOTHER DRY DAY IS LIKELY ON 
FRIDAY AS THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS AMPLIFYING NORTH CENTRAL U.S. 
LONG WAVE TROUGH AND ITS VARIOUS SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES. THE 
GFS AND DEEPER CANADIAN MODEL STAY THE COURSE AND ALLOW AN INITIAL 
WAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT TO SWEEP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SATURDAY. PREFERRED THIS CONCEPT TO THE SLOWER ECMWF WHICH BRINGS 
THE BOUNDARY THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. DEPICTION STILL 
INDICATES LIMITED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN AND LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE WITH THE FROPA SO STAYED WITH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR MOST 
OF THE AREA ON SATURDAY. A HEALTHY AMOUNT OF ENERGY TRAILS THROUGH 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE EASTWARD MIGRATING LONG WAVE ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY THROUGH MID SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AND THEREFORE 
MAINTAINED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR A PERIOD OF POST FRONTAL 
SHOWERS. DRIER AIR SPILLS INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY 
AS THE DEEP UPPER TROUGH FINALLY LIFTS OUT ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN 
U.S. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE MIN TEMPS THROUGH THE 
PERIOD WHILE ADJUSTING SUGGESTED MAXES...WHICH APPEAR TO BE A LITTLE 
TOO OPTIMISTIC...BACK A DEGREE OR TWO WITH THE LENGTHY PERIOD OF 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.   

&&

BORDER. WOULD EXPECT VFR FLIGHT TO DEVELOP AROUND 18-00Z TUE/WED AS

272 
FXUS64 KMRX 180201 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1001 PM EDT MON SEP 17 2012

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO TRACK THROUGH THE 
LOWER-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING...BRINGING WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS/ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL TO THE 
AREA OVERNIGHT AND THROUGH THE DAY TOMORROW. WITH A STRONG 50-60 KT 
LOW-LEVEL JET RAMPING UP OVERNIGHT...ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE 
/WITH PWATS AOA 2 INCHES/...AND A DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER...THE 
POTENTIAL FOR HIGH RAINFALL RATES WILL EXIST WITH THIS ACTIVITY... 
RESULTING IN A LOCALIZED FLOODING THREAT BEGINNING LATE TONIGHT AND 
PERSISTING THROUGH THE DAY TOMORROW. THE BEST CHANCE FOR FLOODING 
WILL BE IN URBANIZED AREAS WHERE RUNOFF ISSUES WILL EXIST. ALSO... 
POOR DRAINAGE AREAS AND LOCATIONS NEAR CREEKS AND STREAMS BE A 
CONCERN ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE 
HEAVY RAINFALL HAS ALREADY OCCURRED...AND WHERE SOME MESOSCALE 
BANDING HAS BEGUN TO SET UP AS THE LOW-LEVEL JET CRANKS UP AND MOVES 
PARALLEL TO A COLD FRONT SLOWLY LIFTING NORTHEASTWARD OVERNIGHT. 
BOTH THE NAM AND GFS HAVE DONE FAIRLY WELL IN RESOLVING THIS AND 
SHOW THE HEAVIEST ACTIVITY LIFTING NORTHWARD WITH THE FRONT 
OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE FAR WESTERN ZONES. LOCALIZED STORM RAINFALL 
TOTALS OF UP TO 4-5 INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THIS AREA...WITH 
GENERALLY 2-3 INCHES BEING POSSIBLE FOR MANY OTHER LOCATIONS ACROSS 
THE REGION BY TOMORROW EVENING. GIVEN ALL THIS...HAVE EXPANDED THE 
FLOOD WATCH ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY. 

THE OTHER FORECAST CONCERN THROUGH LATE TONIGHT WILL BE A LOW-END 
TORNADO THREAT THAT EXISTS PRIMARILY ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE 
INTERSTATE 40 CORRIDOR. A SOMEWHAT DIFFUSE WARM FRONT IS GRADUALLY 
PROGGED TO LIFT NORTHWARD OVERNIGHT. THOUGH INSTABILITY PARAMETERS 
WILL BE EXTREMELY MARGINAL...THE STRENGTHENING LOW-LEVEL JET WILL 
ENHANCE 0-1 KM SHEAR AND HELICITY VALUES. THIS...COMBINED WITH SOME 
SLIGHTLY BACKED WINDS AHEAD OF THE AFOREMENTIONED FRONT...AND THE 
BOUNDARY ITSELF COULD RESULT IN AN ISOLATED STRONGER STORM OR TWO 
DEVELOPING...WHICH WOULD BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING A BRIEF/WEAK 
TORNADO. THUS...A TORNADO WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR MOST OF THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 07Z. IN GENERAL THOUGH... 
AM EXPECTING THE OVERALL THREAT TO BE FAIRLY LOW GIVEN SOME OF THE 
OTHER MISSING PARAMETERS.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  75  54  76  53 / 100  80  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  72  54  73  52 / 100  90  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  72  52  73  50 / 100  90  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  69  53  72  49 / 100  90  50  10  10
