.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...RAIN SHOWERS WITH SOME EMBEDDED 
THUNDER WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE MRX CWA THROUGH THE REST OF 
THE DAY.  AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL ENHANCE THIS CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY OVERNIGHT...GENERATING A LARGE BAND OF CONVECTION AND 
SIGNIFICANT AMOUNTS OF RAIN.  A FLOOD WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA.  CONDITIONS WILL BE SLOW TO IMPROVE ON TUESDAY 
AS RAIN SLOWLY MOVES OUT FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGHOUT THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AT THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD...THE RAINS FROM THIS PRESENT SYSTEM ARE IN THE PROCESS OF 
MOVING OUT OF THE AREA...BUT THE BACK END OF PRECIP MAY WELL BE 
LAGGING INTO THIS FIRST PERIOD.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD BE 
BUILDING INTO THE REGION FROM THE NORTHWEST...IN THE WAKE OF THE 
COLD FRONT PASSAGE.  FOR THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK...IT LOOKS DRY 
AND SEASONABLY COOLER...WITH A LITTLE WARMING TOWARD THE END OF THE 
WEEK IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.  

THE NEXT SYSTEM OF ANY SIGNIFICANCE COMES THIS WEEKEND.  MUCH OF THE 
ENERGY FOR THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO BE FOCUSED FARTHER NORTH INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND/OR GREAT LAKES.  HOWEVER, THERE IS AGREEMENT BETWEEN 
MODELS FOR A WAVE OF UPPER LEVEL LIFT TO SWEEP THROUGH THE AREA FROM 
THE NORTHWEST.  THE TIMING RIGHT NOW FOR THIS EVENT IS CENTERED ON 
SATURDAY OR SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS BOUT OF PRECIP SHOULD BE MUCH LESS 
SIGNIFICANT THAN THE ONE TRUDGING THROUGH THE AREA NOW.  
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLING AGAIN EARLY NEXT WEEK BEHIND THE 
WEEKEND COLD FRONT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.AVIATION...
RAIN SHOWERS WILL BE SPREADING ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE DAY AS A
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TAKES SHAPE OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. INITALLY THE
RAIN SHOWERS WILL BE LIGHT...WITH VFR CIGS AND SOME MVFR VIS AT
TIMES. HEAVY RAIN SHOULD BECOME MORE COMMON BY THE EVENING AT
CHA...AND BY MIDNIGHT AT TYS. HEAVY RAIN WILL LOWER VIS/CIGS TO
PREDOMINANTLY IFR...WITH LOWER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE AT TIMES. SHADOW
EFFECTS IN THE LEE OF THE MOUNTAINS MAY DELAY LOWER VIS/CIGS AT TRI
UNTIL LATE IN THE TAF PERIOD. THERE IS A POTENTIAL FOR LLWS
OVERNIGHT AT ALL SITES...BUT IT APPEARS MARGINAL AND CONFIDENCE IS
TOO LOW TO MENTION AT THIS TIME.

050 
FXUS64 KMRX 170742
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 AM EDT MON SEP 17 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A SIGNIFICANT PRECIP EVENT WILL BE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE REGION
THROUGH TODAY...WITH EXCESSIVE RAINFALL POSSIBLE THROUGH TONIGHT. A
SOUTHERN STREAM CLOSED LOW NOW OVER TX WILL BE TRACKING NW AND
MERGING WITH A DEEPENING TROUGH NOW OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS.
STRONG Q-G FORCING WILL PRODUCE CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE TN
VALLEY...WITH THE SURFACE LOW TRACKING DIRECTLY OVER EAST TN FROM
03Z TO 12Z TONIGHT. MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL BE RAMPING UP THROUGH
THE DAY AS THE SOUTHERLY 850 MB JET STRENGTHENS UP TO 30-40 KTS BY
MIDNIGHT. A STRENGTHENING 300 MB JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL
PLACE MIDDLE AND EAST TN IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION WITH GOOD
UPPER DIVERGENCE. FRONTOGENETIC FORCING IS MAXIMIZED AFTER 00Z OVER
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND THIS IS THE AREA THAT WILL LIKELY SEE
THE GREATEST AMOUNTS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW NARROW BUT DEEP CAPE
THROUGH TODAY AND TONIGHT...FAVORABLE FOR HEAVY RAIN WITH ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS.

RAINFALL AMOUNTS THROUGH 12Z TUE WILL LIKELY AVERAGE BETWEEN 1 AND 3 
INCHES AREA-WIDE...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY 3 TO 5 
INCHES...ESPECIALLY IN THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA. A FLOOD WATCH 
WILL BE ISSUED FROM NOON TODAY THROUGH NOON TUESDAY FOR AREAS WEST 
OF A LINE FROM WISE COUNTY VA TO THE TN/NC BORDER OF CHEROKEE AND 
POLK. FORTUNATELY...WE ARE COMING INTO THIS EVENT WITH DRY SOIL 
CONDITIONS AND LOW RIVER LEVELS...WHICH SHOULD MITIGATE THE FLOOD 
THREAT SOMEWHAT.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE 
REGION ON TUESDAY PROVIDING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON LATE FRIDAY 
AND INTO SATURDAY PROVIDING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS ON SUNDAY. COOLER TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY...OTHERWISE NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES 
ARE EXPECTED FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 170151 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
951 PM EDT SUN SEP 16 2012

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR CHANGES TO THE FORECAST MADE THIS EVENING AS MOST
EVERYTHING LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK. AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM
CURRENTLY SITUATED OVER CENTRAL TEXAS WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK TOWARD
THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT. AHEAD OF THIS STORM
SYSTEM...GULF MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE REGION...RESULTING
IN MID/HIGH DECKS OF CLOUDS SPREADING IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST...ALONG
WITH SOME CHANCES FOR SHOWERS /PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE/. IN GENERAL...THINK THAT COVERAGE WILL BE FAIRLY MINIMAL
AND ISOLATED IN NATURE FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT. HOWEVER...AS LIFT
INCREASES WITH THE APPROACHING STORM SYSTEM LATE TONIGHT...SHOWERS
WILL BEGIN TO BECOME MORE NUMEROUS BY DAYBREAK. THUS...HAVE
ORIENTED THE POP GRIDS WITH THE HIGHEST VALUES FAVORING THE
SOUTHERN ZONES AFTER 06Z. MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE ALSO HINTING AT THE
POTENTIAL FOR SOME LIGHT FOG FORMATION LATE TONIGHT GIVEN THE
INCREASED MOISTURE IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER. HOWEVER...CLOUD COVER
SHOULD LIMIT THIS POTENTIAL TO AREA LAKES...SO HAVE KEPT A MENTION
OF PATCHY FOG IN THESE LOCATIONS ONLY.

OCCURS WELL AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM CHICAGO TO 
OKLAHOMA CITY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A MOIST SHORT WAVE 
RIDING ALONG STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY COMBINED WITH ADDED LIFT FROM 
A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WILL 
BRING WIDESPREAD CONVECTION INTO THE MRX CWA.  SIGNIFICANT PRECIP 
AMOUNTS ARE POSSIBLE AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH.  PRECIP WILL END 
FROM WEST TO EAST MONDAY NIGHT AS THE SYSTEM EXIT THE AREA.  SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FOR DRY AND COOL 
CONDITIONS.  A WEAKENING FRONT TRACKS IN FOR SATURDAY.  TIMING IN 
QUESTION BUT BEST CHANCE OF ASSOCIATED CONVECTION SHOULD BE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR SUNDAY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT SUN SEP 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AS A LOW TO 
MIDLEVEL RIDGE SHIFTS OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST AND A SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
OVER TX SLOWLY MOVES EAST. A JET STREAK WILL BE ACROSS KY AND VA 
TODAY...WITH A 500 MB VORT MAX CROSSING THE AREA TONIGHT. HOWEVER 
THE LOW LEVEL FLOW REMAINS VERY WEAK...SO WHAT LITTLE LIFT WE WILL 
HAVE WILL BE IN THE MID-UPPER LEVELS. BEST CHANCES WILL BE IN 
SOUTHERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE A BIT MORE 
FAVORABLE...BUT STILL JUST IN THE LOW CHANCE RANGE. RAIN CHANCES 
CONTINUE TO INCREASE TONIGHT WITH THE 500 MB VORT MAX AND A 
STRENGTHENING 850 MB FLOW. WILL SPREAD CHANCE POPS FARTHER NORTHWARD 
AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH LIKELY POPS LATE TONIGHT IN SOUTHERN ZONES. 
LACK OF INSTABILITY AND WEAK LIFT SUGGEST ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY LINGERS 
OVER THE AREA ON MONDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS GOING ON MONDAY.
THE HIGHEST CHANCES ARE EXPECTED ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WHEN A
WAVE TRACKS ALONG THE BOUNDARY BRINGING A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON
TUESDAY PROVIDING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. HIGH
PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.
ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON LATE FRIDAY AND INTO SATURDAY
PROVIDING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS. EXCEPT FOR COOLER TEMPERATURES
ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONAL

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1014 PM EDT SAT SEP 15 2012

.DISCUSSION...
THE PRIMARY CHANGE MADE TO THE FORECAST WAS TO REMOVE MENTIONABLE
POPS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. THE NAM IN PARTICULAR HAS SHOWED QPF
SIGNALS ALONG THIS AREA ALL EVENING...BUT THEY HAVE SIMPLY NOT
MATERIALIZED. ADDITIONALLY...MOST OF THE SHOWER ACTIVITY TO THE
EAST OF THE TN/NC STATE LINE HAS DIMINISHED WITH THE LOSS OF SOLAR
HEATING. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PROGRESSING THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE
WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH TOWARD THE REGION...INCREASING MID/HIGH CLOUD
COVER ACROSS THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. THIS CLOUD COVER MAY LIMIT
THE FOG POTENTIAL IN MOST AREA LOCATIONS OVERNIGHT...BUT MODEL
SOUNDINGS DO INDICATE THE POSSIBLY OF THIS IN LOCALIZED SHELTERED
AREAS NEAR BODIES OF WATER...SO HAVE MAINTAINED A MENTION OF THIS
IN THE ZONES LATE TONIGHT. WITH A LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER...
TEMPERATURES MAY BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER...GENERALLY IN THE
UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S.


&&

320 
FXUS64 KMRX 151919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT SAT SEP 15 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN IS THE
PHASING OF THE SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE OVER TEXAS WITH A LONG-
WAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS/GREAT LAKES ON MONDAY
AND TUESDAY. MODELS SHOW THE SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE HELPING TO PULL
INCREASING GULF-MOISTURE INTO A STALLED FRONT OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. STRONG UPPER JET ASSOCIATED WITH NORTHERN STREAM
TROUGH WILL PLACE THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHAINS UNDER
THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET AND AGEOSTROPHIC JET
DIRECT CIRCULATION. THE CIRCULATION WILL INTENSIFY THE
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING OVER THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
MORNING. 

ANOTHER INTERESTING FEATURE IS THE IMPRESSIVE TROPOPAUSE FOLD THAT
DEVELOPS WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH OVER THE OHIO VALLEY
WHICH AIDS IN THE STRONG CYCLOGENESIS LOW THAT DEVELOPS OVER THE
EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY THEN RACES NORTHEAST ALONG THE
APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.

MODELS SHOW A GOOD DEAL OF RAINFALL WITH BETWEEN 2 AND POSSIBLY 4
INCHES ANTICIPATED. HAVE INCLUDED THE POTENTIAL OF LOCALIZED
FLOODING CONCERNS.

IN THE SHORT-TERM...INCREASING MOISTURE/INSTABILITY AND A SERIES OF WAVES
EXITING SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORMS FOR SUNDAY. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG COLD FRONT PUSHING 
THROUGH THE REGION WILL CONTINUE TO BRING IN WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE MRX CWA ON TUESDAY.  THE SYSTEM WILL EXIT 
THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT WITH PRECIP ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST.  HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY AND CONTINUE TO DOMINATE AREA 
WEATHER THROUGH THURSDAY WITH CLEAR SKIES AND COOLER TEMPERATURES..  
AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL ALLOW A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE AREA FRIDAY WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED ON 
SATURDAY WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  84  65  77  64 /  10  30  50  80 100 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  81  63  76  63 /  10  40  40  80 100 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  81  62  75  63 /  10  40  40  80 100

769 
FXUS64 KMRX 150754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT SAT SEP 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)... 
A COLD FRONT IS POSITIONED E-W ACROSS KY THIS MORNING...AND HAS
BEEN SLOW TO PROGRESS SOUTHWARD TOWARD OUR AREA WITH A WEAK FLOW
ALOFT. FORECAST SOUNDINGS TODAY SHOW A MIDLEVEL INVERSION THAT WILL
SUPPRESS DEEP CONVECTION...AND WITH FORCING BEING VERY WEAK...MOST
OF THE AREA SHOULD STAY DRY TODAY AND TONIGHT. SOME TERRAIN-
ASSISTED CONVECTION MAY LEAD TO A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN THE
MOUNTAINS AND SW NC THIS AFTERNOON. WE SHOULD SEE INCREASING
MOISTURE TONIGHT AS THE 850-700 RIDGE OVER FL TODAY MOVES EAST AND
A MORE SOUTHERLY WIND COMPONENT DEVELOPS. STILL...LIFT WILL BE
LITTLE TO NOTHING OVERNIGHT AS THE MID AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW REMAINS
NEARLY ZONAL AND PARALLEL TO THE COLD FRONT THAT WILL BE ACROSS OUR
NORTHERN SECTIONS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY LINGERS
OVER THE AREA INTO SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS
GOING INTO SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR MONDAY
AND MONDAY NIGHT WHEN A WAVES TRACKS ACROSS THE BOUNDARY BRINGING
BETTER CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS
THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY PROVIDING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON FRIDAY
BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS. EXCEPT FOR A DIP IN
TEMPERATURES ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE
SEASONAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.
STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.

1019 PM EDT FRI SEP 14 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT IS CONTINUING TO DROP THROUGH THE WESTERN OHIO VALLEY
INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE THIS EVENING...AND WILL GRADUALLY APPROACH
EAST TENNESSEE OVERNIGHT. FOR THE TIME-BEING...CLOUD COVER HAS
BEGUN TO THIN ACROSS ALL BUT THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SW VIRGINA.
HOWEVER AS THE FRONT APPROACHES...SOME ADDITIONAL DECKS OF MID/HIGH
CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE WESTERN/CENTRAL
ZONES LATE TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW MORNING. WHILE SOME LOCALIZED
AREAS OF FOG WILL BE POSSIBLE...GIVEN THE DRIER CONDITIONS NEAR THE
SURFACE AND SOME PASSING/LINGERING CLOUD COVER LATE TONIGHT...DO
NOT FEEL AS THOUGH IT WILL BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A
MENTION IN THE ZONES ATTM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT FRI SEP 14 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT 
OVER THE WESTERN OHIO VALLEY WILL MOVE END THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
SATURDAY BEFORE BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW 
THE AIRMASS BECOMING MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES OF 500 J/KG. 
UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL PRODUCE A GOOD 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS OVER THE MOUNTAINS WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING.

FOR SUNDAY...STATIONARY BOUNDARY WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY. DIVERGENCE ALOFT INCREASES OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS ALONG WITH A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT-WAVE. THE INCREASING LIFT 
WILL INCREASE THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE AREA. WENT HIGH CHANCE 
POPS AREA-WIDE FOR SUNDAY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL 
BE DRAPED OVER THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AS A SIGNIFICANT 
WEATHER DISTURBANCE MOVES ALONG IT AND INTO THE MRX CWA.  THIS WILL 
BRING WIDESPREAD CONVECTION INTO THE AREA AND HAVE INCREASED POPS TO 
LIKELY FOR MONDAY.  THE FRONT WILL SLOWLY PULL OUT OF THE AREA 
MONDAY NIGHT WITH A SECONDARY FRONT MOVING IN ON TUESDAY.  THIS 
FRONT WILL PROVIDE ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND 
INTO THE EVENING.  A STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA 
ON FRIDAY BUT HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE...SO ONLY A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE TO BEGIN THE WEEKEND. 

ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA ON FRIDAY BUT HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE...SO ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE TO BEGIN THE WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMRX 131842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT THU SEP 13 2012

.SHORT TERM...A SHORT-WAVE MOVING SLOW NORTH ACROSS THE WESTERN
TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS CONTINUE TO SPREAD HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WILL INCLUDE PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR
TONIGHT. AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TONIGHT
AND FRIDAY PULLING A WEAK COLD FRONT TOWARD THE AREA FRIDAY
AFTERNOON. DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE/INSTABILITY LIMITED...BUT ENOUGH
TO CONTINUE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE PLATEAU.

WILL INCLUDE PATCHY DENSE FOG DUE TO EXPECTED STEAM FOG.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEAK...RELATIVELY DRY 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SLIDE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY.  COULD SEE SOME ISOLATED SHOWER ACTIVITY 
OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE BOUNDARY ENTERED THE 
AREA.  HOWEVER...WITH A DRY AND RATHER STABLE AIR MASS IN 
PLACE...THE BOUNDARY SHOULD CONTINUE TO WEAKEN AND WILL KEEP LOW 
POPS ONLY OVER ELEVATED EASTERN MOUNTAINS WHERE TERRAIN ENHANCEMENT 
MAY AID SHOWER DEVELOPMENT.  A WEATHER DISTURBANCE RIDING ALONG THE 
OLD BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO THE MRX CWA ON SUNDAY...PROVIDING A 
BETTER CHANCE OF CONVECTION SUNDAY AND MONDAY FOR CHANCE POPS.  
ANOTHER...STRONGER...WETTER FRONT MOVES IN TUESDAY CONTINUING THE 
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 130744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT THU SEP 13 2012

.SHORT TERM...
DECKS OF MID TO HIGH CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO STREAM ACROSS THE
REGION EARLY THIS MORNING AND INTO THE DAY...THANKS TO A PLUME OF
MOISTURE ALOFT PUSHING NORTHWARD IN RESPONSE TO AN UPPER-LEVEL
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. TO THE EAST
OF THE REGION...AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SITUATED
ALONG THE SPINE OF THE BLUE RIDGE MOUNTAINS WILL REMAIN THE OVERALL
DOMINANT FEATURE CONTROLLING THE WEATHER TODAY...WHICH WILL PROMOTE
PARTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS. HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE FAIRLY
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...WITH MOST LOCATIONS IN THE VALLEYS REACHING
THE 80-85 DEGREE RANGE. MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE CONTINUING TO SHOW THE
POTENTIAL FOR MID-LEVEL CLOUDS DEVELOPING/PERSISTING INTO THE
OVERNIGHT HOURS. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT FOG DEVELOPMENT
OVERNIGHT. GIVEN THIS /COMBINED WITH THE LACK OF FOG FORMATION THIS
MORNING/...HAVE OPTED TO REMOVE A MENTION OF PATCHY FOG FROM THE
GRIDS AFTER MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...
ALL MODELS SEEM IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON A SERIOUS LACK OF MOISTURE
AND LIFT WITH THE WEAK FRONT...WHICH SHOULD BE EAST OF THE FORECAST
AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT. I DID ADD A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER
ACROSS SW VA FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT MAIN CHANGE WAS TO DROP POPS
FOR ALL BUT EASTERN MTNS ON SATURDAY.

GIVEN THE DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY FOR THE REST OF WEEKEND...I WAS 
HESITANT TO MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES. THERE IS A WEAK AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE NOTED OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY REGION THIS MORNING...
BUT THIS SHOULD GET KICKED NE AHEAD OF THE GREAT LAKES TROUGH AND 
WEAK COLD FRONT. THE SREF AND CANADIAN MODELS ARE THEN MAINLY DRY 
FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...WHILE GFS MODEL DEVELOPS A 
TROUGH OVER THE SRN PLAINS AND MOVES IT EASTWARD SPREADING AT LEAST 
SCATTERED CONVECTION INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY 
NIGHT. ECMWF IS NOT NEARLY AS AGGRESSIVE WITH CONVECTION FOR SUNDAY. 
THUS...LITTLE CHANGES FOR NOW. 

TIMING OF THE DEEPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH...PER A MODEL CONSENSUS... 
SEEMS TO BE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY...WHICH SHOULD BE THE WETTER PERIODS 
COMPLETE WITH BOTH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THE PREVIOUS GRIDS 
GENERALLY HAVE HIGHER CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE PERIODS...ALTHO GFSX MOS 
POPS ARE HOLDING CONSISTENTLY AROUND LIKELY POPS. NO SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES JUST YET FOR NOW. 13/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE FAIRLY 
CONSISTENT WITH 12/12Z NUMBERS AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

RATHER MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT BUILDING INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
EARLY IN THE DAY SATURDAY. KEPT THE STILL HARMLESS SLIGHT CHANCE 
PROBABILITY FOR A SHOWER GOING ON SATURDAY DUE TO THE FACT THAT THIS 
PERIOD IS STILL ABOUT THREE DAYS AWAY AND THERE WILL BE A BOUNDARY 
MOVING ACROSS THE REGION. IF THE DWINDLING PRECIP TREND WITH THIS 
FEATURE CONTINUES PROBABILITY OF PRECIP CAN BE REMOVED IN THE NEXT 
PACKAGE. AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES INTO THE EARLY PART 
OF NEXT WEEK. MODELS DIFFER ON HOW FAR SOUTH THIS FRONTAL PROGRESSES 
AND IT MAY HANG AROUND JUST SOUTH OF THE STATE AS ANOTHER WEAK SHORT 
WAVE BUILDS EAST THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY PERHAPS ALLOWING FOR 
A SLIGHT CHANCE OR A SHOWER SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS WAVE AMPLIFIES WITH 
SLOW MOVEMENT INTO THE EASTERN STATES SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WHILE AN 
EVEN STRONGER UPPER LEVEL DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE WESTERN 
CANADIAN PROVINCES FOR TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. BY WEDNESDAY 
THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
DRY...COOL ADVECTION. TRENDED ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD WHILE GOING A LITTLE CLOSER FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

653 
FXUS64 KMRX 120749
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EDT WED SEP 12 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
THE PLEASANT AUTUMN-LIKE CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION
FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE BECOMES CENTERED
ACROSS THE SPINE OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. THOUGH DRY WEATHER IS
EXPECTED TO PERSIST FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS...SOME MID-LEVEL MOISTURE
HAS TRIGGERED SOME CLOUD COVER TONIGHT THAT SHOULD PROHIBIT FOG
DEVELOPMENT ACROSS MOST OF THE SHELTERED VALLEY LOCATIONS.
HOWEVER...THERE MAY BE SOME FOG DEVELOPMENT IN A FEW AREAS AROUND
DAYBREAK /PRIMARILY NEAR BODIES OF WATER WHERE GREATER BOUNDARY
LAYER MOISTURE WILL BE PRESENT/.

GIVEN THE ASSOCIATED HIGHER THICKNESS VALUES...WARMER TEMPERATURES
ALOFT AND THE AMPLE SUNSHINE EXPECTED...HIGHS TODAY SHOULD BE A FEW
DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS SHOULD REACH
THE 80 DEGREE PLATEAU...WITH PERHAPS A FEW SPOTS ACROSS SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE CLIMBING INTO THE MID 80S. OVERNIGHT...SOME LOCALIZED
FOG FORMATION MAY BE POSSIBLE IN THE USUAL FOG-PRONE SHELTERED
AREAS /PARTICULARLY SINCE CLEARER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED/.
HOWEVER...DO NOT EXPECT IT TO BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A
MENTION IN THE FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

.LONG TERM /TOMORROW THROUGH TUESDAY/...
THE UPPER RIDGE HOLDS THROUGH LATE THURSDAY...THEN WEAKENS AS A
SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY
REGION. AN ASSOCIATED WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGS SE INTO THE REGION
BY EARLY SATURDAY... BUT DYNAMICS ARE TO OUR NORTH AND MOISTURE IS
QUITE LIMITED... WHILE BEST MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY IS OVER THE
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION. THIS SHOULD LEAVE US WITH 20
PERCENT POPS BEING SUFFICIENT FOR NOW OVER THE WEEKEND...AS I
PREFER THE DRIER LOOK OF THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS OVER THE
WETTER GFS. MOST HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL GAMES SHOULD BE DRY FRIDAY
NIGHT...AND UT GAME ON SATURDAY MAY ALSO DODGE ANY RAIN AS WELL.

HOWEVER...ENSEMBLES AND GFS/ECMWF ARE ADVERTISING A MUCH DEEPER 
TROUGH APPROACHING BY LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. 12/00Z GFS MOS POPS 
ARE TRENDING UPWARD FROM 11/12Z MOS...SO NUDGING POPS UP TO LOW 
CHANCE FOR NOW. TWEAKED A FEW MAX/MIN TEMPS IN LINE WITH 12/00Z GFS 
NUMBERS AND A BIT TO BETTER MESH WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. 

&&

770 
FXUS64 KMRX 110758
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
358 AM EDT TUE SEP 11 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE CENTERED OVER W
VA EXTENDING SOUTH INTO THE REGION THIS MORNING...PROVIDING MOSTLY
CLEAR SKIES AND PLEASANT TEMPS MAINLY IN THE 50S AT 07Z. UPPER
RIDGE BEGINS TO SPREAD EASTWARD BY TONIGHT...REPLACING THE WEAK
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THAT HAD BEEN OVER THE APPALACHIANS.

ANY FOG THIS MORNING SHOULD BE LIMITED TO NEAR AREA LAKES/STREAMS
AS WE ARE NOT SEEING MUCH FOG DEVELOP NEAR ANY TAF OR OBSERVATION
SITES AT THIS TIME. MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT...AFTER SCATTERED DAYTIME
CUMULUS CLOUDS BREAK-UP...ALTHO BOTH GFS AND NAM MODELS KEEP SOME
FAIRLY HIGH RH LINGERING OVERNIGHT AROUND 850 MB LEVEL. SO PERHAPS
SOME LINGERING PATCHES OF CLOUDS SIMILAR TO THIS MORNING.

GFS MOS MAXES GENERALLY FOLLOWED FOR TODAY...BUT A BIT CLOSER TO A 
MOS BLEND FOR MINS THAN COOLER GFS MINS. CAN'T COMPLAIN ABOUT THIS 
KIND OF WEATHER!


.LONG TERM.../TOMORROW THROUGH MONDAY/...
THE FAIRLY BENIGN AUTUMN-LIKE WEATHER PATTERN WILL PERSIST THROUGH 
THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BECOMES SITUATED OVER THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY. THE ASSOCIATED HIGHER THICKNESS VALUES 
AND TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL PROMOTE A SLIGHT WARMING TREND AS HIGHS 
WILL CLIMB BACK INTO THE MID TO PERHAPS EVEN THE UPPER 80S IN A FEW 
LOCATIONS IN SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE BY FRIDAY. GIVEN THE STRENGTH OF 
THIS RIDGE...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE MINIMAL THROUGHOUT MUCH 
OF THE WEEK.

A CHANGE IN THE PATTERN WILL OCCUR LATE FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND AS 
AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO INTENSIFY AS IT 
ROTATES THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THOUGH THE 
ECMWF...GFS AND CFC ALL DIFFER SIGHTLY IN THEIR TIMING OF THIS 
SYSTEM...THEY ARE ALL INDICATING A COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY SOMETIME ON SATURDAY. THIS FRONT /ALONG WITH A 
PREFRONTAL TROUGH THAT MAY PASS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT/ WILL GIVE THE 
REGION ITS FIRST REASONABLE SHOT OF SHOWERS AND STORMS IN ABOUT A 
WEEK. HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALONG THE PLATEAU ON FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BEFORE INCREASING THEM TO CHANCE POPS SATURDAY AND SATURDAY 
NIGHT AREAWIDE AS THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH. THEREAFTER...HAVE 
TAPERED THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON SUNDAY AS THE FRONT PASSES TO 
THE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. 

LATE IN THE PERIOD...MODELS ARE HINTING AT ANOTHER AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE MOVING NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. GIVEN THE ASSOCIATED 
GULF MOISTURE THAT COULD ACCOMPANY THIS SYSTEM...ADDITIONAL SHOWER 
AND STORM ACTIVITY MAY BE POSSIBLE HEADING INTO THE EARLY PART OF 
NEXT WEEK. WITH BOTH LONG-TERM MODEL SOLUTIONS INDICATING 
THIS...HAVE OPTED TO INTRODUCE LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS ON TUESDAY. 
BUT...GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY ASSOCIATED THIS FAR OUT...WILL 
CONTINUE TO WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONSISTENCY BEFORE MAKING ANY 
FURTHER ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FORECAST.   


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  61  85  61  86 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  58  84  59  85 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       83  56  85  58  85 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              79  50  83  55  83 /   0   0   0   0   0

GUIDANCE TEMPS WERE EXTREMELY CLOSE FOR TODAY'S MAXES AND LOOKED
VERY GOOD...ALSO FOR MINS TONIGHT.

LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TONIGHT MAY ALLOW PATCHY FOG AGAIN AT 
FAVORED SPOTS SUCH AS TRI. OTHERWISE...LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO GRIDS 
FOR TODAY OR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES
THROUGH THE WEEK WITH DRY WEATHER THROUGH FRIDAY. ANOTHER FRONT
TO PASS THROUGH THE REGION SATURDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. TEMPERATURES START OUT
BELOW NORMAL AND WARM TO NEAR NORMAL AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER
SOUTHEAST AND EASTERN STATES FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. AIR
MASS WILL STAY DRY WITH A LARGE DIURNAL RANGE. LOWS WILL BE
GENERALLY BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             80  56  83  57  85 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  77  55  80  54  83 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  53  81  54  83 /   0   0   0   0   0

044 
FXUS64 KMRX 081454
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EDT SAT SEP 8 2012

.DISCUSSION...EARLY BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER HAVE ALLOWED TEMPERATURES
TO RISE TO NEAR FORECAST MAXS ACROSS SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS. 
RETURN OF CLOUD COVER AND IMPENDING CONVECTION SHOULD HINDER FURTHER 
HEATING. THIS ALSO WILL KEEP DESTABILIZATION AT BAY SO STRENGTH OF 
STORMS SHOULD BE LIMITED. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER TODAY. PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER SOME 
BEHIND FRONT WITH SW FLOW ALOFT BRIEFLY. ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE INTO 
THE EVENING HOURS ALONG MNTS AND SW VA. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...07Z SURFACE MAP WOULD PLACE COLD 
FRONT FROM SE OH THRU EXTREME WRN KY AND JUST ENTERING WRN MOST 
COUNTIES OF TN. AREA/LINE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS IN ADVANCE OF THE 
FRONT CONTINUES TO WEAKEN...LESS LIGHTNING AND WARMING TOPS ON IR 
SATELLITE PICS. HOWEVER...THIS ACTIVITY REMAINS ORGANIZED ENOUGH TO 
REACH WRN MOST COUNTIES OF OUR FORECAST AREA BY 09Z TO 11Z. POPS 
WERE INCREASED THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS...WHICH ALSO MESHED BETTER 
WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. POPS WILL FALL OFF FROM THE WEST IN THE 
AFTERNOON...BUT HIGHEST POPS IN THE EASTERN MOST AREAS SHOULD OCCUR 
IN THE EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON HOURS. MAX TEMPS TRICKY BUT I TRENDED 
VERY CLOSE TO GFS MOS. THE WEAKENING TREND OF STORMS THIS MORNING 
INDICATES A STRONG STORM OR TWO AT BEST. 

CLEARING FOR TONIGHT AND SOME DRY AND COOLER AIR FILTERS IN...
DROPPING MINS DOWN INTO SOME VERY PLEASANT UPPER 40S TO UPPER 50S. 
LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES MADE TO FORECAST GRIDS FOR TONIGHT.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DEEP TROUGH BEHIND COLD FRONT 
BRINGS COOLER TEMPERATURES AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE 
REGION SUNDAY. HIGHS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL SUNDAY AND 
THEN WARM SLOWLY AS TROUGH MOVES EAST AND RIDGING ALOFT MOVES INTO 
THE SOUTHEAST. LOWS WILL CONTINUE TO BE MUCH BELOW NORMAL MONDAY 
THROUGH AT LEAST MID WEEK. A FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY BY THE END OF THE WEEK BUT HIGHER PRESSURE WILL STAY STRONG 
THROUGH AT LEAST FRIDAY WITH NO RAIN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. 
&&

THINKING BRINGS SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE TAF SITES DURING 
THE MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON TIME FRAME.  AS THE LINE OF STORMS MOVES 
THROUGH EXPECT OCCASIONAL MVFR CONDITIONS AND POSSIBLE GUSTY 
THUNDERSTORMS WINDS.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER THROUGH THE REST OF 
THE DAY...BUT COVERAGE SHOULD BE LIMITED AND WILL NOT MENTION IN THE 
TAFS AT THIS TIME.

FXUS64 KMRX 071911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 PM EDT FRI SEP 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WITH 
RELATIVELY HIGH DEW POINTS REMAINS IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA. THE 
LAYER IS QUITE DRY WITH PWATS NEAR 1.00 VALUES. DEVELOPING MID TO 
UPPER TROUGH TAKING SHAPE OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. MODEL PROGS DO 
NOT PHASE FRONT SIDE AND BACK SIDE JET SEGMENTS AS NICELY AS 
PREVIOUS RUNS. STRONG DIGGING ON BACK SIDE OF TROUGH WILL SLOW 
EASTERN PROGRESS OF DEVELOPING CONVECTION AND COLD FRONT. THERE ARE 
A FEW FEATURES WHICH WILL ALSO HINDER SEVERE DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON SATURDAY. SW-NE FRONT SIDE JET 
SEGMENT WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT. THIS BRINGS 
WARMING AND INCREASED MOISTURE TO THE MID LEVELS. BULK SHEAR IS 35 
TO 40 KTS BUT IS UNIDIRECTIONAL AS CONVECTION MOVES EAST ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU SATURDAY MORNING. SEVERE PARAMETERS ARE LOW AS 
CONVECTION MOVES THROUGH THE MRX CWA MID MORNING THROUGH EARLY 
AFTERNOON. SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH AROUND MID DAY BUT UPPER 
TROUGH AXIS REMAINS WEST OF THE AREA INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. THIS 
WILL ALLOW CONVECTION TO CONTINUE ACROSS E AND NE AREAS INTO THE 
LATER PART OF THE AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL MOVE LITTLE AND WILL 
BE MOSTLY IN THE 70S. TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WITH 
GOOD COLD AIR ADVECTION LOWERING H85 TEMPS TO NEAR 10C. SOME STRATO 
CU MAY BE CAPPED MODERATING TEMP FALL BUT VALLEY LOWS IN THE 50S 
WILL BE COMMON. SUNDAY WILL BE SUNNY AND DRY WITH TEMPERATURES A 
COUPLE DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE LINGERS 
ACROSS THE REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
FRIDAY. ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA LATE ON FRIDAY. BUT IT 
SHOULD REMAIN WEST OF THE CWA...SO KEPT FRIDAY DRY. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD GENERALLY BE NEAR SEASONAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED CLOSE TO  
MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT FRI SEP 7 2012

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO FORECAST. MORNING FOG HAS BURNED OFF.
LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE PROGGED BY LATEST MODELS SHOULD ENHANCE 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT ACROSS NE TN MNTS. ADDED ISOLATED CONVECTION TO 
THOSE AREAS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. LATE DAY WARM UP ON TRACK. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...PATCHY AREAS OF FOG NOTED 
THIS MORNING WITH SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. WAS 
TEMPTED TO TOSS IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSRA THIS AFTERNOON OVER ERN 
MTNS...BUT COVERAGE IF ANY WOULD BE VERY ISOLATED. TRENDED MAX TEMPS 
IN LINE WITH A MOS BLEND...WHICH WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE THE 
THURSDAY MAX TEMPS.

SHORT RANGE MODELS SEEM IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON RAIN CHANCES WITH 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT TO BE LATE TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY. FRONTAL 
PASSAGE SHOULD OCCUR IN THE AFTERNOON...EVEN FOR FAR EASTERN 
COUNTIES. A FEW STRONG STORMS ARE POSSIBLE AND I KEPT POPS FROM 
PREVIOUS GRIDS...WHICH WERE ABOUT 10 TO 20 PERCENT ABOVE THE LIKELY 
POPS FROM 07/00Z MOS. MOS MINS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT...THEN A 
DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THE WARMER GFS MOS MAXES FOR SATURDAY.

LONG TERM....(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS SPEED UP 
COLD FRONT AND SHOULD BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY EVENING. A FEW 
LINGERING SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS OTHERWISE SKIES WILL CLEAR 
OVERNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE REGION WITH 
MOSTLY SUNNY TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. MUCH 
COOLER LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT GENERALLY IN THE 50S WITH 40S IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES. AS THE HIGH SETTLES OVER THE TN VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT 
AND MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL. A WARMING TREND 
WILL BEGIN TUESDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY WITH HIGHS NEAR 
NORMAL AND LOWS SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL AS DRY AIR MASS STAYS OVER THE 
AREA AND GULF MOISTURE REMAINS CUT OFF FROM THE FORECAST AREA.

MTNS...BUT COVERAGE IF ANY WOULD BE VERY ISOLATED. TRENDED MAX TEMPS 
IN LINE WITH A MOS BLEND...WHICH WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE THE
THURSDAY MAX TEMPS.

SHORT RANGE MODELS SEEM IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON RAIN CHANCES WITH 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT TO BE LATE TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY. FRONTAL 
PASSAGE SHOULD OCCUR IN THE AFTERNOON...EVEN FOR FAR EASTERN 
COUNTIES. A FEW STRONG STORMS ARE POSSIBLE AND I KEPT POPS FROM 
PREVIOUS GRIDS...WHICH WERE ABOUT 10 TO 20 PERCENT ABOVE THE LIKELY 
POPS FROM 07/00Z MOS. MOS MINS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT...THEN A 
DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THE WARMER GFS MOS MAXES FOR SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM....(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS SPEED UP
COLD FRONT AND SHOULD BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY EVENING. A FEW
LINGERING SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS OTHERWISE SKIES WILL CLEAR
OVERNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE REGION WITH
MOSTLY SUNNY TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. MUCH
COOLER LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT GENERALLY IN THE 50S WITH 40S IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR
TEMPERATURES. AS THE HIGH SETTLES OVER THE TN VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT
AND MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN BELOW NORMAL. A WARMING TREND
WILL BEGIN TUESDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY WITH HIGHS NEAR
NORMAL AND LOWS SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL AS DRY AIR MASS STAYS OVER
THE AREA AND GULF MOISTURE REMAINS CUT OFF FROM THE FORECAST AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             93  73  81  57  80 /  10  60  80  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  71  80  56  77 /  10  50  80  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       91  69  79  55  77 /  10  60  80  10  10

FRIDAY AND INTO THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS ON SATURDAY. STRONG TO 
SEVERE ORGANIZED CONVECTION CAN BE EXPECTED ALONG AND AHEAD OF 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. BEST LIFT OVER THE MRX CWA OCCURS EARLY 
SATURDAY. SEVERE PARAMETERS LOWER SOMEWHAT AS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY 
MOVES INTO THE EAST TN VALLEY EARLY SATURDAY. STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS ARE POSSIBLE SATURDAY MORNING WITH LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING 
WINDS THE MAIN THREATS. MOST OF THE CONVECTION SHOULD MOVE EAST OF 
THE GREAT TN VALLEY BY SAT AFTERNOON. LEANED ON THE HIGH SIDE OF MOS 
TEMP GUIDANCE.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AND 
FRONT EXITING THE AREA ON SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS ON SATURDAY NIGHT. HIGH 
PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WERE GENERALLY NEAR SEASONAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 
STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

EXPECTED TO RANGE FROM THE MID 80S NORTH TO LOWER 90S SOUTH.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS HIGHER 
THAN AVERAGE ALTHOUGH STILL SOME TIMING UNCERTAINTY EARLY ON. MAIN 
FEATURE FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE THE UPPER TROUGH AND COLD 
FRONT THAT MOVE IN BY FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY. TREND OF THE MODELS HAS 
BEEN TO MOVE THIS THROUGH MORE QUICKLY...SO WILL TREND THAT WAY AS 
WELL. WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY...THEN LIKELY 
WEST/CHANCE EAST FRIDAY NIGHT AND LIKELY ALL ZONES SATURDAY...MAINLY 
SAT MORNING. MAY BE DRY BY SAT NIGHT...BUT FOR NOW WILL HOLD ON TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS FIRST PART OF THE NIGHT. AFTER THIS 
FEATURE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE IN...AND AN UPPER RIDGE 
WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA BEHIND THE DEPARTING UPPER TROUGH BY THE 
END OF THE PERIOD. SHOULD BE CLEAR/MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY FOR SUNDAY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WILL BE COOLER BEHIND THE FRONT...FOLLOWED BY A 
GRADUAL WARMING TREND.

251 
FXUS64 KMRX 051901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT WED SEP 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...WARM AND MOIST LOW LEVEL AIRMASS
REMAINS IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA. SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL PERSIST 
ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. SCATTERED AFTERNOON CONVECTION WILL 
LINGER INTO THE EVENING HOURS ...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS. A 
DECAYING CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MAY MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU FROM 
THE NORTHWEST EARLY TONIGHT. LATE NIGHT EARLY MORNING FOG WILL 
DEVELOP ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA. A WEAK MID LEVEL TROUGH AXIS WILL 
MOVE EAST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY. CONVECTION SHOULD BE ISOLATED 
TOMORROW. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES RISE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH 
TEMPS A COUPLE DEGREE WARMER ON THURSDAY. 
 
.LONG TERM /TOMORROW NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
A CHANGE IN THE PATTERN WILL OCCUR LATE THIS WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND 
AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH PASSES ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS...DRIVING A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. MODELS ARE 
ALL IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM AND SHOW 
INCREASING CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS OVERSPREADING THE AREA 
FROM WEST TO EAST DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH WILL 
LIKELY TRIGGER SOME ACTIVITY ALONG THE WESTERN PLATEAU AREA FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING. HOWEVER...A BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION FROM THIS 
EVENT SHOULD OCCUR DURING THE DAY ON SATURDAY...BEFORE BEGINNING TO 
WANE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE 
MOUNTAINS. GIVEN THE HIGH BULK SHEAR VALUES AND JET ENERGY 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM...SOME ORGANIZED/STRONGER THUNDERSTORMS 
CANNOT BE RULED OUT. HOWEVER...MORE MODEST TALL/SKINNY CAPE PROFILES 
EXHIBITED BY MODEL SOUNDINGS AND PWATS AOA 2.0 INCHES INDICATE THAT 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE A MUCH BIGGER THREAT /PARTICULARLY IF 
TRAINING OCCURS/. 

IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM A MORE AUTUMN-LIKE AIR MASS WILL GET USHERED 
INTO THE REGION AS DAYTIME HIGHS WILL ONLY PEAK IN THE UPPER 70S TO 
LOWER 80S EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS DROPPING INTO THE 
UPPER 40S ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES SUNDAY/MONDAY NIGHTS. WITH 
ZONAL FLOW RETURNING AND A SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING BACK INTO THE 
LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY NEXT WEEK HOWEVER...MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY 
CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED LATE IN THE PERIOD...ALONG WITH A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND.  




&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             73  92  72  93  71 /  20  20  10  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  91  70  91  70 /  20  20  10  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  92  69  90  69 /  20  30  10  30  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              67  89  65  88  66 /  20  20  20  20  30

DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK TROUGH AXIS SLOWLY PUSHING 
THROUGH TODAY.  WITH CONTINUED ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE OVER THE 
AREA...SHOULD SEE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOP THIS 
AFTERNOON.  BEST CHANCE WILL BE EAST OF THE AXIS WHICH SHOULD KEEP 
THE BULK OF THE SHOWER ACTIVITY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE MRX CWA.  
A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVERNIGHT...THOUGH COVERAGE SHOULD BE QUITE 
LIMITED AND WILL KEEP POPS AT SLIGHT CHANCE.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN FEATURE FOR THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE THE UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT THAT MOVE IN 
BY SATURDAY.  BEFORE THAT WILL JUST CARRY SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY FOR SOME AFTERNOON CONVECTION...THEN LIKELY POPS 
SATURDAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN AND THE COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH.  MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT THAT THIS WILL BE 
AN OPEN WAVE THAT MOVES THROUGH RATHER THAN A LINGERING UPPER LOW AS 
IN SOME PREVIOUS RUNS...SO PLAN TO JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
INTO SUNDAY THEN DRY MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

935 PM EDT TUE SEP 4 2012

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS OVER SRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA HAVE NEARLY 
DISSIPATED WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. 20 TO 30 PERCENT COVERAGE 
OF SHOWERS CONTINUES ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA...WITH MODELS SHOWING A

CONVECTION SHOULD KEEP IT FROM BECOMING WIDESPREAD.

PERSISTENCE LOWER 70S WITH UPPER 60S NE. WEDNESDAY FOLLOWED LOWER
GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR HIGHS SINCE THE LAST COUPLE DAYS HAVE HAD
LOWER HIGHS THAN FORECAST. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...

SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION DURING THE MIDDLE PORTION OF THE WEEK. 
UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT STILL PROMPTING LIKELY POPS FOR 
SATURDAY. MODELS CONTINUE TO DIVERGE ON PLACEMENT OF THE UPPER TROF 
/OR CLOSED LOW/ POST-FRONTAL...THUS I CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE EARLY DAYS OF NEXT WEEK...MAINLY THE NORTHEAST HALF 
OF CWA. ECMWF HAS BEEN THE MOST PERSISTENT WITH NEAR STATIONARY 
CLOSED LOW LATE IN THE PERIOD...OTHER MODELS CLEAR US OUT EARLIER 
FOLLOWING THE FROPA. COMFORTABLE POST FRONTAL TEMPS NEAR OR A LITTLE 
BELOW NORMAL.

FXUS64 KMRX 031925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT MON SEP 3 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...
REMNANT UPPER LEVEL LOW ASSOCIATED WITH ISAAC APPROACHING THE
FORECAST AREA NOW OVER MIDDLE TN EXTENDING NORTH INTO SOUTHERN OH
WITH SURFACE LOW ACROSS SOUTHERN IN AND WESTERN KY AND TN. A NEARLY
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY LIES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND WEST
TN/WEST KY. THE SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST ALONG THE OHIO
RIVER AND THEN INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY TUESDAY NIGHT WITH
THE FRONT APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA BY 00Z WEDNESDAY. AS A
RESULT EXPECT VERY HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT AND SHOWERS LIKELY WITH A
FEW THUNDERSTORMS. SKIES TODAY HAVE HAD FEW BREAKS AND WHERE
SHOWERS HAVE LINGERED TEMPERATURES HAVE STAYED IN THE 70S.
INSTABILITY HAS BEEN LOWER ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION THEN
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS AND WELL TO THE SOUTH IN GA. THIS HAS
LIMITED THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT SO FAR ACROSS THE REGION. JUST
STARTING TO GET A FEW BREAKS WHICH MAY FUEL SOME THUNDERSTORMS OVER
THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS. THERE COULD BE SOME HEAVY RAINFALL IN THE
STORMS BETWEEN NOW AND AROUND MIDNIGHT TONIGHT BUT ONLY IN ISOLATED
LOCATIONS. KEPT SHOWERS LIKELY AND ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDER FOR
THE EVENING. THINK TUESDAY THERE MAY BE A FEW MORE BREAKS SO HAVE
HIGHS SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN WHAT WAS EXPECTED TODAY. INSTABILITY A
LITTLE HIGHER TOO SO EXPECT BETTER CHANCE OF THUNDER. LOWS TONIGHT
ABOUT THE SAME AS THE LAST SEVERAL NIGHTS NEAR 70...ABOUT A DEGREE
ABOVE GUIDANCE TRENDS FOR MOST SITES.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
INCREASED MOISTURE THANKS TO REMNANTS OF ISAAC WILL KEEP THE AREA 
UNDER A MOSTLY DIURNAL CONVECTIVE REGIME EARLY IN THE EXTENDED. 
THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE AT A MINIMUM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT...THEN NEW WEATHER CHANGER COMES INTO VIEW. MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT ON A LONG WAVE TROUGH TO MOVE INTO EASTERN U.S. LATE WEEK. 
THIS WILL OF COURSE BE ASSOCIATED WITH A SURFACE COLD FRONT WHICH 
WILL BRING RAIN AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA...PEAKING ON SATURDAY. 
WENT LIKELY POPS AREA WIDE FOR SATURDAY. AFTER THE FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH AND CLEARS OUT THE CONVECTION...A QUESTION REMAINS ABOUT THE 
LOCATION OF THE POTENTIAL CLOSED LOW IN THE COOL AIR. SO I WILL 
MAINTAIN SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR THE NORTH HALF OF CWA SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY. COOLER TEMPS IN STORE FOLLOWING THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...AT 
OR BELOW NORMAL FOR THE NEW WEEK.

.DISCUSSION...THE REMNANT LOW OF ISAAC WAS LOCATED ALONG THE LOWER

OVER THE LAST FEW HOURS. THIS FEATURE WILL MAKE SLOW PROGRESS EAST.

FEW BREAKS WERE LOCATED OVER SE TN. RAIN SHOWERS WERE MOVING ACROSS
MOST OF THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH MORE SHOWERS
DEVELOPING OVER THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND MOVING INTO NORTHERN
MIDDLE TN. OVERALL FORECAST LOOKS GOOD BUT DROPPED HIGHS A COUPLE
DEGREES AS CLOUD COVER AND FREQUENT SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS
SHOULD SLOW TEMPERATURE RISE THIS AFTERNOON. A FEW LOCATIONS MAY
REACH THE UPPER 80S IF ENOUGH BREAKS FORM. PRECIPITABLE WATER
VALUES ARE VERY HIGH ABOVE 2.00 INCHES AND HEAVY RAINFALL THAT
COULD PRODUCE LOCALIZED FLOODING IS POSSIBLE WITH ANY THUNDERSTORM
DEVELOPMENT. ADDED HEAVY RAINFALL FOR AFTERNOON PERIOD TO MATCH
WORDING IN HWO. BEST CHANCE OF SEVERE WILL BE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE
REGION WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE GREATEST BUT A FEW STORMS MAY
BECOME STRONG DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON OR EARLY EVENING.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE REMNANT LOW FROM ISAAC WILL

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...OHIO VALLEY UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED AXIS OF DEEP MOISTURE ELONGATES AND WEAKENS AS IT TRUDGES 
EASTWARD TOWARD THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS. MAINTAINED LIKELY 
POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS ENVIRONMENT. MODELS 
CONTINUE TO SHOW THIS WIDESPREAD RAIN PRODUCING FEATURE FINALLY 
SHIFTS EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...A FAIR 
AMOUNT OF MOISTURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
AND WITH SOME INSTABILITY PROGGED FELT IT WAS BEST TO HOLD ONTO A 
LOW CHANCE POP ON WEDNESDAY. WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGH AND COOL FRONT 
BUILD INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY WHICH MAY SPARK A COUPLE SHOWERS 
AND A THUNDERSTORM. BY FRIDAY AIRMASS SHOULD BE A LITTLE DRIER BUT 
CONVECTION STILL POSSIBLE...MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES SO 
USED A SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY HERE. MODELS DIFFER ON TIMING AND 
STRENGTH OF NEXT UPPER TROUGH FOR THE WEEKEND. THE AMPLIFIED SYSTEM 
SHOULD BRING MORE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
AT THE END OF THE LONG TERM SO USED A BROAD BRUSHED THIRTY TO FORTY 
PERCENT POP ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 021852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EDT SUN SEP 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
THE SLOW EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE REMNANT LOW FROM ISSAC AND A VERY 
MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE WITH PW VALUES ABOVE 2 INCHES WILL MAKE FOR A 
WET SHORT TERM PERIOD. AFTER A ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
PASSES THROUGH THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON...ANOTHER ROUND IS SHOWN BY 
THE NAM AND THE RUC ARRIVING TOWARD MIDNIGHT. STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ACROSS NORTHERN MS/AL IN A LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE ZONE AND THETA-E MAX...AND MOVE NORTHEAST INTO OUR AREA. 
WHILE THE STORMS SHOULD LOSE SOME INTENSITY DUE TO DIMINISHING 
SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY...SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY AND A 30-40 
KT LLJ WILL HELP KEEP A CHANCE OF STRONG STORMS IN THE SOUTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY TONIGHT. GUSTY WINDS AND 
HEAVY RAIN WILL BE THE MAIN THREATS. CATEGORICAL POPS WILL CONTINUE 
FROM TONIGHT THROUGH THE DAY MONDAY AS THE CLOSED CYCLONIC 
CIRCULATION MOVES DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA. WHILE THE BEST DYNAMICS 
FOR LIFT WILL BE TO OUR EAST...COOLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS UNDER THE LOW 
AND A TROPICAL AIR MASS WILL KEEP PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS GOING THROUGH THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
WEAKENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SLIDES SOUTHEAST AND LOSES IDENTITY 
OVER THE EAST TN VALLEY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. LAYER MOISTURE REMAINS 
HIGH WITH ABOVE NORMAL PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND TEMPERATURES 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. DEEPER MOISTURE SHIFTS EAST FOR THE LATER HALF OF 
THE WEAK WITH DIURNAL CONVECTION FAVORING THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
MODELS CONTINUE TREND OF DEVELOPING STRONG TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN 
U.S. BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE SAT OR EARLY SUN. STRONG 
CONVECTION A POSSIBILITY SAT AHEAD OF FRONT. TROUGH AXIS REMAINS 
WEST OF AREA SUNDAY WITH LINGERING PRECIPITATION CHANCES. DRY 
CONDITIONS AND COOL NIGHTS SETTING UP FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. 

&&

LOST. WHILE THE STORMS SHOULD WEAKEN BEFORE REACHING OUR
AREA...SOME MAY REMAIN STRONG THROUGH THE NIGHT...WITH GUSTY WINDS

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMNANTS OF ISAAC WILL DRAW CLOSER 
DURING THE PERIOD. PLENTY OF MOISTURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA...AND

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING...BUT WITH HIGH PW VALUES AND 
INCREASING LOW LEVEL FLOW CERTAINLY COULD SEE SOME HEAVY RAINS AND 
THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALIZED FLOODING. WILL MENTION THIS THREAT IN 
HWO...BUT THREAT LOOKS TOO LOCALIZED FOR ANY FFA AT THIS POINT.  
JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SLOW MOVING MID SOUTH LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE REGION ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES HOLD STEADY AROUND TWO INCHES AS THE 
PERSISTENT SOUTHERLY FLOW OF VAPOR CONTINUES TO STREAM NORTH FROM 
THE GULF OF MEXICO. CHECKING OUT SOUNDINGS REVEALS A MOIST ADIABATIC 
PROFILE BUT BELIEVE CONVECTION WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY 
DURING THE DAYTIME PERIODS BOTH DAYS. TWEAKED POPS UP TO SEVENTY 
PERCENT ON MONDAY AND ADJUSTED TO SIXTY PERCENT ON TUESDAY AS THE 
REMNANT LOW WEAKENS WHILE SHIFTING SLOWLY EAST. MODELS PUSH THE WEAK 
TROUGH EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY BUT SUFFICIENT MOISTURE 
AND INSTABILITY LINGERS IN CYCLONIC FLOW REGIME WITH AMPLIFYING 
GREAT LAKES UPPER TROUGH AT MID WEEK SO MAINTAINED LOW TO MEDIUM 
CHANCE POPS FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM. ECMWF/GFS SHOW A DRYING 
TREND THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WHILE A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPS SOUTH 
ACROSS THE REGION. WITH BOUNDARY IN THE AREA THURSDAY HELD ONTO 
SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS BUT REMOVED THE CHANCE OF RAIN ON FRIDAY. 
MODELS NOT IN AGREEMENT ON TIMING OF NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM DUE IN THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY WITH 
GFS PREDICTING FASTER MOVEMENT AND ECMWF SLOWER. WENT WITH THE 
QUICKER GFS AND ONLY APPLIED A LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION 
WITH THE FRONT FOR THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.

ADVERTISING A SYNOPTIC COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACCOMPANYING THIS 
SYSTEM WITH ARRIVAL ON THURSDAY. UNCERTAINTY AS TO HOW FAR THIS 
FRONT WILL PROGRESS LEAD TO THE DECISION TO KEEP AT LEAST A SLIGHT 
CHANCE PROBABILITY GOING ON FRIDAY FOR CONVECTION WITH A POSSIBLE 
STALLING OR VERY SLOWLY MOVING BOUNDARY.

PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES OVER 2 INCHES. HOWEVER...MUCH LIKE TODAY
AND YESTERDAY...LIFT THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE VERY WEAK. THUS ANY
SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN...AND COVERAGE SHOULD
REMAIN SCATTERED. SO POPS WILL DROP BACK TO A SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER
00Z THIS EVENING...THEN TO NO CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT. CHANCE POPS
RETURN SATURDAY AFTERNOON. PERSISTENCE WILL BE FOLLOWED FOR TEMPS
TONIGHT...AS THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE HAS BEEN WAY TOO COOL THE PAST
SEVERAL NIGHTS. WITH BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS EXPECTED ACROSS THE
ENTIRE AREA TOMORROW...HIGH TEMPS SHOULD PEAK IN THE 80S EVERYWHERE
OUTSIDE THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE REMNANTS OF
ISAAC WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA LATER IN THE WEEKEND AND EARLY
NEXT WEEK AS IT MOVES EAST FROM MO INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BEGINNING
SATURDAY NIGHT AND MERGES WITH A FRONTAL SYSTEM SUNDAY. RAIN
CHANCES WILL INCREASE SUNDAY WITH HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY THROUGH
TUESDAY. THE FRONT WILL MOVE SLOWLY ACROSS KY TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY WITH ADDITIONAL FRONTAL DEVELOPMENT BEHIND THE FIRST
SYSTEM THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT
SATURDAY NIGHT AND THEN INCREASE SUNDAY. THE LARGEST TOTALS LOOK TO
BE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE DEEPER MOISTURE ASSOCIATED
WITH ISAAC MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH INCREASING LIFT AHEAD
OF THE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. NIGHT TIME TEMPERATURES
WILL STAY ABOVE NORMAL AND DAY TIME HIGHS NEAR NORMAL WITH PARTLY
SUNNY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             74  88  72  89  72 /  20  50  40  60  50

WILL BE LIMITED BY CLOUD COVER. AFTERNOON SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO
DEVELOP NORTHEAST WHERE HEATING WILL BE GREATER...BUT COVERAGE
SHOULD REMAIN ISOLATED AS MOISTURE IS LIMITED THERE. THE CURRENT

TONIGHT SO WILL GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FOR MOST MAV MINS FOR TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...LOOKS LIKE A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD OF THE FORECAST WILL BE DOMINATED BY WHAT WAS 
ONCE ISAAC. THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SHIFT NORTH INTO THE 
MIDWEST STATES BY SATURDAY AND THEN WILL BE NUDGED ALONG BY THE 
WESTERLIES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. MODEL FORECASTS 
GRADUALLY INCREASE MEAN RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND LIFT ESPECIALLY LATER 
IN THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND AS THE SOUTHERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS A BIT WITH 
THE APPROACH OF THIS FEATURE. THEREFORE BASICALLY TWEAKED POPS UP A 
BIT ON SUNDAY WHILE MAINTAINING GOOD CHANCE POPS ON SATURDAY AND 
MONDAY WITH DEEP MOISTURE AND ADEQUATE LIFT PERSISTING WITH THE SLOW 
MOVING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. UNCERTAINTY IN EXACTLY HOW QUICKLY THE 
REMNANTS OF ISAAC DEPART TO THE EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION REQUIRED ONLY GRADUALLY DECREASING PROBABILITY OF 
PRECIPITATION DURING THE WORK WEEK AS A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY TRIES 
TO ADVANCE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NOT SURE HOW MUCH 
PROGRESS THIS FRONT WILL MAKE AND THE BOUNDARY MAY STALL OVER THE 
REGION WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY SO KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP AT THE 
END OF THE PERIOD. TRENDED A LITTLE BELOW MEX MOS MAX TEMPS THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE FORECAST AS THE SUGGESTED WELL ABOVE NORMAL HIGHS LOOK A 
LITTLE TOO WARM IN THIS UNSETTLED PATTERN.

540 
FXUS64 KMRX 301922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT THU AUG 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
AS THE REMNANTS OF ISSAC TRACK N-NW...A MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER
THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY WILL BUILD OVER THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS TONIGHT....THEN SHIFT TO VA/NC ON FRIDAY. IN THE LOW
LEVELS...STATIONARY HIGH PRESSURE OVER GA/SC WILL CONTINUE TO PUMP
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. WITH NO DISCERNIBLE LIFTING
MECHANISMS BENEATH THE BUILDING RIDGE...THE DIURNALLY-DRIVEN SHOWER
ACTIVITY NOW OCCURRING SHOULD DISSIPATE BEFORE MIDNIGHT. A DENSE
CIRRUS SHIELD SHOULD REMAIN IN PLACE TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD HELP
HOLD TEMPS UP. GFS MOS HAS BEEN TOO COOL THE PAST FEW NIGHTS...SO
WILL GO ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR LOW TEMPS.

FOR FRIDAY...SOUTHERN AND WESTERN AREAS WILL HAVE LESS INFLUENCE 
FROM THE UPPER RIDGE...AND WILL ALSO HAVE THE BEST MOISTURE
ADVECTION. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES RISE TO NEAR 2 INCHES AT CHA
IN THE NAM. THE HIGHEST POPS TOMORROW WILL BE IN SOUTHERN AND
WESTERN AREAS. STILL...SYNOPTIC LIFT IS WEAK...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN
THE CHANCE RANGE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTHEAST UNDER THE RIDGE.
WILL FOLLOW PERSISTENCE FOR HIGH TEMPS TOMORROW...IN THE MID AND
UPPER 80S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
LATEST MODEL RUNS SHOW THE FORECAST AREA ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF
THE TROPICAL AIR MASS ASSOCIATED WITH THE REMNANTS OF ISAAC THIS
WEEKEND. SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE FRIDAY
NIGHT AND THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS ISAAC MOVES NORTHEAST THROUGH THE
OHIO VALLEY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS DO NOT APPEAR TO BE THAT GREAT
THROUGH SATURDAY BUT MAY REACH ONE TO THREE INCHES FOR THE PERIOD
FROM SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY OR MONDAY NIGHT. THE
BEST CONSENSUS FOR THE REMNANTS OF ISAACS TRACK IS FROM A LOCATION
OVER MO EARLY SATURDAY TO MOVE SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY
THROUGH TUESDAY. THE PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL LINGER AS IT JOINS
WITH A FRONTAL SYSTEM SUNDAY THAT MOVES SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY. GFS DOES SHOW A SECONDARY FRONT
MOVING THROUGH THURSDAY. ECMWF DOES SHOW A DRYING TREND THURSDAY
WITHOUT THE SECONDARY FRONT. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCES OF RAIN FOR
THE LAST 2 DAYS OF THE FORECAST BUT EITHER WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY
MAY BE DRY IF THE FRONT THAT PICKS UP ISAAC MOVES THROUGH FASTER.
MILD LOW TEMPERATURES THE NEXT SEVERAL NIGHTS IN THE MID 60S TO
LOWER 70S AND HIGHS WILL BE KEPT DOWN BY CLOUDS AND RAIN MOSTLY IN
THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S.

BOUNDARY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WILL UPDATE TO LOWER POPS A BIT.

FXUS64 KMRX 300738
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EDT THU AUG 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED
TO TRACK OVER THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE REGION. SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DEVELOP TODAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH
THE HIGHEST CHANCES ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN AREAS. TEMPERATURE SHOULD
REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN. MAV GUIDANCE LOOKED REASONABLE...SO
STAYED NEAR THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY. THE
BOUNDARY LINGERS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...SO KEPT
THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE SOUTH FOR TONIGHT. GUIDANCE
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT SO STAYED CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LATEST GFS AND ECMWF MODEL
RUNS ARE SHOWING SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE PATH OF THE REMNANT
LOW OF ISAAC THIS WEEKEND...BUT STILL INDICATE THAT ITS ASSOCIATED
MOISTURE WILL COMBINE WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER
THE TN RIVER VALLEY TO CREATE SCATTERED CONVECTION ON FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS BRING THE REMNANTS OF ISAAC
INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEKEND...BUT THE LATEST GFS MODEL
RUN INDICATES A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK THAN THE ECMWF MODEL...AND
CONSEQUENTLY KEEPS THE BULK OF ISAAC'S MOISTURE NORTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA. FOR NOW...WILL TREND THE FORECAST TOWARD THE MORE
SOUTHERLY ECMWF SOLUTION...SINCE THE ECMWF MODEL HAS BEEN MORE
CONSISTENT LATELY AND ALSO HAS SUPPORT FROM THE CANADIAN MODEL.
THIS ECMWF SOLUTION INDICATES THE POSSIBILITY OF HEAVY RAINFALL
OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH WIDESPREAD
RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF TWO TO THREE INCHES POSSIBLE. A COLD FRONT IS
THEN PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON
TUESDAY...TRIGGERING ADDITIONAL CONVECTION ON TUESDAY BUT BRINGING
DRIER WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND
TOWARDS THE GFS NUMBERS WITH MINS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT
WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE WITH MAXES DUE TO THE
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP COVERAGE. IN ADDITION...THESE
COOLER MAXES ARE MORE IN LINE WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 300108 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
908 PM EDT WED AUG 29 2012

.DISCUSSION...
THE MAIN CHANGES TO THE FORECAST THIS EVENING WERE TO INCREASE POPS
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. THE REGION
IS ON THE EDGE OF A DEFORMATION ZONE...WITH DRY AIR PUSHING SOUTH
FROM THE OHIO VALLEY AND A MORE MOIST...TROPICAL AIR MASS PUSHING
NORTH FROM THE GULF COAST AS TROPICAL STORM ISAAC CONTINUES TO TRACK
INTO THE LOWER- MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS SHOULD HELP TO
MAINTAIN/ENHANCE A STATIONARY FRONT CURRENTLY DRAPED ACROSS SE
TENNESSEE AND WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA OVERNIGHT. THIS FRONT...ALONG
WITH MULTIPLE RESIDUAL OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM EARLIER CONVECTION
SHOULD ALLOW FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND A FEW ISOLATED STORMS TO
PERSIST OVERNIGHT...MAINLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE I-40 CORRIDOR
/PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES WHERE THE HIGHEST POPS
EXIST/. IN ADDITION...CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH LANDFALLING TROPICAL
STORM ISAAC WILL CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION OVERNIGHT...
HELPING TO PROMOTE PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACROSS ALL
BUT THE FAR NORTHEASTERN ZONES. THIS...ALONG WITH THE HIGHER
RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES WILL KEEP LOWS A FEW DEGREES WARMER
TONIGHT IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S IN MOST AREAS EXCEPT IN NE
TENNESSEE/SW VIRGINIA.

REGION. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY ISOLATED ENOUGH TO NOT EFFECT
ANY TERMINALS HOWEVER. MVFR VIS RESTRICTIONS FROM LIGHT FOG WILL
BE POSSIBLE AT KTRI FOR A FEW HOURS LATE TONIGHT...ALONG WITH MVFR
CIGS AT CHA INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON...DUE TO ITS PROXIMITY TO THE
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. ISOLATED TO SCATTERED STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE
TOMORROW AFTERNOON ALONG THE BOUNDARY ONCE AGAIN BUT CONFIDENCE IS
TOO LOW TO INCLUDE AT KTRI/KTYS...SO HAVE ONLY INCLUDED VCSH AT
KCHA FOR NOW.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 291854
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EDT WED AUG 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
EAST TN HAS BEEN LOCATED DIRECTLY BENEATH A SADDLE POINT IN THE 
850-500 MB FLOW TODAY...AND THE RESULTING DEFORMATION HAS HELPED TO 
SPARK A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL 
SECTIONS. DIURNAL HEATING IS ALSO DRIVING THE SHOWERS...AND PRECIP 
IS EXPECTED TO END WITHIN A FEW HOURS OF SUNSET. A BOUNDARY 
SEPARATING MORE STABLE AIR TO THE NORTH APPEARS TO BE LOCATED 
BETWEEN TYS AND MRX. THE MODELS SHOW THE DEFORMATION ZONE DRIFTING 
NORTHWARD TONIGHT...WITH THE STABILITY BOUNDARY DRIFTING NORTHWARD 
AS WELL TOMORROW. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO SHOWER ACTIVITY PUSHING 
SLIGHTLY NORTHWARD TOMORROW AFTERNOON. MUCH LIKE TODAY...COVERAGE IS 
EXPECTED TO REMAIN ISOLATED TO SCATTERED WITH LIMITED MOISTURE IN 
PLACE. WENT ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS DUE TO EXPECTED 
CLOUD COVER AND WARM LOWS LAST NIGHT. HIGHS THURSDAY SHOULD BE 
MAINLY IN THE UPPER 80S...SIMILAR TO TODAY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
ABUNDANT MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH ISAAC WILL CONTINUE TO PINWHEEL
INTO E TN AND SW NC THROUGH THE REMAINING WEEK. THUS LOW END RAIN
CHANCES THROUGH FRIDAY CAN BE EXPECTED.

THERE WERE VERY MINOR DIFFERENCES NOTED IN THE 6Z AND 12Z GFS MODEL 
RUNS WHICH LEAD TO ONLY MINOR CHANGES TO THIS FORECAST PERIOD. THE 
ECMWF IS IN THE PROCESS OF RUNNING BUT UNAVAILABLE FOR VIEWING AT 
THIS TIME. THE GENERAL TRACK OF ISAAC WILL KEEP IT ACROSS ARKANSAS 
INTO FRIDAY AND THEN THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY NEXT MONDAY. SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM CHANCES WILL BE THE HIGHEST OVER THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND 
BUT THERE IS STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH TIMING AND THE ACTUAL TRACK 
ISAAC TAKES. RIGHT NOW...WE BELIEVE THAT EVENTUALLY...THE UPPER LEVEL 
FLOW WILL STEER WHAT IS LEFT OF ISAAC ACROSS E TN AS EARLY AS SUNDAY 
INTO MONDAY. THROUGH MONDAY...THE HEAVIEST AVERAGE RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
OF AROUND ONE INCH WILL OCCUR ACROSS SW NC AND SE TN. LIGHTEST 
AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED OVER SW VA AND VALLEY LOCATION IN NE TN. /AC

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
403 AM EDT WED AUG 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS
EXPECTED TO TRACK INTO THE REGION ALLOWING FOR THE CHANCE OF
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING TODAY. WILL CONTINUE
WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN AREAS FOR TODAY.
TEMPERATURE SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN. MAV GUIDANCE LOOKED
ON THE HIGH SIDE FOR TEMPERATURES WITH THE EXTRA CLOUDS...SO STAYED
NEAR THE MET/MAV BLEND TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY. THE FRONTAL
BOUNDARY LINGERS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...SO KEPT
THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THOSE AREAS FOR TONIGHT. GUIDANCE
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT SO STAYED CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN REASONABLE
AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION OF THE REMNANTS OF ISAAC IN THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...AND INDICATE THAT ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE WILL
COMBINE WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE TN RIVER
VALLEY TO CREATE SCATTERED CONVECTION EACH DAY INTO THE WEEKEND.
ISAAC IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHWARD INTO THE OZARKS REGION
ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...AND SHOULD THEN DRIFT INTO THE MID MS
RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY. THEREAFTER...THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS
BEGIN TO DISAGREE WITH THE SPEED OF THE REMNANTS OF ISAAC...BUT
GENERALLY AGREE THAT THESE REMNANTS WILL DRIFT SOUTHEASTWARD INTO
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY OR MONDAY. THIS SCENARIO WOULD RESULT
IN THE POSSIBILITY OF HEAVY RAINFALL OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY
SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO MONDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THIS
POSSIBILITY IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

GUIDANCE BLEND.              

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION BETWEEN MID LEVEL TROUGH TO THE NE AND TROPICAL SYSTEM ISAAC 
TO THE SW EARLY IN THE PERIOD. SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN FROM 
THE NW AND STALL ACROSS THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY. SHEAR AXIS 
ASSOCIATED WITH NE TROUGH WILL LINE UP WITH SURFACE FRONT. CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION N OF THIS BOUNDARY LOOKING LESS IMPRESSIVE WITH CHANCE 
CONTINUING SOUTH OF THE BOUNDARY IN DEEPER MOISTURE. AS THE REMNANTS 
OF ISAAC TRAVEL NNW THROUGH THE MS RIVER VALLEY THROUGH FRIDAY 
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION REMAINS RATHER LOW WHEN CONSIDERING WEAK 
DOWNSLOPE FLOW ALONG SMOKIES AND MORE OF A WESTERLY TRACK. REDUCED 
POPS SOME BUT CONFIDENCE STILL RUNNING BELOW AVERAGE...ESPECIALLY 
THROUGH THE LATER HALF OF THE FORECAST. GFS NOW INDICATING REMNANT 
LOW WILL NOT BE PICKED UP BY NORTHERN STREAM AND MAY LINGER IN THE 
LOWER OH VALLEY TROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THIS WOULD LEAD 
TO ABOVE NORMAL PRECIPITATION CHANCES LATE IN THE WEEKEND INTO NEXT 
WEEK. SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

519 
FXUS64 KMRX 270748
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT MON AUG 27 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE LINGERING OVER THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL 
A FAIRLY DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY...ALONG WITH 
WEAK MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES. THUS...WILL NOT MENTION ANY CONVECTION 
IN THE FORECAST UNTIL TONIGHT WITH THE APPROACH OF THE WEAK COLD 
FRONT. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY APPROACH THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU TONIGHT...SO WILL MENTION ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WITH TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD CONTINUES TO BE THE PROGRESSION OF TROPICAL 
STORM/HURRICANE ISAAC...AS IT TRACKS TOWARD THE NORTHERN GULF COAST 
AND EVENTUALLY INLAND DURING THE MIDDLE TO END OF THE WORK WEEK. 
THERE HAS BEEN A HIGH DEGREE OF MODEL VARIABILITY FROM RUN TO 
RUN...WITH ABOUT HALF OF THE ENSEMBLES FAVORING A WESTERLY TRACK 
INTO CENTRAL LOUISIANA AND ARKANSAS AND THE OTHER HALF FAVORING A 
MORE EASTERLY TRACK INTO ALABAMA AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS HAS LEAD 
TO A FAIRLY COMPLICATED FORECAST...GIVEN THAT THE WESTERLY SOLUTION 
WOULD RESULT IN A DRIER FORECAST FOR THE REGION...WHILE A MORE 
EASTERLY TRACK COULD YIELD SOME HEAVY RAINFALL AND PERHAPS SOME 
FLOODING ISSUES ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

HOWEVER...AS OF EARLY THIS MORNING THERE IS A BIT MORE MODEL 
CONSENSUS MAJOR MODELS AS THE 00Z RUN OF ECMWF HAS FINALLY BEGUN TO 
FAVOR A MORE WESTWARD TRACK LIKE THE GFS...PUSHING ISAAC 
NORTHWESTWARD INTO THE DROUGHT STRICKEN LOWER-MISSISSIPPI/MISSOURI 
RIVER VALLEYS BETWEEN A MID-LATITUDE TROUGH AND A LARGE SUBTROPICAL 
RIDGE. GIVEN THE SIZE OF THE CIRCULATION AND THE DEEP TROPICAL 
MOISTURE THAT WILL ACCOMPANY THE STORM AS IT TRAVELS INLAND... 
SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE REGION /PARTICULARLY 
ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SE TENNESSEE WHICH WILL BE CLOSEST 
TO WHERE THE CENTER OF THE STORM MAY PASS/. GIVEN THE MORE WESTERLY 
TRACK FAVORED BY THE MODELS...DID NOT FEEL CONFIDENT GOING HIGHER 
THAN 30-40 POPS WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. SHOULD IT APPEAR THAT THE 
GFS SOLUTION WILL VERIFY...POPS WILL NEED TO BE LOWERED INITIALLY 
DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. HOWEVER...BY THE START OF THE HOLIDAY 
WEEKEND...MODELS ARE SHOWING ANOTHER MID-LATITUDE TROUGH PICKING UP 
THE REMNANTS OF ISAAC AND RAPIDLY PUSHING IT ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY/GREAT LAKES. THUS...THE REGION /PARTICULARLY THE NORTHEASTERN 
ZONES/ COULD SEE ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SOME PRECIPITATION HEADING INTO 
THE LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD. BY THE END OF THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... 
ISAAC SHOULD BE WELL TO THE NORTH AND EAST OF THE REGION AS 
GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT PREVAILS HEADING INTO THE FIRST WEEK OF 
SEPTEMBER. 

OTHERWISE...KEPT TEMPERATURES AT OR SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE GIVEN 
THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION CHANCES. HIGHS WILL GENERALLY 
PEAK IN THE 80-85 DEGREE RANGE...WITH 70S LIKELY IN THE MOUNTAINS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   92  69  87  70  85 /  10  10  30  40  40 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     91  67  86  68  84 /  10  10  30  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN             91  67  86  68  84 /  10  10  30  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    89  60  82  66  82 /  10  10  30  10  10

407 
FXUS64 KMRX 261927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT SUN AUG 26 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SEEING A VERY RANDOM
POPPING UP OF SHRA/TSRA THIS AFTERNOON...AS AIRMASS HAS GOTTEN
SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE WITH TEMPS TOPPING OUT IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S.
DEW POINT TEMPS STILL RUNNING UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. CONVECTION
HAS LASTED INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS EACH DAY...SO FELT IT WAS
WISE TO CARRY A TOKEN POP IN A LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING PERIOD
THEN DRY OVERNIGHT. LIMITED ANY FOG TO JUST NEAR THE BODIES OF
WATER OVERNIGHT...AND FAVORED PERSISTENCE ON MINS. 

MONDAY STILL LOOKS MOSTLY DRY...BUT SINCE I CAN'T RULE OUT A STRAY
TSRA IN THE AFTERNOON...I KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS JUST FOR NRN
PLATEAU AND SW VA AREAS. BLEND OF MOS MAXES LOOKED BEST.

NOW FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...WHICH COULD TREND TO MORE DRY
THAN WET...GIVEN THE CONSENSUS BEING REACHED AMONGST MODELS ON THE
TRACK OF ISAAC (MORE WESTERLY). THE MID LEVEL TROUGH AND FRONT LOOK
QUITE WEAK FOR TUESDAY...PLUS THE POSSIBILITY THAT SUBSIDENCE
OCCURS ON THE NNE PERIPHERY OF ISAAC. WITH THIS IN MIND...I KEPT
CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND STAYED AROUND 20-30 PERCENT POPS
FOR NOW. MILDER MOS MINS CHOSEN FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND A BLEND FOR
TUESDAY MAXES...DUE TO AN EXPECTED INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE 12Z GFS CONTINUED TO 
DRAMATICALLY SHIFT THE TRACK OF ISAAC FARTHER WEST WITH LANDFALL AT 
THIS TIME EXPECTED AROUND 12Z WEDNESDAY IN THE VICINITY OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI OR LOUISIANA COAST. THIS CONTINUES TO BE A NICE PATH FOR 
THE TROPICAL SYSTEM IN TERMS OF OUR FORECAST FOR THE PAST SEVERAL 
DAYS BECAUSE WE HAVE HELD ONTO POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
GENERALLY BETWEEN 30 AND 50 PERCENT FOR THE MAIN IMPACT PERIOD 
ENCOMPASSING WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ALSO HAD TO RAISE POPS INTO THE 
MEDIUM CHANCE CATEGORY FOR FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND AS THE TROPICAL 
CIRCULATION GETS PICKED UP BY THE NEXT UPPER TROUGH SWINGING THE 
SYSTEM ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND MID SOUTH. ADJUSTED MAX 
TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW DEGREES TO ACCOUNT FOR AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
AND CHANCE FOR RAIN MID WEEK ALONG WITH MODERATING EFFECT OF 
PREVAILING EASTERLY FLOW.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  90  67  90  69 /  10  10  10  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  91  67  90  69 /  20  20  10  30  20

886 
FXUS64 KMRX 260745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT SUN AUG 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION... 
WITH A STAGNANT PATTERN OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION WILL BRING DRIER 
MID LEVEL AIR OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...ALONG WITH SOME 
SUBSIDENCE ALOFT. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT MOST CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
SHOULD BE SUPPRESSED THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...EXCEPT AROUND THE 
MOUNTAINS WHERE ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WITH TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER THAN 
YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IN 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD CONTINUES TO BE THE PROGRESSION OF TROPICAL 
STORM/HURRICANE ISSAC AND WHERE IT WILL TRACK THIS COMING WEEK. THE 
FORECAST HAS BEEN FRUSTRATING TO SAY THE LEAST AS THERE HAS BEEN 
QUITE A BIT OF MODEL VARIABILITY FROM RUN TO RUN AND LITTLE 
CONSENSUS BETWEEN THE MAJOR MODELS. THE MAJOR FACTOR IN WHERE THE 
STORM TRACKS WILL BE A MID-LATITUDE TROUGH...WHICH DEPENDING ON ITS 
TIMING WILL EITHER RECURVE ISSAC FURTHER TO THE NORTH AND EAST...OR 
BYPASS ISSAC AND ALLOW THE STORM TO CONTINUE ON A MORE WESTERLY 
TRACK. 

AS OF EARLY THIS MORNING...THE GFS /WHICH YESTERDAY ATTM HAD AN 
EASTERLY TRACK/ HAS NOW SHIFTED ISSAC MUCH FURTHER TO THE 
WEST...PUSHING THE STORM INTO THE LOUISIANA BAYOUS TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY AND EVENTUALLY INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI/LOWER 
MISSOURI RIVER VALLEYS BY THURSDAY. THE ECMWF...WHICH PREVIOUSLY 
HAD BEEN SHOWING THIS WESTWARD TRACK...HAS NOW SHIFTED TO THE EAST 
AND SHOWS ISSAC MAKING LANDFALL ALONG THE WESTERN FLORIDA PANHANDLE 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND MOVING NORTHWARD THROUGH ALABAMA AND EVENTUALLY 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. 

SHOULD THE STORM TAKE THE MORE WESTERLY TRACK SUGGESTED BY THE 
GFS...A SIGNIFICANTLY DRIER FORECAST FOR THE REGION IS LIKELY. 
HOWEVER...SHOULD THE EASTERLY TRACK VERIFY...THE REGION COULD SEE A 
BOUT OF VERY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING ISSUES...ESPECIALLY ALONG 
THE SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS. OF PARTICULAR CONCERN WILL BE THE FACT 
THAT A REMNANT FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT IS PROGGED TO PASS THROUGH THE 
AREA MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MAY STALL OUT IN THE VICINITY OF THE 
REGION BY MID-WEEK. THIS WOULD SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR THE DEEP 
MOISTURE THAT WILL STREAM NORTHWARD WITH THE REMNANTS OF 
ISSAC...RESULTING IN SEVERAL ROUNDS OF HEAVY SHOWERS/STORMS AS THE 
SYSTEM GRADUALLY SHIFTS OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. 

GIVEN THE HIGH FORECAST UNCERTAINTY /WITH ALMOST AN EQUAL NUMBER OF 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS FAVORING ONE SOLUTION OR THE OTHER/...HAVE OPTED TO 
SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE FOR NOW. THUS...GENERALLY HAVE FOLLOWED THE 
TRACK/TIMING OF THE NHC FORECAST. HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CHANCE 
AREAWIDE STARTING WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING...GOING 
HIGH-END CHANCE /40-50 PERCENT/ THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. 
HOWEVER...GIVEN THE STILL FAIRLY UNCERTAIN TRACK...DID NOT FEEL 
CONFIDENT GOING HIGHER THAN THAT ATTM. BY THE START OF LABOR DAY 
WEEKEND...A RETURN TO PARTLY SUNNY AND DRIER CONDITIONS CAN BE 
EXPECTED.   
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   92  68  93  70  90 /   0   0  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     90  66  92  68  88 /   0   0  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             90  66  91  68  87 /   0   0  20  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    88  59  88  65  84 /   0   0  10  10  20

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AIRMASS WAS SLOW TO
DESTABILIZE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT RANDOM SPOTTY TSRA HAVE DEVELOPED
OVER THE PAST HOUR. THE CONVERGENCE OVER THE TN-NC LINE IS NOT
NOTED THIS AFTERNOON...SO THINK THAT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WILL BE
PLENTY FOR THE EVENING HOURS TONIGHT. AREAS OF FOG HAVE GENERALLY
BEEN LIMITED OVER THE PAST FEW NIGHTS...SO I TRIMMED BACK THE
COVERAGE AND MENTION SOME FOR TONIGHT. PERSISTENCE ON MIN TEMPS
FAVORS A MOS BLEND OVER THE COOLER PURE GFS MINS.

WEAK UPPER LOW DRIFTS AWAY FROM THE REGION SUNDAY AND THEN THERE
APPEARS TO BE INCREASED SUBSIDENCE OVER THE SRN APPALACHIANS ON
MONDAY AHEAD OF THE TROPICAL SYSTEM ISAAC. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
FOR ERN MTNS SUNDAY AFTERNOON...BUT DROPPED ALL POPS ON MONDAY FOR
NOW (WHICH IS LINE WITH ALL MODEL DATA AND MESHES WELL WITH ADJACENT
NWS GRIDS).

MOS GUIDANCE QUITE CLOSE FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY AND GENERALLY
FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...DID NOT MAKE ANY
MAJOR CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH A SIMILAR SCENARIO FROM
RECENT DAYS FORECASTS.LATEST NATIONAL DEPICTION OF TROPICAL SYSTEM
BRINGS THE FEATURE ONTO THE WESTERN FLORIDA PANHANDLE EARLY
WEDNESDAY MORNING FOLLOWED BY MAJOR LEAGUE DECELERATION AND GRADUAL
WEAKENING INTO THURSDAY. STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS THE LOW APPROACHES THROUGH
SOUTHERN ALABAMA. GRADUALLY INCREASE POPS TO MEDIUM AND HIGH CHANCE
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY AS THE INCREASINGLY WEAKENED SURFACE
LOW SHIFTS NORTH TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY OF ALABAMA. THE WEAK
REFLECTION OF THE TROPICAL SYSTEM DRIFTS NORTH ACROSS MIDDLE
TENNESSEE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY THE END OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST
PERIOD AND ACCORDINGLY DROPPED POPS FOR CONVECTION BACK TO LOW AND
SLIGHT CHANCE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY.


&&
