907 
FXUS64 KMRX 250750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT SAT AUG 25 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WITH 
A MORE MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. 
MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS ADDITIONAL MOISTURE WILL HELP TO CREATE A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. WHILE MOST CONVECTION SHOULD INITIATE 
AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...IT APPEARS THAT THERE WILL BE ENOUGH 
OF A NORTHERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW DUE TO A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE MID ATLANTIC REGION TO PUSH THIS CONVECTION OFF THE MOUNTAINS 
AND INTO THE VALLEYS. THUS...WILL MENTION ISOLATED CONVECTION ACROSS 
THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WITH SLIGHTLY 
COOLER TEMPS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN WHERE THERE SHOULD 
BE A LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER COMPARED TO YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...FAIR WEATHER WILL CONTINUE INTO 
THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE REMAINS SITUATED 
OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. THIS WILL PROMOTE MOSTLY TO 
PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND CONTINUED WARM TEMPERATURES WITH HIGHS 
PEAKING INTO UPPER 80S TO THE LOWER 90S IN MANY VALLEY LOCATIONS 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY. OTHER THAN AN ISOLATED STORM ALONG THE 
TERRAIN...MOST AREAS WILL REMAIN DRY GIVEN THE WARMER TEMPERATURES 
ALOFT/STRONGER CAP. AN UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE 
REGION....WHICH WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE PLATEAU 
AND MOUNTAINS WHICH HAVE SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS DURING THIS TIME 
PERIOD/.

AS MENTIONED YESTERDAY...THE BIG WILDCARD IN THE FORECAST CONTINUES 
TO BE TROPICAL STORM/HURRICANE ISSAC AND WHERE EXACTLY IT WILL 
TRACK. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW THE STORM APPROACHING THE 
ALABAMA/FLORIDA BORDER AROUND 00Z WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...THESE MODEL 
SOLUTIONS HAVE ONCE AGAIN DIVERGED. THE ECMWF PUSHES THE REMNANTS OF 
THIS SYSTEM TOWARD THE DROUGHT STRICKEN LOWER-MISSISSIPPI AND 
LOWER-MISSOURI VALLEYS...WHILE THE GFS NUDGES THE STORM NORTH AND 
EAST THROUGH ALABAMA AND ALONG THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY...AND POTENTIALLY INTO FRIDAY IF 
THE FORWARD MOTION SLOWS DOWN. THE ECMWF SOLUTION WOULD LIKELY 
RESULT IN A MUCH DRIER FORECAST FOR THE AREA. HOWEVER...SHOULD AN 
EASTERLY TRACK VERIFY...THE REGION COULD SEE SOME VERY HEAVY 
RAINFALL AND FLOODING IMPACTS OVER A 24-48 HOUR PERIOD BY THE 
MIDDLE TO END OF THE WORK WEEK. THIS WILL PARTICULARLY BE TRUE IF 
THE AFOREMENTIONED FRONT STALLS OUT ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND CAN 
FOCUS SOME OF THE ASSOCIATED DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE THAT WILL BE 
PRESENT. FOR NOW...GIVEN THE GREAT DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY BETWEEN THE 
MODELS...DID NOT FEEL COMFORTABLE IN ALTERING POPS A WHOLE LOT IN 
THE EXTENDED. HOWEVER...DID INCREASE POPS TO SOLID CHANCE AREAWIDE 
TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A HEAVY RAIN EVENT NEXT WEEK... 
WITH THE HIGHEST VALUES /40-50 PERCENT/ FAVORING THE MOUNTAINS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     89  65  91  64  92 /  20  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             89  65  91  63  91 /  20  20  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EDT FRI AUG 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...ANOTHER REPEAT CONVECTIVE PERFORMANCE THIS AFTERNOON
WITH SPOTTY TSRA DOTTING THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...
PLUS SOME EARLY DEVELOPMENT OVER THE HIGHER PEAKS IN SW VA. THE
BEST COVERAGE CURRENTLY IS BETWEEN TRI AND MARION VA SOUTHWARD INTO
THE NW CORNER OF WRN NC...WITH A SLOW MOVEMENT S OR SW. THIS
ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY CONFINED THIS EVENING TO AREAS WHERE SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS WERE ALREADY MENTIONED. THUS NO CHANGES FOR TONIGHT'S
GRIDS EXCEPT TO DECREASE THE AREAS WITH PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT. 
PERSISTENCE ON MINS FAVORS GFS MOS PLUS A DEGREE OR TWO. 

FOR THE WEEKEND PERIODS...WEAK UPPER LOW CIRCULATION IS SHOWN TO
LINGER OVER NC AND VA...SO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WILL BE KEPT FOR
HIGHER TERRAIN AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS. BY SUNDAY...THE UPPER RIDGE
HAS EASED EASTWARD AND CONVECTION SHOULD BE SUPPRESSED EXCEPT FOR
ERN MOST MTN GROUPS. ALL IN ALL...LITTLE CHANGES NEEDED AT THIS
POINT. MOS TEMPS QUITE CLOSE AND MUCH IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS MAX/MIN
TEMP GRIDS.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...QUITE A BIT OF RIDGING 
AND DRY ADVECTION TO START THE PERIOD SHOULD KEEP RAIN OUT OF THE 
FORECAST BASICALLY UNTIL TUESDAY WHEN AN UPPER TROUGH BUILDS INTO 
THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. THE TROUGH WILL DRAG A WEAK AND MOISTURE 
STARVED FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY. THE GFS AND 
CANADIAN MODELS BRING THE TROPICAL SYSTEM NORTHWARD ACROSS THE 
EASTERN GULF COAST WITH ARRIVAL IN THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE EARLY 
TUESDAY HOWEVER...THE OFFICIAL TPC FORECAST BRINGS THE CIRCULATION 
ON SHORE EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING A LITTLE WEST OF THE GFS/CANADIAN 
TRACKS. TRIED TO STAY A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE OFFICIAL TPC/NCEP 
SYSTEM TRACK WHICH BRINGS A WEAKENED CIRCULATION NORTH ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. IN THIS SCENARIO RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY FOLLOWED BY DECREASING PROBABILITIES 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE SHIFTS 
FARTHER NORTH TOWARD THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY. MAX TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL DURING THE EARLY PORTION OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD BUT WILL DROP BACK CLOSER TO NORMAL WHILE THE FORECAST AREA 
IS IMPACTED BY THE TROPICAL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.

152 
FXUS64 KMRX 240800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT FRI AUG 24 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WITH 
A MORE MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. 
MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS ADDITIONAL MOISTURE WILL HELP TO CREATE A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND ALSO 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION ISOLATED 
CONVECTION FOR THESE AREAS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. OTHERWISE...A 
STAGNANT WEATHER PATTERN SHOULD LINGER FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST BUT WITH 
TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THIS WEEKEND INTO THE EARLY PART 
OF THE WORK WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE NOSES ITS WAY INTO THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. GIVEN THE AMPLE SUNSHINE AND HIGHER 
THICKNESS VALUES...TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO PEAK IN THE MID TO 
UPPER 80S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS AND POTENTIALLY TOP OFF IN THE 
LOWER 90S ACROSS PORTIONS OF SE TENNESSEE. ASIDE FROM SOME ISOLATED 
LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND 
PLATEAU...DRY CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST FOR MOST LOCATIONS ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. HOWEVER...AN UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY IS EXPECTED TO PUSH A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE 
REGION...WHICH WOULD SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.

THE MAJOR WILDCARD IN THE FORECAST HEADING INTO LATTER HALF OF THE 
PERIOD WILL BE TROPICAL STORM/HURRICANE ISSAC AND WHERE EXACTLY IT 
WILL TRACK. MODELS HAVE BEEN A BIT ALL OVER THE MAP IN THE PAST 
COUPLE OF DAYS...BUT THE 00Z RUNS OF THE GFS AND ECMWF BOTH PLACE 
THE SYSTEM ROUGHLY OFF OF THE ALABAMA GULF COAST TUESDAY MORNING AND 
SHOW IT PROGRESSING NORTHWARD INTO MIDDLE/EAST TENNESSEE BY A 
WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY TIMEFRAME...BEFORE EXITING THE REGION INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY BY FRIDAY. SHOULD THIS OCCUR...THE POTENTIAL FOR VERY 
HEAVY RAINFALL WILL EXIST ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA 
/PARTICULARLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS IF THE 
EASTERLY GFS SOLUTION PREVAILS/. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE RECENT 
PERFORMANCE OF THE MODELS...DO NOT HAVE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE TO GO 
HIGHER THAN A 30 POP FOR DAYS 6 AND 7 AS A GREAT DEAL OF 
UNCERTAINTY EXISTS WITH THE TRACK/TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM. FOR 
NOW...WILL CONTINUE TO WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY BEFORE 
MAKING ANY FURTHER ADJUSTMENTS TO THE FORECAST.
&&

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES THE REGION AT THE SURFACE...WHILE A 300 MB
TROUGH AXIS SITS OVER THE APPALACHIANS. BROKEN HIGH CLOUDS ALONG
AND EAST OF THIS TROUGH ARE AFFECTING THE EXTREME EASTERN COUNTIES.
A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS ALSO LINGER IN THESE AREAS. MODELS SHOW AN
EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE TROUGH...SO WE SHOULD BE COMPLETELY
CLEAR AND DRY SOON AFTER MIDNIGHT. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE PAST
FEW NIGHTS...PATCHY VALLEY FOG MAY DEVELOP. SOME SLIGHT UPWARD
TEMPERATURE AND DEWPOINT ADJUSTMENTS WILL BE MADE TO THE
GRIDS. SHOWERS SHOULD REMAIN ISOLATED ENOUGH IN THE NEXT HOUR OR
TWO THAT POPS CAN BE REMOVED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT THU AUG 23 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SPOTTY CONVECTION IS
DEVELOPING AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON JUST ABOUT IN THE SAME AREAS AS
YESTERDAY...GENERALLY ALONG OR JUST EAST OF THE TN-NC LINE. FAIR
WEATHER CUMULUS ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN AND LOTS OF SUNSHINE
ELSEWHERE. OPTED TO KEEP THOSE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING INTO THE
EARLY EVENING ACROSS THE EXTREME ERN AREAS. PATCHY AREAS OF FOG
FORMED AGAIN LAST NIGHT OVER A FEW SPOTS OF THE NRN AND CENTRAL
VALLEYS AS WELL AS IN MURPHY NC AREA...SO I ADDED PATCHY FOG AGAIN
FOR THOSE LOCATIONS. TRENDED A LITTLE CLOSER TO MOS BLEND FOR LOWS. 

UPPER RIDGING SEEMS TO NUDGE EAST SOME FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...
WITH RAIN CHANCES STAYING VERY SLIM AND MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER
TERRAIN IN THE EAST. SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST OR NORTHEAST BY
SATURDAY WHICH MIGHT PRODUCE MORE SE LOW LEVEL FLOW...SUPPORTING
OUR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AGAIN IN THE EASTERN AREAS. ADDED A FEW
PIXCELS OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NRN PLATEAU ON SATURDAY...BUT
NOT ENOUGH TO BE REFLECTED IN ZFPMRX PRODUCT YET. 

OTHERWISE...12Z MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS AND
GENERALLY FOLLOWED WITH A SLIGHT PREFERENCE FOR GFS NUMBERS.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE FORECAST SHOULD 
REMAIN BASICALLY DRY DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE LONG TERM AS AN 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TRIES TO BRING A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY TOWARD THE 
REGION FROM THE WEST AND TROPICAL STORM ISAAC SLOWLY APPROACHES THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. FROM THE CARIBBEAN. STAYED WITH ISOLATED 
CONVECTION IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER 
OVER THE WEEKEND WITH INCREASING POPS MONDAY NIGHT INTO MID WEEK AS 
THE TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVES NORTH THROUGH THE EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO. 
OF COURSE...THIS SYSTEM HAS A LONG WAY TO GO AND FORECAST TRACK IS 
UNCERTAIN AT THIS POINT. AN EASTERN ROUTE WOULD MEAN LOWER 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIP AND A RATHER TIGHT QPF GRADIENT AS EASTERLY 
FLOW PRODUCES RAIN ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN ON THE NC/TN BORDER
WITH ADIABATIC WARMING AND DRYING ACROSS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. WILL HAVE TO WAIT A LITTLE LONGER FOR BETTER 
RESOLUTION ON SYSTEM TRACK. STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT ADJUSTED MAXES DOWN A FEW 
DEGREES WHILE PULLING MINS A LITTLE HIGHER LATE.

EXPECTED.

CURRENT FORECAST GRIDS LOOK GOOD WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS 
THE TN-NC LINE PLUS THE EASTERN EDGES OF RUSSELL/WASHINGTON COUNTIES 
IN SW VA. PROBABLY NO NEED FOR AN UPDATE OF ANY WEB PRODUCTS...
UNLESS HOURLY TEMP OR DEW POINT TEMP GRIDS DRIFT OFF A BIT. 

OTHERWISE...WAITING AND WATCHING THE PROGRESS OF TROPICAL STORM ISSAC 
WITH MODELS PERHAPS DRAWING A LITTLE CLOSER ON POSSIBLE TRACKS.

NORTHEAST TODAY AND A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER TONIGHT THAN THIS 
MORNING.

PRESSURE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER STORY FOR THE 
FORECAST AREA FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A WEAK EASTERLY BOUNDARY 
LAYER FLOW INTO THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS/WESTERN CAROLINA WILL PRODUCE 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THERE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. SOME 
OF THE ACTIVITY MAY MOVE INTO THE VALLEY BEFORE DISSIPATING...MAINLY 
OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.

BY MONDAY...A WEAKENING FRONT WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED LATE MONDAY (WEST) AND 
AREA-WIDE TUESDAY. TROPICAL SYSTEM ISAAC WILL MOVE INTO THE 
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES EARLY NEXT WEEK.

SO COULD SEE ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AREA WIDE ON MONDAY.

WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCES INTO TUESDAY. REMNANTS OF TROPICAL LOW 
PRESSURE REMAINING OUT OF THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY...SO KEPT THE

WILL BE NEAR NORMAL TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED 
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 211931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EDT TUE AUG 21 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TOMORROW/... 
ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL LATE-SUMMER DAY IS PREVAILING ACROSS THE REGION
WITH MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND SLIGHTLY WARMER
TEMPERATURES THAN YESTERDAY...AS THE MERCURY HAS ALREADY CLIMBED
INTO THE LOW TO MID 80S ACROSS MANY VALLEY LOCATIONS AS OF 3 PM
EDT. TO THE NORTH ACROSS NORTHERN/CENTRAL KENTUCKY AND THE OHIO
RIVER VALLEY SOME LIGHT/MODERATE SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED IN RESPONCE
TO AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH THAT WILL PASS OVER THE REGION
LATER THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LATER TIMING OF THIS
IMPULSE AND THE DRIER AIR AND LACK OF INSTABILITY IN PLACE...AM NOT
EXPECTING MUCH DEVELOPMENT ACROSS OUR AREA THIS EVENING /THOUGH A
ROGUE SHOWER OR TWO COULD DEVELOP ALONG THE SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS
AND SW VIRGINIA/ DURING THE LATER AFTERNOON AND EVENING/.

TONIGHT...THE COMBINATION OF A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND RELATIVELY CALM
CONDITIONS WILL ONCE AGAIN RESULT IN THE POTENTIAL FOR PATCHY FOG
IN THE VICINITY OF AREA LAKES AGAIN. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE HIGHER
DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS/LOWER RH VALUES EXPECTED ELSEWHERE...AM
EXPECTING THIS FOG TO REMAIN CONFINED TO LOCATIONS NEAR BODIES OF
WATER. SURFACE RIDGING WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION FOR
TOMORROW RESULTING IN ANOTHER NEAR PICTURE PERFECT DAY...WITH
MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES AND SLIGHTLY
WARMER TEMPERATURES RANGING FROM THE LOWER 80S IN THE NORTHEAST
VALLEYS TO THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEYS.

.LONG TERM /TOMORROW NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY
NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. MODELS INDICATING INCREASING MOISTURE MAINLY
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR THE WEEKEND. ISOLATED AFTERNOON
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE EACH DAY ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...PRIMARILY
OVER THE MOUNTAINS. INSTABILITY INCREASES ACROSS THE ENTIRE
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY SO COULD SEE ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS AREA WIDE ON MONDAY. A TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO ENTER
THE AREA TUESDAY SO WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE INTO TUESDAY. AREA
OVER LOW PRESSURE REMAINING SOUTH FOR THE FORECAST PERIOD.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE
PERIOD.

278 
FXUS64 KMRX 201903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT MON AUG 20 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TOMORROW/...
A BEAUTIFUL LATE SUMMER DAY IS ONGOING ACROSS THE REGION THIS
AFTERNOON AS MORNING FOG/CLOUD COVER HAS GIVEN WAY TO MOSTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS. MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE THAT A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE LATE THIS AFTERNOON
AND EVENING...MAINLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE SPINE OF THE TN/NC
MOUNTAINS AND SW VIRGINIA. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE FACT THAT ANY
ACTIVITY THAT TRIED TO INITIATE SO FAR THIS AFTERNOON HAS REALLY
STRUGGLED TO MAINTAIN ITSELF...AM THINKING ANY DEVELOPMENT SHOULD
BE FAIRLY SPOTTY AND ISOLATED IN NATURE. WITH ANY SHOWER ACTIVITY
DYING OFF AFTER SUNSET...GENERALLY MOSTLY CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY
CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED OVERNIGHT. WITH THE DRIER
AIR THAT HAS FILTERED INTO THE REGION...MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE NOT
INDICATING THE SAME DENSE FOG POTENTIAL AS WHAT HAS IN THE PAST
COUPLE OF NIGHTS. HOWEVER...GIVEN THAT FOG DEVELOPMENT NEAR AREA
LAKES WILL BE GETTING MORE COMMON HEADING INTO LATE SUMMER/EARLY
FALL...HAVE OPTED TO MAINTAIN A MENTION OF PATCHY FOG NEAR BODIES
OF WATER AND IN SHELTERED VALLEY LOCATIONS WHERE WINDS MAY
COMPLETELY DECOUPLE AFTER MIDNIGHT.


FOR TOMORROW...ANOTHER SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS/ISOLATED STORMS
WILL EXIST ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEASTERN ZONES AS ANOTHER
UPPER-TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE REGION DURING THE AFTERNOON.
HOWEVER...MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD REMAIN DRY AS A BULK OF THIS
ACTIVITY WILL REMAIN CONFINED TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN. THIS WILL
RESULT IN ANOTHER PLEASANT DAY WITH MOSTLY TO PARTY SUNNY
CONDITIONS AND AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES PERHAPS READING A DEGREE OR
TWO WARMER THAN TODAY.

.LONG TERM /TOMORROW NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
A DEEP RIDGE WILL BE MOVING INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST AT THE
BEGINNING OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND REMAIN OVER THE REGION
THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE PERIOD. WITH THE INFLUENCE OF THE
RIDGE...A PERSISTENCE FORECAST OF DRY CONDITIONS WITH TEMPERATURES
NEAR NORMAL WILL BE FOLLOWED. THE 12Z CANADIAN MODEL IS THE OUTLIER
IN THIS PATTERN...SHOWING A WEAKNESS IN THE RIDGE DEVELOPING OVER
THE TN VALLEY ON SATURDAY. THE DRY GFS AND ECMWF SOLUTIONS HAVE
SHOWN BETTER CONSISTENCY AND ARE PREFERRED. THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT
WARMING TREND THROUGH THE END OF THIS WEEK AS THE CENTER OF THE
RIDGE SLOWLY SHIFTS TO OUR EAST. A SLIGHT INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE IS EXPECTED BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS A MORE SOUTHERLY FLOW
DEVELOPS...BUT THIS SHOULD HAVE LITTLE IMPACT OTHER THAN SLIGHTLY
HIGHER NIGHTTIME TEMPERATURES AS THE MID-UPPER RIDGE REMAINS
OVERHEAD.


&&

NORTHEAST THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING...GENERALLY MOSTLY/PARTLY SUNNY

BUILDING IN EARLY IN THE EXTENDED WILL ALLOW FOR A WARMING TREND AND

TEMPERATURES HELPING TO WEAKLY DESTABILIZED THE ATMOSPHERE...COULD

VALLEY...SO FEEL MORE COMFORTABLE WITH KEEPING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN 
THE FORECAST OVERNIGHT.

PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER....AND TO MENTION ISOLATED SHOWERS

758 PM EDT SUN AUG 19 2012

.AVIATION...UPPER TROUGH STILL GENERATING WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BUT WOULD EXPECT THIS ACTION TO BE

MOISTURE HANGING AROUND AT THE SURFACE WITH CLOUDS THINNING FOR FOG
PRODUCTION AT THE TERMINALS. WENT WITH MVFR REDUCTION IN VSBY AT
CHA AND TYS WHILE DROPPING TRI TO IFR DURING A TWO TO THREE HOUR
PERIOD AROUND SUNRISE. LONG WAVE TROUGH STILL HOLDING POSITION WITH
ANOTHER DISTURBANCE TO ROTATE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON
MONDAY BUT LESS MOISTURE AVAILABLE FOR LIFTING SO KEPT ANY MENTION
OF A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM OUT OF THE FORECAST AT THIS POINT WITH

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SUN AUG 19 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER 
THE REGION...BUT WEAK UPPER SHORT WAVE IS EXITING AND SOME DRYING IS 
EXPECTED DURING THE PERIOD.  WILL CARRY JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
EARLY TONIGHT FOR ANY LINGERING EVENING CONVECTION. WILL GO WITH LOW 
CHANCE POPS EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SLIGHT CHANCE ELSEWHERE FOR MONDAY 
AS INSTABILITY LOOKS TO BE QUITE LIMITED GIVEN EXPECTED DRYING AND 
GIVEN EXPECTED LACK OF ANY SIGNIFICANT FORCING MECHANISM.  WILL 
GENERALLY GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE MAV TEMPS FOR MINS TONIGHT...BUT MAV 
HIGHS FOR MONDAY LOOK GOOD.  

.LONG TERM.../MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/... A LARGE...SLOW-MOVING
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM OVER EASTERN CANADA WILL REMAIN THE
DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS THROUGH THE
MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL
EXIST ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND AGAIN ALONG
THE MOUNTAINS ON TUESDAY AS THE BASE OF THE TROUGH PUSHES OVER THE
REGION. THE GFS WAS A MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN THE NAM /WHICH SHOWED
ALMOST NO QPF SIGNALS ON TUESDAY/. HOWEVER...BASED ON THE POOR
PERFORMANCE OF THE MODELS OF LATE...AND THE ENHANCED LIFT...FELT
THAT SLIGHT CHANCES POPS WERE CERTAINLY WARRANTED DURING THIS TIME
FRAME. THEREAFTER...SLIGHTLY WARMER AND DRIER CONDITIONS WILL EXIST
FOR THE SECOND HALF OF THE WORK WEEK AS THE AFOREMENTIONED TROUGH
EXITS THE REGION AND A SURFACE HIGH BEGINS TO BUILD IN. THIS WILL
RESULT IN MOSTLY/PARTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS AND WARMER TEMPERATURES AS
HIGHS CREEP BACK INTO THE MID/UPPER 80S IN MOST OF THE VALLEY
LOCATIONS BY THURSDAY/FRIDAY. THIS WEEKEND...THE POTENTIAL FOR
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS MAY EXIST ONCE AGAIN AS A SERIES OF
SHORTWAVES PASS OVER THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF AN UPPER RIDGE
SITUATED ACROSS THE UPPER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. FOR NOW...HAVE KEPT
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE GIVEN THE RECENT MODEL PERFORMANCE AND
THE FACT THAT THIS IS STILL A WEEK OUT AT THIS POINT.

FXUS64 KMRX 190637
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 AM EDT SUN AUG 19 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOR THE FIRST SIX HOURS...A 
SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH THE 
MAIN EFFECTS NEAR THE NORTH CAROLINA STATE-LINE. FRONTO-GENETIC 
FORCING IS HELPING TO PRODUCE AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A 
THUNDERSTORM OVER SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THIS 
WAVE WILL CONTINUE TO LIFT NORTHEAST THIS MORNING WITH GREATEST 
CHANCES OF RAIN OVER THE EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURES WILL BE AN UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY/GREAT LAKES WITH A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVE LIFTING NORTHEAST 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AT THE SURFACE/BOUNDARY LAYER...AN 
INVERTED TROUGH WILL BE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AND THEN 
MOVE EAST OF THE AREA TONIGHT. THE INVERTED TROUGH WILL HELP FOCUS 
THE MARGINAL INSTABILITY (CAPES OF 1000 J/KG OR LESS) TO PRODUCE 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODEL/RUN CONSISTENCY QUITE 
POOR WITH HANDLING OF AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING THROUGH THE 
REGION EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  CURRENT TRENDS BRING IT ALONG EITHER 
SIDE OF THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS AND THEN BEGINNING TO MOVE 
AWAY ON MONDAY.  THE TRACK OF THE LOW WILL DETERMINE THE EXTENDED OF 
PRECIP OVER THE MRX CWA.  WILL CONTINUE A COMPROMISE SCENARIO WITH 
LOW POPS WEST AND CHANCE EAST.  WILL LINGER LOW POPS INTO MONDAY 
NIGHT.  ON TUESDAY...A WEAK DISTURBANCE MOVES THROUGH AND THIS 
COMBINED WITH DIURNAL HEATING SHOULD GENERATE ISOLATED 
CONVECTION...MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FOR WEDNESDAY.  THE HIGH WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY BUT COULD SEE ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR SATURDAY WITH THE APPROACH OF 
THE NEXT SYSTEM.  

&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK WARM FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SOUTHERN TN BORDER...EXTENDING FROM AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER SOUTHERN AR. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE MS AND TN RIVER VALLEYS...ASSOCIATED WITH A 
LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. 
THIS BROAD UPPER TROUGH IS PROGGED TO DEEPEN OVERNIGHT AND INTO 
SUNDAY...WHICH WILL HELP TO PUSH THE LOW PRESSURE AREA AND WARM 
FRONT NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...A FEW SHOWERS 
SHOULD DEVELOP OVERNIGHT MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR 
THE MOST PART...BUT WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO BE MORE PESSIMISTIC 
WITH THE CLOUD COVER. WILL NOT PLAN TO MENTION ANY FOG OVERNIGHT DUE 
TO THIS EXTENSIVE AREA OF HIGH CLOUDS.

U.S. WITH BEST LIFT AND DEEPEST MOISTURE SOUTH OF A FRONTAL
BOUNDARY DRAPED NEAR THE SOUTHERN TENNESSEE BORDER. THE WAVE WILL
TRY TO ENCOURAGE THE BOUNDARY NORTH INTO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE LATER
TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING WITH A CHANCE FOR A COUPLE SHOWERS
AROUND CHA LATER TONIGHT INTO DAYBREAK. FARTHER NORTH ISENTROPIC
LIFT WILL BRING SOME HIGH BASED SCT-BKN SC AND BKN AC TO TYS AND
TRI BUT NOT SURE IF LIFT AND MOISTURE WILL BE SUFFICIENT FOR THE
PRODUCTION OF SHOWERS AT A HIGH ENOUGH PROBABILITY TO INCLUDE IN
THE TAF. THEREFORE...KEPT PRECIP OUT OF THESE TERMINALS AT THIS
TIME. BELIEVE THERE WILL BE ENOUGH CLOUDS AROUND TO INHIBIT DECENT
FOG FORMATION OVERNIGHT BUT IF IT OCCURS...IT WILL MOST LIKELY
HAPPEN AT TRI WHERE I PLACED A TOKEN VFR CATEGORY VISIBILITY
RESTRICTION. WITH SHORT WAVE EXITING THE REGION BY MID DAY SUNDAY
STAYED WITH VFR FLIGHT WEATHER FOR THE DAYTIME PORTION OF THE FORECAST.

647 
FXUS64 KMRX 181858
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 PM EDT SAT AUG 18 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER 
THE REGION...AND MODELS HAVE BEEN HAVING A HARD TIME HANDLING PIECES 
OF WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING THROUGH...WHICH LEADS TO A LOWER 
THAN USUAL FORECAST CONFIDENCE EVEN FOR THE SHORT TERM.  APPEARS 
SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY MAY BRUSH SOUTHERN AREAS TONIGHT...SO 
WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOME SHOWERS LATER TONIGHT 
ACROSS SOUTHERN ZONES.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES FOR 
SUNDAY AS THERE SHOULD BE SOME MODEST INSTABILITY PRESENT.  MAV 
TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO JUST A FEW TWEAKS FOR THE SHORT 
TERM PERIOD.  

.LONG TERM.../SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/... A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL
STORM SYSTEM OVER EASTERN CANADA WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER
FEATURE ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS EARLY THIS WEEK. ALTHOUGH THE
FRONT WILL REMAIN DISPLACED SOUTH OF THE REGION... MODELS HAVE
CONTINUED TO TREND WETTER TOMORROW NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS AN AREA OF
LOW PRESSURE SLIDES NORTHEASTWARD ALONG THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. THIS WILL RESULT IN REASONABLE CHANCE POPS
ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES DURING
THIS TIME PERIOD AS MODELS HAVE ALL BEGUN TO TREND THIS
WAY...SHOWING APPRECIABLE QPF SIGNALS /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE
EASTERN AND FAR SOUTHERN ZONES/. THIS AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL
DEPART THE REGION BY TUESDAY MORNING AS THE BASE OF THE TROUGH
SWINGS ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE.

THEREAFTER...FAIR/DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR MUCH OF THE REMAINDER 
OF THE WORK WEEK AS SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS IN...PROMOTING 
MOSTLY/PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND AS HIGHS 
RETURN TO THE LOW TO UPPER 80S ACROSS MOST AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. LATE IN THE PERIOD...MODELS ARE STARTING TO COME 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT ON AN UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH THE GREAT 
LAKES/OHIO VALLEY...WHICH MAY GIVE THE AREA ANOTHER SHOT OF 
PRECIPITATION LATE IN THE WEEK. HAVE INCLUDED LOW-END MENTIONABLE 
POPS AREAWIDE FOR NOW /WITH THE HIGHEST VALUES FAVORING THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN/. THE BEST CHANCES FOR STORMS MAY BE SATURDAY AS THIS TROUGH 
PASSES OVER THE REGION...BUT WILL TAKE A CAUTIOUS APPROACH ON POPS 
FOR NOW GIVEN THAT THIS SYSTEM IS STILL A WEEK OUT.

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT IS MOVING ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AT

CONVECTION TONIGHT. HOWEVER AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM IS STILL
POSSIBLE ALONG THE FRONT AS IT MAKES PROGRESS ACROSS THE VIEWING AREA.

LIKE SOME MVFR CEILINGS MAY DEVELOP BEHIND THE FRONT SO INCLUDED
ACROSS THE VALLEY WITH SOME IMPROVEMENT AROUND 13-17Z. AFTER 16-17Z
VFR FLIGHT WILL BE THE RULE.

986 
FXUS64 KMRX 171908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT FRI AUG 17 2012

.SHORT TERM.../TODAY AND SATURDAY/...A COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO
MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH THE EVENING. CLOUD COVER
FROM THE OVERNIGHT MCS HAS LIMITED AFTERNOON HEATING. WITH SMALL
AMOUNTS OF INSTABILITY AND DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S...CAN EXPECT
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT
HOURS. THESE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL LESSEN IN INTENSITY AND
COVERAGE APPROACHING 12Z. FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE AREA LATE MORNING
WITH CLOUD COVERAGE DECREASING THROUGHOUT THE DAY.

.LONG TERM.../TOMORROW NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/... IN WAKE OF THE
COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION TONIGHT INTO
TOMORROW...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BEGIN TO WANE HEADING INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK. HAVE CONTINUED THE TREND OF SCALING BACK POPS
SIGNIFICANTLY ACROSS THE REGION AS THE NAM-12 HAS COME IN LINE WITH
THE GFS/SREF SOLUTIONS OF PUSHING THE FRONT THROUGH THE ENTIRE AREA
BY TOMORROW. AS A RESULT...HAVE TAKEN OUT ALL MENTIONABLE POPS
TOMORROW NIGHT...AND HAVE KEPT ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS ALONG
THE MOUNTAIN ZONES FOR ANY ISOLATED OROGRAPHIC AIDED DIURNAL
CONVECTION THAT COULD DEVELOP SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. ON
MONDAY...ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG STORM
SYSTEM ROTATING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WILL DROP ACROSS THE REGION.
THIS WILL DRIVE ANOTHER WEAK FRONT THROUGH THE AREA...WHICH MAY
TRIGGER OFF SOME ISOLATED STORMS...PRIMARILY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE
MOUNTAINS AND THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES /WHERE THE LOW-END MENTIONABLE
POPS EXIST ATTM/.

IN ADDITION...AN EARLY AUTUMN AIR MASS WILL FILTER BACK INTO THE 
REGION AS MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS AND SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED THROUGH MOST OF THE WORK WEEK. THE MOST 
NOTABLE CHANGE MAY BE WITH LOW TEMPERATURES...WHICH WILL STRUGGLE TO 
REMAIN ABOVE 60 DEGREES OUTSIDE OF THE MAIN URBAN AREAS DURING THE 
OVERNIGHT PERIODS LATE THIS WEEKEND INTO THE EARLY PART OF THE WORK 
WEEK...BEFORE GRADUALLY WARMING TO MORE SEASONABLE LEVELS BY THE END 
OF THE PERIOD. HIGHS WILL GENERALLY REACH THE UPPER 70S TO MID 
80S...WITH SOME UPPER 80S CREEPING BACK IN BY WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY. 
LATE IN THE WORK WEEK...MODEL THINKING DIFFERS WITH THE TIMING/TRACK 
OF AN UPPER-TROUGH PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE NORTHERN CONUS. THE 
ECMWF IS MUCH MORE PROGRESSIVE WITH THIS FEATURE AND SHOWS A FAIRLY 
GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WHILE THE 
GFS SUPPORTS ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGING BUILDING IN. FOR 
NOW...HAVE KEPT POPS AT LOW-END MENTIONABLE LEVELS LATE IN THE WORK 
WEEK AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY WITH REGARD TO THIS 
PART OF THE FORECAST. 



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  85  62  84  61 /  40  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  85  61  83  60 /  40  10  10  10  10

ENHANCE THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES OF 2000 J/KG OR LESS. THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL BE IN THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE 
JET WHICH WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA.

WILL PLAN FOR LIKELY TO CAT POPS AREA-WIDE. SOME OF THE STORMS COULD 
BE STRONG TO SEVERE WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING STRONG WINDS...HEAVY
RAINS...AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING.

THE STORMS WILL WEAKEN THIS EVENING AND DISSIPATE DUE TO THE LOSS OF 
DAYTIME HEATING. PLAN ON FOLLOWING MOS NUMBER CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA ON SATURDAY AS A COLD FRONT 
PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION.  A SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL 
CONTINUE INTO SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH THE FRONT STRETCHED TO OUR 
SOUTH AND EAST AND A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSE MOVING THOUGH.  SURFACE 
HIGH BUILDS IN FOR DRY CONDITIONS ON TUESDAY.  DIURNAL CONVECTION 
POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER ELEVATION ON WEDNESDAY WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE ON 
CONVECTION ACROSS THE MRX CWA ON THURSDAY.

781 
FXUS64 KMRX 161856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EDT THU AUG 16 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SHIFT EAST AS A COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA.  MOISTURE WILL 
INCREASE AHEAD OF THE FRONT...BUT LOOKS LIKE PRECIP SHOULD MOSTLY 
HOLD OFF UNTIL FRIDAY.  WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS PLATEAU 
LATE TONIGHT...THEN LIKELY POPS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.  WHILE THERE 
ARE STILL QUESTIONS ABOUT HOW MUCH CONVECTIVE ENERGY WILL BE 
AVAILABLE...SOME SEVERE STORMS STILL LOOK POSSIBLE SO WILL LEAVE 
MENTION IN HWO.  GENERALLY LEANED TOWARD A MET/MAV BLEND FOR TEMPS 
TONIGHT BUT STAYED MORE WITH THE HIGHER MAV NUMBERS FOR HIGHS 
FRIDAY.  

.LONG TERM.../FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/... FRIDAY NIGHT INTO
THE WEEKEND...MODELS DIFFER SIGNIFICANTLY WITH THE POSITION OF A
COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA EARLIER ON FRIDAY. THE
GFS/SREF SOLUTIONS ARE FAR MORE BULLISH WITH THE FRONT AND SHOW IT
CLEARING THE ENTIRE AREA BY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY MORNING. THE
NAM-12 IS CONTINUING TO HINT AT A MUCH SLOWER PROGRESSION OF THE
FRONT...AND SHOWS IT HANGING UP ROUGHLY ALONG THE I-40/I-81
CORRIDOR THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEKEND. THIS WOULD RESULT IN A
SIGNIFICANTLY DIFFERENT FORECAST REGARDING PRECIPITATION AS FAIRLY
REASONABLE CHANCES FOR CONTINUED SHOWERS AND STORMS WOULD BE
PRESENT /PARTICULARLY ON SUNDAY/ SHOULD THIS SOLUTION VERIFY. THIS
IS A STARK CONTRAST TO THE GFS/SREF MODELS WHICH ARE MUCH DRIER AND
SHOW ANY CONVECTIVE SIGNALS HUGGING THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE SMOKY
MTNS AND FURTHER TO THE SOUTH ALONG THE FRONT IN NORTHERN
ALABAMA/GEORGIA. GIVEN THIS UNCERTAINTY...HAVE MAINTAINED A MODEL
SPLIT FOR NOW...AND HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW-END CHANCE POPS
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST
POPS FAVORING SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES.
THE BEST POTENTIAL FOR ANY SEVERE WEATHER SHOULD BE DURING THE DAY
ON FRIDAY /WHEN THE BEST INSTABILITY PARAMETERS WILL COMBINE WITH
THE PASSAGE OF A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND THE EVENTUAL COLD FRONT
LATER IN THE EVENING/. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE HIGH PWAT VALUES IN
PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CERTAINLY
BE A CONCERN WITH ANY ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP THIS WEEKEND.

THEREAFTER...A COOL/DRY...EARLY AUTUMN AIR MASS WILL FILTER BACK 
INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL PROMOTE MOSTLY/PARTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS 
AND COOLER HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 70S/LOWER 80S EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...BEFORE A GRADUAL WARMING TREND OCCURS AS A SURFACE HIGH 
BUILDS BACK IN. THE MOST NOTABLE CHANGE MAY BE WITH LOW 
TEMPERATURES...WHICH WILL STRUGGLE TO REMAIN ABOVE 60 DEGREES 
OUTSIDE OF THE MAIN URBAN AREAS DURING THE OVERNIGHT PERIODS. LATE 
IN THE PERIOD...MODEL THINKING DIFFERS WITH THE TIMING/TRACK OF AN 
UPPER-TROUGH PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE NORTHEAST CONUS. FOR 
NOW...HAVE KEPT POPS AT LOW-END MENTIONABLE LEVELS LATE IN THE WORK 
WEEK AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY WITH REGARD TO THIS 
SYSTEM. 



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT THU AUG 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THERE SHOULD BE MORE SUNSHINE 
AROUND TODAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE LINGERING WITH RELATIVELY DRY AIR IN 
PLACE. HOWEVER...THERE MAY BE SOME AREAS OF FOG EARLY WITH MOIST 
SURFACE CONDITIONS DUE TO WEDNESDAY RAINFALL. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A

BUILDS TOWARD THE FORECAST LATER TONIGHT WITH INCREASING CLOUDS AND 
A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TOWARD DAYBREAK. STAYED RATHER CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
BLEND FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE TN VALLEY REGION WILL BE 
UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A LONGWAVE TROUGH THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THE 
BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL BE ON FRIDAY AS HEIGHTS FALL AHEAD OF THE 
DEEPENING TROUGH AND THE UPPER JET MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY POPS ON 
FRIDAY...WITH HIGHEST POPS NORTH CLOSER TO THE UPPER JET. 
INSTABILITY APPEARS MARGINAL...BUT SHOULD SUFFICIENT FOR A FEW 
ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS WHEN COMBINED WITH UPPER LEVEL FORCING. THE 
SURFACE COLD FRONT PUSHES IN FRIDAY NIGHT...AND A DRIER AIR MASS 
BEGINS TO BUILD IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. 

THE NAM AND GFS DIFFER ON THE POSITION OF THE FRONT BY 
SATURDAY...WITH THE GFS PUSHING IT FARTHER SOUTH...WHILE THE NAM 
HANGS UP THE FRONT ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. THE GFS SOLUTION APPEARS TO 
HAVE SUPPORT FROM THE SREF AND CANADIAN...SO WILL JUST HAVE A LOW 
CHANCE POP IN EXTREME SOUTHERN AND EASTERN ZONES FOR SATURDAY. ON 
SUNDAY BOTH THE NAM AND GFS SHOW A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING THROUGH 
THE LARGER TROUGH...SO WILL EXPAND THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS FARTHER 
NORTH AND WEST...BUT STILL JUST A SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POP AS 
MOISTURE APPEARS LIMITED. A CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT PERSISTS THROUGH THE 
EARLY WORK WEEK...WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN THE LOW LEVELS. 
THIS SHOULD GIVE A DRY FORECAST WITH TEMPS BELOW NORMAL FOR MONDAY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

THE MAIN THREATS. COOL FRONT MOVES SLOWLY EAST AND SOUTH FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY BUT AIR MASS WILL REMAIN MOIST WITH
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE MAINLY EASTERN MOUNTAINS...EXTREME SOUTHERN
PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY WITH ACTIVITY
SHIFTING MORE INTO GA AND NC EACH DAY. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY EXPECT
DIURNAL AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN
THE HIGHER EASTERN MOUNTAINS AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE CREEPS BACK
NORTH FROM THE GULF. AHEAD OF THE FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT LOWS WILL BE
MILD IN THE 60S TO NEAR 70. FRIDAY WILL LIKELY BE THE WARMEST DAY
AHEAD OF FRONT WITH HIGHS MOSTLY MID TO UPPER 80S VALLEYS AND UPPER
70S TO LOWER 80S NORTHEAST AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FRIDAY NIGHT WILL
AGAIN BE MILD WITH CLOUDS AND SHOWERS. SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY
HIGHS WILL BE BELOW NORMAL IN THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S WITH LOWS
ALSO COOLER MID 50S NORTH TO MID 60S SOUTH. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST WITH SLIGHT RIDGING WARMING TEMPERATURES A FEW
DEGREES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT WED AUG 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BUILD 
EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH EARLY TODAY BRINGING THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
SHOWER TO THE AREA. RADARS SHOW SOME LIGHT SHOWERS DEVELOPING ACROSS 
CENTRAL KENTUCKY AND NORTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE AT THIS HOUR IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH THIS FEATURE. THE TROUGH AXIS SHOULD MOVE TOWARD 
THE APPALACHIANS BY MID DAY BRINGING AN END TO RAIN CHANCES FOR MUCH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
IN THE FORECAST ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS DURING THE EARLY AFTERNOON. 
DRIER AIR SHOULD FILTER INTO THE REGION FOR A QUIET OVERNIGHT 
PERIOD. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES IN 
THE SHORT TERM.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A LONGWAVE TROUGH PATTERN 
WILL BE DEVELOPING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS BEGINNING LATE 
THURSDAY...AND PERSIST THROUGH THE REST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 
THURSDAY WILL BE DRY BEHIND A DEPARTING RIDGE...WITH CHANCE POPS 
COMING THURSDAY NIGHT WITH THE APPROACH OF THE UPPER JET AND TROUGH. 
BEST LIFT IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET AND GOOD INSTABILITY 
WILL BE FRIDAY AFTERNOON...WITH POPS RISING INTO THE LIKELY RANGE. 
THE SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH 
CHANCE POPS GRADUALLY LOWERING FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST OVERNIGHT 
AS DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR BUILDS INTO THE AREA.

THE WEEKEND FORECAST WILL DEPEND ON WHERE THE FRONT STALLS. 
THE MODEL CONSENSUS INDICATES THAT THE FRONT WILL BE NEAR OUR 
SOUTHERN BORDER ON SATURDAY...SO WILL KEEP A LOW CHANCE POP GOING 
THERE WITH A DRY FORECAST NORTH. THIS SAME PATTERN LINGERS INTO 
SUNDAY. THE BROAD TROUGH ALOFT BECOMES A BIT MORE AMPLIFIED ON 
MONDAY...WHICH PUSHES THE UPPER JET AND SURFACE FRONT FARTHER TO OUR 
SOUTH AND EAST...RESULTING IN A DRY FORECAST FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL.

ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE HIGH INSTABILITY SHOWN BY THE 
NAM SEEMS OVERDONE...BUT THE GFS STILL SHOWS AFTERNOON CAPE VALUES 
IN THE 1500 J/KG RANGE...SO AN ISOLATED SEVERE THREAT CANNOT BE 
RULED OUT. CHANCE POPS WILL CONTINUE INTO TONIGHT AS THE MODELS SHOW 
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSING THE AREA...BUT WITH LESS 
INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE TO WORK WITH. 

THE TROUGH AXIS MOVES TO OUR EAST BY 12Z WED...AND A RIDGE BUILDS 
OVER THE AREA. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ARE EXPECTED WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 50S TO 
MID 60S. AS A TROUGH MOVES FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO THE GREAT 
LAKES...THE RIDGE BECOMES SUPPRESSED. A MORE SOUTHWESTERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW DEVELOPS...BRINGING HIGHS ON THURSDAY INTO THE UPPER 80S AND 
LOWER 90S IN MOST SPOTS. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE THURSDAY 
NIGHT AHEAD OF THIS TROUGH...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP COMING IN LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT TO WESTERN SECTIONS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...ANOTHER LONG WAVE TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES AS IT BUILDS SLOWLY EAST INTO THE EASTERN PORTION OF THE 
NATION OVER THE WEEKEND. MODELS RELATIVELY CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF 
ASSOCIATED COOL FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL BE ON THE 
INCREASE AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT SO HELD ONTO 
HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE 
EXTENDED. ALSO MAINTAINED SOME SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON SATURDAY DUE TO POSSIBLE SLOWER FRONTAL 
MOVEMENT. DID NOT WANT TO STRAY AWAY FROM THE SLIGHT CHANCE 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIP FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY AS MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW UPPER TROUGH HOLDING ITS EASTERN 
U.S. POSITION WITH A HEALTHY AMOUNT OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY CONTINUING 
TO ROTATE THROUGH THE LONG WAVE FEATURE ACROSS THIS PART OF THE 
COUNTRY. ALSO...MEX MOS GUIDANCE POPS CONTINUE TO HANG IN THERE WITH 
MEDIUM CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST. 
STAYED GENERALLY A DEGREE OR TWO UNDER MEX MOS MAX TEMPS WHILE 
ADJUSTING ABOUT ONE OR TWO DEGREES ABOVE SUGGESTED MINS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  68  88  66  92 /  40  30  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  67  85  63  89 /  40  30  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       83  65  86  63  89 /  40  30  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  64  83  58  87 /  50  30  10  10  10

092 
FXUS64 KMRX 140153 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 PM EDT MON AUG 13 2012

.DISCUSSION...
LINGERING SHOWER ACTIVITY FROM A DECAYING LINE THAT MOVED THROUGH
THE REGION EARLIER THIS AFTERNOON IS TAPERING OFF ACROSS THE MTNS
OF NE TENNESSEE. SOME ADDITIONAL SCATTERED SHOWERS HAVE BEGUN TO
DEVELOP ACROSS THE NORTHWEST ZONES WHICH WILL DRIFT ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY DURING THE LATE EVENING...WARRANTING CHANCE POPS
AREAWIDE THROUGH 06Z. A COLD FRONT ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE WILL
THEN SWEEP EASTWARD INTO MIDDLE AND EVENTUALLY THE EASTERN PART OF
THE VOLUNTEER STATE LATE TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW MORNING. THIS FRONT
HAS ALREADY TRIGGERED OFF ANOTHER ROUND OF STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE
STORMS ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE THIS EVENING. MODELS ARE SHOWING
THIS ACTIVITY PUSHING EASTWARD TONIGHT AND MOVING INTO THE WESTERN
ZONES AROUND/AFTER 06Z AND GRADUALLY WORKING ITS WAY EAST DURING
THE LATE NIGHT/EARLY MORNING HOURS. BASED ON THIS POTENTIAL...OPTED
TO INCREASE POPS TO THE 40-50 PERCENT RANGE ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA AFTER 06Z...AND HAVE BUMPED THEM UP TO LIKELY ACROSS THE FAR
WESTERN ZONES. INSTABILITY PARAMETERS ARE NOT TOO IMPRESSIVE...BUT
MODELS DO INDICATE CAPE VALUES AOA 1000-1500 J/KG CREEPING INTO THE
WESTERN ZONES BTWN 09-12Z...WHICH COULD PROMOTE A FEW STRONGER
STORMS LATE TONIGHT. THE MAIN THREATS WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY
HOWEVER...WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. ALSO...GIVEN THE
INCREASED MOISTURE/EXPECTED CLOUD COVER TONIGHT...LOWS SHOULD BE
ABOUT 5-10 DEGREES WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT...WITH MOST LOWER
ELEVATION AREAS REMAINING IN THE MID-UPPER 60S.

.DISCUSSION...

ACCOUNT FOR THE BROAD AREA OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WORKING THEIR WAY
INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE THIS AFTN. GIVEN THE LACK OF
INSTABILITY IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...A GENERAL WEAKENING TREND
IN THE INTENSITY OF THESE STORMS HAS OCCURRED OVER THE PAST COUPLE
OF HOURS...AND IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE INTO THE EARLY EVENING.
THUS...AM THINKING THE POTENTIAL FOR ANY STORMS BECOMING SEVERE
APPEARS TO FAIRLY LOW FOR THE TIME BEING. HOWEVER...THE THREAT FOR
MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL IN THE STRONGEST CELLS WILL EXIST OVER
MUCH OF THE AREA THROUGH 00Z /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE WESTERN AND
CENTRAL ZONES WHERE THE HIGHEST 90-100 POPS EXIST/...ALONG SOME
OCCASIONAL LIGHTNING STRIKES AS WELL.

301 
FXUS64 KMRX 130807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
407 AM EDT MON AUG 13 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL LOSE ITS GRIP 
TODAY AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY REGION TONIGHT. A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT THIS MORNING WILL 
TRANSITION TO A DEEP SW FLOW WITH THE APPROACH OF BROAD UPPER 
TROUGH. 500 MB HEIGHTS WILL BE FALLING THROUGH THE DAY...BRINGING 
INCREASING CLOUDS...BUT PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO HOLD OFF UNTIL TONIGHT 
WHEN MOISTURE DEPTH AND LIFT INCREASE. THERE ARE SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND THE NAM...WITH THE GFS BEING FASTER. 
BOTH HAVE LIKELY POPS...WHICH SEEMS A BIT HIGH GIVEN THE WEAK 
FORCING AND LACK OF PROLONGED MOISTURE FEED AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. THE 
SREF KEEPS POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE TONIGHT...AND THE FORECAST WILL 
FOLLOW THIS. TEMPS WILL BE TRENDING WARMER COMPARED TO THE LAST FEW 
DAYS...IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN THE VALLEY TODAY...AND LOWS IN THE 
60S TONIGHT UNDER BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE
REGION ON TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ON BOTH TUESDAY AND MAINLY INTO THE EVENING HOURS ON
TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRIER WEATHER ON
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE REGION ON THURSDAY
NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO SATURDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE HIGHEST
CHANCES GOING FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WHEN THE DEEPEST
MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT IS EXPECTED. SOME DIFFERENCES IN TIMING ON
WHEN THE FRONT EXITS ON SATURDAY. WILL GO WITH THE DRIER SOLUTION
FROM THE ECMWF. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR
SUNDAY. STAYED NEAR THE MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
906 PM EDT SUN AUG 12 2012

.DISCUSSION...
TRANQUIL WEATHER CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA AS A WEAK SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE SYSTEM AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT ARE PREVAILING OVER THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS EVENING. A COOL/DRY AIR MASS WILL
ONCE AGAIN ALLOW FOR EARLY FALL-LIKE OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPERATURES IN
THE MID/UPPER 50S TO AROUND 60 DEGREES IN THE METRO AREAS. TO THE
WEST OF THE REGION...A TROUGH OVER THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER
VALLEY HAS TRIGGERED OFF AN AREA OF LIGHT/MODERATE SHOWERS OVER THAT
WILL GRADUALLY WEAKEN OVER THE COURSE OF THE EVENING WITH THE LOSS
OF HEATING AS THEY MOVE INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE. STILL...INCREASED
POPS SLIGHTLY IN THE WESTERN ZONES UP FROM ZERO TO ACCOUNT FOR THE
POSSIBLY OF A ROGUE LIGHT SHOWER APPROACHING THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU. HOWEVER...SAW NO REASON TO INCREASE POPS TO NEAR/ABOVE
MENTIONABLE LEVELS. LATE TONIGHT...THE POTENTIAL FOR PATCHY FOG
WILL EXIST ONCE AGAIN IN LOCALIZED SHELTERED AREAS/LOCATIONS NEAR
BODIES OF WATER...THOUGH SOME PASSING MID/HIGH CLOUDS COULD HELP TO
PREVENT VISIBILITIES FROM DROPPING DOWN TOO LOW IN SOME SPOTS.

489 
FXUS64 KMRX 121844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT SUN AUG 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT TRAILING SOUTHWEST OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH 
CLOUDS AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT...AND EXPECT THESE HIGH CLOUDS TO 
GRADUALLY INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND MONDAY AS THE 
COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES. GFS AND NAM MODELS BOTH INDICATE SOME 
PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION MOVING EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN DISAGREE ON THE TIMING OF THIS COLD FRONT 
FOR TUESDAY DUE TO DIFFERENCES IN THE PROGRESSION OF THE UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH. GFS MODEL GENERALLY HAS A FASTER EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE 
COLD FRONT...WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED ON TUESDAY MORNING. NAM 
MODEL REVEALS A LATER FRONTAL PASSAGE ON TUESDAY EVENING...AND THUS 
DEVELOPS A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF 
THE COLD FRONT ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON. ECMWF MODEL SEEMS TO AGREE WITH 
THE SLOWER NAM SOLUTION...SO WILL TREND THE FORECAST TOWARDS AN IDEA 
OF SOME PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY NIGHT...AND THEN ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT ON 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. WITH A VERY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS POSSIBLY DEVELOPING ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON...ALONG 
WITH AN INCREASING MID LEVEL WIND FLOW...IT APPEARS THAT THERE COULD 
BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR ORGANIZED SEVERE STORMS ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING (IF THE NAM/ECMWF SOLUTION VERIFIES). WILL UPDATE THE 
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO FURTHER DEFINE THESE POSSIBILITIES. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN REVEAL SOME DIFFERENCES FOR TUESDAY 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT DUE TO THE FRONTAL TIMING DIFFERENCES. FOR NOW... 
WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO ON TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS ON 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN AROUND THE 
THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY TIME FRAME PROVIDING OUR BEST CHANCE OF SHOWER 
AND THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT DURING THE EXTENDED. CONVECTION MAY 
LINGERING OVER THE AREA...MAINLY NORTHERN AND EAST LOCATIONS ON 
SATURDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND DRYING CONDITIONS BUILD IN FOR 
SUNDAY.
&&

PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRIER WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

SATURDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
GOING FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD...BUT THE HIGHEST CHANCES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

245 PM EDT SAT AUG 11 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

PRESSURE SYSTEM DEEPENING OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY...WITH 
ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY NIGHT. PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT...SO WILL RAISE POPS INTO THE CHANCE 
CATEGORY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK FRONT WILL BE MOVING 
THROUGH/EXITING THE REGION ON MONDAY...PROVIDING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORM. DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ON WEDNESDAY WITH WEAK RIDGING 
ON THURSDAY SHOULD ALLOW FOR A DRY MID WEEK. A COLD FRONT MOVING 
THROUGH ON FRIDAY SHOULD PROVIDE OUR BEST CHANCE AT CONVECTION FOR 
THE EXTENDED WITH ISOLATED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORM EXPECTED TO LINGER 
OVER EASTERN AREAS INTO SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

PRECIP OUT OF OUR AREA BY 12Z. SO WILL KEEP POPS OUT OF THE FIRST
PERIOD...AND COVER EARLY MORNING SHOWERS WITH A NOWCAST. CLOUD
COVER SHOULD EXIT TO THE EAST SHORTLY THEREAFTER...LEAVING MOSTLY
CLEAR SKIES THROUGH THE DAY. ADVECTION OF A DRIER AND COOLER AIR
MASS TODAY WILL GIVE HIGH TEMPS BELOW NORMAL...WITH HIGHS IN THE
UPPER 70S TO MID 80S...AND LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 50S.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH
THE REGION ON TUESDAY BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. MOISTURE DECREASING ON WEDNESDAY SO THE BEST CHANCE
FOR PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON WEDNESDAY.
ANOTHER FRONT TRACKING INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO
FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
GOING FOR BOTH DAYS. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
943 PM EDT FRI AUG 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO PUSH EASTWARD THIS EVENING FROM MIDDLE
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHEASTERN KENTUCKY...BRINGING WITH IT A COOLER AND
DRIER AIRMASS TO THE REGION. ALONG/AHEAD OF THE FRONT...ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS ARE STILL LINGERING ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND
ALONG THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS THIS EVENING...THOUGH A GENERAL
DISSIPATING TREND IS EXPECTED BY THE LATE EVENING GIVEN THE LOSS OF
DAYTIME HEATING AND A MORE STABLE ATMOSPHERE DEVELOPING. SOME DENSE
CLOUD COVER ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE IS GRADUALLY GIVING WAY TO MOSTLY
CLEAR CONDITIONS BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AS DRIER AIR WORKS ITS
WAY INTO THE REGION. STILL...GIVEN THE SLOWER SPEED OF THE
FRONT...SOME CLOUD COVER MAY LINGER ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND NE
TENNESSEE/SW VIRGINIA THROUGH MUCH OF THE OVERNIGHT HOURS /WHILE
POINTS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR/. THIS
CLOUD COVER WILL BE A LIMITING FACTOR FOR ANY FOG DEVELOPMENT IN
THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER AHEAD OF THE FRONT. GIVEN THIS /ALONG WITH
THE DRIER AIR AND NW WINDS LIKELY RESULTING IN SOME MIXING/...OPTED
TO LEAVE A MENTION OF FOG OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR NOW. HOWEVER...
CERTAIN LOCALIZED SHELTERED AREAS COULD SEE SOME DEVELOPMENT AFTER
06Z. GIVEN THE COOLER/DRIER AIRMASS...LOWS WILL ALSO BE NOTABLY
COOLER IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS...BOTTOMING OUT IN THE UPPER 50S TO
LOWER 60S IN MANY AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES.

THE OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS THIS AFTERNOON...PUSHING THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WILL LIKELY LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF SOLAR 
WARMING FOR THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THE MODELS SUGGEST THAT THE LOCAL 
AIR MASS WILL STILL BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO 
THE COLDER AIR ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH. THUS...EXPECT 
ANOTHER LINE OF CONVECTION TO REDEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT THIS 
AFTERNOON...AND WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. 
THE MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
SHOULD COMBINE THIS AFTERNOON TO PRODUCE SOME STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

OHIO VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT. THIS WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT INTO OUR 
AREA TODAY. THE FRONT ACTING ON A MOIST LOW LEVEL AIR MASS WILL 
RESULT IN LIKELY POPS THROUGH TODAY. MORNING CLOUD COVER WILL LIMIT 
INSTABILITY...AND THE STRONGEST LIFT REMAINS NORTH OF OUR AREA...SO 
THE SEVERE THREAT LOOKS LOW. BEST ESTIMATE OF TIMING OF PRE-FRONTAL 
CONVECTION IS BETWEEN 14Z AND 20Z...BASED ON THE NAM AND SREF. MUCH 
DRIER AIR WILL BE WORKING INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT TONIGHT. PW 
VALUES DROP TO UNDER 1 INCH BY MIDNIGHT...WITH SURFACE DEWPOINTS 
FALLING INTO THE 50S. PRECIP CHANCES SHOULD COME TO AN END ACROSS 
THE AREA SOON AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH LOWS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S IN 
MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM ((SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW TROUGH TRACKS
TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA ON SATURDAY SO WILL CONTINUE THE LOW
CHANCES FOR MAINLY THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA FOR SATURDAY.
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.
A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY BRINGING A CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. A SHORTWAVE TRACKING OVER THE AREA
BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM INTO WEDNESDAY.
ANOTHER DISTURBANCE TRACKING IN THE AREA ON THURSDAY. WITH STILL
UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW. STAYED NEAR
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             84  66  85  62  88 /  70  30  10  10  10

OAK RIDGE, TN                       82  63  83  59  85 /  70  20  10  10  10

940 
FXUS64 KMRX 091939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 PM EDT THU AUG 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION 
OCCURRING AHEAD OF AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH...AS IT MOVES 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS SHORT WAVE UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SCATTERED CONVECTION TONIGHT...AS 
ITS PARENT LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH FURTHER AMPLIFIES OVER THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL PUSH THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY...WITH THE MODELS REVEALING SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH ITS 
TIMING. FOR NOW...WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE NAM MODEL'S MORNING 
PASSAGE...AND THE GFS MODEL'S AFTERNOON PASSAGE BY MENTIONING LIKELY 
POPS THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THE INSTABILITY OF THE LOCAL AIR MASS WILL 
GREATLY DEPEND ON THE TIMING OF THE COLD FRONT...BUT IT STILL 
APPEARS THAT A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS COULD DEVELOP BY FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON RESULTING IN A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING 
WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. A DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR 
MASS THEN MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND THE COLD FRONT FOR 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...AND WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL WILL PROVIDE A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. 
A SERIES OF WEAK IMPULSES WILL MOVE THROUGH TUESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY. WITH A WARMING TREND AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURNING TO 
THE AREA...COULD SEE OCCASIONAL ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOP THROUGH 
THE LATER PART OF THE EXTENDED.

CONDUCIVE FOR THE GENERATION OF STRONG DAMAGING WINDS...WITH A DEEP 
MID-LEVEL DRY LAYER OBSERVED ALONG WITH AN INVERTED-V PROFILE IN THE 
BOUNDARY LAYER.

AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

983 
FXUS64 KMRX 090754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT THU AUG 9 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL ROTATE OVER THE REGION TODAY...AHEAD OF
A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM AND IT'S ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT
MOVING THROUGH THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS FEATURE WILL HELP TO
TRIGGER OFF SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS ACROSS THE REGION
TODAY AND TONIGHT. GIVEN THE PROGGED INSTABILITY VALUES /WITH CAPE
VALUES AOA 1500-2500 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES AOA -5C TO -6C/...
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. THUS...FAIRLY DECENT
CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION WILL EXIST AREAWIDE...PARTICULARLY AFTER
18Z. THE PRIMARY THREATS WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY WILL BE LOW-
END SEVERE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS /AS INDICATED BY THE INVERTED-V
SOUNDING PROFILES/. WITH PWATS PROGGED TO BE AROUND 1.5-1.6
INCHES...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IS LIKELY WITH ANY ACTIVITY THAT
DOES DEVELOP. LATER TONIGHT...AS THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT
MOVES INTO KENTUCKY...ADDITIONAL STORMS WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE SOUTH
INTO THE NORTHERN ZONES LATE TONIGHT. THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS
AFTER 00Z ACROSS THIS AREA /SHOWING A SLIGHT GRADIENT FROM
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST/. HIGH TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE A FEW
DEGREES COOLER GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES
/WITH READINGS GENERALLY REMAINING BELOW 90 DEGREES IN THE MID TO
UPPER 80S/.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
MODELS GENERALLY CONSISTENT WITH 12Z RUNS THIS MORNING...SUCH THAT
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS WERE GENERALLY RIGHT ON TRACK. TIMING OF
CONVECTION AHEAD OF OR WITH THE COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY LOOKS CLOSE TO
GRIDS...WITH ONLY SREF A BIT FASTER WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE. AT ANY
RATE...HIGHEST POPS STILL SEEM JUSTIFIED IN THE 12Z-00Z PERIOD
FRIDAY...ALTHOUGH I DID GIVE A W-E POP GRADIENT LOOK TO FRIDAY MORNING
THEN LIKELY ALL AREAS BY THE AFTERNOON.

SOUNDINGS SHOW A UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND PROFILE WITH MODEST SPEED 
SHEAR...WHILE INSTABILITY WILL BE AT LEAST MODERATE. IT WAS 
INTERESTING TO NOTE THAT OUR MOISTURE SUPPLY IS MAINLY LOW AND UPPER 
LEVELS...WHILE THERE IS CONSIDERABLE DRY AIR IN THE MID LEVELS.  
THIS DRY AIR IN THE MID LEVELS WOULD ENHANCE DOWNDRAFT/DOWNBURST 
POTENTIAL...SUGGESTING MAINLY A DAMAGING WIND THREAT WITH STRONGEST 
CONVECTION FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

FOR OTHER PERIODS...AFTER BRIEF SPOTTY MORNING SHOWERS IN THE EAST 
ON SATURDAY...A DRY FORECAST REMAINS IN ORDER INTO MONDAY NIGHT. 
GFSX MOS POPS ARE REPEATING THE PATTERN OF HIGHER POPS FOR TUESDAY 
FROM THE 00Z RUN COMPARED TO THE 12Z RUN. THE PREDICTED SYNOPTIC 
PATTERN DOES NOT SUPPORT CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY OR TUESDAY NIGHT... 
SO KEPT CONTINUITY WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. MODEL 
DIFFERENCES FOR WEDNESDAY SO JUST RUNNING THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
AGAIN...AS PATTERN WOULD AT LEAST INDICATE DIURNAL CONVECTION 
POSSIBLE. GFSX MOS TEMPS VERY CONSISTENT FROM 12Z AND CLOSE TO 
PREVIOUS MAX/MIN TEMP GRIDS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

944 
FXUS64 KMRX 081857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT WED AUG 8 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT ISOBAR ANALYSIS 
INDICATES A WEAK AND DIFFUSE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...BUT A VERY MOIST AIR MASS 
STILL LINGERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S 
TO LOWER 70S. THIS MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS EXPECTED TO LINGER 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...UNTIL A COLD 
FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE REGION BY FRIDAY NIGHT. AN UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVE AHEAD OF THE MAIN LONG-WAVE TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON...TRIGGERING 
SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLY 
PRODUCING DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. THE LONG WAVE 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THEN AMPLIFIES AND BECOMES UNSEASONABLY STRONG 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON FRIDAY...WITH A COLD FRONT 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 
THIS SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ON 
FRIDAY...WITH A GOOD CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER AS WELL. THE MAIN 
SEVERE THREATS APPEAR TO BE THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WINDS... 
LARGE HAIL...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH 
AXIS WILL FOLLOW SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY OUT OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON SATURDAY SO REMOVED POP FROM MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA WHILE LEAVING JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM 
OVER THE EASTERN THIRD...MAINLY DURING THE MORNING. DRIER AND 
SOMEWHAT "MILDER" AIR BUILDS IN ON SUNDAY AND WHILE TEMPERATURES 
CLIMB A DEGREE OR TWO BY MONDAY HUMIDITY LEVELS SHOULD REMAIN 
RELATIVELY LOW. KEPT A DRY MONDAY GOING AS SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW 
WILL NOT BE FULLY DEVELOPED. BY TUESDAY MOISTURE RETURN WILL BE 
SUFFICIENT ALONG WITH A DESTABILIZING ATMOSPHERE AND A POSSIBLE 
SHORT WAVE ARRIVAL TO KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING FOR CONVECTION. 
INCREASING MOISTURE AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS WITH THE HINT OF MORE 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY ON WEDNESDAY REQUIRED KEEPING AT LEAST A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP GOING AT THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. ADJUSTED MAX 
TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD QUITE CLOSE TO IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW 
GUIDANCE WHICH ATTEMPTS TOO RAPID A WARMING SCENARIO FOLLOWING 
AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MINS EXCEPT 
TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD WHERE GUIDANCE LOOKS A LITTLE TOO COOL 
WITH RETURNING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
714 AM EDT WED AUG 8 2012

.DISCUSSION...
BASED ON CURRENT OBS/TRENDS...HAVE OPTED TO CANCEL THE DENSE FOG
ADVISORY. CLOUD COVER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY HAVE LIMITED FOG
DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...NE TENNESSEE AND SW VIRGINIA
THIS MORNING. SOME AREAS OF FOG WILL BE POSSIBLE IN SHELTERED AREAS
THROUGH MID-MORNING...BUT VISIBILITIES ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE
DENSE FOG CRITERIA /ONE-QUARTER MILE/ ACROSS NEARLY ALL OF THE
FORECAST AREA. 

&&

.AVIATION...
VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO PREVAIL AT EACH TERMINAL THROUGHOUT
THE PERIOD AS A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA
TODAY. THE ONE EXCEPTION WILL BE EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH 14Z AT
KTRI WHERE LOCALIZED IFR/MVFR CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE DUE TO SOME
FOG DEVELOPMENT. ISOLATED STORMS MAY DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTN...BUT
COVERAGE WILL BE TOO LOW TO INCLUDE A MENTION IN THE TAF AT THIS
TIME.

FXUS64 KMRX 080800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT WED AUG 8 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS AND STORMS CONTINUE TO
PERSIST ACROSS THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS INTO THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW
NORTH CAROLINA. THOUGH A BRIEF BURST OF MODERATE/HEAVY RAIN MAY
OCCUR WITH THIS ACTIVITY...AN OVERALL WEAKENING TREND IS EXPECTED
OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS AS THESE SHOWERS SHOULD DISSIPATE BY
DAYBREAK. SOME PATCHY FOG IS ALSO EXPECTED GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY
LAYER CONDITIONS EARLY THIS MORNING...THOUGH SOME LINGERING CLOUD
COVER AND SHOWERS MAY TEMPER DEVELOPMENT SOMEWHAT IN SOME LOCATIONS
UNTIL DAYBREAK. STILL...WILL MAINTAIN THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY
ACROSS NE TENNESSEE/SW VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAIN ZONES FROM 09-13Z
AS SKIES SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR EARLY THIS MORNING. WITH A WEAK
SURFACE HIGH MOVING OVER EAST TENNESSEE TODAY...DRIER AND SLIGHTLY
WARMER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AREAWIDE AS THE MERCURY SHOULD
REACH THE LOW TO MID 90S ACROSS A BULK OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.
MODELS /THE NAM-12 IN PARTICULAR/ ARE SHOWING LITTLE TO NO
CONVECTIVE SIGNALS...BUT HAVE MAINTAINED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
AREAWIDE THROUGH MID EVENING TO ACCOUNT FOR SOME ISOLATED DIURNALLY
INDUCED ACTIVITY THAT SHOULD DEVELOP WITHIN THE WARM...MOIST
AIRMASS.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
WEAK RIDGING THURSDAY WILL GIVE WAY TO A LEAD SHORTWAVE TROUGH...
BUT I THINK ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION...UNTIL
PERHAPS LATER THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. THE DEEPENING UPPER
TROUGH AND APPROACHING COLD FRONT SUPPORT OUR CURRENT LIKELY POPS
FOR FRIDAY...SO NO CHANGES MADE FOR THOSE PERIODS.

FRONTAL PASSAGE OCCURS PRIOR TO 12Z SATURDAY...BUT ENERGY COMING 
AROUND THE UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH WILL REQUIRE KEEPING LOW POPS IN 
FOR MOST AREAS ON SATURDAY. GFS/CANADIAN/ECMWF AND SREF ALL FAVOR 
KEEPING SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT DRY. GFSX MOS POPS ARE 
INCREASING FOR TUESDAY AND ARE ABOVE CLIMO...SO OPTED TO ADD SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY. 

GFSX 08/00Z MOS TEMPS WERE VERY CONSISTENT WITH 07/12Z NUMBERS...AND 
CLOSE TO PREVIOUS MAX/MIN GRIDS...SO GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED

954 PM EDT TUE AUG 7 2012

.DISCUSSION...
ISOLATED SHOWERS IN SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ARE
PERSISTING...BUT WITH CONTINUED BOUNDARY LAYER
STABILIZATION...THESE SHOWERS SHOULD DISSIPATE BY MIDNIGHT.

DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE LOWER 70S IN MOST SPOTS. WITH HIGH AND MIDLEVEL
CLOUDS FROM EARLIER CONVECTION DECREASING OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL
HOURS...CONDITIONS LOOK QUITE FAVORABLE FOR FOG DEVELOPMENT. SOME
METARS ARE ALREADY SHOWING 0 DEGREE DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS. WILL HIT
THE FOG WORDING HARDER IN THE ZONES FOR ALL AREAS. CONFIDENCE OF
DENSE FOG FORMATION IS HIGHEST IN NORTHERN AREAS...AND A DENSE FOG
ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED THERE AS WELL AS THE SMOKIES AND SW NC
WHERE VALLEYS WILL LIKELY SEE DENSE FOG.

352 
FXUS64 KMRX 071924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT TUE AUG 7 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...RADAR INDICATING A FEW SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA. THE BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED 
TO EXIT THE AREA TONIGHT SO WILL CONTINUE WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES 
FOR THE EVENING WITH A DRIER AIRMASS MOVING IN AFTER MIDNIGHT. WITH 
THE DECREASING CLOUDS AND LINGERING MOISTURE...MAY SEE AREAS AND 
PATCHY FOG TONIGHT. NOT WIDESPREAD FOR AN ADVISORY. THE GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE.  DRIER AIRMASS IN 
PLACE FOR WEDNESDAY...BUT STILL EXPECTING INSTABILITY TO INCREASE BY 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO DIURNAL THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE IT 
SHOULD BE ISOLATE IN COVERAGE. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED 
REASONABLE FOR WEDNESDAY AS WELL. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
BE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN...ALTHOUGH SOME 
DIFFERENCES EMERGING LATE IN THE PERIOD AS ECMWF A BIT FASTER TO 
BEGIN SHIFTING UPPER RIDGE EASTWARD.  HOWEVER...OVERALL FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD.  MAIN 
FEATURE WILL STILL BE THE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH THAT DIGS IN AND 
THE STRONG FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR COLD FRONT THAT IS FORECAST TO PUSH 
THROUGH SOMETIME FRIDAY OR FRIDAY EVENING.  LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE 
AMPLE FORCING WITH THIS FEATURE...AND SEVERE WEATHER CERTAINLY IS A 
POSSIBILITY.  WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS FOR FRIDAY AND WILL MENTION 
POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS IN HWO.  OTHERWISE...WILL CARRY CHANCE 
POPS THURSDAY AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM AS MOISTURE INCREASES...AND 
SLIGHT CHANCE ALL BUT SOUTHWEST ZONES SATURDAY AS UPPER TROUGH WILL 
STILL BE OVER THE AREA.  WITH DRYER AIR MOVING IN BEHIND THE FRONT 
WILL GO PRECIP FREE FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY FOR NOW. 


&&

110 
FXUS64 KMRX 070751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
351 AM EDT TUE AUG 7 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
HARD TO PIN DOWN THE LOCATION OF THE WEAKENING COLD FRONT THIS
MORNING...BUT SOME DRYING HAS OCCURRED AT 850 MB LEVEL ACROSS SE KY
AND SW VA AREAS. 07/00Z SOUNDINGS FROM OHX AND RNK SHOW
PWAT VALUES DOWN SLIGHTLY TO AROUND 1.5 INCHES. RADAR SHOWS A FEW
SHOWERS DEVELOPING ACROSS EXTREME SE TN AND SWRN NC...WITH MOVEMENT
SLOWLY NE. GIVEN THE SLIGHT DRYING I PREFERRED THE DRIER LOOK OF
THE 00Z NAM MODEL...SO POPS WERE LOWERED BY ABOUT 10 TO 15 PERCENT.
HIGHEST POPS SE TN/SW NC DOWN TO JUST SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS MOST OF
SWRN VA TODAY. SOME PATCHY FOG NOTED BUT PASSING HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD
KEEP VISBY FROM BOTTOMING OUT.

LITTLE CHANGES MADE FOR TONIGHT FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS...KEEPING THOSE 
LOW POPS JUST FOR THE EVENING THEN DRY. FOG DEVELOPMENT MAY BE MORE 
WIDESPREAD TONIGHT. OTHERWISE...STUCK CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR HIGHS 
TODAY AND A BLEND OF MOS FOR MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
A LINGERING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL FINALLY SKIRT OFF TO THE EAST OF 
THE REGION WITH THE PASSAGE OF AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
TONIGHT...WHICH THIS WILL RESULT IN A DRIER FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY 
/WITH THE NAM-12 SHOWING ALMOST NO CONVECTIVE SIGNALS/ ACROSS THE 
AREA. GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER HOWEVER...STILL THINK THAT 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ARE WARRANTED IN THE AFTN/EVENING FROM DIURNAL 
HEATING. THEREAFTER...MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE ACROSS THE 
REGION IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM 
ROTATING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO RIVER VALLEY. PRECIP CHANCES 
WILL INCREASE MARKEDLY BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT PROGGED TO DROP INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY. AS A 
RESULT...HAVE MAINTAINED HIGH-END CHANCE POPS THURSDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST SATURDAY 
MORNING AS THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA. SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL 
BE POSSIBLE THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING...BUT OVERALL DRIER AND COOLER 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM /WITH 
HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW TO MID 80S BEING LIKELY/. LOW-LEVEL 
MOISTURE WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE EARLY NEXT WEEK...WARRANTING 
LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS FOR MONDAY.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             89  70  93  71  92 /  50  30  20  20  50

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE  THROUGH 
THE AREA TONIGHT AND LINGER TO TUESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS. WITH THE SATURATED GROUND IN THE 
CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE CWA...WILL DROP THE WATCH FOR THE PLATEAU 
AND KEEP THE WATCH FOR THE REST OF THE AREA. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES 
LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE. COULD ALSO SEE PATCHY FOG FROM 
THE RAIN TONIGHT. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY LINGERS INTO TUESDAY SO WILL 
CONTINUE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO TUESDAY. THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE AFTERNOON WHEN THE INSTABILITY INCREASES. 
STAYED NEAR BLEND TEMPERATURES FOR TUESDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN REASONABLE
AGREEMENT OVERALL...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR
THE LONG TERM PERIOD. ONE DISAGREEMENT IS THE AMOUNT OF DRYING
TUESDAY NIGHT/WED...WITH THE NAM SHOWING MORE DRYING THAN THE GFS.
THINK THERE WILL BE AT LEAST ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WED TO
WARRANT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOME MAINLY AFTERNOON CONVECTION.
MOISTURE FORECAST TO INCREASE THURSDAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD
FRONT. WILL CARRY HIGH CHANCE POPS THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. FRONT
SHOULD BE EXITING BY FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN MODELS SHOW COOLER AND
DRIER AIR MOVING IN FOR THE WEEKEND. WILL GO PRECIP FREE ALL BUT
FAR NORTH AND EAST SAT AND ALL ZONES SUNDAY...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS MONDAY AS MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE A BIT. WILL NOT ARGUE
MUCH WITH GFS MOS TEMPS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE MOST PART.



&&

782 
FXUS64 KMRX 060826
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
426 AM EDT MON AUG 6 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN IS THE PROBLEMS 
CREATED BY SOME TORRENTIAL RAINFALL SUNDAY EVENING ACROSS OUR NRN 
PLATEAU COUNTIES...AND ALSO GENERALLY NE TN COUNTIES ALONG OR SE OF 
I-81 AND I-40. FLOODING CONTINUES IN THE EXTREME SOUTHERN END OF 
WASHINGTON COUNTY TN AT THIS TIME. BOTH JKL AND MRX RAINFALL 
ESTIMATES RANGED GENERALLY FROM 3 TO NEARLY 6 INCHES OF RAINFALL IN 
THESE AREAS. ACTUAL RAIN GAGE REPORTS INCLUDED 5.57 INCHES JUST NW 
OF THE TOWN OF UNICOI AND MY RAIN GAGE IN WHITE PINE (JEFFERSON
COUNTY) MEASURED NEARLY 3 INCHES LATE SUNDAY EVENING FROM A
DOWNPOUR OVER LESS THAN 2 HOURS.

SCATTERED CONVECTION ALREADY FIRING ALONG THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT 
WITH VERY HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AND K INDICES FROM ACTUAL 
06/00Z AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS. ALTHOUGH BEST CONVERGENCE AND LIFT 
FOR LATER TODAY LOOKS TO BE OROGRAPHIC (RATHER THAN FRONTOGENETIC 
FORCING)...FELT POPS NEEDED TO BE NUDGED UP TO LIKELY OVER MOST 
AREAS. WIND FIELDS RATHER WEAK SO I ANTICIPATE A SLOW STORM MOVEMENT 
EASTWARD...WHICH SUPPORTS A GOOD CHANCE OF MORE NUISANCE TO 
SIGNIFICANT FLOODING. FFG VALUES ARE LIKELY TO BE VERY LOW IN ANY 
AREAS WHERE HEAVY RAINS FELL YESTERDAY. ISSUED A FLOOD WATCH FOR 
GENERALLY ALL AREAS BUT SE TN AND SW NC...AFTER COORDINATION WITH 
OUR NWS NEIGHBORS. 

OTHERWISE...OPTED FOR COOLER MOS MAXES TODAY AND A BLEND OF MOS MINS 
LOOKED FINE FOR TONIGHT. NO MAJOR CHANGES MADE TO FORECAST GRIDS FOR 
TONIGHT...EVEN ABLE TO KEEP POP AND WEATHER GRIDS NEARLY UNCHANGED. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT SETTLES JUST
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND THEN BECOMES STATIONARY JUST
TO THE SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WITH UPPER FLOW PATTERN
STILL FROM THE NW DRIER AIR MASS MOVES IN. EASTERN SECTIONS WILL
HAVE BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND NW SECTIONS POSSIBLY DRY BUT WILL
LEAVE A 20 PERCENT CHANCE THERE. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM A FEW
DEGREES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH MORE SUN. A NEW COLD FRONT
APPROACHES WITH DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES
THURSDAY AND MOVES THROUGH THE REGION FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. RAIN
CHANCES INCREASE. TEMPERATURES COOLER BEHIND NEXT FRONT SATURDAY
AND SUNDAY. MODELS TRY TO END PRECIPITATION BEHIND WEEKEND FRONT
EARLY SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY BUT WITH NW BEHIND IT AND LARGE RIDGE TO
THE WEST WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR NOW AS SHORTWAVE
ENERGY MAY RIDE OVER RIDGE TO THE WEST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  71  88  69  91 /  60  20  50  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  85  69  87  68  89 /  60  30  50  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  68  87  67  90 /  50  30  40  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              81  65  84  63  86 /  70  30  50  30  30

FXUS64 KMRX 051939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 PM EDT SUN AUG 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH APPROACHING 
FROM THE NW. ENTRANCE REGION OF WEAKENING JET SEGMENT WILL MOVE EAST 
THROUGH KENTUCKY THIS EVENING. THIS WILL COINCIDE WITH AFTERNOON 
DESTABILIZATION AND OFFER WITH BEST CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER. VERY 
HIGH PWAT VALUES COULD LEAD TO LOCALIZED FLOODING THIS EVENING AND 
OVERNIGHT. TAIL END OF UPPER TROUGH SLIDES INTO EAST TENNESSEE 
VALLEY TONIGHT. THIS FEATURE WILL ABSORB INVERTED TROUGH OVER NORTH 
FLORIDA AND LEAVE A WEAK TROUGH ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE THROUGH THE 
AREA TONIGHT AND MONDAY AND LINGER ALONG SOUTHERN MRX CWA AND RETURN 
NORTH BY END OF PERIOD. THE LAYER DRIES OT SOME ACROSS N AREAS BUT 
REMAINS FAIRLY MOIST ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS. ABOVE NORMAL 
PRECIPITATION CONTINUES THROUGH THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL COOL 
SOME WHILE REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A BOUNDARY LINGERS OVER 
THE REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE 
CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY. WITH INSTABILITY LINGERING MOST OF THE ACTIVITY FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY SHOULD BE DIURNAL. A FRONT TRACKS 
INTO THE REGION FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...SO WILL KEEP THE 
CHANCES GOING FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR FRIDAY AND INTO  
SATURDAY. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY SO WILL ADD LOW 
CHANCES FOR SUNDAY. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE. STAYED 
NEAR MEX/HPC NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.
