805 
FXUS64 KMRX 051457
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SUN AUG 5 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BRIEF LULL IN THE CONVECTIVE 
PRECIPITATION CONTINUES THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...LATEST RADAR TRENDS 
SHOW CONVECTION INCREASING FROM MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY WESTWARD TO 
THE COLD FRONT. HIGH POPS STILL SEEM IN ORDER FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT 
AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND THEN STALLS INTO MONDAY. ADJUSTED 
TIMING OF SHOWERS AND STORMS A BIT IN THE FORECAST GRIDS...BUT KEPT 
CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS LIKELY TO LOW END OF CATEGORICAL POPS. 

CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE WITH AN EARLY ONSET OF CONVECTION...WHICH 
FAVORS THE COOLER NAM MOS MAXES FOR TODAY. MOS MINS IN THE 60S TO 
LOWER 70S LOOKS GOOD FOR TONIGHT. 

LARGE SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE STORMS INCLUDES THE BULK OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA...WITH MAIN THREATS BEING DAMAGING WINDS...MARGINAL HAIL AND 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LATE SUMMER COLD FRONT 
BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY MONDAY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN TN 
VALLEY. CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER TO START THE DAY AND POSSIBLE 
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE OCCURRING IN THE MORNING 
ALONG AND AHEAD OF FRONT. HIGHS A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN WHERE THERE SHOULD BE MORE CLOUD COVER 
OTHERWISE PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR HIGHS. AS TEMPERATURES WARM IN 
THE AFTERNOON AND THE MOIST AIR MASS BECOMES UNSTABLE THERE WILL BE 
SOME STRONG STORMS ALONG AND JUST SOUTH OF THE FRONT. SCATTERED 
STORMS WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING UNTIL SUNSET THEN DECREASE 
WITH NIGHT TIME COOLING. LOWS SLIGHTLY COOLER BEHIND FRONT MONDAY 
NIGHT. TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY BROAD TROUGH CONTINUES OVER EAST 
AND FORECAST AREA WITH WEAK FRONT JUST TO THE SOUTH. MOIST UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS AND DAYTIME HEATING WILL KEEP SCATTERED AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING SHOWERS AND STORMS FORMING EACH DAY. THURSDAY FRONT 
DISSIPATES BUT PATTERN STAYS THE SAME. FRIDAY A NEW FRONT MOVES 
SOUTH INTO OHIO VALLEY AND THEN INTO EASTERN TN VALLEY SATURDAY. NO 
REAL CHANGE IN UPPER FLOW PATTERN BUT COOLER TEMPERATURES FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS OF FORECAST AREA AS UPPER TROUGH 
DEEPENS OVER THE EASTERN STATES WITH NEXT FRONT. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       87  72  86  68  88 /  70  80  50  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              86  69  84  64  86 /  60  60  60  30  30

FXUS64 KMRX 040825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EDT SAT AUG 4 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LULL IN THE CONVECTIVE 
PRECIPITATION EARLY THIS MORNING...ALTHO AIR MASS REMAINS VERY MOIST 
WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER AROUND 1.5 TO 2.0 INCHES. UPPER AIR PLOTS 
FROM 04/00Z SHOW A WEAK UPPER TROUGH AXIS TO OUR WEST AT 700 MBS 
WITH DIFFLUENT FLOW ALOFT AT 500 MB LEVEL. DAYTIME HEATING AND SOME 
POSSIBLE LEFTOVER SURFACE BOUNDARIES ADDED TO THESE UPPER LEVEL 
FEATURES SHOULD ALLOW FOR SCATTERED OR BETTER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS BY THIS AFTERNOON. KEPT FORECAST GRIDS QUITE CLOSE 
TO PREVIOUS FORECAST...ALTHO POPS WERE SLIGHTLY LOWERED FOR CURRENT 
TIME AND THIS MORNING. UNDERCUT THE WARMER GFS MOS MAXES LIKE 
YESTERDAY GIVEN THE MOIST AIR MASS AND HIGH RAIN CHANCES.

EVENING CONVECTION SHOULD BE ON THE DECLINE AFTER 05/04Z WITH POPS 
LOWERED TO MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT. TEMPTED TO ADD 
PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT...BUT AMOUNT OF DEBRIS CLOUDS COULD INHIBIT 
FOG DEVELOPMENT. PERSISTENCE ON MIN TEMPS WAS CLOSE TO A BLEND OF 
SIMILAR MOS MINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SUNDAY A DEEP UPPER TROUGH
FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WITH ACCOMPANYING
COLD FRONT. HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT AND STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES
WITH CAPE VALUES 1000 TO 3000J PER KG WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS ALSO
POSSIBLE. COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY.
ECMWF...NAM AND CANADIAN BRING THE COLD FRONT JUST SOUTH AND EAST
OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. RAIN CHANCES WILL BE HIGH
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AND THEN DECREASE FROM NW TO SE MONDAY AND
MONDAY NIGHT. FOLLOWED A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR HIGHS AND LOWS
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. TUESDAY FRONT IS STATIONARY TO THE SOUTH
WITH HIGHER PRESSURE TRYING TO BUILD IN FROM THE NORTH. BROAD
TROUGH REMAINS ACROSS THE EAST AND WITH MOIST AIR MASS AND
PROXIMITY OF FRONT JUST TO THE SOUTH RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE BUT
MORE DIURNALLY DRIVEN TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY
FRONT WASHES OUT AND TEMPERATURES WARM SLIGHTLY. UPPER LOW DROPS SE
FROM CANADA INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND ANOTHER FRONT MOVES INTO THE
OHIO VALLEY. CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING HOURS. 
&&

352 
FXUS64 KMRX 031501
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT FRI AUG 3 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. DEBRIS CLOUDS FROM MORNING MCS 
BREAKING UP. THIS WILL ALLOW A FEW HOURS OF SUNSHINE FOR 
DESTABILIZATION. SHORT WAVE OVER MIDDLE TN WILL SLOW AS IT MOVES 
EAST THIS AFTERNOON. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE AND REMAIN 
FAIRLY WIDESPREAD. WARM MOIST AIRMASS SHOULD HINDER SEVERE 
DEVELOPMENT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN FOCUS THIS MORNING IS ON THE 
MCS DROPPING SE INTO MIDDLE TN. SATELLITE PICS SHOW TOPS STILL ON 
THE COLD SIDE...PLENTY OF LIGHTNING STRIKES AND INCREASING INTENSITY 
FROM AREA RADARS. SPC MESO PAGE SHOWS AREAS OF CONVERGENCE AND 
UNSTABLE AIRMASS WITH A LOW LEVEL THETA-E RIDGE INTO NE MS AND 
ANOTHER ACROSS THE NRN PLATEAU INTO SE TN THIS MORNING. UPPER FLOW 
SUPPORTS THIS MCS PUSHING SLOWLY SSE TOWARD OUR FORECAST AREA. 
ALREADY SEEING ISOLATED -TSRA AHEAD OF THIS MAIN ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION. 

PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK WITH A SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENT OR TWO ON TIMING. EXPECTING AT LEAST SOME STRONG STORMS 
TODAY AND ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS ARE CERTAINLY POSSIBLE...ALTHO WIND 
SHEAR LOOKS TO BE ON THE WEAK SIDE. 

FOR TEMPS...WRN AND SRN AREAS MAY ONLY WARM TO THE LOWER NAM MOS 
HIGHS...WHILE NE AREAS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO REACH 90 DEGS OR SO FOR 
HIGHS. MINS TONIGHT SHOULD BE RATHER PERSISTENT IN LINE WITH PAST 
FEW NIGHTS.  


LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FORECAST AREA STILL IN A 
WEAKNESS AREA WITH UPPER RIDGE TO THE WEST AND BERMUDA HIGH OFF THE 
EAST COAST. SLOW MOVING SHORTWAVE CROSSING THE REGION SATURDAY SO 
GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WITH A FEW STRONG TO 
POSSIBLY SEVERE STORMS. THEN A DECREASE SATURDAY NIGHT DUE TO 
COOLING. UPPER TROUGH AND COOL FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY 
SUNDAY AND AIR MASS ACROSS THE TN VALLEY BECOMES QUITE UNSTABLE. 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS 
AND LARGE HAIL POSSIBLE. ACTIVITY SHOULD BE SCATTERED SUNDAY BUT 
SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD BECOME MORE NUMEROUS NORTH AS UPPER TROUGH 
APPROACHES. COLD FRONT TRIES TO MOVE THROUGH MONDAY BUT SLOWS AND 
BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY INTO TUESDAY. FLOW REMAINS OUT OF THE NW 
AND WITH FRONT NEARBY THIS WILL KEEP GOOD CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
STORMS AROUND BOTH DAYS. THE FRONT BECOMES WASHED OUT BY WEDNESDAY 
WITH SOME DRYING OVER THE NW HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. BEST RAIN 
CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. 
HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL SATURDAY AND SUNDAY 80S TO 
NEAR 90 AND LOWS MID 60S TO LOWER 70S...AND THE SAME GENERAL TREND 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED DUE TO CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS AND 
DAILY RAIN CHANCES.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

ON THE COLD SIDE...PLENTY OF LIGHTNING STRIKES AND INCREASING 
INTENSITY FROM AREA RADARS. SPC MESO PAGE SHOWS AREAS OF CONVERGENCE
AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS WITH A LOW LEVEL THETA-E RIDGE INTO NE MS AND 
ANOTHER ACROSS THE NRN PLATEAU INTO SE TN THIS MORNING. UPPER FLOW 
SUPPORTS THIS MCS PUSHING SLOWLY SSE TOWARD OUR FORECAST AREA. 
ALREADY SEEING ISOLATED -TSRA AHEAD OF THIS MAIN ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION. 

PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK WITH A SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENT OR TWO ON TIMING. EXPECTING AT LEAST SOME STRONG STORMS 
TODAY AND ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS ARE CERTAINLY POSSIBLE...ALTHO WIND 
SHEAR LOOKS TO BE ON THE WEAK SIDE. 

FOR TEMPS...WRN AND SRN AREAS MAY ONLY WARM TO THE LOWER NAM MOS 
HIGHS...WHILE NE AREAS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO REACH 90 DEGS OR SO FOR 
HIGHS. MINS TONIGHT SHOULD BE RATHER PERSISTENT IN LINE WITH PAST 
FEW NIGHTS.  


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FORECAST AREA STILL IN A 
WEAKNESS AREA WITH UPPER RIDGE TO THE WEST AND BERMUDA HIGH OFF THE 
EAST COAST. SLOW MOVING SHORTWAVE CROSSING THE REGION SATURDAY SO 
GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WITH A FEW STRONG TO 
POSSIBLY SEVERE STORMS. THEN A DECREASE SATURDAY NIGHT DUE TO 
COOLING. UPPER TROUGH AND COOL FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY 
SUNDAY AND AIR MASS ACROSS THE TN VALLEY BECOMES QUITE UNSTABLE. 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS 
AND LARGE HAIL POSSIBLE. ACTIVITY SHOULD BE SCATTERED SUNDAY BUT 
SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD BECOME MORE NUMEROUS NORTH AS UPPER TROUGH 
APPROACHES. COLD FRONT TRIES TO MOVE THROUGH MONDAY BUT SLOWS AND 
BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY INTO TUESDAY. FLOW REMAINS OUT OF THE NW 
AND WITH FRONT NEARBY THIS WILL KEEP GOOD CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
STORMS AROUND BOTH DAYS. THE FRONT BECOMES WASHED OUT BY WEDNESDAY 
WITH SOME DRYING OVER THE NW HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. BEST RAIN 
CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. 
HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL SATURDAY AND SUNDAY 80S TO 
NEAR 90 AND LOWS MID 60S TO LOWER 70S...AND THE SAME GENERAL TREND 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED DUE TO CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS AND 
DAILY RAIN CHANCES.  


&&

PASSAGE...EXPECT IMPROVED WEATHER AS WE FIND OURSELVES IN A CLOSE TO 
SEASONAL TEMPERATURE REGIME FROM MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH LESS 
HUMIDITY. HIGHEST POPS TUES-THURS ONLY 20-30 PCT WITH MAINLY

FXUS64 KMRX 020715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT THU AUG 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER 
PATTERN TODAY WITH CONTINUE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  EXPECT TO SEE 
DIURNAL CONVECTION DEVELOP OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH BEST 
CHANCE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  CONVECTION SHOULD LINGER INTO THE 
EVENING HOURS WITH ONLY A STRAY THUNDERSTORM EXPECTED OVER SOUTHERN 
AREAS OVERNIGHT.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...IT WILL BE ANOTHER HOT DAY 
WITH TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE 90S OVER MUCH OF THE TN 
VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FOR FRIDAY...SOUTHERLY 
BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS INCREASE PULLING SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE BACK 
INTO THE AREA WITH PWS RAISING TO 2+ INCHES AT BOTH CHA AND TYS.
MAIN FORCING WILL BE TERRAIN FEATURES...SO HIGHEST POPS WILL BE 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. FOR SATURDAY...A WEAK UPPER TROUGH AND 
ABUNDANT SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE (PWS 2-2.25 INCHES) WITH NO CAP WILL 
ALLOW WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP. HEAVY RAINS 
ARE LIKELY WITH LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING POSSIBLE.

FOR SUNDAY...PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY REMAIN ACROSS THE 
AREA. A STRONGER UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW INCREASING AHEAD OF INCOMING FRONT. 
MODELS SHOW GREATEST INSTABILITY OVER MID AND LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY WITH SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE THERE DURING THE 
AFTERNOON. THIS AREA OF STORMS MOVING EAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA 
AND CONVECTION DEVELOPING ON LOW TERRAIN WILL CONTINUE HIGH CHANCES 
OF STORMS. THERE IS A POTENTIAL OF SEVERE STORMS OVER THE AREA.

FOR MONDAY...FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE AREA AS WELL AS UPPER TROUGH SO 
DECREASING CHANCES OF RAIN FROM EAST TO WEST WITH DRY CONDITIONS 
ANTICIPATED FOR MONDAY NIGHT.

DRIER AIR WILL BE IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY IN WAKE OF FRONTAL PASSAGE. PWAT VALUES DROP UNDER ONE 
INCH WITH DRIER AIR IN PLACE. UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO MOVE OFF TO 
THE EAST ON TUESDAY WHILE SURFACE RIDGING BEGINS BUILDING BACK IN 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUES THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT WED AUG 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...AIRMASS REMAINS MOIST AND HAS 
DESTABILIZED...ESPECIALLY ACROSS MIDDLE AND SE TN THIS AFTERNOON. 
DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION UNDERWAY AND WILL CONTINUE INTO THE 
EVENING HOURS. WEAK MID LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL AID IN DEVELOPMENT OF 
STORMS AS IT MOVE SE THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING. SMALL HAIL AND 
STRONG GUSTY WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. PATCHY OVERNIGHT VALLEY 
FOG EXPECTED. AIRMASS DRIES OUT SOME TONIGHT AND THURSDAY IN WAKE OF 
SHORT WAVE. CONVECTION WILL BE ISOLATED AND MAINLY ACROSS THE 
SMOKIES THURSDAY. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES RISE SOME ON 
THU...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SE TN. NAM MOS APPEARS TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH 
100F AT CHA AND WENT WITH A BLEND BETWEEN GFS AND NAM WHICH IS CLOSE 
TO 01/00Z ECMWF.     

.LONG TERM (TOMORROW NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...AN UPPER-RIDGE 
SITUATED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL GRADUALLY FLATTEN LATE THIS 
WEEK AND NUDGE EASTWARD...PROMOTING SOME WARMER TEMPERATURES FOR 
FRIDAY AS THE MERCURY SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE LOWER  90S IN MANY 
AREAS. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER AND A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
PASSING THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY...SOME FAIRLY REASONABLE CHANCES FOR 
SCATTERED STORMS WILL EXIST DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SOME 
ADDITIONAL DECENT THUNDER CHANCES WILL EXIST THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK AS THE AFOREMENTIONED RIDGE MOVES BACK TO THE WEST...AND A 
STRONG UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES PUSHES A 
FRONT TOWARD THE AREA SATURDAY EVENING INTO SUNDAY. THIS WILL RESULT 
IN THE BEST CHANCES FOR STORMS IN THE PERIOD SUNDAY INTO MONDAY AS 
THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS. HEADING 
INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...DRIER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AS 
ZONAL FLOW RETURNS AND THE RIDGE BUILDS BACK INTO THE REGION. SOME 
LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS WERE STILL REQUIRED GIVEN THE POTENTIAL FOR 
DIURNAL CONVECTION IN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER. HIGHS LOOK TO 
INCREASE FROM THE UPPER 80S EARLY IN THE WEEK TO THE LOW TO PERHAPS 
MID 90S IN SOME SPOTS BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT 
AVERAGE.  MOISTURE LOOKS LACKING FOR THURSDAY...AND SO WILL KEEP 
JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN AREAS.  BY FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY MOISTURE INCREASES AS TAIL END OF SOME SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY AFFECTS THE AREA.  A WEAK COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL THEN 
MOVE INTO THE REGION DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND. WILL 
CARRY CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST 
VALUES GENERALLY ON SUNDAY DUE TO PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT.  SOME 
DRYING FORECAST BY TUESDAY...SO WILL KEEP LAST PART OF FORECAST 
PRECIP FREE FOR NOW.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO 
WILL STAY CLOSE.

510 
FXUS64 KMRX 311914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT TUE JUL 31 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SKIES HAVE FOR THE MOST
PART BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON IN THE WAKE OF MCS THAT
STARTED THE DAY OFF OVER SE TN AND NORTHERN ALABAMA. TEMPERATURES
ROSE MORE MODESTLY AND REACHED THE MID TO UPPER 80S BY MID
AFTERNOON WITH HIGHER ELEVATION SITES AND LOCATIONS IN SW VA AND NE
TN ONLY IN THE 70S. CONVECTION HAS BEEN VERY LIMITED ACROSS TN BUT
HAS BEEN ISOLATED TO SCATTERED IN SW VA WITH A FEW STRONGER STORMS
THERE. THINK THERE WILL STILL BE 20 TO 30 PERCENT COVERAGE
ESPECIALLY THE NEXT FEW HOURS AS PEAK HEATING IS REACHED A LITTLE
LATER TODAY BEFORE ACTIVITY DISSIPATES THIS EVENING. HOWEVER NOT
MUCH AS FORMED YET ALONG BOUNDARIES LEFT BY CONVECTION THIS MORNING
IN THE SOUTH. NW FLOW ALOFT AROUND UPPER RIDGE TO THE WEST WILL
CONTINUE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. A SHORTWAVE OVER IN THIS AFTERNOON
SHOULD TRACK INTO KY EARLY TONIGHT AND INTO SW VA LATER TONIGHT.
WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN LONGER THIS REGION TONIGHT AND ELSEWHERE
ACTIVITY SHOULD END AROUND SUNSET. WEDNESDAY UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH WEKA SURFACE LOWER PRESSURE OVER THE TN
VALLEY. THE DEEPER MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE SOUTH BUT SOME LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE REMAINS OVER THE REGION. MORE WEAK IMPULSES MOVE SE FROM
THE OHIO VALLEY AND WILL LIKELY TRIGGER ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS
AND A LITTLE BETTER COVERAGE OVER SW VA. LOWS TONIGHT LOOK TO BE
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN LAST NIGHT WITH PATCHY FOG AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY
MUCH WARMER WITH MORE SUNSHINE IN THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN BASIC AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING THE NWLY FLOW ALOFT
UNTIL THE STRONG SHORTWAVE OUT OF CANADA SQUASHES THE UPPER PART OF
THE RIDGE WHICH CHANGES THE FLOW AND ALLOWS THE RIDGE TO SWELL
TEMPORARILY OVER US FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. HOWEVER...BY SUNDAY
THE SHORT WAVE PUSHES EASTWARD INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND DRAGS ITS
TAIL THROUGH OUR AREA. IN THE WAKE OF THE SHORT WAVE IT LOOKS LIKE
THE END OF THIS FORECAST PERIOD WILL SEE THE UPPER RIDGE TRYING TO
RE-ESTABLISH ITSELF.

LOOKS PRETTY QUIET NOW FOR THE EARLY PARTS OF THIS PERIOD...THE NEXT 
CHANCE FOR SOME POPS ACROSS A MAJORITY OF THE AREA LOOKS TO BE 
FRIDAY.  ALL MODELS AGREE ON A SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH THEN...BUT 
MOISTURE LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE MARGINAL...SO KEEPING POPS PRETTY LOW.

A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE AREA IN THE SUN/MON TIME 
FRAME.  LOOKS LIKE GOOD CHANCES OF SHOWERS/STORMS WHEN THE FRONT 
GETS CLOSE...JUST TIMING IS QUESTIONABLE RIGHT NOW...SO NOTHING 
ABOVE "CHANCE" POPS DURING THIS TIME PERIOD NOW.

FOR TEMPS...WENT BELOW GUIDANCE MORE ON SUNDAY--LOOKING LIKE THE 
BEST CHANCE FOR CLOUD COVER AND WET CONDITIONS ARE CENTERED ON 
SUNDAY.  WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR TIMING...BUT LOOKS LIKE AT LEAST 
PART OF THE AREA WILL GET PRETTY WET DURING A 48 HOUR WINDOW THAT 
I'VE CENTERED ON SUNDAY RIGHT NOW.

285 
FXUS64 KMRX 301922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT MON JUL 30 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MAIN WEATHER STORY FOR THE
SHORT-TERM IS A SHORT-WAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MID-SECTION
OF THE NATION. THIS WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING. MODELS SHOW
FAIRLY DECENT DIVERGENCE ALOFT WITH THIS SYSTEM. SPC ANALYSIS SHOWS
A VERY MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR-MASS ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY WHICH WILL FEED NORTHEAST INTO A WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY
ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE AND ALABAMA. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOWS THE
VERY MOIST...UNSTABLE AIR MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. THE STRONG UPPER LIFT WILL PRODUCE A
COMPLEX OF THUNDERSTORMS THAT WILL MOVE ACROSS MAINLY THE SOUTHERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

DUE TO THE EXPECTED INSTABILITY AND SHEAR...SOME OF THESE STORMS
COULD BE SEVERE LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING. ALSO...HIGHS PWS
(AOB 2 INCHES AND K INDICES OF 40+) WILL SET THE STAGE FOR HEAVY
RAINFALL. ISOLATED FLASH FLOODING PROBLEMS ARE POSSIBLE.

FOR TUESDAY...WAVE MOVES EAST...BUT INSTABILITY REMAINS. WILL COULD
SEE ADDITIONAL 20-30 PERCENT COVERAGE OF STORMS DURING THE
AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...FAIRLY BUSY NORTHWEST 
FLOW PATTERN FOR THE EARLY PARTS OF THIS PERIOD WITH THE 
UPPER HIGH CENTERED OVER W TX AND THE UPPER LOW OVER HUDSON BAY.  
THE PATTERN IS SLIGHTLY AFFECTED AS A CUT-OFF LOW MOVES EWD ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN TIER AND THE LOW'S SHORT WAVE APPROACHES AROUND OUR 
AREA SATURDAY AND LOOKS TO SETTLE INTO THE AREA AROUND 
SUNDAY...ALTHOUGH MUCH OF THE ENERGY OF THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO BE 
WANING AND IS MORE FOCUSED IN THE GREAT LAKES.  THE ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT LOOKS TO BE STRUGGLING TO MAKE IT HERE BY THE END OF THIS 
FORECAST PERIOD...BUT WILL BE IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD.

THE WAVE THAT IS CAUSING THE NEED FOR POPS TONIGHT AND TUESDAY WILL 
BE WELL SOUTH OF THE AREA BY TUESDAY EVENING...MODEL SOUNDINGS 
GENERALLY SHOW A MODERATE CAPPING INVERSION BY LATE TUESDAY AS 
WELL...SO GOING WITH DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY EVENING.  WILL KEEP 
THINGS DRY UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON WHEN NEXT CLIPPER-TYPE SYSTEM IS 
DUE TO RACE THROUGH THE AREA THAT NIGHT...THEN POPS RIGHT THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND AS LIFT AND MOISTURE GATHER OVER MUCH OF THE SE US. BY 
THE VERY END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...MOISTURE MAY BE SLIDING EAST 
OF THE AREA...BUT STILL A LONG WAY OFF.

FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY GOING A LITTLE ON THE COOL SIDE OF HIGH 
TEMPS...BUT LITTLE ADJUSTMENT TO MID TEMPS.

&&

UNCERTAIN...APPEARS BEST CHANCES WILL BE AFTER MIDNIGHT AND SOUTHERN

LOW CHANCE NORTH LATE TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.       

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHOULD BE AN ACTIVE PERIOD 
FOLLOWING A RELATIVELY QUIET WEEKEND AS THE ATMOSPHERE REALLY 
DOESN'T WANT TO RECONFIGURE FOR ANY LENGTHY PERIOD. A MEAN UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL STAY IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN STATES WITH JUST A 
BIT OF DE-AMPLIFICATION AROUND THURSDAY. NICE LOOKING SHORT WAVE 
BUILDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND MODELS SEEM TO BE IN 
AGREEMENT THAT THE MAIN FORCING WITH THE WAVE WILL BE DURING THE 
MORNING AS THE FEATURE SHIFTS OFF TO THE SOUTHEAST. ADJUSTED POP TO 
LIKELY CATEGORY FOR MOST OF THE AREA WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE 
CONVECTION WITH THE HEALTHY LOOKING SYSTEM. DROPPED POPS BACK TO LOW 
OR SLIGHT CHANCE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WITH MODELS INDICATING 
SOME TRAILING...WEAKER ENERGY STREAMING IN ON THE PREVAILING 
NORTHWEST FLOW. BY THURSDAY MODELS POINT TOWARD A LITTLE DRIER AND 
LESS UNSTABLE AIRMASS ACROSS THE REGION SO ADJUSTED POPS BACK 
ACCORDINGLY. PERHAPS ANOTHER WEAK FEATURE SWINGS EAST ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY ON FRIDAY BUT BETTER CHANCE FOR MORE ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION MAY DEVELOP OVER THE WEEKEND WITH MODELS POINTING TOWARD 
A COUPLE STRONGER LOOKING SHORT WAVE SYSTEMS RIDING SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH A SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY 
EDGING SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. 
CONCERNING TEMPERATURE FORECAST GENERALLY ADJUSTED MAX TEMPS BACK A 
DEGREE OR SO EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHILE MORE AGGRESSIVELY LOWERING 
HIGH TEMPERATURES WHICH APPEAR TO BE TOO WARM FROM THURSDAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND WITH THE MORE ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN WHICH FEATURES TRANSIT 
OF NUMEROUS UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVELENGTH SYSTEMS. ALSO RAISED MIN 
TEMPS A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES FROM SOUTH TO NORTH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA LATER IN THE FORECAST PERIOD IN EXPECTED GRADUALLY 
MOISTENING WEATHER PATTERN.

NEUTRAL ADVECTION...LOW SHOULD BE MAINLY IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S 
TONIGHT. THE CAPPING INVERSION IN PLACE TODAY WILL BE WEAKENED 
TOMORROW ACROSS THE NORTH. DIFFULENT UPPER LEVEL FLOW AT THE NOSE OF 
THE JET IN NORTHERN SECTIONS ALONG WITH SLIGHTLY FALLING MIDLEVEL 
HEIGHTS AND TEMPS SHOULD AID THE A CHANCE OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS NORTH. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SUGGEST A WEAK CAP WILL 
REMAIN IN PLACE FOR SOUTHERN SECTIONS. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
NOT MUCH CHANGE TO CURRENT FORECAST AS MODELS BRING SHORT WAVES INTO 
THE TN VALLEY REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS WEAK FRONT TO THE 
SOUTH SHIFTS BACK TO THE NORTH ENHANCING SHOWER DEVELOPMENT OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THEN WEDNESDAY SOME DRYING ACROSS SOUTHERN SECTIONS 
AND SMALLER SHORTWAVE FEATURE DEVELOPS SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTH. 
THURSDAY MAY BE A DRY DAY FOR MOST OF THE AREA STILL BETWEEN 
SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVES BUT FOR NOW LOWERED POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE 
NORTH AND CHANCE EXTREME SOUTH. FRIDAY AND SATURDAY MORE SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY SHOULD INCREASE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES ONCE AGAIN. 
UPPER TROUGH STAYS OVER THE EASTERN STATES AND UPPER FLOW REMAINS 
OUT OF THE NW SO NOT THAT CONFIDENT IN TIMING OF SYSTEMS FOR THE 
EXTENDED. FROM THE FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY PERIOD ECMWF AND GFS HINT 
AT RIDGE STRENGTHENING AGAIN OVER THE TN VALLEY WHICH COULD SYSTEMS 
TO THE NW STAYING NORTH IN THE OHIO VALLEY AND SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS MORE DIURNALLY DRIVEN AND FAVORING THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES TUESDAY WITH MORE CLOUDS 
AND PRECIPITATION MOUNTAINS AND NORTH AND THEN A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. MIN TEMPS WARMER THAN THE LAST COUPLE OF 
NIGHTS FOR THE TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY PERIOD MAINLY UPPER 60S TO 
LOWER 70S AS MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER INCREASES.

FURTHER EAST WHICH MAY END UP SUPPRESSING CONVECTION AND THEREFORE

CHANCE POP ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES. MAV CONTINUES TO SUGGEST

STAYED CLOSER TO MET MOS FOR MAXES EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT ALSO 
STAYED BELOW MEX MOS GUIDANCE MAXES THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE 
FORECAST. ADJUSTED MIN TEMPS A LITTLE HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE FROM

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...

SHOULD DROP DEWPOINTS INTO THE LOWER 60S AREA WIDE...WHICH SHOULD 
MAKE FOR A MORE COMFORTABLE DAY. 1000-850 THICKNESSES ARE A BIT 
LOWER TOMORROW...SO HIGH TEMPS SHOULD BE SLIGHTLY COOLER...IN THE 
MID 80S TO LOWER 90S. DRY MIDLEVEL AIR IN THE DEEP NW FLOW AND A 
STRONG CAPPING INVERSION AROUND 800 MB SHOULD PREVENT ANY CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT BEYOND JUST SCATTERED CU.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...

EVENING AND SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL 
ALLOW FOR LOWER TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S. CHANGES BEGIN TO RETURN 
MONDAY WITH MODELS SHOWING POSSIBLE MCS ACTIVITY OVER THE LOWER OHIO 
VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND THEN MOVING INTO MIDDLE TN MONDAY POSSIBLY 
REACHING EAST TN IN THE AFTERNOON MONDAY. RIGHT NOW HAVE HIGHEST 
RAIN CHANCES MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE ELSEWHERE. MAY HAVE TO RAISE POPS EVERYWHERE IF THIS 
SCENARIO LOOKS MORE LIKELY. COOL FRONT DISSIPATES BY MONDAY AND 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY INCREASES FROM THE NW STARTING MONDAY NIGHT 
REINFORCING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES AND CONTINUING 
THROUGH FRIDAY. A WEAK FRONT TO THE NORTH DOES NOT EVER MAKE IT 
SOUTH BUT THE NW FLOW ALOFT REGIME WILL KEEP FORECAST AREA IN PATH 
FOR DISTURBANCES MOVING THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH POSSIBLY A BREAK 
THURSDAY AND INCREASING AGAIN FRIDAY. RIDGING FROM THE WEST FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY MAY DECREASE THE RAIN CHANCES SOME IN THE 
SOUTHWEST BUT SHORTWAVE ENERGY STILL BRUSHES ACROSS THE NORTH. UPPER 
TROUGH WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD.

HIGHER MET NUMBERS MOST AREAS FOR TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE PERIOD STARTS OUT DRY 
SUNDAY WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY JUST SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. BY 
MONDAY THE ATMOSPHERE INCREMENTALLY MOISTENS AND DESTABILIZES ENOUGH 
FOR CONVECTION TO FORM ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES SO WENT WITH A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP HERE WHILE OPTING TO KEEP THE GREAT VALLEY DRY. 
THE PREVAILING EASTERN U.S. LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL ACTUALLY DEEPEN A 
LITTLE DURING THE WORK WEEK AS MODELS SHOW SEVERAL VORTICITY MAXIMA 
SHIFTING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE NEVER ENDING 
NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN ALOFT. CONVERGENCE OF MODEL SOLUTIONS STILL 
TARGET THE PERIOD TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY FOR THE BEST CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION WITH THE PASSAGE OF A COUPLE HEALTHY LOOKING SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH SYSTEMS. IN KEEPING WITH HOLDING A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE 
MEX MOS GUIDANCE POPS AND THE POSSIBILITY OF A SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY AS 
WELL AS ANOTHER VORT OR TWO PROGRESSING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION...STAYED WITH A LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPS SUNDAY AND MONDAY AND TWEAKED MAXES BACK SLIGHTLY 
DURING MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM. WENT RELATIVELY CLOSE 
TO MINS EXCEPT OVER NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES 
APPEARED TO BE JUST A LITTLE TOO OPTIMISTICALLY COOL.  

&&

990 
FXUS64 KMRX 271914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT FRI JUL 27 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SOUTHERN AREAS WILL 
HAVE THE GREATEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS BOTH K AND 
LIFTED INDICIES INDICATE PLENTY OF INSTABILITY TO BE HAD THERE. 
ONGOING PRECIP IS OCCURRING AHEAD OF A MIDLEVEL SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH...AND SATELLITE INDICATES DRYING WILL ENTER THE AREA THROUGH 
THE EVENING BEHIND THE TROUGH AXIS. A DRY PERIOD FROM MIDNIGHT TO 
ABOUT 4AM IS EXPECTED...THEN A SECOND TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE AREA 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. MODELS SHOW A VORT MAX CROSSING NORTHERN AREAS 
SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY AFTERNOON...WITH THE JET ENTRANCE REGION 
LOCATED OVER WV. THE NAM IS MORE BULLISH ON POPS WITH THIS TROUGH 
THAN THE DRIER GFS...BUT THE NAM IS SUPPORTED BY THE CANADIAN AND 
THE SREF. WHILE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL BE MORE LIMITED 
TOMORROW WITH THIS TROUGH COMPARED TO TODAY...CHANCE POPS SEEM 
REASONABLE ACROSS THE NORTH WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL. THE TROUGH 
AXIS/SURFACE FRONT SHOULD MOVE JUST EAST OF OUR AREA BY 00Z SUN.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
AS COOL FRONT SETTLES JUST EAST AND SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT SATURDAYS SHOWER ACTIVITY SHOULD SHIFT INTO NORTH GA 
AND WESTERN NC BY EVENING. SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR MASS WILL REMAIN OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY AND WILL KEEP RAIN OUT. THE WESTERN HOT 
RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED FAR TO THE WEST AND IF ANY WEAK DISTURBANCES 
MOVE DOWN FROM THE NW ISOLATED STORMS MAY HAVE TO BE INTRODUCED IN 
LATER FORECASTS. NOT MUCH CHANGE IN HIGH TEMPERATURES AS DRIER AIR 
MASS AND SUNSHINE SHOULD WARM TEMPERATURES BACK TO MID 80S NORTH TO 
LOWER 90S SOUTH. LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WILL HOWEVER DROP 
INTO THE 60S TO NEAR 70 AT CHA. WEAK DISTURBANCES IN NW FLOW ALOFT 
MONDAY COULD SET OFF ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH BETTER 
CHANCE IN THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS. THEN LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY 
MORE SHORTWAVE ENERGY TO INCREASE CLOUDS AND THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS. 
ANOTHER WEAK FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY 
AS BERMUDA HIGH OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST BRINGS MOISTURE NORTH.  
SCATTERED AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS RETURN AS 
UPPER TROUGH STAYS OVER THE EASTERN STATES AND UPPER RIDGE STAYS 
WELL TO THE WEST. UPPER RIDGE TRIES TO BUILD WEST FRIDAY BUT KEPT 
CHANCE POPS IN FORECAST. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GUIDANCE WITH HIGHS 
UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S ONLY 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.   

UPPER TROUGH SETS UP MAKES PROGRESS FROM THE EASTERN LAKES AND MID 
SOUTH TO NEW ENGLAND AND MID ATLANTIC COAST BY 12Z SUNDAY. 
ATMOSPHERE DRIES OUT QUITE A BIT OVER MUCH OF THE AREA BUT SOME 
LINGERING DEEPER MOISTURE AND A WEAK SHORT WAVE MAY SPARK A SHOWER 
OR THUNDERSTORM OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE 
NORTH CAROLINA BORDER SO MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP HERE. 
NORTHWEST FLOW WITH DRY ADVECTION ON SUNDAY ALLOWS FOR A DRY DAY 
WITH SOME LOWER DEWPOINTS FOR A CHANGE. GRADUALLY RAISE POPS THROUGH 
THE WORK WEEK AS MODELS REVEAL NUMEROUS SHORT WAVELENGTH TROUGHS 
MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE PREVAILING 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW COMPLIMENTS OF THE PERSISTENT LONG WAVE TROUGH 
OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WHILE LOW LEVELS MOISTEN A BIT ON A RETURN 
WESTERLY FLOW. WENT WITH HIGHEST POP FOR CONVECTION ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY WITH MODELS INDICATING AN MCS OR TWO DROPPING INTO THE 
AREA DURING THIS PERIOD. RAISED PROBABILITY TO LOW CHANCE ON 
THURSDAY WITH MEX MOS GUIDANCE HANGING ONTO A POP ALMOST 20 
PERCENTAGE POINTS ABOVE CLIMO. WENT JUST A LITTLE BELOW MOS MAX 
TEMPS EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH MAV/MEX TOO WARM FOR THE PAST FEW 
DAYS WHILE HOLDING CLOSE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD. 

&&

.DISCUSSION...
THE NAM SEEMS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE LOCATION OF THE SHOWERS
THAT HAVE DEVELOPED IN KY THIS MORNING. PROJECTED MOVEMENT OF THE
SHOWERS TO THE SE BRINGS THEM TO OUR NE BORDER AROUND 17-18Z. UPPER
LEVEL FORCING FOR LIFT REMAINS QUITE WEAK...ESPECIALLY IN SOUTHERN
SECTIONS. HOWEVER INCREASING INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD
RESULT IN ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT ON THE SOUTHERN END OF THE
CONVECTIVE LINE. POPS WILL BE ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY TO FOCUS ON
NORTHERN AREAS FROM NOON TO 20Z...THEN SOUTHERN AREAS FROM 20Z TO
00Z. SLIGHT TEMPERATURE ADJUSTMENTS WILL ALSO BE MADE...RAISING
SOUTHERN AREAS A DEGREE TO TWO TO ACCOUNT FOR FULL SUN THIS MORNING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT FRI JUL 27 2012

.SHORT TERM...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE MOVING THROUGH THE WLY TO NWLY MID
LEVEL FLOW THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO THE AREA. WOULD EXPECT STORMS TO
DEVELOP ON THE PLATEAU AND MOVE EWD OUT INTO THE VALLEY DURING THE
AFTERNOON...DUE TO THE STEERING FLOW AS WELL AS THE PUSH FROM THE
DISTURBANCE. THIS DISTURBANCE IS NOT EASILY DISCERNED...BUT CAN BE
INFERRED THROUGH MID LEVEL RH ORIENTATION AND SREF PRECIP
ORIENTATION.

MODELS AGREE ON WEAK WAVE HAVING ENOUGH ORGANIZATION TO POTENTIALLY 
DEVELOP A LINE OF CONVECTION...THAT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA TO THE 
ESE. SREF SUPPORTS THIS IDEA...AND HAS VERY GOOD CONFIDENCE POPS FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON...SAGGING FARTHER AND FARTHER SOUTH WITH WAVE.

SEVERE THREAT EXPECTED TO BE RELATIVELY WEAK...MAINLY LIMITED TO 
ISOLATED DAMAGING DOWNDRAFTS.  WIND SHEAR WILL BE WEAK...FOCUSED 
MORE TO THE NORTH...BUT MLCAPE VALUES WILL APPROACH 1500 J/KG SOUTH 
AND 1000 NORTH.  

WITH PRECIP MOVING OUT AND SKIES SLOWLY CLEARING TONIGHT...HAD 
THOUGHT FOG MIGHT BE A THREAT...HOWEVER...FEEL THAT FOG WILL BE 
PRETTY LIMITED OVERALL AS PRE-FRONTAL SOUTHWEST WINDS MAY KEEP 
THINGS STIRRED UP ENOUGH PREVENT SIGNIFICANT FOG...SO WILL LEAVE THE 
MENTION OF IT OUT.

WENT A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE ON HIGH TEMPS 
TODAY...THINKING THAT CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURE WILL BE MET AT A LOW 
ENOUGH TEMPERATURE TO KEEP THINGS FROM GETTING QUITE AS HOT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEAK COOL FRONT SLIPS 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY AS UPPER TROUGH MAKES PROGRESS 
FROM THE EASTERN LAKES AND MID SOUTH TO NEW ENGLAND AND MID ATLANTIC 
COAST BY 12Z SUNDAY. ATMOSPHERE DRIES OUT QUITE A BIT OVER MUCH OF 
THE AREA BUT SOME LINGERING DEEPER MOISTURE AND A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
MAY SPARK A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER SO MAINTAINED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP HERE. NORTHWEST FLOW WITH DRY ADVECTION ON SUNDAY ALLOWS 
FOR A DRY DAY WITH SOME LOWER DEWPOINTS FOR A CHANGE. GRADUALLY 
RAISE POPS THROUGH THE WORK WEEK AS MODELS REVEAL NUMEROUS SHORT 
WAVELENGTH TROUGHS MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE 
PREVAILING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW COMPLIMENTS OF THE PERSISTENT LONG 
WAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WHILE LOW LEVELS MOISTEN A BIT ON 
A RETURN WESTERLY FLOW. WENT WITH HIGHEST POP FOR CONVECTION ON 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH MODELS INDICATING AN MCS OR TWO DROPPING 
INTO THE AREA DURING THIS PERIOD. RAISED PROBABILITY TO LOW CHANCE 
ON THURSDAY WITH MEX MOS GUIDANCE HANGING ONTO A POP ALMOST 20

MOVING TO THE E OR NE...SO IT WOULD MAINLY THREATEN KCHA. CLOUD TOP
TEMPS HOLDING PRETTY COLD AND WESTERN EDGE ON SATL IMAGES KEEPS

209 
FXUS64 KMRX 261921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT THU JUL 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THE RIDGE THAT HAS BEEN OVER THE AREA THE PAST FEW DAYS IS MOVING
EAST...AND A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL BE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE AREA
THROUGH FRIDAY. A WESTERLY FLOW FROM 925-700 MB WILL PREVENT DEEP
MOISTURE FROM ADVECTING INTO THE AREA...AND FORCING FOR LIFT WILL
BE WEAK. THUNDERSTORMS THAT ARE EXPECTED TONIGHT OVER KY WILL
LIKELY WEAKEN. THUS POPS FOR LATE TONIGHT AND FRIDAY WILL
BE IN THE CHANCE RANGE...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES NORTH FRIDAY
MORNING...THEN SHIFTING TO THE SOUTH IN THE LATE AFTERNOON.
INSTABILITY LOOKS SUFFICIENT FOR A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE STORMS ON
FRIDAY. THE NAM AND GFS SHOW A SECOND VORT MAX APPROACHING NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT THE GFS DOES NOT PRODUCE
MUCH OF ANY PRECIP WITH IT. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP NORTH
THROUGH THE NIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
MODELS BRING A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY
MORNING. THE PRE FRONTAL CONVECTION SHOULD BE THROUGH THE FORECAST
AREA. A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT
SATURDAY MORNING. DRIER AIRMASS BEHIND THE FRONT WILL KEEP MOST OF
THE FORECAST ARE DRY. HOWEVER LINGERING MOISTURE IN THE MOUNTAINS
MAY BE ENOUGH FOR ISOLATED STORMS LATER IN THE DAY SO KEPT SLIGHT
CHANCE ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT DRY
AS FRONT MOVES SOUTH TO NEAR GULF COAST AND NW FLOW KEEPS DRIER
FLOW OVER THE REGION. THIS WILL AFFECT MAINLY LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT
AND SUNDAY NIGHT. LOWS WILL BE MOSTLY 60S. HIGHS SATURDAY UPPER 80S
TO LOWER 90S AND SUNDAY MID 80S TO LOWER 90S. NW FLOW PATTERN
PERSISTS MONDAY AND WITH WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING SE INTO THE
FORECAST AREA ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE. FROM
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY UPPER RIDGE STAYS CENTERED TO THE WEST.
ALSO COOL FRONT TO THE SOUTH DISSIPATES ALLOWING FOR WINDS TO
SWITCH DIRECTION BRINGING MORE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE NORTH. AT THE
SAME TIME SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES DOWN FROM THE NW INCREASING
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AND REINFORCING THE UPPER
TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES.

EXPECTING FOG AT TRI DUE TO LIGHT WINDS OVERNIGHT COMBINED WITH
INCREASING CLOUD COVER. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TOMORROW
WITH THE COLD FRONT...ARRIVING AT TRI AROUND 14Z...KNOXVILLE
16Z...AND CHA 18Z.

401 AM EDT THU JUL 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT OBSERVATIONS AND SATELLITE

TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES
LOOKED REASONABLE FOR TODAY SO STAYED CLOSE. A FRONT APPROACHING
THE REGION TONIGHT BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.
WILL CONTINUE WITH THE HIGHEST PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR THE
WESTERN COUNTIES AND AFTER MIDNIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED
REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT AS WELL...SO STAYED CLOSE AGAIN.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A FAIRLY STRONG (FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR) UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH PUSHING A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA
SATURDAY MORNING. PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION AHEAD OF THIS FRONTAL
BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY
MORNING...WITH ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT EXPECTED ON
FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO
DEVELOP. THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ALSO BEGINS TO AMPLIFY OVER THE
OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...SO WILL PLAN TO
MENTION LIKELY POPS FOR FRIDAY. THIS WEAK COLD FRONT SHOULD FINALLY
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY MORNING...BUT WILL ONLY
MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS DUE TO THE TIMING OF THE FRONT WHICH
PREVENTS MUCH DAYTIME HEATING FOR CONVECTION. IT APPEARS THAT THIS
COLD FRONT WILL NOT BRING MUCH OF A DROP IN TEMPS BEHIND
IT...EXCEPT FOR LOWER MINS AT NIGHT DUE TO THE SLIGHTLY LOWER
DEWPOINTS IN THE DRIER AIR MASS. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THEN LINGERS
OVER THE FORECAST AREA INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WHICH COULD CAUSE
SOME ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE CLUSTERS OVER THE MID MS OR LOWER OHIO
RIVER VALLEYS TO SNEAK INTO THE FORECAST AREA. FOR NOW...WILL
CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR SUNDAY DUE TO THE FRONTAL
PASSAGE...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT WHEN
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY BEGIN TO INCREASE AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING
WARM FRONT. THIS WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT INTO THE
FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A SLIGHTLY
BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND
CLOSE THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT
WILL BE COOLER THAN GUIDANCE FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WHEN AN
INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND CONVECTION IS EXPECTED.

901 
FXUS64 KMRX 251945
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EDT WED JUL 25 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS HAVE POPPED UP IN SW VA. MUCH OF THE AREA 
REMAINS CAPPED THIS AFTERNOON...AND COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN 
ISOLATED THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON...WITH ANY SHOWERS 
DISSIPATING BY SUNSET. WILL NOT CARRY ANY POPS FOR THE FIRST 
PERIOD...BUT WILL MENTION ISOLATED SHOWERS NORTH IN A PRE-FIRST 
PERIOD. PATCHY FOG COULD DEVELOP NORTH WHERE GROUND MOISTURE IS 
HIGHER FROM RAINFALL LAST NIGHT AND DEWPOINTS ARE HOLDING IN THE 
LOWER 70S. 

ON THURSDAY A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE CROSSING THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION...WITH HIGH PRESSURE LOCATED OVER THE NORTHERN GULF OF 
MEXICO. THE RESULTING PRESSURE GRADIENT SHOULD BRING SW WINDS OF 
10-15 MPH TOMORROW AFTERNOON. THE MIDLEVEL RIDGE AXIS TO OUR WEST 
TODAY WILL SHIFT EASTWARD TOMORROW...SO THE CAP IS EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE TO HELP SUPPRESS CONVECTION TOMORROW AFTERNOON.  WITH HIGHS 
IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S AND DEWPOINTS AROUND 70...HEAT INDEX VALUES 
ARE EXPECTED TO REACH BETWEEN 100 AND 105 IN THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN TN VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS FORECAST PERIOD A COLD FRONT IS HEADED TOWARD THE AREA...ALONG
WITH AN ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH. LOOKS LIKE THU NIGHT AND INTO
FRIDAY MORNING CONVECTION WILL BE MARCHING TOWARD THE AREA FROM THE
NORTHWEST. THE UPPER SUPPORT FOR THIS CONVECTION WILL BE WANING AND
THE CONVECTION WILL BE STRAYING PRETTY FAR AWAY FROM THE FRONT...SO
THINKING THAT CONVECTION WILL BE LIMPING INTO THE AREA AND MAY FADE
AS IT COMES OFF THE PLATEAU...LIKE WE SEE VERY OFTEN DURING THE
MORNING IN THESE SCENARIOS.

MODELS NOT IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON ACTUAL FRONTAL PASSAGE.  MODELS 
AGREE THAT FRONT WILL BE NW OF AREA AT 12Z FRIDAY AND BY 12Z SUNDAY 
THAT THE FRONT WILL BE S AND E OF THE AREA AND THE SURFACE RIDGE 
WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE AREA.  FOR SATURDAY...EVEN IF FRONT IS NOT 
QUITE THROUGH...SURFACE FLOW SHOULD BE VEERED AROUND ENOUGH THAT 
FOCUS WILL BE EAST OF MOUNTAINS...SO NOT THAT SIGNIFICANT WITH 
REGARD TO PRECIP...BUT MORE FOR MIN TEMPS...ONCE RIDGE BUILDS IN 
SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL DRY OUT A LITTLE AND ALLOW LOWER MIN TEMPS BY 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNINGS.  SO GOING A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR 
MINS SATURDAY MORNING AND GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
MORNINGS.  

GOING WITH A DRY FORECAST ACROSS THE AREA UNTIL TUESDAY WHEN RETURN 
FLOW SHOULD GET THINGS UNSTABLE OVER THE PLATEAU...AND NW UPPER FLOW 
SHOULD AID IN BRINGING STORMS OVER THE VALLEY.

WHILE GOING CLOSER TO THE SOMEWHAT COOLER MET MAXES ON WEDNESDAY AS 
GUIDANCE SEEMS TO BE RUNNING JUST A BIT TOO WARM.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RIDGING SURFACE AND 
ALOFT OVER THE AREA THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY. HIGH HUMIDITY REMAINS IN 
PLACE. ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION POSSIBLE WED AND THU. UPPER FLOW 
BECOMES INCREASINGLY SW ON THU AS BROAD TROUGHING BEGINS TO SHIFT S 
INTO THE TN VALLEY. WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGS SOUTH INTO THE AREA 
ON FRI. WIDESPREAD CONVECTION SOUTH OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD TAKE 
SHAPE OVER THE TN VALLEY AND POSSIBLY TRAIN OVER CERTAIN LOCATIONS 
DUE TO PARALLEL FLOW. WEAKLY COUPLED JETS MAY ALSO ADD TO STRENGTH 
AND DEVELOPMENT OF STORMS. UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO DIG SE WITH 
AXIS MOVING EAST OF THE AREA ON SAT. SOME DRYING THROUGH THE LAYER 
WILL LEAD TO REDUCED PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL AND LEANED TOWARD HIGH 
SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE.

TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF  
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
HOURS. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY PUSHES INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY PROVIDING 
A BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE AREA. THE GFS 
IS FASTER THAN THE ECMWF IN PUSHING THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE 
SOUTH ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...WILL GO WITH CONTINUITY AND KEEP THE 
LOW CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION FOR THE WEEKEND. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH 
TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWER 
AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. TEMPERATURE 
WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

SHORTWAVE ENERGY WILL RIDE ALONG THE BACKSIDE OF THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY/SOUTHEAST U.S. UPPER RIDGE. ATMOSPHERE SHOULD BE SUFFICIENTLY 
UNSTABLE AGAIN WITH MORE THAN ADEQUATE MOISTURE AND INTENSE HEATING 
IN ADVANCE OF A COLD FRONT THAT SHOULD MAKE DECENT PROGRESS INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY BY EVENING. STORMS MAY ALSO BECOME ORGANIZED WITH 
STRONGER UPPER LEVEL FLOW BUILDING IN WITH TIGHTENING HEIGHT 
GRADIENT. SEVERE CONVECTION IS A POSSIBILITY IN THIS ENVIRONMENT. 
STAYED CLOSE TO BLEND OF MOS FOR TEMPERATURES.     

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WARM AND HUMID 
CONDITIONS CONTINUE EARLY IN THE PERIOD. HIGH PWAT VALUES AND 
SURFACE DEWPOINT IN THE 70S REMAIN IN PLACE. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL BY THU. BROAD UPPER TROUGH TAKING SHAPE OVER 
THE NORTHEAST QUADRANT OF THE CONUS AND BY FRI WILL DIG SOUTH INTO 
THE TN VALLEY. BETTER THAN NORMAL PRECIPITATION CHANCES FAVOR AREA 
NEAR THE KY AND SW VA BORDERS EARLY IN THE PERIOD. ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION A GOOD BET FOR FRIDAY AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDES S INTO 
THE AREA WITH SOME UPPER SUPPORT. UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH 
LATER FRIDAY EARLY SAT DRYING OUT THE LAYER. SURFACE DEW POINTS WILL 
LOWER INTO THE 60S MOST AREAS. PRECIPITATION CHANCES FALL TO BELOW 
NORMAL FOR THE LATER HALF OF THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
TEMPERATURE WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL.

271 
FXUS64 KMRX 230752
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON JUL 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
WILL AGAIN DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH THE 
GREATEST INSTABILITY LOCATED OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. 
UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS APPEAR TO BE WEAK...WITH YESTERDAY'S SURFACE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY PRETTY MUCH DISSIPATED. THUS...WILL ONLY MENTION 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MOST EVERYWHERE TODAY...WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER 
POPS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN WHERE HIGHER INSTABILITY AND 
A STRONGER MID-LEVEL WIND FLOW SHOULD ENCOURAGE A BETTER COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WITH TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO 
HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE 
ON THE RISE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AS A COUPLE OF MINOR UPPER-LEVEL 
DISTURBANCE ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG STORM SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS 
EASTERN CANADA PASS TO THE NORTH AND EAST OF THE REGION. THE 
INCREASED LIFT FROM THESE SHORTWAVES WILL HELP TO KICK OFF SOME 
ORGANIZED ACTIVITY ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY/EASTERN KENTUCKY...WHICH 
WILL AT LEAST MAKE IT'S WAY INTO THE EASTERN HALF OF THE MRX CWA BY 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS DURING THIS TIME FRAME. THIS 
ACTIVITY WILL ALSO COINCIDE WITH ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNAL 
CONVECTION THAT SHOULD BE ABLE TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGION EACH DAY 
/GIVEN THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE PRESENT ACROSS THE REGION/. WITH VERY 
HIGH PWATS VALUES...THE THREAT FOR HEAVY RAINFALL WILL EXIST EACH 
DAY UNDERNEATH ANY STORMS THAT DO DEVELOP. PROGGED INSTABILITY 
PARAMETERS WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO LOCALLY 
SEVERE CONVECTION EACH DAY...WITH DAMAGING WIND GUSTS BEING THE 
PRIMARY THREAT GIVEN THE INVERTED-V SOUNDING PROFILES EXHIBITED BY 
FORECAST MODELS.

A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO SLIDE BACK 
TOWARD MIDDLE TENNESSEE BY THURSDAY...SQUASHING POPS SOMEWHAT AND 
CREATING THE POTENTIAL FOR WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 90S IN 
MANY AREAS /WITH SOME LOCATIONS ACROSS SE TENNESSEE REACHING THE 
UPPER 90S/. FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...MODELS ARE INDICATING ANOTHER 
COLD FRONT DROPPING SOUTH OUT OF THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND 
POTENTIALLY THROUGH THE AREA...BRINGING WITH IT A BETTER CHANCE FOR 
MORE WIDESPREAD THUNDERSTORMS TO CLOSE OUT THE WORK WEEK. WHILE 
THERE ARE STILL SOME DIFFERENCES IN TIMING...GUIDANCE IS BEGINNING 
TO SHOW SOME CONTINUITY OF THE GREATEST POTENTIAL BEING FRIDAY INTO 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BEFORE THINGS BEGIN TO TAPER OFF ON SATURDAY. GIVEN 
THIS...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO 40-50 PERCENT AREAWIDE DURING THIS 
TIME PERIOD. IN WAKE OF THE FROPA...MODELS SHOW A SURFACE HIGH 
BUILDING BACK INTO THE AREA...RESULTING IN SLIGHTLY WARMER 
TEMPERATURES AND A MAINLY DRY FORECAST TO CLOSE OUT THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   92  73  96  74  97 /  20  20  20  10  20

564 
FXUS64 KMRX 221918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT SUN JUL 22 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CONVECTION CONTINUES TO BE
CONFINED TO ALONG THE TN/KY AND TN/VA LINE THIS AFTERNOON. THIS
CONVERGENCE IS EITHER ASSOCIATED WITH REMNANTS OF WEAK SURFACE
FRONT OR WEAK TROUGH AT 850 MBS. DECENT COVERAGE OF GENERALLY WEAK 
TSRA ACROSS THIS AREA...SO I OPTED FOR A LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD WITH
CHANCE POPS SW VA/NE TN.

LATER TONIGHT...EXPECT THIS CONVECTION TO BE DIMINISHING WITH
POTENTIAL FOR PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT...AS ANY AREAS OF CONVECTIVE
DEBRIS CLOUDS DISSIPATE. A MOS BLEND OF MINS WAS VERY CLOSE TO
PERSISTENCE FOR LOWS. 

MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY CERTAINLY LINGERS AGAIN MONDAY...BUT OTHER
THAN OROGRAPHIC LIFT...NOT SURE HOW MUCH TSRA POPS UP BY THE
AFTERNOON HOURS. PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS WERE REASONABLE AND IN LINE
WITH NWS NEIGHBORS...SO JUST MINOR TWEAKS STAYING WITHIN 20 TO 30
PERCENT RANGE FOR NOW. OUR GROUND HAS BECOME QUITE MOIST GIVEN THE
GENEROUS RAINFALL SO FAR FOR THE MONTH OF JULY...AND WE HAVE SEEN
TEMPS STRUGGLE TO REACH THE WARMER MOS HIGHS EACH DAY. THUS...I CUT
MONDAY HIGHS BACK AT LEAST A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW GFS MOS
ACROSS THE BOARD.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED
WITH THE EXTENDED FORECAST THINKING. BEING ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF
AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP THINGS ON THE
WARMER-THAN-NORMAL SIDE FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. WE WILL
PROBABLY DO BATTLE AT TIMES WITH MCS ACTIVITY DROPPING SOUTHEAST
OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY...MORE LIKELY FOCUSSING ON SW VA AND
ADJACENT AREAS. STILL LOOKS LIKE ONE OR TWO ROUNDS IN THE TUES/WED
TIME FRAME...THEN ONCE AGAIN DURING THE LATE-WEEK TIME FRAME. MODEL
DISCREPANCIES CAST A SHADOW OF UNCERTAINTY OVER THE LATE WEEK
OPPORTUNITY...SO WILL GENERALLY CARRY POPS FOR FRI AT A 30-50 PCT
RANGE...THEN 20-40 PCT FOR SAT.

THE SW PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA /CHATTANOOGA REGION/ WILL BE
SOMEWHAT TUCKED AWAY FROM THE PROJECTED STORM FLOW...WE'LL SEE...
THUS A BIT HOTTER THERE WITH MORE OF A POPCORN TSTM REGIME CAN BE
EXPECTED THERE. 


&&

127 
FXUS64 KMRX 220803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
403 AM EDT SUN JUL 22 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY
GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAIN/PLATEAU RANGE...WITH A VERY
MOIST AIR MASS STILL LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS
INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP OVER THE
FORECAST AREA AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON... BUT SOME UPPER-LEVEL
SUBSIDENCE SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION.
THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION ONLY ISOLATED CONVECTION FOR TODAY AND
TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO GENERALLY FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE
FORECAST WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT...AND WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER
WITH MAXES FOR TODAY SINCE IT APPEARS THAT THE MOIST GROUND HAS
KEPT TEMPS A LITTLE COOLER THAN GUIDANCE LATELY.

.LONG TERM /TOMORROW THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT/...
AN ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN IS EXPECTED DURING THE UPCOMING WEEK...AS 
REASONABLE CHANCES FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL EXIST AS A 
SERIES OF UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION IN 
RESPONSE TO A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH EASTERN 
CANADA AND NEW ENGLAND. GIVEN THE VERY WARM AND MOIST AIRMASS 
PRESENT UNDERNEATH A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE SITUATED TO THE NORTHWEST OF 
THE AREA...THE ENHANCED LIFT FROM THESE PASSING SHORT-WAVES WILL 
HELP TO TRIGGER OFF SOME SCATTERED CLUSTERS OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS /IN ADDITION TO ANY ACTIVITY GENERATED FROM DIURNAL 
HEATING/. THE BEST CHANCES MAY BE INITIALLY ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...SLIGHTLY FAVORING NE TENNESSEE AND SW VIRGINIA WHERE THE 
BEST LIFT WILL BE. THEN LATE IN THE WEEK...MODELS ARE HINTING AT 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT DROPPING SOUTH OUT OF THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY TOWARD THE REGION...WHICH WOULD INCREASE STORM COVERAGE AND  
CHANCES QUITE A BIT HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND AS MORE ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION DROPS SOUTH INTO THE REGION. HOWEVER...ATTM MODELS ARE 
DIFFERING WITH THE TIMING AND LOCATION OF THIS FRONT...SO HAVE HELD 
OFF ON MAKING ANY DRAMATIC CHANCES IN POPS LATE IN THE PERIOD. 

GIVEN THE HIGH PWAT VALUES...THE THREAT FOR VERY HEAVY RAINFALL
WILL EXIST EACH DAY UNDERNEATH ANY STORMS THAT DO DEVELOP. PROGGED
INSTABILITY PARAMETERS ALSO SUPPORT THE POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO
LOCALLY SEVERE CONVECTION EACH DAY...WITH DAMAGING WIND GUSTS BEING
THE PRIMARY THREAT GIVEN THE INVERTED-V SOUNDING PROFILES EXHIBITED
BY MODELS. THE ONLY OTHER FORECAST CONCERN OF NOTE WILL BE FAIRLY
WARM TEMPERATURES OVER THE COURSE OF THE WEEK AS THE AFOREMENTIONED
UPPER-RIDGE SLOWLY MOVES BACK TOWARD MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS WILL
RESULT IN INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND THUS
WARMER HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW TO MID 90S IN MANY AREAS. GIVEN
THE MOIST AIR MASS...LOCATIONS THAT DO NOT EXPERIENCE COOLING FROM
CONVECTION COULD SEE HEAT INDEX VALUES APPROACH 100 DEGREES...
ESPECIALLY ALONG THE CORRIDOR BETWEEN KNOXVILLE AND CHATTANOOGA.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT SAT JUL 21 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...TWO AREAS OF CONVECTION THIS
AFTERNOON WITH INITIAL AREA LIKELY DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE UPPER
LEVEL TROUGH (TSRA MOVING NE INTO CENTRAL VALLEY AND ACROSS THE
SMOKIES)...AND ALSO WHERE WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WAS NOTED
ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THINK THIS ACTIVITY WILL
STAY ISOLATED OVER NRN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA...SO RAN SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS NORTH TO CHANCE SOUTH FOR THE EVENING. KEEPING A SLIGHT
CHANCE POP AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING WHERE SOME
PARTIAL CLEARING OCCURRS. NEXT SHIFT MIGHT BE ABLE TO DROP POPS
AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND CONSIDER IF FOG IS NEEDED ELSEWHERE.

FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A BIT OF MID TO UPR LEVEL DRYING AND MOS
POPS HAVE FALLEN FOR SUNDAY...WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE BEHIND PASSAGE
OF SHORTWAVE TROUGH AXIS. THUS...I OPTED TO LOWER POPS BACK TO 20
TO 30 PERCENT RANGE. THIS ALSO SUPPORTS GOING A LITTLE WARMER THAN
PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID FOR SUNDAY...BUT STAYED BELOW GFS MOS DUE TO
GFS BEING TOO WARM OVER PAST FEW DAYS. PERSISTENCE ON MIN TEMPS
SEEMED BEST CHOICE AND NOT AS COOL AS GFS MINS.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WE WILL GENERALLY
FIND OURSELVES ON THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF
HIGH PRESSURE FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD. AT LEAST WE SHOULD SEE A
MINIMIZING OF CONVECTION THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON THANKS TO DRIER
AIR ASSOCIATED WITH A FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLOWLY MAKING ITS WAY DOWN.
DRIER DEWPOINTS ARE CURRENTLY OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND THESE WILL
HAVE SOME IMPACT HERE DURING THE OPENING DAYS OF THE NEW WEEK. BY
TUES NIGHT/WED...THE STORM PATH MAY ALLOW A RETURN OF MORE
ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS INTO THE NE PORTION OF THE FORECAST
AREA. THE SW PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA /CHATTANOOGA REGION/ MAY
HAVE TO RELY ON MORE OF A POPCORN TSTM REGIME AS IT WILL BE CLOSER
TO THE HOT HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE. THE NEXT MAIN WEATHER MAKER FOR THE
REGION MAY COME INTO PLAY LATE IN THE WEEK.

FXUS64 KMRX 210733
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SAT JUL 21 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAIN/PLATEAU 
RANGE...WITH A MOIST AIR MASS STILL LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...AND THEN STALL OUT AROUND THE MOUNTAINS BY 
TONIGHT. MODELS INDICATE A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WITH SOME UPPER-LEVEL 
SUBSIDENCE HELPING TO LIMIT THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. THUS...WILL 
PLAN TO MENTION ONLY CHANCE POPS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT... 
BUT THINK THAT MAXES SHOULD BE A LITTLE HIGHER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY 
WITH A LITTLE MORE SUNSHINE AND LESS CONVECTIVE COVERAGE EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...AN ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN 
IS EXPECTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...THANKS TO A DEEPENING 
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN UNITED STATES. AS A 
RESULT...SEVERAL UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL DROP SOUTH AND PASS 
THOUGH THE REGION...PROVIDING SOME FAIRLY DECENT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS 
AND STORMS EACH DAY IN A STILL VERY WARM...HUMID AIRMASS UNDERNEATH 
A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE 
AND PROGGED INSTABILITY PARAMETERS...THE POTENTIAL FOR SCATTERED 
STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL EXIST EACH DAY...WITH THE 
BIGGEST IMPACTS LIKELY BEING HEAVY RAINFALL /AS PWATS ARE PROGGED TO 
BE BTWN 1.7-2.0 INCHES/. IN ADDITION...INVERTED-V SOUNDINGS SUGGEST 
A POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS WITH THE STRONGEST 
ACTIVITY. WHILE THE POTENTIAL FOR DIURNALLY INDUCED CONVECTION WILL 
EXIST EACH DAY...THE SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCES FOR THE GREATEST AMOUNT 
OF STORM COVERAGE APPEAR TO BE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WHEN INCREASED 
LIFT FROM A COUPLE OF UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVES PUSH OVER THE AREA. IN 
ADDITION TO THE PRECIP CHANCES...TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO GRADUALLY 
INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE WEEK AS THE UPPER-RIDGE SLIDES SOUTHEAST 
TOWARD MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THOUGH CLOUD COVER/CONVECTION WILL TEMPER 
HEATING SOMEWHAT...HIGHS SHOULD REACH THE LOW TO MID 90S IN MANY 
AREAS BY THE MIDDLE TO END OF NEXT WEEK. A SLIGHTLY DRIER FORECAST 
MAY BE IN STORE LATE IN THE PERIOD GIVEN SLIGHTLY WARMER 
TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND DRIER CONDITIONS WITH THE RIDGE BUILDING BACK 
IN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
737 PM EDT FRI JUL 20 2012

.AVIATION...CONVECTION FIRING AGAIN THIS EVENING ONE CLUSTER
APPROACHING TYS AND ANOTHER AREA JUST EAST OF CHA WHILE MORE
SHOWERS AND STORMS IN SE KY HEADED TOWARD NE TN. AS MOIST UNSTABLE
AIR IS LIFTED IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SINKING
SOUTH FROM THE OHIO VALLEY. ADDED TEMPO FOR STORMS AT TYS AND MAY
NEED TEMPO LATER AT TRI. FOG POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT WITH LOW CLOUD
LAYERS FORMING TOO. KEPT LIGHT FOG AT TYS AND CHA WITH MVFR FOG
AT TRI AND LIFR CEILING. AT CHA BROUGHT IN IFR CEILING AND MVFR AT
TYS WITH CEILINGS IMPROVING TO VFR BETWEEN 14 AND 16Z.

268 
FXUS64 KMRX 201904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT FRI JUL 20 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AIRMASS HAS BECOME QUITE
UNSTABLE FROM W/MID TN NE ACROSS KY...BUT STILL MORE STABLE ACROSS
NE PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA DUE TO LINGERING CLOUD COVER.
CONVERGENCE NOW NOTED ALONG THE WEAK COLD FRONT...PLUS MORE
DEVELOPMENT AHEAD OF THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH. THIS ACTIVITY LOOKS
POISED TO TRACK S TO SE ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING AND
OVERNIGHT. CARRIED LIKELY POPS FOR NRN PLATEAU AND EXTREME SW VA
BEFORE 21/00Z...THEN LOW END OF LIKELY POPS ELSEWHERE TONIGHT.
THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS LOOKS DIMINISHED...BUT LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS
MAY OCCUR (ALTHOUGH STEERING WINDS HAVE INCREASED).

WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY BECOMES QUITE DIFFUSE OVER THE WEEKEND...AND
UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS BY SATURDAY
NIGHT. LINGERING MOISTURE...DAYTIME HEATING AND NW FLOW ALOFT WILL
MAKE IT NECESSARY TO CARRY POPS THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MODELS AND MOS
SUGGEST POPS TAPERING FROM LOWER NORTH TO HIGHER SOUTH...WHICH
LOOKS REASONABLE. 

MOS MINS LOOK TOUGH TO DISAGREE WITH...FAVORING COOLER MOS MAXES
SATURDAY...THEN A BLEND OF MOS FOR SUNDAY HIGHS.
 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...IT LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER 
RELATIVELY ACTIVE PERIOD AS A LONG WAVE TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CANADA AND THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. IN THIS PATTERN 
NUMEROUS UPPER LEVEL FEATURES WILL DROP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL BE 
PRESENT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE 
REGION WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER CHANCE ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BY 
FRIDAY UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL NUDGE THE TROUGH TO THE NORTHEAST 
WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR A LOWER CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION AS 
THE ATMOSPHERE DRIES OUT AN STABILITY INCREASES. STAYED CLOSE TO MOS 
MAX TEMPS EARLY AND THEN ADJUSTED DOWN A DEGREE OR TWO DURING THE 
MORE ACTIVE MIDDLE PORTION OF THE WEEK.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

044 
FXUS64 KMRX 201351
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
951 AM EDT FRI JUL 20 2012

.DISCUSSION...REMNANTS OF MCC THIS MORNING WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS 
STILL AFFECTING PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. AIRMASS VERY MUCH 
STABILIZED BEHIND THIS ACTIVITY...SO STRONGER CONVECTION WILL BE 
DELAYED TODAY. MESO ANALYSIS SHOWS A GREAT AMOUNT OF NEGATIVE 
BUOYANCY TO BE OVERCOME...WITH A LOT CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS TO 
BREAK UP. 

12Z OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW LOTS OF MOISTURE WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER 
VALUES STILL AROUND OR JUST BELOW 2 INCHES. WIND SHEAR WILL BE A BIT 
HIGHER THIS AFTERNOON...WITH FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS 
STILL VERY HIGH. THUS...MAIN THREATS ARE WIND GUSTS AND LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINS. MAY DOWNPLAY THE DAMAGING WINDS SOMEWHAT...AS DAY ONE 
CONVECTIVE OUTLOOK HAS SHIFTED THE SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE AREA TO OUR 
SOUTH AND EAST. 

PLAN TO LOWER POPS FOR THE LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON PERIODS 
THEN TREND BACK TO LIKELY POPS. FRONTAL BOUNDARY JUST TO OUR NORTH 
AND THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH JUSTIFY KEEPING HIGH POPS. 

OTHERWISE...WILL FRESHEN HOURLY GRIDS AND CHECK MAX TEMP FORECAST
WHICH COULD BE AFFECTED BY MORNING CLOUDS AND LATER CONVECTION. 

&&

.AVIATION...

FORECAST AREA. THIS INITIAL CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD DIMINISH THIS

AND EVENING AS THE LOCAL AIR MASS BECOMES MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY 
HIGHLY UNSTABLE. SINCE TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE OF ANY TSTORMS AT 
THE TAF SITES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC...WILL JUST MENTION VCTS AT ALL 
THREE TAF SITES FOR NOW. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS 
ARE EXPECTED OUTSIDE OF TSTORMS FOR MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD.

566 
FXUS64 KMRX 200742
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT FRI JUL 20 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH SOME PRE-FRONTAL 
CONVECTION WEAKENING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...WITH BOTH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS INDICATING A VERY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT. IN ADDITION...PRECIPITABLE 
WATER VALUES ARE PROGGED TO BE VERY HIGH (BETWEEN 2 AND 2.2 INCHES) 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL IN THE ZONES. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT...AND WILL COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS WITH MAXES FOR TODAY. THIS 
APPROACH WITH MAXES WILL YIELD TEMPS A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN 
YESTERDAY...WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE GIVEN THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN 
CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP COVERAGE FOR TODAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
AND ITS ASSOCIATED SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL PROVIDE SOME REASONABLY 
GOOD CHANCES FOR MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EVENING STORMS ON SATURDAY 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ZONES AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS...BEFORE PULLING 
AWAY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN A SLIGHTLY 
DRIER FORECAST FOR SUNDAY GIVEN THE LACK OF UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT. A 
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BEGIN BUILDING BACK 
TOWARD THE AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK...INCREASING THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPS 
ALOFT WHICH WILL RESULT IN HIGHS RETURNING TO THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 
90S IN MANY LOCATIONS ONCE AGAIN. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE 
PRESENT UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE...CHANCES FOR SCATTERED DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WILL EXIST THROUGHOUT THE UPCOMING WEEK. MOST OF THE 
REGION WILL BE ON THE EASTERN PERIPHERY OF THIS RIDGE...WHICH WILL 
PROMOTE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. THIS WILL ALLOW ANY STORM 
COMPLEXES/MCS FEATURES THAT DEVELOP ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY TO POTENTIALLY DROP DOWN INTO THE REGION...ENHANCING 
THE THREAT FOR STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS. IN ADDITION...A SURFACE COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE AREA ONCE AGAIN DURING THE MIDDLE 
PART OF NEXT WEEK...FURTHER INCREASING THE POTENTIAL FOR RAINFALL. 
MODELS ARE SHOWING FAIRLY GOOD QPF SIGNALS WITH THIS ACTIVITY...SO 
HAVE INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY TO SOLID CHANCE POPS DURING THE DAY FOR 
MOST THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST. GIVEN PWAT VALUES PROGGED TO BE 
BTWN 1.5-2.0 INCHES ACROSS THE AREA...THE BIGGEST THREATS WITH THESE 
STORMS WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND SOME MINOR FLOODING 
CONCERNS WHERE TRAINING OCCURS. ADDITIONALLY...INVERTED-V SOUNDING 
PROFILES AND THE INSTABILITY PARAMETERS IN PLACE ALSO INDICATE A 
POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS AND PERHAPS SOME LOW-END 
SEVERE HAIL WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   90  72  88  72  90 /  70  60  40  20  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     88  71  87  70  89 /  70  60  30  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN             88  71  87  70  89 /  70  60  20  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    86  68  85  66  86 /  70  60  30  20  30 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
115 AM EDT FRI JUL 20 2012

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY AHEAD OF IT PRODUCING A LINE OF 
CONVECTION OVER CENTRAL EAST TN. THIS CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO 
GRADUALLY WEAKEN THIS MORNING...WITH A LULL IN CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY 
EXPECTED TOWARDS SUNRISE. BY THE AFTERNOON...THE LOCAL AIR MASS WILL 
AGAIN DESTABILIZE...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION REDEVELOPING AROUND 
THE TAF STIES. SINCE TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES 
WILL BE PROBLEMATIC...WILL MENTION VCTS IN ALL THREE TAFS FOR NOW. 
OTHERWISE...SOME FOG SHOULD DEVELOP AT KTRI AND KTYS TOWARDS SUNRISE 
DUE TO EARLIER RAINFALL. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS 
ARE EXPECTED OUTSIDE OF TSTORMS FOR MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD.

946 
FXUS64 KMRX 191925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT THU JUL 19 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...LATE AFTERNOON OR PRE
20/00Z GRIDS MAINTAIN LIKELY POPS ACROSS SW VA AND A BIT OF THE NRN
PLATEAU COUNTIES. AN MCS IS DEVELOPING OVER SE PARTS OF THE OHIO
VALLEY AND COULD CLIP SW VA EARLY THIS EVENING. SPOTTY TSRA POPPING
OUT AHEAD OF THE MCS WHILE LITTLE DEVELOPMENT ELSEWHERE. STAYED
CLOSE TO GFS MOS POPS FOR TONIGHT WITH GENERALLY 50 PERCENT ACROSS
THE BOARD. MOS BLEND LOOKED GREAT FOR MIN TEMP.

WEAK FRONT DRAWS CLOSE FRIDAY AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES AND
THEN MOVES ACROSS FRIDAY NIGHT. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED GOOD
FOR THESE PERIODS WITH JUST A MINOR TWEAK OR TWO. ALSO KEPT THE
DECREASING POPS FROM THE NORTH ON SATURDAY. INCREASING WINDS ALOFT
AND MOIST AIRMASS CREATE A THREAT OF A FEW SEVERE STORMS FRIDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS AND WIND GUSTS
GREATER THAN 50 MPH THE MAIN THREATS. FREEZING LEVEL HEIGHTS DROP
SO POSSIBLY SOME HAIL UP TO AN INCH OR SO IN DIAMATER. THIS IS
MENTIONED ALREADY IN OUR HWO PRODUCT.

OTHERWISE...MOS GUIDANCE WAS QUITE CLOSE AND REASONABLE FOR FRIDAY
THROUGH SATURDAY...AS WELL AS CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS. I MAY SEND
THE ZFPMRX PRODUCT OUT AGAIN WITH A PRE-FIRST PERIOD TO BETTER
ACCOUNT FOR STORMS APPROACHING SW VA. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SATURDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT PROBABILITY OF CONVECTION DECREASES TO SOME 
DEGREE AS AN UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE BOUNDARY GRADUALLY SLIP AWAY 
FROM THE FORECAST AREA. IN THIS CONFIGURATION THERE WILL ONLY BE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF A THUNDERSTORM OVER MUCH OF THE REGION WITH A LOW 
CHANCE PROBABILITY OVER THE HIGH TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER. THE PERIOD MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WILL BECOME MORE ACTIVE 
ONCE AGAIN AS SEVERAL SHORTWAVES/MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS BUILD 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW 
WITHIN THE EASTERN U.S. LONGWAVE TROUGH. A SURFACE COOL FRONT SHOULD 
BE MAKING PROGRESS THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. USED HIGHER MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY WITH LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY MONDAY AND THURSDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             73  90  72  88  73 /  50  60  60  40  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  89  71  88  71 /  50  70  60  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  87  70  87  70 /  50  70  50  20  20

154 
FXUS64 KMRX 190820
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EDT THU JUL 19 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND A WEAK COLD FRONT LIES TO THE NORTH
FROM NJ ACROSS THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS. A
WARM MOIST AIR MASS CONTINUES ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. LEFT OVER CLOUD
DEBRIS FROM WEDNESDAYS THUNDERSTORMS WAS STILL DISSIPATING AND ONLY
LIGHT FOG HAD FORMED IN A FEW LOCATIONS. TEMPERATURES WERE IN THE
UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S AREA WIDE. BASIC PATTERN IS UNCHANGED FROM
WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE ROCKIES AND FLOW
AROUND IT BRINGING WEAK DISTURBANCES SE IN NW FLOW. AS DAYTIME
HEATING COMMENCES SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE
SLOWLY SOUTHEAST PRODUCING LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS...FREQUENT LIGHTNING
AND GUSTY WINDS. BEST SEVERE THREAT WILL BE NORTH OF REGION IN WV
AND KY SO ONLY ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS EXPECTED. ACTIVITY WILL
LIKELY DEVELOP FIRST ALONG OLD OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM WEDNESDAY.
STORMS SHOULD DIE DOWN IN THE EVENING LIKE WEDNESDAY. ALSO TONIGHT
THE WEAK FRONT MOVES A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH AND NIGHT TIME ACTIVITY
TO THE SOUTH OF IT COULD MOVE INTO SW VA AND EXTREME NORTHERN TN BY
EARLY FRIDAY SO INCREASED POPS THERE LATE. WILL KEEP HIGHS TODAY A
DEGREE OR SO LOWER THAN WEDNESDAYS FORECAST CENTRAL AND SOUTH BASED
ON SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS AND ABOUT THE SAME NE TN AND SW VA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO CURRENT 
FORECAST. ATTENTION MUST BE PAID TO FRI. HIGH MOISTURE 
CONTENT...PWAT VALUES NEAR 2.00 AND POTENTIAL ENERGY ...CAPES ARND 
2000 REMAIN IN PLACE EARLY. ONGOING CONVECTION WILL SEND BOUNDARIES 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE NW. SHEAR VALUES NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE BUT 
STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE EXPECTED WITH DAMAGING 
WINDS ALONG WITH LOCALIZED FLOODING THE MAIN THREATS. THE ACTIVITY 
MAY COME IN TWO FORMS EARLY DUE TO THE AFOREMENTIONED AND AGAIN FRI 
EVENING ALONG WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WHICH WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO 
THE AREA LATE FRIDAY WITH ADDITIONAL FORCING FROM SOME BACKSIDE 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY. MID LEVELS WILL DRY OUT SOME POST TROUGH FOR THE 
WEEKEND WITH SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY LINGERING ALONG EXTREME 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MOST CONVECTION WILL BE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE 
AREA SAT AND SUN. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND LAYER MOISTURE 
RETURN NEXT WEEK WITH BETTER THAN NORMAL PRECIPITATION CHANCES. 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES WILL LIKELY DEVELOP NEXT WEEK BUT STEERING 
SHOULD KEEP THEM NORTH OF THE AREA.

966 
FXUS64 KMRX 181919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT WED JUL 18 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES OF
1.5 TO JUST OVER 2 INCHES IS A MOIST AIRMASS FOR STORMS TO DEVELOP
IN TODAY. AN UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUENT FLOW...DAYTIME HEATING AND
SEVERAL OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES...HAVE WORKED TO CREATE SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS. A FEW HAVE PULSED UP BRIEFLY TO MINIMAL SEVERE
LEVELS WITH A MORE SIGNIFICANT THREAT BEING LOCALIZED FLOODING.
HAIL SO FAR HAS BEEN PEA TO DIME/NICKEL SIZE. 

CARRIED 30 TO 50 PERCENT POPS INTO THE EVENING WITH SCATTERED
WORDING. LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD LEAD TO DECREASED COVERAGE
AFTER MIDNIGHT...SIMILAR TO NAM MODEL DEPICTION. FRONTAL BOUNDARY
INITIALLY ON THURSDAY WILL BE A BIT NORTH OF SE KY/SW VA...BUT
ANY LEFT OVER SMALLER SCALE BOUNDARIES SHOULD LEAD TO LIKELY
COVERAGE BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS AGAIN. JUST MINOR CHANGES FOR
THURSDAY'S POP AND WEATHER GRIDS.

MOS MINS LOOKED IN LINE WITH PAST FEW NIGHT AND WERE CLOSELY
FOLLOWED. UNDERCUT GFS MOS FOR MAXES THURSDAY DUE TO HIGHER POPS
THAN MOS...NOTING THAT MANY AREAS TODAY DID NOT GET OUT OF THE 80S.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HUMID AND THUS 
STORMY PATTERN WILL CONTINUE MOST OF THE WEEK...UNTIL DIGGING TROUGH 
OVER THE EAST COAST WILL HELP USHER IN FRONT/DRIER AIR DURING THE 
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. DUE TO DEEP MOISTURE AND WEAK STEERING 
OUR THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ABLE TO PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. 
WITH THE WEEKEND DRIER AIR...WE WON/T GO TOTALLY DRY BUT NOTABLY 
LESS CONVECTION WILL BE EXPERIENCED ESPECIALLY SUNDAY/MONDAY. A BIT 
OF AN UPTICK BY MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK BACK TO SCATTERED CONVECTION. 
TEMPERATURES WILL RUN AT OR ABOVE NORMAL FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED 
WITH PERHAPS WARMEST WEATHER BY WEDNESDAY AND LATE NEXT WEEK.

FORMED THIS MORNING IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL
EAST TN AND THIS WILL CONTINUE UNTIL AROUND 13Z. WEAK VORTICITY
ADVECTION OVER SE KY AND SW VA MOVING INTO NE TN HAS CAUSED SHOWERS
TO DEVELOP ALREADY IN SE KY AND THEY SHOULD MOVE INTO NE TN AND SW
VA BEFORE SUNRISE. PATTERN SIMILAR TODAY TO TUESDAY WITH AIR MASS
BECOMING MODERATELY UNSTABLE. SO EXPECT PULSE TYPE STRONG TO A FEW
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP. HEAVY RAINFALL ALSO A POSSIBILITY
WITH SOME STORMS AS PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES REACH UP TO ABOUT
1.9 INCHES. LOCALIZED FLOODING POSSIBLE WITH SLOW MOVEMENT OF
STORMS. IT MAY TAKE A LITTLE LONGER FOR STRONGER STORMS TO DEVELOP
WITH COOLER MORNING LOWS AND PATCHY FOG AREAS ALLOWING A SLOWER
WARM UP. HIGHS UNIFORMLY MID 80S TO NEAR 90 EXCEPT LOWER 90S CHA.

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGHING DIGS SE-S 
THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH SAT AND WEAKENS IN PLACE THROUGH 
THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THIS EFFECTIVELY BISECTS THE 
CONTINENTAL MID LEVEL RIDGE FROM THE BERMUDA HIGH. VERY MOIST AIR 
MASS WITH PW AROUND 2 INCHES...LIKELY POPS SEEM WARRANTED FOR 
THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CERTAINLY BE A CONCERN 
BOTH DAYS...AND WITH CAPE AROUND 2000 J/KG...ISOLATED DAMAGING WINDS 
MAY ALSO BE POSSIBLE. A WEAK FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH MRX CWA FRIDAY 
AND LINGER NEAR SOUTHERN PART OF CWA THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE 
PERIOD. TEMPS AND DEW POINTS CHANGE LITTLE NORTH OF FRONT BUT LAYER 
DOES BECOME A BIT DRIER...YET STILL ABOVE NORMAL. CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION DECREASES TO NEAR NORMAL SUNDAY AND MONDAY BUT TRENDS 
WETTER INTO NEXT MID WEEK.

464 
FXUS64 KMRX 171924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT TUE JUL 17 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TOMORROW/...
SCATTERED STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO
DEVELOP IN A WARM...MOIST AND FAIRLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS THIS
AFTERNOON. MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE EXHIBITING A CLASSIC INVERTED-V
SHAPE AND ARE INDICATING CAPE VALUES AOA 2000-3000 J/KG AND LIFTED
INDEX VALUES AT -5C...ALONG WITH PWATS OF BTWN 1.5-1.8 INCHES.
THUS...THE THREAT FOR DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS...HAIL AND
PARTICULARLY LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL EXIST WITH ANY STORMS THAT
DO DEVELOP THROUGH THIS EVENING. WIND SHEAR VALUES ARE FAIRLY
UNIMPRESSIVE...SO THE STORM MODE SHOULD GENERALLY BE PULSE-TYPE
CONVECTION AND VERY OUTFLOW BOUNDARY DRIVEN GIVEN THE LACK OF
UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT. THIS ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN TO WANE WITH THE LOSS
OF DAYTIME HEATING...THOUGH SOME ACTIVITY MAY LINGER ALONG THE
HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS THROUGH MIDNIGHT OR SO. WITH CALM
WINDS...SOME CLEARING CONDITIONS AND A VERY MOIST BOUNDARY
LAYER...PATCHY FOG IS ONCE AGAIN EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT
/PARTICULARLY IN AREAS NEAR BODIES OF WATER/.

FOR TOMORROW...ANY LINGERING FOG WILL DISSIPATE AFTER SUNRISE...BUT
THE THREAT FOR ADDITIONAL CONVECTION WILL EXIST AREAWIDE. AN UPPER-
LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL STILL BE THE DOMINANT SYNOPTIC SCALE
FEATURE IN THE REGION...BUT GIVEN THE VERY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS
/COMBINED WITH LINGERING OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES AND A COLD FRONT
BEGINNING TO TRACK SOUTH TOWARD THE OHIO RIVER/...FAIRLY DECENT
CHANCES FOR SCATTERED STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL EXIST
ONCE AGAIN. COVERAGE MAY EVEN HIGHER THAN TODAY...GIVEN THE
AFOREMENTIONED FRONT WHICH MAY KICK OFF A GREATER AMOUNT OF
ACTIVITY IN KENTUCKY WHICH SHOULD EVENTUALLY MAKE IT DOWN INTO EAST
TN/SOUTHWEST VA BY THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. OTHERWISE CONTINUED
HOT AND HUMID TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S WILL
CONTINUE UNDER A PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKY.


.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
A CLOSED LOW WILL BE CROSSING EASTERN CANADA WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
FRIDAY...WITH A BROAD TROUGH STRETCHING ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS TO 
THE GULF COAST. MODELS ARE SHOWING GOOD CONSENSUS WITH THIS GENERAL 
PATTERN...AS ARE THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. WITH WEAK SYNOPTIC LIFT 
ACTING ON A VERY MOIST AIR MASS WITH PW AROUND 2 INCHES...LIKELY 
POPS SEEM WARRANTED FOR THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. HEAVY RAINFALL WILL 
CERTAINLY BE A CONCERN BOTH DAYS...AND WITH CAPE AROUND 2000 
J/KG...ISOLATED DAMAGING WINDS MAY ALSO BE POSSIBLE. 

THE RIDGE OVER THE PLAINS WILL BUILD EAST...PUSHING THE TROUGH 
FARTHER TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. THIS WILL BRING A DRIER AIRMASS TO 
THE REGION...FURTHER REDUCING PRECIP CHANCES BY SATURDAY AND 
PROVIDING A WARMING TREND. SUNDAY AND MONDAY LOOK DRY WITH A 700-300 
MB RIDGE AXIS EXTENDING OVER THE AREA. THE GFS INDICATES THAT 
ANOTHER CLOSED LOW WILL BE LOCATED OVER EASTERN CANADA BY 
TUESDAY...WHICH MAY HELP WEAKEN THE RIDGE AND ALLOW UPSTREAM 
CONVECTION TO TRACK OUR WAY IN A NW FLOW ALOFT. WILL OPEN DAY 7 WITH 
A SLIGHT CHANCE POP.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  93  73  91  73 /  20  40  30  50  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  91  72  89  72 /  20  50  40  60  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  91  72  89  72 /  20  50  40  60  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              67  88  69  86  69 /  20  50  40  60  60
