618 
FXUS64 KMRX 171502 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1102 AM EDT TUE JUL 17 2012

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE REMAINS THE DOMINANT SYNOPTIC
SCALE WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION TODAY...WHICH WILL PROMOTE
SOME INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT. THUS...DESPITE
SOME CLOUD COVER FROM CONVECTION...SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES ARE
EXPECTED FOR THIS AFTERNOON AS HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO MIDDLE 90S
IN MOST AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN. SPEAKING OF
CONVECTION...THE UPPER-WAVE THAT BROUGHT SOME ENHANCED LIFT TO THE
REGION YESTERDAY HAS PUSHED WELL SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA.
HOWEVER...GIVEN THE PERSISTENT WARM AND VERY HUMID AIRMASS IN PLACE
AND THE PRESENCE OF A FEW RESIDUAL OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES...REASONABLE
CHANCES FOR SCATTERED STORMS WILL EXIST ONCE AGAIN LATE THIS
MORNING TROUGH THIS EVENING /WITH THE MORE FAVORED AREAS BEING
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU/. HAVING SAID
THAT...RADAR IS SHOWING SOME MODERATE SHOWERS/ISOLATED STORMS
DEVELOPING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN KENTUCKY AND MOVING INTO THE GREAT
TENNESSEE VALLEY...SO 30 TO 40 POPS SEEMS REASONABLE AREAWIDE FOR
TODAY. GIVEN THE MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE /WITH PWATS PROGGED TO BE
FAIRLY HIGH AROUND 1.5-1.8 INCHES AND A DEEP WARM CLOUD
LAYER/...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL ONCE AGAIN BE THE PRIMARY
CONCERN WITH ANY ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP. HOWEVER...MODEL
SOUNDINGS HAVE A DISTINCTIVE INVERTED-V PROFILE AND CONTINUE
INDICATE CAPE VALUES AOA 1500-2500 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES AOA -3C
TO -4C BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. THUS...THE POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO
LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL ONCE AGAIN EXIST...WITH THE PRIMARY RISK
BEING STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS. GIVEN THE VERY POOR WIND SHEAR
HOWEVER...STORM ORGANIZATION WILL BE FAIRLY POOR AND FAVOR A
PULSE-TYPE STORM MODE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             94  73  93  73  92 /  40  20  40  30  50

REMAINS OVER THE SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL STATES WEDNESDAY WITH

NE AND SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BECOME
A LITTLE MORE NUMEROUS WEDNESDAY AND ESPECIALLY THURSDAY AS THE
FRONT DROPS A LITTLE FURTHER SOUTH EACH DAY AND MOISTURE INCREASES.
HIGHS WEDNESDAY ABOUT THE SAME AS TUESDAY AND THEN COOLER THURSDAY
WITH MORE CLOUD COVER AND RAINFALL. UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NE DROPS
INTO FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AND COOL FRONT SOUTH OF FORECAST AREA
SATURDAY. GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH
SATURDAY. ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY
MONDAY AND HIGHS MOSTLY 80S FRIDAY THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A WARM AND VERY HUMID AIR MASS 
LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. RADARS REVEAL THAT MOST OF THE 
EARLIER CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA HAS DIMINISHED 
FOR THE NIGHT...BUT ISOLATED CONVECTION CONTINUES TO LINGER OVER THE 
SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MODELS INDICATE THAT A MARGINALLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE 
NIGHT...BUT ALSO INDICATE THAT SOME UPPER-LEVEL SUBSIDENCE WILL KEEP 
EVERYTHING SUPPRESSED OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY EVENING PRECIP WORDING...AND 
TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

910 
FXUS64 KMRX 161915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON JUL 16 2012

.SHORT TERM...
THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT WILL BE
PRECIPITATION CHANCES AS LIFT FROM AN UPPER-TROUGH MOVING THROUGH
THE REGION WILL COMBINE WITH AN ABUNDANTLY MOIST ATMOSPHERE TO
CREATE SOME REASONABLE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO BE SCATTERED
IN NATURE AS IT DEVELOPS ACROSS SRN KENTUCKY...NE TENNESSEE...SW
VIRGINIA...AND ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU...GRADUALLY SPREADING SOUTHEAST INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
AND THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE OVERALL ENVIRONMENT
IS EXTREMELY FAVORABLE FOR HEAVY RAINFALL WHICH WILL BE THE PRIMARY
THREAT /ALONG WITH LIGHTNING/ FROM ANY ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP.
MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE SHOWING A LARGE TALL/NARROW AREA OF CAPE AOA
2000 J/KG...A DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER AND PWATS AOA 1.7-1.9 INCHES.
WIND SHEAR VALUES TODAY ARE SLIGHTLY BETTER THAN YESTERDAY...WHICH
COMBINED WITH THE INSTABILITY PARAMETERS HAS ALLOWED SOME OF THIS
ACTIVITY TO BECOME STRONG AND DEVELOP INTO SEMI-ORGANIZED MULTICELL
CLUSTERS. OVERALL...FEEL THAT THE SEVERE POTENTIAL THROUGH THIS
EVENING IS STILL FAIRLY LOW...BUT NOT ZERO GIVEN THE AFOREMENTIONED
ENVIRONMENT IN PLACE. GIVEN THE INVERTED-V NATURE OF THE
SOUNDINGS...STRONG OUTFLOW WINDS FROM THESE STORMS WOULD BE THE
OTHER THREAT THAT THE STRONGEST CELLS WOULD POSSESS.

STORMS SHOULD BEGIN TO DIMINISH SOMEWHAT AFTER SUNSET...THOUGH SOME
ISOLATED ACTIVITY COULD LINGER /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS
AND NORTHEASTERN ZONES THROUGH MIDNIGHT OR SO/. CLOUD COVER SHOULD
BEGIN TO EVENTUALLY THIN OUT LATER TONIGHT...WHICH COMBINED WITH
THE VERY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER AND CALM WINDS WILL PROVIDE A
REASONABLE SHOT OF PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT AREAWIDE AFTER 06Z.
THUS...HAVE ADDED A MENTION OF THIS IN THE ZONES. OTHERWISE...
CONTINUED MILD OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER
70S ARE EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN FOR MOST LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM...
THE MIDLEVEL FLOW ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS WILL BECOME INCREASINGLY 
AMPLIFIED AS A RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE PLAINS AND A CLOSED LOW CROSSES 
EASTERN CANADA AND NEW ENGLAND. SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION IS 
EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY...THEN MORE ORGANIZED DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH FALLING 500 MB HEIGHTS AND A SURFACE FRONT 
APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH. GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AND ECMWF ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS PATTERN AND TIMING...SO CONFIDENCE IS HIGH. 
POPS RISE TO LIKELY NORTH THURSDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY...THEN LIKELY POPS TREND SOUTHWARD FRIDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES 
TO THE TN/KY BORDER WITH A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TN 
VALLEY. 

WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE TROUGH AXIS FRIDAY NIGHT...A DEEP NORTHERLY 
FLOW OF DRIER AIR SHOULD REDUCE POPS TO A SLIGHT CHANCE IN MOST 
SPOTS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. A RIDGE AXIS EXTENDING FROM THE GREAT 
PLAINS HIGH BUILDS OVER THE AREA FOR MONDAY...WHICH SHOULD FURTHER 
REDUCE PRECIP CHANCES. WILL OPEN DAY 7 WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

252 
FXUS64 KMRX 161512 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1112 AM EDT MON JUL 16 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A LARGE SUBTROPICAL HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM REMAINS THE DOMINANT
WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION...WHICH HAS PROMOTED THE MOSTLY
TO PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION
THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...AN UPPER SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS ALSO ROTATING
ALONG THE EASTERN PERIPHERY OF THIS RIDGE. THIS FEATURE WILL SERVE
AS A FOCUS FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY
LATE THIS MORNING THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT
MOISTURE AT THE SURFACE /WITH LOW 70S DEWPOINTS NEARLY EVERYWHERE
AND PWATS AOA 1.7-1.8 INCHES/...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE A
BIG THREAT WITH ANY ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP. MODEL SOUNDINGS
ALSO SUPPORT THIS...SHOWING A DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER AND A
TALL/NARROW AREA OF CAPE VALUES AOA 1500-2000 J/KG BY THE
AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE INSTABILITY PARAMETERS IN PLACE...STRONG TO
LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE /MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON
AND EARLY EVENING/. WIND SHEAR VALUES ARE FAIRLY POOR...BUT MAY
SUPPORT SOME SEMI-ORGANIZED MULTICELL CLUSTERS OF STORMS THAT
COULD PRODUCE HEAVY RAINFALL IN THIS WARM...HUMID AIRMASS OVER
LOCALIZED AREAS SHOULD TRAINING OCCUR. THE BEST CHANCES FOR ANY
ACTIVITY WILL BE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA THROUGH THE
EARLY AFTERNOON...BEFORE SLIGHTLY FAVORING THE MOUNTAINS AND THE
SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. DESPITE THE SCATTERED
NATURE OF THIS CONVECTION...FELT THAT GENERALLY 40 TO 50 POPS
SEEMED WARRANTED /PARTICULARLY GIVEN THIS VERY MOIST AIR MASS/.
OTHERWISE...PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE
UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S SHOULD BE EXPECTED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
DAY.

THE REGION AND ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL PROVIDE THE

THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME FRAME...GIVING US OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION 
DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  SHOULD CONTINUE TO SEE ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY INTO THE WEEKEND WITH MAINLY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION THE MAIN THREAT.  TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN SLIGHTLY ABOVE

RIDGE WILL COMBINE WITH A REMNANT FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND AN UPPER-
SHORTWAVE TROUGH TO PROVIDE SOME REASONABLE CHANCES FOR SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THE RIDGE CENTERED
DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA ON TUESDAY...STORM COVERAGE MAY BE SOMEWHAT
SPARSER GIVEN SOME WARMER TEMPERATURES ALOFT /WHICH MAY ALLOW HIGHS
TO CREEP BACK TOWARD THE MID 90S ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE
AREA/. STORM COVERAGE SHOULD BEGIN TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE BY MID
TO LATE WEEK HOWEVER...AS THE AFOREMENTIONED SHORTWAVE PASSES
THROUGH THE REGION AND THE RIDGE SHIFTS OFF THE WEST. A STRONG
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH EASTERN CANADA WILL PUSH A
COLD FRONT SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND POTENTIALLY INTO THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY INTO
FRIDAY...WHICH WOULD SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME MORE WIDESPREAD
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND ALSO PROMOTE SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER
CONDITIONS FOR LATE IN THE WEEK. GIVEN THE PROGGED INSTABILITY
VALUES...FEEL THAT ANY STORMS THAT DO DEVELOP WILL BE CAPABLE OF
BECOMING STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE...PARTICULARLY LATE IN THE WEEK
WHEN BULK SHEAR VALUES INCREASE. GIVEN THE HIGH PWATS...LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE GREATEST IMPACT WITH ANY
ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP.




&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  94  72  94  73 /  30  40  20  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  92  71  92  72 /  30  40  30  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  92  70  91  72 /  30  40  20  30  20

PERIPHERY CREATING A VERY HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

BUT WITH A STORM MOTION AROUND 25 KTS...THINK THESE STORMS SHOULD 
NOT PRODUCE ANY MAJOR FLOODING PROBLEMS OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF EVENING PRECIP AND TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT SAT JUL 14 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FOR THE SHORT 
TERM AS UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND INTO OUR AREA FROM THE 
EAST...AND PLENTY OF MOISTURE REMAINS.  AGAIN APPEARS THERE WILL NOT 
BE MUCH FORCING FOR PRECIP...SO CONVECTION SHOULD BE TIED MAINLY TO 
HEATING.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS FOR THIS EVENING AND AGAIN 
SUNDAY...ESPECIALLY AFTERNOON.  WITH BOUNDARY LAYER SO MOIST EXPECT 
SOME FOG DEVELOPMENT AGAIN TONIGHT...SO WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG.  
MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...WILL TWEAK SOME MINS UP 
SLIGHTLY BUT OVERALL WILL STAY CLOSE.  


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND AN UPPER-
TROUGH AXIS DRAPED ALONG THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY WILL BE
THE TWO DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURES ACROSS THE REGION HEADING INTO
THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. DESPITE THIS RIDGE BEING SITUATED
ACROSS THE REGION...WITH ABUNDANT LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE STILL PRESENT
AND THE AFOREMENTIONED UPPER-TROUGH GRADUALLY MEANDERING EAST
TOWARD THE AREA...REASONABLY SOLID CHANCES FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION
WILL EXIST THROUGHOUT THE WEEK. GIVEN THE PROGGED INSTABILITY
PARAMETERS AND VERY HIGH PWAT VALUES IN EXCESS OF 1.75
INCHES...STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG
VERY HEAVY RAINFALL WITH ANY ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP. THE
SLIGHTLY MORE FAVORED AREA FOR PRECIPITATION WILL BE ACROSS THE
NORTHWEST/WESTERN ZONES WHICH WILL LIKELY BE CLOSEST TO THE
POSITION TROUGH AXIS AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS. ADDITIONALLY WITH CONTINUED HIGHER THICKNESS
VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT...HIGHS WILL REMAIN AT SEASONABLE LEVELS
IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S...THOUGH AFTERNOON CLOUD COVER/STORMS
WILL LIMIT HEATING IN SOME AREAS.

HEADING INTO THE LATTER PART OF THE WEEK...MODELS SHOW THE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGE PUSHING WEST INTO THE MID/LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
VALLEY AS A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM BLASTS THROUGH EASTERN 
CANADA. THE SYSTEM WILL DRIVE A FRONT INTO THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY...AND POTENTIALLY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS/TENNESSEE 
VALLEY LATE THIS WEEK /THOUGH MODEL SOLUTIONS ARE STILL DIFFERING 
ONT THE TIMING/MAGNITUDE OF THIS/. FOR NOW...HAVE KEPT SOLID 30 TO 
40 POPS IN THE ZONES FOR THE LATE PERIOD AND WILL CONTINUE TO 
MONITOR THE LATEST MODELS TRENDS WITH RESPECT TO THIS SYSTEM.

934 
FXUS64 KMRX 131908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT FRI JUL 13 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD SLOWLY 
WEST OVER THE AREA DURING THE SHORT TERM...BUT CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE 
WILL LINGER.  HARD TO FIND MUCH FORCING OTHER THAN DIURNAL 
HEATING...SO PLAN TO CARRY CHANCE POPS TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...WITH 
HIGHEST VALUES THIS EVENING/SAT AFTERNOON. EXPECT SOME SUN 
SATURDAY...AND TEMPS SHOULD BE HIGHER THAN TODAY.  HOWEVER...WILL 
NOT GO QUITE AS HIGH AS MAV CENTRAL AND NORTH...BUT WILL BLEND IN A 
BIT OF THE LOWER MET NUMBERS IN THOSE AREAS.  MAV TEMPS LOOK GOOD 
FOR TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION FROM THE
EAST SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...SQUEEZING AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH
AXIS THAT HAS BEEN SITTING OVER AREA THIS WEEK BACK ALONG THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI RIVER. DESPITE THE RIDGE BUILDING OVERHEAD...GIVEN THE
ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE PRESENT ACROSS THE REGION SOME
DIURNALLY INDUCED SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS ARE EXPECTED ON
SUNDAY INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK /WITH THE MORE FAVORED AREAS BEING THE
EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES/. GIVEN THE INSTABILITY PARAMETERS IN PLACE
ACROSS THE AREA...SOME LOCALLY STRONG STORMS WILL BE
POSSIBLE...WITH HEAVY RAINFALL BEING THE BIGGEST THREAT AS PWATS
WILL REMAIN OVER 1.75 INCHES. GIVEN THE INCREASING THICKNESS
VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT...HIGHS WILL ALSO REBOUND TO AT OR
SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONABLE LEVELS NEXT WEEK...WITH THE MERCURY
REACHING THE UPPER 80S TO LOW 90S IN MOST LOCATIONS.

THE AFOREMENTIONED TROUGH AXIS MAY BEGIN TO MEANDER BACK TOWARD THE 
REGION DEPENDING ON WHERE THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE IS LOCATED...BUT 
IT IS GENERALLY PROGGED TO REMAIN TO THE NORTH AND WEST OF THE AREA. 
THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT WEATHER FEATURE OF NOTE MAY COME TOWARD THE END 
OF THE WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM PASSES THROUGH THE 
NORTHEASTERN US...POTENTIALLY PUSHING A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE AREA. 
HOWEVER...MODEL SOLUTIONS STILL DISAGREE ON HOW THIS SITUATION WILL 
EVOLVE AS SOME GUIDANCE INDICATES A RIDGE CONTINUING TO DOMINATE THE 
WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION INTO THE WEEKEND. THUS FOR NOW...HAVE KEPT 
THE FORECAST PRETTY GENERIC AND WILL WAIT FOR SOME BETTER MODEL 
CONTINUITY BEFORE ALTERING THE FORECAST TO FAVOR A PARTICULAR 
SOLUTION.

.DISCUSSION...MODELS OVERDOING PRECIP SO FAR TODAY ESPECIALLY OUR

BIT BUT STILL WILL GO NO LOWER THAN LIKELY. SOME BREAKS IN THE

AND BUMP SOME TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY. UPDATE OUT SOON.

207 
FXUS64 KMRX 121930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT THU JUL 12 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE MUCH NEEDED RAINFALL CONTINUES TO SLOWLY WORK ITS WAY ACROSS E
TN AND SW VA THIS AFTERNOON. THE RAIN HAS BEEN SLOW TO MOVE INTO
THE TRI CITIES AREA AND PARTS OF SW VA DUE TO THE EASTERLY
DOWNSLOPE LOW LEVEL WINDS. THESE WINDS HAVE KEPT THE LOWER
ATMOSPHERE RELATIVELY DRY MUCH OF THE DAY. WHAT HAS FALLEN HAS BEEN
LIGHT. ANTICIPATE THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE TO WIN OUT OVER THE LIMITED
DRYING OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS. RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD BE WELL
LESS THAN A QUARTER OF AN INCH...BUT WE WILL TAKE WHAT WE CAN GET.
CHATTANOOGA RECORDED ALMOST 2.25 INCHES OF RAINFALL FOR THE PAST
SIX HOURS ENDING AT 2PM. 

OVERNIGHT...SHOWERS SHOULD BE SPOTTY AS THEY WILL MOVE UP FROM
NORTHEAST ALABAMA AND NORTHERN GEORGIA. LOW CLOUDS AND PATCHY FOG
COULD DEVELOP ESPECIALLY NEAR THE TRI CITIES SHORTLY AFTER
MIDNIGHT. THE CONVERGENT ZONE...WHERE ALL THIS PRECIPITATION IS
TAKING PLACE WILL SLOWLY MIGRATE WEST AS HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE
EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA COAST BUILDS INTO EAST TENNESSEE BY MID DAY
FRIDAY. BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL REMAIN OVER THE PLATEAU THROUGH
TOMORROW. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A GRADUAL WARMING AND DRYING TREND WILL BE IN STORE ACROSS THE
REGION HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH AXIS THAT HAS BEEN SITUATED ACROSS THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS WILL SHIFT FURTHER WEST /ALMOST
DIRECTLY ALONG THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER/...ALLOWING FOR A
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE TO NOSE INTO THE AREA FROM THE EAST. SOME FAIRLY
APPRECIABLE MOISTURE WILL STILL BE PRESENT UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE
THIS WEEKEND...WHICH WILL PERMIT SOME DECENT CHANCES FOR SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND STORMS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA BOTH DAYS. GIVEN SOME OF
THE PROGGED INSTABILITY PARAMETERS...SOME STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE
STORMS /ALONG WITH LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL/ WILL CERTAINLY BE
POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY. AS THE RIDGE BECOMES CENTERED
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK...POPS WILL
DECREASE SLIGHTLY AS THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPS ALOFT INCREASE. AS A
RESULT...DAYTIME HIGHS ARE EXPECTED TO RETURN TO AROUND NORMAL FOR
MID-JULY IN THE UPPER 80S TO THE LOWER 90S ACROSS THE ENTIRE
FORECAST AREA. HEADING INTO THE LATTER HALF OF NEXT WEEK...THE
FORECAST WILL BECOME A BIT MORE COMPLICATED AS AS THE ECMWF
MAINTAINS AN UPPER-RIDGE OVER THE REGION...WHILE THE GFS SHOWS A
STRONG UPPER-TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND DROPPING A
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO THE AREA. GIVEN THESE
DRAMATIC DIFFERENCES...HAVE MAINTAINED SEASONABLE TEMPS IN THE
UPPER 80S/LOWER 90S AND LOW TO MODERATE CHANCE POPS FOR DAYS 6 AND
7 AND WILL WAIT FOR SOME BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY BEFORE ALTERING
THE FORECAST TOWARD ONE SOLUTION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  85  70  88  71 / 100  60  40  50  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT THU JUL 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER DAY WITH RATHER 
HIGH PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE 
ATMOSPHERE COMPLETE WITH MOISTURE PROFILE...LOW LEVEL AND UPPER 
LEVEL FEATURES LOOKS SIMILAR TO WEDNESDAY. MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
WILL BE AVAILABE ALOFT WITH CONVERGENCE ALONG AN 85H TROUGH 
EXTENDING ACROSS THE REGION IN A VERY MOIST ENVIRONMENT. ONCE AGAIN 
THE POTENTIAL EXISTS FOR IMPRESSIVELY BELOW NORMAL HIGH TEMPERATURES 
WITH A BROAD EASTERLY FLOW IN THE LOW LEVELS. STAYED CLOSE TO A 
GUIDANCE BLEND WHICH OFFERS ANOTHER VERY SMALL DIURNAL RANGE IN 
TEMPERATURES. LACK OF LOW LEVEL WARMING SHOULD KEEP CONVECTION 
LIMITED AGAIN TODAY WITH MOST PRECIPITATION FALLING IN THE FORM OF 
SHOWERS. MAINTAINED HIGH POPS THIS EVENING DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN HOW 
QUICKLY UPPER LEVEL ENERGY DEPARTS NORTHEAST INTO THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE ATLANTIC RIDGE WILL 
GRADUALLY BUILD WESTWARD THROUGH THE WEEKEND...LEADING TO DRIER AND 
WARMER CONDITIONS ACROSS THE AREA. DEEP MOISTURE WILL STILL BE IN 
PLACE FRIDAY WITH PW NEAR 2 INCHES...BUT FORCING WILL BE WEAKER AS 
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEPARTS. WITH THE RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE 
CAROLINAS...BEST PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE IN THE WESTERN SECTIONS ON 
FRIDAY...BUT POPS WILL BE IN THE LIKELY RANGE EVERYWHERE. 

FOR SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...A TROUGH WILL BE NEARLY STATIONARY 
OVER THE MS VALLEY AS THE RIDGE AXIS EXTENDS ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
STATES. DECREASING GULF MOISTURE AND WEAK SYNOPTIC LIFT WILL RESULT 
IN MAINLY DIURNAL CHANCE-SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE GRADUALLY WARMING EACH DAY 
UNDER THE BUILDING RIDGE...WITH HIGHS IN THE VALLEY MAINLY IN THE 
UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

OF OUR CWA WITH TROWAL TYPE OF LIFT ROTATING AROUND WEAK UPPER LOW. 
WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED FOR ANY CHANGES MAKING FOR MORE OF A THREAT 
INTO OUR AREA.

OVER AN INCH AT KCHA...A LITTLE UNDER AN INCH AT KTYS...AND ABOUT 
1/2 INCH AT KTYS.  NW CWA ALSO ABOUT 1 INCH OR SO.  AFTER SUCH A HOT 
AND DRY SPELL LEADING INTO THIS EVENT...RIVERS STILL FORECAST TO 
STAY PRETTY LOW.  

FOR TEMPS...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE OVERNIGHT...AND A LITTLE ON THE 
COOL SIDE FOR THURSDAY MAX TEMPS.  


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK UPPER 
TROUGH WILL MOVE NORTH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS 
THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH ABUNDANT SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE 
CONTINUING TO LIFT NORTH ACROSS THE FROECAST ARA. PWS WILL BE NEAR 2 
INCHES OVER THE REGION. MODELS SHOW SOME DIFLUENCE ALOFT ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY/CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. ALSO...SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT NOTED AS 
WELL FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. 

MODELS SHOW ANOTHER WIDESPREAD CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVING ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT WITH ADDITIONAL 
STRONG CONVECTION FOR FRIDAY...ESPECIALLY OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. WILL INCLUDE SOME RAIN MAY BE HEAVY IN THE 
FORECAST. 

FOR THIS WEEKEND...BERMUDA RIDGE BUILDS BACK WEST INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS WITH PWS DROPPING TO 1.4-1.7 INCHES...SO COVERAGE OF 
STORMS WILL LESSENS WTIH BEST POPS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. WEAK 
UPPER RIDGING WILL REMAIN INTO EARLY-MID NEXT WEEK. WILL MAINTAIN 
MAINLY DIURNAL POPS WITH CONTINUED GREATEST COVERAGE OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY THROUGH THE PERIOD.

WIDESPREAD RAINS NOW OCCURRING OVER MUCH OF THE AREA...BUT VERY

CHANCE OF THUNDER/...THINKING THAT IT WILL NOT GET OVERLY UNSTABLE
THIS AFTERNOON WITH THE THICK CLOUD COVER. TRIMMED BACK MAX TEMPS
THIS AFTERNOON...AT LEAST A CATEGORY MOST AREA...AND UP TO A COUPLE
OF CATEGORIES IN THE EASTERN HALF OF THE AREA WHERE THE RAIN WILL
HAVE LITTLE CHANCE TO EXIT AND THEREFORE KEEPING TEMPS COOLER.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             83  71  82  71  86 /  90  70  80  50  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  70  82  70  85 /  80  60  80  60  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       80  70  79  70  85 /  80  60  80  60  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              80  67  80  67  83 /  80  60  70  60  60

956 
FXUS64 KMRX 110735
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT WED JUL 11 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE FORECAST AREA REMAINS IN A 
FAVORABLE REGION FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. MODELS AGREE THAT HIGH PW AIRMASS WILL 
BE AVAILABLE FOR LIFTING IN THE CONVERGENT ZONE ASSOCIATED WITH AN 
85H LOW OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH EXTENSION OF TROUGH 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. ADDITIONALLY...LIFT SHOULD BE 
ENHANCED AS WEAK VORTS SHIFT EAST NORTHEAST OVER THE REGION. ONE OF 
THESE FEATURES APPEARS TO BE MOVING TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA FROM 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE EARLY THIS MORNING. SLOW MOVING SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS MAY PRODUCE SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING AGAIN TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. WIDESPREAD CLOUD COVER AND CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION WILL 
INHIBIT INTENSE HEATING TODAY AND STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
MAX TEMPS. WENT A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE SUGGESTED MINS TONIGHT IN THE 
HUMID AIRMASS REMAINING OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FOR THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT...LOW PRESSURE WILL TRACK FROM WEST TN TO THE GREAT 
LAKES...WITH A PERSISTENT AND DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW OF GULF MOISTURE 
KEEPING THE AIR MASS VERY MOIST. THE BEST FORCING FOR HEAVY PRECIP 
ON THURSDAY APPEARS TO BE OVER MIDDLE TN CLOSER TO THE LOW...THOUGH 
A JET STREAK ACROSS THE OH VALLEY REGION WILL PROVIDE GOOD UPPER 
DIVERGENCE AND A WARM FRONT WILL BE LIFTING NORTH ACROSS OUR AREA. 
QPF AMOUNTS ON THE ORDER OF 1 INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE IN SOUTHERN AND 
WESTERN SECTIONS THURSDAY...AND CATEGORICAL POPS WILL BE FORECAST. 

AS THE LOW MOVES INTO IL/IN ON THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY...PRECIP WILL 
LIKELY BECOME MORE DIURNALLY-BASED AS WE LOSE OUR MID/UPPER LEVEL 
FORCING AND THE RIDGE ALONG THE CAROLINA COASTLINE RETROGRADES. 
MOISTURE WILL REMAIN PLENTIFUL HOWEVER...SO WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS ON 
FRIDAY. BY SATURDAY THE RIDGE AXIS EXTENDS ACROSS 
MS/AL/GA...REDUCING OUR FEED OF GULF MOISTURE. MEANWHILE A SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH WILL PASS TO OUR NORTH SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. WILL HAVE 
CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES 
NORTH AND DURING THE AFTERNOONS. TEMPS WILL RE RETURNING TO THE 
LOWER 90S IN THE VALLEY BY THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK.

&&

966 
FXUS64 KMRX 102223
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
623 PM EDT TUE JUL 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED ZONES TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING TO DECREASE 
RAIN CHANCES. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH 
WILL BECOME MORE DIFFUSE AS IT SLOWLY SETTLES INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION.  THE BOUNDARY COMBINED WITH ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE SCATTERED CONVECTION ON AND OFF 
THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM.  LOCATIONS THAT HAVE SEVERAL SHOWERS OR 
THUNDERSTORMS MOVE THROUGH MAY SEE SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL AMOUNTS AND 
COULD EXPERIENCE LOCALIZED MINOR FLOODING OF LOW LYING AREAS AND 
NORMAL FLOOD PRONE AREAS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A WEAKNESS IN THE 
UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...THEN BERMUDA 
RIDGE EXPANDS EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR THIS WEEKEND. END 
RESULT WILL BE CONTINUE RELATIVELY HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS THROUGH 
FRIDAY...THEN DROPPING OFF TO MORE CLIMO (30 PERCENT) FOR THE 
WEEKEND. GREATEST COVERAGE AND INTENSITY WILL REMAIN DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE TORRENTIAL RAINS DUE 
TO CONTINUED HIGH PWS (1.75-2.00 INCHES) AND DOWNBURSTS WINDS.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...AN UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO THE NORTHEAST 
UNITED STATES WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE NORTHWEST. MEDIUM RANGE 
MODELS SUGGEST A SERIES OF MCS MAY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM 
THE OHIO VALLEY. THESE STORMS COULD BE SEVERE. WILL NEED TO MONITOR 
HOW THE SYNOPTIC SETUP COMES TOGETHER.

AGAIN...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

439 
FXUS64 KMRX 100732
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT TUE JUL 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...A SLOW-MOVING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY WILL BE THE DOMINANT 
FEATURE FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. A DEEP MOISTURE FEED OFF THE GULF 
WILL KEEP PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES BETWEEN 1.75 AND 2 INCHES 
THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD. THE DIFFICULTY WILL BE TO PINPOINT THE 
TIMING AND AREAS OF STRONGER LIFT...AND THE MODELS HAVE SOME 
DISAGREEMENT ON THIS. FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...MESOSCALE BOUNDARIES 
WILL BE THE MAIN FOCUS FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AS SYNOPTIC LIFT 
WILL BE LACKING. AS WE MOVE TOWARD WEDNESDAY...THE FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED...WITH A 300 MB TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE MS 
VALLEY AND THE JET ENTRANCE REGION OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. 
THE GFS AND CANADIAN POINT TOWARD WEDNESDAY FOR GREATEST SYNOPTIC 
LIFT IN THE JET ENTRANCE REGION AND 700 MB DEFORMATION ZONE. THE NAM 
GIVES THE BEST LIFT ON THURSDAY WITH STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE AND A 
850 CONVERGENCE ZONE ACROSS SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS. GIVEN 
THIS UNCERTAIN TIMING...WILL BLANKET LIKELY POPS FOR BOTH DAYS. WITH 
EITHER MODEL SCENARIO...DEEP MOISTURE AND PERIODS OF HEAVY RAINFALL 
WILL BE LIKELY...WITH GOOD POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING. FLOOD WATCH 
ISSUANCES MAY BE NEEDED WITH LATER FORECASTS ONCE THE TIMING BECOMES 
MORE CLEAR. WILL MENTION IN HWO FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS SEEM TO AGREE THAT THE 
FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN IN A FAVORABLE POSITION FOR CONVECTION 
ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE PERIOD AS DEEP MOISTURE TRANSPORT CONTINUES 
TO STREAM NORTH FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO. THE BROAD RIVER OF MOISTURE 
LADEN AIR FROM HIGHER LEVELS WILL BE CHANNELED BETWEEN MEAN 
TROUGHING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND RIDGING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC STATES WHILE SURFACE THROUGH LOW LEVEL FLOW 
WILL TAP THE WESTERN ATLANTIC AND EASTERN GULF WATERS. TWEAKED POPS 
UP A BIT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY IN THIS REGIME WITH A REGION OF LIKELY 
PROBABILITIES WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE WAS PROGGED. A FAVORED REGION OF LIFT APPEARS TO BE ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WITH A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL COMPONENT LEADING TO 
SOME OROGRAPHIC ENHANCEMENT. ALSO ADJUSTED POPS JUST A TAD HIGHER 
FOR BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY...ALTHOUGH WOULD EXPECT RELATIVELY LOWER 
PROBABILITIES DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST WITH THE BERMUDA 
HIGH BULGING WESTWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. AS THIS OCCURS 
THE DEEPER MOISTURE WILL BE PUSHED GRADUALLY WEST OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS WHILE SUBSIDENCE SLOWLY STRENGTHENS OVER THE REGION. 
ADJUSTED MAX TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW MOS GUIDANCE FOR THE FIRST 
COUPLE DAYS IN THE MOIST PATTERN BUT THEN STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX 
MAX TEMPS ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS THE RIDGE BUILDS.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             89  71  85  71  83 /  70  60  60  60  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  86  70  83  71  83 /  70  50  60  60  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  70  82  69  81 /  70  50  60  60  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  66  80  66  82 /  60  30  50  50  60

987 
FXUS64 KMRX 100207 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 PM EDT MON JUL 9 2012

.DISCUSSION...
THE ONLY CHANGE MADE TO THE FORECAST THIS EVENING WAS TO INCREASE
POPS ACROSS THE WESTERN ZONES/CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TO DEFINITE
THROUGH 06Z...GIVEN THE LATEST OBS/TRENDS. THE MAIN STORY
CONTINUES TO BE THE POTENTIAL FOR SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS
AND STORMS ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THIS EVENING...AND PERSISTING
INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AS A COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO DRIFT
SOUTHWARD INTO EAST TENNESSEE. ATTM...INSTABILITY VALUES ARE STILL
FAIRLY HIGH WITH MUCAPE VALUES AOA 2000-2500 J/KG AND LIFTED
INDICES BTWN -5C TO -7C ACROSS A BULK OF EAST TENNESSEE.
THUS...SOME LOCALLY STRONGER STORMS WILL CERTAINLY CONTINUE TO
OCCUR WITH GUSTY OUTFLOW WINDS AND SOME SMALL HAIL POSSIBLE.
HOWEVER...THE BIGGEST IMPACTS FROM THESE STORMS WILL BE LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINFALL AS PWAT VALUES ARE ESTIMATED TO BE AROUND 1.75 TO
2.O INCHES. THIS COULD LEAD TO SOME MINOR FLOODING ISSUES IN
LOCATIONS WHERE STORMS TRAIN/REGENERATE /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE
HIGH TERRAIN/. WIND SHEAR VALUES ARE FAIRLY UNIMPRESSIVE...SO THE
PRIMARILY STORM MODE WILL BE PULSE TYPE AND MULTICELL CLUSTERS.

AFTER MIDNIGHT...INSTABILITY GRADUALLY DECREASES...AS DOES THE
EXPECTED STORM COVERAGE. HOWEVER...WITH MULTIPLE RESIDUAL OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION AND THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD
FRONT DROPPING INTO THE AREA...REASONABLY GOOD CHANCES FOR
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL EXIST THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT.
OTHERWISE...PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH MILD LOW
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 60S TO LOW 70S ARE EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN. NAM
SOUNDINGS SUPPORT SOME LOCALIZED AREAS OF FOG...BUT GIVEN THE CLOUD
COVER AND WARM CONDITIONS...DID NOT FEEL THAT ANY DEVELOPMENT WOULD
BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A MENTION IN THE ZONES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             92  72  89  72  85 /  50  80  60  70  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  91  69  86  70  84 /  60  80  60  70  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       90  69  86  70  83 /  60  80  60  60  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              88  67  83  65  81 /  70  70  60  60  70

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.AVIATION...

MVFR FOG DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED AT KTYS/KTRI /AND POSSIBLY SOME

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS 
SHOW A WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER RIDGE REMAINING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. THE 
WEAKNESS IN THE RIDGE WILL ALLOW SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE TO REMAIN 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH PWS GENERALLY BETWEEN 1.75-2.00 INCHES.

FRONTAL BOUNDARY (ESPECIALLY FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY) 
WILL ALLOW FOR A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY...
ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.

FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 PM EDT SUN JUL 8 2012

.DISCUSSION...
BASED ON CURRENT OBS/TRENDS...HAVE ADJUSTED POPS UP ACROSS NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA TO LIKELY
AS SCT SHOWERS AND STORMS APPEAR IMMINENT ACROSS MUCH OF THIS AREA
THIS EVENING AND INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. WITH A COLD FRONT
CONTINUING TO SAG SOUTHWARD FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...COMBINED
WITH A STILL FAIRLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS...SEVERAL CLUSTERS OF STRONG
TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE CONTINUING TO FIRE ACROSS SOUTH CENTRAL
KENTUCKY AND ARE GRADUALLY WORKING THEIR WAY INTO OUR FAR NORTHERN
ZONES AS OF 9:30 PM EDT. WHILE THE PRIMARILY THREATS WITH THIS
ACTIVITY WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND LIGHTNING...SOME LOW-
END SEVERE HAIL AS WELL AS STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS CANNOT BE RULED
OUT WITH THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY /PARTICULARLY BEFORE MIDNIGHT WHEN
CAPE VALUES ARE STILL PROGGED TO BE BTWN 1500-3000 J/KG IN MOST
SPOTS/. AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL CONTINUE TO
STABILIZE WHICH WILL LIMIT THE SEVERE THREAT. HOWEVER...REASONABLE
CHANCES FOR SOME SHOWER/STORM ACTIVITY AND MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION
WILL EXIST THROUGH DAYBREAK /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES
WHICH WILL BE CLOSEST TO THE FRONT/. ATTM...THE FRONT STILL APPEARS
TO BE ON TRACK TO WORK ITS WAY INTO THE AREA LATE TONIGHT...WHICH
WILL SET UP SOME BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS TOMORROW.
OTHERWISE...MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS AND CONTINUED MILD
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S ARE EXPECTED ONCE AGAIN
IN MOST LOCATIONS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
A HOT AND HUMID AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHWARD INTO EASTERN KY AND 
SOUTHWEST VA BY SUNSET...WITH A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF IT. AS A RESULT...EXPECT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH THE BEST 
COVERAGE OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN DUE TO THEIR PROXIMITY 
TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...AND THEN BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY 
AROUND THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST WILL HELP TO KEEP THE LOCAL AIR MASS 
UNSTABLE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED 
EACH DAY AND NIGHT. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE LOCAL AIR MASS SHOULD 
BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SO THINK 
THAT SOME STORMS COULD PRODUCE DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST WITH MINS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL TREND TOWARDS 
THE WARMER GFS GUIDANCE MAXES WHICH HAVE BEEN VERIFYING BETTER 
LATELY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL STALL OVER 
TO JUST SOUTH AND EAST OF THE MRX CWA. IT IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN IN 
THE GENERAL AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED...PROVIDING A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY. THE COMBINATION OF THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IN THE AREA AND ASSOCIATED CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP 
TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONAL LEVEL THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT SAT JUL 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A BERMUDA HIGH CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC... 
WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES 
REGION. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT INTO THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY BY LATE TONIGHT...AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY 
NIGHT. THUS...WILL SLOWLY INCREASE POPS EACH PERIOD...WITH THE 
HIGHEST POPS ON MONDAY AS THE FRONT STALLS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING AHEAD AND ALONG THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AND MID-LEVEL WINDS INCREASING NEAR THE FRONTAL 
ZONE...THINK THAT SOME SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE EACH PERIOD 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS 
THE WARMER GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...WHICH HAVE 
BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UNSETTLED CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL LINGER 
OVER THE REGION TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...PROVIDING A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM EACH DAY. UPPER TROUGH OVER THE AREA FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY...WILL KEEP AT LEAST 20 TO 30 POPS IN PLACE FOR THE END 
OF THE PERIOD. GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   74  96  73  92  72 /  20  40  50  60  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     74  95  73  90  72 /  10  40  50  60  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN             74  95  73  90  72 /  10  40  50  60  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    70  93  69  86  68 /  10  40  50  60  50 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY UNTIL 9 PM EDT /8 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MARION...
     MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...
     WEST POLK.

VA...NONE.

845 
FXUS64 KMRX 071416
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT SAT JUL 7 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE ENTIRE SOUTHEAST...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER 
VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES REGION. DEWPOINTS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
HAVE RISEN TO AROUND 70 DEGREES WITH VERY WARM LATE MORNING TEMPS 
ALREADY IN THE MID 80S. AS A RESULT...THE HEAT ADVISORY FOR 
SOUTHEAST TN APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...WITH ANOTHER HOT AND HUMID DAY 
EXPECTED ACROSS THE ENTIRE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. AN UPPER- 
LEVEL HIGH CENTERED OVER THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY IS PROGGED TO 
BUILD SOUTHEASTWARD TODAY AND SHOULD BECOME CENTERED OVER EASTERN KY 
AND SOUTHWEST VA BY SUNSET. SUBSIDENCE ALOFT WITH THIS UPPER-LEVEL 
HIGH SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN THIS AFTERNOON...WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION EXPECTED 
GENERALLY SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...THINK 
THAT A FEW ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THE ZONES THIS MORNING TO RAISE TEMPS A LITTLE. WILL ALSO 
PLAN TO UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE SEVERE 
POSSIBILITIES FOR TODAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  101  74  96  73  91 /  20  20  40  50  60 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     99  73  95  73  89 /  10  10  40  50  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN             99  73  95  73  89 /  10  10  40  50  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    97  70  93  68  86 /  10  10  40  50  60 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY UNTIL 9 PM EDT /8 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MARION...
     MCMINN...MEIGS...NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE...
     WEST POLK.

FXUS64 KMRX 070743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EDT SAT JUL 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
MID-UPPER RIDGE AXIS TO OUR NORTH WILL SHIFT SLIGHTLY SOUTHWARD 
TODAY...STRETCHING FROM FROM VA ACROSS THE OH VALLEY. THIS WILL 
SUPPRESS CONVECTION ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA TODAY...ESPECIALLY 
NORTH. NAM SHOWS A WEAK SURFACE TROUGH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS 
OF THE AREA TODAY...WITH LESS CIN IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS THERE AS 
WELL. WILL INCLUDE A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HOT TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TODAY BENEATH 
THE RIDGE...WITH MOST AREAS IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S...AND AROUND 100 
IN CHA. WITH DEWPOINTS CLOSE TO 70...HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL TOUCH 
105 FOR AN HOUR OR TWO IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...SO WILL KEEP THE 
HEAT ADVISORY GOING FOR THAT AREA. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE
REGION BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
FOR SATURDAY. THE MAIN ACTIVITY ON SATURDAY SHOULD BE DURING THE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. A FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY
AND LINGERS OVER THE REGION INTO FRIDAY BRINGING A CHANCE FOR
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD. WILL CONTINUE
WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR MONDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN
ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE EARLY PORTIONS OF THE PERIOD...THEN BECOME
SEASONAL FOR THE LATTER PORTIONS OF THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
932 PM EDT FRI JUL 6 2012

.DISCUSSION...
NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES NEEDED AS THE FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK.
IN WAKE OF THURSDAY'S MCS...THE FORECAST HAS BEEN MUCH MORE BENIGN
THIS EVENING. THE ONLY STORMS THAT DEVELOPED HAVE BEEN WEAK
OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED CONVECTION THAT HAVE BEGUN TO WANE WITH THE
LOSS OF SOLAR HEATING. WITH A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE
CONTROLLING THE WEATHER...TEMPERATURES ONCE AGAIN APPROACHED OR
EXCEEDED RECORD LEVELS EARLIER THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE AREA. THE
WARM CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE INTO THE NIGHTTIME HOURS AS LOWS WILL
STRUGGLE TO DROP BELOW 70 DEGREES ACROSS MUCH OF THE GREAT
TENNESSEE VALLEY...AND WILL LIKELY ONLY FALL INTO THE UPPER 60S
ACROSS THE FAR NORTHEASTERN ZONES.

973 
FXUS64 KMRX 061923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT FRI JUL 6 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A MESO HIGH CENTERED OVER THE FORECAST AREA... 
RESULTING FROM THE CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW OF YESTERDAY'S MCS. THIS 
CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW HAS ALSO RESULTED IN A DRIER AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...WHICH HAS LIMITED CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY THIS 
AFTERNOON. MODELS INDICATE THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS WILL SLOWLY BUILD EASTWARD OVER THE OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS 
ON SATURDAY...WITH TEMPS REMAINING WELL ABOVE NORMAL AND ISOLATED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING AGAIN IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WITH THE 
CENTER OF THE UPPER HIGH CLOSER TO THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY... 
THINK THAT TEMPS SHOULD BE A LITTLE WARMER (COMPARED TO TODAY). IT 
APPEARS THAT HEAT INDICES OVER SOUTHEAST TN WILL BE AROUND 105 
DEGREES ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON...SO WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A HEAT 
ADVISORY. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD INCREASE SOME ON SUNDAY... AS 
DEWPOINTS AND INSTABILITY SLOWLY INCREASE AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD THEN 
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT...INCREASING THE 
CONVECTIVE COVERAGE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WITH COOLER TEMPS ON SUNDAY DUE TO THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN 
CLOUD COVER AND CONVECTIVE COVERAGE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WILL BE IN AN UNSETTLED WEATHER 
PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED. MODEL CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN POOR WITH 
TIMING OF A COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE AREA. CURRENT THINKING IS IT 
WILL MOVE IN AROUND THE MONDAY TIME FRAME...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH 
LIKELY POPS FOR MONDAY. THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO STALL JUST TO THE 
SOUTH AND EAST OF THE MRX CWA AND CONTINUE TO EFFECT AREA WEATHER 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. THIS WILL PROVIDE A CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THE COMBINATION OF SLIGHTLY 
COOLER AIR BEHIND THE FRONT AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL ALLOW FOR COOLER...MORE SEASONAL 
TEMPERATURES.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   72 100  74  96  74 /  20  20  20  40  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     71  98  73  95  73 /  20  20  20  40  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN             71  98  73  95  73 /  20  20  20  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    66  96  68  93  68 /  20  20  20  40  50 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

     SATURDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...

FXUS64 KMRX 061505
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT FRI JUL 6 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A MESO HIGH CENTERED OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WHICH IS A RESULT OF THE CONVECTIVE 
OUTFLOW FROM YESTERDAY'S MCS. THIS CONVECTIVE OUTFLOW HAS ALSO 
RESULTED IN A DRIER AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH LOWER 
DEWPOINTS OBSERVED IN THE MID 60S. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT THE 
CONVECTIVE COVERAGE THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BE SCATTERED. TEMPS SHOULD 
BE A LITTLE COOLER COMPARED TO YESTERDAY...DUE TO THE DELAYED 
WARMING CREATED BY THIS MORNING'S FOG COVERAGE AND INCREASED SOIL 
MOISTURE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST 
TRENDS AND TO LOWER POPS A LITTLE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  100  73  98  73  93 /  30  20  20  20  40 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     98  71  98  73  92 /  30  20  20  20  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN             98  72  98  72  92 /  30  20  20  20  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    96  65  96  69  91 /  30  20  20  20  40

512 
FXUS64 KMRX 060756
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
356 AM EDT FRI JUL 6 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
OVERALL PATTERN TODAY LOOKS SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...SO WILL NOT STRAY 
TOO FAR FROM PERSISTENCE. THE DAY WILL BEGIN WITH PATCHY FOG IN 
AREAS THAT SAW RAIN YESTERDAY AND CLEARING SKIES OVERNIGHT. WV 
IMAGERY INDICATES A SHORTWAVE TROUGH ACROSS OH/PA THAT WILL BE 
MOVING SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY. THIS MAY HELP SPARK CONVECTION IN 
NORTHERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON...MUCH LIKE YESTERDAY BUT WITHOUT AS 
MUCH SEVERE POTENTIAL. ISOLATED DAMAGING WIND GUSTS MAY BE POSSIBLE. 
A SOUTHWARD MOTION OF STORMS WILL BRING THEM ACROSS THE TN VALLEY 
THROUGH THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WILL HAVE HIGH CHANCE POPS 
IN MOST SPOTS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE LATEST MOS GUIDANCE 
HAS TRENDED COOLER WITH TEMPERATURES TODAY...AND WITH MOST AREAS 
RECEIVING SOME GROUND MOISTURE FROM YESTERDAY'S STORMS...WILL LOWER 
TEMPS A BIT FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST...THOUGH STILL ABOVE THE 00Z MOS. 
THIS WILL PUT THE SOUTHERN VALLEY BELOW HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR 
THE VAST MAJORITY OF THE DAY. HEAT INDICIES SHOULD TOP OUT BETWEEN 
100-104...SO WILL CANCEL THE HEAT ADVISORY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES 
TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE WEEKEND. MOST OF THE ACTIVITY SHOULD 
DIURNAL. A FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY AND LINGER OVER THE 
REGION INTO THURSDAY BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD. WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGHEST CHANCES FOR 
MONDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE EARLY 
PORTIONS OF THE PERIOD...THEN BECOME SEASONAL FOR THE LATTER 
PORTIONS OF THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             99  73  98  73  93 /  30  30  20  20  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  97  71  98  73  92 /  40  20  20  20  40

.AVIATION...

SHOULD KEEP VIS THERE IN THE MVFR RANGE. THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED
AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...MOVING FROM SW VA AROUND MID AFTERNOON TO
THE TN/GA BORDER IN THE EVENING. WILL MENTION VCTS AT ALL
SITES...THOUGH CONFIDENCE IS HIGHEST AT TRI AND LOWEST AT CHA.

FXUS64 KMRX 051817
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
215 PM EDT THU JUL 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A HOT...HUMID...AND STAGNANT AIR MASS OVER THE 
REGION...WITH A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL AN AIR MASS THAT IS VERY CONDUCIVE TO 
PRODUCING STRONG WIND GUSTS...EVIDENCED BY AN INVERTED-V PROFILE IN 
THE BOUNDARY LAYER AND A DEEP MID-LEVEL DRY LAYER. THUS...IT APPEARS 
THAT THE CURRENT COMPLEX OF STORMS MOVING SOUTHWARD FROM THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY COULD PRODUCE A WIDESPREAD WIND EVENT WITH LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL AND FREQUENT CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING. OTHERWISE... 
MODELS INDICATE THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS 
WILL BUILD FARTHER EASTWARD OVER THE WEEKEND...WITH TEMPS REMAINING 
WELL ABOVE NORMAL AND DIURNAL SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING EACH 
DAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...AND WILL REISSUE THE HEAT ADVISORY 
FOR SOUTHEAST TN FOR TOMORROW SINCE HEAT INDICES WILL AGAIN REACH 
AROUND 105 DEGREES IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN CONCERN DURING THE 
EXTEND CONTINUES TO BE TIMING AND POSITION OF AN APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT.  THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE IN AROUND THE SUNDAY/MONDAY 
TIME FRAME... THEN STALL JUST SOUTH AND EAST OF THE REGION FOR 
TUESDAY AND CONTINUE TO EFFECT AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED.  AS A RESULT...WILL SEE A RATHER UNSETTLED EXTENDED PERIOD 
WITH A CHANCE OF CONVECTION MOST DAYS.  BEST CHANCE WILL BE AS THE 
FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA.  CURRENT MODEL RUNS BRING THE FRONT AND 
THE BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION IN ON MONDAY AND HAVE INCREASED POPS 
TO LIKELY FOR THIS PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 051312
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 AM EDT THU JUL 5 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A HOT...HUMID...AND STAGNANT AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH HIGH DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S TO 
LOWER 70S. A MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
MOVES SOUTHWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA ALONG THE EASTERN PERIPHERY 
OF AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. THIS SHORT WAVE HAS 
ALREADY TRIGGERED A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM (MCS) OVER OHIO THIS 
MORNING...AND THIS MCS SHOULD CONTINUE MOVING SOUTHWARD INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AS THE LOCAL AIR MASS BECOMES VERY 
UNSTABLE. THUS...THIS EVENT APPEARS TO HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE 
A WIDESPREAD DAMAGING WIND EVENT ALONG WITH LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL 
AND FREQUENT CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL 
UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF 
AN MCS PRODUCING DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL THIS 
AFTERNOON. 

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST 
RENDS. IN ADDITION...WILL PROBABLY NEED TO RAISE POPS A LITTLE MORE 
LATER THIS MORNING AS THE AREAL COVERAGE OF THE CONVECTION BECOMES 
MORE APPARENT.
&&

832 
FXUS64 KMRX 050815
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EDT THU JUL 5 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE LOCATED ACROSS THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY 
WILL BEGIN TO NUDGE BACK TOWARD THE REGION TODAY...RESULTING IN 
SLIGHTLY INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES AND TEMPERATURES ALOFT. 
THUS...DAYTIME HIGHS WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES WARMER TODAY WITH 
MOST AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS REACHING THE MID TO UPPER 90S 
/WITH SOME LOCATIONS ACROSS SE TENNESSEE APPROACHING THE CENTURY 
MARK/. THIS HEAT WILL COMBINE WITH A HUMID AND MUGGY AIRMASS TO 
CREATE SOME HIGH HEAT INDEX VALUES...PARTICULARLY ACROSS SE 
TENNESSEE WHERE THE BOUNDARY LAYER IS NOT EXPECTED TO MIX OUT AS 
MUCH. THUS...A HEAT ADVISORY WAS NEEDED FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING ACROSS MUCH OF THIS AREA TO ACCOUNT FOR SOME DANGEROUS HEAT 
INDEX VALUES AROUND OR IN EXCESS OF 105 DEGREES. 

THE OTHER WEATHER CONCERN FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT WILL BE THE 
POTENTIAL FOR SOME STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN AN  
VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS /WITH CAPE VALUES PROGGED TO BE BTWN 
2000-3000 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES AOA -6C TO -8C/. ATTM...A COUPLE 
OF MCS FEATURES WERE NOTED ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND ARE GRADUALLY 
WORKING THEIR WAY SOUTHWARD INTO THE OHIO VALLEY THIS MORNING. 
SHOULD THIS COMPLEX /OR SOME OF ITS OUTFLOW/ APPROACH THE AREA 
DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING...IT WILL INCREASE THE THREAT FOR 
SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS OUR AREA GIVEN THE ENVIRONMENT DESCRIBED 
ABOVE. THE SLIGHTLY MORE FAVORED AREA FOR STORMS MAY BE NE TENNESSEE 
AND SW VIRGINIA GIVEN THE TRACK OF THE POTENTIAL MCS...BUT MODELS 
ARE HINTING AT A REASONABLE SHOT OF SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING  
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND ACROSS MOST OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
THIS AFTERNOON. GIVEN THIS POTENTIAL...HAVE GONE ABOVE GUIDANCE AND 
KEPT A SOLID CHANCE POP IN FOR THE ENTIRE AREA THIS AFTERNOON 
THROUGH MID EVENING. ALSO...WITH THE HIGH PWAT VALUES AND SOME 
FAIRLY STEEP LOW-LEVEL LAPSE RATES...THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL AND DAMAGING WINDS WILL EXIST IN ANY STORMS THAT DO 
DEVELOP...SO HAVE KEPT A MENTION OF THOSE THREATS IN THE ZONES AS 
WELL. MOST OF THE ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP IS EXPECTED TO WANE BY 
THE LATE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS...SO HAVE DECREASED WORDING TO 
ISOLATED AFTER MIDNIGHT.    


.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
DIURNAL CONVECTION LOOKS TO OCCUR BOTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS STILL ON TRACK. HOT TEMPS REACHABLE
FRIDAY AFTERNOON BEFORE ANY CONVECTION DOES DEVELOP. FACTORING IN
DEW POINT TEMPS IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S WILL ALLOW HEAT INDICES TO
CREEP BACK ABOVE 100 DEGREES... MAYBE AROUND 105 FOR PARTS OF SE
TN. SATURDAY MOS MAX TEMPS ARE A BIT LOWER THAN FRIDAY...AND IF NO
INCREASE IN CONVECTION DOES OCCUR...THEN MIGHT BE A COUPLE OF
DEGREES TOO LOW.

HEIGHTS FALL ON SUNDAY INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH COLD FRONT SAGGING 
SOUTHWARD. THIS LEADS TO INCREASING RAIN CHANCES (RAINFALL MUCH 
NEEDED) AND COOLER TEMPERATURES. I THINK LIKELY POPS ARE NEEDED BY 
SUNDAY NIGHT OR MONDAY...BUT TIMING ISSUES SUPPORT STAYING WITH VERY 
HIGH CHANCE POPS AND SCATTERED WORDING FOR ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR SO. 

FRONTAL BOUNDARY STALLING INTO TUESDAY SEEMS REASONABLE AND GFSX MOS 
POPS ARE CONSISTENTLY HIGH FOR TUESDAY...THUS KEEPING CHANCE POPS 
FOR TUESDAY AND ALSO FOR WEDNESDAY FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...I INCREASED SKY COVER SOME FOR PERIODS WHEN GREATER THAN 
30 PERCENT POPS WERE IN THE GRIDS. 05/00Z GFSX MOS MAX TEMPS ARE 
TRENDING A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN 04/12Z MOS...WHICH MAKES SENSE.
ADJUSTED MAINLY MAX TEMP GRIDS IN LINE WITH THIS TREND IN GFSX MOS.
MINS STAY IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S EARLY ON IN THE EXTENDED...BUT 
THEN FALL SLIGHTLY BY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE. 


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 041924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT WED JUL 4 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A HOT...HUMID...AND STAGNANT AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
RADARS REVEALING SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE ENTIRE REGION. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH AN UPPER- 
LEVEL SHORT WAVE PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTHWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ALONG THE EASTERN PERIPHERY OF AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH CENTERED OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS. THIS SHORT WAVE HAS ALREADY TRIGGERED A MESOSCALE 
CONVECTIVE SYSTEM (MCS) OVER NORTHERN MN THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH 
SHOULD THEN MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION INTO 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...AND THEN SOUTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA ON THURSDAY. THIS MCS WILL HAVE TO POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE A 
WIDESPREAD DAMAGING WIND EVENT ALONG WITH LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND 
FREQUENT CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING...ESPECIALLY IF IT ARRIVES IN THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS WHEN PEAK HEATING COULD CREATE A POTENTIALLY HIGHLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL 
MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL 
IN THE ZONES. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST...BUT WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS ON THURSDAY 
DUE TO THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP COVERAGE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE UPPER RIDGE OVER 
THE PLAINS IS FIRMLY IN PLACE THURSDAY NIGHT. THE FORECAST AREA WILL 
BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE BUT ON THE EASTERN EDGE. DIURNAL STORMS WILL 
LIKELY BE DYING OUT LATE THURSDAY EVENING AS IS TYPICAL THIS TIME OF 
YEAR. 

CONFIDENCE RATHER LOW FOR PRECIP CHANCES ON FRIDAY WITH DIVERGENT 
MODEL SOLUTIONS. THE NAM PICKS UP ON A SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED MCS 
MOVING ACROSS EASTERN KY WHILE THE GFS PICKS UP WIDELY SCATTERED/ 
ISOLATED STORMS OVER THE E TN MOUNTAINS. LOW END CHANCE POPS ACROSS 
THE AREA BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON LOOKS REASONABLE.

THE BIGGER STORY THAN THE PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE THE HEAT ON FRIDAY 
INTO SATURDAY. AHEAD OF A WEAK COLD FRONT...SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL 
BE ON THE RISE ALONG WITH THE TEMPERATURES. THUS HEAT INDICES WILL 
APPROACH 105 DEGREES. THIS WILL BE SOMETHING TO WATCH OVER THE NEXT 
COUPLE OF DAYS.

BY SUNDAY...SOME RELIEF TO THE HEAT MAY BE ON THE WAY. LONGER RANGE 
MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT IN PRODUCING RAINFALL FOR THE FORECAST 
AREA. THERE ARE HINTS OF SLOWING THIS FEATURE SO IF RAIN DOES NOT 
MAKE IT BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY LOOK LIKE THE 
BEST BET. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD STALL IN THE VICINITY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK HOPEFULLY SERVING AS A FOCUS FOR MORE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO BRING THE MUCH NEEDED RAINFALL THIS AREA NEEDS.
&&

945 AM EDT WED JUL 4 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS LINGERING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH AREA RADARS ALREADY INDICATING SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE ENTIRE

STORMS POSSIBLY BECOMING STRONG TO SEVERE. WITH THE LACK OF ANY

CONVECTION WILL LIKELY BE AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TEMPS SHOULD 
BE FAIRLY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...SINCE THE AIR MASS HAS NOT CHANGED 
MUCH FROM YESTERDAY. THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS 
MORNING TO RAISE TEMPS A LITTLE.

211 
FXUS64 KMRX 040755
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT WED JUL 4 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
THE UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE THAT HAS HELPED PROMOTE THE INCREDIBLE HEAT 
THAT HAS PLAGUED THE REGION IN RECENT DAYS WILL PUSH FURTHER TO THE
NORTH AND WEST OF THE AREA TODAY. THUS...WITH SLIGHTLY LOWER
THICKNESS VALUES AND TEMPERATURES ALOFT...HIGHS THIS INDEPENDENCE
DAY SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER IN MOST LOCATIONS /WITH THE
MERCURY GENERALLY PEAKING IN THE LOW TO MID 90S/. MODELS CONTINUE
TO HINT AT AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH DROPPING SOUTHEASTWARD
THROUGH THE AREA LATER TODAY...WHICH COULD PROVIDE SOME ENHANCED
LIFT FOR SOME AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER...
GUIDANCE HAS BACKED OFF ON THE THUNDER THREAT SOMEWHAT...WITH THE
NAM IN PARTICULAR NOW SHOWING VERY ISOLATED ACTIVITY GENERALLY
FAVORING THE MOUNTAINS. STILL...BASED ON THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT
IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...THE AFOREMENTIONED SHORTWAVE AND AN
UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE...CERTAINLY FEEL LIKE CHANCE POPS ARE WARRANTED
ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...THOUGH HAVE
DECREASED THEM A BIT OVERNIGHT. THE MORE FAVORED LOCATIONS FOR
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WILL BE ACROSS SW VIRGINIA AND NE
TENNESSEE...WHICH WILL BE CLOSEST TO THE BEST UPPER-LEVEL LIFT...AS
WELL AS HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS. WITH WEAK WIND SHEAR VALUES
EXPECTED...STORM ORGANIZATION SHOULD BE FAIRLY POOR...WITH PULSE
STORMS AND PERHAPS SOME MULTICELL CLUSTERS BEING THE PREDOMINANT
STORM TYPE.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO FLEX BACK OUR WAY THURSDAY INTO
SATURDAY...WHICH WOULD SENSIBLY LEAD TO MORE HOT TEMPS AND RATHER
LIMITED RAIN CHANCES. MOST LIKELY ANY CONVECTION WILL BE ISOLATED
AND MAINLY DIURNAL FOR THESE PERIODS... BUT GIVEN SOME UNCERTAINTY
I KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR NOW. THIS LED ME TO FAVOR
THE HOTTER MAX TEMPS WHERE ANY SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED...AND
IN FACT A FEW 100 DEGREE PLUS HIGHS MAY VERY WELL CREEP BACK INTO
THE REGION (ESPECIALLY ACROSS SRN AREAS).

THE PATTERN DOES TAKE A NOTICABLE CHANGE BY SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY 
WITH HEIGHTS FALLING AND A W-NW FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPING. MESOSCALE 
COMPLEX COULD EASILY BE HEADED OUR WAY BY LATE SUNDAY OR MONDAY... 
BRINGING INCREASED RAIN CHANCES AND COOLER TEMPS. FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
LOOKS TO BE APPROACHING MONDAY AND COULD HANG AROUND INTO TUESDAY
...WHICH IS BEING DEPICTED BY ECMWF. GFSX MOS POPS REMAIN ABOVE 
CLIMO FOR TUESDAY FROM LAST 3 MOS RUNS...SO IT IS WISE TO KEEP 
CHANCE POPS GOING FOR NOW. I NUDGED MAX TEMPS DOWN A BIT FOR SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY GIVEN THE CHANGING PATTERN...WHILE GFSX MOS MINS 
WERE CONSISTENT AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             96  72  98  72  99 /  30  30  30  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  94  71  96  71  97 /  30  30  30  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       95  71  96  70  97 /  30  30  30  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              92  68  93  64  95 /  30  30  20  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EDT TUE JUL 3 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...RADAR INDICATING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH A SHORTWAVE. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST
CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS FOR TONIGHT. ANOTHER SHORTWAVE
TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN...BUT NO RECORDS SHOULD
BE BROKEN. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE...STAYED CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS HAVE
DIVERGED IN THEIR SOLUTIONS FROM THE PAST TWO MAJOR RUNS. THE GFS
CONTINUES TO BE THE MOST PERSISTENT HOWEVER NAM HAS HANDLED
PRECIPITATION BETTER. STILL SEEMS REASONABLE TO HAVE HIGH END
CHANCE POPS ESPECIALLY OVER SW VIRGINIA AND NE TENNESSEE. WITH A
LOT OF CONVECTION STILL DEVELOPING BY EARLY EVENING...EXPECTING THE
ACTIVITY TO SLOWLY DISSIPATE BEFORE MIDNIGHT. THIS MAY INHIBIT THE
CELEBRATION ACTIVITIES PLANNED FOR AFTER DARK. CERTAINLY NOT CLEAR
CUT AND CONFIDENCE FROM YESTERDAY/S FORECAST IS SLIGHTLY LOWER.

BOTH THE GFS AND NAM AGREE ON A MCS TYPE SYSTEM MOVING SOUTH TO 
SOUTHWEST OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND INTO THURSDAY. 
BOTH MODELS ARE BULLISH IN COVERAGE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND A 
SYSTEM LIKE THIS COULD BRING BENEFICIAL RAINFALL TO THE REGION. 

THE GRIP OF THE UPPER HIGH BEGINS TO TAKE HOLD OF THE REGION ONCE 
AGAIN. THIS SHOULD PRODUCE WELL ABOVE NORMAL DAYTIME TEMPERATURE 
TRENDS AND LOWER RAINFALL CHANCES. THE FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
EXTREME EASTERN TN LOOKS LIKE THE BETTER BET. 

LONGER RANGE MODELS STILL INDICATE A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE 
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. CONFIDENCE IS PRETTY HIGH 
THAT FOR RAINFALL ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS THE 
UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AND A COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTHWARD INTO 
AL/GA/SC AND NC. EXPECT THIS WEEKEND DAYTIME TEMPERATURES TO BE WELL 
ABOVE NORMAL...NEAR 100 DEGREES.

679 
FXUS64 KMRX 030812
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
412 AM EDT TUE JUL 3 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMAINING CONVECTION IS
EXTREMELY ISOLATED THIS MORNING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A
CLUSTER OF CONVECTION CONTINUES TO WEAKEN UPSTREAM OVER CENTRAL AND
NW KY...AS IT MOVES SE AT NEAR 20 MPH TOWARD NRN PARTS OF THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS ARE THINNING AND THERE
MIGHT BE A FEW AREAS OF FOG WHERE RAINS OCCURRED MONDAY AFTERNOON
OR EVENING.

03/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW WEAKER NW FLOW ALOFT ACROSS NE HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...BUT TRACK OF CONVECTION TODAY WILL 
BE SE AT 15 TO 20 MPH. MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING OVER KY AND NRN PLATEAU IN THE HEAT OF THE 
DAY...THEN TRACKING SE. ISOLATED CONVECTION COULD ALSO POP UP JUST 
ABOUT ANYWHERE...BUT PROBABLY MORE LIKELY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 

PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED REASONABLE WITH A SLIGHT 
INCREASE TO CHANCE POPS EARLIER TODAY OVER OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES. 
THICKNESSES AND 850 MB TEMPS SUGGEST A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW MONDAY 
MAXES...WITH A BLEND OF SIMILAR MOS HIGHS GOOD. NO HEAT ADVISORY OR 
RECORD HIGHS FOR TODAY...(CHA - 102...TYS - 99...TRI - 95).

CONVECTION FOR TONIGHT SHOULD BE MAINLY LIMITED TO 00Z TO 06Z 
WEDNESDAY...WITH NO CHANGES MADE FOR NOW AS CHANCE POPS ARE 
SUFFICIENT. MOS MINS VERY CLOSE AND FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...THE MAIN WEATHER THEME FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE
CONTINUED ABOVE NORMAL /BUT COOLER/ TEMPERATURES AND SOME CHANCES
FOR SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY
NEXT WEEK. ON INDEPENDENCE DAY...THE CENTER OF A STRONG SUBTROPICAL
RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED ACROSS THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER
VALLEY...INDUCING A PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT ACROSS THE
REGION. MODELS ARE ALSO SHOWING A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH
EAST TENNESSEE DURING THE AFTERNOON...WHICH WILL SERVE AS A TRIGGER
FOR SOME SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE REGION GIVEN THE
PROGGED INSTABILITY VALUES IN PLACE /WITH CAPE VALUES AOA 1500-2000
J/KG AND LIFTED INDEX VALUES AROUND -5C/. THE BEST CHANCE FOR
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WILL BE ACROSS SW VIRGINIA AND NE
TENNESSEE...WHICH WILL BE CLOSEST TO THE BEST UPPER-LEVEL LIFT.
WITH FAIRLY MODEST WIND SHEAR VALUES...STORM ORGANIZATION WILL BE
LIMITED SOMEWHAT...WITH MULTICELL CLUSTERS BEING THE PREDOMINANT
STORM TYPE. ANYONE WITH OUTDOOR PLANS ACROSS THE REGION THIS
INDEPENDENCE DAY SHOULD PLAN FOR THE REASONABLE PROBABILITY OF
THUNDERSTORMS GIVEN THE FACTORS MENTIONED ABOVE.
ADDITIONALLY...SOME COOLER TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED...WITH
HIGHS PEAKING IN THE LOW TO MID 90S...A WELCOME CHANGE AFTER THE
RECORD BREAKING HEAT THIS PAST WEEKEND.

THEREAFTER...THE AFOREMENTIONED RIDGE WILL SCOOT BACK TOWARD THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND LATER IN THE WEEK...RESULTING IN A SLIGHT 
WARMING TREND HEADING TOWARD THE WEEKEND /WITH HIGHS PEAKING IN THE 
MID TO UPPER 90S/. STILL...AT LEAST SOME SLIGHT CHANCES FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN/ WILL EXIST 
GIVEN THE MOISTURE THAT WILL BE PRESENT UNDER THE RIDGE AND THE 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS THAT WILL BE IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION. EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...MODELS ARE SHOWING THE RIDGE FLATTENING AND PUSHING 
SOUTH OF THE AREA AS AN UPPER-TROUGH SWINGS TROUGH THE GREAT 
LAKES...PUSHING A COLD FRONT IN THE VICINITY OF THE AREA. SHOULD 
THIS SOLUTION VERIFY...SOME COOLER TEMPERATURES AND CONTINUED 
RAIN/THUNDER CHANCES WILL EXIST HEADING INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK.

479 
FXUS64 KMRX 021939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 PM EDT MON JUL 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SHORTWAVES TRACKING THROUGH THE
AREA BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT AND
TUESDAY. THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE CWA. MAY SEE A FEW STRONG STORMS TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES SHOULD
BE COOLER ON TUESDAY...BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THE UPPER HIGH THAT
SHIFTED WEST THIS PAST WEEKEND HAS PUT THE FORECAST AREA UNDER A
BRIEF NW FLOW REGIME THAT IS EXPECTED TO LAST THROUGH THE HOLIDAY.
ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS TUESDAY AFTERNOON WILL LINGER INTO
TUESDAY NIGHT. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE VERY UNSTABLE BY LATE
AFTERNOON.

BOTH GFS AND ECMWF INDICATE A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH TRANSLATING IN 
THE MEAN FLOW ON THE NORTHEASTERN FRINGE OF THE HIGH BACK OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS PATTERN WOULD FAVOR ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. ONCE AGAIN...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE PRIMED AS INSTABILITY 
INCREASES. LIFTED INDICES FROM -4 TO -8 DEGREES C AND CAPE NEAR 1500 
J/KG WILL SUPPORT THUNDERSTORMS. IN PARTICULAR...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE LOOK LIKE THE BEST BET AS THESE LOCATIONS 
WILL BE CLOSER TO THE UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT. WEDNESDAY IS THE 4TH OF 
JULY AND OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES MAY BE HINDERED BY THE STORMS. PEOPLE 
ARE REMINDED THAT IF THEY ARE CLOSE ENOUGH TO HEAR THUNDER THEY ARE 
CLOSE ENOUGH TO BE STRUCK BY LIGHTNING. 

AFTER WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK OVER 
THE REGION NEARLY SQUASHING ANY PRECIPITATION CHANCES THROUGH THE 
END OF THE WEEK INTO THE EARLY WEEKEND. HIGHER TERRAIN OVER FAR 
EASTERN TN AND SW VA WILL BE FAVORED AREAS DURING THIS TIME FRAME.  

THE UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AGAIN ON SUNDAY AND THIS TIME IT LOOKS 
LIKE A LONG TERM PATTERN CHANGE. BELIEVE IT OR NOT...MODELS ARE 
HINTING AT A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE REGION BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK. THE NORTHWEST FLOW WOULD HELP STEER STORMS THAT FORM OVER THE 
MS/OH VALLEYS INTO MIDDLE AND EAST TN. STILL A LONG WAYS OUT BUT FUN 
TO THINK ABOUT AFTER THE RECORD BREAKING OF RECENT PAST. NOT ONLY 
WOULD SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR ARRIVE BUT MUCH NEEDED PRECIPITATION WOULD 
BRING RELIEF TO THE DRIEST AREAS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
440 AM EDT MON JUL 2 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ONE MORE DAY WITH RECORD 
HIGHS AND ABOVE 100 DEGREES STILL EXPECTED ACROSS SE TN...WHERE THE
HEAT ADVISORY CONTINUES. CONVECTION GOT RATHER ROBUST SUNDAY EVENING 
AND CONTINUES EARLY THIS MORNING...DUE IN PART TO NEW ACTIVITY 
POPPING ALONG OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES. 02/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW THE 
UPPER RIDGE HAS GIVEN WAY A BIT TO NW FLOW ALOFT OVER MUCH OF OUR 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS IN FAIR AGREEMENT ON A SERIES OF UPPER LEVEL 
DISTURBANCES IN THIS NW FLOW...TO GENERATE THUNDERSTORMS AT ABOUT 
ANY TIME...WITH A PEAK IN THE AFTERNOONS AND EVENINGS. EXPECTING A 
FEW STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORMS...WITH HAIL UP TO 1 INCH IN 
DIAMETER AND WIND GUSTS TO 60 MPH. TORRENTIAL RAIN...AS NOTED SUNDAY 
EVENING...IS ALSO POSSIBLE WITH A FEW STORMS. 

850 MB TEMPS AND LOW LEVEL THICKNESSES DEFINITELY DROP FROM THE HEAT 
WAVE DAYS...RIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS SHOULD EASE MAX TEMPS DOWN 
INTO THE 80S AND 90S...STILL SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS.
MOS MAX/MIN TEMPS LOOKED REASONABLE AND WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

MAJOR CHANGE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WAS TO 
INCREASE POPS JUST ABOUT EACH PERIOD...IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS AND 
ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT
THE SURFACE CONTINUES WITH THE MAIN UPPER RIDGE ALOFT CENTERED OVER
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTH CENTRAL STATES. TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN
STATES EXTENDING THROUGH THE CAROLINAS WILL KEEP THE DOOR OPEN FOR
SHORTWAVE ENERGY TO MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS
WITH THE SOUTHWEST SECTION WITH THE LEAST CHANCE OF CONVECTION.
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY ECMWF SHOWS RIDGING DEVELOPING TO THE NORTH IN
THE OHIO VALLEY WITH GFS SHOWING THIS TOO WITH DRYING NORTH AND
CONVECTION BEING CONCENTRATED TO THE SOUTH AS A POSSIBLE WEAK FRONT
MOVES INTO GA AND AL FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY. THE RIDGING NORTH AND
FRONT TO THE SOUTH MAY DECREASE IMPULSES MOVING AROUND THE RIDGE.
HIGHS SHOULD BE STILL ABOVE NORMAL IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S WITH
UPPER 80S IN SW VA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS.
THAT IS STILL A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL.

HAS BEEN UNDERESTIMATING THE WARMTH OF THIS AIRMASS. FORECAST GRIDS

CHALLENGES THE RECORD HIGHS FOR MONDAY JULY 2. CHA 99 TYS 98 TRI 97 
ALL SET IN 1954. HEAT ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE REQUIRED FOR THE

736 
FXUS64 KMRX 010843
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
443 AM EDT SUN JUL 1 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING 
ACROSS SE STATES HAS BEEN SUPPRESSED SLIGHTLY OVER SW VA...WITH W-NW 
FLOW NOTED ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS AND OHIO VALLEY. GFS 
MODEL SEEMS MORE SENSIBLE FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH NAM CREATING 
AN INCREDIBLE INCREASE IN CONVECTION WITH LITTLE CHANGE IN PATTERN. 
THUS...I KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS POP/WEATHER GRIDS...STAYING 
IN THE 15 TO 30 PERCENT RANGE ON POPS FOR NOW. TSRA FAVORS HIGHER 
TERRAIN TODAY...BUT ALLOWING FOR AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS 
THE BOARD TONIGHT. FORECAST AREA REMOVED FROM SLIGHT RISK THREAT...
BUT A BRIEFLY STRONG TO MINIMAL SEVERE STORM CAN'T BE RULED OUT IN 
THE INTENSE HEAT OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

TEMPS GET OFF TO A ROBUST START THIS MORNING...WITH LITTLE IF ANY 
DROP IN 850 MB TEMPS OR PARTIAL THICKNESSES. THIS FAVORS GOING A 
DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THE HOTTER MOS HIGHS...EXCEPT OVER SW VA. RECORD 
HIGHS WILL BE SET AGAIN TODAY...WITH HEAT INDICES PROBABLY VERY NEAR 
VALUES FROM YESTERDAY (PROVIDED DEW POINT TEMPS TUMBLE A BIT FROM 
MIXING). HEAT ADVISORY LOOKS ON TRACK WITH NO ADDITION OF SW VA OR 
REMAINING MTN GROUPS NEEDED. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE
FINALLY BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN MONDAY. THICKNESSES LOWER AND
850 MB TEMPERATURES DROP. KEPT TREND OF TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY ABOVE
MAV MAXES ESPECIALLY WITH LACK OF RAINFALL AND RECORD BREAKING HEAT
WAVE IN PROGRESS. SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS STILL NEAR OR
SLIGHTLY ABOVE 100 WITH HEAT INDEX VALUES 100 TO 105 IN THOSE
AREAS. RECORD HIGHS STILL A POSSIBILITY FROM KNOXVILLE SOUTH. A
LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS SHORT WAVE
ENERGY MOVES SOUTHEAST ACROSS MAINLY NE TN AND SW VA MONDAY AND
TUESDAY IN ABOUT ALL AREAS. NAM MODEL MORE AGRESSIVE WITH ACTIVITY
MONDAY AND GFS MONDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE GENERALLY 30 PERCENT LATE
AFTERNOON AND EVENING DECREASING TO SLIGHT CHANCE OVERNIGHT MONDAY
NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGHS TUESDAY A FEW DEGREES COOLER
THAN MONDAY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH UPPER RIDGE CENTERED OVER
THE CENTRAL STATES NW FLOW WILL BRING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE FORECAST AREA BUT HIGHS STILL ABOVE NORMAL.
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY THERE IS SOME REBUILDING OF THE RIDGE WHICH
SHOULD CAUSE A DECREASE IN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. SOME STRONG
TO POSSIBLY SEVERE STORMS COULD DEVELOP EACH DAY WITH DAMAGING
WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL THE MAIN THREATS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT SAT JUN 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE DEW POINTS AND LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE HAVE BEEN CREEPING UP. ISOLATED OROGRAPHIC CONVECTION 
REMAINS POSSIBLE THIS EVENING WITH A SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCE SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY. BEST LAYER THICKNESS PACKING REMAINS NORTH OF AREA BUT A 
MEAGER SHIFT IN THE SOUTHEAST TRACK OF ONGOING CONVECTIVE COMPLEX 
COULD AFFECT NE AREAS TONIGHT. 

MODELS CONTINUE TO TRY TO SUPPRESS RIDGE SOUTH AND WEST. LEANED 
TOWARD A SLOWER AND WARMER SOLUTION GIVEN STURDY NATURE OF THE 
BUBBLE. NORTHEAST AREAS COULD SEE LOWER PARTIAL THICKNESS VALUES AND 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER RESULTING IN LOWER AFTERNOON HIGHS BUT 
READINGS WILL CONTINUE WELL ABOVE NORMAL. EXTENDED THE HEAT ADVISORY 
INTO SUNDAY FOR EXPECTED PLUS 100 HEAT INDICES BUT ALSO DUE TO 
DURATION OF THE EVENT. OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 70S WILL BE COMMON.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES ARE 
EXPECTED TO TRACK OVER THE RIDGE BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA FOR TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. STILL ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED RELATIVELY 
CLOSE TO MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

842 
FXUS64 KMRX 300855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
455 AM EDT SAT JUN 30 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME LINGERING PATCHY CLOUDS 
BEHIND THE THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX...OTHERWISE THERE IS LITTLE CHANGE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THICKNESSES AND 850 MB TEMPS SUGGEST A 
REPEAT OF YESTERDAY'S SOARING HEAT. BASED ON HIGHS ON FRIDAY PLUS 
DEW POINT TEMPS LIKELY TO STAY A FEW DEGREES HIGHER...I OPTED TO 
EXPAND OUR HEAT ADVISORY TO INCLUDE THE NRN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
COUNTIES. MOS MAXES WERE IN LINE WITH CURRENT MAX TEMP GRID...BUT
I KEPT MOSTLY 90S FOR SW VA AND NRN MTN GROUP OF E TN. 

RAIN CHANCES ARE SLIM BUT KEEPING CONTINUITY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
THIS AFTERNOON AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS. MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
ON ANOTHER MCS (THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX) POSSIBLY CLIPPING SW VA AND NE 
TN LATE TONIGHT. SEEMS REASONABLE...SO 15 TO 25 PERCENT POPS WERE 
ADDED FOR THOSE AREAS FROM 03Z TO 09Z SUNDAY. NAM MOS MINS MAY BE A 
TAD TOO WARM...SO I WENT CLOSER TO GFS MINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER PATTERN BEGINS TO
CHANGE SUNDAY AS CENTER OF RIDGE ALOFT SINKS SLOWLY SOUTH.
THICKNESS VALUES LOWER AND STORM COMPLEXES DEVELOPING AROUND THE
EDGE OF THE RIDGE WILL MOVE SE INTO SW VA AND NE TN. INCREASED
MOISTURE WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP IN THE UNSTABLE AIR MASS...MORE
CONCENTRATED AT FIRST IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HAVE HIGH
TEMPERATURES DROPPING FROM ABOVE 100 TO MOSTLY 90S MONDAY EXCEPT
AT CHA. DEW POINTS RISE INTO THE 60S SO HEAT INDEX VALUES SUNDAY
WILL STILL RISE TO ABOUT 100 NE TN TO ABOVE 105 NEAR CHA. ON MONDAY
EVEN WITH HIGHS SLIGHTLY COOLER HEAT INDEX VALUES ARE STILL 100 TO
105 IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS SO HEAT ADVISORIES WILL
LIKELY STILL BE ISSUED THROUGH MONDAY. FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
EXTENDED UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES OVER CENTRAL STATES AND TROUGH DIGS
SOUTH ALONG EAST COAST. SURFACE HIGH CONTINUES OVER THE SOUTHEAST
AND FORECAST AREA WILL BE AFFECTED MORE FROM SHORTWAVE ENERGY
MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE OHIO VALLEY. THERE WILL BE MORE SCATTERED
SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND COOLER AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES.
HOWEVER TEMPERATURES STILL ABOVE NORMAL. THERE IS SOME RISK FOR
STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY WITH HEATING AND STEEP
LAPSE RATES. DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES AT

TEMPS SE OF THE AREA TOMORROW THEN BUILD BACK SLOWLY ON SUNDAY. DONT 
EXPECT THESE SLIGHTLY LOWER READINGS TO MAKE MUCH DIFFERENCE WITH 
CONTINUED AFTERNOON READING AT OR ABOVE 100F. OVERNIGHT TEMPS WILL 
CREEP UP OVER THE WEEKEND AND THE LAYER ALSO BECOMES GRADUALLY MORE 
MOIST. ISOLATED OROGRAPHIC THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE BUT COVERAGE 
WILL BE LOW. HEAT ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED FOR SAME AREAS SATURDAY 
AND MAY BE EXPANDED IN COVERAGE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA 
SHIFTS OUT OF THE AREA ALLOWING FOR INCREASING MOISTURE FOR THE 
PERIOD. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES ARE EXPECTED TO TRACK OVER THE 
RIDGE...SO KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES WILL BE ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WHEN THE BEST MOISTURE 
AND LIFT IS EXPECTED. STILL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR THE 
PERIOD. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.
