PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...TEMPS QUITE MILD THIS MORNING 
WHERE MIXING DOWN WARMER AIR ALOFT WAS OCCURRING...AND IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS. HEIGHTS RISE AGAIN SLIGHTLY TODAY WITH 850 MB TEMPS 
ALSO A DEGREE OR SO HOTTER...WHICH SUPPORTS RECORD HIGHS THIS 
AFTERNOON (POSSIBLY AT ALL TAF SITES). THE ABNORMALLY DRY SOIL 
ACROSS THE REGION ALSO FAVORS GOING WITH OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE MOS MAX 
TEMPS FOR TODAY.

HEAT INDEX VALUES ARE A CONCERN...AND DEPEND ON WHAT DEW POINT TEMPS 
DO LATER TODAY. MOS GUIDANCE...MAINLY GFS...SEEMED TOO HIGH FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON...SO DEW POINT TEMPS WERE TRENDED MORE IN LINE WITH THE 
NAM MOS. OPTED TO ISSUE A HEAT ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL/SRN VALLEY AND 
SRN PLATEAU COUNTIES...FROM 1PM TO 8PM EDT. THESE TIMES AND AREAL 
OUTLINE WERE VERY CONSISTENT WITH NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS. 

SATURDAY MAXES SHOULD FALL A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW TODAY'S MAXES...BUT 
A RISE IN DEW POINT TEMPS WILL CREATE HEAT INDEX VALUES QUITE CLOSE 
TO CRITERIA AGAIN. OTHERWISE...GENERALLY CLOUD FREE WITH ANOTHER 
MILD TO MUGGY NIGHT IN STORE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
HOT TREND CONTINUES SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS RIDGING ALOFT REMAINS
OVER SOUTHEAST STATES. UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO SINK SOUTH WITH UPPER
FLOW BECOMING MORE NORTHWEST ACROSS NE HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.
INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY AND
MONDAY. LOWERED HIGHS A DEGREE OR SO SUNDAY AND AGAIN MONDAY. DID
NOT WANT TO LOWER TEMPERATURES MUCH DUE TO DRY GROUND FROM LACK OF
RAIN. INCREASED MOISTURE SHOULD PRODUCE MORE CLOUD COVER SUNDAY AND
MONDAY ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.
THUNDERSTORMS THAT FORM MAY BECOME STRONG DUE TO STEEP LAPSE RATES
...MODERATE INSTABILITY AND SHEAR. LOWS WILL BE VERY MILD AS WELL
IN THE MID 60S TO MID 70S. HAVE KEPT RAIN CHANCES AT SLIGHT FROM
TUESDAY TO THURSDAY WITH GRADUALLY LOWERING HIGH TEMPERATURES BACK
DOWN TO THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S BY THURSDAY. MAY HAVE TO INCREASE
CHANCES LATE IN THE EXTENDED AS RIDGE SHIFTS BACK TO THE WEST AND
MORE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP AROUND UPPER RIDGE AND MOVE
INTO REGION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN            105  73 104  73 103 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN 103  72 102  71 101 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                      102  70 102  71 101 /   0   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN             100  63 100  66  98 /   0   0  10  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY FROM 1 PM EDT /NOON CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM 
     EDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...
     HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...RHEA...ROANE...SEQUATCHIE...UNION...WEST 
     POLK.

FXUS64 KMRX 290055
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
855 PM EDT THU JUN 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COAST...WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING 
ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AN 
UNSEASONABLY DRY AND HOT AIR MASS REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS EVENING...WITH DEWPOINTS RANGING FROM THE UPPER 40S TO UPPER 
50S. CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK OVERALL... 
BUT WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO 
THE LATEST TRENDS. ALSO...WILL RAISE THE HIGH TEMPS FOR TOMORROW 
SINCE TOMORROW'S HIGHS ARE EXPECTED TO BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER 
THAN TODAY'S. IT APPEARS THAT THE DRY GROUND IS ALLOWING TEMPS TO 
RISE A LITTLE HIGHER THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED. 
&&

.SHORT TERM...AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING WIDESPREAD 
EXCESSIVE HEAT. VERY HIGH 850 MB TEMPERATURES WILL BE LOCATED OVER 
THE REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH NEAR 
RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 90S AND LOW 100S POSSIBLE EACH 
DAY. SEE SPSMRX FOR RECORD TEMPERATURES. MOISTURE IN THE LOWER
LEVELS WILL INCREASE SLIGHTLY OVER THE WEEKEND AS RIDGE BUILDS TO
THE SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA...BUT PRECIPITATION SEEMS UNLIKELY
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. NO MAJOR CHANGES TO THE FORECAST OTHER THAN
JUST A FEW TWEAKS TO THE TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA 
SO KEPT MONDAY DRY FOR NOW. MOISTURE ON THE INCREASE AS A SERIES OF 
SHORTWAVES TRACK OVER THE RIDGE...SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. STILL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR THE 
PERIOD. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

942 
FXUS64 KMRX 281505
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1105 AM EDT THU JUN 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED AS FORECAST SEEMS TO BE ON
TRACK.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
STRENGTHEN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM.  WARMING TREND INTENSIFIES TODAY WITH HIGHS EXPECTED TO REACH 
WELL INTO THE 90S ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.  OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL 
ALSO TREND WARMER AS THE HIGH SETTLES INTO THE REGION.  
OTHERWISE...A QUIET FORECAST WITH NO EXPECTED CONVECTION OVER THE 
AREA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...GENERALLY SHOWING AN 
UPPER LEVEL HIGH OVER THE REGION WITH JUST A GRADUAL SHIFT OF THE 
RIDGE AXIS TO THE WEST. THIS WILL LEAD TO AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF VERY 
HOT CONDITIONS...POSSIBLY RECORD BREAKING...FOR OUR AREA.  WILL 
CONTINUE SPS HIGHLIGHTING THE HEAT.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
INCREASE A BIT LEADING TO HIGHER HUMIDITY...BUT STILL LOOKS TO BE ON 
THE DRY SIDE.  CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION LOOK QUITE LOW AT LEAST 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND INTO MONDAY.  WILL ONLY INCLUDE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY FOR NOW.  WILL GENERALLY STAY 
CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMPS...BUT WILL TWEAK TEMPS UP A BIT ESPECIALLY 
LATER PERIODS GIVEN GFS TRENDING TOO MUCH TOWARD CLIMO.  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

736 
FXUS64 KMRX 271927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT WED JUN 27 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
LOW LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE AREA SUPPRESS SOUTH SLIGHTLY IN THE WAKE OF 
DEBBY THROUGH THE PERIOD. STRONG UPPER RIDGING BUILDS EAST THROUGH 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BECOMING CENTERED OVER GA BY END OF PERIOD. 
THICKNESS VALUES RISE CONSIDERABLY WITH TIME. 1000-850MB THICKNESS 
IN EXCESS OF 1450 METERS WILL BE COMMON. H85 TEMPS CLIMB TO ABOVE 
25C. RECORD TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND AND CURRENT 
RECORDS ARE NOTED IN MEMSPSMRX. CONFIDENCE IN MEETING THESE RECORD 
VALUES IS QUITE HIGH. STRONGER UPPER JET SEGMENTS WILL BE MOVING 
EAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY DURING THE PERIOD. LAYER MOISTURE IS 
ALSO HIGHER IN THAT REGION. BELIEVE DAILY CONVECTION WILL REMAIN 
NORTH OF THE MRX CWA. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH INDEPENDENCE DAY)...
THE DANGEROUS HEAT WILL CONTINUE INTO SUNDAY AS THE UPPER-RIDGE WILL 
REMAIN CENTERED OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. WITH VERY HIGH THICKNESS 
VALUES AND CONTINUED 850 MB TEMPS AOA 25-26 DEG CELSIUS...DAYTIME 
HIGHS AROUND OR IN EXCESS OF THE CENTURY MARK WILL BE COMMON ONCE 
AGAIN /PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN/ WHERE HEAT INDEX VALUES 
WILL APPROACH OR EXCEED 105 DEGREES. THUS...A HEAT ADVISORY WILL 
LIKELY BE NEEDED LATER THIS WEEK THROUGH THE ENTIRE WEEKEND. 
THEREAFTER...THE CENTER OF THE AFOREMENTIONED RIDGE WILL SHIFT A BIT 
TO THE SOUTH AS AN UPPER-TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE HUDSON BAY REGION 
OF CANADA. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES 
HEADING INTO INDEPENDENCE DAY WEEK AS THICKNESS VALUES DECREASE AND 
THE UPPER-FLOW VEERS TO THE NORTHWEST. HAVE MAINTAINED HIGHS 
GENERALLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 90S EARLY NEXT WEEK GIVEN THE DRY 
CONDITIONS AND MOS DEFAULTING TOO MUCH TO CLIMO IN THE EXTENDED. 
ALSO...WITH SOME MOISTURE PRESENT UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE SOME SLIGHT 
CHANCES FOR SOME THUNDERSTORMS WILL EXIST...PRIMARILY ACROSS THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. ATTM...FEEL THAT THE GFS HAS BEEN TOO AGGRESSIVE 
WITH QPF SIGNALS...PARTICULARLY ON SUNDAY GIVEN THE WARM 
TEMPERATURES ALOFT. HOWEVER...HAVE MAINTAINED LOW-END MENTIONABLE 
POPS MONDAY THROUGH INDEPENDENCE DAY GIVEN A WEAKER CAP AND A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN MOISTURE. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  96  67 101  72 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  95  67  99  69 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  95  67 100  69 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  93  61  98  65 /   0   0   0  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 271537
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1130 AM EDT WED JUN 27 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
BUILD INTO THE REGION.  THIS WILL RESULT IN CONTINUED CLEAR 
SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AND WARMING TEMPERATURES.  VALLEY HIGHS TODAY 
WILL RANGE FROM THE MID 80S NORTH TO LOW 90S SOUTH WITH COOLER 
READING OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  DEW POINTS WILL SLOWLY INCREASE 
DURING THE SHORT TERM...SLIGHTLY INCREASING HUMIDITIES AND PROVIDE 
FOR SLIGHTLY WARMER OVERNIGHT LOWS.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...GENERALLY SHOWING AN UPPER 
LEVEL HIGH OVER THE REGION...LEADING TO A PERIOD OF VERY HOT 
CONDITIONS. WILL CONTINUE SPS HIGHLIGHTING THE HEAT. A WEAK COLD 
FRONT WILL SAG TOWARD THE AREA DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT SHOULD STAY 
WELL TO OUR NORTH. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL INCREASE A BIT LEADING TO 
HIGHER HUMIDITY...BUT STILL LOOKS TO BE ON THE DRY SIDE. CHANCES FOR 
PRECIPITATION LOOK QUITE LOW AT LEAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND 
PERHAPS FOR THE ENTIRE LONG TERM PERIOD. WILL ONLY INCLUDE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY FOR NOW. WILL GENERALLY STAY 
CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMPS. HOWEVER...EVEN ITS VERY HIGH MAX TEMP 
NUMBERS MAY BE A BIT LOW GIVEN HOW DRY IT IS.

067 
FXUS64 KMRX 261910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE JUN 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A MUCH DRIER AND COOLER DAY 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT DEW POINTS HAVE DROPPED INTO THE 
40S WITH A FEW PLACES EVEN 30S AS WINDS HAVE PICKED UP AND MIXED THE 
DRIER AIR DOWN TO THE SURFACE. TEMPERATURES HAVE ONLY WARMED TO THE 
MID 70S TO MID 80S AT 2 PM WITH RH VALUES IN THE 20S TO 30S. HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY IS 
KEEPING THE TENNESSEE VALLEY DRY AND THE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE SE 
STATES WILL REMAIN THERE AS DEBBY SLOWLY MOVES EAST NORTHEAST TOWARD 
THE FLORIDA COAST TONIGHT. THE SURFACE HIGH TO THE NORTH WILL SLOWLY 
SETTLE SOUTH TO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS BY LATE WEDNESDAY. 

BIGGEST CONCERNS NEXT 24 HOURS WILL BE LOW HUMIDITIES AND COOL NIGHT 
TIME LOWS TONIGHT AND THE BEGINNING OF A WARMING TREND WEDNESDAY. 
WINDS WILL DECREASE BY EARLY EVENING AND TEMPERATURES WILL DROP 
QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET. TRI CITIES WILL APPROACH THE RECORD OF 49 SET 
IN 1979. OTHER SITES SHOULD STAY A FEW DEGREES ABOVE RECORD LOWS. 
WEDNESDAY WARMED HIGHS A FEW DEGREES SOUTH TO 5 TO 10 DEGREES NORTH 
WHICH WILL BE NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL AND ABOUT A 30 TO 35 
DEGREE RISE ABOVE THE MORNING LOWS. WITH THE SURFACE HIGH CENTER 
MOVING CLOSE TO EAST TN WINDS WILL BE LIGHT NORTHERLY WEDNESDAY.
MINIMUM RH VALUES WILL LOWER ABOUT TO TODAYS READINGS BETWEEN 20 AND 
35 PERCENT.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH LINGERING 
OVER THE MIDDLE OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THIS UPPER HIGH 
WILL CREATE UNSEASONABLY HOT TEMPS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THE 
END OF THE WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND...WITH MOISTURE AND CLOUDS FROM 
DEBBY REMAINING FAR ENOUGH EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA TO NOT PROVIDE 
MUCH RELIEF FROM THE HEAT. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY 
DRIFT INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY THE WEEKEND...BUT IS EXPECTED TO 
BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. MOISTURE WILL 
INCREASE BY THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WHICH SHOULD 
CAUSE ISOLATED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP EACH DAY BEGINNING ON SATURDAY. 
HOWEVER...THIS MOISTURE WILL ALSO CREATE MUGGY CONDITIONS WITH 
DANGEROUSLY HIGH HEAT INDICES EACH AFTERNOON. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT TEMPS COULD ULTIMATELY BE HIGHER DUE TO THE 
DRY SOIL MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT MON JUN 25 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...ANOTHER MOSTLY SUNNY AND HOT DAY 
IN THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY. TEMPERATURES ARE ABOUT AS 
WARM AS SUNDAY CURRENTLY IN THE UPPER 80S NORTH TO MID 90S SOUTH.
GOOD CU FIELD HAS FORMED OVER NE TN AND SW VA BUT NO SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED YET. WEAK COLD FRONT LIES OVER KY AND 
WV WITH PRE FRONTAL AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS EASTERN 
VA. LATEST RUC MODEL SHOWS A FEW SHOWERS OR STORMS DEVELOPING 
BETWEEN NOW AND ABOUT 3Z AS THE FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE CWA. HAVE 
ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND THE 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS OF TN INCLUDING SW VA THROUGH EARLY EVENING. 
OTHERWISE A COOLER NIGHT AS AN EVEN DRIER AIR MASS MOVES INTO THE 
REGION OVERNIGHT AND TUESDAY. TUESDAY WILL BE MUCH COOLER WITH HIGHS
IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S SW VA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 80S 
ELSEWHERE. LOCATIONS NEAR CHA MAY STILL BE CLOSE TO 90. HOWEVER DEW 
POINTS FALLING INTO THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S SOUTH WILL HELP WITH 
THE BREAK IN THE HEAT. FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MAV LOWS TONIGHT AND THE 
WARMER MAV HIGHS FOR TUESDAY.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH DEVELOPING 
OVER THE MIDDLE OF THE COUNTRY WITH TROPICAL STORM DEBBY SLOWLY 
DRIFTING UP THE EASTERN SEABOARD. THIS UPPER HIGH WILL CREATE 
UNSEASONABLY HOT TEMPS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THE END OF THE 
WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND...WITH MOISTURE AND CLOUDS FROM DEBBY 
REMAINING FAR ENOUGH EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA TO NOT PROVIDE MUCH 
RELIEF FROM THE HEAT. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT 
INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY THE WEEKEND...BUT SHOULD BECOME QUASI- 
STATIONARY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT MOISTURE 
WILL INCREASE ENOUGH BY THE WEEKEND TO ALLOW ISOLATED CONVECTION TO 
DEVELOP EACH DAY...BUT THIS MOISTURE WILL ALSO CREATE MUGGY 
CONDITIONS WITH HIGH HEAT INDICES. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY 
TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

OF THE WEEK THROUGH THE NEXT WEEKEND. ALSO...CONTINUED DRY 
CONDITIONS WITH LOW AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES (AFTERNOON RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES IN THE 20S) THROUGH THE PERIOD.

FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...SURFACE RIDGING AND DRY NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT WITH PWS AT OR BELOW 50 PERCENT. UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN NEAR 
SEASONAL WITH PLEASANT READINGS AT NIGHT.

FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST LIFTS 
ALLOWING A DOMINANT UPPER RIDGE TO SETTLE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
WITH 850MB TEMPERATURES WARMING INTO THE MIDDLE 20S. IN RESULT WILL 
BE HIGHS IN THE MIDDLE AND UPPER 90S...WITH SOME AREAS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY LIKELY REACHING TO NEAR 100 
DEGREES FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS 
CLOSELY.

MOISTURE FINALLY CREEPS BACK INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND...SO WILL 
INCLUDE A SLIGHT POP FOR MAINLY THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

731 
FXUS64 KMRX 241922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT SUN JUN 24 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
SHOWER ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN MAINLY TO OUR EAST WITH A NW 
FLOW ALOFT...THE EXCEPTION BEING ISOLATED SHOWERS IN SW NC FOR THE 
NEXT FEW HOURS. SOME THIN CIRRUS FROM CONVECTION OVER IL MAY CROSS 
THE AREA OVERNIGHT...BUT WITH LITTLE IMPACT. AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS AND 
MOS GUIDANCE INDICATE LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 60S IN MOST SPOTS. 

TOMORROW WILL BE ANOTHER HOT DAY BEFORE A FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA. 
HIGHS WILL REACH WELL INTO THE 90S AGAIN...WITH CHA TOUCHING THE 
UPPER 90S. A DIFFLUENT LOW LEVEL FLOW AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND A LACK 
OF MOISTURE IN THE PRECEDING NW FLOW WILL PREVENT MUCH CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT TOMORROW. CAPPING WILL BE WEAK HOWEVER...SO WILL HAVE 
JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS THE FRONT 
APPROACHES. DRIER AIR WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 40S TO 50S WILL 
BUILD SOUTHWARD INTO THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE FRONT. THIS
SHOULD MAKE FOR A VERY COMFORTABLE NIGHT...WITH LOWS IN THE 50S
NORTH TO MID 60S SOUTH AND A LIGHT NORTH WIND.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
MAIN WEATHER STORY FOR THE EXTENDED CONTINUES TO BE A DEVELOPING
HEAT WAVE FOR THE END OF THIS WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND. DRIER AND
COOLER TEMPERATURES IN STORE TUESDAY BUT WARMING TEMPERATURES
WEDNESDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. PWS DROP TO 0.5 TO ONE INCH TUESDAY AND
THEN RISE SLOWLY WEDNESDAY. DEW POINTS DROP INTO THE 40S NORTH AND
50S SOUTH TUESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN GREAT
LAKES DROPS DOWN TO THE TN VALLEY AND BRINGS BRIEF FROM THE 90S
INTO THE 80S. NORTHEAST WINDS DOWN THE VALLEY WILL BRING IN THE
DRIER AIR MASS. LOWS WILL FALL TO THE 50S WITH HIGH ELEVATION SITES
POSSIBLY IN THE UPPER 40S.

AS SURFACE RIDGING FROM THE CENTRAL STATES AND LOWER MS VALLEY MOVES 
EAST AND UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NE STATES SHIFTS NE WINDS WILL SHIFT 
TO LIGHT SOUTH AND SOUTHEASTERLY AND TEMPERATURES WARM BACK TO THE 
UPPER 80S AND LOWER 90S. VERY WARM 850MB TEMPERATURES AND HEIGHTS 
THURSDAY INTO THE SATURDAY AND POSSIBLY SUNDAY WILL PRODUCE HOT 
CONDITIONS. A SLOW INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BEGIN 
THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY AS FIRST EITHER SOME MOISTURE FROM THE 
REMAINS OF DEBBY MOVES INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND THEN TN VALLEY 
OR INCREASED SOUTHERLY FLOW SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AHEAD OF A COOL 
FRONT DROPPING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WILL REACH THE 95 
TO 100 DEGREE RANGE THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY FOR MUCH OF THE VALLEY 
AND WITH HEAT INDEX VALUES NEAR 100 OR HIGHER FRIDAY. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ALTHOUGH ISOLATED LATE FRIDAY FOR 
SOME RELIEF...THEN ISOLATED VALLEYS AND SCATTERED MOUNTAINS SATURDAY 
AND SCATTERED SUNDAY FOR MORE RELIEF. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE GFS 
ENSEMBLE HIGH MOS VALUES FOR LAST FEW DAYS OF THE EXTENDED.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 231907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT SAT JUN 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN FALLING THIS AFTERNOON WITH BOUNDARY LAYER 
MIXING AND SOME WEAK DRY ADVECTION FROM THE NORTH. AS A RESULT...WE 
SHOULD SEE TEMPS A BIT LOWER TONIGHT THAN PREVIOUS  
NIGHTS...ESPECIALLY NORTH. THIS SHOULD ALSO PREVENT WIDESPREAD FOG 
DEVELOPMENT. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE LOWER GREAT LAKES TODAY WILL 
SHIFT EAST AND BE NEAR THE MID ATLANTIC COAST TOMORROW. THE NAM 
SHOWS A WEAK SURFACE TROUGH ACROSS WEST VA TO SW VA TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. WEAK CAPPING SEEN IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT 
ISOLATED AFTERNOON SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP IN SW VA AND NE TN. CAPPING 
LOOKS STRONG ENOUGH TO PREVENT MUCH ACTIVITY ELSEWHERE TOMORROW. 
WARM TEMPS CONTINUE FOR SUNDAY...REACHING THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
ISOLATED EARLY EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AND EXTREME NORTHEAST BEFORE SUNSET OTHERWISE A DRY AND 
WARM NIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT. WITH A NAM/GFS MODEL BLEND LOWS IN THE 60S. 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY TO THE TN VALLEY AND ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS. 
MODELS SHOW ONLY WEAK LIFT AND MINIMAL SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY OUT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. GFS PAINTS VERY LITTLE QPF AND NAM 
A LITTLE MORE AGGRESSIVE. WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MOST AREAS 
AND LOW CHANCE NE. TEMPERATURES STILL VERY WARM SOUTH AND ONLY A FEW 
DEGREES COOLER NE THAN SUNDAY. MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY A BRIEF 
BREAK IN THE HEAT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE THAT CAME FROM SOUTHERN 
CANADA...NORTHERN PLAINS AND WESTERN GREAT LAKES MOVES OVERHEAD. 
LOWS EXPECTED TO DROP INTO MID 50S NORTH TO MID 60S SOUTH ALTHOUGH 
CHATTANOOGA UPPER 60S. MAIN STORY WILL BE BUILDING HEAT MID TO LATE 
WEEK AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES WEDNESDAY 
AND EXPANDS EASTWARD INTO THE SOUTHEAST.

A TROPICAL SYSTEM TRYING TO FORM IN THE GULF OF MEXICO TODAY IS 
FORECAST TO MOVE EITHER EAST OR WEST AND NOT INFLUENCE THE HOT 
PATTERN TAKING SHAPE OVER THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY NEXT WEEK.
HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD RISE TO THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S WEDNESDAY 
AND THEN 90S EVERYWHERE THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. FRIDAY SOME 
PLACES MAY REACH NEAR 100. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
DEVELOP IN THE TERRAIN AREAS THURSDAY AND INCREASE A LITTLE FRIDAY. 
SATURDAY RAIN CHANCES INCREASE A LITTLE MORE AS AN UPPER LOW MOVES 
OVER ONTARIO AND AN UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH INTO THE EASTERN STATES. 
A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND THE RIDGE WILL SINK 
FARTHER SOUTH.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
CONVECTION HAS HAD A DIFFICULT TIME DEVELOPING ACROSS SOUTHERN AND 
CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE AREA...WITH MOST SUSTAINED ACTIVITY ACROSS 
NORTHERN AREAS. COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO BE SCATTERED NORTH TO 
ISOLATED SOUTH THROUGH THE EVENING. A SURFACE FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL

FRONT REMAINS JUST NORTH OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT...AND SURFACE 
DEWPOINTS REMAIN IN THE 60S. THIS SHOULD SUPPORT FOG 
DEVELOPMENT...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS THAT SEE SHOWERS THIS EVENING. 
WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG IN THE NORTHERN HALF. 

A DEEP NW FLOW WILL BRING DRIER AIR ALOFT TOMORROW...WITH THE GFS  
SHOWING PW VALUES UNDER 1 INCH FOR MOST OF THE AREA. THE NAM SHOWS 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN WESTERN NC TOMORROW AFTERNOON ALONG A WEAK 
SURFACE CONVERGENCE ZONE...SO WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SW 
NC. TEMPS TOMORROW LOOK PRETTY SIMILAR TO THE PAST FEW DAYS...WITH 
UPPER 80S NORTH TO LOWER/MID 90S CENTRAL AND SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... 
WEAK FRONT THAT PASSED THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TODAY WILL BECOME
STATIONARY TO THE SOUTH AND EAST SATURDAY EVENING WITH A SURFACE
RIDGE BUILDING SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL GULF OF MEXICO IS FORECAST
TO BECOME A TROPICAL SYSTEM DURING THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS. ANOTHER
WEAK SYSTEM MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST SUNDAY AND
LINGERING MOISTURE ALONG AND EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL ALLOW
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP SUNDAY OVER THE
EASTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. MONDAY THIS FRONT MOVES
INTO THE FORECAST AREA WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION IN THE
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY ABOVE NORMAL SUNDAY
BUT COOL MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS RAIN CHANCES INCREASE NE AND COOL
FRONT BRINGS UPPER TROUGH INTO THE REGION TUESDAY. THE TROPICAL
SYSTEM OVER THE GULF WILL PULL MOISTURE INTO THE EASTERN STATES AS
EARLY AS TUESDAY BUT MORE LIKELY LATER IN THE WEEK. SOME OF THESE
SHOWERS AND STORMS COULD MOVE INTO THE FAR EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. THERE IS UNCERTAINTY
ON THIS TRACK AND ANOTHER FRONT WILL APPROACH FRIDAY. WILL FOLLOW
HIGHER POPS FRIDAY BASED ON ANOTHER FRONT RATHER THAN THE APPROACH
TO THE EAST OR SOUTHERN AREAS OF A TROPICAL SYSTEM.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  94  67  94  69 /  20  10  10  10  20

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT FRI JUN 22 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
CONVECTION HAS HAD A DIFFICULT TIME DEVELOPING ACROSS SOUTHERN AND 
CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE AREA...WITH MOST SUSTAINED ACTIVITY ACROSS 
NORTHERN AREAS. COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO BE SCATTERED NORTH TO 
ISOLATED SOUTH THROUGH THE EVENING. A SURFACE FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL 
KY WILL SINK SOUTHEAST TONIGHT...BUT WITH LOSS OF INSTABILITY AND A 
LACK OF MID/UPPER LEVEL LIFT...SHOWERS SHOULD END BY MIDNIGHT. THE 
FRONT REMAINS JUST NORTH OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT...AND SURFACE 
DEWPOINTS REMAIN IN THE 60S. THIS SHOULD SUPPORT FOG 
DEVELOPMENT...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS THAT SEE SHOWERS THIS EVENING. 
WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG IN THE NORTHERN HALF. 

A DEEP NW FLOW WILL BRING DRIER AIR ALOFT TOMORROW...WITH THE GFS  
SHOWING PW VALUES UNDER 1 INCH FOR MOST OF THE AREA. THE NAM SHOWS 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN WESTERN NC TOMORROW AFTERNOON ALONG A WEAK 
SURFACE CONVERGENCE ZONE...SO WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SW 
NC. TEMPS TOMORROW LOOK PRETTY SIMILAR TO THE PAST FEW DAYS...WITH 
UPPER 80S NORTH TO LOWER/MID 90S CENTRAL AND SOUTH.

RIDGE BUILDING SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. A LOW

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT THU JUN 21 2012

.DISCUSSION...SOME LATE DEVELOPING TSRA FROM SRN VALLEY NNE TO 
BETWEEN OQT AND MRX...WITH MESO ANALYSIS SUGGESTING A WEAK SURFACE 
TROUGH. THIS AXIS OF CONVERGENCE AND LINGERING INSTABILITY OF 1000 
TO 2000 J/KG (PER LAPS DATA)...PLUS SOME OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM 
ONGOING CONVECTION...WILL JUSTIFY KEEPING LOW POPS IN OVERNIGHT.

22/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW UPPER TROUGH AXIS EXTENDING SOUTH FROM 
WRN GREAT LAKES THRU MID-MS VALLEY REGION...WITH STORM TRACK NOW 
LIKELY TO BE MORE NE THAN N. MAIN THREAT HAS BEEN PULSE TYPE FOR 
GUSTY WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS DUE TO SLOW MOVEMENT (LESS THAN 
10 MPH). OHX 22/00Z SOUNDING SHOWS A HIGH CLOUD BASE WITH DRY AIR 
BELOW...TO SUPPORT GUSTY WINDS FROM ANY WEAKENING TSRA. SOME 50 DBZ 
CORES HAVE BRIEFLY REACHED LEVELS HIGH ENOUGH FOR SMALL HAIL.

WILL UPDATE FORECAST GRIDS...ALL PRODUCTS AND GRAPHICAST OVER THE 
NEXT 30 TO 45 MINUTES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT THU JUN 21 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)... CONVECTION THIS
AFTERNOON SHOULD REMAIN ISOLATED THROUGH THE EARLY EVENING BEFORE
DISSIPATING. WITH A LACK OF INSTABILITY AND UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT FOR
LIFT...SHOWERS SHOULD DISSIPATE SOON AFTER SUNSET. A BROAD MID-
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA LATE TONIGHT AND
TOMORROW...ALONG WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT. THIS SHOULD PROVIDE SOME
WEAK LIFT...RESULTING IN BETTER PRECIP CHANCES TOMORROW...MAINLY
ACROSS THE NORTH. STILL...MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH A WESTERLY
850 MB FLOW. POPS WILL BE LOWERED FROM PREVIOUS FORECASTS TO A HIGH
CHANCE NORTH TO A SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH. WE SHOULD SEE TEMPS BACK
INTO THE 90S TOMORROW IN MOST SPOTS IN THE VALLEY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH BEHIND COLD
FRONT AND HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDING IN WITH DRIER AIR MASS SATURDAY
WILL ALLOW FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY AND NO SHOWERS. TEMPERATURES
HOWEVER WILL ONLY BE SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN FRIDAY. LOWS SATURDAY
NIGHT SHOULD BE SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER NE. SUNDAY MOISTURE BEGINS
TO INCREASE AGAIN ESPECIALLY MOUNTAINS AND NE WITH ISOLATED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE INTO THE EVENING. MONDAY FRIDAYS FRONT
EXPECTED TO MOVE BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS. LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS WILL
QUICKLY SPREAD EAST WITH A SECOND CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. A MORE
SIGNIFICANT TROUGH DIGS SOUTH INTO THE EASTERN STATES BEHIND THE
MAIN COLD FRONT MONDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 70S
NORTH AND 80S SOUTH FOR THE PERIOD TUESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE
EXTENDED.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE
AREA BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TODAY AND THIS
EVENING. THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL BE FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE
INSTABILITY INCREASES. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT IS ACROSS THE
PLATEAU AND THE MOUNTAINS SO KEPT THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THOSE
AREAS. THE ACTIVITY SHOULD END DURING THE EVENING HOURS. IT WILL BE
ANOTHER HOT DAY TODAY WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL.
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE TO FORECAST
NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LONG-RANGE MODELS ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE MIDDLE
OF NEXT WEEK...WITH THE MAIN FEATURES BEING A WEAK COLD FRONT
MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND A LONG WAVE UPPER-
LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THE WEEKEND
THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. THE WEAK COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY
SHOULD HELP TO GENERATE A BETTER COVERAGE OF
CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA. WITH A LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF
THE NATION...A NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT PATTERN WILL DEVELOP OVER THE
FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. THIS
NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN IS NORMALLY CONDUCIVE FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF
SOME MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS (MCS) FROM THE UPPER MS RIVER
VALLEY TO EVENTUALLY AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA. FOR NOW...WILL JUST
MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...SINCE A QUASI-
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE LINGERING ACROSS THE TN RIVER
VALLEY AND THE MODELS ARE ONLY SLIGHTLY HINTING AT THE POSSIBILITY
OF MCS ACTIVITY FROM UPSTREAM. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND
CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             93  68  93  68  92 /  20  20  40  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  91  68  90  67  89 /  20  20  50  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       92  68  90  67  89 /  20  20  50  20  10

046 
FXUS64 KMRX 201912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT WED JUN 20 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)
THE UPPER HIGH HAS BEGUN TO SHIFT EASTWARD IN RESPONSE TO THE
TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS. A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS
HAVE DEVELOPED OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE SMOKIES IN E TN AND SW
VA. EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO DIMINISH SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET. A FEW OF
THESE STORMS WILL BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL...SMALL
HAIL AND STRONG GUSTY WINDS.

THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY CURRENTLY STRETCHES FROM WISCONSIN TO KANSAS.
THIS FRONT WILL MARCH ITS WAY TO WESTERN KENTUCKY BY LATE THURSDAY
AFTERNOON. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO INFILTRATE THE
FORECAST AREA TOMORROW MAKING FOR A MORE HUMID DAY.
ADDITIONALLY...EXPECT SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS OVER MORE OF THE
REGION DUE TO THE INCREASED MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE
FRONT. LOOK FOR THE HIGHER SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM CHANCES TO
OCCUR OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA TOMORROW
AFTERNOON. 

PATCHY FOG WILL ALSO BE A POSSIBILITY OVER THE TRI-CITIES AREA
AGAIN OVERNIGHT. IT SHOULD DEVELOP AFTER MIDNIGHT AND DISSIPATE
SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT
WILL SLIDE ACROSS THE AREA ON FRIDAY. MODELS TRENDING TOWARD LESS
MOISTURE...INDICATING A MORE SCATTERED BAND OF CONVECTION. HAVE
LOWERED POPS SLIGHTLY BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY POPS OVER
NORTHEASTERN AREAS...THEN KEEP 20 TO 30 POPS ACROSS THE AREA FOR
THE EVENING. DIURNAL ISOLATED CONVECTION EXPECTED THIS
WEEKEND...MAINLY CONFINED TO HIGHER TERRAIN. ANOTHER EVEN WEAKER
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TRACKS THROUGH ON MONDAY FOR ANOTHER LOW CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR NOW TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN.

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SATELLITE ANIMATION CONFIRMS THE FORECAST AREA IS ON THE

SUPPRESSION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS HIGH MAY BE ENOUGH TO LIMIT

HOWEVER...LI/S OF -4 DEGREES C AND ANY WEAKNESS IN THE WEAK UPPER
FLOW COULD PRODUCE AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM OVER THIS AREA. SHOULD
SEE DEVELOPMENT ONCE AGAIN IN THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER
LATER THIS AFTERNOON. THE LOW END CHANCE MENTIONED IN THE ZONES
LOOKS GOOD. FORECAST MAX TEMPERATURES IN THE 90S LOOK REASONABLE
TOO. NO MAJOR UPDATES ANTICIPATED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY.

022 
FXUS64 KMRX 200801
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 AM EDT WED JUN 20 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH
THE AREA BRINGING A LOW CHANCE FOR DIURNAL ACTIVITIES DURING THE
AFTERNOON HOURS. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT IS ACROSS OUR
NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS SO KEPT THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR
THOSE AREAS. THE ACTIVITY SHOULD END DURING THE EVENING HOURS. IT
WILL BE ANOTHER HOT DAY TODAY WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING ABOVE
NORMAL. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LONG-RANGE MODELS ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT
WEEK...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE TN
RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY WITH A LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH
DEVELOPING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THE WEEKEND AND
EARLY NEXT WEEK. ON THURSDAY...AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH WILL SLOWLY
DRIFT EASTWARD OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC...WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION
POSSIBLE AGAIN IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...MAINLY AROUND THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A WEAK COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY SHOULD HELP TO
GENERATE A LITTLE BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY OVER
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE NOT INDICATING
MUCH MOISTURE WITH THIS COLD FRONT...BUT WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR
FRIDAY TO MAINTAIN FORECAST CONTINUITY. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THEN
DEVELOPS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT
WEEK...AS A LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN
HALF OF THE NATION. THIS NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN IS NORMALLY
CONDUCIVE FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS
(MCS) FROM THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY TO EVENTUALLY AFFECT THE
FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...THE ECMWF MODEL HINTS AT AN MCS AFFECTING
THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH THE GFS MODEL HINTING AT ONE FOR
MONDAY. SINCE THE MODELS ALWAYS HAVE PROBLEMS RESOLVING THE EXACT
TIMING AND POSITION OF THESE SYSTEMS...WILL JUST MENTION SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY FOR NOW. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL
GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE
MEANS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

976 
FXUS64 KMRX 191915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT TUE JUN 19 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS EVENING ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS IN 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER BEFORE 
DISSIPATING. THE FORECAST AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BE DOMINATED BY A 
MASSIVE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ON WEDNESDAY EVEN THOUGH THE PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL BE SLIPPING VERY SLOWLY EAST. LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER DAY OF 
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED MOUNTAIN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH VERY 
LITTLE IF ANY PRECIP OVER THE GREAT VALLEY. THE HEAT CONTINUES WITH 
HIGHS BUMPING INTO THE LOWER 90S EXCEPT IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE 
80S WILL BE COMMON.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
THE UPPER HIGH WILL BE CENTERED NEAR THE D.C. AREA PUTTING E TN...SW 
VA AND SW NC ON THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF THE HIGH. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WILL LIKELY BE 
SUBSIDING SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET. THE FOCUS SHIFTS TO THE UPPER TROUGH 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. SIGNIFICANT 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE POOLING AHEAD OF THE FRONT ALONG WITH LI/S LESS 
THAN -3 DEGREES C WILL BE OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. THUS 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE GOOD BET PARTICULARLY AREAS NORTH OF 
INTERSTATE 40. MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT WITH THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY...ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY. THUS HAVE 
BUMPED UP RAIN CHANCES FRIDAY TO LIKELY MAINLY FOR THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE AREA. CONFIDENCE REMAINS FAIRLY HIGH FOR MEASURABLE RAINFALL 
TO OCCUR BY FRIDAY EVENING. THE ECMWF AND GFS DIVERGE IN THEIR 
SOLUTIONS AFTER THE WEEKEND. THEREFORE THE CONFIDENCE IN THE 
FORECAST AFTER THE WEEKEND IS RATHER LOW AS FAR AS PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES ARE CONCERNED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  92  67  92  68 /   0  10  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  91  67  91  69 /  10  10  10  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  92  66  92  68 /   0  10  10  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  91  62  90  65 /  10  10  10  30  30

.DISCUSSION...PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO RISE ACROSS THE REGION

BIT. SHOULD BE RATHER WARM TODAY WITH POWERFUL SOLAR INSOLATION
COMBINED WITH SUBSIDENCE. LOW 90 DEGREE MAX TEMPS WILL DO FINE.

THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. THE HIGHEST CHANCES WILL DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS. ANOTHER TROUGH TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY 
BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES WILL BE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS AGAIN. A 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA IN THE FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY TIME 
FRAME BRINGING A BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. A 
BOUNDARY FOLLOWS ON SUNDAY AND INTO MONDAY PROVIDING ANOTHER CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM. THE TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY ABOVE 
NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 181908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT MON JUN 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...GETTING WARMER. ASIDE FROM
ROUTINE AFTERNOON ISOLATED CONVECTION...TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON
THE WARM SIDE. FAIRLY LIGHT WINDS WILL OFFER LITTLE RELIEF TO THE
WARMTH AND INCREASING MUGGINESS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN STORY THROUGH THIS 
TIME PERIOD WILL BE THE INCREASING CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY AND THE HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS PRECEDING. 
A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. THIS UPPER HIGH WILL TRANSLATE EAST AS A 
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE 
HIGH AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THIS WILL SPELL WARMER THAN 
NORMAL DAYTIME TEMPERATURES AND HIGHER HUMIDITY LEVELS PARTICULARLY 
ON THURSDAY AND INTO FRIDAY. CONSEQUENTLY...AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL ALSO BEGIN TO INCREASE WEDNESDAY AND BECOME MORE 
SCATTERED BY FRIDAY. THE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
PRECLUDE THE FRONT ON THURSDAY...WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT. 

DO NOT EXPECT THIS FRONT TO BRING MUCH RELIEF TO THE HEAT BECAUSE 
SUMMER HAS ARRIVED. ANOTHER AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS 
THE EASTERN PLAINS AND INTO THE DAKOTAS. THE GRIPS OF THIS HIGH WILL 
BE BORDERLINE FOR US IN REGARDS TO SUPPRESSING THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT. WE ARE WILL BE ON THE FAR EASTERN FRINGES IN NORTHWEST 
FLOW. ANOTHER WEAK BOUNDARY MAY PROVIDE ENOUGH FOCUS TO PRODUCE SOME 
ISOLATED SHOWERS SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. AC

027 
FXUS64 KMRX 180741
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT MON JUN 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN AREA OF 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SO WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. OTHERWISE...A STAGNANT PATTERN 
WILL LINGER OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE A 
LITTLE WARMER THAN NORMAL. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A STRONG SUBTROPICAL UPPER- 
LEVEL RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE IN THE FORECAST 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEK...AND POTENTIALLY INTO NEXT WEEK AS WELL. 
THE CENTER OF THIS RIDGE IS EXPECTED TO SHIFT DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA 
BY TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY...WHICH WILL PROMOTE VERY WARM 
TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW TO POTENTIALLY MID 90S AS THICKNESS VALUES/ 
850 MB TEMPERATURES INCREASE. WARMING WILL BE HINDERED SLIGHTLY ON 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY THANKS TO SOME INCREASED CLOUD COVER/ 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES ASSOCIATED WITH THE PASSAGE OF A WEAK COLD 
FRONT. THEN HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND...850 MB TEMPERATURES JUMP BY 
ABOUT 4-5 DEGREES TO AROUND 21-22C. SHOULD THIS OCCUR...EVEN WARMER 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO PERHAPS THE UPPER 90S IN SOME LOCATIONS 
COULD BE POSSIBLE BY SUNDAY. 

DESPITE THE WARM CONDITIONS...THERE WILL BE AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS EVERY THIS WEEK GIVEN THE MOISTURE THAT WILL 
BE PRESENT UNDER THE RIDGE...ALONG WITH SOME APPRECIABLE INSTABILITY 
PARAMETERS. THUS...ISOLATED/SCATTERED STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE 
STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE INITIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...BEFORE MORE WIDESPREAD ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY AS THE AFOREMENTIONED COLD FRONT PUSHES 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. HAVE MAINTAINED MENTIONABLE 
POPS ALONG THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AFTN/ 
EVENING...BEFORE EXPANDING THEM AREAWIDE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. GIVEN 
THE INCREASED LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND THE 
FAIRLY GOOD QPF SIGNALS SEEN WITH THE MODELS...HAVE INCREASED POPS 
TO LOW-END CHANCE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD AS WELL. SATURDAY 
GENERALLY APPEARS TO BE DRY...BEFORE ANOTHER STRONGER FRONT 
APPROACHES THE REGION SUNDAY EVENING INTO MONDAY...GIVING THE AREA 
ANOTHER SHOT OF SHOWERS AND STORMS TO BEGIN THE NEW WEEK.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT SUN JUN 17 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SEEING AN INCREASE IN
SHRA/TSRA THIS AFTERNOON UPSTREAM OVER NRN MIDDLE TN INTO CENTRAL
AND EASTERN KY. THIS AREA IS WHERE DEEPEST LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE
WAS NOTED ALONG WITH HIGHEST INSTABILITY (CAPES OF 1000 TO 2000
J/KG). CAN'T ARGUE WITH THIS ACTIVITY MOVING ESE INTO THE FORECAST
AREA LATER THIS EVENING...AND POSSIBLY AT LEAST ISOLATED SHRA
LINGERING OVERNIGHT. FOLLOWED PREVIOUS GRIDS QUITE CLOSE FOR
TONIGHT. SEEMS BEST TO GO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE THE COOLER GFS MOS
MINS...GIVEN THE FACT THAT GFS HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY 2 TO 4 DEGREES
TOO COOL OVER PAST FEW NIGHTS.

HIGHEST PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE TONIGHT AND MONDAY...WITH A
NOTICABLE DECREASE AFTERWARDS ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHERN AREAS.
LIMITING POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY TO ERN MTNS AND HIGHER
TERRAIN OF SW VA STILL LOOKS GOOD. UNDERCUT MOS MAXES MONDAY...THEN
WENT CLOSER TO THOSE UPPER 80S AND LOWER 90S BY TUESDAY. GENERALLY
DID NOT MAKE MANY CHANGES TO FORECAST GRIDS FOR THE SHORT TERM.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE
GETS A GRADUAL NUDGE TO THE EAST EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHILE LOW
LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE CENTER MOVES OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC.
INCREASING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL HELP TO SLOWLY MOISTEN UP THE
ATMOSPHERE OVER THE MID SOUTH ALONG WITH INCREASING INSTABILITY AS
THE UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS EAST. THEREFORE...KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS AREA WIDE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. BY FRIDAY A LONG WAVE TROUGH
WILL HAVE MIGRATED EAST ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN CANADA AND THE
NORTHEASTERN U.S. WHILE DRAGGING A COOL FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. MAINTAINED LOW CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION ACROSS THE
REGION ON FRIDAY DROPPING BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AS
BOUNDARY SLIPS SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE CAROLINAS. KEPT SLIGHT
CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON SATURDAY DUE TO
UNCERTAINTY IN SPEED OF SURFACE FRONT. KEPT SUNDAY DRY FOR THE MOST
PART WITH AN ISOLATED POP IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. EDGED MAX/MIN
TEMPS UP JUST A BIT EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHILE UNDERCUTTING STEAMY
MAX TEMPS LATER IN THE PERIOD WHEN SURFACE BOUNDARY ENTERS THE
PICTURE LATE IN THE WEEK/EARLY NEXT WEEK.

345 AM EDT SUN JUN 17 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A SIMILAR AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. THIS COLD FRONT 
IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TODAY...WITH 
OUTFLOW FROM ITS PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION AND A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE EXPECTED TO COMBINE TO TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...SO 
WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF STRONG TO SEVERE CONVECTION 
IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS MAXES 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY...AND LOOK REASONABLE. WILL TREND 
TOWARDS THE WARMER NAM MINS FOR TONIGHT...WHICH HAVE BEEN VERIFYING 
BETTER LATELY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL 
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL BE THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS UPCOMING WEEK. AS THE CENTER OF THE 
RIDGE MOVES DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA...THICKNESS VALUES AND 
TEMPERATURES WILL INCREASE...RESULTING IN A WARM FORECAST FOR THE 
ENTIRE WEEK. HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO EVEN THE MID 90S SEEM LIKELY 
/PARTICULARLY DURING THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK/...BEFORE A GRADUAL 
COOLING TREND OCCURS BY FRIDAY. GIVEN THE MOISTURE THAT WILL BE 
PRESENT UNDER THE RIDGE AND SOME APPRECIABLE INSTABILITY 
PARAMETERS...ISOLATED/SCATTERED STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE INITIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS MONDAY AND TUESDAY. MODELS 
THEN CONTINUE TO INDICATE SOME BETTER CHANCES FOR MORE WIDESPREAD 
ACTIVITY WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK....WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES OCCURRING ON FRIDAY AS A FRONT IS PROGGED TO SAG SOUTHWARD 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY.  GIVEN THIS POTENTIAL... 
HAVE MAINTAINED MENTIONABLE POPS AREAWIDE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING BEGINNING WEDNESDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES FAVORING THE 
PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. STILL FEEL THAT MODELS MAY BE OVER DOING WITH 
THE CONVECTIVE SIGNALS LATE IN THE PERIOD...SO HAVE STOPPED JUST 
SHORT OF CHANCE POPS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...BEFORE INCREASING THEM 
TO CHANCE ON FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT WHEN THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL OCCUR.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   86  65  90  68  92 /  10   0  20   0  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     85  65  88  66  92 /  30  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             86  64  89  66  92 /  30  20  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    84  58  86  61  90 /  30  30  30  10  10

270 
FXUS64 KMRX 161918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT SAT JUN 16 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MOST CONVECTION TODAY HAS
STAYED OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SE KY...MOVING SOUTH AT 5 TO
10 MPH. GIVEN SLIGHT INSTABILITY AND SEVERAL HOURS OF HEATING...I
KEPT MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR THE EVENING HOURS...SLIGHTLY
HIGHER OVER THE SEQUATCHIE VALLEY COUNTIES BASED ON RADAR TRENDS. 
GFS MOS HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY A COUPLE OF DEGREES TOO COOL ON MINS
SO A MOS BLEND LOOKED BEST FOR TONIGHT.

SATELLITE PICS HINT AT A WEAK CIRCULATION IN THE UPPER MIDWEST OR
WESTERN GREAT LKES THIS AFTERNOON...AND THIS FEATURE SEEMS TO BE
WHAT MODEL DEPICT TO GENERATE SCATTERED CONVECTION OVERNIGHT. THIS
CONVECTION SHOULD REACH NRN PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA SUNDAY
MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON. UPPER LEVELS NOT FAVORABLE FOR ANY
CONVECTION BEYOND SUNDAY EVENING NOR ON MONDAY MORNING. DIURNAL
CONVECTION IS INDICATED FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON...MAINLY ACROSS SW VA 
NE TN AND SMOKIES. I INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY
CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND OF POPS FOR NOW. 

PERSISTENCE ON TEMPS SEEMS REASONABLE...ALTHO A SLIGHT RISE IN
HEIGHTS OCCURS MONDAY WITH MORE OF A SW LOW LEVEL FLOW...SO
POSSIBLY A FEW DEGREES WARMER FOR HIGHS MONDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION ON TUESDAY WHICH SHOULD SUPPRESS CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT WITH MAINLY ISOLATED STORMS ON THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
FEATURES. HOWEVER...UPPER RIDGE SLIPS SLOWLY EAST WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY AND INSTABILITY INCHES HIGHER SO KEPT THE BROAD BRUSHED 
ISOLATED DEVELOPMENT IN PLACE FOR THIS PERIOD. BY FRIDAY AN UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL HAVE MADE PROGRESS INTO THE EASTERN LAKES AND 
EVENTUALLY NORTHEAST QUARTER OF THE NATION DRIVING A SYNOPTIC COOL 
FRONT TOWARD THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY INTO 
SATURDAY. AT THIS TIME THE BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION WOULD BE 
FRIDAY NIGHT AS BOUNDARY SLIPS SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
HOWEVER...MAINTAINED SLIGHT CHANCE POP DURING THE DAY FRIDAY AHEAD 
OF THE FEATURE AND ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ON SATURDAY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY ABOUT HOW QUICKLY FRONTAL SYSTEM 
MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. WEST RELATIVELY CLOSE TO ABOVE NORMAL 
GUIDANCE TEMPS AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD AND SLIGHTLY UNDER 
DURING THE ACTIVE FRONTAL PORTION OF THE FORECAST FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. 


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SAT JUN 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES...WITH THE AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA A LITTLE DRIER COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE MID LEVELS OF THE LOCAL ATMOSPHERE 
WILL BE A LITTLE DRIER TODAY AS WELL...SO THINK THAT ANY ISOLATED 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT IN THE AFTERNOON OR EVENING WILL MAINLY BE 
AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE MAIN FEATURE CONTROLLING 
THE WEATHER IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE A SPRAWLING UPPER-LEVEL 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE THAT WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FROM THE 
LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS WEEKEND. AS THE RIDGE BECOMES MORE 
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THE EARLY TO MIDDLE 
PART OF NEXT WEEK... THICKNESS VALUES AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON 
THE INCREASE /WITH READINGS IN THE 90S LIKELY ACROSS MOST OF AREA BY 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY/. GENERALLY DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGHOUT 
THE UPCOMING WEEK...BUT GIVEN THE MOISTURE PRESENT UNDERNEATH THE 
RIDGE AND SOME APPRECIABLE INSTABILITY PARAMETERS...ISOLATED/ 
SCATTERED STRONG TO LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE INITIALLY 
ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS EARLY NEXT WEEK. MODELS THEN CONTINUE TO INDICATE 
SOME BETTER CHANCES FOR SLIGHTLY MORE WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. GIVEN THIS POTENTIAL... 
HAVE GONE WITH MENTIONABLE POPS AREAWIDE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING BEGINNING WEDNESDAY. FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...AN UPPER-LOW 
SWINGING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES WILL PUSH A FRONT INTO THE AREA AND 
BEGIN TO SHOVE THE AFOREMENTIONED HIGH FURTHER TO THE SOUTH AND 
EAST.

717 
FXUS64 KMRX 151927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT FRI JUN 15 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...CONVECTION IS PRETTY
SPARSE THIS AFTERNOON...DUE TO LOWER DEW POINT TEMPS...MUCH LESS
ORGANIZED LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE...AND THE MAIN AXIS OF INSTABILITY
TO OUR WEST FROM MIDDLE/W TN INTO NRN MS. MODELS WERE SUGGESTING
THIS AXIS OF INSTABILITY WOULD SHIFT WEST TODAY...BUT I EXPECTED AT
LEAST A FEW POCKETS OF CONVERGENCE. OPTED TO LOWER POPS MOSTLY TO
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THE EVENING HOURS...SINCE THE AIRMASS CONTINUES
TO DE-STABILIZE AS MAX TEMPS WARM INTO THE MID 80S TO NEAR 90
DEGREES. MOS MINS HAVE BEEN QUITE CLOSE...SO JUST A MINOR TWEAK ON
GFS NUMBERS.

FOR SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...NOT MUCH FOCUS FOR CONVECTION
SATURDAY...BUT I ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE AFTERNOON FOR NRN
PLATEAU AND SMOKIES. THIS IS DUE TO OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND TO MESH
WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS. KEPT A DRY FORECAST SATURDAY NIGHT...ALTHO
MCS TYPE ACTIVITY MAY BE ONGOING TO OUR NORTH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT.
ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS NRN 2/3RDS ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON... 
WHEN MODELS SHOW A SHORTWAVE PASSING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND
OHIO VALLEY. 

MOS TEMPS LOOKED GOOD WITH GENERALLY PERSISTENT LOWS/HIGHS EXPECTED
WITH UPPER RIDGE THE DOMINANT FEATURE.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THIS PERIOD WILL BE 
CHARACTERIZED BY A STRENGTHENING RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WHICH 
WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY MID 
WEEK. IN THIS PATTERN ATMOSPHERIC CONDITIONS WILL NOT BE CONDUCIVE 
TO WIDESPREAD CONVECTION. THE BEST APPLICATION OF CONVECTIVE POPS 
THROUGH THE PERIOD WOULD BE ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES INCLUDING 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...THE HIGHER RIDGES ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND THE TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. STAYED A LITTLE 
UNDER THE MEX MOS SUGGESTED WARMING TREND DURING THE PERIOD 
CONCERNING THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST.

MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA (ESPECIALLY AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS). WHILE THE AIR MASS 
IS NOT PROGGED TO BE AS UNSTABLE AS YESTERDAY...THERE APPEARS TO BE 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A FEW TSTORMS TO POSSIBLY BECOME STRONG TO 
SEVERE AGAIN. OVERALL...TODAY'S WEATHER PATTERN SHOULD BE VERY 
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY'S. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND CLOSE 
TO A PERSISTENCE FORECAST SINCE THE AIR MASS REMAINS SIMILAR TO 
YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE MAIN FEATURE DOMINATING 
THE WEATHER ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE A 
SPRAWLING UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE. THIS RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO 
NUDGE INTO THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND EVENTUALLY THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL PROMOTE 
FAIR SUMMERTIME WEATHER...WITH MOSTLY SUNNY AND WARM CONDITIONS 
PREVAILING WELL INTO NEXT WEEK. WITH THICKNESS VALUES AND 850 MB 
TEMPS ON THE RISE...HIGHS WILL BE ON A WARMING TREND OVER THE COURSE 
OF THE PERIOD. WHILE GENERALLY DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED...SOME 
MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE AND AN UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT DURING THE 
AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING MAY PROMOTE SOME ISOLATED/SCATTERED STRONG 
TO LOCALLY SEVERE STORMS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. MODELS ARE INDICATING THAT SOME SLIGHTLY HIGHER AND MORE 
WIDESPREAD THUNDER CHANCES WILL EXIST HEADING INTO DURING THE LATTER 
HALF OF THE WORK WEEK. THUS...FELT THAT GIVEN THE FAIRLY APPRECIABLE 
QPF SIGNALS SHOWN BY THE MODELS...SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WERE WARRANTED 
FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AREAWIDE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   88  65  87  64  88 /  20  20  10   0  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     87  64  86  63  87 /  20  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             87  64  87  63  87 /  20  20  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 141911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT THU JUN 14 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE NOT ABLE TO 
CAP OFF CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...AS WEAK ESE UPSLOPE FLOW HELPED 
TSRA POP ACTUALLY BY LATE MORNING. SPC MESO PAGE SHOWS A MOISTURE
CONVERGENCE AXIS FROM SURFACE TO 850 MBS EXTENDING FROM E CENTRAL 
AL/W CENTRAL GA NWD INTO SE TN AND PLATEAU. SPOTTY SHRA/TSRA 
CONTINUE TO DEVELOP ALONG THIS MOIST/UNSTABLE AXIS...WITH MOVEMENT 
SLOW AND VARIABLE. BASED ON LATEST RADAR TRENDS...I ADDED SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING...FOR THESE 
AREAS. ANY AREAS GETTING RAIN TODAY COULD SEE PATCHY FOG OVERNIGHT.

OTHERWISE...EXPECT VERY SIMILAR WEATHER PATTERN FOR FRIDAY WITH 
MOSTLY AFTERNOON TSRA IN THE FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. SLIGHT 
CHANGES OCCUR BY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...1) THE LOW LEVEL FLOW 
IS NO LONGER WEAK UPSLOPE...AND 2) 500 MB HEIGHTS INCREASE A GOOD 
BIT AS THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS NE INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION. FOR 
THESE REASONS I CHOSE TO KEEP OUR FORECAST DRY FOR BOTH FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY...AND WE WILL SEE HOW THIS PANS OUT.

FOR TEMPS...PATTERN FAVORS PERSISTENCE ON LOWS AND HIGHS...WHICH IS 
GENERALLY WHAT THE NAM AND GFS MOS ARE SUGGESTING. STAYED CLOSE TO 
PREVIOUS TEMP GRIDS AND 12Z GUIDANCE. FOR POPS...MOS POPS PROBABLY 
GOOD OVERALL...BUT TOO LOW IN HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS FOR TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY...WHERE I KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS GOING. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL THROUGH 
SURFACE RIDGING WILL GRADUALLY EXPAND ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE LONG TERM. KEPT ALMOST THE ENTIRE PERIOD 
DRY IN THIS PATTERN WHERE AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM COULD DEVELOP 
MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES EARLY IN THE PERIOD BEFORE 
THE WARM RIDGE FORMS AND AGAIN LATE AS THE LOW LEVEL RIDGE SLIPS 
FARTHER EAST AND A SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPS. HOWEVER...PROBABILITY IS 
SO LOW WITH GUIDANCE KEEPING POPS BELOW CLIMO DECIDED NOT TO INCLUDE 
AT THIS POINT. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMPS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED.

FXUS64 KMRX 121929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 PM EDT TUE JUN 12 2012

.SHORT TERM...
THIS AFTERNOON...A COLD FRONT IS CONTINUING TO PUSH THROUGH EAST
TENNESSEE AND IS ROUGHLY LOCATED JUST EAST OF THE I-75 CORRIDOR AS
OF 3 PM EDT. THIS FRONT WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND STORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. RADAR IS ALREADY SHOWING
SOME SCATTERED ACTIVITY DEVELOPING ALONG/AHEAD OF THIS BOUNDARY
ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. GIVEN THE
CURRENT INSTABILITY PARAMETERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT /WHICH INDICATE
SB CAPE AND MU CAPE VALUES AOA 1500-2000 J/KG/...AM EXPECTING
COVERAGE TO INCREASE AS THIS BOUNDARY BEGINS TO TAP INTO THE MORE
UNSTABLE AIR MASS. THE FAIRLY LOW BULK SHEAR VALUES MEAN THAT STORM
ORGANIZATION WILL BE RELATIVELY POOR...BUT SOME BRIEF STRONG
THUNDERSTORM CORES ARE CERTAINLY POSSIBLE GIVEN THE AMOUNT OF
INSTABILITY PRESENT ACROSS THIS AREA. MODELS ARE GENERALLY SHOWING
A DIMINISHING TREND WITH THIS ACTIVITY AFTER SUNSET...THOUGH SOME
STORMS MAY CERTAINLY BE ABLE TO KEEP GOING ALONG THE HIGHER
TERRAIN THROUGH THE LATE EVENING HOURS. IN WAKE OF THIS
FRONT...DRIER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR WEDNESDAY AS A SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM BUILDS INTO THE AREA. THIS WILL PROMOTE
CLEARING CONDITIONS AND WARMER TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO THE LATTER
HALF OF THE WORK WEEK.

.LONG TERM...
BY WEDNESDAY EVENING THE COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY OOZE ACROSS NORTHERN 
GEORGIA AND NORTHERN SOUTH CAROLINA. ANY SHOWER ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS FEATURE SHOULD REMAIN SOUTH OF THE TN AND NC BORDERS 
OVERNIGHT WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW 
CLIMATE NORMALS.

THE UPPER FLOW WILL BE RELATIVELY WEAK OVER E TN AND SOUTHWEST VA 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK. THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT 
SHOULD REMAIN PRECIPITATION FREE AS HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES THE 
FORECAST AREA. AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH BISECTING MIDDLE TENNESSEE 
IS EXPECTED TO TRANSLATE INTO E TN AND SW VA ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 
THE POSSIBILITIES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON IN THE VICINITY OF THIS BOUNDARY. ADDITIONALLY THE AIR 
WILL BECOME INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE WITH LI/S BETWEEN -2 AND -4 
DEGREES C. WARM...MOIST AIR WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
PRODUCING THE DIURNAL SUMMERTIME CONVECTION SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND 
POSSIBLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON TOO. THE SURFACE TROUGH WILL REMAIN 
SITUATED SOMEWHERE ACROSS THE REGION POSSIBLY AIDING IN CONVECTION 
INITIATION THROUGH MONDAY DESPITE THE UPPER RIDGE SITTING OVER 
WESTERN NY STATE.

.DISCUSSION...
LATE THIS MORNING...A COLD FRONT IS CONTINUING TO PUSH EASTWARD
TOWARD THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS CLOUD COVER FROM A DEPARTING
UPPER-TROUGH AND A REMNANT OVERNIGHT/MORNING MCS ACROSS THE LOWER-
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LINGER ACROSS THE AREA. DESPITE THE LIMITED
CLEARING AT THE MOMENT...THIS CLOUD COVER SHOULD BEGIN TO BREAK UP
SOMEWHAT BY THIS AFTERNOON. THIS WILL COINCIDE WITH THE
AFOREMENTIONED FRONT TRACKING EASTWARD INTO A MORE UNSTABLE
ENVIRONMENT PRESENT ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...AND CREATE SOME DECENT
CHANCES FOR SOME SCATTERED STORMS TO DEVELOP. ATTM...THE ATMOSPHERE
IS RELATIVELY UNCAPPED EAST OF THE I-75 CORRIDOR...WITH SB CAPE AND
MU CAPE VALUES AOA 1000-1500 J/KG. THESE VALUES ARE PROGGED TO
INCREASE OVER THE COURSE OF THE DAY /PARTICULARLY ACROSS NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/ WHERE THE GREATEST CHANCES FOR
STORMS WILL EXIST AS THE FRONT BEGINS TO TAP INTO THE MORE UNSTABLE
AIR MASS. STILL...WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR HOW ANY LINGERING CLOUD
COVER PLAYS IN HINDERING ANY DEVELOPMENT...BUT ATTM CERTAINLY
THINK THAT SOME ACTIVITY IS PROBABLE IN THIS AREA THIS AFTERNOON.
GIVEN THE UNIMPRESSIVE SHEAR VALUES...STORM ORGANIZATION WILL BE
RELATIVELY POOR...THUS DIMINISHING THE SEVERE POTENTIAL ACROSS OUR
AREA. ALSO...GIVEN THE GREATER AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER PRESENT...HAVE
KEPT TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT... 
THINK THAT SHOWERS SHOULD BE THE DOMINATE PRECIP TYPE WITH ONLY 
ISOLATED TSTORMS.

TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF EVENING PRECIP.

636 
FXUS64 KMRX 111917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EDT MON JUN 11 2012

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TOMORROW/... 
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUES TO PUSH NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT THAT IS
APPROACHING THE LOWER- MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. A BROAD AREA OF SHOWERS
THAT PUSHED ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE LATE THIS MORNING HAS
SINCE DISSIPATED AS IT PUSHED FURTHER TO THE NORTH. HOWEVER...AS
LIFT HAS INCREASED WITH THE PASSAGE OF THIS UPPER-TROUGH SOME
ADDITIONAL SCATTERED SHOWER ACTIVITY HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS MIDDLE
TENNESSEE AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND GRADUALLY HAS BEEN
EXPANDING EASTWARD WITH TIME. SOME OF THIS ACTIVITY HAS BECOME
STRONGER OVER TIME /PRIMARILY ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE WHERE
INSTABILITY VALUES ARE HIGHER/. WHILE THERE IS SOME ELEVATED
INSTABILITY ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...VALUES ARE LOWER AND THUS FEEL
ANY THUNDER THREAT WILL REMAIN FAIRLY ISOLATED LATE THIS AFTERNOON
AND THIS EVENING. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THIS ACTIVITY DEVELOPING
AND MOVING ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH MOST OF THE EARLY TO MID
EVENING...BEFORE DISSIPATING. SOME ADDITIONAL ACTIVITY IS PROGGED
TO LINGER ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT...SO HAVE
MAINTAINED THE HIGHER POPS THERE THIS EVENING.

WITH ALL THIS DEEP MOISTURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA...THE FOCUS 
WILL TURN TO A COLD FRONT AND THE ASSOCIATED THUNDERSTORMS CHANCES 
IT WILL BRING TO THE AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW. MODELS 
CONTINUE TO INDICATE SOME FAIRLY APPRECIABLE QPF SIGNALS DEVELOPING 
ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU DURING THE 
MORNING...AND SPREADING EASTWARD AND FAVORING THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN 
ZONES BY THE AFTERNOON. WITH SOME HIGHER INSTABILITY VALUES IN 
PLACE...A BETTER CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS WILL EXIST TOMORROW AND 
HAVE ADJUSTED THE WX GRIDS TO REFLECT THIS. HOWEVER...ANY THREAT FOR 
SEVERE WEATHER STILL APPEARS TO BE PRETTY MARGINAL ATTM. GIVEN THIS 
POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPITATION...HAVE MAINTAINED SOME FAIRLY HIGH POPS 
THROUGH TOMORROW EVENING. GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT...DEEP 
WARM CLOUD LAYER AND SOME PROGGED INSTABILITY...THE THREAT FOR SOME 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING WILL CERTAINLY EXIST AS WELL... 
PARTICULARLY IF TRAINING BEGINS TO OCCUR. IN ADDITION...GIVEN THE 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIP CHANCES...HAVE LOWER HIGH TEMPERATURES 
BY A FEW DEGREES AS WELL.   

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. A N-NW
FLOW IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS INDICATES DYNAMIC SUPPORT FOR LIFT
ALONG THIS FRONT IS LACKING. SOME WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE MAY
BRING SOME SHOWERS TO THE AREA AFTER 00 WED...BUT WILL JUST CARRY
CHANCE POPS FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE NIGHT.

A LARGE RIDGE FROM 850-500 MB WILL EXTEND FROM EASTERN CANADA TO THE 
LOWER MS REGION...REMAINING NEARLY STATIONARY FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY. WITH A LACK OF UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT...DIURNAL CONVECTION IN 
AREAS OF HIGH TERRAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. THERE 
IS A SLIGHT UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THAT ROTATES AROUND A CLOSED LOW OVER 
THE EASTERN ATLANTIC THAT MODELS SHOW CROSSING THE AREA ON FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY...WHICH MAY EXPAND THE CHANCES OF PRECIP INTO THE TN 
VALLEY. BUT WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LACKING...NO MORE THAN SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS SEEM WARRANTED AT THIS TIME. A SLIGHT SOUTHWARD PUSH OF 
THE RIDGE SHOULD REMOVE EVEN DIURNAL TERRAIN POPS FROM SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO NORMAL THROUGH THE 
PERIOD...WITH VERY LITTLE DAY-TO-DAY VARIATION IN THE PERSISTENT 
BLOCKING PATTERN.

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  82  65  86  62 /  70  70  40  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1121 AM EDT MON JUN 11 2012

.DISCUSSION...
LATE THIS MORNING...AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO LIFT
NORTHWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...BRINGING WITH IT ABUNDANT
GULF MOISTURE AND THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL
THIS AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT. AN INITIAL AREA OF HEAVIER SHOWERS
HAS PUSHED NORTHWARD INTO MUCH OF SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE THIS
MORNING AND HAS GENERALLY PRODUCED RAINFALL TOTALS OF 1/4 TO 1/2
OF AN INCH OVER THE PAST 4-5 HOURS IN THIS AREA. THIS INITIAL
CLUSTER WILL CONTINUE TO WORK ITS WAY NORTHWARD ALONG THE I-75
CORRIDOR THIS AFTERNOON. AS THE AFOREMENTIONED TROUGH CONTINUES TO
SWING NORTHWARD INTO THE AREA...SHOWER COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO
BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD AS LIFT INCREASES. THE MOST FAVORED
LOCATIONS FOR THIS ACTIVITY APPEAR TO BE ACROSS THE EASTERN ZONES/
MOUNTAINS...BUT GIVEN THE ENVIRONMENT IN PLACE...THE POTENTIAL FOR
MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS WILL EXIST ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA
THIS AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT...DEEP WARM CLOUD
LAYER AND SOME PROGGED INSTABILITY...THE THREAT FOR SOME LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING WILL CERTAINLY EXIST...PARTICULARLY
IF TRAINING BEGINS TO OCCUR. HOWEVER...IN GENERAL THIS IS NOT
EXPECTED TO BE A WIDESPREAD ISSUE GIVEN THE CURRENT FORWARD
MOTION OF THIS ACTIVITY AND A LACK OF ANY SIGNIFICANT BOUNDARIES IN
THE AREA TODAY.

THE MID TENNESSEE VALLEY LATER TONIGHT. WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH MOVES 
NE INTO THE AREA THIS EVENING. ABUNDANT MOISTURE CONTINUES TO 
TRANSPORT INTO THE AREA IN SW FLOW IN ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING 
TROUGH. VERY HIGH PWAT VALUES AND DEEP MOIST FORECAST SOUNDING HINT 
AT A THREAT FOR HEAVY RAINFALL. FCST SOUNDINGS HAVE ALSO BECOME 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE FOR THIS AFTERNOON. LIFT AND SHEAR VALUES DO NOT 
SUPPORT SEVERE TSTMS. LACK OF STATIONARY FEATURE OR BOUNDARY DOES 
NOT SUPPORT AREAL FLOODING. MID LEVELS BEGIN DRYING OUT IN THE WAKE 
OF PASSING TROUGH OVERNIGHT. PRECIPITATION COVERAGE WILL TAPER OFF 
IN THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. TEMPERATURES CONTINUE INSIDE CLIMO NORMALS 
MODERATED BY CLOUDS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...ON TUESDAY...ABUNDANT GULF 
MOISTURE WILL BE IN PLACE FROM A LINGERING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT 
IS MOVING UP FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  THIS WILL COMBINE 
WITH AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT MOVING IN FROM THE WEST TO GENERATE 
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM ACROSS THE MRX CWA.  THE RESULT 
WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD RAINFALL AND THE POSSIBILITY OF 
HEAVY RAIN AND MAYBE EVEN LOCALIZED FLOODING.  PRECIP WILL SLOWLY 
END FROM WEST TO EAST TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE SYSTEM 
PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE REST OF 
THE EXTENDED FOR A QUIETER WEATHER PATTERN.  HOWEVER...A COUPLE OF 
WEAK IMPULSES MOVING THROUGH AS WELL AS NORMAL SUMMERTIME DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WILL PROVIDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM 
ACTIVITY MOST DAYS AND GENERALLY CONFINED TO HIGHER TERRAIN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             78  68  86  68  87 / 100  60  70  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  78  67  84  65  84 / 100  70  80  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       78  67  84  64  84 / 100  60  70  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              78  66  81  60  81 / 100  80  80  50  10

.DISCUSSION...

WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...SO THINK SOME THUNDER WILL BE POSSIBLE...BUT 
SHOWERS SHOULD BE THE DOMINATE PRECIP TYPE. WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER 
VALUES APPROACHING 2 INCHES TONIGHT...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE WITH SOME OF THE STRONGER CONVECTION 
OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF EVENING PRECIP.

493 
FXUS64 KMRX 101926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT SUN JUN 10 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WATER VAPOR SHOWS AN UPPER
TROUGH ACROSS THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. MODELS SHOW THIS WAVE
LIFTING NORTH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR
TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. ABUNDANT TROPICAL-LIKE MOISTURE WITH
PWS AROUND 2 INCHES WILL ACCOMPANY THIS TROUGH INTO THE AREA THE
NEXT 24-36 HOURS. A GOOD DEAL OF CONVECTION WITH TORRENTIALS ARE
MOVING NORTH ACROSS ALABAMA/GEORGIA. THIS ACTIVITY WILL MOVE INTO
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING/NIGHT. 

AS THE UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES THE AREA MONDAY...WIDESPREAD SHOWERS
AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL ONCE AGAIN RE-DEVELOP. GIVEN PWS
NEAR 2 INCHES...SKINNY CAPE...AND OVER 10KFT DEPTH OF THE LCL-
FREEZING LEVEL...CONDITIONS ARE SET FOR HEAVY RAINS ONCE AGAIN. IF
TRAINING OF CELLS TO SETUP...FLASH FLOODING WILL BE A CONCERN FOR
THIS EVENING (SOUTHERN HALF) AND MONDAY (AREA-WIDE). HAVE INCLUDED
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IN THE FORECAST AND HARARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE IS FAIRLY HIGH...SO DID NOT FEEL WIDESPREAD
FLOODING WOULD BE AN ISSUE.

TRENDED CLOSELY WITH GFS MOS TEMEPRATURES.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE THREAT FOR
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL PERSIST MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS AN
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH LIFTS THROUGH THE AREA AND WILL COINCIDES WITH A
PASSING COLD FRONT. THE COMBINATION OF THESE TWO FEATURES WILL
FOCUS SOME OF THE DEEP MOISTURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE
REGION...TRIGGERING SOME ADDITIONAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS AND STORMS.
MODELS ARE STILL INDICATING MOST FAVORED AREA FOR DEVELOPMENT WILL
BE ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES ALONG THE SPINE OF THE
APPALACHIANS BEGINNING LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS THE FRONT
PUSHES EAST AND COMBINES WITH SOME LOCALIZED OROGRAPHIC EFFECTS TO
CREATE THIS INCREASED POTENTIAL. HOWEVER...MODELS ARE SHOWING
FAIRLY WIDESPREAD COVERAGE OF APPRECIABLE QPF SIGNALS ACROSS THE
ENTIRE AREA THROUGH TUESDAY BEFORE BEGINNING TO TAPER THINGS OFF
FROM WEST TO EAST BEGINNING TUESDAY NIGHT. AS SUCH...HAVE INCREASED
POPS TO DEFINITE ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN 1/2 TO 2/3 OF THE CWA
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION PROGGED
TO OCCUR LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. GIVEN THE HIGH
MOISTURE CONTENT...A DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER...AND THE POTENTIAL FOR
NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING PARALLEL TO THE MEAN
UPPER-FLOW...THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING
WILL PERSIST THROUGH AT LEAST TUESDAY AND THUS HAVE CONTINUED TO
HIGHLIGHT THIS THREAT IN THE HWO. THEREAFTER...HAVE SHOWN A SHARP
DECREASE TO CHANCE POPS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.

A WEAK HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA THURSDAY INTO 
FRIDAY...PROMOTING MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS AND ALLOWING TEMPERATURES 
TO GRADUALLY WARM BACK INTO THE MID TO UPPER 80S. HOWEVER...HAVE 
KEPT MENTIONABLE POPS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS EACH EVENING THROUGH THE 
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD AS SOME ENHANCED OROGRAPHIC LIFT COULD 
CERTAINLY LEAD TO SOME LOCALIZED SHOWER/STORM ACTIVITY LATE IN THE 
WEEK.  

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EDT SUN JUN 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS EAST 
OF THE APPALACHIANS AND CENTERED IN THE ATLANTIC THROUGH THE PERIOD.
UPPER LOW WILL MOVE NNE THROUGH THE MS RIVER VALLEY TODAY AND INTO 
THE OH RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL TRANSPORT 
ABUNDANT MOISTURE FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO ACROSS THE REGION. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE MOST FAVORABLE NEAR LEADING EDGE OF SW FLOW. 
A LEADING BAND OF RAIN SHOWERS WILL MARCH SLOWLY NORTHWARD THROUGH 
THE MRX CWA TODAY. FORECAST SOUNDINGS PORTRAY WARM RAIN EVENT WITH 
LITTLE ROOM FOR EVAPORATION. HIGH FREEZING LEVEL...LOW LAPSE RATES 
AND WEAK SHEAR DO NOT POINT TO MUCH THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY BUT A 
STRAY LIGHTENING STRIKE IS POSSIBLE. DOWNSLOPING FLOW WILL HINDER
PRECIPITATION EARLY ACROSS NE VALLEY AREAS BUT FLOW SHIFTS TO NEARLY 
UP VALLEY BY THIS AFTERNOON. RELATIVELY SMALL DIURNAL TEMPERATURE 
RANGE MODERATED BY CLOUDS AND RAIN.
  
.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...EVERYTHING STILL ON TRACK FOR 
A WET FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED.  AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING IN 
FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL PULL ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE 
INTO THE AREA.  ASSOCIATED SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORM WILL 
CONTINUE TO SPREAD NORTHWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
ON MONDAY AND HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CATEGORICAL.  ADDING TO THE MIX 
WILL BE A COLD FRONT TRACKING INTO THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY...ENHANCING PRECIP OVER THE AREA.  HAVE INCREASED POPS TO 
HIGH LIKELY AND CATEGORICAL AS WELL FOR THIS TIME FRAME.  
ADDITIONALLY ...WITH POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL OCCURRING... 
COULD SEE LOCALIZED FLOODING.  CURRENT MODELS WANTING TO MOVE 
CONVECTION OUT A BIT FASTER AND HAVE TRENDED POPS THIS DIRECTION FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR 
THE REST OF THE EXTENDED AND OTHER THAN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF DIURNAL 
CONVECTION OVER HIGHER TERRAIN...HAVE LEFT POPS OUT OF FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY.

OVER CENTRAL AL AND CENTRAL GA. MODELS AGREE THAT SCATTERED SHOWERS 
WILL BEGIN TO MOVE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...WITH A LARGER AREA OF SHOWERS WITH SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER 
MOVING IN TOWARDS SUNRISE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK IN TERMS OF PRECIP 
TIMING AND TEMPS...BUT WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO BE MORE 
PESSIMISTIC WITH THE SKY COVER WORDING.

568 
FXUS64 KMRX 091918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT SAT JUN 9 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...RIDGING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS WILL GIVE WAY TO AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN
GULF. THIS UPPER LOW WILL DRIFT NORTH INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.
GULF MOISTURE WILL PULL NORTHWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH PWS INCREASING TO 2 INCHES+. PERIODS OF
SHOWERS AND EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN HALF
OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY MORNING AS A SHORT-WAVE EJECTS NORTH
TOWARD THE REGION. 

MODELS SHOW THIS WAVE WEAKENING BY EARLY AFTERNOON WITH AREA OF
RAIN DIMINISHING...BUT ABUNDANT TROPICAL-LIKE MOISTURE AND TERRAIN
FORCING WITH PRODUCE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. BEST CHANCE WILL BE
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA WITH THE MOISTURE RETURN WILL
THE DEEPEST.

LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS ARE EXPECTED WITH THE STRONGER STORMS.
LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING WILL BECOME MORE OF A CONCERN DURING THE
NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AND THE TROPICAL MOISTURE BECOMES MORE
WIDESPREAD OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE SHORT-TERM.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...EVERYTHING STILL 
LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK FOR A PROLONGED RAIN EVENT ACROSS THE REGION
AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT ACROSS THE AREA
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY. WITH A STRONG FLUX OF GULF MOISTURE
BEING IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA...CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION
CHANCES WILL PERSIST THROUGH THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF NEXT
WEEK AS A COUPLE OF DISTURBANCES IMPACT THE REGION. INITIALLY
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL CONTINUE TO
DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGION IN RESPONSE TO THE ENHANCED LIFT FROM THE
AFOREMENTIONED PASSING UPPER-TROUGH. HOWEVER IN ADDITION...ANOTHER
STORM SYSTEM PASSING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES WILL DROP A COLD FRONT
SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO EASTERN TENNESSEE MONDAY
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. THIS FRONT WILL SERVE AS AN EVEN GREATER FOCUS
FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS. THE 06Z RUN /AND TO A LESSER EXTENT THE 12Z
RUN/ OF THE NAM-12 HIGHLIGHTED THIS THREAT...SHOWING FAIRLY HEAVY
QPF SIGNALS DEVELOPING ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/GREAT TENNESSEE
VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND GRADUALLY WORKING THEIR WAY EASTWARD
TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. IN FACT...SHOULD THE FRONT BE SLOW TO
CLEAR THE AREA SOME ENHANCED OROGRAPHIC LIFT COULD CERTAINLY LEAD
TO PERSISTENT SHOWER ACTIVITY FAVORING THE EASTERN/MOUNTAIN ZONES
THROUGH WEDNESDAY AND POSSIBLY THURSDAY EVENING.

IN GENERAL...HAVE NOT ALTERED POPS CATEGORICALLY THROUGH 
TUESDAY...BUT HAVE INCREASED THEM TO LIKELY ACROSS THE EASTERN ZONES 
TUESDAY NIGHT BEFORE SHOWING A TAPERING TREND FROM WEST TO EAST 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT...A DEEP 
WARM CLOUD LAYER...AND THE POTENTIAL FOR NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS MOVING PARALLEL TO THE MEAN UPPER-FLOW...THE POTENTIAL 
FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING STILL APPEARS TO BE A 
CONCERN EARLY THIS UPCOMING NEXT WEEK. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO 
HIGHLIGHT THIS THREAT IN THE HWO. GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER/PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HAVE GONE BELOW MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGH 
TEMPERATURES SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY BEFORE CLEARING 
OCCURS AND HIGHS CAN WORK THEIR WAY BACK TO THE MID TO UPPER 80S BY 
FRIDAY.

&&

TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHOULD BE A RATHER WET EXTENDED 
AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LIFTS OUT OF THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI REGION 
AND ONTO THE MRX CWA ON SUNDAY.  SHOWERS AND EVEN A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL SPREAD NORTHWARD ACROSS THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  THE 
LOW AND THE RAINFALL WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION MONDAY.  A COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY PROVIDING ADDITIONAL MOISTURE 
AND ENERGY TO THE CONVECTION.  RAIN MAY BECOME HEAVY AT 
TIMES...CREATING LOCALIZED FLOODING OR FLASH FLOODING.  THE FRONT 
WILL SLOWLY PULL OUT OF THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY WITH LINGERING PRECIP 
ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  SURFACE 
HIGH BUILDS IN FOR FRIDAY WHICH SHOULD FINALLY ALLOW FOR A DRY DAY.
