671 
FXUS64 KMRX 081919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT FRI JUN 8 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL KEEP DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA. AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE GULF/GULF COAST STATES WILL MOVE
NORTH TOWARD THE AREA FOR SUNDAY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A DEPARTING RIDGE
OF HIGH PRESSURE SATURDAY NIGHT WILL ALLOW AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM TO SHIFT FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE
AREA. THIS WILL PROVIDE A GOOD SUPPLY OF GULF MOISTURE AND LEAD TO
INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND RAINFALL CHANCES BEGINNING SUNDAY MORNING
INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT
ON THE TIMING OF THE INITIAL WAVE OF PRECIPITATION...SHOWING IT
ARRIVING AT THE DOORSTEP OF OUR SOUTHERN ZONES BY 06-12Z ON SUNDAY.
THE NAM-12 IS SLIGHTLY MORE AGGRESSIVE IN PUSHING THIS ACTIVITY
NORTHWARD INTO MUCH OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND EVEN PARTS OF
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BY THE MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...ALL
MODELS SHOW APPRECIABLE QPF SIGNALS MOVING INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY
AND LINGERING THROUGH THE EARLY TO MIDDLE PART OF THE WORK WEEK.
ALL INDICATIONS ARE THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT THE
REGION...THOUGH THERE IS STILL SOME DISCREPANCY BETWEEN THE MODELS
ON HOW QUICKLY ITS DEPARTURE WILL BE. GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE
CONTENT...A DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER...AND THE POTENTIAL FOR NUMEROUS
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING PARALLEL TO THE MEAN UPPER-FLOW...
THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING APPEARS TO BE
A CONCERN HEADING INTO THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK. GIVEN FAIRLY
GOOD MODEL AGREEMENT ON THE INITIAL TIMING AND THE POTENTIAL FOR
SHOWERS AND STORMS...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY BEGINNING SUNDAY
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST ZONES AND SHOW AN INCREASING TREND
TO AREAWIDE LIKELY POPS BY MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT. THEREAFTER...HAVE
KEPT A SOLID CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH
WEDNESDAY...BEFORE GRADUALLY TAPERING THEM OFF BY THURSDAY /WITH
THE HIGHEST POPS FAVORING THE EASTERN ZONES CLOSEST TO THE FRONT/.
GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HAVE GONE
BELOW MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPERATURES SUNDAY THROUGH THE
REMAINDER GENERALLY THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

557 
FXUS64 KMRX 071916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT THU JUN 7 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...DRY NORTHWEST FLOW WITH PWS
BETWEEN .50 AND .75 INCH AND SURFACE RIDGING WILL PRODUCE DRY
CONDITTIONS FOR THE SHORT-TERM. AREAS OF FOG NEAR AREA LAKES AND
STREAMS WITH THE MAIN STORY ALONG WITH THE DRY CONDITIONS. CALM
WINDS AND CLEAR SKY WILL ALLOW AREAS OF STREAM FOG TO DEVELOP NEAR
AREA LAKES AND STREAMS. FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE WILL PROMOTE WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS ON SATURDAY...WITH
DAYTIME HIGH TEMPERATURES APPROACHING THE MID TO UPPER 80S. THE
CENTER OF THIS RIDGE WILL THEN SLIDE OFF TO THE EAST SATURDAY
NIGHT...ALLOWING FOR AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO PUSH
EASTWARD INTO THE AREA FROM THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS
PROVIDE A GOOD SUPPLY OF GULF MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION AND LEAD
TO INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND RAINFALL CHANCES BEGINNING SUNDAY
MORNING INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK. MODELS HAVE BEEN IN FAIRLY GOOD
AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...THOUGH THE 12Z NAM HAS
STARTED TO PUSH CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION INTO SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE SLIGHTLY QUICKER ON SUNDAY MORNING. THUS...HAVE INCREASED
POPS A LITTLE TO SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS THE FAR SOUTHERN/SOUTHWEST
ZONES SUNDAY MORNING...AND INCREASED THEM TO CHANCE ACROSS MOST OF
THE AREA BY SUNDAY AS THIS SYSTEM BEGINS TO NUDGE INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY. THEREAFTER...AT LEAST SOLID CHANCE POPS SEEM
PLAUSIBLE ATTM FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD AS THIS SYSTEM MAY
BE SLOW TO EXIT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. SHOULD SOME OF THE
SLOWER MODEL PROJECTIONS COME TRUE...SOME FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE REGION.
HOWEVER...GIVEN SOME OF THE CONTINUED MODEL UNCERTAINTY...HAVE
OPTED TO KEEP POPS AT CHANCE LEVELS FOR NOW. AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM
SYSTEM ROTATING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES BY MID-WEEK WILL FINALLY
PUSH THIS SYSTEM EAST OF THE AREA...THOUGH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD
FRONTAL PASSAGE MAY SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR ADDITIONAL THUNDER CHANCES
THROUGH WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY OF NEXT WEEK. ALSO...GIVEN THE EXPECTED
CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HAVE GONE BELOW MOS GUIDANCE
SUNDAY THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT THU JUN 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS WILL CONTINUE 
TO VERY GRADUALLY INCREASE DURING THE SHORT TERM AS THE NORTHEASTERN 
TROUGH SLIPS EAST. THERE SHOULD BE A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE TODAY 
BUT WITH A CONTINUATION OF THE EASTERLY FLOW AROUND 700 MB AND 
BELOW...HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD STILL BE JUST A TAD BELOW NORMAL IN 
THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S. QUIET WEATHER EXPECTED TONIGHT WITH 
BELOW NORMAL MINS AS DEWPOINT TEMPERATURES DROP A COUPLE MORE 
DEGREES IN A LIGHT NORTHEASTERLY FLOW REGIME.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL 
KEEP THE AREA DRY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH AN UPWARD TREND IN 
TEMPERATURES EACH DAY. BY SUNDAY THE RIDGE WILL BE OFF THE ATLANTIC 
COAST...AND A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE LOCATED OVER THE MS DELTA 
REGION. THIS WILL GIVE A GOOD SUPPLY OF GULF MOISTURE TO THE 
AREA...WITH RAIN CHANCES INCREASING FROM SOUTH TO NORTH ON 
SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT. MODELS HAS MAINTAINED REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THIS SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM...SO CONFIDENCE IN A WET FORECAST 
FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY IS RISING.  THE LOW MOVES VERY SLOWLY EAST 
UNTIL IT GETS PICKED UP BY A MID-LATITUDE SHORTWAVE TROUGH ON 
WEDNESDAY. WITH A PROLONGED FEED OF GULF MOISTURE...WE COULD SEE 
SOME SIGNIFICANT PRECIP AMOUNTS SPREAD OVER SEVERAL DAYS. THERE ARE 
SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES IN THE MODELS REGARDING THE EXIT OF THE 
SYSTEM...BUT WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING THROUGH THE END OF THE 
FORECAST. KEPT TEMPERATURES A BIT BELOW GUIDANCE DUE TO THE EXPECTED 
BROKEN/OVERCAST CLOUD COVER IN THE VERY MOIST ENVIRONMENT.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 061838
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT WED JUN 6 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL REMAIN ACROSS 
THE APPALACHIANS WITH SURFACE RIDGING. DUE TO COLD POOL ALOFT AND 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE...WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT POPS FOR THE 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS FOR THIS EVENING. MAIN CONCERN IS EXTENT OF FOG 
DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN AND EASTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE AREA. MODELS SHOW A GOOD DEAL OF SURFACE MOISTURE 
WITH DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS BECOMING NEAR ZERO OVERNIGHT. DUE TO 
LIGHT/CALM WINDS...CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY SKY...AND NEAR SATURATED AIR 
MASS...HAVE INCLUDED AREAS/PATCHY FOG. SOME OF THE FOG MAY BECOME 
LOCALLY DENSE. FOR THURSDAY...SURFACE RIDGING AND DRIER AIR WILL 
PRODUCE A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY AFTER FOG DISSIPATES. FOLLOWED GFS MOS 
CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THE LONG-WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
WILL MOVE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL 
RIDGE DEVELOPING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. BOTH 
THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT GULF MOISTURE 
WILL SPREAD NORTHWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...AS A 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AREA BECOMES SITUATED OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC. ECMWF MODEL IS MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN THE GFS MODEL WITH THE 
MOISTURE RETURN FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...MAINLY DUE TO THE INFLUENCE OF 
A WEAK CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW IN THE ECMWF SOLUTION. FOR NOW...WILL 
GRADUALLY INCREASE POPS FROM SUNDAY ONWARD...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT 
EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE 00Z GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
WHICH ARE IN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 060736
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT WED JUN 6 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOST OF THE REGION WILL REMAIN DRY 
TODAY WITH SCATTERED ALTO CU. HOWEVER...EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH 
REMAINS IN PLACE AND A COUPLE OF SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES WILL 
ROTATE THROUGH THIS CIRCULATION AND ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR A 
SHOWER AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS AREA AND ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER AS THE FIRST WAVE BUILDS THROUGH EARLY IN THE 1ST 
PERIOD. THE SECOND WAVE WILL BUILD IN AROUND MID DAY INTO THE 
AFTERNOON AND MODELS INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ENHANCING LIFT. STAYED CLOSE TO A 
GUIDANCE BLEND CONCERNING MAX/MIN TEMPS TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A LARGE RIDGE WILL BE 
BUILDING OVER THE AREA AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD...GIVING DRY 
CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND THROUGH THE FIRST PART OF THE LONG 
TERM PERIOD. TEMPS WILL GO FROM THE MID 70S-LOWER 80S THURSDAY TO 
LOWER-UPPER 80S BY SATURDAY. THE SURFACE-850 MB RIDGE WILL BE 
POSITIONED TO OUR EAST BY SATURDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING AN INCREASINGLY 
SOUTHERLY FLOW OF GULF MOISTURE. THE MOISTURE FEED CONTINUES TO 
INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH ON SUNDAY AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE 
MS DELTA. THE GFS...CANADIAN...AND ECMWF ARE IN PRETTY GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THIS FEATURE. ALL SHOW DEEP MOISTURE ENCROACHING ON 
THE AREA BEGINNING SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE LOW 
KEEPING PRECIP OVER THE AREA THROUGH TUESDAY. WILL RAISE POPS UP 
FROM PREVIOUS FORECASTS...BUT WILL STAY IN THE CHANCE RANGE.

089 
FXUS64 KMRX 060231
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 PM EDT TUE JUN 5 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS NE AREAS
WITH APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH FROM NW. TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY BELOW 
NORMAL. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CONTINUE TO SEE WEAK IMPULSES 
RIDING THROUGH THE UPPER TROUGH.  ANOTHER WILL TRACK THROUGH LATE 
TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.  MAIN ENERGY WILL STAY TO OUR 
NORTHEAST...BUT COULD SEE A STRAY SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM MOVE INTO 
THE MRX CWA...MAINLY OVER NORTH AND AND EASTERN LOCATIONS.  
OTHERWISE...NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL KEEP THINGS RELATIVELY QUIET 
WITH NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY 
CONSISTENT IN BUILDING THE UPPER RIDGE EASTWARD THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
THIS SHOULD KEEP THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY DRY WITH WARMING 
TEMPS...ALTHO I DON'T EXPECT MORE THAN STRAY 90 DEGREES OR HIGHER 
MAXES OVER THE WEEKEND...MOSTLY 80S. THE SURFACE RIDGE AXIS DOES 
SHIFT FAR ENOUGH EAST BY MONDAY TO ALLOW A GRADUAL/SLIGHT INCREASE 
IN MOISTURE...SO CAN'T RULE OUT ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION BY 
MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. A DEEPER MOISTURE INCREASE IS NOTED BY 
TUESDAY WHERE I INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW...WAITING TO 
SEE PERSISTENCE FROM LONG RANGE MODELS BEFORE GOING UP TO CHANCE 
POPS. HIGHER POPS MIGHT BE JUSTIFIED IF A WEAK UPPER LOW WERE TO 
APPROACH FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION BY MONDAY OR 
TUESDAY. 

OTHERWISE...GFSX MOS HAS BEEN SHOWING GOOD CONTINUITY FROM RUN TO 
RUN ON BOTH MINS AND MAXES. GFS MOS HAS ALSO PERFORMED WELL OF LATE 
FOR SHORT TERM TEMPS...SO NO REASON TO DIFFER MUCH FROM GUIDANCE 
TEMPS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

206 
FXUS64 KMRX 050743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EDT TUE JUN 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...
SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA WILL BE PUSHING SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE 
MORNING AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH ROTATES AROUND THE CLOSED UPPER LOW 
OVER NEW ENGLAND. ADVECTION OF DRIER AIR FROM THE NORTH SHOULD END 
PRECIP BY NOON. HOWEVER ADDITIONAL ISOLATED SHOWERS COULD DEVELOP 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON AS MIDLEVEL TEMPS DROP BENEATH 
THE TROUGH...CREATING STEEPENING LAPSE RATES. THE CWA WILL BE SPLIT 
IN HALF BY THE 300 MB JET STREAM AND 500 MB CHANNELED VORTICITY FROM 
THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING..WITH THIS PATTERN CHANGING 
VERY LITTLE AS THE CLOSED LOW REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES BEING IN NORTHERN AREAS...WITH 
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS EACH PERIOD. POPS WILL DIMINISH LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE CLOSED LOW BEGINS TO SLOWLY TRACK EASTWARD 
AND A RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD OVER THE TN VALLEY REGION FROM THE WEST.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
EASTERN STATES UPPER TROUGH GRADUALLY SHIFTS EAST OUT TO SEA
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY ALLOWING FOR THE RETURN OF A RIDGE. THE RIDGE
AXIS BUILDS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. THIS
PATTERN APPEARS TO PERSIST THROUGH MONDAY ALTHOUGH MODELS TRY TO
SHOW A WEAKNESS BUILDING EAST THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TOWARD
THE MID SOUTH. WITH RIDGING PRESSING A LITTLE FARTHER EAST LATE IN
THE FORECAST PERIOD THERE SHOULD BE A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MEAN
RELATIVE HUMIDITY ALONG WITH GRADUALLY INCREASING INSTABILITY.
HOWEVER...STAYED THE COURSE KEEPING THE FORECAST DRY THROUGH MONDAY
AS RIDGING SHOULD BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF
THE NEW WEEK. STAYED CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE WHICH FEATURES A
WARMING TREND WHICH ENDS UP WITH MAX TEMPS APPROXIMATELY FIVE
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL BY SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 PM EDT MON JUN 4 2012

.DISCUSSION...
LATE THIS EVENING...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS ASSOCIATED
WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE CONTINUE TO PUSH PRIMARILY
ACROSS NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA.
ADDITIONALLY /AS SHOWN BY THE MODELS EARLIER/...SOME HEAVIER AND
MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION HAS BEGUN TO FIRE ACROSS CENTRAL AND
WESTERN KENTUCKY WITH THE PAST HOUR OR SO AND IS GRADUALLY MAKING
IT'S WAY SOUTHEASTWARD TOWARD EASTERN/NORTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF
MIDDLE TENNESSEE. MODELS HAVE BEEN SHOWING SOME SOLID CONVECTIVE
SIGNALS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS ACTIVITY PUSHING INTO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH THE
EARLY MORNING HOURS...WITH THE MORE FAVORED AREAS BEING LOCATIONS
ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE INTERSTATE 40 CORRIDOR. THOUGH THE
DIMINISHED INSTABILITY VALUES WILL BE A LIMITING FACTOR FOR
THUNDERSTORMS...THE POTENTIAL FOR AT LEAST A COMBINATION OF SHOWERS
AND STORMS WILL EXIST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA
OVERNIGHT. ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINA RAIN
CHANCES APPEAR TO BE SLIGHTLY LOWER...AND GIVEN THE LACK OF
INSTABILITY...LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS SEEM MUCH MORE LIKELY
THERE. STILL...WITH PWAT VALUES AROUND 1.2-1.4 INCHES...SOME LOCALLY
HEAVIER RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE UNDERNEATH THE STRONGER CELLS
AREAWIDE. THUS GIVEN THE LATEST OBS/TRENDS...HAVE INCREASED POPS
AND QPF SLIGHTLY /PRIMARILY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA/.

WINDS...SO I OPTED TO DROP POPS FOR THURSDAY. 

THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS EASTWARD THRU THE WEEKEND...WHICH SHOULD KEEP 
OUR REGION DRY WITH TEMPS CLIMBING A BIT EACH DAY...POSSIBLY SEEING 
MAX TEMPS FLIRT WITH 90 DEGREES BY SAT/SUN ACROSS THE SRN VALLEY. 
SURFACE RIDGE AXIS MAY SHIFT EAST OF THE TN VALLEY/SRN APPALACHIANS

TO KEEP MONDAY DRY FOR NOW. GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE GENERALLY CONSISTENT 
FROM 00Z TO 12Z RUN...WITH JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON JUN 4 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A WARM FRONT APPEARS TO BE LOCATED BETWEEN CHA AND TYS THIS 
MORNING...AND CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT HAS SPARKED A LINE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC. THE MAIN CONCERN 
WITH THE STORMS OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS WILL BE TRAINING AND 
FLOODING. THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DIMINISH BY LATE 
MORNING...AFTER WHICH TIME WE SHOULD SEE A BRIEF LULL IN PRECIP 
ACROSS THE AREA. WHILE UPPER LEVEL FORCING WILL BE WEAK THIS 
AFTERNOON...THE PRESENCE OF THE WARM FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL PORTIONS 
OF THE AREA AND MODERATE INSTABILITY SHOULD PRODUCE SCATTERED 
AFTERNOON/EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CENTRAL AND SOUTH. AN 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND JET ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE CLOSED LOW OVER 
NEW ENGLAND WILL DROP SOUTH INTO THE AREA TONIGHT...SO EXPECT THAT 
CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN SOUTHERN PORTIONS 
OF THE AREA WHERE THE STATIONARY SURFACE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO 
LINGER. UNIDIRECTIONAL SHEAR PARALLEL TO THE FRONT WILL AGAIN MAKE 
TRAINING STORMS AND FLOODING A CONCERN TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHORTWAVES ARE EXPECTED TO
MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY...WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY
BRINGING A CHANCE FOR MAINLY ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
OVER THE AREA WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE CWA. RIDGE BUILDS IN ON FRIDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR
TEMPERATURES.

222 
FXUS64 KMRX 040229 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1029 PM EDT SUN JUN 3 2012

.DISCUSSION...
THIS EVENING...STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ASSOCIATED WITH AN
MCV FEATURE OVER ARKANSAS CONTINUE TO FIRE ACROSS WESTERN AND
MIDDLE TENNESSEE. WITH PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...THESE
STORMS WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT TOWARD THE REGION /MAINLY PARALLEL TO
A WARM FRONT DRAPED FROM THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL INTO SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE LATE THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...WITH THE LOSS
OF DAYTIME HEATING...INSTABILITY VALUES ARE PROGGED TO DECREASE
MARKEDLY OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS...DECREASING THE THREAT FOR
SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE. THE BEST CHANCES FOR
THUNDERSTORMS /PARTICULARLY STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS/ WILL BE
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...WHICH WILL
BE CLOSEST TO THE FRONT AND WHERE INSTABILITY VALUES WILL BE
SLIGHTLY HIGHER. GIVEN THE FAIRLY STRONG BUT UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND
SHEAR...THE MAIN STORM TYPE WILL BE MULTICELL LINES/CLUSTERS...WITH
DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE PRIMARY THREAT. ADDITIONALLY...GIVEN
THE HIGHER PWAT VALUES ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE DEEP WARM
CLOUD LAYER NOTED ON MODEL SOUNDINGS...THE THREAT FOR SOME LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE ENHANSED SOMEWHAT ACROSS THIS AREA SHOULD
TRAINING BEGIN TO OCCUR WITH THE MORE INTENSE CELLS. FURTHER
NORTH AND EAST...THUNDER CHANCES ARE LOWER /PARTICULARLY GIVEN THE
WEAKER INSTABILITY PARAMETERS THERE/...THOUGH SOME ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED ACTIVITY CANNOT BE RULED OUT LATE TONIGHT. NO SIGNIFICANT
CHANGES TO THE FORECAST WERE NEEDED AND ONLY MINOR TWEAKS WERE MADE
TO POPS AND TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN JUN 3 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEASTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO...WITH A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING 
FROM THE OZARKS REGION SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS CENTRAL AL AND CENTRAL 
GA. WATER VAPOR SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVELY- 
INDUCED VORTEX OVER THE OZARKS REGION...WHICH IS EXPECTED TO TRIGGER 
A LARGE COMPLEX OF CONVECTION OVER THE MID SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD THEN MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD ALONG THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TOWARDS SOUTHEAST TN TONIGHT...WITH CONVECTION 
BECOMING LIKELY OVER SOUTHEAST TN...ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. WITH 
A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND STRENGTHENING MID-LEVEL WIND FLOW 
EXPECTED NEAR THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...IT APPEARS THAT STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY. BOTH THE 
GFS AND NAM MODELS INDICATE REDEVELOPMENT OF ANOTHER CONVECTIVE 
COMPLEX ON MONDAY AFTERNOON NORTH OF THE TRACK OF TONIGHT'S COMPLEX. 
THIS NEXT CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MAY AFFECT THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING...WITH A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS POSSIBLY GENERATING SOME DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE 
HAIL...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. DRIER AIR IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS SINCE A HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WITH 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT CONTINUING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. WILL PULL A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES INTO THE REGION 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THIS WILL CARRY OCCASIONAL BANDS OF CONVECTION 
INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. MOISTURE AND LIFT LIMITED OVER 
THE MRX CWA WITH BEST CHANCE OVER NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS AND WILL 
KEEP POPS GENERALLY AT SLIGHT CHANCE. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS. THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE 
APPROACHING THE AREA ON SUNDAY. CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING AND DETAILS 
AND WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY FOR NOW.

OVER A TAF SITE...BE PREPARED FOR BRIEF MVFR CONDITIONS WITH LOW 
CLOUDS AND REDUCED VIS.  HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING AND FOR 
NOW WILL ONLY MENTION VC WORDING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 AM EDT SUN JUN 3 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE (CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN 
GA AND NORTHERN FL) EXTENDING NORTHWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA... 
WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE PRODUCING SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. IT APPEARS THAT THESE SHOWERS SHOULD 
EXIT THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON...AS THE MODELS INDICATE 
SOME SUBSIDENCE DEVELOPING BEHIND THIS SHORT WAVE WHICH SHOULD 
SUPPRESS ANY ADDITIONAL SHOWER DEVELOPMENT FOR THIS AFTERNOON. A 
LARGE COMPLEX OF CONVECTION OVER THE OZARKS IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
SOUTHEAST THIS AFTERNOON...AND WILL LIKELY PRODUCE SOME HIGH CLOUDS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION 
PARTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. THIS MESOSCALE 
CONVECTIVE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE MOVING SOUTHEAST TONIGHT 
ALONG A WARM FRONT LOCATED NEAR THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH 
TSTORMS POSSIBLY AFFECTING THE CHATTANOOGA AREA BEFORE SUNRISE. WITH 
A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND STRENGTHENING MID-LEVEL WIND FLOW 
EXPECTED NEAR THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...IT APPEARS THAT STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT AND INTO MONDAY...MAINLY 
OVER SOUTHEAST TN. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK 
TO MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE 
ANY MORNING WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS AND SKY CONDITIONS A LITTLE 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON. WILL ALSO MENTION TSTORMS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR LATE TONIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SAT JUN 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COOL AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION BRINGING SEVERAL UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE PERIOD. MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THESE INDIVIDUAL SHORT WAVES...AND ALSO 
THE LOCATION OF A WARM FRONT ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. A COUPLE OF 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVES LATE TONIGHT AND ON SUNDAY MAY PRODUCE A FEW 
ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS...SO WILL MENTION PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. A WARM FRONT IS THEN 
PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHWARD FROM THE DEEP SOUTH TOWARDS SOUTHEAST TN 
LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED 
TO DEVELOP AROUND THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...MAINLY SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 
40. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND STRENGTHENING MID-LEVEL 
WIND FLOW EXPECTED NEAR THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...IT APPEARS THAT 
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ON MONDAY...MAINLY OVER 
SOUTHEAST TN. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO 
MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A SERIES OF WEAK 
DISTURBANCES TRACK THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION EARLY IN 
THE EXTENDED. THEN STRONGEST OF THESE MOVES OVER THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY...PROVIDING OUR BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 
ANOTHER MOVES THROUGH TO OUR NORTHEAST ON WEDNESDAY...GENERATING 
ISOLATED CONVECTION ACROSS NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS. THE 
TROUGH AXIS SLIDES THROUGH ON THURSDAY...MAIN ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY 
TO OUR NORTH AND EAST BUT COULD SEE ISOLATED CONVECTION ACROSS THE 
MRX CWA. HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. BEGINS TO BUILD 
INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND THE 
BEGINNING OF A WARMING TREND.

974 
FXUS64 KMRX 020207 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 PM EDT FRI JUN 1 2012

.DISCUSSION...
BASED ON CURRENT OBS AND TRENDS...HAVE MADE A FEW MINOR ADJUSTMENTS
TO THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT.

IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT THAT SWEPT THROUGH THE REGION EARLIER
TODAY...SOME BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS HAVE HELPED TO USHER IN A
COOL AIR MASS INTO THE AREA TO KICK OFF METEOROLOGICAL SUMMER.
THIS COOL AIR WILL HELP TO CONTRIBUTE TO BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES
OVERNIGHT AS LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER 40S TO THE LOWER 50S
AREAWIDE. SOME PARTIAL CLEARING HAS TAKEN PLACE OVER MUCH OF THE
GREAT TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS EVENING...WHICH HAS ALLOWED
TEMPERATURES TO DROP OFF A BIT FASTER THAN EXPECTED. HOWEVER...
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND SOUNDING DATA IS SHOWING A PLUME OF LOW-
LEVEL MOISTURE SWEEPING IN FROM THE MISSOURI AND MID-MISSISSIPPI
RIVER VALLEYS...HELPING TO MAINTAIN SOME SCT/BKN DECKS OF CLOUDS
OVERNIGHT. THUS...ONLY ADJUSTED TEMPS DOWNWARD BY A DEGREE OR TWO AS
THIS CLOUD COVER COMBINED WITH SOME MIXING SHOULD HELP TO KEEP THIS
COOLING IN CHECK SOMEWHAT. GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER...HAVE
ADDED A MENTION OF PATCHY FOG IN THE VICINITY OF AREA LAKES AFTER
06Z...THOUGH THINK THAT IT MAY STILL BE FAIRLY MARGINAL GIVEN SOME
MIXING AND PERSISTENT CLOUD COVER.

&&

PRESSURE THAT WILL SLIDE IN MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. ANOTHER WEAK 
WAVE ROTATES IN ON WEDNESDAY FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION 
MAINLY OVER NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS. WILL KEEP THURSDAY AND

FRONT...DRY AIR WILL MOVE IN THOUGH CLOUDS WILL BE SLOW TO 
DECREASE.  WINDS WILL INCREASE...BECOMING GUSTY FOR THE AFTERNOON.  
OVERNIGHT...CLOUDS...DEW POINTS AND WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO 
DECREASE AND THE DRIER AIR AND WEAK WIND FIELD SHOULD BE ENOUGH TO 
KEEP CONDITIONS VFR THROUGH THE REST OF THE TAF PERIOD.

650 
FXUS64 KMRX 311840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT THU MAY 31 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WARM FRONT JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR THE CONFLUENCE OF THE OHIO AND 
MISSISSIPPI RIVERS. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING... 
WITH ITS ASSOCIATED STRONG COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVING ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A VERY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS WILL DEVELOP OVER WEST AND MIDDLE TN THIS AFTERNOON...WITH 
INSTABILITY DECREASING FURTHER EAST OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS A 
RESULT...ANY STRONG TO SEVERE CONVECTION OVER THE WESTERN TN RIVER 
VALLEY SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EASTWARD THIS EVENING...BUT THIS 
CONVECTION MAY HAVE ENOUGH ORGANIZATION TO CONTINUE MOVING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL LATER THIS EVENING 
BEFORE COMPLETELY DISSIPATING. IT APPEARS THAT THE BEST INSTABILITY 
AND LIFT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE ALONG THE COLD FRONT LATE 
TONIGHT...AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AFTER SUNRISE ON 
FRIDAY MORNING BETWEEN 12 AND 18 UTC. A FAIRLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY MORNING... 
WHICH WILL CREATE A FAIRLY STRONG WIND FIELD FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 
THUS...IT APPEARS THAT TWO ROUNDS OF SEVERE WEATHER COULD AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS...ONE ROUND THIS EVENING AND 
THE NEXT ONE AROUND SUNRISE AND THEREAFTER ON FRIDAY MORNING. THE 
MAIN THREATS APPEAR TO BE DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL...BUT AN 
ISOLATED TORNADO APPEARS TO BE POSSIBLE WITH THE DECENT WIND FIELD 
OCCURRING ALONG THIS STRONG COLD FRONT. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD 
QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON...WITH 
UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR MOVING IN BEHIND IT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...AND WILL TREND TOWARDS 
THE WARMER NAM MAXES WHICH HAVE BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH MAY 
ROTATE IN A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORM INTO PORTIONS OF THE 
MRX CWA SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE CENTRAL U.S. 
EARLY IN THE WEEK...PUTTING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. A SERIES OVER SHORT WAVES AND BOUNDARIES WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW...PROVIDING US WITH OCCASIONAL 
CONVECTION MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. STRONGEST SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. MODELS STILL SHOW DISCREPANCIES IN TIMING 
BUT HAVE TRENDED FASTER WITH THE SYSTEM AND BROUGHT IN HIGHER POPS 
TUESDAY NIGHT. LEFT THURSDAY DRY WITH ONLY A WEAK IMPULSE PROGGED 
INTO THE AREA.


008 
FXUS64 KMRX 310822
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EDT THU MAY 31 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO 
INTENSIFY ACROSS THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY...AND IS 
EXPECTED TO DEEPEN FURTHER OVER THE COURSE OF THE DAY AS IT 
PROGRESSES EASTWARD INTO THE GREAT LAKES. AS IT DOES SO...A COLD 
FRONT WILL DROP SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE 
MID-SOUTH AND TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY INTO THIS EVENING. THIS FRONT 
AND IT'S ASSOCIATED PREFRONTAL TROUGH WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT LATER THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. 
MODELS HAVE CONTINUED TO SLOW DOWN THE SPEED OF THIS SYSTEM...WITH 
MOST SOLUTIONS HOLDING OFF ANY ACTIVITY FROM DRIFTING INTO THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU UNTIL THE MID TO LATE AFTERNOON...WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES OCCURRING AFTER 00-06Z AS THE MAIN COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND 
PUSHES ACROSS THE AREA. THE SPEED OF THIS SYSTEM AND THE TIMING OF 
THIS FRONT WILL HAVE A FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON THE SEVERE 
WEATHER POTENTIAL FOR LATER THIS EVENING.

PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS HAD BEEN INDICATING A REASONABLE SHOT FOR AN 
ELEVATED SEVERE WEATHER THREAT /PARTICULARLY DAMAGING STRAIGHT-LINE 
WINDS/ FROM AN MCS FEATURE PROGGED TO MOVE OUT OF THE OHIO 
VALLEY/MID-SOUTH TOWARD THE REGION DURING THE EVENING. HOWEVER...WITH 
A SLOWER MOVING SYSTEM...THE WINDOW OF OPPORTUNITY FOR A WIDESPREAD 
SEVERE WEATHER EVENT ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE MAY BE SOMEWHAT LIMITED 
AS INSTABILITY VALUES DECREASE SIGNIFICANTLY AFTER 03Z OR SO. 
THUS...DESPITE THE FAIRLY IMPRESSIVE DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
STORM SYSTEM FOR LATE MAY/EARLY JUNE...IT IS CONCEIVABLE THAT AN 
OVERALL WEAKENING TREND WITH THIS ACTIVITY WILL OCCUR AS IT PUSHES 
INTO THE AREA DURING THE LATE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS. THE MOST 
FAVORED AREAS FOR THUNDERSTORMS AND THE ASSOCIATED SEVERE WEATHER 
THREAT WILL BE ACROSS THE WESTERN ZONES/CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THAT 
COULD EXPERIENCE SOME CONVECTION DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY 
EVENING. HOWEVER...MODELS SEEM TO AGREE THAT A BULK OF THE ACTIVITY 
WILL IMPACT THE FORECAST AREA AFTER 06Z ON FRIDAY /AFTER INSTABLITY 
VALUES HAVE DECREASED/. 

BASED ON THIS THINKING...HAVE SCALED BACK MENTIONABLE POPS SOMEWHAT 
TODAY /REMOVING THEM COMPLETELY FROM THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA PRIOR TO 18Z/...BEFORE GRADUALLY RAMPING THEM UP 
DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS /WITH THE MOST 
FAVORED AREAS BEEN ACROSS THE WESTERN ZONES/. IT SHOULD BE NOTED 
THAT GIVEN THE STRONG WIND SHEAR IN PLACE /WITH 0-1 KM VALUES AOA 
20-25 KTS AND 0-6 KM SHEAR VALUES AOA 40-45 KTS/...SOME STRONG AND 
FAIRLY ORGANIZED/LONG-LIVED STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE SHOULD THEY BE 
ABLE TO TAP INTO THE HIGHER INSTABILITY THAT WILL BE IN PLACE ACROSS 
THE AREA EARLIER IN THE AFTERNOON/EVENING. THUS...THE THREAT FOR 
DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS/HAIL...AND EVEN AN ISOLATED TORNADO 
WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THIS ACTIVITY DEPENDING ON HOW THE TIMING 
SHAKES OUT LATER TODAY. BUT...GIVEN THESE UNCERTAINTIES/LIMITING 
FACTORS...EXACTLY HOW WIDESPREAD THIS THREAT WILL BE IS STILL 
UNCLEAR ATTM.  


.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
MAIN CHANGE HAS BEEN THE SLOWER TIMING OF THE UPPER LOW/TROUGH AND
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY. I INCREASED POPS IN THE 12Z TO 16Z
GRIDS ON FRIDAY TO RELFECT THE SLOWER TIMING...BUT KEPT POPS
FALLING TO SLIGHT CHANCE W TO CHANCE E BY THE MID TO LATE
AFTERNOON. THE THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS HAS LOWERED
SIGNIFICANTLY...AS TSRA ARRIVE VERY LATE THURSDAY NIGHT WELL AFTER
BEST INSTABILITY HAS OCCURRED. THE SHEAR AND LIFT REMAIN POTENT FOR
FRIDAY MORNING...HENCE THE HIGH LIKELY TO LOW CATEGORICAL
POPS...BUT AIRMASS DOES NOT DESTABILIZE AGAIN UNTIL THE CONVECTION
IS ALMOST EAST OF OUR REGION. THIS LEAVES BEST FOCUS FOR SEVERE
STORMS OVER THE CAROLINAS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...I WILL
MENTION STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE FRIDAY MORNING IN THE HWO
PRODUCT...WITH MAIN THREATS UP TO LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS FOR
NE TN AND SW VA.

OTHERWISE...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT AND IN LINE WITH 
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. MOSTLY DRY OVER THE WEEKEND BEHIND THE EXIT 
OF FRIDAY'S SYSTEM. TOUGH TO PIN DOWN DETAILS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY
AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE PLAINS AND MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION.
THIS PLACES OUR AREA IN NW FLOW ALOFT...BUT MODELS CONTINUE TO 
DIFFER ON TRACK AND TIMING OF POTENTIAL MESOSCALE CONVECTION...WHICH 
COULD OCCUR BOTH DIURNALLY AND NOCTURNALLY. PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED 
REASONABLE WITH LITTLE CHANGES FOR NOW. GFSX MOS CONTINUES TO OFFER 
BEST POPS FOR TUESDAY...SO KEPT DECENT CHANCE POPS FOR THAT PERIOD. 
GFSX MOS TEMPS ARE FLUCTUATING A BIT FROM 12Z TO 00Z RUN...MAINLY ON 
HIGHS FOR MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY. BLENDED WARMER HIGHS FOR THOSE DAYS 
IN WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS...AND MADE A FEW TWEAKS ELSEWHERE ON MAX/MIN 
TEMPS TO FIT BETTER WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             90  65  76  53  81 /  40  80  70  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  88  64  74  51  76 /  40  70  70  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  64  74  50  75 /  40  70  70  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              87  61  75  49  73 /  20  40  80  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

POINT. COULD BE A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM LATE IN THE PERIOD...BUT
PROBABILITY OF OCCURRENCE AT ANY GIVEN SITE LOOKS RATHER LOW SO
WILL LEAVE OUT FOR NOW. WILL HAVE A VFR FORECAST ALL SITES FOR THE
PERIOD.


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

664 
FXUS64 KMRX 301856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT WED MAY 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH THE CENTER OF TROPICAL DEPRESSION BERYL 
ALONG THE NC COAST NEAR THE OUTER BANKS. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SHOULD SLOWLY DRIFT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT...WITH A 
WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE COMBINING TO POSSIBLY TRIGGERING SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION TONIGHT...MAINLY OVER SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST 
TN...AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE 
PLAINS TONIGHT...WHICH WILL THEN STRENGTHEN A SURFACE LOW OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS LOW IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS 
THE OZARKS ON THURSDAY MORNING...AND THEN OVER THE LOWER OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM APPEARS TO BE 
FAIRLY STRONG FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR...WITH A DECENT WIND FIELD 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT. THUS...EXPECT ORGANIZED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THURSDAY EVENING AHEAD OF ITS ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT. SOME PRE-FRONTAL ACTIVITY COULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY EVENING...BUT IT APPEARS THE BEST 
INSTABILITY AND LIFT WILL BE ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 12 UTC ON FRIDAY MORNING. DUE TO 
THE STRENGTH OF THIS SYSTEM...WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SEVERE STORMS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING IN THE ZONE 
FORECASTS. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...WITH UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR MOVING IN 
BEHIND IT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL TREND 
TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY WARMER NAM MINS AND WARMER GFS MAXES WHICH HAVE 
BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL SOLUTIONS RELATIVELY 
CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST WHICH FEATURES A 
CLOSED LOW AND MEAN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH EXTENDING FROM THE GREAT 
LAKES INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THIS PATTERN WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM SKY ROCKETING OUT OF CONTROL WITH AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF 
NORTHERLY STEERING FLOW. IN ADDITION...THERE WILL BE A CHANCE FOR A 
FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY IN NORTHERN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES 
BUILD SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. A SLIGHTLY STRONGER 
WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY SO THERE 
WILL BE A SLIGHTLY HIGHER PROBABILITY FOR THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA. FOR THE NEW DAY SEVEN (WEDNESDAY) ALSO ADDED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER DISTURBANCE 
MOVING ACROSS THE REGION IN THE PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE 
EASTERN U.S. STAYED RATHER CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT 
THE FORECAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   64  90  66  78  51 /  10  40  70  70  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     63  88  66  76  50 /  10  40  70  70  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             62  88  65  76  50 /  10  40  70  70  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    59  86  63  74  48 /  20  30  60  70  10

533 
FXUS64 KMRX 300809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
409 AM EDT WED MAY 30 2012

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/... 
THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THAT ACCOMPANIED A COLD FRONTAL
PASSAGE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HAVE PUSHED WELL TO THE
SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. IN THEIR WAKE...SOME
CLEARING WILL BEGIN TO OCCUR FROM WEST TO EAST...THOUGH SOME OF THE
CLOUD COVER MAY LINGER ACROSS EASTERN/NORTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE LATE MORNING HOURS. ADDITIONALLY...GIVEN
THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER THAT IS IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...SOME
FOG DEVELOPMENT HAS OCCURRED IN SOME OF THE USUAL SHELTERED AREAS
AND NEAR LAKES/RIVERS. THUS...HAVE INTRODUCED LOCALIZED PATCHY FOG
IN THESE LOCATIONS THROUGH 12Z TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS. AFTER
SUNRISE...THE FOG WILL DISSIPATE AND WITH ZONAL FLOW PREVAILING
ALOFT...A BEAUTIFUL FAIR WEATHER DAY IS EXPECTED WITH ABUNDANT
SUNSHINE YIELDING WARM TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S BY THE
AFTERNOON.

OVERNIGHT...A DEVELOPING UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM AND ITS 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL BEGIN TO TRACK TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY AND EVENTUALLY THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BY THURSDAY. MODELS HAVE 
MAINTAINED SOME WEAK QPF SIGNALS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT PUSHING INTO 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AREA FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE BEFORE 12Z. 
SO...HAVE ADDED LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS TO THIS AREA AFTER 06Z. 
HOWEVER...GENERALLY DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT...WITH MOST OF 
THE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY IMPACTING THE REGION THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
WETTEST SYSTEM FOR THESE PERIODS STILL LOOKS TO BE THURSDAY NIGHT
AND FRIDAY...AS A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT APPROACH.
TIMING LOOKS MORE LIKE LATE AFTERNOON IN WRN AREAS AND THE EVENING
HOURS AND OVERNIGHT IN THE ERN AREAS. I ADJUSTED POPS TO BETTER
REFLECT THIS TIMING. SHEAR AND INSTABILITY SHOULD SUPPORT STRONG TO
SEVERE STORMS...AT LEAST THROUGH ABOUT 04Z FRIDAY.

MOST...IF NOT ALL...MODELS SUPPORT A DRY FORECAST SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY...SO POPS WERE ONLY KEPT FOR SATURDAY MORNING. UPPER RIDGE 
AXIS SHOULD BE TO OUR WEST BY MONDAY...WITH SOME DIFFERING ON HOW 
STRONG THE RIDGE IS. OUR FORECAST AREA SHOULD BE UNDER NW FLOW ALOFT 
WITH POTENTIAL FOR MCS TO DEVELOP AND PASS ACROSS OR NEAR OUR 
REGION. FOR NOW...I KEPT JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT. GFSX MOS POPS ARE DECREASING FOR MONDAY BUT INCREASING 
FOR TUESDAY...SO I SPREAD LOW CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE BOARD FOR 
TUESDAY. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...
ANOTHER LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAS DEVELOPED OVER MIDDLE
TN...AND THE SOUTHEASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE LINE SHOULD GIVE THE
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE ARE THE BEST CHANCES OF PRECIP THROUGH THE
REST OF THE EVENING. WILL ADJUST POP GRIDS TO RAISE IN THE SOUTH
AND LOWER IN THE NORTH. ALL PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA WITHIN
A FEW HOURS AFTER MIDNIGHT. EARLIER RAINFALL HAS COOLED TEMPS WELL
BELOW FORECAST VALUES...SO WILL ALSO NEED TO UPDATE TEMPERATURES.
FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE TONIGHT SHOULD RESULT IN CLEARING SKIES BY
MORNING. 

&&

.AVIATION...
THUNDERSTORMS OVER MIDDLE TN ARE MOVING TOWARD THE SOUTHEAST...AND
ARE MOST LIKELY TO AFFECT CHA IN THE FIRST 3-5 HOURS OF THE TAF
PERIOD. WILL INCLUDE A TEMPO THERE FOR TS WITH GUSTY WINDS...AND
MENTION VCTS AT TYS. THE STORMS SHOULD STAY SOUTH OF TRI.
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN PREDOMINANTLY VFR FOR THE REST OF
THE NIGHT AS A FRONT WORKS ITS WAY INTO THE AREA...WITH CLEAR SKIES
BY MID MORNING.

280 
FXUS64 KMRX 291907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT TUE MAY 29 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH 
THE AREA TONIGHT. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND HIGHEST LIFT IS DURING 
THE EVENING HOURS SO WILL CONTINUE THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR EARLY 
TONIGHT. INSTABILITY OVER THE AREA TONIGHT STILL EXPECTED TO PRODUCE 
A FEW THUNDERSTORMS EARLY TONIGHT. BUT SEVERE WEATHER IS NOT 
EXPECTED. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY. 
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE SIMILAR SO STAYED CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS HAVE COME 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT IN HANDLING THE DEPTH OF THE UPPER TROUGH THAT 
DIGS IN EARLY IN THE PERIOD AS WELL AS THE TIMING OF THE COLD FRONT 
THAT MOVES THROUGH OUR AREA.  AFTER A DRY WED NIGHT...WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS THU...WITH LIKELY WEST THU NIGHT AND ALL ZONES FRIDAY AS 
THE FRONT PUSHES IN AND THROUGH.  LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE AT LEAST 
SOME RISK OF SEVERE STORMS THU THROUGH FRIDAY...SO WILL MENTION IN 
HWO.  WITH LATEST MODELS TRENDING FASTER WE COULD BE MOSTLY DRY BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...BUT GIVEN UNCERTAINTY THAT FAR OUT WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS 
SATURDAY.  WHILE FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS SLIGHTLY ABOVE AVERAGE FOR 
WED NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...IT QUICKLY FALLS BELOW AVERAGE BY SUNDAY 
GIVEN POOR MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY.  SOME SOLUTIONS SHOW SOME 
WEAK ENERGY ROTATING THROUGH THE TROUGH BY SUNDAY WHICH MAY BRING 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME PRECIP...BUT HAVE OPTED TO KEEP THE FORECAST DRY 
SUNDAY GIVEN UNCERTAINTY IN MODEL HANDLING SUCH FEATURES THAT FAR 
OUT AND THE MENTIONED POOR CONSISTENCY.  MODELS HAVE ALSO TRENDED 
TOWARD BRINGING ANOTHER WEAK BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH DOWN CLOSE ENOUGH 
TO IMPACT AT LEAST NORTHERN ZONES BY MONDAY. WILL CARRY LOW POPS 
NORTH MONDAY AND ALL ZONES TUESDAY. GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO ONLY SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.


625 
FXUS64 KMRX 291340
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 AM EDT TUE MAY 29 2012

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT TRIGGERING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
UPSTREAM.  WILL LEAVE CURRENT RAIN CHANCES AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND 
THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE 
MORNING WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FORECAST AREA STILL UNDER
INFLUENCE OF RIDGING THIS MORNING...WITH MILD TEMPS IN THE 60S TO
MID 70S. SPOTTY WEAK SHOWERS OVER WRN NC...ASSOCIATED WITH FLOW
AROUND REMNANTS OF BERYL...HAD DISSIPATED. SOME CONVECTION WAS
DEVELOPING JUST AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT...STILL WELL TO
OUR WEST. I LOWERED RAIN CHANCES FOR EARLY TO MID MORNING HOURS...
AND DROPPED THUNDER FOR THOSE PERIODS. SOME FORCING DOES DEVELOP
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT NOT OVERLY IMPRESSIVE. HOWEVER...
INSTABILITY EASILY REACHES 1000 TO 1500 J/KG...AND THE WARM AIR
ALOFT WILL HAVE LESSENED MAKING FOR A WEAKER CAP.

OPTED TO KEEP SOME LIKELY POPS GOING FOR GENERALLY ALL AREAS BUT SE
TN...WHERE MOS POPS ARE THE LOWEST FOR TODAY. PROXIMITY OF BERYL
CIRCULATION AND THE WEAK COLD FRONT...SUPPORTS AT LEAST SCATTERED
CONVECTION THIS EVENING. PREVIOUS POPS WERE VERY CLOSE TO A MOS
BLEND...BUT I DID NUDGE POPS UP A BIT FOR SW VA AND NE TN TO MESH
BETTER WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. HAS BEEN HOT AND DRY FOR SEVERAL
DAYS SO RAIN SHOULD BE WELCOMED BY MOST FOLKS.

FOR TEMPS...CURRENT TEMPS MILD TO WARM SO ANY DELAY IN CONVECTION
DEVELOPING WOULD SUPPORT THE WARMER MOS MAXES. RECORDS ARE NOT IN
JEOPARDY...(CHA - 99...TYS - 95 AND TRI - 90). MOS BLEND OF SIMILAR
LOWS LOOKED GOOD AND CLOSE TO PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN
FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD CONTINUES TO BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM DURING THE LATTER PART
OF THE WORK WEEK.

AS THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL DEPRESSION BERYL SHOOT NORTHEASTWARD OFF 
THE CAROLINA COAST BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...DRY CONDITIONS ARE 
EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY AS GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL PREVAIL. 
FAIRLY LOW INSTABILITY VALUES AND CAPPING SHOULD PROHIBIT MOST 
DIURNAL CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HOWEVER...ON 
THURSDAY AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL SWING OUT OF THE CENTRAL 
ROCKIES ONTO THE GREAT PLAINS AND TOWARD TENNESSEE VALLEY...PUSHING 
A COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION AND BRINGING THE AREA A FAIRLY DECENT 
SHOT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY 
SATURDAY MORNING. HOWEVER...THERE CONTINUES TO BE SOME SIGNIFICANT 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE MODELS REGARDING THE TIMING AND TRACK OF THIS 
SYSTEM. THE GFS AND ECMWF FAVOR A FASTER MOVING AND MORE NORTHERLY 
TRACK OF THE LOW...WHILE THE CMC CONTINUES TO INDICATE A SLOWER AND 
MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK /ALONG WITH A MORE INTENSE SYSTEM/ PROPAGATING 
THROUGH THE RED RIVER VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY. SHOULD THE CMC SOLUTION VERIFY...COOLER CONDITIONS AND 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL LINGER THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER... 
GIVEN A BETTER CONSENSUS BETWEEN THE GFS/ECMWF/SREF...HAVE OPTED 
TO LEAN TOWARD A BLEND OF THESE SOLUTIONS. HAVE MAINTAINED THE SAME 
TREND OF SHOWING INCREASING POPS DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH THE GREATEST CHANCES BEING ON FRIDAY...BEFORE 
THEY TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST FRIDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY SATURDAY 
MORNING. IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM...A WARM UP CAN BE EXPECTED AS HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL NUDGE BACK INTO THE REGION BY THE LATE WEEKEND... 
PUSHING HIGHS BACK INTO THE MID 80S TO AROUND 90 DEGREES TO BEGIN 
THE NEW WEEK. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             90  66  92  63  88 /  50  20  10  10  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  64  90  61  87 /  60  30  10  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       87  63  90  62  87 /  60  30  10  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              85  58  86  55  86 /  60  50  10  10  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

DAYS SO RAIN SHOULD BE WELCOMED BY MOST FOLKS.

FOR TEMPS...CURRENT TEMPS MILD TO WARM SO ANY DELAY IN CONVECTION
DEVELOPING WOULD SUPPORT THE WARMER MOS MAXES. RECORDS ARE NOT IN
JEOPARDY...(CHA - 99...TYS - 95 AND TRI - 90). MOS BLEND OF SIMILAR
LOWS LOOKED GOOD AND CLOSE TO PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN
FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD CONTINUES TO BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM DURING THE LATTER PART
OF THE WORK WEEK.

AS THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL DEPRESSION BERYL SHOOT NORTHEASTWARD OFF 
THE CAROLINA COAST BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...DRY CONDITIONS ARE 
EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY AS GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL PREVAIL. 
FAIRLY LOW INSTABILITY VALUES AND CAPPING SHOULD PROHIBIT MOST 
DIURNAL CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HOWEVER...ON 
THURSDAY AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL SWING OUT OF THE CENTRAL 
ROCKIES ONTO THE GREAT PLAINS AND TOWARD TENNESSEE VALLEY...PUSHING 
A COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION AND BRINGING THE AREA A FAIRLY DECENT 
SHOT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY 
SATURDAY MORNING. HOWEVER...THERE CONTINUES TO BE SOME SIGNIFICANT 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE MODELS REGARDING THE TIMING AND TRACK OF THIS 
SYSTEM. THE GFS AND ECMWF FAVOR A FASTER MOVING AND MORE NORTHERLY 
TRACK OF THE LOW...WHILE THE CMC CONTINUES TO INDICATE A SLOWER AND 
MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK /ALONG WITH A MORE INTENSE SYSTEM/ PROPAGATING 
THROUGH THE RED RIVER VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY. SHOULD THE CMC SOLUTION VERIFY...COOLER CONDITIONS AND 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL LINGER THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER... 
GIVEN A BETTER CONSENSUS BETWEEN THE GFS/ECMWF/SREF...HAVE OPTED 
TO LEAN TOWARD A BLEND OF THESE SOLUTIONS. HAVE MAINTAINED THE SAME 
TREND OF SHOWING INCREASING POPS DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH THE GREATEST CHANCES BEING ON FRIDAY...BEFORE 
THEY TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST FRIDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY SATURDAY 
MORNING. IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM...A WARM UP CAN BE EXPECTED AS HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL NUDGE BACK INTO THE REGION BY THE LATE WEEKEND... 
PUSHING HIGHS BACK INTO THE MID 80S TO AROUND 90 DEGREES TO BEGIN 
THE NEW WEEK. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             90  66  92  63  88 /  50  20  10  10  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  64  90  61  87 /  60  30  10  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       87  63  90  62  87 /  60  30  10  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              85  58  86  55  86 /  60  50  10  10  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
133 AM EDT TUE MAY 29 2012

.AVIATION...SE FLOW FROM 850 TO 700 MBS ASSOCIATED WITH TROPICAL 
DEPRESSION BERYL IS SPREADING SPOTTY SHOWERS ACROSS WRN NC...BUT NOT 
VERY LIKELY THAT THESE SHOWERS AFFECT ANY SITE OTHER THAN TRI AT 
THIS TIME. SHOWERS ARE QUITE WEAK AND LOOK TO DISSIPATE...BUT A LOW 
CLOUD DECK AROUND 1500 FEET COULD SPILL OVER INTO NE TN BEFORE 
DAYBREAK.

CONDITIONS BECOME MORE FAVORABLE FOR CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION FROM 
LATE MORNING THROUGH AT LEAST THE EARLY EVENING HOURS TODAY. 
THUS...WILL CARRY A 30 PRECENT PROBABILITY FOR -TSRA AT EACH TAF 
SITE DURING AT LEAST THE AFTERNOON HOURS...AND LET LATER SHIFTS 
BETTER DEFINE AND TIME ACTUAL SHOWERS/TSRA THAT DO OCCUR.

653 
FXUS64 KMRX 281910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON MAY 28 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MOISTURE INCREASING TONIGHT AS 
THE REMNANTS OF TS BERYL TRACKS TO SOUTH OF THE CWA SO WILL CONTINUE 
THE LOW CHANCES FOR TONIGHT. HIGHER CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION 
ARRIVES ON TUESDAY AS A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION. WITH AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER...COOLER WEATHER IS EXPECTED. GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURE SIMILAR SO STAYED CLOSE.  



.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT EARLY ON...BUT DIVERGE QUITE A BIT BY THE LATTER PERIODS.  
SOME DRYING FORECAST TO OCCUR TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS LOOK TOO DRY FOR CONVECTION WED AFTERNOON...SO AFTER 
CHANCE POPS NORTHEAST TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUE NIGHT...WILL GO DRY 
WED AND WED NIGHT.  BY THURSDAY NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING.  
UPPER TROUGH WILL BE DIGGING TO OUR WEST AND THEN WILL SHIFT 
EAST...WITH SURFACE LOW PRESSURE TRACKING BY TO OUR NORTHWEST 
DRAGGING A COLD FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA.  MODELS DISAGREE ON 
TIMING/DEPTH OF THIS SYSTEM...WITH THE CMC DEEPER WITH THE UPPER 
TROUGH AND SLOWER...AND THE 00Z ECMWF SHALLOWER/QUICKER.  THE GFS IS 
IN BETWEEN...AND FOR NOW WILL LEAN TOWARD A SOLUTION CLOSER TO A 
GFS/ECMWF BLEND.  WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS THU NIGHT/FRIDAY...WITH 
JUST SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH AND CENTRAL BY SATURDAY.  WILL GO DRY 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE EXPECTED TO TAKE CONTROL.  
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS NEAR AVERAGE EARLY ON IN THE PERIOD...BUT 
BELOW AVERAGE AFTER FRIDAY.

324 
FXUS64 KMRX 281359
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
959 AM EDT MON MAY 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. NOT EXPECTING MUCH 
PRECIPITATION WITH A FAIRLY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE TODAY. BUT NOT 
CONFIDANT ABOUT THE COVERAGE FOR THIS AFTERNOON TO REMOVE 
PRECIPITATION...SO WILL GO WITH CONTINUITY AND LEAVE THE CURRENT 
RAIN CHANCES AS IS FOR TODAY. NEAR RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REGION STILL UNDER THE INFLUENCE 
OF THE STRONG UPPER RIDGE...WITH T.S. BERYL WEAKENING SOME AS IT 
MOVES ACROSS NRN FL AND SE GA. I GENERALLY FOUND THE NAM/GFS/SREF 
ALL TOO WET FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AS I DON'T THINK THAT 
THE AIR MASS OVER THE SRN APPALACHIANS WILL CHANGE MUCH FROM 
YESTERDAY. ECMWF OFFERS A DRIER LOOK AND FITS WELL WITH OFFICIAL 
TRACK OF T.S. BERYL...SO I PREFER TO TREND MUCH CLOSER TO ECMWF FOR 
THE SHORT TERM. I DID KEEP CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS...HAVING 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE BOARD FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT.
HOWEVER...I EXPECT OVERALL ANY TSRA COVERAGE TO BE 10 PERCENT OR SO
...EXCEPT FOR PERHAPS SW NC (WHERE POPS WHERE NUDGED UP TO VERY LOW 
CHANCE). 

A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER SHOULD KEEP MAX TEMPS JUST A TAD 
BELOW RECORDS FOR TODAY...CHA - 95...TYS - 94 AND TRI - 92. KEEPING 
THOSE LOW POPS FOR TONIGHT WITH VERY MILD TEMPS IN THE 60S TO LOWER 
70S. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MOISTURE INCREASE TUESDAY
WITH TS OR TD BERYL HAS MOVED NORTH INTO GA AND SC WITH DEEPEST
MOISTURE ALONG THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN CREST EASTWARD. ALSO A COLD
FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH THAT WILL BE APPROACHING THE OHIO VALLEY
WILL BE THE FOCUS FOR MORE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY AND
MORE CLOUDS. KEPT LIKELY POPS OVER NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE
REGION AND HIGH CHANCE SOUTH. TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES COOLER
THAN TODAY BUT STILL ABOVE NORMAL. MODELS SHOW BEST COVERAGE OF
CONVECTION NORTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY THEN
SHIFTING TO THE NE IN VA AND NC TUESDAY EVENING. BERYL WILL GET
CAUGHT UP WITH THE TROUGH AND LIFTED NE THROUGH THE CAROLINAS
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. SHOWERS END TUESDAY NIGHT AND SKIES
CLEAR WEDNESDAY.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT THE COLD FRONT WILL BECOME STATIONARY ALONG THE TN
AND GA BORDER. CLOUDS INCREASE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS A
NEW LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS. THE SURFACE LOW THEN GETS WOUND
UP AND TRIES TO BECOME CLOSED OFF BY FRIDAY AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS
SOUTH ACROSS THE PLAINS. SHOWERS BECOME LIKELY AGAIN THURSDAY NIGHT
AND FRIDAY AS STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE TN AND OH
VALLEYS. MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL BEHIND THIS SECOND
FRONT FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MODELS CLOSE OFF TROUGH TO AN
UPPER LOW FRIDAY MORNING OVER THE UPPER MS VALLEY AND MOVE IT
SLOWLY EAST INTO THE NORTHEAST BY LATE SUNDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BEHIND
DEEP TROUGH WILL BRING SUNNY SKIES BACK TO THE REGION LATER
SATURDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH SUNDAY. LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE
COMFORTABLE 50S BOTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHTS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             91  68  89  65  90 /  20  20  50  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  67  86  65  88 /  20  20  60  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       90  67  87  64  88 /  20  20  60  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              90  62  84  60  85 /  20  20  60  50  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

.AVIATION...ANOTHER NIGHT WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND SOME PATCHY

AIRMASS REALLY HAS NOT CHANGED MUCH...VERY WARM WITH A TYPICAL 
AMOUNT OF MOISTURE FOR THE SUMMERLIKE PATTERN. THUS...MOST MODELS 
PROBABLY OVERDOING THE CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. I WOULD EXPECT ONLY ABOUT 10 PERCENT COVERAGE OF WEAK TSRA
SO WON'T HIGHLIGHT ANYTHING IN TAFS FOR NOW. 

THIS WILL CHANGE BY TUESDAY MORNING...BUT WELL AFTER 12Z TUESDAY... 
SO KEEPING VFR CONDITIONS IS BEST BET FOR NOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 271925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SUN MAY 27 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE AREA BEGINS TO WEAKEN AND PULL EAST ON MONDAY. T.S. BERYL 
MOVES WEST INTO NE FL TONIGHT AND BEGINS TO WEAKEN MONDAY INLAND 
OVER S GA. UPPER DEFORMATION ZONE SETS UP OVER AREA MONDAY AFTERNOON 
AS UPPER RIDGE SPLITS WITH INFLUENCE OF BERYL NUDGING NW WHILE UPPER 
TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE NW. AIRMASS REMAINS RELATIVELY DRY BUT 
ISOLATED AFTN CONVECTION HAS A SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCE THAN RECENT 
DAYS. JET CORE IN NORTHERN TROUGH MOVES INTO THE OH VALLEY ON 
TUESDAY WITH INCREASED WESTERLY STEERING FLOW ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. 
THIS WILL ALLOW FOR ONGOING PREFRONTAL CONVECTION TO MARCH INTO THE 
AREA MUCH OF TUESDAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY NIGHT. WARM TEMPERATURES CONTINUE THROUGH 
THE PERIOD THOUGH NOT AS WARM AS THE WEEKEND AFTERNOONS. DEW POINTS 
WILL RISE IN ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING FRONT.


.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FRONT LINGERS OVER THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY. WITH AN AMPLE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL 
CONTINUE THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE REGION IN THE THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY TIME FRAME...SO WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. THE FRONT MAY LINGER INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING...SO KEEP LOW CHANCES OF SHOWERS FOR SATURDAY. HIGH 
PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...27/00Z NAM MODEL APPEARS TO BE 
OVERDOING MOISTURE AND DEVELOPING TOO MUCH CONVECTION TODAY. 00Z 
UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW THE RIDGING VERY PERSISTENT...WHILE WATER VAPOR 
SATELLITE PICS SHOW A DRY AIR MASS OVER THE SRN APPALACHIANS AND 
MOST OF THE GULF COAST STATES. THUS...I FAVOR THE MUCH LOWER GFS MOS 
POPS WITH ONLY TSRA CHANCES (SLIM) ALONG THE ERN MOST MTNS...WHERE 
JUST ENOUGH WEAK CONVERGENCE COULD OVERCOME THE CAPPING WARM AIR 
ALOFT. HOWEVER...ANY CONVECTION WOULD BE WEAK AND SHORT-LIVED...SO I 
CHOSE TO DROP POPS FOR THIS EVENING (WHICH ALSO MESHES QUITE WELL 
WITH NEIGHBORING NWS GRIDS). 

OTHERWISE...EXPECT HIGHS TODAY VERY CLOSE TO OR JUST A DEGREE OR SO 
ABOVE SATURDAY'S MAX TEMPS...WHICH WILL BE NEAR RECORD HIGHS ACROSS 
THE BOARD...(CHA - 95...TYS - 94 AND TRI - 89). STILL FAVORING THE
SLIGHTLY COOLER MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT DUE TO DRYNESS OF AIR MASS...
SOIL AND BOUNDARY LAYER. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL START 
OUT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY MONDAY AS WEAKENING TROPICAL 
SYSTEM SPINS OVER NORTH FL AND SOUTHERN GA. LOW PRESSURE ALONG THE 
CANADA AND US BORDER WITH COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS VALLEY WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST MONDAY. MOISTURE FROM THIS SYTEM APPROACHES 
THE OHIO VALLEY BY MONDAY EVENING. SOME MOISTURE FROM TROPICAL 
SYSTEM MAY MOVE INTO EXTREME SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA 
BY 00Z TUESDAY BUT MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL ENCOUNTER ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DUE TO DAYTIME HEATING. WILL CONTINUE 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS. TEMPERATURES LOWER A COUPLE 
DEGREES FROM TODAY BUT STILL NEAR 90. MONDAY NIGHT KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS OVERNIGHT AS COOL FRONT APPROACHES AND TROPICAL MOISTURE 
INCREASES FROM THE SOUTH AND EAST. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY AHEAD OF FRONT AND LEFTOVERS OF EXITING 
TROPICAL SYSTEM AND MAINLY NE HALF WITH LIKELY POPS THERE CHANCE 
ELSEWHERE. FRONT MOVING FASTER THAN EARLIER MODEL RUNS WITH SHOWERS 
POSSIBLY OUT BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. REST OF WEDNESDAY LOOKS DRIER SO 
REMOVED POPS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY AND COOLER WITH LOWS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS IN THE 50S. THURSDAY UPPER TROUGH DIGS FARTHER SOUTH OVER 
THE EASTERN STATES AND NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM BRINGS RENEWED SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM CHANCES OVER THE REGION. GOOD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY AS THE NEW SYSTEM MOVES SLOWLY EAST. EVEN 
DEEPER TROUGH SETTLES OVER FORECAST AREA SATURDAY. IMPROVING 
CONDITIONS SATURDAY AND EVEN LOWER TEMPERATURES THEN FRIDAY. HIGHS 
ONLY IN THE 60S MOUNTAINS AND NE AND 70S CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
SECTIONS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             94  68  91  68  89 /  10  10  20  20  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  92  66  89  67  87 /  10  10  20  20  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       93  66  90  67  87 /  10  10  20  20  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              91  59  89  62  85 /  10  10  20  20  60

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SAT MAY 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE TO 
CURRENT FORECAST. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AND UPPER RIDGING OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY REMAIN IN 
PLACE OVERNIGHT. THESE FEATURES WEAKEN AS TROPICAL STORM BERYL MOVES 
SOUTHWEST TO THE N FL/S GA BORDER THROUGH THE PERIOD. SOME PATCHY 
LATE NIGHT FOG AND HAZE TONIGHT. THICKNESS VALUES LOWER SLIGHTLY 
SUNDAY BUT WIDESPREAD 90S CAN BE EXPECTED. AREA REMAINS RELATIVELY 
DRY WITH HIGHER MOISTURE SE AND W ALONG PERIPHERY OF LOW LEVEL 
RIDGE. ISOLATED...MAINLY AFTERNOON CONVECTION REMAINS POSSIBLE 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH INCREASED EASTERLY LOW TO MID 
LEVEL FLOW. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE AROUND 10 DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA 
ON TUESDAY AND LINGERS INTO WEDNESDAY. WITH AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
AND LIFT PROVIDING A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER 
THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE REGION 
IN THE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TIME FRAME...SO WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. THE FRONT 
SHOULD LINGER INTO SATURDAY MORNING...SO WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM FOR SATURDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

322 
FXUS64 KMRX 261500
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SAT MAY 26 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. CURRENT TEMPERATURES RUNNING A 
COUPLE DEGREES AHEAD OF NORMAL DIURNAL CURVE. FORECAST MAX 
TEMPERATURES AT OR NEAR RECORD VALUES SO NO NEED TO BUMP HIGHER. 
ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE ACROSS SW VA/NE TN AND SMOKIES. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG RIDGING ACROSS THE REGION 
AGAIN WILL PROVIDE ANOTHER MOSTLY DRY AND HOT DAY. A FEW DEGREES 
WARMER EACH DAY HAS BEEN THE TREND OF LATE...AND ALLOWING FOR THIS 
SHOULD LET RECORD HIGHS BE IN JEOPARDY...(CHA/TYS - 94...TRI - 89 
AND OQT - 88).

AIRMASS BECOMES UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON WITH MAX TEMPS REACHING 80S 
TO MID 90S...BUT FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A SIGNIFICANT CAPPING 
INVERSION PLUS EXTREMELY WEAK WINDS ALOFT. THUS...I OPTED TO TRIM 
POPS BACK AND MAINLY LIMIT TO HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA AND NE TN DOWN 
TO THE SMOKIES. THIS MESHES GENERALLY WELL WITH NEIGHBORING NWS 
OFFICES TO OUR EAST...BUT I WILL KEEP THE EVENING GRIDS DRY FOR NOW 
AND LET DAY SHIFT MONITOR TO SEE IF CONVECTION CAN DEVELOP AT ALL.

MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT AND THE DRY AIRMASS HAS BEEN FAVORING THE 
COOLER MOS MINS...SO LOWS WERE KEPT NEAR THE COOLER GFS MOS.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST STATES SHOULD STAY IN CONTROL ONE MORE DAY EVEN AS 
TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVES SLOWLY SE TOWARD THE GA AND FL COASTS. AIR 
MASS BECOMES MODERATELY UNSTABLE BUT STILL MIGHT BE CAPPED. ANOTHER 
VERY WARM DAY IS FORECAST WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR 90 TO THE LOWER 
90S. NOT MUCH CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN SUNDAY NIGHT MOISTURE 
INCREASES AS TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO FL AND GA. INCLUDED SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT. 
MONDAY THERE SHOULD BE INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND NOT QUITE AS 
UNSTABLE HOWEVER SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD DEVELOP AT ANY 
TIME. TUESDAY COLD FRONT APPROACHES. AIR MASS BECOMES MORE UNSTABLE 
WITH INCREASED SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY. THERE WILL BE 
INCREASED MOISTURE FROM THE TROPICAL SYSTEM THAT IS TO THE SOUTH OF 
THE REGION TOO. SOME STORMS COULD BE STRONG. SCATTERED SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS THE FRONT 
MOVES SLOWLY ACROSS THE REGION. WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY THERE 
COULD BE A BRIEF DRY PERIOD BEFORE A SECONDARY SYSTEM SPREADS MORE 
RAIN INTO THE TN VALLEY LATE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. UPPER TROUGH WILL 
DIG SOUTH OVER THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY 
ABOVE NORMAL MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AND THEN COOL SOME THURSDAY 
AND MUCH COOLER FRIDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             94  67  93  69  91 /  10  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  91  66  92  67  89 /  10  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       90  65  93  67  90 /  10  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              89  60  89  61  88 /  10  10  10  10  20

653 
FXUS64 KMRX 251931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT FRI MAY 25 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...UPPER RIDGING EXTENDS 
FROM THE LOWER MS RVR VLY THROUGH THE TN VLY AND INTO THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS. THIS FEATURE WILL CHANGE SLIGHTLY THROUGH THE PERIOD 
BECOMING STRONGER OVER THE CNTRL APPS. LAYER THICKNESS VALUES 
CONTINUE TO RISE ON SATURDAY WITH H85 TEMPS APPROACHING 20C. NEAR 
RECORD HIGHS FOR SAT. A WEAK SHORT WAVE OVER IL WILL CONTINUE EAST 
THIS EVENING. LAYER RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AFTN MOUNTAIN CONVECTION 
WILL RISE SOME ON SAT AS THE MOISTURE FROM THIS FEATURE RISE OVER 
AND THEN DOWN EAST SIDE OF RIDGE. DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE ATLANTIC IS PROGGED TO MOVE SW TO NEAR NE FL/SE GA COAST BY 
SUN MORNING. THIS WILL INCREASE THE LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND 
MOISTURE ADVECTION ACROSS THE CAROLINAS AND BRING A CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION ACROSS EASTERN AREAS FOR SUNDAY AFTN. THICKNESS VALUES 
LOWER SLIGHTLY ON SUNDAY AND WITH SOME CLOUD COVER...NOT AS 
CONFIDENT WITH VERY WARM HIGHS WHICH WILL APPROACH RECORDS.   


.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A SUMMER PATTERN CONTINUES INTO 
MONDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST FOR THE  
HIGHER TERRAIN. A FRONT TRACKS INTO THE AREA FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY WITH AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND LIFT PROVIDING A BETTER 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE REGION IN THE THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY TIME FRAME...SO WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPERATURES.

986 
FXUS64 KMRX 251515
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1115 AM EDT FRI MAY 25 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOG SEEMS TO BE LESS PREVALENT 
THAN 24 HOURS AGO AND WAS YET TO FORM AT CHA OR TYS AT FORECAST 
TIME. 25/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS AND SATELLITE PICS SHOW UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDING EAST THIS MORNING. INCREASING HEIGHTS AND 850 MB TEMPS 
TODAY SUPPORT MAX TEMPS ABOUT 4 TO 6 DEGREES ABOVE THURSDAY HIGHS. 
THESE HIGHS SHOULD BE QUITE CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND AND AT LEAST A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR MAY 25TH.

NOT MUCH CHANGE IN PATTERN ALOFT OR SURFACE FOR TONIGHT...WITH 
RIDGING KEEPING FORECAST DRY AND QUITE MILD. MOS BLEND LOOKED RIGHT 
IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID...SO VERY LITTLE CHANGES MADE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE LIES
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND BUT THE FLOW AROUND THE RIDGE
WILL INCREASE MOISTURE OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND NE SECTIONS
TRIGGERING MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. HIGHS WILL REACH THE LOWER TO MID 90S NEAR RECORDS WITH
LOWS IN THE 60S. SUNDAY TROPICAL SYSTEM OFF THE SE COAST EXPECTED
TO MOVE WEST INTO GEORGIA. THERE SHOULD BE SOME INCREASE IN CLOUDS
WHICH WILL LOWER HIGHS A FEW DEGREES. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AGAIN POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MONDAY WILL BE SIMILAR TO
SUNDAY WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES BUT COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ACROSS THE WHOLE REGION DUE TO MORE MOISTURE
FROM THE TROPICAL SYSTEM. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY A COLD FRONT MOVES
ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. AS TROUGHING MOVES INTO THE EASTERN STATES AT MID
WEEK ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE MID MS VALLEY AND FRONT
WILL APPROACH. TEMPERATURES WILL BE THE COOLEST OF THE WEEK UPPER
70S TO MID 80S. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             92  65  94  68  92 /   0  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  64  93  67  91 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       91  64  93  67  92 /  10   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              88  58  91  60  88 /  10   0  10  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

MASS (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH MOSTLY

DRIER AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO LAST NIGHT...THINK 
THAT THIS FOG SHOULD BE PATCHY IN NATURE AND NOT AS WIDESPREAD AS 
LAST NIGHT.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO MENTION PATCHY FOG 
DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO 
THE LATEST TRENDS.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST 
FOR THE AFTERNOON/EVENING STORMS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. A FRONT 
TRACKS INTO THE AREA FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH AN INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE AND LIFT PROVIDING A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE AREA. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE AREA 
CONTINUING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 241411
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EDT THU MAY 24 2012

.DISCUSSION...UPDATE TO REMOVE MORNING FOG. INCREASED AFTERNOON POPS 
ACROSS NE AREAS BY 10%. TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS ON TRACK. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE TO PULL 
AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY.  COULD SEE A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY OVER FAR 
NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS.  OTHERWISE...WILL TRANSITION INTO A 
RELATIVELY DRY AND HOT WEATHER PATTERN.  

LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL BE THE MAIN 
THEME FOR THE EXTENDED BETWEEN FRIDAY AND MONDAY. HOT AFTERNOONS 
WILL BE THE MAIN STORY WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S COMMON PLACE. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS ARE MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH ONLY A WEAK CAP...SO 
STILL EXPECT ISOLATED-WIDELY SCATTERED AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
CONVECTION OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS EACH DAY. THE VALLEY SHOULD 
STAY GENERALLY DRY.

FOR TUESDAY...UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN ALLOWING A COLD FRONT TO MOVE 
INTO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING. WILL UP POPS TO 
CHANCE AREA-WIDE WITH STILL HIGHER POPS OVER THE TERRAIN. 

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS TEMPERATURES/POPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EDT WED MAY 23 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE 
CAROLINAS...WITH A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
RADARS REVEAL THAT MOST OF THE EARLIER CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY HAS 
DIMINISHED...WITH NOT MUCH REDEVELOPMENT EXPECTED OVERNIGHT AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE CAROLINAS GRADUALLY WEAKENS. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS QUITE A BIT OF CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS EVENING...BUT THINK THESE CLOUDS SHOULD DIMINISH OVERNIGHT 
ALLOWING FOR SOME PATCHY FOG TO DEVELOP AFTER MIDNIGHT. TEMPS SHOULD 
FALL CLOSE TO THE CURRENT DEWPOINTS BY SUNRISE...SINCE NO DRY AIR 
ADVECTION IS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF 
PRECIP...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

679 
FXUS64 KMRX 231908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT WED MAY 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER SW NC WILL 
WEAKEN TONIGHT AND MOVE NORTHEAST ON THURSDAY. SCATTERED 
CONVECTION...AIDED BY AFTERNOON HEATING WILL CONTINUE THIS EVENING 
...MAINLY OVER NE AREAS. ISOLATED SHOWER ACTIVITY POSSIBLE 
OVERNIGHT. LESS CLOUD COVER EXPECTED OVERNIGHT ALLOWING FOR BETTER 
CHANCE OF LATE NIGHT STRATUS AND FOG FORMATION. PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES CONTINUE THURSDAY OVER NE AREAS NORTH OF UPPER TROUGH AXIS. 
MID LEVELS WILL BE DRIER OF WEST SIDE OF DEPARTING TROUGH FOR SW 
AREAS. LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES INCREASINGLY SOUTHWESTERLY EARLY 
THURSDAY WILL ONSET OF RISING THICKNESS VALUES. NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPERATURE TONIGHT WITH ABOVE NORMAL READING AND MORE SUNSHINE 
THURSDAY. 

.LONG TERM...
THE UPPER-LEVEL LOW THAT HAS CONTROLLED THE WEATHER ACROSS THE 
REGION FOR THE BETTER PART OF THE WORK WEEK WILL FINALLY MOVE WELL 
INTO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY REGION BY 00Z FRIDAY. IN ITS WAKE...A 
STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL PUSH EASTWARD THROUGH 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. WITH INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES AND MODELS 
INDICATING 850 MB TEMPERATURES INCREASING TO AROUND 20-21C BY 
SUNDAY...SOME NEAR RECORD TO RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
POSSIBLE THIS WEEKEND /PARTICULARLY ACROSS NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA 
WHERE THE RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED BY SUNDAY/. TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
WARM TO THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S BY FRIDAY AND INTO THE LOW TO MID 
90S BY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. AS THE CENTER OF THE HIGH MOVES OFF TO 
THE EAST ON MEMORIAL DAY...A GENERAL COOLING TREND WILL BEGIN 
HEADING INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK. SOME LATE AFTERNOON OROGRAPHICALLY 
INDUCED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE THIS 
WEEKEND...GIVEN SOME OF THE MOISTURE THAT WILL STILL BE PRESENT 
UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE. 

THE OTHER PLAYER IN THE WEATHER LATE THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK MAY BE A TROPICAL LOW THAT HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE GULF STREAM 
OFF OF THE COAST OF SOUTH CAROLINA/GEORGIA. THE LAST COUPLE OF RUNS 
OF THE NAM HAVE SHOWN THIS LOW DEEPENING AND APPROACHING THE 
GEORGIA COASTLINE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THE PREVIOUS RUN OF 
THE GFS ALSO SUPPORTED THIS SOLUTION...BEFORE BACKING OFF IN ITS 
CURRENT RUN. SHOULD THIS OCCUR...ADDITIONAL MOISTURE WOULD BEGIN TO 
INFILTRATE THE REGION LATE THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...INCREASING THE POTENTIAL FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS /PARTICULARLY 
ON A TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME WHEN A FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
PUSH THROUGH THE REGION/. FOR NOW...FEEL THAT AT LEAST LOW END 
CHANCE POPS IS WARRANTED FOR THIS TIME PERIOD...WITH THE HIGHEST 
VALUES FAVORING THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS.   

.CLIMATE...

DAILY RECORD HIGHS MAY 25TH THROUGH MAY 28TH:

...CHATTANOOGA...
MAY 25TH: 95 DEGREES /1953/
MAY 26TH: 94 DEGREES /1962/
MAY 27TH: 95 DEGREES /1911/
MAY 28TH: 95 DEGREES /1962/

...KNOXVILLE...
MAY 25TH: 93 DEGREES /2011/
MAY 26TH: 94 DEGREES /1926/

FXUS64 KMRX 231404
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT WED MAY 23 2012

.DISCUSSION...MINOR CHANGES WITH MORNING UPDATE. LOWERED 
TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS. RAISED POPS 
ACROSS NE AREAS WHERE LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE LOOKS FAVORABLE FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM  (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY LIFT 
NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE CAROLINAS TODAY.  ROTATION AROUND THIS LOW 
WILL CARRY IS ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION INTO THE MRX CWA 
DURING THE SHORT TERM.  MORNING ACTIVITY SHOULD BE SHOWERS AND 
REMAIN GENERALLY OVER NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS.  AS THE AIR 
MASS BECOMES WEAKLY UNSTABLE DURING THE AFTERNOON...A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE AREA.  CLOUD COVER WILL HELP 
KEEP TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL FOR TODAY.  THE LOW WILL SLOWLY BEGIN 
TO PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION OVERNIGHT WITH ANY LINGERING CONVECTION 
ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW AND ASSOCIATED 
MOISTURE WILL BE LOCATED ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THURSDAY 
KEEPING A CHANCE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS GOING 
FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. DRY ELSEWHERE.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...UPPER RIDGING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AND SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL PRODUCE A VERY 
WARM/HOT PERIOD OVER THE AREA WITH LIMITED CHANCES OF CONVECTION. 
HOWEVER...FORECAST SOUNDINGS DO SHOW ENOUGH MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY
TO KEEP CHANCES OF AFTERNOON/EVENING STORMS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
BEGINNING SATURDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. SOME OF 
THESE THUNDERSTORMS COULD MOVE INTO THE VALLEY DURING THE EARLY 
EVENING HOURS. MAIN STORY AGAIN WILL BE THE SUMMER-LIKE HEAT WITH 
HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S.

FOR TUESDAY...UPPER RIDGING WEAKENS ALLOWING A FRONT TO APPROACH THE 
AREA. DUE TO WEAKENING RIDGE...WILL INCLUDE CHANCE POPS AREA-WIDE.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS CLOSELY THROUGH THE PERIOD.

&&

.DISCUSSION...00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS AND LATEST WATER VAPOR SATELLITE

ALSO LOWER POPS TO CHANCE ACROSS THE BOARD...ALTHO I WILL KEEP AN 
AREAL QUALIFIER OF SCATTERED OVER EASTERN 2/3RDS OF THE AREA...AS
UPPER LOW/VORT MAX CONTINUES TO TRACK NE OVERNIGHT.

DON'T PLAN TO ADD ANY FOG AT THIS POINT...DUE TO CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS 
OVERNIGHT. FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS WILL BE UPDATED BY 1030 PM TO
