523 
FXUS64 KMRX 222344
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
743 PM EDT TUE MAY 22 2012

.AVIATION...CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER WITH AT LEAST 
SCATTERED COVERAGE THROUGH MIDNIGHT...AS AN UPPER LOW/VORT MAX MOVES 
NE FROM SRN GA. LIGHTNING STRIKES HAVE BEEN DIMINISHING SO LIMITED 
TO CB/VCTS FOR JUST CHA AND TRI FOR NOW. 

PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN LIGHT SO FAR FOR TAF SITES...SO 
CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS SHOULD INHIBIT DENSE FOG FROM DEVELOPING. 
CONVECTION WILL LIKELY DEVELOP AGAIN IN THE HEAT OF THE AFTERNOON 
ON WEDNESDAY...BUT IT SEEMS PREMATURE TO TRY TO PIN DOWN EXACTLY 
WHERE. THUS...I WENT FOR VFR CONDITIONS AND JUST VCSH. 

PREVIOUS AFD...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
CONVECTION VERY SLOW TO MOVE THIS AFTERNOON AS WEAK TROUGH HANGS
OVER AREA. MUCH OF THE ENERGY FOR THE TROUGH HAS HEADED SOUTH WITH
VORT MAX/PSBL UPPER LOW THAT'S ABOUT TO CROSS INTO SW GA.
PERSISTENT RAINS OVER CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ARE MAINLY FROM DIURNAL
HEATING AND SHOULD DISSIPATE THIS EVENING. LIKEWISE MUCH OF THE
SHOWERS AND STORMS OVER THE AREA NOW WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE THIS
EVENING. BEST CHANCES OVERNIGHT WILL BE IN THE EAST AND NORTHEAST
WHERE UPPER LEVEL DIFLUENCE KEEPS SOME SLOW LIFT GOING THROUGH THE
NIGHT. KEEPING QPF VALUES FAIRLY LIGHT...CONSIDERING SOME OF THE
FLOW IS HAVING TO CROSS MOUNTAIN RIDGES TO GET INTO THE AREA.

FOR WEDNESDAY...THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS SHOULD BE EAST OF THE 
AREA...BUT A SPOKE OR TWO OF LIFT MAY SWEEP THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN 
AREAS...MAKING FOR BETTER PRECIP CHANCES.

FOR TEMPS...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...BUT SLIGHTLY COOLER FOR MAX 
TEMPS WED IN NORTHEAST DUE TO THICKER CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD CONTINUE TO BE 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WEDNESDAY EVENING INTO THURSDAY FROM A 
DEPARTING UPPER-LOW AND THE UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES EXPECTED 
FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND.

AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS REGION AS MODELS STILL ARE SHOWING IT CENTERED OVER 
WEST CENTRAL NORTH CAROLINA BY 00Z ON THURSDAY. THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL PERSIST INTO THE EVENING 
HOURS WEDNESDAY AS SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE INFILTRATES THE EASTERN 
ZONES ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW. ON THURSDAY...PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES WILL BE LESSENED AS THIS STORM SYSTEM BEGINS TO TRACK INTO 
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. HOWEVER...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LINGERING 
ACTIVITY ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES WILL EXIST DURING THE 
MORNING...ALONG WITH SOME OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED CONVECTION ALONG 
THE MOUNTAINS DURING THE AFTERNOON.

IN THE WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM...A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS WEEKEND. WITH 
INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES AND 850 MB TEMPERATURES PROGGED TO WARM 
5-6C TO AROUND 20-21C BY SATURDAY/SUNDAY...SOME NEAR RECORD TO 
PERHAPS RECORD HIGHS WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND. BY 
FRIDAY...HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S WILL BE COMMON ACROSS MOST OF THE 
AREA...AND THIS WEEKEND THE MERCURY COULD APPROACH THE MID 90S IN 
SOME LOCATIONS. BY MEMORIAL DAY...THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE WILL SHIFT 
EAST OF THE AREA...BUT WARM TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 80S TO AROUND 
90 DEGREES ARE STILL EXPECTED TO CLOSE OUT THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND. SOME 
INCREASED PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND SOME COOLER TEMPERATURES MAY BE 
ON THE HORIZON HEADING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM 
SYSTEM BEGIN TO TRACK TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY.

.CLIMATE...
DAILY RECORD HIGHS MAY 25TH THROUGH MAY 28TH:

...CHATTANOOGA...
MAY 25TH: 95 DEGREES /1953/
MAY 26TH: 94 DEGREES /1962/
MAY 27TH: 95 DEGREES /1911/
MAY 28TH: 95 DEGREES /1962/

...KNOXVILLE...
MAY 25TH: 93 DEGREES /2011/
MAY 26TH: 94 DEGREES /1926/
MAY 27TH: 94 DEGREES /1941/
MAY 28TH: 94 DEGREES /1914/

...TRI CITIES...
MAY 25TH: 90 DEGREES /1953/
MAY 26TH: 89 DEGREES /1991/
MAY 27TH: 89 DEGREES /1941/
MAY 28TH: 92 DEGREES /1941/

AREAS...MAKING FOR BETTER PRECIP CHANCES.

FOR TEMPS...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE...BUT SLIGHTLY COOLER FOR MAX 
TEMPS WED IN NORTHEAST DUE TO THICKER CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD CONTINUE TO BE 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WEDNESDAY EVENING INTO THURSDAY FROM A 
DEPARTING UPPER-LOW AND THE UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES EXPECTED 
FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND.

AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS REGION AS MODELS STILL ARE SHOWING IT CENTERED OVER 
WEST CENTRAL NORTH CAROLINA BY 00Z ON THURSDAY. THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL PERSIST INTO THE EVENING 
HOURS WEDNESDAY AS SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE INFILTRATES THE EASTERN 
ZONES ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW. ON THURSDAY...PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES WILL BE LESSENED AS THIS STORM SYSTEM BEGINS TO TRACK INTO 
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. HOWEVER...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LINGERING 
ACTIVITY ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES WILL EXIST DURING THE 
MORNING...ALONG WITH SOME OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED CONVECTION ALONG 
THE MOUNTAINS DURING THE AFTERNOON.

IN THE WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM...A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS WEEKEND. WITH 
INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES AND 850 MB TEMPERATURES PROGGED TO WARM 
5-6C TO AROUND 20-21C BY SATURDAY/SUNDAY...SOME NEAR RECORD TO 
PERHAPS RECORD HIGHS WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND. BY 
FRIDAY...HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S WILL BE COMMON ACROSS MOST OF THE 
AREA...AND THIS WEEKEND THE MERCURY COULD APPROACH THE MID 90S IN 
SOME LOCATIONS. BY MEMORIAL DAY...THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE WILL SHIFT 
EAST OF THE AREA...BUT WARM TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 80S TO AROUND 
90 DEGREES ARE STILL EXPECTED TO CLOSE OUT THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND. SOME 
INCREASED PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND SOME COOLER TEMPERATURES MAY BE 
ON THE HORIZON HEADING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM 
SYSTEM BEGIN TO TRACK TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY.

.CLIMATE...

...CHATTANOOGA...

MAY 26TH: 94 DEGREES /1962/
MAY 27TH: 95 DEGREES /1911/

191 
FXUS64 KMRX 221511
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1111 AM EDT TUE MAY 22 2012

.DISCUSSION...
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS VERY STRONG VORT MAX IF NOT UPPER LOW
HEADED INTO CENTRAL AL...AND IS STILL DIGGING TO SE...THAT SEEMS TO
BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE ON WV LOOP. IF THIS FEATURE IS TAKING
/CONTROL/ THEN PREVIOUS MODELS HAD EVERYTHING FOCUSED TOO FAR
NORTH. HAVE RAISED POPS IN THE SOUTHERN AREAS TO LIKELY AS WELL AND
HAVE BUMPED UP THE QPF IN THAT AREA. FOR WEATHER GRID...HAVE
SHOWERS AS MAIN FEATURE THIS AFTERNOON WITH CHANCE OF THUNDER SOUTH
AND ISOLATED THUNDER NORTH.

ALTHOUGH WE ARE SURROUNDED BY FLOOD WATCHES IN OUR FAR NORTHERN
AREAS...NOT REALLY CONSIDERING FLOOD WATCH RIGHT NOW...PARTLY DUE
TO THE POSSIBILITY THAT THE FOCUS MAY BE FARTHER SOUTH...BUT ALSO
BECAUSE OUR AREAS DID NOT SEE THE HEAVY RAINS THAT THE SURROUNDING
AREAS DID...MOSTLY LESS THAN 0.10 INCH...EXCEPT FOR WESTERN LEE
COUNTY VA WHERE ISOLATED 1.5"+ AMOUNTS FELL YESTERDAY.

SURFACE FRONT HARD TO LOCATE IN PRESSURE FIELD...BUT LOOKING AT DEW
POINTS...IT STILL APPEARS TO BE NEAR PLATEAU. DUE TO PRESSURE
PATTERN WINDS WILL BE SWINGING AROUND ANYWAY...BUT DEW POINTS WILL
BE SLOW TO DROP THIS AFTERNOON AS WEAK FRONT WASHES THROUGH THE
AREA.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL LINGER

TONIGHT.  APPEARS BEST HEATING AND INSTABILITY WILL BE SOUTH...AND 
WHILE SHEAR WILL BE QUITE WEAK...INSTABILITY MAY BE HIGH ENOUGH FOR 
A FEW SEVERE STORMS THIS AFTERNOON.  WILL MENTION IN HWO.  MAV TEMPS 
LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER LOW PULLING AWAY FROM 
THE MRX CWA ON WEDNESDAY WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED CONVECTION.  A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL LINGER OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ON THURSDAY AS THE INFLUENCE OF THE DEPARTING LOW 
CONTINUES TO LESSEN.  STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR 
FRIDAY AND THE WEEKEND.  THIS WILL ALLOW SEASONALLY VERY WARM 
TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB TO SEASONALLY HOT CONDITIONS WITH HIGHS 
EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE 90S ACROSS MOST OF THE VALLEY LOCATIONS.  
ADDITIONALLY...SOME DIURNAL CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE OVER MAINLY 
HIGHER TERRAIN FOR BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY 
FOR MONDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE REMAINING ON CONTROL.

241 
FXUS64 KMRX 211921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT MON MAY 21 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED SHEAR 
AXIS ALONG WITH ELEVATED TERRAIN ON THE PLATEAU...LOOK TO BE 
ORGANIZING SHOWERS AND STORMS OVER WESTERN SECTIONS OF OUR AREA.  WE 
HAVE RECEIVED SOME PEA SIZE HAIL REPORTS ABOUT THESE STORMS.  

INDIVIDUAL THUNDERSTORM CELLS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO GET VERY
ORGANIZED AS SHEAR IS VERY WEAK...BUT THERE COULD BE BRIEF TIMES
WHERE THUNDERSTORMS GET STRONG ENOUGH TO PRODUCE PEA SIZE HAIL AND
OUTFLOW WINDS TO 40 MPH. THESE INSTANCES WOULD LIKELY LAST ONLY 5-10 
MINUTES AS DOWNDRAFTS CHOKE OFF UPDRAFT AREA.  STEERING FLOW IS 
EXPECTED TO FURTHER WEAKEN THIS AFTERNOON...SO SHOWERS/STORMS MAY 
MOVE MORE SLOWLY LATER.

LOOKS LIKE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE OVER US FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF 
DAYS.  WILL BE NEEDING TO KEEP POPS IN FORECAST AREA WIDE FOR THESE 
TWO PERIODS.  WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE WASHING THROUGH THE AREA 
LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES
COOLER TUESDAY...BUT NOTHING DRAMATIC.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THE MAIN FORECAST
HIGHLIGHTS FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES
MIDWEEK FROM A DEPARTING UPPER-TROUGH/LOW AND THE POTENTIAL FOR
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND.

MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THAT WILL PROPAGATE 
THROUGH THE VOLUNTEER STATE ON TUESDAY GRADUALLY EVOLVING INTO A 
CLOSED LOW OVER EAST TENNESSEE/WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA AS IT SLOWLY 
MOVES OFF TO THE EAST TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. WITH ABUNDANT 
MOISTURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA AND SOME ENHANCED LIFT ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE PASSAGE OF THIS STORM SYSTEM...A SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE OF 
STORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 00Z THURSDAY IS WARRANTED...
WITH THE HIGHEST PROBABILITIES FAVORING THE EASTERN AND
NORTHEASTERN ZONES /WHERE THE GREATER INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE WILL
BE LOCATED/. SOME ADDITIONAL CONVECTION MAY ALSO FAVOR THE
MOUNTAINOUS TERRAIN...PARTICULARLY DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY.

RAIN CHANCES WILL WANE SIGNIFICANTLY BY WEDNESDAY EVENING/NIGHT AS 
THE UPPER-LOW EXITS THE REGION. THIS WILL ALLOW A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL 
HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM TO PUSH INTO THE AREA LATE THIS WEEK AND BECOME 
THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH MEMORIAL DAY 
WEEKEND. AS A RESULT...MAINLY FAIR WEATHER IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE 
AREA ALONG WITH SOME UNSEASONABLY HOT CONDITIONS BY SATURDAY INTO 
SUNDAY AND THE CENTER OF THIS HIGH BECOMES SITUATED DIRECTLY OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MODELS ARE SHOWING 850 MB TEMPERATURES 
INCREASING TO AROUND 20-21C BY THIS TIME PERIOD. GIVEN THESE 
VALUES...THINK THAT MOS GUIDANCE IS DEFAULTING TOO MUCH TO CLIMO 
DURING AND HAVE RAISED TEMPS IN THE GRIDS BY A FEW DEGREES. THINK 
THAT HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S SEEM REASONABLE FOR 
FRIDAY...AND THAT THEY SHOULD INCREASE TO THE LOW TO EVEN THE MID 
90S ACROSS SOME PORTIONS OF THE AREA BY THE WEEKEND. WITH SOME 
MOISTURE PRESENT UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
AFTERNOON OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED CONVECTION ALONG THE MOUNTAINS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE...SO HAVE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALONG THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AFTER 18Z SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. 

&&

SOUTHWEST PARTS OF REGION. BETWEEN THIS AXIS AND CONVECTION
DEVELOPING OVER PLATEAU...LOOKS LIKE CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS DOES

KEEPING MAX TEMPS AS-IS.

FXUS64 KMRX 210734
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT MON MAY 21 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE IN 
DURING THE PERIOD...AND A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH IN AND MOVE 
SLOWLY ACROSS THE AREA.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE...WHILE FORCING NOT 
EXPECTED TO BE OVERLY IMPRESSIVE STILL SHOULD WARRANT LIKELY POPS 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE PLATEAU TODAY WITH CHANCE 
ELSEWHERE...THEN HIGH CHANCE ALL ZONES TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS CONTINUE 
TO LOOK REASONABLE FOR HIGHS...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  MAV LOWS ALSO 
LOOK DECENT BUT WILL MAKE SOME MINOR UPWARD ADJUSTMENTS MOST 
LOCATIONS.     

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL BE 
ALIGNED RIGHT OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AND MODELS STILL 
INDICATE A NICE SWATH OF DEEP MOISTURE ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA AND 
COLD AIR ALOFT TO CRANK UP THE INSTABILITY AS HEATING BUILDS DURING 
THE DAY. STAYED WITH A GRADIENT OF HIGHEST POPS EAST THROUGH LOWER 
POPS WEST FOR THE CONVECTIVE EVENT WITH SIGNIFICANT DROP OFF IN 
PROBABILITY OVERNIGHT. APPARENTLY THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE IN NO 
HURRY TO ENTIRELY DEPART THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. IN FACT 
MODELS SUGGEST A CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW VERY NEAR THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER WITH A POCKET OF MOISTURE TO BOOT. THEREFORE HELD ONTO SOME 
SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY FOR A SHOWER AND A COUPLE 
THUNDERSTORMS FROM EAST CENTRAL THROUGH NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS WELL 
AS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE THE BETTER INSTABILITY AND DEEPER 
MOISTURE WILL BE PRESENT. THE UPPER LOW WILL BE GRADUALLY SLIPPING 
FURTHER AWAY TO THE NORTH AND EAST FROM THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AS A 
MAJOR LEAGUE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS STEADILY NORTHEAST FROM THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE MID SOUTH THROUGH SOUTHEASTERN 
U.S. BY SUNDAY...MODELS SHOW THE CENTER OF THE RIDGE PARKED OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THEREFORE DROPPED POPS EVERYWHERE BUT THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AS SUBSIDENCE 
WARMING ALOFT SHUTS DOWN CONVECTION. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE WARMING 
TREND SUGGESTED BY MOS WHICH ENDS UP WITH MAX/MIN TEMPERATURES WELL 
ABOVE NORMAL BY THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND.

FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. IT SHOULD BE DRY FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
THE PERSISTENT SUMMER-LIKE PATTERN THAT HAS DOMINATED THE REGION FOR 
THE PAST FEW DAYS WILL FINALLY BEGIN TO CHANGE THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM. THE MID/UPPER RIDGE WILL GET PINCHED OFF BETWEEN THE COASTAL 
LOW AND AN APPROACHING TROUGH FROM THE WEST. FALLING 500 MB HEIGHTS 
AND A WEAK PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AT THE SURFACE WILL BRING RISING 
PRECIP CHANCES THROUGH THE DAY TOMORROW FROM WEST TO EAST...WITH 
LIKELY POPS IN THE PLATEAU BY THE AFTERNOON. HOWEVER PRECIP AMOUNTS 
SHOULD BE LIGHT AS LIFT IS GENERALLY WEAK. INSTABILITY SHOULD BE 
SUFFICIENT FOR SOME ISOLATED SEVERE POTENTIAL...MAINLY IN SOUTHERN 
AREAS AND THE PLATEAU. INCREASING CLOUD COVER SHOULD LIMIT HIGH 
TEMPS TOMORROW TO THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER TROUGH MOVES SE INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY. SURFACE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY SLIDES SE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON. CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO BE WIDESPREAD IN ADVANCE OF THE 
COLD FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH. THIS ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN TAPERING OFF 
BY TUE AFTN. TEMPERATURES INSIDE OF CLIMO DUE TO CLOUD COVER. CUT 
OFF LOW TRIES TO DEVELOP JUST EAST OF THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY. THIS IS FOLLOWED BY AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN FROM THE 
SW. A GOOD WARMING TREND SETS UP INTO NEXT WEEKEND. ISOLATED AFTN 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE MOUNTAINS.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  82  61  79  57 /  20  60  30  50  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  81  60  78  56 /  10  50  50  60  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  79  60  78  56 /  10  60  30  70  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              54  81  57  76  52 /  10  40  40  70  20

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL

PATTERN FOR THE SHORT TERM SO FAIRLY PERSISTENT FORECAST.  WILL 
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALL BUT SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE AREA WHERE 
WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS THIS AFTERNOON...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE INTO 
THIS EVENING ALL ZONES. MAV TEMPS HAVE BEEN VERY GOOD RECENTLY FOR 
HIGHS SO WILL FOLLOW CLOSELY FOR TODAY...BUT WILL GO ABOVE MOST MAV 
TEMPS A BIT FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...H5 TROF MOVING THROUGH THE 
OHIO VALLEY MONDAY WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SHWRS AND TSTMS EARLY IN 
THE WORK WEEK. MODELS DIVERGE ON THE TIMING OF TROF EXIT...WITH 
ECMWF KEEPING A CUTOFF LOW OVER OUR REGION THROUGH WED NGT...THE GFS 
AND NAM ARE ABOUT A DAY EARLIER. EVEN SO...AFTER THE EARLY WEEK RAIN 
CHANCES...ALL MODELS BUILD IN STRONG HIGH PRESSURE FOR LATTER 
PORTION OF THE WEEK...AND TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL. AS STATED 
ALREADY...THE GFS IS QUICKEST WITH TROF EXIT AND RIDGE BUILDING. 
WILL FAVOR A SLOWER SOLUTION AND CUT BACK ON MOS TEMPS A TAD. EXPECT 
ISOLATED MOUNTAIN TSTMS WITH THE HEAT LATE WEEK...BUT OTHERWISE DRY.

378 
FXUS64 KMRX 200133
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
933 PM EDT SAT MAY 19 2012

.DISCUSSION...STORMS SLOWING HEADING SOUTH OF THE AREA. DRIER 
WEATHER MOVING IN FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...  

.SHORT TERM TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANGES TO THE SYNOPTIC WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM...A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WILL BE FOLLOWED CLOSELY. THE 
RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES DOES SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD TO NEW 
ENGLAND TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...WHILE THE LOW OFF THE CAROLINA COAST 
REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY. THE SLIGHT WEAKENING OF THE MIDLEVEL 
RIDGE AND SLIGHTLY GREATER AMOUNT OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY PRODUCE 
BETTER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW...ESPECIALLY 
NORTH. STILL...ONLY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED AFTERNOON STORMS ARE 
EXPECTED...WITH LARGE HAIL BEING POSSIBLE WITH A STORM OR TWO GIVEN 
PLENTIFUL CAPE. TEMPS TONIGHT AND TOMORROW WILL BE CLOSE TO WHAT WE 
HAVE SEEN THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS...WITH LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 
60S AND HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...OVERALL PATTERN FOR THE 
EXTENDED WILL SEE SUMMERTIME LIKE CONVECTION...MAINLY OVER HIGHER 
TERRAIN AND GENERALLY IN THE LATE AFTERNOON AND POSSIBLY INTO THE 
EARLY EVENING MOST DAYS THROUGH THE PERIOD.  HOWEVER...THE MAIN 
SYSTEM WILL BE A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH AND WILL BRING IN MORE 
WIDESPREAD CONVECTION MONDAY INTO TUESDAY.  THIS WILL PROVIDE US 
WITH OUR BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AN THUNDERSTORMS WITH SCATTERED 
COVERAGE.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL REMAIN WARM THROUGH THE PERIOD 
AND STAYED CL0SE TO GUIDANCE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  61  86  61  86  62 /  20  20  10  30  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    60  85  59  84  60 /  10  10  10  30  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN            59  85  59  84  60 /  20  10  10  30  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   55  83  54  82  56 /  10  10  10  30  40

.DISCUSSION...

DEVELOPING OVER ELEVATED TERRAIN WILL CONTINUE TODAY. A STRONG

PORTIONS OF OUR AREA WILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THIS RIDGE TO A
GREATER EXTENT THAN YESTERDAY. THIS SHOULD SUPPRESS CONVECTION IN
THAT AREA TODAY...WITH MOST ACTIVITY SOUTH AND CENTRAL. CAPE IS
PLENTIFUL...SO A FEW STORMS COULD PRODUCE LARGE HAIL. CURRENT
FORECAST TEMPS ARE IN LINE WITH OBS AND LATEST GUIDANCE...SO NO
UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED.

711 
FXUS64 KMRX 190736
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SAT MAY 19 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL REMAIN TO 
OUR WEST DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD...WITH WEAK UPPER LOW TO OUR 
EAST.  APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME DRYER AIR WORKING IN TODAY WHICH 
SHOULD LEAD TO LESS CONVECTION THAN OCCURRED FRIDAY...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHERN 
TWO THIRDS OF THE AREA FOR THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING.  MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE FOR TODAY...BUT WILL TWEAK MOST MAV TEMPS 
UP SLIGHTLY FOR TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ATMOSPHERIC INSTABILITY AND 
MOISTURE IN THE VICINITY OF AN UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
U.S. COAST SHOULD BE JUST HIGH ENOUGH FOR THE PRODUCTION OF ISOLATED 
CONVECTION OVER THE MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS ON SUNDAY. MODELS INDICATE 
SOMEWHAT DEEPER MOISTURE AND SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY FOR ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED CONVECTION ON MONDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MAKES 
PROGRESS ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS FEATURE WILL DRIVE A 
SURFACE COLD FRONT TOWARD THE AREA LATER MONDAY WITH THE BOUNDARY 
PRESSING EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY. MODELS SEEM TO 
AGREE ON THIS SCENARIO WITH THE MORE ACTIVE WEATHER IN PLACE OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THIS PERIOD SO ADJUSTED POPS INTO A 
MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE CATEGORY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. MODELS 
NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT ON STRENGTH AND POSITION OF A LINGERING 
UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWING THE ACTIVE EARLY WEEK PATTERN. BLENDING MODEL 
SOLUTIONS FOR WEDNESDAY ALLOWED FOR A CONTINUATION OF SLIGHT AND 
SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION ON THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
AS WELL AS CENTRAL EAST AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. BY THURSDAY UPPER 
LEVEL FEATURE SHOULD BE BUILDING FARTHER EAST BUT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY 
KEPT ISOLATED OROGRAPHIC SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS GOING IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION BY FRIDAY 
WHICH SHOULD SUPPRESS CONVECTION. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMP 
GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT THE LONG TERM.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  59  86  61  85 /  20  20  20  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  59  85  59  84 /  20  10   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       86  58  86  58  83 /  20  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  50  82  53  81 /  10   0   0   0  20

395 
FXUS64 KMRX 190145
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT FRI MAY 18 2012

.DISCUSSION...ACTIVITY DECREASING AS IT STABILIZES. WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...IT SHOULD BE MOSTLY DRY FOR 
TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO 
OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
AFTERNOON CONVECTION SHOULD MAINLY STAY ANCHORED TO THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...THEN 
DISSIPATE BEFORE MIDNIGHT WITH THE LOSS OF SURFACE HEATING. THE 
850-500 MB RIDGE LOCATED TO OUR NORTH WILL DRIFT SLIGHTLY TOWARD THE 
SOUTHEAST TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE SLIGHTLY 
DRIER MIDLEVEL AIR WORKING INTO THE AREA TOMORROW. SO THE CHANCES OF 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT LOOK SLIGHTLY LOWER TOMORROW AFTERNOON THAN 
TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN NORTHERN AREAS. WILL HAVE A MENTION OF 
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND 
MOUNTAINS AND SW NC. WILL FOLLOW PERSISTENCE FOR TEMPERATURES AS 
1000-850 THICKNESSES REMAIN NEARLY THE SAME...GIVING HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 80S IN MOST SPOTS. 


.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...DIVERGENCE IN THE
MODELS WILL MAKE THIS A LOWER CONFIDENCE FORECAST FOR THE TUE-FRI
TIME FRAME. INITIAL COASTAL LOW THAT WILL LINGER NEAR THE CAROLINAS
WILL BE THE MAIN WX FEATURE THROUGH MONDAY. THE GFS SHOWS THE NEXT
H5 TROF KICKS OUT THE LOW...BUT THE OLD ECMWF AND DGEX SUGGEST THE
TROUGH CUTS OFF AND REPLACES THE COASTAL LOW. SO OBVIOUSLY THERE IS
DIVERGENT OPINIONS ON TEMPS AND WEATHER...WITH THE GFS BEING
WARMEST WITH STRONG H5 HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD. THE 00Z GFS
ENSEMBLES SHOW SEVERAL DAYS IN THE EXTENDED THE GFS MOS IS ON THE
WARM SIDE WHILE MOST ENSEMBLES ARE A LITTLE COOLER...SUGGESTING TO
ME THE ENSEMBLES MAY BE SIMILAR TO ECMWF/DGEX. WILL TEND TO FAVOR
LOWER THAN MOS MAX TEMPS. CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE OVER
THE MOUNTAINS SUNDAY AND AREA WIDE MONDAY AS THE H5 TROF
APPROACHES. IF THIS DOES CUTOFF...THEN THE WHERES AND HOW LONGS WILL
CONTINUE TO CHALLENGE THE FORECAST. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  86  59  87  60 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  84  58  86  59 /  10  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  85  57  87  58 /  10  10   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  82  51  83  53 /  10  10   0   0   0

NC...NONE.

SOUTHEAST TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE SLIGHTLY 
DRIER MIDLEVEL AIR WORKING INTO THE AREA TOMORROW. SO THE CHANCES OF 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT LOOK SLIGHTLY LOWER TOMORROW AFTERNOON THAN 
TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN NORTHERN AREAS. WILL HAVE A MENTION OF 
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND 
MOUNTAINS AND SW NC. WILL FOLLOW PERSISTENCE FOR TEMPERATURES AS 
1000-850 THICKNESSES REMAIN NEARLY THE SAME...GIVING HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 80S IN MOST SPOTS.

SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WENT WITH AN OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED ISOLATED 
IN NATURE CONVECTIVE LOOK TO THE FORECAST AREA FOR THURSDAY WITH THE 
TROUGH PROGGED TO BE EAST OF THE REGION. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO

.DISCUSSION...
MADE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS THIS EVENING TO THE POPS/WX AND TEMP
GRIDS...BUT OTHERWISE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. SOME
ISOLATED STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO RUMBLE ACROSS THE
HIGHER TERRAIN OF NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF
HOURS...BEFORE WEAKENING WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. MADE
SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO THE ORIENTATION OF THE POP GRIDS TO ACCOUNT
FOR CURRENT AREAS OF STORM DEVELOPMENT...BUT AM EXPECTING THIS
ACTIVITY TO REMAIN FAIRLY ISOLATED ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES
THROUGH 03Z OR SO AND HAVE MAINTAINED THIS THINKING IN THE GRIDS.
LATER TONIGHT...MODELS ARE SHOWING THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LOCALIZED
FOG DEVELOPMENT AFTER 06-09Z THROUGH DAYBREAK. GIVEN THE HIGHER
BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE AND THE MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS
EXPECTED...THINK THAT THIS CERTAINLY SEEMS PLAUSIBLE IN OUR TYPICAL
SHELTERED/FOG-PRONE AREAS NEAR BODIES OF WATER...SO HAVE ADDED A
MENTION OF THIS TO THE FORECAST AFTER 06Z. OTHERWISE...A PLEASANT
NIGHT IS EXPECTED WITH LOWS BOTTOMING OUT IN THE 50S AREAWIDE ONCE
AGAIN.

FXUS64 KMRX 172118 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
518 PM EDT THU MAY 17 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS...AN UPPER LOW WILL BE OVER THE OUTER
BANKS...WITH A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE GREAT LAKES. WITH
LITTLE CHANCE IN THIS PATTERN EXPECTED THROUGH TOMORROW...WILL
FOLLOW CLOSELY TO PERSISTENCE. SOME DIURNALLY-DRIVEN PULSE SHOWERS
HAVE POPPED UP OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN THIS AFTERNOON...AND EXPECT
MUCH THE SAME TOMORROW WITH UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS LACKING. A WEAK
INVERTED TROUGH AT THE SURFACE MAY HELP PROVIDE SOME CONVERGENCE
FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. HIGH AND LOW TEMPERATURES WILL NOT
CHANGE MUCH FROM THE PAST 24 HOURS...WITH LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 50S
AND HIGHS TOMORROW IN THE 80S.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLE MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY AND BUILDING INTO THE NE WITH 
WEAK UPPER LOW OFF THE CAROLINA COAST WHICH WILL TRIGGER A FEW 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO FRIDAY EVENING MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS AS INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE WILL BE GREATER ON THE 
EASTERN BORDER. THIS PATTERN WILL NOT CHANGE MUCH SATURDAY AND AGAIN 
SUNDAY WITH MORE ACTIVITY EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS THEN IN TN OR SW VA 
AND ACTIVITY WILL BE AFTERNOON AND EVENING STORMS IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE PERSISTENT AS WELL WITH HIGHS IN
THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S AND LOWS IN THE 50S. MONDAY THE PATTERN
BEGINS TO CHANGE AS A FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS.
THERE SHOULD BE A BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
ALTHOUGH STILL SMALL ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA
AND THE UPPER LOW IS EXPECTED TO MOVE NE. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY THE
FRONT MOVES SLOWLY EAST WITH MORE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS AND COOLER TEMPERATURES. THURSDAY HIGHER PRESSURE
BEGINS TO BUILD BACK IN BUT KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER AND
THUNDERSTORM.

&&

703 
FXUS64 KMRX 170816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
416 AM EDT THU MAY 17 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOG DEVELOPMENT SHOULD BE LIMITED
TODAY AND CONFINED TO MAINLY NEAR LAKES...RIVERS AND STREAMS WITH A
DRIER AIRMASS IN PLACE. FOG SHOULD DISSIPATE EARLY THIS MORNING. A
WEAK TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA TODAY BRINGING A CHANCE FOR
SCATTERED DIURNAL SHOWERS AND FEW THUNDERSTORMS. THE HIGHEST
CHANCES WILL BE FOR THE MOUNTAINS. THE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO END
IN THE EVENING. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKING REASONABLE SO STAYED
CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
GENERALLY REVEAL A RELATIVELY QUIET AND SUMMER-LIKE PATTERN. AN AREA 
OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEASTERN PART OF THE NATION 
WILL LINGER OVER THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
THROUGH NEXT WEEK. THIS UNSTABLE AIR MASS SHOULD ALLOW ISOLATED 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ESPECIALLY AROUND 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL LOW IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
OVER THE SOUTHEAST THIS WEEKEND...BUT LATEST MODEL RUNS INDICATE 
THAT IT WILL NOT HAVE MUCH EFFECT ON THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH 
ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION EXPECTED EACH DAY ALONG WITH SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY...INCREASING 
THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION A LITTLE. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND 
THIS COLD FRONT MAY CREATE ADDITIONAL CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY...WITH 
THE ECMWF MODEL REVEALING A STRONGER UPPER TROUGH THAN THE GFS MODEL 
(AND THUS...BETTER CHANCES FOR CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY). AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  59  86  58  85 /  10  10  20  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  56  85  57  84 /  10  10  20  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  56  85  57  84 /  10  10  20  10  20

AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING EACH AFTERNOON/EVENING ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. THIS 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS SHOULD CREATE SOME SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION... 
ESPECIALLY AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A DEEP EASTERLY FLOW ON 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY SHOULD DRY OUT THE ATMOSPHERE ENOUGH TO PREVENT 
ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE WEEKEND. A MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW 
THEN DEVELOPS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY...AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS ON MONDAY SHOULD AGAIN TRIGGER SOME OROGRAPHICALLY 
ENHANCED CONVECTION IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY...INCREASING THE 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
219 PM EDT MON MAY 14 2012

.AVIATION...
FOG AND LOWEST CLOUDS HAVE LIFTED NOW DUE TO DAYTIME HEATING.
CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURES ARE FAIRLY LOW THIS AFTERNOON...SO THINK
GOOD COVERAGE OF SHOWERS IS EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON AS HEATING
CONTINUES. ISOLATED THUNDER ALSO POSSIBLE. IN TAFS HAVE ONLY
INSERTED VCSH AT THIS POINT. THIS EVENING AS SURFACE COOLS SHOWERS
SHOULD MOSTLY DISSIPATE. SOME EARLY MORNING FOG EXPECTED...BUT WITH
STRATOCUMULUS LAYER EXPECTED TO HANG IN OVERNIGHT...NOT EXPECTING
FOG TO GET TOO THICK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1116 AM EDT MON MAY 14 2012

.DISCUSSION...
WEAK SURFACE LOW NEAR KCHA THIS MORNING WITH INVERTED TROUGH
EXTENDING TO THE NORTHEAST. BAND OF SHOWERS HAS BEEN CONTINUING
ALONG THIS TROUGH THIS MORNING...LOOKING LIKE IT IS FADING SOMEWHAT
NOW. THE LOW AND TROUGH ARE FORECAST TO DRIFT TO THE ENE THIS
AFTERNOON. AIR MASS LOOKS TO BE MARGINALLY UNSTABLE CONSIDERING
AFTERNOON FORECAST TEMPS...WITH MAX CAPE VALUES NEAR 1000 J/KG. SO
KEEPING POPS IN FORECAST...EVEN IN WAKE OF TROUGH...BUT WITH
TAPERING POPS TO THE WEST. WENT MOSTLY WITH SHOWERS...BUT HAVE
INCLUDED ISOLATED THUNDER AS WELL.


FOR TEMPS HAVE SHAVED OFF 1-2 DEGREES TO MAX TEMP
SELECTIVELY...FIGURING THAT LOW CONVECTIVE TEMPS WILL KEEP SURFACE
FROM HEATING UP TOO MUCH...HOWEVER...DOWNSLOPING POTENTIAL AT SOME
LOCATIONS ARE KEEPING ME FROM GOING A FEW DEGREES COOLER.

AND VISIBILITIES SHOULD GRADUALLY IMPROVE INTO VFR RANGES AFTER

741 
FXUS64 KMRX 140750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON MAY 14 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NORTHEAST AL...WITH ITS 
ASSOCIATED TROUGH EXTENDING NORTHEASTWARD ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. THIS LOW IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH SHOWERS CONTINUING FOR MOST OF THE 
DAY. MODELS INDICATE A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...SO WILL MENTION A CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS 
THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO 
LINGER OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THROUGH TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD KEEP 
SOME CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED SHOWERS LINGERING THROUGH THE NIGHT 
TIME HOURS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IN 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD REMAINS THE WANING PRECIPITATION CHANCES ACROSS 
THE REGION THROUGH THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK FROM A SLOW DEPARTING 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH. BY TUESDAY MORNING...A SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL 
PROGRESS EAST OF THE AREA...RESULTING IN SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUD 
SHIELD AS SOME DRIER AIR ALOFT MOVES IN /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU REGION/. HOWEVER...WITH THE UPPER-TROUGH AXIS 
STILL PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA TOMORROW...THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS /GIVEN SOME SLIGHTLY HIGHER 
INSTABILITY VALUES/ WILL EXIST THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS....WITH THE 
BEST PRECIP CHANCES FAVORING THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CWA. GIVEN THE 
LIMITED AMOUNT OF CAPE AND THE LOW BULK SHEAR VALUES IN THE 
LOW-LEVELS...AM NOT EXPECTING ANY STORMS THAT DO DEVELOP TO BECOME 
TERRIBLY STRONG OR POSSESS MUCH ORGANIZATION. HOWEVER...SOME BRIEF 
BURSTS OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL FROM THE ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP 
WILL SLIGHTLY INCREASE THE STORM-TOTAL PRECIP AMOUNTS /WHICH SHOULD 
GENERALLY BE BETWEEN 1-2 INCHES/. 

THE TROUGH AXIS WILL SHIFT JUST EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. THIS WILL RESULT IN CLEARING SKIES AND MAINLY DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK INTO 
THE WEEKEND AS UPPER-LEVEL RIDGING BEGINS TO NOSE INTO THE REGION. 
STILL...THERE WILL BE SOME MOISTURE PRESENT NEAR THE SURFACE WHICH 
WILL ALLOW FOR SOME ISOLATED OROGRAPHIC INDUCED CONVECTION TO OCCUR 
IN THE MOUNTAINS LATE THIS WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND. OTHERWISE...FAIR 
WEATHER AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED...WITH THE MERCURY 
RETURNING TO THE LOW TO MID 80S IN MANY AREAS BY THE END OF THE WORK 
WEEK. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   75  59  80  57  82 /  60  30  20  20  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     74  57  77  56  80 /  70  50  30  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             74  57  75  55  80 /  70  40  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    71  54  72  52  76 /  80  60  30  20  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 PM EDT SUN MAY 13 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND
SURFACE FRONT/TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA...
ESPECIALLY TONIGHT AND MONDAY. KEPT POPS VERY HIGH OVERNIGHT AND
LIKELY WEST TO CATEGORICAL EAST ON MONDAY. THREAT OF THUNDERSTORMS
IS VERY MINIMAL...SO LIMITED TO MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. ACTUALLY
ALTHOUGH POPS DECLINE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...I SEE BETTER
CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS ON TUESDAY. THE SURFACE FRONT MOVES EAST
AND THERE MAY BE SOME BREAKS OF SUNSHINE...ALTHO UPPER TROUGH AXIS
IS STILL TO OUR WEST THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING. FORECAST SOUNDINGS
SHOW BEST INSTABILITY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...DUE IN PART
TO SOME MID LEVEL DRYING PLUS COOLER 500 MB TEMPS. FAVORED GFS MOS
POPS FOR TONIGHT AND A BLEND ON MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

OTHERWISE...TEMPS HAVE STRUGGLED TO WARM MUCH TODAY...BUT ALSO
WON'T FALL MUCH OVERNIGHT. TRENDED TOWARD THE COOLER NAM MOS HIGHS
MONDAY AND WENT VERY CLOSE TO BLEND FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...APPARENTLY A DRIER 
PERIOD IN STORE WITH UPPER TROUGH AXIS AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE/LIFT 
SHIFTS EAST OF THE TERRAIN PARKING OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC 
COAST EARLY AND THEN GRADUALLY SHIFTING OUT OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC. WAS ABLE TO GO DRY WITH THE FORECAST THROUGHOUT MOST OF 
THE LONG TERM. PLACED SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OROGRAPHIC 
CONVECTIVE PRECIP IN THE TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE 
TEMPS.

AREA. NOT MUCH THREAT OF THUNDER THIS MORNING WITH 12Z OHX/RNK

VERY LITTLE POSITIVE CAPE. 12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW MUCH OF OUR 
REGION IN THE RIGHT REAR QUAD OF JET MAXES...WHICH WILL ENHANCE LIFT 
AND COVERAGE OF SHOWERS.

FORECAST GRIDS SEEM TO BE IN FINE SHAPE AT THIS TIME. WILL MONITOR 
HOURLY GRIDS OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS...AS MAX TEMPS MAY 
STRUGGLE TO REACH 70S...SO MIGHT NEED TO TWEAK HIGHS FOR TODAY. THE 
ZFPMRX PRODUCT SHOULD NOT NEED AN UPDATE.

142 
FXUS64 KMRX 130755
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT SUN MAY 13 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER CENTRAL MS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED 
TROUGH EXTENDING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THIS LOW IS PROGGED 
TO SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHEASTWARD TODAY...AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 
TONIGHT. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY IS 
PROGGED TO AMPLIFY SOME OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...WHICH WILL HELP TO GENERATE A FAIRLY EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
SHOWERS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY WITH THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. BOTH 
THE GFS AND NAM MODELS INDICATE SOME WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPING 
OVER SOUTHEAST TN THIS AFTERNOON...SO WILL MENTION A CHANCE FOR SOME 
THUNDER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IN 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE PRECIPITATION CHANCES EARLY THIS WEEK 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE PASSING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE 
SOUTHEASTERN US. BY MONDAY MORNING...MODELS ARE ALL SHOWING 
WIDESPREAD APPRECIABLE QPF SIGNALS ACROSS MUCH OF FORECAST AREA AS 
LIFT/FORCING CONTINUES TO INCREASE WITH THE PASSING TROUGH. THIS 
SYSTEM WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE EASTWARD ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND GIVEN 
THE LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE CONTENT...AT LEAST A CHANCE OF SHOWERS WILL 
LINGER ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION THROUGH 00Z WEDNESDAY...WITH THE 
HEAVIEST RAINFALL CONTINUING TO FAVOR THE I-81 CORRIDOR OF NORTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST VA AND THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS.  

HAVE TWEAKED POPS SLIGHTLY...BUT HAVE MAINTAINED THE ORIENTATION OF 
THE MOST FAVORED AREAS BEING ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CWA. 
HAVE GONE LIKELY TO DEFINITE POPS IN THESE AREAS DURING THE DAY ON 
MONDAY...BEFORE SCALING BACK TO CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE MONDAY NIGHT. 
THEN AS THE SYSTEM GRADUALLY PULLS AWAY ON TUESDAY...HAVE TAPERED 
VALUES TO SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE WESTERN CWA TO LOW-END CHANCE IN THE 
EAST. THOUGH THERE MAY BE SOME LOCALLY HEAVIER AMOUNTS...PWAT VALUES 
ARE NOT OVERLY IMPRESSIVE FOR A WIDESPREAD VERY HEAVY RAIN/FLOODING 
EVENT FOR THE MONTH OF MAY...AND STILL GENERALLY THINK THAT STORM 
TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE ON THE ORDER OF 1 TO 2 INCHES FOR 
MOST LOCATIONS.  

SOME LINGERING SHOWERS WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT 
OTHERWISE RAIN CHANCES WILL DIMINSH SIGNIFICANTLY FOR THE REMAINDER 
OF THE WEEK AS UPPER-LEVEL RIDGING BEGINS TO NOSE INTO THE AREA FROM 
THE EAST. THIS WILL LEAD TO CLEARING CONDITIONS AND A GRADUAL 
WARMING TREND EACH DAY DURING THE SECOND HALF OF THE WEEK AS 
THICKNESS VALUES AND 850/700 MB TEMPS INCREASE. HIGHS WILL RISE FROM 
THE LOW TO MID 70S ON MONDAY TO THE LOW TO MID 80S BY THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   71  61  76  58  80 / 100  80  40  30  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     71  60  75  57  79 / 100 100  60  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             71  60  74  57  78 / 100  90  60  30  20

391 
FXUS64 KMRX 121916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT SAT MAY 12 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...INITIAL BAND OF MOISTURE
MOVED ACROSS THIS MORNING...AND AS OF YET NO SHOWERS OF MUCH IF ANY
SIGNIFICANCE THIS AFTERNOON. LITTLE WIND SHEAR AND JUST SLIGHT
INSTABILITY CURRENTLY...THUS POPS WERE LOWERED FOR THE LATE
AFTERNOON HOURS AND THIS EVENING. UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONT
SLOWLY APPROACH OVERNIGHT...SO KEPT GOOD CHANCES OF SHOWERS FOR ALL
BUT NE TN/SW VA. POPS WERE LOWERED TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH 12Z MOS
AND TO BETTER MESH WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. MILD NIGHT WITH CLOUDS
AND SHOWERS MOVING IN...WITH MOS MINS REASONABLE.

BETTER FORCING ON SUNDAY WITH SOME UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE NOTED...
SO 90 TO 100 PERCENT POPS STILL IN ORDER. INSTABILITY IS NOT
EXTREMELY IMPRESSIVE...SO KEPT WORDING AS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS. COOLER NAM MOS HIGHS BETTER WHERE SLIGHT DIFFS WERE
NOTED. 

LIKELY OR HIGHER POPS STILL LOOKED GOOD FOR SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH
POPS ONLY DROPPING OFF ACROSS WESTERN AREAS ON MONDAY...DUE TO
EASTWARD PUSH OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY. UPPER TROUGH AXIS NOT COMPLETELY 
THROUGH UNTIL TUESDAY. A BIT MORE INSTABILITY ON MONDAY AND PERHAPS
BEST CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS (NON SEVERE) THEN. STUCK CLOSE TO THE
SIMILAR MOS MINS/MAXES FOR THOSE PERIODS.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...JUST A BIT MORE SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY TO FOLLOW MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY TO KEEP CHANCE POPS 
GOING FOR DAYTIME/EARLY EVENING CONVECTION AND A SHOWER AT NIGHT. 
THE OFFENDING EASTERN STATES UPPER TROUGH MOVES JUST EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS ALLOWING FOR DRYING TO BEGIN AS EARLY AS WEDNESDAY. THE 
DRY PATTERN MAY LAST ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK WITH 
LITTLE IN THE WAY OF DEEP MOISTURE ADVECTION. TRIED TO STAY CLOSE TO 
MEX MOS TEMPS.

716 
FXUS64 KMRX 120800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT MAY 12 2012

.SHORT TERM...
AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTING FROM OKLAHOMA INTO THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL BRING A GOOD CHANCE FOR WIDESPREAD 
PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT. CURRENT RADAR 
IMAGERY IS SHOWING A BAND OF HIGH BASED LIGHT SHOWERS PUSHING 
THROUGH NORTHERN ALABAMA INTO SOUTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE...WITH SOME 
SLIGHTLY HEAVIER RETURNS NOTED FURTHER TO THE SOUTH AND WEST. THIS 
ACTIVITY HAS DEVELOPED FASTER THAN MODELS WERE HINTING...THOUGH THE 
GFS SEEMS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON THE TIMING/LOCATION OF THESE 
SHOWERS AT THE MOMENT. 

AFTER SUNRISE...AM EXPECTING SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS TO PUSH INTO 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND EVENTUALLY MUCH OF 
THE GREAT TENNESSEE VALLEY BY THE EARLY AFTERNOON. AS FORCING/LIFT 
BEGINS TO INCREASE WITH THE APPROACHING UPPER-TROUGH LATER IN THE 
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...MODELS ALL SHOW SOLID QPF SIGNALS AND THE 
POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWER COVERAGE /ALONG WITH SOME ISOLATED 
STORMS/. GIVEN THIS THINKING...HAVE INCREASED POPS QUITE A BIT THIS 
AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST VALUES FAVORING THE 
WESTERN AND SOUTHWESTERN ZONES. WITH A FAIRLY DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER 
AOA 10 KFT AND PWATS PROGGED TO INCREASE TO BETWEEN 1.3-1.5 INCHES 
AFTER 00Z...CERTAINLY FEEL THAT LOCALLY HEAVY BURSTS OF RAINFALL 
WILL BE POSSIBLE /PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU REGION/. THESE VALUES...HOWEVER...DO NOT 
PARTICULARLY FAVOR A WIDESPREAD VERY HEAVY RAIN/FLOODING EVENT
ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE MONTH OF MAY. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT CLOUD
COVER AND SHOWER ACTIVITY...HIGHS WILL REMAIN ON THE COOL SIDE
TODAY IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 70S.

.LONG TERM...
(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
IN PULLING TEXAS UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SUNDAY AND MONDAY. DECENT JET STRUCTURE 
ENHANCING DIRECT CIRCULATION OVER THE AREA WHICH WILL STRENGTHEN 
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING. THERE IS SOME DISAGREEMENT IN RESPECT TO THE 
LOCATION OF THE BEST FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING...BUT INVERTED SURFACE 
TROUGH WILL PROVIDE DECENT LIFT TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD RAIN/SHOWERS 
OVER THE AREA SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO WARRANT 
INCLUDING THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON AREA-WIDE. TOTAL 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES ANTICIPATED MOST LOCATIONS.

FOR TUESDAY...UPPER TROUGH PULLS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS...BUT 
REMAINING INSTABILTY AND LOW LEVEL FORCING FROM OROGRAPHICS AND 
INVERTED TROUGH TO KEEP CHANCE OF SHOWERS GOING. BEST CHANCES OVER 
THE FAR EASTERN COUNTIES.

FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING WILL BUILD 
INTO THE AREA WITH DRIER CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND...ESPECIALLY 
FOR DAYTIME HIGHS. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED.

BEST LIFT...INSTABILITY AND DEEPER MOISTURE IS SUNDAY...WHEN I
NUDGED POPS UP SLIGHTLY TO BE CLOSER TO GFS MOS POPS. ALSO...ADDED
A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. MOS TEMPS IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT AND
GENERALLY FOLLOWED...ALTHO I DID FAVOR THE NAM MOS FOR HIGHS ON
SUNDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...ALTHOUGH MODELS HAVE
GENERAL AGREEMENT OVERALL...THEIR QPF SOLUTIONS TEND TO DIVERGE
OVER OUR CWA. THE NAM/DGEX IS THE WETTEST WITH A CLOSED LOW STUCK
OVER MIDDLE AND EAST TN EARLY IN THE WORK WEEK. MEANWHILE THE GFS
AND ECMWF ARE MORE PROGRESSIVE WITH THIS WEEKEND/S WET WEATHER
SYSTEM SUCH THAT POPS/QPF ARE NOTABLY REDUCED ON TUESDAY...WITH A
MOSTLY DRY FCST FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK...XCPT MAYBE SOME
AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION OVER THE MOUNTAINS LATE WEEK.
TEMPERATURES WILL RUN MOSTLY AROUND NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
UNDER THE FAIR SKIES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EDT FRI MAY 11 2012

.SHORT TERM...
A FAIRLY BENIGN WEATHER SETUP IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AS
AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS OVER THE REGION...PROMOTING FAIR
WEATHER AND MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS AREAWIDE. WITH INCREASED
THICKNESS VALUES AND 850 MB TEMPERATURES PROGGED TO BE AROUND 4-5
DEGREES CELSIUS WARMER THAN YESTERDAY...DAYTIME HIGHS WILL BE 10-12
DEGREES WARMER IN THE MID 70S TO AROUND 80 DEGREES. AN UPPER-LEVEL
LOW WILL SLOWLY MOVE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS OF WEST TEXAS INTO
THE RED RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...ALLOWING SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO BEGIN
TO OVERSPREAD THE AREA FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. SOME SHOWERS
AND STORMS WILL ALSO BEGIN TO WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AS WELL...BUT WILL REMAIN DISPLACED TO THE
SOUTHWEST OF THE AREA BEFORE MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON
SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING 
WILL MOVE EAST ALLOWING AN UPPER TROUGH OVER TEXAS TO MOVE SLOWLY 
EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST STATES SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. A 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS SOUTHERN 
CANADA/NORTHERN GREAT LAKES THIS WEEKEND WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
PULLING SOUTH TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BY LATE IN THE WEEKEND.

THESE FEATURES TOGETHER WILL PRODUCE UNSETTLED WEATHER WITH PERIODS 
OF SHOWERS ANTICIPATED FOR LATE FRIDAY SOUTHWEST FORECAST THEN 
SPREAD NORTHEAST SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY/INVERTED TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
AREA. MODELS SHOW INCREASING INSTABILITY FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK AS MORE 
SUNSHINE ANTICIPATED...SO HAVE ADDED THUNDERSTORMS IN FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. SYSTEMS MOVE EAST OF THE AREA FOR MID-WEEK WITH DRIER AND 
WARMER WEATHER RETURNING.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT THU MAY 10 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A TRANQUIL PERIOD WITH
RIDGING THE MAIN FEATURE. MOISTURE STARTS TO INCREASE ON SATURDAY
AND COULD LEAD TO A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 
ECMWF WAS DRIER LIKE 12Z NAM...SO I KEPT SW VA AND NE TN AREAS DRY
FOR NOW. GFS MOS POPS MINUS 10 PERCENT OR SO MESHED WITH OUR NWS
NEIGHBORS GRIDS.

SOME LINGERING FAIR WEATHER CUMULUS CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY
EVENING SHOULD DISSIPATE...AS MORE MIXING OCCURS. THIS LEAVES
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES UNTIL PROBABLY AROUND 06Z SATURDAY. 850 MB TEMPS
DON'T SUGGEST ANY COOLER THAN UPPER 30S IN A FEW SPOTS TONIGHT. MOS
TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED FOR EACH PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THIS PERIOD APPEARS 
TO BE SOMEWHAT ACTIVE WITH MEAN TROUGHING OVER THE EASTERN STATES. 
MODELS HAD SOME DIFFERENCES BUT STAYED WITH A BLEND OF THE EUROPEAN 
AND GFS MEANS WHICH BASICALLY BRING A SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH 
TOWARD THE REGION DURING THE WEEKEND SO HAVE LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS SATURDAY NIGHT AS MOISTURE IS INCREASING AHEAD OF THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TROUGH. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH BUILDS ACROSS THE 
DEEP SOUTH ABOUT SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY WITH INCREASING LIFT AS WELL 
AS INSTABILITY. CRANKED UP POPS FOR DAYTIME CONVECTION AND NIGHTTIME 
SHOWERS INTO THE GOOD CHANCE TO LIKELY RANGE FOR THE SLOW PUSH EAST. 
DURING THE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY TIMEFRAME...MODELS DEPICT A FINAL 
PIECE OF ENERGY DROPPING THROUGH THE BASE OF THE NORTHERN STREAM 
MEAN TROUGH SO JUST KEPT CONVECTIVE POPS IN A LOWER SLIGHT AND 
CHANCE REALM FOR THIS PERIOD. UPPER TROUGH MAY BE EAST OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THURSDAY WITH DRY ADVECTION AND BUILDING 
HEIGHTS. THEREFORE WAS ABLE TO KEEP THE FINAL DAY OF THE EXTENDED 
DRY AT THIS POINT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EDT THU MAY 10 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE IS BUILDING OVER
THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS AS
UPPER TROUGH MOVES OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD BEHIND DEPARTING COLD
FRONT. QUIET PATTERN NEXT 24 HOURS AS SURFACE HIGH SETTLES OVER THE
OHIO AND TN VALLEYS BY FRIDAY MORNING. FOLLOWING A MET/MAV BLEND
WITH HIGHS A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THE DATE. WINDS WILL BE
NORTH TO NORTHWEST 5 TO 15 MPH DURING THE DAY THEN DROP OFF TO NEAR
CALM AND TEMPERATURES THEN FALLING INTO THE 40S WITH UPPER 30S
MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER VALLEYS OF NE TN AND POSSIBLY SW VA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND 
DRY CONDITIONS CONTINUE OVER THE AREA THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY. 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE LOWERS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE AREA SATURDAY. UPPER LOW 
OVER TX BEGINS TO SHEAR OUT ON SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
INCREASE OVER THE AREA WITH CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION ARRIVING LATE 
SATURDAY FROM THE SW. BROAD SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDS FROM THE GULF 
OF MEXICO INTO THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR MUCH OF THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST. THE MOISTURE THROUGH THE LAYER WILL REMAIN FAIRLY 
HIGH. THE CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER THROUGH THE PERIOD 
WITH UPPER TROUGH AXIS LAYING WEST OF THE AREA WITH GENERAL 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW THROUGH THE LAYER. COOLER THAN NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES INTO SUNDAY FOLLOWED BY SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES INTO THE MID WEEK.

256 
FXUS64 KMRX 091928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EDT WED MAY 9 2012

.SHORT TERM...
A FEW AREAS OF LIGHT SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO SHIFT INTO THE 
CAROLINAS AND CENTRAL VIRGINIA OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS...AND
SHOULD CLEAR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY THE LATE AFTERNOON AS AN
UPPER-TROUGH SHIFTS EAST OF THE REGION. CLOUD COVER HAS ALSO BEGUN
TO BREAK UP ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS DRIER AIR PUNCHES IN
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM FROM THE NORTHWEST. THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE
OVER THE COURSE OF THE EVENING...WITH ONLY HIGH CLOUDS AND MOSTLY
CLEAR CONDITIONS OCCURRING IN MOST LOCATIONS BY 00Z OR SO. THE
COMBINATION OF LIGHT WINDS AND MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS IN
AREAS THAT RECEIVED MEANINGFUL RAINFALL MAY RESULT IN SOME
LOCALIZED LIGHT FOG DEVELOPMENT IN SOME SHELTERED AREAS.
HOWEVER...WITH DRIER AIR WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE REGION...DO NOT
FEEL ANY WIDESPREAD FOG DEVELOPMENT IS LIKELY. WITH A COOLER POST
FRONTAL AIRMASS IN PLACE ACROSS THE AREA...TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT
WILL BE NOTABLY COOLER IN MANY SPOTS. IN FACT...THESE WILL BE THE
COOLEST READINGS THIS MONTH BY ABOUT 10-15 DEGREES...AS THE MERCURY
WILL FALL INTO THE UPPER 40S TO AROUND 50 DEGREES ACROSS MUCH OF
THE FORECAST AREA. MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND FAIR WEATHER IS
EXPECTED ON THURSDAY...BUT NORTHERLY FLOW WILL HELP TO KEEP THE
COOL AIR IN PLACE AND HIGHS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S AREAWIDE.

.LONG TERM...
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS NOT TOO HIGH AS MAIN FEATURE 
WILL BE THE TIMING OF THE APPROACH OF CLOSED LOW FROM THE DESERT 
SOUTHWEST. MODEL DIFFERENCES OVER WHEN IT OPENS AND COMES THROUGH...
AND WHETHER IT IS REPLACED BY A NEW CLOSED LOW THANKS TO ENERGY 
DROPPING DOWN FROM THE NORTH...ARE ALL UNDERSTANDABLE GIVEN THE 
NATURE OF SUCH FEATURES. MOST OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD WILL 
CONTAIN CLOUDS AND SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS. FORTUNATELY...NEW
ECMWF RUN IS CONSISTENTLY DRIER THAN THE GFS/NAM...SO MY 
UNDERCUTTING OF MEX MOS GUIDANCE COULD PAN OUT WELL.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1047 AM EDT WED MAY 9 2012

.DISCUSSION...
MADE SOME SLIGHT CHANGES TO POPS/WX AND TEMP GRIDS THIS
MORNING...BUT OTHERWISE THE FORECAST IS ON TRACK. WIDESPREAD LIGHT
TO MODERATE SHOWERS HAVE CONTINUED TO PUSH ACROSS THE REGION LATE
THIS MORNING AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ROTATES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN TO DIMINISH FROM WEST TO EAST
OVER THE COURSE OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS THE AFOREMENTIONED
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST OF THE AREA. GIVEN THE RECENT TRENDS AND LACK OF
INSTABILITY TO WORK WITH...HAVE OPTED TO REMOVE A MENTION OF
THUNDER IN THE FORECAST. THE MOST FAVORED AREAS FOR POPS WILL BE
ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES...NORTHEAST TN AND SW VIRGINIA
FROM THE LATE MORNING THROUGH THE MID AFTERNOON. MORE SCATTERED TO
EVENTUALLY ISOLATED ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU INTO THE WESTERN GREAT TENNESSEE VALLEY AFTER 16-17Z OR SO.
BY 00Z PRECIP CHANCES WILL WANE SIGNIFICANTLY AREAWIDE AS A DRIER
AND COOLER AIRMASS IS PUSHED INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THIS
SYSTEM. ALSO...GIVEN THE SHOWERS AND PERSISTENT CLOUD
COVER...NOTABLY COOLER HIGHS TEMPS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S
ARE ANTICIPATED FOR THIS AFTERNOON...SO HAVE ADJUSTED TEMPS
ACCORDINGLY BY A DEGREE OR TWO TO REFLECT THIS.

FXUS64 KMRX 090820
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EDT WED MAY 9 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT HAS MOVED JUST EAST
OF THE APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. SKIES ARE CLOUDY WITH SOME PATCHY
DENSE FOG ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. SHOWERS WERE OCCURRING ACROSS
MIDDLE TN AHEAD OF A SHORT WAVE AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES TOWARD THE
FORECAST AREA. CURRENT RADAR IN EAST TN IS DRY. THAT WILL CHANGE
BEFORE 12Z AS MODELS SHOWING LIKELY RAIN CHANCES TODAY WITH THIS
FEATURE. HAVE KEPT FORECAST SIMILAR TO WHAT WAS ALREADY IN GRIDS
BUT INCREASED POPS SOMEWHAT FROM WEST TO EAST TO AROUND 40 PERCENT
CHANCE WEST AND 60 PERCENT MOUNTAINS FOR THIS MORNING AND DECREASING
POPS THIS AFTERNOON. THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE PLATEAU MAY BE
BEFORE 12Z AS IMPULSE TRACKS EAST EARLY THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES
ARE ONCE AGAIN MILD IN THE UPPER 50S TO UPPER 60S. WITH WINDS
INCREASING FROM THE NORTHWEST AND CLOUDS MUCH OF THE MORNING AND
AFTERNOON EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO RISE 5 TO 10 DEGREES TO MID 60S TO
MID 70S. RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT AND INSTABILITY WELL
SOUTH AND EAST. CLOUDS DECREASE LATE THIS AFTERNOON WEST AND THIS
EVENING ELSEWHERE WITH TEMPERATURES MUCH COOLER.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND 
DRY AIR MASS SETTLE INTO THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. OVERNIGHT 
TEMPERATURES COOL TO BELOW NORMAL WITH HIGHS NEAR NORMAL.
UPPER LOW MOVES INTO TX BY SATURDAY MORNING AND UPPER RIDGE AXIS 
MOVES EAST TO THE APPALACHIANS. AS THE LOW APPROACHES FROM THE SW 
THROUGH SUNDAY AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH DEVELOPS FROM THE GULF 
INTO THE TN VALLEY. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING CLOUDS AND EVENTUALLY 
PRECIPITATION INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. INVERTED TROUGH 
CONTINUES INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS INTO NEXT WEEK. A WET AND 
RELATIVELY COOL PATTERN CAN BE EXPECTED AS SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
CONTINUES OVER THE AREA WHILE DEEP UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE 
MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. 
&&

855 
FXUS64 KMRX 081942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EDT TUE MAY 8 2012

.SHORT TERM...
A DEPARTING UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE AND AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT 
FRONT FROM THE NORTHWEST WILL RESULT IN INCREASED RAIN CHANCES AND 
SOME COOLER CONDITIONS FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP ACROSS A VERY 
MOIST AIRMASS THE AFTERNOON. A BULK OF THE ACTIVITY IS ACROSS FAR 
NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IN RESPONSE TO A 
DEPARTING SHORTWAVE TROUGH EXITING TO THE NORTHEAST. 
HOWEVER...ADDITIONAL NEW DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON HAS BEEN 
TRIGGERED BY A PREFRONTAL TROUGH THAT HAS NOW WORKED ITS WAY INTO 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. NOT TOO FAR BEHIND IT...A COLD FRONT HAS 
BEGUN TO WORK ITS WAY INTO TO MIDDLE TENNESSEE FROM THE NORTHWEST. 
IT IS THIS FRONT AND THE ASSOCIATED JET DYNAMICS FROM ITS PARENT 
UPPER-TROUGH THAT WILL BE THE SOURCE FOR OUR PRECIPITATION CHANCES 
OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. 

BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO THIS EVENING...THE AFOREMENTIONED FRONT 
WILL HAVE BEGUN TO MOVE THROUGH THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND INTO THE 
GREAT TENNESSEE VALLEY. GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER AND SOME 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER INSTABILITY PARAMETERS...SOME SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP INITIALLY...BEFORE BECOMING 
PREDOMINANTLY RAIN SHOWERS AS THE FRONT PUSHES FURTHER EAST INTO THE 
SMOKIES AND A MORE STABLE AIRMASS BY THE LATE EVENING. OVERNIGHT 
INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY...MODELS ARE SHOWING A GOOD POTENTIAL FOR 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS FROM GEORGIA 
INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. HOWEVER...LATER IN THE DAY THERE IS SOME  
DISCREPANCY REGARDING THE TIMING AND DURATION OF THE PRECIPITATION. 
THE NAM IS SHOVING MOST OF THE APPRECIABLE QPF SIGNALS EAST OF THE 
AREA BY LATE MORNING...WHILE THE GFS HANGS UP THE FRONT A LITTLE 
FURTHER NORTH AND IS INDICATING A GREATER AMOUNT OF ENHANCED LIFT 
FROM THE PASSING UPPER TROUGH...WHICH COULD GENERATE ADDITIONAL 
SHOWERS /MAINLY ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES AND SW VIRGINIA/ 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. GIVEN THIS POSSIBILITY...HAVE INCREASED POPS 
TO LIKELY ACROSS PORTIONS OF THIS AREA LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MIDDAY 
TOMORROW...AS OROGRAPHIC LIFT SHOULD ALLOW SOME ACTIVITY TO PERSIST 
WELL INTO THE DAY TOMORROW...BUT DO CONTINUE TO SHOW THINGS SOLIDLY 
TAPERING OFF FROM WEST TO EAST BY THE AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION TO THE 
RAINFALL CHANCES...THE TREND OF COOLER TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE AS 
HIGHS WILL REACH THE MID TO UPPER 70S TOMORROW AND DROP BACK INTO 
THE UPPER 40S AND LOWER 50S TOMORROW NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS 
FORECAST PERIOD...THE AREA WILL BE IN AN UPPER LEVEL NW FLOW WITH 
AN EXITING TROF TO OUR EAST AND AN UPPER RIDGE OVER THE ROCKIES.  A 
PROGRESSIVE SETTING SHOWS THE UPPER RIDGE MOVING INTO THE REGION 
DURING FRIDAY AND INTO SATURDAY...THEN A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVE TROFS 
MOVE INTO THE REGION SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.

AT THE SURFACE...THURSDAY WILL HAVE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE 
REGION.  BY SATURDAY...A RETURN FLOW BEGINS AND BY SUNDAY AND INTO 
MONDAY AN INVERTED TROF WILL BE EDGING CLOSER TO THE AREA. DURING 
THIS UNSETTLED TIME...THE LATER PERIODS...NO MAJOR UPPER LEVEL LIFT 
IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE AREA...BUT LOWER TO MID LEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT 
LOOKS LIKE IT WOULD BE WIDESPREAD IN ADVANCE OF THE INVERTED TROUGH.

IN GENERAL...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH PLACEMENT OF MAJOR 
FEATURES WITH THIS SYSTEM NEXT WEEK...AND MOST ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE 
IN THE BALLPARK WITH THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM.  THIS SYSTEM LOOKS 
FAIRLY WET...SO WILL BUMP UP POPS IN THE LATER PERIODS SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE GUIDANCE.

INSTABILITY OVERALL NEXT WEEK...LOOKS ONLY MARGINAL WITH THE 
INVERTED TROUGH...SO NOT EXPECTING SEVERE STORMS AT THIS POINT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  75  49  76  48 /  30  30  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  74  49  72  47 /  40  30  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  75  48  73  46 /  30  20  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              55  71  46  70  40 /  50  50  10   0   0

1054 AM EDT TUE MAY 8 2012

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE MADE SOME SLIGHT CHANGES TO AFTERNOON POPS/WX AND TEMPS...BUT
GENERALLY THE FORECAST IS ON TRACK. THIS MORNING...SOME SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED STORMS ASSOCIATED WITH A DEPARTING UPPER
SHORTWAVE TROUGH ARE CONTINUING TO PUSH ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN
ZONES. THIS ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO WANE THROUGHOUT THE DAY...BUT
SOME ISOLATED ACTIVITY SHOULD PERSIST ACROSS THIS AREA THROUGHOUT
THE AFTERNOON. A COLD FRONT PRESENTLY LOCATED ACROSS WESTERN TN/KY
WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK TOWARD THE AREA OVER THE COURSE OF THE
DAY...INCREASING CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING FROM WEST TO EAST. THE ONE INHIBITING FACTOR MAY BE SOME
BKN/OVC DECKS OF LOW CLOUD COVER THAT WILL MAY PERSIST ACROSS MUCH
OF EAST TN THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY. HOWEVER...SOME BREAKS IN THE
CLOUDS HAVE BEEN NOTED ON VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY ACROSS MIDDLE
AND SOUTHEASTERN TN ALREADY. WITH SOME APPRECIABLE INSTABILITY
PROGGED TO BE IN PLACE BY THIS AFTERNOON AND THE FRONT AND
PREFRONTAL TROUGH APPROACHING...CERTAINLY FEEL THAT A CHANCE OF
STORMS IS WARRANTED ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE CWA BY THIS
AFTERNOON AND HAVE ADJUSTED THE GRIDS ACCORDINGLY. WITH SLIGHTLY
LESS CLOUD COVER AND SW FLOW...TEMPS MAY ALSO CREEP UP INTO THE
LOWER 80S AT KCHA AND SURROUNDING AREAS ACROSS SE TENNESSEE...SO
HAVE BUMPED VALUES UP A FEW DEGREES THERE.

FXUS64 KMRX 080814
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EDT TUE MAY 8 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT ACROSS MIDDLE TN WILL 
MOVE SE INTO MRX CWA THIS AFTERNOON AND THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS 
TONIGHT. WEAKENING UPPER SHORT WAVE MOVING EAST THROUGH THE MRX CWA 
THIS MORNING. FEATURES DO NOT PHASE VERY WELL FOR GOOD DYNAMIC SETUP 
FOR CONVECTION. MID LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL AND DOES NOT SUPPORT 
LIFT. HEATING WILL BE HINDERED BY HIGH LEVEL CANOPY. SO HAVE BACKED 
OFF ON POPS FOR TODAY ESPECIALLY ACROSS WESTERN AREAS. FRONTAL ZONE 
WILL LINGER EARLY TONIGHT ACROSS EASTERN AREAS SUPPORTING CONTINUED 
CONVECTION. LATER TONIGHT SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW INCREASES IN 
ADVANCE OF APPROACHING TROUGH. CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE TOWARD 
MORNING. DID NOT STRAY FROM SIMILAR MODEL TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE BUT 
LEANED A BIT WARM FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT
FINALLY SHIFTS EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY BUT PREFER THE NAM
MODEL WHICH DEVELOPS SECONDARY IMPULSE ALONG FRONT WEDNESDAY
MORNING AND THEN SHIFTS NORTHEAST THROUGHOUT THE DAY. CONSIDERABLE
CLOUDS EASTERN SECTIONS WITH GOOD CHANCE SHOWERS AND LIKELY
NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS. FOLLOWED CLOSER TO NAM TEMPERATURES FOR
HIGHS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT UPPER TROUGH MOVES IN BEHIND COLD FRONT WITH
CLEARING SKIES AND MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES. THURSDAY THROUGH
SATURDAY MORE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES AS HIGH PRESSURE AND NORTHWEST
FLOW PATTERN KEEPS REGION DRY. FRIDAY WEAK UPPER LOW DEVELOPS OVER
TEXAS AND SPREADS MOISTURE AND SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MS VALLEY SATURDAY. THE UPPER LOW AND ANOTHER
COLD FRONT MOVE OUT OF THE MS AND OHIO VALLEYS SUNDAY AND INTO THE
TN VALLEY MONDAY. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE LAST
TWO DAYS OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY NEAR
SEASONAL THE LAST COUPLE DAYS.

976 
FXUS64 KMRX 071915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON MAY 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WEAKENING RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE ALOFT OVER THE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO FLATTEN AND MOVE TO THE
EAST COAST IN RESPONSE TO PRIMARY SHORTWAVE THAT WILL MOVE INTO
GREAT LAKES...AND SECONDARY SHORTWAVE THAT WILL MOVE EASTWARD
/BETWEEN THE EAST COAST RIDGE AND GREAT LAKES TROF/ THROUGH THE OHIO
VALLEY AND INTO THE APPALACHIANS OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THIS SECONDARY
SHORTWAVE WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH A SURFACE COLD FRONT...THUS
FORECAST CALLS FOR SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
TONIGHT AND TUESDAY AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. 

TENDED TO FAVOR PREVIOUS FORECAST MAX TEMPS FOR TUESDAY...CLOSER
TO MET MOS...THUS UNDERCUTTING MAV MOS A LITTLE. 

MCC REFIRING OVER MS MAY BE AN INHIBITING FACTOR TO HIGH MODEL
POPS OVER OUR CWA...SPC HAS CUT OUT THE SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE FOR
OUR AREA DUE TO THIS FEATURE. MY POPS TONIGHT ARE CLOSER TO MET MOS
THAN TO THE MAV...TUESDAY POPS SOMEWHAT OF A BLEND OF THE TWO MOS
VALUES WITH NEAR 70 PERCENT AREA WIDE WITH FROPA.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS ARE SHOWING BIG DIFFERENCES WITH THE TIMING OF EXITING PRECIP 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THE GENERAL PATTERN OF THE MODELS SEEMS 
TO INDICATE THAT THE SURFACE FRONT WILL HANG UP NEAR THE MOUNTAINS 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT BEFORE A DEEP UPPER TROUGH IS ABLE TO PUSH IT 
EASTWARD LATE WEDNESDAY. GFS KEEPS PRECIP EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS 
TUESDAY NIGHT...WHILE THE CANADIAN HANGS ON TO PRECIP OVER US 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING...WITH THE NAM BEING A COMPROMISE 
SOLUTION. WILL FOLLOW THE TREND OF RECENT GFS/NAM RUNS AND TAPER OFF 
POPS A BIT FASTER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECAST...BUT STILL KEEP A CHANCE 
POP IN FAR EASTERN ZONES THROUGH WEDNESDAY. 

A MUCH COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS BUILDS INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT/THURSDAY AS A CLOSED LOW TRACKS ACROSS NEW ENGLAND. HIGHS 
THURSDAY WILL BE IN THE MID 60S TO MID 70S RANGE UNDER SUNNY SKIES. 
A WARMING TREND FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WILL BRING TEMPS BACK UP TO NEAR 
NORMAL. 

THE GFS HAS BEEN SHOWING A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH BRINGING 
PRECIP INTO OUR AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...THEN MERGING WITH A 
DEEP NORTHERN STREAM LONGWAVE TROUGH ON SUNDAY NIGHT. THE CANADIAN 
AND ECMWF ARE QUITE DIFFERENT...AND THERE IS CONSIDERABLE SPREAD IN 
THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. WILL KEEP THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.

TEMPS LOOK GOOD AGAIN SO WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL RETREAT EASTWARD 
MONDAY NIGHT...ALLOWING FOR INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION AHEAD OF A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE WEST. THE NAM AND SREF HAVE 
SLOWED DOWN THE PRECIP JUST A LITTLE FROM PREVIOUS RUNS...WITH 
PRECIP ENTERING THE PLATEAU LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND THE BEST CHANCES 
AREA-WIDE BEING TUESDAY. WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS GOING THROUGH THE DAY 
TUESDAY. SEVERE POTENTIAL LOOKS LOW TUESDAY GIVEN THE WEAK 
AMPLIFICATION OF THE TROUGH. THE SURFACE FRONT LAGS THE UPPER TROUGH 
PASSAGE...SO WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. 
UNCERTAINTY IS HIGH REGARDING FRONTAL TIMING...WITH THE NAM AND GFS 
SHOWING ABOUT A 12 HOUR DIFFERENCE WITH THE FROPA. WILL GRADUALLY 
LOWER POPS DOWN TO A SLIGHT CHANCE BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.

DRIER AND COOLER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS 
A DEEP CLOSED LOW OVER NEW ENGLAND PROVIDES A NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT. 
A BUILDING RIDGE WILL BRING TEMPS BACK TO NORMAL BY SATURDAY. GFS 
AND ECMWF SHOW THE RIDGE WEAKENING AND A BROAD TROUGH DEVELOPING 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AN OHIO VALLEY ON SUNDAY...AND WILL CARRY A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP SUNDAY WITH THIS SYSTEM. 


&&

OF THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW A CUT OFF LOW TRACKING NE FROM

WEDNESDAY AS THE SYSTEM EXITS THE AREA.  BEHIND THE SYSTEM...SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR A DRY AND QUIET WEATHER REGIME THROUGH

LINE/MCS ON SATURDAY NIGHT...MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME ADDITIONAL
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA ON SUNDAY /WITH
THE BETTER CHANCES FAVORING THE HIGHER TERRAIN/. THE MAIN WEATHER
FEATURE THAT WILL IMPACT THE AREA WILL BE A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD FROM THE NORTHERN
PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO RIVER VALLEY. A COLD FRONT
THAT HAS BEEN HUNG UP WELL TO THE NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER WILL BE
FORCED SOUTHWARD TOWARD THE REGION MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AND WILL
SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION EARLY NEXT WEEK.

IN WAKE OF THE FROPA MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...MODELS ARE STILL IN 
A LITTLE BIT OF DISAGREEMENT WITH WITH THE EXACT MOVEMENT AND 
POSITION OF THE AFOREMENTIONED UPPER-LOW. THE GFS HAS BEEN FAR MORE 
PROGRESSIVE WITH THIS SYSTEM...PUSHING IT TO THE NORTHEAST INTO THE 
ST LAWRENCE RIVER VALLEY WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. THE ECMWF HAD BEEN 
TRENDING SLOWER...WITH THE 00Z RUN SHOWING MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK AND 
A CUT-OFF LOW DEVELOPING OVER KENTUCKY/TENNESSEE DURING THIS SAME 
TIME PERIOD. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE 12Z RUN HAS TRENDED MUCH MORE 
TOWARD THE GFS SOLUTION...WHICH WOULD CERTAINLY TAPER OFF RAIN 
CHANCES FOR THE REGION BY MID-WEEK. HOWEVER...GIVEN SOME UNCERTAINTY 
IN THE TRACK...OPTED TO PLACE LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS /MAINLY IN 
THE FAR NORTHEASTERN ZONES/ WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. DRIER 
CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED TOWARD THE END OF THE WORK WEEK AS AN 
UPPER-RIDGE WILL SHIFT BEGIN TO SHIFT OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN US BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...A SHORT-WAVE IS MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WITH WATER VAPOR SHOWING WELL
DEFINED DRY BEHIND THE WAVE. THIS DRYING WILL ALLOW SKIES TO BECOME

THE AREA WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND TEMPERATURES WARMING INTO THE
80S. CAPE WILL INCREASE TO 2000-2500 J/KG LATE TODAY AND EARLY
TONIGHT. 

LATEST NAM CONTINUES TO SUGGEST AN MCS WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE
AREA OVERNIGHT. MAY NEED TO INCREASE POPS FOR TONIGHT DURING THE
AFTERNOON PACKAGE. SOME OF THESE STORMS COULD BE SEVERE WITH
DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL. WILL UPDATE HWO TO REFLECT THIS THINKING.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
RIDGE INTO THE AREA FROM THE EAST. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL LINGER IN 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. UPPER SHORT WAVE...WHICH TRIGGERED CONVECTION 
OVERNIGHT WILL EXIT THE AREA TO THE EAST EARLY TODAY. WARM AND HUMID 
AIRMASS REMAINS IN PLACE. SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL AGAIN 
DEVELOP TODAY FAVORING ELEVATED AREAS. UPPER NW FLOW IN WAKE OF 
DEPARTING SHORT WAVE. CHANCE OF CONVECTIVE COMPLEX MOVING IN FROM 
THE NW IS IMPROVING FOR TONIGHT. LEANED ON HIGH SIDE OF TEMPERATURE 
GUIDANCE.    

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A RATHER UNSETTLED WEATHER 
PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  WILL SEE A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT 
WAVES RIDE THROUGH A BOUNDARY OVER THE AREA AND WILL BRING 
OCCASIONAL BANDS OF SCATTERED CONVECTION THROUGH SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY.  AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL PRODUCE ADDITIONAL SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  CURRENT MODELS BRING OUR BEST 
CHANCE ON MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE REGION WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER 
LOW TO OUR NORTH SLIDES THROUGH.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY ON THURSDAY 
AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...CONTINUED 
HOT FOR THE WEEKEND WITH COOLER AIR MOVING IN BY THE END OF THE 
PERIOD.

.DISCUSSION...04/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS AND SATELLITE PICS SHOW UPPER

MOVING NORTH AT 25 TO 30 MPH ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY. THIS 
ACTIVITY IS HOLDING TOGETHER AND SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE NRN PLATEAU 
COUNTIES AND POSSIBLY LAKEWAY COUNTIES AS WELL. WE DID GET SEVERAL 
REPORTS OF SHELF CLOUDS...PLUS SOME WINDS GUSTS UP TO 40 MPH OR SO 
AS THESE STORMS MOVED ACROSS SE TN. SOME SMALL HAIL...UP TO DIME OR 
PENNY SIZE OCCURRED BRIEFLY THIS EVENING WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS.

PLAN TO UPDATE THE GRIDS AND PRODUCTS SHORTLY. WILL OPT FOR AREAL 
QUALIFIER WHERE GREATEST COVERAGE IS ONGOING...AND WORD AS SHOWERS 
WITH ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. HOURLY TEMPS WILL BE ADJUSTED AS NEEDED 
WITH MIN FORECAST LIKELY ON TRACK.

360 
FXUS64 KMRX 031929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 PM EDT THU MAY 3 2012

.SHORT TERM...
AN UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE WILL CONTINUE TRACKING ACROSS CENTRAL
TENNESSEE THE AFTERNOON...BRINGING INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. AS OF 19Z...AN AREA OF
SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM HAS BEGUN TO PUSH INTO
NORTHEASTERN ALABAMA AND THE EXTREME SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE
CWA. ADDITIONALLY...WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND A WEAKER CAP
IN SOME AREAS...SOME SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BEGUN TO DEVELOP
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE
MOUNTAINS OF EXTREME NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE. OVER THE COURSE OF THE
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS...THE AFOREMENTIONED TROUGH IS EXPECTED
TO SHIFT NORTHEASTWARD AND SWING ACROSS THE SPINE OF THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS.

MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW SHOWERS AND STORMS GRADUALLY OVERSPREADING
THE AREA FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST OVER THE COURSE OF THE EVENING
HOURS. ADDITIONALLY...ANOTHER PLUME OF LOW TO MID LEVEL MOISTURE
IS PROGGED TO SURGE NORTHWARD FROM GEORGIA TOWARD THE SMOKY
MOUNTAINS LATE TONIGHT...POTENTIALLY INITIATING MORE SCATTERED
SHOWERS INTO THE EARLY MORNING HOURS TOMORROW. GIVEN THIS
POTENTIAL...HAVE TWEAKED POPS OVERNIGHT TO FAVOR THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS...THOUGH A SOLID CHANCE IS EXPECTED AREAWIDE...BEFORE
TAPERING THEM OFF AFTER 12Z TOMORROW.

WITH THE AFOREMENTIONED DISTURBANCE WEAKENING AND SHIFTING EAST OF
THE AREA...A LARGE SUBTROPICAL HIGH LOCATED ACROSS THE RIO GRANDE
VALLEY WILL GRADUALLY BEGIN TO NOSE INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL
INDUCE A NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND POTENTIALLY ALLOW SOME SCATTERED
STORMS THAT WILL DEVELOP ACROSS OHIO VALLEY TO DRIFT TOWARD THE
NORTHERN ZONES LATE IN THE DAY IN ADDITION TO ANY TERRAIN IN
INCUDED STORMS THAT DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS WEEKEND WITH UPPER RIDGE WEAKENING 
OVER THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS WITH STRONGEST PART TO THE SOUTH AND 
WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA...OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS STATES. SHORT 
RANGE ENSEMBLE MODELS BRING WEAK SHORT WAVE ACTIVITY MAINLY ACROSS 
THE NE HALF OF THE REGION OVERNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT THEN SLOWLY MOVING 
SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY. RIDGE STRENGTHENS TO THE 
WEST AND FLOW AROUND THE RIDGE COMES MORE FROM THE NW. SATURDAY 
NIGHT RAIN CHANCES DROP OFF AS TEMPERATURES COOL FROM DAY TIME 
HEATING AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY SINKS SOUTH. SUNDAY UPPER RIDGE TRIES 
TO REBUILD SOMEWHAT ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. THINK DAY TIME HEATING 
WILL STILL BE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE SCATTERED ACTIVITY DURING THE DAY 
AND CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING. MONDAY LOW PRESSURE WITH A COLD FRONT 
MOVES INTO THE LOWER OHIO AND MS VALLEYS WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
STORMS TO CONTINUE AND INCREASE ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
SECTIONS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. A LARGE UPPER TROUGH REPLACES THE 
RIDGE BY MID WEEK. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD FINALLY MOVE THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES STILL MUCH ABOVE NORMAL SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY WITH LOWS MOSTLY LOWER TO MID 60S AND HIGHS IN THE 80S. 
FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH REMAINDER OF THE 
EXTENDED. LOWS WILL DROP TO THE 50S BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HIGHS 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY MID 70S TO LOWER 80S. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN THURSDAY BEHIND FRONT WITH LESS CLOUD COVER AND 
TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONAL NORMAL AND NO RAIN.

036 
FXUS64 KMRX 031446
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1046 AM EDT THU MAY 3 2012

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE TWEAKED THE FORECAST TO ACCOUNT FOR THE LATEST TRENDS WITH THE
TRACK AND WEATHER IMPACTS FROM AN UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE PROGGED
TO PUSH INTO THE VOLUNTEER STATE LATER TODAY. AS OF 14Z...THE AREA
OF LOW PRESSURE WAS CENTERED ROUGHLY OVER THE TENNESSEE RIVER IN
EXTREME NORTHWEST ALABAMA AND WEST CENTRAL TENNESSEE. THIS SYSTEM
AND ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIPITATION HAS BEEN SLOWER IN MOVING TO THE
NORTH AND EAST THAN PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT...THOUGH MODELS STILL
CONTINUE TO INDICATE A GENERAL NNE MOTION THROUGH CENTRAL TENNESSEE
OVER THE COURSE OF THE DAY AND EVENING. ANY PRECIPITATION
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM HAS REMAINED ROUGHLY ALONG THE I-65
CORRIDOR OF ALABAMA AND TENNESSEE...THOUGH RECENT RADAR TRENDS HAVE
SHOWN SOME MORE EASTERLY MOVEMENT/DEVELOPMENT WITHIN THE PAST HOUR
OR SO.

GIVEN THIS...HAVE OPTED TO LOWER POPS INITIALLY THIS MORNING
ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA...BEFORE INCREASING CHANCES
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU REGION FOR
THE AFTERNOON AS THIS SYSTEM SLOWLY PROGRESSES EASTWARD. CURRENT
THINKING IS THAT LOCATIONS ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA WILL GENERALLY REMAIN DRY AND PARTLY SUNNY FOR MOST OF THE
DAY...BEFORE SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION MAY DEVELOP LATE IN THE DAY
AND EARLY EVENING. IN FACT...GIVEN THE WEAKER CAP IN PLACE ACROSS
THIS AREA...THE MAIN MODE OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE EASTERN TWO-
THIRDS OF THE CWA MAY BE DIURNAL OR OROGRAPHIC INDUCED CONVECTION.
THE ONLY OTHER TWEAK WAS TO TEMPERATURES AS SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER
VALUES ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE APPEAR LIKELY GIVEN THE
PERSISTENT CLOUD COVER/HIGHER RAIN POTENTIAL. MEANWHILE...VERY
WARM READINGS /MID-UPPER 80S/ IN THE UPPER TENNESSEE VALLEY ARE
EXPECTED GIVEN THE GREATER INSOLATION AND THICKNESS VALUES THERE.
