207 
FXUS64 KMRX 030805
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU MAY 3 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
AND ITS ASSOCIATED FLUX OF DEEP MOISTURE WILL BUILD INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT INCREASING THE CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS MAINLY ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON. 
BY LATE AFTERNOON RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE OVER THE EASTERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A BIT OF A CAP IN 
PLACE THIS MORNING THAT WILL BREAK DOWN BY MID DAY INTO THE 
AFTERNOON ALLOWING FOR THE FORMATION OF A FEW THUNDERSTORMS. THE 
DEEPER MOIST AXIS AND LIFT WITH THE UPPER LEVEL FEATURE WILL SHIFT 
TOWARD THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT INCREASING THE CHANCE OF RAIN ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
MODERATED TO SOME DEGREE ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS WITH INCREASED 
CLOUD COVER AND RAIN WHILE SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE ENJOY A LITTLE MORE SUNSHINE. THEREFORE...HIGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A LITTLE WARMER IN THIS AREA THAN SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. CONCERNING LOW TEMPS 
TONIGHT...ADJUSTED CLOSER TO THE WARMER SUGGESTED MINS DUE TO 
BLANKET OF CLOUDS AND HIGHER DEWPOINT AIR IN PLACE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT...IN THE EARLY PERIODS...CONTINUING TO WEAKEN THE UPPER 
RIDGE OUR AREA AND CONTINUE WITH THE MORE DOMINANT RIDGE OVER 
TEXAS.  BY EARLY NEXT WEEK OVER OUR AREA...THE RIDGE HAS COMPLETELY 
RECEDED AND THE FLOW HAS GONE ZONAL...WITH A LARGE TROUGH MAKING ITS 
WAY OUT OF THE ROCKIES AND TOWARD THE MISS VALLEY.  

DURING THIS PERIOD...SINCE RIDGE HAS RECEDED MINOR DISTURBANCES IN 
THE FLOW ARE A POSSIBILITY/LIKELIHOOD...BUT TIMING WILL BE 
DIFFICULT.  MODELS SHOW DECENT AGREEMENT IN A DISTURBANCE MOVING 
THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY IN THE NW FLOW.  TREATED 
POPS ON SATURDAY WITH THIS SCENARIO. ALSO ADJUSTED TEMPS 
SLIGHTLY...WARMED OVERNIGHT LOWS FRIDAY NIGHT A COUPLE OF DEGREES AND 
DELAYED DIRUNAL WARM-UP SATURDAY DUE TO INCREASED CLOUD COVER AS 
DISTURBANCE MOVES THROUGH.

AT THE SURFACE FORCING SHOULD BE WEAK THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD A MODERATE TO STRONG FRONT LOOKS LIKE 
IT COULD BE NEARING THE AREA.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  64  85  68  87 /  60  50  20  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  63  85  68  85 /  50  50  20  40  40

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT WED MAY 2 2012

.DISCUSSION...SPOTTY STRONG CONVECTION...THAT FORMED OVER WRN NC 
JUST SOUTH OF MTN CITY TN AND OVER SW VA...FINALLY DISSIPATED 
COMPLETELY OVER THE LAST HOUR OR SO. GOT A REPORT OF MOSTLY DIME 
SIZED HAIL WITH A STORM OVER RUSSELL COUNTY VA AROUND 235 PM. 

TO OUR SW...THE WEAK UPPER LOW/SHEAR AXIS ALONG LA/MS COAST 
CONTINUES TO SPREAD A WEAKENING COMPLEX OF TSRA NNW THRU AL AND INTO 
W TN AT THIS TIME. THIS ACTIVITY DOES STILL HAVE A FEW AREAS WITH 
TOPS COOLING ON IR SATELLITE PICS...BUT LOOKS LIKE THIS WILL MAINLY 
AFFECT TN ALONG AND W OF I-65 OVERNIGHT. THEREFORE...I WILL KEEP 
GRIDS DRY FOR REST OF TONIGHT...AND LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT SEE IF SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS ARE NEEDED BEFORE 12Z THURSDAY.

THE HIGH DEBRIS CLOUDS ARE REACHING CHA WITH AN INCREASE IN BOTH MID 
AND HIGH CLOUDS LIKELY OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY SE TN/SW NC AND 
PLATEAU. HOURLY TEMPS AND DEW POINT TEMPS ARE RUNNING CLOSE TO GRIDS
...SO PROBABLY WON'T NEED ANY UPDATES.

115 
FXUS64 KMRX 022332
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
631 PM EDT WED MAY 2 2012

.AVIATION...ISOLATED STRONG CONVECTION LINGERED ON THE PERIPHERY OF 
OUR FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT AT TAF ISSUANCE TIME THIS 
ACTIVITY CONTINUED A WEAKENING TREND. NO THREAT TO ANY TAF SITE...
ALTHO WEAK UPPER LOW OVER COASTAL LA/MS WILL SPREAD CLOUDS OUR WAY 
OVERNIGHT. SOME CONVECTION...CAUSED BY THIS FEATURE...COULD AFFECT 
CHA MOST LIKELY BETWEEN 12Z AND 18Z THURSDAY...THEN SPREAD NE TO AT 
LEAST REACH TYS IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS. 

FOR NOW...KEEPING CONDITIONS VFR WHICH LOOKS GOOD...UNLESS A TSRA 
WERE TO PASS DIRECTLY ACROSS CHA OR TYS THURSDAY MORNING OR 
AFTERNOON. BEST TO WAIT AND SEE ON THIS...GIVEN POPS OF 50 PERCENT 
OR LESS.

PREVIOUS AFD...

.SHORT TERM...
WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM NOSING INTO THE REGION
FROM THE CAROLINAS AND PERSISTENT SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW...TEMPERATURES
HAVE SOARED WELL INTO THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN MANY LOCATIONS ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...WITH SOME LOW TO MID
LEVEL MOISTURE PRESENT...SOME OROGRAPHIC INDUCED THUNDERSTORMS HAVE
DEVELOPED ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINA AND WESTERN
NORTH CAROLINA. MODELS ARE HINTING AT THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME
ADDITIONAL CONVECTION FIRING ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE
SMOKIES LATE THIS AFTERNOON BEFORE DYING OFF WITH THE LOSS OF
DIURNAL HEATING. THUS...HAVE SOME LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS THROUGH
00Z IN THESE AREAS. 

TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW...CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AS A
DISTURBANCE NUDGES INTO CENTRAL AND EASTERN TENNESSEE FROM THE
SOUTH...BRINGING INCREASED GULF MOISTURE AND COOLER TEMPERATURES
ALOFT. THIS WILL RESULT IN INCREASED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE REGION DURING THE LATE MORNING AND
AFTERNOON HOURS TOMORROW. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT ON
THIS...SHOWING SOME FAIRLY APPRECIABLE CONVECTION SIGNALS
OVERSPREADING THE GREAT TENNESSEE VALLEY AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY
18Z AND MOVING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE AREA OVER THE COURSE OF THE
AFTERNOON. THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CHANCE AREAWIDE...WITH THE
HIGHER 40-50 POPS FAVORING THE FAR SOUTHERN AND WESTERN ZONES.
GIVEN THE INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND LOWER THICKNESS VALUES...HIGHS
WILL BE A BIT COOLER TOMORROW IN THE LOWER 80S GENERALLY...THOUGH
LOCATIONS FAR NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA MAY BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES
WARMER. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)... 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH CONTINUING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS OVERNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT AS MOISTURE COMES NORTH FROM
THE GULF COAST STATES BUT SHOULD SLOWLY LOWER WITH DIURNAL COOLING.
RIDGE SHOWING A WEAKNESS IN STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE
EASTERN STATES WITH SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY MOVING
SOUTHEAST AROUND RIDGE WHICH WILL BE CENTERED MORE OVER CENTRAL
GULF AND SOUTH CENTRAL STATES BY FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. BEST
CHANCES WILL BE IN THE AFTERNOONS AND AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH MONDAY WITH A COLD FRONT SLOWLY
MOVING THROUGH THE REGION THROUGH WEDNESDAY. RAIN CHANCES MAY BE A
LITTLE HIGHER THEN. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MUCH ABOVE NORMAL
THROUGH THE EXTENDED. IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS HIGHS WILL BE MUCH
COOLER DUE TO MORE CLOUD COVER AND BETTER RAIN CHANCES. AIR MASS
BECOMES QUITE UNSTABLE SATURDAY AND THEN AGAIN MONDAY AND TUESDAY
WITH BETTER POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE STORMS THOSE DAYS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  81  63  86  65 /  10  50  20  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  81  62  82  65 /  10  40  30  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  83  62  82  65 /  10  40  30  30  30

155 
FXUS64 KMRX 021447
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1047 AM EDT WED MAY 2 2012

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE FORECAST PACKAGE THIS MORNING. AN
UPPER- SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OFF THE CAROLINA COAST REMAINS THE
DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION. WITH PREVAILING
SOUTHWEST FLOW AND SIMILAR 700/850 MB TEMPS AND THICKNESS VALUES TO
YESTERDAY...NEAR RECORD TO RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED
ACROSS THE REGION BY THIS AFTERNOON ONCE AGAIN /WITH THE MERCURY
PEAKING IN THE MID 80S TO AROUND 90 DEGREES AREAWIDE EXCEPT IN THE
HIGHER TERRAIN/. THE ONE FORECAST CONCERN WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR
SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION THAT SHOULD DEVELOP ALONG THE
SPINE OF THE SMOKIES AND POTENTIALLY NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS ARE SHOWING
SOME APPRECIABLE INSTABILITY VALUES TO WORK WITH IN LOCATIONS WITH
A WEAKER/BROKEN CAP. HOWEVER...SUBSIDENCE WILL ALSO BE ON THE
INCREASE AS THE AFOREMENTIONED UPPER-RIDGE AXIS SCOOTS TOWARD THE
AREA...WHICH WOULD ACT TO SUPPRESS THUNDER CHANCES ACROSS MOST OF
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. AS SUCH...HAVE MAINTAINED SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE HIGH TERRAIN OF THE SMOKY MTNS...BUT DID NOT
HAVE QUITE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE TO GO MENTIONABLE ACROSS THE FAR
WESTERN ZONES YET.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT WED MAY 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A 
SURFACE THROUGH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE EXPANDING FROM THE SOUTHEAST 
ATLANTIC COAST STATES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS REVEAL SUBSIDENCE WITHIN THE RIDGE WILL PRODUCE A BIT OF 
WARMING AROUND 800-700 MB WHICH WILL TEND TO LIMIT CONVECTION OVER 
MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. THE BEST SHOT AT SEEING ISOLATED 
CONVECTION WILL BE OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE THE ATMOSPHERE IS 
PROGGED TO BE JUST A LITTLE BIT LESS STABLE. OROGRAPHIC LIFT MAY AID 
DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA AS 
WELL.
THE BIG STORY TODAY WILL BE THE HEAT AS HIGH TEMPERATURES WARM INTO 
THE MIDDLE AND UPPER 80S ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE WILL LIKELY WARM TO AROUND 90 DEGREES FOR A SECOND 
STRAIGHT DAY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ARE
IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH BREAKING DOWN THE RIDGE OVER THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY ENOUGH TO INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY. MAIN FORCING WILL BE OROGRAPHIC...SO GREATEST POPS WILL
BE ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN. FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...A WEAK COLD
FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA KEEPING A CHANCE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON
AND EVENING CONVECTION GOING. AGAIN...THE HIGHER CHANCES OVER THE
TERRAIN FEATURES.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...A SHORT-WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE PLAIN STATES
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY/SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES REGION PULLING FRONT BACK
NORTH OVER THE AREA MONDAY WITH ANOTHER FRONT MOVING INTO THE
REGION FOR TUESDAY. WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL OF MORE
ORGANIZED SEVERE WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AS FRONT MOVES INTO THE
FORECAST AREA.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

062 
FXUS64 KMRX 020226
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 PM EDT TUE MAY 1 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. LOW CHANCE OF CONVECTION NORTHERN 
AREAS AND SMOKIES. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SEEING A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
DEVELOPING ALONG AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM CONVECTION TRACKING ALONG 
AN OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER KY/WV.  ADDITIONALLY..A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE AREA DUE TO STRONG DAYTIME 
HEATING AND AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS.  EVENING CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN 
LIMITED AND MUCH OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD WEAKEN THEN DISSIPATE 
OVERNIGHT.  FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH WILL SLOWLY LIFT FARTHER 
NORTHWARD...CARRYING CONVECTIVE CHANCES WITH IT.  HOWEVER...AIR MASS 
WILL ONCE AGAIN DESTABILIZE ON WEDNESDAY AND COULD SEE SOME DIURNAL 
CONVECTION DEVELOP MAINLY OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE AFTERNOON.  
AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL CONTINUE TO SEE HOT CONDITIONS WITH 80S 
TO AROUND 90 DEGREES EXPECTED ACROSS THE VALLEY LOCATIONS WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THIS PART OF THE 
FORECAST BEGINS WITH A WEAK UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA THAT THE 
MODELS AGREE WILL WEAKEN IN LATER PERIODS AND WITH THE GFS ALSO 
RETROGRADING THIS RIDGE WWD...LEAVING US IN MORE OF A NWLY UPPER 
FLOW. OTHER MODELS SEEM TO LEAVE REMNANTS OF THE RIDGE OVER THE 
AREA.  AT ANY RATE...WE SHOULD BE OUT OF THE MAIN STORM 
TRACK...HOWEVER THERE WILL BE ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE/INSTABILITY 
AS WELL AS A WEAK CAP TO ALLOW DIURNAL CONVECTION ESPECIALLY IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND AREAS DOWNSTREAM.  THERE COULD BE A COLD 
FRONT THAT SNEAKS THROUGH IN THE LATTER PERIODS...MODELS NOT SHOWING 
GOOD CONSISTENCY ON THE PLACEMENT OF THIS FRONT.  EDGED TEMPS DOWN A 
BIT TO ALLOW FOR THIS COOLING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  66  90  63  86  61 /  10  10  10  30  20

HEATING AND AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS.  EVENING CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN 
LIMITED AND MUCH OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD WEAKEN THEN DISSIPATE 
OVERNIGHT.  FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH WILL SLOWLY LIFT FARTHER 
NORTHWARD...CARRYING CONVECTIVE CHANCES WITH IT.  HOWEVER...AIR MASS 
WILL ONCE AGAIN DESTABILIZE ON WEDNESDAY AND COULD SEE SOME DIURNAL 
CONVECTION DEVELOP MAINLY OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE AFTERNOON.  
AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL CONTINUE TO SEE HOT CONDITIONS WITH 80S 
TO AROUND 90 DEGREES EXPECTED ACROSS THE VALLEY LOCATIONS WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THIS PART OF THE 
FORECAST BEGINS WITH A WEAK UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA THAT THE 
MODELS AGREE WILL WEAKEN IN LATER PERIODS AND WITH THE GFS ALSO 
RETROGRADING THIS RIDGE WWD...LEAVING US IN MORE OF A NWLY UPPER 
FLOW. OTHER MODELS SEEM TO LEAVE REMNANTS OF THE RIDGE OVER THE 
AREA.  AT ANY RATE...WE SHOULD BE OUT OF THE MAIN STORM 
TRACK...HOWEVER THERE WILL BE ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE/INSTABILITY 
AS WELL AS A WEAK CAP TO ALLOW DIURNAL CONVECTION ESPECIALLY IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND AREAS DOWNSTREAM.  THERE COULD BE A COLD 
FRONT THAT SNEAKS THROUGH IN THE LATTER PERIODS...MODELS NOT SHOWING 
GOOD CONSISTENCY ON THE PLACEMENT OF THIS FRONT.  EDGED TEMPS DOWN A 
BIT TO ALLOW FOR THIS COOLING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

623 
FXUS64 KMRX 010716
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EDT TUE MAY 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
SHOWERS ACROSS KY ARE ON THE TAIL END OF A DEPARTING SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH. SOME OF THESE SHOWERS MAY CLIP THE EXTREME NORTHERN FRINGES 
OF THE CWA THIS MORNING. ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT IS 
EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON AHEAD OF ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW OVER 
THE PLAINS. NORTHERN AREAS WILL BE FAVORED AS IT TRACKS ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT ALL LOCATIONS 
COULD SEE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON AS THE 
CAP IS QUITE WEAK. WITH THE NAM SHOWING MLCAPE VALUES OF 1500-2000 
J/KG THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...LARGE HAIL WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH 
ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP.

THE RIDGE OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST WILL RETROGRADE THROUGH 
THURSDAY...BECOMING CENTERED OVER UPSTATE SC. A RIDGE AXIS WILL BE 
EXTENDING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...AND THIS WILL STRENGTHEN 
THE MIDLEVEL CAP AND SUPPRESS CONVECTION WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. IT 
WILL ALSO PROVIDE THE WARMEST TEMPS OF THE YEAR SO FAR...WITH HIGHS 
AROUND 90 IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY TO UPPER 80S NORTH BOTH DAYS. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE
FORECAST WITH THE GFS SOMEWHAT MORE AMPLIFIED WITH BREAKING DOWN
SOUTHEASTERN STATES RIDGE AS A DEEP UPPER LOW DROPS SOUTHEAST FROM
VICINITY OF HUDSON BAY ON FRIDAY ENDING UP OVER NEW ENGLAND ON
MONDAY. THE GFS BRINGS A SYNOPTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY THROUGH THE AREA
ON SUNDAY WITH RELATIVELY SIGNIFICANT COOLING SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY. STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE ECMWF/CMC WHICH ARE LESS
EAGER TO BRING A FRONTAL BOUNDARY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. THE
MODELS DO SEEM TO AGREE ON THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME MCS ACTIVITY
MOVING THROUGH THE DEVELOPING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AROUND THE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY TIME FRAME.
THEREFORE USED A LOW CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION NORTHERN TWO THIRDS
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ON MONDAY WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF THE FRONTAL
BOUNDARY MAKING PROGRESS INTO THE REGION. STAYED RATHER CLOSE TO
MEX MOS TEMPS THROUGH SATURDAY AND THEN HAD TO ADJUST SEVERAL
DEGREES HIGHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

WERE INTRODUCED FOR NOW FOR BOTH MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT.

SUGGEST STAYING SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO...ESPECIALLY FOR MAXES.
30/12Z GFSX MOS MAXES WERE JUST ABOUT AS WARM AS 30/00Z MAXES...SO
I NUDGED HIGHS MOST DAYS MUCH CLOSER TO AT LEAST THE 30/00Z NUMBERS.

549 
FXUS64 KMRX 291907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT SUN APR 29 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...TEMPS WELL INTO THE 70S TO MID
80S THIS AFTERNOON AND OUR WARM AIR ALOFT CONTINUES TO CAP OFF ANY
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. NOT THAT MUCH WOULD DEVELOP ANYAWAY...AS 
LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE HAS BEEN VERY LACKING OVER OUR FORECAST AREA. 
DEW POINT TEMPS VERY CLOSE TO YESTERDAY AND I THINK THAT CUMULUS
CLOUDS DISSIPATE AND DEBRIS CLOUDS THIN OUT AFTER MIDNIGHT. THIS
SHOULD FAVOR THE COOLER GFS MOS MINS. ADDED SOME PATCHY FOG IN THE
VALLEYS LATE TONIGHT.

FOR MONDAY...GFS IS PROBABLY A LITTLE ROBUST WITH COVERAGE OF
CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION IN THE 18Z TO 00Z PERIOD. NAM SOUNDINGS
SHOW THE CAPPING INVERSION A BIT WEAKER FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON...
BUT I JUST DON'T SEE ENOUGH OF A FOCUS FOR MORE THAN ISOLATED TSRA. 
THUS...I KEPT OUR MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR THE NRN AREAS
PLUS THE SMOKIES. NAM COULD VERY WELL BE CORRECT...WHICH WOULD
YIELD DRY AGAIN. A BIT WARMER EACH DAY...BUT I STAYED A DEGREE OR
TWO BELOW THE WARMER GFS MOS. THIS STILL PRODUCES NEAR RECORD HIGH
FOR TRI FOR 4/30...WITH RECORD HIGH 86 DEGREES IN 1986 AND 1970.
LOWER 90S ARE RECORD HIGHS FOR CHA/TYS...SO OUT OF REACH FOR NOW. 


.LONG TERM...MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT 
WAVES WILL RIDE ALONG AN OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY POSITIONED TO OUR NORTH 
EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL ALLOW OCCASIONAL SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE ACROSS THE MRX CWA...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN 
AREAS.  STRONGEST OF THE WAVES MOVES THROUGH ON TUESDAY...PROVIDING OUR 
BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION THROUGH THE EXTENDED.  THE BOUNDARY LIFT 
FURTHER NORTH OF THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...LIMITING 
CONVECTION TO MAINLY NORTHERN AREAS AS WELL AS THE POTENTIAL FOR 
DIURNAL CONVECTION OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  WILL LEAVE LOW POPS ACROSS 
THE AREA FOR FRIDAY AND AGAIN ON SATURDAY.  KEPT THINGS DRY ON

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...18Z SURFACE MAP WOULD PLACE

COUNTIES OF E TN. CONSIDERING HOW MUCH FOG OCCURRED OVER SE TN
FRIDAY NIGHT...I CHOSE TO INCLUDE PATCHY FOG AGAIN FOR THAT AREA.

POSSIBLY SOME CLOUD COVER OVER NRN AREAS TONIGHT.

OPTED TO LOWER OR REMOVE POPS FOR SUNDAY. I AM NOT SURE HOW MUCH OF

DRIFTS BACK THIS FAR SOUTH?). DROPPED POPS FOR SE TN/SW NC AND

THE NAM MOS HIGHS (GFS WAS FEW DEGS WARMER).

DISTURBANCES WILL TRACK ALONG A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO 
OUR NORTH EARLY IN THE EXTENDED...BRINGING OCCASIONAL CONVECTION 
INTO THE MRX CWA.  CONVECTIVE COVERAGE WILL BE LIGHT AND CONFINED 
MAINLY TO NORTHERN AREAS.  BEST CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT/TUESDAY AS THE MOST SIGNIFICANT 
OF THE WEAK DISTURBANCES MOVES THROUGH.  UPPER RIDGE TO OUR 
SOUTHEAST STRENGTHENS ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...LIMITING CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION...WILL KEEP MENTION OF SLIGHT POPS MAINLY NORTH AND ACROSS 
OF HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  A WEAK FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON FRIDAY FOR 
ANOTHER SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS.  WILL GO DRY ON 
SATURDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.

PROXIMITY TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...

IMPULSES MOVES THROUGH THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. MAIN

MAY REACH INTO THE CHA AREA...THOUGH COVERAGE SHOULD BE MINIMAL AND 
WILL NOT MENTION IN THE TAF AT THIS POINT.  THE BOUNDARY WILL LIFT 
NORTH ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT...CARRYING IN OCCASIONAL BANDS OF 
CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY A STRAY SHOWER.  FAIR SKIES EARLY SATURDAY AS 
WEAK RIDGING TRIES TO BUILD IN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 AM EDT THU APR 26 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ACTIVE WEATHER DAY ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE WEATHER ANTICIPATED. RADAR 
AND SATELLITE SHOWS AN AREA OF CONVECTION ACROSS WESTERN 
KENTUCKY...SOUTHERN ILLINOIS...AND SOUTHERN INDIANA. THESE STORMS 
ARE IN RESPONSE TO A 90-100KT UPPER JET MOVING SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY. THE LEFT EXIT REGION OF THE JET IS PRODUCING 
DIVERGENCE ALOFT. ALSO...WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS SITUATED ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. THIS BOUNDARY ALONG 
WITH AN INCOMING WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS.  SOME OF THESE STORMS WILL LIKELY BECOME SEVERE WITH 
THE MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND HEAVY 
RAINFALL. ISOLATED TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE GIVEN THE EXPECTED 
SHEAR...BUT MAINLY ASSOCIATED WITH BOW FEATURES.

THIS BOUNDARY WILL MOVE SOUTH OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT ENDING THE 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION. PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO KEEP SKIES 
MOSTLY CLOUDY OVERNIGHT. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE 
PERIODS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...OVERALL...THE DAYS IN THIS 
PART OF THE FORECAST WILL HAVE VERY LITTLE SIGNIFICANT UPPER LEVEL 
DYNAMICS PASSING THROUGH THE REGION...BUT AT THE SURFACE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARIES WILL BE IN THE AREA QUITE A BIT THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

AT THE START OF THIS PERIOD A STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE 
LOCATED JUST SOUTH OF THE CWA...ORIENTED W-E ACROSS N GA.  DURING 
THE DAY ON FRIDAY THE BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO LIFT NORTHWARD INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY.  HOWEVER...THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO SURGE SOUTHWARD 
AGAIN AS A SURFACE LOW ZIPS EASTWARD TO OUR NORTH AROUND SUNDAY.  

HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY STARTS TO BUILD INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE 
FRONT...BUT THEN SHIFTS TO BUILD MORE EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...RESULTING IN MORE OF A BACKDOOR FRONTAL SITUATION FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.  RETURN FLOW STARTS IN THE MISS VALLEY 
QUICKLY...AND BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD ON WENDESDAY...THE 
RETURN FLOW SHOULD BE GETTING ESTABLISHED HERE AS WELL.  WITH GOOD 
AGREEMENT ON THIS RETURN FLOW...BUMPED UP DEW POINTS IN THE SOUTHERN 
AREAS AS KCHA SEEMED TOO LOW FOR LAST 24-36 HOURS OF FORECAST.  ALSO 
BUMPED UP MIN TEMP SLIGHTLY FOR TUE AND WED NIGHTS IN THE SOUTH.  

ALTHOUGH THUNDER IS POSSIBLE IN SOME OF THESE PERIODS...LOOKS LIKE 
SEVERE THREATS WILL BE LOW.

PRESSURE SYSTEM IS NOT EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL

MAY COMPLETELY DRIFT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY MORNING...

LAKES SHORT WAVE RIPS EAST. THE COLD FRONT MOVES OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION ON SUNDAY AND MAINTAINED MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR 
CONVECTION AS THE BOUNDARY SHIFTS SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS THE REGION. 
BASICALLY STEADILY BACK OFF PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION SUNDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF A FOCUS FOR RAIN WITH

AFTERNOON AND VFR FLIGHT WILL BE THE RULE. THERE IS A SMALL CHANCE
THAT A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL BUILD ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AROUND 01Z THURSDAY AND LATER AS SOME OF THE ONGOING
CONVECTION OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DRIFTS EAST.
HOWEVER...THE BEST CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
AROUND 05Z THROUGH 10Z THURSDAY AS MODELS SEEM TO AGREE THAT A
THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY THIS
EVENING...EVENTUALLY BUILDING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
LATER TONIGHT. THE BEST LIKELIHOOD FOR CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION
WILL BE AT TRI WITH SLIGHTLY LOWER PROBABILITY AT TYS AND CHA. USED
AN MVFR CEILING AT TRI BUT THERE IS A CHANCE THAT IT MAY LOWER TO
IFR AROUND DAYBREAK WITH SUFFICIENT RAINFALL IN THIS AREA.
BASICALLY HAVE THE FORECASTS MAINTAINING OR TRENDING TO VFR
EVERYWHERE BY 15Z THURSDAY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$



929 
FXUS64 KMRX 251401
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT WED APR 25 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE 
UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WARM FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHEAST OF IT 
ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND INTO SOUTHEAST TN. THIS WARM 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON...BRINGING A WARMER AND MORE MOIST AIR MASS INTO THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY RESULTING IN A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE A CAPPING STABLE LAYER BETWEEN 900 AND 700 MB 
THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS MOST CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON TO ACCOUNT FOR SOME POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE PENETRATION OF 
THIS CAP. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO TWEAK 
TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS...AND TO REMOVE ANY 
MENTION OF MORNING PRECIP.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN             78  60  76  61  79 /  20  50  50  50  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    75  57  76  56  76 /  20  60  60  30  40

564 
FXUS64 KMRX 250714
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT WED APR 25 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WARM FRONT WILL PULL NORTH
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT IS CURRENTLY
PRODUCING AN AREA OF SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS AREA OF SHOWERS WILL DIMINISH BY MID-
MORNING AS LIFT WEAKENS. MODELS SHOW INCREASING MOISTURE AND
INSTABILITY FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS WARM FRONT PULLS
NORTHEAST. ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO WARRANT INCLUSION OF A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. FOR TONIGHT...A SHORT-WAVE
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH DIFLUENCE ALOFT AND
INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT AIDING TO PRODUCE AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. STEERING WINDS WILL PULL THIS AREA SOUTHEAST INTO
THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST OVERNIGHT. WILL HAVE HIGHEST
POPS TONIGHT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. 

ISOLATED STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE. MAIN
CONCERN HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS ALONG WITH HEAVY RAIN.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARIES ARE MAJOR 
FACTORS FOR THE EARLY PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM...WITH A COLD FRONT 
SAGGING SOUTHWARD THURSDAY FROM THE SOUTHERN OHIO VALLEY. THIS FRONT 
SHOULD MAKE IT INTO EXTREME SRN PARTS OF TN ACROSS THE NC-SC STATE 
LINE BY FRIDAY MORNING...THEN MOVES NE AS A WARM FRONT. ADJUSTED 
POPS A BIT TO BETTER FIT THE LATEST MODEL TRENDS...AND OPTED TO 
NUDGE POPS UP A BIT ON THURSDAY IN LINE WITH GFS/ECMWF AND CANADIAN 
MODELS. THESE ALL ADVERTISE A GOOD SWATH OF CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION 
WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. TEMPS ALSO TWEAKED ACCORDINGLY.

UPPER FLOW AND SURFACE FEATURES A BIT UNCERTAIN FOR THE WEEKEND...
THEN SOME UPPER RIDGING ON MONDAY. THUS...MADE LITTLE CHANGES FOR 
NOW FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS...WITH POPS FOR THE WEEKEND AND DRY ON 
MONDAY. GFSX MOS TEMPS HAVE FLUCTUATED CONSIDERABLY FROM 24/00Z TO 
25/00Z RUNS...SO TRIED TO KEEP SOME CONTINUITY AND STAY IN LINE WITH 
NEIGHBORING NWS GRIDS. 

GFSX MOS CONTINUES TO CARRY NEAR OR ABOVE CLIMO POPS FOR TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT...PLUS NWS NEIGHBORS HAVE POPS FOR DAY 7. FELT IT WAS 
PRUDENT TO INTRODUCE POPS FOR BOTH TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...IN 
LINE WITH A BLEND OF 24/12Z AND 25/00Z GFSX MOS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             79  59  80  62  82 /  20  30  30  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  76  60  77  61  81 /  20  50  40  50  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       77  60  76  61  79 /  20  50  50  50  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              72  54  76  56  76 /  30  60  60  30  40

818 
FXUS64 KMRX 250148 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
948 PM EDT TUE APR 24 2012

.DISCUSSION...
MIDLEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND UPPER LEVEL JET STREACK ARE BRINGING
OVERCAST CLOUDS AND LIGHT RAIN TO MUCH OF THE AREA THIS EVENING.
OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS...CENTRAL AREAS WILL SEE THE MOST
PRECIP...THEN TRANSITION INTO NORTHERN AREAS LATER TONIGHT AS THE
JET BEGINS TO PULL EASTWARD. ADJUSTED POPS UPWARD CENTRAL AND NORTH
INTO THE LIKELY RANGE...BUT POPS SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT IN MOST
SPOTS...GENERALLY LESS THAN A QUARTER INCH. UPSTREAM PRECIP THAT
IS PROJECTED TO AFFECT SOUTHERN AREAS APPEARS MORE SPOTTY AND
SCATTERED. SLIGHT TEMPERATURE AND DEWPOINT ADJUSTMENTS WERE MADE TO
ALIGN BETTER WITH OBSERVATIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 241905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT TUE APR 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH 
THE AREA BRINGING A CHANCE OF RAIN TONIGHT AND INTO WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT IS TONIGHT SO WILL CONTINUE WITH THE 
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR TONIGHT. INSTABILITY WILL BE INCREASING SO A 
THUNDERSTORMS BE POSSIBLE ON WEDNESDAY BUT COVERAGE SHOULD BE LIMITED. 
IT SHOULD BE WARMER TONIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE 
FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...SO STAYED CLOSE.  



.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS HAVE COME INTO 
BETTER AGREEMENT SINCE 24 HOURS AGO...BUT STILL SOME DIFFERENCES 
ESPECIALLY FROM FRIDAY ON. FORECAST CONFIDENCE HAS RISEN TO ABOUT 
AVERAGE.  A PIECE OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY IS FORECAST TO MOVE ACROSS 
WED NIGHT...THEN A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO SAG INTO THE AREA 
THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT.  THIS WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE AREA EARLY ON.  WILL GO LIKELY NORTH WED 
NIGHT...OTHERWISE CHANCE POPS.  HOW FAR SOUTH THE FRONT WILL MAKE IT 
BEFORE RETREATING BACK NORTH IS STILL PROBLEMATIC.  ECMWF/GFS IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH CMC FURTHER SOUTH.  WILL LEAN TOWARD A 
ECMWF/GFS BLEND AND WILL KEEP BEST CHANCES FOR ANY PRECIP NORTH 
FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH DRY FORECAST FOR SOUTHERN ZONES.  SLIGHT 
CHANCE ALL AREAS SATURDAY...BUT WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED IF SAT IS 
PRECIP FREE.  ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH SAT NIGHT/SUNDAY 
WITH BETTER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION. HIGH PRESSURE FORECAST TO BUILD 
IN BEHIND THE FRONT.  WILL GO DRY MONDAY AND TUESDAY.


242 
FXUS64 KMRX 241415
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT TUE APR 24 2012

.DISCUSSION...LATEST MODELS INDICATING A WEAK TROUGH ENTERING THE 
AREA BY LATE IN THE DAY. WILL BUMP UP POPS A BIT FOR THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF FORECAST ON TRACK...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A DRY SLOT NOTED ON WATER VAPOR
SATELLITE PICS IS MOVING ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING.
PRESSURE GRADIENT HAD RELAXED A BIT...SO WAS ABLE TO CANCEL THE
WIND ADVISORY A FEW HOURS EARLY. HOURLY TEMPS IN GENERAL HAVE BEEN
RUNNING ABOVE FORECAST GRIDS...ALTHO SOME SHELTERED/OUTLYING AREAS
PROBABLY COULD SEE A BIT OF FROST THIS MORNING...AND MINS SHOULD
FALL TO OR BELOW FREEZING IN THE WARNING AREA. 

WARM AIR ADVECTION DEVELOPS LATER TODAY...BRINGING AN INCREASE IN
CLOUDS AND SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS BY THIS EVENING. NOT ANY
SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY OR ELEVATED UNTIL WEDNESDAY...SO KEPT
THUNDER OUT FOR NOW. MOS MAXES WERE CLOSE AND I FOLLOWED...NOTING
THAT GFS MAXES WERE ON THE MARK FOR MONDAY. WARMER NAM MOS MINS A
BETTER CHOICE FOR TONIGHT...AND A MOS BLEND FOR NE TN AND SW VA.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS SHOW A WARM FRONT 
LIFTING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WEDNESDAY. GFS AND NAM SHOW DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE AREA FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...GFS HOLDS OFF ON CONVECTION 
UNTIL EVENING DUE TO A FAIRLY STRONG 800MB INVERSION. BY EVENING...
CAP WEAKENS ALLOWING SCATTERED-BROKEN CONVECTION TO DEVELOP. DECENT 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE STRONG TO POSSIBLY SCATTERED SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS LATE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY EVENING. MAIN CONCERN 
WILL BE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS.

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...A NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. THIS 
TROUGH WILL PULL A COLD FRONT BACK INTO THE AREA. MODELS DIFFER ON 
HOW FAR SOUTH FRONT GOES...BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS 
AREA-WIDE WITH GREATEST CHANCES OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND...A SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVES EAST OUT 
FRO THE ROCKIES INTO THE PLAINS. THE GFS KEEPS THIS WAVE GENERALLY 
SEPARATE WITH LITTLE TO NO PHASING WITH A NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORT-WAVE. THE ECMWF SHOWS MUCH MORE PHASING WITH THE NORTHERN 
STREAM WAVE. EITHER WAY...THE COLD FRONT WILL BECOME 
QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY THEN LIFT NORTH UNTIL 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH DURING THE WEEKEND. THESE SYSTEMS 
WILL KEEP THE FORECAST UNSETTLED WITH CHANCES OF CONVECTION EACH 
DAY. BEST CHANCES WILL BE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA DUE 
ITS CLOSER PROXIMITY TO THE WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MEX MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  49  77  59  83 /  20  40  20  20  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  46  75  58  79 /  20  60  20  40  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  46  74  59  79 /  20  60  20  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              60  37  71  52  78 /  20  40  10  50  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...FREEZE WARNING UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...NONE.

.AVIATION...VFR CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING AND 
WINDS AT TAF SITES HAVE SWITCHED TO WSW...WITH MUCH LESS GUSTINESS.
I EXPECT CLOUDS TO INCREASE BY LATE THIS MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON 
AS WARM AIR ADVECTION SPREADS OUR WAY. ALONG WITH THE CLOUDS (VFR 
HEIGHTS) MAY COME SOME LIGHT RAIN TOWARD THE EARLY EVENING HOURS. 

CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION MAY ARRIVE AFTER 12Z WEDNESDAY...BUT TIMING 
OF THIS IS UNCERTAIN JUST YET. MORE ON THIS IN THE NEXT AFD/12Z TAF 
PACKAGE.

1000 PM EDT MON APR 23 2012

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LOW PULLING OUT OF THE REGION TONIGHT.  WILL 
CONTINUE TO SEE A TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT THROUGH THE NIGHT WHICH 
WILL KEEP A STRONG WIND FIELD IN PLACE FOR BREEZY...GUSTY 
WINDS...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  A WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN 
PLACE FOR NEED AREAS TONIGHT.  WINDS ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
VALLEY SHOULD DECREASE THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT.  IT WILL BE ANOTHER 
COLD NIGHT WITH FREEZING CONDITIONS EXPECTED OVER THE EAST TN 
MOUNTAINS.  A FREEZING WARNING IS IN PLACE.  PATCHY FROST IS 
POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE AREA.  ALL ON 
TRACK IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...NO UPDATES EXPECTED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
721 PM EDT MON APR 23 2012

.AVIATION...
VFR CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST THROUGH THE PERIOD. WINDS ARE THE MAIN
AVIATION CONCERN...WITH GUSTS OF 20-25 KTS LASTING FOR ANOTHER HOUR
OR TWO THIS EVENING. GUSTS SHOULD DROP OFF AFTER SUNSET WITH
SUSTAINED WINDS AROUND 8-10 KTS...BUT WILL PICK BACK UP AGAIN AFTER
SUNRISE TOMORROW...MAINLY AT TRI. CHA AND TYS ARE LESS LIKELY TO
SEE GUSTY WINDS TOMORROW...BUT THERE COULD BE A FEW UNDER 20 KTS AT
TIMES.

FXUS64 KMRX 231912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT MON APR 23 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING 
OUT OF THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT. THE GUSTY WINDS SHOULD 
DIMINISHING IN THE EVENING. WILL LEAVE THE WIND ADVISORY AND FREEZE 
WARNING AND AREAS OF PATCHY FROST AS IS. A SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH 
THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AND LIFT...WILL 
KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR TUESDAY. IT WILL BE BREEZY AGAIN ON 
TUESDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT EARLY ON...THEN POOR MODEL AGREEMENT AND CONSISTENCY FOR 
FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS BELOW 
AVERAGE...ESPECIALLY AFTER THE FIRST FEW PERIODS.  EASTERN TROUGH 
WILL GRADUALLY BE LIFTING OUT EARLY IN THE PERIOD...AND WARMER AIR 
WILL START TO MOVE IN. WILL SEE SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT EARLY 
ALONG WITH A COUPLE OF SHOTS OF WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY...SO LOOKS 
LIKE AT LEAST CHANCE POPS WARRANTED ESPECIALLY TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
AGAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  BETTER POPS NORTH WED 
NIGHT/THURSDAY AS A SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL ALSO BE SAGGING TOWARD 
THE AREA.  FURTHER OUT BECOMES PROBLEMATIC SINCE FRONT WILL BE 
LINGERING BUT SIGNIFICANT MODEL DIFFERENCES ABOUT WHERE. MAY END UP 
BEING DRY IF GFS IS CORRECT AT LEAST SOUTHERN HALF FRIDAY AND ALL 
AREAS SATURDAY...BUT GIVEN UNCERTAINTY AND CURRENT FORECAST WILL 
LEAN TOWARD A GFS/ECMWF BLEND.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH CHANCE POPS ON SUNDAY AS 
ANOTHER FRONT SHOULD BE PUSHING IN.  DRY MONDAY FOR NOW BEHIND THE 
FRONT.

148 
FXUS64 KMRX 231407
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 AM EDT MON APR 23 2012

.DISCUSSION...RADAR COVERAGE DECREASING SO WILL CONTINUING WITH 
THE DECREASING POPS FOR TODAY. IT SHOULD BE BREEZY SO WILL CONTINUE 
THE ADVISORY.  TEMPERATURE AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK...WILL UPDATE TO LOWER POPS FOR TODAY. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR RETURNS HAVE BEEN RATHER 
SPARSE AND WEAK SO FAR OVERNIGHT...BUT MOISTURE DOES APPEAR TO BE 
ROTATING SOUTH FROM THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. MODEL FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS FOR THIS MORNING DO SHOW STEEP LAPSE RATES AND CAPES OF 
AROUND 50 J/KG OR HIGHER. THUS...I STILL EXPECT SOME SHOWERS TO 
DEVELOP AND PASS ACROSS AT LEAST SW VA AND NE TN DURING THE MORNING 
HOURS. SOME SHOWERS WILL BE RAIN...SOME SNOW. INTERNET ACCESS HAS 
BEEN DOWN THIS MORNING...BUT PER 12 PLANET CHAT WINTER WEATHER DESK 
GRAPHICS ARE MUCH MORE IN LINE WITH THE DRIER NAM QPF AND LESSER 
SNOW AMOUNTS FROM THE NAM MODEL (GFS HEAVY QPF AND HEAVIER SNOW 
AMOUNTS NOT A GOOD CHOICE). NW LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW IS A POSITIVE 
FOR SNOW SHOWERS...BUT SURFACE AND BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS DON'T FAVOR 
MUCH SNOW. THUS...BACKED OFF SNOW JUST A BIT.

OTHERWISE...WINDS ARE INCREASING AND SHOULD BECOME QUITE GUSTY LATER 
THIS MORNING THROUGH THE DAY. WIND ADVISORY IS ON TRACK WITH NO 
CHANGES MADE. WINDS INHIBIT FROST TONIGHT...BUT I AGREE WITH 
NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES ON A FREEZE WARNING FOR SMOKIES AND NRN 
MTNS...RUNNING FROM 4AM TO 9AM TUESDAY.

MOS GUIDANCE GENERALLY FOLLOWED EXCEPT FOR UNDERCUTTING MOS FOR 
HIGHS TODAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD UPPER TROUGH BEGINS
TO SHIFT EAST TUESDAY. SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVES SOUTHEAST INTO THE
FORECAST AREA AROUND STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGE ACROSS EASTERN TWO
THIRDS OF THE COUNTRY. THIS WILL INCREASE CLOUDS ACROSS THE REGION
KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE AREA AND ALLOW WINDS TO
STY FAIRLY STRONG FROM THE WEST TO NORTHWEST. TEMPERATURES WILL
WARM INTO THE 60S EXCEPT UPPER 50S NORTHEAST AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
ANOTHER WEAK DISTURBANCE OR TWO WILL CONTINUE THIS PATTERN TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AND A WARM FRONT WILL HELP TO TRIGGER MORE
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS AS WARMER MORE UNSTABLE AIR MASS
MOVES IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST WEDNESDAY. BEST PRECIPITATION CHANCES
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AS NEXT COLD FRONT
APPROACHES AND THEN PASSES THROUGH. FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY THE
COLD FRONT COMES BACK THROUGH AS A WARM FRONT AND YET ANOTHER
SYSTEM WILL KEEP SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE SUNDAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MORE SEASONAL FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S AND 70S AND LOWS IN THE 40S AND 50S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             59  40  67  47  76 /  10   0  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  55  37  61  45  74 /  10  10  10  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  38  62  46  73 /  10  10  10  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              50  30  58  38  68 /  50  10  20  30  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 8 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     ANDERSON...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...
     MORGAN...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...ROANE...
     SCOTT TN...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...UNION...WASHINGTON 
     TN.

     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...

     SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

FXUS64 KMRX 231134
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
735 AM EDT MON APR 23 2012

.AVIATION...STILL WAITING FOR SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION TO REACH TRI 
AND MVFR CEILINGS ARE POSSIBLE THERE THIS MORNING. MAIN CONCERN WILL 
BE INCREASING NW-N WINDS...AND I EXPECT A NOTABLE INCREASE AND 
GUSTINESS BY 15Z TODAY. WINDS SHOULD TAPER OFF BY OR AFTER 24/00Z 
WITH MAINLY VFR THRU 12Z TUESDAY.

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR RETURNS HAVE BEEN RATHER 
SPARSE AND WEAK SO FAR OVERNIGHT...BUT MOISTURE DOES APPEAR TO BE 
ROTATING SOUTH FROM THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. MODEL FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS FOR THIS MORNING DO SHOW STEEP LAPSE RATES AND CAPES OF 
AROUND 50 J/KG OR HIGHER. THUS...I STILL EXPECT SOME SHOWERS TO 
DEVELOP AND PASS ACROSS AT LEAST SW VA AND NE TN DURING THE MORNING 
HOURS. SOME SHOWERS WILL BE RAIN...SOME SNOW. INTERNET ACCESS HAS 
BEEN DOWN THIS MORNING...BUT PER 12 PLANET CHAT WINTER WEATHER DESK 
GRAPHICS ARE MUCH MORE IN LINE WITH THE DRIER NAM QPF AND LESSER 
SNOW AMOUNTS FROM THE NAM MODEL (GFS HEAVY QPF AND HEAVIER SNOW 
AMOUNTS NOT A GOOD CHOICE). NW LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW IS A POSITIVE 
FOR SNOW SHOWERS...BUT SURFACE AND BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS DON'T FAVOR 
MUCH SNOW. THUS...BACKED OFF SNOW JUST A BIT.

OTHERWISE...WINDS ARE INCREASING AND SHOULD BECOME QUITE GUSTY LATER 
THIS MORNING THROUGH THE DAY. WIND ADVISORY IS ON TRACK WITH NO 
CHANGES MADE. WINDS INHIBIT FROST TONIGHT...BUT I AGREE WITH 
NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES ON A FREEZE WARNING FOR SMOKIES AND NRN 
MTNS...RUNNING FROM 4AM TO 9AM TUESDAY.

MOS GUIDANCE GENERALLY FOLLOWED EXCEPT FOR UNDERCUTTING MOS FOR 
HIGHS TODAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD UPPER TROUGH BEGINS
TO SHIFT EAST TUESDAY. SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVES SOUTHEAST INTO THE
FORECAST AREA AROUND STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGE ACROSS EASTERN TWO
THIRDS OF THE COUNTRY. THIS WILL INCREASE CLOUDS ACROSS THE REGION
KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE AREA AND ALLOW WINDS TO
STY FAIRLY STRONG FROM THE WEST TO NORTHWEST. TEMPERATURES WILL
WARM INTO THE 60S EXCEPT UPPER 50S NORTHEAST AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
ANOTHER WEAK DISTURBANCE OR TWO WILL CONTINUE THIS PATTERN TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AND A WARM FRONT WILL HELP TO TRIGGER MORE
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS AS WARMER MORE UNSTABLE AIR MASS
MOVES IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST WEDNESDAY. BEST PRECIPITATION CHANCES
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AS NEXT COLD FRONT
APPROACHES AND THEN PASSES THROUGH. FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY THE
COLD FRONT COMES BACK THROUGH AS A WARM FRONT AND YET ANOTHER
SYSTEM WILL KEEP SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE SUNDAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MORE SEASONAL FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S AND 70S AND LOWS IN THE 40S AND 50S.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT SUN APR 22 2012

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LOW OVER THE REGION WILL ROTATE THROUGH A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVERNIGHT.  OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS...MAINLY ABOVE 
3000 FEET ...TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW.  WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE AND COVERAGE...EXPECT SNOW AMOUNTS TO AVERAGE LESS 
THAN 2 INCHES AND GENERALLY CONFINED TO FAVORED UPSLOPE LOCATIONS.  
MAIN CONCERN OVERNIGHT WILL BE INCREASE WINDS OVER THE AREA... 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN.  NORTHWEST WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO 
INCREASE TO 20 TO 30 WITH GUSTS TO 40 MPH.  A WIND ADVISORY IS IN 
EFFECT OF THESE LOCATIONS.  ADDITIONALLY...WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO 
BRING IN COOLER AIR AND OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE 30S ACROSS 
MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS...AND INTO THE UPPER 20S IN THE MOUNTAIN 
AREAS.  ALL LOOKS GOOD IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...HAVE ADDED LOW POPS 
TO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS AND WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING.

&&

.AVIATION...

VFR. CLOUDS MAY BECOME SCATTERED TO BROKEN BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON AS

FROM THE N-NW WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE DAY AS STRONG LOW PRESSURE
TRACKS UP THE ATLANTIC COASTLINE.

FXUS64 KMRX 221944
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EDT SUN APR 22 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW TRACKING SE THROUGH
KY AND WILL SLIDE SW VA TONIGHT. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OFF NC COAST 
WILL DEEPEN AND MOVE INTO PA. NW WINDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AND 
CONTINUE STRONG THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. NW FLOW PATTERN PRECIPITATION 
A GOOD BET OVERNIGHT WITH SEVERAL HOURS WITH HIGH RH IN THE SNOW 
GROWTH REGION. FREEZING LEVEL WILL FALL TO AROUND 3000 FEET WITH 
WILL ALLOW FOR SOME SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 
LOWER ELEVATION MAY SEE SOME SNOW BUT SURFACE TEMPERATURE TOO WARM 
FOR ACCUMULATIONS. POWER LINES AND TREES MAY BE STRESSED BY THE 
HEAVY NATURE OF THE SNOW. GOOD SNOWFALL POTENTIAL BUT ACCUMULATION 
WILL BE DIFFICULT AND BRIEF. BRISK WIND AND LOW WINDS CHILLS VALUES 
WILL BE THE MOST REALIZED CONDITIONS COME MONDAY MORNING. THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY MONDAY MORNING SO 
PRECIPITATION SHOULD TAPER OFF BY AFTERNOON. THE STRONG WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE AND WITH GOOD MIXING THE WIND ADVISORY MAY HAVE TO BE 
EXTENDED INTO CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS ON MONDAY. COLD 
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY NIGHT. THE WINDS WILL ALSO 
REMAIN STRONG MOST AREAS. THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL LIKELY SEE 
FREEZING TEMPERATURES. NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SW VA LOWER 
ELEVATIONS WILL BE CLOSE TO FROST FREEZE CONDITIONS PENDING THE 
STRENGTH OF THE EARLY MORNING WINDS. A SPEED MAX MOVES INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NW ON TUE WHICH MAY BRING SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION TO THE 
NORTHERN AREAS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK TROUGH TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE 
REMAINS NORTH AGAIN SO WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH. A 
FRONT ENTERS THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY 
NIGHT SO WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS GOING. THE FRONT LINGERS ACROSS 
THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...SO WILL KEEP THE 20 PERCENT 
CHANCE GOING. ANOTHER TROUGH ENTERS THE REGION ON SUNDAY. WITH STILL 
UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND STRENGTH...WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.  
STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

717 
FXUS64 KMRX 221508
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SUN APR 22 2012

.DISCUSSION...WILL SEE SOME CLEARING ACROSS SW AREAS TODAY. NE AREAS 
SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH CHANCE FOR LIGHT PRECIPITATION. 
LOWERED NE TEMPS A COUPLE DEGREES FOR TODAY. FREEZING DRIZZLE AND 
FREEZING FOG WILL LIKELY START OCCURRING ACROSS THE VERY HIGH 
ELEVATIONS THIS AFTERNOON. HAZARDOUS WINTER CONDITIONS APPEAR 
FAVORABLE FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW/VA E TN OVERNIGHT AND 
EARLY MONDAY. WILL MONITOR 12Z MODEL TRENDS FOR EXTENT OF THREAT 
OVERNIGHT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING NE THIS MORNING...AS A SHORTWAVE DROPS 
QUICKLY SE FROM IOWA/ILLINOIS. LOW PRESSURE DEEPENS OVER OHIO VALLEY 
AND SRN APPALACHIANS TODAY...AND WINDY CONDITIONS DEVELOP TONIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. WIND ADVISORY POSTED FOR THIS PERIOD DUE TO 
STRONG GRADIENT AND STRENGTH OF 850 MB WINDS.

RAIN CHANCES BUMPED UP FOR ESPECIALLY E AND NE AREAS...WITH A SWITCH 
TO SNOW SHOWERS FOR SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES LATE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY. 
TWEAKED SNOW AMOUNTS UP SOME IN FAVORED AREAS...BUT SEE NO NEED FOR 
AN ADVISORY AT THIS TIME. 

CURRENT HOURLY TEMPS WERE RUNNING ABOVE THE PREVIOUS FORECAST 
GRIDS...BUT STILL FAVORED THE COOLER NAM MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY. MOS 
MINS TONIGHT WERE QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. MUCH TOO WINDY 
FOR ANY AREAS OF FROST TONIGHT...AND PROBABLY SAME COULD BE SAID FOR 
MONDAY NIGHT. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...NW FLOW CONTINUES MONDAY 
INTO TUESDAY WITH SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE EARLY MONDAY WITH SOME LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN UNTIL 
ABOUT LATE MORNING. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES AS SURFACE 
LOW MOVES SLOWLY NE UP THE EAST COAST AND ACCOMPANYING UPPER LOW 
MOVES NORTH INTO CANADA. TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES COLDER 
MONDAY AND WENT ON THE LOW SIDE OR A DEGREE OR SO BELOW MAV 
GUIDANCE. INCREASED CLOUD COVER AS WELL MONDAY. WIND CHILL WILL 
AFFECT PEOPLE SINCE IT HAS BEEN SO WARM THIS SPRING. MONDAY NIGHT 
USED A BLEND ON TEMPERATURES EXCEPT CLOSE TO WARMER MET GUIDANCE UP 
NORTH WITH STRONG WINDS. FROST NOT LIKELY AS WINDS TO STRONG. SKIES 
SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT. TUESDAY WINDS STILL STRONG 
WITH TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BUT BEGIN TO RELAX TUESDAY NIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WARM WITH LESS CLOUD COVER TUESDAY. AS UPPER TROUGH 
SHIFTS EAST MOISTURE RIDES OVER TOP OF RIDGE OVER THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN 
STATES AND CLOUDS INCREASE WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. LOW PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND WARM FRONT 
EXTENDING INTO THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY WILL BE FOCUS FOR SHOWERS AND 
STILL WARMER TEMPERATURES. NEXT COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY. 
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE MAINLY SOUTH. FRIDAY FRONT PUSHES SOUTH FOR 
IMPROVING WEATHER BUT FRONT RETURNS NORTH FOR MORE SHOWERS SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  38  57  37  63 /  20  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  37  58  37  64 /  10  10  10  10  10

USED A BLEND ON TEMPERATURES EXCEPT CLOSE TO WARMER MET GUIDANCE UP

SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT. TUESDAY WINDS STILL STRONG
WITH TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BUT BEGIN TO RELAX TUESDAY NIGHT.
TEMPERATURES WARM WITH LESS CLOUD COVER TUESDAY. AS UPPER TROUGH
SHIFTS EAST MOISTURE RIDES OVER TOP OF RIDGE OVER THE ROCKY
MOUNTAIN STATES AND CLOUDS INCREASE WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY
WEDNESDAY MORNING. LOW PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND WARM
FRONT EXTENDING INTO THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY WILL BE FOCUS FOR
SHOWERS AND STILL WARMER TEMPERATURES. NEXT COLD FRONT MOVES
THROUGH THURSDAY. THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE MAINLY SOUTH. FRIDAY FRONT
PUSHES SOUTH FOR IMPROVING WEATHER BUT FRONT RETURNS NORTH FOR MORE
SHOWERS SATURDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 220207
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT SAT APR 21 2012

DISCUSSION...A FEW ISOALTED SHOWERS LINGERING ACROSS THE AREA WILL 
CONTINUE TO PULL AWAY AS A COLD FRONT EXITS THE REGION.  DRIER AND 
MUCH COOLER AIR HAS BEGUN TO SETTLE INTO THE MRX CWA BEHIND THE 
FRONT.  ADDITIONALLY...WINDS MAY BEGIN TO PICK UP OVERNIGHT...BUT 
THE STRONG...BREEZY WIND FIELD SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL SUNDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LARGE AREA OF SOUTHERN 
CONVECTION DID A GOOD JOB ROBBING PREFRONTAL MOISTURE AS WELL AS 
DISRUPTING UPPER LEVELS ACROSS E TN VALLEY TODAY. COLD FRONT 
CONTINUES TO MOVE SE THROUGH THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH PRESSURE 
FALLS ALREADY EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. PATTERN MAKING A DRAMATIC 
SHIFT THROUGH REMAINDER OF SHORT TERM. STRONG UPPER JET DIVING SE 
INTO WEST TN VALLEY ON SUNDAY WHILE SURFACE LOW DEEPENS AND MOVE N 
ALONG THE ATLANTIC COAST. UPPER JET CARVES DEEP TROUGH ABSORBING 
SOUTHERN SYSTEM WITH UPPER LOW CENTERED NEAR SOUTH CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS BY MONDAY. TONIGHT AND SUNDAY LIGHT PRECIPITATION 
POSSIBLE ...MAINLY ACROSS NE AREAS. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE AS 
PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS ACROSS MUCH OF SOUTHEAST ON SUNDAY AND 
MUCH OF THE EAST ON MONDAY. LATE SEASON NW FLOW PATTERN LOOKS 
INCREASINGLY IMPRESSIVE WITH LATEST MODEL RUNS. SCATTERED SHOWERS 
WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY ACROSS NE AREAS INCLUDING THE SMOKYS. 
FREEZING LEVEL DROPS TO AROUND 2000 FEET EARLY MONDAY. RAIN SHOWERS 
WILL BECOME MIXED WITH OR CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. GROUND TEMPERATURES WONT ALLOW FOR MUCH ACCUMULATION BUT 
HEAVY SNOW MAY IMPACT TREES ACROSS HIGH ELEVATIONS. NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WITH COOL DOWN KICKING INTO A HIGHER GEAR ON 
SUNDAY. STRONG WINDS WILL MAKE APPARENT TEMPERATURES MUCH COOLER 
THAN RECENT TRENDS. LOWS IN THE 30S WILL BE COMMON BY MONDAY 
MORNING. SOME CLEARING BUT CONTINUED COLD ON MONDAY. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK TROUGHS TRACK 
THROUGH OUR NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH SO WILL KEEP IT DRY FOR NOW. 
ANOTHER TROUGH TRACKS THROUGH ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH AGAIN SO WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS GOING FOR THURSDAY. THE FRONT 
SHIFT SOUTH ON FRIDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
737 AM EDT SAT APR 21 2012

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT THIS MORNING APPEARS TO BE FROM THE NE CORNER 
OF AL NE TO JUST WEST OF CSV AND INTO SE KY. SPOTTY SHRA DEVELOPING 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...WHILE MOST SHOWERS ARE OCCURRING ALONG AND 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. KEPT TSRA OUT OF TAFS...BUT CONDITIONS SHOULD 
TREND DOWNWARD TO AT LEAST MVFR LATER THIS MORNING. IFR QUITE 
POSSIBLE TONIGHT AS COLD AIR SPREADS IN AND AIRMASS REMAIN MOIST IN 
THE LOW LEVELS.

PREVIOUS AFD...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT APPARENTLY BETWEEN 
BNA AND CSV AT 07Z/3AM EDT...AND SHOULD EASE GRADUALLY EAST OF THE 
REGION BY THIS AFTERNOON. BEST COVERAGE OF CONVECTION THIS MORNING 
IS POST FRONTAL...OVER WRN PARTS OF MIDDLE TN NE INTO CENTRAL KY. I 
ADJUSTED INITIAL POPS DOWNWARD FOR THE MORNING HOURS...THEN BLENDED 
BACK INTO THE LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. 
INSTABILITY AND LIFT IS NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE TODAY...SO OPTED TO 
DOWNPLAY THUNDERSTORMS TO A SLIGHT CHANCE OR ISOLATED. 

UPSTREAM SHORTWAVE SHOULD CAUSE CLOUDS TO LINGER AS WELL AS A FEW 
SHOWERS TONIGHT. HOURLY TEMPS WERE RUNNING A BIT BEHIND PREVIOUS 
GRIDS...AND MAX TEMPS MAY STRUGGLE TO REACH EVEN THE COOLER NAM MOS 
HIGHS. STAYED MUCH CLOSER TO PREVIOUS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY...AND 
NUDGED MIN TEMPS UP JUST A BIT...TO BE CLOSER TO 21/00Z MOS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DEEPENING TROUGH OVER
EASTERN STATES SUNDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES TO EAST COAST. SHORT
RANGE MODELS INTENSIFY SYSTEM ALONG THE EAST COAST AS IT MOVES
NORTHEAST AND BRING UPPER LOW FROM OHIO VALLEY EAST OR SOUTHEAST TO
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY MONDAY MORNING. MOISTURE WRAPPING AROUND
SYSTEM AND INTERACTION WITH UPPER LOW WILL KEEP SHOWERS OVER
NORTHEAST SECTIONS SUNDAY. SLOW DRYING TREND ACROSS NE SUNDAY NIGHT
AND MONDAY WITH LINGERING SHOWERS UNTIL ABOUT 12Z MONDAY. ELSEWHERE
SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY SUNDAY NIGHT AND THEN MOSTLY SUNNY
MONDAY. COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL LOWER TEMPERATURES SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY WITH LOWS IN THE LOWER 30S MOUNTAINS AND MID 30S LOWER
ELEVATIONS OF NE TN AND SW VA. WINDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT AND
ESPECIALLY MONDAY AS COLDER AIR MASS MOVES IN. FROST NOT MUCH OF A
CONCERN SUNDAY NIGHT BUT MONDAY AS WINDS DECREASE FROST POSSIBLE NE
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. TUESDAY WARMING TREND BEGINS WITH BRIEF
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL. SOUTHERN SECTIONS WILL SEE THE MOST
WARMING. NW FLOW BRINGS ANOTHER SYSTEM INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY
WITH CLOUDS INCREASING AND SHOWERS DEVELOPING BY WEDNESDAY MORNING
AND CONTINUING INTO THURSDAY AS FRONT SLIDES THROUGH. IMPROVING
CONDITIONS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES
SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY.

SW VA WITH FROST POSSIBLE. HOWEVER GFS AND ECMWF ARE KEEPING MORE
CLOUD COVER WHICH WOULD AFFECT FROST AND KEEP LOWS WARMER. MONDAY
TEMPERATURES ONLY RECOVER TO MID 50S TO MID 60S WITH ANOTHER COLD
NIGHT IN THE 30S TO MID 40S AND AGAIN A CHANCE OF FROST. TROUGH
LIFTS OUT TUESDAY WITH WARMING TREND. MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE
FROM THE NW WITH SHOWERS POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

RETURNS FAVORING THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ACTIVE UPPER PATTERN TAKES

PHASED SOLUTION BETWEEN NORTHERN STREAM AND LOW CUTTING OFF ACROSS 
NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. MRX CWA SENSIBLE WEATHER WILL BE MAINLY 
INFLUENCED BY NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH. THIS SOLUTION FAVORS FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND MOST OF SATURDAY FOR PRECIPITATION CHANCES. COLD FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. MAX TEMPS WILL BE CHALLENGED 
BY CLOUDS AND SHOWERS AND WILL LIKELY FALL IN THE AFTERNOON 
FOLLOWING WIND SHIFT. NORTHWEST UPPER FLOW TAKES SHAPE BY SATURDAY 
NIGHT WITH BEST PRECIPITATION CHANCES ACROSS EASTERN MOUNTAINS. 
TEMPERATURES COOL TO NEAR NORMAL.     

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE 
AREA ON SUNDAY MORNING SO WILL CONTINUE THE LOW POPS FOR EARLY 
SUNDAY. WEAK SHORTWAVES TRACK THROUGH OUR NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE 
CWA ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AND AGAIN ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY 
AND FINALLY ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS 
NORTH SO WILL KEEP IT DRY FOR NOW. A FRONT ENTERS THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND STRENGTH 
WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

THE AREA AS EARLY AS FRIDAY NIGHT...AND SHOULD EXIT TO OUR EAST 
SATURDAY.  WILL CARRY CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS SATURDAY...BUT LOOKS 
LIKE BETTER FORCING FOR PRECIP MAY GO NORTH AND SOUTH OF US.  WITH 
EXPECTED FASTER EXIT OF SYSTEM WILL DRY THINGS OUT QUICKER THAN 
PREVIOUS FORECAST...WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE EARLY SUNDAY MAINLY 
EAST.   WILL BE IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT EARLY IN THE WEEK SOME SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY MAY BRING SOME SHOWERS ESPECIALLY NORTH...BUT GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING ANY OF THESE SUBTLE FEATURES OUT THAT FAR WILL 
GO DRY FOR THE MON THROUGH WED PERIOD.

729 
FXUS64 KMRX 181857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT WED APR 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE 
EAST OF THE AREA THIS EVENING. THE BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION HAS 
MOVED EAST AND WILL CONTINUE TO TAPER OFF. CLOUD COVER WILL SLOWLY 
ERODE FROM THE WEST TONIGHT. WEAK SURFACE LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES 
NEAR FLORIDA PANHANDLE WHILE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGES FROM THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS SW THROUGH THE TN VALLEY. WIND FLOW WILL BE LIGHT AND 
MAINLY DOWN VALLEY FROM THE NE. AS THE CLOUD COVER DECREASES FOG 
WILL DEVELOP OVERNIGHT AND CONTINUE EARLY THURSDAY. LEANED COOLER 
WITH THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST GOING SLIGHTLY BELOW ECMWF/GFS/NAM. 
LATEST LAMP/HRRR/SREF RUNNING COOLER THAN FORECAST TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A MORE POTENT STORM SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TAKING SHAPE OVER THE WEST 
COAST TONIGHT SUCH THAT BY THURSDAY NIGHT THE HY5 TROF WILL BE 
SHARPENING UP LEE OF THE ROCKIES. ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT WILL 
EXTEND FROM MIDLAND TX TO GREEN BAY WI THURSDAY EVENING...WITH A 
SOUTHERLY SFC FLOW AHEAD OF IT. MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY. THE H5 TROF WILL CONTINUE TO 
DEEPEN AS IT MOVES TOWARD THE ARKLATEX FRIDAY EVENING WITH A SWATH 
OF RAIN FROM SOUTH TX TO THE GREAT LAKES. BY SATURDAY MORNING...AN 
H5 CUTOFF LOW WILL DEVELOP ALONG WITH A SFC LOW OVER THE 
NORTHCENTRAL GULF. LOCALLY...DURING THE LATE FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY 
TIME FRAME IS WHEN THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES WILL BEGIN...ALTHOUGH 
SOME LOW CHANCE POPS WILL APPEAR IN THE FORECAST PRIOR TO THEN. BUT 
IT IS AFTER SATURDAY THAT THE FORECAST GETS MURKY. BOTH THE GFS AND 
ECMWF DROP A SECOND PIECE OF ENERGY INTO THE TROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT...THE ECMWF DROPS THIS ENERGY FURTHER SOUTH THAN THE GFS SUCH 
THAT THE EC KEEPS A STRONG CLOSED LOW OVER THE CAROLINAS/VIRGINIA 
THROUGH MONDAY WHEREAS THE GFS OPENS UP THE SOUTHERN CLOSED LOW AS A 
NEW ONE DEVELOPS OVER OH/PA. THE EC VERSION KEEPS WRAP-AROUND PRECIP 
OVER PORTIONS OF OUR CWA THROUGH TUES WHILE THE GFS GENERALLY DRIES 
US OUT SUNDAY NIGHT. GIVEN THE RELATIVELY POOR MODEL PERFORMANCE 
WITH THIS SYSTEM SINCE LAST WEEK...WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN FOR MONDAY 
AND CONTINUE TO MONITOR.

AND SW VA...WHERE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS LINGER. STORMS HAVE WEAKENED A 
BIT AFTER SEVERAL DROPPED SOME PEA TO PENNY SIZED HAIL. MOST HAIL 
WAS EAST OF OUR COUNTY WARNING AREA...EXCEPT FOR HAIL IN CLAY CO NC. 

RUC AND NAM MODELS HINT AT LESSER COVERAGE OVERNIGHT FOR PLATEAU AND 
SRN VALLEY...SO I MAY LOWER POPS FOR THOSE AREAS. WILL KEEP LIKELY 
OR HIGHER POPS ELSEWHERE...AND A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
EASTERN AREAS.

WILL ADJUST HOURLY TEMPS AND TWEAK A FEW OTHER GRIDS AS NEEDED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   54  71  51  78  54 / 100  60   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     54  68  51  76  54 / 100  90   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             52  68  51  76  54 / 100  80   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    52  62  46  75  49 / 100 100   0   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 172332
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
732 PM EDT TUE APR 17 2012

.AVIATION...UPPER LEVEL AND SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVING NE THIS 
EVENING WILL SPREAD SHOWERS NNE INTO THE REGION. SOME ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY AND LIFT OVERNIGHT COULD ALLOW FOR ISOLATED TSRA. THIS 
LOOKS MOST LIKELY FOR TYS FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS BASED ON RADAR 
AND LIGHTNING DETECTION. CEILINGS AND VISBYS SHOULD TREND DOWNWARD 
INTO MVFR CATEGORY FOR ALL 3 TAF SITES AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE WORST 
CONDITIONS LINGER AT TRI WHERE SHOWERS ALSO END LAST. 

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS LOCATED 
JUST EAST OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS SOUTHWEST ACROSS NORTHERN 
GEORGIA AND NORTHERN ALABAMA. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A SHORT-WAVE 
TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH 
A 115 KT UPPER LEVEL JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS JET WILL PLACE 
THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE 
JET. DIRECT CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE RRQ WILL ENHANCE THE 
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG AND NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY. THIS LIFT IS 
ALREADY PRODUCING AN AREA OF RAIN ACROSS SOUTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE 
AND NORTHERN ALABAMA. 

THIS LIFT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND THE FIRST 
HALF OF WEDNESDAY PRODUCING WIDESPREAD RAIN/SHOWERS. IN THE 
SHORT-TERM DECENT INSTABILITY OVER THE FAR EAST AND SOUTHEAST AREAS 
TO PRODUCE THUNDERSTORMS. FOR OVERNIGHT...SOUNDINGS SHOW ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY ACROSS THE EASTERN AND SOUTHERN FORECAST AREA TO INCLUDE 
THUNDER AS WELL. 

LIFT FROM FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WILL DECREASE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
WITH DIMINISHING RAIN INTENSITY AND COVERAGE FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS VALUES 
CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS 
ARE IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN STORY BEING THE HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING DURING THE WEEKEND. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT 
AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CREATE DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE 
THAT A HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL CREATE A STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...WHICH 
WILL THEN MOVE UP THE EASTERN SEABOARD EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS 
SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY...WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS EXPECTED EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   54  71  51  78  54 / 100  60   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     54  68  51  76  54 / 100  90   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             52  68  51  76  54 / 100  80   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    52  62  46  75  49 / 100 100   0   0   0

AND NORTHERN ALABAMA.

WITH INCREASING CHANCES OF SHOWERS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. ALSO...FAR
SOUTHERN AREAS...ESPECIALLY SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA IS CLOSE
ENOUGH TO THE SURFACE BOUNDARY TO INCLUDE THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL.
ALSO...SATELLITE SHOWS ENOUGH BREAKS TO HELP DESTABILIZE AND WARM
THE AIR-MASS ALONG THE FAR SOUTHERN AND EASTERN COUNTIES.

DUE TO THE BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER...HAVE RAISED HIGH TEMPERATURE
FORECAST FOR TODAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SHOWERS WILL END FROM WEST 
TO EAST ON WEDNESDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE MOVES THOUGH THE REGION.  
WEAK SURFACE HIGH WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT EXPECTED ON THURSDAY.  A 
SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT AND 
PROVIDE A CHANCE OF CONVECTION FRIDAY AFTERNOON.  THERE IS SOME 
DISCREPANCY OF TIMING OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.  GFS IS SLOWING THIS SYSTEM DOWN A BIT BUT WILL 
KEEP OUR BEST CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS WITH LIKELY POPS ON SATURDAY 
WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AND CHANCE POPS THROUGH SUNDAY AS THE UPPER 
LOW SLIDES THROUGH.  MONDAY LOOKS DRY FOR NOW WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
EXPECTED TO MOVE IN.

649 
FXUS64 KMRX 170140
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT MON APR 16 2012

.DISCUSSION....FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA. LIGHTNING IS LIMITED 
SO WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE THUNDER AND THE EVENING WORDING. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A WEAKENING PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH 
IS MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. ONLY SCATTERED 
SHOWERS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS BOUNDARY. MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
NOTED ALONG THIS BOUNDARY WITH CAPES OF 500+ J/KG. SPC MESO-ANALYSIS 
DOES SHOW MOISTURE CONVERGENCE ALONG THE INCOMING FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
LOCATED OVER THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. AS FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE AREA 
SCATTERED CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE WITH ISOLATED STRONG STORMS. MAIN 
CONCERN BEING STRONG GUSTY WINDS UP TO 45 MPH AND SMALL HAIL.  

CONVECTION WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET WITH ONLY WIDELY 
SCATTERED SHOWERS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT.

FOR TUESDAY...MODELS SHOW THIS BOUNDARY BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE OUT OF 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO TO THE SOUTHEAST TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. 
DEPENDING ON THE EXACT LOCATION OF BOUNDARY...FRONTAL-GENETIC 
FORCING WILL RE-IGNITE THE STATIONARY BOUNDARY. A 90-100KT JET OVER 
THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PLACE THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS UNDER THE 
FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION. THE DIRECT CIRCULATION WITH THE JET 
WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTAL-GENETIC FORCING PRODUCING PERIODS OF 
SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE 
IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL TWO LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE 
FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND THE WEEKEND. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE IS PROGGED TO BE LOCATED OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT...WITH A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE CAROLINAS. THIS 
SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN A GOOD COVERAGE OF SHOWERS OVER THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING. ZONAL UPPER- 
LEVEL FLOW AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN CREATE DRY AND 
TRANQUIL CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING...WITH A 
COLD FRONT PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT. 
BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS REVEAL A HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH DEVELOPING BEHIND THIS FRONT FOR THE WEEKEND...RESULTING IN A 
DEEP CUT-OFF LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
THIS SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN AN UNSETTLED PATTERN WITH BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBER THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   59  71  52  72  52 /  50  80  40  30   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     58  69  52  70  50 /  30  80  50  30   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             57  69  52  70  50 /  30  70  40  30   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    54  69  50  67  47 /  30  70  40  40   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1112 AM EDT MON APR 16 2012

.DISCUSSION...A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA
TODAY WITH A LINE OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. AIRMASS IS
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES OF 500 J/KG OR LESS. GREATEST
COVERAGE WILL BE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA
WHERE INSTABILITY IS GREATER. GUSTY SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS
BETWEEN 10 AND 20 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 30 MPH.

980 
FXUS64 KMRX 160814
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT MON APR 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE WEAK COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST 
WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT.  CONVECTIVE LINE 
TO OUR WEST IS WEAKENING...AND MODELS HAVE BEEN BACKING OFF ON 
PRECIP FOR OUR AREA TODAY.  GIVEN MODEST INSTABILITY AND WEAK 
FORCING WILL JUST CARRY LIKELY POPS WEST TODAY WITH CHANCE 
ELSEWHERE...THEN CHANCE POPS TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL SLIP JUST EAST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA IN THE FOOTHILLS OF THE BLUE RIDGE MOUNTAINS BY 
12Z TUESDAY BUT WILL NOT MAKE MUCH FURTHER PROGRESS AS A SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORT WAVE TROUGH SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST FROM THE ARKLATEX REGION 
TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. THIS SCENARIO WILL 
REQUIRE HIGHER POPS FOR SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WHERE DEEPER 
MOISTURE/LIFT WILL BE PRESENT IN THE VICINITY OF THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY. HAD TO KEEP THE SLIGHT THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS GOING ACROSS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA 
MAINLY TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE 
MAKES ITS WAY EAST. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER THROUGH THE DAY WEDNESDAY 
DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN HOW QUICKLY THIS FEATURE AND ASSOCIATED 
MOISTURE MOVES ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS BUT MOST OF THE REGION WILL BE 
DRY WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING. THURSDAY SHOULD BE A BETTER DAY PLENTY 
OF SUNSHINE AND TEMPERATURES REBOUNDING BACK ABOVE NORMAL. NEXT 
UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION/CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THE ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT WILL MEAN THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
BE STEADILY INCREASING LATER IN THE DAY FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. 
PLACED THE HIGHEST LIKELIHOOD FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE 
FORECAST ON SATURDAY AS THE COLD FRONT MAKES ITS WAY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. USED LIKELY POPS AT THIS TIME AS MODEL 
FORECAST SHOW THIS SYSTEM UNDERGOING MAJOR AMPLIFICATION BY WEEKS 
END. BOTH THE ECMWF AND THE GFS DEEPEN THE SYSTEM SUFFICIENTLY FOR 
THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CLOSED UPPER LOW IN THE VICINITY OF THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS DURING THE DAY SUNDAY. PLENTY OF MOISTURE WILL BE 
AVAILABLE FOR SHORT WAVE LIFTING SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY FOR THE 
GENERATION OF SHOWERS SO STAYED WITH SOME CHANCE POPS DURING THIS 
PART OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  57  72  53  73 /  60  50  60  50  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  81  57  73  52  71 /  40  50  30  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  55  72  50  71 /  50  50  30  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              82  52  71  49  68 /  30  40  20  30  20

344 
FXUS64 KMRX 160115
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT SUN APR 15 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. THE PRECIPITATION 
SHOULD OFF UNTIL MONDAY. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW
RIDGING ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST BREAKING DOWN ENOUGH TO ALLOW A COLD
FRONT TO MOVE INTO THE AREA BY LATE MONDAY. SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD
OF THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO PULL INCREASING BOUNDARY LAYER
MOISTURE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE VALLEY...
PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. PWS INCREASE ALONG WITH
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF FROPA WITH CAPES APPROACHING 1000 J/KG OVER
THE PLATEAU COUNTIES MONDAY. SCATTERED TO BROKEN SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ARE ANTICIPATED ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE FRONT MONDAY
AFTERNOON EVENING. STRONGEST WIND FIELDS WILL BE NORTH OF THE AREA
(OVER THE OHIO VALLEY) WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY SO DO NOT EXPECT
ANY WIDESPREAD SEVERE...BUT CAN NOT RULE OUT ISOLATED STRONG STORMS
WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING SMALL HAIL AND GUSTS WINDS UP TO 45 MPH.

BESIDES THE CONVECTION...MODELS SHOW INCREASING BOUNDARY MOISTURE
AND CLOUDS OVER THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST
AREA TONIGHT AND MONDAY. BREEZY CONDITIONS WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS
BETWEEN 10 AND 20 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 25 MPH THIS AFTERNOON AND AGAIN MONDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN TO START OFF WITH AS SW FLOW ALOFT WILL 
BRING A DISTURBANCE INTO REGION THAT WILL FIRE OFF A NEW ROUND OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER AL MON NGT THAT WILL IMPACT THE CWA 
TUESDAY. SHORTWAVE IN THE OVERALL FLOW WILL THEN TRY TO PUSH PRECIP 
EAST OF AREA EXCEPT THE ECMWF MODEL IS SLOWER WITH THAT PUSH...AND 
KEEPS PRECIP CHCS OVER AREA INTO WED. DRIER WEATHER FINALLY MAKES IT 
IN THOUGH...AND LATTER WED THROUGH THURS LOOKS FAIR CONSIDERING A 
GFS/ECMWF BLEND. THE NEXT SYSTEM BRINGS PRECIP BACK TO THE FORECAST 
FRIDAY...AND THIS SYSTEM WILL GRADUALLY DEEPEN INTO A DECENT EAST 
COAST/APPALACHIAN TROUGH BRINGING IN COOLER AIR INTO OUR AREA 
THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND. NEXT SUNDAY/NEXT MONDAY MORNING COULD SEE 
SOME FROST IF CLOUDS AND WINDS ARE FAVORABLE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  78  58  71  49 /  10  70  50  60  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  78  58  70  49 /  10  60  50  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  78  57  69  48 /  10  60  40  40  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  80  54  69  44 /   0  40  40  40  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

345 
FXUS64 KMRX 150807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN APR 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL 
SHIFT EAST DURING THE PERIOD...WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
TO OUR SOUTHEAST.  WARMER AND MORE MOIST AIR WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
INTO THE AREA IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW...BUT SHOULD BE PRECIP FREE  FOR 
THE SHORT TERM.  WILL SEE SOME INCREASE IN CU TODAY WITH THE 
INCREASED MOISTURE...BUT STILL PLENTY OF SUNSHINE.  TEMPS WILL BE 
WELL ABOVE NORMAL.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST 
SOME MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY PASSES 
NORTHEAST FROM THE MIDWEST INTO NEW ENGLAND 12Z MONDAY THROUGH 12Z 
TUESDAY. A NARROW BAND OF DEEP MOISTURE WILL ACCOMPANY A COLD FRONT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SHORT WAVE GENERATING A DECENT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY MONDAY 
AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING. THE MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE 
PROBLEMS WITH A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE TRAILING MONDAY'S FRONTAL 
SYSTEM WHICH REDUCES FORECAST CONFIDENCE DURING THE TUESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY TIMEFRAME. DECIDED TO GO WITH THE SLOWER/MORE AMPLIFIED 
ECMWF/CMC RATHER THAN THE LESS AMPLIFIED AND FASTER NAM/GFS. 
THEREFORE...KEPT SLIGHT AND CHANCE POPS GOING TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY 
DUE TO PASSAGE OF RELATIVELY STRONG SHORT WAVE ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WAS ABLE TO KEEP THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING 
DRY WHILE AWAITING NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM. 
USED A COMBINATION OF THE FASTER GFS AND SLOWER ECMWF WITH THIS 
SYSTEM GRADUALLY EDGING POPS FROM SLIGHT CHANCE FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE ON SATURDAY FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             83  62  79  56  72 /   0  10  60  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  61  81  56  71 /   0  10  50  40  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       82  61  79  55  70 /   0   0  60  30  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              82  52  83  55  70 /   0   0  40  40  20

316 
FXUS64 KMRX 150125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT SAT APR 14 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES THIS EVENING. A WEAK TROUGH BRINGING A 
FEW CLOUDS FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
WITH HIGH PRESSURE SITTING OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST AND LOW PRESSURE 
DEEPENING OVER THE PLAINS...A STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW 
WILL TRANSPORT MOISTURE INTO THE AREA THROUGH TOMORROW. WE SHOULD BE 
MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES TO THE 
NORTH...THEN CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH DURING THE DAY AS 
HIGHER THETA-E AIR AT 850 MB ADVECTS NORTHWARD. EXPECT AN EXTENSIVE 
CU FIELD TO DEVELOP BY AFTERNOON IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AREAS. 
WITH RISING DEWPOINTS OVERNIGHT...LOWS WILL BE IN THE 50S IN MOST 
SPOTS TONIGHT. WARM ADVECTION AND A S-SW WIND AT 10 -15 KTS WILL 
HELP BRING HIGH TEMPS INTO THE LOWER 80S ACROSS MUCH OF THE TN 
VALLEY ON SUNDAY. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE LAST PERIOD OF THE 
WEEKEND STILL LOOKS DRY BUT WARM AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES OVERNIGHT 
SUNDAY NIGHT. DEEP LOW PRESSURE OVER THE UPPER MS VALLEY AND 
TRAILING COLD FRONT THAT STRETCHES TO THE TEXAS GULF COAST MOVES 
SLOWLY EAST AND AT FIRST MOVES MAINLY NORTH AS IT RUNS INTO STRONG 
RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST. LOWS WILL BE VERY MILD WITH CONTINUED 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER. SURFACE LOW FILLS AS IT 
MOVES FROM THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST STATES MONDAY 
MODELS SOMEWHAT IN AGREEMENT THE NAM/GFS IN BRINGING SHOWERS AND A 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THE FRONT BY 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. TEMPERATURES QUITE WARM AGAIN BUT 
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN SUNDAY. NAM DECREASES PRECIPITATION AREA 
SIGNIFICANT BY LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WITH GFS SHOWING MORE 
ACTIVITY. ECMWF HOWEVER DEVELOPS WAVE ALONG FRONT TO THE SW SLOWING 
THE SYSTEM DOWN MARKEDLY AND MOVING A LARGE AREA OF PRECIPITATION 
ACROSS THE REGION TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE CANADIAN MODEL 
DEVELOPS PRECIPITATION TO THE SW AND MOVES IT ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST 
STATES WELL TO TH SOUTH. RIGHT NOW WILL FOLLOW A NAM/GFS BLEND WITH 
LOWER POPS AND FASTER MOVEMENT THROUGH SO DECREASED POPS TUESDAY AND 
HAVE RAIN CHANCES MOVING OUT TUESDAY NIGHT EXCEPT A LITTLE IN THE 
MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY MORNING. HIGHER PRESSURE SLIDES ACROSS THE 
REGION WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THURSDAY A FAST MOVING SYSTEM 
ACROSS THE NE SECTIONS WILL BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THEN A 
STRONGER SYSTEM AFFECTS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  81  62  78  59 /   0   0  10  60  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  81  60  79  56 /   0   0   0  50  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       54  81  61  78  54 /   0   0   0  60  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              49  82  53  81  51 /   0   0   0  40  50 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
