CU FIELD TO DEVELOP BY AFTERNOON IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AREAS. 
WITH RISING DEWPOINTS OVERNIGHT...LOWS WILL BE IN THE 50S IN MOST 
SPOTS TONIGHT. WARM ADVECTION AND A S-SW WIND AT 10 -15 KTS WILL 
HELP BRING HIGH TEMPS INTO THE LOWER 80S ACROSS MUCH OF THE TN 
VALLEY ON SUNDAY. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE LAST PERIOD OF THE 
WEEKEND STILL LOOKS DRY BUT WARM AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES OVERNIGHT 
SUNDAY NIGHT. DEEP LOW PRESSURE OVER THE UPPER MS VALLEY AND 
TRAILING COLD FRONT THAT STRETCHES TO THE TEXAS GULF COAST MOVES 
SLOWLY EAST AND AT FIRST MOVES MAINLY NORTH AS IT RUNS INTO STRONG 
RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST. LOWS WILL BE VERY MILD WITH CONTINUED 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER. SURFACE LOW FILLS AS IT 
MOVES FROM THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST STATES MONDAY 
MODELS SOMEWHAT IN AGREEMENT THE NAM/GFS IN BRINGING SHOWERS AND A 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THE FRONT BY 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. TEMPERATURES QUITE WARM AGAIN BUT 
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN SUNDAY. NAM DECREASES PRECIPITATION AREA 
SIGNIFICANT BY LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WITH GFS SHOWING MORE 
ACTIVITY. ECMWF HOWEVER DEVELOPS WAVE ALONG FRONT TO THE SW SLOWING 
THE SYSTEM DOWN MARKEDLY AND MOVING A LARGE AREA OF PRECIPITATION 
ACROSS THE REGION TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE CANADIAN MODEL 
DEVELOPS PRECIPITATION TO THE SW AND MOVES IT ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST 
STATES WELL TO TH SOUTH. RIGHT NOW WILL FOLLOW A NAM/GFS BLEND WITH 
LOWER POPS AND FASTER MOVEMENT THROUGH SO DECREASED POPS TUESDAY AND 
HAVE RAIN CHANCES MOVING OUT TUESDAY NIGHT EXCEPT A LITTLE IN THE 
MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY MORNING. HIGHER PRESSURE SLIDES ACROSS THE 
REGION WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THURSDAY A FAST MOVING SYSTEM 
ACROSS THE NE SECTIONS WILL BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THEN A 
STRONGER SYSTEM AFFECTS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 140809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT APR 14 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER 
THE AREA AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO OUR EAST DRIFTS 
SOUTHEAST.  SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL SWING BY TO OUR NORTH.  WILL 
SEE SOME VARYING AMOUNTS OF MAINLY HIGH AND MID CLOUDS TODAY...WITH 
A DECREASING CLOUD TREND LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. EXPECT ANY PRECIP 
TO STAY NORTH...SO WILL GO DRY DURING THE PERIOD. WINDS WILL BE 
STRONGER TODAY...BECOMING GUSTY FROM THE SOUTHWEST.  THE WARMING 
TREND WILL CONTINUE...AND WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.    

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...PROTECTIVE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
ALLOWS FOR MORE GREAT WEATHER ON SUNDAY BUT IS SHOVED EAST TO THE 
ATLANTIC SEABOARD ON MONDAY AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY BUILDS EAST ACROSS 
THE UPPER MIDWEST. AS THIS HAPPENS A COLD FRONT WILL BE PULLED 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY LATE EVENING. ADJUSTED 
POPS A LITTLE HIGHER FOR CONVECTION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS 
MODELS APPEARED TO BE IN AGREEMENT WITH A LITTLE FASTER MOVEMENT OF 
THIS SYSTEM THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. MODEL SOLUTIONS START TO DIVERGE 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WITH THE 00Z ECMWF THE SLOWEST AND MOST 
AMPLIFIED WITH A TRAILING SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE WHICH PRODUCES 
A NICE SHOT OF POST FRONTAL PRECIPITATION LATER MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT. BASICALLY WRAPPED UP THE EVENT BY 12Z WEDNESDAY GOING 
CLOSER TO THE FASTER 00Z GFS FOLLOWED BY THE 00Z CANADIAN WHICH 
SEEMED TO BE A MORE ACCURATE FORECAST DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE ECMWF 
DOES NOT END PRECIP OVER THE REGION UNTIL LATE THURSDAY. GOING WITH 
THE FASTER SOLUTIONS ALLOWS A RETURN TO SOME SUNSHINE AS EARLY AS 
WEDNESDAY. THE FAIR WEATHER REGIME SHOULD LAST THROUGH THE DAYTIME 
HOURS FRIDAY WITH A NICE WARMING TREND. APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
IN THE GRIDS FRIDAY NIGHT WITH MODELS EAGER TO BRING ANOTHER UPPER 
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM INTO THE EASTERN U.S. BY THIS 
TIME.

782 
FXUS64 KMRX 140117
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
917 PM EDT FRI APR 13 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE 
PROVIDING A DRY NIGHT TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE  
FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS BROKEN MID AND HIGH CLOUDS TO OUR WEST 
ROUNDING THE TOP OF A MIDLEVEL RIDGE. TO THE WEST OF THE RIDGE 
AXIS...AN EXTENSIVE CU FIELD HAS DEVELOPED. THE RIDGE AXIS WILL BE 
OVER OUR AREA TONIGHT...BRINGING INCREASING CLOUDS ESPECIALLY TO 
NORTHERN AREAS OVERNIGHT. WITH THE RIDGE AXIS TO OUR EAST TOMORROW 
AND AN INCREASING SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW BRINGING HIGHER 
DEWPOINTS...EXPECT SOME SCATTERED CU DEVELOPMENT IN THE AFTERNOON. 
TEMPS TONIGHT UNDER INCREASING CLOUD COVER DO NOT FAVOR FROST 
DEVELOPMENT...WITH LOWS MAINLY IN THE 40S. HIGHS SATURDAY WILL REACH 
INTO THE 70S OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
TROUGH DEEPENS ACROSS THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST STATES SATURDAY NIGHT 
AND SUNDAY AS RIDGE STAYS STRONG OVER THE GULF AND SOUTHEAST. 
THICKNESSES RISE AS WELL WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING AT NIGHT AND 
DURING THE DAY. LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT RISE ABOVE NORMAL TO UPPER 40S 
TO MID 50S. SUNDAY MAY BE WARMEST DAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND 
HIGHS UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S. MOISTURE AND CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE 
SUNDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS EAST AND SOUTHERLY WINDS 
DEVELOP. MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT BY BRINGING NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM 
INTO THE LOWER TN AND OH VALLEYS MONDAY. FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE TN VALLEY AND EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. ECMWF SLOWER AND STRONGER WITH SYSTEM THAN GFS WHICH 
WEAKENS SYSTEM AS IT APPROACHES THE MOUNTAINS MONDAY NIGHT. GFS THEN 
TRIES TO DEVELOP A WAVE TO THE SOUTHWEST MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY 
WHICH SHIFTS PRECIPITATION TO THE EAST AND SOUTHEAST MUCH QUICKER. 
MONDAY STILL LOOKS VERY WARM AS LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT DUE TO SOUTHERLY 
FLOW AND CLOUDS WILL ONLY DROP INTO THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S. PREFER 
SLOWER ECMWF RIGHT NOW WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE LATE 
MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY THEN DECREASING TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS IN THURSDAY AND CONTINUES FRIDAY WITH ANOTHER 
SYSTEM APPROACHING BY THE WEEKEND. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT FRI APR 13 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO 
OUR NORTH WILL SHIFT SOUTHEAST AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD 
OVER THE AREA.  WILL SEE SOME MAINLY HIGH AND PERHAPS MID CLOUDS 
DURING THE PERIOD...BUT SHOULD REMAIN PRECIP FREE. WARMING TREND 
WILL CONTINUE AS WELL.  MAY BE SOME PATCHY FROST MAINLY NORTH AND 
PERHAPS SW VA COUNTIES LATE TONIGHT...BUT DOES NOT LOOK SIGNIFICANT 
ENOUGH FOR ANY FROST ADVISORY.  CURRENT FROST ADVISORY FOR THIS 
EARLY MORNING WILL BE LEFT AS IS FOR NOW.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM 
MAV TEMPS.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WENT A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE 
00Z ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS THROUGH THE PERIOD AS THE GFS BECOMES 
A LITTLE TOO PROGRESSIVE WITH THE EARLY WEEK SYSTEM. AMPLIFYING 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE SHOULD KEEP THE FORECAST AREA DRY OVER THE WEEKEND 
WITH A NICE WARMUP AS SUBSIDENCE AND SOUTHERLY WINDS HELP BOOST 
TEMPERATURES BACK ABOVE NORMAL. THE WARMEST DAYS APPEAR TO BE SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY WITH STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL FLOW OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO. 
AS A SHORT WAVE TROUGH SHIFTS NORTHEAST FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE 
GREAT LAKES DURING THE DAY MONDAY DEEP MOISTURE WILL BE LIFTED AHEAD 
OF A COLD FRONT WHICH SHOULD MAKE PROGRESS INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE BY 
00Z TUESDAY. ADJUSTED PROBABILITY OF CONVECTION FROM SLIGHT CHANCE 
DURING THE DAY MONDAY TO MEDIUM THROUGH LIKELY POPS MONDAY NIGHT AS 
THE WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE LAKES. THE MEAN UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO 
AMPLIFY ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON TUESDAY AS A RELATIVELY 
SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE PRESSES EAST NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. 
APPLIED LIKELY POPS ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AS 
THIS FEATURE DRAGS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY TUESDAY NIGHT. HELD ONTO SOME POST FRONTAL POPS 
WEDNESDAY MORNING FOLLOWED BY AFTERNOON DRYING MOST AREAS. DRY 
ADVECTION CONTINUES THROUGH THURSDAY SO MAINTAINED POP LESS THAN 
FIFTEEN PERCENT.

FXUS64 KMRX 130157
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT THU APR 12 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE DRIFTING FROM THE OHIO/TN VALLEY 
REGION TO THE MID-ATLANTIC REGION THROUGH TOMORROW. ALOFT...A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS WV TO NC TONIGHT...BUT ANY 
CLOUDINESS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE SHOULD STAY TO OUR EAST. 
WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS...WE WILL HAVE GOOD RADIATIONAL 
COOLING CONDITIONS AGAIN TONIGHT. DEWPOINTS THIS AFTERNOON ARE A 
LITTLE HIGHER THAN THIS TIME YESTERDAY...SO LOW TEMPS ARE EXPECTED 
TO BE SLIGHTLY HIGHER. A FROST ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE 
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE AREA...THE SMOKIES...AND SW NC. ISOLATED 
POCKETS OF NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW FREEZING TEMPS CANNOT BE RULED OUT 
IN SHELTERED VALLEYS. THE WARMING TREND WILL CONTINUE ON 
FRIDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL CONTINUE A WARMING TREND 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A WARM FRONT MAY BRUSH THE WESTERN AND NORTHERN 
SECTIONS FRIDAY NIGHT WITH SOME CLOUDS AND A FEW SPRINKLES BUT ANY 
SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION WILL BE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. LOWS FRIDAY 
NIGHT WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER WITH COLDEST TEMPERATURES NEAR 
THE TRI CITIES AIRPORT. SATURDAY SHOULD BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER 
THAN FRIDAY. SUNDAY RIDGING STRENGTHENS AGAIN OVER THE EASTERN 
STATES AS A TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE ROCKIES. THIS RIDGE WILL 
CONTINUE WITH DRY AND WARM WEATHER THROUGH MONDAY. HIGHS SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY REACH THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S. STILL LOOKS LIKE CLOUDS 
INCREASE MONDAY NIGHT WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
AHEAD OF DEVELOPING SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE MS AND LOWER OHIO 
VALLEYS. THIS SYSTEM MOVES SLOWLY EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 70S WITH 
MORE CLOUD COVER AND RAIN. HIGHER PRESSURE BUILD BACK IN THURSDAY 
WITH SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  73  49  78  56 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  37  69  46  76  54 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  69  45  77  53 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              32  66  39  75  47 /   0   0   0   0   0 

&&

NC...FROST ADVISORY FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FROST ADVISORY FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT THU APR 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE DRIFTING FROM THE OHIO/TN VALLEY 
REGION TO THE MID-ATLANTIC REGION THROUGH TOMORROW. ALOFT...A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS WV TO NC TONIGHT...BUT ANY 
CLOUDINESS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE SHOULD STAY TO OUR EAST. 
WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS...WE WILL HAVE GOOD RADIATIONAL 
COOLING CONDITIONS AGAIN TONIGHT. DEWPOINTS THIS AFTERNOON ARE A 
LITTLE HIGHER THAN THIS TIME YESTERDAY...SO LOW TEMPS ARE EXPECTED 
TO BE SLIGHTLY HIGHER. A FROST ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE 
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE AREA...THE SMOKIES...AND SW NC. ISOLATED 
POCKETS OF NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW FREEZING TEMPS CANNOT BE RULED OUT 
IN SHELTERED VALLEYS. THE WARMING TREND WILL CONTINUE ON 
FRIDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL CONTINUE A WARMING TREND 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A WARM FRONT MAY BRUSH THE WESTERN AND NORTHERN 
SECTIONS FRIDAY NIGHT WITH SOME CLOUDS AND A FEW SPRINKLES BUT ANY 
SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION WILL BE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. LOWS FRIDAY 
NIGHT WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER WITH COLDEST TEMPERATURES NEAR 
THE TRI CITIES AIRPORT. SATURDAY SHOULD BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER 
THAN FRIDAY. SUNDAY RIDGING STRENGTHENS AGAIN OVER THE EASTERN 
STATES AS A TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE ROCKIES. THIS RIDGE WILL 
CONTINUE WITH DRY AND WARM WEATHER THROUGH MONDAY. HIGHS SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY REACH THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S. STILL LOOKS LIKE CLOUDS 
INCREASE MONDAY NIGHT WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
AHEAD OF DEVELOPING SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE MS AND LOWER OHIO 
VALLEYS. THIS SYSTEM MOVES SLOWLY EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP INTO THE 70S WITH

.AVIATION...

AGAIN TONIGHT...CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO INCLUDE IN THE
FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

ALIGNS WELL WITH THE CURRENT FORECAST...SO NO UPDATE IS NEEDED.

471 
FXUS64 KMRX 120744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT THU APR 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. IT SHOULD BE A COOL
START EARLY TODAY WITH TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO BE BELOW FREEZING
EXCEPT FOR THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. WILL LEAVE CURRENT FREEZE WARNINGS
AND ADVISORIES AS IS FOR FOR THIS MORNING. ANOTHER COOL NIGHT
EXPECTED TONIGHT AS WELL...WITH FROST EXPECTED FOR NORTHERN
PORTIONS AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR LATE TONIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES
LOOKED REASONABLE...SO STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...BUT THEN 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE TIMING OF A COLD FRONT EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION ON FRIDAY MORNING...RESULTING IN ONE MORE MORNING OF BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPS BEFORE A WARMING TREND QUICKLY BEGINS ON THE WEEKEND. A 
WARM FRONT WILL MOVE NORTHWARD THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE DEVELOPING OVER THE SOUTHEAST FOR 
THE WEEKEND. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER 
THE WESTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON SUNDAY...WITH THE LATEST ECMWF 
MODEL RUN REVEALING A FASTER SOLUTION THAN THE GFS MODEL WITH THE 
APPROACH OF A COLD FRONT OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. IN ADDITION...THE 
ECMWF MODEL SOLUTION SHOWS A MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
DEVELOPING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY...RESULTING IN A 
SLOWER EXIT OF THE POST-FRONTAL PRECIP. FOR NOW...WILL MENTION SOME 
CONVECTION FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THE ECMWF 
SOLUTION. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

579 
FXUS64 KMRX 120144
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT WED APR 11 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. WINDS WEAKENING AND CLOUD DECK 
ACROSS THE NORTH THINNING. SREF ENSEMBLE MEAN MIN TEMPS NEAR 
FORECAST LOWS. CONFIDENT MOST OUTLYING AREAS WILL SEE FREEZE LATE 
TONIGHT. SON 


PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
WITH A LARGE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE MS VALLEY AND A CLOSED 
UPPER LOW OFF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST...A DEEP NORTHERLY FLOW OF COLD 
AIR WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT AND THURSDAY. AS 
WINDS DROP TO NEAR CALM AFTER SUNSET THIS EVENING...EXCELLENT 
RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP INTO THE 
UPPER 20S NORTH TO MID 30S SOUTH. SUB-FREEZING TEMPS ARE LIKELY IN 
SHELTERED VALLEYS OF SW VA/NE TN...TN MOUNTAINS...SW NC...AND THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THE KNOXVILLE AREA WILL BE CLOSE TO 
FREEZING...WITH ENOUGH POCKETS AT OR BELOW TO WARRANT A FREEZE 
WARNING. EXPECT THE CHATTANOOGA AREA TO BOTTOM OUT IN THE MID 
30S...AND WILL HAVE A FROST ADVISORY THERE. 

WHILE 1000-850 MB THICKNESS VALUES TOMORROW ARE SHOWN BY MODELS TO 
BE IDENTICAL TO TODAY...TEMPS SHOULD BE A BIT WARMER THURSDAY WITH 
LIGHTER WINDS AND LESS COLD ADVECTION. HIGHS WILL STILL BE BELOW 
NORMAL...IN THE UPPER 50S NORTH TO MID 60S SOUTH. LOW TEMPS THURSDAY 
NIGHT MAY APPROACH OR DROP JUST BELOW FREEZING AGAIN ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. ANOTHER FROST ADVISORY OR FREEZE WARNING 
MAY BE NEEDED AGAIN...BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY ADDITIONAL W/W/A 
STATEMENTS AT THIS TIME. TEMPS SHOULD REBOUND TO NEAR NORMAL BY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS THE UPPER RIDGE MOVES DIRECTLY OVERHEAD...MID 
60S TO LOWER 70S.

REGARDING FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS FOR THURSDAY...WHILE VERY LOW 
AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL CONTINUE...WINDS ARE NOT EXPECTED 
TO BE GUSTY...AND SUSTAINED WINDS SHOULD GENERALLY BE UNDER 10 MPH. 

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN 
FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED WITH RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE POSITIONED OVER 
THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S.  STORM TRACK STAYS TO THE NORTH THROUGH MONDAY 
WITH A WARMING TREND DEVELOPING OVER THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND.  MAIN 
SYSTEM FOR THE EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH 
ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY EVENING.  SOME CONVECTION MAY 
LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY OVER NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS AS THE 
FRONT PULLS AWAY FOR THE REGION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   35  66  38  72  49 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     33  63  37  69  46 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             32  63  36  69  47 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    29  60  32  67  41 /   0   0   0   0  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FREEZE WARNING FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FREEZE WARNING FROM 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ TO 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ 
     THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HANCOCK...
     HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...
     MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...NORTHWEST MONROE...
     ROANE...SCOTT TN...SEQUATCHIE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...

THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S.  STORM TRACK STAYS TO THE NORTH THROUGH MONDAY 
WITH A WARMING TREND DEVELOPING OVER THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND.  
MAIN SYSTEM FOR THE EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY EVENING.  SOME CONVECTION 
MAY LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY OVER NORTHERN AND EASTERN LOCATIONS AS THE 
FRONT PULLS AWAY FOR THE REGION.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1022 AM EDT WED APR 11 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE OHIO AND TN VALLEY
REGIONS TODAY. CLOUDS ACROSS WV AND WESTERN VA MAY SKIRT THE
EXTREME NE FRINGES OF THE AREA...OTHERWISE SUNNY SKIES ARE
EXPECTED. OBSERVED TEMPS ARE RUNNING A LITTLE ABOVE FORECAST IN
SOME AREAS...AND 06Z MOS GUIDANCE IS A BIT ABOVE FORECAST AS
WELL...SO THE UPDATE WILL BUMP UP FORECAST HIGH TEMPS
SLIGHTLY...MAINLY CENTRAL AND SOUTH.

DECISIONS ABOUT UPGRADING THE FREEZE WATCH TO A WARNING WILL BE
MADE THIS AFTERNOON ONCE THE 12Z MODEL GUIDANCE ARRIVES. AT THIS
TIME...IT APPEARS THAT AT LEAST THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA WILL
SEE NEAR TO BELOW FREEZING TEMPS...WHICH WILL NECESSITATE A
WARNING...WITH AN ADVISORY ELSEWHERE. THE PRECISE LOCATION FOR THE
WARNING WILL BE PINNED DOWN WITH THE AFTERNOON FORECAST PACKAGE.

&&

276 
FXUS64 KMRX 110813
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
413 AM EDT WED APR 11 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT TEMPERATURES FALLING AS 
WIND DECREASES. ALREADY DOWN TO 32 DEGREES AT LONESOME PINE. WILL 
LEAVE CURRENT FREEZE WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES AS IS FOR TODAY AND THE 
WATCH GOING FOR TONIGHT AS WELL. WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TODAY...BUT ONLY A FEW CLOUDS IS 
EXPECTED. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS ALLOWING FOR A MOSTLY CLEAR AND COOL 
NIGHT TONIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE...SO DIDN'T 
STRAY TOO FAR.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH EARLY NEXT
WEEK...AND REVEAL A DRY PATTERN UNTIL TUESDAY WITH A RAPID WARMING
TREND BACK TO ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS BY THE WEEKEND. HIGH PRESSURE
WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THURSDAY
NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING... RESULTING IN ONE MORE MORNING OF BELOW
NORMAL TEMPS. A WARNING TREND WILL THEN QUICKLY BEGIN ON THE
WEEKEND...AS THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA DRIFTS EASTWARD RESULTING IN
SOUTHERLY WINDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A WARM FRONT WILL MOVE
NORTHWARD THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH AN
UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE DEVELOPING OVER THE SOUTHEAST FOR THE WEEKEND. A
STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE WESTERN
HALF OF THE NATION ON MONDAY...AND WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT ACROSS
THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. AS FOR
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE
MEANS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE APR 10 2012


.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT IS MAKING ITS WAY 
THROUGH THE FORECAST HOUR THIS AFTERNOON. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT BKN 
ALTO CU CEILINGS HAVE LIMITED EVAPORATION AT THE SURFACE KEEPING 
RELATIVE HUMIDITY SOMEWHAT ELEVATED. THIS LAYER WILL SLIP STEADILY 
SOUTH ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH EARLY EVENING LEAVING SKIES CLEAR TO 
PARTLY CLOUDY. MODELS INDICATE THAT THERE MAY BE JUST A BIT TOO MUCH 
PRESSURE GRADIENT BEHIND THE FRONT OVERNIGHT AND THIS SHOULD KEEP 
THE LOW LEVEL FLOW FROM ENTIRELY DECOUPLING. THEREFORE...REMOVED THE 
FREEZE WARNING FROM THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
WHILE KEEPING THE PRODUCT IN PLACE FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MUCH 
OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. SHOULD BE A 
DECENT DAY RETURNING ON WEDNESDAY ALTHOUGH MAX TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
LIMITED TO THE 50S ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH LOWER AND  
MIDDLE 60S ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE SLIDES SE THROUGH THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD. LIGHT WINDS 
AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO FALL TO FREEZING 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE MRX CWA AND THE MOUNTAINS 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHTS. THE RIDGE SLIDES INTO THE ATLANTIC 
OVER THE WEEKEND. SOUTHWEST RETURN FLOW COMMENCES WITH A WARMING 
TREND CONTINUING INTO NEXT WEEK. FRONTAL BOUNDARY BECOMES NEARLY 
STATIONARY NORTH OF THE AREA AND PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE CONFINED TO 
PROXIMITY OF FRONT. COLD FRONT MOVES EAST INTO TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE 
IN THE PERIOD. MAJORITY OF PRECIPITATION WITH THIS SYSTEM SHOULD 
OCCUR AROUND MID WEEK. USED MODEL BLEND WITH AVERAGE UNCERTAINTY 
WITH REGARDS TO TIMING OF NEXT WEEK SYSTEM. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
941 AM EDT TUE APR 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST BASICALLY ON TRACK TODAY AS A WEAK SHORT
WAVE SHIFTS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. ALSO NOTED
A NICE DEWPOINT GRADIENT AND A BIT OF A TEMPERATURE GRADIENT ACROSS
THE OHIO VALLEY. SOME MAY CALL IT A FRONT. MAY HAVE TO ADJUST SKY
WORDING TO PARTLY SUNNY AS SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A SWATH OF
BKN-OVC AC STREAMING EAST JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THE CLOUDS WILL
HAVE A SLIGHT IMPACT ON HIGH TEMPS ALTHOUGH NOT ENOUGH TO PULL
RANGES DOWN A CATEGORY. THE CLOUDS SHOULD HELP KEEP RELATIVE HUMIDITY A
BIT HIGHER THAN IT OTHERWISE WOULD BE. WILL AMEND FORECAST FOR SKY CONDITION.
OTHERWISE...THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST IS IN GOOD SHAPE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT TUE APR 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED COLD FRONT OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHWARD TODAY...WITH GUSTY WINDS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THE VERY DRY AIR MASS WILL COMBINE WITH 
THESE GUSTY WINDS TO CREATE AN ELEVATED FIRE DANGER AGAIN THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. IN FACT...IT APPEARS THAT SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN MAY NEED A RED FLAG WARNING...BUT WILL FIRST COORDINATE 
WITH FORESTRY OFFICIALS LATER THIS MORNING BEFORE ISSUING. THIS 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL PUSH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT...WITH TEMPS FALLING INTO THE 
30S AND AREAS OF FROST DEVELOPING OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
WILL PLAN TO UPGRADE THE FREEZE WATCH TO A WARNING...AND WILL ALSO 
INCLUDE THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. WILL ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY 
FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
REGION SHOULD KEEP PRECIPITATION OUT OF AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
COOLER AIR TRACKING OVER THE REGION BRINGING AREAS OF FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES AND FROST ON EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING...AND AREAS OF 
FROST IS EXPECTED AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT OVER THE AREA. LOW 
TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE THROUGH THE PERIOD. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
913 PM EDT MON APR 9 2012

.DISCUSSION...WEAK DRY COLD FRONT HAS SLIPPED JUST SOUTH AND EAST
OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. WINDS HAVE DECREASED BUT THERE
STILL MIGHT BE A FEW GUSTS OVER THE NE AS THERE STILL IS A GOOD
PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN LOW PRESSURE OVER MA AND HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDING SOUTH ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. SOME WIND OVERNIGHT WILL
KEEP RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES RATHER LOW OVER THE MID SLOPE APPALACHIAN
SITES AS WELL AS WIND EXPOSED LOCATIONS IN THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU.
RH VALUES TUESDAY LOOK TO BE A FEW PERCENT HIGHER ACROSS SW VA WITH
COOLER TEMPERATURES BUT A FEW PERCENT LOWER FARTHER SOUTH WITH
SUSTAINED WINDS OF 10 TO 15 MPH AND GUSTS TO 25 MPH. A SPECIAL
WEATHER STATEMENT ABOUT INCREASED FIRE DANGER TUESDAY WILL BE
UPDATED TO INCLUDE SW VA WHICH WAS UNDER A RED FLAG WARNING TODAY.
AS STRONGER COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH TUESDAY WINDS MAY ACTUALLY BE
A LITTLE STRONGER THAN TODAY. INCREASING COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL
DROP LOWS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO THE 30S WITH FREEZING TEMPERATURES NE
AND FROST POSSIBLE CENTRAL AREAS. CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT
LOOKS GOOD SO NO TEXT UPDATE PLANNED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT MON APR 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM FOR GENERALLY CLEAR SKIES WITH WARM DAYS AND 
COOL NIGHTS.  THE DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE WILL KEEP RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES LOW.  ADDITIONALLY...WITH A DRY FRONTAL PASSAGE...WINDS 
WILL BE BREEZY AND GUSTY TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  THIS COMBINATION WILL 
CONTINUE TO PROVIDE AN INCREASED FIRE WEATHER RISK.  FOR 
NOW...EXPECT CONDITIONS TO REMAIN BELOW RED FLAG CRITERIA AND WILL 
KEEP SPS IN PLACE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
SLIDES SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT WITH 
NW FLOW ALOFT. REINFORCING COLD AIR ADVECTION BECOMES NEUTRAL BY 
FRIDAY. MAIN CONCERNS THROUGH FRIDAY WILL BE POTENTIAL OF 
FREEZE/FROST CONDITIONS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

BESIDES THE POTENTIAL OF FREEZE/FROST CONDITIONS...LOW DEWPOINTS AND 
WARM AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES WILL ALLOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES 
TO FALL INTO THE 20S FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...THE UPPER 20S AND 
MIDDLE 30S FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK.

BY NEXT WEEKEND...UPPER RIDGING AND WARMER THICKNESS WILL ALLOW 
TEMPERATURES TO WARM BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S FOR THE 
LATER HALF OF THE PERIOD. ALSO...CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS AS SURFACE 
RIDGING INTO THE EASTERN GULF WILL KEEP DEWPOINTS LOW.

ACTIVE WEATHER SHOULD REMAIN WEST AND NORTH OF THE AREA. 

&&

532 
FXUS64 KMRX 090649
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT MON APR 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...CREATING GUSTY WESTERLY 
WINDS...ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. THE VERY DRY 
AIR MASS WILL COMBINE WITH THESE GUSTY WINDS TO CREATE A HIGH FIRE 
DANGER THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. IN FACT...IT APPEARS THAT 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN MAY NEED A RED FLAG WARNING...BUT WILL 
FIRST COORDINATE WITH FORESTRY OFFICIALS LATER THIS MORNING ABOUT 
ISSUING THIS AND POSSIBLY OTHER STATEMENTS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND 
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...DRY NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE THE 
MAIN FEATURE OF THE FORECAST THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK. DEEP UPPER 
TROUGH ACROSS THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES/SOUTHEAST CANADA WILL KEEP 
THE UPPER FLOW NORTHWEST WITH A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT-WAVES PULLING 
WEAK COLD FRONTS ACROSS THE AREA RE-INFORCING THE CHILLY AIR. MAIN 
CONCERNS THROUGH FRIDAY WILL BE POTENTIAL OF FREEZE/FROST CONDITIONS 
FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HAVE ISSUED A FREEZE WATCH 
FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...AND SMOKY MOUNTAINS 
FOR TUESDAY. 

BESIDES THE POTENTIAL OF FREEZE/FROST CONDITIONS...LOW DEWPOINTS AND 
WARM AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES WILL ALLOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES 
TO FALL INTO THE 20S FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...THE UPPER 20S AND 
MIDDLE 30S FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK.

BY NEXT WEEKEND...UPPER RIDGING AND WARMER THICKNESS WILL ALLOW 
TEMPERATURES TO WARM BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. ALSO...CONTINUED DRY 
CONDITIONS AS SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE EASTERN GULF WILL KEEP 
DEWPOINTS LOW.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD.
&&

TUESDAY NIGHT. 

MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS WERE VERY CLOSE ALL PERIODS AND GENERALLY
FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE FORECAST AREA WILL 
BE IN THE COLD PART OF THE AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL PATTERN TO START 
THE PERIOD. A SHORT WAVE WILL DROP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY BUT MOISTURE WILL BE EXTREMELY LIMITED SO 
JUST MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. AFTER THIS FEATURE MOVES AWAY HEIGHTS BEGIN 
BUILDING. THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES 
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT 
REMAIN WEST AND NORTH OF THE REGION AND WITH LITTLE TO FOCUS PRECIP 
KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW 
NORMAL TO START OUT TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY BUT WILL GRADUALLY 
WARM BACK ABOVE NORMAL AROUND FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL 
PARK OVER THE EASTERN U.S. THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEK KEEPING 
TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. A COUPLE OF SHORT 
WAVELENGTH FEATURES WILL ROTATE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE LONGWAVE TROUGH. KEPT A FEW SPRINKLES AND POSSIBLY A SNOW FLURRY 
IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE ON MONDAY NIGHT AND DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY COINCIDENT 
WITH EACH SHORT WAVE PASSAGE. SLIGHTLY WARMER AND MORE MOIST AIR 
WILL RETURN DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AS THE 
UPPER TROUGH EXITS MAKING ROOM FOR AN AMPLIFYING RIDGE. AS THE WARM 
AIR IS LIFTED OVER THE RETREATING COOLER AIR MASS A FEW SHOWERS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DRY NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE THE 
MAIN FEATURE THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH A LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH OVER 
THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT-WAVES WILL RIDE 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE APPALCHIANS INTO THE UPPER TROUGH BRINGING WITH 
IT SUCCESSIVE RE-INFORCING COOLER AIR. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED AND 
ONLY EXPECT NORTHWEST OROGRAPHIC SHOWERS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE EXPECTED AREAS OF FROST 
MAINLY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHTS.  

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST ALLOWING FOR RIDGING AND WARMER WEATHER 
FOR THURSDAY AND ESPECIALLY FOR FRIDAY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS 
CLOSELY THROUGH THE PERIOD.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1011 PM EDT FRI APR 6 2012

.DISCUSSION...AT MID EVENING HIGH PRESSURE WAS SETTLING SOUTH FROM
THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. TEMPERATURES
HAVE BEEN HELD UP SOMEWHAT BY NORTH TO NORTHEAST WINDS ABOUT 5 TO
10 MILES PER HOUR. HAVE ADJUSTED DEW POINTS DOWN ABOUT 5 DEGREES TO
ALMOST 10 DEGREES IN PLACES AS DRIER AIRMASS IS ADVECTED SOUTH.
TEMPERATURES RUNNING CLOSE TO EARLIER GRIDS. WINDS AT LATE EVENING
HAD DECREASED. DEW POINTS SHOULD RISE A BIT AS WINDS DIE DOWN NEXT
FEW HOURS. 

ADJUSTED SOUTHERN HALF OF FORECAST AREA TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW
DEGREES. AS A RESULT EXPANDED FROST ADVISORY TO INCUDE ALL PLATEAU
AND EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES AS WELL AS NORTH CAROLINA AND CENTRAL VALLEY
AREAS OUTSIDE OF KNOXVILLE. FROST POSSIBLE MAINLY IN WIND SHELTERED
VALLEYS IN THESE AREAS. UPDATE ALREADY SENT.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT FRI APR 6 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN WEATHER CONCERN IS AREAS 
OF FROST LATE TONIGHT FOR SW VA AND NE TN. THIS EVENT STILL LOOKS ON 
TRACK AS DEFINED EARLIER...SO NO CHANGES IN THE ADVISORY AREA FOR 
NOW. THE SURFACE HIGH BUILDING IN FROM THE NORTH SHOULD KEEP A LIGHT 
NE DOWN VALLEY WIND FOR THE CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY AREAS...PLUS ANY
HIGHER TERRAIN HAS 850 MB TEMPS OF 3 TO 5 DEGREES CELSIUS WITH LIGHT 
W OR NW WINDS.

UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS REGION THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT..THEN 
FLATTENS ON SUNDAY AS AN UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS ERN CANADA AND THE 
GREAT LAKES. DRY AIRMASS STAYS IN PLACE THROUGH SUNDAY...BUT MOSTLY 
40S FOR LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT. MAX TEMPS SUNDAY SHOULD BE A FEW 
DEGREES ABOVE SATURDAY HIGHS...ALTHO A FEW CLOUDS WILL PASS ACROSS 
ON SUNDAY. MOS TEMPS WERE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MUCH OF THIS PERIOD WILL 
ACTUALLY BE COOLER THAN NORMAL AS AN UPPER TROUGH BECOMES 
ESTABLISHED ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. THE PREVAILING NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW WILL YIELD A WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGH ON TUESDAY WHICH MAY 
PRODUCE A COUPLE SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. HOWEVER...MOISTURE 
WILL BE RATHER LIMITED THUS THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP. WEDNESDAY SHOULD 
BE DRY AND QUITE COOL WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH WILL BE APPROACHING THE EASTERN STATES 
ON THURSDAY AND THEN PRESSING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY SO 
EDGED POPS UP FROM SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON THURSDAY TO LOW 
CHANCE PROBABILITY ON FRIDAY. TRENDED TEMPERATURE FORECAST TOWARD 
THE NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT FRI APR 6 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE SOUTHEASTERN GA COAST...WITH A TROUGH 
EXTENDING NORTHWEST OF IT BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AROUND THE MOUNTAINS 
OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH...BUT THESE 
SHOWERS SHOULD END BY THE AFTERNOON AS THIS UPPER TROUGH SWINGS 
EASTWARD OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE THEN 
BUILDS OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY TONIGHT...WHICH WILL 
SET THE STAGE FOR EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS AS SKIES 
CLEAR AND WINDS BECOME LIGHT. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE IN THE 30S 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...THINK THAT AREAS OF FROST 
WILL DEVELOP AND WILL ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS LATE 
TONIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN EMPHASIS DURING THE 
EXTENDED IS THE DEVELOPING LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST 
UNITED STATES/SOUTHEAST CANADA. A SERIES OF COLD FRONTS WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BEGINNING SUNDAY AND ANOTHER MONDAY. 
MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED AND ONLY EXPECT A SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE 
SHOWERS FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS DUE TO OROGRAPHIC LIFT. 

AFTER MONDAY'S SHORT-WAVE PASSAGE...THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS DIFFER 
GREATLY ON THE POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER WAVE ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW 
FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. ECMWF SHOWS A STRONGER WAVE COMING ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH FAIRLY CHILLY THICKNESS TO SUPPORT 
MOUNTAIN SNOWS. HOWEVER...THE OPERATIONAL AND ENSEMBLE GFS DOES NOT 
SHOW THIS WAVE AT ALL. WILL TREND TOWARD THE GFS FOR THE EXTENDED 
PERIODS...AND WILL FOLLOW MEX MOS CLOSELY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
351 PM EDT THU APR 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE
TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT. SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE
TONIGHT. THE LOW EXITS THE AREA ON FRIDAY WITH COOLER WEATHER
PUSHING IN TONIGHT. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON. MAY
SEE PATCHY FROST IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON FRIDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...ATMOSPHERE WILL BE
GRADUALLY TRANSITIONING INTO A COOLER REGIME AS DEEPENING NEW
ENGLAND UPPER LOW BEGINS TO RETROGRADE FROM JUST OFFSHORE TO QUEBEC
THROUGH TUESDAY. THE LARGE CIRCULATION WILL PULL AT LEAST TWO
FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT SHORTER WAVELENGTH TROUGHS SOUTH ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH MID WEEK. THEREFORE THE FORECAST
STARTS OFF DRY SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT WITH DRY
ADVECTION. BY MONDAY THE FIRST WAVE BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION
BRINGING SHOWERS. THE MOISTURE LADEN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES
INTO MID WEEK WITH INCREASINGLY COLDER AIR BUILDING SOUTH. KEPT
SLIGHT AND CHANCE POPS GOING FOR APPROXIMATELY THE NORTHERN TWO
THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY. AS 85H TEMPS DROP
BELOW FREEZING TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...MIXED IN A COUPLE
SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN. PRECIP LOOKS TO WRAP UP BY
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON SO KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY WITH
A SLIGHT WARMING TREND FOR THURSDAY. TRENDED TEMPS CLOSER TO HPC
NUMBERS WHICH INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN
THE HIGHER TERRAIN AS WELL AS SOME OF THE COLDER VALLEYS ACROSS
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

EXTENDING ACROSS EASTERN KY. THE COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY DROP SOUTH
ACROSS TN AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES EAST SOUTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHEAST
STATES BY THIS EVENING AND TO THE SE COAST BY FRIDAY MORNING.
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE LATER TODAY AS SURFACE
HEATING ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TAKES PLACE AND AIR MASS BECOMES
UNSTABLE WITH THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT AS DEW POINTS WILL BE IN
THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. SOME STORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE
ESPECIALLY SOUTH OF THE FRONT WITH LARGE HAIL POSSIBLE AND DAMAGING
WINDS. LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE FRONT.
AIR MASS SHOULD BECOME MUCH MORE STABLE TONIGHT BUT SHOWERS WILL
CONTINUE UNTIL UPPER LOW MOVES EAST AND SOUTHEAST OF THE MOUNTAINS.
HAVE POPS DECREASE GRADUALLY TONIGHT. HIGHS COOLER IN THE 70S TODAY
EXCEPT 60S NE NORTH OF THE FRONT. LOWS WILL BE MUCH COOLER TONIGHT
AS FRONT WILL BE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FOR THE WEEKEND WITH NW FLOW ALOFT. DRY CONDITIONS WITH 
TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL. REMAINDER OF FORECAST WILL DEPEND ON HOW 
UPPER LOW TAKES SHAPE OVER THE NE U.S. AND HOW FAR IT WILL 
RETROGRADE WEST. ALSO IN QUESTION IS HOW DEEP THE TROUGH BUILDS 
SOUTH. SHORT WAVE ENERGY DIVING INTO WESTERN SIDE OF UPPER TROUGH 
WILL BRING SOME REINFORCING COLD AIR ADVECTION. MOISTURE AND LOW 
RAIN CHANCE WILL BE LIMITED...MAINLY TO NE TN AN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. 
FREEZING TEMPERATURES APPEAR RESTRICTED TO THE MOUNTAINS ABOVE 3500 
FEET. NE VALLEYS WILL LIKELY SEE SOME FROST TUE AND WED MORNINGS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

417 AM EDT WED APR 4 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WARM FRONT STRETCHES FROM
SOUTHERN OH ACROSS WV INTO VA THIS MORNING WITH A MOIST AND
UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. LOW PRESSURE
WAS LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS
THE SE STATES. TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S AT THIS
HOUR. SHORT WAVE ENERGY ACROSS KY AND OH IS TRIGGERING SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS CENTRAL KY AND SOUTHERN OH AT THIS
TIME. A FEW SHOWERS ARE ALSO OVER SE TN. THE ACTIVITY IN KY WILL
MOVE EAST AND MORE ACTIVITY NEAR THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL DEVELOP
LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH INTO THE NORTHERN
SECTIONS BY TONIGHT AND BE A FOCUS FOR MORE SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT. A CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL STAY OVER THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS TODAY. HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT COMBINED WITH SURFACE
HEATING AND STEEP MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL CAUSE THE AIR MASS TO
BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE. ORGANIZED STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO
DEVELOP AND MOVE EAST INTO WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA
WITH LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL MAY PRODUCE SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING
OVER SW VA AND NORTHERN TN. WITH MORE CLOUD COVER EXPECTING
TEMPERATURES TO BE ABOUT 5 DEGREES COOLER. MILD TEMPERATURES AGAIN
TONIGHT. WENT CLOSE TO MAV NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...CUT OFF UPPER LOW MOVES
TO N AL THU WHILE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST THROUGH
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. HIGHEST POPS WILL TRANSITION FROM NORTHERN
AREAS TO SOUTHERN AREAS BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING AS SYSTEM
PUSHES THROUGH. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY INTO THURSDAY
EVENING. HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE THE MAJOR THREAT FROM THESE STORMS.
CHANCE POPS CONTINUE INTO FRIDAY AS THE CLOSED LOW MOVES THROUGH
THE SRN APPALACHIANS WHILE ABSORBING INTO THE MEAN NE U.S. TROUGH.

A DEEP RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY...PROVIDING MILD TEMPS AND MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. BY MONDAY A 
DEEP CYCLONIC CIRCULATION BECOMES POSITIONED OVER ONTARIO...WITH A 
STRONG JET ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE AREA AROUND MONDAY...WITH A MUCH COLDER AIR MASS 
BUILDING IN FOR TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSER TO NORMAL.  
AGRICULTURAL INTERESTS WILL NEED TO KEEP AN EYE ON THE POTENTIAL FOR 
A LATE SEASON FROST OR FREEZE NEXT WEEK...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS. IMPULSE IN NW FLOW MAY BRING SOME SHOWERS TO NE TN/SW VA TUE 
AND TUE NGT.

LAYER SHEAR LOOKS WEAK.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
429 AM EDT TUE APR 3 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDS FROM 
WEST CENTRAL KENTUCKY THROUGH EAST TENNESSEE...VICINITY MORRISTOWN 
AND CONTINUE SE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS INTO SOUTH 
CAROLINA. SIGNIFICANT DEW POINT GRADIENT ACROSS FRONT WITH LOWER 60S 
TO THE SW AND UPPER 40S TO UPPER 30S NE INTO SW VA. THIS FRONT WILL 
RETURN NORTH AS A WARM FRONT TODAY. GOOD DESTABILIZATION WILL AGAIN 
OCCUR WEST OF THE FRONT. LAPSE RATES AROUND 6.5C REMAIN IN PLACE. 
TRIGGERS ARE HARD TO FIND BUT DIFFERENTIAL HEATING WILL BE MAIN 
TRIGGER. WEAK WESTERLY STEERING ALOFT WILL RESULT IN SLOW MOVING 
STORMS WHICH MAY RESULT IN MINOR FLOODING. SMALL HAIL IS ALSO 
POSSIBLE. HIGH LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES SUPPORT ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN WHERE 80S WILL BE 
COMMON. LOW CHANCE CONVECTION REMAINS POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT WITH VERY 
WARM TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...INCREASING CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY AS A SHORTWAVE PASSES THROUGH
THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. BEST CHANCES NORTH
DECREASING OVER THE EXTREME SOUTH. HIGHS SHOULD BE SEVERAL DEGREES
COOLER WITH EARLIER START TO SHOWERS. A COLD FRONT OVER KY WILL
SLIDE SOUTH INTO TN DURING THE DAY AND WILL HELP FOCUS MORE
PRECIPITATION OVER THE AREA. PRECIPITATION WILL DECREASE WEDNESDAY
EVENING BUT MORE ACTIVITY DEVELOPING AROUND THE CIRCULATION OF AN
UPPER LOW MOVING INTO THE MS AND OHIO VALLEYS COULD CONTINUE
CONVECTION ALL NIGHT. THE UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT SO RAIN CHANCES STAY HIGH AND MORE
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE AS AIR MASS CONTINUES TO BE UNSTABLE. STILL
COOLER TEMPERATURES THURSDAY. UPPER LOW FINALLY SHIFTS EAST FRIDAY
WITH DECREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS. RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH DRY CONDITIONS. A FAST MOVING COLD FRONT
WILL ONLY CAUSE A FEW SHOWERS SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WITH A BROAD
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES.

&&

LOSING INTENSITY AS THE INSOLATION WANES. HOWEVER...EXPECT
ISOLATED DEVELOPMENT IN THE VICINITY OF THE BOUNDARY INTO THE LATER
EVENING PERIOD. NOT SO SURE HOW MUCH FURTHER SOUTH THIS FRONT WILL
SLIP AS THE ARKLATEX UPPER LOW EDGES A BIT FARTHER EAST PUSHING THE
NARROW RIDGE AXIS TOWARD THE EASTERN SEABOARD. THEREFORE...KEPT
THUNDER OUT OF CHA FOR TONIGHT BECAUSE DON'T BELIEVE THE CENTRAL
EAST TENNESSEE DEVELOPMENT WILL MAKE IT THIS FAR SOUTH BEFORE
DISSIPATING. THERE SHOULD BE SOME FAIRLY DECENT FOG DEVELOPMENT
TONIGHT AND USED PREVAILING MVFR VSBY IN FOG WITH IFR VSBY AND SOME
LIFR CEILINGS IN TEMPO GROUPS AT TRI AND TYS. STAYED QUITE A BIT
HIGHER AT CHA WHERE SOME OF THE CI DEBRIS SLOWS COOLING LATE
TONIGHT. BEST AXIS OF INSTABILITY WILL BE FROM AROUND TYS TO CHA ON
TUESDAY SO WENT WITH VICNITY THUNDER AND BROKEN CU CEILINGS IN
THESE AREAS.

FXUS64 KMRX 021928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EDT MON APR 2 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER AREA WILL ERODE OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF
DAYS...BUT ENOUGH PERSISTS ON TUESDAY FOR ANOTHER WARM AND HUMID
DAY. EXCEPTION WILL BE THE COOLER AND DRY AIR NUDGING IN FROM THE
NORTHEAST INTO SW VA. BUT THE SHORT TERM FEATURES ARE FAIRLY
UNIMPRESSIVE COMPARED TO THE EXTENDED FORECAST.

SCATTERED CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE VALLEY IN AND AROUND
MORRISTOWN AS WELL AS NEAR TRICITIES...COULD SEE ADDITIONAL
DEVELOPMENT THROUGH EARLY EVENING. SCATTERED CONVECTION AGAIN ON
TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH IN THE NW FLOW WILL BE PASSING OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY. NAM AND GFS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT IN THIS TIME FRAME. PRECIP CHANCES BEGIN RISING 
TUESDAY NIGHT...PEAKING WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WITH DIURNAL ENHANCEMENT 
FROM DAYTIME HEATING. WHILE A FRONT IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN NORTH OF 
THE AREA...THERE MAY BE SOME ENHANCED CONVERGENCE ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS IN THE AFTERNOON AS IT DRIFTS SOUTH. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON IN THE NORTH WITH CHANCE POPS SOUTH. 

A WEAK SHORTWAVE RIDGE ALOFT CROSSES THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT BEFORE 
A MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM APPROACHES FOR THURSDAY. THE MODELS BEGIN 
TO DIVERGE SOMEWHAT ON THE TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM...WITH THE GFS 
SHOWING A SLOWER NW-SE TRACK AND THE NAM SHOWING A FASTER DUE EAST 
TRACK FROM THE OZARKS ACROSS TN. FAVORABLE JET POSITIONING AND 
FALLING 500MB HEIGHTS BY BOTH MODELS SUGGEST LIKELY POPS ARE 
WARRANTED FOR THURSDAY. THE FRONT THAT WAS TO OUR NORTH BEGINS TO 
PUSH SOUTHWARD INTO THE AREA LATE THURSDAY. WITH THE FRONT IN OUR 
VICINITY...CHANCE POPS CONTINUE THURSDAY NIGHT...TAPERING OFF 
THROUGH FRIDAY AS THE UPPER LOW EXITS. COOLER TEMPS CAN BE EXPECTED 
UNDER DENSE CLOUD COVER FRIDAY...IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S. 

A LARGE RIDGE WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...GIVING 
SUNNY SKIES AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND. THE GFS SHOWS A COLD FRONT 
PASSAGE ON SUNDAY WITH A BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN 
CONUS...AND THE ECMWF SHOWING A GENERALLY SIMILAR PATTERN BUT A 
SLOWER FRONT. GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SEEM TO ALL BE SLOWER THAN THE 
OPERATIONAL GFS AND FAVOR THE ECMWF. THUS WILL LEAN TOWARD THE 
SLOWER SOLUTION AND HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP MONDAY.

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT SUN APR 1 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED 
WARM FRONT STRETCHING FROM CINCINNATI TO LONDON KY TO KNOXVILLE TO 
ANDREWS NC. CURRENT RADAR AND SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEAL CLEAR SKIES 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...BUT ADDITIONAL CONVECTION WAS 
BEGINNING TO DEVELOP OVER CENTRAL INDIANA. THIS CONVECTION IS 
EXPECTED TO FURTHER ORGANIZE INTO A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM 
LATER THIS EVENING...WHICH SHOULD MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN DURING THE EARLY MORNING HOURS AFTER MIDNIGHT. WITH 
A FAIRLY STEEP MID-LEVEL LAPSE RATE COMBINED WITH A DECENT UPPER- 
LEVEL WIND FLOW...IT APPEARS THAT SOME OF THESE STORMS WILL HAVE THE 
POTENTIAL FOR LARGE HAIL.

WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE ZONE FORECASTS TO 
MENTION CONVECTION AFTER MIDNIGHT OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. ALSO...CLOUDS SHOULD INCREASE AREAWIDE LATER TONIGHT 
AS THIS COMPLEX FURTHER EXPANDS IN COVERAGE...WHICH SHOULD LIMIT THE 
AREAL COVERAGE OF FOG LATER TONIGHT.

OVER THE AREA. ALSO...CONCERN ABOUT POTENTIAL OF ISOLATED FLASH 
FLOODING DUE TO THE PERSISTENT PERIODS OF CONVECTION. PWS INCREASE 
TO NEARLY 1.5 INCHES BY MID-WEEK.

RETURNING FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
730 AM EDT SUN APR 1 2012

.AVIATION...IFR FOG WILL BURN OFF BY 01/14Z. WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
IN PLACE ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY IN THE VICINITY OF INTERSTATES 40. 
THIS FEATURE WILL MOVE SLOWLY NORTH THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD. LIGHT 
SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL DEVELOP AFTER DAY BREAK. ISOLATED CONVECTION 
WILL DEVELOP ALONG AND NORTH OF THE FRONT LATER TODAY. ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION IS EXPECTED THIS EVENING/TONIGHT TO MOVE SE THROUGH KY 
INTO SW VA. TRI TSRA VCNTY MAY BE UPGRADED TO PREVAILING OR TEMPO 
CONDITIONS WITH LATER UPDATES.  
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM EDT /8 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...

600 
FXUS64 KMRX 010757
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
356 AM EDT SUN APR 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDS EAST 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS 
BOUNDARY WILL MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE PERIOD. HIGHER MOISTURE REMAINS 
SOUTH OF THE FRONT. INSTABILITY WILL BE ON THE RISE TODAY WITH A 
WELL DEFINED AXIS ALONG THE FRONT TODAY. ISOLATED CONVECTION IS 
POSSIBLE ANYWHERE TODAY BUT ESPECIALLY ALONG THE FRONT. A CONVECTIVE 
COMPLEX AND MID LEVEL IMPULSE WILL MOVE SE THROUGH KENTUCKY LATER 
TODAY. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO SW VA EARLY TONIGHT. WET 
BULB ZERO HEIGHTS ARE AROUND 9000 FEET. SMALL TO LARGE HAIL IS 
POSSIBLE WITH ANY STORMS THAT DEVELOP. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
CONTINUE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE 
REGION WILL SEE A SERIES OF WEAK IMPULSES MOVE THROUGH THE NORTHWEST 
FLOW EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY 
FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  THE RIDGE WEAKENS AND 
DROPS SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT ALLOWING THE APPROACH OF A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM.  THE FRONT AND EVENTUALLY THE UPPER LOW MOVES THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY TIME FRAME...PROVIDING THE BEST 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACTIVITY DURING THE EXTENDED.
A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO FRIDAY...MAINLY NORTH AND 
EAST..OTHERWISE  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

&&

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              76  54  79  52  81 /  30  50  20  20  30

     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EDT SAT MAR 31 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH A MILD AND 
MOIST AIR MASS STILL LINGERING BEHIND IT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION LINGERING OVER EXTREME 
NORTHEAST TN...BUT MODEL DATA INDICATES THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE EARLIER CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WAS EXITING 
THE REGION. THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATED THE FORECAST LATER THIS 
EVENING TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF CONVECTION. REST OF THE FORECAST 
APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE.

025 
FXUS64 KMRX 311859
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT SAT MAR 31 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGGING 
SOUTH INTO THE AREA IS COMBINING WITH A WEAK UPPER IMPULSE TO BRING 
SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA.  THESE SHOULD DIMINISH 
THIS EVENING...AND EXPECT SOME PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT.  WITH 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY STILL IN THE AREA SUNDAY MAY SEE SOME AFTERNOON 
CONVECTION AGAIN...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON.  MAV TEMPS LOOK A BIT TOO LOW TONIGHT AND TOO HIGH 
SUNDAY...SO WILL BLEND IN SOME OF THE MET TEMPS TO MAKE THE RANGE A 
BIT SMALLER.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A DIRTY RIDGE WILL
SUMMARIZE THE WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE UPCOMING WEEK. FLOW OVER THE
TOP OF THE RIDGE WILL PERMIT WEAK DISTURBANCES TO PLAY WITH THE CWA
/ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST HALF/ AND FOCUS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY...HOWEVER
EVEN WHEN SUCH DISTURBANCES ARE ABSENT...THE WARM AND SORTA HUMID
AIR WILL YIELD ISOLATED CONVECTION MOST AFTERNOONS/EVENINGS. ONLY
AFTER A CLOSED LOW MOVES THROUGH THE AREA /THAT FOR NOW THE
GFS..DGEX..AND ECMWF AMAZINGLY AGREE ON/ DURING LATE THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY DO WE POTENTIALLY GET A COUPLE DAYS OF FAIR AND QUIET
WEATHER FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 310715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT SAT MAR 31 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHING SLOWLY 
SOUTH INTO TN LATE THIS MORNING. RELATIVELY HIGH DEW POINTS WILL 
PERSIST ACROSS MRX CWA UNTIL FRONT PASSES LATER THIS AFTERNOON. 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SERVE AS FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TODAY. MODERATE INSTABILITY FAVORABLE WHILE 
LAYER SHEAR IS LOW. SEVERE THREAT IS LOW WITH SMALL HAIL A 
POSSIBILITY. AXIS OF UPPER SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE SE THROUGH THE AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON. COVERAGE OF CONVECTION WILL DECREASE FROM THE NW. 
DESPITE CLOUD COVER...ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE. NORTHERN 
AREAS WILL APPROACH NORMAL MIN TEMPS TONIGHT WITH DECENT RADIATION. 
FOG WILL LIKELY DEVELOP ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA AS TEMPS COOL TO DEW 
POINTS LATE.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODEL AND RUN CONSISTENCY 
REMAINS QUITE POOR AND CONFIDENCE STILL LOW THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED.  SUNDAY REMAINS OUR BEST CHANCE FOR DRY CONDITIONS WITH 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  DIRTY RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY.  A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVES ROUND OVER THE 
RIDGE...BRINGING WEAK LIFT AND A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS.  THE RIDGE DAMPENS AND A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE 
AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.  THIS WILL PROVIDE OUR BEST 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION WITH STRONGEST LIFT AND DEEPEST LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IN PLACE.  UPPER LOW MOVES THROUGH ON THURSDAY/THURSDAY 
NIGHT FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS.  WILL KEEP FRIDAY 
DRY AS A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.

&&

TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. MAY TWEAK LOW TEMPS HIGHER

761 
FXUS64 KMRX 301856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EDT FRI MAR 30 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...WARM FRONT HAS MOVED NORTH OF 
THE AREA AND MOISTURE HAS INCREASED. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL IMPULSE WILL 
AFFECT THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING...THEN A WEAK 
COLD FRONT WILL PUSH IN ON SATURDAY.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS EARLY 
TONIGHT...THEN CHANCE. SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON SATURDAY AS DRIER AIR 
WORKS IN. NO MAJOR ARGUMENTS WITH MAV TEMPS SO JUST A FEW MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE BEGINNING OF THE 
EXTENDED WILL BE DRY WITH WARM AFTERNOONS DUE TO A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE AREA WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY SOUTH AND WEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL PULL NORTHEAST INTO THE 
REGION FOR MONDAY WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY PRODUCING 
WIDELY SCATTERED TO SCATTERED MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
CONVECTION.

FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS CONTINUE TO 
DIFFER ON THE AMOUNT OF PHASING BETWEEN A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORT-WAVES. THE ECMWF IS MUCH DIFFERENT FROM YESTERDAY WITH 
A DEFINED SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS TEXAS AND 
NORTHERN GULF AS WELL AS A MUCH DEEPER UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN 
QUARTER OF THE UNITED STATES.  THE GFS AND CANADIAN MODEL ARE CLOSER 
IN AGREEMENT WITH BRINGING SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER LOW ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. WILL FOLLOW THE GFS MODEL BUT WITH LOWER THAN 
AVERAGE CONFIDENCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             77  58  80  51  84 /  70  60  20  10   0

FXUS64 KMRX 300713
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT FRI MAR 30 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDS SE FROM 
W KY ACROSS EAST TN INTO SC. THIS BOUNDARY WILL MOVE NORTH TODAY AS 
A WARM FRONT. DEW POINTS WILL REMAIN HIGH ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE 
FRONT. THE AIRMASS WILL DESTABILIZE WITH DAY TIME HEATING. LOW LEVEL 
THICKNESS VALUES SUPPORT TEMPERATURES WARMER THAN MOS GUIDANCE. THE 
MOS MAY BE ALLUDING TO MORE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER BUT SEE NO REASON 
TO GO A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN THURSDAY. AIRMASS THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE EARLY TODAY AND CONTINUE THIS EVENING AS A SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. STAYED ABOVE TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE TONIGHT 
WITH COLD FRONT REMAINING NORTH OF THE AREA. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL LINGER OVER THE MRX CWA ON SATURDAY AS A COLD 
FRONT PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION.  SHOULD BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND.  CONSISTENCY REMAINS POOR FOR THE REST OF 
THE EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  HOWEVER...EXPECT TO MOVE INTO 
AN UNSETTLED PATTEN MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS A SERIES OF 
FRONTS/LOWS TRACK THROUGH THE AREA.  BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION WILL 
REMAIN TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT SLIDES THROUGH.  
UPPER LOW MOVES THROUGH FOR WEDNESDAY FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF 
CONVECTION.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY.  GUIDANCE LOOKS 
GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AND SEVIER COUNTIES WHERE MOST OF THE CONVECTION DEVELOPED THIS 
AFTERNOON. MARYVILLE EXPERIENCED VERY LOCALLIZED DOWNPOURS.

WILL FRESHEN HOURLY GRIDS...MAINLY WHERE RAIN COOLED TEMPS MUCH 
BELOW CURRENT HOURLY GRIDS. UPDATED GRIDS AND PRODUCTS SHORTLY AFTER

FXUS64 KMRX 292327
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
725 PM EDT THU MAR 29 2012

.AVIATION...CONVECTION HAS WEAKENED GREATLY FROM MID TO LATE 
AFTERNOON...BUT SOME SPOTTY SHOWERS OR POSSIBLY -TSRA COULD LINGER 
ALONG OR NEAR THE STALLED FRONT. THIS WOULD AFFECT MOSTLY TYS AND  
SOME PATCHY DENSE FOG MAY DEVELOP THERE BEFORE DAYBREAK (DUE TO 
NEARLY 3/4THS OF AN INCH OF RAIN TODAY). TOOK VISBY DOWN TO 4SM BR 
FOR NOW.

ONE MODEL SPREADS SHOWERS NE OVERNIGHT FROM MS/AL...BUT CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW IN THIS ACTUALLY HAPPENING. A MORE SENSIBLE FORECAST IS FOR 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING AGAIN ON FRIDAY IN THE AFTERNOON...TIED MUCH 
TO LOCATION OF STALLED FRONT OR WARM FRONT LIFTING NE. FOR NOW KEPT 
TSRA OUT OF TAFS...CHOOSING CB AND SHOWERS AT BOTH CHA AND TYS.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE 
AREA WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH TONIGHT.  
SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED OVER CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
AREAS NEAR AND SOUTH OF THIS BOUNDARY...AND WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS THROUGH TONIGHT IN THESE SAME AREAS TONIGHT.  MODELS INDICATE 
THE FRONT WILL BEGIN MOVING BACK NORTH FRIDAY AS A WEAK LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM TRAVERSES THE OHIO VALLEY.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AND MODELS 
INDICATE A WEAK UPPER IMPULSE MAY BRUSH THE AREA...SO WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES FOR FRIDAY.  NO MAJOR ARGUMENTS WITH MAV 
TEMPS.     

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
WILL START WILL A QUICK MOVING SHORT-WAVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY 
INTO THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH 
CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE OF SATURDAY. BOUNDARY 
MOVES SOUTH OF THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT BEGINS TO MOVE BACK 
NORTH FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH LOW CHANCE POPS OF CONVECTION.

THE MEDIUM RANGE MODEL SHOWS CONSIDERABLE DISAGREEMENT FOR EARLY TO 
MID PART OF NEXT WEEK. THE ECMWF SHOWS A PHASED NORTHERN STREAM 
DOMINATED TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. 
THE OPERATIONAL GFS SHOWS A SEPARATE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM 
TROUGHS. SINCE THE SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE IS NOT PHASED WITH THE 
NORTHERN WAVE...CONVECTION LASTS CONSIDERABLY LONGER. GFS ENSEMBLE 
SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN THE GFS MEMBERS...SO HAVE 
LOW CONFIDENCE ON HOW SYSTEM WILL EVENTUALLY EVOLVE. WILL TREND MORE 
TOWARD THE MORE PROGRESSIVE ECMWF SOLUTION. WILL CALL FOR DRIER 
WEATHER RETURNING BY WEDNESDAY.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

483 
FXUS64 KMRX 290816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU MAR 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY CONTINUES 
TO MAKE ITS WAY VERY SLOWLY SOUTH THROUGH SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA EARLY 
THIS MORNING. FRONTAL MOVEMENT IS SLOW ENOUGH THAT IT MAY NOT MAKE 
IT SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE BORDER AROUND CHATTANOOGA. WITH MODEST 
MOISTURE AND A BIT OF INSTABILITY PROGGED ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE 
MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM 
GENERALLY SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. KEPT THE CHANCE GOING THROUGH THE 
EVENING AND ADJUSTED FARTHER NORTH ACROSS A SMALL PART OF THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NEAR THE KENTUCKY BORDER AS MOISTURE AND LIFT 
WILL BE GRADUALLY INCREASING LATER TONIGHT AS THE OLD FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY LIFTS BACK NORTH IN RESPONSE THE ADVANCE OF THE PLAINS 
STATES UPPER TROUGH. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MAX TEMP GUIDANCE BLEND 
TODAY...PULLING MAX TEMP A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW BLEND AT CHA AS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND ASSOCIATED CLOUDS MOVE INTO THIS AREA DURING 
THE AFTERNOON. TRIED TO GO A COUPLE DEGREES MILDER THAN SUGGESTED 
MIN TEMPS WITH UNCERTAINTY IN JUST HOW FAR SOUTH FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
GETS BEFORE MOVING BACK NORTH.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LOW PRESSURE TRACKING OVER 
THE LOWER GREAT LAKES WILL BRING INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION IN A 
LOW LEVEL SW FLOW ON FRIDAY. PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE RISING THROUGH 
THE DAY AS 500 MB HEIGHTS FALL AND THE MID/UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES 
MORE AMPLIFIED. BEST PRECIP CHANCES APPEAR TO BE IN NORTHERN AREAS 
FRIDAY EVENING WHEN THE UPPER JET BECOMES POSITIONED OVER THE UPPER 
OH VALLEY AND THE 850-700 MB TROUGH PASSAGE OCCURS. INSTABILITY 
LOOKS SUFFICIENT FOR A MARGINAL SEVERE THREAT FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING...BUT WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES BARELY OVER 1 
INCH...COVERAGE WILL NOT BE EXTENSIVE. A SLIGHT CHANCE POP WILL 
CONTINUE FOR SOUTHERN AREAS INTO SATURDAY MORNING AS A COLD FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH. THE NAM SHOWS MUCH COLDER AIR BUILDING IN BEHIND THE 
FRONT THAN THE GFS...WILL LEAN TOWARD THE NAM SOLUTION WHICH HAS 
SUPPORT FROM THE SREF AND CANADIAN. 

AN INCREASINGLY AMPLIFIED RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST WILL MEAN 
CONTINUED MILD TEMPERATURES AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR SUNDAY. ONCE 
THE RIDGE AXIS MOVES TO OUR EAST ON MONDAY...MOISTURE ADVECTION 
INCREASES AHEAD OF A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CROSSING THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER IN THEIR DEPICTION OF THIS 
SYSTEM WITH THE GFS SHOWING A SOUTHERN STREAM CLOSED LOW WHILE THE 
ECMWF SHOWS A DEEP OPEN TROUGH...BUT BOTH MODELS POINT TO LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES AND TUESDAY MORNING FOR 
TIMING OF FROPA. BOTH SHOW STRONG JET DYNAMICS GIVING A POTENTIAL 
FOR SEVERE STORMS...BUT ESPECIALLY THE GFS WITH ITS CUT OFF LOW. 
SIGNIFICANTLY COOLER AND MORE SEASONABLE TEMPS WILL FOLLOW THE FRONT 
FOR WEDNESDAY.

&&

.AVIATION...WEAK COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO DROP SOUTH FROM ERN KY AND

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SAG 
SOUTH INTO THE AREA TONIGHT...THEN STALL IN VICINITY OF OUR SOUTHERN 
BORDER.  LOOKS LIKE BEST MOISTURE/INSTABILITY AND LIFT WILL BE 
NORTH...SO WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS NORTH...JUST SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH 
TONIGHT. STILL APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME THREAT OF SEVERE

SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTHERN COUNTIES.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST WILL BE DETERMINED BY TWO SHORT-WAVES. FIRST (WEAKER WAVE) 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY FRIDAY. FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...WARM
FRONT WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE WESTERN FORECAST AREA PRODUCING 
A CHANCE OF CONVECTION. FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...FAST MOVING 
SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH A TRAILING MOVING 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY MORNING. 

RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL PRODUCE MOSTLY DRY AND MILD 
CONDITIONS FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. STRONG UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE 
ACROSS PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT/EARLY TUESDAY 
MORNING. ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE A CONCERN OF SEVERE WEATHER 
LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS IN AGREEMENT WITH 
AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION FOR EARLY-
MID WEEK NEXT WEEK...WHICH WILL USHER IN MUCH COOLER WEATHER.

875 
FXUS64 KMRX 280813
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT WED MAR 28 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH EDGING EASTWARD 
TOWARD THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES WITH COLD FRONT PRESSING INTO THE 
UPPER MIDWEST EARLY THIS MORNING. SOME CONVECTION ALREADY NOTED JUST 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT ACROSS ILLINOIS. MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD 
ENJOY ANOTHER GREAT DAY COMPLETE WITH WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
AS INSOLATION COMPETES WITH SCATTERED TO BROKEN CIRRUS CLOUDS DURING 
THE MORNING. A SOUTHWESTERLY BREEZE WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGION 
WHICH WILL HELP TEMPERATURES CLIMB. DURING THE AFTERNOON A LINE OF 
CONVECTION WILL DROP FURTHER SOUTH THROUGH KENTUCKY AS THE MID WEST 
COLD FRONT CONTINUES ITS TREK TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. BY LATE AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BECOME 
LIKELY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. MUCH OF THE STRONGER UPPER LEVEL 
DYNAMICS AND DEEPER MOISTURE WILL SWING EAST THROUGH THE MIDDLE 
ATLANTIC STATES BY EVENING BUT THERE WILL STILL BE A RELATIVELY HIGH 
CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM WEDNESDAY NIGHT MAINLY NORTH OF 
INTERSTATE 40 WITH CHANCES RAPIDLY DECREASING ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE 
THAT SOME OF THE CONVECTION THAT BUILDS SOUTH INTO THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE TODAY AND THIS EVENING MAY BECOME SEVERE 
WITH WEAK INSTABILITY AND SHEAR PROGGED IN THIS AREA. WOULD EXPECT 
CONVECTION TO WEAKEN DURING THE EVENING WITH THE LOSS OF HEATING. 
WENT CLOSE TO THE WARMEST MAX TEMP GUIDANCE TODAY WITH ONLY A THIN 
VEIL OF CIRRUS AND A FEW CU DURING MUCH OF THE DAY WHILE OPTING FOR 
THE MILDER SUGGESTED MIN TEMPS AS THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED CLOUDS 
SAG SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS APPEAR TO BE TRENDING 
FASTER WITH THE SYSTEM FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...AND POPS WILL BE 
ADJUSTED ACCORDINGLY. THE NAM...GFS...AND SREF SHOW HIGHEST POPS 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING IN ASSOCIATION WITH A FAST-MOVING 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH. MOISTURE REMAINS FAIRLY LIMITED WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE. A DEEP NW FLOW 
DEVELOPS BEHIND THE TROUGH PASSAGE...WHICH SHOULD GIVE DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. A BUILDING RIDGE WILL KEEP 
TEMPS WELL ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

THE GFS AND THE ECMWF BOTH SHOW A WELL-DEFINED FRONT MOVING INTO THE 
AREA MONDAY NIGHT. THIS SHOULD BRING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS BEGINNING MONDAY AFTERNOON. WITH A ZONAL FLOW 
ALOFT...THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH QUICKLY...SO TUESDAY LOOKS DRY 
ALONG WITH TEMPERATURES CLOSER TO SEASONAL NORMS. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 280157

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EDT TUE MAR 27 2012

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. THIN HIGH CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY INVADE 
FROM THE WEST OVERNIGHT. LOW SURFACE DEW POINTS SUPPORT ADDITIONAL 
COOLING TONIGHT...HOWEVER TEMPERATURES REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM  (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY 
SHIFT OUT OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT ALLOWING FOR ONE MORE PERIOD OF 
CLEAR AND QUIET CONDITIONS.  AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL SPREAD 
HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY WITH A CHANCE 
OF CONVECTION REACHING INTO MAINLY NORTHERN AREAS DURING THE LATTER 
HALF OF THE AFTERNOON.  MOISTURE REMAINS LIMITED BUT THE AIR MASS 
BECOMES QUITE UNSTABLE FOR A CHANGE OF SOME STRONG...AND POSSIBLY 
SEVERE STORMS LATE IN THE DAY.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...BEST CONFIDENCE IS THE 
FIRST HALF OF THE LONG TERM...THEN MUCH LOWER CONFIDENCE FROM SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY. GFS SOLUTION FOR THOSE LATER PERIODS IS THE ONLY 
WET ONE...WITH NAM...ECMWF AND CANADIAN ALL SUPPORTING MOSTLY A DRY 
FORECAST. KEPT SOME CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND AFTER 
COORDINATION WITH JKL...KEPT JUST OUR SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY...GOING AGAINST THE INCREASING GFSX MOS POPS. 

THE EARLY PERIODS FEATURE ANOTHER WEAK E-W ORIENTED FRONT THAT DOES 
NOT PUSH THRU...BEFORE LIFTING BACK AS A WARM FRONT ON FRIDAY. A 
POTENTIAL SHORTWAVE AND ANOTHER FRONT MAY PRODUCE A BETTER SWATH OF 
CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION BY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...BUT FOR NOW 
I KEPT THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY DRY. NUDGED POPS UP TO LIKELY W AND 
HIGH CHANCE E FOR SATURDAY...DUE TO SOME CONSISTENCY AND CONSENSUS 
AMONGST MODELS. OTHERWISE...TRENDED FAIRLY CLOSE TO A BLEND OF 
27/00Z AND 27/12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS.

969 
FXUS64 KMRX 270703
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 AM EDT TUE MAR 27 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A BACKDOOR COLD FRONT IS PUSHING INTO THE AREA THIS MORNING AS HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES MOVES SOUTHEAST. THE FRONT NEVER MAKES 
IT ENTIRELY THROUGH THE AREA...AND ITS MAIN IMPACT WILL BE LOWER 
DEWPOINTS IN THE NORTH BEFORE IT DISSIPATES. WITH FULL SUN...HIGHS 
WILL REACH THE UPPER 70S SOUTH TO AROUND 70 NORTH. 

AS THE HIGH SHIFTS OFF THE SOUTH ATLANTIC COAST TONIGHT...A 
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL DEVELOP IN THE LOW LEVELS. HOWEVER THE EAST-WEST 
ORIENTATION OF THE RIDGE AXIS WILL PREVENT A GOOD INFLUX OF GULF 
MOISTURE. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO THE 
MID ATLANTIC STATES ON WEDNESDAY. ALTHOUGH MOISTURE WILL BE 
LIMITED...GOOD INSTABILITY DEVELOPS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
ALONG WITH A PRE-FRONTAL CONVERGENCE ZONE...GIVING A HIGH CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS NORTH. NAM AND GFS SHOW DIFFERING AMOUNT 
OF INSTABILITY...BUT WITH EVEN THE LESS UNSTABLE GFS SHOWING CAPE 
NEAR 1000 J/KG...SOME SEVERE STORMS MAY BE POSSIBLE...MAINLY IN THE 
NORTH. THE POPS DECREASE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT AND 
INSTABILITY ARE LOST. 

THE END OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD LOOKS MUCH LIKE THE 
BEGINNING...WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES PUSHING A 
BACKDOOR COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. 
THIS WILL BRING DRIER AIR INTO THE AREA...WITH MILD DAYTIME TEMPS IN 
THE 70S TO LOWER 80S AND COOL OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE UPPER 30S AND 
40S. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS START OUT IN AGREEMENT CLOSING OUT THE END OF MARCH BUT
DIVERGE AS THE NEW MONTH ARRIVES WITH THE 12Z ECMWF A LITTLE SLOW
TO MOVE WEEKEND SHORT WAVE OUT AND LACKS AMPLIFICATION OF WESTERN
STATES UPPER TROUGH WHICH APPEARS TO BE THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER FOR
THE EASTERN U.S. BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. DID NOT MAKE ANY
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE LONG TERM FORECAST WITH HIGHEST POPS FOR
CONVECTION SATURDAY NIGHT WHILE DROPPING BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE ON
SUNDAY AS SHORT WAVE SHIFTS EAST. WITH UNCERTAINTY IN SPEED OF NEXT
SYSTEM MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS ON MONDAY. TRENDED MAX/MIN TEMPS TOWARD THE NEW MEX
MOS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             78  52  79  56  81 /   0   0  20  30  20

MIDDLE AND UPPER 30S. PATCHY-AREAS OF FROST IS EXPECTED ACROSS
THESE AREAS TOWARD MORNING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SHELTERED VALLEYS.

AREAL EXTENT IS NOT SUFFICIENT TO WARRANT A FROST ADVISORY.

CURRENT FORECAST LOWS LOOK GOOD. MADE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO
HOURLY TEMPERATURE AND DEWPOINT.

&&

258 PM EDT MON MAR 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR A

WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT AN ADVISORY AT THIS TIME.  PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE AND WARM TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR TUESDAY AS THE HIGH 
CONTINUE TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THESE PERIODS START OUT 
WITH A WEAKENING UPPER RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION. 
THIS ALLOWS A WEAK E-W FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO GRADUALLY WORK SOUTH 
THROUGH THE SRN APPALACHIANS BY LATE THURSDAY. VERY BRIEF UPPER AND 
SURFACE RIDGING FOR FRIDAY ALLOWS DRY WEATHER FOR A PERIOD OR TWO.

THE OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY LIFTS NE AS THE NEXT WEAK SHORTWAVE 
APPROACHES FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. UPPER LEVELS LOOK A BIT NOISY 
INTO MONDAY WITH SOME TYPE OF LINGERING FRONTAL BOUNDARY POSSIBLE. 

WEAK IS CERTAINLY THE APPROPRIATE TERMINOLOGY WITH ANY OF THE THESE 
SYSTEMS...SO NOT MUCH QPF EXPECTED NOR ANY REAL THREAT OF SEVERE 
WEATHER EITHER. TEMPS WON'T HIT THE 80S FOR HIGHS NOR 30S FOR LOWS
...STAYING MOSTLY 60S AND 70S FOR HIGHS AND LOWS IN THE MID 40S TO 
MID 50S...STILL ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 AM EDT MON MAR 26 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
LINGERING CLOUD COVER BEHIND A DEPARTING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
MAINLY AFFECT NORTHERN AND EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS 
MORNING. OTHERWISE SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY BY AFTERNOON...WITH 
TEMPERATURES PEAKING IN THE 70S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. 

HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES WILL SHIFT EAST THROUGH 
THE DAY...MOVING TO ONTARIO BY TONIGHT. THIS WILL PUSH A BACKDOOR 
COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA AFTER 00Z. THE MAIN IMPACT OF THIS FRONT 
WILL BE LOWER DEWPOINTS...WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO FALL INTO THE 
30S ACROSS THE NORTH. THERE IS UNCERTAINTY REGARDING HOW MUCH WINDS 
WILL STAY UP OVERNIGHT AS THE NAM SHOWS A PRETTY GOOD PRESSURE 
GRADIENT BEHIND THE FRONT...WHICH SHOULD HELP HOLD TEMPS UP ABOVE 
FREEZING. SOME POCKETS OF MID 30S IN SHELTERED VALLEYS OF SW VA AND 
NE TN WILL BE POSSIBLE. IF WINDS GO CALM...COLDER TEMPS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE AND A FROST ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED. CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH 
ENOUGH TO ISSUE ONE THIS FAR IN ADVANCE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE LINGERING OVER
THE REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON TUESDAY. A FRONT TRACKS THROUGH
THE AREA ON LATE WEDNESDAY AND INTO THURSDAY BRINGING A CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. A
FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON SATURDAY FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER FRONT ON
SUNDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR
THE WEEKEND. STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
NORTHERN OHIO...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING 
SOUTHWARD ACROSS CINCINNATI AND THE TRI-CITIES AREA. A DEEP UPPER- 
LEVEL LOW OVER THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY 
DRIFT SOUTHEASTWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND INTO THE EVENING HOURS. VERY COLD AIR ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
UPPER LOW WILL LIKELY HELP TO TRIGGER ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WHICH COULD EASILY PRODUCE SOME HAIL 
DUE TO THE LOWERING FREEZING LEVELS.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST TO REMOVE ANY MORNING 
WORDING FOR TODAY...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE 
LATEST TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT SAT MAR 24 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
LINE OF CONVECTION ALONG A COLD FRONT IS MAKING SLOW EASTWARD 
PROGRESS. EXPECT THAT NORTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA WILL STILL 
SEE SOME THUNDERSTORMS AFTER SUNRISE. THUNDERSTORM INTENSITY AND 
SEVERE THREAT SHOULD DECREASE AS STORMS MOVE INTO A LESS UNSTABLE 
REGION. BEHIND THE CONVECTIVE LINE...SATELLITE SHOWS AN AREA OF 
PARTIAL CLEARING...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW FOR SOME SUNSHINE TO BRING 
TEMPS INTO THE LOWER 70S TODAY IN THE VALLEY. LOWER THETA-E AIR WILL 
PUSH INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT TODAY...WHICH WILL LIMIT 
INSTABILITY AND POTENTIAL FOR THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER WITH COOLING 
MIDLEVEL TEMPS UNDER THE CLOSED LOW...WILL HAVE A CHANCE OF THUNDER 
ALONG WITH LIKELY POPS...AND SOME HAIL CANNOT BE RULED OUT WITH 
STRONGER STORMS. THE UPPER LOW TAKES IT TIME MOVING EAST...AND 
SHOULD BE OVER THE CAROLINAS BY LATE TONIGHT. WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS GOING TONIGHT...BUT TAPERING OFF THROUGH THE NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING
THROUGH THE AREA PRODUCING SHOWERS TO THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND
SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS.
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN ON MONDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON MONDAY THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERING THE REGION ON THURSDAY BRINGING A
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. STAYED
NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE...TO WARRANT A LOW RISK OF
