213 
FXUS64 KMRX 231920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT FRI MAR 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED OCCLUDED FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXTENDING 
SOUTHWARD ACROSS WEST TN AND ALONG THE MS/AL BORDER. A DEEP 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WAS OCCURRING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WITH AREA RADARS INDICATING MOSTLY SCATTERED 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE SCATTERED NATURE OF 
THIS PRECIP APPEARS TO BE DUE MAINLY TO THE COMBINATION OF A 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER THE GULF COAST REGION (WHICH IS CUTTING OFF 
MUCH OF THE MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH)...AND TO DOWNSLOPING EFFECTS OF 
THE SOUTHERLY 850 MB WIND FLOW INTO THE GREAT TN VALLEY. AS A 
RESULT...WILL PLAN TO MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR TONIGHT...WITH CONVECTION AGAIN BECOMING 
LIKELY BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE MID 
MS RIVER VALLEY SLOWLY DRIFTS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THE 
FREEZING LEVEL LOWERING WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER LOW...IT 
APPEARS THAT SOME SEVERE TSTORMS WITH LARGE HAIL WILL BE POSSIBLE 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
LOOK REASONABLE. HOWEVER...SOME DISCREPANCIES ARE SEEN WITH THE 
MAXES DUE TO THE DIFFERENCES CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP COVERAGE. FOR 
NOW...WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SETS OF GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL EARLY 
IN THE EXTENDED FOR QUIET WEATHER MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS 
DIFFER BY THE END OF THE PERIOD AND CONFIDENCE LOW ON DETAILS. 
OVERALL...NEXT SYSTEM BRINGS IN A COLD FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR 
THURSDAY AND THEN ANOTHER SYSTEM POSSIBLY BEGINNING TO REACH INTO 
THE AREA FOR FRIDAY. WILL KEEP HIGHEST POPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WHICH 
CURRENT LOOKS THE BEST TIMING FOR THE INITIAL FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AS 
FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 231439
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1040 AM EDT FRI MAR 23 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE 
OZARKS REGION...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY EXTENDING SOUTHWARD ALONG THE MS RIVER VALLEY. A DEEP 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WAS OCCURRING OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WITH AREA RADARS INDICATING MOSTLY SCATTERED 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THE SCATTERED NATURE 
OF THIS PRECIP APPEARS TO BE DUE MAINLY TO THE COMBINATION OF A 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER THE GULF COAST REGION (WHICH IS CUTTING OFF 
MUCH OF THE MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH)...AND TO DOWNSLOPING EFFECTS OF 
THE SOUTHERLY 850 MB WIND FLOW INTO THE GREAT TN VALLEY. OVERALL... 
IT APPEARS THAT THERE WILL STILL BE A HIGH CHANCE FOR RAIN THIS 
AFTERNOON MOST EVERYWHERE...BUT WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE WORD 
'OCCASIONAL' TO ACCOUNT FOR THE OFF AND ON NATURE OF THE CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY. MODELS AGREE THAT THE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL 
BECOME MARGINALLY TO POSSIBLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION TSTORMS.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON BY MAINLY 
REMOVING ANY MORNING WORDING...WITH THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
APPEARING TO BE ON TRACK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 230748
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EDT FRI MAR 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW OUT OF THE GULF WILL SUPPLY AMPLE MOISTURE TO 
THE AREA THIS MORNING. A LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE ZONE WILL BE THE MAIN 
LIFTING MECHANISM THIS MORNING AND INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON FOR 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. A POTENTIAL LIMITING FACTOR MAY BE 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY NEAR THE GULF COAST THAT MAY CUT OFF THE DEE 
MOISTURE FEED THIS FAR NORTH. STILL...WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS 
TODAY. OVERCAST CLOUD COVER AND LACK OF UPPER LEVEL FORCING WILL 
LIMIT THE THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS. THERE MAY BE JUST ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY FOR A LOW HAIL THREAT.

AS THE CLOSED UPPER LOW TRACKS EAST FROM THE PLAINS TO THE LOWER OH 
VALLEY BY TONIGHT...UPPER LEVEL FORCING WILL CONTRIBUTE TO LIFT WITH 
300 MB DIVERGENCE AND COOLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS. THIS WILL KEEP THE 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS GOING OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER THE 850 MB FLOW TURNS 
MORE SW AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE IS LACKING...SO POPS AND QPF WILL 
LOWER THROUGH THE NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE
TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION BRINGING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
THE AREA IN THE SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY TIME FRAME. WILL KEEP THE
HIGHEST CHANCES ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE
PUSHING INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON MONDAY
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERING THE REGION ON THURSDAY
BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. STAYED NEAR
MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

681 
FXUS64 KMRX 221900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT THU MAR 22 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT EXTENDING GENERALLY ALONG THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF SHOWERS OCCURRING AHEAD OF IT. 
THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED SHOWER ACTIVITY SLOWLY 
INCREASING OVER THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE WEST. MODELS INDICATE A 
MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT...SO WILL ALSO INCLUDE A MENTION OF THUNDER THROUGH THE 
NIGHT. A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW WILL ALSO MOVE FROM THE OZARKS REGION 
ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...WHICH WILL HELP TO 
INCREASE THE VERTICAL WIND PROFILE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION ON FRIDAY AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES. THUS...IT APPEARS 
THAT A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL WIND PROFILE WILL COMBINE WITH A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS TO PRODUCE THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE 
TSTORMS ON FRIDAY...ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
HOURS. WHILE FRONTAL PASSAGE IS EXPECTED ON FRIDAY NIGHT...THE 
UPPER-LEVEL LOW IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SATURDAY. THUS...CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD LINGER OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY NIGHT. WITH THIS UPPER LOW 
LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT... 
THINK THAT SEVERE TSTORMS WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY IN 
REGARDS TO THE POSSIBILITY OF LARGE HAIL DUE TO THE LOWERING 
FREEZING LEVEL ASSOCIATED WITH THIS UPPER LOW. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH MINS THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. HOWEVER...LARGE DISCREPANCIES 
ARE SEEN WITH THE MAXES DUE TO THE LARGE VARIATIONS IN POSSIBLE 
CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP COVERAGE. FOR NOW...WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO SETS OF GUIDANCE...BUT WILL LEAN MORE TOWARD THE 
COOLER NAM NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW RESIDUAL SHOWERS WILL 
LINGER INTO MONDAY MORNING AS AN UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY FROM THE 
REGION. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR QUIET WEATHER PATTERN MONDAY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. NEXT SYSTEM MOVES IN AROUND WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR 
THURSDAY FOR OUR NEXT CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EDT THU MAR 22 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT EXTENDING GENERALLY 
ALONG THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER OCCURRING AHEAD OF IT. THIS COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO ONLY DRIFT EASTWARD VERY SLOWLY TODAY ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH MOST OF ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIP REMAINING WEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...MODELS AGREE THAT THE LOCAL AIR MASS WILL 
BECOME MARGINALLY TO POSSIBLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED TO DEVELOP.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON BY RAISING THE 
POPS SOMEWHAT ACROSS ALL ZONES. OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT CHANGE.
&&

078 
FXUS64 KMRX 220701
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 AM EDT THU MAR 22 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA 
WILL FINALLY BEGIN TO GIVE WAY AS THE UPPER LOW OVER THE PLAINS 
DRIFTS TOWARD THE AREA.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE...AND SHOULD SEE A 
BAND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING IN BY TONIGHT.  INSTABILITY 
LOOKS ON THE WEAK SIDE...SO APPEARS SEVERE THREAT WILL BE LOW.  WILL 
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TODAY EXCEPT CHANCE SOUTH...THEN LIKELY 
SOUTHWEST TO SLIGHT CHANCE FAR NORTHEAST TONIGHT. WILL CONTINUE TO 
BE QUITE WARM...AND MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO ONLY SOME 
MINOR TWEAKS.    


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE CONSISTENT FROM 
12Z RUN AND IN GENERAL AGREEMENT...MOVING THE ERN TX PANHANDLE/SW OK 
CLOSED UPPER LOW GRADUALLY EAST. TIMING OF CONVECTION AHEAD OF AND 
WITH THE COLD FRONT IS VERY SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS GRIDS. HOWEVER...OUR 
WESTERN MOST COUNTIES ARE NOW INCLUDED IN A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE 
STORMS. SUFFICIENT SHEAR AND INSTABILITY NOTED...BUT COLD POOL ALOFT 
ARRIVES ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SUGGESTING A THREAT OF 
DIME TO QUARTER SIZE HAIL WITH SATURDAY'S TSRA. WILL MENTION BOTH 
WIND AND HAIL THREAT FRIDAY AFTERNOON IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK. 

LINGERING CLOUDS AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO SUNDAY...THEN THE NEXT 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS EAST TO KEEP THE FORECAST DRY THROUGH MID NEXT 
WEEK.

PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE RIGHT ON TRACK. I DID NUDGE POPS UP TO LOW END 
OF LIKELY FOR NE TN AND SW VA BY LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON...AND ALSO 
SLIGHTLY RAISED POPS IN ERN MOST AREAS FRIDAY NIGHT. NO MORE 80S FOR 
AWHILE...BUT HIGHS CONTINUE ABOUT 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH 
THE PERIOD. LOWS DROP BACK INTO THE 40S TO MID 50S. MAX/MIN TEMP 
GRIDS WERE CLOSE TO LATEST GFSX MOS (22/00Z) AND MATCHED ADJACENT 
NWS GRIDS. 


&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       80  58  78  55  72 /  20  50  90  50  50

253 
FXUS64 KMRX 211903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT WED MAR 21 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER TEXAS AND 
ASSOCIATED PLUME OF MOISTURE AND PRECIP OVER THE MISS VALLEY IS 
STILL HEADED THIS WAY WITH POPS BEGINNING WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE 
AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY.  INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED TO BE 
LOW...SO ALTHOUGH THERE MAY SOME SOME THUNDER...SEVERE WEATHER 
EXPECTATIONS ARE MINIMAL THROUGH FRIDAY.  ALSO...PRECIPITATION 
AMOUNTS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE OVERLY HEAVY EITHER...AS OPPOSED TO 
THE SOAKING AMOUNTS IN THE GULF STATES OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF 
DAYS.  THE LOW LEVEL JET PRESENT RIGHT NOW IN THOSE AREAS IS 
EXPECTED TO WEAKEN OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS AS THE UPPER LOW 
FILLS...SO MOISTURE TRANSPORT WILL WEAKEN...AS WELL AS SOME TERRAIN 
EFFECTS STEALING SOME MOISTURE FROM NEAR KNOXVILLE NORTHEASTWARD UP 
THE VALLEY AS THE LOW LEVEL SOUTH WINDS MAKE THEIR WAY UP AND OVER 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER.

TEMPERATURE FORECASTS LOOK GOOD OVERALL...WENT ON THE COOL SIDE OF 
THE GFS MOS ON FRIDAY MAX TEMP IN THE WEST DUE TO EXPECTED CLOUDS 
AND PRECIP.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A TRANSITION FROM THE 
RECENT HOT WEATHER PATTERN WILL OCCUR DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST AS THE PLAINS UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL CONTINUE TO SHIFT SLOWLY 
EAST ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT ARRIVING OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY SATURDAY NIGHT. THEREFORE THE WEATHER 
WILL BECOME UNSETTLED THE APPROACHING LOW. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL 
BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE ON SATURDAY AS CHILLY AIR ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE PRESSURE CENTER BUILDS OVER THE WARM LOW LEVEL AIRMASS. THE 
FREEZING LEVEL WILL LOW ENOUGH FOR THE PRODUCTION OF LARGE HAIL 
DURING THE HEATING OF THE DAY. KEPT THE BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA CLOSER TO THE COLDER 
AIR ALOFT. BY SUNDAY THE UPPER LOW WILL BE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BUT 
STILL CLOSE ENOUGH WITH CYCLONIC FLOW TO GENERATE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE 
EASTERN U.S. BY MID WEEK. THE PREVAILING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL 
MAKE IT FEEL MORE LIKE SPRING THAN OUR RECENT SUMMER-LIKE WEATHER. 
THE COOLEST DAY WILL BE SUNDAY BUT A WARMING TREND WILL BOOST 
TEMPERATURES BACK ABOVE NORMAL MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS SHOULD 
BE A PERIOD OF FAIR WEATHER WITH DRY ADVECTION KEEPING PRECIPITATION 
OUT OF THE FORECAST.      

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             59  82  61  76  54 /  10  20  70  90  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  81  58  81  54 /   0  10  40  90  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  82  58  80  54 /   0  20  50  90  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  81  52  78  54 /   0  10  20  60  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
152 PM EDT WED MAR 21 2012

.AVIATION...MUCH OF THE REGION STILL ENJOYING A PROTECTIVE MID TO
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. HOWEVER...CYCLONIC FLOW AROUND WEAK MID ATLANTIC
UPPER LOW IS AIDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THE STORMS INITIATE OVER
THE TERRAIN AND DRIFT SOUTHWEST. APPLIED A VICINITY THUNDER AT TRI
BUT WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR AMENDMENT IF CONVECTION CLOSES IN ON THE
TERMINAL. INTERESTING TO SEE THE DOWNSLOPE AFFECT AT TYS WHERE JUST
A FEW CU ARE DEVELOPING IN THE HEALTHY DOWNSLOPING SOUTHEASTERLY
FLOW CROSSING THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. SUPPOSE THE BEST CHANCE FOR SOME
LIGHT FOG FORMING WILL BE AT TRI TOWARD DAYBREAK. DON'T BELIEVE
THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM AT THE TERMINALS
PRIOR TO 18Z THURSDAY. BUT THE LOW LEVEL ATMOSPHERE WILL GRADUALLY
MOISTEN ON THURSDAY WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE BEYOND THE
VALID PERIOD OF THE TAF.

.DISCUSSION...

DRY IN THIS FORECAST...BUT WILL WATCH FOR HOW FAR SW ALONG THE MTN
CHAIN THE DEEP CONVECTION DEVELOPS...SINCE ANY OF THIS WILL LIKELY
HEAD WWD OR NWWD INTO THE VALLEY.

NOT PLANNING ON A RE-ISSUE OF FORECAST AS ALL PARAMETERS LOOK ON TRACK.

AND STORMS AHEAD OF AND WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...WITH BEST 
COVERAGE LIKELY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. BEST THREAT OF SEVERE 
STORMS SHOULD BE SATURDAY AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MAIN THREAT LOOKS TO BE LARGE HAIL AS TEMPS 
COOL ALOFT...AND FREEZING/WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS DROP TO AROUND 8000 
FT ASL. 

LINGERING SHOWERS INTO SUNDAY MORNING...THEN DRY WEATHER RETURNS AS 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BEHIND EXITING UPPER LOW. MAX TEMPS MAY STILL TOP 
80S DEGREES IN A FEW SPOTS BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...THEN FALL 
GENERALLY INTO THE 60S AND 70S DUE TO RAIN OVER THE WEEKEND...PLUS 
COOLING BEHIND PASSAGE OF UPPER LOW. LOWS NO COOLER THAN 40S TO MID 
50S...SO STILL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIODS. THE 
21/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE EXTREMELY CLOSE TO 20/12Z VALUES...SO 
LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS TEMP GRIDS.

777 
FXUS64 KMRX 201902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EDT TUE MAR 20 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
TRIGGERING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. WILL KEEP 
LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR THE EVENING 
HOURS...BUT MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD BE DRY TONIGHT. SHOULD ALSO HAVE 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AGAIN TONIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES 
LOOKED REASONABLE SO STAYED CLOSE. A WEAK TROUGH IS EXPECTED TO 
TRACK THOUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO CARRIED 
THE SLIGHT CHANCES FOR JUST THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. MORE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED AGAIN ON 
WEDNESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
BE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...SO HIGHER 
THAN AVERAGE CONFIDENCE IN THE OVERALL PATTERN.  HIGH AMPLITUDE 
RIDGE OVER THE AREA TO START THE PERIOD WILL KEEP THINGS QUITE WARM 
AND SHOULD KEEP CONVECTION MINIMAL THROUGH THURSDAY.  WILL GO DRY 
WED NIGHT AND WILL CARRY JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON. UPPER LOW WILL MOVE OUT OF THE PLAINS AND WILL AFFECT THE 
AREA TOWARD THE WEEKEND.  STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT TIMING...BUT 
WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY...THEN 
WILL TAPER POPS OFF AS SYSTEM MOVES EAST.   UPPER RIDGE FORECAST TO 
BEGIN BUILDING OVER THE REGION BEHIND THIS SYSTEM...SO WILL GO DRY 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  



&&

761 
FXUS64 KMRX 201402
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1002 AM EDT TUE MAR 20 2012

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE PROVIDING A MOSTLY DRY AND WARM DAY 
TODAY. WITH WEAK INSTABILITY...WILL LEAVE THE CURRENT POPS FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS AS IS. MOST THE AREA SHOULD BE DRY. ANOTHER DAY WITH ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES. COULD BREAK A FEW RECORDS AGAIN TODAY. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE 
ZONES TO REMOVE EARLY WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TRANQUIL AND VERY WARM WEATHER
AGAIN TODAY AS SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE HOLD ACROSS THE REGION. KEPT
THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR AN AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORM ALONG THE TN-NC
LINE. LOW LEVEL TO 850 MB FLOW BECOMES LIGHT SE THIS AFTERNOON...
WHICH MAY PROVIDE SOME WEAK CONVERGENCE...SUPPORTING SOME VERY
ISOLATED TSRA. 850 MB TEMPS AND LOW LEVEL THICKNESSES DON'T CHANGE
MUCH FROM YESTERDAY...SO KEPT HIGHS TODAY ONLY A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE
MONDAY MAXES. ONCE AGAIN MAX TEMPS REACH NEAR OR EXCEED RECORD
HIGHS...CHA - 85...TYS - 83...TRI -78 AND OQT - 82.

FAIR AND MILD TONIGHT WITH SOME AMOUNT OF HIGH CLOUDS POSSIBLE...
BUT NO FOG ENOUGH TO MENTION. MOS MINS WERE GENERALLY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGING WILL REMAIN 
IN CONTROL WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT KEEPING A MOSTLY DRY AND 
UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS. FOR FRIDAY...UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN 
WITH INCREASING CHANCE OF CONVECTION AS FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA.
ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW OVER THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES MOVES TOWARD THE 
CENTRAL-SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY. 

FOR SATURDAY...INCOMING UPPER TROUGH WITH ASSOCIATED COOLING ALOFT 
WILL COMBINE WITH DAYTIME HEATING TO DESTABILIZE THE AIRMASS TO 
PRODUCE SCATTERED-BROKEN THUNDERSTORMS. DUE TO THE COLD AIR 
ALOFT...SOME OF THESE STORMS WILL BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING LARGE HAIL.

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA 
WITH RIDGING RE-ESTABLISHING ITSELF OVER THE AREA.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS GUIDANCE CLOSELY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  57  84  57  79 /  10  10  10  10  20

OAK RIDGE, TN                       85  56  83  55  81 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              82  49  81  51  79 /  10  10  10  10  10

316 PM EDT MON MAR 19 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO

THOUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO CARRIED THE 
SLIGHT CHANCES FOR JUST THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON. 
MORE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED AGAIN ON TUESDAY...MAY SEE 
NEW RECORDS SET AGAIN. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN PRETTY GOOD 
AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...SO HIGHER THAN AVERAGE 
CONFIDENCE IN THE OVERALL PATTERN. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE 
DETAILS...ESPECIALLY HOW MUCH CONVECTION MAY BE ABLE TO DEVELOP 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD UNDER THE RIDGE.  HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE OVER THE 
AREA TO START THE PERIOD WILL KEEP THINGS QUITE WARM AND SHOULD  
KEEP CONVECTION MINIMAL.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOME OF 
THE EASTERN AND NORTHERN HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS BOTH WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY AFTERNOONS...BUT WILL KEEP REMAINDER OF AREA PRECIP FREE.  
UPPER LOW WILL MOVE OUT OF THE PLAINS AND WILL AFFECT THE AREA 
TOWARD THE WEEKEND.  STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT TIMING...BUT WILL 
CARRY CHANCE POPS FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.  UPPER RIDGE FORECAST TO 
BEGIN BUILDING OVER THE REGION BEHIND THIS SYSTEM...SO WILL GO DRY 
MONDAY.

163 
FXUS64 KMRX 191355
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EDT MON MAR 19 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING. WITH SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY BY THE AFTERNOON...CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD. TEMPERATURES 
AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST FOR TODAY ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRIEST OVERNIGHT PERIOD IN
SEVERAL DAYS AS UPPER RIDGE IS BEGINNING TO BUILD EASTWARD INTO
THE REGION. PATCHY FOG IS STILL POSSIBLE THROUGH DAYBREAK...BUT
SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND SATELLITE PICS INDICATE NOT VERY
SIGNIFICANT.

19/00Z OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS WERE STILL MOIST...WITH DAYTIME HEATING AND 
SOME WEAK CONVERGENCE IN THE EASTERN MTNS...WHICH LED ME TO ADD SOME 
VERY LOW POPS FOR THOSE AREAS THIS AFTERNOON. THIS ALSO BLENDS IN 
BETTER WITH NWS GRIDS TO OUR NE AND E. HIGHS TODAY SHOULD REACH NEAR 
RECORD VALUES...CHA - 86...TYS - 82...AND TRI - 81. MAINLY CIRRUS 
CLOUDS AND SOME AREAS OF CUMULUS CLOUDS.

DRY TONIGHT WITH MILD LOWS MOSTLY IN THE 50S. FORECAST SOUNDINGS 
REVEAL A FAIR AMOUNT OF CIRRUS CLOUDS SLIPPING THROUGH THE UPPER 
RIDGE...SO KEPT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGING STAYS STRONG
TUESDAY BUT INSTABILITY AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE OVER THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE ENOUGH FOR SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER MOST AREAS WILL BE DRY. LOOKS LIKE NEAR
RECORD OR RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES TUESDAY WITH HIGHS LOWER TO MID
80S. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH ACROSS WESTERN STATES CLOSES OFF OVER THE
DESERT SOUTHWEST TUESDAY. MOST OF THE CONCENTRATED SHOWER AND
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY STAY OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
PLAINS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BERMUDA LIKE HIGH OVER THE EASTERN
ATLANTIC WILL STRENGTHEN WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WHICH WILL KEEP A
SOUTHEAST FLOW OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL ALLOW MORE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM
ACTIVITY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...MAINLY IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS
WEDNESDAY AND A SLIGHT CHANCE ALL AREAS THURSDAY. HIGHS SHOULD BE
A FEW DEGREES COOLER DUE TO CLOUD COVER. THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MS VALLEY SHOULD
BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS INCREASE AND WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE REGION
SATURDAY AS THE FRONT FINALLY MOVES THROUGH. THE UPPER LOW LAGS
BEHIND SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY CONTINUING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS. HIGHS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER EACH DAY FROM
FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. MOST LOCATIONS ONLY 60S SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  58  85  56  81 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  56  84  55  80 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  55  85  56  80 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              80  48  82  51  78 /  10  10  10  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

781 
FXUS64 KMRX 181456
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1055 AM EDT SUN MAR 18 2012

.DISCUSSION...VORT AXIS EXITING AREA TO THE NE. SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY DECREASE IN COVERAGE ACROSS NE TN/SW VA. 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND AFTERNOON DESTABILIZATION WILL ALLOW FOR 
SCATTERED AFTERNOON CONVECTION FAVORING ELEVATED AREAS. MAX TEMPS IN 
LINE WITH LAMP DATA. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWERS AND SCATTERED STORMS 
CONTINUE TO SPREAD EAST OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...FROM 
INTERSTATE 40 NORTHWARD INTO SW VA. RAIN CHANCES WILL BE HIGHEST 
THIS MORNING PRIOR TO 12Z...WITH GRIDS ADJUSTED TO REFLECT THIS. 
POPS WILL DROP OFF FROM THE WEST AS AN UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE TAKES 
THE SHOWERS/STORMS EAST...BUT I DID KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR EXTREME NE 
TN (TRI) AND SW VA BEYOND 12Z TODAY.

GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT WITH JUST SLIGHT TO CHANCE POPS A FEW 
AREAS THIS EVENING. DECREASING CLOUDS COULD LEAD TO PATCHY DENSE 
FOG...WHICH WAS ALSO IN PREVIOUS GRIDS. FOR TEMPS...POTENTIAL TO 
REACH CLOSER TO THE MOS MAXES FOR TODAY...ESPECIALLY WITH SUNSHINE 
BY LATE MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON. THUS...STAYED CLOSE TO SIMILAR 
MOS HIGHS. MINS TONIGHT WERE REASONABLE...BUT POSSIBLY A TAD COOL 
GIVEN SPRING TYPE AIR MASS AND DEW POINT TEMPS...SO KEPT MINS A 
DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE GUIDANCE. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING NOSES UP 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY WITH A DEEP TROUGH ACROSS THE WEST 
BUT MOVING INTO THE PLAINS STATES. THIS SHOULD SHUT OFF THE 
PRECIPITATION WITH SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES SOUTH AND SEVERAL 
DEGREES NORTH. AIR MASS WILL BE DRIER AS WELL WITH LESS CLOUD COVER. 
MAIN SURFACE HIGH WILL BE OVER THE EASTERN ATLANTIC AND SOUTHEAST 
FLOW ON EAST SIDE OF APPALACHIANS WILL LIKELY TRIGGER A FEW SHOWERS 
OVER THE NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS. MONDAY NIGHT SKIES SHOULD BECOME 
MOSTLY CLEAR WITH TEMPERATURES STILL VERY MILD. TUESDAY RIDGING 
STILL ABOUT THE SAME. MODELS TRY TO DEVELOP SHOWERS OVER THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING BUT WITH UPPER LOW LIKELY TO 
CLOSE OFF ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THIS SHOULD SLOW THE EAST WARD 
PROGRESS OF THE SYSTEM. WILL KEEP TUESDAY DRY AND WITH VERY WARM 
TEMPERATURES LIKE MONDAY. WEDNESDAY MOISTURE INCREASES A BIT MORE SO 
WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE 
PLATEAU AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS. THURSDAY THE PLAINS AND MS VALLEY 
SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE TN VALLEY. HIGHER POPS THURSDAY BUT THERE ARE 
SOME INDICATIONS THAT THE SYSTEM IS SLOWING SO POPS MAY HAVE TO BE 
ADJUSTED DOWN IN NEXT MODEL RUNS. AIR MASS BECOMES MORE UNSTABLE 
WITH THUNDERSTORMS PROBABLE. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY AS COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH WITH WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE WITH WOUND UP UPPER LOW SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT WILL 
ALLOW MORE SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY COOL BUT STILL BE ABOVE NORMAL 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  55  84  57  83 /  20  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  54  82  55  82 /  30  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       81  53  82  55  83 /  30  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              74  47  79  50  81 /  60  20  10  10  10

344 
FXUS64 KMRX 170857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
457 AM EDT SAT MAR 17 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ONGOING CONVECTION OVER NE AL AND 
NW GA CONTINUES TO AFFECT A SMALL PART OF EXTREME SE TN. ELSEWHERE
PATCHY AREAS OF FOG WERE NOTED UNDER PASSING MOSTLY MID DECK CLOUDS. 
THESE CLOUDS HAVE LIMITED THE FOG FROM BECOMING DENSE AND MORE 
WIDESPREAD. WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS HINT AT A WEAK IMPULSE OVER 
THE CENTRAL PLAINS AREA...WHILE 17/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW A 
POSSIBLE SPEED MAX TO APPROACH LATER TODAY. SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOW 
SCATTERED OR GREATER COVERAGE OF TSRA DEVELOPING AGAIN TODAY...IN AN 
AIR MASS REALLY UNCHANGED FROM YESTERDAY. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS 
WITH A FEW AREAS OF LIKELY POPS TO HIGH CHANCE LOOKED ON TRACK. I 
EXPECT A FEW STRONG STORMS WITH MAIN THREATS LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS AND 
DIME SIZE OR SMALLER HAIL AGAIN.

WILL GO WITH A MOS BLEND OR CLOSER TO COOLER NAM MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY 
...WHICH WORKED OUT WELL FRIDAY. CONVECTION LOOKS TO BE DIMINISHING 
AGAIN TONIGHT AFTER LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...AND THIS WAS THE TREND 
IN PREVIOUS POP/WEATHER GRIDS. STAYED CLOSER TO MILDER MINS ALREADY 
IN GRIDS FOR MINS TONIGHT...GIVEN THE MOIST AIR MASS. PATCHY FOG A 
GOOD BET AGAIN.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER AIR PATTERN BEGINS TO
CHANGE SUNDAY AS RIDGING BEGINS TO STRENGTHEN FROM SOUTH TO NORTH
AND FROM WEST TO EAST. SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING FROM THE OHIO
VALLEY TO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WILL KEEP A BETTER CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER NE SECTIONS. RISING THICKNESSES
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM BACK INTO
THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S AT LOWER ELEVATION SITES. CLOUD COVER
SUNDAY MAY AFFECT HIGHS SOMEWHAT BUT WILL GO CLOSE TO MET NUMBERS.
SUNDAY NIGHT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DECREASE MORE QUICKLY
THAN TONIGHT WITH NE AND EASTERN SECTIONS ONLY HAVING ISOLATED
CONVECTION IN THE EVENING. MONDAY AND TUESDAY RIDGING IS STRONGEST
WITH SUBSIDENCE HELPING CONVECTION TO BE SUPPRESSED. EASTERLY FLOW
AROUND HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG EAST COAST WILL ALLOW ACTIVITY
JUST TO THE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. INTRODUCED POPS WEDNESDAY
MAINLY PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS AS FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO LOWER MS
AND TN VALLEYS AND MOISTURE INCREASES ACROSS FORECAST AREA. THIS
SYSTEM WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST THURSDAY AND BY FRIDAY MORNING MOVE
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE ABOVE
NORMAL WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY BUT A FEW DEGREES COOLER AS RIDGE
BEGINS TO WEAKEN WITH INCREASING CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

SOUTHWEST OF THE DEPARTING SHORT WAVE.

THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCE FOR

WEATHER FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS IN THE 
AREA ON THURSDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL

.DISCUSSION...WEAKENING CONVECTION TO THE WEST THIS MORNING. THIS 
WILL LEAVE A DIFFERENTIAL HEATING BOUNDARY WHICH SHOULD INITIATE 
ADDITIONAL CONVECTION ACROSS EAST TN VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND DESTABILIZATION FROM HEATING WILL ALSO HELP
CONVECTIVE INITIATION. RAISED AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES 2 TO 3 DEGREES 
WHICH WILL CHALLENGE RECORDS AT CHA/TYS/OQT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION PRETTY SPARSE THIS 
MORNING...BUT AIR MASS REMAINS MOIST AND APPEARS TO BE OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES AROUND TO HELP INITIATE SHRA OR TSRA RATHER EARLY TODAY. 
KEEPING POPS BUILDING BACK UP TO LIKELY LOOKS VERY REASONABLE. WIND  
FIELDS SHOW LITTLE WIND SHEAR...BUT INSTABILITY IS AT LEAST SLIGHT 
TO MODERATE. ALSO...FREEZING LEVEL AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS ARE 
FAVORABLE FOR MORE SMALL HAIL AGAIN TODAY. CLOUDS AND EARLY START TO 
MORE CONVECTION SUPPORT A BLEND OF MOS FOR HIGHS...PERHAPS A BIT 
CLOSER TO THE MILDER GFS. FORECASTED HIGHS ARE ABOUT 2 TO 3 DEGREES 
BELOW RECORD HIGHS FOR MAR 16TH...CHA - 83...TYS - 81...TRI - 82 AND 
OQT - 79.

EVENING CONVECTION LOOKS TO DISSIPATE GRADUALLY AGAIN TONIGHT...SO 
KEPT CHANCE POPS WITH AREAL QUALIFIER IN THE EVENING THEN TAPERED 
POPS BACK SLIGHTLY AFTER 17/06Z. SUSPECT THAT MILDER MOS MINS ARE 
BEST CHOICE. 

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING 
CONTINUES THROUGH THE WEEKEND BUT SMALL SCALE SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
MOVING THROUGH THE FLAT RIDGING WILL CONTRIBUTE TO CONVECTION BOTH 
DAYS ESPECIALLY IN THE TERRAIN AREAS. HAVE CONTINUED LIKELY POPS 
ACROSS THE TERRAIN AREAS SATURDAY AND CHANCE IN THE VALLEYS. 
DECREASING AT NIGHT AS CONVECTION WILL BE DIURNAL IN NATURE. THE 
RIDGE WILL BUILD A LITTLE MORE SUNDAY. MAV/MET POP GUIDANCE STILL 
LIKELY BUT KEEPING TREND LOWER IN THE CHANCE RANGE. FOLLOWING 
UNUSUAL HIGHER TEMPERATURE TREND WITH HIGHS MUCH ABOVE NORMAL IN THE 
UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY 
RIDGE BUILDS EVEN MORE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST AND TN VALLEY. LOW POPS 
SUNDAY EVENING THEN DRY FORECAST MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WEAK UPPER 
LOW OR WEAKNESS IN RIDGE WILL ALLOW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS JUST 
TO THE NE AND EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS ANY SHIFT IN THIS FEATURE THOUGH 
MAY BRING MORE SHOWERS INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THURSDAY A DEVELOPING 
UPPER LOW OVER THE PLAINS AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM SPREAD 
CLOUDS AND SHOWERS INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER 
TEMPERATURES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. &&

DESTABILIZATION. THE MAIN THREAT FROM STORMS WILL BE HAIL WITH THE 
FREEZING LEVEL AVERAGING AROUND 10,500 FT. LOCALIZED FLOODING IS 
ALSO A POSSIBILITY WITH SLOW STORM MOTIONS.

THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCE FOR THE NORTHERN

CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN UNORGANIZED WITH MINIMAL COVERAGE 
AND WILL HAVE POPS AT CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD AND RUN TO RUN
CONSISTENCY HAS GENERALLY BEEN GOOD...SO WHILE SOME UNCERTAINTY IN
THE DETAILS THERE IS ABOVE AVERAGE CONFIDENCE IN THE OVERALL
PATTERN. SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY FORECAST TO AFFECT THE AREA
FRIDAY...AND WHILE INSTABILITY LOOKS UNIMPRESSIVE STILL EXPECT
SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS
OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH A VERY HIGH AMPLITUDE
RIDGE OVER THE REGION FOR MON THROUGH WED. MAY BE ENOUGH
MOISTURE/INSTABILITY AROUND FOR SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
CONVECTION DURING THE WEEKEND...SO WILL CARRY LOW POPS. CANNOT
TOTALLY RULE OUT ANY CONVECTION FOR THE MON THROUGH WED
PERIOD...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF
THE RIDGE. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  57  81  55  82 /  40  40  60  40  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  77  55  78  55  79 /  40  40  70  50  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       77  55  77  54  79 /  40  40  70  40  20

910 PM EDT WED MAR 14 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION CONTINUING OVER NORTHERN MIDDLE TN...WHICH WAS OCCURRING 
IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. THIS SHORT WAVE IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
OVERNIGHT...AND MAY TRIGGER A FEW ISOLATED STORMS AROUND THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATER TONIGHT. 

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO HANDLE THIS SCENARIO FOR 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO TWEAK TEMPS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS...AND TO ADD A MENTION OF 
PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 141907

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT WED MAR 14 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EAST OF 
THE APPALACHIANS. WEAK SHORT WAVE RIDGING ALOFT TONIGHT. LIGHT WINDS 
WITH PATCHY LATE NIGHT FOG. WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST THROUGH THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY ON THURSDAY. LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS WITH INCREASING 
CLOUDS. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE MRX CWA BY 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON. LIFT IS WEAK BUT INSTABILITY WILL SUPPORT SOME 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY. WIND SHEAR IS WEAK AND FREEZING LEVEL 
RELATIVELY HIGH. SMALL HAIL IS POSSIBLE. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE 
WELL ABOVE NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE 
MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WILL WEAKEN THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE 
AREA WITH SCATTERED-BROKEN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ANTICIPATED FOR 
FRIDAY. MARGINAL INSTABILITY SO SEVERE CHANCES QUITE LOW. 

UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO REBUILD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY LIMITING CONVECTION MAINLY OVER THE TERRAIN 
FEATURES...BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS/LOW POPS AREA-WIDE.

AS A STRONG UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE ROCKYS THIS WEEKEND AND 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION 
BUILDS. THE UPPER RIDGING WILL DRY AIRMASS WITH MID-LEVEL WARMING 
LIMITING CONVECTION POTENTIAL FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MEX MOS 
SEEMS TOO COOL DUE TO TRENDING TOWARD CLIMO...SO WILL GO SEVERAL 
DEGREES WARMER THAN GUIDANCE HIGHS FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 132318
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
717 PM EDT TUE MAR 13 2012

.AVIATION...SPOTTY SHOWERS HANGING ON IN THE LAST BIT OF HEAT ACROSS 
EXTREME SE KY AND SW VA...BUT SHOULD DISSIPATE SHORTLY. THIS SHOULD 
LEAVE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES UNTIL LOWER CLOUDS AND PATCHY FOG FORM 
AFTER 06Z WEDNESDAY. PREVIOUS TAFS REFLECT THE EXPECTED FOG AND 
CLOUDS...ALTHO I THINK IT IS VERY POSSIBLE FOR A LOWER CEILING TO 
DEVELOP AT TRI. VFR CONDITIONS RETURN AROUND 15Z WEDNESDAY WITH 
LIGHT WINDS.

PREVIOUS AFD...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHOWERS HAVE ENDED 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY AREA WIDE. 
TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED CONSIDERABLY WEST AND SOUTH BUT SLOWLY NE 
AND MOUNTAINS AS CLOUD COVER HELD ON LONGER. A WEAK FRONT LIES OVER 
THE OHIO VALLEY AND IS EXPECTED TO MOVE CLOSER TO THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT BUT RIDGING ALOFT WILL KEEP IT TO THE NORTH. NAM AND RUC 
MODELS TRY TO DEVELOP SHOWERS OVERNIGHT IN THE NE AS THERE IS SOME 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE AND GFS MODEL KEEPS AREA DRY AFTER 00Z TONIGHT.
WILL KEEP TONIGHTS FORECAST DRY. LEFT OVER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND 
LIGHT WINDS WILL ALSO ALLOW SOME SHALLOW FOG FORMATION. OVERALL 
MOSTLY FAIR CONDITIONS WITH TEMPERATURES ONLY FALLING TO THE UPPER 
40S TO LOWER 50S TONIGHT AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY IN THE 70S TO NEAR 80 
AT CHATTANOOGA. MAY APPROACH THE RECORD OF 78 AT TRI SET IN 1990. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...OUR BUSY PATTERN 
OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS HAS SLOWED DOWN AS OUR CURRENT ZONAL FLOW 
GIVES WAY TO AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE THAT BUILDS IN THE LATTER PERIODS 
AS THE LARGE TROUGH TAKES OVER IN THE SOUTHWEST U.S.

AT THE SURFACE, WE SHOULD KEEP A SOUTHERLY COMPONENT THROUGH THESE 
TIME PERIODS. HOWEVER...EVEN THOUGH THE PATTERN SEEMS QUIET WE DO GET
INTO A SUMMER PATTERN WITH AVAILABLE MOISTURE TO SUPPORT SOME
DIURNAL SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. AS THE RIDGE BUILDS
STRONGER IN LATER PERIODS...THE POPS WIND DOWN. TEMPERATURES SHOULD
BE ABOVE AVERAGE THE ENTIRE PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  80  57  80  58 /   0  10  10  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  77  56  78  55 /  10   0  10  20  30

CONDITIONS DRY AND WARM FOR WEDNESDAY.  AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL

FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  AN UPPER RIDGE SLOWLY BUILDS BACK IN FOR

OF CONVECTION IN THE FORECAST...MAIN OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

894 
FXUS64 KMRX 130135
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EDT MON MAR 12 2012

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS TRACKING 
THROUGH THE AREA. ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE TO EXIT THE AREA SO WILL 
KEEP THE DECREASING CHANCES FOR TONIGHT. WITH NOT MUCH LIGHTNING 
SEEN...WILL REMOVE THE THUNDER FOR TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST 
OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT REMAINS OVER THE SOUTHEAST
STATES WHILE A MOIST FLOW AROUND THE HIGH CONTINUES TO BRING
MOISTURE NORTH INTO THE GULF STATES AND TN VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON.
SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY. AN UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO
MOVE NE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TOWARD ONTARIO. LIGHT SHOWERS ARE
CONTINUING IN A FEW SPOTS OVER EAST TN AND SW VA OTHERWISE THERE
HAS BEEN FAR LESS COVERAGE OF SHOWERS TO THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST.
CURRENT MODEL PROGS SHOW MORE SHOWER AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS
TONIGHT BUT CLOSEST ACTIVITY LIES OVER LAKE MICHIGAN AND SOUTHERN
LA. HAVE A SOMEWHAT PESSIMISTIC FORECAST WHICH IS CLOSER TO MET
GUIDANCE OF 30 PERCENT NORTH TO 50 PERCENT SOUTH OF SHOWERS. KEPT
THUNDER WORDING IN FORECAST BUT INSTABILITY HAS BEEN LIMITED DUE TO
CLOUD COVER. AFTER 3Z MOISTURE SHIFTS EAST SO MOST LIKELY POPS WILL
DROP TO NIL. HAVE CHANCE POPS MOST AREAS FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT.
DRIER AIR MASS WORKS IN AS RIDGE STRENGTHENS TUESDAY. AIR MASS
BECOMES MODERATELY UNSTABLE BY AFTERNOON SO STILL THINK A FEW
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE BUT ONLY OVER THE MOUNTAINS.
TEMPERATURES MUCH WARMER IN THE 70S.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING WILL DOMINATE THE FORECAST THROUGH
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A DRY AIR MASS ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS AND UNSEASONABLY
WARM AFTERNOONS.

A WEAK SHORT-WAVE WILL RIDE OVER THE UPPER RIDGE LATE THURSDAY 
THROUGH FRIDAY INCREASING THE CHANCE OF CONVECTION AND CLOUDS. 
AT THIS TIME...MODELS SHOW MARGINAL INSTABILITY...BUT ENOUGH FOR 
INCLUSION OF THUNDERSTORMS.

WEAK UPPER RIDGE OF PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY TO CONTINUE 
WITH CHANCE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON/EVENING THUNDERSTORMS FOR SATURDAY. 
BEST CHANCE WILL BE ACROSS THE HIGH TERRAIN.

STRENGTHENING UPPER RIDGE AND BEST MOISTURE CONVERGENCE LOCATED EAST 
OF THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...SO WILL LOWER POPS SUNDAY.  FOR 
MONDAY...ONLY ISOLATED TERRAIN FOCUSED CONVECTION ANTICIPATED. 
OVERALL...PATTERN IS BECOMING MORE LATE SPRING-SUMMER LIKE OVER THE 
AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             57  77  54  80  53 /  50  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  75  52  78  51 /  40  10  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       54  76  52  78  52 /  40  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              48  74  46  74  46 /  40  10  10   0   0

990 
FXUS64 KMRX 121452
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1052 AM EDT MON MAR 12 2012

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE IS CENTERED OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST OF
THE US WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE ALONG THE SOUTHEAST COAST. AN UPPER
LOW WAS OVER IOWA. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WAS LOCATED ACROSS THE
UPPER MIDWEST. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HAS INCREASED OVER MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA. WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY HAS MOVED INTO THE LOWER
MS...OHIO AND TN VALLEYS AND WAS TRIGGERING SHOWERS OVER WESTERN
KY AND NORTHERN MIDDLE TN LATE THIS MORNING. ONLY A FEW SPRINKLES
HAVE DEVELOPED OVER THE FORECAST AREA THE PAST FEW HOURS. FOR THE
REST OF THE DAY SHORT RANGE MODELS TRY TO BRING SEVERAL WEAK
VORTICITY MAXES ACROSS EAST TN AND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS
AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING. THE BEST INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE
SHOULD STAY ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF TN SO THAT AREA LOOKS MORE
CONDUCIVE TO THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. OVER FORECAST AREA
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S AT THIS HOUR AND DEW
POINTS ARE MOSTLY IN THE 40S WITH 50S SOUTHWEST. CLOUDS WILL LIMIT
TEMPERATURES FROM RISING MUCH PAST THE MID TO UPPER 60S. ADJUSTED
WORDING IN FORECAST FOR SHOWERS TO MID TO LATE AFTERNOON AND KEPT
POPS AROUND 60 PERCENT. NOT REAL CONFIDENT OF ANYTHING SIGNIFICANT
UNTIL LATE IN THE DAY. CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVER NORTH MS AND
WESTERN AL THOUGH MAY BECOME STRONG AND MOVE TOWARDS SOUTHEAST TN
BY LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

386 
FXUS64 KMRX 120814
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON MAR 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW WILL LIFT OUT OF THE 
PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES TODAY. SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING 
AROUND THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH OUR AREA.  FORCING LOOKS WEAK 
FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD...BUT CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL COMBINE 
WITH THE WEAK FORCING TO BRING SOME SHOWERS TO THE AREA.  
INSTABILITY WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE...SO MAY BE SOME THUNDER THIS 
AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS TODAY...HIGH CHANCE 
TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME MINOR 
TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY SLIPS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE MORNING ON TUESDAY WITH SOME 
DRYING NOTED BY AFTERNOON. SUPPOSE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP NOT A BAD 
IDEA WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A VERY WEAK SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY HANGING 
AROUND THE AREA. NICE RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN STATES TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND WAS ABLE TO SLIGHTLY EXTEND THE DRY 
FORECAST THROUGH THIS PERIOD. BY THURSDAY SOME MOISTENING OCCURS ON 
WARM SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND MODELS FEATURE SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY RIDING NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ACROSS THE OHIO AND 
TENNESSEE VALLEY REGION SO HELD ONTO CHANCE POPS MAINLY ON THE 
PLATEAU FOR THURSDAY WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE MUCH OF THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS SEEM TO AGREE ON PASSAGE OF A SLIGHTLY 
STRONGER SHORT WAVE TROUGH FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT SO ADVANCED POPS 
INTO MEDIUM CHANCE RANGE ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION DURING THIS TIME 
PERIOD. TRIED TO DOWNPLAY POPS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE OVER THE WEEKEND 
GENERALLY FAVORING THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES AS THE UPPER PATTERN 
BECOMES A BIT MORE AMPLIFIED WITH RISING HEIGHTS OVER THE EASTERN 
THIRD OF THE NATION ALONG WITH A NICE 85H RIDGE HOLDING STRONG OR 
EVEN STRENGTHENING TO SOME DEGREE HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND. THIS 
PATTERN WOULD KEEP THE DEEPER INFLUX OF MOISTURE OFF THE GULF 
SUPPRESSED FARTHER WEST OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LIMITING AREAL 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. IN THE WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS EXPECTED THIS 
WEEK THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEFINITELY BE POSSIBLE AND MAINTAINED 
CONVECTION DURING THE DAYTIME PERIODS WITH SHOWERS AT NIGHT WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WHEN STRONGER UPPER LEVEL 
FEATURE PASSES ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. MOS GUIDANCE HAS HAD A 
DIFFICULT TIME PREDICTING MAX TEMPERATURE THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS AND 
DOES NOT SEEM TO UNDERSTAND THAT SPRING HAS SPRUNG EARLIER THAN 
USUAL THIS YEAR. WITH THIS IN MIND AND THE PREVAILING SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW PATTERN EXPECTED THIS WEEK...ADJUSTED BOTH MAX AND MIN 
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE HIGHER THROUGH THE LONG TERM FORECAST. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  57  77  56  79 /  70  50  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  54  74  54  78 /  70  50  20  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  53  75  56  78 /  70  50  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              67  48  73  48  75 /  60  40  20  10   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

334 
FXUS64 KMRX 120128
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
928 PM EDT SUN MAR 11 2012

.DISCUSSION...A TROUGH TRIGGERING PRECIPITATION UPSTREAM. WILL LEAVE 
THE CURRENT RAIN CHANCES AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING 
CHANCES...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A CLOSED LOW WILL BR TRACKING NORTHEAST FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS TO
THE UPPER GREAT LAKES TONIGHT THROUGH TOMORROW. A TRAILING SPOKE OF
500 MB VORTICITY WILL BRING RAIN SHOWERS TO THE AREA
TONIGHT...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND INTO MONDAY MORNING. LIFT
REMAINS QUITE WEAK...AND THE NE TRACK OF THE SYSTEM WILL MEAN A
WEAKENING TREND AS THE PRECIP AREA MOVES EAST. CATEGORICAL POPS ARE
WARRANTED IN WESTERN SECTIONS BUT WITH LIGHT QPF.

THE 850 MB RIDGE OFF THE ATLANTIC COASTLINE WILL BE RETROGRADING
THROUGH MONDAY...BECOMING POSITIONED OVER THE FL PANHANDLE BY
TUESDAY. THIS WILL CUT OFF OUR SUPPLY OF GULF MOISTURE...AND WITH A
LACK OF UPPER LEVEL FORCING...RAIN CHANCES LOOK SLIM MONDAY NIGHT
AND TUESDAY. HOWEVER...THE NAM AND GFS SHOW ELEVATED INSTABILITY
AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WITH A WEAK TROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY MORNING...SO WILL KEEP A CHANCE POP GOING EVERYWHERE. THE
GFS SHOWS A STRENGTHENING CAP THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH VERY
DRY MIDLEVEL AIR IN A DEEP WESTERLY FLOW...SO WILL REMOVE POPS FROM
THAT PERIOD. WITH A BUILDING RIDGE TO THE SOUTH AND DECREASING
CLOUDS...TEMPERATURES WILL BE UNSEASONABLY WARM ON TUESDAY...WITH
HIGHS IN THE 70S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM  (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
RIDGING ALOFT AND DRIER AIR FILTERING BEHIND EXITING SYSTEM TUESDAY. 
WILL KEEP A WARM AND DRY PATTERN TO THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. INCREASING SOUTHERLY FLOW AND INSTABILITY THURSDAY 
AND THURSDAY NIGHT WILL ALLOW A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP. GFS MODEL SHOWS BEST CHANCES THOUGH WILL 
WAIT UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVES 
THROUGH. ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN THOUGH AS NO 
FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BE NEARBY. ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES MAINLY IN THE 
TERRAIN AREAS FOR THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES MUCH ABOVE NORMAL IN THE 
MID 40S TO MID 50S AT NIGHT AND 70S DURING THE DAY. UPPER 70S IN 
PLACES WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AND SLIGHTLY COOLER FRIDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY.  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

GH/DGS/TD

.DISCUSSION...
A DEVELOPING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ADVECT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO
THE AREA TODAY AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS NE ACROSS THE
PLAINS. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE THIS AFTERNOON...WITH RAIN CHANCES
HOLDING OFF UNTIL TONIGHT AS THERE IS A LOT OF DRY AIR TO BE
OVERCOME IN THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING. THIS IS IN LINE WITH THE CURRENT
FORECAST. OBSERVED TEMPS ARE IN THE BALLPARK WITH THE
FORECAST...SO NO UPDATE IS NEEDED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

507 
FXUS64 KMRX 110859
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
450 AM EDT SUN MAR 11 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO THE EAST 
WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT FURTHER AWAY FROM THE REGION.  A WEAKENING 
AND SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH FROM THE WEST LATE 
TONIGHT...AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW TO OUR 
WEST AND NORTHWEST WILL SWING INTO THE AREA.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE 
AS MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...AND SHOWERS SHOULD MOVE 
INTO SOUTHWEST ZONES BY MIDNIGHT AND MAY REACH NORTHEAST ZONES 
BEFORE DAYBREAK.  WILL CARRY CAT POPS TONIGHT SOUTHWEST AND WEST 
ZONES...WITH JUST CHANCE POPS NORTHEAST ZONES.  MAV TEMPS LOOK 
REASONABLE FOR TODAY...BUT WILL GENERALLY GO A BIT HIGHER THAN MAV 
NUMBERS FOR LOWS TONIGHT GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP 
MOVING IN.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER TROUGH PRESSES 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES ON MONDAY AND THEN SHIFTS EAST 
ACROSS SOUTHEASTERN CANADA AND THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. ON TUESDAY. 
NICE INFLUX OF MOISTURE FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO. LIFT FROM THE 
ADVANCING TROUGH AND MOISTURE CONVERGENCE SHOULD LEAD TO SHOWERS ON 
MONDAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. CONFIDENCE HIGH ENOUGH TO BOOST 
POPS TO CATEGORICAL RANGE MOST AREAS ON MONDAY. SEVERAL MODELS 
CONTINUE TO DRAG A WEAKER SHORT WAVE FEATURE AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE MID SOUTH MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY SO KEPT GOOD CHANCE 
POPS GOING MONDAY NIGHT REDUCING TO CHANCE CATEGORY ON TUESDAY AS 
DRIER AIR EVENTUALLY BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST ALLOWING FOR A DRY 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS STILL GENERALLY AGREE THAT 
THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BECOME SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE DUE TO A LENGTHY PERIOD 
OF MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW COMPLETE WITH STRENGTHENING MID MARCH 
INSOLATION DURING THE PERIOD THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. ADDING IN A 
COUPLE SHORT WAVE FEATURES IN THE PREVAILING SOUTHWEST FLOW REQUIRES 
THE USE OF A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR DAYTIME CONVECTION WITH A SHOWER 
OR TWO AT NIGHT. PERHAPS THE BEST CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM WOULD BE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AS MODEL 
FORECASTS KEY IN ON A SHORT WAVE THAT MIGRATES FROM THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY NORTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. STAYED FAIRLY 
CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE TEMP BLEND THROUGH TUESDAY AND THEN TWEAKED 
MEX MOS TEMPS A LITTLE HIGHER FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD DUE TO 
THE AMPLIFIED APPEARANCE TO THIS WEEK'S WEATHER PATTERN. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 110226
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
926 PM EST SAT MAR 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA BRINGING ANOTHER CLEAR SKY AND DRY WEATHER TONIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGED 
NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TODAY WILL
SHIFT TO THE NC/VA COAST TOMORROW. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A MORE
SOUTHERLY WIND COMPONENT AND WEAK ADVECTION OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. THE NAM SHOWS CONSIDERABLE
CLOUDINESS DEVELOPING IN THE SOUTH WITH THIS MOISTURE
ADVECTION...BUT THIS APPEARS TO BE OVERDONE AS THE SOUTHERLY FLOW
REMAINS WEAK UNTIL THE LATE AFTERNOON. MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL
SEE HIGH TEMPS IN THE UPPER 60S TOMORROW. LOWS TONIGHT WILL DROP
INTO THE 30S IN MOST SPOTS...WITH SUB-FREEZING TEMPS IN NE TN AND
SW VA. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
INCREASE IN MOISTURE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH CLOSED LOW OVER THE CENTRAL
PLAINS MOVING NE TOWARD THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES BY LATE MONDAY.
SHOWERS SPREAD EAST ACROSS FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY NIGHT BUT
MAINLY DURING THE DAY MONDAY. RIGHT NOW AMOUNTS LOOK TO BE VERY
LIGHT. MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY SHOWERS STILL AROUND THEN HEIGHTS
BUILD AS ATLANTIC HIGH STRENGTHENS. WEDNESDAY STILL LOOKS VERY WARM
AND DRY. THIS PATTERN COULD CONTINUE A COUPLE MORE DAYS BUT MODELS
SHOW SOME WEAKNESSES IN RIDGE AND INCREASE OF MOISTURE FROM GULF.
WILL KEEP CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.
HIGH PRESSURE AREA BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST AT THE BEGINNING OF THE
WEEKEND SO SHOWERY PATTERN CONTINUES THROUGH SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES
MUCH ABOVE NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY WITH HIGHS MOSTLY UPPER
60S TO AS HIGH AS UPPER 70S AND LOWS MID 40S NE VALLEYS TO UPPER
40S TO MID 50S ELSEWHERE.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 100808
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST SAT MAR 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO OUR 
NORTH WILL SHIFT SOUTHEAST DURING THE PERIOD...WITH A DRY AIRMASS 
OVER OUR AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD.  MAY SEE A FEW HIGH CLOUDS MAINLY 
LATER TONIGHT. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST A FEW 
MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK 
STARTS OUT WITH SOME DECENT WEATHER AS AN UPPER RIDGE MIGRATES 
ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS A CLOSED UPPER LOW SHIFTS NORTHEAST FROM 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TO THE GREAT LAKES. THIS FEATURE WILL PULL A 
COLD FRONT TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON MONDAY. STILL 
NOT CONVINCED OF THIS SYSTEM'S ABILITY TO GENERATE WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. BEST CHANCE WOULD BE OVER WESTERN 
SECTIONS AND APPLIED GOOD CHANCE THROUGH LIKELY POPS MAINLY ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ON MONDAY AFTERNOON WITH LOW TO MEDIUM CHANCE 
ELSEWHERE AND THEN SPREAD GOOD CHANCE POPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION 
MONDAY NIGHT AS A FEW SHOWERS LIMP INTO THE REGION. ASSUMING A WEAK 
BOUNDARY AND MOIST AXIS HAS SHIFTED EAST TO THE MOUNTAINS ON TUESDAY 
KEPT A LOW CHANCE POP AND SLIGHT CHANCE POP ELSEWHERE FOR A SHOWER 
OR THUNDERSTORM ON TUESDAY. BY WEDNESDAY HEIGHTS START TO BUILD 
AGAIN ALOFT WITH A NICE BERMUDA SURFACE HIGH WEDGING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. PUSHING ANY LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN WELL WEST 
ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. BY THURSDAY MODELS START TO MOISTEN 
UP THE LOW LEVELS A BIT WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A WEAK IMPULSE 
DRIFTING EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. AS THE WARM SOUTHERLY FLOW GETS 
GOING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BECOME 
SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE SO KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST ON THURSDAY INCREASING TO LOW CHANCE 
BY THURSDAY NIGHT AS IMPULSE CONTINUES EAST. MAINTAINED A LOW CHANCE 
PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION ON FRIDAY AS WELL IN THE SLIGHTLY 
UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE WHICH WILL BE IN PLACE TOWARD THE END OF THE 
WEEK.   

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST FRI MAR 9 2012

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION BRINGING A CLEAR SKY 
AND SEASONAL TEMPERATURES TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING...NO 
OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A COOL NW FLOW ALOFT TONIGHT
WITH A SURFACE HIGH IN PLACE. EXPECT CLEAR SKIES...DIMINISHING
WINDS...AND SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES...MEANING MANY LOCATIONS WILL
FALL A LITTLE BELOW FREEZING ON THIS WINTER NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE AND RIDGING ALOFT WILL HOLD THROUGH SUNDAY WITH WARMING 
TEMPERATURES. MOISTURE WILL BEGIN INCREASING LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT WITH LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER COLORADO SHIFTING TO THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS. GULF MOISTURE INCREASES ON BACK SIDE OF HIGH PRESSURE AREA 
AND THIS BRINGS CLOUDS INTO THE TN VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. 
SHOWERS POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY BUT QPF AMOUNTS WILL BE 
LIGHT. WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY STAYS TO THE WEST MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY WITH MAIN SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND MORE CONCENTRATED 
RAINFALL NORTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT AND THEN DECREASING TUESDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT 
STILL ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR A FEW SHOWERS. ECMWF AND GFS ALONG WITH 
CANADIAN SHOW STRENGTHENING RIDGE SOMETIME TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. REMOVED POPS FOR WEDNESDAY THEN INCREASED SOUTHWEST FLOW 
AHEAD OF ANOTHER FRONT WILL BRING ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR MORE SHOWERS 
AND WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 70S BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY THERE WILL 
BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY.

756 
FXUS64 KMRX 090848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST FRI MAR 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PRECIP QUICKLY EXITING BEHIND COLD 
FRONT...SO SHOULD BE DRY FOR THE SHORT TERM.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BUILD IN ALONG WITH MUCH DRIER AIR. CLOUDS WILL DECREASE 
TODAY...THEN EXPECT MAINLY CLEAR CONDITIONS TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS LOOK 
REASONABLE SO NO BIG ADJUSTMENTS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST 
LOOKS MORE LIKE LATE APRIL RATHER THAN EARLY MARCH AS HEIGHTS BUILD 
OVER MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE NATION BY THURSDAY. MUCH 
OF THE TIME THE PREVAILING UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL BE SOUTHWESTERLY 
PULLING INITIALLY MILD AND THEN WARM AIR INTO THE REGION. THE 
WEEKEND LOOKS RATHER DECENT AS AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS 
THE EASTERN U.S. SUNDAY SHOULD REMAIN DRY BUT THE CHANCE FOR A 
SHOWER WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AS A TROUGH 
SWINGS NORTHEAST FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE WILL INCREASE AHEAD OF A WEAKENING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WHICH WILL MAKE BETTER PROGRESS ACROSS THE MIDWEST THAN THE 
MID SOUTH. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN HOW FAR EAST THIS BOUNDARY MAY 
PROGRESS MAINTAINED MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS MONDAY INTO 
MONDAY NIGHT. TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY DEFINITELY STARTS LOOKING 
MORE LIKE THE MIDDLE OF SPRING WITH THE MAIN STORM TRACK SHIFTED 
NORTH AND WEST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THE MODELS HINT 
AT THE POSSIBILITY OF A COUPLE WEAK SHORT WAVE PASSAGES THROUGH THIS 
PERIOD WITH SOME INSTABILITY NOTED IN THE WARMER...HIGHER DEWPOINT 
AIRMASS OFF THE GULF BUT NOTHING TO REALLY KEY IN ON. THEREFORE 
STAYED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION THROUGH THURSDAY. WENT 
A LITTLE ABOVE MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE IN THIS MILD PATTERN.     

&&

NORTHERN PLAINS MONDAY AND INTO ONTARIO TUESDAY. FRONTAL SYSTEM

MOVING NE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP WITH THESE 
FEATURES. A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE NW ON DAY SEVEN 
POSSIBLY WITH THE CHANCE OF THUNDERS. TEMPERATURES WARM INTO THE 70S 
AS DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA 
BRINGS UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS NEXT WEEK.

NEXT WEEK...WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED EACH
AFTERNOON AND EVENING FROM MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MODELS

GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD (EXCEPT ON FRIDAY

GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...

AFTERNOON AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND THE UPPER JET MOVES INTO

BRING PRECIP INTO THE AREA THAN THE NAM. THE TIMING OF THE SREF AND 
CANADIAN ARE BETWEEN THE TWO AND WILL BE FOLLOWED...WITH CHANCE POPS 
COMING IN AFTER 18Z...WITH LIKELY POPS AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS ARRIVING IN THE PLATEAU AFTER 21Z. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL 
PUSH THROUGH THE MRX CWA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  DEEP MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT MAY GENERATE AREAS OF HEAVY RAINFALL.  
ADDITIONALLY...THE AIR MASS WILL BECOME WEAKLY UNSTABLE FOR A FEW 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS.  MODEL CONSISTENCY QUITE POOR FOR THE REST 
OF THE EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  CURRENT TRENDS BRING A 
SURFACE HIGH INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS.  THE NEXT 
SYSTEM MOVES IN SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WHICH SHOULD SPREAD SHOWERS AND 
POSSIBLY A STRAY THUNDERSTORM INTO THE AREA.  SCATTERED SHOWERS 
SHOULD LINGER INTO TUESDAY AS THE SYSTEM EXITS.  WILL KEEP THINGS 
DRY FOR WEDNESDAY WITH WEAK RIDGING EXPECTED OVER THE REGION.

FXUS64 KMRX 050803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST MON MAR 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
FAST-MOVING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER SOUTHEAST KY...WITH 
ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THIS 
SYSTEM WILL QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE SUNRISE... 
WITH NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND THE COLD FRONT PRODUCING SOME ADDITIONAL 
SCATTERED RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS. WITH A WARM AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...THESE SHOWERS HAVE NOT BEEN PRODUCING 
MUCH SNOW AT THE OBS SITES OUTSIDE OF SOUTHWEST VA. IN FACT...TEMPS 
ARE STILL IN THE 40S MOST EVERYWHERE IN EAST TN...ESPECIALLY BELOW 
2500 FEET. WARM TEMPS IN THE 40S ARE EVEN BEING REPORTED OVER MIDDLE 
TN BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT ANY SNOWFALL THIS 
MORNING WILL HAVE A TOUGH TIME ACCUMULATING ON THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU AND NORTHEAST TN...SO WILL CANCEL THE ADVISORIES IN THESE 
AREAS. IT APPEARS THAT SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS WILL STILL 
HAVE A SHOT OF SOME SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS...SO WILL LEAVE THESE 
AREAS IN A WARNING OR ADVISORY FOR A FEW MORE HOURS. WILL ALSO ISSUE 
A WIND ADVISORY FOR THIS MORNING ACROSS THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND THE 
NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS. HIGH PRESSURE THEN QUICKLY BUILDS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BY TONIGHT...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL START 
DRY AND MILD THANKS TO A STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING 
FROM EAST OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS TO THE SOUTHEAST UNITED 
STATES. THIS RIDGING WILL PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS TUESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY.

BY THURSDAY...A NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL RACE ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST CANADA AND ANOTHER OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS/NORTHERN 
GREAT LAKES HELPING TO PULL A COLD FRONTS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
BY FRIDAY. A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
WILL PULL MOISTURE FROM THE GULF OVER THIS FRONT TO PRODUCE 
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS FOR FRIDAY. ENOUGH INSTABILITY NOTED TO INCLUDE A 
CHANCE OF THUNDER FOR THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST 
AREA.

FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...THIS BOUNDARY PULLS WELL SOUTH OF THE AREA...BUT 
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF 
ISENTROPIC UPGLIDE OVER THE BOUNDARY TO KEEP CLOUDS MOSTLY CLOUDY 
WITH A GOOD CHANCE OF RAIN RETURNING BY SUNDAY. THERE IS A LOT OF 
UNCERTAINTY OF THE PLACEMENT OF THE SOUTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH/LOW 
NEXT WEEKEND...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.
&&

POPPED EARLY TODAY AND AIRMASS SEEMS TO BE COLDER THAN ADVERTISED.

GFS AND NAM AGAIN...AND THE SWATH OF PRECIPITATION ALSO IS RIGHT
ACROSS SW VA AND NRN PARTS OF E TN. SOME CHANGES OF CONCERN WERE...
1) SURFACE COLD FRONT WITH FRONTOGENETICAL FORCING ADDED IN...AND
DEEP MOISTURE OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA...ACTUALLY UP TO 600
MBS ACROSS NRN AREAS. VERY COLD ALOFT SO EXCELLENT SNOW GROWTH.

THIS ALL FITS IN WELL WITH HPC WINTER WEATHER DESK GRAPHIC FOR DAY
1 NOW DEPICTING HEAVIER SNOW ACROSS SW VA. THUS...I UPGRADED THE
ADVISORY TO A WARNING FOR SW VA AND THE NRN MTNS OF E TN. THE
MOISTURE AND LIFT SEEMS TO ALSO SUPPORT A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY
FOR LESSER SNOW ACROSS NRN PLATEAU AND THE TRI CITIES AREAS. THE
CENTRAL VALLEY...INCLUDING LAKEWAY AREA...COULD GET A DUSTING UP TO
2 INCHES...BUT I DID NOT ADD AN ADVISORY THERE YET.

BRISK W-NW WINDS ARE SOME CONCERN BUT SHOULD STAY JUST BELOW
ADVISORY CRITERIA. OTHERWISE...I UNDERCUT MINS TONIGHT AND MAXES
MONDAY...IN ANTICIPATION OF ACCUMULATING SNOW TONIGHT AND MONDAY.

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY GRIDS LOOKED RIGHT ON TRACK AS SURFACE AND
UPPER RIDGE BUILD IN...AND TEMPS QUICKLY REBOUND ABOVE SEASONAL
NORMALS AGAIN. GUESS WINTER WANTED TO HIT US WITH A BRIEF REMINDER
THAT WINTER IS NOT OFFICIALLY OVER!


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY IN 
AGREEMENT EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE KEEPING 
DRY WEATHER IN PLACE THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. THE MODELS START TO 
DIVERGE LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS THE ATMOSPHERE STARTING 
TO GO INTO A PATTERN MORE REMINISCENT OF LATE APRIL INTO MAY AS A 
LUMBERING UPPER LOW FORMS OVER THE DESERT SOUTHWEST ON THURSDAY AND 
ONLY SLOWLY SHIFTS NORTHEAST TOWARD THE MIDWEST BY THE END OF THE 
PERIOD. WENT A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE ECMWF THURSDAY WHICH INDICATES A 
COLD FRONT DROPPING INTO THE AREA FOR HIGHER CHANCE POPS THURSDAY 
NIGHT. MERGED CLOSER TO THE GFS THEREAFTER WITH FASTER PROGRESSION 
OF THE UPPER LOW AND ASSOCIATED LOWER LEVEL PRESSURE CENTERS WHICH 
PULL WARM AND MOIST AIR BACK INTO THE REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
THIS IS A LOW PROBABILITY FORECAST DUE TO DIFFERING MODEL SOLUTIONS 
BUT KEPT A CHANCE OF SHOWERS GOING THROUGH THE WEEKEND IN THIS 
UNSETTLED PATTERN. TRENDED TEMPERATURE FORECAST TOWARD HPC 
GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
610 AM EST SUN MAR 4 2012

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OFF THE CAROLINA 
COAST...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALING SOME HIGH CLOUDS LINGERING 
BEHIND IT OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. HIGH CLOUDS WILL 
LIKELY CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AND A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES 
ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL HELP TO 
GENERATE GUSTY WESTERLY WINDS OVER THE TAF SITES THIS AFTERNOON. 
THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THEN WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
TONIGHT...WITH WINDS INCREASING AGAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT. OVERALL...VFR 
CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES ARE EXPECTED AT ALL THREE TAF SITES 
THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD.

985 
FXUS64 KMRX 040810
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST SUN MAR 4 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A COLD FRONT ALONG THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALING SOME HIGH CLOUDS LINGERING BEHIND IT OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. HIGH CLOUDS WILL LIKELY LINGER THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
AND HELPS TO GENERATE BREEZY WESTERLY WINDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE 
INTO THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON...AND THEN ACROSS THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS 
'CLIPPER' SYSTEM WILL SPREAD PRECIP MAINLY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. LIGHT SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS APPEAR POSSIBLE...BUT MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET WHERE TEMPS SHOULD BE BELOW FREEZING. IN 
THE VALLEYS...TEMPS WILL LIKELY REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING THROUGHOUT THE 
NIGHT...WHICH SHOULD COMBINE WITH WARM GROUND TEMPS TO LIMIT ANY 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS BELOW 2500 FEET. WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND... 
WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN (INCLUDING THE SMOKIES)...AND WILL 
REISSUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR CENTRAL EAST TN AND 
NORTHEAST TN OUTSIDE OF THE ADVISORY AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND 
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT TODAY THROUGH 
MONDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL START THE EXTENDED FORECAST WITH DRY AND MILD WEATHER 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  SURFACE RIDGING WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST LATE 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY ALLOWING MOISTURE TO PULL BACK INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY. BY LATE THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. HERE IS 
WHERE THE MEDIAN RANGE MODELS DIFFER GREATLY. GFS SOLUTION STALLS 
FRONT OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED (SATURDAY)...BUT 
THE ECMWF PULLS BOUNDARY SOUTH OF THE REGION. GFS ENSEMBLE SHOWS A 
GOOD DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY OF HOW FAR SOUTH BOUNDARY WILL MOVE. WILL 
TREND TOWARD THE GFS WITH A LESS AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL ALLOW FRONT TO STALL.

A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM BECOMES CUT-OFF OVER TEXAS/OKLAHOMA. AGAIN 
MODELS DIFFER ON THIS SYSTEM. FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...PLAN 
ON KEEPING CHANCES OF SHOWERS GOING. INSTABILITY WITH THIS NEXT 
SYSTEM LACKING AND NO PLANNING ON INCLUDING THUNDER.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD...EXCEPT FOR 
HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. TRENDED A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER DUE TO 
CLOUDS AND RAINFALL.

200 
FXUS64 KMRX 032031
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EST SAT MAR 3 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AFTER A VERY SPRING LIKE
SEVERE WEATHER EVENT FRIDAY...WINTER WEATHER MAKES A BRIEF VISIT
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY. 

BEFORE THE WINTRY SYSTEM...MODELS (MOSTLY GFS) DEVELOP A WEAK WAVE
ON THE COLD FRONT TO OUR SOUTH...AND PUSH SOME VERY LIGHT PCPN
NORTHWARD THAT COULD CLIP OUR EXTREME SE AND EASTERN COUNTIES
OVERNIGHT. I AM THINKING MOSTLY CLOUDS SO I WENT WITH A MOS BLEND
MIXING THE DRIER NAM MOS IN WITH GFS MOS POPS.

VERY TEMPTED TO DROP POPS ENTIRELY FOR SUNDAY...BUT LOWERED TO
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR NOW...LEAVING MIDNIGHT SHIFT TO DROP POPS
ENTIRELY IF SO DESIRED. 

NOW THE MAIN EVENT...A RATHER STRONG FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE LOOKS TO
SWEEP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY.
FORCING IS ON A SYNOPTIC SCALE INITIALLY BUT ENDS AS A NW UPSLOPE
EVENT MONDAY MORNING...WITH POSITIVE CAPES AROUND 40 J/KG. NAM AND
GFS HANDLE THIS EVENT RATHER SIMILARLY AND I CAN'T REALLY DISAGREE
MUCH WITH WINTER WEATHER DESK GRAPHIC FOR DAY 2. PRECIPITABLE WATER
VALUES ARE AROUND 1/4 TO 1/3 OF AN INCH AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS
SUGGEST MOSTLY SNOW AFTER 03Z TO 06Z MONDAY. 

THUS...I INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY OR HIGHER IN THE FAVORED AREAS
AND MENTIONED SNOW ACCUMS UP TO 2 OR 3 INCHES FOR NOW. SPS TO BE
ISSUED SHORTLY WHICH WILL HIGHLIGHT POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HEAVIER
SNOW ACCUMS...MAINLY IN HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA...AS SYNOPTIC
FORCING AND BETTER MOISTURE LOOKS TO BE A LITTLE NORTH OF THE
SMOKIES. ALSO BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS ARE MORE FAVORABLE FOR SNOW
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN MONDAY MORNING.

OTHERWISE...MOS TEMPS GENERALLY FOLLOWED FOR THE SHORT TERM.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS WILL STRUGGLE 
WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM...AS IT WILL PROBABLY AT SOME POINT BE A CUTOFF 
LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN HIGH PLAINS...THUS THE MAIN ISSUE WILL BE 
TIMING OF PRECIP IN OUR AREA. MODELS AVBL AT THIS TIME ARE GREATLY 
DIVERGENT. DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY...POPS ARE NO HIGHER THAN 30 
PERCENT LATE NEXT WEEK PARTLY TO MATCH WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES. IN 
THE MEANTIME WE WILL LOOK AT NICE WEATHER FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE AREA WITH TEMPERATURES REBOUNDING BACK TO 
THE ABOVE NORMAL READINGS WE ARE ACCUSTOMED TO OF LATE.

FXUS64 KMRX 030856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EST SAT MAR 3 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH MUCH 
COOLER AND DRIER AIR FILTERING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL SOME LINGERING POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING...WHICH SHOULD GRADUALLY EXIT THE REGION AFTER SUNRISE. 
HOWEVER...NAM AND GFS MODELS AGREE THAT AN AMPLIFYING UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON WILL GENERATE SOME 
ADDITIONAL SHOWER ACTIVITY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. THUS...WILL LEAVE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE FORECAST THROUGHOUT THE DAY OVER THE 
MOUNTAINS. THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO SWING OVER THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...AND WILL POSSIBLY GENERATING ADDITIONAL 
LIGHT PRECIP (IN THE FORM OF RAIN OR SNOW) OVER THE MOUNTAINS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS 
GOING. TEMPERATURES INDICATE IT SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A MIXTURE 
OR ALL SNOW FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EST FRI MAR 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT ALONG THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH 
SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION ALREADY DEVELOPING ALONG IT OVER SOUTHEAST 
TN. THIS WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE QUICKLY NORTHWARD ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WITH DEWPOINTS RISING TO NEAR 60 
DEGREES OVER SOUTHEAST TN AFTER SUNRISE. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 
LOCAL AIR MASS WILL QUICKLY BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE BY THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH HIGH HELICITY VALUES BETWEEN 500 AND 600 M2/S2 AS 
THE VERTICAL WIND FLOW STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS COLD FRONT WILL BE LOCATED OVER 
MIDDLE TN BY SUNSET...BUT THINK THAT A SQUALL LINE AHEAD OF THIS 
COLD FRONT COULD QUICKLY RACE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT AND AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA AS EARLY AS LATE AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION...WITH THE 
LOCAL AIR MASS BECOMING MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON...AM 
WORRIED THAT SOME DISCRETE SUPERCELLS MAY FORM AHEAD OF THE SQUALL 
LINE. WITH HIGH HELICITY VALUES THIS AFTERNOON...IT APPEARS THAT 
SOME STRONG AND LONG-LIVED TORNADOES WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH ANY 
DISCRETE SUPERCELLS DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS...IN 
ADDITION TO VERY LARGE HAIL (AROUND GOLFBALL SIZE OR LARGER) AND 
DAMAGING WINDS. MODELS INDICATE A STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 50 KT) 
DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SO WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS REVEAL SOME LARGE DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY...BUT ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT. WITH BREEZY SOUTHERLY WINDS EXPECTED TODAY... 
WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE MEDIUM RANGE FORECAST 
WILL START WITH A FAIRLY DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS SOUTHEAST CANADA/ 
EASTERN GREAT LAKES WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINA AND 
GULF COAST STATES. COLDER AND DRIER AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE FORECAST 
WITH SHOWERS ENDING EARLY SATURDAY.

FOR LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE AND 
ASSOCIATED REINFORCING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE COLD ENOUGH FOR A MIXTURE OR ALL 
SNOW FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.  MINOR SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. FOLLOWED 
COLDER MET MOS GUIDANCE FOR SUNDAY'S HIGHS DUE TO CLOUD AND 
PRECIPITATION. 

FOR LATE MONDAY THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...UPPER TROUGH WILL 
LIFT NORTHEAST BEING REPLACED WITH MORE WESTERLY ZONAL FLOW FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...THEN SOUTHWESTERLY BY MID-WEEK AS AN UPPER TROUGH 
DEVELOPS OVER THE ROCKIES. OVERALL...MODERATING TREND WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1006 PM EST THU MAR 1 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A WARM FRONT WILL BE LIFTING NORTHWARD INTO THE AREA
OVERNIGHT...BRINGING DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S TO AROUND 60 AND RISING
TEMPERATURES LATE TONIGHT. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND ELEVATED INSTABILITY
WILL PRODUCE SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AFTER 06Z.
MODELS ARE SHOWING THAT RAIN WILL DEVELOP WITHIN THE NEXT FEW HOURS
OVER CNTL AL...REACHING CHA AROUND 08-09Z. SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO
BE NEAR KNOXVILLE AROUND SUNRISE. 

NOT MUCH CHANGE IN REGARD TO THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT TOMORROW
NIGHT. THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN TN VALLEY APPEAR TO HAVE
THE BEST CHANCES OF SEEING SEVERE STORMS. STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO
DEVELOP IN MIDDLE TN...REACHING OUR WESTERN COUNTIES AROUND 03Z
GIVE OR TAKE AN HOUR...THEN MOVE THROUGH THE VALLEY 04Z-08Z. WHILE
THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING WILL CURB THE INSTABILITY A BIT...A 50+
KT LLJ...STRONG LOW LEVEL FRONTOGENETICAL FORCING...AND STRONG
UPPER DIVERGENCE WILL HELP SUSTAIN SEVERE STORMS INTO THE TN
VALLEY. DISCRETE SUPERCELLS WILL BE THE FAVORED MODE OF
CONVECTION...WITH TORNADOES POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHLY SHEARED
ENVIRONMENT. THE IMPACT LOOKS GREATER THAN THE EVENT
YESTERDAY...AND ALL RESIDENTS OF THE AREA WILL WANT TO STAY ALERT
TO THE LATEST UPDATES. AN SPS WILL BE ISSUED TO BETTER HIGHLIGHT
THE THREAT.

RAIN SHOWERS INTO THE TAF SITES.  SHOWERS SHOULD REACH INTO THE CHA 
AREA BY 09Z AND AS FAR NORTH AS TRI AROUND 15Z.  AS SHOWERS MOVE 
ACROSS A TAF SITE...BRIEF MVFR CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE.  MAY SEE A 
SHORT BREAK IN THE SCATTERED SHOWER ACTIVITY BEFORE STRONGER...MORE 
SIGNIFICANT CONVECTION APPROACHES THE AREA.  THIS CONVECTION MAY NOT 
REACH TAF SITES UNTIL AFTER 00Z.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&
