FXUS64 KMRX 012053
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 PM EST THU MAR 1 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL ALLOW THE EVENING TO START OUT CLEAR...
BEFORE CLOUDS INCREASE LATE TONIGHT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING WARM
FRONT. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE THE MAIN SOURCE OF LIFT...WITH A
MOIST AIRMASS BEING LIFTED (PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES GREATER THAN
1.00 INCH). ELEVATED INSTABILITY SUGGESTS THUNDERSTORMS...BUT MOST
LIKELY NOT STRONG TO SEVERE. MODEL QPF MAY BE OVERDONE...BUT STAYED
CLOSE TO HPC QPF. WARM AIR SHOULD SUPPORT AT LEAST A MOS BLEND FOR
HIGHS FRIDAY...WITH LOWS TONIGHT MILD 50S SOUTH TO COOLER UPPER 30S
NORTH.

THINKING THAT THERE WILL BE AT LEAST A BRIEF BREAK IN CONVECTION
WITH THE WARM FRONT...BEFORE THE COLD FRONT ARRIVES. NOT SURE HOW
MUCH PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION POPS AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...BUT I
DID LOWER POPS BRIEFLY TO A CHANCE IN THE EAST. CATEGORICAL POPS
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT WHICH THEN TAPER OFF ON SATURDAY MORNING. THE
SEVERE THREAT LOOKS TO ARRIVE MID TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING AND THEN
LASTS OVERNIGHT.

EXPECTED QPF WOULD NOT APPEAR TO RAISE ANY RIVER LEVELS TO ACTION
STAGE OR ANY HIGHER. NAM WINDS COULD BE A LITTLE TOO STRONG WITH
THIS SYSTEM...BUT SPEEDS MAY REACH NEAR WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA
FRIDAY NIGHT. I HELD OFF ON AN ADVISORY FOR NOW. 

OTHERWISE...CLOSELY FOLLOWED MOS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL BE SLOW TO SHIFT EAST SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AS AT LEAST 
TWO SHORT WAVE IMPULSES DROP SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE PREVAILING 
NORTHWEST FLOW ON BACK SIDE OF THE FEATURE. THE FIRST SHIFTS ACROSS 
THE REGION ON SUNDAY PRODUCING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA WHILE ANOTHER CLIPPER 
SYSTEM MOVES IN SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING. CHILLY AIR 
STREAMING IN SUNDAY NIGHT WILL MEAN THAT RAIN WILL BE CHANGING TO 
SNOW...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE A STRONG NORTHWEST 
FLOW WILL CREATE A DECENT ENVIRONMENT FOR SNOW SHOWERS. THE CHANCE 
FOR SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MID DAY MONDAY...IN THE 
MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...BEFORE 
ENDING. A NICE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AGAIN TO AID IN 
WARMING AND A RETURN TO DRY WEATHER TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BY 
THURSDAY ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BE 
APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA. PLACED JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A 
SHOWER IN THE FORECAST DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING/STRENGTH OF THIS 
SYSTEM.

OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE LAST HOUR TAKING THE LAST AREA OF

TEMPERATURES ARE STILL VERY MILD IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S AT THIS
HOUR WITH CLOUDS ONLY ACROSS THE EXTREME NE AND EXTREME SOUTH. 
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MS VALLEY WILL BRING ANOTHER
SUNNY SPRING LIKE DAY TODAY WITH HIGHS REACHING THE MID 60S TO MID
70S. DRIER AIR MASS JUST REACHING THE PLATEAU AREA WITH DEW POINTS
THERE DROPPING INTO THE 30S. THIS FAIR WEATHER WILL BE BRIEF AS
ANOTHER TROUGH DIGS SOUTH OVER THE WESTERN STATES TODAY. LOW
PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS LATER TODAY AND THE COLD
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE BACK NORTH TONIGHT INTO THE PLATEAU AND
SOUTHERN VALLEY AND THEN ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA
DURING THE DAY FRIDAY. SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
POSSIBLE NEAR THE WARM FRONT OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. FRIDAY SURFACE LOW
DEEPENS AS IT MOVES FROM MO/AR INTO GREAT LAKES BY EVENING. SIMILAR
EVENT AND TIMING WITH WEDNESDAY SYSTEM WITH MODERATE RISK FOR
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY NIGHT JUST TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST
AREA AS COLD FRONT MOVES EAST ACROSS THE TN AND OHIO VALLEYS.
STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF SYSTEM WILL WARM TEMPERATURES ONCE
AGAIN INTO THE LOWER 70S. RAINFALL IS EXPECTED TO BE GREATER AS WELL
WITH RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ONE TO TWO INCHES POSSIBLE FROM FRIDAY
MORNING INTO SATURDAY MORNING. SHOWERS LINGER SATURDAY MORNING AND
COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL KEEP HIGHS ONLY IN THE 50S.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLDER PATTERN AS
TROUGH DEEPENS IN THE EASTERN STATES. CLEARING SKIES SATURDAY NIGHT
WITH LOWS NEAR FREEZING BUT SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES THROUGH BASE OF
TROUGH INTO THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY AND COLD RAIN
SHOWERS SUNDAY WILL BE FOLLOWED BY SOME SNOW SHOWERS SUNDAY NIGHT
INTO MONDAY MAINLY NORTHERN AREAS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TROUGH
MOVES OUT MONDAY NIGHT AND RIDGING ALOFT BRINGS BACK CLEARING SKIES
AND A WARMING TREND THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AWAITING THE ARRIVAL OF
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS THIS AFTERNOON...AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING
COLD FRONT. COLD FRONT AT 19Z APPEARED TO BE JUST ENTERING NW
CORNER OF TN NORTH ACROSS EXTREME WRN KY. LINE OF SEVERE STORMS
AHEAD OF THE FRONT HAS MOVED INTO ERN KY SW TO NRN MIDDLE TN...WITH
SOME NEWER DEVELOPMENT SW INTO AREAS BETWEEN I-40 AND I-65. SEEING
STRONG SHEAR AND HELICITY JUST TO OUR WEST WHICH IS PROGGED TO
REACH OUR AREA BY LATE AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS. MAX TEMPS
HAVE BEEN HELD BACK SOME BY CLOUDS AND SPOTTY CONVECTION AHEAD OF
THE LINE...SO INSTABILITY HAS BEEN LIMITED THUS FAR.

KEEPING POPS HIGH FOR MUCH OF TONIGHT...DUE TO ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE LINE OF SEVERE STORMS PLUS ANY LINGERING CONVECTION ALONG 
THE ACTUAL FRONTAL BOUNDARY. LATER 3 PERIODS GENERALLY WERE ON TRACK 
IN PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS WITH JUST SOME VERY MINOR TWEAKS. BOTH 
THURSDAY AND EARLY THURSDAY NIGHT LOOK TO BE DRY...BEFORE NEXT 
SYSTEM SPREADS CLOUDS AND SHOWERS NE LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY. PUSHED POPS UP TO LIKELY BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...AS ONLY NAM 
WAS SLUGGISH IN SPREADING RAINS NE. ALL OTHER MODELS OFFERED TIMING 
VERY SIMILAR TO WETTER GFS MODEL...INCLUDING ECMWF/CMC AND SREF.
ONE OTHER ITEM WAS TO ADD THUNDERSTORMS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS TEMPS EXCEPT I DID UNDERCUT THE WARMER 
MOS NUMBERS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY...DUE TO CLOUDS AND EARLIER START TO 
SHOWERS. MILDER MINS THURSDAY NIGHT SEEMED A BETTER CHOICE GIVEN
INCREASING CLOUDS. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FRONT TRACKS
THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP THE
HIGHEST CHANCES FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT PASSES. COULD SEE
THUNDERSTORM ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. UPPER LOW TRACKS THROUGH
THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS IN
THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA. MAY SEE A FEW FLURRIES IN THE
NORTHERN ZONES ON SUNDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY
WEATHER FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

607 
FXUS64 KMRX 290914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EST WED FEB 29 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE AREA
WAS LOCATED OVER IOWA EARLY THIS MORNING WITH A COLD FRONT
EXTENDING SOUTHWEST THROUGH MO INTO TX. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET IS
FEEDING INTO THIS SYSTEM WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WIDESPREAD
OVER KY AND ISOLATED SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS OVER NE TN AT
THIS HOUR. TEMPERATURES ARE MUCH WARMER THIS MORNING IN THE 50S
WITH DEW POINTS IN THE MID 40S TO MID 50S AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
INCREASES. THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS
UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES ACROSS NORTHERN MS VALLEY AND STRONG MID
LEVEL JET OF AROUND 80 TO 90 KNOTS BRINGS WARM MOIST AIR MASS INTO THE
OH VALLEY. STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE OVER KY THIS MORNING AND
EXTEND INTO MIDDLE TN LATER IN THE MORNING. AS INDICATED IN DAY 1
CONVECTIVE OUTLOOK HEATING TODAY WILL CAUSE MORE CONVECTION TO
DEVELOP OVER WEST TN JUST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT AND MOVE EAST
INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO THIS EVENING.
DAMAGING WINDS SHOULD BE THE BIGGEST THREAT WITH A LINE OF STORMS
BUT LARGE HAIL IS POSSIBLE WITH ANY SUPERCELLS AND ISOLATED
TORNADOES. HEAVY RAINFALL IS POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS
ORGANIZED CONVECTION MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WINDS WILL BE
QUITE STRONG ALOFT AND GUSTS APPROACHING WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA
COULD OCCUR IN SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OVER SW VA AND THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU. STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST OF THE
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS BY AROUND MIDNIGHT WITH SKIES CLEARING DURING
THE LATE NIGHT HOURS. CLOUDS WILL LIMIT TEMPERATURES WARMING TODAY
SOMEWHAT BUT HIGHS SHOULD REACH THE LOWER 70S IN THE LOWER
ELEVATIONS AS STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES AHEAD OF COLD
FRONT. GENERALLY FOLLOWED MET/MAV GUIDANCE FOR LOWS TONIGHT MAINLY
MID 40S TO NEAR 50.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO EXTENDED 
FORECAST. A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT ON THURSDAY WILL BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS. 
BACKING 850 MB WINDS WILL INCREASE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT THURSDAY NIGHT. THE NAM IS DRIER THAN THE GFS THIS 
PERIOD...BUT WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WETTER GFS WHICH HAS SUPPORT FROM 
THE CANADIAN AND ECMWF MODELS. AT THE SURFACE A WARM FRONT PUSHES 
INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY...BRINGING MILD TEMPS IN THE 70S AND 
DEWPOINTS INTO THE 50S. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A WEAKENING CAP 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...WHILE THE LLJ STRENGTHENS TO NEAR 50 KTS. 
EXPECT THAT CONVECTION WILL INITIATE IN THE AFTERNOON OVER MIDDLE TN 
CLOSER TO THE UPPER JET AND IN THE INSTABILITY AXIS...WITH STORMS 
MOVING INTO THE AREA IN THE EVENING. GOOD MODEL CONSENSUS SHOWS THE 
STRONGEST SYNOPTIC LIFT FRIDAY NIGHT. DRY AIR AND STRONG WINDS 
THROUGH THE MID LEVELS WILL MEAN STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS WILL BE THE 
MAIN THREAT...BUT CAPE VALUES AND HIGH DEEP-LAYER SHEAR WILL SUPPORT 
HAIL AS WELL. 

LEANING TOWARD GFS SOLUTION FOR THE REMAINDER OF FORECAST. BACKED 
OFF ON POPS SATURDAY ESPECIALLY IN THE AFTERNOON. LONG WAVE TROUGH 
EXTENDS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM SUNDAY INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. GFS HAS BEEN TRENDING COLDER WITH REINFORCING SHORT WAVE 
SUNDAY NIGHT. BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS INTO MONDAY. BACKED OFF ON POPS 
SUN NGT BUT INTRODUCED SOME SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS NORTHERN AREA. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE REMAINDER OF 
THE EXTENDED. 

&&

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  50  71  50  71 /  90  80  10  30  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       70  49  71  50  71 /  90  70  10  30  50

685 
FXUS64 KMRX 290206
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EST TUE FEB 28 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT 
STRETCHING ACROSS KENTUCKY AND SOUTHERN WEST VIRGINIA...WITH AN 
UNSEASONABLY MILD AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS CLOUDS INCREASING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
THIS EVENING...WITH AREA RADARS REVEALING SOME SCATTERED LIGHT 
SHOWERS OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. MODELS INDICATE SOME INCREASING 
ISENTROPIC LIFT OVERNIGHT...WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE ALSO 
MOVING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THUS...EXPECT SHOWERS TO BECOME 
LIKELY AFTER MIDNIGHT...BUT RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL PROBABLY BE ON THE 
LIGHT SIDE. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE LOCAL AIR MASS WILL 
REMAIN FAIRLY STABLE OVERNIGHT...SO WILL BACK OFF ON THE TSTORM 
WORDING IN THE ZONES BY MENTIONING SHOWERS BECOMING LIKELY WITH ONLY 
A CHANCE OF TSTORMS. WITH CLOUDS AND DEWPOINTS SLOWLY INCREASING 
THROUGH THE NIGHT...THINK THAT TEMPS WILL REMAIN ON THE WARM SIDE 
OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO REMOVE 
ANY EVENING PRECIP WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING 
TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

299 
FXUS64 KMRX 282009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EST TUE FEB 28 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...CLOUDS STILL 
SPREADING ACROSS CWA SW-NE...ALTOCU FIRST THEN STRATOCU.  CEILINGS 
REALLY LOW BACK UNDER CANOPY...CENTRAL AL/MS BACK TO GULF COAST.  
TRAJECTORY FORECASTS SHOWING 500-1500M TRAJECTORIES COMING STRAIGHT 
FROM THIS AREA...SO LOTS OF DEEP MOISTURE UNDERGOING ISENTROPIC LIFT.

BREEZY CONDITIONS EXPECTED TOMORROW...AND UNSURPRISINGLY...THERE 
SHOULD BE GOOD SHEAR AS WELL.  INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED TO BE 
MARGINAL...WITH SREF MLCAPE VALUES ONLY AROUND 500 J/KG IN THE LATE
AFTERNOON AND WEAKENING INTO THE EVENING. HOWEVER...0-6 SHEAR
VALUES ARE EXPECTED TO BE 70+ KT...AND 0-1 HELICITY VALUES OF 200+
M2/S2. WOULD EXPECT INITIAL THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT TO START AHEAD
OF THE FRONT IN THE THETA-E RIDGE WELL W AND NW OF HERE DURING THE
AFTERNOON...AND THEN FOR A LINE OF STORMS TO MOVE TOWARD AND
THROUGH THE AREA DURING LATE AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT. MOST OF THE
PRECIP SHOULD BE EAST OR SOUTHEAST OF THE CWA BY 12Z THURSDAY.

WENT VERY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS...ONLY TWEAKING MAX TEMPS 
WED...BUMPING UP SRN AREAS 1-3 DEGREES...AND BUMPING DOWN NRN AREAS 
1-2 DEG.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT ON THURSDAY WILL BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED THURSDAY 
NIGHT AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS. BACKING 850 
MB WINDS WILL INCREASE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC 
LIFT THURSDAY NIGHT. THE NAM IS DRIER THAN THE GFS THIS PERIOD...BUT 
WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WETTER GFS WHICH HAS SUPPORT FROM THE CANADIAN 
AND ECMWF MODELS. AT THE SURFACE A WARM FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA 
ON FRIDAY...BRINGING MILD TEMPS IN THE 70S AND DEWPOINTS INTO THE 
50S. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A WEAKENING CAP THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON...WHILE THE LLJ STRENGTHENS TO NEAR 50 KTS. EXPECT THAT 
CONVECTION WILL INITIATE IN THE AFTERNOON OVER MIDDLE TN CLOSER TO 
THE UPPER JET AND IN THE INSTABILITY AXIS...WITH STORMS REACHING THE 
PLATEAU AROUND 00Z SATURDAY. WITH GOOD MODEL CONSENSUS SHOWING THE 
STRONGEST SYNOPTIC LIFT COMING FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL RAISE POPS TO 
CATEGORICAL THAT PERIOD. LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING MAY HELP STORMS 
WEAKEN A BIT BEFORE REACHING OUR AREA...BUT THE NAM STILL SHOWS CAPE 
VALUES OF 1000-1500 J/KG AT 00Z. DRY AIR AND STRONG WINDS THROUGH 
THE MID LEVELS WILL MEAN STRAIGHT-LINE WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN 
THREAT...BUT CAPE VALUES AND HIGH DEEP-LAYER SHEAR WILL SUPPORT HAIL 
AS WELL. TORNADO THREAT CANNOT BE RULED OUT...BUT WILL DEPEND ON 
MESOSCALE BOUNDARIES WHICH ARE TOO DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN THIS FAR 
OUT. IF THE SURFACE WARM FRONT REMAINS ACROSS THE AREA...THE TORNADO 
THREAT WILL BE HIGHER.

GFS IS THE FASTEST MODEL TO PUSH THE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE 
AREA...PLACING IT EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY 12Z SATURDAY...BUT WILL 
KEEP POPS GOING THROUGH SATURDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THE SLOWER ECMWF AND 
EVEN SLOWER CANADIAN. THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS TRAILS WELL BEHIND THE 
FRONT...CROSSING THE AREA ON SUNDAY. COLD TEMPS ALOFT AND VORTICITY 
ADVECTION WILL BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS NORTH ON 
SUNDAY...ALONG WITH COOLER TEMPS. A LARGE RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY MONDAY AND TUESDAY...WITH A SLIGHT WARMING 
TREND AS THE HIGH MOVES EASTWARD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  70  50  71  50 /  70  90  70  10  30

584 
FXUS64 KMRX 280919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
419 AM EST TUE FEB 28 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE...CENTERED 
OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WILL MOVE QUICKLY OFF TO THE EAST 
TODAY. A WARM FRONT WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. CLOUD COVER WILL BE ON THE INCREASE TODAY. 
STRENGTHENING ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING LIGHT RAIN INTO THE 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE VALLEY LATER THIS AFTERNOON. DESPITE CLOUD COVER
MODERATE WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL RESULT IN TEMPERATURES ABOVE 
NORMAL. SOUTHWESTERLY LAYER FLOW INCREASES TONIGHT AS JET SEGMENT 
INCREASES ON SOUTHEAST SIDE OF NEGATIVELY TILTED TROUGH WHICH 
REMAINS NW OF THE AREA. PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION RISES TONIGHT 
ACROSS THE REGION. BEST LAYER SHEAR....LIFT AND INSTABILITY REMAINS 
WEST OF MRX CWA BUT THERE IS A CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS LATE TONIGHT 
ACROSS CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MINIMUM TEMPERATURE WELL ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...TIGHTLY WOUND UP SYSTEM
OVER THE MS VALLEY EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING WILL LIKELY HAVE ONGOING
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH WARM FRONT ALREADY THROUGH
WARM MOIST FLOW AHEAD OF COLD FRONT WILL WARM TEMPERATURES INTO THE
UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S. DEEP SURFACE LOW AND STACKED UPPER LOW
WITH COLD FRONT MOVE EAST INTO GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY WITH TRAILING
COLD FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL KY AND WESTERN TN BY 00Z THURSDAY. STRONG
LOW LEVEL LIFT COMBINED WITH SURFACE HEATING AND DEW POINTS IN THE
MID TO UPPER 50S WILL GIVE MIXED LAYER CAPE VALUES OF 500-1000 J/KG.
STRONG WINDS ALOFT AND GOOD SHEAR VALUES WILL BRING INGREDIENTS
TOGETHER FOR THE THREAT OF DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL AND ISOLATED
TORNADOES DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS...PER SPC DAY 2
OUTLOOK. THE ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY WEAKEN DURING THE EVENING AS LINE
OF THUNDERSTORMS MOVE INTO A MORE STABLE AIR MASS ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. THE COLD FRONT WILL EXIT THE MOUNTAINS AROUND 6-12Z
THURSDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING. LITTLE COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND
FRONT WITH WESTERLY FLOW SO TEMPERATURES STAY MILD THURSDAY. NEW
TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER WESTERN STATES THURSDAY AND DEEPENS THURSDAY
NIGHT. WARM FRONT MOVES BACK THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AND
DEVELOPING SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS COMBINES WITH NORTHERN SYSTEM.
ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SOME STRONG WILL AFFECT
THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND THE
SECOND FRONTAL SYSTEM AND QUIETER AND COOLER PATTERN ROUNDS OUT THE
EXTENDED PERIOD.

449 
FXUS64 KMRX 272024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST MON FEB 27 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...CLOUDS STILL MAKING THEIR WAY 
OUT OF THE REGION...WHILE WEAK COLD FRONT IS ENTERING.  WINDS HAVE 
ALREADY BEEN VEERING TO THE WEST...SO FRONTAL PASSAGE IS A LITTLE 
DIFFICULT TO DISCERN...STRICTLY FROM A WIND-SHIFT STANDPOINT.  
FRONTAL LOCATION CAN BE SEEN IN THETA-E ADVECTION...SHOWING IT 
MOVING INTO NW TN NOW.  LOOKS LIKE AN UNEVENTFUL FRONTAL PASSAGE 
THIS EVENING WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT.  AS HIGH SLIDES TO EAST ON TUESDAY A QUICK RETURN FLOW 
ENSUES AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.  

WILL KEEP POPS LOW TUESDAY AND ONLY IN THE SWRN AREAS IN THE 
AFTERNOON.  CLOUDS SHOULD BE GETTING PRETTY THICK DURING THE 
AFTERNOON IN THE SOUTHWEST AREAS...BUT MOISTURE STILL NEEDS TO BE 
DEEPER TO WARRANT HIGHER POPS FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON...SEE NEXT 
FORECAST PERIOD FOR TIMING OF BULK OF PRECIP.

WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE NUMBERS ON TEMPS FOR THESE TWO PERIODS.  
MODEL DEW POINTS RIDING A LITTLE TOO LOW IN NORTHEAST AT START OF 
PERIOD...SO HAVE BUMPED THEM UP FOR FIRST FEW HOURS.


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...FRONT IS EXPECTED TO 
TRACK THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY BRINGING A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES FOR WEDNESDAY. 
INSTABILITY IS ALSO EXPECTED...PROVIDING A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
ON WEDNESDAY. IN ADDITION...A STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE 
WINDS ON WEDNESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR THURSDAY. ANOTHER FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE IN ON FRIDAY AND 
FRIDAY NIGHT PROVIDING ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. SHOWERS SHOULD LINGER OVER THE REGION INTO SATURDAY. 
DRIER WEATHER MOVES INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. STAYED NEAR

AWAY.

TODAY AND COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE TONIGHT LEANED TOWARD WARM END OF MOS 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL KEEP A FEW LOW POPS 
MOVING INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.  THE 
SYSTEM WILL PUSH IN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY FOR LIKELY POPS.  
INSTABILITY AND LIFT SUFFICIENT FOR A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS AS 
WELL.  ADDITIONALLY...A STRONG 850MB JET WILL INCREASE WINDS ON 
WEDNESDAY.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY FOR BRIEF DRYING.  
ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN FOR FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT FOR ANOTHER 
ROUND OF LIKELY POPS INCLUDING A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.  SHOWERS 
WILL LINGER OVER THE AREAS FOR SATURDAY WITH DRIER AND COOLER AIR 
MOVING IN FOR THE REST OF THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1225 AM EST MON FEB 27 2012

.AVIATION...A COUPLE OF FEATURES TO AFFECT THE REGION THROUGH THE
FORECAST PERIOD. THE FIRST IS A MODERATELY AMPLIFIED LONG WAVE
TROUGH PASSING SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WHICH WILL PUSH A
WEAK COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY LATE 
THIS EVENING. THE OTHER FEATURE WHICH WILL HAVE MORE IMPACT ON THE 
AREA IS A WEAK SHORT WAVE WHICH IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS QUITE A BIT 
OF LOW LEVEL CLOUD COVER OVER THE GULF EXTENDING INTO THE COASTAL 
PLAIN. INTERESTING TO SEE THIS MOISTURE TRYING TO WORK ITS WAY 
FARTHER NORTH BUT IT IS BEING EATEN ALIVE IN THE LOW DEW POINT AIR 
MASS IN PLACE ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. EVENTUALLY AS ISENTROPIC 
LIFT INCREASES WITH THE WEAK WAVE...A LOWER DECK WILL BUILD ACROSS 
THE TERMINALS. EXPECT A LOWER VFR CEILING TO FORM JUST BEFORE 
SUNRISE AT CHA DETERIORATING TO MVFR BY 12Z. HAVE FORECAST THIS 
FLIGHT CONDITION THROUGH MID DAY BEFORE IMPROVING. DON'T BELIEVE 
THAT MVFR CEILINGS WILL DEVELOP AT TYS OR TRI. HOWEVER...LOWER VFR 
CEILINGS ARE CERTAINLY POSSIBLE HERE DURING THE DAY MONDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SERIES OF SHORT-
WAVE TROUGHS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE CONUS THROUGH THE FORECAST
PERIOD. FIRST WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. MODELS IN AGREEMENT WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE
/FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS FOR TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO ALSO WARRANT
THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL.

FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...RIDGING BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL 
PRODUCE DRY AND MILD WEATHER.

LATE FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...A STRONGER UPPER TROUGH WILL 
ESTABLISH A LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH OVER SOUTHEAST CANADA WITH COLDER 
AIR FOR NEXT WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WEEK. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ARE IN 
AGREEMENT WITH PULLING STRONG DYNAMICS OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY WITH UPPER JET ENHANCING FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING. ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY TO WARRANT INCLUDING THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE SOUTHERN 
TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

COLDER AND DRIER WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS SURFACE RIDGING 
BUILDS BACK INTO THE AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 PM EST SAT FEB 25 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
TONIGHT WILL CONTROL OUR WEATHER SUNDAY.  ANY LINGERING CLOUDS NORTH 
EXPECTED TO CLEAR OUT THIS EVENING...BUT MAY BE A FEW HIGH CLOUDS 
AROUND OVERNIGHT.  EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE SUNDAY.  WITH RELAXING 
PRESSURE GRADIENT LOOKS LIKE WIND ADVISORY CAN BE LET GO A COUPLE OF 
HOURS EARLY...SO WILL CANCEL WITH THIS ISSUANCE.     



.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CLASSIC LA NINA 
PATTERN TO CONTINUE THROUGH THIS FORECAST PERIOD WITH THE MAIN STORM 
TRACKS PLOWING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY.  AS THESE 
SYSTEMS PASS TO OUR NORTH...TWO ASSOCIATED COLD FRONTS WILL PASS 
THROUGH THE AREA...NUMBER 1 AROUND MID WEEK...AND NUMBER 2 AT THE 
END OF THE WEEK.  NEITHER ONE OF THESE SYSTEMS IS EXPECTED TO BRING 
MUCH INSTABILITY THIS FAR NORTHEAST...HAVE INCLUDED THUNDER FOR 
SYSTEM NUMBER 1...BUT ONLY INCLUDED THUNDER IN THE SWRN PARTS OF THE 
AREA FOR SYSTEM NUMBER 2.  WILL NEED TO WATCH THE INSTABILITY AS 
THESE EVENTS GET CLOSER FOR POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE STORMS. TIMING OF 
SYSTEMS WILL ALSO MATTER WITH A DIFFERENT RESULT IF THE MAIN WAVE 
FOR CONVECTION PASSES THROUGH AT 3PM VERSUS 3AM.  TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD NOT BE ANYTHING EXTREME...JUST A LOT OF WARMING AND COOLING 
IN RELATION OF FRONTAL PASSAGES.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM

AFTERNOON. MID AND UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING THROUGH THE E 
TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS MORNING. SOME STRATO CU AND ALTO CU WILL 
CONTINUE AHEAD AND BEHIND TROUGH MANY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS OF MRX 
CWA. DRY AIRMASS TODAY WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM BUT COLD AIR 
ADVECTION CONTINUES TONIGHT. BELOW NORMAL TEMPS CONTINUE. 
 
.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL EARLY IN THE EXTENDED FOR DRY WEATHER AND A WARMING TREND 
FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA 
TUESDAY...BRINGING IN A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ON TUESDAY.  THE MAIN BAND 
OF PRECIP SLIDES IN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY PROVIDING OUR BEST 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS.  ADDITIONALLY...WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPS ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FOR A CHANCE OF A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
AS WELL.  HIGH PRESSURE  BUILDS BACK IN FOR THURSDAY.  ANOTHER 
SYSTEM MOVES QUICKLY THOUGH ON FRIDAY FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST FRI FEB 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLDER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO 
PUSH IN DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A GOOD SET 
UP FOR UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS...BUT WILL CARRY LOW POPS IN SW VA AND 
MOST OF THE TN MOUNTAIN ZONES TONIGHT.  SHOULD BE DRY SATURDAY WITH 
MORE SUN SOUTH THAN NORTH.  OBS HAVE SHOWN WINDS MOSTLY BELOW WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA TODAY...BUT STILL RATHER GUSTY SO WILL ALLOW WIND 
ADVISORY TO CONTINUE THROUGH 00Z.  WINDS WILL BE GUSTY FROM THE WEST 
AGAIN SATURDAY...BUT SHOULD STAY BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO NO MAJOR ADJUSTMENTS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...QUIETER PATTERN FOR A 
FEW DAYS AS HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. UPPER 
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST SATURDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHT RIDGING TO MORE WEST TO 
EAST FLOW SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. ONE SYSTEM TRACKS SOUTH ALONG GULF 
COAST SUNDAY WITH ANOTHER MUCH LARGER SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH THE 
WESTERN GREAT LAKES AND SOUTHERN CANADA. SLOW WARMING TREND INTO THE 
MID 50S SUNDAY AND 60S MONDAY. WEAK FRONT MOVES INTO OHIO VALLEY 
MONDAY WHILE DEEPENING SYSTEM BECOMES ORGANIZED OVER THE DESERT 
SOUTHWEST. THE SOUTHWEST SYSTEM THEN BRINGS IN GULF MOISTURE INTO 
THE MS AND WESTERN TN VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. A WEAK 
WARM FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY WITH A FEW 
SHOWERS POSSIBLE AND MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES. COLD FRONT MOVES 
ACROSS TN VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. TIMING OF CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ABOUT 12 HOURS FASTER 
WITH GFS THAN ECMWF SO STARTED THUNDER TUESDAY NIGHT AND KEPT IT IN 
WEDNESDAY WITH SHOWERS INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BRIEF DRYING THURSDAY 
THAN ANOTHER FAST MOVING ORGANIZED SYSTEM FRIDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...GOOD LOW LEVEL JET VEERING INTO A

MORNING. TEMPERATURES NEAR 70 AND DEW POINTS 55 TO 60 CREATING A 
RICH ENVIRONMENT THIS EARLY FEBRUARY MORNING. CONVECTION WILL MOVE 
THROUGH EARLY THIS MORNING WITH A POSSIBILITY FOR SEVERE STORMS WITH 
MAIN THREAT BEING WIND DAMAGE. COOL MINIMUM TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE 
REALIZED AS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH AFTER DAY BREAK. SHOWER 
ACTIVITY WILL LINGER ACROSS EASTERN AREAS THIS MORNING AND ACROSS NE 
TN AND SW VA INTO THE AFTERNOON. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL 
RESULT IN STEADY OR FALLING TEMPERATURES INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 
SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL REMAIN STRONG WILL SHIFTING TO THE WEST THIS 
AFTERNOON. SHOWERS WILL END AS SNOW SHOWERS EARLY TONIGHT. MOISTURE 
WILL BE LIMITED SO ACCUMULATIONS NOT EXPECTED. BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES RETURN TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW POCKET OF LIGHT SNOW 
OR FLURRIES WILL LINGER INTO SATURDAY MORNING...MAINLY OVER FAVORED 
UPSLOPE LOCATIONS...AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY 
FROM THE REGION.  OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON 
SATURDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND THROUGH MONDAY.  THE 
MAIN SYSTEM OF THE EXTENDED WILL MOVE THROUGH TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY.  WITH A WARM...MOISTURE AND WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING OVER THE AREA...COULD SEE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO TUESDAY 
NIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING BACK IN FOR A RETURN TO DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
844 PM EST THU FEB 23 2012

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT APPROACHING MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT 24/01Z
WITH STILL LITTLE TO NO CONVECTION DEVELOPING. BEST LIFT AND
CONVERGENCE IS OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE WARM FRONT OVER
EXTREME NRN KY...WHERE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING IS MAXIMIZED. SOMEWHAT
PERPLEXING GIVEN THE MODERATE OR BETTER WIND SHEAR THIS EVENING...
PLUS BETTER SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT AND
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...YET RADARS VERY QUIET THIS EVENING.

THUS...AFTER COORDINATING WITH SPC AND NWS OFFICES IN OUR VICINITY
(HUN/OHX/JKL)...FEEL IT IS PRUDENT TO DOWNPLAY SEVERE STORMS
OVERNIGHT. PLAN TO UPDATE THE SPS VERY SOON AND THEN FORECAST GRIDS
BY OR JUST AFTER 9 PM EST. THIS WILL HELP TV METS AND EMA FOLKS
WITH ANY OVERNIGHT CONCERNS.

CLINCH RIVER ALONG FORECAST POINTS FROM CLEVELAND TO SPEERS FERRY
TO TAZEWELL IS LOOKING TO HAVE CRESTED BELOW ACTION STAGE OR
TRENDING TO BARELY REACH ACTION STAGE. THUS...NO UPDATED STATEMENTS
ON THE CLINCH. 

OTHER ITEM OF CONCERN IS WINDS OVERNIGHT...WITH THE TREND BEING FOR
GUSTINESS TO DIMINISH. SEE NO NEED TO START UP OUR WIND ADVISORY
ANY EARLIER THAN 14Z FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
627 PM EST THU FEB 23 2012

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT NEARING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER EARLY THIS 
EVENING WITH SOME WEAK CONVERGENCE ACROSS MAINLY W TN. AREA RADARS 
ARE VIRTUALLY ECHO FREE...BUT THERE IS SLIGHT INSTABILITY AND STRONG 
WINDS ALOFT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. SATELLITE PICS SHOW COOLING 
TOPS OVER NE MISSISSIPPI...SO THERE IS STILL POTENTIAL FOR 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP THIS EVENING AND POSSIBLY REACH AT LEAST WRN 
PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA TOWARD MIDNIGHT. BEST CHANCES OF TSRA 
SEEM TO BE CHA...SO DROPPED TYS AND TRI TO VCTS WITH A 4 HOUR PERIOD 
OF SHRA BEFORE DAYBREAK. IF SHRA AND TSRA DO DEVELOP THEN THERE IS A 
POSSIBILITY OF MVFR CONDITIONS LATE TONIGHT. ALSO...STRENGTH OF 
WINDS ALOFT MAY WARRANT LLWS AT TRI...BUT WATCHING THERE FOR SURFACE 
WINDS TO PICK BACK UP AGAIN...WHICH WOULD NEGATE THE NEED FOR LLWS 
AT TRI.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH 
THE AREA LATER TONIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY. TREND OF THE MODELS IS TO 
SLOW THIS DOWN A BIT FROM EARLIER FORECAST.  BETTER DYNAMICS WILL 
STAY TO OUR NORTH...AND MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY LOOK SOMEWHAT 
LIMITED FOR OUR AREA TONIGHT.  HOWEVER...STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL 
BE A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING THROUGH TONIGHT...AND 
SOME LINGERING SHOWERS AT LEAST EASTERN AREAS EARLY FRIDAY.  WILL 
CARRY LIKELY POPS TONIGHT...AND STILL SOME POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE 
STORMS GIVEN STRONG LOW LEVEL JET/IMPRESSIVE LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR.  
WILL CONTINUE SPS FOR THE STORMS TONIGHT. WINDS WILL BE GUSTY FROM 
THE SOUTHWEST AND WEST TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...AND LOOKS LIKE IT MAY 
REACH WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA DURING THE DAY FRIDAY...SO WILL ISSUE A 
WIND ADVISORY FOR ALL ZONES FOR FRIDAY.      


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AT THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD WE WILL BE UNDER THE LARGE TROUGH THAT IS PLOWING THROUGH THE 
AREA.  THERE WILL BE SOME POST FRONTAL INSTABILITY IN THE 
NORTHEASTERN AREAS THAT WILL ALLOW SOME SNOW SHOWERS FRIDAY NIGHT 
ESPECIALLY AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WITH MORE FLURRIES IN THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS.  THIS SYSTEM MOVES ON TO THE EAST AND LEAVES THE AREA 
DRY UNTIL ABOUT THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK WHEN THE NEXT SYSTEM CLOSES 
IN.  THERE SHOULD BE A THREAT OF THUNDER BY MID WEEK AHEAD OF THIS 
FRONT...DEW POINTS AND INSTABILITY LOOK TO BE A LITTLE LOW FOR 
THREAT OF SEVERE RIGHT NOW...BUT WILL NEED TO MONITOR.

339 
FXUS64 KMRX 230912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST THU FEB 23 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL SHIFT
EAST FROM THE PLAINS STATES TO THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
PRIOR TO THE MAIN EVENT...THERE COULD BE A COUPLE OF SHOWERS AND 
POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE EARLY IN THE DAY AS A WEAK IMPULSE RIDES EAST IN THE FAST 
UPPER LEVEL FLOW. LOW LEVELS A LITTLE MOIST THIS MORNING SO PATCHES 
OF BKN-OVC STRATUS AND SOME FOG WILL TAKE A LITTLE WHILE TO 
DISSIPATE AS MIXING GETS UNDERWAY WITH STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL WEST 
TO SOUTHWEST WINDS. MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT ON THE LATE 
DAY/NIGHT TIME SYSTEM. DIFFERENCES IN LOW LEVEL MOISTENING WERE 
NOTED BETWEEN THE NAM AND GFS AS A STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW SHIFTS 
EAST FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY BY 00Z 
FRIDAY. THE GFS LOOKED A LITTLE CLOSER TO REALITY WITH A CONVECTIVE 
LINE DEVELOPING JUST EAST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND DRIVING TOWARD THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TOWARD EVENING.

MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW IMPRESSIVE SHEAR WITH THE DEVELOPING SYSTEM 
WITH HELICITY VALUES AROUND 400-500 M2/S2 HOWEVER...INSTABILITY 
APPEARS TO BE SOMEWHAT LIMITED. STILL BELIEVE CONVECTION WILL 
DEVELOP ALONG A SQUALL LINE DURING THE EVENING HOURS WHICH SHOULD 
MAKE PROGRESS THROUGH MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 07Z FRIDAY. 
TRAILING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE ACROSS THE HIGH TERRAIN ALONG 
THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER BY 12Z BRINGING AN END TO THE RAIN. 
CERTAINLY ENOUGH WIND ENERGY WILL BE PRESENT ALONG THE CONVECTIVE 
LINE TO PRODUCE DAMAGING WIND AND HAIL. CANNOT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED 
TORNADO AS WELL WITH SUCH HIGH HELICITY VALUES.

WENT AHEAD AND STAYED CLOSE TO IF NOT A DEGREE ABOVE THE WARMEST 
GUIDANCE TEMPS TODAY WITH AMAZINGLY MILD MAX TEMPS IN THE UPPER 60S 
AND LOWER 70S MOST AREAS. WENT CLOSER TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MINS 
TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE ALONG THE 
APPALACHIANS BY 12Z FRIDAY. WITH A +150 KT 300 MB JET AND STRONG 500 
MB COOLING WITH THE TROUGH PASSAGE...SCATTERED TO ISOLATED SHOWERS 
WILL PERSIST IN NORTHERN AREAS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. COLD 
ADVECTION WILL ALLOW FOR A CHANGE TO SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT...AND A +30 
KT NW FLOW AT 850 MB WILL PROVIDE SOME UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT. HOWEVER 
MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED SO ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT 
AND MAINLY IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SURFACE WINDS WILL BE CLOSE TO WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA ON FRIDAY.

A BUILDING RIDGE WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER AND WARMING TEMPS THROUGH 
MONDAY. A SOUTHERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS ON TUESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE 
DEEPENS OVER THE PLAINS. GFS AND ECMWF GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT THAT 
THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL 
HAVE CHANCE POPS IN THAT TIME FRAME. WILL HAVE A MENTION OF 
THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE GFS SHOWS A STRONG LLJ DEVELOPING 
AND GOOD ADVECTION OF GULF MOISTURE AHEAD OF A STRONG COLD FRONT. 
TEMPS WILL BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL AGAIN FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST WED FEB 22 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL 
ENHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS EVENING...BUT THESE SHOULD 
DIMINISH TO JUST SHOWERS AND WILL EXIT AFTER MIDNIGHT.  WILL CARRY 
LIKELY POPS ALL ZONES TONIGHT.  STILL SOME THREAT OF SEVERE LATER 
THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING MAINLY SOUTHERN HALF WHERE BETTER 
DESTABILIZATION HAS OCCURRED NEAR AND SOUTH OF THE WARM FRONT.  
TOMORROW CLOUDS SHOULD BREAK AND ALLOW FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY 
AFTERNOON.  TEMPS THURSDAY WILL BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL...AND WINDS 
WILL BE GUSTY FROM THE SOUTHWEST.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME TWEAKS MAINLY TO RAISE SOME LOWS 
TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AFTER A WARM AND
BREEZY THURSDAY A DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY WILL KEEP STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA
THURSDAY NIGHT. A STRONG SHORT WAVE MOVING INTO THE MID MS VALLEY
WILL ENHANCE MOISTURE TRANSPORT AND LIFT AND WITH STRONG WINDS
ALOFT AND HIGH SHEAR A SQUALL LINE IS POSSIBLE LATE IN THE EVENING
AND EARLY MORNING FRIDAY. THE ENVIRONMENT IS ALSO FAVORABLE FOR
ISOLATED SUPERCELLS JUST AHEAD OF THE SQUALL LINE WITH LARGE HAIL AND
A FEW TORNADOES POSSIBLE. THE STRONG WINDS MAY REQUIRE A WIND
ADVISORY FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY. FRIDAY SHOWERS LINGER AND
TEMPERATURES ARE MUCH COOLER BEHIND FRONT. ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL
DISTURBANCE WITHIN THE UPPER TROUGH BEHIND THE COLD FRONT FRIDAY
NIGHT WILL BRING SOME SNOW SHOWERS TO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA. AT THIS TIME AMOUNTS LOOK TO BE ABOUT AN INCH OR
LESS FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING. LOWS FRIDAY NIGHT WILL
BE NEAR FREEZING CENTRAL AND SOUTH AND A FEW DEGREES BELOW FREEZING
NORTH AND MOUNTAINS. HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS IN SATURDAY AFTERNOON
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. FOR THE PERIOD MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
ECMWF AND CANADIAN BRINGS SYSTEM IN MONDAY AND TUESDAY. GFS KEEPS
HIGH PRESSURE OVER FORECAST AREA FOR THE FIRST OF THE WEEK WITH
MAIN SYSTEM WEDNESDAY. WILL FOLLOW CLOSER TO ECMWF AND GRADUALLY
INCREASE POPS WITH UNSETTLED PATTERN MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

299 
FXUS64 KMRX 220933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST WED FEB 22 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE MODELS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK 
WITH EXPECTED WEATHER ACROSS THE MID SOUTH TODAY AS CONVECTION 
FIRING OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS EARLY THIS MORNING IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
AN INITIAL SHORT WAVE FEATURE THAT WILL BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AROUND MID DAY INTO THE AFTERNOON. A SECOND IMPULSE 
WILL DROP SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE UPPER MIDWEST TO AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA LATE IN THE DAY AND DURING THE EVENING. UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE 
WILL INCREASE AS 90 KT JET STREAKS ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. THE LOW 
LEVEL JET WILL ALSO BE STRENGTHENING THIS MORNING PULLING WARM AND 
MOIST AIR NORTH. AS COLD AIR ALOFT STREAMS IN WITH THE UPPER LEVEL 
WAVE THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD DESTABILIZE SUFFICIENTLY FOR CONVECTION. 
MODEL CAPES NOT TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE AROUND 150 TO 250 J/KG BUT SHEAR 
SHOULD COMPENSATE WITH AVERAGE 0-6 KM AVERAGE WIND AROUND 50 KTS. 
SEVERE CONVECTION POSSIBLE AS THE STRONG FLOW IS TAPPED. SRH WILL BE 
RATHER SIGNIFICANT AS WELL WITH VALUES AROUND 300 TO 400 M2/S2. 
FREEZING LEVEL SHOULD BE LOW ENOUGH FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF LARGE 
HAIL IN SOME OF THE STRONGER STORMS. MUCH OF THE CONVECTION WILL 
SHIFT EAST WHILE WEAKENING LATE THIS EVENING. WENT WITH THE WARMER 
MAV MOS FOR MAXES TODAY WHILE OPTING FOR THE MILDER MET MIN GUIDANCE 
TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ON THURSDAY A SURFACE LOW 
WILL DEVELOP NEAR THE OZARKS AS A UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTHWARD ACROSS 
THE PLAINS AND A STRONG UPPER JET DEVELOPS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. IN 
RESPONSE...SURFACE WINDS IN THE TN VALELY BACK TO A SOUTHERLY 
DIRECTION AND STRENGTHEN TO 15-25 MPH THURSDAY AFTERNOON. WARM 
ADVECTION WILL RAISE TEMPS INTO THE UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S IN MUCH 
OF THE AREA. A CAPPING INVERSION SHOULD HOLD BACK CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY THURSDAY AFTERNOON...BUT THE POTENTIAL EXISTS FOR A 
SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER EVENT THURSDAY NIGHT ONCE THE CAP IS 
BROKEN. MESOSCALE LIFT MAXIMIZES OVER THE AREA BETWEEN 03-09Z A 
FRONTOGENESIS ZONE COINCIDES WITH A 150 KT JET AT 300 MB ACROSS ERN 
KY. DRY AIR ALOFT ORIGINATING FROM THE DESERT SW WILL PROVIDE AN 
ELEVATED MIXED LAYER AND STEEP LAPSE RATES. THE TRACK OF THE SURFACE 
LOW ACROSS KY WILL BACK SURFACE WINDS...RESULTING IN HIGH 0-1 KM 
HELICITY AND GREATER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FLUX CONVERGENCE. MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY WILL BE A LIMITING FACTOR. DAMAGING WINDS APPEAR TO BE 
THE MAIN THREAT...BUT TORNADOES WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE GIVEN THE 
STRONGLY SHEARED ENVIRONMENT. GIVEN THE THREAT WILL COME AT NIGHT 
AND WE ARE IN A TIME OF YEAR WHEN SEVERE WEATHER AWARENESS IS 
TYPICALLY LOW...WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO HEIGHTEN AWARENESS.

A BROAD 500 MB TROUGH WILL PUSH ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY AND FRIDAY 
NIGHT...WITH COLD TEMPS ALOFT KEEPING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
GOING...MAINLY IN NORTHERN AREAS. A CHANCE TO SNOW MAY BE POSSIBLE 
NORTH BEFORE ENDING EARLY SATURDAY MORNING...WITH SOME UPSLOPE 
ENHANCEMENT FROM A 30 KT NW 850 MB FLOW. LIMITED MOISTURE SHOULD 
MEAN ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 

WITH A RIDGE SHIFTING TO THE ATLANTIC COASTLINE...A RETURN FLOW OF 
GULF MOISTURE DEVELOPS SUNDAY NIGHT. GFS AND ECMWF HAVE SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES...BUT GENERALLY FOCUS ON MONDAY FOR THE PERIOD OF BEST 
MOISTURE AND LIFT. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS MONDAY...FOLLOWED BY A 
FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH COOLER/DRIER AIR ON TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  48  71  50  56 /  60  40  10  70  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  50  71  47  56 /  60  40  10  70  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
700 PM EST TUE FEB 21 2012

.DISCUSSION...WINDS HAVE LOWERED AND WIND ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED.
ADJUSTED DEW POINT TEMPS DOWNWARD AS DRY AIR BUILDS IN FROM THE SW 
OVERNIGHT. OVERNIGHT LOWS APPEAR ON TRACK. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM  (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WILL BE BRIEFLY BETWEEN 
WEATHER SYSTEMS TONIGHT FOR MAINLY CLEAR SKIES...DECREASING WINDS 
AND SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.  THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES IN ON WEDNESDAY.  
THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE A BIT STRONGER THAN TUESDAY/S FRONTAL 
PASSAGE AND SHOULD SPREAD SCATTERED SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE A STRAY 
THUNDERSTORM ACROSS THE MRX CWA FOR THE AFTERNOON.  ADDITIONALLY... 
WILL SEE WINDS INCREASE ONCE AGAIN FOR BREEZY AND LOCALLY GUSTY 
WINDS.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS AGREE SOMEWHAT 
IN THE EARLY PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY EVENING...THEN PERHAPS A BETTER CHANCE 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. ELEVATED INSTABILITY IS INDICATED 
WEDNESDAY EVENING...THEN BETTER MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH SURFACE BASED 
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT LATE THURSDAY. MODELS DO DIVERGE 
SLIGHTLY WITH TIMING OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...AND I TRENDED TOWARD 
AN EARLIER FRONTAL PASSAGE. THIS KEPT MY HIGHEST POPS IN FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT WITH POPS LINGERING INTO FRIDAY...BUT MAINLY ACROSS 
NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA (ESPECIALLY HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA 
AND NE TN) WHERE SHORTWAVE ENERGY FROM THE DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH 
PASSES. 

THERE IS GOOD CONSISTENCY IN AN UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE KEEPING A 
DRY FORECAST IN ORDER FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...SO LITTLE TO NO 
CHANGES FOR THOSE PERIODS. SIGNIFICANT TIMING DIFFERENCES LINGER 
BETWEEN THE LATEST ECMWF AND GFS MODEL RUNS FOR COLD FRONT EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...WITH CANADIAN MODEL SLOWER THAN GFS IN LINE WITH ECMWF. 
HPC SEEMS TO BE MORE OF A BLEND AND REASONABLE. THUS...I DECREASED 
CLOUDINESS ON MONDAY WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS...LEADING INTO 
CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY. STILL TOO FAR OUT TO BE VERY CONFIDENT JUST 
YET. OTHERWISE...GFSX MOS WAS CONSISTENT FROM 12Z NUMBERS AND 
GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

659 
FXUS64 KMRX 210832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 AM EST TUE FEB 21 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
OVERALL FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS LOW THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS MODELS 
APPEAR TO BE HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME IN HANDLING A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW 
WITH WEAK SHORTWAVES. FOR TODAY...A BAND OF SHOWERS IN WEST TN 
ASSOCIATED WITH A ZONE OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE CONVERGENCE AND 500 MB 
VORT MAX IS QUICKLY MOVING EAST...BUT IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN 
SUBSTANTIALLY BEFORE IT REACHES THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU DUE TO THE 
VORT MAX LIFTING NE AND ENCOUNTERING A DRY AIR MASS OVER THE GREAT 
TN VALLEY. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE WESTERN HALF THIS 
MORNING WITH A CHANCE ON THE NW FRINGES. IT WILL BE BREEZY TODAY 
WITH A 15-25 MPH SW WIND...BUT MOST SPOTS SHOULD STAY BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA. 

BETTER PRECIP CHANCES COME WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AS THE FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMES SLIGHTLY MORE AMPLIFIED...ALLOWING POSITIVE THETA-E 
ADVECTION AT 850 MB. THE NAM SHOWS SOME WEAK INSTABILITY TO HELP 
GENERATE SOME SHOWERS IN THE AFTERNOON. WITH THE VERY PROGRESSIVE 
FLOW...WILL CONFINE THE CHANCE POPS TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. THE NAM IS FASTER TO BRING SHOWERS INTO THE AREA THAN THE
GFS...WITH GREATER INSTABILITY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. FOR NOW WILL
HAVE CHANCE POPS IN THE AFTERNOON...ALONG WITH A CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPS WILL BE VERY WARM WITH A STRONG SW LOW LEVEL
FLOW...WITH HIGHS REACHING THE LOWER 70S IN MANY VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...ALTHOUGH MODEL 
SOLUTIONS NOT TOO DISSIMILAR STAYED CLOSER TO THE GFS/CANADIAN ON 
FRIDAY WHILE OPTING FOR A MODEL BLEND SATURDAY. STARTED THE LONG 
TERM OUT WITH LIKELY POPS AS THERE SEEMED TO BE MODEL CONSENSUS 
CONCERNING AN AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH DROPPING THE FROM THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS/WESTERN LAKES THURSDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS 
LATER FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY MORNING. AT THE SURFACE...LOW PRESSURE 
DRIVES ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST DRAGGING A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT. SOME INSTABILITY NOTED AND BLENDED A 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION INTO WESTERN SECTIONS THURSDAY EVENING. QUITE A 
BIT OF UPPER LEVEL ENERGY TRAILS THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROUGH 
FOR FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT SO MAINTAINED THE MEDIUM CHANCE POPS 
FOR SHOWERS ON FRIDAY WITH STRENGTHENING COLD AIR ADVECTION AND 
NORTHWESTERLY COMPONENT TO THE LOW LEVEL FLOW LEADING TO THE 
POSSIBILITY OF OF OROGRAPHIC SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MOST OF THE HIGH ELEVATION REGION ALONG 
THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. PRECIP WRAPS UP BY SATURDAY MORNING WITH 
A NICE WEEKEND BREAK IN THE ACTION AS RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND 
ALOFT ALLOW FOR INCREASING SUNSHINE FROM SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AND 
REBOUNDING TEMPERATURES. NEXT SYSTEM MAY NOT IMPACT THE REGION UNTIL 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. MODELS NOT IN AGREEMENT WITH THE GFS 
QUITE A BIT FASTER THAN THE ECMWF WITH A SHORT WAVE BUILDING ACROSS 
THE EASTERN U.S. STAYED CLOSER TO THE SLOWER EUROPEAN MODEL. 
HOWEVER...DUE TO UNCERTAINTY JUST APPLIED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS FOR THIS LATE PERIOD SYSTEM. 

WENT A LITTLE BELOW MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS WITH POST 
FRONTAL PRECIP ON FRIDAY. ALSO ADJUSTED MINS LOWER FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF DECENT RADIATION IN DRY 
ATMOSPHERE...CALM WIND ENVIRONMENT. OF COURSE HAD TO ADJUST THE 
MAX/MIN FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT DUE TO EXPECTED SLOWER 
PROGRESSION OF EARLY WEEK SYSTEM.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EST MON FEB 20 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL 
TONIGHT FOR MAINLY CLEAR SKIES AND BENIGN WEATHER.  A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL SLIDE THROUGH ON TUESDAY...ASSOCIATED MOISTURE AND 
ENERGY VERY MINIMAL AND EXPECTED A FEW MID TO HIGH CLOUDS MOVING 
THROUGH WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF.  HOWEVER...A TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL INCREASE WINDS 
ACROSS THE REGION.  WIND WILL BECOME QUITE BREEZY AND GUSTY 
ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP BELOW 
ADVISORY CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT AND 
MINOR IMPULSES IN A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...WILL BRING SLIGHT 
CHANCES FOR RAIN THROUGH THURSDAY. HOWEVER...BEST RAIN CHANCES 
SHOULD BE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WHEN A MORE AMPLIFIED 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. 
MILD TEMPS FOR THE REGION UNTIL LATE FRIDAY WHEN AIRMASS COOLS 
ENOUGH TO MENTION RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS...BUT MAINLY FOR NRN PLATEAU 
NE TN AND SW VA. I GENERALLY FOUND GFS/NAM/ECMWF/SREF IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT ON THE WEATHER PATTERN INTO THE WEEKEND...AND KEEPING 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY DRY SEEMED PRUDENT FOR NOW. 

FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...MODELS OFFER MINOR DIFFERENCES WITH SW 
LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPING WHILE HEIGHTS RISE ALOFT. I OPTED TO ONLY 
PUT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN ON MONDAY THEN VERY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
MONDAY NIGHT. GFSX 00Z MOS TO 12Z MOS VARIED SLIGHTLY BUT TEMPS WERE 
REASONABLE AND CLOSE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. GFSX OFFERING A FEW 
70S ON THURSDAY WHICH WOULD BE NICE.

634 
FXUS64 KMRX 200902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EST MON FEB 20 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)... 
MOISTURE TRAPPED BELOW A STRONG INVERSION AND WEST OF THE
MOUNTAINS IS KEEPING CLOUDY SKIES IN PLACE EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT
SHOULD ERODE QUICKLY WITH BOUNDARY LAYER MIXING AFTER SUNRISE. WITH
CLEARING SKIES IN THE WESTERN SECTIONS...TEMPS ARE FALLING INTO THE
20S...WHICH COULD CRATE SOME BLACK ICE PROBLEMS AND SLICK ROADS.
WILL CONTINUE TO COVER THIS WITH AN SPS.

HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE SURFACE TO THE UPPER LEVELS WILL BE BUILDING 
OVER THE AREA TODAY. CLEAR SKIES BY AFTERNOON WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO 
RISE INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S IN MOST SPOTS. THE RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS TO OUR EAST TONIGHT...WITH A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW AND 
WARM ADVECTION DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT IN RESPONSE TO A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING ACROSS THE PLAINS. SOME MID TO HIGH CLOUDS 
WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE FROM THE WEST AS THE UPPER JET NOSES INTO THE 
TN VALLEY LATE TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK FRONT TRACKS THROUGH
THE AREA ON TUESDAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED WILL KEEP
LOW CHANCES FOR TUESDAY. A FRONT AND AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVES
ACROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE
CHANCE POPS GOING. THE SYSTEM EXITS ON THURSDAY. ANOTHER FRONT IS
EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY
BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF RAIN. UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS ON FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WITH THE COOLER AIRMASS BEHIND THE FRONT...MAY
SEE SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. BUT MOST
AREAS SHOULD DRY ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. HIGH PRESSURE
RETURNS PROVIDING DRY WEATHER ON SUNDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST SUN FEB 19 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED ALONG THE GEORGIA 
COAST NEAR SAVANNAH...WITH WARM TEMPS IN THE 40S EXTENDING NORTH OF 
THIS LOW ALONG AN INVERTED TROUGH UP INTO THE GREAT TN VALLEY. 
LATEST OBS INDICATE THAT RAIN HAS CHANGED OVER TO SNOW ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA...WITH 
REPORTS OF TWO INCHES OF SNOW IN WISE COUNTY AND TWO TO FIVE INCHES 
ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NEAR JELLICO. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE 
WINTER STORM WARNING THIS EVENING...SINCE THE WESTERN EDGE OF THIS 
PRECIP IS BACK IN MIDDLE TN AND WILL CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
FOR SEVERAL MORE HOURS. THE RAIN IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS SHOULD 
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW BY SUNSET AND THEREAFTER...BUT ANY ACCUMULATIONS 
SHOULD BE LIGHT DUE TO WARM GROUND AND NEAR-SURFACE TEMPS. THE MAIN 
CONCERN FOR TONIGHT IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS WILL BE THE SUB- 
FREEZING TEMPS EXPECTED AFTER MIDNIGHT...WHICH MAY CAUSE SOME AREAS 
OF BLACK ICE.

ON MONDAY...A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION...WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY...WITH MODELS INDICATING LIMITED 
MOISTURE ALONG IT...BUT POSSIBLY ENOUGH FOR SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS. A 
BROAD SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS HIGH SHOULD KEEP 
TEMPS ABOVE NORMAL ON TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM 
AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL BE IN AN OVERALL 
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED AS A SERIES OF WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARIES MOVES THOUGH THE REGION. CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING 
AND DETAILS FOR THE SYSTEMS...BUT GENERALLY EXPECTED ONE AROUND THE 
WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME...AND ANOTHER THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY. THROUGH THIS PART OF THE EXTENDED...TEMPERATURES REMAIN 
WARM ENOUGH FOR MAINLY RAIN. COLDER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND FRIDAY/S 
SYSTEM. A THIRD FRONT MOVES THROUGH AROUND SATURDAY. THIS SYSTEM 
LOOKS QUITE DRY AND WEAK...AND FOR NOW...WILL KEEP LOW POPS CONFINED 
TO FAR NORTH AND EAST...THOUGH COULD SEE A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW OVER 
THESE AREAS IS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EST SUN FEB 19 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER 
CENTRAL GA...WITH RAIN BEING REPORTED IN THE FORECAST AREA AS TEMPS 
LINGER IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. INFRARED SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALS COLDER CLOUD TOPS OVER MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY ASSOCIATED 
WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH...WHICH WAS SLOWLY MOVING EAST-NORTHEAST 
TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA. DUAL POL RADAR INDICATES THAT THE 
FREEZING LEVEL IS BETWEEN 3500 AND 4000 FT MSL THIS MORNING...BUT 
THIS FREEZING LEVEL WILL LIKELY DESCEND SOME MORE BY THIS AFTERNOON 
AS THE UPPER TROUGH AND FRONTOGENETICAL FORCING INCREASES PRECIP 
RATES AND INDUCES SOME DYNAMICAL COOLING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND MOUNTAIN RANGE. THUS...EXPECT THIS MORNING 
RAIN TO CHANGE OVER TO SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH THE CHANGE OVER OCCURRING LATER IN THE VALLEYS 
(TOWARDS SUNSET AND THEREAFTER) AS THE MOISTURE BEGINS TO EXIT THE 
REGION.

CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE MOST PART...BUT WILL 
PLAN TO UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING WORDING...AND TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

446 
FXUS64 KMRX 190830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST SUN FEB 19 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)... 
RADAR SHOWS RAIN BEGINNING TO BLOSSOM ACROSS MIDDLE TN. SATELLITE
SHOWS THE HEAD OF THE COMMA CLOUD DEVELOPING OVER AR AS THE LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM INTENSIFIES AND OCCLUDES. THE 700 MB DEFORMATION
ZONE ASSOCIATED WITH THE COMMA HEAD WILL BE TRACKING DIRECTLY OVER
OUR AREA TODAY. FRONTOGENETIC FORCING WILL PROVIDE LIFT FOR
PRECIP...WHICH MAY BE MODERATE TO HEAVY AT TIMES.

THE TRICKY PART OF THE FORECAST WILL BE TEMPERATURES...AND THIS WILL 
MAKE ALL THE DIFFERENCE IN REGARD TO SNOW AMOUNTS. WE ARE STARTING 
THE DAY QUITE WARM IN THE MID 40S TO AROUND 50 AT THE MOMENT. WITH 
THE FRONTOGENESIS ZONE DIRECTLY ACROSS THE AREA AND EVAPORATIVE 
COOLING...TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO DROP ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS THIS 
MORNING. THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS MAY BEGIN TO SEE A SNOW/RAIN MIX AS 
EARLY AS 12Z...ALTHOUGH EARLY ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIMITED AS 
SURFACE TEMPS WILL REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING THIS MORNING. THE CHANGE TO 
SNOW WILL ALSO BE DEPENDENT ON DYNAMIC COOLING DUE TO PRECIP 
RATES...ADDING ANOTHER DIMENSION OF DIFFICULTY TO THE FORECAST. WITH 
SUCH MARGINAL TEMPERATURE EVENTS...THERE IS OFTEN A PERIOD OF SLEET 
DURING THE RAIN-SNOW TRANSITION...AND WILL MENTION A CHANCE OF IP 
WITH CATEGORICAL RAIN AND SNOW. FALLING TEMPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON 
WILL LOWER THE FREEZING LEVEL AND BRING THE RAIN/SNOW LINE SOUTHWARD 
INTO THE VALLEY. BY 00Z MOST PRECIP SHOULD BE SNOW AS FAR SOUTH AS 
KNOXVILLE...BUT MIDLEVEL DRYING WILL END MOST PRECIP FROM MIDNIGHT 
TO VERY EARLY MORNING FROM SW TO NE. 

AGAIN...SNOW AMOUNTS WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON THE HEIGHT OF THE 
FREEZING LEVEL AND PRECIP RATES...SO UNCERTAINTY IS HIGH AND 
ACCUMULATION RANGES WILL BE LARGE DEPENDING ON ELEVATION. HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS THAT SEE SNOW BEGIN DURING THE MORNING WILL HAVE THE 
HIGHEST AMOUNTS...WITH A RAIN/SNOW/CHANCE SLEET MIX LIMITING 
ACCUMULATIONS IN LOWER ELEVATIONS UNTIL THE AFTERNOON OR EVENING. 
THE WINTER STORM WARNING FOR SW VA AND NE TN WILL REMAIN AS IS WITH 
2-6 INCHES EXPECTED IN THOSE AREAS...LOCALLY UP TO 8 IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. THE NORTHERN PLATEAU WILL BE RAISED TO A WARNING...WITH 
2 TO 5 INCHES EXPECTED. THE SMOKIES WILL BE ADDED TO THE 
WARNING...MAINLY ABOVE 3000 FT...WITH AMOUNTS OF 2-5 INCHES. AN SPS 
WILL BE ISSUED FOR THE TN VALLEY TO MENTION UNDER 2 INCHES IN THE 
TRI-CITIES AREA...AND LESS THAN 1 INCH AROUND KNOXVILLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY. A WEAK FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE
AREA ON TUESDAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL
CONTINUE A DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY. A FRONT AND AREA OF LOW
PRESSURE MOVES ACROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL
CONTINUE THE CHANCE POPS GOING. THE SYSTEM EXITS ON THURSDAY.
ANOTHER FRONT IS EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT
AND FRIDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY IN STRENGTH AND TIMING...WILL
ADD ONLY LOW CHANCES FOR NOW. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

760 
FXUS64 KMRX 182011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST SAT FEB 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE UPPER TEXAS COAST. 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS AND LIGHT RAIN 
OVER THE DEEP SOUTH MOVING NORTHEASTWARD TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA 
AHEAD OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. IT APPEARS THAT THE CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY ALONG THE NORTHERN GULF COAST WILL CUT-OFF A SIGNIFICANT 
AMOUNT OF GULF MOISTURE FEEDING INTO OUR AREA. THUS...WHILE POPS 
WILL BE HIGH TONIGHT FOR MEASURABLE RAINFALL...QPF AMOUNTS SHOULD BE 
FAIRLY LIGHT UNTIL LATER TONIGHT TOWARDS SUNRISE AS THIS LOW MOVES 
ACROSS CENTRAL ALABAMA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH PRODUCING 
STRONG LIFT OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS ON 
SUNDAY...AS UPPER-LEVEL DIVERGENCE INCREASES IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE 
REGION OF A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL JET AND FRONTOGENETICAL FORCING 
STRENGTHENS OVER THE CUMBERLAND RANGE. WHILE IT APPEARS THAT THE 
VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW OVER SOUTHWEST VA 
(ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS)...THE NAM AND GFS MODELS 
REVEAL SOME SIGNIFICANT DISCREPANCIES WITH THE VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE 
OVER THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...THE NAM MODEL PROFILE 
IS QUITE A BIT WARMER...ESPECIALLY AT THE 800 MB LAYER...WHICH WOULD 
RESULT IN THE POSSIBILITY OF SLEET BEFORE CHANGING OVER TO SNOW. 
WITH MODERATE TO OCCASIONALLY HIGH PRECIP RATES EXPECTED OVER THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...THINK THAT SOME DYNAMICALLY COOLING COULD CAUSE 
THE RAIN TO CHANGE TO SNOW QUICKER THAN THE MODELS WOULD CURRENTLY 
SUGGEST. THIS QUICKER CHANGE OVER COULD RESULT IN WARNING-LEVEL 
SNOWFALL AMOUNTS OVER THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. SINCE THIS 
SCENARIO IS STILL UNCERTAIN...WILL CONTINUE WITH THE WINTER STORM 
WATCH FOR THE PLATEAU...BUT WILL UPGRADE TO A WARNING ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS AND START IT EARLIER (AT 
12Z). IN THE VALLEYS...WARM GROUND TEMPS FROM THE RECENT WARM 
WEATHER SHOULD COMBINE WITH AFTERNOON SURFACE TEMPS LINGERING IN THE 
UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S TO CREATE A HOSTILE ENVIRONMENT FOR ANY 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING AS THE MOISTURE EXITS 
THE REGION. THUS...THINK THAT ANY SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE 
GREAT TN VALLEY SHOULD BE LIGHT BELOW 2500 FEET MSL. AS FOR THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WILL GENERALLY CONTINUE WITH THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST'S SNOWFALL AMOUNTS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE HIGH MOVING 
AWAY WILL KEEP THINGS DRY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WILL MOVE INTO 
AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AS A SERIES 
OF WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARIES AND SHORT WAVES SLIDES THROUGH.  MOISTURE 
AND LIFT LIMITED AND WILL KEEP POPS GENERALLY AROUND 20 TO 30.  HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR SATURDAY.
&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS

TO HIGH-LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE DEEP SOUTH MOVING NORTHEASTWARD AHEAD 
OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY SPREAD 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AS THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
SLOWLY MOVES EASTWARD INTO THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY TOWARDS SUNSET. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THE RAIN 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT SOUTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST NC TOWARDS SUNSET...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF RAIN FOR LATE THIS AFTERNOON IN THESE AREAS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING WORDING...AND TO TWEAK 
TEMPS AND SKY CONDITIONS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

837 
FXUS64 KMRX 180842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 AM EST SAT FEB 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
LOW PRESSURE WILL DEVELOP OVER TX AND INTENSIFY AS IT TRACKS EAST 
INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY THROUGH TODAY. MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL BE 
VARIABLE TODAY...MAKING FOR A TRICKY TEMPERATURE FORECAST. WILL STAY 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S IN MOST 
SPOTS. 

CONVECTION NOW OVER TX IS EXPECTED TO EXPAND INTO MS/AL/GA THIS 
AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING. WITH AN EAST-WEST ORIENTED BOUNDARY 
ACROSS THAT AREA...CONVECTION TO OUR SOUTH WILL LIKELY CUT OFF A 
SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF GULF MOISTURE FEEDING INTO OUR AREA. POP AND 
QPF WILL BE CUT BACK SIGNIFICANTLY TODAY AND TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR 
THIS. STILL...WE SHOULD SEE CATEGORICAL POPS WITH LIGHT PRECIP 
SPREADING INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS EVENING AS 500 MB 
VORTICITY ADVECTION INCREASES AND UPPER DIVERGENCE INCREASES IN THE 
ENTRANCE REGION OF A STRONG UPPER JET.

PRECIP INTENSITY WILL INCREASE AFTER 12Z SUNDAY AS THE 700 MB LOW 
TRACKS DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS SHOW A 850-700 
MB FRONTOGENESIS ZONE SETTING UP ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU TO SW 
VA ON SUNDAY. THE RESULTING AGEOSTROPHIC CIRCULATION WILL PROVIDE 
GOOD LIFT IN THIS AREA BETWEEN 15Z AND 21Z. WEAK COLD ADVECTION WILL 
BE REINFORCED BY MODERATE TO OCCASIONALLY HIGH PRECIP RATES...WITH A 
CHANGE TO SNOW FROM NORTH TO SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY. THE NAM 
CONTINUES TO COOL THE COLUMN FASTER AND PRODUCES MORE SNOW THAN THE 
GFS. WHILE THE NAM APPEARS MORE REALISTIC...WILL NOT QUITE GO 
WHOLE-HOG WITH ITS SNOW AMOUNTS. BUT THE WATCH AREA WILL BE EXPANDED 
TO INCLUDE THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...ALL OF SW VA...AND THE NE TN 
MOUNTAINS. 2 TO 6 INCHES ARE EXPECTED IN THE WATCH AREA...WITH LOCAL 
AMOUNTS UP TO 8 POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA. FROM 
KNOXVILLE TO TRI-CITIES...A DUSTING TO 2 INCHES IS EXPECTED AT THIS 
TIME...BUT COULD BE HIGHER IF THE FASTER COOLING OF THE NAM PANS 
OUT. MIDLEVEL DRYING AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY WILL BRING AN END TO 
ALL POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY. A WEAK FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA ON TUESDAY. WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL CONTINUE A 
DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY.  A STRONGER FRONT AND AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
MOVES ACROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE 
CHANCE POPS GOING. THE SYSTEM EXITS ON THURSDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER FRONT 
IS EXPECTED TO TRACK THE REGION ON FRIDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY IN 
TIMING...WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY. 

&&

FOR THE REST OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHERN SECTIONS OF TENNESSEE.

DEAL OF MID-LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA.

HAVE A GOOD NIGHT...

035 
FXUS64 KMRX 172000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST FRI FEB 17 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...FAIR WEATHER THIS 
EVENING...THOUGH HIGH PRESSURE WILL LOSE ITS HOLD AND WILL GIVE WAY 
TO APPROACHING MESSY GULF COAST WEATHER SYSTEM DURING SATURDAY. 
EXPECTING PRECIP TO HOLD OFF THROUGH NOON...THEN LIGHT RAIN WILL 
BEGIN AND SPREAD NORTHEASTWARD FROM CHATTANOOGA TO I-40 CORRIDOR 
DURING THE AFTERNOON. WILL KEEP POPS OUT OF VA ZONES FOR DAYTIME 
SATURDAY...BUT SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BE QUITE WET ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA AS THE LONG TERM DISCN BELOW DESCRIBES.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVING THROUGH EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  INITIAL ROUND AHEAD OF A COLD 
FRONT/SURFACE LOW WILL GENERATE WIDESPREAD RAIN ACROSS THE AREA INTO 
SATURDAY NIGHT.  COLD AIR ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN 
TO FILTER IN LATE SATURDAY NIGHT OR EARLY SUNDAY MORNING.  THIS WILL 
ALLOW RAIN TO MIX WITH OR CHANCE TO SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA.  THERE REMAINS QUESTION ON SPEED OF 850MB COLD 
TEMPS AS WELL AS SURFACE TEMPERATURES...AND SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN.  FOR NOW...WILL TAKE MIDDLE ROAD AND EXPECTED 
A COUPLE OF INCHES OF ACCUMULATIONS MAINLY OF SW VA...HIGHER AMOUNT 
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND PORTIONS OF THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS.  
LESSER AMOUNTS...ALONG THE NORTHERN VALLEY.  THE SYSTEM SHOULD PULL 
OUT SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY.  WILL MOVE INTO AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  CONFIDENCE LOW ON DETAILS WITH A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY AND THEN A SHORT WAVE TO OUR NORTH MOVING THROUGH EFFECTING 
AREA WEATHER.  WILL HAVE BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY...LOWER POPS FOR THURSDAY AND DRY FRIDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

SURFACE LOW WILL TRACK ACROSS THE REGION ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

BE SATURDAY NIGHT. COOLER AIR MOVING ON SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY

PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. COLD
FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE
POPS GOING. WEAK SHORTWAVE FOLLOWS ON THURSDAY...SO KEPT THE LOW
POPS GOING.

FXUS64 KMRX 162023
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 PM EST THU FEB 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...THE WEAK COLD FRONT IS NOW 
WASHING THROUGH THE AREA.  IT IS A SLOW DRY-OUT IN THE WAKE OF THIS 
FRONT AS DEW POINTS IN THE 40S EXIST UPSTREAM BACK TO THE OHIO 
RIVER.  WITH THIS HUMID AIR RISING UP IN THE MOUNTAINS...AM GOING 
WITH FOG/DRIZZLE FOR THE E TN MOUNTAINS THIS EVENING...BUT THE 
SUBSIDING AIR MASS WILL LIKELY CONTINUE TO SLOWLY DRY OUT...SO WILL 
NOT CARRY THESE ALL NIGHT IN THE MOUNTAINS.

THE AIR SHOULD EVENTUALLY BE DRYING OUT...AS TRAJECTORY FORECASTS 
FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON SHOW THE LOW LEVEL AIR AS COMING FROM THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS WHERE THE CURRENT DEW POINTS ARE IN THE 20S.  THE AIR 
WILL LIKELY MODIFY SOME ON ITS WAY HERE...BUT DEWPOINTS SHOULD BE 
MUCH DRIER FRIDAY.  GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED GOOD OVERALL...WENT 
VERY CLOSE TO THEM.  KEEPING GOOD AMOUNT OF SKY COVER THROUGH THE 
PERIOD AS UPPER CLOUDS FROM NEXT SYSTEM ARE ALREADY STREAMIING 
OVERHEAD.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...INCREASING CLOUDS ON 
FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE MAIN SYSTEM OF THE EXTENDED APPROACHES THE 
AREA.  THIS SYSTEM WILL REACH THE MRX CWA ON SATURDAY...SPREADING 
RAIN SHOWERS FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST.  HAVE INCREASED POPS BY 
LATE AFTERNOON FROM CATEGORICAL SOUTH TO HIGH CHANCE FAR NORTH.  
LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.  AS 
TEMPERATURES DROP...RAIN MAY MIX WITH OR TURN TO SNOW OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS BY SUNRISE SUNDAY.  AS THE LOW PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA 
ON SUNDAY...SHOULD CONTINUE TO SEE SCATTERED WRAP AROUND PRECIP 
SLOWLY END FROM WEST TO EAST.  A FEW UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS MAY LINGER 
OVER THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS SUNDAY EVENING...BUT SURFACE HIGH 
BUILDING IN OVERNIGHT WILL PROVIDE DRY CONDITIONS BY MONDAY 
MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  
THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES IN AROUND WEDNESDAY FOR OUR NEXT CHANCE OF 
PRECIP WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST THU FEB 16 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TODAY ALONG WITH THE ASSOCIATED WEAK 
COLD FRONT. MODELS SHOW STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE AREA THIS 
MORNING AHEAD OF FROPA. AS FRONT MOVES THROUGH TODAY...RAIN WILL 
SLOW END...BUT EXPECT AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE TO CONTINUE INTO 
THE AFTERNOON.

FOR TONIGHT...MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRAPPED WHICH 
WILL KEEP MOST OF THE AREA CLOUDY WITH LIGHT SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. THERE MAY BE SOME DRIZZLE IN THE VALLEY BUT CONFIDENCE 
NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO PUT INTO THE FORECAST.

FOR FRIDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE WILL DOMINATE WITH LOW 
CLOUDINESS ERODING...BUT BEING REPLACED BY INCREASING HIGH/MID LEVEL 
CLOUDS. ANOTHER UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY WILL BE ON TAP.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS SEEM TO BE
SLIGHTLY CLOSER ON THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE OUT OF THE
SRN PLAINS SATURDAY AND TRACK ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES SATURDAY
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. 16/00Z ECMWF IS NOW MUCH CLOSER TO GFS SOLUTION
WHILE NAM IS A BIT SLOWER IN DEVELOPING PRECIPITATION ON SATURDAY...
BUT HAS A SIMILAR TRACK. MODERATE TO STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT PLUS
UPSLOPE SE WINDS WILL CREATE PLENTY OF LIFT...SO I CHOSE TO BUMP
POPS UP TO LIKELY BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS SRN PARTS OF THE
FORECAST AREA. HIGH POPS JUSTIFIED FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...THEN POPS
AND QPF DECREASE ON SUNDAY.

ACTUAL TRACK COULD DRAW COLDER AIR INTO SW VA AND NE TN ON SUNDAY
WITH POTENTIAL FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS. THIS BEARS WATCHING...BUT FOR
NOW I WORDED AS BOTH RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS. MONDAY LOOKS DRY WITH
SEASONAL HIGHS AS A LARGE UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. 

UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ELONGATED SURFACE LOW BRING ANOTHER CHANCE
OF SHOWERS BY TUESDAY NIGHT THRU WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT TOO SOON TO 
GO MORE THAN SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. GFSX MOS TEMPS
WERE GENERALLY CONSISTENT FROM 12Z TO 00Z RUNS...AND WERE FOLLOWED.

FXUS64 KMRX 152011
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST WED FEB 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID 
ATLANTIC STATES...WITH A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. A WARM FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE DEEP SOUTH TONIGHT...AND 
INTO SOUTHEAST TN TOWARDS SUNRISE ON THURSDAY MORNING. SHOWERS AHEAD 
OF THIS WARM FRONT SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT SOUTHEAST TN AFTER 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...AND WILL THEN SPREAD NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE LOCAL AIR MASS WILL REMAIN FAIRLY STABLE 
TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION ONLY 
SHOWERS WITH THIS SYSTEM. WITH THE COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
SYSTEM EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY 18Z...WILL 
MENTION THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN SHOWERS IN THE MORNING WITH ONLY 
SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT DURING THE AFTERNOON. 
CLOUDS SHOULD BE SLOW TO DIMINISH THURSDAY NIGHT...AS A MID-LEVEL 
INVERSION DEVELOPS OVER THE FORECAST AREA IN THE ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR 
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO AN 
EARLY PERIOD ECMWF/BLEND WHICH DEPICTS A MOIST WEEKEND. BOTH THE 
NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN BRANCHES OF THE JET STREAM WILL BE ACTIVE 
DRIVING A SURFACE LOW AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND OFFSHORE FROM 12Z SATURDAY TO 12Z SUNDAY WHILE A 
NORTHWESTERN GULF LOW BUILDS NORTHEAST TO THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC 
COAST DURING THE SAME PERIOD. EDGED PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION UP 
A TAD FOR THIS EVENT AREA WIDE. AIRMASS CHILLS JUST ENOUGH LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING TO ADD A SNOW SHOWER ON THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES. HIGHEST POPS WILL BE SATURDAY NIGHT BUT HAD 
TO EXTEND CHANCE POPS ON SUNDAY WITH SLOW SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM 
EXIT. A NICE RIDGE WILL ALLOW FOR A RETURN TO SUNSHINE ON MONDAY 
WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM ADVANCING THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EARLY 
ON TUESDAY IN TIME TO BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER TO THE AREA 
BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS WARM AND MOIST AIR STREAM NORTH OFF THE 
GULF. ASSOCIATED COLD MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS 
NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT ON TIMING/STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE AT THIS 
TIME RANGE SO KEPT POPS IN A LOW CHANCE CATEGORY.

SIX THOUSAND FEET.

FXUS64 KMRX 150809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 AM EST WED FEB 15 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN THIS 
MORNING IS POTENTIAL OF DENSE FOG. CURRENTLY...ONLY DENSE FOG 
REPORTED IS AT ANDREWS...NC. HOWEVER...LOW LEVEL AIRMASS IS QUITE 
MOIST AND WINDS ARE GENERALLY CALM WITH A WET GROUND. SATELLITE 
SHOWS SOME BREAKS DEVELOPING IN LOW CLOUD DECK WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR 
SOME RADIATIONAL DENSE FOG TO DEVELOP. WILL CONTINUE WITH DENSE FOG 
ADVISORY WITH PATCHY WORDING.

FOG AND LOW CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE THIS MORNING...BUT PLENTY OF HIGH 
AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. NEXT 
SHORT-WAVE AND ASSOCIATED WEAK COLD FRONT/BOUNDARY WILL MOVE ACROSS 
LATE TONIGHT AND THURSDAY. WILL CALL FOR CATEGORICAL POPS FOR 
THURSDAY. INSTABIBILITY NONE EXISTENT...SO ONLY RAIN ANTICIPATED. 
MAIN FORCING WILL COME FROM JET DYNAMICS...FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING 
ALONG BOUNDARY...AND ISENTROPIC LIFT.

SOME WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL PRODUCE LIGHT 
SHOWERS...POSSIBLY MIXED WITH SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT.

FOLLOWED GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES CLOSELY.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS START OUT CONSISTENT 
FOR FRIDAY AS UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL BEHIND THURSDAY SYSTEM. 
SURFACE HIGH SETTLING SOUTHWARD FROM THE OHIO VALLEY WILL BRING WEAK 
COLD AIR ADVECTION...ESPECIALLY TO SW VA AND NE TIP OF TN. THIS MADE 
COOLER NAM MOS HIGHS A BETTER CHOICE FOR SW VA AND NE TN...AND GFS 
OR A BLEND BEST ELSEWHERE.

MODELS THEN START TO DIVERGE ON THE PATTERN FROM SATURDAY INTO 
TUESDAY...BASICALLY WITH SHORTWAVE ENERGY IN THE SRN STREAM COMING 
FROM THE SRN PLAINS. THE ECMWF SEEMS TO BE THE ONLY MODEL TRENDING 
DRIER (KEEPING THE ENERGY MOSTLY TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS GULF COAST 
STATES)...WHILE GFS/SREF/CMC ALL SUPPORT KEEPING POPS IN FOR 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY. OPTED TO WAIT FOR SOME BETTER 
CONTINUITY BEFORE GOING ANYWHERE NEAR LIKELY POPS. I DID INCREASE 
POPS SLIGHTLY TO MESH BETTER WITH NWS NEIGHBORS GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...PATTERN SHOULD TREND BACK TO A BUILDING UPPER RIDGE...AT 
LEAST BRIEFLY FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. KEPT TUESDAY DRY TO START 
AND THEN ADDED LOW POPS FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. 
GFSX MOS TEMPS INCONSISTENT FROM 14/12Z TO 15/00Z RUN...SO MINOR 
TWEAKS JUST AS NEEDED FOR NOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 141955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST TUE FEB 14 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING 
OUT OF THE REGION TONIGHT. WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS. NO WINTER WEATHER IS EXPECTED 
TONIGHT. PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE AREA BEFORE THE 
COOLER TEMPERATURES ARRIVE. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
BE IN DECENT AGREEMENT EARLY ON...BUT BY THE WEEKEND THINGS MORE 
HAZY GIVEN POOR RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY AND LACK OF MODEL AGREEMENT.  

A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH THE REGION LATE WED NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY.  LOOKING MORE LIKE WE MAY BE CAUGHT BETWEEN BETTER 
DYNAMICS TO OUR NORTH AND BETTER MOISTURE TO OUR SOUTH...WITH LESS 
PRECIP OVER OUR AREA.  STILL APPEARS TO WARRANT AT LEAST LIKELY POPS 
WED NIGHT/EARLY THU.  SHOULD BE AN ALL LIQUID PRECIP EVENT AS TEMPS 
WILL BE MILD.  APPEARS THERE IS SOME POTENTIAL FOR MOUNTAIN WAVES 
AND STRONG WINDS IN THE NORMALLY AFFECTED HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS AND 
FOOTHILLS FOR A BRIEF PERIOD WED NIGHT/EARLY THU. LATER SHIFTS MAY 
NEED TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY.  WILL MENTION IN HWO.    

EXPECT DRY WEATHER FRIDAY...THEN THE DETAILS OF THIS WEEKEND LOOK 
VERY UNCERTAIN AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE WELL BELOW AVERAGE.  MODELS 
COMING INTO SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT THAT THERE WILL BE A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING BY TO OUR SOUTH...AND PRECIP APPEARING MORE 
LIKELY AT SOME POINT DURING THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER TIMING AND EXACT 
TRACK STILL QUITE UNCERTAIN. COULD BE SOME POTENTIAL FOR SNOW FOR 
OUR AREA...ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT THIS POTENTIAL VERY 
SENSITIVE TO THE DETAILS WHICH ARE STILL QUITE UNCERTAIN AT THIS 
POINT.  FOR NOW WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS MAINLY SAT NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  
DRY MONDAY AND TUESDAY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 AM EST TUE FEB 14 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NEXT AREA OF PRECIPITATION OVER
MIDDLE TN AND NE AL WILL BE MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS
MORNING. HOWEVER...SURFACE OBSERVATIONS...DUAL POL RADAR PRODUCTS
AND PHONE CALLS MADE REVEAL THE THREAT OF WINTRY MIX HAS DECREASED. 
ENOUGH WARMING HAS OCCURED TO DROP THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR
MARION...SEQUATCHIE...HAMILTON AND BRADLEY COUNTIES WITH THE EARLY
MORNING FORECAST. KEPT THE REST OF THE ADVISORY GOING THROUGH 10 AM
PER COORDINATION WITH FFC AND GSP...ALTHO I DID DOWNPLAY SNOW AND
ICE ACCUMULATIONS. SURFACE TEMPS PROBABLY TOO WARM IN THE ADVISORY
AREA FOR ANY FREEZING RAIN SO WEATHER TYPE CHANGED TO RAIN WITH
SOME SNOW OR SLEET EARLY. MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION ENDS THIS
AFTERNOON...BUT FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY GET
TRAPPED. THIS COULD KEEP THE CLOUDS IN LONGER AND ALSO SUPPORTS
PATCHY DRIZZLE AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS.

UNDERCUT GFS MOS HIGHS FOR TODAY...THEN MINS TONIGHT ARE DEPENDENT
ON HOW MUCH CLOUDS DECREASE...SO I BLENDED BETWEEN THE DIFFERING
NAM AND GFS MOS MINS FOR NOW.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN 
REASONABLE AGREEMENT DURING THE ACTIVE EXTENDED PERIODS. MODELS SHOW 
NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM ENERGY PHASING ACROSS THE PLAIN STATES 
THEN MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY. 
WIDESPREAD RAIN IS ANTICIPATED. LITTLE IF ANY INSTABILITY NOTED WITH 
THE SYSTEM. MAIN LIFT IS FRONT FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING AND ISENTROPIC 
LIFT.

UPPER FLOW REMAIN ZONAL FOR FRIDAY WITH SURFACE RIDGING. ANOTHER 
NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WITH 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY. AT THE 
SAME TIME...A SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVING FROM THE NORTHERN 
MEXICO/TEXAS WILL PRODUCE CYCLO-GENESIS JUST OFF THE SOUTHEAST TEXAS 
COAST SATURDAY. MODELS SHOW THE SURFACE LOW MOVING EAST OR EAST 
NORTHEAST ACROSS FAR SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. FAIRLY STRONG SYNOPTIC FORCING WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE 
WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR A MIXTURE OF RAIN/SNOW OR ALL SNOW. WILL NEED 
TO WATCH THE EXACT PATH OF THE SURFACE LOW AND HOW COLD AIR GETS 
PULLED INTO THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE THE SYSTEM MOVES IN.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MEX MOS EXCEPT FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY 
DUE TO EXPECTED MIXED BAG OF PRECIPITATION.
