FXUS64 KMRX 132007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST MON FEB 13 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA BRINGING A WINTRY MIX TO THE AREA TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL 
KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS FOR AFTER MIDNIGHT. IT SHOULD BEGIN AS RAIN 
THEN COULD SEE LIGHT FREEZING LATER TONIGHT WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE CWA. IT SHOULD 
CHANGE BACK TO RAIN BY THE AFTERNOON. THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA BY 
TOMORROW. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT NOT 
TOO BAD FOR THE MOST PART...BUT GIVEN EXPECTED MODEL COMPETENCE 
HANDLING WEAKER FEATURES IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
A BIT BELOW AVERAGE AT LEAST FROM THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY.  EXITING 
SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT WILL LEAVE CONSIDERABLE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
LINGERING...SO EXPECT CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY SOME LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE.  
SOME DRYING WEDNESDAY...THEN A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING FROM THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT 
TOWARD OUR AREA WED NIGHT AND THEN THROUGH OUR AREA THURSDAY.  LOOKS 
LIKE A WARM EVENT...SO JUST RAIN IN THE FORECAST WITH THIS ONE. WEAK 
HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD PROVIDE A DRY FRIDAY...THEN THE LOWER 
CONFIDENCE PART OF THE FORECAST AS MODELS HINT OF ANOTHER UPPER 
TROUGH APPROACHING...WITH SOME SOUTHERN SURFACE DEVELOPMENT 
POSSIBLE...THAT COULD BRING SOME PRECIP TO THE AREA SAT AND/OR SAT 
NIGHT.  FOR NOW WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GIVEN LOW 
CONFIDENCE IN MODEL HANDLING OF THIS SITUATION.  SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
DRY FOR NOW WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND DRIER AIR EXPECTED.

239 
FXUS64 KMRX 131500
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST MON FEB 13 2012

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY WEATHER TODAY. TEMPERATURES 
AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO 
REMOVE EARLY WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...CHILLY TEMPS THIS MORNING
WITH COLD SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS THE REGION...AND THIS COLD AIR MASS
LOOKS TO CAUSE A BRIEF PERIOD OF WINTRY MIXED PCPN LATE TONIGHT
JUST PAST DAYBREAK TUESDAY. LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING OVER LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION WILL PROVIDE ISENTROPIC LIFT...WITH AN
AREA OF MOSTLY RAIN MOVING INTO SE TN GENERALLY AFTER 06Z TUESDAY.
HOWEVER...MODEL AND BUFKIT SOUNDINGS SUGGEST COLD AIR SHOULD GET
TRAPPED IN VALLEYS OF POLK COUNTY INTO CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES
OF SW NC. THIS IS ALSO TRUE FOR VALLEYS OF HIGHER TERRAIN IN MONROE
COUNTY. THERE IS A BRIEF PERIOD WHERE A LIGHT SNOW AND/OR ICE
ACCUMULATION COULD OCCUR WITH AN INCH OR SO OF SNOW AND PERHAPS UP
TO 1/10 INCH OF ICE. THUS I OPTED TO ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY FOR THOSE AREAS...FROM 07Z TO 15Z TUESDAY...WITH MAINLY
RAIN AFTER THAT TIME. MODELS SHOW CONSISTENCY AND IN LINE WITH
WINTER WEATHER DESK GRAPHIC FOR DAY ONE. THANKS TO GSP AND FFC FOR
COORDINATION.

MOST FORECAST GRID CHANGES WERE TO COVER THE ADVISORY PERIOD...BUT 
POPS WERE ALSO INCREASED ON TUESDAY. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO PREVIOUS 
MAX AND MIN TEMP GRIDS...WHICH WERE A BIT CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM 
MOS NUMBERS. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...PRECIPITATION MOVES
OUT TUESDAY NIGHT WITH MOSTLY RAIN ALTHOUGH A LITTLE SNOW POSSIBLE
AFTER MIDNIGHT NORTHEAST AS TEMPERATURES COOL INTO THE LOWER 30S.
NO SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION EXPECTED. FAST MOVING HIGH PRESSURE
AREA SLIDES ACROSS WEDNESDAY AND LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL WARM
TEMPERATURES BACK ABOVE NORMAL. ANOTHER FAST MOVING SYSTEM OVER THE
PLAINS WEDNESDAY TRACKS INTO THE MS VALLEY AND TOWARD THE GREAT
LAKES WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SHOWERS SPREAD INTO THE TN VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THURSDAY MORNING AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT.
SOUTHERLY FLOW SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES UP WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY. POSSIBLY INSTABILITY WILL BE GREAT ENOUGH FOR A FEW
THUNDERSTORMS TOO AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT DURING THE DAY THURSDAY.
WITH TIMING UNCERTAINTY OF THE FRONT WILL LEAVE OUT THUNDER FOR
NOW. DECREASING SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT. FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
FORECAST AREA STAYS IN MEAN TROUGH WITH WEATHER SYSTEMS STAYING
NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE REGION ALTHOUGH ECMWF SHOWS A SOUTHERN
SYSTEM BRUSHING OVER THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT WILL KEEP FORECAST
AREA DRY WITH NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 PM EST SUN FEB 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LARGE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL ROLL THROUGH THE SOUTHEAST TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY...THEN INTO 
THE ATLANTIC ON TUESDAY. UPPER SHORT WAVE RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. LARGE DIURNAL TEMPERATURE RANGE 
EXPECTED TONIGHT AND MONDAY WITH DRY AIRMASS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. 
MIN TEMPS TONIGHT DOUBLE DIGIT BELOW NORMAL. RATHER FLAT MID LEVEL 
FLOW INCREASES INTO MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. AIRMASS WILL MOISTEN 
FROM ABOVE AS CLOUDS THEN VIRGA WORK DOWNWARD MONDAY NIGHT. LOW 
LEVEL TEMPERATURE PROFILE IN LAGGING SURFACE RIDGE WILL BE CRITICAL 
TO EXTENT AND DURATION OF PRECIPITATION TYPE EARLY TUESDAY. GOOD 
CLOUD COVER SHOULD HINDER COOLING OVERNIGHT. EXPECT LIGHT SNOW AS 
ONSET PRECIPITATION. WARM LAYER AT H85 APPEARS TO MOVE NE FAST SO 
PERIOD OF MIXED PRECIP TYPE SHOULD BE SHORT LIVED. FREEZING RAIN 
SHOULD SWITCH TO ALL RAIN WITHIN AN HOUR SO HAZARD APPEARS TO BE 
LIMITED AT THIS TIME. SHELTERED VALLEYS COULD PROVE OTHERWISE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FRONT IS EXPECTING 
EXITS THE REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT  WILL KEEP THE LOW CHANCE GOING 
WITH THE  HIGHEST CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS.  MAY SEE SNOW ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCE FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATION...BUT MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE RAIN. DRY 
CONDITIONS RETURN BY WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER FRONT ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS GOING. MAY SEE 
SNOW ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING WITH THE BEST CHANCE 
FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATION. SNOW WILL 
POSSIBLE AGAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING WITH BEST CHANCE 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 120941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
441 AM EST SUN FEB 12 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PESKY LINGERING LOW CLOUDS AND 
FLURRIES OVER MAINLY SW VA AND NE TN THIS MORNING...SHOULD GRADUALLY 
DISSIPATE BY MID MORNING. NOT LIKELY TO SEE ANY MORE SNOW ACCUMS...
SO LET WINTER WX ADVISORY EXPIRE FOR LEE AND WISE COUNTIES AT 4AM.
ALSO...WINDS DIMINISHED A GOOD DEAL OVERNIGHT...PLUS CLOUD COVER TO 
KEEP WIND CHILL VALUES AROUND 5 DEGREES ABOVE ZERO OR HIGHER. SO...
OPTED TO CANCEL OUR WIND CHILL ADVISORY WHICH HAD RUN THRU 9AM. I 
WILL MENTION WIND CHILLS FOR EARLY TODAY IN OUR HWO PRODUCT. 

OTHERWISE...COLD SURFACE RIDGE SETTLES OVER SE STATES TODAY AND
TONIGHT. NOT THINKING THERE WILL BE MUCH SIGNIFICANT SNOW
COVER...BUT I UNDERCUT GFS MOS SLIGHTLY FOR HIGHS. MINS TONIGHT
COULD BE CHILLY AS SURFACE RIDGE SETTLES RIGHT ACROSS THE SRN
APPALACHIANS. THIS MADE THE COLDER GFS MOS MINS A BETTER CHOICE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD SURFACE RIDGE OVER
FORECAST AREA BEGINS TO MODERATE MONDAY ALTHOUGH DRY AIR MASS WILL
KEEP DEW POINTS IN THE TEENS. HIGHS ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN
TODAY. CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE IN THE AFTERNOON AS NEXT SYSTEM
DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND SPREADS MOISTURE NE. MONDAY
NIGHT CLOUDS WILL THICKEN AND LOWER WITH PRECIPITATION SPREADING
INTO THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. TEMPERATURES WILL DROP TO
NEAR FREEZING AS PRECIPITATION BEGINS. A MIXTURE OF PRECIPITATION
TYPES IS POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING AS THE SYSTEM
MOVES EAST. A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF ICING AND AN INCH OR SO OF SNOW IS
POSSIBLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY BEFORE THE ATMOSPHERE WARMS
AND PRECIPITATION CHANGES TO ALL RAIN. WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS SYSTEM IN
THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH THIS SYSTEM
STAYS ALONG THE GULF COAST AND THEN REINFORCING HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS BACK OVER THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY.
BREAK IS ONLY TEMPORARY AS A SECOND STRONGER SYSTEM BRINGS SHOWERS
INTO THE REGION THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS DRYING
TREND FOR THE WEEKEND.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 120040
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
730 PM EST SAT FEB 11 2012

.DISCUSSION...PRESSURE GRADIENT WEAKENING...ALLOWING WINDS TO 
DECREASE TO BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.  THEREFORE...HAVE ALLOWED THE 
WIND ADVISORY TO EXPIRE.  HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE TO SEE 
BREEZY...GUSTY WINDS THROUGH THE REST OF THE EVENING.  CONTINUING 
TO SEE UPSLOPE SNOW OVER WISE AND LEE COUNTIES AND HAVE 
EXTENDED THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH 4 AM IN THOSE 
LOCATIONS.  FOR THE REST OF THE AREA...DRY AIR MOVING IN AND 
WEAKENING NORTHWEST FLOW...HAS DIMINISHED SNOWFALL TO A FEW POCKETS 
OF LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES WITH LITTLE TO NO ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED...SO THE SNOW ADVISORY HAS ALSO BEEN ALLOWED TO EXPIRE IN 
THOSE LOCATIONS.  ONLY ISSUE REMAINING FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS WILL 
BE COLD TEMPERATURES.  THESE COMBINED WITH RESIDUAL BREEZY 
CONDITIONS WILL PUSH WIND CHILLS INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS ACROSS MOST 
VALLEY LOCATIONS AND BELOW ZERO IN HIGHER TERRAIN.  THEREFORE...A 
WIND CHILL ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND 
PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA.  ALL HANDLED WELL IN THE CURRENT 
FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EXPIRED HEADLINES AND EVENING 
WORDING.

.AVIATION...
COLD MIDLEVEL TEMPERATURES ARE GENERATING SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS SW VA
AND NE TN...BUT THE TREND OVERNIGHT WILL BE GREATER STABILIZTION
AND DECREASING SHOWERS. WILL INCLUDE A TEMPO AT TRI FOR MVFR VIS
WITH SNOW FOR A FEW MORE HOURS...THEN HAVE VFR AT ALL LOCATIONS BY
MIDNIGHT. GUSTY WINDS THIS EVENING SHOULD DIMINISH TO 10-12 KTS
BY MIDNIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING OVER THE AREA FROM THE
WEST THROUGH TOMORROW...WHICH SHOULD BRING CLEAR SKIES AND WINDS
LESS THAN 10 KTS AT ALL SITES.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL 
CONTINUE EARLY THIS EVENING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS UPSLOPE AREAS. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST. LOW LEVEL CYCLONIC 
CURVATURE WILL BEND MOVE ANTICYCLONICALLY AS VERY DRY AIR FILTERS 
INTO THE REGION. SHOWER ACTIVITY SHOULD TAPER OFF FAIRLY FAST. VERY 
COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES INTO SUNDAY MORNING. WIND CHILLS IN THE 
SINGLE DIGITS WILL BE COMMON WITH READINGS BELOW -5F ACROSS AREAS IN 
PROPOSED WIND CHILL ADVISORY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE 
SOUTHEAST FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. COLD AND DRY CONDITIONS 
CAN BE EXPECTED.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FRONT IS EXPECTING TO 
MOVE INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL KEEP THE  HIGH 
CHANCE POPS GOING.  MAY SEE SNOW ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING 
MORNING WITH THE BEST CHANCE FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATION. SHOULD BE MAINLY DRY BY WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER 
FRONT ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING. MAY 
SEE SNOW ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING WITH THE BEST 
CHANCE FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATION. AND AGAIN 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SATURDAY. STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 111615
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1115 AM EST SAT FEB 11 2012

.DISCUSSION...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THIS AFTERNOON.
SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE PERSISTENT ACROSS UPSLOPE AREAS. STRONG 
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL PERSIST AND TEMPERATURES WILL DROP THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR (DUAL POL PRODUCTS) 
INDICATE MOSTLY LIGHT SNOW AS PRECIPITATION TYPE THIS MORNING...WITH 
SURFACE OBSERVATIONS OVER SW VA AND NRN PLATEAU NORTH INTO SE KY 
SUPPORTING THIS. CENTRAL VALLEY TEMPS SOUTHWARD STILL UPPER 30S TO 
LOWER 40S SO POSSIBLY A LITTLE MIX WITH LIGHT RAIN FOR A FEW MORE 
HOURS. EXPECT SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAY HAVE ALREADY 
OCCURRED OVER SW VA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NRN AND SMOKY 
MTNS...PLUS AT LEAST A DUSTING TO HALF AN INCH OVER NRN PLATEAU. 

STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION KICKS IN LATER THIS MORNING WITH BRISK NW 
UPSLOPE FLOW WINDS. LAPSE RATES STEEPEN AND POSITIVE CAPES UP TO 60 
J/KG...SO OUR WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY LOOKS ON TRACK WITH NO CHANGES 
MADE AT THIS TIME. WIND ADVISORY SPEEDS MAY BE ONLY MARGINALLY 
REACHED IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS...BUT NO PROBLEM FOR HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES CAN ONLY GO DOWN TODAY...SO FORECAST GRIDS 
WILL REFLECT THIS...WHILE BRISK NW WINDS MAKE IT REALLY FEEL LIKE 
WINTER. DECREASING CLOUDS OR CLEARING TONIGHT AND QUITE COLD. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE 
SETTLES OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES SUNDAY WITH HIGHS ONLY IN THE 
30S...SOME 10 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. DEW POINTS VERY LOW IN THE 
SINGLE DIGITS. THEN ANOTHER COLD NIGHT WITH LOWS ONCE AGAIN IN THE 
TEENS AS SURFACE HIGH BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST. LOW PRESSURE IN TEXAS 
ALONG OLD SURFACE BOUNDARY MOVES INTO LOWER MS VALLEY MONDAY. 
MOISTURE STREAMS NORTH INTO THE CENTRAL STATES WITH PRECIPITATION 
DEVELOPING WITH SNOW IN THE PLAINS AND RAIN AND OR FREEZING 
PRECIPITATION MOVING INTO OK AND AR. ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE 
SOUTH. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE DURING THE AFTERNOON. DEW POINTS WILL 
BEGIN TO COME UP LATE MONDAY.

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS MOVES INTO THE MS
AND TN VALLEYS. TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY DROP BELOW FREEZING MONDAY
EVENING WITH DRY AIR MASS AND DIURNAL COOLING. LATER ATMOSPHERE
SLOWLY MOISTEN UPS AND TEMPERATURES BECOME STEADY WITH SKIES CLOUDY.
OVERRUNNING NORTH OF SOUTHERN FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL CAUSE
PRECIPITATION TO DEVELOP BY MORNING. MODEL SOUNDINGS HINT THAT
SOME LOCATIONS IN SOUTHEAST TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU MAY HAVE
WARM AIR ALOFT WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING TUESDAY MORNING FOR
SOME FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET BEFORE TEMPERATURES WARM ABOVE FREEZING
AND PRECIPITATION CHANGES TO ALL RAIN. WILL HAVE SNOW AND RAIN
MIXTURE IN FORECAST FOR NOW BUT MAY NEED TO ADD A WINTERY MIX IN
LATER UPDATES. SNOW EARLY TUESDAY WILL CHANGE TO ALL RAIN BY ABOUT
18Z BUT SOME AREAS MAY HAVE LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS TUESDAY MORNING.
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY SHOWERS LINGER MOSTLY RAIN BUT SNOW
POSSIBLE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY A NEW
DEVELOPING SYSTEM IN THE MS VALLEY SPREADS PRECIPITATION INTO THE
FORECAST AREA. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE WARMER AND BRING MOSTLY RAIN.
SHOWERS CONTINUE INTO FRIDAY.

MOSTLY LIGHT SNOW AS PRECIPITATION TYPE THIS MORNING...WITH SURFACE 
OBSERVATIONS OVER SW VA AND NRN PLATEAU NORTH INTO SE KY SUPPORTING 
THIS. CENTRAL VALLEY TEMPS SOUTHWARD STILL UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S SO 
POSSIBLY A LITTLE MIX WITH LIGHT RAIN FOR A FEW MORE HOURS. EXPECT 
SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAY HAVE ALREADY OCCURRED OVER SW VA 
AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NRN AND SMOKY MTNS...PLUS AT LEAST A 
DUSTING TO HALF AN INCH OVER NRN PLATEAU. 

STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION KICKS IN LATER THIS MORNING WITH BRISK NW 
UPSLOPE FLOW WINDS. LAPSE RATES STEEPEN AND POSITIVE CAPES UP TO 60 
J/KG...SO OUR WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY LOOKS ON TRACK WITH NO CHANGES 
MADE AT THIS TIME. WIND ADVISORY SPEEDS MAY BE ONLY MARGINALLY 
REACHED IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS...BUT NO PROBLEM FOR HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES CAN ONLY GO DOWN TODAY...SO FORECAST GRIDS 
WILL REFLECT THIS...WHILE BRISK NW WINDS MAKE IT REALLY FEEL LIKE 
WINTER. DECREASING CLOUDS OR CLEARING TONIGHT AND QUITE COLD. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE
SETTLES OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES SUNDAY WITH HIGHS ONLY IN THE
30S...SOME 10 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. DEW POINTS VERY LOW IN
THE SINGLE DIGITS. THEN ANOTHER COLD NIGHT WITH LOWS ONCE AGAIN IN
THE TEENS AS SURFACE HIGH BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST. LOW PRESSURE IN
TEXAS ALONG OLD SURFACE BOUNDARY MOVES INTO LOWER MS VALLEY MONDAY.
MOISTURE STREAMS NORTH INTO THE CENTRAL STATES WITH PRECIPITATION
DEVELOPING WITH SNOW IN THE PLAINS AND RAIN AND OR FREEZING
PRECIPITATION MOVING INTO OK AND AR. ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
MONDAY TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABOUT 10 DEGREES WARMER AS WINDS
SHIFT TO THE SOUTH. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE DURING THE AFTERNOON. DEW
POINTS WILL BEGIN TO COME UP LATE MONDAY.

MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS MOVES INTO THE MS
AND TN VALLEYS. TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY DROP BELOW FREEZING MONDAY
EVENING WITH DRY AIR MASS AND DIURNAL COOLING. LATER ATMOSPHERE
SLOWLY MOISTEN UPS AND TEMPERATURES BECOME STEADY WITH SKIES CLOUDY.
OVERRUNNING NORTH OF SOUTHERN FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL CAUSE
PRECIPITATION TO DEVELOP BY MORNING. MODEL SOUNDINGS HINT THAT
SOME LOCATIONS IN SOUTHEAST TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU MAY HAVE
WARM AIR ALOFT WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING TUESDAY MORNING FOR
SOME FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET BEFORE TEMPERATURES WARM ABOVE FREEZING
AND PRECIPITATION CHANGES TO ALL RAIN. WILL HAVE SNOW AND RAIN
MIXTURE IN FORECAST FOR NOW BUT MAY NEED TO ADD A WINTERY MIX IN
LATER UPDATES. SNOW EARLY TUESDAY WILL CHANGE TO ALL RAIN BY ABOUT
18Z BUT SOME AREAS MAY HAVE LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS TUESDAY MORNING.
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY SHOWERS LINGER MOSTLY RAIN BUT SNOW
POSSIBLE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY A NEW
DEVELOPING SYSTEM IN THE MS VALLEY SPREADS PRECIPITATION INTO THE
FORECAST AREA. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE WARMER AND BRING MOSTLY RAIN.
SHOWERS CONTINUE INTO FRIDAY.
&&

1000 PM EST FRI FEB 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL USHER IN BANDS OF LIGHT 
SHOWERS.  WITH MUCH COLDER AIR MOVING IN...RAIN HAS ALREADY SWITCHED 
TO SNOW IN SOME LOCATIONS.  SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT OVER 
THE SOUTHERN LOCATIONS...A HALF INCH TO AN INCH IS POSSIBLE OVER THE 
CENTRAL VALLEY...WITH 1 TO 3 INCHES POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA.  HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF THE APPALACHIANS AND SOUTHWEST VA COULD SEE LOCALLY 3 
TO 5 INCHES BY THE TIME THINGS WIND DOWN LATE SATURDAY.  A SNOW 
ADVISORY IS IN PLACE FOR NEEDED AREAS.  ADDITIONALLY...STRONG... 
GUSTY WINDS WILL DEVELOP BEHIND THE FRONT ON SATURDAY AND A WIND 
ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THE ENTIRE MRX CWA.  ALL ON TRACK IN 
THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

.AVIATION...AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL PULL IN BANDS OF LIGHT 
SHOWERS.  AS A RESULT...CIGS WILL LOWER AND AS RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW 
VISIBILITIES MAY BE REDUCED FOR OCCASIONAL MVFR CONDITIONS 
OVERNIGHT.  CONDITION SHOULD SLOWLY IMPROVE AFTER 15Z WITH A RETURN 
TO VFR CONDITIONS WITH IMPROVING CEILINGS AND NO RESTRICTIONS TO 
VISIBILITIES.  HOWEVER...INCREASING WINDS BEHIND THE FRONT WILL 
GENERATE STRONG...GUSTY WINDS SATURDAY AFTERNOON.

566 
FXUS64 KMRX 102028
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EST FRI FEB 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...RAPID PATTERN CHANGES 
TONIGHT. SHORT WAVE OVER OK MOVES QUICKLY THROUGH THE SOUTHEAST. 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE DEEPENS NEAR THE OUTER BANKS EARLY SATURDAY. 
STRONG JET SEGMENT IN THE MEAN UPPER TROUGH DIGS SE INTO THE TN 
VALLEY. LARGE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AREA SINKS INTO THE UPPER 
PLAINS. ISENTROPIC LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH SHORT WAVE HAS BEEN WORKING 
OVER THE DRY LOW LEVELS OVER THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY. THIS 
ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE INTO TONIGHT. THE RESIDENT AIR MASS WILL 
CONTINUE TO FILL WITH VIRGA AND MOISTEN FROM ALOFT BEFORE 
PRECIPITATION REACHES THE SURFACE THIS EVENING. THE PRECIPITATION 
WILL BECOME MIXED AND EARLY ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE SPARSE. THE AXIS 
OF THE SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH LATER THIS EVENING FOLLOWED BY A 
DRAMATIC FALL IN THE FREEZING LEVEL. GOOD AVAILABLE MOISTURE WILL 
CONTINUE UNTIL COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE AROUND DAY BREAK SATURDAY. LIGHT 
SYNOPTIC SNOWFALL ANTICIPATED OVERNIGHT. PRESSURE GRADIENT VERY 
TIGHT BEHIND COLD FRONT. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE RAPIDLY AND 
CONTINUE MUCH OF THE DAY. COLD AIR ADVECTION VERY STRONG. 
TEMPERATURES WILL MOVE LITTLE AND LIKELY FALL IN THE AFTERNOON. 
SCATTERED INSTABILITY SNOW SHOWERS AND UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS WILL 
BECOME FAVORABLE WITH TYPICAL LIMITED MOISTURE. OCCASIONAL 
CONVERGENT BANDS OF STRONGER SNOW BURST POSSIBLE WITH INCREASED 
LAPSE RATES. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN RAPIDLY SO BEST NW FLOW AND 
CYCLONIC CURVATURE LOSES CHARACTER INTO SAT EVENING. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION CONTINUES SATURDAY NIGHT AND WINDS STAY UP SUFFICIENTLY TO 
HINT AT POSSIBLE WIND CHILL ADVISORY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
FOR SUNDAY MORNING. LIQUID TO SNOW RATIOS AROUND 1:40 NEAR EVENT END 
COULD ALLOW FOR DECENT ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. EVENT TOTAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL VARY GREATLY 
ACROSS THE REGION. TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS WILL BE WIDESPREAD. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE LARGE SCALE UPPER LEVEL 
POLAR LOW OVER EASTERN CANADA AND THE SUBTROPICAL HIGH OVER THE 
CARIBBEAN REMAIN ANCHORED IN PLACE THROUGH THIS PART OF THE 
FORECAST...INDUCING A BUSY FLOW OVER THE AREA.  

UPPER SHORT WAVE TROUGH PASSAGES LOOK TO BE TIMED AROUND TUESDAY AND 
AGAIN NEAR THE END OF THE FORECAST.

AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS FORECAST...COLD HIGH PRESSURE IS BUILDING 
INTO THE REGION. ON MONDAY MOISTURE WILL BE STREAMING INTO THE AREA 
ALOFT...BUT SURFACE DEW POINTS WILL START OUT THE DAY VERY LOW.  IT 
IS LIKELY THAT VIRGA WILL BE SEEN ON MONDAY AS IT WILL TAKE A WHILE 
FOR THE LOWER TROPOSPHERE TO MOISTEN UP.  TRICKY FORECAST FOR MONDAY 
NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY...AS WARM ADVECTION WILL BE ON-GOING...BUT 
LIFT WILL BE COOLING THE AIR MASS...SO PRECIP WILL LIKELY BE A 
MIXTURE OF RAIN/SNOW AT DIFFERENT TIMES...DEPENDING ON TIMING OF 
WARMING TO CHANGE TO RAIN...BUT THEN MAX LIFT POSSIBLY CHANGING 
TEMPORARILY BACK TO SNOW.  ONCE LIFT MOVES ON THROUGH...THEN AIR 
MASS CAN CONTINUE TO WARM AND MOST PRECIP WILL STAY RAIN.  AT 
PRESENT...LOOKS LIKE BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON...MOST OF THE AREA WOULD 
BE CHANGED TO RAIN.

FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK COLD AIR STAYS NORTH AND PRECIP SHOULD BE 
MAINLY LIQUID...EVEN IN THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
438 AM EST FRI FEB 10 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND WEAK 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL PROVIDE SYNOPTIC SCALE LIFT STARTING THIS 
EVENING. MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION (PCPN) LOOKS TO MAINLY ARRIVE 
AROUND 11/00Z...SO I KEPT GOOD CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS POP GRIDS. 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION MOVES IN BY 06Z TO 12Z SATURDAY...WITH A 
SECONDARY SHORTWAVE TO PASS ACROSS ON SATURDAY. LAPSE RATES STEEPEN 
WITH MODERATE LOW LEVEL NW UPSLOPE FLOW...SO EVENT SHIFTS TO SNOW 
SHOWERS ON SATURDAY FOR FAVORED AREAS IN AN NW UPSLOPE EVENT. OPTED 
TO BEEF UP POPS FOR SW VA/NE TN AND SMOKIES THROUGH MOST OF SATURDAY.

POTENTIAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS PLUS MUCH COLDER AIR SUPPORT ISSUING A 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SW VA/NE TN/SMOKIES...FROM 7PM FRIDAY TO 
7PM SATURDAY. ALMOST INCLUDED NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES...BUT NOT SURE IF 
SIGNIFICANT SNOW LINGERS LONG ENOUGH TO GET MORE THAN AN INCH OR SO 
OF SNOW THERE. STRENGTH OF COLD AIR ADVECTION WARRANTS GOING WITH OR 
JUST BELOW THE COOLER HIGHS ON SATURDAY...AS TEMPS ACTUALLY TAKE ON 
A FEEL OF WINTER! THANKS TO JKL AND RLX FOR COORDINATION ON WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...NW FLOW CONTINUES
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN MOUNTAINS
DURING THE EVENING TAPERING OFF AFTER MIDNIGHT. WINDS WILL STILL BE
BRISK WITH SUSTAINED WINDS UP TO 25 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND TEMPERATURES DROPPING INTO THE TEENS. WIND CHILLS
WILL LIKELY BE AROUND 0 OR BELOW. COLD HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH TEMPERATURES STAYING COLD. HIGHS MOSTLY
IN THE 30S. ANOTHER COLD NIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE HIGH MOVES
OVERHEAD. MONDAY HIGH SHIFTS EAST WITH A WARMING TREND. NEW TROUGH
MOVES INTO CENTRAL STATES LATE MONDAY. LOW PRESSURE OVER TEXAS AND
THE WESTERN GULF AND FRONTAL SYSTEM TRACKS EAST WITH PRECIPITATION
SPREADING INTO THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S
BY MORNING TUESDAY WITH SNOW POSSIBLE LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY
TUESDAY CENTRAL AND NORTHERN SECTIONS BEFORE WARMING TUESDAY
CHANGES PRECIPITATION TO RAIN BY AFTERNOON. THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE
QUICKLY EAST BY TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRIEFLY
WEDNESDAY WITH ANOTHER WARMER SYSTEM MOVING IN THURSDAY PRODUCING
MAINLY RAIN.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EST THU FEB 9 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
REMAINS OVER THE AREAS TONIGHT. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WITH TEMPERATURES 
AT OR BELOW NORMAL. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST ON FRIDAY. A 
MID LEVEL SHORT WAVE APPROACHES FROM THE SW. CLOUD COVER INCREASES 
AND LOWERS THROUGH THE DAY. PATCHES OF RAIN WILL ADVANCE INTO THE 
AREA BY LATE AFTERNOON. THE FREEZING LEVEL AT THE BEGINNING OF THE 
PRECIPITATION EVENT WILL BE BETWEEN 3500 TO 4000 FEET. THE SHORT 
WAVE WILL MOVE QUICKLY EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE MRX CWA. 
A STRONG UPPER JET WILL QUICKLY FOLLOW FROM THE NW. THE FREEZING 
LEVEL WILL LOWER FRIDAY NIGHT AND THE RAIN WILL CHANGE TO MOSTLY 
SNOW BY SATURDAY MORNING. THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE IS BECOMING 
FAVORABLE FOR LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS IN THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY 
BY SATURDAY MORNING. THE AVAILABLE MOISTURE...ESPECIALLY IN THE SNOW 
GROWTH REGION IS MARGINAL AND QUESTIONABLE AT THIS TIME. CONFIDENCE 
IS RISING FOR A REQUIREMENT FOR A SNOW ADVISORY ACROSS SW VA AND THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS OF TENNESSEE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION ON SATURDAY WILL KEEP 
TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL. UPSLOPE AND SCATTERED INSTABILITY 
SNOW SHOWERS WILL PERSIST MUCH OF THE DAY BUT LIMITED MOISTURE WILL 
HOLD DOWN SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS. H85 TEMPS WILL RANGE FROM -10 
TO -15C AND SURFACE TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS WILL BE COMMON SUNDAY 
MORNING.   

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A FRONT IS 
EXPECTING TO MOVE INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL    
KEEP THE LOW POPS GOING.  MAY SEE SNOW ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY 
MORNING MORNING WITH THE BEST CHANCE FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATION.  WILL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY FOR 
NOW. ANOTHER FRONT ENTERS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. 
WILL ADD CHANCE POPS FOR RAIN. IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL 
RAIN. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD ADVECTION WILL KEEP

DECENT AGREEMENT OVERALL. FORECAST CONFIDENCE FALLS OFF SOMEWHAT FOR 
THE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME AS RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY HAS 
NOT BEEN VERY GOOD.  

UPPER TROUGH WILL DIG IN EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH A COLD FRONT 
PUSHING THROUGH THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...USHERING IN A SHOT OF MUCH 
COLDER AIR FOR THE WEEKEND.  MOISTURE LOOKS SOMEWHAT LIMITED WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...BUT STILL LOOKS LIKE LIKELY POPS ARE WARRANTED FRIDAY 
NIGHT AT LEAST NORTH AND CENTRAL ZONES.  WILL CARRY LOW POPS FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON AS THIS SYSTEM APPROACHES...AND THIS SHOULD BE MAINLY RAIN 
DUE TO WARM BOUNDARY LAYER...ALTHOUGH MAY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS 
OVER THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.  SNOW SHOWERS HIGHER ELEVATIONS FRIDAY 
NIGHT...AND VALLEYS MAY SEE A CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS AS WELL AS 
BOUNDARY LAYER COOLS.  SOME SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO SATURDAY 
MAINLY NORTHERN HALF ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN NORTHWEST FLOW 
AS COLDER AIR PUSHES IN.  LOOKS LIKE AT LEAST HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
COULD PICK UP SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS...SO WILL MENTION IN HWO.  

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN WITH DRY WEATHER SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...THEN THINGS MORE MUDDLED FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  LATEST 
RUNS SEEM TO LEAN TOWARD A WEAK SYSTEM AROUND TUESDAY...WITH 
WEDNESDAY DRIER.  HOWEVER...GIVEN UNCERTAINTY THAT FAR OUT AND WITH 
THE LACK OF RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR THE ENTIRE 
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME FOR NOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 082100
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 PM EST WED FEB 8 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL IN 
WAKE OF EXITING SHORT WAVE. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO
THE AREA FROM THE WEST. WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION THROUGH MID DAY 
THURSDAY. LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS FLURRIES POSSIBLE ACROSS NE AREA THIS 
EVENING. OTHERWISE...AIRMASS DRIES OUT RAPIDLY WITH SOME ADVANCING 
CIRRUS ON THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FROM THE START OF 
THIS PERIOD THROUGH THE WEEKEND...THE AREA IS GENERALLY UNDER THE 
INFLUENCE OF THE LARGE UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN CANADA...AND EVEN 
INTO NEXT WEEK...WE ARE IN THE FAST FLOW BETWEEN THAT TROUGH AND THE 
SUBTROPICAL HIGH OVER THE CARIBBEAN.  

AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE COVERS THE AREA AT THE START OF THE 
PERIOD...THE TIMING OF THE COLD FRONT PASSAGE STILL LOOKS LIKE 
FRIDAY NIGHT...FOLLOWED BY THE FILLING OF EVEN HIGHER PRESSURE INTO 
THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND.  BY MONDAY...RETURN FLOW STARTS UP AS 
THE HIGH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA. THE LAST SYSTEM AROUND THE MIDDLE
OF NEXT WEEK SEEMS HIGHLY VARIABLE IN THE MODELS...WITH RESPECT TO
ITS TIMING AND INTENSITY. IT DOES APPEAR THAT IN THE ADVANCE OF
THIS NEXT SYSTEM THAT RELATIVELY HIGH DEW POINTS WILL SURGE INTO
THE AREA FROM THE GULF...SO WILL HAVE TO LOOK FOR THE THUNDERSTORMS
WITH THAT SYSTEM...FOR NOW WILL KEEP IT SHOWERS.

IN THE MEANTIME...THE SYSTEM FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...HAVE PUT IN 
LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE GRIDS...MAINLY IN THE NORTHEAST
AND FROM THE SMOKIES NORTHWARD IN THE MOUNTAINS...WITH TOTAL
AMOUNTS FOR NOW MAINLY BELOW ONE INCH. WILL HAVE TO SEE IF THIS
SYSTEM GETS BETTER ORGANIZED AS IT GETS CLOSER. FOR THE NEXT SYSTEM
MONDAY NIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY...MAY HAVE A MIX INITIALLY IN THE
NORTHEAST...BUT WARMER AIR SHOULD CHANGE IT ALL OVER TO RAIN.

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO RAISE POPS ACROSS SW VA/NE TN EARLY THIS
AFTERNOON FOR VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION. DRY SLOT FILTERING IN FROM 
SW IN ADVANCE OF COLD CORE SHORT WAVE WILL DEPLETE SNOW GROWTH 
REGION OF MOISTURE. GOOD COLD AIR ADVECTION ABOUT TO COMMENCE SO

SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK SHORT WAVE...FOLLOWED BY A 
TROUGH AXIS WILL BRING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE SHORT TERM.  BEST CHANCE OF 
PRECIP WILL BE OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  A FEW FLURRIES OR LIGHT 
SNOW IS POSSIBLE EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT SHOULD QUICKLY SWITCH TO 
RAIN OVER MOST LOCATIONS.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER NORTHERN 
AND EASTERN AREAS THIS EVENING WITH PRECIP CHANGING TO SNOW OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN POSSIBLE.  OVERALL...ANY PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO 
BE QUITE LIGHT...GENERALLY ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS.  ANY SNOW OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS ALSO QUITE LIGHT...WITH MOSTLY A TRACE TO POSSIBLY 
A COUPLE OF TENTHS.  DRIER...COOLER AIR WILL SETTLE IN OVERNIGHT.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH START TO DIVERGE A BIT BY 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.  WILL START OFF THURSDAY WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE REGION...THEN A COLD FRONT WILL LATER FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT.  
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS WITH THIS FEATURE.  THERMAL 
PROFILES LOOK COLD ENOUGH FOR MENTION OF SNOW ESPECIALLY HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...POSSIBLY EVEN VALLEYS LATE FRI NIGHT/EARLY SAT.  HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH TEMPS BELOW SEASONAL 
NORMS FOR THE WEEKEND.  SHOULD BE DRY BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH 
NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING BY TUESDAY.  GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THIS 
SYSTEM THAN ECMWF...AND SINCE CONFIDENCE STILL FAIRLY LOW WILL JUST 
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUESDAY.  STILL A LONG WAY OUT...BUT LOOKS 
LIKE A MAINLY LIQUID EVENT AT THIS POINT AT LEAST ON THE FRONT 
SIDE.

IS POSSIBLE EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT SHOULD QUICKLY SWITCH TO RAIN 
OVER MOST LOCATIONS.  A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER NORTHERN AND 
EASTERN AREAS THIS EVENING WITH PRECIP CHANGING TO SNOW OVER HIGHER 
TERRAIN POSSIBLE.  OVERALL...ANY PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE QUITE 
LIGHT...GENERALLY ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS.  ANY SNOW OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ALSO QUITE LIGHT...WITH MOSTLY A TRACE TO POSSIBLY A 
COUPLE OF TENTHS.  DRIER...COOLER AIR WILL SETTLE IN OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH START TO DIVERGE A BIT BY 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.  WILL START OFF THURSDAY WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE REGION...THEN A COLD FRONT WILL LATER FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT.  
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS WITH THIS FEATURE.  THERMAL 
PROFILES LOOK COLD ENOUGH FOR MENTION OF SNOW ESPECIALLY HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...POSSIBLY EVEN VALLEYS LATE FRI NIGHT/EARLY SAT.  HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH TEMPS BELOW SEASONAL 
NORMS FOR THE WEEKEND.  SHOULD BE DRY BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH 
NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING BY TUESDAY.  GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THIS 
SYSTEM THAN ECMWF...AND SINCE CONFIDENCE STILL FAIRLY LOW WILL JUST 
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUESDAY.  STILL A LONG WAY OUT...BUT LOOKS 
LIKE A MAINLY LIQUID EVENT AT THIS POINT AT LEAST ON THE FRONT 
SIDE.    



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  31  52  31  55 /  20  10   0   0  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  29  50  29  53 /  20  10   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       46  29  50  30  53 /  20  10   0   0  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              44  26  46  25  51 /  40  20  10   0  10

.AVIATION...CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO INCREASE GRADUALLY OVERNIGHT 
AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER LOW...BUT EXPECT VFR CONDITIONS FOR 
THE MOST PART DUE TO WEAK LIFT AND LIMITED MOISTURE. MID DECK 
CEILINGS MAY LOWER TO 4000 TO 5000 FT TOWARD 16Z TO 18Z...AND 
COULD LOWER TO MVFR BRIEFLY AT TRI AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERS AS 
COLDER AIR ALSO MOVES IN BY WEDNESDAY EVENING. THE CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION IS MAINLY ACROSS SW VA WHERE SOME LIGHT SNOW COULD 
FALL...SO WILL JUST CARRY VCSH AT TRI BEFORE UPPER LOW EXITS.

.DISCUSSION...FINALLY SEEING A FEW SPRINKLES REACH THE GROUND AT BNA

INCREASING CLOUDS AND JUST LOW POPS FOR OUR WRN MOST TN COUNTIES AND 
SW VA TOWARD DAYBREAK. 

THE HOURLY TEMP GRIDS HAVE SLIPPED A BIT OFF TRACK...DUE TO DRY AIR 
AND LIGHT WINDS UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. WILL FRESHEN THE HOURLY 
TEMPS AND DEW POINTS PLUS REMOVE ANY "AFTER MIDNIGHT" WORDING FROM 
THE ZFPMRX PRODUCT.

884 
FXUS64 KMRX 072341
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
640 PM EST TUE FEB 7 2012

.AVIATION...MID LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE WRN THIRD OF TN AHEAD 
OF THE APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH/UPPER LOW. SOME WEAK RADAR 
RETURNS ALSO NOTED...BUT NOT MUCH PRECIPITATION (PCPN) REACHING THE 
SURFACE JUST YET. 

EXPECT LOWERING MID DECK CLOUDS AFTER ABOUT 03Z TO 06Z WEDNESDAY
AND MOISTURE MAY BE SUFFICIENT FOR A STRAY SNOW OR RAIN SHOWER AT
TRI AROUND AND AFTER 18Z WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...I DON'T SEE ENOUGH 
MOISTURE OR LIFT TO CREATE LOWER THAN VFR CONDITIONS EVEN AT TRI.

THUS...TAFS FEATURE VFR CONDITIONS WITH LIGHT AND VARIABLE WINDS 
OVERNIGHT...THEN WESTERLY WINDS AROUND 10 MPH BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. 

PREVIOUS FORECAST DISCUSSION BELOW...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SKIES ARE MOSTLY SUNNY AT MID 
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH TEMPERATURES A 
FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. A COLD FRONT 
WAS MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MID MS VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON. A WEAK SHORT WAVE WAS DEVELOPING SOME LIGHT RAIN AHEAD OF 
IT OVER ARKANSAS. TONIGHT...SKIES WILL BE CLEAR INITIALLY AND THEN 
INCREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT AS A SHORT WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE TN AND OHIO 
RIVER VALLEYS AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. PRECIPITATION SHOULD BEGIN 
LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD ON THE PLATEAU AND THEN SPREAD INTO THE 
NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR 
FREEZING NORTHEAST...WITH A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE MAINLY 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA. LOWER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE A 
MIXTURE IN THE MORNING BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. FOR HIGHS WEDNESDAY 
STAYED A FEW DEGREES BELOW COOLEST GUIDANCE. OVER SOUTHWEST VA... 
HIGHS MAY ONLY REACH THE LOWER 40S AND HOVER IN THE 30S DURING THE 
MORNING.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A QUIET PATTERN WITH A COLD FRONT ON 
THE WEEKEND BEING THE MAIN FEATURE. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS 
THE SOUTHEAST REGION ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...BRINGING TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPS. A FAIRLY STRONG COLD FRONT IS THEN 
PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT... 
WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND IT CREATING SOME LIGHT PRECIP INTO 
SATURDAY. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN SETTLE OVER THE 
REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...BRINGING BELOW NORMAL TEMPS FOR A CHANGE. 
THIS HIGH SHOULD THEN DRIFT EAST OF THE REGION ON MONDAY...WITH 
SOUTHERLY FLOW ON ITS BACK SIDE BRINGING A RETURN TO ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPS. ANOTHER WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY... 
BRINGING A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MOSTLY RAIN. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN 
TO TREND CLOSE THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   37  55  31  52  30 /  10  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     34  50  30  50  29 /  10  20  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             35  50  30  50  29 /  10  30  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    30  47  27  47  26 /  10  40  20   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 070745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 AM EST TUE FEB 7 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTROL 
OUR WEATHER TODAY.  A SHORT WAVE WILL APPROACH LATE TONIGHT.  CLOUDS 
WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT...AND MAY SEE SOME PRECIP START TO MOVE IN 
LATE ESPECIALLY NORTHWEST ZONES.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS FROM NORTHERN PLATEAU INTO PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
FOR LATE TONIGHT.  A LOOK AT THERMAL PROFILES INDICATES SNOW IS 
POSSIBLE...SO WILL GO WITH RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS AS PRECIP TYPE.  MAV 
TEMPS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY GOOD OF LATE AND LOOK REASONABLE AGAIN...SO 
NO MAJOR ADJUSTMENTS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE RIDES 
THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  MAIN BAND OF MOISTURE AND LIFT STAYS 
OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS FOR 20 TO 30 POPS AND OUR BEST CHANCE OF 
PRECIP DURING THE EXTENDED.  COOL TEMPERATURES IN PLACE FOR LIGHT 
SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS EARLY IN THE MORNING...ALL PRECIP SHOULD 
HAVE SWITCHED TO RAIN BY LATE MORNING.  A FEW SHOWERS...POSSIBLY 
LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES...MAY LINGER OVER FAR NORTHERN AND EASTERN 
AREAS WEDNESDAY EVENING.  OVERALL...PRECIP WILL REMAIN LIGHT THROUGH 
THE EVENING AND LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED.  SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  ANOTHER WEAK WAVE 
SLIDES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...EXITING SATURDAY MORNING.  AGAIN LOOKS 
TO BE A LIGHT PRECIP EVENT AND WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION LOW POPS 
NORTHERN HALF.  TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE COOL ENOUGH THAT THE PRECIP 
SWITCHES TO LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES OVERNIGHT BUT AGAIN LITTLE TO NO 
ACCUMULATION EXPECTED.  WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

786 
FXUS64 KMRX 070220
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST MON FEB 6 2012

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING THE RISK OF SPRINKLES ARE OUT OF THE 
CWA SO WILL REMOVE THE EVENING PRECIPITATION. WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING IN...IT SHOULD BE A DRY NIGHT ACROSS THE AREA. COULD SEE 
PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING GROUP. NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WEAK SURFACE TROUGH WAS
STILL LOCATED OVER EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA THIS AFTERNOON. LOW
CLOUDS WERE STARTING TO SCATTER OUT ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY
AND SW NC THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES HAD WARMED TO THE LOWER TO
MID 50S IN MOST LOCATIONS EXCEPT 40S HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHICH IS
NEAR THE SEASONAL NORMALS. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE
CINCINNATI AREA WILL CONTINUE EAST INTO WV THIS EVENING AND THEN
OPEN TO A TROUGH OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY MORNING. A FEW
SPRINKLES POSSIBLE TONIGHT OVER SW VA AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES BY TO
THE NORTH. ELSEWHERE SKIES CLEARING WITH DRIER AIR WORKING IN FROM
THE WEST. PATCHY FOG STILL POSSIBLE LATE AS MOISTURE STILL NEAR THE
GROUND. LOWS NEAR FREEZING TONIGHT AND A FEW DEGREES WARMER TUESDAY
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...FOR THE EXTENDED...A 
PATTERN CHANGE OCCURS WITH A DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE HUDSON BAY 
WITH FLOW BECOMING MORE NORTHWEST. A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL MOVE 
QUICKLY SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH LIMITED MOISTURE. 
FIRST WAVE MOVES THROUGH WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH COLDER AIR 
MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. BEST DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE WILL BE 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE REGION. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE 
POPS NORTH WITH DRY CONDITIONS SOUTH. MORE SEASONABLE AIR 
ANTICIPATED WITH VERTICAL PROFILE COLD ENOUGH FOR A MIXTURE OF SNOW 
AND RAIN FOR MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

EXTENDED BECOMES MORE COMPLICATED FOR THIS WEEKEND...AS A SOUTHERN 
STREAM WAVE MOVES NORTHEAST ACROSS THE GULF INTO THE SOUTHEAST 
UNITED STATES. MOISTURE FROM THIS SYSTEM REMAIN SOUTH AND EAST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA AS LITTLE IF ANY PHASING ANTICIPATED WITH NORTHERN 
STREAM WAVE. HOWEVER...ADDITIONAL COLD AIR MOVES INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE...MAINLY 
HIGH ELEVATIONS.

UPPER FLOW RETURNS TO THE WEST TO SOUTHWEST FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...SO 
A WARMING TREND BACK TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ANTICIPATED.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 060853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST MON FEB 6 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STILL CONSIDERABLE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE LINGERING OVER THE AREA.  A SHORT WAVE WILL BRUSH THE AREA 
AS IT MOVES BY TO OUR NORTH TODAY.  TREND OF THE MODELS HAS BEEN 
DRIER WITH THIS FEATURE...AND DOES NOT APPEAR THERE WILL BE MUCH 
LIFT SO WILL HAVE FORECAST PRECIP FREE FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  
SHOULD SEE GRADUAL DRYING LATER TODAY AND INTO TONIGHT...WITH MAINLY 
CLEAR CONDITIONS BY LATER TONIGHT. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL 
STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS NOT TOO FAR APART IN 
DEPICTION OF THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST ALTHOUGH BY THE WEEKEND THE 
ECMWF BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED AND A LITTLE FASTER THAN THE GFS. 
TUESDAY STILL LOOKS GOOD WITH DRY AIR ALLOWING FOR SOME SUNSHINE. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW PASSAGE OF A COUPLE WEAK SHORT WAVES ABOUT 
MID WEEK. AM SKEPTICAL CONCERNING THE ABILITY FOR THESE FEATURES TO 
PRODUCE MUCH IN THE WAY OF PRECIP SO KEPT PROBABILITY IN THE SLIGHT 
TO LOW CHANCE REALM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WITH THE FIRST WAVE 
AND THEN WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH THE TRAILING SYSTEM. LIFT IS WEAK AND 
ATMOSPHERE HAS A DIFFICULT TIME MOISTENING SUFFICIENTLY IN THIS TIME 
FRAME AND BASICALLY KEPT SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE DRY. IF PRECIP DEVELOPS 
TEMPERATURES WOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A FEW LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS/FLURRIES ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. PRESSURE 
INCREASES THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FOR A SHOT AT MORE SUNSHINE. MORE 
AMPLIFIED TROUGH BUILDS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE MIDWEST DURING THE DAY 
FRIDAY IN TIME TO PRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY 
SNOW SHOWERS LATER FRIDAY NIGHT AS COLDER AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND 
SYSTEM COLD FRONT. COLD...DRY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE 
DURATION OF THE WEEKEND SHUTTING DOWN THE CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION.

&&

609 
FXUS64 KMRX 060115
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
815 PM EST SUN FEB 5 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO ECHOES SHOWING UP ON RADAR YET. BUT SHORTWAVE MAY 
STILL BRING RAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN ZONES SO WILL LEAVE THE 
CURRENT POPS AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK... WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
CLOUDS ARE SLOWLY BECOMING MORE BROKEN THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...AND 
THIS TREND IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING AS DRIER AIR 
ADVECTS INTO THE AREA. AS HIGH PRESSURE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS 
BUILDS SOUTHWARD...A SOUTHEASTERLY FETCH OFF THE ATLANTIC WILL BRING 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS SC INTO NORTHERN GA AND SW NC. WEAK 
ISENTROPIC LIFT AND AN UPSLOPE WIND COMPONENT MAY BRING ISOLATED 
SHOWERS INTO CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES LATE TONIGHT. CLOUDS MAY 
SPREAD INTO THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AS WELL BY MORNING. 

AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA MONDAY...AND A 500 
MB VORT MAX WILL BE CROSSING IN THE AFTERNOON. MOISTURE WILL BE 
LIMITED TO BELOW 700 MB...BUT SOME WEAK LIFT WITH THE VORT MAX AND 
STEEPENING LAPSE RATES COULD GENERATE SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS...MAINLY 
IN NORTHERN AREAS. THERE IS MUCH UNCERTAINTY REGARDING TEMPERATURES 
AS CLOUD COVER WILL BE VARIABLE...BUT LEANED TOWARD THE COOLER SIDE 
OF GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOW WEAK UPPER LOW MOVING ACROSS NORTHERN PART 
OF FORECAST AREA MONDAY EVENING WITH A FEW SHOWERS POSSIBLE. THINK 
THIS FEATURE WILL BE A QUICK MOVER AND WILL REACH THE OTHER SIDE OF 
THE APPALACHIANS BY 06Z SO HAVE LEFT MONDAY NIGHT DRY ALTHOUGH A FEW 
SPRINKLES ARE POSSIBLE OVER SW VA. HIGH PRESSURE AND RIDGING ALOFT 
WILL BRING A DRY DAY TO THE REGION TUESDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY TROUGH OVER CENTRAL STATES APPROACHES WITH INCREASING 
CLOUDS AND A THREAT FOR SHOWERS WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY EVENING. 
HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS BEHIND THIS SYSTEM THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. 
ANOTHER FAST MOVING SYSTEM THAT STAYS MOSTLY TO THE SOUTH AFFECTS 
THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY LOOK DRY NOW AS HIGHER 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NW. MUCH COOLER ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY 
WITH HIGHS IN THE 40S AND LOWS IN THE 20S TO NEAR 30.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  55  33  57  36 /  10  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  52  33  57  35 /  10  20  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  52  33  55  35 /  10  20  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              35  51  28  55  32 /  10  20  10   0  10

.DISCUSSION...
ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS IN PLACE OVER THE AREA THIS
MORNING...WITH LOW CLOUDS AND FOG JUST BEGINNING TO SHOW SIGNS OF
LIFTING. SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS DRIER AIR ACROSS EASTERN KY...AND
MODELS SHOW LOWER SURFACE DEWPOINTS WORKING THEIR WAY INTO THE AREA
FROM THE NORTH THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. THIS SHOULD ELIMINATE THE
FOG...BUT A SATURATED LAYER NEAR 925-850 MB SHOULD KEEP LOW CLOUDS
IN PLACE TODAY. REGIONAL 12Z SOUNDINGS SHOW VERY DRY AIR ABOVE 800
MB...SO NO MEASURABLE PRECIP IS EXPECTED THROUGH THE DAY. DUAL-POL
RADAR DATA SHOWS LIGHT DRIZZLE OVER NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA.

THE UPDATE WILL REMOVE POPS BUT MENTION ISOLATED SPRINKLES NORTH.
TEMPERATURES WILL NOT RISE MUCH FROM CURRENT OBSERVATIONS...AND BE
LOWERED TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPECTED OVERCAST CLOUD COVER.

FXUS64 KMRX 050904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SUN FEB 5 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME DRYING WILL TAKE PLACE TODAY 
AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY.  ANY LINGERING PATCHES OF LIGHT 
RAIN WILL END OVER MUCH OF THE AREA BY MID AFTERNOON...BUT WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE EAST TN 
MOUNTAINS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.  MODELS DO NOT AGREE VERY WELL ON 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THAT APPROACHES THE AREA TONIGHT.  NAM ON THE 
WEAK SIDE WITH THIS...AND TREND OF THE MODELS HAS BEEN WEAKER AND 
DRIER.  WILL KEEP QUITE A FEW CLOUDS AROUND AND KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS GOING IN SOME OF THE MOUNTAIN ZONES...BUT OTHERWISE WILL HAVE A 
DRY FORECAST TONIGHT.  MAY BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN LATE TONIGHT IF ANY PRECIP DOES OCCUR.  WILL UNDERCUT 
SOME MAV TEMPS A BIT TODAY...BUT OVERALL WILL NOT STRAY FAR.   

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...NO MAJOR AMPLIFICATION OF THE 
UPPER PATTERN IS EXPECTED DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH SEVERAL 
WEAKER SHORT WAVE FEATURES GRADUALLY DEEPENING INTO AN EASTERN U.S. 
UPPER TROUGH BY FRIDAY. MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT IN THIS 
PATTERN BUT GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE ECMWF WHICH STARTS THE PERIOD 
MONDAY WITH A WEAK SOUTHERN OHIO VALLEY THROUGH SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TRANSITING TRAILING SHORT WAVE TROUGH. THIS FEATURE 
LACKS SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT FOR MORE THAN A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
FOR A SPRINKLE DURING THE MORNING MAINLY ACROSS A SMALL PART OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. NICE DRY PERIOD MONDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT STILL LOOKS GOOD. EUROPEAN MODEL SHOWS A 
COUPLE WEAK SHORT WAVES WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT SO KEPT A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR A SHOWER DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST. WE MAY BE 
ABLE TO SQUEEZE OUT A DRY THURSDAY WHILE AWAITING AMPLIFICATION OF 
EASTERN CANADIAN UPPER TROUGH DROPPING THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN 
QUARTER OF THE NATION. WOULD EXPECT A COLD FRONT TO ACCOMPANY THIS 
SYSTEM AND APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS DURING THE DAY AT THIS 
REMOTE PERIOD OF THE EXTENDED WHILE MIXING IN A BIT OF SNOW FRIDAY 
NIGHT AS COLDER AIR SPILLS IN BEHIND THE FRONT. DRY COLD ADVECTION 
BUILDS INTO THE REGION FOR SATURDAY ALLOWING A RETURN TO SOME 
SUNSHINE. TEMP FORECAST DIFFICULT WITH FORECAST AREA IN BETWEEN THE 
CHILLY NORTHEASTERN U.S. AIRMASS AND MILDER DEEP SOUTHERN AIR. 
STAYED A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW MAXES MOST OF THE FORECAST ESPECIALLY 
ON WEDNESDAY WITH EXPECTED WEATHER. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MINS. 

&&

472 
FXUS64 KMRX 050226
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
926 PM EST SAT FEB 4 2012

.DISCUSSION...LINE OF SHOWERS TRACKING ACROSS CWA. CURRENT POPS LOOK 
REASONABLE SO WILL LEAVE AS IS. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE FOR THE EVENING GROUP. NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
A BAND OF SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH A ZONE OF MOISTURE CONVERGENCE 
WILL BE PUSHING THROUGH THE AREA THIS EVENING. ONCE THIS LINE MOVES 
THROUGH...THERE IS LITTLE IN THE WAY OF LIFT TO PRODUCE MUCH PRECIP 
THE REST OF THE NIGHT. HOWEVER THE SURFACE TO 700 MB LAYER REMAINS 
SATURATED UNTIL 12Z...WITH DRY ADVECTION AND THE SURFACE COLD FRONT 
ENTERING THE AREA AROUND OR AFTER THAT TIME. THE EAST-WEST
ORIENTED 500 MB TROUGH REMAINS WELL TO THE NORTH AND IS VERY SLOW
TO MAKE ITS WAY SOUTH. MODEL MOISTURE PROFILES THROUGH THE DAY SHOW
MOISTURE CONFINED BELOW 850 MB WITH VERY DRY AIR ABOVE...SO LITTLE
IF ANY PRECIP IS EXPECTED AS THE SURFACE FRONT MOVES THROUGH DURING
THE DAY. WILL CARRY SOME LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN SUNDAY IN
NORTHERN AREAS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
LOW CONFIDENCE FORECAST THIS EXTENDED. COLD CORE UPPER LOW LAGS 
BEHIND COLD FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AND MOVES EAST ALONG THE 
TN/KY BORDER. ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS FOR THOSE PERIODS. WITH
FREEZING LEVEL LOWERING TO BELOW 4000 FEET SOME SNOW COULD ALSO FALL 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. LOW 
TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY DROP TO THE LOWER TO MID 30S IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND NE. DO NOT EXPECT ANY ACCUMULATIONS. HIGHER PRESSURE 
TAKES CONTROL MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH TUESDAY THE 
DRIEST AND SUNNIEST DAY OF THE WEEK. FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY 
THE NW FLOW PATTERN BRINGS A FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY DROPPING TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES. THEN 
FRIDAY ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM 
APPROACHES SATURDAY BUT KEPT THAT DAY DRY FOR NOW. STILL 
TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL WITH HIGHS NEAR 50 AND LOWS AROUND 
FREEZING. HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NE SECTIONS COULD SEE A LITTLE SNOW 
AND RAIN LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY AND THEN AGAIN 
EARLY FRIDAY.          

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  62  40  57  33 / 100  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  56  38  53  32 / 100  10  20  10  10

TN/KY BORDER. ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS FOR THOSE PERIODS. WITH
FREEZING LEVEL LOWERING TO BELOW 4000 FEET SOME SNOW COULD ALSO FALL 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. LOW 
TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY DROP TO THE LOWER TO MID 30S IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND NE. DO NOT EXPECT ANY ACCUMULATIONS. HIGHER PRESSURE 
TAKES CONTROL MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH TUESDAY THE 
DRIEST AND SUNNIEST DAY OF THE WEEK. FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY 
THE NW FLOW PATTERN BRINGS A FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY DROPPING TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES. THEN 
FRIDAY ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM 
APPROACHES SATURDAY BUT KEPT THAT DAY DRY FOR NOW. STILL 
TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL WITH HIGHS NEAR 50 AND LOWS AROUND 
FREEZING. HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NE SECTIONS COULD SEE A LITTLE SNOW 
AND RAIN LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY AND THEN AGAIN 
EARLY FRIDAY.          

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  62  40  57  33 / 100  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  56  38  53  32 / 100  10  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  55  38  53  31 /  90  10  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              46  53  34  51  28 / 100  40  20  10  10

HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE LOCATION OF THIS PRECIP...AND SHOWS IT
NEAR OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES BY 18Z. GIVEN THE SW-NE ORIENTATION OF
THE LINE...MOST PRECIP WILL BE IN NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. WILL MAKE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO POP/WX GRIDS
TO BETTER MATCH THESE TRENDS. SLIGHT DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENTS WILL ALSO
BE MADE TO TEMPERATURES TO MATCH LATEST GUIDANCE.

DEPICTION OF EXPECTED WEATHER THROUGH ABOUT MID WEEK. STAYED WITH 
THE LINGERING SHOWERS CONCEPT ON SUNDAY AS TRAILING UPPER LOW BUILDS 
EAST FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 
12Z MONDAY. PREFERRING THE FASTER GFS SCENARIO OVER THE ECMWF 
ENABLES PRECIP TO WRAP UP LATER SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A NICE TWO DAY DRY 
PERIOD MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. THE NEXT FEATURE TO IMPACT THE REGION 
MAY BE A QUICK MOVING SHORT WAVE WHICH COULD BRING A PERIOD OF LIGHT 
SHOWERS TO THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY. KEPT 
THURSDAY DRY BUT ADDED A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS HIGHER TERRAIN THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS A BROAD UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE ON FRIDAY. STAYED RELATIVELY 
CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST FRI FEB 3 2012

.DISCUSSION...RAIN CURRENTLY UPSTREAM SHOULD CONTINUE SPREAD TO INTO 
OUR CWA FROM THE SOUTHWEST TONIGHT. CURRENT RAIN CHANCES LOOK 
REASONABLE. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEAR ON 
TRACK. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A WARM FRONT LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL MS TO SOUTHERN GA TODAY WILL 
SLOWLY LIFT NORTHWARD TONIGHT. ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THIS FRONT WILL 
RESULT IN INCREASING RAIN CHANCES THROUGH THE NIGHT. RAIN SHOULD BE 
LIGHT MOST OF THE NIGHT...BUT BECOME HEAVIER LATE AND ON SATURDAY 
MORNING AS THE LLJ STRENGTHENS TO AROUND 30 KTS AND ISENTROPIC LIFT 
AT THE 300K LEVEL IS MAXIMIZED. THERE MAY BE A BRIEF LULL IN THE 
RAIN IN THE AFTERNOON...BUT LIFT PICKS UP AGAIN BY SATURDAY EVENING 
AS UPPER DIVERGENCE INCREASES AND THE SURFACE LOW MOVES ALONG THE 
TN/KY BORDER. WITH GOOD MODEL AGREEMENT FOR THIS EVENT...WILL HAVE 
CATEGORICAL POPS COMING INTO SOUTHERN AREAS LATE TONIGHT...THEN 
SPREADING TO ALL AREAS THROUGH SATURDAY AND SATURDAY EVENING. 
WEAKENING LIFT AND MIDLEVEL DRYING WILL DIMINISH POPS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. THE MID-UPPER POSITIVELY-TILTED TROUGH AXIS LAGS BEHIND 
AND DOES NOT MOVE THROUGH THE AREA UNTIL LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON...SO 
WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF PRECIP GOING THROUGH SUNDAY. TEMPS MAY BEGIN 
TO FALL SUNDAY AFTERNOON BEHIND THE PASSAGE OF THE SURFACE COLD 
FRONT. WITH THE EXPECTED RAIN AND CLOUD COVER...WILL GO SLIGHTLY 
BELOW MOS FOR HIGH TEMPS AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE MOS FOR LOW TEMPS 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND COLD FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT WITH 
CLEARING SKIES AND COLDER LOWS THOUGH STILL ABOVE NORMAL. CANADIAN 
AND ECMWF SLOWER THAN GFS KEEPING CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION 
SUNDAY EVENING. WILL GO WITH FASTER GFS AND KEEP SUNDAY NIGHT DRY. 
LARGE SURFACE HIGH OVER THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN AND PLAINS STATES SETTLES 
OVER THE SE STATES MONDAY. THIS HIGH SHIFTS EAST BY WEDNESDAY 
EVENING. WEAK SYSTEM MOVES EAST THROUGH NW FLOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
INTRODUCED CHANCE OF RAIN POSSIBLY SNOW MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
THURSDAY CLEARING BEHIND THIS SYSTEM THEN AN OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO 
THE SOUTH IS PICKED UP BY LOW PRESSURE OVER THE GULF THAT MOVES NE 
ONSHORE AND THEN SOUTH AND EAST OF THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY. SLIGHT 
CHANCE SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE OF SHOWERS FRIDAY.

SLOWLY SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A MOISTURE LADEN SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE 
OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO IN ADVANCE OF THE ASSOCIATED SLOWLY MOVING 
SURFACE LOW. THE LOW WILL BE IN THE OZARKS REGION TO START THE DAY 
SATURDAY AND WILL MOVE TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 12Z SUNDAY. 
THE WARM AND MOIST AIR WILL BE LIFTED ISENTROPICALLY ACROSS THE 
REGION FOR CATEGORICAL POPS IN SHOWERS ON SATURDAY AND THE MODELS 
SHOW LIFTED INDICES APPROACH OR GO SLIGHTLY NEGATIVE BY SATURDAY 
NIGHT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM COLD FRONT SO KEPT CATEGORICAL POP FOR 
SHOWERS IN PLACE ALONG WITH A CHANCE FOR CONVECTION. WEAK UPPER 
LEVEL LOW PRESSURE APPEARS LIKE IT MAY HANG BACK OVER THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SUNDAY SLOWING THE ADVANCE OF THE 85H TROUGH 
AND SURFACE LOW WHICH MAY MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS DURING THE 
DAY. THEREFORE...HELD ONTO CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS ON SUNDAY AND 
THEN BRING AN END TO THE RAIN MOST OF THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT. 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE LOWERS DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM 
WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE ARRIVING A LITTLE EARLIER THAN PREVIOUS 
FORECAST SUGGESTED...PERHAPS ON WEDNESDAY. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT 
THIS TIME RANGE JUST MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS ON 
THURSDAY. TRENDED THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST TOWARD THE NEW MEX MOS 
HOWEVER...DID UNDERCUT MAX TEMPS ON SUNDAY BY SEVERAL DEGREES WITH 
MEDIUM RAIN CHANCE ALONG WITH SOME COLD AIR ADVECTION.

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

DOMINATE THE FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY. DRIER DEWPOINTS WILL CONTINUE

THE RIDGE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY...BUT OVERALL MOSTLY 
SUNNY/PARTLY SUNNY FORECAST.

BEGIN TO SHIFT EAST FRIDAY NIGHT AS LOW PRESSURE IN THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS HEADS FOR THE MS AND LOWER OHIO VALLEYS. A WARM FRONT MOVING 
NORTHEAST FROM AL WILL REACH THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY. RAIN 
WILL SPREAD FROM SW TO NE LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. INCREASED 
INSTABILITY SATURDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE LOW PRESSURE AREA BRINGS A 
CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS. LATE SATURDAY NIGHT OR EARLY SUNDAY THE 
LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL BE OVER EAST TN. SHORT RANGE MODELS TRY TO 
DEVELOP A WAVE ALONG FRONT TO THE SOUTH SUNDAY INTO MONDAY SO WILL 
KEEP SHOWERS IN THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY BUT THE BULK OF 
THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD FALL SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. MONDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR DRY WEATHER AND 
A WEAK SYSTEM THURSDAY SHOULD INCREASE CLOUD COVER WITH A FEW 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING. MILD TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE WITH TEMPERATURES 
STAYING MOSTLY FREEZING OR ABOVE AT NIGHT AND 50S TO LOWER 60S 
DURING THE DAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EST THU FEB 2 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL 
DOMINATE THE FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY. DRIER DEWPOINTS WILL CONTINUE 
TO ADVECT INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT WHICH WILL LIMIT FOG 
CHANCES EVEN THOUGH CLEAR SKY AND CALM WINDS ARE ANTICIPATED. FOR 
FRIDAY...SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA...BUT UPPER RIDGE 
WILL CONTINUE WITH UNSEASONABLY MILD TEMPERATURES ANTICIPATED.

MODELS DO SHOW A GOOD DEAL OF HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS SPILLING OVER 
THE RIDGE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY...BUT OVERALL MOSTLY 
SUNNY/PARTLY SUNNY FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BEGIN TO SHIFT EAST FRIDAY NIGHT AS LOW PRESSURE IN THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS HEADS FOR THE MS AND LOWER OHIO VALLEYS. A WARM FRONT MOVING 
NORTHEAST FROM AL WILL REACH THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY. RAIN 
WILL SPREAD FROM SW TO NE LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. INCREASED 
INSTABILITY SATURDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE LOW PRESSURE AREA BRINGS A 
CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS. LATE SATURDAY NIGHT OR EARLY SUNDAY THE 
LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL BE OVER EAST TN. SHORT RANGE MODELS TRY TO 
DEVELOP A WAVE ALONG FRONT TO THE SOUTH SUNDAY INTO MONDAY SO WILL 
KEEP SHOWERS IN THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY BUT THE BULK OF 
THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD FALL SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. MONDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR DRY WEATHER AND 
A WEAK SYSTEM THURSDAY SHOULD INCREASE CLOUD COVER WITH A FEW 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING. MILD TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE WITH TEMPERATURES 
STAYING MOSTLY FREEZING OR ABOVE AT NIGHT AND 50S TO LOWER 60S 
DURING THE DAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EST THU FEB 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH IS
EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION THIS MORNING SO WILL KEEP THE RAIN
CHANCES FOR THE MORNING AND GENERALLY FOR THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE CWA. DENSE FOG REPORTS ARE ISOLATED SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION
IN THE NOWCAST AND NOT GO FOR AN ADVISORY. DRY WEATHER RETURNS
TONIGHT. MORE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED AGAIN TODAY AND
TONIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE...SO STAYED
RELATIVELY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS HAVE COME INTO
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE
EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN FEATURE BEING THE SLOW EASTWARD
PROGRESSION OF A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY
ON SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. MOISTURE IS PROGGED TO INCREASE RAPIDLY
OVER THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING WARM
FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. THIS WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO
THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...WITH SHOWERS BECOMING LIKELY AS
CONVECTION MOVES EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ALONG THIS
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE LOCAL AIR MASS WILL BE
FAIRLY STABLE...SO WILL NOT MENTION ANY THUNDER FOR NOW...BUT LATER
FORECASTS MAY NEED TO ADD THUNDER FOR SATURDAY OR SATURDAY NIGHT
DUE TO THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME ELEVATED CONVECTION. LATEST ECMWF
MODEL RUN APPEARS TO BE COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE GFS
MODEL FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...AND INDICATE THAT THE COLD FRONT
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL PASS THROUGH THE
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY MORNING...WITH SOME POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS
LINGERING INTO MONDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE
FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS
WITHOUT MUCH OF A COOL DOWN. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE CLOSE
TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS AND REVEAL A CONTINUATION OF ABOVE NORMAL
CONDITIONS THROUGH AT LEAST THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
222 PM EST WED FEB 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
A MID-UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA THIS
EVENING. MOST OF THE RAIN IS EXPECTED TO BE EAST OF THE AREA BY
AROUND MIDNIGHT AS LIFT MOVES OUT AND MIDLEVEL DRY AIR BUILDS IN.
HOWEVER THE SURFACE COLD FRONT IS LAGGING WELL BEHIND THE
TROUGH...AND IS CURRENTLY POSITIONED FROM THE OZARKS TO JUST NORTH
OF THE OHIO VALLEY. FROPA IS NOT EXPECTED UNTIL AFTER 12Z...SO LOW
CLOUDS AND FOG ARE EXPECTED TO LINGER OVERNIGHT. TEMPS AND
DEWPOINTS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO FALL VERY MUCH FROM CURRENT OBSERVED
VALUES OVERNIGHT. WILL ALSO KEEP A CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP
GOING LATE TONIGHT AND TOMORROW MORNING UNTIL THE FRONTAL PASSAGE.
BY AFTERNOON...WE SHOULD SEE CLEAR SKIES. COLD ADVECTION IS VERY
WEAK BEHIND THE FRONT AS THE UPPER JET STAYS WELL NORTH...SO TEMPS
WILL CONTINUE TO BE WELL ABOVE NORMAL...REACHING THE 60S ACROSS
MOST OF THE TN VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY FOR
QUIET...SEASONALLY WARM CONDITIONS. THE MAIN SYSTEM OF THE EXTENDED
WILL BEGIN TO PULL IN SHOWERS LATE FRIDAY NIGHT WITH THE MAIN BAND
OF RAIN SHOWERS MOVING THROUGH ON SATURDAY. MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE
BY SUNDAY AND CONFIDENCE FALLS. WILL KEEP 20 TO 30 POPS FOR
SUNDAY...BUT MAIN QUESTION IS...WILL THE SYSTEM EXIT THE AREA BY
MONDAY OR WILL A SECOND ROUND OF SHOWERS TRACK INTO THE AREA. HAVE
COMPROMISED FOR NOW AND HAVE MAINLY LOW POPS IN PLACE FOR MONDAY.
HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD BUILD BACK IN FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.
OVERALL... TEMPERATURES REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL AND STAYED NEAR
GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 010858
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
358 AM EST WED FEB 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FRONT EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH
THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. RADAR INDICATING A FEW ECHOES TO THE
WEST ASSOCIATED WITH THE DISTURBANCE. IT SHOULD INCREASE IN
COVERAGE BY THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH. WILL
KEEP THE LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL CHANCES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. NO
FLOODING IS ANTICIPATED. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABOVE NORMAL
AGAIN...STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT
THEN REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. AFTER SOME
LIGHT MORNING SHOWERS OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA ON
THURSDAY MORNING...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE OHIO AND TN RIVER
VALLEYS THROUGH FRIDAY. MOISTURE INCREASES RAPIDLY FRIDAY NIGHT
FROM THE DEEP SOUTH...AS SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF AN
APPROACHING WARM FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE OZARKS REGION ON SATURDAY...AND THEN
ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY NIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT THAT SHOWERS WILL BECOME LIKELY SATURDAY OVER THE
FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT A CUT-
OFF UPPER- LEVEL LOW OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL DRIFT ACROSS THE
TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...TRIGGERING SOME LINGERING SHOWERS OVER
THE FORECAST AREA. THE GFS MODEL THEN BRINGS HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY
CONDITIONS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.
HOWEVER...THE ECMWF MODEL KEEPS THE CUT-OFF UPPER LOW WELL NORTH OF
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SUNDAY...WITH A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW
BRINGING SIGNIFICANT AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE FROM SOUTH TEXAS BACK
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY. SINCE BOTH MODELS HAVE BEEN
CONSISTENT WITH THEIR DIVERGING SOLUTIONS...WILL COMPROMISE FOR NOW
BY MENTIONING A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON MONDAY. AS FOR
TEMPS... WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE CLOSE TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS AND
REVEAL A CONTINUATION OF ABOVE NORMAL CONDITIONS THROUGH EARLY NEXT
WEEK.

SYSTEM WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA EARLY THURSDAY WITH CLEARING SKY.

WILL REMAIN.

LOW WILL MEANDER NE FROM THE FOUR CORNERS AREA. STRENGTH AND 
POSITION OF LOW UNCERTAIN THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. UPPER 
DIVERGENCE...ISENTROPIC LIFT AND AVAILABLE MOISTURE WILL RESULT IN A 
SERIES OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE SOUTH...TENNESSEE VALLEY AND THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH SUNDAY.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL LIKELY 
BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST BY LATE SUNDAY. CONDITIONS SHOULD 
BE DRIER INTO NEXT WEEK. AGAIN...POSITION OF UPPER LOW/TROUGHING 
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY REMAINS IN QUESTION. WILL BASE FORECAST ON A 
DRIER SOLUTION BANKING ON MOST WRAP AROUND ACTIVITY TO STAY NORTH OF 
THE AREA. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE.

INJECTION OF DEEP MOISTURE THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY IN ADVANCE

SLOWLY EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE ON SUNDAY/EARLY MONDAY.

UNDERDONE. WARM TEMPERATURES CONTINUE WITH NEXT PROMISE OF SUB ZERO 
850 MB TEMPS NEXT WEEK.

TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS ANTICIPATED AS A COLD FRONT MOVE ACROSS THE REGION SATURDAY.

BEST GULF MOISTURE SOUTH OF THE AREA...BUT BEARS WATCHING FOR 
CHANCES OF THUNDER. GFS AND ECMWF CONTINUE TO SHOW SOME DIFFERENCES 
ON EXACT PATH AND STRENGTH OF THE SYSTEM. COLDER AIR WILL SPILL IN 
BEHIND FROPA WITH PRECIPITATION MIXING WITH OR CHANGING TO SNOW...

MIXING IN LATER FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING IN THE HIGHER

AT ANOTHER CLIPPER DROPPING INTO THE REGION SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY 
NIGHT SO HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIP RIGHT THROUGH 12Z 
SUNDAY WITH SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWFA BY

SLIGHT INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS AND BREEZY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS IN THE 
AFTERNOON. OVERALL...VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE TAF 
PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES.
&&

NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

835 
FXUS64 KMRX 290751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EST SUN JAN 29 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...WITH A COLD FRONT 
OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THE 
MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE WITH THIS FRONT WILL BE VERY LIMITED. 
THUS...EXPECT THIS COLD FRONT TO BRING JUST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN 
HIGH CLOUDS...AND BREEZY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS IN THE AFTERNOON. HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH TONIGHT...BRINGING 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...NAM AND GFS NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE AND WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL START THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH 
DRY CONDITIONS.  AN UPPER TROUGH DRIVING SOUTH OUT OF CANADA INTO 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES WILL BE THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER. AS 
SURFACE RIDGING IN THE GULF MOVES EAST...RETURN FLOW OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL PULL MOISTURE NORTH INTO INCOMING SHORT-WAVE 
TROUGH. SHOWERS WILL BREAK OUT ACROSS THE PLAINS TOWARD THE OHIO 
VALLEY/GREAT LAKES TUESDAY. ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR WEDNESDAY WITH A RETURN CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS.

FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...A GREAT DEAL OF MODELS DIFFERENCE IS 
NOTED WITH TIMING OF ADDITIONAL SHORT-WAVE DIVING ACROSS THE PLAINS 
STATES TOWARD THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS. TIMING OF THESE WAVES IS 
ALL OVER THE PLACE MAKING FORECAST OF BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION 
DIFFICULT WITH LOW CONFIDENCE. HOWEVER...ALL MODELS SHOW A PATTER 
CHANGE BY NEXT WEEK WITH A LARGE SCALE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION WITH MUCH COLDER AIR SPILLING INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. HAVE UNDER-CUT GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES FOR LATE IN THE 
PERIOD...BUT COULD BE EVEN COLDER IF MODELS VERIFY.

ALSO...TIMING OF INDIVIDUAL WAVES DIVING INTO LONG-WAVE TROUGH COULD 
SET THE STAGE FOR SNOW...ESPECIALLY FOR THE MOUNTAINS...NEXT WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

002 
FXUS64 KMRX 282027
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EST SAT JAN 28 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...RAPID CLEARING BEHIND THE
EXITING COLD FRONT WITH MUCH LOWER DEW POINT TEMPS UPSTREAM.
CLEARING SKIES AND DECREASING WINDS OVERNIGHT FAVOR THE COOLER MOS
MINS. WON'T FORECAST ANY PATCHY FOG SINCE THE BRISK WESTERLY WINDS
KICKED IN THIS AFTERNOON TO DRY THINGS OUT.

ANOTHER FAST MOVING CLIPPER TYPE SHORTWAVE MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT
LAKES AND SRN OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY...BUT THIS ONE IS MUCH TOO FAR
NORTH TO REALLY AFFECT US VERY MUCH. HOWEVER...I DID KEEP NRN AREAS
CLOSER TO THE COOLER MOS MAX TEMPS ON SUNDAY. MIDNIGHT SHIFT COULD
AT LEAST CONSIDER A POSSIBLE WIND ADVISORY FOR OUR HIGHEST TERRAIN
AREAS...BUT I THINK MOST GUSTS WILL STAY BELOW 40 MPH. 

MINIMUM RH VALUES FALL WELL BELOW 20 PERCENT SUNDAY AFTERNOON WITH
SOME SUSTAINED WIND SPEEDS 20 MPH OR GREATER. HOWEVER...FUEL
MOISTURES SHOULD STILL BE ON THE WET SIDE IN NEARLY ALL AREAS. PER
COORDINATION WITH GSP...I CONTACTED OUR SW NC FIRE WEATHER FOLKS...
AND I WILL ALSO ISSUE A FIRE DANGER STATEMENT FOR THOSE DISTRICTS
IN LINE WITH GSP AND RAH PLANS. 

FOR THE LATER PERIODS...UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL...WHILE THE
SURFACE RIDGE SETTLES OVER THE SE STATES SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.
SOUTHWEST FLOW ON BACK SIDE OF THE SURFACE RIDGE BRINGS EVEN WARMER
TEMPS...SO SORRY FOR ANYONE THAT HAS BEEN SEEKING SNOW THIS WINTER. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS STILL HAVING 
DIFFICULTY IN THE LONGER TERM PERIOD WITH LITTLE AGREEMENT 
ESPECIALLY FROM THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. WAS ABLE TO KEEP MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY DRY. NEXT WEAK SHORT WAVE PUSHES EAST ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES INTO SOUTHEASTERN CANADA DRIVING A FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SLOWLY SOUTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY 12Z WEDNESDAY AND THEN THE 
BOUNDARY SLIPS CLOSER TO THE AREA LATER IN THE DAY. SOME QUESTION AS 
TO HOW MUCH RAIN MAY OCCUR ON WEDNESDAY AND SO STAYED WITH MAINLY 30 
PERCENT POPS DURING THE DAY WHILE INCREASING TO 40 PERCENT WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. A TRAILING SHORT WAVELENGTH TROUGH PRESSES INTO 
THE APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THIS PERIOD WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE 
LOW PRESSURE FINALLY DRAGGING COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS IN DISAGREEMENT BUT MAINTAINED A DRY FRIDAY 
AND APPLIED SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS SATURDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WITH ECMWF DEPICTING UPPER TROUGH DESCENDING 
SOUTH THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. LATER MODEL 
RUNS WILL CERTAINLY BRING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST INTO BETTER 
FOCUS.

FXUS64 KMRX 280745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EST SAT JAN 28 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH A DRY AND SEASONABLY COOL AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY TODAY...BRINGING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND BREEZY WINDS. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH THIS 
FRONT...SO WILL MENTION ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS OVER THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD 
ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH TONIGHT...BRINGING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND 
LIGHT WINDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS 
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS 
THE GREAT LAKES WILL START THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT DYNAMICS AND 
MOISTURE FROM THIS SYSTEM WILL BE MAINLY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
A DRY START IS EXPECTED FOR SUNDAY. UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE 
NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH UPPER FLOW OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
BECOMING MORE WEST TO SOUTHWEST ALLOWING FOR A WARM-UP INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. SURFACE RIDING INTO THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL KEEP 
THE AIR-MASS DRY THROUGH TUESDAY. 

BY LATE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE NATION WITH MOISTURE STREAMING NORTH AROUND 
THE BACK SIDE OF RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE SOUTHEAST 
UNITED STATES. MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE OVER THE TENNESSEE 
AND OHIO VALLEYS MID-WEEK. GULF MOISTURE WILL POOL ALONG A COLD 
FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH FROM UPPER TROUGH. THIS FRONT ALONG WITH 
RETURN OF MOISTURE WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THURSDAY. GFS AND ECMWF HAVE SOME DISAGREEMENT IN REGARD TO THE 
STRENGTH OF A SHORT-WAVE ROTATING SOUTHEAST FROM THE UPPER TROUGH 
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. THE ECMWF IS STRONGER AND GFS IS WEAKER. 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON STRENGTH OF SYSTEM...BUT WILL CALL FOR BOUNDARY 
AND ASSOCIATED MOISTURE TO PULL SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT WITH DRIER AIR BY FRIDAY.

819 
FXUS64 KMRX 272016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST FRI JAN 27 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN FEATURE TO AFFECT OUR
FORECAST FOR TONIGHT IS THE AMOUNT OF LINGERING CLOUDS. THE LATEST
VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS SHOW CLOUDS HOLDING NORTH OF I-40 INCLUDING
BULK OF NE TN AND SW VA. THESE LINGERING CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO
DECREASE THIS EVENING...AND PERHAPS AT LEAST BRIEFLY CLEAR OUT...
BEFORE CLOUDS INCREASE LATE TONIGHT WITH THE UPSTREAM SHORTWAVE
AND WEAK COLD FRONT. I KEPT MIN TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE GFS MOS
DUE TO LIGHT WINDS AND THE POTENTIAL CLOUDS.

WEAK FRONT ON SATURDAY SHOULD PRODUCE JUST TRACE AMOUNTS OF PCPN...
SO I KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS WHERE LOW POPS OR
SPRINKLE/FLURRY WORDING WAS USED. DECREASED SKY COVER OVER SE TN
AND SW NC TO BETTER MESH WITH OUR SRN NWS NEIGHBORS. REINFORCEMENT
OF COOL AIR FAVORS COOLER MOS HIGHS OVER SW VA/NE TN AND MILDER
HIGHS SE TN/SW NC.

OTHERWISE...MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH
SOME CHILLY MINS SAT NIGHT...THEN A BIT ABOVE CLIMO ON SUNDAY MAXES.
VERY LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES MADE FOR THOSE 2 PERIODS.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE PERIOD BEGINS WITH
AN EXITING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. HEIGHTS BUILD ALL THE WAY THROUGH
TUESDAY HOWEVER...NEXT LOW AMPLITUDE SHORT WAVE MAKES ITS WAY
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES ON WEDNESDAY WHILE DRAGGING A COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE FINAL TWO DAYS OF THE
EXTENDED FORECAST GET A BIT MURKY WITH LITTLE AGREEMENT IN EXTENDED
MODELS. WENT WITH THE HPC IDEA OF STALLING THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
JUST EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS AWAITING A TRAILING SHORT WAVELENGTH
FEATURE WHICH WILL KEEP SOME SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST ON THURSDAY.
IN THIS SCENARIO FRIDAY ENDS UP WITH DRY COLD ADVECTION. WENT A
LITTLE ABOVE THE COLDER MEX MOS GUIDANCE THROUGH FIRST HALF OF THE
PERIOD AND STAYED CLOSE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A
