WEAK COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EASTWARD TODAY...WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY BEHIND IT. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT SOME LINGERING SHOWERS THIS MORNING WILL 
GRADUALLY DIMINISH BY THE AFTERNOON. CLOUDS SHOULD ALSO GRADUALLY 
DECREASE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT SOME ADDITIONAL HIGH CLOUDS AHEAD OF 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL LIKELY RETURN BY TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS... 
NAM AND GFS NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT WILL START THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH A SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS 
THE GREAT LAKES ON SATURDAY. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY MORNING WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW 
SHOWERS OR SPRINKLES VALLEY. THE FRONT MOVES EAST QUICKLY. ANOTHER 
SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVES QUICKLY BACK INTO THE GREAT LAKES FOR 
SUNDAY...BUT WILL HAVE LITTLE EFFECT ON THE FORECAST AREA.

THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES/NORTHEAST MOVES EAST ALLOWING 
THE FLOW TO BECOME MORE WEST THAN SOUTHWEST INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
GFS AND ECMWF DIVERGE ON MOVEMENT OF NEXT SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS 
THE ROCKIES THEN INTO THE PLAINS. THE GFS HAS MORE OF A SOUTHERN 
ROUTE WHILE THE ECMWF IS FARTHER SOUTH. WILL TREND TOWARD THE GFS 
FOR NOW...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW. WILL CALL FOR INCREASING CLOUDS AND 
CHANCES OF SHOWERS FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENTLY LOW PRESSURE WAS OVER

MORNING. TEMPERATURES WERE IN THE MILD MID 40S TO MID 50S EXCEPT A
FEW UPPER 30S EXTREME NE TN VALLEYS AND NEAR 60 OVER SW NC. FOR THE
NEXT 24 HOURS LOW PRESSURE WILL SLIDE NE INTO THE OHIO AND TN
VALLEYS WITH A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS
EVENING AND THEN MOVING EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY ABOUT 12Z
FRIDAY. WARM AIR AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES MILD
TODAY AND MODEL TRENDS ARE DELAYING THE START OF THE MORE STEADY
RAINFALL UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON. AREA RIVERS ARE STILL FALLING SLOWLY
BUT LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IS POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL SYSTEM
TONIGHT. HOWEVER...AVERAGE RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ABOUT ONE INCH WITH
LOCAL AMOUNTS UP TO TWO INCHES ARE EXPECTED TO ONLY BRING RIVERS UP
TO NEAR BANK FULL. THIS IS SIMILAR TO LEVELS FROM THE LAST SYSTEM.
LOCALIZED FLOODING IN URBAN AREAS COULD DEVELOP THIS EVENING BUT
THE HEAVIER RAINFALL IS NOT EXPECTED TO BE LONG ENOUGH TO CAUSE
SIGNIFICANT FLOODING. SLIGHT INSTABILITY WILL ALLOW ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. STRONG
SOUTHWEST WINDS ARE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH WIND GUSTS TO 35 MPH POSSIBLE...JUST BELOW
ADVISORY LEVELS. LATE TONIGHT RAIN CHANCES WILL LOWER AS THE FRONT
MOVES EAST. LOWS WILL STILL BE MILD IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LIGHT SHOWERS ACTIVITY AND 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE CONTINUES EARLY FRIDAY AS UPPER TROUGH AXIS 
EXITS THE AREA. HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. 
BROAD UPPER TROUGHING OVER THE NORTHERN U.S. WITH STRENGTHENING JET 
SEGMENT OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SATURDAY. LIMITED MOISTURE 
BUT A FEW SPRINKLES POSSIBLE SATURDAY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS. UPPER 
TROUGHING DIGS INTO THE TN VALLEY SUNDAY WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVING EAST ACROSS THE AREA. MIN TEMPERATURES COOL TO NEAR NORMAL 
SUN AND MON MORNING. SURFACE RIDGE CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST NEXT WEEK 
ALLOWING ANOTHER WARMING TREND. NEXT COLD FRONT AND BEST 
PRECIPITATION EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY.

STREAM SHORTWAVE AND SRN PLAINS UPPER LOW ON THURSDAY TO THURSDAY
NIGHT. THIS SHOULD SWEEP THE ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH AND FRONT
THROUGH BEFORE 12Z FRIDAY...WHICH MAY VERY WELL LEAVE FRIDAY DRY. 
FLOW FROM 925 TO 850 MBS DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE STRONGLY UPSLOPE...
BUT FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT QPF IS LIKELY FROM LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON
THROUGH 06Z FRIDAY...SO I ADDED LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE AND
KEPT RAIN AMOUNTS UP TO A MAX OF AROUND 1.5 INCHES FOR SE TN AND SW
NC FOR THIS EVENT. THERE IS SOME SLIGHT INSTABILITY BY THURSDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...POSSIBLY ELEVATED IN NATURE AS WARM FRONT
AND/OR OCCLUDED FRONT PASSES THROUGH.

OTHERWISE...LATER SHIFTS MAY VERY WELL BE ABLE TO DROP POPS ON
FRIDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO SIMILAR NAM/GFS MOS TEMPS ALL PERIODS...
AND ONLY WENT ABOVE MOS POPS FOR LATE TONIGHT (CLOSE TO MOS FOR ALL
OTHER PERIODS).


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE REGION PROVIDING A SMALL CHANCE FOR SNOW ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT IN THE NORTHERN AREAS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. A FRONT ENTERS THE REGION BRINGING A 
CHANCE FOR RAIN ON WEDNESDAY. WILL KEEP LOW CHANCES FOR NOW. STAYED 
NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

COAST WILL RETREAT NORTHWARD AND PATCHY LIGHT RAIN WHICH WAS
ALREADY DEVELOPING OVER EASTERN AR...WEST TN AND NORTHERN MS WILL
BE POSSIBLE BY LATE AFTERNOON ACROSS SE TN. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL
AGAIN BE MILD IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. TONIGHT THE LOW
PRESSURE AREA MOVES INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY WITH THE WARM FRONT
MOVING INTO WEST TN AND NORTH GA. SKIES SHOULD BECOME CLOUDY WITH A
LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF RAIN AND LOWS IN THE 40S. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...BELOW NORMAL CONFIDENCE IN 
EXTENDED. NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE NORTH 
CENTRAL U.S EARLY IN THE PERIOD. CUT OFF LOW MOVING NORTHEAST FROM 
EAST TX. LONG FETCHING SURFACE LOW WILL DEVELOP FROM NORTHERN GULF OF 
MEXICO THROUGH THE TN VALLEY TO THE OH VALLEY. GOOD MOISTURE 
ADVECTION ALONG AND EAST OF DEVELOPING LOW. PHASING OF THE UPPER 
SYSTEMS REMAINS IN QUESTION WHILE INCREASE IN LAYER MOISTURE IS 
IMPRESSIVE. WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM. THIS ACTIVITY WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE MRX CWA BY THU 
AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE INTO EARLY FRIDAY. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES 
ARE 2 STANDARD DEVIATIONS ABOVE NORMAL. MODEL SOUNDINGS DEPICT 
SKINNY CAPE AND WARM PROCESS RAINFALL WHICH SHOULD BECOME HEAVY AT 
TIMES. FAVORABLE CONDITIONS FOR LOCALIZED FLOODING BEGINNING TO SET 
UP BUT UNCERTAINTY IN THE PHASING OF THE UPPER SYSTEMS LEADS TO 
ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY TO HOLD OFF ON FLOOD WATCH. SHORT WAVE ENERGY IN 
NW UPPER FLOW KEEPS PRECIPITATION CHANCE GOING FRIDAY DESPITE 
SURFACE RIDGING BUILDING NE THROUGH THE TN VALLEY. CONDITIONS DRY 
OUT FOR SAT WHILE TEMPS REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL. WEAK SYSTEM IN NW UPPER 
FLOW MOVES ACROSS NORTHERN AREA SAT NT/EARLY SUNDAY. AVAILABLE 
MOISTURE IN QUESTION BUT TEMP PROFILE SUPPORTS LIGHT FLURRIES AND 
SNOW NE TN/SW VA AND SMOKIES BY SUNDAY MORNING. BROAD UPPER 
TROUGHING DOWN INTO THE TN VALLEY BEGINS TO FLATTEN INTO NEXT WEEK. 
DRY CONDITIONS AS SURFACE RIDGE MOVES NORTHEAST THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. NEXT PRECIPITATION CHANCE TUESDAY NIGHT. BLENDED WARM 
GFS AND COOLER HPC NUMBERS FOR TEMPS.  
&&

389 
FXUS64 KMRX 241955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST TUE JAN 24 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A STORM SYSTEM WILL BREW
OVER THE BIG BEND OF TEXAS TONIGHT...TAPPING GULF AND SUBTROPICAL
MOISTURE AS IT MOVES EAST. THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THAT SYSTEM...WHICH
WILL BE A CLOSED LOW...WILL DRAG OUT THE RAIN EVENT ACROSS OUR
AREA...WITH THE HEAVIEST HOLDING OFF UNTIL THE LONG TERM /DISCUSSED
BELOW/. UNTIL THEN...A FAIR NIGHT TONIGHT WILL SURRENDER TO INCREASING
CLOUDINESS WEDNESDAY MORNING...AND LIGHT RAIN WILL BEGIN TO
INFILTRATE THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE WEST AROUND THE NOON HOUR.
NOT EXPECTING MUCH ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER THROUGH SUNDOWN
WEDNESDAY...MAYBE A SPRINKLE OR TWO IF THAT. TEMPERATURES WILL
CONTINUE THEIR MILD REGIME AND WINDS WILL BE FAIRLY LIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS SHOW AN 
UPPER TROUGH MOVING EAST OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE GULF 
COASTS STATES WITH A NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT FROM NORTHERN STREAM 
WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY. NORTHERN STREAM JET 
COMBINED WITH THE SOUTHERN STREAM JET WILL PLACE THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY UNDER FAVORED UPPER DIVERGENCE. FAIRLY DECENT FRONTO-GENETIC 
FORCING ALONG WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTHERN SHORT-WAVE 
WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS/RAIN OVER THE AREA THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT.

THERE ARE SOME FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT MODEL DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS 
AND NAM/ECMWF SOLUTION. THE GFS SHOWS MUCH LESS PHASING BETWEEN THE 
NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN JET SHORT-WAVES/JETS. THIS ALLOWS THE GULF 
SHORT-WAVE TO MOVE SLOWER AND PRODUCE MUCH MORE RAINFALL ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. I HAVE LOW CONFIDENCE IN GFS SOLUTION SINCE 
THE PREVIOUS MODELS RUNS TRENDED TOWARD THE CURRENT NAM/ECMWF 
SOLUTION.  WILL TREND FORECAST TOWARD THE ECMWF WHICH SHOWS A MORE 
PROGRESSIVE MOVEMENT. WILL END RAIN CHANCES FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...MODELS SHOW UPPER FLOW 
BECOMING MORE WEST WITH A SERIES OF WEAK NORTHERN STREAM WAVES FOR 
THE WEEKEND. WILL KEEP WEATHER DRY UNTIL TUESDAY AS ANOTHER SOUTHERN 
STREAM WAVE MAY MOVE INTO REGION BY LATE IN THE EXTENDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST MON JAN 23 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WITH THE MAIN WEATHER NOW 
OFF TO OUR EAST...WE ARE ONLY AWAITING THE COLD FRONT TO PASS
THROUGH. IT SHOULD BE AN UNEVENTFUL FROPA AND WILL MOSTLY SCOUR OUT
THE ELEVATED DEWPOINTS AND ALLOW MIN TEMPS IN THE 30S ACROSS THE
VALLEY TONIGHT...BUT HIGHS WILL REBOUND TO ABOVE AVERAGE AGAIN
TUESDAY WITH MID TO UPPER 50S IN THE VALLEY. WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH
THE FRONT THIS EVENING ARE GONNA BECOME INCREASINGLY SOUTHWESTERLY
OR WESTERLY BUT THIS WILL NOT BE AN OVERLY BREEZY SITUATION FOR US.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE AND UPPER 
RIDGING WILL START THE EXTENDED WITH DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT...BUT RIDGING BREAKS DOWN QUICKLY WITH NEXT UPPER TROUGH 
MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE GULF COAST STATES FOR 
LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. AT THE SAME TIME...A NORTHERN 
STREAM UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WITH ASSOCIATED 
COLD COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. NORTHERN STREAM 
JET ALONG WITH JET FROM SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH WILL PLACE THE AREA 
UNDER DIVERGENCE ALOFT. THE AGEOSTROPHIC CIRCULATION FROM THE JETS 
WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. WIDESPREAD SHOWERS/RAIN ANTICIPATED. 
INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED TO THE GULF COAST STATES...SO DO NOT 
PLAN ON MENTIONING THUNDER WITH THIS SYSTEM.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE EXTENDED (THIS WEEKEND)...UPPER FLOW 
BECOMES MORE WEST TO NORTHWEST WITH COOLER AIR AND A SERIES OF WEAK 
SHORT-WAVES MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. WILL 
INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS (RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS) FOR 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR THE WEEKEND...OTHERWISE DRY CONDITIONS 
ANTICIPATED.

...DISCUSSION...UPDATE TO CANCEL SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 10. WHILE

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET INCREASING 
EARLY THIS MORNING ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY. H85 WINDS WILL JUMP 
TO AROUND 60 KTS. HENCE WIND ADVISORY FOR MOUNTAINS. STRONG WARM AIR 
ADVECTION WILL PUSH N-SE WARM FRONT EAST INTO MRX CWA EARLY TODAY. 
PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION RATHER UNORGANIZED SPREADING RAPIDLY INTO SE 
TN THIS MORNING. BULK SHEAR IMPRESSIVE...HELICITY VALUES HIGH AND 
SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY SUFFICIENT TO SUPPORT SEVERE TSTORMS THIS 
MORNING MAINLY ACROSS CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. STRONG 
STORMS AND MODERATE RAINFALL ON TRACK AREA WIDE FOR THE MORNING 
HOURS. COLD FRONT REMAINS WELL TO THE WEST TODAY. STEERING FLOW 
QUICKLY BECOMES MORE WESTERLY AS NEGATIVELY UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWINGS 
THROUGH THE AREA. THIS SHOULD HELP PUSH MOST OF THE CONVECTION EAST 
OF THE AREA BY LATE MORNING. FRONT MOVES SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE AREA 
IN THE LATE AFTERNOON HOURS. MODERATE LOW LEVEL COLD AIR ADVECTION 
SHOULD DRIVE TEMPS DOWN OVERNIGHT WHILE REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL.  


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...QUIET DAY ON TUESDAY WITH 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL.  MAIN SYSTEM OF THE EXTENDED 
APPROACHES THE MRX CWA LATE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY.  IN ADVANCE OF THE 
SYSTEM...WILL SEE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS MOVE THROUGH.  THE 
MAIN BAND OF PRECIP WILL PUSH IN ON THURSDAY AND HAVE INCREASED POPS 
TO LIKELY.  TEMPERATURES REMAIN QUIET WARM AND ALL PRECIP IS 
EXPECTED TO REMAIN RAIN.  MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR FOR THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED.  WILL LEAVE CHANCE POPS AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY FROM THE 
REGION.  A WEAK BOUNDARY SETTLES INTO THE AREA DURING THE WEEKEND 
BUT CURRENT MODELS TRENDED WITH LIMITED MOISTURE AND LIFT SO HAVE 
CONTINUED WITH A DRY WEEKEND FORECAST FOR NOW.

QUICKLY BECOMES MORE WESTERLY AS NEGATIVELY UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWINGS

SHOULD DRIVE TEMPS DOWN OVERNIGHT WHILE REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL.  MAIN SYSTEM OF THE EXTENDED 
APPROACHES THE MRX CWA LATE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY.  IN ADVANCE OF THE

MAIN BAND OF PRECIP WILL PUSH IN ON THURSDAY AND HAVE INCREASED POPS 
TO LIKELY.  TEMPERATURES REMAIN QUIET WARM AND ALL PRECIP IS 
EXPECTED TO REMAIN RAIN.  MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR FOR THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED.  WILL LEAVE CHANCE POPS AS THE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY FROM THE 
REGION.  A WEAK BOUNDARY SETTLES INTO THE AREA DURING THE WEEKEND 
BUT CURRENT MODELS TRENDED WITH LIMITED MOISTURE AND LIFT SO HAVE 
CONTINUED WITH A DRY WEEKEND FORECAST FOR NOW.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
CENTERED NEAR KANSAS CITY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING 
SOUTH ACROSS EASTERN OKLAHOMA. SATELLITE AND RADAR IMAGERY REVEAL 
THAT A PRE-FRONTAL SQUALL LINE OF SEVERE CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED 
AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT OVER ARKANSAS. AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND 
MOIST AIR MASS EXTENDS AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT OVER WEST AND MIDDLE 
TN...WITH A COLD AIR DAMMING SCENARIO OVER THE CAROLINAS. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY LATE TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED 
SQUALL LINE LIKELY RACING AHEAD OF IT AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
LATE TONIGHT TOWARDS SUNRISE. THIS SQUALL LINE SHOULD WEAKEN 
SOMEWHAT AFTER MIDNIGHT...AS IT MOVES INTO A MORE STABLE AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...WITH A STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 
60 TO 70 KT) PROGGED TO BE MOVING OVER THE FORECAST AREA AROUND 
SUNRISE...THINK THAT SOME DAMAGING WINDS AND AN ISOLATED TORNADO 
WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THIS SQUALL LINE EARLY MONDAY MORNING.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE LATER THIS EVENING TO TWEAK PRECIP WORDING. WITH DEWPOINTS 
ALREADY IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA... 
WILL PLAN TO RAISE MINS A LITTLE SINCE THESE DEWPOINTS SHOULD RISE A 
LITTLE MORE BEFORE FRONTAL PASSAGE AFTER SUNRISE ON MONDAY MORNING. 
WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AS WELL... 
WITH THE CAMP CREEK TOWER IN SOUTHEAST GREENE COUNTY ALREADY 
REPORTING WIND GUSTS UP TO 50 MPH.

THINK THAT THIS FOG SHOULD REMAIN PATCHY IN COVERAGE OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO

IN FOR SUNDAY EVENING THEN INTRO THE CATEGORICAL POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
SPC HAS GENERAL OUTLOOK OF THUNDER SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A SLIGHT RISK 
OF SEVERE /FOR THE TIME BEING/ OVER THE W AND SW PORTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. THUS ADDED MENTION OF THUNDER AREA WIDE 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. SYSTEM LOOKS TO DEPART FAIRLY QUICKLY...MAINTAINING 
MORNING POPS ON MONDAY...HIGHEST IN THE EAST...THEN DRY FOR MONDAY 
AFTERNOON. A DRY TUESDAY WILL FOLLOW. BEYOND WEDNESDAY...THE LONG 
RANGE MODELS ARE STRUGGLING TO ACHIEVE ANY AGREEMENT FOR A 
LATTER-HALF OF WEEK SYSTEM. IT SEEMS IT WILL BE A CUTOFF LOW OVER 
THE SW U.S. AND THUS THE MODELS ALL DIFFER ON ITS STRENGTH AND THE 
TIMING OF ITS EJECTION. WILL MAINTAIN CHC TO SLGT CHC POPS WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH FRIDAY. AFTERWARD...THE GFS AND ECMWF LEAN TOWARD A DRY 
SOLUTION NEXT SATURDAY...SO LETS BE OPTIMISTIC. OTHERWISE TEMPS ARE 
GENERALLY GONNA BE ABOVE NORMAL NEXT WEEK...MILD FOR JANUARY.

CIGS/VIS...SO FORECAST CONFIDENCE BELOW AVERAGE FOR THE
TONIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY PORTION OF THE TAF PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE HAS DEEPENED

EAST THROUGH THE VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY 
TODAY. STRONG THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED ALONG THE COLD FRONT. 
AIRMASS ALONG AND WEST OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU REMAINS UNSTABLE 
AND SHOULD SUPPORT CONTINUES STRONG TO SEVERE CONVECTION EARLY 
TODAY. THE AIRMASS EAST OF THE PLATEAU IS CAPPED AND STABLE. IT 
APPEARS AT THIS TIME THAT THIS AREA WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY STABLE AS 
THE CONVECTION MOVES INTO EAST TENNESSEE. ELEVATED INSTABILITY WILL 
REMAIN POSSIBLE WITH GOOD UNIDIRECTIONAL SHEAR. MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT ON MOVING COLD FRONT INTO THE APPALACHIANS EARLY THIS 
AFTERNOON. SOUTHERN AREAS WILL LIKELY EXPERIENCE MAX TEMPERATURES IN 
THE PREFRONTAL ENVIRONMENT IN THE MORNING HOURS. SHORT WAVE THAT IS 
DRIVING THESE FEATURES WILL MOVE INTO THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY 
THIS AFTERNOON BRINGING DRYING IN THE MID LEVELS. POST FRONTAL COLD 
AIR ADVECTION IS WEAK. LOW LEVELS REMAIN CAPPED SO CLEARING 
OVERNIGHT TONIGHT IS SUSPECT AS FOG AND STATUS COULD BECOME 
WIDESPREAD. ABOVE NORMAL MIN TEMPS EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WITH INCREASING LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND VERY WEAK LIFT...COULD SEE A STAY SHOWER ON SUNDAY 
AHEAD OF AN ADVANCING SYSTEM.  THE MAIN THREAT OF CONVECTION IS 
EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY AS A COLD FRONT PUSHES 
THROUGH THE MRX CWA.  INSTABILITY TO OUR SOUTH MAY ALLOW A 
THUNDERSTORM OR TWO OVER SOUTHERN AREAS.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR 
TUESDAY.  THE END OF THE EXTENDED...MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH 
TIMING AND TRACK OF A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  
FOR NOW...WILL KEEP GENERALLY CHANCE POPS IN PLACE WEDNESDAY THOUGH 
FRIDAY.

TWEAKS.       

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AS THIS PERIOD BEGINS 
THE FRONT AND PRECIPITATION IN THE SHORT TERM WILL BE EXITING TO THE 
EAST WITH HIGH PRESSURE FILLING IN.  HOWEVER...WITH A STRONGER 
SYSTEM QUICKLY APPROACHING FROM THE PLAINS...THE LOW LEVEL WINDS 
QUICKLY VEER IN A RETURN FLOW ORIENTATION DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY.  

THE FRONT FROM THIS STRONGER SYSTEM BLITZES THROUGH THE AREA VERY 
QUICKLY ON MONDAY...LOOKING LIKE FAIRLY EARLY ON MONDAY RIGHT NOW.  
BETTER CHANCES OF THUNDER EXIST SUNDAY EVENING.

LOOKING AT THE LATTER PERIODS...LOOKING LIKE A SLOW-MOVING SYSTEM 
LATE NEXT WEEK OVER THE MISSISSIPPI AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS...WILL 
NEED TO WATCH FOR THE POSSIBILITY LONG-DURATION RAINS OVER PARTS OF 
THE AREA DURING THIS TIME.  

FOR TEMPS...WENT ON THE LOW SIDE OF THE MAX TEMPS IN THESE LATTER 
PERIODS.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...WEAK AND DRY COLD 
FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH INTO THE AREA TONIGHT...THEN WILL STALL BEFORE 
HEADING BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT FRIDAY. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE 
TONIGHT AS LOW LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS.  LOW CLOUDS WILL ADVANCE INTO 
THE AREA FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST...AND APPEARS THERE WILL BE 
ENOUGH ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR SOME DRIZZLE/LIGHT RAIN SOUTH LATE 
TONIGHT...SPREADING ACROSS THE REST OF THE AREA ON FRIDAY.   WILL

CHANCE FAR NORTH ON FRIDAY.  NEXT COLD FRONT SHOULD BE NEAR OUR 
WESTERN BORDER BY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT...AND LOOKS LIKE THERE MAY BE 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR ISOLATED THUNDER.  WILL MENTION THUNDER WITH 
CAT POPS ALL BUT NORTHEAST ZONES...WHERE WILL KEEP POPS LIKELY WITH 
NO THUNDER.  WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS SLIGHTLY 
FRIDAY...OTHERWISE NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF ADJUSTMENTS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THIS PERIOD STARTS WITH A 
COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE REGION.  THE FRONT SHOULD BE CLEAR OF 
THE AREA BY SUNSET SATURDAY...BUT DOES NOT GET VERY FAR AWAY.  BY 
SUNDAY A RETURN FLOW HAS ALREADY STARTED AND A STRONGER FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY.  

LOOKS LIKE MOST IF NOT ALL THE PRECIP FOR THIS PERIOD WILL BE IN 
LIQUID FORM...AS A MATTER OF FACT...EVEN THOUGH IT IS JANUARY 
PUTTING IN SOME THUNDER WITH SOME OF THE POPS AHEAD OF AND ALONG 
COLD FRONTS.

FOR TEMPS...FELT LIKE THE MIN TEMPS WERE A LITTLE TOO MUTED...SO 
WENT A LITTLE WARMER ON THE MINS PRE-FRONTAL...AND A LITTLE COOLER 
POST-FRONTAL...OTHERWISE WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.

PUTTING IN SOME THUNDER WITH SOME OF THE POPS AHEAD OF AND ALONG 
COLD FRONTS.

FOR TEMPS...FELT LIKE THE MIN TEMPS WERE A LITTLE TOO MUTED...SO 
WENT A LITTLE WARMER ON THE MINS PRE-FRONTAL...AND A LITTLE COOLER 
POST-FRONTAL...OTHERWISE WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.

699 
FXUS64 KMRX 190833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST THU JAN 19 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOULD BE A QUIET WEATHER DAY 
TODAY WITH HIGH CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE AHEAD OF GREAT LAKES SHORT 
WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM. SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPS 
ACROSS THE REGION BOOSTING TEMPERATURES WELL INTO THE 40S WITH LOWER 
50 DEGREE MAXES POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA. UPPER TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. 
TONIGHT DRIVING COLD FRONT THROUGH MOST OF THE VIEWING AREA. DEEP 
MOISTURE SOMEWHAT LACKING WITH THIS SYSTEM. HOWEVER THERE MAY BE 
ENOUGH PRESENT WITH A BIT OF FRONTAL/OROGRAPHIC LIFTING FOR A FEW 
SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS HIGH TERRAIN FEATURES IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS TEMPERATURE PROFILE BECOMES MORE 
FAVORABLE FOR SOME FLAKES. MODELS ALSO HINT AT POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT 
RAIN DEVELOPING ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS 
LIFTED ALONG THE FRONT. NOT CONVINCED PRECIP CAN FORM HERE AS BETTER 
DYNAMICS WITH SHORT WAVE WELL NORTH AND ONLY A SHALLOW LAYER OF 
MOIST AIR PRESENT.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A ZONAL FLOW IN THE MID AND 
UPPER LEVELS BECOMES SLIGHTLY MORE AMPLIFIED ON FRIDAY AS A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES FROM THE PLAINS TO THE OHIO VALLEY. AT THE 
SURFACE...A WARM FRONT WILL LIFT ACROSS THE AREA LATE FRIDAY AS THE 
SURFACE LOW MOVES INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY REGION. WEAK ISENTROPIC 
LIFT WITH THE WARM FRONT WILL BRING LIGHT PRECIP INTO THE AREA 
STARTING FRIDAY AFTERNOON. LIFT IS ENHANCED SATURDAY MORNING BY 
UPPER DIVERGENCE AND A 50 KT LLJ PROVIDING STRONG POSITIVE THETA-E 
ADVECTION. THERE IS SOME WEAK INSTABILITY AS WELL...WHICH SHOULD 
GIVE AT LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. THERE ARE SOME 
TIMING DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE SLOWER NAM AND THE FASTER GFS WITH 
THIS SYSTEM. PREFER THE FASTER SOLUTION GIVEN THE SHALLOW 
AMPLIFICATION OF THE UPPER TROUGH...BUT WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS 
IN SATURDAY NIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS UNCERTAINTY.  

TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WELL ABOVE NORMAL ON SUNDAY AS A STRONG 
SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS IN A HIGHLY PROGRESSIVE PATTERN. A DEEPER 
TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND GREAT LAKES SUNDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY...WITH A TRAILING COLD FRONT CROSSING OUR AREA SUNDAY 
NIGHT. THE ECMWF AND GFS ARE IN MUCH BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THIS 
PATTERN THAN YESTERDAY...AND THE SPREAD OF THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
IS SMALLER. WILL TRIM POPS BACK TO JUST SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY...WITH TUESDAY BECOMING DRY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. A WEAK 
PUSH OF COLD AIR WILL BRING TEMPERATURS CLOSER TO NORMAL FOR 
TUESDAY...BUT A SOUTHERLY FLOW OF WARM MOIST AIR RETURNS 
WEDNESDAY...ALONG WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             54  36  57  51  63 /   0  10  30  60  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  34  55  48  59 /   0  10  20  60  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       51  32  55  48  58 /   0  10  20  60  80

630 PM EST WED JAN 18 2012

KY TO SW VA AND NE TN...MAINLY AFFECTING TRI FOR A FEW MORE HOURS.
THE LOW CLOUDS WILL GIVE WAY TO SOME SCATTERED MID TO HIGH CLOUDS

ANYWAY...VFR CONDITIONS ARE OCCURRING AND LIKELY TO CONTINUE AT 
LEAST INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
LOW CLOUDS FINALLY CLEARING OUT AND THIS TREND SHOULD CONTINUE
THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING...BUT VARYING AMOUNTS OF HIGHER CLOUDS CAN
BE EXPECTED TONIGHT AND THURSDAY AS SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY
MOVES ACROSS TONIGHT AND THEN A COLD FRONT APPROACHES THURSDAY.
SHOULD BE PRECIP FREE FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. MAV TEMPS LOOK
REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT...BUT WILL BLEND IN SOME GENERALLY LOWER MET
NUMBERS FOR HIGHS THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
WEAK COLD FRONT TO MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE WILL BE
QUITE LIMITED BUT A FEW SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT.
ONLY SLIGHT ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED NE TN AND SW VA. LOWS WILL BE
NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FREEZING. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN
FRIDAY AND CONTINUED MILD TEMPERATURES. DEVELOPING SYSTEM MOVES
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. ENOUGH
INSTABILITY FOR THUNDERSTORMS LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH
SOUTHERN SECTIONS RECEIVING POSSIBLE HEAVY RAINFALL OF A COUPLE
INCHES DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. SURFACE LOW WITH FRONTAL SYSTEM
SHOULD BE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY SUNDAY MORNING WITH SKIES
CLEARING AND MILD CONDITIONS AS FLOW STAYS WEST TO SOUTHWEST.
A NEW DEEPER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS AND BEGINS A PERIOD
OF UNSETTLED WEATHER WITH COLD FRONT APPROACHING MONDAY FOLLOWED BY
A SECONDARY SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TUESDAY AND
CONNECTED TO A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE TN VALLEY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL MOSTLY 50S TO LOWER 60S AND
LOWS IN THE 30S AND 40S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST WED JAN 18 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLDER AIR BUILDING INTO THE 
REGION TODAY WITH A MASS OF POST FRONTAL STRATUS ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES THIS MORNING WILL GIVE WAY TO INCREASING AMOUNTS OF 
SUNSHINE IN MOST AREAS. SHOULD TAKE A LITTLE LONGER TO BREAK ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. A QUIET NIGHT IN 
STORE TONIGHT WITH A FEW HIGH CLOUDS AS WARMER AIR RETURNS ALOFT. 
STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A FAST-MOVING VORT MAX AT 
500 MB AND THE NOSE OF THE 300 MB JET PROVIDE SOME WEAK LIFT ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THURSDAY EVENING. HOWEVER MOISTURE 
IS LIMITED...SO WILL HAVE JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP THU 21Z TO FRI 
03Z NORTH. A WARM ADVECTION PATTERN SETS UP ON FRIDAY AS LOW 
PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS. STRONG ADVECTION OF HIGH THETA-E 
AIR AT 850 MB WILL BRING SHOWERS FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN FORCING REACHES 
ITS PEAK SATURDAY WHEN A NICE UPPER JET COUPLET ENHANCES DIVERGENCE 
OVER THE AREA. THERE IS SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY AS WELL...SO WILL 
ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH AND WEST TO GO ALONG WITH 
LIKELY POPS. PRECIP CHANCES END SATURDAY NIGHT ONCE THE TROUGH AXIS 
MOVES EAST. WITH THE FLOW ALOFT BEHIND THE SYSTEM BEING NEARLY 
ZONAL...THERE IS NOT MUCH OF A COLD PUNCH BEHIND IT...SO 
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF THE 
WEEK. 

CONFIDENCE IN THE MODELS IS VERY LOW FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AS 
THERE IS CONSIDERABLE SPREAD IN THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS...AND POOR 
RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY. THE OPERATIONAL GFS SHOWS MOST PRECIP ON 
MONDAY...WITH THE ECMWF AND SEVERAL ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ON TUESDAY. 
WILL CARRY A CHANCE POP THROUGH MOST OF THIS TIME FRAME. ABNORMALLY 
WARM TEMPERATURES APPEAR LIKELY TO CONTINUE BOTH DAYS.

THE AREA THIS EVENING.  CONVECTION OUT AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL 
GENERATE OCCASIONAL EMBEDDED THUNDER AND BRIEF MODERATE TO HEAVY 
RAIN AS THE NARROW BAND OF CONVECTION MOVES THROUGH.  THE STRONG 
WIND FIELD AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL MOVE OFF EARLY THIS EVENING AND 
WILL ALLOW THE WIND ADVISORY TO EXPIRE.  BEHIND THE FRONT...LOOK FOR 
IMPROVING CONDITIONS WITH DECREASING WINDS AND CLOUDS.  SURFACE HIGH 
BUILDS IN ON WEDNESDAY WITH A COOL...DRY AIR MASS MOVING IN FOR A 
QUIET WEATHER DAY WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING INTO THE 30S AND 40S.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GREAT LAKES SHORTWAVE 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WON'T BRING ANY PRECIPITATION TO OUR 
REGION IN THE FIRST FEW PERIODS...BUT WILL KEEP MIN TEMPS ON THE 
COOL SIDE RIGHT AROUND SEASONAL NORMALS. AFTERWORDS...MIN TEMPS 
MODERATE TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO...SO NO WINTRY WEATHER AHEAD FOR NOW. 
HIGHS WARM THROUGH THE 50S POSSIBLY INTO MID 60S...DEPENDENT ON HOW 
MUCH CLOUD COVER AND SHOWERS DEVELOP. 

THE UPPER FLOW STAYS SOMEWHAT ZONAL AND PROGRESSIVE INTO THE WEEKEND 
BEFORE AN UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS (POSSIBLY CLOSING OFF) OVER THE SRN 
PLAINS BY MONDAY. MODELS DIVERGE CONSIDERABLY FROM SUNDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY...WITH MORE CONTINUITY IN FOLLOWING THE GFS MODEL FOR NOW. 
THIS MEANS A MAIN PERIOD OF PRECIPITATION FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY 
WITH A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE...WHICH ECMWF ALSO SHOWS. MODELS 
TRENDING DRIER ON FRIDAY...ALSO NOTED IN SREF...SO POPS WERE JUST 
ABOUT DROPPED UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT. SOME UNCERTAINTY FOR WHETHER 
SUNDAY REMAINS DRY...BUT ECMWF LOOKS OVERDONE SO TRENDED WITH DRIER 
GFS. GFS MODEL IS NOW SLIGHTLY MORE AMPLIFIED WITH SRN PLAINS UPPER 
LOW FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH BEST RAIN CHANCES MONDAY NIGHT OR 
TUESDAY. 

&&

162 
FXUS64 KMRX 170921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST TUE JAN 17 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...A DEEPENING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE TRACKING FROM MO TO SOUTHERN ONTARIO THROUGH 
THE DAY. SYNOPTIC LIFT IS NOT STRONG WITH A NEAR-ZONAL UPPER LEVEL 
FLOW...BUT A STRONG LLJ WILL TRANSPORT PLENTY OF WARM MOIST AIR INTO 
THE TN VALLEY...AND PRODUCE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY SOME THUNDERSTORMS. 
SOME LOW LEVEL FORCING ARRIVES LATE IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
WITH THE APPROACH OF A STRONG COLD FRONT...AND WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL 
POPS WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER IN THIS TIME FRAME. THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE LOOKS TO OCCUR BETWEEN 00Z AND 04Z. MIDLEVEL DRY AIR BUILDS 
IN AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE 850 MB TROUGH. THE ONSET 
OF COLD AIR APPEARS TO BE JUST BEHIND THE EXITING MOISTURE...WHICH 
SHOULD PREVENT MUCH IN THE WAY OF SNOWFALL LATE TONIGHT. WILL HAVE 
JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE  OF SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS AFTER 
06Z...THEN END ALL POPS BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. 

SO FAR OBSERVATIONS OF WIND IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS HAVE BEEN 
MARGINAL FOR THE WIND ADVISORY...BUT WILL KEEP IT GOING AS THE LLJ 
PEAKS IN THE LATE MORNING AND WINDS ALOFT WILL BE MIXING DOWN A 
LITTLE MORE AFTER SUNRISE. THE STRONGER SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL BE CAPABLE OF BRINGING STRONG WINDS ALOFT TO THE SURFACE...AND 
A FEW SEVERE STORMS CANNOT BE RULED OUT.

A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND UPPER JET CROSSES THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY EVENING....THEN ANOTHER TROUGH PASSES JUST NORTH THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON. MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED WITH BOTH OF THESE SYSTEMS...AND 
WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN 
AGREEMENT DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST WHICH HAS TWO ACTIVE 
PERIODS. INITIALLY AN UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES ACROSS THE CENTER OF 
THE NATION FRIDAY BUILDING EAST THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS ON 
SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE STRENGTHENING FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY 
NIGHT AS MOISTURE ADVECTION INCREASES AHEAD OF A SURFACE WAVE 
TRANSITING THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. ALLOWED FOR A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS ON THE PLATEAU AND ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE REMAINDER OF THE VIEWING 
AREA ON FRIDAY. MAIN LIFT AND DEEPEST MOISTURE IN PLACE FRIDAY NIGHT 
AS THE SURFACE WAVE SHIFTS EAST NORTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SO EDGED POP IN THE LIKELY CATEGORY FOR THIS PERIOD 
WHILE DROPPING BACK TO CHANCE ON SATURDAY. HOWEVER...THIS MAY NEED 
TO BE PULLED BACK FURTHER IN SUBSEQUENT FORECAST ISSUANCE AS THE GFS 
IS A LITTLE QUICKER TO BRING DRIER AIR INTO THE REGION. BASICALLY 
KEPT SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY DRY WHILE AWAITING ARRIVAL OF A 
MUCH MORE AMPLIFIED SYSTEM. MATCHING NEIGHBORING WFO'S...WENT WITH 
THE FASTER GFS CONCERNING THIS FEATURE AND ADVANCED POPS FOR SHOWERS 
TO A LOW CHANCE CATEGORY WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND 
SLIGHT CHANCE EAST SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST MON JAN 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL MOVE THROUGH DURING THE SHORT TERM.  THIS WILL SPREAD SHOWERS 
ACROSS THE AREA BEGINNING TONIGHT WITH THE MAIN BAND EXPECTED TO 
SLIDE THROUGH ON TUESDAY.  THE SYSTEM WILL EXIT THE AREA ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT WITH THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS DECREASING FROM WEST TO EAST.  
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARM ENOUGH TONIGHT AND TUESDAY FOR MAINLY A 
RAIN EVENT.  HOWEVER...AS TEMPERATURES FALL ON TUESDAY NIGHT...ANY 
RESIDUAL SHOWERS WILL MIX WITH OR CHANCE OVER TO SNOW LATE.  LITTLE 
TO NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED AT THIS TIME.  ALSO OF CONCERN THIS 
PERIOD IS INCREASING WINDS AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE.  A 
TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL GENERATE WIDESPREAD BREEZY 
CONDITIONS TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  STRONGER...WINDY CONDITIONS ARE 
EXPECTED OVER THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS AND A WIND ADVISORY WILL BE 
ISSUED FOR THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER TERRAIN OF WISE CO, VA 
BEGINNING TONIGHT AND CONTINUING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MOISTURE JUST ABOUT GONE 
WEDNESDAY MORNING AS COLD AIR ADVECTION ARRIVES...SO JUST ADDED A 
SMALL AREA OF LOW POPS FOR WEDNESDAY MORNING TO MESH WITH RLX/RNK 
AND GSP GRIDS. FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT LOOK TO 
BRING SHOWERS BY MAINLY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE SUPPORTS MOSTLY LIQUID PRECIPITATION...AND I MAY NEED TO GO 
LIKELY ON POPS FOR THIS EVENT...BUT WILL STAY WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS 
FOR NOW. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY AND LOW LEVELS WARM AHEAD 
OF ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH LATE MONDAY...WITH POPS HELD OFF UNTIL 
MONDAY NIGHT FOR NOW. 

FOR TEMPS...GFSX MOS TEMPS A BUT INCONSISTENT FROM 16/00Z TO 16/12Z 
MODEL RUN...SO I BLENDED THE NUMBERS WHERE SIGNIFICANT DIFFS WERE 
NOTED...MATCHING NEIGHBORING NWS GRIDS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
403 AM EST MON JAN 16 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)... 
A WARM FRONT IS LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL AL TO CENTRAL KY TO
SOUTHERN IL THIS MORNING...AND WILL GRADUALLY BE LIFTING THROUGH
OUR AREA TODAY. RADARS TO OUR SW SHOW PRECIPITATION FALLING FROM A
MIDLEVEL CLOUD DECK...BUT OBS SHOW NO PRECIP REACHING THE GROUND.
MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A VERY DRY LAYER FROM THE SURFACE TO
700 MB REMAINING IN PLACE THROUGH THE DAY. ADVECTION OF WARM MOIST
AIR AT 850 MB DOES NOT COMMENCE UNTIL AFTER 00Z. THE MID TO UPPER
LEVEL FLOW STAYS ZONAL FROM THE SW THROUGH TODAY AND TONIGHT...THUS
FORCING FOR LIFT IS WEAK. THE 850 MB JET DOES STRENGTHEN TONIGHT TO
AROUND 50 KTS...WITH 500 MB HEIGHTS FALLING SLIGHTLY. MODELS HAVE
TRENDED SLOWER WITH THE ONSET OF PRECIP...AND WILL REMOVE ALL POPS
FROM TODAY AND LOWER POPS TONIGHT TO NO MORE THAN A CHANCE...MAINLY
AFTER 06Z. TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE A TRICKY BALANCE BETWEEN
STRENGTHENING WARM ADVECTION IN THE SW FLOW BEHIND THE WARM FRONT
AND INCREASING CLOUD COVER. WILL LEAN SLIGHTLY TOWARD THE WARMER
SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS TODAY AND LOWS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE AREA ON TUESDAY. WILL KEEP THE LIKELY POPS GOING FOR 
TUESDAY. IT SHOULD BE BREEZY ON TUESDAY AS THE FRONT PASSES. THE 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT. THE 
PRECIPITATION COULD CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW AS IT EXITS THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT. SNOW ACCUMULATION SHOULD BE LIGHT AND MAINLY ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION 
BY THE END OF THE WEEK. WILL KEEP CHANCE GOING FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY. THE FRONT MAY LINGER INTO SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...BUT 
WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL LEAVE BOTH PERIODS DRY FOR 
NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST SUN JAN 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH A WEAK LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG 
THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN WILL DEVELOP 
TONIGHT INTO MONDAY...AS A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF A 
DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS. THE VERTICAL TEMP 
PROFILE OVER THE FORECAST AREA APPEARS TO BE WARM ENOUGH FOR RAIN 
SHOWERS ON MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY. THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE PLAINS IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY NIGHT...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVING 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON. COLDER AIR BEHIND 
THIS FRONT WILL GRADUALLY CHANGE THE RAIN SHOWERS TO SNOW SHOWERS ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT IT APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT MOST OF THE MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL EXIT THE FORECAST AREA BY THE TIME 
THE SUB-FREEZING TEMPS ARRIVE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BRIEFLY BUILD IN WEDNESDAY FOR DRY AND QUIET CONDITIONS. THE HIGH 
SLIDES TO OUR SOUTH ON THURSDAY BUT WILL MAINTAIN CONTROL OF AREA 
WEATHER THROUGH FRIDAY. A COLD FRONT PUSHES IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...PROVIDING OUR NEXT CHANCE OF SHOWERS. WITH WARM 
TEMPERATURES IN PLACE...PRECIP SHOULD BE MOSTLY RAIN WITH A FEW SNOW 
SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. 
THIS SYSTEM SHOULD EXIT THE REGION BY SUNDAY FOR A RETURN TO DRY 
CONDITIONS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EST SUN JAN 15 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SOME LIGHT SNOW LINGERS OVER PORTIONS OF SW VA AND THE NE TN 
MOUNTAINS EARLY THIS MORNING. BASED ON RADAR AND SATELLITE TRENDS 
AND RUC FORECAST SOUNDINGS...THESE SHOULD BE TAPERING OFF SOON. WILL 
INCLUDE A MENTION OF FLURRIES IN THESE AREAS FOR THE EARLY 
MORNING...BUT WITH ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL ENDING...WILL DROP THE 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY. 

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE DRIFTING ACROSS THE AREA TODAY...WITH 
A BUILDING RIDGE ALOFT. CLOUDS IN THE NORTH THIS MORNING WILL 
GRADUALLY DECREASE...AND ALL AREAS SHOULD SEE FULL SUN BY THE 
AFTERNOON. HIGHS WILL RANGE FROM THE UPPER 40S SOUTH TO MID/UPPER 
30S NORTH. NEUTRAL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION DURING THE DAY WILL 
TRANSITION TO SLIGHT WARM ADVECTION TONIGHT AS THE HIGH SHIFTS EAST 
OF THE MOUNTAINS AND LOW PRESSURE TRACKS ACROSS THE PLAINS. HIGH 
CLOUDS WILL ALSO BEGIN TO INCREASE LATE TONIGHT AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR MOST OF MONDAY. A FRONT MOVES INTO THE 
AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY NIGHT. IT SHOULD ALSO BE BREEZY ON MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY. THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THE PRECIPITATION COULD CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW AS IT EXITS THE 
AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. ANOTHER FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION 
ON SATURDAY. WITH STILL UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL LEAVE THE 
CURRENT LOW POPS FOR SATURDAY AS IS.

IS ALSO CONTRIBUTING. LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT REPORTED 1/2 TO 1 1/2
INCHES OF SNOWFALL ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE. SHORT- WAVE WILL EXIT THE AREA BY SUNRISE. WILL CONTINUE
CURRENT WSW AND EXPECTING ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS GENERALLY
AROUND 1 INCH...EXCEPT FOR GREATER AMOUNTS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

AS WAVE MOVES EAST...CLEARING LINE IS ALREADY APPROACHING THE
PLATEAU COUNTIES. PLATEAU AND CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY
WILL CLEAR AFTER MIDNIGHT.

HAVE MADE SOME MINOR CHANCE TO CLOUD COVER AND POP FOR REST OF THE NIGHT.

085 
FXUS64 KMRX 141941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST SAT JAN 14 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A LEE TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS LOW IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND 
IT PRODUCING SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY IN THE FAVORED 
UPSLOPE AREAS ACROSS THE NORTHWEST-FACING SLOPES OF THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. LATEST MODEL RUNS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
PROGRESSION OF THIS FAST-MOVING 'CLIPPER' LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...AND 
ALSO AGREE THAT MOISTURE WILL BE FAIRLY LIMITED OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...EXPECT MOST SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS TO BE 
CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND WILL PLAN TO ISSUE AN 
ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT. WILL REISSUE 
THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF UP TO 
INCH OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WITH SOME OF THE SNOW SHOWERS OVER 
THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CENTRAL GREAT TN VALLEY. HIGH 
PRESSURE THEN SETTLES OVER THE REGION ON SUNDAY...WITH A STRONG WARM 
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING SUNDAY NIGHT AS DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW DEVELOPS AHEAD OF A STRENGTHENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
PLAINS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE 
WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR RAIN ON MONDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY... 
BUT BEGIN TO REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT. WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH 
THE REGION ON TUESDAY WILL BRING WIDESPREAD RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
MRX CWA. THE FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND ANY RESIDUAL 
SHOWERS WILL MIX WITH OR CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BRIEFLY SLIDES IN FOR A 
RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY. MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT FOR THE 
END OF THE EXTENDED. A WEAK WAVE MOVES QUICKLY THROUGH TO OUR NORTH 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR NOW. THE NEXT 
SYSTEM MAY REACH INTO THE AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT OR SATURDAY AND HAVE 
INTRODUCES A SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     27  43  28  52  42 /  40   0   0  20  50

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    24  40  23  51  38 /  60   0   0  20  50

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EST SAT JAN 14 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE TO LINGER IN SW VA EARLY THIS 
MORNING. RADAR RETURNS OVER EASTERN KY INDICATE THE SNOW DECREASING 
IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS. WILL HAVE A MENTION OF FLURRIES IN THAT AREA 
UNTIL AROUND 14Z.

AN AREA OF CHANNELED VORTICITY NOW STRETCHING FROM MO TO THE DAKOTAS 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TN VALLEY LATE TODAY INTO TONIGHT. CLOUDS WILL 
BEGIN TO INCREASE WITH THIS SYSTEM THIS AFTERNOON. THE SYSTEM MOVES 
THROUGH QUICKLY...WITH THE BEST LIFT OCCURRING IN A NARROW WINDOW 
BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z. LIGHT PRECIP MAY ARRIVE A LITTLE BEFORE 00Z IN 
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AREAS AND SW VA...BUT MOST PRECIP WILL OCCUR 
AFTER 00Z. HIGHEST POPS (LIKELY RANGE) AND QPF WILL BE IN NORTHERN 
AREAS WHERE LIFT AND MOISTURE ARE DEEPEST. THE LOW LEVEL FLOW IS 
FROM THE SW...NOT PARTICULARLY FAVORABLE FOR MUCH UPSLOPE QPF 
ENHANCEMENT...SO AMOUNTS SHOULD BE FAIRLY UNIFORM. WITH THE FAST 
MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM...SNOW AMOUNTS SHOULD STAY UNDER ADVISORY 
CRITERIA OF 2 INCHES. AT THIS TIME...MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD SEE UNDER 
ONE INCH...WITH A LITTLE ABOVE ONE INCH POSSIBLE IN SW VA AND NE TN 
MOUNTAINS. POPS LOWER TO A CHANCE NORTH AND EAST AFTER 06Z AS THE 
SYSTEM MOVES EAST OF THE AREA. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A FRONT MOVES INTO 
AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE 
LIGHT SNOW ON MONDAY NIGHT...BUT MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD HAVE LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY NIGHT. THE FRONT LINGERS ACROSS THE REGION 
ON TUESDAY SO WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE FOR RAIN FOR TUESDAY. THE 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT. THE 
PRECIPITATION COULD CHANCE TO LIGHT SNOW AS IT EXITS THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST FRI JAN 13 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LEE TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A VERY COLD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...SO WILL PLAN TO BE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD 
COVER AND WILL MENTION SCATTERED FLURRIES FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION OF A 
FAST-MOVING 'CLIPPER' LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
ON SATURDAY...WHICH SHOULD MOSTLY AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY 
NIGHT. NAM AND GFS MODELS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH HOW MUCH 
MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO MODELS BY MENTIONING CHANCE POPS SATURDAY NIGHT OVER 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. A HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL 
THEN SETTLE OVER THE REGION FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH NOT 
MUCH COLD AIR EXPECTED BEHIND THIS CLIPPER SYSTEM. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER GFS NUMBERS WHICH SEEM TO 
BE VERIFYING BETTER LATELY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...BRIEF WARMING TREND EARLY IN 
THE EXTENDED AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR MONDAY. A COLD FRONT 
MOVES INTO THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WITH WARM TEMPERATURES 
IN PLACE...SCATTERED SHOWERS SHOULD BE RAIN ACROSS MOST LOCATIONS. 
HOWEVER...THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS COULD SEE LIGHT SNOW LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT. THE FRONT PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT WITH ANY 
LINGERING SHOWERS MIXING WITH OR CHANCING TO LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR A 
RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. MODELS IN POOR 
AGREEMENT BY FRIDAY WITH THE APPROACH OF THE NEXT SYSTEM AND WILL 
KEEP THINGS DRY FOR NOW.

WINTER WX ADVISORIES EXPIRE AT THEIR NORMAL TIMES THIS MORNING.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING MAINLY TO REMOVE ANY MORNING WORDING...AND TO 
MENTION SCATTERED SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
351 AM EST FRI JAN 13 2012

.SHORT TERM. (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SNOW SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED TO PERSIST ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF
THE AREA THROUGH THE MORNING. THE SHOWERS ARE BEING GENERATED BY
STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES BENEATH VERY COLD AIR ALOFT.
INSTABILITY WILL DECREASE BY THE AFTERNOON AS TEMPS ALOFT WARM AND
MOISTURE DEPTH DECREASES...WHICH SHOULD BRING AN END TO THE
SHOWERS. WILL DROP ALL POPS AFTER 18Z. ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS
THROUGH THE MORNING WILL BE VERY LIGHT...LESS THAN ONE INCH.
HOWEVER...WILL KEEP THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING FOR THE
NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. THE MAIN IMPACT WILL BE ICY PATCHES ON
ROADS AS TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE 20-25 DEGREE RANGE THIS
MORNING. WILL ADDRESS THIS IMPACT IN SOUTHERN AREAS WITH AN SPS.
THE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AS OBSERVED WINDS HAVE
BEEN MARGINAL AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO DECREASE THROUGH THE MORNING.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHORTWAVE PASSING
THROUGH THE REGION PROVIDING A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS OUR
NORTHERN AREAS ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING. DRY WEATHER
RETURNS MONDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. A FRONT MOVES INTO AREA
ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE LIGHT
SNOW ON MONDAY NIGHT...BUT MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD HAVE LIQUID
PRECIPITATION. THE CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY. THE
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO EXIT THE REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
PRECIPITATION COULD CHANCE TO LIGHT SNOW OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATION
AS IT EXITS THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS
BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

428 
FXUS64 KMRX 122001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST THU JAN 12 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG COLD FRONT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU... 
WITH TEMPS IN THE 30S BEHIND IT OVER MOST OF MIDDLE TN. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION OF AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH OVER THE OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS TONIGHT...WHICH WILL 
CREATE MAINLY AN UPSLOPE SNOW EVENT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
FRIDAY MORNING. AS A RESULT...EXPECT MOST OF THE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
TO OCCUR ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE BIG QUESTION WITH THIS 
SYSTEM CONTINUES TO BE HOW MUCH MOISTURE REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA BY THE TIME THE AIR COOLS ENOUGH FOR A CHANGEOVER TO SNOW. WITH 
SEVERAL DAYS OF WARM TEMPS...THINK THAT ANY SNOWFALL WILL HAVE A 
TOUGH TIME ACCUMULATING INITIALLY IN THE VALLEYS...BUT RAPIDLY 
FALLING TEMPS AFTER SUNSET COULD PRODUCE SOME SLIPPERY ROADS WITH 
BLACK ICE DEVELOPING FROM LINGERING MOISTURE FROM THIS AFTERNOON'S 
RAINFALL. AROUND AN INCH OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS STILL APPEARS 
POSSIBLE IN THE GREAT TN VALLEY...ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME 
BLACK ICE. THUS...WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE ADVISORIES AS 
ADVERTISED...BUT WILL EXTEND THE EXPIRATION TIMES A FEW MORE HOURS 
ON FRIDAY MORNING TO ACCOUNT FOR SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS. 
ANOTHER FAST-MOVING 'CLIPPER' SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH LIMITED MOISTURE. THUS...IT 
APPEARS THAT A FEW SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA...NORTHEAST TN...AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... 
BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER GFS NUMBERS WHERE DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A STRAY LIGHT SNOW SHOWER MAY 
LINGER OVER FAR NORTHEAST LOCATIONS EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. 
OTHERWISE...WILL SEE A BRIEF WARMING AND DRYING TREND FOR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES IN MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS COULD HAVE LIGHT SNOW LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT...BUT MOST LOCATIONS SHOULD SEE SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS. 
THE SYSTEM WILL EXIT THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT WITH ANY RESIDUAL 
SHOWERS MIXING WITH OR CHANCING TO LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER TERRAIN 
OVERNIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM 
FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.
&&

.AVIATION...IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT...WILL CONTINUE 
TO SEE AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN AND DRIZZLE AS WELL AS LOW CIGS... 
GENERALLY MVFR.  THE FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION THIS EVENING.  BEHIND THE FRONT...MUCH COLDER AIR 
WILL RUSH IN...SWITCHING -RA TO -SN.  SNOW WILL OCCASIONALLY REDUCE 
VIS AND WILL KEEP LOW CIGS AT MVFR.  PRECIP WILL END AND CONDITIONS 
SHOULD IMPROVE BY THE END OF THE TAF PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST THU JAN 12 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED COLD 
FRONT EXTENDING FROM NEAR CHICAGO IL SOUTH NEAR TO LOUISVILLE KY... 
NASHVILLE TN...AND TUPELO MS. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...WITH TEMPS FALLING 
RAPIDLY AND WINDS INCREASING BEHIND IT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL BECOME HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED OVER THE 
OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND THE FRONT... 
RESULTING IN A STRENGTHENING BAND OF POST-FRONTAL RAIN AS THE COLD 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. IT STILL APPEARS THAT RAIN 
WILL QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BEFORE 
SUNSET...WITH THE CHANGEOVER OCCURRING A LITTLE LATER OVER THE GREAT 
TN VALLEY WHERE TEMPS SHOULD RISE INTO THE MID 50S AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THIS MORNING MAINLY TO REMOVE ANY MORNING WORDING AND TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

634 AM EST THU JAN 12 2012

.AVIATION...MVFR CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THIS MORNING WITH AREAS OF 
DRIZZLE/LIGHT RAIN. CEILING WILL LIFT TO IFR CONDITIONS LATE THIS 
MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON BEFORE A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES IN CHA 
BETWEEN 19-21Z. AFTER FROPA...CEILING WILL DROP BACK TO VFR-MVFR 
CONDITIONS. CEILINGS WILL DROP BACK TO 2000-3000 FEET...BUT 
VISIBILITIES DUE TO RAIN/SNOW THEN SNOW WILL LOWER VISIBILITIES TO 1 
MILE AT TIMES. CEILING WILL LIFT ABOVE 3KT BY 03Z...BUT SCATTERED TO 
BROKEN SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS TRI AND TYS. THESE SHOWERS 
WILL REDUCE VISBILITIES TO 2 MILES AT TIMES. WINDS WILL BE GUSTY AS 
WELL AFTER FROPA WITH WEST TO SOUTHWEST WINDS BETWEEN 15 AND 30KTS.

046 
FXUS64 KMRX 120911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
411 AM EST THU JAN 12 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS
SHOWS A STRONG COLD FRONT NEAR THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER WITH
TEMPERATURES FALLING RAPIDLY AN HOUR OR TWO AFTER FROPA. A STRONG
NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO
AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TODAY AND TONIGHT. A 120KT+ 300MB JET WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE GULF COAST TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY
PLACING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED LEFT EXIT REGION. THE
STRONG INDIRECT CIRCULATION WILL ENHANCE THE AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL
CIRCULATION RE-INFORCING THE FRONTAL-GENETIC FORCING. A BAND OF
PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. INITIALLY...THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE RAIN...BUT AS
TEMPERATURE FALL QUICKLY BEHIND THE FRONT THE RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW.

AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE AREA...TEMPERATURE ALOFT QUICKLY
COOL WITH 500MB TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO -30C. THE COLD AIR ALOFT
WILL STEEPEN THE LAPSE RATES WITH FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOWING CAPES
OF 80-120 J/KG WHICH WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SNOW SHOWERS. THE
HEAVIEST SNOWFALL WILL BE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT UP TO
1 INCH IS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN-CENTRAL TENNESSEE VALLEY.
ALSO...EARLIER RAIN MAY QUICKLY FREEZE PRODUCING AREAS OF BLACK ICE.
THE SNOW SHOWERS WILL DIMINISH FRIDAY AS UPPER TROUGH LIFTS
NORTHEAST. 

BESIDES THE SNOW...THE STRONG PRESSURE RISES ALONG AND BEHIND FROPA
WILL PRODUCE WINDY CONDITIONS...SO HAVE ISSUED A WIND ADVISORY FOR
LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS SEEM TO BE 
CONSISTENT AND IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR THIS WEEKEND INTO THE MIDDLE 
OF NEXT WEEK. A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE/CLIPPER IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
ACROSS NORTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
SUNDAY...AND STILL WARRANTS JUST ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS AT THIS TIME. 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING ACROSS EASTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY AND A RETURN 
OF SW FLOW IN THE LOWER LEVELS...WILL BRING A DRY AND WARMING TREND 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS SHOULD 
RETURN ON TUESDAY...AS ALREADY DEPICTED IN PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS.
LIKELY POPS MAY BE JUSTIFIED FOR TUESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE IS LACKING 
TO GO ANYMORE THAN HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR NOW...SINCE THIS IS QUITE 
FAR OUT IN THE EXTENDED PERIODS. 

FOR TEMPS...FACTORING IN SOME POTENTIAL MEASURABLE SNOWFALL ACROSS 
PARTS OF THE PLATEAU...SW VA AND ANY MTN AREAS...LENDS CREDENCE TO 
UNDERCUTTING BOTH MINS AND MAXES (SLIGHTLY BELOW GFSX MOS) UNTIL THE 
SNOW IS LESS OF A FACTOR BY SUNDAY AND BEYOND.  

&&

967 
FXUS64 KMRX 112035
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EST WED JAN 11 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NORTHERN 
KENTUCKY NEAR LOUISVILLE...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED OCCLUDED FRONT 
EXTENDING SOUTHEAST ACROSS EAST TN NEAR KNOXVILLE AND THE SMOKIES. 
THIS OCCLUDED FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE NORTHEASTWARD THIS 
AFTERNOON ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...WITH A MARGINALLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS ALONG IT SUPPORTING SOME TSTORM DEVELOPMENT. AN 
UPPER-LEVEL LOW (CENTERED NEAR CHATTANOOGA THIS AFTERNOON) WILL 
CONTINUE TO CREATE A COLD AIR MASS ALOFT WITH THIS FRONT...WHICH 
WILL LOWER THE FREEZING LEVEL TO AROUND 6700 FT MSL RESULTING IN 
SMALL HAIL WITH SOME OF THE STRONGER STORMS. THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE MID ATLANTIC REGION BY THIS EVENING...WITH 
LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE 
NIGHTTIME HOURS. A STRONG COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY...WITH AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH BEHIND IT GENERATING STRONG LIFT ALONG IT. A SOLID BAND OF 
RAIN IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT DURING THE 
AFTERNOON...WITH THIS RAIN QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW OVER THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY LATE AFTERNOON WITH UP TO AN INCH OF SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE BY SUNSET. MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN AGREEMENT 
THAT THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL EXPERIENCE A CHANGE-OVER TO 
SNOW AFTER SUNSET THURSDAY EVENING. THE BIG QUESTION WITH THIS 
SYSTEM WILL BE HOW MUCH MOISTURE REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY 
THE TIME THE AIR COOLS ENOUGH FOR A CHANGE-OVER TO SNOW. WITH 
SEVERAL DAYS OF WARM TEMPS IN THE VALLEY...THINK THAT ANY SNOWFALL 
WILL HAVE A TOUGH TIME ACCUMULATING INITIALLY...BUT RAPIDLY FALLING 
TEMPS AFTER SUNSET COULD PRODUCE SOME SLIPPERY ROADS WITH BLACK ICE 
DEVELOPING FROM LINGERING MOISTURE FROM THE AFTERNOON RAINFALL. WITH 
ALL OF THIS MIND...WILL GO AHEAD AND ISSUE A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH THIS FORECAST PACKAGE...WITH THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ADVISORY BEGINNING LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON...AND 
THE ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VA BEGINNING THURSDAY 
EVENING. FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF UP TO AN 
INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH SLIPPERY ROADS FROM 
BLACK ICE ALSO POSSIBLE. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS WHERE 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ECMWF/GFS ONLY HAD MINOR 
DIFFERENCES DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST WHICH STARTS OUT DRY 
DURING THE DAY SATURDAY BUT ANOTHER...WEAKER CLIPPER SYSTEM MOVES 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING AND THIS FEATURE COULD PRODUCE SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES...SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND MUCH OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER. RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN STATES LATER IN THE DAY 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY AS ANOTHER HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACH THE AREA. THE MAIN PERIOD OF RAIN 
WITH THIS FRONT WILL BE DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. BRACKETED EITHER 
SIDE OF THIS PERIOD WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO ACCOUNT FOR POSSIBLE 
TIMING CHANGES WITH THIS SYSTEM. THE LONG TERM STARTS OUT SEVERAL 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL BUT SHOULD JUMP BACK ABOVE NORMAL DURING THE 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY TIME FRAME.
&&

836 
FXUS64 KMRX 110819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EST WED JAN 11 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A VERY DYNAMIC UPPER TROUGH WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY AND TONIGHT. A 300MB JET 
OF 120+ KTS WILL PULL NORTHEAST ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES PLACING 
THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED LEFT FRONT QUADRANT OF THE JET. 
THIS JET IS HELPING TO PRODUCE THUNDERSTORMS OVER ALABAMA EARLY THIS 
MORNING EVEN THOUGH INSTABILITY IS LACKING. ASSOCIATED FRONT WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTH THIS MORNING...CENTRAL AREAS EARLY AFTERNOON 
AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS BY EARLY THIS EVENING. MODELS SHOW ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY (CAPES 500-800 J/KG) AS COLD AIR ALOFT STEEPENS LAPSE 
RATES. SOUNDINGS SHOW ENOUGH INSTABILITY BETWEEN THE -10 TO -30C TO 
PRODUCE SMALL HAIL WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS. AN ISOLATED SEVERE IS 
POSSIBLE MAINLY FOR AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40.

FOR TONIGHT...UPPER TROUGH EXITS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...BUT 
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW ISENTROPIC LIFT HELPING TO CONTINUE LIGHT 
RAIN OR DRIZZLE THROUGH THE NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN CHANGES MADE WERE IN 
THE FIRST 3 PERIODS OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST. MODELS IN VERY GOOD 
AGREEMENT ON STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION BY LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON.
THIS WILL SEND TEMPS SHARPLY DOWNWARD...WITH SYNOPTIC SCALE LIFT FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT...ENHANCED BY STRONG JET DYNAMICS AND FRONTOGENETIC 
FORCING. THIS LIFT ACTS UPON PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AS HIGH AS 
1/4 TO 1/3 OF AN INCH...SO POPS WERE INCREASED IN FAVORED AREAS 
WHERE ADVISORY SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ARE QUITE LIKELY TO OCCUR. PER 
COORDINATION WITH NWS NEIGHBORS (GSP)...TOO EARLY TO ISSUE A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY JUST YET...BUT WILL HIGHLIGHT IN OUR HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER OUTLOOK.  

MAX TEMPS TO OCCUR THURSDAY MORNING THEN STEADY EARLY AFTERNOON AND 
FALLING BY 21Z. MOS MINS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT WERE TWEAKED IN LINE 
WITH MOS BLEND...WHILE COOLER GFS MOS MAXES FRIDAY SEEMED BEST 
CHOICE AS SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED. 

LATER PERIODS SEEMED GENERALLY ON TRACK...WITH A FLURRY EVENT 
POSSIBLE LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...AS A CLIPPER TYPE 
SHORTWAVE MOVES ACROSS TO OUR NORTH. FOR NOW...I CHOSE TO KEEP OUR 
GRIDS DRY. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN ON MONDAY...BUT ANOTHER SRN STREAM 
SYSTEM LOOKS TO BRING RAIN BY MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY. POPS ALREADY 
IN FOR THIS SYSTEM...SO LITTLE TO NO CHANGES. 11/00Z GFSX MOS MAX 
AND MIN TEMPS WERE CONSISTENT WITH 10/12Z...SO SOME SLIGHT TEMP 
ADJUSTMENTS WERE MADE. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 102014
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EST TUE JAN 10 2012

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING 
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE AND   
LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE FEATURE...WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL POPS FOR 
BOTH PERIODS. WINDS SHOULD ALSO INCREASING TONIGHT...MAINLY ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATION AS A LOW LEVEL JET PASSES. COULD SEE PERIODS OF 
HEAVY RAIN. BUT IT SHOULD BE TOO BRIEF FOR ANY WIDESPREAD FLOODING 
CONCERNS. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...INITIAL SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH MAKES ITS EXIT WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH CONSIDERABLE WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE/LIFT ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE EVENING SO HELD ONTO HIGH POPS 
NORTH WITH SLIGHT THROUGH CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS SOUTH. MOST OF THE 
PRECIP COMPLETED AS DAYBREAK APPROACHES. NEXT UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES 
SOUTHEAST FROM THE WESTERN LAKES REGION INTO THE OHIO VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY. DEEPEST MOISTURE IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS SYSTEM ARRIVES 
DURING THE AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS WITH IMPACT MAINLY 
ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE PROBLEM IS 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE PRECIP SHOULD REMAIN IN A SUPER COOLED MODE 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA UNTIL MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. THIS SHOULD 
KEEP PRECIP MOSTLY IN LIQUID FORM WITH THE EXCEPTION OF TERRAIN 
ABOVE 4000 FT WHERE SOME SNOW COULD MIX WITH THE RAIN. BY EARLY 
THURSDAY EVENING TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR RAIN TO 
CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS AT ELEVATIONS AROUND 2000 FT AND HIGHER WITH 
A SMALL CHANCE FOR A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE VALLEY FLOOR 
IN CENTRAL EAST AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. HOWEVER...THE DEEPER 
MOISTURE WILL BE LIFTING OUT WHILE LIFT DECREASES AS THE EVENING 
PROGRESSES. THEREFORE...EXPECT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION MAY ONLY BE 
AROUND AN INCH IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. THERE WILL BE A LIGHT 
DUSTING ACROSS THE VALLEYS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. KEPT A FEW SPRINKLES OF SNOW ACROSS A SMALL PART OF THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER THROUGH FRIDAY 
MORNING BUT PRECIP WILL HAVE ENDED ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AS DRY ADVECTION OCCURS. MODELS STILL IN 
DISAGREEMENT ON STRENGTH/AVAILABILITY OF DEEPER MOISTURE WITH A 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH PASSAGE ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE 
NATION SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS 
FEATURE...MAINTAINED PERSISTENCE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR THIS PERIOD 
AWAITING THE ARRIVAL OF MORE WELL DEVELOPED SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY. AFTER A CHILL DOWN OVER THE WEEKEND...WARM AIR ADVECTION 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD KEEP PRECIP IN LIQUID FORM WITH THE 
EARLY WEEK SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1130 AM EST TUE JAN 10 2012


.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS HAVE INCREASED ACROSS THE AREA.  WILL UPDATE 
FORECAST TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER FOR TODAY. CURRENT 
TEMPERATURES...POPS AND THE REST THE FORECAST ON TRACK..NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LIGHT WESTERLY WINDS ACROSS SW
VA AND EXTREME NE TIP OF TN HAVE BROKEN UP THE DENSE FOG SOMEWHAT
...PER AVAILABLE OBSERVATIONS. OPTED TO KEEP THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY
INTACT FOR ALL FORECAST AREAS THRU 9AM EST TODAY...AS FOG REMAINS A
MAJOR ISSUE FOR NEARLY ALL OF E TN INTO SW NC. PATCHY LIGHT RAIN OR
DRIZZLE MAY MOVE ACROSS EXTREME SRN TIER OF FORECAST AREA THIS
MORNING...BASED ON RADAR TRENDS OVERNIGHT.

CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER NE TX IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST INTO THE LOWER 
MS VALLEY REGION THIS AFTERNOON...AND LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN WILL 
INVADE SE TN AND SW NC POSSIBLY BEFORE 11/00Z. THIS AREA OF RAIN 
OVERSPREADS ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA AFTER 11/06Z...SO I NUDGED POPS 
UP TO 100 PERCENT SOUTH AND 80 PERCENT NORTH. 

FOR TEMPS...I DON'T SEE ENOUGH DRYING OVER SE TN FOR CHA TO REACH 
LOWER 60S...ALTHO WARMER MOS HIGHS ARE POSSIBLE FOR SW VA AND NE TN
WHERE AIRMASS WILL BE DRIER FOR AT LEAST MUCH OF THE DAY. FOR 
TONIGHT...I DON'T THINK RAIN WILL COOL AIRMASS ENOUGH TO REACH THE 
COOLER GFS MOS MINS...GIVEN EXPECTED DEW POINT TEMPS. THUS...WENT 
FOR A BLEND OF NAM/GFS MOS ON MINS.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE EXTENDED IS QUITE 
ACTIVE AT THE BEGINNING WITH A VERY DYNAMIC UPPER TROUGH MOVING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY. MODELS SHOW STRONG LARGE SCALE 
ASCENT WITH GOOD QG FORCING...AND JET DYNAMICS...AND DEFORMATION 
ZONE FOR WEDNESDAY AND FIRST HALF OF WEDNESDAY NIGHT. CAT POPS 
ANTICIPATED BOTH PERIODS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS ALSO SUGGEST THE 
POTENTIAL OF THUNDERSTORMS...ESPECIALLY AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF 
INTERSTATE 40 AS FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE AREA.

FOR THURSDAY...A STRONG NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH MOVES TOWARD THE OHIO 
VALLEY WITH A STRONG 120KT UPPER JET MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY. THE JET WILL MOVE OVER A STRONG COLD FRONT ENHANCING FRONTAL-
GENETIC FORCING FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON-EVENING. A BAND OF 
PRECIPITATION...INITIALLY RAIN...WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
TEMPERATURES QUICKLY DROP WITH FROPA AND EXPECT A PERIOD OF RAIN 
CHANGING TO SNOW...ESPECIALLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ADVISORY 
CRITERIA SNOWFALL POSSIBLE OVER THE MOUNTAINS. WILL ALSO HAVE TO 
WATCH THE VALLEY AS WELL FOR LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS 
ENOUGH SNOW/ICE POSSIBLE TO MAKE TRAVEL SLIPPERY.

SNOW SHOWERS WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THURSDAY 
NIGHT...BEFORE TAPERING TO FLURRIES OVER THE MOUNTAINS.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING WILL PRODUCE 
DRY CONDITIONS WITH A MODERATING TREND. FOR MONDAY...ANOTHER SYSTEM 
WILL INCREASE THE ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE AREA WITH A RETURN CHANCE 
OF RAIN.



&&

945 AM EST TUE JAN 10 2012

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION HAS EXITED

TEMPERATURES...POPS AND THE REST THE FORECAST ON TRACK..NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LIGHT WESTERLY WINDS ACROSS SW
VA AND EXTREME NE TIP OF TN HAVE BROKEN UP THE DENSE FOG SOMEWHAT
...PER AVAILABLE OBSERVATIONS. OPTED TO KEEP THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY
INTACT FOR ALL FORECAST AREAS THRU 9AM EST TODAY...AS FOG REMAINS A
MAJOR ISSUE FOR NEARLY ALL OF E TN INTO SW NC. PATCHY LIGHT RAIN OR
DRIZZLE MAY MOVE ACROSS EXTREME SRN TIER OF FORECAST AREA THIS
MORNING...BASED ON RADAR TRENDS OVERNIGHT.

CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER NE TX IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST INTO THE LOWER 
MS VALLEY REGION THIS AFTERNOON...AND LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN WILL 
INVADE SE TN AND SW NC POSSIBLY BEFORE 11/00Z. THIS AREA OF RAIN 
OVERSPREADS ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA AFTER 11/06Z...SO I NUDGED POPS 
UP TO 100 PERCENT SOUTH AND 80 PERCENT NORTH. 

FOR TEMPS...I DON'T SEE ENOUGH DRYING OVER SE TN FOR CHA TO REACH 
LOWER 60S...ALTHO WARMER MOS HIGHS ARE POSSIBLE FOR SW VA AND NE TN
WHERE AIRMASS WILL BE DRIER FOR AT LEAST MUCH OF THE DAY. FOR 
TONIGHT...I DON'T THINK RAIN WILL COOL AIRMASS ENOUGH TO REACH THE 
COOLER GFS MOS MINS...GIVEN EXPECTED DEW POINT TEMPS. THUS...WENT 
FOR A BLEND OF NAM/GFS MOS ON MINS.

ACTIVE AT THE BEGINNING WITH A VERY DYNAMIC UPPER TROUGH MOVING

VALLEY WITH A STRONG 120KT UPPER JET MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY. THE JET WILL MOVE OVER A STRONG COLD FRONT ENHANCING FRONTAL-
GENETIC FORCING FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON-EVENING. A BAND OF 
PRECIPITATION...INITIALLY RAIN...WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
TEMPERATURES QUICKLY DROP WITH FROPA AND EXPECT A PERIOD OF RAIN 
CHANGING TO SNOW...ESPECIALLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ADVISORY 
CRITERIA SNOWFALL POSSIBLE OVER THE MOUNTAINS. WILL ALSO HAVE TO 
WATCH THE VALLEY AS WELL FOR LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS 
ENOUGH SNOW/ICE POSSIBLE TO MAKE TRAVEL SLIPPERY.

LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS AND LOWERING CIGS/VISBYS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
622 PM EST MON JAN 9 2012

.AVIATION...
A FRONT REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY OVER OUR AREA...WITH PLENTY OF
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TRAPPED IN THE VALLEY. THERE IS SOME DRIER AIR
ALOFT ACROSS KY THAT MAY FILTER INTO THE AREA...BUT THE NEAR-
SURFACE LAYER IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN SATURATED OVERNIGHT. THIS
SHOULD RESULT IN IFR CONDITIONS OR LOWER AT ALL TAF SITES. HOWEVER
CONDITIONS MAY BE HIGHLY VARIABLE...PARTICULARLY UNTIL
MIDNIGHT...SO WILL CARRY A TEMPO THROUGH THE EVENING EVERYWHERE.
CONDITIONS WILL IMPROVE TO VFR BY NOON TOMORROW AS DRIER AIR MIXES
DOWN TO THE SURFACE AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH.

TONIGHT. WILL KEEP HIGHEST CHANCE FOR THE EVENING HOURS.  FRONT 
PUSHES BACK INTO AREA LATE ON TUESDAY...SO WILL KEEP THE LOW POPS FOR 
THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE CWA FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  STAYED NEAR 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT FOR THE TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY SYSTEM. CONFIDENCE HIGH 
FOR A WET PERIOD WITH WARM ENOUGH TEMPS FOR AN ALL LIQUID 
EVENT...SO WILL CARRY MAINLY CATEGORICAL POPS BOTH PERIODS...THEN 
CHANCE SOUTH TO LIKELY NORTH WED NIGHT AS THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
PULLS AWAY.   UPPER TROUGH FORECAST TO DIG IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM 
WITH A COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT TIME 
FRAME.  WILL CARRY LOW POPS BOTH PERIODS...AND WITH COLDER AIR 
PUSHING IN ANY LINGERING PRECIP SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS THU 
NIGHT.  MODEL/ENSEMBLE AGREEMENT POOR FURTHER OUT AND CONFIDENCE 
LOWER THAN AVERAGE FOR LATER PERIODS.  12Z GFS HAS A SIGNIFICANT 
SYSTEM AFFECTING THE AREA BY THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEKEND...BUT 
ECMWF AND CMC DO NOT AGREE...AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS HAVE 
CONSIDERABLE SPREAD.  GIVEN LACK OF SUPPORT FOR GFS AND ITS POOR RUN 
TO RUN CONSISTENCY WILL LEAN TOWARD THE DRIER ECMFW/CMC...AND FOR 
NOW WILL KEEP FORECAST PRECIP FREE FOR THE LATTER PERIODS THROUGH 
MONDAY.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  62  48  62  45 /  30  20 100  80  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  56  45  59  44 /  20  10  90  90  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       37  56  44  58  44 /  10  10  90  90  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              35  55  39  53  41 /  20   0  80 100  60

885 
FXUS64 KMRX 091504
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1004 AM EST MON JAN 9 2012

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATION PRECIPITATION DECREASING BUT STILL 
SOME DEVELOPMENT SEEN UPSTREAM. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO ADD 
AFTERNOON WORDING. TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST ON 
TRACK. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COOLING TOPS ON IR SATELLITE
PICS OVER THE ARKLATEX AREA INTO N MS AND W TN THIS MORNING...WITH
SHOWERS CONTINUING TO DEVELOP OVER MIDDLE TN NW INTO WRN KY. MODELS
SHOW THIS SHORTWAVE FEATURE MOVING NE TODAY...WITH MODERATE
ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING ACROSS THE BULK OF OUR FORECAST AREA
AFTER 15Z AND THEN DIMINISHING AFTER 21Z. THIS CERTAINLY SUPPORTS
THE HIGHER MOS POPS (COMPARED TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS)...SO POPS
WERE INCREASED OVER GENERALLY THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. WOULD HAVE
GONE ANOTHER 10 PERCENT OR SO UP...BUT KEPT SOME CONTINUITY AND
STAYED IN TOLERANCE WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. LATEST HPC QPF GRIDS
LOOKED GOOD.

THE APPROACHING SHOWERS (RAIN) FAVORED GOING BELOW MOS FOR MAX TEMPS 
TODAY...AND I ALSO NOTED THAT MOS HIGHS WERE A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES
TOO WARM ON SUNDAY. RAIN SHOULD DIMINISH BY THIS EVENING AND THEN
DRY WITH SOME CLEARING OVERNIGHT...AS DEPICTED QUITE WELL IN
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. SOME CONCERN THAT PATCHY FOG COULD DEVELOP
WHERE CLEARING HAPPENS...BUT WILL TAKE A WAIT AND SEE APPROACH.
MINS FOR TONIGHT WHERE ADJUSTED UP A BIT IN LINE WITH 09/00Z MOS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...TUESDAY STARTS OUT DRY
AS WEAK HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OH AND TN VALLEYS KEEPS DRIER AIR
MASS OVER FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER
MS VALLEY WILL BEGIN TO MOVE EAST INTO THE SOUTHEAST AND TN VALLEY
DURING THE DAY SPREADING MOISTURE IN THE FORM OF CLOUDS INTO SE TN
AND SW NC AND THE PLATEAU BY AFTERNOON AND LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS
SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY BY ABOUT 00Z. SHORT RANGE
MODELS HAVE SURFACE LOW OVER WEST TN WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH PRE 
FRONTAL SHOWERS AND A POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM OUT AHEAD OF THE
SYSTEM WEDNESDAY. LARGE AREA OF PRECIPITATION SHOULD MOVE THROUGH
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY EVENING WITH RAIN ENDING EARLY THURSDAY.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS FROM TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT MAY
TOTAL UP TO ABOUT 2 INCHES IN THE SOUTH. SECONDARY FRONT NOW
EXPECTED TO FOLLOW ON ITS HEELS THURSDAY AND THURSDAY EVENING. MUCH
COLDER AIR MASS TO FOLLOW SECOND FRONT WITH CHANCE OF SNOW THURSDAY
EVENING. AN INCH OR TWO POSSIBLE IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FRIDAY THROUGH
SUNDAY. NW FLOW WILL BRING BIG COOL DOWN WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW
NORMAL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  40  62  48  58 /  80  20  20  90  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  39  56  45  58 /  70  20  10  70  80

REFLECTION ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY WAVES NE INTO THE EASTERN SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS MONDAY. AVAILABLE MOISTURE REMAINS AND LIFT IMPROVES BY 
MID DAY MONDAY TO SUPPORT ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION. 
UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT AND LAYER 
DRIES OUT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST ON TUESDAY 
SETTING UP A WARM AND DRY DAY. TEMPERATURES REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. FREEZING TEMPS WILL BE HARD TO FIND TONIGHT AND 
SPOTTY MONDAY NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKS ACROSS THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL CONTINUE 
WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON WEDNESDAY. COOL AIR PUSHING INTO THE 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. DRIER AIR IS EXPECTED BEFORE 
THE COOL WEATHER ARRIVES SO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THURSDAY SHOULD LIMITED AND PRIMARILY CONFINED TO THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. DRIER WEATHER SHOULD RETURN BY THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA.

SECTIONS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NEXT
SYSTEM SPREADS SHOWERS INTO THE TN VALLEY. AIR MASS BECOMES
UNSTABLE WEDNESDAY WITH SHOWERS LIKELY AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS.
UPPER LOW IS FORECAST TO MOVE FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY
MORNING INTO THE MID ATLANTIC THURSDAY MORNING. COLD AIR ADVECTION
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM WILL BRING IN MUCH COLDER AIR MASS THURSDAY AND
ESPECIALLY FRIDAY. GFS BRINGS IN SECONDARY SYSTEM FRIDAY WITH ECMWF
DRYING AREA OUT BY THURSDAY NIGHT AND HAVE HIGH PRESSURE OVER AREA
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP REGION DRY FOR LAST TWO DAYS.

FXUS64 KMRX 070923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST SAT JAN 7 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CLOUDS INCREASING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...AS AN UPPER TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE 
MOVES EAST ACROSS THE GULF COAST REGION AND A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES 
SLOWLY SE ACROSS MID MS VALLEY AND WRN OHIO VALLEY REGIONS. SEEING 
SOME SPOTTY WEAK RADAR RETURNS OVER MIDDLE AND W TN...BUT DOUBT IF 
MORE THAN SPRINKLES WILL REACH THE SURFACE INITIALLY OVER E TN. 
PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS LOOKED GOOD FOR THE VERY SHORT TERM...BUT I 
DID NUDGE SE TN/SW NC POPS UP TO LOW END OF LIKELY FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON. I THINK THE WEAK FRONT SLIPPING INTO THOSE AREAS AND 
DEEPENING MOISTURE JUSTIFY THE POP INCREASE. ALSO...DON'T LIKE TO 
RUN JUST CHANCE POPS GIVEN LATEST HIGHER HPC QPF AMOUNTS FOR TODAY.
HOWEVER...FURTHER NORTH OVER SW VA...I STILL LIKE THE 20 TO 30 
PERCENT CHANCE POPS. HARD TO DISAGREE WITH SIMILAR MOS HIGHS FOR 
TODAY...IN LIGHT OF CURRENT MILD TEMPS WHERE CLOUDS AND LIGHT SW 
WINDS WILL ALLOW A WARM START.

FOR TONIGHT...WEAK FRONT SETTLES ACROSS OR JUST SOUTH OF SE TN/SW NC 
SO SOME PARTIAL CLEARING COULD OCCUR OVER NRN MOST AREAS. LIMITED 
RAIN CHANCES TO MAINLY AREAS SOUTH OF I-40 AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS. 
FAVORED GOING AT OR JUST ABOVE MOS FOR MINS OVER SRN AREAS TONIGHT
BUT GENERALLY CLOSE TO MOS FOR MINS IN THE NORTH.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT TO
HANG OUT TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY.
MODELS BRING SHORTWAVE ENERGY NORTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA MAINLY
SOUTH SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AND THEN ANOTHER IMPULSE AREA WIDE
MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT. RAIN CHANCES LOW NORTH UNTIL MONDAY.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.
TEMPERATURES STILL MUCH ABOVE NORMAL SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.
ON TUESDAY A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BECOMES WOUND UP OVER THE LOWER MS
VALLEY AND THIS SYSTEM MOVES NE INTO THE TN VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY. AFTER A LULL IN ACTIVITY TUESDAY SHOWERS INCREASE
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. AIR MASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE
WEDNESDAY WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS. A SECONDARY FRONT
THURSDAY WILL BRING IN A MUCH COLDER AIR MASS. SNOW SHOWERS
POSSIBLE AT TAIL END OF THIS SYSTEM BUT NO SIGNIFICANT
ACCUMULATIONS ACCEPTED. COLD HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN LATE THURSDAY
WITH LOWS FALLING INTO THE 20S AND HIGHS IN THE MID 30S TO MID 40S
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.
&&

ARE ACHIEVED AND LIGHT PRECIPITATION SHOULD MATERIALIZE ALONG AND

MRX CWA SATURDAY NIGHT AS AVAILABLE MOISTURE DWINDLES FROM THE 
NORTH. FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND MOISTURE WAVES NORTHWARD SLIGHTLY  ON 
SUNDAY WITH BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION REMAINING ACROSS THE SOUTH. 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD. FREEZING 
LEVEL REMAIN HIGH SO SIGNIFICANT WINTRY PRECIPITATION NOT EXPECTED.

SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION WITH GOOD

STRONGER SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVE THE GULF COAST AND MOVES NORTHEAST
