.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...MILD WARM UP CONTINUES 
TONIGHT AND FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO THE SOUTH MOVES EAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NORTHERN JET SAGS SOUTH INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY EARLY SATURDAY. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES 
RAPIDLY UP THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY SATURDAY MORNING. LOW LEVEL 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL AID IN PRECIPITATION PRODUCTION. BEST LIFT WILL 
BE ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE KNOXVILLE AREA. WEAK COLD FRONT SLIDES SSE 
INTO THE AREA LATE ON SATURDAY. MID LEVEL FLOW GENERALLY ZONAL SO 
WENT ABOVE GUIDANCE WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. 
   
.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS ARE NOT IN 
VERY GOOD AGREEMENT EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH A FRONT THAT TRACKS IN 
THE ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. GFS STALLS IT ACROSS THE AREA. 
STAYED TOWARD THE DRIER ECMWF AND KEEP THE HIGHEST CHANCES ON THE 
WEDNESDAY WHEN AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKS INTO THE REGION. DRIER 
WEATHER SHOULD RETURN BY THURSDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 050741
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 AM EST THU JAN 5 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WARMING TREND CONTINUES TODAY AS 
SOUTHERLY SURFACE WINDS AND PLENTY OF SUNSHINE HELP TEMPERATURES 
CLIMB INTO THE 40S AND LOW 50S THIS AFTERNOON.  A WEAK IMPULSE 
MOVING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH MAY PULL IN A FEW MID TO HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS...OTHERWISE...A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN IN PLACE FOR CONTINUED 
DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WHILE MODELS IN MARGINALLY 
BETTER AGREEMENT TONIGHT THAN 24 HOURS AGO FOR THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD...UNFORTUNATELY STILL CONSIDERABLE RUN TO RUN VARIABILITY IN 
THE MODELS AND SO FORECAST CONFIDENCE REMAINS BELOW AVERAGE.  AFTER 
A DRY AND MILD DAY FRIDAY...LOOKS LIKE SOME LIGHT PRECIP WILL MOVE
IN FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY AS MOISTURE RETURNS AHEAD OF A WEAK
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THINGS QUITE MURKY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
PERIOD. TREND HAS BEEN TO KEEP FRONTAL BOUNDARY NEARBY AND KEEP
THINGS MORE MOIST FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...THEN TO BRING A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM INTO THE AREA BY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. WILL
TRY TO KEEP SOME CONTINUITY IN THE FORECAST...BUT WILL TREND TOWARD
MORE CLOUDS/HIGHER POPS...WHILE KEEPING THE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH
TUESDAY PERIOD PRECIP FREE FOR NOW WITH EXCEPTION OF SOUTH TUESDAY.
TEMPS SHOULD BE MILD DURING THE PERIOD SO LOOKS LIKE PRECIP WILL
BE ALL LIQUID.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EST WED JAN 4 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE LOWER OHIO 
AND LOWER MS RIVER VALLEYS...GENERALLY ALONG AN INDIANAPOLIS TO 
PADUCAH TO LITTLE ROCK LINE. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
OVER THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY HELPING TO GENERATE SOME CLOUDS 
AHEAD OF IT. MODELS AGREE THAT LIMITED MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
WILL PREVENT ANY PRECIP DEVELOPMENT TONIGHT. TEMPS APPEAR TO BE 
FALLING A LITTLE FASTER THAN FORECAST OVER NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA...SO WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO TWEAK TEMPS 
ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

421 
FXUS64 KMRX 042043
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 PM EST WED JAN 4 2012

.SHORT TERM...
WEAK 500MB TROUGH MOVING INTO THE APPALACHIANS SHORTLY. IS
ASSOCIATED WITH CLOUD COVER OVER E KY THAT WILL MOVE ACROSS SW VA
THIS EVENING...BUT WILL BE QUICK. NW FLOW ALOFT TEMPORARILY RETURNS
TO CWA UPON THE PASSING OF THIS TROUGH...AND EXPECTING AT LEAST
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVER SW VA AND MAYBE FAR NE TN TO LAST THROUGH
THURSDAY. OTHERWISE...WARMING TREND...UPON SOUTHWESTERLY SURFACE
WINDS AT THE SURFACE...CONTINUES THURSDAY WITH MAX TEMPS CLIMBING
TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AT THE START OF THIS PERIOD...SHORT-WAVE RIDGING IS BUILDING INTO 
THE AREA...WITH DRY CONDITIONS.

HOWEVER...THIS THIS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE GET KNOCKED DOWN BY PHASING
TROUGHS OVER THE PLAINS AND GULF COAST...ALREADY BY LATE FRIDAY.
WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS MOVING INTO THE AREA BY
SATURDAY...BUT EXITING BY MONDAY. GOOD PART OF THE PRECIP MAY WELL
STAY SOUTH OF THE AREA...BUT WILL KEEP THESE LIGHT POPS IN.

RIDGING AGAIN BUILDS INTO THE AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER LOW
CUTS OFF NEAR W TX. GOOD AGREEMENT IN 12Z RUNS BETWEEN GFS AND EURO
THAT THIS UPPER LOW WILL HEAD INTO AREA AROUND END OF PERIOD
WEDNESDAY. PRETTY POTENT LOOKING SYSTEM...BUT STILL A WEEK AWAY. LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE MAY BE LIMITED...ONLY SPREADING SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS SW-NE STARTING TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WILL
NEED TO WATCH THIS SYSTEM...IF IT REALLY IS THIS INTENSE...IT MAY
SURGE ENOUGH MOISTURE NORTHWARD FOR STORMS.

HAVE GONE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS...EXCEPT WENT ABOVE ON MINS AT THE 
END OF THE PERIOD DUE TO EXPECTED WARM ADVECTION.

151 
FXUS64 KMRX 040736
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 AM EST WED JAN 4 2012

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WARMING TREND BEGINS TODAY AS 
WINDS BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY BRINGING IN WARMER AIR AND ABUNDANT 
SUNSHINE AIDS WARMING.  THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB INTO 
THE UPPER 30S AND 40S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.  A TROUGH AXIS MOVING IN 
LATE IN THE DAY WILL BRING IN A FEW CLOUDS BUT LACK OF MOISTURE WILL 
KEEP THE AREA DRY AS IT PASSES.  QUIET CONDITIONS CONTINUES 
OVERNIGHT AS THE TROUGH MOVES OFF AND OVERNIGHT LOWS FALL INTO 
THE 20S ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD...BUT POOR MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY FOR THE WEEKEND AND BEYOND RESULTS IN LOWER THAN AVERAGE 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE FORECAST.  SHOULD BE 
DRY WITH A WARMING TREND THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE 
DOMINATES OUR WEATHER.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH FRONTAL SYSTEM 
THAT WILL AFFECT THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND.  ECMWF DEEPER WITH 
UPPER TROUGH AND MUCH MORE BULLISH WITH SIGNIFICANT PRECIP...BUT HAS 
LITTLE SUPPORT OTHER MODELS.   GFS DRIER WITH INITIAL SYSTEM...BUT 
HAS SECOND WAVE THAT BRINGS PRECIP FOR SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY.  
HOWEVER...GFS SIMILARLY LACKS SUPPORT FROM OTHER MODELS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM.  GIVEN DIVERSITY OF SOLUTIONS AND LOW FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
WILL JUST LOWER POPS SOME FOR THE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY TIME 
FRAME...AND KEEP CONTINUITY OF A DRY FORECAST MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 


&&

927 
FXUS64 KMRX 032321
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
621 PM EST TUE JAN 3 2012

.AVIATION...CLEARING SKIES ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA WITH WINDS  
EXPECTED TO DROP OFF TO LIGHT AND VARIABLE...AS SURFACE RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS ESE INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT. 

THUS...ALL 3 TAF SITES SHOULD EXPERIENCE VFR CONDITIONS THROUGH AND 
PERHAPS BEYOND THE NEXT 24 HOURS OR SO. 

PREVIOUS AFD FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CLOUDS ARE RAPIDLY DECREASING 
THIS HOUR ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA AND ARE SUNNY OVER THE REST OF THE 
REGION. VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS SOME SNOW COVER OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN SMOKIES. REPORTS TODAY WERE MOSTLY LESS THAN 
ONE INCH EXCEPT THE HIGHER EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
OF SW VA RECEIVED 2 TO 4 INCHES. TEMPERATURES ARE ABOUT WHAT WAS 
EXPECTED LOWER TO MID 30S CENTRAL AND SOUTH VALLEYS IN THE SUN AND 
20S NORTHEAST WITH TEENS AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS WHERE 
SKIES ARE STILL PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY. SNOW FLURRIES HAVE ABOUT 
ENDED ACROSS THE NE AND WILL BE MOSTLY A TEMPERATURE FORECAST NEXT 
24 HOURS. WINDS ARE DECREASING OVER THE SOUTH AND WILL BEGIN TO 
DECREASE IN THE NORTH THIS EVENING AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT RELAXES 
BETWEEN LOW PRESSURE OFF THE EAST COAST AND STRONG HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY. WIND CHILL READINGS NEAR 0 WILL BE 
POSSIBLE IN SW VA AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS FROM THE SMOKIES NORTH 
AS TEMPERATURES FALL INTO THE TEENS WITH NORTHWEST TO SOUTHWEST 
WINDS STILL 10 TO 20 MPH. LOWS TONIGHT AS COLD TO A FEW DEGREES 
COLDER THAN LAST NIGHT TEENS TO NEAR 20 WITH SINGLE DIGITS HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. COLD HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST WEDNESDAY AND SHORTWAVE 
MOVES INTO OH AND TN VALLEYS WITH SOME MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS AND 
A SOUTHWEST WIND TO WARM TEMPERATURES 10 TO 15 DEGREES OVER TODAYS 
SUB FREEZING TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND 
ARE NOW COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE POSSIBLE IMPACTS OF A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. OVERALL...A WARMING TREND 
WILL CONTINUE INTO THE WEEKEND...WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO BE ABOVE 
NORMAL FROM FRIDAY ONWARD. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
SLOWLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...WITH A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES SATURDAY NIGHT AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION AND OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND. THE ECMWF AND GFS 
MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND NOW 
REVEAL A DRY AND TRANQUIL PATTERN ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. BOTH MODELS AGREE THAT A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL DEVELOP OVER THE DEEP SOUTH AND TRACK ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST BY 
THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...WHICH COULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA BY TUESDAY NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...TEMPS APPEAR WARM ENOUGH FOR 
MOSTLY RAIN...BUT THE LATEST ECMWF AND GFS MODEL RUNS HAVE NOT QUITE 
COME TO A CONSENSUS ON THE PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   20  48  28  50  30 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     17  44  26  49  28 /   0  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             17  44  26  49  28 /   0  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    12  40  24  47  26 /   0  10   0   0   0

RIVER VALLEY. THIS SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND. THE ECMWF AND GFS 
MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND NOW 
REVEAL A DRY AND TRANQUIL PATTERN ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. BOTH MODELS AGREE THAT A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL DEVELOP OVER THE DEEP SOUTH AND TRACK ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST BY 
THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...WHICH COULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA BY TUESDAY NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...TEMPS APPEAR WARM ENOUGH FOR 
MOSTLY RAIN...BUT THE LATEST ECMWF AND GFS MODEL RUNS HAVE NOT QUITE 
COME TO A CONSENSUS ON THE PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   20  48  28  50  30 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     17  44  26  49  28 /   0  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             17  44  26  49  28 /   0  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    12  40  24  47  26 /   0  10   0   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST TUE JAN 3 2012

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE ARKLATEX REGION...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS LINGERING 
CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AXIS ALONG THE EASTERN SEABOARD. AREA 
RADARS REVEAL SOME SCATTERED FLURRIES LINGERING OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD 
GRADUALLY DIMINISH THIS MORNING AS THE UPPER TROUGH EXITS THE 
REGION. WILL PLAN TO LET THE WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS 
EXPIRE THIS MORNING...SINCE THESE SNOW FLURRIES SHOULD NOT PRODUCE 
ANY ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS. 

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING 
WORDING...AND TO MENTION SOME LINGERING FLURRIES THIS AFTERNOON 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST TUE JAN 3 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE 
TO EXIT EAST AND HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN.  LINGERING SNOW 
SHOWERS AND FLURRIES WILL DIMINISH AND END THIS MORNING/EARLY 
AFTERNOON...AND CLOUDS WILL CLEAR OUT FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. 
APPEARS SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL STILL BE SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH THIS 
MORNING TO WARRANT THE ADVISORY BEYOND 7 AM...SO PLAN TO EXTEND TO 
10 AM.  EXPECT A MOSTLY CLEAR NIGHT TONIGHT.  IT WILL BE COLD...AND 
MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK GOOD SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDES 
THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY.  MODELS SHOW LITTLE AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND 
WEAK DYNAMICS AND WILL KEEP THINGS DRY WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE.  DRY 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT ON THURSDAY WITH WEAK RIDGING ON FRIDAY FOR DRY 
CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND FOR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK.  A 
SHORT WAVE TRACKS THROUGH FROM THE SOUTH DURING THE WEEKEND WITH 
BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP EXPECTED SATURDAY NIGHT.  TEMPERATURE REMAIN 
RELATIVELY WARM WITH SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND WILL KEEP PRECIP AS RAIN 
FOR NOW.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT BY MONDAY AS A SECOND WAVE 
APPROACHES BUT SHOULD SLIDE TO OUR EAST AND A TROUGH AXIS 
APPROACHING FOR THE WEST.  FOR NOW HAVE LEFT THINGS DRY...BUT THIS 
MAY CHANGE WITH THE NEXT MODEL RUN.

987 
FXUS64 KMRX 030243
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
943 PM EST MON JAN 2 2012

.DISCUSSION...RECEIVED A REPORT OF AN INCH OF SNOW IN WISE COUNTY 
AND FLURRIES REPORTED ELSEWHERE. WILL LEAVE CURRENT ADVISORY AS IS 
SINCE IT SHOULD STAY BELOW WARNING CRITERIA. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING. NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER FLOW PATTERN HAS BROUGHT 
A SHORT WAVE SE FROM THE GREAT LAKES INTO NORTHERN TN AND SW VA WITH 
SNOW SHOWERS MOVING ACROSS SW VA AND INTO NORTHERN TN. MOST 
LOCATIONS HAVE ONLY RECEIVED TRACE AMOUNTS OF DRY SNOW. TEMPERATURES 
AREA IN THE UPPER 20S AND 30S ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA WITH LOWER 40S 
AT CHA. CLOUDS HAVE STEADILY INCREASED DURING THE DAY BUT DUE TO THE 
SHOWERY NATURE SKIES ARE NOT COMPLETELY OVERCAST AND SKIES ARE STILL 
MOSTLY SUNNY IN THE EXTREME SOUTHERN SECTIONS. WINDS HAVE BEEN 
STRONG WITH SPEEDS GENERALLY 15 TO 25 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS. MODELS 
KEEP 850 MB WINDS AT ABOUT 30 KNOTS TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING WITH 
STRONGER SPEEDS ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. HAVE ENDED THE 
ADVISORY AT 12Z INSTEAD OF 18Z WITH MAIN SHORTWAVE MOVING NE BY 
ABOUT 12Z TUESDAY THOUGH SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE A FEW MORE HOURS 
ACROSS NE SECTIONS. LOWS WILL BE THE COLDEST OF THE SEASON IN THE 
TEENS LOWER ELEVATIONS AND SINGLE DIGITS HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
MOUNTAINS. ARCTIC AIRMASS STILL AROUND TUESDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 20S 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NE AND 30S ELSEWHERE. CLOUDS WILL LINGER IN 
THE NE BUT BECOME SUNNY ELSEWHERE. WINDS WILL GRADUALLY SUBSIDE WITH 
WIND CHILLS NOT AS MUCH AFFECT IN THE AFTERNOON.    

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH MOST OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A DRY AND TRANQUIL PERIOD UNTIL THE 
WEEKEND. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY...BUT MODELS AGREE THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED 
ALONG WITH WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS. THUS...EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS 
WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND INTO THE WEEKEND. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS 
THEN PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...AND SHOULD 
GRADUALLY BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY JUST SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 
SUNDAY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO HAVE A BETTER RETURN FLOW OF 
GULF MOISTURE WITH IT...SO WILL MENTION A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS REVEAL 
SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE POSSIBLE DEVELOPMENT OF A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. THE LAST COUPLE OF GFS MODEL RUNS HAVE 
NOT DEVELOPED THIS SYSTEM YET...WHILE THE LAST FEW ECMWF MODEL RUNS 
HAVE SHOWN INCONSISTENCIES WITH THE LOCATION AND MOVEMENT OF THIS 
SYSTEM. FOR NOW...WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS 
BY MENTIONING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS ON MONDAY...AND THEN A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS FOR MONDAY NIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH 
FRIDAY...BUT WILL THEN TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS 
AFTERWARDS (WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS).

RESENDING AFD FOR MEDIA...SINCE IT WAS NOT ON OUR WEB PAGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  19  31  18  46  26 /  30  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       18  31  18  46  26 /  20  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              17  27  11  43  24 /  50  20   0   0   0

     SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

.DISCUSSION...LIGHT SNOW BEGINNING ACROSS NORTHERN WISE COUNTY

LAKES AREA. COLD AIR ADVECTION KEEPING TEMPERATURES FROM RISING
MUCH WITH CLOUDS MOVING INTO NORTHEAST THIRD OF FORECAST AREA.

CURRENT TEMPERATURES IN PLACES. LOWERED HIGH TEMPERATURES A FEW
DEGREES IN CENTRAL SECTIONS BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. WILL UPDATE
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY SHORTLY. TIMING OF MEASURABLE SNOW STILL
LOOKS OK BUT MAY HAVE TO START SOONER FOR A FEW COUNTIES IN SW VA
IF SNOW SHOWERS BECOME NUMEROUS.

528 
FXUS64 KMRX 020918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST MON JAN 2 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A SHORT WAVE WILL DROP ACROSS 
THE AREA LATER TODAY/EARLY TONIGHT...ACCOMPANIED BY A SURGE OF VERY 
COLD AIR THAT CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY.  WINDS WILL BE GUSTY FROM THE 
WEST/NORTHWEST TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT LOOKS LIKE SPEEDS SHOULD STAY 
JUST BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA.  WILL SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS AND 
FLURRIES AS LAPSE RATES STEEPEN AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES. 
WILL KEEP WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AS IS FOR NOW...ALTHOUGH MAY SEE 
THINGS WIND DOWN A BIT QUICKER THAN CURRENT FORECAST.  WIND CHILLS 
WILL DIP BELOW ZERO AT TIMES OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN BY 
TONIGHT...AND WILL MENTION WIND CHILLS IN ADVISORY.   SHOULD SEE ANY 
LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES END TUESDAY AND CLOUDS WILL 
DECREASE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AFTER THE DEPARTURE OF 
THE DEEP EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH DRIER WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGH 
THE WORK WEEK. HOWEVER...MODELS STILL DEPICT ANOTHER CLIPPER SHORT 
WAVE DROPPING SOUTHEAST LATER WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS 
SYSTEM STILL APPEARS TO BE LACKING SUFFICIENT MOISTURE FOR PRECIP 
ALTHOUGH KEPT THE INCREASING CLOUD TREND DURING THIS PERIOD AS THE 
FAST MOVING FEATURE SWINGS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE 
NEXT SYSTEM OF INTEREST WILL BE A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
THAT SHIFTS STEADILY EAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ACROSS THE DEEP 
SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. SUFFICIENT SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT SHOULD KEEP 
PRECIPITATION IN THE LIQUID FORM AS SHOWERS SPREAD ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM. MODEL SOLUTIONS A BIT 
DIVERGENT AT THIS TIME RANGE WITH SOME TIMING ISSUES. ALSO THE UPPER 
LEVEL FLOW BECOMES PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF A COUPLE WAVES ALONG THE FRONT. TRIED TO INDICATE 
BEST CHANCE OF RAIN SATURDAY NIGHT BUT MAINTAINED 30 PERCENT POP 
DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND PERIOD DUE TO UNCERTAINTY.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  21  36  21  48 /  10  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  19  30  18  44 /  10  30  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  19  31  18  44 /  10  20  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              34  17  27  12  41 /  30  50  20   0  10 

&&

NC...NONE.

     TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON EST 
     TUESDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...
     WASHINGTON...WISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1225 AM EST MON JAN 2 2012

.AVIATION...A SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE AREA LATER
TODAY/EARLY TONIGHT...ALONG WITH A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR.
CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN...BUT EXPECT CIGS TO BE MAINLY VFR...ALTHOUGH
MAY REACH MVFR LEVELS ESPECIALLY TRI AT TIMES. SOME SNOW SHOWERS
AND FLURRIES ALSO POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY NORTH. WILL CARRY TEMPO
MVFR CIGS/VIS FOR SNOW SHOWERS AT TRI AROUND 00Z...AND CERTAINLY
MAY LAST LONGER. GUSTY WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED
TODAY INTO TONIGHT.

607 
FXUS64 KMRX 020250
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 PM EST SUN JAN 1 2012

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES AND THE 
REST OF FORECAST ON TRACK. NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED RAIN SHOWERS ARE JUST EXITING THE 
AREA...AND STRONG ADVECTION OF COLDER AND DRIER AIR IS BEGINNING. 
THE AIR MASS WILL REMAIN VERY DRY THROUGH TONIGHT...BUT MOISTURE 
DEPTH WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ON MONDAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH BECOMES 
MORE AMPLIFIED. AS THE UPPER JET PUSHES TO OUR SOUTH IN THE 
MORNING...A SURGE OF FRIGID MIDLEVEL AIR ARRIVES MONDAY AFTERNOON. 
VERY STEEP LAPSE RATES AND LOW LEVEL TRAJECTORIES OFF LAKE MICHIGAN 
WILL CREATE FAVORABLE CONDITIONS FOR SNOW SHOWERS...BEGINNING MONDAY 
AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING INTO TUESDAY MORNING. A 30 KT UPSLOPE WIND 
WILL ENHANCE LIFT AND ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
INSTABILITY AND UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD GRADUALLY BEGIN TO MODERATE 
TUESDAY MORNING AS THE DEEP TROUGH MOVES EAST.

A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED FOR SW VA...THE 
SMOKIES...AND THE MOUNTAINS OF NE TN. BETWEEN 1 AND 3 INCHES IS 
EXPECTED IN THESE AREAS...WITH UP TO 4 IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 
LOCATIONS ACROSS THE NORTHERN TN VALLEY AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COULD 
SEE A DUSTING. WIND CHILLS WILL BECOME A FACTOR IN THE MOUNTAINS 
MONDAY NIGHT...POSSIBLY AS LOW AS -10 DEGREES...AND WILL MENTION 
THIS IN THE WINTER WX ADVISORY. SUSTAINED WINDS TONIGHT AND MONDAY 
ARE EXPECTED TO STAY JUST BELOW WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA OF 26 
MPH...WITH GUSTS AROUND 35 MPH. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER TROUGH BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT 
AS MODIFIED ARCTIC HIGH SLIPS EAST TO A CENTER OVER FLORIDA BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. LOWS STILL IN THE TEENS BUT A CLIPPER SYSTEM 
MOVES EAST SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO THE EAST COAST. MODELS 
KEEP THIS FRONT DRY WITH MOSTLY MID AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE. SOME 
LOWER LEVEL MOISTURE NE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY OTHERWISE 
THE FRONT WILL REESTABLISH TROUGH OVER THE EAST AND MORE COLD 
TEMPERATURES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT THOUGH NOT AS COLD AS MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. UPPER FLOW FLATTENS OUT THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE HANGING ON AND HIGH TEMPERATURES MODIFYING INTO THE 50S. A 
SOUTHERN SYSTEM MOVES NE FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY SATURDAY WITH RAIN INCREASING SATURDAY THEN 
THE SYSTEM SLOWS WITH A BETTER CHANCE OF RAIN OVER THE REGION SUNDAY 
WITH THE FRONT RIGHT ON TOP OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES STAY 
WARM SATURDAY AND THEN COOL A FEW DEGREES SUNDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             26  42  20  36  20 /   0  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  25  36  18  30  18 /   0  10  20  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       25  36  18  31  18 /   0  10  20  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              24  33  17  26  12 /  10  30  50  20   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO NOON EST TUESDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...

710 
FXUS64 KMRX 011708 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1208 PM EST SUN JAN 1 2012

.AVIATION...
A NARROW BAND OF SHOWERS ALONG A COLD FRONT WILL BRING SOME
VISIBILITY AND CEILING RESTRICTIONS FOR THE NEXT 1-2 HOURS AT
TRI. ONCE THE FRONT PASSES...CEILINGS WILL RISE TO VFR AND WINDS
WILL TURN TO THE WEST AND BECOME GUSTY. CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY
DIMINISH TO CLEARING IN THE EVENING...AND GUSTS SHOULD DIE DOWN
AFTER SUNSET ALTHOUGH SUSTAINED WINDS WILL LIKELY REMAIN AT OR
ABOVE 10 KTS. GUSTY WINDS TO 25-30 KTS ARE EXPECTED TO RESUME
TOMORROW AFTER SUNRISE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

313 
FXUS64 KMRX 011422 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
922 AM EST SUN JAN 1 2012

.DISCUSSION...
A BAND FO SHOWERS HAS DEVELOPED IN A ZONE OF VIGOROUS LOW LEVEL
CONVERGENCE ALONG THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT. 12Z OHX SOUNDING
SHOWS AN UNSTABLE LAYER UP TO 700 MB. ACTIVITY IS A BIT GREATER
THAN EXPECTED...SO POPS WILL BE RAISED WITH THE UPDATE.
HOURLY TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO NEED SOME SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS...BUT
THE GENERAL TREND OF FALLING TEMPS IN THE AFTERNOON LOOKS ON TRACK.

TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 011132

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
632 AM EST SUN JAN 1 2012

.AVIATION...A COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. EXPECT A
FEW SHOWERS AROUND TODAY ESPECIALLY EARLY SO WILL CARRY VCSH. LOW
LEVEL JET RATHER STRONG EARLY IN PERIOD...AND WITH SURFACE WINDS
STILL ON THE LIGHT SIDE WILL CARRY BRIEF LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR.
EXPECT SOME MVFR CIGS AT LEAST AT CHA FOR WHILE EARLY IN PERIOD.
WILL CARRY IN TAF AT CHA...BUT CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO
INCLUDE ELSEWHERE AT THIS TIME...SO WILL KEEP TYS AND TRI VFR FOR
THE PERIOD.

520 
FXUS64 KMRX 010934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST SUN JAN 1 2012

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH 
TODAY...USHERING IN A SHOT OF ARCTIC AIR LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT.  
LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE ENOUGH MOISTURE SURGING AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
TO ALLOW FOR SOME SHOWERS TODAY...SO WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL 
ZONES.  LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE DRY TONIGHT...WITH MAINLY CLEAR 
CONDITIONS SOUTH BUT MORE CLOUDS EXPECTED NORTH IN THE COLD 
ADVECTION AND NORTHWEST FLOW.  SOME GUSTY WINDS EXPECTED TODAY AND 
CONTINUING INTO TONIGHT ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT LOOKS 
BORDERLINE FOR ANY WIND ADVISORY AND WILL NOT ISSUE AT THIS TIME.  
MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
AMPLIFY SIGNIFICANTLY ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION ON 
MONDAY. THE TIGHT GRADIENT IN PRESSURE WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL HELP 
TAP FRIGID POLAR AIR. STRENGTHENING COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. INITIALLY MOISTURE WILL BE RATHER SHALLOW IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH THIS SYSTEM BUT DEEPER MOISTURE WILL BUILD ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THE LATE 
EVENING HOURS AS A STRONG VORT MAX SHIFTS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE 
WESTERN GREAT LAKES. INCREASED POPS TO GOOD CHANCE AND EVEN LIKELY 
LATER IN THE DAY INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS FOR SOME OF THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ON THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER WHERE A STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW WILL 
LIFT THE MOISTURE GENERATING SNOW SHOWERS. THE CHILLY AIR ALOFT AND 
DEEPER MOISTURE MAY ALLOW FOR SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS MUCH OF THE GREAT 
VALLEY AND OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES IN SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. EXPECT A LIGHT SNOWFALL IN THE PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED 
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS ON THE ORDER OF ONE...TO POSSIBLY 2 INCHES IN 
SOME OF THE HIGHER PEAKS BY TUESDAY MORNING. THE UPPER TROUGH LIFTS 
OUT BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON ALONG WITH RAPIDLY DECREASING MOISTURE SO 
THE EVENT SHOULD BASICALLY BE OVER BY 18Z TUESDAY. A CLIPPER SYSTEM 
BUILDS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR WEDNESDAY BUT MOISTURE 
APPEARS TO BE LIMITED AND WAS ABLE TO MAINTAIN A DRY FORECAST ALL 
THE WAY THROUGH THE EARLY EVENING HOURS FRIDAY. HOWEVER...ANOTHER 
SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE APPROACHES THE AREA LATE IN THE WEAK AND 
KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS GOING LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
INCREASED THE PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION TO 30 PERCENT ON SATURDAY 
TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS SYSTEM.

STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF 
MAX TEMPS WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WHICH LOOK A LITTLE TOO 
OPTIMISTIC FOLLOWING THE DEPARTURE OF THE EARLY WEEK MODIFIED ARCTIC 
AIRMASS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  25  38  18  31 /  40   0  10  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  26  39  18  31 /  40   0  10  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  23  33  17  27 /  40  10  20  20  10
